The highest peak of Jue Mountain is the Zhan Xian Tai.
On Zhan Xian Tai, there is a tree.
** Literal name “Deity Executing Stage”

It’s not strange to have trees on high mountains. However, it’s eerie that there’s only one single half-dead ancient tree on such a large mountain, which is otherwise barren.

The villagers of Juefeng Village at the foot of the peak are used to it, although it was lush green here twenty years ago, as far as the eyes could see.

The old people in the village often say that it’s called the “Lone Mountain Nurturing Immortal Tree.” The ancient tree has become a spirit and ascended to immortality. As an immortal tree, how could it coexist with ordinary grass and trees? Naturally, it occupies a mountain peak alone.

There’s a solid reason to call that half-dead, nameless wilted tree a divine tree. Twenty years ago, many disciples from many unknown sects came to Jue Mountain to investigate.

According to the elders, they came with the intention to destroy that old tree. Unfortunately even those mighty and powerful, ended up fleeing with serious injuries. Since then, no one has dared to attempt to destroy that tree.

After that Jue Mountain became spookier, perpetually covered in fog. Villagers occasionally get lost in the barren mountain, wandering at the foot of the mountain for hours.

Such a sinister place deters people.

However, lately there seems to be a group of people who are undeterred and come every year. Although they can’t ascend the mountain, they would hire some villagers to bury black iron boxes they bring at the foot of the mountain.

Those boxes are extremely strange, like iron but not iron, with a surface covered in sticky black ooze that moves slowly, as if it would melt into a puddle of black water at any moment.

When these were being buried, the men in black prohibit villagers from touching the boxes with their hands, and they can only use specially made iron forks to push the boxes into the pit. Wu Lao San from the east of the village once accidentally touched one of those boxes with his hand, and his entire palm was eroded away, earning him the nickname “Wu One-Hand.”

This job is fraught with endless danger, and even though the pay is generous, villagers are unwilling to do it.

But there was always some people who seem like their souls had been snatched, being driven up the mountain in a daze.

The villagers suspect they are under some sort of spell. Whenever this happens, people hide in their homes, afraid to go to the fields to work, lest their strong men be caught by these evil forces.

Even so, some unsuspecting travelers from other places are still captured to carry the boxes.

As a result, the divine tree’s reputation couldn’t help but be tainted, and people started to call it an ominous object that caused Jue Mountain to become a land of evil spirits.

If children misbehaved, they can be threatened with ” If you throw any more tantrums, will leave you on Jue Mountain!” Upon hearing this, even the most stubborn children are frightened into silence, hiding under their blankets.

Although the village is somewhat poor, everyone is strong and healthy, with many elderly. In contrast, the sickly girl from Carpenter Xue’s family in the east of the village seems out of place compared to children her age.

The Xue couple had been married for many years without any children and finally had a daughter fifteen years ago. She turned out to be a sickly child who seemed like a slightly strong wind might break her waist.

The couple cherished this only daughter like the apple of their eye, reluctant to let her go outside.

Xue’s wife, Qiao Lian, is making pickled radishes. She looks up to see her daughter, Ran Ran, standing on tiptoe looking over the courtyard wall, seemingly watching the rowdy children. She goes over and says, “Good girl, those are just a bunch of wild boys outside and may knock into you…if you want to go out to play, how about we get your dad to take you by the river?”

Xue Ran Ran reluctantly withdrew her gaze, swallowed silently, and obediently replied with a pair of eyes clear as an autumn lake, “Mother, I’m not a child anymore. I don’t want to go out and play.”

Qiao Lian looked over the short wall and immediately understood once she saw the chubby boy from the Ding family holding a Flower Jujube Puff in his hand.

Her Ran Ran is well-behaved and obedient, just born with a fondness for food. She is always munching on snacks. If she sees some seasonal delicacies, her big eyes can stare at them for hours on end.

That chubby boy is holding the delicate pastry that only rich families have, and Ran Ran was craving for it.

Qiao Lian felt a little sorry and could only say, “Good girl, that pastry is only sold in the county town. When your father finishes his work for Mr. Ding and earns some money, he will buy for you to eat.”

By this time, Ran Ran had already sat back down on her stool. She tugged on her hair bun she just combed and sensibly said, “Mother, isn’t that very expensive? I already caught the scent just now, they added cotton sugar to jujubes, wrapped in pork lard kneaded dough, baked with a medium fire for six minutes. When autumn comes and we harvest the jujubes, Mother can buy a small packet of cotton sugar, and I can make it too.”

Qiao Lian smiled and pinched her face: “Do you really have a puppy’s nose? You can tell how its made just by smelling it? Who told you the recipe, are you trying to fool your mother?”

Seeing that her mother did not believe her, Ran ran didn’t speak anymore. She smiled and went to help her mother pack the radishes into the jar. She pinched a piece of radish and said while biting into it, “Didn’t Father cut a piece of smoked duck meat yesterday? Let’s have radish stewed with smoked duck tonight?”

Qiao Lian snatched the piece of radish from her hand and said, “You can’t be greedy and eat it raw. You have a weak stomach. Be careful not to upset your stomach, or you won’t be able to eat the duck meat tonight.”

People wonder why this couple, who are strong and healthy, gave birth to a sick child. Only Qiao Lian knows the truth, that Ran Ran was found by her under the withered tree in Jue Mountain sixteen years ago.

That day, she didn’t know why, but she had woken from her afternoon nap with a tightness in her chest, so she went up the mountain for a walk. In the rolling fog, she somehow reached the top of the mountain and heard a baby’s cry from afar.

A small white bundle was huddled under the tree, with big eyes half open, filled with tears, crying pitifully. Qiao Lian’s heart was broken by its cries.

She didn’t know who could be so cruel to abandon such a cute and round little baby under the divine tree. But Qiao Lian felt it was a blessing from the heavens, who took pity on the childless couple and gifted them with a daughter.

Xue Lian Gui also agreed with his wife and was overjoyed with the baby girl his wife brought home. Only later did they discover that the baby was born with a frail constitution, frequently falling ill or falling into deep sleep, unable to open her eyes. The couple sought help from many doctors nearby and spent a lot of money on medicine, but there was no improvement.

As time went by, the couple became experienced in caring for a sick child and managed to raise the frail Ran Ran to her current age. Their delicate seedling finally managed to grow this big.

When the baby was found, there was a red birthmark on the palm of her right hand. Xue the carpenter asked the village scholar and learned that the pattern looked like the character “Ran,” so they simply named her Xue Ran Ran.

However, when Ran Ran turned one year old, the birthmark on her palm slowly faded away and disappeared.

Many children’s birthmarks fade as they grow older. The carpenter couple didn’t pay much attention to it and focused on earning money to raise their daughter. Their modest life was still filled with lots of joy.

While the mother and daughter were talking, someone shouted from outside the low wall: “Auntie, I bought some pastries specially, can Ran Ran try a piece??”

Qiao Lian turned her head and saw that it was the elder brother of the chubby boy who was eating the pastry, the second son of Ding family.

The Ding family is a wealthy family in the village. Their second son is studying in the town’s academy, soon to take the imperial exam, with a promising future. He is also engaged to the daughter of a successful exam graduate in the county, but he frequently returns to the village to flirt with her Ran Ran.

Qiao Lian knew that her daughter, although frail, had a beautiful face with delicate eyebrows and snow-white skin, standing out among the fifteen or sixteen-year-old girls in the village.

Unfortunately, her frail and delicate figure was not appealing to the traditional rural families. If a farming family in the village were looking for a daughter-in-law, they probably wouldn’t choose Ran Ran, who couldn’t do heavy work.

However, Young Master Ding, having read a few books, had a different perspective from the farmers. Like an annoying fly that won’t leave, he had been watching Ran Ran closely for the past year.

He even asked the village matchmaker to convey his intentions, implying that after he got married, he would bring Ran Ran into his home as a concubine.

Qiao Lian immediately refused, telling the matchmaker to pass the message to Young Master Ding that her daughter Ran Ran had no desire to marry into a wealthy family and asked him to choose someone else.

But this Young Master Ding would always bring food back to the village to tempt Ran Ran.

Fortunately, although her daughter was fond of food, she was not a shallow girl and would keep her distance from him.

So when Young Master Ding called out from across the wall, he only received a cold stare from Auntie Xue and saw Qiao Lian taking Ran Ran back into the house, to cook their meal.

Young Master Ding left in disappointment, carrying his cakes.

That day, Xue the carpenter, who had gone out to make furniture for someone, came back very late. As soon as he entered, he anxiously closed and bolted the courtyard door, then pulled Qiao Lian, who had opened the door for him, into the house. After checking on their daughter sleeping in the small room, he pulled his wife into their own room and asked in a low voice, “Do you remember what day it was when we brought Ran Ran back?”

Qiao Lian blinked and hesitated, “You said you wanted to treat her as your own daughter, so to avoid the villagers gossiping and the child feeling sad about her origins in the future, you had me return to my parents’ home to pretend to be pregnant. Then, more than a year later, we brought the girl back to the village and reduced her age by a full year. So the day we found Ran Ran… should be her birthday pushed back sixteen years and ten months, which is the ninth day of the ninth month in the Qinggeng year.”

Hearing this, Xue the carpenter slapped his thigh and lowered his voice even more, “I had a vague feeling it should be this month… Do you know? The black-robed men who came this time went from village to village nearby, asking if anyone had seen a child on Xiantai Mountain in the Qinggeng year in September.”

Qiao Lian’s eyes widened in alarm, and she couldn’t help but pace anxiously, “Is this… is this Ran Ran’s biological parents or relatives coming to take her away?”

Xue the carpenter was also worried about this, so when he heard the news while working as a carpenter at the wealthy Master Ding’s house, he rushed back home without even settling his wages.

When it comes to their children, mothers are usually more decisive.

Qiao Lian quickly calmed down and said firmly, “She’s not a cat or a dog. They think they can abandon her and then take her back whenever they want? How cold is it on the mountain in September! Such a small child, without even a swaddle, was just abandoned under the tree. I think only animals could do such a thing! Our family may not be rich or noble, but we love our daughter like a treasure. She is my life! If anyone wants her, they’ll have to kill me first!”

Earlier, Carpenter Xue’s mind was in turmoil, the kind-hearted man that he was, he thought that if the child’s biological parents really came to claim her, wouldn’t it be cutting off Ran Ran’s ties with her relatives if he didn’t give her up?

But now, hearing his wife’s words, he also felt there was reason in them. The couple had struggled for sixteen years to raise their daughter, how could they just give her up because someone else demanded it? Just thinking about his daughter getting married in a few years made Carpenter Xue’s heart ache and his eyes tear up.

After this, the couple returned to the small room and looked at their daughter sleeping on the bed.

In a few days, she would be seventeen years old. Her delicate face was sleeping sweetly, and they didn’t know what she was dreaming about, but she was smiling with the corners of her mouth curled up…

Next

The couple didn’t know that this unfounded trouble had already been brewing a few days ago.

The people in black searching the village, are disciples of the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu. They are also the group that came to Jue Mountain every year to bury those iron boxes.

Just two days ago, several black-clothed disciples stood respectfully at the foot of the mountain and reported to a beautiful woman in a black gauze and gold-embroidered long skirt.
“Elder Tu, the entire Jue Mountain seems to be surrounded by some spiritual force. We circled around the mountain and couldn’t enter at all.”

The woman in black gauze narrowed her eyes slightly, “You are not here for the first time. Just hire some villagers to go in. They don’t have spiritual roots and won’t be blocked by the spiritual barrier. Plus, with the Soul Capturing Spell making them lose their senses, they can at least reach halfway up the mountain.”

The lead disciple replied tensely, “This disciple did exactly as instructed, but… in the past, those people only needed to bury the boxes filled with resentment water at the foot of the mountain and didn’t need to go up. But now, after they enter the mountain, they seem to encounter a ghost wall and have been wandering in the mist for the whole day, just circling at the foot of the mountain and are unable to go up at all!”

This woman in black gauze, named Tu Jiu Yuan, was an Elder under Wei Jiu. Hearing this, she suddenly waved her sleeve and the chilling wind knocked more than a dozen disciples to the ground, “A bunch of fools! This is the year the Rebirth Tree will bear fruit. Twenty years ago, Mu Qingge’s was destroyed and a wisp of her scattered soul was lodged in the tree. If there is not enough resentment water to irrigate the roots, the fruit that is grown may end up a useless being. Our revered Master is currently at the stage of **Yuan Ying transforming into a divine being, urgently needing the aid of the reborn Mu Qingge. We must ensure that the Rebirth Tree will bear spiritual fruit that is up to standard!”

** Yuan Ying is from Taoist cultivation concept, Nascent Soul.
“Cultivators form a new untouched soul which must ascend to the heavens facing heavenly tribulation at each step.”

While she spoke, the disciples who were knocked away seemed to be suspended in mid-air by some invisible force, their eyes bulging as they let out painful howls.

Tu Jiu Yuan clenched her fist and a black mist suddenly rose. With a fierce pull, she seemed to have extracted some energy from those disciples. The men fell to the ground as if they had been skinned and deboned.

“I have used the Bone Sacrifice Spell to strip all your spiritual energy, so you can go in and investigate without hindrance. Even without spiritual roots, the compass made of dragon bones is enough to break through the Smokescreen Spell to reach the mountaintop. I believe you can handle it better than those villagers. Once the boxes are buried, I have the means to restore your spiritual energy.”

These nonchalant words were really just to fool the newcomers of the Sect.

The Bone Sacrifice Spell is the most vicious punishment for disciples who violate the sect rules. It has been unheard of, for anyone who has been stripped of their spiritual roots to be restored after.

Even the female demonic cultivator Mu Qingge, who once caused chaos in the immortal cultivation world, became powerless to fight back after being hit by the Ninefold Bone Sacrifice Curse.

Since Mu Qingge’s demise, the top demonic cultivator is their revered Master Wei Jiu of their Crimson Gate , whose cultivation far exceeds that of Mu Qingge back then.

It’s too bad that the rebirth of the once all-powerful witch Mu Qingge, will merely be as a ginseng fruit to boost their master’s cultivation.

**人参果 is a legendary mythical fruit

However, it’s obvious that not only the Crimson Gate covets this ginseng fruit. Even the righteous sects that claim to be orthodox have sent people to set up a spiritual shield on the mountain, forbidding others from encroaching the Rebirth Tree.

After the soul has scattered, the person reborn from the Rebirth Tree will be as reincarnated, unrelated to the past, neither righteous or evil. It will be easy to teach and nurture.

Mu Qingge had a naturally extreme yin spirit demonic physique, with strong spiritual power embedded in her soul.

Many famous orthodox sects, even as they do not openly declare it, have the intention to obtain this spiritual child of the immortal tree, to raise from a young age, and used for their own purposes.

After all, the heavenly lightning tribulation that occurs once every three hundred years is approaching, and many powerful cultivators who are almost able to ascend need talented disciples to help them overcome the tribulation trial.

Mu Qingge’s reborn body is just right for this purpose.

Thinking of this, Tu Jiu Yuan’s heart felt much more at ease.

Mu Qingge and her were once fellow disciples. Seeing their Master favor Mu Qingge, allowing only her to learn the true teachings and form her golden core early on, while she was always inferior to this junior in every way. Tu Jiu Yuan had always been tormented by jealousy.

But now, Mu Qingge is just a fruit on a tree. When the fruit ripens and falls, it will just be the beginning of her tragic rebirth…

Thinking of this, Tu Jiu Yuan broke into a sinister smile.

She took a few strands of hair that she had just pulled from the heads of those disciples, put them into a small bronze censer in her hand, and silently recited a spell. In no time, she was able to connect with those disciples who went up the mountain, replacing her own sensory input with theirs.

Sacrificing a few disciples was indeed beneficial, indeed much more useful than those villagers.

Maybe the spiritual shield had been set up for too long. This time she was able to control the puppet-like disciples to reach the mountaintop without any resistance, and she could clearly see everything on the mountain through their eyes.

However she was stunned when she saw the weathered fragments under the tree – could it be that the Spirit fruit had fallen long ago?

She made the disciples on the mountain lift their heads and saw a large fruit hanging on the tree, which reassured her a bit.

Just then, a gust of wind blew by and her scalp tightened. In the blink of an eye, someone had pulled a few strands of her hair.

The next moment, Tu Jiu Yuan also lost her senses and came under the control of another.

The remaining disciples respectfully knelt down and shouted in unison, “Long live our Revered Master!”

A man in a black robe had arrived. Although he had a somewhat feminine appearance, his tall stature and the coldness in his narrow phoenix eyes made him unmistakably a man full of murderous intent.

He is Wei Jiu, the Revered Master of the Crimson Gate.

Wei Jiu slowly twirled the strands of Elder Tu’s hair around his long fingers, already having a clear view of the situation on the mountain. He directed the disciples on the mountain to pick up the fruit shell fragments and used a Retrospection Spell to deduce that the fruit had fallen in the Qing Geng year.

Wei Jiu curled his thin lips, snapped his fingers to burn the broken hair at his fingertips and coldly ordered, “Send people down the mountain to search. Find all the children born in the Qing Geng year for me!”

At this time, Tu Jiu Yuan’s senses returned and she hurriedly knelt down and saluted, “Revered Master, could the spiritual child from the prematurely fallen Rebirth Fruit already be gone from the vicinity of Jue Mountain?”

Wei Jiu narrowed his eyes coldly and sneered, “The premature falling of the Rebirth Fruit has already posed a great risk. If the spiritual child is too far from the Rebirth Tree, there’s no chance of survival. She must be nearby. Search thoroughly!”

With numerous disciples and vast influence of the Crimson Gate, an order from the Revered Master led to a thorough search of the nearby villages and towns.

However, despite finding several boys and girls of the appropriate age, none of them possessed the aura of the Rebirth Tree’s spiritual power.

After hearing the report from his disciples, Wei Jiu turned his gaze back to the mountaintop of Jue Mountain, where another fruit was still rapidly growing on the tree, seemingly about to ripen soon.

He was also present during that battle back then, and was well aware that Mu Qingge’s sister, Mu Ran wu, had also perished together with her.

It made sense that two souls had entered the tree and resulted in two fruits.

Now that one fruit had fallen too early… although Mu Ranwu with her mediocre talent was more likely to have fallen first, Wei Jiu felt that a thorough investigation was necessary to avoid any future troubles.

“Mu Qingge…” Wei Jiu softly uttered the name, his eyes filled with a determined and sinister gleam.

He practiced a demonic path that involved devouring souls and craving spirits, which amplified his innate greed. Wei Jiu was obsessed with Mu Qingge, whom he had always coveted but never obtained.

Thinking of this, a bloodthirsty red light flickered in Wei Jiu’s eyes, and his originally noble appearance became terrifying to behold.

Meanwhile, Qiao Lian and her husband had made their decision. They planned to stay at home for the next few days, waiting for the unorthodox disciples and their people to leave before their next move.

Fortunately, they had been cautious and hadn’t immediately brought the child back to the village when they found her. So, when someone did come knocking, they stuck to the story they had told the other villagers, giving a fake birth date for their daughter. Since they had delayed her age by a year, the records clearly did not match the Qing Geng year. The villagers could all testify, leaving no loose ends.

When the black-clothed men burst into the courtyard and saw the frail and sickly daughter of the Xue family, they couldn’t be bothered to take a second look.

After all, this little girl had no aura of spiritual wisdom and seemed a mere ordinary mortal who was not even qualified to enter the path of cultivation, let alone be the spiritual child reborn from the Rebirth Tree!

After that one visit, no one else came knocking.

Although they had delayed their daughter’s birth year by one year, Ranran had always been frail and appeared smaller than children of her age, so no one ever suspected anything.

However, in the village, five children born in the year of Qing Geng were said to have had their fingers cut by the black-clothed disciples, and their blood was dripped into a black incense burner.

After carpenter Xue found out about this, he turned pale. His daughter Ranran was delicate and weak, and if she were really cut with a knife, it would take her at least ten days to half a month to recover.

Later, that group of black-robed disciples, stubbornly determined, took away all the children born in the year of Qing geng from the surrounding villages.

Although they claimed to be checking for spiritual roots, this act of kidnapping without any trace of the victims was utterly lawless.

Some people resisted fiercely, but in the end, they were beaten half to death by the powerful demonic cultivator disciples and could only watch helplessly as their children were taken away.

Ranran didn’t understand why her parents had been very listless the past few days, with her mother even lying in bed for two days like she had been traumatized. But as a daughter, she felt it was her duty to show filial piety when her mother was ill.

Ranran asked her father to help heat up the stove, and she made sesame sweet potato cakes that she had seen before. After they were steaming hot from the oven, Ranran placed them on a small table for her parents to eat.

Qiao Lian was amazed at the delicate cakes her daughter made and asked where she had learned to do so. She was full of praise as she asked her.

Ranran didn’t know either. She just nibbled on the cake contentedly and mumbled, “I knew how to make it after eating it once. Mother, do you think I starved to death in my past life? Is that why I always think about food?”

Qiao Lian spat once on the ground forcefully, “Tsk tsk, what’s a little girl like you saying about life and death in this way? I think you just died of gluttony in your past life!”

After saying that, she paused, realizing she herself had mentioned about life and death, while her clever daughter laughed out loud and took a big bite to satisfy her craving.

Qiao Lian laughed along with her daughter and the tension of the past few days eased—the black-robed people hadn’t been coming to the village much these days, so they are probably in the clear.

Qiao Lian and her husband decided that after the winter, they would put together some money and return to their old home in He Ning, far away from this troubled place.

Previous
Next

After Qiao Lian made this decision, the family began to prepare for their trip.

Just at sunset, at the top of Jue Mountain, someone was quietly gazing at the village below, where smoke was curling up from the chimneys.

The person was tall, with a posture like a sturdy pine tree, wrapped in a rather worn green robe, looking somewhat desolate. His long loose hair, half-concealed his face. But his features were indistinct as if covered by a layer of pale false skin, creating an eerie appearance.

Although Jue Mountain was protected by a spiritual shield, for some reason, it did not stop this person and his two followers from reaching the top of the mountain, unobstructed the entire way.

The man standing behind him, with the eyes of a leopard and the waist of a bear, is named Yu Chen.

At this moment, Yu Chen had been accompanying his master in the cold wind for an hour. He tried to hold back but finally couldn’t help but cautiously remind him, “Master, should we report this matter to the other sects?”

The “matter” he referred to was the fact that the Rebirth Tree had already borne a spiritual fruit, but the fruit had fallen to the ground at an unknown time, leaving only fragments of the fruit shell.

This tree had grown for ten thousand years. In the past, his master, Su Yishui, had sacrificed his blood to consecrate it, giving up half of his cultivation that formed his Golden Core, just to allow this tree to accept the remnant soul and transform nothingness into a physical body.

Yu Chen didn’t quite understand his master’s self-harming behavior. Since his master had done all these just to enable the notorious female demonic cultivator, Mu Qingge, to be reborn!

Even though Su Yishui had once been a disciple of Mu Qingge, it was the female demon Mu Qingge who coveted Su Yishui’s outstanding appearance and forcibly persuaded him, who was originally a disciple of Mount Shu, to switch to her side. She also forced him to cultivate the demonic path.

He thought of his master, who before embarking on the path to cultivate immortality, had been the illegitimate son of the then-powerful Prince Ping. Although he couldn’t be included in the ancestral genealogy, he was raised in luxury since he was the son of Prince Ping’s beloved woman. How could he be ordered around by a woman?

Unexpectedly, after the Young Master decided to cultivate immortality and sever worldly ties at the age of sixteen, this flower youth fell into the hands of the notorious female demon.

Fortunately, his Master was a genius with extraordinary talent. Even though his cultivation was not as high as Mu Qingge’s, he later surpassed her and even defected from her sect to assist the righteous path in killing this evil female demon.

Back then, Mu Qingge was attacked simultaneously by the three major immortal cultivation sects and hit by the Ninefold Bone Sacrifice Curse, leaving her with no chance to fight back. In the end, her spiritual roots were stripped away, her spiritual power dispersed, and she met a tragic end with the scattering of her shattered soul .

If it weren’t for his Master’s mercy, attaching a trace of her remnant soul to the Rebirth Tree, the world might never see the demonic cultivator Mu Qingge ever again.

However that despicable woman, before dying, managed to cast a curse on his Master, that damn Melting Face Curse! It sealed the celestial appearance of Su Yishui, forcing him to cover his face with a veil from then on.

Even in her dying moments, she played a prank like a mischievous child, fully showing the wickedness of that female demon!

Perhaps due to the Melting Face Curse, whenever his Master occasionally showed his true face, it always led to exclamations or ridicule. In the years that followed, he spoke less and less, and unless he was building training alchemy, he spent most of his time like the present, standing silently before empty mountains and the wilderness.

That gentle and warm-hearted young man in his memory seemed to have changed into a different person after Mu Qingge was executed, becoming so deadly silent that it was frightening.

Perhaps his Master was so persistent in ensuring this female demon would be reborn in order to break this annoying curse?

However, when Yu Chen and his sister Yu Tong accompanied the Master to Jue Mountain seventeen years ago, they found that the tree had suddenly borne fruit. Unfortunately at that time, the three major sects had sent people to destroy the Rebirth Tree once again. The Master stopped them and battled fiercely with several powerful cultivators.

Because he had spent much of his core to help Mu Qingge’s rebirth, Su Yishui had been greatly weakened. However, his bold stance of being ready to shatter his soul and perish with everyone, made it difficult for them to withstand his attacks.

After all, everyone knew that the three major sects were able to win back then thanks to Su Yishui’s significant contributions. If he were to die at the hands of the three major sects, the reputation of the righteous path would be ruined for turning on their benefactor.

In the end, those powerful cultivators were really annoyed by Su Yishui’s persistent fighting. Seeing his once charming appearance now indistinct, they felt pity and decided to make a concession. They generously made an agreement with Su Yishui to allow Mu Qingge to be reborn on the tree, so that Su Yishui could break his curse.

But the three major sects made it clear that after the curse was lifted, Mu Qingge’s life and death would no longer be up to Su Yishui to decide.

After that, Jue Mountain has been placed under a Barrier Spell and no one is allowed to approach. They will just wait ten years until the Rebirth Fruit ripens and falls.

However, because the tree was once watered with Su Yishui’s golden core and spiritual blood, even though there is a spiritual shield, it can only block people with ulterior motives and cannot prevent Su Yishui from going up the mountain.

But in these long years, Su Yishui had never returned. It was only today, when they passed by this place and suddenly found that the spiritual shield had been weakened, as if someone had broken in, that they came up the mountain to take a look.

What they found was shocking! The Yu siblings discovered that the Rebirth Tree had lost its fruit some time ago, and the whereabouts of the reincarnated female demon were unknown. If the reborn Mu Qingge remains unchanged in her demonic nature and is not restrained, wouldn’t it cause chaos in the world once again?

At this moment, Su Yishui, who had been standing on the mountain for a long while, finally uttered a few words: “There is still one more…”

Hearing this, Yu Chen looked back and was astonished to find that the tree, which was somewhat bald, indeed still had another fruit.

He couldn’t help but rub his eyes and found that the fruit was hidden behind a few wilted leaves. Maybe he hadn’t looked carefully before, which was why he hadn’t noticed?

But the branch that bore the fruit was clearly different from ten years ago! Could it be… that the tree bore two fruits?

The woman who had been standing silently beside him was Yu Chen’s younger sister, Yu Tong, who had also been following and serving Su Yishui.

Seeing this situation, Yu Tong tentatively said, “Back then, Mu Qingge was extremely evil, but her fellow disciple and younger sister Mu Ranwu was a kind and pure person, completely opposite to her sister in character. Unfortunately, such a good person couldn’t escape Mu Qingge’s clutches and perished together with her in the battle on Jue Mountain…”

At this point, Yu Tong paused, as if she suddenly thought of something, “At that time, Mu Ranwu assisted the three major sects, trying to use the Soul-Devouring Lock to lock Mu Qingge’s soul. Unfortunately, she was countered by Mu Qingge and pulled into the Soul-Devouring Lock. Could it be that their remnant souls became entangled and were both reborn on the Rebirth Tree, resulting in two fruits?”

Yu Tong was young at the time and had not yet built her foundation, so her impression of Mu Ranwu was really scant. Although Mu Ranwu was good-natured, compared to her sister, who was highly talented and exceptionally beautiful, Mu Ranwu was so ordinary that people couldn’t even recall her appearance.

What’s baffling is, if the tree had borne two fruits, which one of them was the first to fall to the ground and be reborn, Mu Ranwu or Mu Qingge?

When Yu Chen raised this question, Su Yishui, who had been standing in the wind, still did not speak.

But Yu Tong, with her lips tightly pressed, said indignantly, “Haven’t you seen a cuckoo bird occupy the nest of other birds? Once the cuckoo chick hatches, it will push the original owner’s eggs out of the nest. The Rebirth Tree’s spiritual power is limited. If there are two fruits, the spiritual power would be divided. Naturally, the weaker one has been forced out.”

Seventeen years ago, Yu Tong had accompanied her Master to Jue Mountain. At that time, the fallen fruit grew on the western branch of the tree. But now, the fruit on the western branch is gone, and the almost invisible fruit on the eastern branch has suddenly grown much larger.

It’s obvious that Mu Qingge edged out her younger sister’s remnant soul and monopolized the spiritual tree. After all, Mu Ranwu, in terms of talent or spiritual root, was far inferior to her sister Mu Qingge.

Poor Mu Ranwu, falling before her time, probably didn’t even form a physical body and just dissipated in the wind.

Thinking of Mu Ranwu’s simple and kind appearance, Yu Tong felt saddened.

But at this moment, Su Yishui, who had been standing silently for a long time and rarely uttered a long sentence, said “Lingxi Palace has not accepted disciples for a long time. You two, go to the nearby villages and gather some disciples.”

The Yu siblings were taken aback. Lingxi Palace was the sect founded by the female demon Mu Qingge. Conditions for acceptance into the sect did not consider the quality of one’s spiritual roots but only accepted orphans based on their appearance, whether male or female. Such rules clearly exposed the true nature of a lustful demon.

And her recruiting of a disciple with outstanding talent like Su Yishui was purely a fluke, like a blind cat stumbling upon a dead rat.

After the female demon was executed, the notorious Lingxi Palace also fell into decline.

However, the female demon did leave behind a considerable amount of gold and silver for her orphaned disciples. Since most of them had no demonic cultivation and the three major sects prided themselves on being righteous, they did not want to execute them along with their master, which would tarnish the reputation of the righteous path. Thus, they let them leave with the money and fend for themselves.

But now, Su Yishui intended to reopen Lingxi Palace and accept disciples under its name, which really puzzled the Yu siblings.

However, Su Yishui was unwilling to explain further. With a light tap of his toes, his green robe fluttered as he quickly descended the mountain from the other side, and the Yu siblings hurriedly followed their master on the wind.

While it was turbulent on the mountain in recent days, the village below remained peaceful, with people continuing their daily routine of working at sunrise and resting at sunset.

After deciding to move, Qiao Lian began to arrange for the long-term lease of their few acres of land.

The houses in the village were not valuable, so it was better to keep their house for now and see if they wanted to return after the things return to normal.

But at this time, an unexpected complication arose.

When Carpenter Xue went to settle his wages at Master Ding’s home, Ding’s wife had nitpicked his craftsmanship, claiming that the table he made had cracked and refused to pay him.

As Ding’s second son was about to get married, Xue Lian Gui had worked for more than a month on a complete set of furniture for them, but now they refused to pay him. Now, they may find it difficult to buy daily necessities, let alone afford to start their long journey.

Carpenter Xue is a tough man. He had told Master Ding from the beginning that the wood for the table was not of good quality, being damp and likely to crack if used for furniture.

But Master Ding had insisted on saving money on wood costs and refused to replace it.

Xue Liangui had no choice but to follow the homeowner’s orders and complete the carpentry work, only for Ding’s wife to turn around and deny responsibility, even instructing their servant to slap him twice.

In fact, Ding’s wife did this on purpose. Her second son had a bright and promising future and had finally attached himself to a prestigious family in the county. But he was bewitched by the frail Xue Ranran and constantly mumbled on about taking her as a concubine in future.

If the scholar’s daughter knew about this, wouldn’t she be furious enough to call off their marriage?

Ding’s wife felt that her second son had lost his senses because of the sickly Xue Ranran’s slender waist, so she decided to teach the Xue family a lesson, letting them know that it won’t be easy to enter the threshold of a wealthy family. She hoped the little vixen would give up soon and stop trying to seduce her son, so she found fault with his work and deny him his wages. She even took the opportunity to teach Carpenter Xue a lesson.

Qiao Lian was so angry that her cheeks turned red and she cursed, “Blast it, they are so unscrupulous! No wonder no one was willing to take on work at their house.”

Previous
Next

Xue Liangui was also coming to his senses at this time, realizing that the willow wood table was not fit to be shown. The furniture used for Ding’s family wedding was all made of high-quality mahogany, except for that table, which looked like it was meant for the servants, yet they made a big fuss about it.

How could it be that the servants having no table to eat at, would delay their son’s wedding?

It was obvious that the Ding family had set a trap, intending to default on the payment from the start. The carpenter regretted deeply, even his daughter Ranran had advised him not to take up the job, but he was tempted by the high wages offered by the Ding family and ended up taking this disgusting task.

Ranran had been listening by their side and saw her parents’ indignation. She comforted Xue Liangui, saying, “Father, it’s not worth arguing with such wicked people like the Ding family. Just consider it as making a free set of funeral furniture for them.”

However, the carpenter couple are obviously not listening to their daughter’s gentle persuasion.

Qiao Lian is a feisty woman, how could she tolerate her man being wronged like this?

Seeing their nearly empty rice bin at home, she couldn’t hold back any longer. She put down the cooking spoon, hurriedly untied her apron and went to the village chief’s house. She wanted to ask the village chief to accompany her to the Ding family’s house to argue for their payment.

Xue Liangui, still anxious, told his daughter to eat first and hurried followed Qiao Lian.

Ranran, fearing her parents would get the worst of it, quickly changed into her outer garment and called out towards the yard, “Mother, if you really have to go, please don’t quarrel with them. Just mildly lament about how we have nothing to cook with, heap praise their second son’s good character, and say he will surely pass the provincial examination with flying colors!”

Unfortunately, Qiao Lian, in her anger, did not listen to her daughter’s words—she would be crazy to praise that lecherous Ding family’s second son!

By the time Ranran finished changing her clothes, her parents had already left. She hurried out, intending to catch up to them.

But just as she stepped out and looked up, she saw a man in faded green clothing standing in front of her house.

The man was very tall, and the petite Ranran could only look up at him. She realized he was wearing a hat, with a thick veil covering his face completely.

At this moment, the man seemed to be looking down at her as well. A breeze brought a whiff of chrysanthemum fragrance by the fence, blowing the veil slightly, but his face remained unclear.

Ranran froze for a moment before recovering. She was certain he was not from the village and quickly stepped back a few paces, watching him warily.

Clearly, he was waiting for someone, but it was unclear whom he was waiting for.

Just then, Grandmother Huang from next door drove a stout man from her yard by splashing a bucket of swill on him: “Just a few days ago, you came to our village to kidnap people and today you’ve come up with a new scheme to deceive us! Bah! What becoming immortal and achieving eternal life? Everyone in our family is living a long life!”

Yu Chen was unaware that Wei Jiu’s disciples had recently caused trouble in the village. He had been accompanying his master in seclusion in the mountains for cultivation and had not visited the village in a long time. He did not expect people to have become more vicious.

He had just gone in to ask the old lady for some drinking water and casually inquired if there were any young men in the village who wanted to learn the Taoist arts of immortality. Before he could finish speaking, the old lady had already swung her bucket and splashed him with swill.

Regrettably even after years of cultivation, his intellect was rather lacking. Although he silently recited the Water Avoidance Chant, his control was not quite adequate. The sour and rancid slops splashed forcefully into his face.

Even though Yu Chen was well versed in martial skills, but the pride of a martial artist forbade him from beating up ignorant old women from the village. Instead, he could only roar angrily, his eyes widening as he snatched the wooden barrel and smashed it into bits with one strike.

This display of force frightened Grandmother Huang, who quickly closed and locked her door, afraid to curse aloud.

Xue Ranran was also frightened. Just as she turned to return to her yard, a tall and imposing woman with thick brows and bright eyes blocked her way.

She politely greeted Xue Ranran with a fist-and-palm, “Young lady, may we borrow your water bucket so that my elder brother can wash his face?”

Just then, the big man covered in slops also approached, staring at Xue Ranran as if she dared to say half a ‘no,’ he would smash her into pieces like that barrel.

Xue Ranran paused for a moment, and replied with a nod, “The water jar is in the yard, please help yourselves.”

As the big man walked into the yard, Xue Ranran turned and ran. Since villains had entered her home, she had to quickly go to the village head and ask him to organize the young men to drive these people away.

Unfortunately, she had not run a few steps when her legs, as if no longer under her control, automatically moved towards her own yard.

As she entered, the yard gate also closed on its own, seemingly pushed by the wind.

Xue Ranran looked at her legs in disbelief; they had completely disobeyed her, as if possessed…

At this moment, the tall man with the veil was already standing in their yard, seemingly staring at her coldly through the veil.

Xue Ranran felt controlled by a strange force just now, so she was too frightened to move. She then slowly moved along the wall, picking up the wooden stool her father often sat on, and politely offered it to the man, ‘Sir, please have a seat. Let me fetch some hot water for the gentleman to wash his face…’

She then immediately rolled up her sleeves, went into the kitchen, lifted the lid and ladled out some hot water from the large iron pot.

Yu Tong standing by, was quite surprised and raised an eyebrow. Earlier, her Master had cast a spell on the young lady to guide her back into the yard.

Normally, this rural girl should have been screaming in fear, but unexpectedly, she just blinked her big dewy eyes and quickly regained her composure, already politely and attentively buttering up her Master.

Other things aside, this girl may look thin and weak, but her courage was unusual.

While the girl was fetching water, Yu Tong asked, ‘Young lady, how old are you?’

Xue Ranran replied softly, ‘Almost sixteen…’

As the hot water arrived, Yu Chen eagerly washed the slops off his face, while the girl retreated to the side, observing them carefully.

Fortunately, these people were different from the black-clad ones from before; they didn’t force people to cut their hair or hands.

But the big man seemed to have worked up an appetite from the slops; after washing, he started clamoring about being hungry, asking if there was any food in Ranran’s house.

Yu Chen didn’t want to scare the girl, but he wasn’t originally born with the immortal cultivation physique. Back when he served in the army when he was younger, he was chosen by Prince Ping to protect Su Yishui, so he had stayed by the young master’s side ever since.

Later on, he even resolutely brought along his young sister to cultivate immortality with the young master.

Initially, he couldn’t really understand much, and now after twenty years, he had barely learned some superficial knowledge. He was far from the stage of fasting and must have three meals a day regularly.

Since the fierce-looking man is complaining of hunger, Xue Ranran had to bring out the freshly cooked food again, watching as the big man and the noble-looking woman sat down to eat.

But as the aroma of the rice filled the air, Xue Ranran… also got hungry.

She just couldn’t stand hunger; If she was already going to die, she might as well eat to her fill and not go to the underworld with an empty stomach to drink Mengpo soup.

Since she couldn’t go out to look for her parents, letting these two eat all the food would be even more of a loss, right?

Thinking of this, Xue Ranran turned and grabbed a pair of chopsticks, filled a bowl of rice and sat down somewhat shyly to eat with them.

The young lady seemed delicate and refined. When their eyes met, she would even smile shyly. But her bamboo chopsticks moved swiftly like flowing clouds and water. There were only a few thin slices of cured meat in the bowl of stir-fried green beans, and all were deftly picked out by the young lady straight into her mouth.

Even Yu Chen can’t beat her; he felt the young lady was being deliberate so he glared at her. Unfortunately, Xue Ranran is always focused when she is eating, once she entered a state of bliss she paid no attention to others.

With Sue Yishui’s cultivation level, he already no longer needed to eat three meals a day. So he didn’t sit at the table. Instead, he stood by the side, looking at the corner of the yard where Dianthus were planted.

It wasn’t the season for Dianthus to bloom, but the ones in the yard were exceptionally vibrant and lush, blooming brightly.

Sue Yishui slowly turned his head and asked, ‘Who planted these flowers?’

Yu Chen looked at the young lady who was eating seriously, and prompted her,
‘Hey, he’s asking you!’

Xue Ranran’s face was buried in the bowl as she mumbled, ‘I planted them…’

Her father worked as a carpenter and strained his eyes, so she specially planted Dianthus to dry and make tea for her father.

After looking at the splendid flowers for a while, Su Yishui turned and walked towards Xue Ranran.

He slowly squatted down, meeting Xue Ranran’s eyes as she sat on the small stool.

Being looked at like this made it difficult to continue eating. Ranran cutely held her bowl up to the tall man, ‘Sir, would you like to eat?’

She noticed that the man’s hand which received the bowl was very beautiful, with long fingers that seemed emitting a jade-like glow. A man with such beautiful hands, one can only imagine how handsome his face must be, like an immortal banished to the mortal realm…

Just then, a strong gust of wind blew, lifting the man’s veil for a moment. Although it was only a moment, it was enough for Xue Ranran to see his face clearly.

This should be the kind of monster that scares children in nightmares, with indistinguishable features except for a mouth and chin.

Xue Ranran’s body instinctively leaned back, almost falling off the stool. If the strange-faced man hadn’t reached out to hold her, she would have fallen down.

As if not satisfied with scaring the young girl enough, the man actually slowly took off his hat, completely revealing his blurred and terrifying face. He went closer to Ranran, saying, “What, do I look very frightening?”

Ranran knew she should be tactful at this moment and pick some nice words to say, but she moved her greasy little mouth, struggling to find a compliment for a face like this.

However, this can’t stump Xue Ranran. After calming her mind, she picked the least offensive part of his face and said sincerely, “Sir, your chin is smooth and well-defined, and your mouth is so beautiful that one would not bear to blink. You’re far from scary!”

At these words, Yu Chen spat out the rice in his mouth onto his sister Yu Tong’s head. He was deadly loyal to Su Yishui, but even he couldn’t bring himself to utter such flattering and insincere words.

A face sealed by the Melting face curse was indeed terrifying and scary. He and his sister had always been careful to avoid mentioning any topics related to appearances, and Su Yishui rarely showed his true face to others.

Unexpectedly, today his Master is acting out of character and used his ruined face to scare a little girl.

And when the girl said those dishonest words, her eyes were so sincere that they seemed to be rippling with clear autumn water, as if it was the truth!

Su Yishui seemed to be pleased by the flattery and releasing his hand, he slowly stood up and said,
“It’s hard to find a confidante in life, and even fewer people who are not afraid of my appearance… Since we are fated, and I’m cultivating in the western mountains, why don’t you follow me and cultivate the way of immortality together…”

Ranran quickly waved her hands in refusal and said, “I was born weak, and I’m just an ordinary person, how can I cultivate such an extraordinary skill?”

The man with the strange face countered unhurriedly, “The weaker the body, the more you need to cultivate the way of immortality to prolong life and maintain youth. Look, don’t my chin and mouth appear very young?”

At this, even Yu Tong was left gaping.

Her Master had always been a man of few words since he was a youth. Even before he was cursed, he maintained a polite yet distant demeanor with others. Even when the female demon had teased him ever so often, her Master never showed the expressive emotions of ordinary youth. But now, seeing him being so talkative with a silly little girl, he didn’t seem like her Master, who is normally aloof and cold as ice!

Previous
Next

Xue Ranran did not expect the man with the strange face to actually use her insincere compliments to corner her. Just when she was at a loss for how to turn his offer down, she suddenly heard the sound of knocking at the door.

She heard Qiao Lian urgently shouting outside, “Ranran, open the door quickly!”

Ranran felt relieved now that her parents were home. She hurried to open the door, only to see Qiao Lian crying and supporting the blood-covered Xue Lian gui.

Earlier, she had gone with the village chief to seek justice. Initially, the village chief spoke reasonably, but Ding’s wife hinted that their second son had influence in the county school, which could be helpful for the village chief’s son who was about to enter the school.

Hearing this, the village chief suddenly back-pedaled, saying that the furniture was indeed defective and shouldn’t be paid for. He then made an excuse about his dog giving birth and hurried off.

At this point, Qiao Lian became livid and started arguing with Ding’s wife.

The Ding family, having many relatives, eventually had several burly cousins come over and try to beat Qiao Lian. Xue Lian gui, in order to protect his wife, took a beating again.

Fortunately, Qiao Lian suddenly remembered her daughter’s advice before leaving the house and had an epiphany. She shouted loudly, “Come and see! The parents of Scholar Ding are trying to beat someone to death! What kind of son can such a family raise, and how can he pass the moral examination for the provincial exam?”

Her words finally stopped the Ding family.

After all, Ding’s second son was about to take the exam, and these past few days officials had been coming to the village to inspect the conduct of the candidates. If a life was really lost, wouldn’t it ruin his son’s future?

Master Ding, alarmed by Qiao Lian’s shouting, worried that his wife’s lapse in judgment might jeopardize their son’s prospects, reluctantly threw three strings of coins at Qiao Lian.

Although they got back his owed wages, Xue Lian gui had already been beaten badly.

Qiao Lian was filled with hatred and regret. She hated the entire Ding family for being beasts and regretted not listening to her daughter’s advice earlier. If she had used the Ding family’s weak point to negotiate, how could her husband have been injured?

She cried all the way home while supporting her husband, only to find several menacing figures in her yard upon opening the door, one of whom… didn’t even seem to have eyes or a nose!

Overwhelmed, Qiao Lian’s eyes rolled back and she fainted. Ranran, with only two hands, could hardly support her mother, let alone her father as well, who was so frightened that his legs turned into jelly.

Fortunately, the woman named Yu Tong, came over to help Ranran support her mother and helped them back into the house.

Although Xue Lian gui was terrified, seeing that the three people seemed to have no ill intentions, he calmed down enough to ask his daughter, “Ranran, who are these people?”

Ranran glanced at the man with the strange face who had already put his veil hat on again and let out a sigh of relief. Fearing her father might say the wrong thing, she quickly informed him, “Father, these are immortals who have come to recruit disciples and offer longevity…”

Hearing his daughter say this, Xue Lian gui’s face turned even paler—had those life-shortening lot returned? Could it be that they found out Ranran was also born in the Qing geng year?

Just then, Qiao Lian was revived with some water and was regaining consciousness with some groans. Ranran, fearing her mother might faint again, quickly explained that these immortals were just here to drink water and eat.

Yu Tong felt they had imposed long enough and took out a purse, rummaging through it.

She thought to herself: the meal they just had, the only meat went into that girl’s mouth, and with just simple fare, there was no need to give too much.

After considering for a moment, she finally pinched out a tiny piece of silver, placed it on the table as payment for the meal, and prepared to leave.

The Rebirth Fruit is about to fall soon and it seems that Wei Jiu and his disciples were also lurking around. If the reborn Mu Qingge falls into Wei Jiu’s hands, the Master’s chance to break the curse might be ruined.

So, in the next few days, she needed to find time to guard Jue Mountain and ensure the safety of the spiritual fruit!

Of course, once the Master breaks the curse, Mu Qingge’s life and death would no longer matter. Yu Tong hoped she would drop dead at once and stop harming her Master.

But Su Yishui did not seem to want to leave. Seeing that Xue Lian gui’s leg seemed to be broken, he reached out to set the broken bone and then covered the wound with his hand.

Xue Lian gui, originally in excruciating pain, unexpectedly felt a warm and soothing sensation when the strange man covered the wound with his hand, and in a short while, he felt no pain at all.

Such divine power was indeed something only immortals possessed!

Overjoyed, Xue Lian gui cautiously thanked the strange man. However, Su Yishui merely said mildly, “I have only temporarily numbed your pain. In three days, you will start to feel pain again, but the broken bone has been set. As long as you keep it immobilized and rest sufficiently, it should heal without any major issues.”

Hearing the plight of the Carpenter couple, Yu Chen, who was beside them, became angry and said, “Do you want me to teach those Ding tyrants a lesson?”

Xue Lian gui was already full of regret and quickly waved his hand, saying, “No need. We are planning to move away from here anyway, so it’s better not to make things complicated.”

At this moment, Qiao Lian also gradually woke up. After hearing her daughter’s quiet explanation, she finally calmed down.

To Yu Tong’s complete surprise, Su Yishui, who was usually detached from worldly affairs, seemed very approachable today. With just a few words, he started handing out predictions like a fortune-teller.

After hearing that they were planning to return to their old home in He Ning, Su Yishui bluntly said that their daughter had a ill-fated look and might only have a few days left to live. Only by cultivating some immortal techniques for longevity could she prolong her life.

Normally, the couple would have easily believed such convincing words about the occult.

But with the recent criminals searching for children born in the year of Qing geng, and now this strange-looking person seemed persistent, trying all means to recruit their daughter for a disciple, it didn’t seem like a good thing no matter how they looked at it.

And saying that she only had a few days left? That sounded too bizarre and more like a curse!

So Qiao Lian firmly refused and politely prepared to send them away.

Su Yishui did not say any more, leaving only one sentence: “If you regret it, you can find me at the western mountains in Yongcheng. My name is Su Yishui.”

After saying this, he ethereally led his two followers away and left. If one didn’t look at his face, just his figure from the back was indeed that of a tall and handsome man with broad shoulders and a narrow waist…

Qiao Lian found herself staring at the man’s back, lost in thought, and quickly gathered her wits.

What was wrong with her? Why was she unconsciously staring at that strange-faced man…

As Su Yishui left the Xue family’s home, Yu Tong asked,
“Master, should I stay and guard the Rebirth Tree to prevent any mishaps with the spiritual fruit?”

But Su Yishui replied indifferently, “No need. We have been wandering for too long. It’s time to return…”

However, just as they were about to leave the village, they happened to encounter the carriage of the Dings, also leaving.

Master Ding who just had a dispute with the Xue couple, was forced to pay the carpenter his wages due to concerns about the upcoming provincial examination, and he was now very displeased.

Tonight there was a social gathering in the county town. He was rushing to take his son to the banquet, to curry favor with the officials who had arrived in the county to inspect the candidates’ conduct.

Sitting in the carriage, he scolded his son in a low voice, “A man’s future is most important. At this time, why are you getting involved with that sickly girl from the Xue family? Once you have an official rank, she’s not even worthy of being your maid! A family of shrews. Once this matter is over, I’ll set fire to the Xue family’s house in the middle of the night!”

His son laughed it off, “I was just teasing her casually. Why are you taking it so seriously like Mother? That kind of girl is always trying to get my attention. She’s just a frivolous girl to play with. Don’t get angry, Father. You still have to drink with the examiners later!”

Although Su Yishui was far from the carriage, as an immortal cultivator, his hearing was extraordinary. Despite being a village road apart, he could hear everything clearly.

Yu Tong saw it clearly; her Master lightly lifted his finger and quickly drew a talisman in the air, casting a spell towards the carriage.

It was an entry-level spell for immortal cultivators, called the “Heart and Mouth as One” curse.

The person affected by this curse would not be able to speak falsely for the next six hours; they would only speak the truth from their heart. Hence the name “Heart and Mouth as One.”

The Ding father and son pair were going to meet the examiners, and they would inevitably say some disingenuous flattery. With this curse, who knows what kind of deadly jokes they would make…

Clearly, the Ding father and son had displeased the Master.

Yu Tong felt bewildered again. Her Master, who usually didn’t like to meddle in other people’s affairs, seemed to be possessed today!

Back at the Xue home, Qiao Lian had initially planned to leave after winter, but now that they had offended the Ding family, it was not advisable to delay their departure.

Although they only gotten back three strings of coins, if they were frugal, sell some wooden barrels and stools along the way and take on some carpentry odd jobs would be enough.

So Qiao Lian prepared the food and dried goods for the journey, packed a few simple bags. Xue Lian gui loaded his carpentry tools onto the donkey cart and locked the yard door with a strong lock, they hurriedly set off.

However, when they reached the vicinity of the county, they met villagers returning from there. They were relishing the fresh gossip they had heard in the west market of the county town that morning.

It was said that last night, the Ding father and son had bought their way into attending a banquet with the important people in the county town.

But the father and son, not knowing how much liquor they had already drunk at home, started talking nonsense as soon as they were seated at the banquet.

Master Ding, when he heard his future in-law praising his son’s substantial knowledge, he actually laughed and said that his second son was an ignorant scoundrel. In the past few exams, he had hired someone to take it for him, and had paved his way up with silver.

Speaking with such pride about his son’s cheating scandal, made everyone present look at each other in disbelief.

And Ding’s second son was even more “drunk”. He asked the county magistrate where he bought his concubine with such a voluptuous figure, saying it would be great if he could sleep with her a few times.

In short, the Ding father and son didn’t speak one reasonable word, and their future in-law was so embarrassed that he wanted to hide under the table.

In the end, the Ding father and son granted a stick beating by the furious County Magistrate and thrown out. Offending everyone at such an occasion, the future and marriage prospects of Young Master Ding are in jeopardy.

Hearing about the Ding family’s scandal, Xue Lian gui and Qiao Lian felt assuaged. However, they knew the Ding family, despite their downfall, still had some influence, so it was still best to lay low for a while.

Their old donkey was getting on in years and couldn’t pull a heavy cart, so for most of the journey, Xue Lian gui, with his injured leg and Ranran rode in the cart, while Qiao Lian led the donkey from the front.

Thanks to the miraculous powers of the immortal Su, the carpenter did not feel any pain for the first three days. It was only on the third day that his leg began to ache as if pricked by needles.

But Xue Lian gui had no time to worry about his leg pain, because his daughter Ranran suddenly became ill a day after they left Juefeng Village.

Ranran didn’t have a fever, but she seemed to wither like a flower drained of water, her small face quickly turning waxen and thin.

Previous
Next


Since Ranran had never been like this before, Qiao lian was terrified and hurriedly sought a doctor at their temporary lodging. However, the doctor said that Ranran’s pulse was so weak that it was barely detectable. She was likely nearing the end of her life, so he advised the couple to prepare for the worst.

After saying this, the doctor didn’t even take the consultation fee and left in a hurry.

Poor Ranran who had also heard the doctor’s words, actually comforted her parents with a smile, “Father and Mother, please don’t be grieved, my illness had always……been a burden to you, and if I were to pass this way, you can be relieved. My life has been…..there has been nothing bad, with you as my parents, I am very contented.”

The couple, helpless, watched their daughter trying to comfort them and cried in agony. At that moment, Qiao lian suddenly remembered the faceless immortal’s prediction that their daughter did not have long to live.

Although she had not taken it seriously at the time, she now grasped at it like a lifeline. They had been traveling for two days and had just arrived in Yongcheng. The couple hurriedly asked the locals for directions to the western mountains. The local said, that’s fortunate, the western mountains is not far from where they are, and there indeed lives an immortal and divine doctor named Su Yishui.

Hearing this, Qiao lian completely let go of any doubt and rushed with her husband to the western mountains in their donkey cart. When they reached the foot of the mountain, Qiao lian was ready to carry her daughter up the steep path. She saw the veiled immortal Su standing in a pavilion below, as if waiting for someone.

Qiao lian couldn’t care less about his frightening appearance, she rushed over and kowtowed to beg the divine doctor to save her daughter’s life.

Su Yishui came over, looked at Ranran lying in the donkey cart, took out a porcelain bottle, and had Qiao lian pour its contents into Ranran’s mouth. In a short while, Ranran’s waxen face gained a hint of color, as if a wilted flower had absorbed water and regained some vitality.

Master Su was indeed a divine doctor, and despite his ugly appearance, they were still grateful.

Ranran found the water very sweet. Once she regained her breath she asked “What medicine is this?”
Su Yishui, through his veil, said mildly, “It’s water soaked with tree roots.”
Ranran had wanted to sound out the prescription, but who would have thought that the divine doctor was so cunning, giving such a superficial answer.

Master Su stated that taking medicine only treated the symptoms and not the root cause. For Ranran to be healthy again, she had to stay behind. Given Ranran’s condition, the couple was desperate and saw this as a ray of hope. However, they couldn’t agree to leave their beloved daughter behind.

Ranran is also sixteen now, and they had to be cautious about gender boundaries. They are willing to stay as well, offering to work as servants without pay to thank the divine doctor and accompany their daughter during her illness.

Unfortunately, Master Su was very business-like, saying he preferred peace and quiet and didn’t want outsiders staying on the mountain. They are free to leave with their daughter if they wished, but they had to leave a tael of gold as the fee for the treatment just now.

Qiao lian was dumbfounded, having never heard of such an outrageous consultation fee. Was the divine doctor trying to charge exorbitant prices? Su Yishui seemed uninterested to argue with the woman from the village. Without mentioning the fee again, he turned and went up the mountain.

Qiao lian, seeing him leave, immediately followed, calling out urgently. However, the divine doctor, was swift as the wind and disappeared in a moment.

Xue Lian gui, stopping Qiaolian, said softly, “Don’t shout anymore. You’ve already angered him. Look at his old robe, washed pale without color. He must be struggling to make ends meet, so he wanted to charge more now that there is finally a consultation.”

Qiao lian slapped her hand in frustration, “Don’t you think I know that. But the price was too outrageous. There should have been room for negotiation. Why did he leave without a word?”

Qiao lian wanted to go up the mountain, but for some reason, she couldn’t find her way in.

Eventually, they could only take their daughter back to the inn where they had stayed.

The innkeeper told them that only the nobles and wealthy could afford to seek medical treatment on **Xishan. Master Su was also very particular about who he treats. He only treats three patients a year regardless of their condition, each consultant at a fee of a hundred taels of gold.

**western mountains will be refereed to as XiShan from this point forth

Qiao lian was dumbfounded and asked if anyone would really seek his treatment at such a sky-high price. Wasn’t that just throwing money away?

But the innkeeper looked at her as if she were a country bumpkin and said, “No one? There’s a mad scramble for it! Gold has a price, but a divine doctor is priceless. If you don’t believe me, tomorrow is the day he treats patients this year. You’ll see for yourselves. It’s a rare kindness that he made an exception to treat your daughter for only a tael of gold! This is an incredible act of benevolence. “

Qiao lian, being mocked by the innkeeper, felt uneasy. The next day, they hurried to Xishan again on their donkey cart.

But this time, they couldn’t even get close to the mountain. The road and bridges at the foot of the mountain were blocked by all kinds of luxurious carriages.

It was said that many nobles and dignitaries had come to seek medical treatment, and just comparing their backgrounds and wealth, many had already been pushed out of the queue.

This time, only the burly man Yu Chen, who followed the faceless man, came down the mountain. He looked at a stack of visiting cards, seemed to randomly select three, announced the names and dispersed everyone else.

This upset those who weren’t selected. One of the richly dressed servants huffed, “My Master is the son of the current Prime Minister Lin. Why did you choose some small officials to treat and neglected my master?”

Yu Chen sternly replied, “My Master treats illness based on the virtue of the patient. If the patient is a deceitful and wicked person, even the best medical skills can’t cure them.”

As Prime Minister Lin was notoriously corrupt and had framed many loyal officials, this statement quelled the anger of those who didn’t get selected. Regardless, it was clear that Master Su was uncompromising, not sparing any face for the powerful elites.

The servant of the Lin family was furious. Coming from the capital, he had quite a temper. Upon hearing these disparaging words from an uncouth nobody about an esteemed official , he reached out to grab Yu Chen. But before his hand could touch Yu Chen, his clothes shone with a golden light, and the servant howled in pain, rolling on the ground.

It was said that Master Su was an immortal who had cultivated on the mountain, and even his two servants had received some celestial favor and were not ordinary people.

After demonstrating his supernatural powers, Yu Chen turned and ascended the mountain.

Those he named could freely go up, but others who wanted to climb the mountain were blocked by an invisible barrier.

This spectacle completely intimidated first-time seekers of medical treatment. The son of the Prime Minister, who was in a sedan chair, also reprimanded his servant, implying that they should not disrespect the immortal and return next time even if they failed this time.

It seemed that Master Su’s medical skills were indeed extraordinary, as even the Prime Minister’s son did not dare to offend him.

Observing from afar and hearing the crowd’s discussions, Qiao lian was thoroughly convinced. She now realized how invaluable the opportunity to consult this divine doctor was.

Seeing her daughter’s spirit waning again the next morning, Qiao lian was already desperate enough to sell herself to save her daughter, wanting to kneel and beg the divine doctor once more.

After the crowd had dispersed, she eagerly led her daughter to the mountain, but upon reaching the foot, it was as if the mountain was covered by a dome and they couldn’t enter.

After several attempts and as dusk approached, Ranran couldn’t bear it any longer and stepped off the cart to try to walk a few steps forward. She easily entered the mountain.

Seeing her parents are unable to follow, Ranran said, “Mother, stay with Father at the foot of the mountain. I’ll be back soon.”

Qiao lian had never let her daughter out of her sight, let alone on such a mysterious mountain. How could she be at ease letting her go alone?

But Ranran smiled and said, “If those masters wanted to detain me, neither Father nor Mother could stop them. I don’t think Master Su is a bad person. We’ve already offended him, and it’s a special favor that he’s allowing me to go up the mountain. Please don’t worry, Mother. I’ll be back soon.”

Qiao lian knew that her daughter, although physically weak, had always been perceptive. Moreover, her words made sense.

Seeing Ranran’s cheeks, which had turned rosy after taking the medicine yesterday, had turned waxen again today, Qiao lian felt helpless. She could only hope for the best and let her daughter go up the mountain first.

So Ranran bid farewell to her mother and went up the mountain alone.

Strangely, after entering the mountain, Ranran’s feeble body felt much lighter. Her chest, which had been stuffy, also breathed more freely. It was as if a fish trapped in a net was released back into the water, feeling indescribably comfortable.

She took a few deep breaths and then, lifting her skirt, followed the winding mountain path and began going up.

This mountain was different from Juefeng Mountain, with lush greenery everywhere, making it a refreshing sight.

Although there were many forks on the mountain, Ranran walked more and more as if in a trance, as if she had walked on this same path in a dream before. She actually did not take any wrong turn and smoothly reached the top of the mountain.

Upon reaching the top and seeing the dilapidated houses built against the cliffs, Ranran understood why the seemingly transcendent Master Su had to persist to earn more money – maintaining and rebuilding these old houses on the high mountain would indeed require a lot of gold and silver.

However, looking at the neglected and unimpressive courtyard, it was hard to tell where Master Su’s money had gone.

Yu Tong, the woman with thick brows, was already waiting in front of the courtyard. Seeing Ranran, she said, “The Master is treating patients right now. You can wait in the east room.”

After that, she led Ranran to a house adjacent to a garden.

Ranran, who had grown up in a village, had never been in any grand houses. From the cobweb-covered beams and corners, she could tell that this house was once exquisitely and elegantly built. Even the old curtains hanging by the windows had been made of fine silks and fabrics.

Even the wealthy Master Ding would have been reluctant to use such refined fabric for clothes!

Unfortunately, these fabrics were too old, severely faded, and exuded an air of decay. Although the floor and table were regularly cleaned, it was evident that maintaining so many houses on the mountain with just three people was a bit overwhelming.

Compared to the dilapidated house, the cakes on the table were truly attractive, looking like delicate cherry blossoms in bloom.

Ranran’s stomach was already growling with hunger and she felt like eating the cakes. But she didn’t dare to touch them and could only stare longingly.

Yu Tong kindly reminded her, “…My master has abstained from food for a long time. My brother and I, although we haven’t reached the realm of immortals, also try to eat only one meal a day. These cakes are made of wax and can’t be eaten. They’re just placed here to fill the space on the table.”

Ranran nodded in admiration. Clearly, Yu Tong, the housekeeper, was frugal with money but also had some elegant pursuits. If there were any visitors to the mountain, placing a plate of wax cakes could also save face.

Previous
Next

At this moment, Ranran’s stomach started growling, so she had no choice but to snack on the pumpkin seeds she had brought with her to stave off her hunger. Yu Tong realized belatedly and grabbed a handful of peanuts from the kitchen for her.

As Ranran focused on peeling the peanuts, Yu Tong watched her silently.

After leaving Juefeng Village that day, Master returned to Jue Mountain and broke off a branch from the Rebirth Tree, and also dug up a section of its roots.

After their return to Xishan, he planted the branch in the garden and used spiritual water to help the branch take root— if she guessed correctly, this girl was the spirit fruit that had been squeezed off the Rebirth Tree.

An immature spirit fruit, if it strays too far from the Rebirth Tree on Jue Mountain, is bound to start lacking spiritual energy, so Master brought a branch of the Rebirth Tree here.

When he first attached the soul into the tree, Master expended his own Golden Core and sacrificed blood from his wrist, so he is connected to the reborn spirit fruit. When he encountered this young girl in the village, it is very likely that he recognized her through their shared aura.

Moreover, her name also contains the character “Ran,” could she be Mu Ranwu reborn?

Thinking that she might not be the demonic woman Mu Qingge but the kind-hearted sister who once helped Master, Yu Tong felt relieved and treated her warmly.

Master had instructed her not to say too much. Yu Tong, always cautious, naturally kept her mouth shut and did not mention the peculiarities of this young girl to even her brother.

“Not enough? Want me to grab a few more handfuls?” Yu Tong, usually very careful with expenses, made an unusually generous offer.

Ranran shook her head and asked, “How were these peanuts roasted? They have a special roasted aroma that I can’t quite place.”

Yu Tong smiled and said, “They’re just ordinary peanuts, but they got a bit damp recently. I didn’t want to waste them, so I took the opportunity to roast them in the cauldron vent while Master was refining pills. The flavor turned out really good!”
