Ranran nodded in realization. As a food-loving girl, she appreciated the down-to-earth approach of Master Su who is willing to use a pill-refining cauldron to roast peanuts. Despite his blurred features, this added a few points of likability.

At this moment, the tall man in a simple and elegant white robe walked quickly along the garden path towards them. Ranran noticed that he made no sound when walking, as if gliding over waves, truly embodying the true grace of an immortal.

Thinking how her mother was fearful yesterday, for scolding him for extorting money, Ranran tactfully apologized on her mother’s behalf first.

After Su Yishui gestured for Yu Tong to leave the room, he slowly sat down and carefully examined the young girl in front of him through the thin veil covering his face. Her emaciated appearance was like a hungry ghost or a consumptive, even her originally passably delicate face seemed somewhat damaged.

He leisurely asked, “Are you satisfied with the houses and courtyards here?”

What’s there to be satisfied with in such a dilapidated mountain dwelling?

Ranran dared not speak her mind and could only try to pick out something to compliment, “You can tell at a glance that you are a person of high taste. The carvings on the beams are very exquisite!”

She then heard Su Yishui say in a flat tone, “These houses were built by another. I don’t really like such extravagant and ostentatious styles.”

Ranran, having little interaction with outsiders since childhood, struggled to handle such conversation killers and could only force a laugh. She then took out a bag from her waist, offered a handful of her own roasted pumpkin seeds, and asked, “Immortal Su, would you like some?”

Su Yishui did not accept, mildly stating, “I have been fasting for three years… Although the houses on the mountain are somewhat dilapidated, I will have someone repair them in a few days. You still have no foundation and must eat the food of the mortal world. I have instructed Yu Tong to purchase more rice and meat. You can also receive three taels of silver each month to help support your parents…”

Such a generous offer hit all of Ranran’s soft spots. Born with a love for food, she had always only had simple meals of radishes and greens due to her family’s poverty.

Just now, she passed by the kitchen and indeed saw Yu Chen transporting things up the mountain. The newly hung hams and sausages in the courtyard were as festive as New Year’s firecrackers.

There were also baskets of fruits and vegetables, full of the atmosphere of daily life, completely different from her imagined cultivation lifestyle of absorbing the essence of the sun and moon and drinking dew.

This made Ranran feel a bit more at ease. At least she could eat her fill on the mountain.

The most important thing was that he said he would give her three taels of silver every month. If she could earn money to support her family, wouldn’t that greatly alleviate her parents’ hardships?

However, such generous treatment made Ranran somewhat uneasy. She probed, “Why such wonderful benefits? What do you expect me to do?”

Su Yishui mildly stated, “Disciples who enter Xishan have always been treated well. You are not the only one I am accepting. In a few days, you will see your fellow disciples.”

This made Ranran feel even more at ease. Perhaps Master Su truly desired to pass on his teachings. If she was not the only disciple, at least she would have companions in the future.

Ranran knew that her illness had always been a burden to her family. Even their departure from the village this time was because of her. Now that she had the opportunity to share her parents’ burden, Ranran was most willing to stay in spite of the risk.

Thus, the matter of Ranran becoming a disciple of the Lingxi Palace was settled.

That day, Ranran went down the mountain to discuss everything with her parents. Although Qizo Lian did not care about the three taels of silver as subsidy, thinking that Master Su could cure her daughter’s illness, she could only reluctantly leave her on the mountain.

As a result, the couple temporarily rented a house in a town not far from Xishan. Ranran said her Shifu has graciously allowed her to visit them once a month, which made the carpenter couple feel even more at ease.

** I am going to use Shifu in this case since Mister/Master is used by other characters for a different designation, and Teacher sounds too stiff

Yu Tong arranged for her to stay in a room next to the garden, which was filled with all kinds of exotic flowers and plants, including a half-dead tree.

According to Yu Tong, this was a branch that Master had broken off from an ancient tree. It barely rooted after being watered with water steeped in thousand-year-old ginseng.

Ranran’s room was very close to this small tree. Yu Tong pointed to a pitch-black large vat and said that it contained spiritual water. Ranran was instructed to water this wilting tree every day.

Although Su Yishui had accepted Ranran as a disciple, he seemed to have no interest in teaching her any skills. He only personally took her into the main hall of the house on Xishan.

The plaque in the main hall, covered in dust, faintly bore the three characters “Lingxi Palace.”

It is said that the founder of Lingxi Palace was named Mu Qingge. When she was alive, she widely accepted disciples and the place was bustling. The rules and disciplines of Lingxi Palace were written in a free and unrestrained style on the entire wall.

As Qiao lian had helped in the village school’s kitchen for two years, Ranran was able to study a little without paying tuition. She managed to barely make out the rules.

However, these rules were truly bizarre and somewhat incomprehensible. For example, one might not cultivate their temperament, but must not neglect their appearance and clothing, needing to dress beautifully every day to please the Master.

Another example was that meals could be minimal but must not lack in refinement. One must taste all the flavors of the mortal world to cultivate the essence of the Great Dao, lest the Nascent Soul forms without retaining the sense of taste, leaving regrets.

There were many more such unorthodox sect rules written with great detail.

Although Ranran was not versed in the ways of cultivation and immortality, she felt that the rules of Lingxi Palace were somewhat contradictory. If one simply wanted to be a prodigal child and a wastrel, there was no need to learn anything in order to comply with all the rules and disciplines.

As she was looking up, she suddenly heard a deep voice behind her asking, “Can you do all of these?”

Unbeknownst to her, her Shifu had been standing behind her and asked the question.

Ranran quickly took a few steps backwards and replied with ambition, “Disciple will definitely try her best to achieve them!”

However, Su Yishui was not very satisfied. Even though he was behind a veil, she could feel his somewhat critical gaze.

Ranran looked down at her somewhat faded dress and thought about her emaciated appearance due to illness, which indeed violated the first rule. She immediately said, “I will change into a nicer dress tomorrow…”

But her Shifu snorted coldly, “The rules on the wall are all nonsensical dog farts. Can’t you even realize that?”

Although Su Yishui had no face, his demeanor was that of a transcendent immortal. The sudden use of the phrase “dog fart” felt as jarring as placing excrement on a jade plate.

However, Ranran smoothly went along with it, widening her eyes in realization and saying, “Shifu’s insight is profound. I also felt the same, but I lacked Shifu’s foresight. Then… which rule should the disciple follow?”

Unfortunately, her Shifu seemed to think she was unteachable. After giving her another cold look, he turned and left with a sweep of his sleeves.

At dinner time, Ranran ate with the Yu siblings. Seeing the table full of meat and dishes, it was comparable to a wealthy landlord’s feast.

Yu Tong sighed while muttering, “Master exceptionally instructed me to buy more meat, vegetables, and grains to welcome the new disciple. Ranran, you should be grateful to the Master. But seeing how thin you are, you probably can’t eat that much… If you can’t finish it, I’ll set some aside and hang it in the well, so we can eat it again tomorrow.”

No one responded to her words.

Ranran initially began to taste the food with great hope, but after the first bite, she paused, unsure of what to say.

The entire table of food was prepared by Yu Tong, who was feeling bad about too many dishes. But Ranran was feeling bad that the good ingredients had all been ruined.

Clearly, Yu Tong, who had also been fasting with her Master, had lost her sense of taste. The dishes she cooked were either lacking oil or undercooked, making them very unappetizing.

However, Yu Chen seemed not to mind his sister’s cooking skills. The greasy and rich dishes were too delicious for him to bother with talking. Having not touched meat and vegetables for a long time, he devoured them like an army without caring if they are cooked properly.

Ranran, who was picky, really couldn’t eat it. Unable to leave the table yet, she tried to make conversation by mentioning her lesson on the rules of Lingxi Palace with Shifu earlier.

When the rules were mentioned, Yu Chen’s face showed shame as he said, “Although Master comes from a wealthy background, he has always practiced frugality and has been fasting very early on, almost transcending the mortal body, being indifferent to money and material items. If it weren’t for our lack of progress, still unable to break free from worldly habits, why would Master need to treat those people to earn money to support us?”

Having said that, he fiercely finished off a greasy chicken drumstick.

Yu Tong felt she needed to warn Master’s young new disciple, so she wouldn’t be led astray by the rules left by the former Master of Lingxi Palace, “The previous Master of Lingxi Palace fell into the demonic path and was not a good person. Your Shifu is the complete opposite of her. Don’t learn from that bad Master!”

Ranran listened and nodded in agreement. In her opinion, it wasn’t just the previous Master who was bad news; her faceless Shifu was also not a good character either. He gave her a test out of nowhere, using the old rules of the demon-possessed Master to test her character, almost causing her to fail.

Not imparting any teachings and testing immediately after admission, such a Shifu is cunning and hateful! Would her days as a disciple in Lingxi Palace be somewhat bleak?

Previous
Next

But fortunately, Ranran is not the only novice disciple in Lingxi Palace.

Although XiShan’s Lingxi Palace had not accepted disciples for a long time, with the reputation of the immortal physician Su Yishui, it was very easy to gather disciples.

The rowdy applicants created quite the bustling occasion, but in the end, only three disciples were accepted.

Among them, the two young men were older than Ranran. The senior brother was named Gao Cang, said to have a background in martial arts. Tall and upright, he is a young man with thick eyebrows and big eyes.

The second senior brother, surnamed Bai, was called Bai Baishan. Although he was thin, he exuded an air of scholarly elegance.

In addition to the two senior brothers, Ranran also gained a third senior sister named Qiu Xier, who, like Ranran, was an incurable sickly child. Her family couldn’t afford the medical expenses and she was originally left to die, but was taken in by Shifu for treatment.

It was said that Qiu Xier suffered from chronic chest pain, but she was fair, plump and cute.

Ranran originally had doubts why Master Su would take in a sickly child like her. Now it seems that Shifu has an unusual hobby of collecting sickly children, probably to improve his medical skills?

The three of them were ranked by age, not by the order in which they arrived at the mountain. However, they were a bit puzzled about how to address Yu Chen and Yu Tong.

Su Yishui said, “They are also cultivating together with me, so they are considered as your elders, you will refer to them as Great Uncle Masters.”

The Yu siblings insisted that that was out of the question. Even if they became immortals one day, they would still be serving Su Yishui. How could they disrupt the hierarchy and call their Master as their brother?

After some debate, Su Yishui, becoming somewhat tired of these worldly matters, waved his sleeve and went to meditate at the top of the mountain.

After discussing among themselves, the younger disciples decided to call Yu Chen and Yu Tong “Great Uncle Master” and “Second Uncle Master”; the Yu siblings will still call Su Yishui “Master.”

They chose a day and the four young disciples knelt down together to offer tea and performed the ceremony of acknowledging the portrait of the Founding Master of Lingxi Palace.

Although Lingxi Palace had changed hands, the portrait of the former Grand Master had not been removed.

During the ceremony, Ranran sneaked a peek at the portrait of the demonic Grand Master hanging high in the hall. It was actually of a woman with beauty that exudes a bright aura. She was dressed in fiery red, riding a white tiger, with her jade feet raised high, an embroidered shoe hanging off her foot, and holding a large wine gourd. Her entire demeanor seemed frivolous and licentious.

How did such a female drunkard produce a disciple like Su Yishui, who is so strict and disciplined?

Xue Ranran privately thinks that her Shifu, Su Yishui, is pure of heart with no earthly desires, that he seems more like a monk in meditation. He does not seem to fit in with the old rules and style of Lingxi Palace.

Having produced such an unsatisfactory disciple and the Founding Master falling early to demonic ways, it’s no wonder that the Lingxi Palace has been on the decline year by year,

The three senior brothers and sister are all new to the Sect. Although Xue Ranran is the youngest, she has arrived a few days earlier than them, so she confidently led them to familiarize themselves with every corner of Lingxi Palace. She also introduced the ridiculous old rules on the walls, warning her senior brothers and sister to take heed and not to follow them at all.

The third senior sister, Qiu Xier, looked at the old rules with a face full of regret and muttered, “Alas, I wasn’t here for the good times…”

The second senior brother, Bai Baishan, is quite learned. He has family members who have practiced Taoism and is familiar with the past stories of Xishan. At this time, he vividly told his junior brothers and sisters about the history of their Sect.

It is said that the female demon possessed great power but was insatiable in her desires, and fantasized about dominating the Three Realms. She opened the gateway of the Demon Realm to usher in the Demon Lord to destroy the world.

This act was condemned by the righteous path, and the battle at Xishan at the time sent shockwaves throughout the world. The three major sects, together with many righteous fighters, exerted all their power to finally subdue the female demon.

Nowadays, Lingxi Palace is only a name from the past. Its already changed fundamentally, returning to the righteous path.

Qiu Xier sighed after hearing this, “It’s already been twenty years. Mu Qingge was also our Grandmaster. Even if she commit wrongs, we should not disrespect her in our words.”

The reticent eldest senior brother, Gao Cang, also nodded, “My mother said that we should not criticize our elders recklessly. We are here to learn skills, no matter what path of righteousness or demonic, we are on whatever path our Shifu is on.”

Xue Ranran also nodded quickly in agreement, although she, like Qiu Xier, felt that the old rules were better.

But when Ranran had accompanied the Second Uncle Master, Yu Tong, down the mountain to buy groceries a few days ago, she saw her haggling with the vegetable vendor for a difference of three cents for a long time.

From this, she could tell that the Sect rules have been set.
The first rule of Lingxi Palace today is: Be frugal whenever you can.

For this reason, she dared not eat too much at the dining table, fearing that she would be kicked out for being too wasteful. At the same time, for the sake of her own sensitive taste buds, she volunteered to take on the task of cooking three meals a day.

Yu Tong originally didn’t like these kitchen chores. In the past, she would just eat some coarse cakes with wild fruits to stave off hunger.

After all, to get rid of the mortal flesh, how could she indulge her appetite?

Since Ranran likes to cook, let her make what she loves to eat. In a few years, the children will probably start practicing fasting and cultivating.

As for food, make what you love to eat while you can!

After the new disciples entered the sect, they naturally had to choose the direction of their cultivation.

Generally speaking, whether on the path of immortality or demonic cultivation, there is no difference when they start out as beginners, it all depends on the eventual path of cultivation.

Most people practice the inner cultivation path of building foundation, forming the golden core, nurturing the Nascent Soul and ascending through tribulations, but this requires innate physique and serendipity.

If you have a natural talent and extraordinary physique, like Su Yishui, the cultivation progress can be rapid and ascension will not be far off.

But if you have an ordinary mortal physique like Yu Chen, forcibly cultivating will only extend your lifespan for a while, but in the end, you can’t escape the cycle of life, old age, sickness, and death.

Therefore, a small number of people take a different path, practicing refining and taking pills, refining immortal pills to help themselves ascend to immortality.

This path is not dependent on physique, but the failure rate is very high. The cultivators often toil until they are old and white-haired, just barely entering the beginner stage. There are also examples like Emperor Qin Shi Huang, who practiced until death without seeing any results.

The last is the crooked path similar to demonic path. For example, supplementing one’s spiritual form with the spiritual form of others, relying on absorbing the foundation building and golden core of others to supplement one’s own cultivation. The so-called yin-yang replenishment in the folk is mostly this kind.

However, there are also righteous people who practice this third method, capturing demonic cultivators who cause harm to the world, absorbing their spiritual power to enhance their own cultivation, which can be considered a righteous method.

Su Yishui adopted a laissez-faire approach to the four newly accepted disciples, letting them decide what they want to learn.

Among them, the two male disciples quickly identified the path of cultivating Qi and building foundation, as their talents are relatively good, this path is also easier for them.

The third senior sister, Qiu Xier, has a slightly worse physique, but she is also considered to have potential.

Only Xue Ranran is incompatible with the path of immortality, with an inner emptiness so vast that it echoes. Even Yu Tong was surprised to note that there are even worse physiques than her brother for cultivating immortality.

Yu Tong was very disappointed because of this – after all, Ranran was born from the spiritual fruit, but her physique is even worse than that of her previous life’s Mu Ranwu. It seems that she will continue to be mediocre in this life. Since she had been pushed off the tree early, this deficiency is permanent and can’t be rectified.

After some research, the two young girls Ranran and Xier, decided to take the path of refining and taking pills.

At the very least, Xue Ranran felt that it was quite cozy to be fanning the hot cauldron while refining pills and can even doze off a little. It’s much better than meditating and fasting or fighting and killing.

Since they decided to take the path of pill refining, they had to claim their cauldron. Qiu Xier received a brand new copper cauldron with a three-clawed golden lid with a copper turtle on top, which was very imposing.

As for Xue Ranran, it seemed that Shifu had ran out of money, so she was only given a black metal cauldon from long ago.

Ranran suspected that this cauldron had been damaged by fire before, as there was obvious repair marks on the bottom.

As for their Shifu’s partiality, Qiu Xier felt quite embarrassed and offered to exchange with Ranran. However, Ranran felt that it didn’t matter if it was old or new. After all, she had already been determined to be useless, and it was not good to hold onto a new cauldron and not put it to proper use.

When it came to test their cauldrons, the two of them refined the entry-level Qingxin ( Mind Cleansing ) Pill.

This type of pill is very effective in removing the irritability generated during meditation. The formula is simple, one just needs to match the medical ingredients according to the prescription and control the fire.

After three days and three nights, Qiu Xi er refined two shiny pills.

Xue Ranran also put in a lot of effort. She stared at the cauldron fire for three nights with wide eyes, until her eyes were red. When dawn came, it was finally time to open the cauldron and take out the pills.

However, when opening her cauldron, Qiu Xier took a sniff and asked with a surprised tone, “What a nice fragrance, how come it smells different from mine?”

Xue Ranran affectionately looked at the two pills she refined for the first time and eagerly said, “Our pills are just right for our two senior brothers to take to help them relieve the fatigue of meditation.”

The path of cultivating Qi and building foundation is a tough one, and the two senior brothers have been meditating in the Grass hall for three days with Great Uncle Master Yu Chen, so they could really use these pills.

Qiu Xier, taking advantage of her longer legs, ran to the refined second senior brother first and handed her pill to him solicitously.

Bai Baishan thanked the third senior sister, took the pill and swallowed it with water.

Ranran, who arrived later, handed one of the pills from her medicine box to their senior brother Gao Cang.

Unlike the second senior brother who swallowed the pill in one gulp, Gao Cang chewed the pill for a long time, seemingly reluctant to swallow it. Xue Ranran asked a little impatiently, “How is it? What do you feel?”

Gao Cang finally swallowed it reluctantly and said, “It has a seasoned taste… somewhat like soup-filled meat buns…”

Xue Ranran’s little face fell slightly – the Qingxin Pill should have a calming effect when taken, aiding in fasting. Why did the senior brother find it appetizing?

Could it be… because she was hungry while fanning the fire and had juicy meat buns on her mind, that caused the change in the taste of the pills?

At dinner time, the second senior brother who just came back from meditating in the Grass hall only drank a bowl of thin porridge to settle his stomach.

But the eldest senior brother, like a hungry tiger, ate up all the dishes on the table and still shouted that he was hungry. Later on, he even sneaked up in the middle of the night and started gnawing on the air-dried raw ham in the corridor where food was stored.

If Shifu hadn’t realized it in time and pressed his sleep acupoint, the eldest senior brother might have died from intestinal swelling due to insatiable eating.

And Gao Cang’s insatiable greed, is obviously related to the Qingxin Pill with the taste of meat buns.

The three days of meditation were completely ruined by the meat buns. Gao Cang not only failed to still his worldly desires, but his appetite was stimulated, and he couldn’t control himself.

When Su Yishui asked Yu Chen to carry Gao Cang away, Xue Ranran came forward to Shifu with a drooping head and admitted that it was her fault.

Su Yishui asked for the remaining pill, pinched off a small piece, sniffed it slightly, and put it in his mouth. The fragment melted immediately. Su Yishui’s body suddenly stiffened slightly, and he threw the remaining pill far away.

Even though his facial features were not clear, it seemed that his forehead was protruding high, probably… frowning?

Previous
Next


Xue Ranran squatted down sadly, picking up the pill that her Shifu had thrown on the ground. When she stood up, she made ready to be scolded by her Shifu. But Su Yishui was silent for a while and then suddenly turned and left.

Ranran didn’t feel relieved at all. She had been weak since childhood and had always been a burden to her parents. Now that she had finally found a way to learn skills, she was still useless, how could she not feel depressed?

Qiu Xier, unaware of her junior sister’s distress, let out a long sigh of relief for her and whispered, “It looks like Shifu can’t be bothered to waste words with you, hurry back to your room and hide.”

Xue Ranran silently put the remaining pill back into her box, planning to find an opportunity to recheck the formula and see where she had made a mistake this time.

She then obediently went back to her room, took off her jacket, crawled into bed to sleep.

But she couldn’t sleep because of the moonlight shining through the window. She was also worried about her senior brother who had overeaten, not knowing how he was doing.

After tossing and turning for a while, Ranran felt that the senior brother might want to drink some light porridge to nourish his stomach early tomorrow morning.

So she tiptoed out of bed, getting ready to go to the kitchen to prepare some porridge.

However, before she reached the kitchen, she saw a dark figure standing in the small kitchen from afar.

Ranran was startled, thinking it was the senior brother sneaking out again. But when she got closer, she found that the person holding a bowl and eating leftovers by the stove… was actually her Shifu…

She remembered that just the other day, she heard her Second Master Uncle Yu Tong proudly mention that their master had transcended the worldly desires and had completely entered the period of fasting from three years ago, occasionally eating petals and dew, absorbing the essence of the sun and moon, and had not consumed any worldly food for a long time.

But the celestial figure that Yu Tong had described was now, taking one bite after another, eating very deliciously…

“Are you hungry? Do you want me to make you some hot food?” Xue Ranran couldn’t help but ask.

It was only when she spoke that Su Yishui, who was immersed in the ham fried rice, became aware of someone behind him.

He turned his head quickly, looking at the young girl behind him with some annoyance.

That Qingxin Pill was too potent!

He had only smelled the aroma and tasted it lightly.

At first, he had only felt a surge of emotions after it entered his mouth, but after calming down, he didn’t feel anything amiss.

But when he sat in meditation at night, sitting on the grass cushion, all he could think about was memories from his youth.

His former Shifu, Mu Qingge, took him to stroll through the long streets of the capital city. Along the way, there was hustle and bustle, numerous shops, with brocade banners fluttering in the wind…

This demoness knew exactly which shop had delicious desserts and pastries, being one who loved to indulge in leisure. She bought a lot along the way, also making him eat a lot, while snickering and saying, “Eat more and put on some weight, once you become ugly, I’ll let you go…”

The laughter that ran wild in the streets pierced through the lonely quiet night, growing in the meditating heart like wild grass. And between the breaths, he seemed to smell the fragrances in those streets once more.

A sense of restlessness grew quietly in the silent night.

Su Yishui felt that he couldn’t calm his mind, so he thought of walking under the moonlight, but before he knew it, he had come to the small kitchen.

After that, he just continued to come in. He saw a bowl of cold ham fried rice on the stove, and he picked it up and started to eat it…

This act of eating, was like water breaking through a dam, out of control. And he was caught red-handed by this sick girl.

Ranran only had good intentions. She was afraid that her Shifu’s stomach, which hadn’t had soup or rice for three years, would get cold from the cold leftovers, so she thought of heating it up for him.

She did not expect that, in the next moment, Su Yishui suddenly grabbed her thin shoulder in a fierce grip.

Ranran didn’t have time to cry out before she felt the big hand gripping her shoulder as if it was about to crush it.

Just as she cried out in pain, she suddenly noticed that her Shifu’s face which came up close to her, seemed to melt away like sealing wax under hot water, revealing sharp brows and eyes shining with a cold light of the night.

Ranran ignored the pain in her shoulder and called out a low voice, “Shifu… your face…”

Right then, Su Yishui suddenly let go and took a few steps back, then said coldly, “What are you doing here in the middle of the night instead of sleeping?”

By now, his features had become quite clear.

Just as Ranran had imagined, Su Yishui’s appearance was as stunning as his posture and demeanor. Even though she could not get a clear look in the night, she could still see his tall nose and cold, starry eyes.

But… why did a man who should be in his thirties still have the youthful vigor of an eighteen or nineteen-year-old on his face…

It seemed as if the last twenty years had been frozen on Su Yishui’s face.

Ranran didn’t have the leisure to admire her Shifu’s handsome appearance, she just gasped and asked, “…Shifu… you scared me to death.”

Su Yishui said mildly, “It’s dark, I thought you were a thief. Tomorrow, I’ll have Yu Tong get you some ointment to prevent bruises.”

Hearing that her Shifu had mistaken her for someone else, Ranran felt somewhat relieved and coughed to remind him, “Um… Shifu, your face is showing…”

Su Yishui looked into the water tank, and indeed saw his long-lost face reflected back in the clear moonlight…

He seemed slightly startled, then took another hard look at the young girl holding her neck, frowned deeply, and left with a sweep of his sleeves.

Ranran stood blankly for a while, then she soaked the rice and prepared soup before returning to bed.

Early next morning, Su Yishui wore a mask made of ebony wood, covering everything but his mouth, seemingly still ashamed to show his face.

He specifically called Ranran to the tea hall and asked if she had mentioned anything about the revelation of his face, to the other disciples.

Ranran shook her head candidly. The incident had just happened last night, and since she didn’t share a room with her sister Qiu Xier and the others, she had no chance to talk about it.

And since she was now called over before breakfast this morning, she naturally hadn’t spread the word.

Su Yishui nodded and said indifferently, “The first rule of the sect is not to mention or discuss my appearance with anyone. Take it that last night’s incident never happened.”

Ranran did not understand why her Shifu instructed her so, but she obediently nodded. She was a disciple who could receive three taels of silver every month, and she held her Shifu in high regard as if he were a lord.

Since her lord Shifu had spoken, she would follow his orders without questioning. After giving his instructions, Su Yishui looked at her for a while longer, seemingly getting displeased again and icily said, “You may leave.”

However, it seemed that her fellow disciples had not learned this first new rule.

During the casual conversation at dinner, Qiu Xier regretfully said, “Our Shifu has such great charisma, it’s a pity that he’s not good-looking, and now he’s even wearing a dark mask… It’s said that cultivating immortality can keep one youthful forever, will our Shifu become more pleasing to the eye when he advances his cultivation?”

She had heard of the divine physician on XiShan since she was a child, and so many years had passed, yet her Shifu actually looked so ugly and strange. It seemed that the belief of immortality preserving youth was somewhat overrated.

This also made Qiu Xier, who considered herself not beautiful enough, feel hopeless about her future. If she couldn’t become an immortal, at least cultivating to be youthful and beautiful would not be a waste of the boring time spent fanning the fire by the pill cauldron.

As they spoke, Ranran was focused on eating. Due to the trouble caused by her Qingxin Pill yesterday, she hadn’t eaten well for two consecutive meals. Today, she herself made honey-glazed ribs and delicious fish soup, and was now enjoying her meal.

Hearing her senior sister’s words of envy, Ranran disagreed, saying, “Looks can’t be eaten.”

Beside her, the second senior brother Bai Baishan, who was picking up vegetables, joked, “Your pill can indeed be eaten as a meal, little junior sister. What flavor of pill are you planning to refine next time?”

Hearing this, Ranran’s expression fell. Their senior brother was still on bed rest.

Because of the trouble she caused, even her broken pill cauldron had been taken away by Yu Tong.

According to Yu Tong, Shifu had instructed her to practice meditation first. Only when she could focus without distractions and let go of all thoughts could she start refining pills again.

And their esteemed Shifu, who had now regained his youthful appearance, seemed very stingy about showing himself. He had gone to a cave on the north side of Mount Xi to meditate in seclusion, apparently not planning to come down the mountain for a month.

Since their Shifu was so diligent, how could his disciples slack off? So, apart from eating and fetching water, they spent the rest of their time sitting cross-legged in meditation with the Yu siblings.

Qiu Xier’s dream of attaining beauty had not yet materialized, but her legs seemed they are becoming bowed.

One day, as the young ones were practicing with Yu Chen, the copper bells hanging on the tree in the courtyard suddenly started ringing.

Yu Tong told them that these bells were connected to the spiritual shield at the foot of the mountain. The continuous ringing indicated that someone was breaking into the mountain.

Normally, ordinary people could not cross the spiritual shield to come up the mountain, but the bells kept ringing and eventually shattered into pieces to the ground.

Obviously, someone had successfully breached the mountain and entered directly through the mountain gate.

The Yu siblings exchanged glances, both getting up and preparing to go down the mountain when the intruders had already arrived in front of them.

The newcomers were a group of tall men and women in moon-white robes, appearing to be around twenty years old. But from their speed and ability to leap to the top of the mountain in an instant, they were clearly not ordinary people, but likely cultivators.

The leader was a man with a red exorcism talisman painted between his brows, wearing a feather crown, and with an arrogant expression. He cupped his fists and said, “I am Wei Fang, the chief disciple of the Jiuhua Sect, and I am here by the order of my master to request Master Su to head to Jueshan to subdue demons.”

The Jiuhua Sect was one of the three major sects that had besieged the female demon back then and was also part of the group that nearly leveled the top of Jueshan some years ago.

Back then, they were at a stalemate with Su Yishui, and since they couldn’t destroy the Reincarnation Tree, they temporarily agreed to wait until the spiritual fruit matured and fell before deciding the fate of the reincarnated female demon.

Now, as the twenty years have passed and the time for the spiritual fruit to fall is approaching, the three major sects have agreed to go to Jueshan together.

But unexpectedly, Jueshan has been occupied by the disciples of the demonic Wei Jiu, making it impossible to enter the mountain. If the situation continues, a fierce battle is inevitable. Therefore, Holy Master Kaiyuan of the Jiuhua Sect sent someone to invite Su Yishui, who is also considered a powerful ally.

However, Yu Chen has no good impression of these righteous cultivators and simply gave a perfunctory greeting, saying, “My master is in seclusion and will not be out until a month later. Please go back.”

Before Wei Fang could respond, his fellow disciples behind him indignantly spoke up, “Even the Jiuhua Sect is not being respected. Is Su Yishui being too arrogant?”

Wei Fang was also dissatisfied and coldly said, “It was your master who obstructed us in every possible way, claiming he needed to undo the Face melting curse, which is why our respected elders left the Reincarnation Tree alone. Now that the demonic Wei Jiu has been drawn here, your master is hiding and not mentioning the curse. Does he really want to live without a face forever and become a faceless immortal?”

These words were practically an insult, and Yu Chen, with his fiery temper, was not about to tolerate it. He made a lightning-fast move, intending to punch the man.

Wei Fang, as the chief disciple of the Jiuhua Sect, has cultivation far superior to Yu Chen’s. So when Yu Chen attacked, he quickly formed an ice spell and cast it towards Yu Chen.

In the next moment, Yu Chen was frozen in ice, unable to move.

Previous
Next

The Jiuhua Sect focuses mainly on water based spells out of the five elements, and as expected its disciples can manipulate ice and water extremely well. Seeing that their senior brother has froze that rash man, the rest of the disciples laughed heartily.

“Su Yishui is only capable of training such trash and he has the audacity to challenge us?”

This angered the few Xishan young disciples who had just arrived.

Senior brother Gao Cang was about to rush over, but was stopped by his junior sister Ranran behind him. Their Uncle Master hadn’t even made half a move before being frozen into an ice lump. These novice disciples who had just entered the sect, what can they even achieve?

Gao Cang thought that his younger sister was scared and just glared with wide eyes: “A man can be killed but not insulted! These bastards have bullied us to our faces, how can we be cowards?”

Ranran whispered softly, “Senior brother, aren’t you really good with your slingshot?”

Saying that, she reached into her waist and took out the pill that had been thrown on the ground by Shifu earlier, pinched it into several small balls with her fingers, handed them to the senior brother, and then pointed to the slingshot on his waist.

The slingshot was what he usually used to hit birds with. Seeing that his junior sister took out her refined pill, Gao Cang immediately understood.

He had eaten this thing and had been paralyzed in bed for a whole day and night! So Gao Cang quickly raised his slingshot and shot out his junior sister’s Qingxin pill.

Gao Cang came from a military family, so his slingshot was specially made and very powerful.

Those few small pills shot straight into the mouths of the Jiuhua disciples who were laughing heartily.

The pill melts in the mouth immediately, so those disciples couldn’t spit it out even if they wanted to, and the taste… was too delicious!

The few people smacked their mouths a few times, then glared and said, “You little brat, what did you shoot over?”

Just at this moment, Ranran calmly took off the snack bag from her waist, took out a handful of smoked jerky, and scattered it on the ground like she was feeding dogs.

Wei Fang raised his eyebrows, not understanding what the thin girl was doing.

But at this moment, a few of his disciples behind him widened their eyes, their nostrils moving nonstop. Finally, they couldn’t bear it anymore, they bent down and started picking up and eating the meat that had fallen on the ground.

The appearance of each one of them, were as if they were hungry ghosts reincarnated. Where was a trace of dignity from disciples of a famous righteous Sect?

Qiu Xier couldn’t help but clap and laugh: “Where did this group of wild dogs come from, no wonder they were barking so loudly, it turns out they were hungry and looking for food!”

Wei Fang was also stunned. He hurriedly scolded in a low voice, but those disciples continued to lower their heads and pick up food to eat, some had mud on their mouths but did not care, looking like hungry ghosts.

This also astonished the disciples of the other two major sects, Kongshan sect and the Mt Feiyun sect , who arrived later.

Wei Fang knew that his disciples had been tricked, and the dignity of the Jiuhua Sect was utterly lost by these disciples today. He could only compose his ashen face and put the few disciples who were picking up food on the ground to sleep by hitting their acupoints.

If he couldn’t regain their dignity today, how could he, as the tenth-generation eldest disciple of the Jiuhua Sect, have the nerve to go back to see his Master? Thinking of this, he actually pulled out his sword and rushed towards Gao Cang and the others with killing intent.

But just as the sword was about to strike, a wave of heat surged and he was driven back at once. Just then, the frozen Yu Chen was also freed from the ice that shackled him. Screaming and grabbing Wei Fang’s collar, he threw him far away with extraordinary force.

At this moment, everyone who broke into the mountain gate heard a clear and cold voice echoing in the air: “Xishan does not welcome distant guests, Su is in seclusion, so we won’t be entertaining you all.”

The voice was so very real, approaching closer and closer, as if someone was talking beside their ears, which made their hair stand on end. The disciples of the three major sects couldn’t help but retreat a few steps.

They knew that the person speaking was not nearby. This was the technique of thousand-mile voice channeling used by people with extremely high cultivation.

Thinking that Su Yishui, who was only thirty-six years old, when compared with common cultivators of hundreds of years old, he could only be considered a youngster; but his cultivation progress had far exceeded ordinary people.

Although rumors in the past ten years have suggested that Su Yishui’s cultivation has not recovered well, which was why he has been living in seclusion. Unexpectedly, the move he showed today is still beyond the reach of these disciples from sects with some reputation.

This was true especially for the disciples of the Jiuhua Sect, who were secretly glad that Mu Qingge had taken Su Yishui away from the Jiuhua Sect back then.

Otherwise, if there was such a talented junior in the sect, when would they ever be able to stand out?

Su Yishui obviously hasn’t come out of seclusion yet, and once again used the technique of thousand-mile voice channeling to emit a piercing long shrill, sending the uninvited guests out of Xishan’s mountain gate all at once.

One of those who came from the Kongshan Sect this time was a woman in her thirties with a beautiful appearance, but unfortunately, there was a striking slanting scar on her right cheek.

The scar-faced woman was shaken out of the mountain gate and channeling her qi, stood on the treetops. She also used her spiritual power to send a message to the top of Xishan, saying, “Yishui, we bear no ill intentions in coming here. My Master also invites you to come forward to jointly resist the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu. You surely don’t want the tragedy of the past to happen again… The disciples of the Jiuhua Sect were a bit reckless and impolite. I will apologize to you on their behalf!”

After saying this, she took a long hard look at the Xishan peak covered by lush greenery, hoping for a response from Su Yishui.

However, after waiting for a long time, the mountain top remained silent. The woman showed a most wistful look and left with the disciples of the Kongshan Sect.

Yu Chen, who had practiced with his master in the past, was now the Uncle Master of Gao Cang and Bai Boshan. He was upset that he didn’t perform well today, almost losing his dignity before the younger generation. After shaking off the water droplets from his body and clearing his throat, he angrily cursed the disciples of the Jiuhua Sect for being treacherous and hateful for launching a sneak attack, causing him to fall into their trap.

If they were real men, they should come back and have a fair fight with him for three hundred rounds.

Ranran, being considerate, immediately echoed, “Uncle Master, you were just going easy on them because they are young. Later, I’ll make you a delicious sweet red bean soup to prevent you from catching a cold.”

After easily easing what is an awkward situation, she naturally won the favor of her Uncle Master. Yu Chen smiled at Ranran satisfactorily, shook off the water from his body again, and went to the meditation room to practice his cultivation earnestly.

At dinner, both Yu Chen and Yu Tong were not present, so the young ones ate together. As usual, the dinner prepared by Xue Ranran was delicious, and the fresh and savory braised meatballs were highly praised.

During the meal, Bai Boshan continued to show off the strange tales of immortal cultivation he had garnered. He asked his fellow disciples if they had noticed anything unusual when confronting the three major sects during the day.

Qiu Xier’s mother was a matchmaker in the town, so she was quite worldly and understood the nuances of male and female relationships. She rolled her eyes and said mysteriously, “That woman from the Kongshan Sect with a scar on her face actually called our Shifu ‘Yishui’… Why does it sound a bit …you know?”

Bai Boshan immediately looked at the third junior sister with approval and said, “Do you know? That woman with a scar on her face is the Great Elder of the Kongshan Sect, Wen Hongshan. The Kongshan Sect and the Jiuhua Sect are very close and their disciples often practice cultivation together.”

Our Shifu used to be a disciple of the Jiuhua Sect and had a close relationship with Wen Hongshan. At one point, they almost became an immortal couple.”

Xue Ranran, who loved to hear about the gossip of the older generation, asked while biting into a fried cake, “Then why didn’t it work out? Could it be that my Shifu was rejected because he had no face?”

Bai Boshan, who was well-versed in the history of Xishan’s immortals, dismissed the idea, “Do you think our Shifu has always been faceless? The name of Yishui Xianjun was so famous, who didn’t know it? How many women wanted to become an immortal couple with our Shifu! And there were even some men… In short, our Shifu’s charm was immense!”

Everyone at the table listened with sparkling eyes, and Qiu Xier became flustered, urging, “What happened after that?”

Bai Boshan first bowed with cupped fists to the ancestral hall of Lingxi Palace to apologize to the former GrandMaster, then lowered his voice slightly and said, “How could our former GrandMaster, the female demon, allow others to touch her favored disciple? Just like that, with a wave of her hand, she slashed Wen Hongshan’s face, and the wonderful fate of the immortal couple was broken in an instant…”

Xue Ranran couldn’t help but gasp, feeling that if the former GrandMaster Mu Qingge really acted like this, wasn’t it too extreme.

Didn’t she know that a melon forcibly taken before its time won’t be sweet? To disrupt someone else’s perfect marriage for no reason, it’s no wonder she ended up with a shattered soul.

“Have you all had enough?”

Just as the four of them were sharing the love history of their Shifu, a cold voice suddenly came from behind them—Yu Tong, the Second Uncle Master, was standing behind them with a stern expression.

Bai Boshan, who had been talkative, immediately shrank his neck like a quail.

Compared to the carefree Uncle Master, their Second Uncle Master Yu Tong, who was meticulous about everything, and was not easy to fool. If she found any fault, they couldn’t escape the hard labor of carrying water up and down the mountain.

However, this time, Yu Tong just glared at them and then said to Xue Ranran, “The Master wants you to go to the mountain top.”

Su Yishui had been in seclusion for half a month. It was unclear why he wanted her to meet him before coming out of seclusion. Xue Ranran quickly drank a sip of water and followed Yu Tong to the top of the mountain.

The path to the mountain top was all stone steps. If it were the old Ranran, she would have been exhausted and lying flat after climbing a few steps.

However, since she became a disciple on Xishan, her Shifu had not given her the root spirit water again. Besides meditating, her daily routine was just watering the small tree transplanted outside the window.

Perhaps it was the natural environment of the mountains that nourished her; she had never been so comfortable and healthy from her childhood until now.

Yu Tong did not use the riding wind technique, perhaps to let Ranran exercise her muscles and work out, so she accompanied her step by step to the top of the mountain.

However, when they reached the last few steps, Yu Tong did not go up but let her go alone.

When she reached the mountain top, Ranran followed the stone path to the cave entrance. Just as she reached the entrance, she smelled a strong scent of medicine brewing in the cave.

When she peeked inside, Su Yishui was sitting next to the cave entrance, brewing tea.

However, Ranran’s attention was drawn to a small bundle of white fluff curled up beside the tea stove. “Shifu, where did this cat come from? It’s so cute!”

For some reason, after Ranran spoke, the cat bared its teeth and meowed, although it looked fierce, it was a babyishly cute “meow”.

Su Yishui glanced at the cat still acting fierce and pointed to the table opposite: “I got some good tea. Sit down and have a cup.”

Perhaps it was because he was alone in the mountains, Su Yishui did not wear a mask. He did not even tie up his long black hair in a crown. It just cascaded down like a black waterfall, reaching his waist.

Beautiful people are always suitable whether with light or heavy makeup. Shifu, with his eyebrows and eyes exposed, was no exception. The disheveled hair that seemed sloppy on others became poetic and free-spirited on him.

Xue Ranran had previously listened to the second senior brother’s stories about the grievances and stories of their elders and found them somewhat exaggerated.

But now, looking at Shifu with his handsome eyebrows and starry eyes, she felt that it was quite possible for someone to lose their mind and slash someone’s face in order to compete for such an incredibly outrageous stunning man.

Previous
Next

While lamenting, she once again affirmed in her heart that not only can appearance not be used as food, but sometimes it can also drive people crazy and stupid—it’s truly harmful without any benefit!

Ranran didn’t think she would make any great achievements in the path of immortal cultivation; she was just seeking to eliminate diseases and disasters. In the future, when she becomes healthy, she will go down the mountain to reunite with her parents and marry an honest and upright husband.

The husband she is looking for is probably a sturdy and honest man. Someone as handsome as her Shifu, she can’t have him, she doesn’t dare to! Otherwise, she would have to worry about getting her face slashed, and she wouldn’t even be at ease to enjoy eating anymore!

Ranran may be greedy for food, but she never reaches out to ask for food from others. Since her Shifu is like a peach offering on the immortal’s table, she naturally won’t even consider it since she can’t even touch the peach fuzz.

However, even though he is out of her league, it’s still a pleasure to have a look now and then…

While she was lost in thought staring at her Shifu’s face, she absentmindedly picked up the little cat on the table that was showing off its prowess to her, and started to stroke its fur.

Although the cat was unwilling, the feeling of being kneaded on its chin and belly was too heavenly, and it gradually stopped meowing, just raising its paws and enjoying itself with squinted eyes.

Su Yishui didn’t remind his little disciple of her impropriety. After letting her stare at his face for a while, using his long finger, he gently pushed a cup of dark tea to her and said mildly, “Drink it.”

Ranran suddenly came back to her senses and picked up the tea cup with some embarrassment. However, as soon as she took a sip, the taste that was a hundred times more sour and astringent than medicinal soup rushed straight to her scalp from her taste buds.

She instinctively wanted to spit it out but Su Yishui elegantly tapped her neck lightly with his long fingers.

Ranran couldn’t control herself and swallowed the weird-tasting tea with a gulp.

Being a girl who has always valued eating, even when she was starving, she would never eat something bad tasting. After all, even simple ingredients can still taste good and delicious after careful preparation.

Radishes and green vegetables can also be enjoyed in eight different ways!

But what was that tea she just drank? Was it scooped out from a cesspool?

Ranran wanted to vomit, but she couldn’t. She just opened her eyes wide, and her aggrieved tears came running down, causing the cat in her arms to start licking her tears.

However, after licking for a while, the cat also seemed to be overwhelmed by the medicinal smell as well and quickly ran away with a meow.

Su Yishui knew that the tea would be hard to drink, but he didn’t expect her to be so picky that she would be upset enough to cry.

Although he once charmed women all over the world, it was obvious that the Immortal Su had no skills whatsoever in coaxing women. After frowning at her for a moment, he got up, picked an orange from the citrus tree beside him and handed it to his weeping disciple.

Ranran, although good-tempered, really couldn’t bear it right now. She didn’t take the orange, but choked out between sobs, “What did you give me to drink?”

Su Yishui’s hand froze there. He frowned, then slowly peeled the orange for her and handed the pieces of fruit back to her, “It contains a few herbs. As for what they are, it’s better for you not to know.”

Ranran’s imagination ran wild, thinking of all kinds of beetles, snakes, lizards, and even spiders and bugs. She became even more frightened and anxious, and said timidly, “Shifu, are you angry that my pill disrupted your three years of abstinence from food, so you are punishing me?”

Su Yishui slowly brought the piece of orange to her mouth and stuffed the fruit in. He tranquilly said, “This medicinal soup is beneficial to you, so it can’t be considered a punishment.”

The tea she drank just now had contained dried molt from a thousand-year-old Black Scaled Dragon—a Scaled dragon is a deep-sea water beast with a strong fishy smell. Drinking water boiled with the molt of this mythical beast can conceal five-element spiritual energy.

She is a spirit child who fell from the Reincarnation Tree. Even though her adoptive parents had deliberately obscured facts and reported her birth year incorrectly, anyone who has a connection with the Reincarnation Tree would recognize the wood spiritual energy on her.

By drinking this cup of Black Scaled Dragon brew, this early-fallen fruit can blend in with ordinary people without being recognized.

Unfortunately, the side effect of this medicinal water are quite strong. For example, at the beginning, there will be a lingering fishy smell on the body. At this very moment, Xue Ranran feels that the smell on her body is unbearable.

Su Yishui didn’t seem to shun her. He even sat beside her and continued to feed her pieces of orange without batting an eye.

Ranran came back to her senses, refusing his feeding, but she accepted the orange even though she had no appetite.

“What…… were you thinking about when you were making that Qingxin Pill?” Su Yishui suddenly asked.

After overcoming the initial fishy smell, Ranran finally managed to calm down and said, “…I was thinking about meat buns…”

“And what else?”

Xue Ranran thought for a moment, and found that she couldn’t help but reveal her inner thoughts under his clear and water-like gaze, “I was also thinking… what does Shifu really look like, whether you are as good-looking as your bearing…”

Hearing this, Su Yishui didn’t reprimand her for being frivolous, but just asked quietly, “Are you satisfied with my appearance?”

Ranran shyly nodded her head—how could she just be satisfied? Having such a beautifully ethereal immortal as a Shifu is truly a blessing of three lifetimes!

Su Yishui seemed pleased. He also nodded and said to her, “Remember what I told you, don’t mention to anyone about me regaining my appearance and don’t talk about what I asked you to do on the mountain top.”

Ranran had already gotten used to her Shifu’s mysterious ways and just obediently acknowledged his instructions.

Although Shifu did not admit that he was punishing her, the fact remained that it definitely seemed like a punishment. Since coming down from the top of Xishan, the usually optimistic and cheerful Ranran had never felt so depressed.

Why did the delicious red bean cake taste like raw fish scales when it entered her mouth?

Afraid that the smell on her body would bother her senior brothers, Xue Ranran simply took sick leave and hid in her room without coming out.

But it wasn’t long before Gao Cang, Qiu Xier themselves couldn’t stand it anymore.

Qiu Xier said through the window to Ranran, who was hiding in her blanket, “Little junior sister, if you don’t come out to cook soon, we are all going to die on the path to immortality. Do you know? The Second Uncle Master has been feeding us radishes for three meals in a row. Those radishes are all burnt with a bitter taste, we really can’t take it anymore!”

Ranran replied in a muffled voice, “There are ingredients in the kitchen. If Second Uncle Master’s cooking is bad, you can cook for the senior brothers!”

Qiu Xi thought of Ranran’s braised meatballs and stir-fried sweet beets with almonds, and she couldn’t help but swallow her saliva. She couldn’t admit that her cooking skills were even worse than their second uncle Master, could she?

Fortunately, when Ranran woke up three days later, she suddenly found that the strange smell on her body had dissipated. She took out some dried sweet potatoes from her snack jar and ate a handful with relish, then sighed regretfully.

It is said that after forming a golden core and ascending after attaining a nascent soul, one can no longer distinguish the flavors of sour, sweet, bitter, and spicy. What was so great about immortality without any desires?

She couldn’t taste delicious foods on her tongue for just three days and already felt like dying. Would those immortal beings feel regret looking at the worldly pleasures when they see them?

But Ranran’s days of slacking off were over. Her Shifu finally came down from the top of the mountain. He ended his seclusion early and headed to Jueshan.

It seems that the commotion of the three major sects was useful after all. Su Yishui decided to take matters into his own hands and meet Wei Jiu in Jueshan.

Jueshan was Ranran’s hometown, so it was nice to go back and have a look. Before leaving, she even took the time to go down the mountain to see her parents.

Although it was just a brief meeting in a thatched resting shed at the foot of the mountain, it was all the more precious.

Qiaolian and her husband, Xue Liangui, had rented a shop in a nearby town. They sold beancurd for breakfast every morning. Carpenter Xue helped grind beans and tended the stove in the morning, and during the day, he went around to take on some odd jobs of repairing wooden utensils.

Although it was hard work, they earned more than when they were in Juefeng Village. Qiaolian could only see her daughter once a month, so the several packages she brought were always stuffed full.

Newly made flower jackets, quilts with new cotton wadding, all kinds of candied fruits and dried meat snacks, homemade salted vegetable shreds stir-fried with meat, plus salty duck eggs oozing with golden oils. If the food was not good, one can finish two bowls of rice with these.

Since she didn’t know what the meals were like on the mountain, Qiaolian was afraid her darling daughter would be hungry there.

When she heard that Ranran was going to Jueshan with Master Su, Qiaolian and her husband also wanted to go.

However, Ranran said that her Shifu was also going to teach them the technique of riding the wind on this trip, so they would be walking all the way, which would probably be very exhausting.

Moreover, with so many young disciples of the same age from the sect, if she is the only one bringing her parents, it might make her seniors feel resentful.

Hearing this, Qiaolian felt a pang of heartache again. If it weren’t for seeing her daughter looking like a sprout nourished by immortal dew, with her cheeks becoming plump and growing much taller, she really wanted to take her daughter home immediately.

Qiaolian secretly instructed her daughter not to take cultivating and learning the way of the Tao too seriously. After all, Ranran would still have to leave the sect to get married in the future. If she was tired, she should plead with her Shifu and pay for a donkey with her own money to rest her feet.

Saying this, she also stuffed the three taels of silver that her daughter had specifically received from the second uncle master back into her arms, telling her not to make herself suffer when she was away from home.

Ranran naturally refused to take it back, but Qiaolian was somewhat annoyed, “Your father and I have hands and feet and we earn enough money now. As the old saying goes, ‘A family should be frugal but bring more money on a journey!’ If you have more silver on you, your father and I can be more at ease!”

Thus, Ranran could only keep it, but she wouldn’t spend it. She wanted to save money to build a big house for her parents.

The carpenter couple couldn’t enter the mountain, so Ranran had to carry the things back by herself. The packages were too heavy. Her steps up the mountain gradually slowed down.

Fortunately, her senior brothers Gao Cang and Bai Baishan “just happened” to go down the mountain for a stroll and helped their junior sister carry things.

When young men and women are together, even if there is no exchange of glances, some feelings of affection and ambiguity will arise.

Apart from the stingy second uncle master on the mountain, there were only two girls, Qiu Xier and Xue Ranran. Although Qiu Xier was not ugly, she had a chronic heart disease, her lips were slightly purple and her figure was not very graceful.

Ranran, who had recovered a bit, had red lips and white teeth and her bright eyes were full of charm. Such a graceful young girl, wouldn’t every gentleman would want to try to pursue her?

Gao Cang was still naive and only knows that he feels very happy when he saw his junior sister, and his voice unconsciously raised when he spoke.

The second senior brother Bai Baishan, who was well-versed in human affairs, although he joked with Qiu Xier, he would also specially look at Xue Ranran to see if she looked at him with adoring eyes after he showed off his knowledge of immortal history and legends.

Now that he had the opportunity to show off in front of his junior sister, both senior brothers were very diligent.

Gao Cang rolled up his sleeves, revealing his strong and firm muscles. He carried all the packages on his body like a strutting rooster, walking briskly in front of Ranran.

Bai Baishan was beside his junior sister, from time to time telling her about some comical moments from their cultivation practice, making Ranran smile in delight.

The scene of two young men and a young girl frolicking and chasing each other in the mountains was indeed pleasing to the eye.

At least to Yu Tong, who was standing halfway up the mountain, felt as if she had returned to twenty years ago when Lingxi Palace had been full of handsome young men.

Feeling nostalgic, she couldn’t help but mutter to herself, “Xishan has been quiet for too long, even the birds haven’t heard such hearty laughter for a long time…”

Her Master, who was standing in front of her, was also looking down the mountain—the considerate female disciple was taking out her handkerchief to wipe the sweat from her senior brother’s forehead!

Previous
Next

By rights, a harmonious relationship among the disciples should be comforting to the Master.

However, when Gao Cang and the others climbed to the top of the mountain with smiles on their faces, they found their Shifu standing in the middle of the mountain path, wearing an ebony wooden mask, looking at them with a stern gaze.

The joyful atmosphere immediately dissipated. They quickly bowed to greet their Shifu.

But Su Yishui’s mouth seemed to have melted as well, standing in the middle of the road, silent for a long while.

At this point, Gao Cang and Bai Baishan secretly glanced at each other, wondering if their Shifu was angry.

Xue Ranran stood behind her two senior brothers, was only able to tiptoe and look over their shoulders at their Shifu.

Now their Shifu no longer wore a veil, but always wore a dark mask that covered most of his face, and his tightly pursed lips did not reveal any emotions.

Just as the young disciples were feeling uneasy, Su Yishui slowly spoke and asked the two male disciples, “Xue Ranran went down the mountain to visit her mother, why did you two follow?”

Gao Cang honestly said, “We were worried that our little junior sister would get tired, so we specially helped her carry her things.”

Su Yishui nodded and said, “Helping fellow disciples… very good. However, if you had been diligent in your studies, you should have some foundation in your footwork by now. Why then did you walk so slowly when climbing the mountain? Go, exchange the baggage in your hands for a sandbag weighing twenty jin and climb up and down twenty times.”

Hearing their Shifu’s words, both senior brothers wailed in unison.

Although Xishan is not very high, it is extremely steep, and it takes a lot of effort to climb up and down once. But now, their Shifu told them to carry a sandbag up and down twenty times, which is very likely to kill them of exhaustion halfway up the mountain.

Xue Ranran listened to this and felt that the sudden misfortune of her two senior brothers was related to helping her carry her things.

So she softly pleaded on the side, “It’s my fault for asking the two senior brothers for help…”

Although the two senior brothers actually came uninvited, they were kind-hearted but ended up in such a tragic state. Ranran wanted to plead for them.

However, Su Yishui flatly said, “Oh. And you, spending more time in the kitchen than in the alchemy room every day. I remember that I accepted a disciple, not a cook. Go! Copy the alchemy formula three times. If you can’t finish copying before we set off, take the stationery with you and write while we’re on the road!”

Copying that thick alchemy formula book once, would take three days.

Now, all three disciples kept their mouths shut, and dejectedly went up the mountain. They then proceeded to receive their punishment individually.

Although Xue Ranran felt a bit down initially by the punishment, but upon further thought, she realized that her Shifu’s words was very reasonable.

Her senior sister Qiu Xi had already started refining a higher-level pill, the Calming Pill, and she hadn’t even touched the alchemy cauldron yet!

Thinking this way, she willingly accepted the punishment. While copying and learning the medicinal formulas by heart, she could take the opportunity to practice her calligraphy and revise her homework, so her mood actually improved as she was writing. When Yu Tong passed by the study, she even heard the young girl humming a tune from Jueshan.

That clear and soft voice was sweet to the ears.

Yu Tong smiled as she looked through the window, but the sight of the girl propping her chin with one hand and writing elegantly made her feel like she was in a daydream. She felt the scene was somewhat familiar, but she couldn’t pinpoint which part of her distant memories it was from…

When it was time for dinner, the two brothers who had climbed the mountain, left half alive, staggered into the dining hall and struggled to get to the dining table.

Xue Ranran, who had written too much, felt a bit sore in her wrist when holding chopsticks. Fortunately, it was the Second uncle master Yu Tong who was the main cook today, so there was no regret even if she ate a few bites less. She just closed her eyes and swallowed a few mouthfuls of white rice to satisfy her hunger.

Unfortunately, it seemed that someone couldn’t put up with just that.

Since returning from his seclusion on the mountain top, their respected teacher Su Yishui had not yet recovered his cultivation from breaking his fast. He had already shared several meals with them. His appetite was not small, and he was quite particular regarding the variety of dishes.

For example, fish should not be eaten with raw items, and the knife work for cutting meat should not be done along the grain of the meat, and so on.

But today’s meal was not prepared by Ranran. Yu Tong’s cooking skills, which could make ghosts cry, turned a plate of stir fried green vegetables into a charred mess.

When not abstaining from eating, the immortal Su was quite particular about his food. After only one bite, he refused to try any other dishes and asked Ranran, “Which one did you make?”

Ranran bit her chopsticks and timidly said, “Shifu, didn’t you criticize me for not being diligent and forbade me to enter the kitchen?”

After being reminded by his little disciple, Su Yishui paused for a moment. He then put down his chopsticks and left the dining hall with big strides, his expression hidden behind the dark mask.

Yu Tong was quite distressed and muttered to herself, “What should I do? I just don’t know how to cook. If the Master doesn’t abstain from meals and he can’t enjoy his three meals a day, what should I do?”

Xue Ranran now suspected that Su Yishui’s previous abstention from meals was forced by Yu Tong’s cooking skills.

However, seeing the second uncle master so upset, Ranran still gently comforted her. Perhaps Shifu was preoccupied about going to Jueshan to have a decisive battle with the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu, which is why he had no appetite.

By the side, Yu Chen snorted coldly and said, “If the Master had not used his Golden Core to attract souls and wasted twenty years in vain, even ten Wei Jius would not be a match for him!”

Qiu Xier listened and asked nervously, “Does that mean that our Shifu can’t beat Wei Jiu now? Then… aren’t we going to our deaths if we go?”

Yu Chen slammed the table and said, “How could he not beat him? You’re underestimating the teacher, which is a great disrespect! He is a genius in cultivating immortality who formed his Golden Core at the age of sixteen! And the righteous path of cultivating immortality is to exorcise demons and save the world! In the face of evil demons, how can we be cowardly and afraid of death?”

Xue Ranran listened with wide eyes: When she initially sought to learn from a teacher, it was just for survival. If she had known that cultivating immortality also involved putting one’s life on the line, she should have considered it more carefully before becoming a disciple.

Her mother said she still had to leave the mountain and get married in the future!

Unfortunately, even though Su Yishui had abandoned the old rules of Lingxi Palace, when she first became a disciple, he emphasized one point: it’s easy to enter Xishan, but hard to leave.

Once you become a disciple, unless you are expelled by the teacher, there is no way to give up halfway.

As for what consequences there would be if one wanted to retreat and escape halfway, Shifu didn’t say. However, at that time, when they were meditating under the tree in the grass hall, a poisonous snake suddenly crawled onto the grass mat. The teacher flicked his finger lightly and the poisonous snake instantly turned into ash and dissipated in the breeze…

So Xue Ranran felt that if she wanted to repent and flee halfway, she would probably end up like that snake, without even a chance to become a bowl of snake soup.

In any case, no one can back down on the path of exorcising demons and eliminating evil.

Su Yishui seemed to be aware that he was going against the odds and so he did not seem to be in a hurry to go to his death. He took his time until almost the end of the month before setting off.

It’s unclear where he spent the thousands of gold taels from his medical consults. They did not even have a donkey cart when they set out.

It seemed that in consideration of the frailty of his two female disciples, he finally bought a horse when they passed through a village so that the two female disciples could sit on horseback to rest their feet.

As for the others, they all carried their baggage and wore bamboo hats, braving the wind and rain to move forward.

In Ranran’s large water bag was the root tea brewed by her Shifu, the same kind that cost a tael of gold per cup when she first arrived at Xishan. Every morning after getting up, her quiet Shifu would remind her to drink her medicine every time.

Ranran couldn’t help but feel touched. Although her Shifu was strict on a daily basis, he was considerate of his disciples. If he encountered an accident in the future during a confrontation, she, as a disciple, would definitely show filial piety by his sickbed, pull weeds in front of his grave, set up a memorial tablet, and burn incense, never abandoning him!

Su Yishui seemed very relaxed. He did not seem like he was going to exorcise demons, but more like a geomancer exploring dragon veins and burial grounds. Along the way, he would look at a rusty compass from time to time.

Later, when they passed through a forest of Scholar trees, Su Yishui stopped and instructed them to set up camp at the edge of the forest to rest for the night.

At night, after Su Yishui took a walk in the forest, he called Ranran, who was roasting sweet potatoes by the fire, to come with him again into the Scholar tree forest shrouded in the night.

Listening to the strange calls of night owls in the forest and seeing Su Yishui’s steps that seem unwilling to stop, Ranran felt somewhat uneasy.

After all, even if they were teacher and disciple, it was still rather improper for a man and a woman to enter the forest together at night. Just as Ranran was thinking about how to politely suggest to her Shifu that they should go back, Su Yishui stopped, turned around, and took off his mask.

With the full moon hanging high and the clear moonlight pouring through the trees, Ranran suddenly felt relieved seeing his indescribably handsome face and thought: It turns out that good looks are useful after all. At least when committing a crime, it makes others feel less hateful.

As she was staring at her Shifu and letting her thoughts run wild, Su Yishui took out a brocade bag and said to her, “Plant these seeds in the forest for me.”

Ranran took the bag and poured dozens of flat round seeds into her hand, but she couldn’t tell what kind of plant they were.

However, she followed her Shifu’s instructions and did as she was told.

After instructing her to plant the seeds under eight different trees, Su Yishui picked a large rock to sit on with his legs crossed, seemingly getting ready to absorb the essence of the moonlight.

However, he didn’t close his eyes, he just watched the girl digging holes and planting seeds while muttering to herself.

“Sleep well, drink water, and grow quickly!” her mouth formed a sweet smile and she seemed to be earnestly taking care of a group of helpless children.

Just as Ranran buried the last seed and was about to stand up, she suddenly realized that her Shifu, who was sitting down before, had been standing right behind her from an unknown time.

She bumped into her Shifu’s very broad chest when she turned around, causing her nose to feel a bit sore.

“Shifu..” She rubbed her nose and called out softly. Su Yishui looked down at her slightly tearing eyes, became silent for a while. His gaze was so focused as if something was about to surge out, but in the end, he said nothing again, turned and left.

The next morning after they had planted the seeds in the forest, they set off again.

Since they took their time and didn’t rush, it took them a full five days to reach Juefeng Village again.

The usually quiet village was bustling like a town these days.

In addition to the disciples of the three major sects and Wei Jiu’s sect, many other small and large cultivation sects also sent people.

The incident caused by Mu Qingge in the past stirred up a huge wave between the cultivation and demonic cultivation worlds. Now that the female demon will be reborn again, it naturally attracted attention. The great powers all wanted to know if the reincarnated spiritual fruit had repented and returned to the path of righteousness.

If she chose to join forces with Wei Jiu after she arrives, it would be a waste of the chance of reincarnation given by the heavens, and the righteous path would definitely unite to execute her.

Perhaps because the fruit was about to ripen and fall, a very domineering shield automatically formed around Jueshan’s Immortal Platform, preventing anyone from approaching. No one knew when it would fall, so they could only wait at the foot of the mountain.

However, there were only so many houses in the village. Although many of the great cultivators were not short of money, there were too many people, all divided into different sects, and unwilling to share a house. Those who came later and couldn’t rent a house had to endure the elements and sleep outdoors.

But Su Yishui’s disciple is from the village. Moreover, since Qiaolian left in a hurry, the house was not rented out yet. So they naturally went to stay at the Xues’ house.

However, when they arrived at the front door, Ranran found that the originally locked door was open, and it seemed that someone had already moved into her yard.

Previous
Next

Ranran was somewhat surprised. When she was about to push the door open to enter, Su Yishui pulled the back of her collar and made her stand behind him.

After Su Yishui pushed the door open, Ranran tiptoed to look over her Shifu’s shoulder and saw that it was the disciples of the Kongshan Sect sitting in her yard.

Because Wen Hongshan, the woman with the scar on her face, was also startled when she saw Su Yishui pushing the door open.

Since Su Yishui was wearing a mask, she naturally couldn’t recognize him at first. But when she saw Yu Chen and Yu Tong next to him and took a closer look at his figure, she recognized him.

Wen Hongshan’s voice trembled slightly as she softly said, “Yishui, you’ve finally come.”

At this moment, Ranran stood next to her teacher, looking at the Kongshan Sect disciples filling the courtyard, she thought that since Master Wen almost became her Shifu’s wife, she decided to ease up on her questioning tone.

She stole a glance at her Shifu beside her, to see if he wanted to catch up with Master Wen.

However, her Shifu, wearing a mask, looked indifferent, as if he didn’t want to take the initiative to greet her.

Instead, Wen Hongshan couldn’t hide an uncontrollable look of joy on her face and said, “How did you know I was here? What do you want with me…”
