Just then, Grandmother Huang, the neighbor next door, came over enthusiastically, grabbing Ranran and saying, “Oh, Ranran, how come you’re back? Where are your parents?”

Ranran politely greeted Grandmother Huang and explained that she had come back alone. She then asked, “Grandmother Huang, may I know why are there are people in my house?”

At this, Grandmother Huang looked a bit embarrassed, but thinking that Ranran was young and easy to fool, she smiled and said, “Recently, many people have come to rent houses, offering a lot of gold and silver. I thought it was a pity that your house was empty, so I rented it out for you. I’ll give the rent to your mother when I see her… Miss Wen doesn’t like being disturbed by outsiders. Are you going to stay for a few days? My empty house is also rented out… How about staying with me?”

Although Ranran was young, she was very clever and observant. She understood right away – Wen Hongshan had rented the house at a high price, and with no more houses to rent, Grandmother Huang had set her sights on their yard, opened the lock without permission and rented the house to the Kongshan Sect.

Realizing this, Ranran’s tone became less polite. She smiled and asked Grandmother Huang, “When my mother left, I don’t think she asked you to help take care of the house and rent it out. And how did you open the door without the key since the lock is so big?”

Grandmother Huang was at a loss for words and couldn’t think of a reply. Yu Chen, who had once received a bucket of slop from this old woman, was not very polite either and said, “Breaking into someone’s house is a violation of the law. I don’t think it’s as simple as just returning the rent.”

At this moment, Su Yishui, who had been silent, spoke up: “Miss Wen, the homeowner is back. Please move out with your people.”

Wen Hongshan had been listening to the situation from the side and realized that Grandmotehr Huang had rented out someone else’s house without permission. If that was the case, it could be easily resolved, perhaps just by paying double the original rent as compensation.

But she never expected that the young girl who is the homeowner had not yet spoken, but Su Yishui would be the first to ask them to leave.

Wen Hongshan realized that she had been mistaken. Su Yishui had not come to find her at all.

Her heart that was burning with hope, was doused with cold water. Wen Hongshan bit her lower lip and then turned to Ranran, saying, “I’m really sorry, young lady. Since we’ve already moved in, it’s really not convenient to move again. How about this? I’ll double the original rent as compensation.”

Ranran felt it was not appropriate for her to interfere in her Shifu’s old romantic affairs, so she decided to pass the hot potato to her teacher.

She replied obediently, “I don’t mind, but my Shifu doesn’t have a place to stay now either. As his disciple, I should offer my own house for my teacher, uncles, and brothers to stay in… Otherwise, you can ask my Shifu if he is willing to share the courtyard with you.”

Misunderstandings and quarrels between lovers are common. Ranran had often seen scenes of young men and women bickering in the village when she used to peek over walls.

If there were misunderstandings, it would be good to clear them up. As a disciple, she naturally wanted to help her Shifu bridge the gap, hoping to reunite the once-lovers and create a beautiful story of an immortal couple.

The path was laid out, just waiting for her Shifu to nod and take the easy way out.

Unexpectedly, when Wen Hongshan looked at her Shifu with hope, the man wearing the mask coldly said, “Yu Chen, see the guests out!”

Yu Chen has always obeyed his master, so he waved his hands at the Kongshan Sect disciples in the courtyard, saying, “Please move, go and get the rent from that old woman who broke into the house!”

Ranran sneaked a glance at Wen Hongshan, only to see her very pale, looking utterly disappointed as she muttered, “Yishui, you still refuse to forgive me? I… didn’t mean to deceive you back then…”

Su Yishui didn’t say anything else, clearly unwilling to say another word.

At this moment, the disciples of the Kongshan Sect behind her started to make a fuss, “We were here first, why should we give up the house to you!”

But Wen Hongshan said, “Shut up, all of you, follow me out!”

After regaining some dignity as the Elder of the Kongshan Sect, she led her disciples away with a grim face, one of whom dragged Grandmother Huang by the collar to her house to demand their rent back.

Ranran didn’t bother with Grandmother Huang, who was complaining about the lack of respect from the neighbors. After securing the main door, she went straight to her own room.

Perhaps the disciples of the Kongshan Sect thought they had paid for the place and treated it like an inn, leaving it in a mess without bothering to clean up.

She had always been tidy since she was young and didn’t like to share bedding with others. But now that her bedding had been used by others, she had no choice but to take apart the quilt covers and sheets for washing to avoid any lingering odors.

Su Yishui sat in a wicker chair in the courtyard, watching his little disciple in an apron with her sleeves tied up bustling about. One moment she was sweeping the floor, sprinkling water, and later bundling up a pile of sheets to be washed.

But the thin arms that had just gained a bit of flesh struggled with the laundry bat in the big basin, washing the sheets.

Earlier, Su Yishui had sent Yu Chen and Yu Tong to the foot of Jue Mountain to gather information, while Gao Cang and the others cleaned the house where Shifu was going to stay.

Their Shifu and the little junior sister seemed to share the same habit of not being comfortable living in a place with traces of others and needing a thorough cleaning.

After watching his little disciple struggle with the laundry for a while, Su Yishui casually asked, “If you wash all the sheets and quilt covers, what will you use tonight?”

Ranran looked up and wiped her sweat, saying, “My mother gave me a thick jacket, I’ll use it as a cover to sleep tonight.”

She paused and asked her Shifu, “I’ve washed all the sheets in the two rooms, do you have anything to cover with tonight?”

Although her Shifu didn’t seem to sleep much while in Yongcheng’s Xishan, he must want to rest well with the big battle imminent.

Thinking that her Shifu didn’t have any warm clothes, she quickly got up and went back to her room, took out her little flower jacket and handed it to Su Yishui, “How about, you can cover with this tonight. I’m young and resistant to the cold, sleeping in my clothes is fine.”

Faced with his disciple’s filial piety, Su Yishui was not appreciative. He looked at the rustic pink jacket and said flatly, “Are you saying that I’m very old?”

Um… How to answer without offending the teacher-student relationship?

If calculated by the age of ordinary mortals, her Shifu should be in his late thirties, right?

For cultivators, surpassing the life and death of mortals, being in their thirties and forties is just the beginning of their journey, so they can be considered youthful.

Moreover, her Shifu has the technique of maintaining his appearance. Pretending to be an eighteen or nineteen-year-old youth is no problem at all. It is true that he can hardly be associated with the elderly.

Ranran has always been likable since she was young, with a good affinity for elders, but she found that she couldn’t please her Shifu no matter what. Her Shifu seemed always be quick to find faults in her words.

Just as Ranran was thinking about how to compliment her Shifu’s handsome youthful appearance without violating the first rule of the sect, he instead stood up and said, “Let’s go, let’s go to the nearby market to buy some quilts.”

Qiu Xier was overjoyed to hear about going to the market, so the little disciples quickly got ready and followed Su Yishui out.

The market in town sells local specialties from nearby villages, but even the somewhat mediocre goods couldn’t stop the joy of shopping.

The youngsters like Gao Cang, Qiu Xier all bought various snacks and drinks. Ranran, as the big spender with three taels of silver, was somewhat reluctant to part with her money, spending most of her time watching others eat.

Su Yishui stopped in front of a ready-made clothing store and said to Ranran, who was following him in a pink floral jacket, “Let the tailor take your measurements and make a new dress for you.”

Ranran felt that her teacher was giving her a surprise test again, to see if she was extravagant and wasteful. She immediately smoothly replied, “Shifu, I have enough clothes. There’s no need for new ones.”

Behind the mask, a pair of critical eyes scrutinized the pink, rustic-looking girl in front of him. Su Yishui calmly said, “Change to something plain. It’s too garish for the eyes…”

Being repulsed by her Shifu, Ranran had no choice but to remain silent. But she thought her clothes were very pretty, specially made for her with the floral fabric picked by her mother!

However, young girls naturally like colorful clothes. Seeing Ranran getting lost in the pile of colorful fabrics, Su Yishui seemed unable to bear it any longer and personally stepped in to pick out some fabric for his disciple.

He rejected those gaudy rural colors and chose a piece of moon-white fabric. He also steered clear of the tailor’s eagerly offered dress designs, directly drew the style of the long robes he wanted, and instructed the tailor to make it accordingly.

Of course, as a teacher, he treated everyone equally. Gao Cang, Bai Baishan, and Qiu Xier also each had a garment made in the same style.

Because Su Yishui was very generous, the tailor turned a blind eye to his strange mask, smiling broadly and assuring that he would find more seamstresses so that the clothes could be delivered to their village abode by the afternoon of the next day for the brilliant disciples.

In addition to clothes, there were also small items like hairpins for the girls, all personally selected by Su Yishui. However, the prices of these items left them speechless.

According to the shopkeeper, these were precious items brought in from the capital, but because the place was small and no one recognized their value, they had not been sold.

Ranran silently watched her Shifu spend money like water, feeling that the rules of the former Lingxi Palace had a successor. Although her Shifu did not voice out his particular nature, he truly inherited the extravagant style of the female demon.

When he became fastidious, everything about clothing, food, accommodation and travel had to be of high quality. It was said by the second uncle master in a vague manner that he was the son of a Prince, raised in luxury and wealth, so it was no wonder that when he did become particular, he wouldn’t settle for anything less.

Previous
Next

Of course, she didn’t dare to speak such rebellious words out loud; she could only grumble quietly in her heart.

When the new clothes arrived, Ranran couldn’t help but admire her Shifu’s elegant taste. The seemingly simple moon-white robe, once worn, gave a sense of being as graceful as a fairy.

She unconsciously took off the pink floral hairpin from her head, re-combed her hair into a simple hair bun and put on the newly bought jade hairpin. Looking at herself in the mirror again, she suddenly felt as if she was exuding an immortal aura, and that her cultivation had improved significantly. She could surely refine the elixir of immortality if she started brewing now!

However, Qiu Xier, who was a bit chubby, was quite dissatisfied because the loose and casual moon-white robe didn’t suit her slightly plump figure, and no matter how she adjusted it, she couldn’t achieve the slender and graceful look that Ranran had.

Qiu Xier was very self conscious of her looks and didn’t want to wear it, but the second uncle master said that they were going to meet with fellow cultivators at Jue Mountain the next day.

At that time, disciples from every cultivation sect would wear their uniforms. Since their Shifu had tailor-made clothes for them, they had to dress neatly and not disgrace the reputation of Xishan immortal cultivators of Yongcheng.

On the day they had gone to the market, their two uncle masters went around to gather information. They briefly described the situation under Jue Mountain when they came back.

Some people from the righteous sects had already thought of a way to deal with Mu Qingge. It was said that Kongshan Sect had a Dragon Abyss used to imprison Jiao dragons. Once someone fell into it and was bound by iron chains, it was very difficult to escape from.

The head of Kongshan Sect, Wen Shitai, was the first to declare that no one should covet Mu Qingge’s cultivation. Although Mu Qingge had been reincarnated, which was a chance given by heaven, she had not made any mistakes in this life. It would be somewhat unreasonable to execute her, but to prevent her from causing chaos in the world again, once she was born, everyone would join forces to capture her and imprison her in Dragon Abyss, never to be reborn!

Other sects seemed not very interested in Wen Shitai’s proposal, and few responded, as everyone had their own plans.

The demonic cultivator Wei Jiu would pay no attention to Wen Shitai. His disciples had already occupied the northwest of the mountain, while the three major sects occupied the southeast. The two camps were ready for a battle at any moment.

The words of the uncle masters made all the young disciples quite nervous and unable to sleep.

The next day, before dawn, a sudden explosive sound came from the top of Jue Mountain. A beam of spiritual light shot up into the sky, breaking through layers of morning clouds and mist.

This tumultuous sound was quite earth-shattering. The next moment, cultivators who were staying in the village leaped out of their houses, lightly tapped their toes, silently recited the wind-riding spell to rush towards the mountain top.

However, there were also inexperienced young cultivators with shallow cultivation. Their shoes and leggings were not tightly tied, and the flying shoes that were flung off in a hurry were quite a spectacle!

Uncle master Yu Chen and Gao Cang felt that a big battle was imminent and their blood started to boil. They shouted and wanted to fly up to join them.

But Su Yishui stopped them and then turned to ask Ranran, “Is breakfast ready?”

Just out of bed, Ranran had slept in her clothes last night. She did not even dare to undress, fearing that she might need to rush up the mountain in a hurry during the night.

Hearing her Shifu suddenly asking for breakfast, she let out an “Ah” and hurriedly nodded.

Ever since the second uncle master Yu Tong made a few meals with strange flavors, the task of cooking somehow inexplicably fell back on Ranran.

Ranran always prepared the food the night before going to bed. In the morning, she could warm up porridge and small dishes and they could eat.

So, amidst the shouting and the flying of various cultivators in the sky, the seven disciples of Xishan Sect of Yongcheng sat around a table in the small courtyard of the Xue family, slurping hot porridge and peeling five-spice eggs…

Yu Tong’s concentration was always better than her brother’s, but seeing her master’s calm demeanor, she couldn’t help but remind him, “Master, if we arrive late and Mu Qingge is captured by Wei Jiu, or if she is executed, wouldn’t you lose the chance to restore your appearance…”

But Ranran knew that her Shifu had already restored his appearance and was not in a hurry at all.

She also felt that this was very well. As a person of the righteous path, if they didn’t show up, they would inevitably be criticized by others. However, if they charged ahead, they would inevitably be putting their lives on the line.

Shifu was so composed and steady, not being a show-off, filled with the solidity and reliability of being both a person and a cultivator, which was admirable in every way!

So she attentively served some side dishes to her Shifu, letting the honored master eat a bit more, so that when walking up the mountain later, his dantian would also be warmer.

But the eldest senior brother, Gao Cang, was full of passion for cultivating the true way and was so eager that he secretly signaled to Ranran to let their Shifu eat faster. If they were late, wouldn’t they completely miss those on the demonic path?

Ranran tried to lower her eyelids as much as possible, pretending not to see, and buried her face in her bowl of hot porridge with shrimp pieces.

After finally finishing breakfast, Su Yishui calmly got up and took his disciples, dressed in their new clothes, to the mountain for a fight.

Qiu Xier looked at her own clothes with some reluctance. Although they didn’t look good, they were made of precious fabric. What should she do if blood splashed on them later and it couldn’t be washed off?

As rookies who had just entered the sect, she and Ranran had no power to resist the enemy at all. They only had invisibility pills given by their Shifu in their arms. If the situation gets out of control later on, they could just take the pills and make a quick escape.

With the pills at arms reach, Ranran felt slightly more at ease. She was curious about the withered tree on the old mountain of her hometown, and even more curious about what the demonic revered Grandmaster, Mu Qingge, who had been reborn as a human, would look like.

By the time they reached the middle of the mountain, the shouts of killing were already shaking the sky. They saw disciples of the Crimson Gate in black robes all over the mountain, apparently determined to obtain the spiritual fruit that had landed.

The experts of the three major sects also joined the battle, fighting against a man in a black robe embroidered with gold threads and a gentle appearance in the air. The scene was extremely tragic.

Listening to Yu Chen’s commentary on the side, that man who was giving everyone a thrashing was the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu.

He was on the cusp of forming a Nascent Soul and was the person with the highest cultivation in the demonic cultivator world in a hundred years. He was good at using a pair of Qilin Demon Blade Hooks. Wherever the hooks went, flesh and blood flew and spiritual power was shattered.

After losing more than a dozen powerful disciples, all three major sects retreated. Right now, they were in a tight spot.

Wei Fang of the Jiuhua Sect had one arm sliced by that hook and was bloodied and unable to move. The head of the Jiuhua Sect, Kaiyuan Zhenren, stood in the front of the team, watching the battle in the sky with a grave face.

Just then, Wei Fang inadvertently turned his head and saw Su Yishui and the others coming leisurely. He immediately excitedly shouted at Wei Jiu on the mountain top: “Demon Wei! Your nemesis, Su Yishui, is here!”

Wei Jiu had been waiting for the spiritual shield of the Jue Mountain to disappear for a long time.

But as he led his disciples up the mountain when the spiritual shield disappeared, the righteous sects that had been lying in ambush all came up to kill him, like cockroaches and bugs. Although they were insignificant, they were extremely annoying.

Finally, when he had driven them back, he suddenly heard such a shout. He raised his eyebrows, looked in the direction of the sound, and indeed saw his old enemy, Su Yishui.

Back then, he had wanted to enter the sect of Mu Qingge and had knelt in front of Yongcheng Xishan’s mountain gate for one day and night. However, Mu Qingge only glanced at him and casually dismissed him with the words, “There is no master and disciple fate, do not force it.”

But after that, Mu Qingge went out of her way and did everything she could, to forcibly take Su Yishui, a disciple from another sect, under her wing.

This dumped a bucket of cold water on his zeal at that time.

People had always said that Mu Qingge liked to take in beautiful orphans as disciples. He was an orphan without parents and his appearance was impeccable. Why did Mu Qingge show undisguised disdain when she looked at him?

And that Su Yishui was not even an orphan at all. He was the illegitimate son of the once powerful Prince Ping, a noble child raised privately in luxury. But he had been favored by Mu Qingge, who taught him everything she knew!

It would seem that no matter how high one’s cultivation is, it is hard to escape the worldly practice of being a snob!

From then on, the already radical Wei Jiu became even more bitter, so he turned to the Crimson Gate to practice demonic cultivation. Along this path, he endured hardships and even committed the act of killing his master and stealing his cultivation, all for the sake of forming a Nascent Soul as soon as possible. Because he wanted to let Mu Qingge see what kind of genius she had missed back then. He also wanted to make Mu Qingge taste regret.

But he believed that when Mu Qingge was besieged by the three major righteous sects, she must have regretted it, right? Taking in a rebellious traitor like Su Yishui was truly digging her own grave!

Now hearing the shout of the Jiuhua Sect disciple, could it be that the world still thought that he, Wei Jiu, that his abilities were still below Su Yishui’s?

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu couldn’t help but laugh loudly. He then leaped up, charging straight towards Su Yishui.

The Qilin Double Hooks shone with cold light, bringing a force of a thousand pounds fiercely. If struck, muscles and bones in the entire body would shatter and the spiritual power would also be greatly damaged.

Looking at Su Yishui, he showed no intention of fighting back and stood calmly in the wind.

When Wei Jiu attacked, he did not dodge, but simply took out a piece of black wooden square plaque and held it up high.

It was inevitable that the people around would break into a cold sweat for Su Yishui. Yu Chen was even more than eager to rush up to block the fatal blow for his master.

Who would have thought that when Wei Jiu saw the intricate carvings on the plaque, he suddenly pulled back his attack. As he turned around, he asked in a low voice with furrowed brows, “Is what you have in your hand the key to the spiritual spring of the underworld?”

As soon as he said this, the people who heard it paled in fear – the spiritual spring of the underworld was previously just a legend in the cultivation world, but Mu Qingge had turned the legend into reality. She not only broke into the underworld, found the spiritual spring, but also released the demon child that brought disaster to the world.

The underworld is not the land of the dead as discussed by ordinary mortals and the spiritual spring contains the source of endless extreme yin spiritual power. Su Yishui, who accompanied Mu Qingge into the underworld at that time, gained a great increase in spiritual power because of this. Back then, he formed his golden core even before he had reached the age of sixteen, and his cultivation speed was so rapid that it was astonishing.

Afterwards, many people wanted to learn the secrets of the spiritual spring of the underworld from him, but Su Yishui never mentioned it. After retreating into seclusion, outsiders could not even see him, let alone ask.

For demonic cultivators who absorb others’ spiritual power to enhance their cultivation, they are willing to use everything to exchange for the key to the door of the spiritual spring of the underworld.

And Wei Jiu, who always took the shortcuts of the demonic way, naturally made every effort to seek this secret realm that could allow him to ascend in a day.

Unfortunately, with the execution of Mu Qingge, the whereabouts of the key became a mystery, and no one has ever visited the spiritual spring again.

Wei Jiu had seen the pattern of the key to the underworld in ancient bamboo texts, so as soon as he saw what was in Su Yishui’s hand, he immediately stopped.

Previous
Next

Back when Mu Qingge was about to be annihilated, only Su Yishui was by her side. It would make sense if he obtained this secret key from her.

Hearing Wei Jiu’s question, Su Yishui tranquilly said, “Exactly. Without this item, it would be impossible for mortals to find the gate to the Netherworld in their lifetime.”

Wei Jiu’s eyes were fixed on the plaque and he slowly smiled, his eyes gleaming with an evil light, “Su, are you proposing a deal with me by taking out this item?”

Su Yishui held the key in his hand and said, “I came here today to make a Soul Oath with Master Wei. As long as Master Wei agrees, I will give this item to you.”

This statement stunned not only Wei Jiu, but also the people from other sects.

Even the always composed Master Kaiyuan of the Jiuhua Sect exclaimed in frustration, “Su Yishui, have you gone mad?”

If Wei Jiu really found the Netherworld spring and formed his Nascent Soul, no one would be able to match him. Wouldn’t that mean the demonic path would then dominate the world of cultivation?

When the three realms descend into chaos, how will the righteous path be able to fight back?

Wei Jiu was also wary and asked, “What kind of Soul Oath do you want me to make?”

Su Yishui said solemnly, “You can’t have both the fish and the bear’s paw. If Master Wei wants to explore the Netherworld, you must not seek to harm the spirit child born from the reincarnation tree. You must swear to withdraw your people from Jue Mountain immediately and never harm the life of the reincarnation tree’s spirit child, nor use it to cultivate or benefit yourself. If you break this Oath, you will incur heavenly tribulation and will never be reborn.”

Cultivators do not make Soul Oaths lightly, because once made, the pact becomes binding and true.

Su Yishui was clearly forcing him to give up the soon-to-be-born Mu Qingge in exchange for the key to the Netherworld.

Wei Jiu wouldn’t have cared about exchanging with anything else, but the Netherworld’s spiritual spring was too tempting.

Although Mu Qingge’s spiritual power was extremely yin, it couldn’t be compared to that ancient secret place. Moreover, he knew that the reincarnation tree bore two fruits. The first one, although weaker, had already taken some of the spiritual power. The whereabouts of that fruit were unknown, and he might not meet the conditions for ascending even if he took all the spiritual power from the later-born fruit.

If what Su Yishui said was true, of course, it would be best to get the key.

As for Mu Qingge, Wei Jiu knew that his feelings for her were more complicated. For cultivators, time is long, and waiting was definitely not going to be an issue.

He need only swear not to kill her today and not to harm her life in future, but what other plans he had in mind would not restricted by the Soul Oath! But… was the key authentic?

While Wei Jiu was doubting the authenticity of the key, Su Yishui calmly said, “I can also make a Soul Oath to guarantee that this key is real. However if you insist on fighting, I will immediately grind this key into dust.”

Wei Jiu couldn’t help but be agitated. The Netherworld’s spiritual spring was said to be a gate of nothingness and without this key, it was impossible to enter.

So he smirked and pondered for a moment before raising his eyebrows and saying, “If what you say is true, then I too, will keep my word.”

Just as the deal seemed about to be struck, those from the three major sects started to protest.

Master Wen Shitai of the Kongshan Sect, known for her fiery temper, shouted angrily, “Su Yishui, you were once a model of righteousness. How can you now engage in such treacherous impossible dealings with Wei Jiu? Stop talking nonsense and kill him quickly!”

Not only those orthodox sects, even Yu Chen and Yu Tong couldn’t understand. They felt that their Master lacked the vigor he once had when he wielded his sword. Not only did he seem to make preparations for nothing, but now he was even bargaining with evil forces. It was really hard to justify his actions.

However, Xue Ranran felt that her Shifu was tempering force with mercy, and his approach of using non-violent methods was truly brilliant!

She saw clearly that this demonic Wei was terrifying. His hooks were like hooks for butchering meat, tearing people’s bodies apart. If her Shifu were to confront him directly, wouldn’t he be at a disadvantage?

Seeing the old lady from the Kongshan Sect provoking and challenging her Shifu to sacrifice himself, Xue Ranran couldn’t help but raise her voice and said, “Even when the three major sects joined forces, they could not defeat Wei Jiu. Why don’t you appreciate my Shifu’s efforts to save you? If you could kill him, you should not retreat! It’s nearly lunchtime, and the situation hasn’t been resolved. If there’s a ceasefire, everyone can happily descend the mountain for a meal! Don’t take my Shifu like a sandbag on a dam, for you to place wherever you want to plug the leaks!”

Her Shifu must not act impulsively and rush forward. Otherwise, the disciples from the Xishan Sect like her would end up like rootless weeds, left to wither on Xishan.

Although Ranran thought she spoke loudly, her voice had always been delicate and soft . Her words carried a sweet and childish tone, softening the originally sarcastic words and making them sound more tender and aggrieved. Elder Wen, whose face turned red after choking with embarrassment and her head throbbed with anger.

Actually what Xue Ranran said was the truth that everyone was aware of. The three major sects had all gone to seek Su Yishui’s help, hoping he would take the lead in the fight against Wei Jiu and cut him down to size.

Their plan had been for Su Yishui to first weaken the demonic forces. Halfway through the fight, the three sects would then join forces to drive them back, thus adding another glorious tale of subduing demons to their legendary achievements .

Unfortunately, after his appearance was sealed, Su Yishui had became reclusive. His personality underwent a big change and he outright refused to help.

Later on, when he brought his disciples to Juefeng Village, everyone was relieved, thinking that although he had become eccentric, he had not abandoned righteousness and was not going to be just a bystander in this fight.

Who would have thought that at the critical moment in a fight to the death when the spiritual fruit was about to fall, Su Yishui would arrive late and even engage in negotiations instead of fighting?

Now, their intentions of using him as a patsy had been exposed by a young girl, making it hard for them to remain dignified.

While the Leaders of the Feiyun and Jiuhua Sects were also displeased, they had to watch as the situation on the mountain top intensified. If Wei Jiu didn’t leave and Su Yishui didn’t take action, they would have to watch Wei Jiu slaughter all the disciples of the three sects and abduct Mu Qingge.

As for the rumors of the Netherworld, no one knew the actual details, but back then Mu Qingge had still been killed by all of them after she explored that secret place, hadn’t she?

It’s clear that the most important thing at the moment is to drive away the demon Wei Jiu without risking a life-and-death battle, then make long-term plans after. Besides, in each of the major sects, there are great powers who are about to form their Nascent Soul, and they can’t afford any mistakes before ascending right now.

Master Kaiyuan spoke to ease the tension, “The item is in Su Yishui’s hands. If he is willing to give it away, he will bear the consequences. Master Wen, you need not be too angry.”

Master Wen snorted coldly, and after glaring at the soft-spoken young girl, she could only watch helplessly as Wei Jiu and Su Yishui made their Soul oaths with their blood.

After the oaths were made, Su Yishui threw the plaque to Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu didn’t waste any time. After giving the masked Su Yishui a meaningful look, he gave a wave of his hand and his followers swiftly descended the mountain, laughing strangely as they left.

At this moment, Jue Mountain was left with only the righteous cultivators, the stench of blood, and the scattered corpses.

After Wei Jiu left, Master Kaiyuan, noticing the grim expressions of the other sect leaders, said, “Yishui, you were once a disciple of our Jiuhua Sect. Although you were abducted by the demoness and strayed from the path, you are inherently good. Why did you choose to allow bad consequences to occur in future?”

He had just comforted Master Wen, and now he was the first to criticize Su Yishui for making a deal with the tiger. He was clearly trying to get the others to start in on him.

Faced with his former Master, Su Yishui remained as calm as he has always been and simply said, “If I can’t defeat him, why should I court death?”

This statement, left everyone dumbfounded again.

It did make sense. Su Yishui had sacrificed his Golden Core to the tree and later fought fiercely against the Elders of the three major sects to protect it. He seemed to have suffered severe internal injuries at the time.

Since then, he had rarely appeared in public, but often sent Yuchen and Yutong to spend a fortune on searching for millennial ginseng and other medicinal herbs for pills to replenish Qi, which are obvious signs of a depleted spirit.

But even if he couldn’t defeat Wei Jiu, few would openly admit it in front of so many people!

Such an admission of weakness made his followers, including Gao Cang, cover their faces in low cries of lamentation.

Putting such truth out in the open, if the major sects continued to blame Su Yishui for not fighting or risking his life, they would have no grounds to do so.

After all, the leaders of these sects had all wisely retreated, so how could they blame others for not seeking death?

In any case, the path up the mountain was finally clear.

Several sect leaders now coveted the reincarnated spirit child, so Master Wen gave Su Yishui a glare before leading her disciples, including Wen Hongshan, to the top of the mountain first.

The other sects’ disciples, couldn’t be bothered with Su Yishui now, also rose into the air and headed towards the mountain top, once again resulting in a flurry of shoes falling from the air.

After they have all gone, the always silent Yutong asked with trembling lips, “Master, all these years, you never told us… Has your internal injury not healed yet?”

Yuchen and Yutong hadn’t spent much time with Su Yishui over the past twenty years, as he often secluded himself in a cave on West Mountain.

Although Yutong followed his instructions to regularly purchase medicinal herbs from various places, she didn’t know what he used them for, only that his medical earnings was quickly spent, so they always had to be frugal.

But today, before so many people, he candidly admitted he couldn’t defeat Wei Jiu… He had always been a proud person, how could he so readily admit this unless his body had reached its limit?

Thinking of this, Yu Tong felt a wave of sadness. Hearing his sister’s words, Yuchen also realized the situation. Just now he had even thought that his Master was timid and weak. Overcome with remorse, he knelt down and choked out, “Master, we have failed to take care of you!”

With such a big scene, the four disciples also fell to their knees, their hearts filled with mixed emotions.

Bai Baishan felt regret for not doing enough research before becoming his disciple. Today’s events opened his eyes to the reality that there were always stronger men out there. He had always thought highly of XiShan’s renowned reputation, but now he realized that his Shifu was nothing in front of the other great cultivators…

Ranran felt genuinely sorry for her Shifu. She had heard many glorious stories about him in recent days. A natural talent, successful at a young age, it would indeed be lamentable if he became disheartened due to his injuries.

Looking at all his disciples kneeling, Su Yishui simply said, “Let’s go up the mountain.”

When they finally reached the top, they saw a large fruit had fallen under the Rebirth Tree.

The disciples of the various sects who had arrived earlier dared not approach it, warily watching the fruit.

Just as Su Yishui stepped onto the mountain top, the fruit suddenly burst open with golden light and slowly cracked open its shell.

Everyone was momentarily blinded by the light, and in that moment, a white cloak was suddenly removed from a female disciple of the Kongshan Sect.

When they regained their senses, they found that the cloak had already wrapped around the body of the girl, newly emerged from the shell.

Naturally, no man-made fabric would be on the body of a being born from a fruit. But in that instant of emergence, the girl managed to manipulate her spiritual energy to remove the cloak from the female disciple and wrapped it around herself.

This ability immediately made everyone wary, while also exciting them: True to her extremely Yin constitution, even after her soul had scattered and reincarnated, her spiritual energy remained undiminished. If one could make use of her, the benefits would be endless!

Previous
Next


Ran Ran stood behind her Shifu, squinting her eyes due to the dazzling light. As the light dissipated, she focused her gaze and thought, “What a stunning girl!”

The spirit child, now fully ripened and fallen from the tree, took the form of a sixteen or seventeen-year-old girl. Her features were as delicately outlined as if painted with a fine brush, and even without makeup, she was incomparably beautiful.

Qiu Xier couldn’t help but sigh, “There really is such a gorgeous lady in the world…”

Ran Ran nodded in agreement, but she also noticed that this spirit fruit girl bore a fifty percent resemblance to the portrait of their Grandmaster hanging in the main hall of Xi Shan. She thought it was about fifty percent because, although this girl was beautiful, she lacked the unrestrained and carefree demeanor depicted in the painting.

However, since her Shifu had criticized her taste as being too rustic, she felt she wasn’t in a position to judge such a beautiful girl too harshly.

And moreover, portraits don’t usually depict people accurately, so it seems that the person before her is indeed the reincarnation of her Grandmaster, Mu Qingge!

As for the young girl, after wrapping herself in the cloak, she looked around and, upon seeing the people around her, greeting slowly and said, “Long time no see, everyone.”

Seeing this, Teacher Wen spoke coldly, “You were shattered to pieces, yet you still carry memories from your previous life in this reincarnation. You’re truly extraordinary.”

The newly born girl gave a bitter smile and said, “Back then, I went astray and practiced the forbidden soul-transferring technique of the demonic path, which led me to commit many mistakes. It’s only right for the esteemed teachers to have taught me a lesson. I’ve been repenting for my sins while residing in this tree for twenty years, and I’m grateful to Yi Shui for giving me the opportunity to be reborn. This time, I will definitely correct my past wrongs and make amends for my mistakes.”

Her words seemed reasonable. At least the arrogant Mu Qingge of the past would never have spoken such humble words. It seems like being trapped under the Five-Finger Mountain like Sun Wukong for years has finally led to some repentance and education!

However, if one were to think about it, before practicing the soul-transferring technique, Mu Qingge of Xi Shan sect, despite being unrestrained, carefree and committed some minor transgressions, was not an evil doer.

Moreover, she once helped the then young prince, now the esteemed Emperor Su Yu of the Great Qi, ascend to the throne.

When Mu Qingge suddenly assisted Su Yu, who is also the uncle of Su Yi Shui, in winning the Great Battle of Fan Yao, she completely overthrew the then-powerful Prince Ping, laying the foundation for the current emperor to ascend to the throne.

Therefore, while the cultivation world shudders at the mention of Mu Qingge, in the secular world, her golden statue is still worshiped as the “War Goddess,” receiving offerings from the people.

Since Mu Qingge was always indulgent in worldly pleasures, whenever she was short of gold and silver, she would flatter the powerful and willingly get involved in worldly disputes, which is quite consistent with her character.

Such actions of clinging to the rich and powerful are also taboo in the cultivation world and are despised!

The once-ascended great cultivator, Yao Laoxian, once lamented that if Mu Qingge had been less infatuated with the secular world and more focused on her cultivation, she could have formed her Nascent Soul and ascended to immortality long ago.

And the drastic change in Mu Qingge’s personality, leading her down the path of destruction, indeed started after her return from the Netherworld Spring and her practice of the soul-transferring technique.

However, the people who had been guarding here for days and nights didn’t come to watch the drama of Mu Qingge’s repentance and reform.

Teacher Wen’s adopted daughter and chief disciple, Wen Hongshan, asked coldly, “You say you have repented, but you need to give everyone a convincing reason. Otherwise, you won’t be leaving Jue Mountain today.”

When Mu Qingge looked towards Wen Hongshan’s face, she showed a remorseful expression and said softly, “I am willing to sacrifice my spiritual power to heal the scar on Miss Wen’s face. I really shouldn’t have let jealousy get the better of me and scarred your face…”

Hearing her words, Wen Hongshan’s face suddenly changed and she stared at Mu Qingge without saying anything.

Among these people, Kai Yuan Zhenren was one of the kinder ones. He smiled slightly and said, “If Miss Mu is sincere in her repentance, that would be wonderful. We, the righteous cultivators, are indeed focused on saving others. However, to reassure everyone and to continue cultivating with peace of mind, it’s best for you to choose someone as your new Master and rejoin a sect. This would also be convenient for the righteous path to monitor and test your character, to see your sincerity!”

His words are exactly the intentions of the other sects.

Hearing Kai Yuan Zhenren’s suggestion, the others echoed in agreement.

Mu Qingge nodded and said slowly, “Since it’s Kai Yuan Zhenren’s proposal, I shall comply…”

She looked all around and finally set her gaze on the tall man wearing a black mask.

Although he was partially masked, his figure and aura were extraordinary. If he had once held a place in her heart, it’s likely that even reincarnation couldn’t make her forget.

Mu Qingge seemed to be filled with mixed emotions as she looked at Su Yi Shui and said softly, “Yi’er, it’s my fault. I had sealed your appearance. Now that I’ve decided to let go of the past and grievances, shall I release the seal for you?”

As she spoke, she raised her hand gently in a gesture to lift the curse. When she completed the gesture, there was no change in Su Yi Shui.

Just as Mu Qingge showed a hint of unease, his black mask suddenly cracked and fell apart in two pieces.

The face revealed was as if drawn with ink, with eyes as deep as the starry sky, and a high nose that gave his cheeks a clear outline. Looking at him, one truly understood what it meant to have unforgettable love at first sight……

Although many people present had seen Su Yi Shui before, twenty years had passed, and unless one’s cultivation had reached an extraordinary level, everyone had aged somewhat.

For example, Wen Hongshan, who was around the same age as Su Yi Shui, now had fine lines around her eyes.

But the man in front of them, wearing a somewhat old long robe, had an unmistakably youthful face.

This couldn’t help but make people envious, and some even thought that the curse might have the effect of preserving youth and beauty!

Ran Ran stood quietly behind, feeling like she was watching a bizarre drama.

Others might not know, but she was well aware that her Shifu, Su Yi Shui, had long since recovered his appearance. However, he didn’t reveal it and instead cooperated with the reincarnated Mu Qingge to perform a touching drama of past grievances resolved.

What undisclosed mystery lies within?

Ran Ran kept her mouth shut, choosing not to spoil the moment of reunion between her Shifu and his former master.

However, as an observer, she couldn’t help but notice that Mu Qingge seemed to breathe a sigh of relief and relax a lot after seeing Su Yi Shui regain his appearance, regaining some confidence.

It seems that even a once-glorious demoness, after reincarnation, still has some insecurities, fearing that she might have lost her spiritual roots and no longer possess the spiritual power from her past life.

The other great cultivators present were delighted to see this. The centennial heavenly tribulation was approaching and several sect leaders about to undergo their Nascent Soul tribulations.

Therefore, whether Mu Qingge was truly repentant didn’t matter. What mattered was whether this demoness, with her cultivation physique, could sincerely protect them and shield them from the fatal blow of the heavenly tribulation during their tribulation.

Now that Mu Qingge had lifted the curse she had placed on Su Yi Shui before her death, it indicated that her spiritual power had recovered well during her twenty years on the tree. She was a talent worth utilizing, and so one after another, they scambled to get custody of this demoness.

Mu Qingge listened to their oblivious discussions, as if she was merely a dog or cat, without any resentment. She spoke softly, “I have been reborn and all past grievances are settled. If you still doubt me and fear that I might stray into the demonic path again, I’m willing to voluntarily become a disciple of Su Yishui. You can trust his character and abilities and everyone can rest assured.”

It seemed that Mu Qingge was very grateful to Su Yishui for sparing her life in the past and guiding her remnant soul to the reincarnation tree. In this lifetime, she would become his disciple and serve under him.

Upon hearing this, the expressions of the crowd changed suddenly. After waiting so long for this ginseng fruit and suffering the losses of so many disciples, was it all to benefit Su Yishui?

At this moment, Su Yishui spoke slowly, “Xishan is just a small sect and I have recently taken in several new disciples. I simply cannot spare the energy to teach others. Moreover, you were once my Master. Re-entering my sect would disrupt the cardinal rules and fundamentals.”

With these words, the crowd relaxed. This young man Su had been lurking in the West Mountain for many years, but now he seemed more insightful than before, at least knowing not to meddle in this messy business.

However, Mu Qingge seemed surprised that Su Yishui would flatly refuse her request, her expression changing slightly.

She couldn’t help but look at the reincarnation tree—its spiritual power had been completely absorbed by the fruit in its final days, turning from half-dead to completely withered, showing no signs of the number of fruit it has borne…

When she gathered her thoughts again, she turned to look at the new disciples Su Yishui had mentioned—there were just four of them, none of them emanating spiritual energy.

Two male disciples were somewhat presentable, but the two female disciples lacked solid spiritual roots, especially the slightly chubby girl with purple lips, indicating some heart ailment.

As for the other girl, she was slender, a little fragile-looking, but with rosy cheeks and tender lips, exuding a cute innocence…

Before she could speak again, Su Yishui turned to his disciples behind him and asked, “Are you hungry?”

Ranran nodded vigorously; she had been hungry for a long while, anticipating a reunion banquet after the reunion.

Su Yishui turned back to the leaders and politely said, “My disciples are still at the foundational stage and young. They cannot endure hunger. So, I bid you farewell for now and take my leave.”

With that, he led his bunch of bewildered disciples away, gracefully departing down the mountain.

Mu Qingge’s eyes widened slowly, and in a desolate tone, she called out, “Yi’er!”

Unfortunately, the rebellious disciple is still rebellious, so Yi’er acted as if he hadn’t heard, continuing down the mountain without looking back.

Mu Qingge clenched her fists tightly, took a long while to take in a deep breath to calm her emotions. She then smiled at the leaders, “Since Yongcheng Xishan refused to take me in again, Qingge can only trouble you to give me another chance to cultivate the immortal path by the righteous way…”

At this point, Mu Qingge glanced at the folding fan slowly opening in the hands of Kaiyuan Zhenren…

After a moment’s thought, she said, “Kaiyuan Zhenren is the most trusted person among you. I am willing to become a disciple under Kaiyuan Zhenren’s guidance, reform myself, and return to the righteous path.”

These words made the leaders of the other two sects somewhat displeased.

Among the three major sects, the JiuHua Sect had numerous disciples and a formidable presence. If Mu Qingge joined the JiuHua Sect, it would further diminish the standing of the other two sects.

Although the ultimate goal of the righteous path was to transcend the mundane world, they still had to make a living in the secular world for the next hundred years before ascension. Seeing the increasing strength of the JiuHua Sect, the leaders of the other two sects were resentful and once again engaged in a theoretical dispute.

Mu Qingge understood that Kaiyuan Zhenren had ways to deal with the leaders of the other two sects, whether through persuasion or coercion.

So, she didn’t need to worry about how Kaiyuan Zhenren would convince them. She shifted her gaze to the mountainside, where she could see Su Yishui calmly leading his attendants and disciples down the mountain.

He… didn’t even turn his head.

Mu Qingge bit her lip hard—where had things gone wrong? Why was everything different from what she had expected?

Previous
Next

After she was standing silently for a while, the three major sects finally reached a decision: Mu Qingge would be supervised by the Jiuhua Sect on a daily basis. If she dared to act rashly, the Jiuhua Sect would immediately execute her. Otherwise, the other two sects would take over.

If the other two sects’ powerful figures encountered heavenly tribulations, the Jiuhua Sect would send disciples to assist them with all their might.

With this arrangement, everyone was satisfied.

It was only after the people from the other two sects had finally dispersed that Mu Qingge turned and smiled at Kai Yuan Zhenren. She glanced at the folding fan in his hand – it was painted with a picture of a white tiger lying under the shade of some banana leaves.

This fan was painted by Mu Qingge herself and had been taken away by the current Emperor, who was the little prince Su Yu at the time.

The realm of cultivation and the secular world are like water in separate wells, not interfering with each other.

Mu Qingge’s involvement in the struggle for the throne was already improper. And since Su Yu was the Emperor, even if he was grateful for Mu Qingge’s assistance, it would not be appropriate for him to intervene directly and provoke the future powerful immortals.

But how could he, as the Emperor, stand by and watch his benefactor from the past be reduced to a prisoner?

It was obvious that Kai Yuan Zhenren received this fan as a trust from the Emperor, signaling to Mu Qingge that he would take care of her on behalf of the Emperor.

That’s why, after she glanced at the fan, she immediately understood and chose the Jiuhua Sect to “supervise” her.

Sure enough, after everyone left, Kai Yuan Zhenren, with a smile on his face, took out a letter from the Emperor and handed it to her.

Mu Qingge took the letter and read it slowly. The gist of the letter was that Kai Yuan Zhenren was a trusted expert by the Emperor, and he would definitely take good care of “War Goddess” Mu Qingge.

Kai Yuan Zhenren has always been tactful in his actions, and it seems that he has had many contacts with the court of Qi in secret. No wonder, among the three major sects, the Jiuhua Sect’s reputation is the most magnificent, and its disciples are spread all over the world, with unparalleled strength.


Mu Qingge’s heart was reassured after reading the sincere words in the letter.

See, everything is going smoother than she imagined – Mu Qingge indeed had a notorious reputation. But as long as she is willing and put in effort, not wasting her innate talent, she can stand at the pinnacle of power and look down on all beings!

With this thought, she wrapped her cloak tighter around her and slowly exhaled in the wind: It’s really good to be able to live again. She will definitely plan every step carefully and live…… even more brilliantly than Mu Qingge did!

Taking a break from how the powerful figures on the summit of Jue Mountain has distributed the ginseng fruit for now.

Speaking of the early departure from the Xi Shan Sect, the first thing the master and disciples did after descending the mountain was to go into a town to eat at a restaurant.

Previously, because of Su Yishui’s sealed appearance, to avoid scaring people, the Yu siblings rarely went to lively places in towns when they occasionally went down the mountain with him.

Firstly, it didn’t fit the habit of cultivators who usually isolate themselves from the crowd. Secondly, they were afraid that Su Yishui would be ridiculed by those commoners.

But today, Master’s curse is finally lifted, and there’s no need to cover up with a veil or a mask anymore.

Yu Tong was happy for her Master, and coupled with the clamoring of the younger disciples, she decided to splurge on a lavish restaurant for a “Forever Young Banquet.”

Xue Ranran had already been hungry when they were on the mountaintop. When dish after dish of beautifully plated dishes were served, her big eyes shone brightly, and her chopsticks moved without stopping, practically inhaling the dishes, soup and rice.

However, Qiu Xier ate without tasting the food at all. She just stared blankly at her stunningly handsome Shifu, and finally clutching her chest, swallowed an emergency pill to save her trembling heart.

Goodness, Shifu is so youthful and handsome! How is one supposed to keep their heart calm and focus on cultivation?

While she was staring helplessly, Su Yishui suddenly looked up, casting a glance her way.

Just that indifferent glance sent a shiver down the spine of the infatuated Qiu Xier. Her heart beat even more intensely, but it was not palpitations but due to fright.

She dared not raise her head to look at Shifu impolitely anymore and just imitated her junior sister Ranran, burying her head in food.

After she was about a third full, Ranran resumed the demure airs that a young girl should possess. She stopped focusing on her own eating and drinking, and diligently served dishes and soup for Shifu and her Uncle Masters.

However, Shifu seemed to have not moved his chopsticks at all. His fasting periods seemed to come and go unpredictably. After they had left XiShan, he had only eaten some food cooked by Ranran when he was in Juefeng Village.

The rest of the time, Su Yishui would occasionally drink some water, but never seemed to eat anything bought along the way.

Ranran wondered if this was a side effect of eating the “Gluttonous Pill” she concocted, as Shifu seemed to only be willing to eat what she cooked.

Feeling overwhelmed with honor, Ranran also felt a great responsibility resting on her shoulders. At the very least for the next meal, even if they were on the road, she would have to find a way to prepare some warm and palatable food for Shifu.

After the meal, Ranran obediently took the medicine bag handed over by Shifu and drank most of the bag of tree root water under his gaze, before starting their return journey to Xi Shan in Yongcheng.

However, not far after exiting the town, Yu Tong whispered to Su Yishui, “Master, someone is following us…”

Su Yishui did not respond, continuing to lead his disciples leisurely on the country path. Obviously, he had long noticed someone tailing them but had remained silent.

Ranran who experienced the carnage on Jue Mountain, naturally did not think that the person secretly following them would be an admirer of Shifu.

She whispered to Su Yishui, “Why don’t we turn back?”

Su Yishui actually replied this time. He lowered his head at his little disciple and asked, “Why?”

Ranran whispered, “When we were on Jue Mountain, that demon Wei Jiu agreed too readily. Human nature is greedy, and powerful people do not deign to make choices. If possible, they would take both the fish and bear’s paw… Didn’t you say in our lessons before that although Soul oaths are reliable, they have a fatal flaw, which is that if the party who made the Soul oath is no longer alive, the Soul oath automatically dissolves…”

Listening to the young girl’s soft and detailed analysis, Yu Tong and Yu Chen also suddenly realized: That demon Wei Jiu was determined to get Mu Qingge, so how could he give up so easily? It was just that at that time, he was wary of Su Yishui and the other powerful cultivators joining forces, so he pretended to agree, first securing the key to the Netherworld.

Then, after Su Yishui and the three major sects went their own way, he could move to eliminate Su Yishui, completely lifting the Soul oath that shackled Wei Jiu.

Just like what Ranran said, if they now return to the town, they might be able to join up with other immortal sects that have not left yet, and the demon Wei Jiu might become hesitant to act.

Thinking of this, Yu Tong urged anxiously, “Master, let’s hurry back. If someone blocks the way, you just go on ahead. My brother and I will cover the rear for you!”

But Su Yishui just looked at Ranran thoughtfully and continued to walk forward.

Not far from them was the Scholar tree forest they had passed by before.

Ranran remembered that Shifu had them rest here. He also frequently went for walks alone in the forest. Later, he even took her inside to bury some seeds whose names she did not know…

Just then, a few disciples dressed in black from the Crimson Gate suddenly appeared, attacking Su Yishui with Flame Throwing Umbrellas.

The Crimson Gate uses the fire element, and their umbrellas were equipped with mechanisms. In addition to the Kunlun Mountain black oil that aided combustion, they also contained the wielder’s spiritual power. Thus, ordinary flames were enhanced into Samadhi Fire. Once burned, flesh and blood would instantly turn to charred bones.

Therefore, one has to maintain a distance from these flames!

As the disciples manipulated their fire umbrellas to close in on Su Yishui, he raised his hand to draw water from a nearby canal to resist with a water wall.

At first, the water wall looked quite decent, eight feet high and difficult to cross. But in less than the time it takes to drink a cup of tea, the “wall” gradually thinned and became shorter.

Anyone familiar with cultivation knew that this was due to insufficient inner core strength and a lack of flow in spiritual power! Su Yishui was indeed a paper tiger that could be easily overcome, completely vulnerable!

The assailants were overjoyed and they advanced boldly!

Just as Su Yishui’s robe sleeves were half scorched by the true fire, he frowned and instructed the Yu siblings and disciples behind him, “Enter the forest immediately, find a large tree wrapped in thick vines, and climb up. Without my command, no one is allowed to come down!”

As he spoke, he held Ranran with one arm, lightly tapped his toes and flew into the forest. He leaped onto a large tree almost covered in purple vines.

After setting Ranran down, he instructed her to hold onto a thick branch and sit down, then turned and leaped to an adjacent tree.

Qiu Xier was also carried up the tree by her second uncle master, Yu Tong, while the eldest uncle and the other two junior brothers also climbed up the trees, ready for battle.

Ranran was still in shock and looked intently at the forest. The setting sun’s afterglow hadn’t yet faded, and the rosy light spread throughout the forest, making everything clear.

The forest floor was covered with dense purple vines, many of which had climbed up the trees.

But just a few days ago, when she and her master entered the forest, there weren’t so many thick vines here!

The tree Ranran was on was very tall. From her high vantage point, she could see clearly that the large trees climbed by the purple vines were located at one corner of the forest, totaling eight trees.

The thick vines on the ground were not growing randomly; they seemed to be arranged like a diagram. When the vines connected with the eight large trees, it looked like… like the Fuxi Bagua diagram drawn at fortune-tellers’ stalls!

However, counting her Shifu and the disciples, there were seven of them, each occupying one tree, leaving one tree unoccupied, which seemed empty.

…No, that empty tree also had something, a fluffy white ball, wasn’t it the white cat her Shifu kept in the cave on Xi Shan? When did it follow them here?

At this moment, the white cat climbed to the highest point of the tree, meowing with its mouth open, looking majestic like a mountain king.

As Ranran was looking around, a foul wind suddenly rose, the disciples of the Crimson Gate had already surged in like a tidal wave, surrounding the entire forest tightly.

It seemed like they intend to shoot fish in a barrel and bleed them dry!

Wei Jiu’s voice now echoed from on high in the forest: “Brother Yishui, you’re really good at hiding! Hiding in the forest and not coming out, do you intend to be a weak coward?”

It seemed that Wei Jiu has already heard that Su Yishui had suffered severe internal injuries and damaged his cultivation. Now he will kill him and break their Soul oath!

Thinking of the reports from the spies he planted in the three major sects, which said that after he left, Su Yishui had admitted in front of everyone that he was severely damaged internally and dared not confront him, Wei Ju was livid.

In the past, he had been repeatedly defeated by Su Yishui and inevitably had some fear. He never even considered the idea that the current Su Yishui was just a paper tiger.

Considering that he was easily tricked by Su Yishui into making a soul oath and leaving Jue Mountain, he felt that if he didn’t tear Su Yishui to pieces, his hatred would not be appeased!

After receiving the report from the spy, Wei Jiu immediately turned back, planning to ambush the motley crew from Xi Shan on the way.

Previous
Next

This opportunity is truly a rare occurrence, with favorable conditions and timing meeting! Wei Jiu naturally wanted to seize this chance to eliminate his inner demons accumulated over the years.

However, upon probing, Su Yishui indeed lost the imposing manner of being as unstoppable as before. Although he had sensed that the followers of the Crimson Gate were tailing them, he found it difficult to withstand even a few ordinary Crimson Gate disciples for long. In the end, he and his few disciples had to hide in the forest like cowards.

After Wei Jiu’s men tested Su Yishui’s baseline, he actually felt himself in a leisurely mood, wanting to toy and torment this young man who used to dominate him.

He decided to show up in person, planning to strangle each and everyone of his weak disciples in front of Su Yishui, break his limbs and then drain his remaining spiritual power!

But as Wei Jiu took a few steps into the forest, he suddenly saw the densely covered purple vines in the center of the forest. He narrowed his eyes to look closely. His expression changed drastically, and he muttered, “This is bad!”

He wanted to retreat from the forest immediately.

But at this moment, it was already too late! His men had already stepped on the purple vines…

The next moment, the originally silent vines suddenly moved like agile pythons, moving swiftly!

The entire forest instantly turned into an Eight Trigram maze, enclosed in an iron bucket, intercepting all intruders at different positions, making it difficult for them to reinforce each other.

Wei Jiu furrowed his brows and hollered, “Burn the vines with fire!”

His disciples immediately used their fire umbrellas to spray fire at the vines entwining towards them. However, the fire seemed to enhance the growth of these strange plants. In a short time, the originally arm-thick vines became as thick as tree trunks!

These plants have a fire attribute! Could it be… the legendary demonic Binding Immortal Vine? It thrives even more with fire…

Wei Jiu had a rude awakening and wanted his disciples to quickly stop the True fire attacks, but it was too late. He only heard the wretched screams of his disciples not far away, separated by the dense vine wall and the smell of burnt flesh filled the air.

Obviously, they didn’t manage to burn the vines but burned themselves to a crisp.

Wei Jiu quickly looked around and soon found eight large trees with people crouching on them, realizing that these eight trees were the eye of the formation. If he wanted to get out, he had to destroy the eye first.

So he leaped up and attacked the tree without anyone on it.

He was eager to break the formation, so naturally, he chose a good starting point. The large tree in the northwest corner where no one was present, was the best target.

But who would have thought that as soon as he approached that tree, a snow-white ball of fluff suddenly jumped out of the treetop. Looking closely, it turned out to be a cat.

It seems that Su Yishui’s arrangement of the vine formation had lacked manpower. This demon vine needs living people to drive it, so it seems he had caught a random cat to act as a substitute .

Wei Jiu sneered inwardly, dodging countless vine attacks with his agile body. He then wielded his twin hooks, intending to cut the big tree in half from the middle of the tree.

These vines were born attached to the eight large trees. As long as the trees were cut, the vines would naturally wither and die. But just as the hooks were about to hit the trunk, a thunderous roar sounded from above.

Wei Jiu looked up and all blood drained from his face— that cat suddenly opened its mouth wide and turned into a glaring white tiger in that thunderous roar, suddenly pouncing towards him.

He quickly used a Shifting technique to avoid the white tiger’s fatal blow.

After the white tiger missed its attack, it jumped back onto the tree with a resounding roar, shaking the ground of the entire forest.

Wei Jiu exclaimed incredulously, “Geng jin White Tiger! Mu Qingge’s mount… has been in your hands all along?”

Back then, Mu Qingge had shunned ordinary mounts like horses and bulls and felt that they were too mundane. She once went to the Western Sky Jade Peak alone and subdued a Geng jin White Tiger.

Although this tiger has the appearance of a tiger, it is actually an ancient exotic beast that feeds on living beings and is extremely ferocious. It once participated in the Fan Yao Battle with Mu Qingge and gained fame from that battle.

Considering the ferocity of this tiger, Wei Jiu, who was eager to break free, naturally didn’t want to entangle with it any further. He turned his head and looked at the big tree where a comely young girl was sitting.

However, when that young girl saw him glaring over at her, she didn’t panic at all; instead, there was a kind of eager smile on her face… which made one suspicious.

Moreover, that young girl’s smile… seemed somewhat familiar, but Wei Jiu couldn’t recall where he had seen her before.

He was naturally very paranoid and seeing Xue Ranran smiling so brightly, he felt something was amiss, so he decisively turned around and attacked the big tree where Su Yishui was.

When he turned around, he naturally couldn’t see the calm and composed expression of the young girl behind him instantly collapse, her hands clasping in prayer while chanting softly.

Thank heavens, she was just afraid that this demon would come over, so she deliberately smiled at him. Although her Shifu instructed her that as long as she stayed on the tree, the vines would protect her, this fierce belly-splitting demon coming aggressively over was still terrifying!

But Wei Jiu charged towards her Shifu, she did not know if Shifu was confident enough to withstand his thunderous strike.

Su Yishui had been meditating with closed eyes on the central tree to the north all along. His left finger pointing upwards and his right finger pointing downwards, his wrist constantly rotating as if controlling the vine attacks.

Wei Jiu put in eighty percent of his spiritual power into this thunderous strike, intending to kill Su Yishui instantly and eliminate future troubles.

After all, Su Yishui was not who he used to be. Where was his formidable prowess? Wei Jiu had cultivated hard for twenty years and was very confident. Even the heads of the three major sects might not be able to withstand this fatal blow.

But just as his hooks were about to reach him, Su Yishui suddenly opened his eyes wide and took out a long rolling pin.

Ranran, who was on the adjacent tree, naturally saw it clearly; it was the one her mother had given her when she returned to Xi Shan.

No wonder she couldn’t find it when she was making biscuits before leaving the mountain. It turned out her Shifu had kept it in his sleeve.

Wei Jiu’s double hooks were extremely domineering. But Su Yishui, calm and unhurried, met them with the rolling pin. With a clever move, he parried the hooks with the rolling pin and quickly locked them up. As one who reels in a kite by rapidly taking in the string, he entangled them around the rolling pin.

This may look effortless, but it required channeling spiritual power continuously to counter the Qilin hooks; otherwise, a normal wooden stick would have been broken by the hooks immediately, how could it become the shortcoming of the hooks!

Wei Jiu exerted force to pull back his hooks, but he was unable to overpower Su Yishui. At this moment, he realized that Su Yishui was also entangled with purple vines, absorbing the spiritual power of the entire forest’s vines to fight him. Su Yishui’s open eyes also emitted a purple demonic light.

This trash Su, is so despicable! Su actually merged with the vines, manipulating the purple vines to absorb his spiritual power.

Even he, a demonic cultivator, scorned using methods aided by demonic boosts. It was a pity that Su Yishui, a model of righteousness, had fallen so low to the point of using demonic vines in combat!

These vines usually takes more than ten days to grow and requires extremely strict conditions of feng shui and light. How shrewd must Su be, designing this step by step, constantly showing weakness, leading him into this trap that he had prepared in advance.

Wei Jiu finally understood everything, but it was too late now.

As Su Yishui quickly reeled in, he had already pulled Wei Jiu to his side.

Wei Jiu was good at long-range attacks. He had fought with Su Yishui before and knew he shouldn’t get close to Su Yishui’s body. Within a foot, it was all Su Yishui’s domain, and it was difficult to free oneself when one got close.

As a last resort, Wei Jiu had to release the double hooks and try to retreat. But the rapidly growing vines around him had already coiled around him like a dragon. Even if Wei Jiu used spiritual power to shatter a few, new vines immediately entangled him again.

This kind of consumption was simply never-ending. Even Wei Jiu, who was about to form a Nascent Soul, couldn’t keep up. Because those purple vines seemed to have thin tendrils that pierced into his body like needles, constantly absorbing his spiritual power…

Feeling his spiritual power plummeting rapidly, Wei Jiu began to panic. He gritted his teeth, shouting, “Su Yishui! If anyone finds out that you’re secretly nurturing demonic vines, your reputation will be ruined!”

But Su Yishui, who seemed to be in a demonic state, did not stop at all, absorbing the unending stream of spiritual power through the vines.

Right then, Su Yishui used the vines to quickly absorb Wei Jiu’s spiritual power into his body. In a moment, his hair crown shattered, his long hair danced in the air, looking like an evil god descending.

But his face was still expressionless, until Wei Jiu was about to be covered by the vines all over his body, he coldly spoke, “Twenty years ago, I had told you to stay away from me, otherwise I would… kill you.”

When Su Yishui said this, his eyelids lowered, showing disdain, his tone as if crushing an insignificant cockroach.

This inherent contempt stimulated Wei Jiu’s hatred, making him grit his teeth.

But he knew clearly that this Su wasn’t bluffing!

These purple vines has got to be the legendary Parasitic Immortal Vines. If entangled by this demonic thing, it was very likely to end up a dry corpse.

Everyone else all thought Su Yishui was upright, lofty, and even disdainful of associating with his father, the Prince Ping who became a rebel king.

But Wei Jiu always felt that this guy was very sinister, making him fearful.

Now he had fallen into Su Yishui’s trap and was about to become a dried corpse. The only solution was to pull a *cunning escape by sacrificing half of his golden core and see if he could break free.
*金蝉脱壳 literally means golden cicada escapes its shell

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu was infuriated. He could only grit his teeth and chant a spell, forcing out half of his golden core. Turning it into a human form with spiritual power, he let the purple vines entangle it. As for himself, he silently chanted the Earth Escape Technique, quickly shrinking and escaping underground.

Seeing how he was just about to form a Nascent Soul but was now forced to sacrifice half of his core, destroying years of cultivation in an instant, his frustration was beyond words.

But this method did work, at least saving his life.

When the battered and exhausted Wei Jiu finally crawled out of the ground, he looked back at the faint purple light in the forest. He reached out, and crushed the subordinates who came to talk to him, absorbing their spiritual power to replenish his depleted golden core.

“Su Yishui! I am your sworn enemy!”

Tu Jiuyuan stood aside, feeling shocked and terrified, with a wave of heartache upon looking at her Master in such a sorry state.

Not to mention Wei Jiu cursing and swearing, using foul language, vowing to tear Su Yishui into pieces.

Meanwhile, in the forest full of vines, after Wei Jiu fled in panic, the last rays of the setting sun also disappeared. As the forest gradually became shrouded in darkness, those purple vines wilted rapidly as if dehydrated, disappearing in a blink of an eye.

When Yu Chen and the others came down from the trees, still in shock, Gao Cang looked amazed and said, “Shifu you are truly amazing! It’s a pity that the people from the three major sects are not here, or else who would dare to say you are weak!”

But Bai Baishan had an unsettled expression. He had been obsessed with cultivation since he was young, naturally understanding more than Gao Cang and the others.

Just now, Wei Jiu shouted “demonic vines”. If what he said was true, wouldn’t Su Yishui be privately nurturing demonic things prohibited by those of the righteous path?

Upon hearing the hesitant inquiry from his second disciple, Su Yishui mildly said, “All living things grow, each with its own purpose. Whether it’s demonic or celestial, it’s all determined by the heart. If it can save a life, how could it be a monster?”

This statement was ambiguous, neither denying nor admitting. Bai Baishan was tactful and didn’t ask further.

However, it was clear that Su Yishui had taken the third path of cultivation. By using the purple vines to absorb more than half of Wei Jiu’s cultivation, and effectively filled his own golden core which had been empty for a long while. Such a high-grade supplement as Wei Jiu’s cultivation was something you couldn’t buy even with a thousand taels of gold!

Previous
Next

Even though Xue Ranran is young, she had formed a habit since she was confined to the yard by her parents. She liked to look over their wall and quietly observe and think about the people walking outside.

However, it was obvious that her Shifu was not someone she could easily figure out. She felt that her Shifu was truly unfathomable and one would find him difficult to guard against.

Clearly, he had taken advantage of the opportunity presented by the birth of the spirit fruit to carefully weave a large net. Su Yishui was like a hunting spider, while Wei Jiu was a fat and juicy worm that came charging into the net.

It’s no wonder that back then, Mu Qingge ended up in such a tragic situation. If Su Yishui had intentions to scheme against someone, it would definitely be meticulously planned and undetectable.

Thinking of this, Xue Ranran suddenly felt a suffocating feeling in her chest and she sighed faintly. However, as soon as she finished sighing, she saw her Shifu looking at her coldly.

“What are you thinking about?”

Ranran hesitated and said, “I just feel that Shifu is really very…..clever!”

After saying this, she felt that her tone was not sincere enough, so she was about to put on a smiling face and start flattering her Shifu profusely.

However, Shifu did not seem very pleased. He turned around, and left the woods quickly.

Ranran touched her hair bun, unsure if Shifu was angry. But she also thought that if the seeds she planted harmed passing travelers, it wouldn’t be good.

After Shifu had cooled down, he set her concerns to rest. “That plant has a very short life, once it withers, it will not sprout again. Moreover, its seeds are difficult to bear, taking three hundred years to produce one.”

Ranran breathed a sigh of relief after hearing this, but she couldn’t help but wonder, “Shifu, why did you ask me to plant it?”

Su Yishui brought the tree root water to her mouth and said lightly, “Your life’s lot favors plants. Aren’t the flowers in your yard blooming very well?”

Ranran obediently drank the water, feeling that her Shifu’s words made sense. Indeed, the flowers, plants and vegetables she had been growing since childhood all flourished.

However, after drinking the water, there was brown medicine residue left on the corner of her lips. Su Yishui took out a handkerchief to wipe it. Ranran felt embarrassed and moved back a bit.

Su Yishui said flatly, “Girls should be neat, this is disgraceful, don’t move!”

Ranran could only remain still, letting her Shifu wipe her mouth. But her big eyes had nowhere else to settle on, so she could only stare blankly at her Shifu’s handsome face.

Seeing his face up close, like a painting, was truly like a breath of fresh air. Su Yishui did not say anything, just letting his little disciple stare at him in a daze.

However, there seemed to be something brewing in his lowered eyes, but it was difficult to discern in this moment.

Shifu and disciple sat together on a large rock, appearing to have a harmonious relationship. However, Qiu Xier, watching from afar, always felt something was off about the relationship between her little junior sister and their Shifu.

Their Shifu was cold and would sometimes teach them by simply pointing to ancient texts, letting them figure it out themselves without saying anything more than necessary.
