However, he would speak more to their little junior sister. Yet it wasn’t accurate to say that Shifu only favored her because sometimes, he was always particularly strict with her.

Take the fact that the little junior sister had not been allowed to touch the alchemy cauldron again! Unlike her, who had already begun a higher level of cultivation.

After successfully ambushing the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu, the journey ahead became much smoother.

Bai Baishan was worried that Wei Jiu would spread rumors about Shifu using demonic vines, so while fetching water by the river, he brought it up with his fellow disciples.

But Ranran laughed and said, “I think Wei Jiu would be the one more worried about this.”

Xier didn’t understand and asked, “What would he be worried about?”

“He should be worried that Shifu will spread the news that he lost alot of his cultivation!” Ranran filled the water bag while tilting her head.

After hearing the words of the little junior sister, Bai Baishan suddenly realized: Wei Jiu had always been unscrupulous and made many enemies. Now that he had been drained of his cultivation, he would definitely keep a low profile and never reveal his vulnerability voluntarily.

When they returned to Xishan, Xue Ranran finally had the chance to bathe and change clothes, lying comfortably in bed to sleep. But after lying down for a while, Qiu Xier, who was afraid of the cold, knocked on her door, wanting to sleep together.

Ranran had never had sisters to accompany her since childhood, so she was a bit unfamiliar with the late-night chats under the same blanket with her sister, which also felt novel.

Qiu Xier had been unsettled these past few days, unable to resist sharing the ups and downs she had experienced.

Although it had been less than half a month since they had left Xishan, Qiu Xier had gained a whole new understanding of her sect and Shifu.

Especially after seeing the reincarnated former Grandmaster Mu Qingge in Jue Mountain, she had already written a complete script filled with grievances and love.

It was mostly about their demonic Grandmaster Mu Qingge lusting after her handsome disciple, unwilling to let go even after reincarnation. However, Mu Qingge was so beautiful that it was difficult for any man to resist.

Is Shifu Su Yishui naturally cold-blooded or has he cultivated away desire. Back then, Shifu could still act ruthlessly even while facing such a beautiful woman, showing that one can be invincible if they are heartless.

Thinking back to the day when they were eating in town, that one look Shifu gave her made Qiu Xier shudder even in the warm blankets.

Ranran asked with some curiosity, so Qiu Xier described with effort, “It’s like… being stared at by a fierce beast… no, something even more terrifying than a fierce beast, as if at any moment, Shifu would grind me into ashes…”

As she spoke, Qiu Xier remembered Shifu’s iron-blooded tactics when confronting Wei Jiu in the woods, and she now belatedly started crying in fear.

Although Ranran couldn’t empathize, she still hugged her fleshier sister tightly, comforting her softly.

At the same time, Ranran thought about how there were a few times when she caught Shifu lost in thought, and his gaze towards her seemed profound and unreadable.

It was clear that Shifu was very sensitive about others coveting his beauty. So Ranran felt a wave of lingering fear and darkly reminded herself not to be disrespectful and stare at Shifu too much.

After returning to Xishan, Su Yishui had to go into seclusion at the mountaintop for a month again. It would probably take some effort to digest Wei Jiu’s spiritual power to rebuild his golden core.

During this time, representatives from the three major sects came knocking several times but they now found that the once easily penetrable West Mountain spiritual shield had suddenly become very strong, and they couldn’t break through no matter how they tried.

After the trip to Jue Mountain, Wei Fang from Jiuhua Sect especially looked down on Su Yishui.

But since they failed to break into West Mountain several times, they couldn’t help but wonder: That Su Yishui, who was clearly too weak and afraid to fight Wei Jiu head-on, why was his mountain protection spiritual shield becoming stronger?

Although the people below the mountain refused to leave and insisted on waiting for Su Yishui to end his seclusion, the top of West Mountain remained very peaceful.

After the white tiger came out of the forest, it had turned back into a cat-like appearance and seemed very hungry. It would disappear into the woods on most days, but every now and then, it would grab a few wild chickens and run into the kitchen, and meow non-stop at Ranran.

Only later did Ranran understand that the little tiger was asking her to remove the chicken feathers.

Although she was initially a little afraid of it, she realized that it too was a fellow gourmet and so she formed a good impression from its good taste. She would pluck the feathers very cleanly and even thoughtfully cut the meat into pieces so that it could lie on the porch, basking in the sun while eating.

Ranran followed its example. She moved a rocking chair from the old storage room, brought a plate of homemade almond walnut pastries, and spent her time leisurely in the courtyard.

While her other three fellow disciples were busy with their studies and rigorous training, Ranran used cooking their three meals as an excuse, finding lots of time to slack off.

Most of the time, she could quickly prepare the meals and then sit in her small courtyard, watering flowers, plants and the small tree, eating pastries, and bask in the sun.

Speaking of which, that small tree Shifu had instructed her to take care of had grown a lot after they returned. Its lush branches had spread out, looking like a small green umbrella from afar. Every time Ranran hid under the shade of the tree, she could take a sweet afternoon nap.

Before going into seclusion, Shifu had instructed them to get books from the study and study on their own.

However, Second Uncle Master Yu Tong prohibited them from entering without permission; she would always be the one to bring out the books for them. But on this day, Yutong had something to do, so she instructed Ranran to fetch the books from the study.

Among these disciples, Ranran was the most deft and careful, so she probably would not damage Master’s belongings.

This was Ranran’s first time entering Shifu’s study. It was said that this had also been the study of their former GrandMaster, and it contained countless ancient texts, mostly on bamboo slips and sheepskin.

Ranran brought a large ladder and climbed up to the high bookshelves. After sorting the books according to the list given by Second Uncle Master, she suddenly noticed the tiger pattern carved onto the shelf.

This was probably the work of the former GrandMaster, depicting the scene of a Geng jin tiger playing with a hedgehog. The tiger’s tail was high in the air like a hand, and quite amusing.

For some reason, Ranran felt an urge to pull the tiger’s tail. But as soon as she pulled it a couple of times, she heard a “click” from the highest shelf.

Ranran thought she had damaged the shelf and panicked, quickly climbing up to check. However, she found that behind a few books, there was a secret compartment full of dust, obviously untouched for a long time.

Driven by curiosity, she reached in and pulled out a package wrapped in oiled paper. Opening it, she found a book made of some unknown material, with two big characters “Playing Classics” written elaborately on the cover.

She recognized this writing style, its similar to the palace rules on the hall walls, indicating that this was compiled by Mu Qingge herself.

Ranran nodded in admiration. The former GrandMaster was indeed unique, being able to compile a guide like the “Playing Classics” just from “playing” alone!

With a sincere mind to learn, Ranran flipped open the first page and saw all sorts of “play” listed in the index. There was Food and Culinary arts, Brewing methods of famous alcohols, Appreciation of exotic items, and Explorations of famous mountains.

The Food section recorded the former GrandMaster’s experiences of enjoying delicacies.

For example, the pan-fried buns from the Capital’s ShengJi, paired with condiments of a half spoonful of mature vinegar from Baiwei Zhai with three drops of spicy oil. The tofu from Bagong Mountain must be blanched with cilantro to fully appreciate its freshness… and so on, there were many detailed instructions on culinary pairings.

Grandmaster Mu was afraid that her gourmet experiences would be lost, so she earnestly compiled them into a book, intending to pass them down to her disciples and grand-disciples!

Ranran read through the pages with relish until she came across a section called “Fierce Beasts.” She wondered if it recorded the method for taming the Geng jin white tiger. So she turned to that page according to the index.

But when she looked at that page, Ranran was dumbfounded again. The lifelike illustration of a beautiful young man… wasn’t it her Shifu, Su Yishui?

And beside the illustration were serious annotations: “This creature is ferocious, dislikes onions and garlic, will retaliate if provoked, must be approached with caution. If praised for its appearance, its killing intent will peak. Must be coaxed slowly, and if given dried longans marinated with sea salt, can pacify anger by a third…”

As Ranran read this, she couldn’t help but burst out laughing.

What a sarcastic former GrandMaster!

Shifu Su Yishui was just a sixteen-year-old teen back then. Mu Qingge played with his youthful nature like this, knowing that he avoided others discussing his appearance but she went against the grain and even compiled it into a book…

No wonder Shifu hated her so much that he eventually betrayed her and left her sect!

Previous
Next

Come to think of it, Shifu also has his favorite snacks. How delicious can this sea salt-cured longan be..

Ran Ran was quite a connoisseur, but she still couldn’t imagine what it tasted like.

This book was obviously the former Grandmaster’s personal item, hidden here and never discovered by anyone.

Ran Ran felt that if she took it out and kept it on herself, and Shifu found out, she would probably be grinded to dust.

So she read it for a while and reluctantly put it back, planning to return to read this great work thoroughly another time.

As the chapter on food in “Playing Classics” was right up Ran Ran’s alley, she memorized a few recipes to try out.

Notably there was a kind of wine called ” Detain Heaven’s Immortal,” which was said to be so delicious that it made people reluctant to ascend to immortality.

Ranran was curious, so she found rice grains for brewing, bought wine jars, and tried to brew some. Although the process of making this wine was complicated and required precise control of temperature and humidity, Ranran managed to grasp the technique after a few failed attempts.

Her parents ran a snack stall in town, so Ranran thought if she could brew some wine and let her mother sell it, they could earn more money and her parents wouldn’t have to work so hard.

Of course, she also made some sea salt-cured longan, but after a few tries, it just did not taste good. She tried adding some honey to offset the sharp taste from the salt, which finally worked.

One day, after the little tiger had eaten two chickens, it jumped into Xue Ranran’s arms contentedly. A girl and a tiger, lying on the rocking chair, quickly falling asleep.

When Su Yishui finally came out of seclusion and arrived at his disciple’s courtyard, what he saw was the swaying branches and a young girl hugging a cat, sleeping deliciously.

Su Yishui with his long legs, walked without a sound and stood beside the chair. The little tiger glanced at him with alertness, before running off with a swish of its tail.

In her drowsy state, Ranran felt her face itching a little. When she opened her eyes slightly, she realized her respected Shifu had arrived.

She quickly got up, still half-asleep, and said, “Shifu, did you need me for something?”

Su Yishui was still in his plain clothes, reached out to pick some fallen leaves on her head and asked, “At this hour, shouldn’t you be meditating in the grass hall?”

Hearing Shifu ask this, Ranran suddenly realized she had been caught slacking off. She stammered, “We’re having braised duck in brown sauce and mushroom buns tonight, so I came back early to prepare the ingredients…”

Su Yishui said mildly, “Do you think just because you’re getting healthier, you don’t need to study anymore?”

Ranran quickly made up an excuse, “Disciple dares not, it’s just… disciple truly doesn’t have the constitution for immortal cultivation, so I thought I’d first memorize the Pill Alchemy classics and then practice other things, to avoid mistakes in future pill-making alchemy…”

As she spoke, she felt ashamed about slacking off and making up lies, so she decided to honestly admit her lack of progress, to save her Shifu’s efforts.

So she gritted her teeth and said honestly, “My mother said as long as I cultivate a healthy body well, I don’t need to truly cultivate immortality… in the future, I would still leave the mountain to serve my parents.”

Su Yishui asked calmly, “So, is that your aspiration, just to live for a few decades, then marry and have children, repeating your parents’ lives?”

Ranran felt that isn’t this the wish of most people? Although it sounded plain and mundane, it wasn’t too bad.

But hearing a hint of reproach in her Shifu’s words, she decided to embellish her aspirations a bit more: “Of course, I also want to earn more money for my parents, so they can build a bigger house.”

Su Yishui continued to look at her directly and said, “Then in the future, you should marry someone wealthy. If you marry a prince or a king’s son, your wish will be fulfilled at once.”

Ranran felt she wouldn’t be so blessed, but hearing Shifu say that, she couldn’t help but smile in embarrassment.

Su Yishui seemed uninterested in the girl’s blushing smiles, and said with a stern face, “Since you’ve entered my sect, how can you lack ambition? If you continue to be lazy like this, you can pack up and leave immediately.”

Ranran quickly apologized in a small voice.

Unlike the other disciples, if she were expelled from the sect and her strange illness recurred, she would have no other way to live.

Su Yishui nodded and asked Ranran to make him a cup of tea.

As Ranran was making tea inside, she suddenly glanced at the honey jar, where she had put the sea salt-cured longan according to “Playing Classics.” So she grabbed a handful and plated it, along with the tea, and sent them out on a tray.

Shift clearly came to find fault today, so she had to appease the old gent.

Unexpectedly, when Shifu saw the plate with the dried longan sprinkled with fine salt, he didn’t say anything for a long time. He then asked icily “Where is this from?”

Ranran did not dare to mention the impudent “Playing Classics”, so she said quietly “I ate it before so I tried to make some. Shifu would you like to try some?”

Su Yishui downed his tea in one gulp, but he won’t even touch that dried longan. He then turned around and left without a word.

Ranran felt a bit despondent as she ate the longan, tasting the salty-sweet flavor spreading on her tongue… this thing wasn’t actually very tasty.

Although Mu GrandMaster had already been reborn, she certainly did not know that her former ferocious beast disciple had changed his taste. This dried fruit which used to reduce anger by thirty percent, was no longer effective.

The next morning, while Ranran was cooking, she heard from her cooking assistant, her second uncle Master talk about the constant stream of visitors coming to the mountain in the past few days.

It turned out that the ginseng fruit Mu Qingge had finally decided to join the JiuHua Sect.

The JiuHua Sect was the most prestigious and powerful among the three major sects. The other two sects had nothing to say about Mu Qingge’s decision.

As the new Master of Mu Qingge, Master Kaiyuan had a dignified demeanor. His first act was to send Wei Fang to escort Mu Qingge to the West Mountain and personally demand the artifacts and mount that belonged to her.

But since Su Yishui had been in seclusion all this time, the letter demanding these items couldn’t be delivered. Wei Fang and his team couldn’t enter the mountain, so they could only leave their calling card at the stone in front of the West Mountain gate.

When Su Yishui came out of seclusion, Yutong handed the calling notice to the Master.

The Yu siblings were very disdainful of JiuHua Sect’s eager stance to let Mu Qingge claim her inheritance from the entire West Mountain.

Setting aside the grievances between Su Yishui and Mu Qingge, Mu Qingge had once said in front of the Xishan disciples that Lingxi Palace would be inherited by Su Yishui in the future.

These past twenty years, it had been the three of them managing and taking care of this place.

Now, although Mu Qingge had been reborn, she was no longer the Master of Lingxi Palace after she had passed. Now she was asking for her things again, which inevitably seemed like she was going back on her word.

Su Yishui didn’t comment on this. He had Xue Ranran and others send down the little tiger, some small and large divine artifacts and a sparkling sword adorned with gemstones.

Ranran had been feeding the little white tiger often these days. As she fed it, she developed some affection for it. Thinking that she wouldn’t get to see it again in the future, she felt unwilling to part with it.

So on the way down the mountain, she held the little tiger, whispered to its fluffy ears and told it not to catch mice to eat anymore, not to be too picky with food if there’s no one to pluck chicken feathers; after eating, to remember to wipe its paws with a damp cloth.

Qiu Xier watched nervously from the side, fearing that her junior sister would babble too much and anger the fierce Geng jin Divine Beast, lest it bit her junior sister’s head off with one bite.

But if one was not aware, that white tiger Divine Beast really did look just like a cat. It lay obediently in Xue Ranran’s arms, occasionally sticking out its tongue to lick her face.

When they reached the foot of the mountain, Ranran found out that Mu Qingge was here as well. It seemed that she was treated very well in the JiuHua Sect, surrounded by a group of disciples, not looking like a prisoner under house arrest but more like a pampered guest.

Bai Baishan said softly beside her, “It is said that our former GrandMaster was good at ingratiating herself with the rich and powerful. Back then, she helped the current emperor ascend to the throne, making significant contributions. So even though she violated the taboos of immortal cultivation, privately opening up the demon realm and almost causing a disaster, she is still an eminent figure in the imperial palace!”

As he spoke, there was an unmistakable envy in the words of the second senior brother. After all, not everyone could ascend to immortality, but gaining favor and prestige among the powerful was immediately gratifying.

One would suppose that since Mu Qingge was so comfortable in the JiuHua Sect, there must be someone backing her up behind the scenes.

In this light, Mu Qingge’s reincarnation wasn’t a complete failure; she could definitely start anew and rise again!

There were even several people around her who looked familiar.

Ranran recognized them; they seemed to be the ones who had come to West Mountain seeking medical treatment but had been rebuffed. They seemed to be… servants of Minister Lin, and the tall, thin, fair-faced scholar they followed, could he be Minister Lin’s son who came seeking medical treatment before?

Seeing that tall and thin young master Lin behaving respectfully, calling Mu Qingge “Master” repeatedly, it seemed that Mu Qingge had quickly acquired a noble disciple by her side, adapting swiftly to everything twenty years later…

However, when Mu Qingge saw that it was Su Yishui’s disciples who brought the items, and not Su Yishui himself, a hint of disappointment appeared on her face.

Since Ranran and the others knew that this was their former Grandmaster— the previous owner of West Mountain, so even though they weren’t on good terms with Wei Fang and the other JiuHua disciples, they just handed over the items civilly as requested.

Everything else was fine, but when it came to the Geng jin White Tiger, just as Mu Qingge reached out her hand, the tiger suddenly bristled its fur and growled menacingly at Mu Qingge with a ‘Ao~u’.

Its body obviously like a cat, but its mouth suddenly enlarged, its tiger roar thundered, catching everyone off guard.

The disciples of the JiuHua Sect couldn’t help but step back, and Mu Qingge seemed to resist retreating as well. With a forced smile at the Geng jin white tiger, she said with a hint of regret, “Back then, I made a soul oath with this tiger before it became my mount. Now it seems that when my spiritual energy was disrupted twenty years ago, this oath was broken. It’s originally a wild divine beast of the mountains and should be free. Since it doesn’t want to be with me anymore, I won’t force it…”

After hearing this, the little tiger ignored everyone. It flicked its tail, and turned to the mountains to catch chickens to eat.

While others were fine with this, Ranran was very happy to hear this; it seemed that she could still bask in the sun together with the little tiger in the yard in the future.

Although Mu Qingge didn’t want her former mount anymore, she accepted everything else without hesitation. Especially when she looked at the sparkling sword, she seemed to attach great importance to it. It was said that this sword was specially made for Mu qingge by the current emperor in the past and was very precious.

“How come there’s no Nine Revolutions Black Iron Pill Cauldron?” she asked softly.

Previous
Next

The few junior disciples who came down the mountain had never heard Shifu mention any cauldron before.

So, when Bai Boshan heard Mu Xian Shi’s question, he quickly volunteered and ran up the mountain to ask their Shifu if he had left any cauldron behind.

Su Yishui rarely had such leisurely moments. He was adjusting the strings of his zither by the pavilion in the courtyard. When Bai Baishan came to ask, Su Yishui responded with a question of his own, “Did your little junior sister personally give those things away?”

Bai Baishan respectfully replied, “You instructed her to do so, she naturally delivered everything perfectly. However, there was no pill furnace among the things she took!”

Su Yishui used his long fingers to pluck the freshly tuned zither strings, producing ancient and clear melodies. Then, he lowered his gaze and said, “Tell the visitors from below that the furnace was refined from meteoric iron that I personally extracted from the Snow Peak and refined. It was only loaned to Mu Qingge and does not belong to her. If I don’t want to give it, no one can take it away.”

After remembering Shifu’s instructions, Bai Baishan hurried back down.

While Bai Baishan went to inquire, Mu Qingge had been chatting with the remaining three disciples. Despite just falling from the tree not too long ago, Mu Qingge was a great conversationalist, worldly-wise, fitting her experiences from two lifetimes.

In just a few words, she had managed to inquire about the background and origins of Su Yishui’s new disciples.

Ranran didn’t say much. Whenever Mu Qingge asked about her, Ranran only pretended to be enchanted by Mu Qingge and kept smiling foolishly.

It’s not that Ranran had any secrets about her family background. She was just cautious because she felt that Mu Qingge had too many entanglements and conflicts with their Shifu. Currently unclear if she was friend or foe, Ranran wondered what she should do if Mu Qingge remained unchanged in her ways, used her family as leverage to coerce her into harming her Shifu.

So when Gao Cang saw that she wasn’t speaking and was eager to answer for her, Ranran quickly interrupted him, pointing to the persimmon tree beside the mountain road and smiling, “Teacher Mu, are you thirsty? Would you like me to pick a few persimmons for you to eat?”

Mu Qingge smiled and shook her head, but she did take a few more glances at this girl named Xue Ranran.

Among Su Yishui’s disciples, only this girl seemed to have some brains and looked quite decent…

As her thoughts wandered, she suddenly reached out and grasped Ranran’s slender wrist, concentrating to feel her pulse and spiritual power.

However, after a grip, she found there was nothing, no echo, no trace of spiritual wood aura… This girl was just average in talent, an ordinary person with nothing exceptional.

Su Yishui used these few mediocre disciples as an excuse to reject her outright, unwilling to continue the Master-disciple relationship with her…

She remembered hearing Su Yishui’s heart-wrenching “Qingge” before her soul had scattered. Why did he look so indifferent now that they met again?

Could it be that he knew about the spirit fruit that had fallen earlier?

Thinking of this, Mu Qingge took a deep breath. She had discreetly asked Grandmaster Kaiyuan of Jiuhua Sect before, and he didn’t know about how many spirit fruits had been on the tree.

Let alone Su Yishui, who had always been reclusive!

The unripe fruit which had fallen prematurely sixteen years ago, indicating that “she” had no will to survive. Now that was no sign at all and was probably gone by now.

And she just needed to focus on managing everything well for herself.

Thinking of this, Mu Qingge felt a little relieved. But when she heard the message from Bai Baishan, something seemed to be swirling in her eyes. A shimmer of tears evoked sympathy from others.

Beside her, Wei Fang glared, “Your Xishan Sect is too arrogant. You should know that this furnace is for the current Emperor’s alchemy purposes…”

Before he could finish his words, Mu Qingge shot him a sharp look, and Wei Fang immediately realized his mistake and shut up grudgingly.

Since she had been rejected, Mu Qingge didn’t mention the furnace again and instead changed the subject to talk about how she missed the old houses of West Mountain and wanting to take a walk up the mountain.

Unfortunately, Mu Qingge’s requests to revisit Lingxi Palace and see the ice lotus she had planted in the back mountain were also turned down by their master.

Poor Bai Baishan had to climb up and down to relay messages, his back aching terribly. He also had to carefully consider how to convey Shifu’s words without hurting Mu Xian Shi’s feelings.

But since she had retrieved the sword bestowed by the Emperor, Mu Qingge didn’t say anything further. She just kindly instructed the younger disciples of West Mountain to take care of the lotus pond in the Xishan Lingxi Palace before leaving with the disciples of Jiuhua.

It’s well-known that Mu Qingge especially loved lotus flowers. It was said that she was so obsessed, that in order to collect a rare ice lotus, she had ventured into the lakes in the Snowy Mountains and fought dragons for them!

So her parting instructions were reasonable, showing her reluctance to part with her beloved possessions from the past.

However, after she returned, Second Uncle Master sighed slightly when Ranran and her were chatting as they prepared their meal.

Few people knew that Mu Qingge had built the lotus pond back then solely for Su Yishui. At that time, his internal fire was too strong, and he could not control the early formation of his Golden core, which almost caused him to rupture and die.

Fortunately, Mu Qingge found a pool of ice lotus from Yaochi and she personally blessed it. She soaked herself and Su Yishui in the lotus pond for forty-nine days, slowly guiding back his heart that was going out of control.

At this point, the Second Uncle Master had to admit that although Mu Qingge’s actions were bizarre and absurd, she was exceptionally good to her disciples.

Its unfortunate that she didn’t follow the right path and eventually caused a disaster, leading to her downfall.

Ranran, after listening to the Second Uncle Master, suddenly realized something.

She had been puzzled before why Mu Qingge had mentioned the lotus pond so specifically before leaving.

Now, thinking about it, she was indeed nostalgic for the flowers and plants of West Mountain, but she probably also hoped to evoke Su Yishui’s memories, remind him of her kindness, and salvage their past master-disciple relationship?

After finishing her meal, Ranran took a walk in the mountains and specifically went to the back mountain to look at the lotus pond.

Now that it was almost winter, the lotus flowers had long withered, and all that remained was desolation. There was nothing particularly unforgettable about this lotus pond.

After looking for a while, she rolled up her pants, took a shovel and tried to dig for some lotus root by the pond.

Since that day she had expressed her ordinary mortal aspirations, just wanting to go down the mountain early to serve her parents, and perhaps marry and have children for a peaceful life, she noticed that her Shifu seemed somewhat displeased when he looked at her.

Ranran thought it might be because her Shifu had been in seclusion for too long and hadn’t eaten anything to his liking. So today, she planned to make some refreshing Fried lotus root.

Regrettably, the ground by the pond was too slippery. Ranran almost slipped into the pond several times, which frightened her, as she can’t swim. She quickly retreated, ending up with only muddy feet for her trouble.

Because her feet were now dirty, Ranran washed them with a bucket of water. She then decided to take a bath too. As a cultivator of Pills, the most convenient thing was a constant supply of warm water throughout the day.

When she wanted to take a hot bath, she could use any of the large stoves in the alchemy room. But after bathing, Ranran looked at the pill furnace that the Second Uncle Master had returned to her a few days ago. Its surface was blackened and dirty, somewhat displeasing to the eye.

Since she had taken a bath herself, she thought she might as well clean the cauldron too. Perhaps her sincerity would move the cauldron, and it wouldn’t embarrass her during the next alchemy session.

Holding onto this thought, Ranran found a rag and some alkaline water to remove the dirt and grime from the furnace. She hummed a tune as she wiped the furnace.

After wiping it a few times, Ranran found that this Pill furnace’s surface was actually quite good, with beautiful patterns engraved on it, so she wiped it even more vigorously.

After cleaning most of the furnace, she discovered that it was originally made of a material that resembled gold but wasn’t gold. It seemed like the bottom of the furnace got burned later on, and a black metal was used for repairs.

It was evident that the repairs were done very carefully, as even the patterns were seamlessly restored. Ranran accidentally saw a line of engraved characters on the bottom of the furnace.

She carefully looked at it and softly read aloud, “Nine Revolution Black Iron.”

After reading it, Ranran fell silent for a moment, then her eyes gradually widened: could this “Nine Revolution Black Iron” be… the one Mu Qingge had wanted to take?

Since the disciples from Jiuhua Sect had come from afar specifically for this item, it indicated that it was precious and rare enough. But, did Shifu just casually give this furnace to her, a mediocre novice?

Ranran felt uneasy. She quickly washed her hands, picked up the wild persimmons she had picked from the foot of the mountain and ran to find her Shifu.

When she entered her Shifu’s courtyard, she didn’t find him. She searched all the way and then circled back to the dried-up lotus pond.

Before she could see anyone, she heard a melodious tune of a Guqin.

The simple melody played with this ancient tone had a kind of lingering excitement. Ranran couldn’t help but slow down her steps, quietly listening to the melodious tune.

At this moment, the man with long hair draped over his shoulders was sitting on a wooden bridge, closing his eyes and plucking the strings facing the withered lotus pond.

At first, it was like a nocturne softly murmuring in half-revealed moonlight. Gradually, the Guqin became intense, like the solemnity of a battlefield, ringing with sharpness. In a trance, Ranran seemed to be in a noisy battlefield, countless arrows were shooting towards her.

But the next moment, someone pulled her onto the White Tiger. Someone beside her angrily roared, “You save others, why not save yourself first?”

In her daze, the stirring zither sound calmed again. It was only then that she came to her senses, touched her somewhat itchy face, and realized that tears were streaming down her face.

The zither sound now ceased and the fragrance of lotus filled the air. In the time Su Yishui played the zither with his eyes closed, the already dried-up lotus pond miraculously bloomed with lotus flowers again…

The Yaochi Ice Lotus were not ordinary. Each one was snow-white and translucent, as if carved from ice and snow, crystal clear and bright…

Ranran didn’t even have time to wipe away her tears. She was full of joy and amazement as she came to the edge of the lotus pond, looking at the blooming flowers and saying, “Shifu, you really have miraculous powers, these flowers…”

At this point, she paused slightly.

Only just now, Mu Qingge mentioned that she hoped someone would take care of her lotus pond. And afterwards, Shifu used music to channel his spiritual power, growing a pond full of rare and beautiful ice lotuses.

This former Master and disciple seemed to be of the same mind!

People always said that Su Yishui and Mu Qingge’s relationship was ambiguous, and now it seemed to be true!

Shifu seemed tough and cold but clearly, his zither music contained deep worldly affections, showing great longing.

Ranran, who had heard many variations of stories of Master-disciple relationships from third senior sister, was very bright. In an instant, she inferred that Su Yishui was only firm in speech but soft in heart towards Mu Qingge.

If he still cherished their past relationship, why did he refuse to let her come up the mountain earlier? If he could let Mu Qingge see her beloved lotus flowers, surely then they could let go of their unresolved grudges!

Previous
Next

Su Yishui had walked up to her without her noticing. He took out a handkerchief and handed it to her.

Ranran, feeling embarrassed, quickly took it and wiped her tears. She smiled serenely, “Shifu’s zither skill is truly exquisite. I was enchanted and moved by it, and somehow, I ended up crying.”

Su Yishui looked at her little tear-stained face, his expression slightly tense. He lowered his head and asked, “When you heard the music, did you remember anything?”

Ranran opened her mouth halfway, intending to mention the scenes in her imagination from earlier, but the words that came out were, “I was just moved by the music.. And it’s great that the lotus flowers are blooming again. We can pick the lotus leaves to make Beggar’s Chicken…”

As she finished speaking, she noticed that her Shifu’s face had turned cold as ice.

Remembering not to stare at Shifu like an infatuated girl for too long, Ranran quickly lowered her head. She suddenly remembered the reason for coming to find Shifu and asked, “Shifu, the Pill furnace you gave me to use… is it the Nine Revolution Black Iron Furnace?”

She then mentioned her discovery after cleaning the furnace earlier and ended with a timid question, “Could it be that Shifu, unintentionally, mistook it for an old furnace and gave it to me?”

Su Yishui’s face still looked upset, seemingly processing that Beggar’s Chicken. But his tone was gentle, “It was idle just being there, so don’t you let it go to waste.”

Ranran, seeing her Shifu’s tacit acknowledgment, suddenly felt a surge of enthusiasm like red flames in her heart: she, such a mediocre novice, had been given the best furnace by her Shifu! If she couldn’t refine thousands of Resurrection Divine Pills, wouldn’t it be a waste of her Shifu’s deep affection?

The previously indifferent and unambitious heart, at this very moment, now had an impulse to reform and begin anew!

Ranran solemnly promised her Shifu that she would be completely focused and work hard to refine decent pills this time.

Su Yishui didn’t even look at her this time, just stood silently by the pond, watching the sparkling ice lotuses, lost in thought. Watching his back, there was a hint of loneliness…

Ranran did not dare to disturb Shifu’s contemplation. After bowing respectfully, she left with light steps.

Third Senior Sister was already starting to refine a higher-grade Marrow-cleansing pill, so Ranran had to practice diligently day and night; she couldn’t be lazy anymore.

This time, facing the bright and clean furnace, Ranran quietly recalled Shifu’s teachings on calming the mind and spirit, crossed her legs, and focused her energy in her lower abdomen.

At first, she could still hear the crackling of the furnace fire, but gradually, as her breath and pulse harmonized, the surrounding noises gradually faded away.

Qiu Xier, who had just dozed off, blinked groggily and inadvertently glanced at Ranran beside her. She couldn’t help but be stunned.

Whether it was the reflection of the furnace fire or not, there was a faint glow on her little junior sister’s face, and her entire person… seemed a bit different from usual.

As to what was different, Qiu Xier couldn’t quite pinpoint it, but she felt a sense of awe and respect!

Qiu Xier sighed, realizing that meditation could indeed elevate one’s disposition. So, she didn’t dare to slack off and quickly closed her eyes, focusing on the furnace fire to calm her mind and spirit, hoping to become a peerless beauty like her Shifu soon.

Perhaps sensing Ranran’s sincerity, this time when the furnace was opened, it was not overflowing with the scent of steamed buns. Ranran quickly took the Clear-Heart Pill and went to find First Senior Brother.

She hadn’t done well last time, so this time she had to make it up to her senior brother and help him calm his mind.

However, Senior Brother Gao cang waved his hand like fanning a fan, hastily saying that he’s been very calm recently and doesn’t need to take any pills.

When she handed it to Second Senior Brother, he forced a smile, saying that he’s had diarrhea recently and shouldn’t eat randomly.

Ranran knew that her Pill Alchemy reputation had been tarnished. Last time she nearly killed Senior Brother, so naturally no one dared to take it this time.

She didn’t want to trouble others, so she tried it herself. As she tasted it, she found that this time it actually carried the sweet and refreshing taste of lotus flowers.

Ranran was a quite nervous herself and instructed Qiu Xier to take away all the snacks in her room so that she wouldn’t lose control at night and eat until she died without anyone knowing.

However, this time, the Clear Heart Pill was obviously refined very well. A day passed, and Ranran just didn’t feel like eating anything.

Even when cooking for everyone and smelling the aroma of bamboo shoot chicken, she remained indifferent.

This made Ranran, who found enjoyment in eating, feel quite sorrowful.

The chicken had been brought by a patient healed by Shifu and was a local short-legged Luhua chicken from the village below. Its legs were thick and its buttocks plump, looking very delicious. Ranran was originally looking forward to eating this chicken and even asked Second Senior Uncle to buy bamboo shoots to go with it.

During the meal, everyone enjoyed the food immensely. Even Su Yishui drank three bowls of chicken soup in one go. Only Ranran looked at everyone dully, having no urge at all to eat any of the dishes.

Seeing Ranran’s pitiful appearance, Gao cang felt sorry for her and said, “Although the Clear-Heart Pill can calm the mind, it shouldn’t be so overbearing as to make someone abstain from food immediately?”

Bai Baishan continued, “In my opinion, little junior sister, although your foundation is a bit lacking, you are truly a genius in alchemy. Every time you refine pills, you can produce extraordinary ones. But junior sister, don’t test pills recklessly next time. If something goes wrong, it’ll really make people have heartache.”

Su Yishui didn’t say much, just ate almost half of the chicken, which seemed to really suit his taste.

But seeing his second disciple once again trying to please his junior sister, he spoke up, “Heartache indicates a lack of vitality and blood circulation. You need to practice your cultivation more. Tomorrow, when working on your legs…”

Bai Baishan was quite clever and suddenly realized that Shifu probably didn’t like seeing his disciples flirting. Before Shifu finished assigning “homework,” he immediately took over Shifu’s bowl, deftly adding more soup for him and said with a smile, “Shifu, I just said that junior sister’s cultivation is not yet mature. If she eats something wrong, it will teach her a lesson… Junior sister, you must be more attentive, don’t let Shifu worry about you.”

This kind of ambiguous attitude made even Qiu Xier scornful so she glared fiercely at Second Senior Brother.

She initially found Second Senior Brother refined and polite, pleasing to the eye. But after spending time together, she felt that boys like Senior Brother, who were straightforward and reliable, were more trustworthy.

After the meal, Su Yishui called Ranran, who was about to clean up the dishes, and asked her to follow him to the back mountain and then to the edge of the lotus pond.

He pointed to the most flourishing lotus bloom in the middle of the pond and said to Ranran, “Go, pick that one.”

Ranran said, “Oh,” and then looked around for a small boat to enter the water. The middle of the lotus pond was very deep. Without a boat, it was impossible to reach.

But Su Yishui said, “No need for a boat, just walk straight over.”

Ranran looked at the lotus pond in disbelief and asked in a low voice, “What am I supposed to walk on?”

Su Yishui, with his hands behind his back, said tranquilly, “Step on the lotus leaves that is used to wrap Beggar’s Chicken, and you’ll be able to cross.”

Hmm… Ranran was a bit unsure whether Shifu was mocking her or genuinely wanted her to do so.

Although the species of lotus flowers in the pond were valuable, the lotus leaves were nothing special. If she stepped on them, she would definitely fall into the water.

Ranran had been weak since childhood. Her mother didn’t allow her to play in the river with the other children in the village, so she didn’t know how to swim. Upon hearing Shifu’s words, she was dumbfounded.

Su Yishui saw her staring at him as if he were a murderer, and his lips curled slightly before saying, “Cultivation and abstinence from food are for cleansing oneself, allowing true energy to flow smoothly through the meridians. You haven’t eaten anything these few days, it’s the best time to cultivate and gather your qi. As long as you grasp the technique, stepping on the lotus leaves is not difficult.”

Ranran nodded in realization.

But seeing Senior Brother and Second Senior Brother practicing so hard for so long, she felt that they had only become a bit lighter on their feet when they went down the mountain to collect goods. Could she, a novice with no foundation, really learn such a profound light body technique?

“Practice well. You also know that XiShan and Crimson Gate are enemies. If Wei Jiu comes over, he will surely come for revenge. None of the disciples will be spared. You can’t just smile sweetly at Wei Jiu every time you meet him and expect to escape.” Su Yishui said with a faint disdain in his tone.

Ranran remembered that last time in the woods, she did indeed smile too ingratiatingly at Wei Jiu, losing her righteous demeanor, which made her feel ashamed and also faintly afraid.

This Shifu, who always reminds his disciples that their lives were not guaranteed after joining the sect, was truly rousing. Seeing how reasonable her Shifu’s words were, Ranran suddenly felt motivated.

She went back to her room and put on a thicker chest wrap and changed into thicker pants so that she wouldn’t expose herself even if she fell into the water. Then she returned and memorized the spell for the Light body Technique. She followed Su Yishui to the pond and meditated for a moment by the edge.

After adjusting her breath, she bravely jumped onto the lotus leaf…

There was a “plop,” and her slender body plunged straight into the water.

When her Shifu pulled her out of the water with a spell, dripping wet Ranran lay on the bank spitting out water. Then, coughing, she asked Shifu, “Can I not practice this? Is that okay?”

Su Yishui half squatted in front of her, silent for a moment, then said gently but firmly, “No.”

Although the weather was very cold, the water in the pond was warm, which was the only comforting thing in her unfortunate situation.

In any case, Ranran flopped around in the lotus pond for a full five days. Every day when she went back to rest, she was soaking wet.

Plus, she had been abstaining from food these past days, not even thinking about eating malt sugar to please her mouth. She was beginning to feel that life has lost all meaning.

This morning, after Su Yishui had finished tormenting Ranran, he was in an unusually good mood and took some people down the mountain to visit friends.

Qui Xier couldn’t bear it any longer and asked sighing as she dried little junior sister’s hair, “Ranran, what did you do to offend Shifu? Why is he only making things difficult for you?”

Ranran stared blankly at herself in the mirror. She then straightened her back, trying to cheer herself up. She encouraged herself, saying, “Shifu is not making things difficult for me. He wants to teach me some skills!”

But Qiu Xier didn’t believe it. She raised an eyebrow and asked, “So what have you learned?”

Ranran felt a bit gratified and said, “At least I’ve learned how to swim.”

After falling into the water so many times, she became more proficient at holding her breath. Sometimes when she fell in, she could even paddle a few times. Gradually becoming self-taught, she actually enjoyed swimming with the dog-paddle technique.

While Qiu Xier was drying Ran Ran’s hair, she suddenly exclaimed, “Eeh,” and then leaned down to examine her junior sister’s face closely. She said, “Ranran, why do I feel like your skin has been improving alot recently? Your features have become more refined too.”

Although Ranran had always been prettier than her, she was at best a beautiful girl next door.

But lately, Ranran seemed to be like a pearl hidden in dust, shining from the inside out after being polished thoroughly. Although her features hadn’t changed, there was an indescribable aura emanating from her. Her skin was fair and radiant, making her more and more captivating to look at.

Previous
Next

After hearing Qiu Xier’s words, Ranran also checked herself in the bronze mirror and found that her skin had indeed improved a lot.

She recalled what Second Uncle Master had said before, that the ice lotus in the lotus pond was originally a spiritual item that could harmonize one’s spiritual power foundation. Mu Qingge had used it to harmonize Su Yishui’s vitals back then.

Could it be that soaking in the water from this lotus pond was the reason for her improved skin?

Upon hearing Ranran’s guess, Qiu Xier couldn’t help but feel excited and prepared to join Ranran to soak in the lotus pond right away.

If she could get rid of the freckles on her face, it wouldn’t be cultivating in vain!

It happens that today Shifu took Senior Uncle Master and the two Senior Brothers down the mountain to visit friends. There were no men in the mountains, so it wouldn’t be bad to have an open-air skincare bath!

When they arrived at the pond, Ran Ran got changed first into thick chest wraps. She then plunged into the water for a swim around the pond.

Qiu Xier was originally worried about the cold water, especially since it was almost winter.

But seeing Ranran swimming so happily, she tentatively tested the water temperature with her hand. It wasn’t as cold as she had expected. So she impatiently took off her outer clothes, put on her chest wrap, and jumped right into the water.

However, after swimming for a while, Qiu Xier suddenly felt an indescribable chill, creeping into every pore of her body. Before long, she started screaming in horror, shouting, “Quick, I… I’m freezing to death!”

She frantically swam towards the shore while asking Ranran, “Why did the water turn freezing cold?”

Ranran was stunned because she didn’t feel cold at all! She even felt that the water was pleasantly warm, and her entire body felt indescribably comfortable!

But Qiu Xier didn’t seem to be exaggerating. She was shivering uncontrollably in the water, with frost forming on her skin. She looks about to freeze solid!

She couldn’t swim back to shore in time, already feeling her limbs stiffening, half opening her mouth, looking at Ranran in panic, wanting to cry for help but her tongue was already frozen.

Ranran hurriedly swam over, trying to push Qiu Xier back to shore. But with her dog paddle strokes, how could she save someone?

The blood slowly drained from Qiu Xier’s face, she was about to freeze to death. Ranran is really distressed now, she wished that she could carry Xier and fly onto shore.

Just then, the water in the pond surged, especially around Ranran, as if it was boiling. A strange warmth surged from her lower abdomen.

Unable to control it, Ranran suddenly leaped out of the water, lightly landing on a lotus leaf.

She was startled for a moment, but there was no time to think. She reached out to drag Qiu Xier, who was gradually stiffening in the water. But Qiu Xier was quite heavy, and Ranran couldn’t pull her up at all.

At that moment, a white figure flashed before her eyes. Su Yishui suddenly appeared. He waved his long finger and the water surged and pushed Qiu Xier steadily onto the shore.

Second Uncle Master Yu Tong quickly placed her palm on Qiu Xier’s back, channeling her spiritual energy to force out the invading cold from her body. Senior Uncle Master Yu Chen then helped carry the unconscious Qiu Xier back to rest in bed.

The sudden scene shocked the two Senior Brothers who had just returned with Shifu.

Especially Ranran, who was standing lightly on the lotus leaf, her white wet dress sticking to her body, revealing delicate shoulders. Her slightly wet hair clung to her cheeks and neck, while water droplets dripped continuously from her slender ankles and rolled onto the green lotus leaf, all looking…..very mesmerizing.

Ranran hadn’t even reacted yet when Shifu, with an ashen face, suddenly took off his cloak, flew up, wrapped Ranran in it, and brought her back to the shore.

The two male disciples were craning their necks to continue looking, but Su Yishui blocked her from their view, just in time to cover their sight.

Only when they saw Shifu’s piercingly cold gaze did they realize their indiscretion.

Su Yishui coldly said, “There’s nothing here. Go practice on your own!”

Gao Cang and Bai Baishan were originally following Shifu to the grass hall to cultivate their qi. They didn’t expect such an accident to happen at the lotus pond along the way. They also had no idea what had happened.

They shouldn’t say it, but why did little junior sister’s figure look so good?

In their impression, she should be a thin and frail girl. But when her long skirt was wet and clinging to her body, she… really had an enticing figure. Unfortunately, after a brief glimpse, Shifu blocked their view. They could only walk away with lingering regret.

“Why did you take off your clothes to swim? Don’t you know people could pass by here?” After everyone dispersed, Su Yishui with a cold face, picked up the clothes on the ground, wrapped Ranran up like a dumpling, and began to reprimand her.

Ranran had thought they had gone down the mountain and wouldn’t return for a while, but she didn’t expect Shifu to come back at this crucial moment.

Things could have been disastrous just now. She knew she was at fault and could only lower her head and listen to Shifu’s scolding.

Still she couldn’t help but interrupt Shifu’s neverending scolding and asked impatiently, “What happened to Xier? Why did she almost freeze to death?”

Su Yishui obviously hadn’t finished what he was going to say, but seeing Ranran so anxious, he still explained with a stern face, “The lotus pond here grows ice lotuses, which are extremely cold. They have changed the water quality here over these long years, and not everyone can play in the water. You are of the Wood element, needing emptiness within. These ice lotuses are very beneficial for you. But for those who are unsuitable, going in can easily absorb too much cold qi and freeze to death.”

Hearing this, Ranran couldn’t help but draw a cold breath. In other words, if Su Yishui hadn’t come back in time, Xier might have been frozen to death!

Seeing her guilty look, Su Yishui softened his tone: “It’s my fault for not explaining clearly to you all. From now on, keep them away from this ice lotus pool. Yu Tong has given Xier a Warming Pill and she was also found in time. She just needs to rest for a while, and she’ll be fine.”

Ranran nodded vigorously. She would never dare to bring Xier to play in the water again. But just now, did she… stand on the lotus leaf?

Now that she had set down her worries, she finally remembered jumping onto the lotus leaf in her moment of desperation.

And Su Yishui looked at her thoughtfully, remarked, “You are naturally lazy, looks like you need some pressure to make progress…”

It seemed that this accident had also opened up insights for Shifu. The teacher, like a cook, had to look at the meat before using the knife. For someone like Xue Ranran, who had no ambition and only thinking about marrying and leaving the mountain, she needed some pressure to improve.

So in the following lessons, it wasn’t just walking on lotus leaves. Su Yishui also brought a wooden barrel of pebbles to throw at Ranran while she stood on the lotus leaf.

Although Shifu didn’t use real force, getting hit by the pebbles was still painful. In order to dodge them, Ranran had to do her best and jump around like a rabbit spirit had possessed her.

As for the other disciples, seeing someone like Xue Ranran who was originally of a constitution unsuited for cultivation, mastering the Light body technique of floating on water in such a short time, was really enviable.

Bai Baishan, who had been wavering in his pursuit of the Dao recently, became more resolute.

He had initially suspected that Shifu was unwilling to teach them real skills, only making them carry sandbags up and down the mountain every day. But now it seemed that Su Yishui was indeed capable. Not only could he deal with the number one demonic cultivator Wei Jiu, but he could also train someone who was useless like the little junior sister into someone so outstanding.

Such a Shifu was truly exceptional! But was Shifu biased? Why was the little junior sister progressing so rapidly while he was not taught real skills?

Two days later, Bai Baishan couldn’t hold back and asked Su Yishui why he didn’t teach them higher-level Cultivation techniques.

Su Yishui glanced at him and said mildly, “In Cultivation, you start from the basics. The higher your Cultivation level, the harder it is to change your foundation. If you regret joining the XiShan Sect, it’s not too late to change now. But if your Cultivation is deeper, and you want to leave, you’ll have to disperse your foundation, which can inevitably damage your tendons and bones. Learning later, is also hoping that you won’t regret it.”

Ranran listened on the side, recalling the previous time when the Jiuhua Sect came to collect things, and the Second Senior Brother was indeed very attentive, and seemed to be trying to build a relationship with Mu Qingge.

Su Yishui had obviously sensed the Second Senior brother’s hidden agendas and thus gave him a reminder.

Bai Baishan didn’t expect that his little schemes had been noted by Shifu. And now, its all laid out in front of all the senior brothers and sisters, so he felt quite ashamed. He quickly declared that he had no intention of changing sects.

Su Yishui looked at him and said mildly, “Many disciples came to join the XiShan Sect at the beginning. Why did I choose you few? It’s because your ancestors have some history with XiShan. Someone owed favors to your elders in the past, and I’m just fulfilling an old promise that person made. However the depth of the master-disciple relationship is beyond human control. If you regret it now, you can leave at any time.”

After saying that, he stood up and walked out of the dining hall.

Obviously, this was also the answer to Bai Baishan’s question – since you entered Su Yishui’s sect, you should follow his rules. If he asks you to carry sandbags every day, then carry them obediently. If you can’t bear it and feel like you haven’t learned anything, the sect is open for you to leave anytime. But if you regret it and want to leave, don’t blame Shifu for taking back the foundation he had taught you!

Ranran bit her chopsticks, feeling that Shifu was also testing her. Once you set foot on the path of Cultivation in Yongcheng West Mountain, it’s not something you can give up just because you want to.

She sighed slightly, wondering how disappointed her parents would be if she didn’t marry, but only focused on cultivating in XiShan. And she didn’t know if they would have more children in the future; otherwise, if they had no one to take care of them in their old age, how could she focus on cultivation?

But Xier didn’t take Ranran’s concerns seriously: “Who said cultivation and marriage can’t go hand in hand? If you reach a certain level, finding an immortal companion is true bliss! Besides, the saying goes, when one person achieves the Dao, even their animals ascends with them. If you truly achieve immortality, why would you worry about your parents having nobody to rely on?”

Ranran wasn’t someone who dwell on worries. After hearing the Third Senior Sister’s words, she felt they made sense. She realized that she had considered herself a useless person in cultivation before, it was her own knowledge that was inadequate.

Now that she had glimpsed the path and entered the sect, she naturally had to focus and first learn self-preservation.

Since Xier fell into the water, triggering Ranran to make her breakthrough and mastered the Light body technique, Su Yishui seemed to have found a great teaching method. He kept raising the stakes for Ranran and even the other senior brothers and sisters ‘benefited’ as well.

On this day, Shifu solemnly announced that he would take them down the mountain to study cultivation!

This matter stemmed from Shifu’s recent trip down the mountain to visit his friend.

On that trip, Shifu met with an old acquaintance from twenty years ago.

This person named Qin Xuanjiu, was now the defending general stationed at the strategic Northwestern town of Wangxiang Pass in Daqi. This time he had come to West Mountain fiercely determined to see Su Yishui.

Su Yishui, however, changed his usual aloof demeanor, and personally went down the mountain to meet him. He even had a hearty drink with him in the pavilion at the foot of the mountain.

Originally, General Qin was disdainful of drinking with Su Yishui, but it seemed that he had been upset by something and was eager to drown his sorrows in alcohol, becoming quite excitable for a while.

Previous
Next

The two senior brothers had been responsible for buying groceries, wine and running errands. They were not able to hear any of the conversation between Shifu and his old acquaintance.

But at the end, when they saw General Qin drinking until his tears and snot flowed, he was no longer aggressive towards Shifu. It seemed that the alcohol had worked its magic, resolving all grievances and enmities in one drunken stupor!

After Xier recovered, Su Yishui proposed taking them along with General Qin to Wangxiang Pass and practice cultivation along the way.

This journey was going to be a little further. Su Yishui gave the instructions and Second Uncle Master, with immense heartache about spending a fortune, bought a carriage with a horse and three swift horses for riding.

The disciples of XiShan no longer needed to measure the distance with their feet, making the journey much easier.

General Qin traveled with a few personal guards alongside them.

It wasn’t until later, when Ranran and the others spoke with General Qin, that they learned he was also a disciple of XiShan (West Mountain).

Others believed that Su Yishui was Mu Qingge’s closed-door disciple. But that wasn’t accurate. Before being executed, Mu Qingge once made an exception and accepted one more disciple.

This General Qin, past forty years old, covered in pockmarks, was Mu Qingge’s closed-door disciple.

Qin XuanJiu became Mu Qingge’s disciple was completely accidental.

Back then, Mu Qingge assisted the Daqi garrison in defending FangYao Pass against the rebellion of Prince Ping in a great battle. It was during that time that she saved the critically wounded Qin Xuanjiu and accepted him as her disciple.

Unlike other disciples who were fresh and tender, General Qin’s rough appearance and pockmarked face did not fit Mu Qingge’s standards for accepting disciples.

Curious, Xier asked the Senior Uncle Master if General Qin was more handsome twenty years ago?

Yu Chen shook his head vigorously, and said that General Qin didn’t look as robust and was even creepier, thinner and uglier back then.

Just then General Qin passed by on his horse, he glared at Yuchen and shot, “My Master didn’t mind my appearance. Who do you think you are to criticize me?”

It’s worth noting that General Qin actually did not get along well with Su Yishui and his two attendants.

Ranran also only learned later, that Su Yishui was actually the illegitimate son of Prince Ping who started the rebellion.

In other words, if Mu Qingge hadn’t intervened, Prince Ping might have been successful in his rebellion and become Emperor. At that time, if Su Yishui was made legitimate, he would have become a real prince.

Because of this, General Qin, a military officer of Daqi, didn’t have a good opinion of the illegitimate son of the Rebel prince and his attendants. This, coupled with the betrayal incident involving the Master, created new worries and old grudges!

When General Qin cursed, Yu Chen also got upset. With a few words, the two started arguing on horseback.

Yu Chen cursed, “Look at yourself in the mirror. With your appearance, Mu Qingge must have been so drunk and made a mistake when she accepted you!”

As his Master had been killed shortly after he joined the sect, General Qin Xuanjiu had always been upset that he couldn’t be recognized officially and return to his roots in the sect.

Now, hearing Yu Chen point out his weaknesses, he became livid. He took out a pair of golden hammers from his bag and preparing to fight Yu Chen to the death.

Ranran watched the spectacle from the carriage by their side for a while, and seeing that they couldn’t resolve it, she hurriedly smiled and comforted the angry general.
“General Qin, my Senior Uncle Master is just joking with you, playing around. One can see that you clearly have extraordinary foundation, a rare talent for cultivation. Moreover, the disciples of Xishan belong to the Wood element. Your name has the character ‘wine,’ just like my Shifu’s name has ‘water,’ which is beneficial for Wood energy. Grandmaster Mu must have thought that your life lot will be good for her, so she accepted you as a disciple.”

These were just conciliatory words, but when General Qin heard them, he looked at her in amazement, tears welling in his leopard eyes, and said, “……My Master said the same thing back then. How did you know, little girl?”

Um… Ranran could only awkwardly smile and say that she was just talking nonsense, and if there was any resemblance to the truth, it was purely coincidental.

Unfortunately, this unintentional talk aroused General Qin’s nostalgia for his esteemed Master, so that night, he sought out Su Yishui by the riverside camp to drink, getting very drunk again.

Ranran found the subtle interaction between these seemingly opposing fellow disciples very profound.

Considering their opposite attitudes toward their former Master, Mu Qingge, but they were still able to travel together peacefully, was truly unthinkable. However, she didn’t know what circumstances had linked these two together, leading them to Wangxiang Pass in the Northwest.

But very soon, she found out the reason.

Allowing his disciples to relax along the way, as they were approaching Wangxiang Pass, he looked at the dark clouds that have gathered and asked his disciples, “Do you know the mystery behind the name ‘Wangxiang’?”

Bai Baishan never missed a chance to show off his knowledge of cultivation texts and immediately said, “The Three Realms are divided into Heaven, Earth and Human Realms. Among them, the Earth Realm is the realm of death and forgetfulness. It is said that before the dead souls enter the underworld, they have to linger in Wangxiang Valley for three years, waiting to resolve their lingering thoughts from the human world, forget their ties before they can reincarnate from the underworld.”

Su Yishui nodded, indicating that his second disciples’s words were correct. Then he continued, “Originally, Wangxiang Valley did not overlap with the human world. But twenty years ago, during the Fangyao Battle, there were too many casualties. Together with the secret opening of the Netherworld, the balance between Yin and Yang was disrupted. The Yin energies of Wangxiang Valley leaked out and overlapped with the surface, turning Wangxiang Pass into a place of heavy Yin energy. Coupled with being a key border town, there are always conflicts here. The Yin energy, nourished by grievances, has even bred many Yin demons. Your purpose in coming here is to assist General Qin in subduing demons and eliminating evil.”

Gao Cang, the passionate young man, was excited and eager, filling with impatience. But the other three disciples became wide-eyed with fear.

Bai Baishan cautiously asked, “Shifu, besides cultivating and building foundations through meditation and carrying sandbags up and down the mountain, we haven’t learned anything else! Now that we’re in such a perilous place, what abilities do we have to subdue demons and eliminate evil?”

Ranran also nodded vigorously by the side. Besides pill alchemy, she had only practiced bouncing on lotus leaves. If Shifu brought them some minor demons for them to practice on, it would still be fine. But now that they were in a place full of Yin demons, won’t they would just be swallowed up whole by those demons instead?

Qin Xuanjiu stood aside with disappointment: “Since when have disciples of XiShan Sect become so cowardly and afraid of death? Think about how impressive my Master used to be. How did you produce such timid disciples? This is really not giving her any reason to be proud!”

Yu Chen coldly snorted, “What does Master’s disciples have to do with that female demon?”

But obviously, arguing was of no help in improving their skills. Su Yishui’s disciples lacked confidence and had no assurance of saving any dignity for XiShan’s Lingxi Palace.

Su Yishui tried to reassure his disciples by comparing their experiences with Ranran’s Light body technique: “If you want to make rapid progress in cultivation, you must face life-threatening situations. This kind of situation is exactly a great opportunity for your advancement, so you must cherish it even more.”

Ranran was a bit unsure whether the master meant for them to cherish the opportunity for advancement or cherish the remaining time of their lives.

However, seeing Su Yishui’s serious expression, it was clear he wasn’t joking. The disciples, who had been enjoying themselves along the way, reluctantly began memorizing the techniques for Subduing Demons and practicing their skills of pasting talismans.

Qiu xier would cry while practicing, then wipe her tears and continue.

Ranran wanted to cry with her, but fearing it would waste time, she could only pat her choking senior sister on the back and say, “Be good, recite the Thirteen Techniques for Demon-Slaying with me again.”

In short, *the inadequate disciples managed to cram in some knowledge by **rote learning before reaching the Main gate of Wangxiang Pass. They more or less learnt the basic skills that they were going to use when facing demons.
*赶鸭子上架 :
比喻强迫去做能力达不到的事情 forced to do something they are not capable of doing
**囫囵吞枣: literal- swallowing the whole date without chewing – learning without analyzing at all

They also learned about the strange events that occurred at Wangxiang Pass two months ago. It turned out that just two months ago, an entire camp of Qin Xuanjiu’s soldiers went missing while patrolling along the Wangxiang River.

The border had been calm for a while with no conflict, so Qin Xuanjiu immediately sent people to search for the missing soldiers.

But the soldiers who returned were all deathly pale and some spoke incoherently, only saying they were all in the river.

When Qin Xuanjiu went to see for himself, he found the naked bodies of thirty-six soldiers floating on the river’s surface, their armor and clothing neatly stacked by the riverbank.

It looked as though they had collectively decided to throw themselves into the river.

But Qin Xuanjiu didn’t believe it at all. Several of these thirty-six soldiers were trained by him personally, all of them were straightforward and brave men. Two of them had families at Wangxiang Pass, and they were even about to become fathers.

Before they set off for the patrol, they had joked, eaten and drank together, saying they would continue the celebration when they returned. How could they have done such a senseless thing?

The mystery of these deaths by drowning had not been solved, and similar strange events had subsequently occurred at Wangxiang Pass.

Rumors began to spread, suggesting that Qin Xuanjiu had mistreated his men so much that they couldn’t bear the humiliation and chose to die by drowning with grievances.

Qin Xuanjiu couldn’t defend himself, so he took soldiers to guard the river for three nights, but nothing unusual happened. This seemed to further confirm the accusations of mistreatment of soldiers.

Right when he was inexplicably accused, he suddenly remembered something and quickly retrieved an Bagua compass from behind the portrait of his Master, Mu Qingge.

Looking at it, he saw that the yin and yang on the compass were completely reversed, things were out of order.

Qin Xuanjiu remembered his Master’s instructions when she gave him this compass, saying that if there were anomalies on the compass, he must look for Su Yishui. So, he temporarily put aside his grudges against Su and went to West Mountain to find him, asking him to come and resolve the crisis at Wangxiang Pass and took the chance to vent some of his pent-up resentment towards Su Yishui.

If it weren’t for the vow he made to his esteemed Master never to make things difficult for Su Yishui, he really wanted to kill this ungrateful *white-eyed wolf with one swing of his blade!
*白眼狼 raised someone ungrateful

But Qin Xuanjiu didn’t expect that Su Yishui, while a rascal as a disciple, was even worse as a Master. He had actually sent out his newly initiated disciples as sacrifice for evil spirits.

In the vast yellow sands of the northwest, watching a few young people wrapped in borrowed military uniforms like dumplings, standing pitifully by the Wangxiang River like abandoned children, Qin Xuanjiu asked uncertainly, “Is it really okay to leave them here for the night?”

Over the past two months, there had been three consecutive inexplicable incidents of soldiers drowning. Was it really alright to leave behind four rookie cultivators who were still so green by a dark river?

Su Yishui nodded and took out a stack of something from his pocket, handing it to Ranran.

Ranran took a look and found that it was a stack of green paper cut into lotus leaves…

Su Yishui said, “If you feel something is wrong, throw these into the river.”

“Master, are these Thunderbolt Spirit Talismans capable of subduing demons and eliminating evil?” Ranran asked hopefully.

However, Su Yishui shook his head. “It’s too cold here, and lotus leaves can’t grow in the river. With these, you can use Light body technique to avoid drowning…”

This kind of answer made Ranran’s little face fall—she was afraid she might be ensnared by some evil spirit and lose her senses, simply won’t remember to use light body techniques to step on lotus leaves.

Moreover, these green oiled paper lotus leaves seemed too perfunctory, right? They were Master and disciples, at least provide some real lotus leaves!

After instructing them, with a wave of his sleeve, Su Yishui left without taking any disciple with him, and went to the city.

Although Qin Xuanjiu sympathized with these young people, he couldn’t persuade Su Yishui, so he also shook his head and left with the soldiers.

The imperial envoy had already entered the Pass, and Qin Xuanjiu had to deal with those annoying lawsuits. But he consoled himself a little—if Su Yishui’s disciples also drowned, it would at least prove that it wasn’t his mistreatment of soldiers that led to their suicides by drowning.

In recent days, coffins in nearby towns had been in high demand. He wondered if their Master would be willing to spend a large sum of money to prepare some good funeral items for them…

Second Senior Uncle, Yu Tong, felt sorry for her nephews and nieces and left them with two warm military tents, fire starters and a bundle of firewood for keeping warm at night. As she left, she sighed helplessly, telling them to take care and strive to have a reunion breakfast the next day.

When everyone had left, only four fellow disciples remained, looking at each other.

Qiu Xier said with a sullen face, “My mother said she sent me up the mountain to cultivate immortality, but she didn’t say I would be fed to evil spirits! Big Senior Brother, Second Senior Brother, should we think of a solution ourselves?”

With a loud clang, Gao Cang drew out his sword that had been passed down his family, and said with determination, “Third Junior Sister, don’t be afraid. If there are truly evil spirits or demons, I will fight to the death to protect you all!”

Ranran was more practical. She borrowed the sword from her eldest senior brother, to open up the bundle of firewood. She then made a fire for them to keep warm, roasted some sweet potatoes and drumsticks that she had prepared, to pass this long night in the northwest.

After the firewood burned into embers, Ranran tossed the sweet potatoes into it and soon a sweet fragrance filled the air. Adding to that the drumsticks marinated with coarse salt and spirits on the grill, these naive young men and women couldn’t help but swallow continuously, setting aside their fear for a while.

After the drumsticks were grilled, Ranran mysteriously took out a wine bag from her pocket. “You’re in for a treat. I brought this from the Western Mountains…” Gao Cang took a sniff and widened his eyes, “So fragrant? What kind of wine is this?”

Ranran smiled and said, “I brewed it myself. If it’s nice, have a few more sips. It’ll warm you up.”

She made this wine, called “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” brewed following the instructions in the ‘Playing Classics’. She had been hesitant to bring it out for fear of her Shifu recognizing it.

Now with only her fellow disciples left, it was the perfect time to fortify their spirits against the cold.

The night in the northwest was very cold, but Ranran was dressed warmly. Inside her thick cotton military coat, she wore a small floral jacket her mother had made for her. Although it made her look plump like a roly-poly doll, she felt really warm when she drew her neck into the woolen collar.

After enjoying the delicious food and wine, everyone’s dantian felt warm.

Bai Baishan told some jokes at the right time, making everyone laugh heartily. This didn’t seem like demon hunting anymore but more like an excursion. Ranran started singing folk songs from the mountains, her beautiful and clear voice echoing in the wilderness, soothing everyone’s hearts.

Coupled with the exceptionally mellow wine, they forgot what fear was, completely immersed in the excitement and laughter of youth.

Coming from a military family, Gao Cang, after taking a sip of “Detain Heaven’s Immortal,” poured a cup into the river to honor the fallen soldiers.

These brave spirits buried in the mountains had sacrificed themselves for their country. How could he drink alone?

The night was too dark for Gao Cang to notice that when he poured the wine into the river, bubbles began to emerge from the calm surface.

After they finished eating, they each returned to their tents to sleep, but such an atmosphere made sleep elusive. So, they decided to meditate in their tents to calm and restore themselves.

Ever since Ranran took the Clear Heart Pill she refined some time ago, after over ten days of fasting, she suddenly felt some breakthroughs.

During meditation, she no longer felt unbearable back pain. When her breathing and the flow of energy throughout her body synchronized, she really felt a sense of connection with the world.

Her hearing also became much sharper, able to hear the distant howls of wolves on the mountain and the sounds of rodents digging holes not far away.

In short, all sounds were amplified endlessly, while she herself gradually became calm amidst the cacophony…

Suddenly, Ranran opened her eyes wide and whispered, “There’s a sound in the river…”

To be precise, it was an almost inaudible song. Vaguely, the lyrics seemed to be something like “Returning home…”

When she looked at Qiu Xier next to her, she realized Xier had already opened her eyes, staring blankly at the river outside the tent.

Ranran called out to her several times, but Xier remained unresponsive, completely ignoring everyone.

At that moment, Ranran heard the bubbling sounds from the river seem to grow louder. Qiu Xier stood up suddenly, and walked out of the tent.

Ranran quickly got up and followed her out, finding that the two senior brothers from the other tent had also come out.

Their eyes were vacant, clearly in the same state as Qiu Xier, walking blankly towards the Wangxiang River.

Ranran continued calling out to them, but they did not turn back. When they reached the riverbank, the three of them started to undress and neatly fold their clothes, placing them by the shore.

The uniformity of their movements was absolutely chilling and goosebumps inducing. This scene was exactly as General Qin Xuanjiu had described before!

Realizing that if she didn’t do something right now, they would soon take off their underwear and shoes, and jump into the river, Ranran quickly picked up a new piece of firewood, made a torch from the still-burning firewood pile, and ran to shine it towards the river.
