When the firelight illuminated the area, she saw large bubbles emerging from the river, but she could not tell what was in the water.

Turning back to look at those who had fallen under the spell, Ranran bit her lip, suddenly recalling something. She took out the Clear Heart Pills she had refined from her pocket. Then she poured three of them into her mouth, chewed them into pieces, and put them into their mouths.

Ranran wasn’t sure if it would work, but she remembered Shifu saying that the simpler the pill, the purer its effects.

For example, the Clear Heart Pill she used at the entry-level was not only helpful for cultivating and fasting but also lived up to its name, calming the mind and resisting mental disturbances.

Although her Shifu had never explained, Ranran speculated randomly that the pills she made with the alchemy furnace used by Mu Qingge before, was itself a divine item that focused spiritual energies. It had higher demands towards the user of the furnace, and must not mix in distractions which could completely disrupt the control of the pill’s effects.

Perhaps because of this, the pills she first made, with distractions mixed in, were so overbearing that they ruined her Shifu’s three years of fasting.

Now, the pills she refined were made during her meditation, with fewer distractions. Today, out of desperation, she could only try giving them to see if they would work.

The crushed pills melted in their mouths. Even without swallowing, they flowed down their throats. Just as they were about to take off their inner wear and shoes, the Clear Heart Pills finally took effect.

Bai Baishan was the first to come to his senses. He shivered in the cold wind, then looked down at the neatly stacked pile of clothes, feeling somewhat dumbfounded.

Next, Qiu Xier came around as well. She first saw the under-dressed appearance of the two senior brothers, then looked down at herself, realizing she was only wearing her undergarments. She immediately screamed in embarrassment and anger, then quickly squatted down to pick up her outer clothes and put them back on.

Senior Brother was awakened by Third Sister’s scream, looking foolishly at his fellow disciples, and stuttered, “Wha… what’s going on?”

Xue Ranran had no time to explain, so she just pointed to the river and said, “There’s something strange in the water, quickly move away from the river.”

At this moment, the three who had just awakened also saw the roiling water bubbles on the surface of the water, so they quickly picked up their clothes and shoes and hurriedly retreated.

Perhaps because the three controlled individuals resisted the evil power and woke up in time, the river now became even more turbulent, even starting to emit water sprays that gradually turned into numerous rising streams of water, which rushed towards the shore as if to drag these few young people into the water.

“Quick, set up the formation!” Ranran shouted quickly.

The other three immediately formed the Demon-subduing formation taught by their Shifu, drawing talismans with their hands in front of their chests, while the four of them formed a *’Pin’-shaped formation. *品

According to their Shifu, once the formation was set up, they could support each other and face the enemy more calmly. The so-called demons were just a kind of creature that absorbed yin energy.

As long as they remained calm, observed carefully, discover the vital points of these creatures, they could use their swords to subdue the demons and uphold righteousness.

Unfortunately, these few novices were using this technique for the first time. Some were fast, some were slow. Qiu Xier was panicking and completely uncoordinated. In the end, she didn’t run to her position and even tripped and fell to the ground.

When she exclaimed as she fell, the demon-subduing formation, which was fine just now, revealed a gap. The water stream also seemed to have noticed this weak point and suddenly attacked Ranran.

“It” had just used a spell to bewitch the minds of people, and while the other three were all affected, only this young girl was not affected at all. She even had a way to awaken the other three.

So “it” decided to deal with this troublemaker first, before dealing with the remaining three.

Previous
Next

Ranran was caught off guard and swept up by the water stream. Although Senior Brother drew his sword to chop at the water stream, cutting at the water only made it flow more vigorously, and he couldn’t intercept Ranran, who was swiftly being swept away.

Just as Ranran was about to be pulled into the water, she pulled out the thick stack of green oiled paper lotus leaves and scattered them on the river surface like a *heavenly maiden scattering flowers. *天女散花

Upon touching the water, the seemingly ordinary green oiled paper, suddenly emitted thousands of streaks of golden light. These lights quickly connected to form a vast net, woven from the numerous pieces of green oiled paper, tightly covering a large area of the river surface.

As the golden light formed a net, a sharp and miserable howl suddenly came from the river. The water stream holding Ranran also suddenly loosened its grip and she was about to fall into the water.

With her life hanging on a thread, the technique she had memorized by heart came into play. Ranran used the Light body technique and landed steadily on the lotus leaves made of oiled paper.

The mysterious power in the water continued to struggle, extending water streams like tentacles. Ranran, who had been trained by Shifu to dodge stones, now agilely leaped back and forth like a little rabbit, dodging very timely.

When she managed to get a moment, Ranran shouted loudly at the three dumbfounded people on the riverbank, “Quick! Form the attack formation!”

The three were stunned by Ranran’s extraordinarily agile movements. Usually lazy and always goofing off, she had only been enthusiastic about cooking and eating. But their little junior sister actually possessed such light and nimble skills!

Only when they heard their little junior sister’s reminder did they react and hurriedly proceeded to fell into formation.

Unfortunately, they were too slow to react. The power in the river had rallied again, breaking through the golden net to once again envelop Ranran.

At this critical moment, a white cat rushed out from the nearby bushes and transformed into a fierce Gengjin white tiger in an instant, roaring as it pounced toward the strange waves.

Taking advantage of the situation, Ranran somersaulted onto the back of the white tiger. The Geng jin white tiger firmly planted its four paws on the lotus leaves made of oiled paper and fiercely bit towards the foaming area of the river surface.

Under the shining golden light of the lotus leaves, Ranran noticed that the white tiger was biting at the area where the foam was churning vigorously. There was a rending wail, and black water emerged from there.

Ranran understood that this area of foaming bubbles is the vital point of this water demon.

She shouted again for Senior Brother to throw her his sword . This time, Gao cang finally reacted quickly and threw the long sword in his hand to Ranran.

Sword in hand, Xue Ranran rode on the back of the tiger, clasping its waist with her legs and moved back and forth with the white tiger. Whenever she saw a foaming area on the river surface, she fiercely stabbed into it with her sword.

As she had guessed, there was resistance when the sword pierced into the water, and it indeed hit something!

Soon, the disturbance in the water became weaker and weaker. Although the unknown water demon was dodging everywhere in the water, it couldn’t match the speed of the white tiger. It was soon covered in wounds from Ranran’s sword. It let out a loud splash, and then dived into the river bottom to escape.

When the white tiger carried Ranran back to shore, Qiu Xier rushed to the front, agitatedly hugging Ranran and said, “Junior sister, you’re amazing!”

The other two senior brothers also gathered around and praised their junior sister’s bravery.

However, Ranran felt a bit embarrassed; she knew her own limitations. If it weren’t for the lotus leaves made of oiled paper covering the river surface and the help of the white tiger, she would have fallen into the river long ago.

Unfortunately, although she injured the water demon with the help of the white tiger, it fled so quickly. She didn’t know if it would come back and cause chaos again.

Just as the four were still in shock, the water surface suddenly churned again, but this time with even greater momentum, the waves surged straight into the sky.

Obviously, the demon had returned and its power was even more violent now. The oil paper lotus leaves on the river surface were quickly swept away without a trace.

Ranran looked up at the huge waves, feeling a tightness in her chest. She felt that even if the white tiger was powerful, it would not be able to enter the river in such a violent wave.

Just as the giant waves were about to slam down on the river surface, suddenly, as if blown by a violent wind, they were abruptly stopped.

In the sweeping whirlwind, a figure in white robes suddenly appeared.

The youths all looked closely and shouted in unison, “Shifu!”

It turned out that Su Yishui appeared just in time and conjured a whirlwind spell to stop the giant waves. He held a random branch picked from somewhere in his hand, and seemed to casually thrust it into the center of the giant waves, and another earth-shattering wail sounded.

The water on the river surface then retracted, and it seems like the demon intended to escape again. However, Su Yishui held a random fishing net from somewhere. He threw it onto the river surface and pulled it back, actually pulling out a humanoid creature with fish scales and gills from the water. With a twist of his wrist, he slammed it fiercely onto the shore.

With this, the giant waves also fell heavily, crashing back into the water.

Ranran held the sword with both hands, nervously facing the “monster” that Shifu had thrown onto the shore. Upon closer inspection, she found that it looked very human, and it was a woman with a rather beautiful face.

With the exception of “her” face, “it” was covered in scales all over its body, even its fingers were webbed, and there were fish gill-like things on the sides of its cheeks.

There was a gaping hole in its chest, oozing black blood, and its cheeks were also full of scars.

Ranran guessed that the bubbles earlier were from the monster’s gills, so the two gills should be the ones she had cut, and the fatal wound on its chest should have been inflicted by Shifu.

Seeing that Shifu did not abandon them and leave, but was silently standing guard nearby, Ranran’s heart was full, and she looked ardently towards Shifu.

Unfortunately, Shifu did not seem to feel the ardent gaze of his disciple. He came over with a cold face and spoke harshly to her, “In the Ninth Technique of Subduing Demons, it is said that when in danger, one should first protect oneself and not chase after enemies. Why did you risk your life just now, fighting it while riding on the white tiger?”

This… Ranran was a bit at a loss for words on where to begin refute his words. If they started at the beginning, she had been in danger only because Shifu had left them here in the first place!

However, according to the news rules of the XiShan Sect, everything Shifu said is correct. Ranran could only humbly accept the lesson and promised that she would definitely escape when she could, should they fight demons again.

Seeing that his disciple was still receptive to his teaching, Su Yishui finally stopped looking stern and turned his head to look at the injured monster.

“Shifu, what kind of exotic beast is this?” Bai Baishan couldn’t recognize it, so he asked.

“She’s not a monster, just a woman who practiced Beast Taming Technique and became possessed.”

Beast Taming Technique? Ranran had heard about it when Second Uncle Master talked about the Summary of Spells. It was a technique to merge oneself with the body of a beast, aiming to change one’s ordinary mortal attributes.

For example, merging with tigers and leopards could give sharp claws and swiftness in movement. This woman had obviously merged with a fish-like aquatic creature, gaining the features of a fish, allowing her to cause trouble in the water.

At this moment, Su Yishui lowered his head with a cold face and asked the strange woman, “Why did you lure soldiers into the river?”

The woman’s mouth was already oozing blood, and she reached out in fear as if seeking help, “I… I had no choice, save……save me…”

Xi’er looked at her pitifully. Feeling sorry for her, she took out hemostatic medicine powder, wanting to apply it for her.

But as soon as she squatted down, the woman suddenly revealed a murderous intent. Her webbed fingers suddenly grew sharp thorns and fiercely stabbed towards Xi’er’s neck.

Clearly, this woman knew that she did not have long to live, so she wanted to take someone along with her if she could.

Fortunately, Su Yishui extended his long leg and kicked Xi’er aside, narrowly avoiding the attack.

The woman’s scheme failed, she only smiled grimly and glared at Ranran. Suddenly, her voice, which had been feminine, became low and terrifying, completely different from her voice before: “Why… aren’t you controlled? Who are you really…”

Before she could finish her words, she died. The originally red pupils gradually dissipated, becoming dark and murky.

Just then, as the sky was getting brighter, Qin Xuanjiu rushed over with his men on horses.

Seeing the strange-looking fish-woman, Qin Xuanjiu’s brows furrowed, “How could such a monster appear in Wangxiang River?”

Su Yishui pointed to a tattoo of a talisman-like pattern on her neck and said, “Someone was controlling her. Even after being injured, she can come back again. Such reckless fighting also seems a bit involuntary…”

Ranran squatted down carefully, looking at the talisman, which was different from what Shifu usually taught. This was very complicated, and seemed to have some ancient text that was difficult to understand.

Qin Xuanjiu frowned, “Someone is controlling her? For the sake of harming people’s lives? What’s the benefit?”

Su Yishui looked at Qin Xuanjiu and said mildly, “With your kind of brain, how did you manage to remain an official until now?”

Qin Xuanjiu didn’t expect Su Yishui to attack him suddenly with such sarcastic words, which made him so angry that his belly bulged up and down. He was about to retort when Ranran, who was thinking by the side, whispered thoughtfully, “Yeah, what’s the benefit? Naturally, it’s to destabilize General Qin’s position. Wasn’t there already an imperial envoy sent to investigate General Qin?”

This silenced Qin Xuanjiu. Because the fact was just that. If he was convicted of mistreatment of his soldiers and causing them to commit suicide, he would definitely be punished and sure to lose his position.

But who would go to such lengths to frame him? After all, being a small city defense general was not a glorious position. Being stationed in such a poor and remote place, many military commanders would want to avoid it!

Su Yishui looked at the endless Wangxiang River and said to Qin Xuanjiu, “Your Master once entrusted you with the task of remaining at Wangxiang Pass, because this is where the Yin and Yang converge, a place of obscurity. If there are any anomalies, they will definitely begin from here. Someone went to great lengths to get rid of you, probably thinking that your presence was hindering them.”

Thinking of the instructions from his Master, Mu Qingge, Qin Xuanjiu felt fire in his heart. He clenched his fists, declaring, “I absolutely will not leave Wangxiang Pass!”

Before he finished speaking, Su Yishui suddenly reached out and grabbed Qin Xuanjiu’s collar, throwing him into the river.

Qin Xuanjiu struggled to stand up, already becoming completely soaked. He wiped the water off his face and roared furiously, “Su, what are you doing?!”

Su Yishui maintained the demeanor of a Master, calmly saying, “Helping you resolve your current lawsuit.”

……

Previous
Next

When Qin Xuanjiu ordered the body to be carried into the city, it was already bright daylight, and the road leading into the city was bustling with merchants. Along the way, the onlookers were shocked by the scene.

As for the earlier rumors about Qin Xuanjiu mistreating the soldiers, they were naturally debunked — it turns out there was such a monster enticing the soldiers to jump into the river! Fortunately, General Qin showed his bravery by entering the river and killing the monster. Truly deserving of the title of a brave and heroic general!

With such a mighty General stationed there, it was a blessing for the people! Watching the drenched Qin Xuanjiu return to the city, its clear that he had personally fought the water demon in the river.

The people eagerly cheered for General Qin, creating a lively scene. If it weren’t for the guards protecting him, they might have even knocked down the Imperial Envoy Li, who was standing in front.

As for the disciples of XiShan, they kept a low profile and quietly entered the city with the crowd. They then went to a porridge shop to have breakfast.

However, Gao Cang felt a bit disappointed. Looking at the distant cheering crowd, he felt that the flowers and accolades should have been for them.

Ranran comforted her senior brother, “If it weren’t for Shifu, we would be floating on the river now, probably also carried into the city and watched by a crowd. So, sitting together like this having breakfast is better than being a spectacle.”

After hearing her junior sister’s words, Gao Cang recalled the danger of last night. He quickly drank the porridge to calm himself, feeling that this blissful moment did not come easy.

Ranran also attentively served some side dishes to her senior brother.

Afterwards, Ranran suddenly noticed Shifu staring at her, with great displeasure in his eyes. Not understanding why, she quickly placed some food into Shifu’s bowl with her chopsticks as well.

Usually, Su Yishui didn’t like eating outside food from street vendors or restaurants. However, seeing his disciple serving him out of filial piety, he reluctantly ate it slowly.

Ranran silently noted down in her heart: Shifu doesn’t like disciples serving each other dishes; at the dining table, we should only serve Shifu!

Although Shifu didn’t say it explicitly, but another peculiar rule from XiShan was added.

After accepting their heroes welcome, Qin Xuanjiu reported to Envoy Li about last night’s battle. When Li saw the half-human, half-fish monster, he was quite horrified.

He came here intending to bring charges against Qin Xuanjiu; there were instructions from above, hoping General Qin would relocate. Originally, everything was falling into place; even though there were no soldiers in the camp accusing him of cruel treatment, the deaths of so many people in two months were strong evidence.

But who would have thought that in just one night, Qin Xuanjiu would suddenly catch a water monster from the Wangxiang River. Now, the soldiers’ inexplicable actions of jumping into the river had an explanation; it was this water monster’s ability to enchant hearts, luring the soldiers to lose their senses and jump into the river.

Qin Xuanjiu said he had already written a report and had it expedited to the emperor. The body of this female water monster would also be wrapped in lime to prevent decay and sent to the capital.

As for being framed for mistreating soldiers, he officially objected to accusation and had already requested his former superior — the current Minister of War, General Zhou Dao — to seek justice for him.

Envoy Li, knew that now charging General Qin and investigating him would seem untenable. The Emperor would surely be alerted to such a strange incident and likely to prompt deeper inquiries.

So, he couldn’t immediately convict him as planned; he had to report back first and then make new plans.

Qin Xuanjiu had just sent away the envoy when one of his subordinates hurriedly reported that the village’s chief constable, while watching the water monster’s body being paraded, recognized her as the missing widow Yue’e from their village.

This widow took on the task of delivering meals to the nearby military outpost for construction work, cooking three meals a day near the military outpost’s large stove with three women from the village.

But three months ago, she suddenly disappeared and never returned. At that time, it caused quite a stir; her elder brother even said that soldiers in the camp fancied his sister’s beauty, which is why they abducted and imprisoned her.

Unexpectedly, when they saw her again, not only was she dead, but she also turned into that ghastly appearance, which was truly frightening! The chief constable felt this matter was significant and didn’t dare to conceal it, so he immediately reported it to General Qin.

Upon hearing this, Su Yishui asked if there could be a mistake.

The chief constable thought for a moment and said affirmatively that the female demon had a black mole on her cheek, identical to Yue’e’s, which was too coincidental.

Su Yishui then inquired about what kind of person Yue’e was in daily life.

The chief constable said disapprovingly, “She was young and could have married a young man, but she chose to marry the 80-year-old rich widower in the village. Unfortunately, less than a year after their marriage, the old man died. She conspired with her brother to try to take over the family’s fortune but was ousted by the old man’s daughter, as she did not manage to birth a child. She failed miserably and became a laughingstock in the village, so she went to work at the military outpost to make a living.”

Knowing that this water demon was an ordinary village woman just three months ago made the situation even more suspicious.

Upon hearing this, Su Yishui asked the chief constable to summon the women who worked with Yue’e.

The chief constable nodded and called the women who worked with Yue’e to the General’s residence for questioning.

At first, these women were a bit fearful, but once they saw Su Yishui, their eyes widened in astonishment— my my, there’s a man who looked like a handsome immortal from a painting, how is he so handsome!

Ranran, seeing this and fearing that they were staring at him for too long, which may annoy Su Yishui, stood in front of them and waved her hand, saying, “Excuse me, do you know Wang Yue’e?”

These women, after recovering their senses, looked at the young girl in front of them — My my, how could she also be so beautiful?

One of the women said honestly, “We know her, but we don’t know who kidnapped her. It’s been a long time since we’ve seen her.”

Ranran asked again, “Do you remember the last time you saw Yue’e? When was it?”

After thinking for a while and discussing with each other, they finally remembered. It was at the beginning of the month, three months ago when Yue’e had dressed up nicely, put on a new dress, and said she was going to the town to buy things. She rode on a donkey and went by herself.

Listening to the women’s words, it didn’t sound like she was buying things but rather meeting a man in secret.

So, when she didn’t return for a long time, they speculated privately that Yue’e had eloped with a man. But it was strange because during those days, they were so busy working in the military outpost, cooking for over fifty craftsmen three times a day; where would she find time to meet a man? Could she have met a man from the army camp?

But she insisted on dressing up every day, wearing pretty dresses, looking very cheerful, and occasionally standing by the Wangxiang River, smiling foolishly.

After further questions, nothing substantial could be gleaned from the women. Furthermore, based on Yue’e’s daily activities, it seemed to have nothing to do with any activities linked to sinister spirits or talismans.

Why did she suddenly mutate into a demon who killed countless people?

However, as for who was behind this female water demon, that needed to be thoroughly investigated. Otherwise, if similar events happened again, innocent soldiers would be killed. To investigate thoroughly was quite simple; all they needed to do was examine the origin of the talisman symbols on her neck.

Su Yishui had already instructed Yu Tong to copy down the symbols for him to search through ancient texts. But after a thorough search, he still couldn’t find anything similar.

There was another thing that Ranran couldn’t understand. If the water demon wanted to frame General Qin, why were those three nights he was on duty peaceful?

Regarding this, Su Yishui had an explanation. He mildly said, “His destined lot is good; he was born in the Year of the Cat and can escape nine dangers. The three days that he was on duty happened to coincide with a cold wave, which caused the Wangxiang River to freeze. The water demon absorbs water vapor to generate her power, she will hibernate when the water surface freezes.”

After hearing this, Ranran looked at General Qin with respect. Such a great fortune was truly rare. However, General Qin had already risked his life on the battlefield many times before; who knows how many of these nine lives he had left?

As for why Mu Qingge had made an exception to accept such an ugly disciple, could it be because she saw value in his remarkable destiny lot?

As for this incomprehensible talisman, it seemed they needed to find an expert to decipher it.

Su Yishui remembered a person, conveniently living not far from the Wangxiang river in the Cuiwei Mountain, which can be reached in a day.

That person was an expert in taslimans; consulting him might provide some clues.

So Su Yishui, accompanied by his entourage and disciples, went to visit. Qin Xuanjiu also followed them.

After a day’s journey, when they reached the foot of Cuiwei Mountain, there was a cultivated farmland, and as far as the eye could see, it was filled with lush green wheat seedlings and vast patches of sweet potato seedlings.

Bai Baishan looked at the farmland in shock and muttered to himself, “Now… isn’t it almost winter? How are these seedlings growing so well?”

This place was not the water-rich region of Jiangnan, and approaching winter, barren fields were the norm; how could there be such fresh wheat seedlings?

Gao Cang saw several farmers wearing straw hats weeding in the fields and walked over to inquire.

But no matter how he called out, that person didn’t respond. Gao Cang got a little angry and reached out to pull the person.

Unexpectedly, the person was as frail as paper glued together; with a little force, the person fell straight down.

Scared, Gao Cang also jumped, then quickly squatted down to help the person. But when he turned the person over, Gao Cang screamed in horror and jumped up again.

It turned out that person… was actually made of straw, dressed in clothes and wearing a hat, but there were no eyes or nose on the face, just lying there like that, scaring the living daylights out of people.

Ranran was also startled; she stared at the “people” working in the field and found that their movements were stiff, each one emitting a strange bizarre vibe.

Just then, a strong wind blew, and several “people” floated along with the wind, spinning in the air. When the wind subsided, those “people” fell to the ground again, picked up their hoes, and continued working methodically.

It seemed that these “people” were all made of straw. Ranran noticed that there were talismans attached to their backs, apparently someone was controlling them to work in the fields.

At this moment, a crow suddenly landed on one of the straw figures, tilted its head, carefully scrutinizing Su Yishui and his group. It then opened its long, sharp beak and cawed, “Who goes there?”

Previous
Next

Su Yishui glanced at the talisman tied to the crow’s foot. Clearly someone was controlling the bird to come and inquire about their identities.

So he replied, “Xishan Su Yishui, here to visit Elder Jiu.”

Upon hearing Su Yishui’s name, the crow suddenly jumped up, flapping its wings and said, “Bastard Su Yishui, won’t see won’t see!”

Qin Xuanjiu, listening from the side, developed a newfound appreciation for this Elder Jiu, whom he had never met. At the very least, they shared a mutual dislike for this Su guy.

Su Yishui was not annoyed; he reached out in a flash, somehow grabbed the crow’s neck, and then took out their copied water demon talisman, and held it in front of the bird. He said, “This was obtained from a woman practicing Beast Taming. Sir, I would like to ask, do you know its origin?”

The crow, upon seeing the talisman, widened its eyes massively and forcefully broke free from Su Yishui’s hand. In a sharp voice, it asked, “How is this possible? Someone actually knows about this…”

It was clear that the person controlling the bird was in a dilemma. The crow landed on the back of a straw figure again, pacing anxiously, then finally made up its mind, “Alright, come to the Grass Hall on the mountain.”

So Su Yishui and the others followed the crow’s lead and climbed up the mountain.

The road up Cuiwei Mountain was really steep, they can see that not many people came here. If it were in the past, Ranran would definitely not be able to make it up. Fortunately, her Light Body Technique had become more proficient; she effortlessly leaped and hopped up the steep slope like a deer on her tiptoes.

As for Gao Cang and Bai Baishan, who were used to their Shifu’s punishments back in Xishan, their legs were agile from training with sandbags. It was only poor Xier who couldn’t make even halfway up and had to stay at the foot of the mountain to wait for their return.

The mountain became even more steep, so Qin Xuanjiu, Yu Chen, Senior brother, and Bai Baishan couldn’t go any further and had to stay behind.

In the end, only Su Yishui and Ranran climbed up the mountain.

Actually, Ranran didn’t want to continue the climb a while ago. It wasn’t because she was tired, but she felt that it would be nice to stay with her senior brothers halfway up the mountain, have some of her drinks, eat some dried jerky and biscuits that she brought, and enjoy the scenery.

Unfortunately, Shifu didn’t allow her to stop. In the end, he even held her waist and carried her along, riding on the wind, and quickly arrived at the mountaintop.

The mountaintop of Cuiwei Mountain was also lush green, with a simple grass hall nearby and several barns filled with sweet potatoes and wheat.

The air was filled with the fragrant aroma of sweet potato wine, and a short old man was turning the brewing materials in front of a wine vat.

Seeing the visitors, the old man, with a nose covered in yeast, snorted, “I wondered why another barrel of wine went bad today? Turns out a Disaster star was coming!”

Su Yishui didn’t mind the old man’s peculiar temperament; he just stood in the courtyard, waiting for the Elder Jiu to come over to talk.

The Elder Jiu seemed to not know Su Yishui. After angrily smashing the spoiled wine vat, he limped over, scrutinizing Su Yishui from head to toe, “You look quite decent! No wonder that Mu girl was so bewitched, you made her suffer so terribly!”

It seemed the old man was an old friend of Mu Qingge’s and harbored great animosity towards Su Yishui, the rebellious disciple. Then, he rudely gave Xue Ranran the once over, and asked coldly, “And who might you be?”

Xue Ranran bowed politely and softly said she was Su Yishui’s disciple, causing the Elder Jiu’s eyes to widen in surprise.

“What can you learn from someone who betrays their Master and ancestors? Young girl, you’ve gone astray at such a young age!” the Elder Jiu retorted.

Xue Ranran couldn’t find a rejoinder so she could only pretend to inspect the surroundings, slipping away to the side.

Su Yishui seemed to understand the elderly man’s eccentric nature and didn’t engage in a verbal argument. Instead, he took out the copied symbols of the talisman and said, “Old Sir, you seem to recognize this talisman. Could you tell me their origin?”

The Elder Jiu circled him a few times, before reaching out for the talisman, carefully examining it. They couldn’t quite tell if his face showed a mix of nervousness or excitement, but he laughed almost breathlessly, “That Mu girl did her very best to seal the breach caused by the Netherworld spring. But in the mouths of those righteous folks, it became her causing trouble in the mortal world! A scapegoat, indeed. *‘Picking hundreds of flowers to make honey, for whom do they suffer, for whom is it sweet’! But your retribution came swiftly! Aren’t you self-proclaimed righteous people? Let’s see who else will be as foolish as that Mu girl, to give their all to save you from the breach opened by the Netherworld this time !”
*采得百花成蜜后，为谁辛苦为谁甜
A poem that praises the great virtues of hardworking bees and criticizes those who benefit from the hard work of others

He laughed maliciously, but his words left Xue Ranran bewildered.

According to this elderly man, was Mu Qingge actually a good person before? Was there something more to her privately breaking into the Spiritual spring and releasing the demon lord?

But seeing him mock Shifu like this, Xue Ranran couldn’t help but step in to defend her master: “Old Sir, what you’re saying isn’t fair. When the chaos of Yin and Yang arrives, who could keep to themselves? And can you just stay hidden here making wine? Besides… your wine-making isn’t right! You’ve wasted so much grain for nothing!”

The Elder Jiu was the younger brother of the renowned Grand Medicine Immortal who ascended long ago. Due to his love for wine, he had delayed his progress in cultivation and, despite living to two hundred years old he was always one step away, still yet to achieve immortality.

The old man was uninterested in the first half of Xue Ranran’s words but took great offense at her remark about how his “wine-making isn’t right”.

He has boasted that he had tasted the best wines in the world and was not only a connoisseur but also skilled in brewing. How could this silly young girl dare say his wine wasn’t brewed right?

The Elder Jiu jumped up, angrily asking, “What’s wrong with it? If you can’t explain yourself, watch me knock you down the mountain with one strike!”

Xue Ranran, who was bored earlier, had smelled the wine from the broken jars on the ground and picked up a piece, taking a small sip.

Upon tasting it, she immediately recognized the wine… It was an attempt to copy the renowned “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” from the “Playing Classics”. However, the timing of adding ingredients during fermentation was wrong, and the fermentation temperature was off, leading to a deviation in taste.

Actually, the wine itself wasn’t bad, but since Xue Ranran had tasted the genuine “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” she had brewed following the recipe, she naturally found this imitation extremely awful.

Xue Ranran stole a glance at her Shifu, weighed the pros and cons, and decided that resolving the water demon issue was more important right now.

So she asked the Elder Jiu in a low voice if he was trying to brew the “Detain Heaven’s Immortal”. The old man was astonished, staring at her with wide eyes and asked, “What? Have you heard of this wine before?”

Xue Ranran nodded and handed him the wine gourd by her side.

This was the last of “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” that she had brought; the rest had been consumed by her senior brothers while they were keeping watch by the river.

The Elder Jiu was initially skeptical but, upon opening the gourd, was hit by a strong aroma of wine. He couldn’t resist tasting it and completely disregarding if the wine might be poisoned, he just drank it without any thought. After savoring a sip, his eyes lit up. He quickly took several more big gulps.

In just a few gulps, he finished the wine. Longing for more, he smacked his lips in satisfaction, and asked, “Young girl, how do you have such authentic ‘Detain Heaven’s Immortal’?”

Xue Ranran honestly replied, “I brewed it. If you like it, I can help you brew some.”

The Elder Jiu, hearing this, jumped back, “Nonsense! Nonsense! Only Mu Qingge knows how to brew this. How could a young girl like you know it?”

Xue Ranran felt he was getting drunk and cautiously hid behind her Shifu, showing only half of her little face and said in a small voice, “It’s just wine, not some elixir of immortality. Why can’t I know how to brew it?”

This remark made the Elder Jiu start stomping his feet in fury once more. It was this wine, that he had only tasted once and could never forget. But despite spending twenty years studying it painstakingly, he just couldn’t replicate the taste again.

Now, a young girl spoke to him with such disdain, as if the wine was ordinary well water, isn’t she mocking him for being stupid?

But after jumping around for a while, the intoxicating taste of the wine that lingered on his tongue was too much. How could a few mere sips satisfy his craving? The Elder Jiu stopped jumping and solicitously directed his words behind Su Yishui, “Young girl, I couldn’t confirm the authenticity of the flavor just now. Give me another pot to taste.”

Xue Ranran remained hidden behind her Shifu, refusing to come out. She muttered, “I don’t have any left. But if you tell my Shifu about the origin of that talisman, I’ll brew you a vat.”

The Elder Jiu raised his eyebrows and glared at Su Yishui, his tone unfriendly as he said, “I heard that you saved Mu Qingge in the end and guided her soul to the tree?”

Su Yishui nodded and replied mildly, “She has safely reincarnated.”

The Elder Jiu let out a gratified sigh, believing this statement immediately. It seemed that after living in seclusion for so long, this man had forgotten that people can be deceitful, revealing a childlike innocence.

The Elder Jiu was pondering in his mind: he and Mu Qingge were old friends who bonded over wine. If Mu Qingge had died at this kid’s hands, he would rather never satisfy his craving than strike a deal with this kid.

But since Mu Qingge was still alive, making a very small deal with Su Yishui wouldn’t be considered betraying their friendship of the wine cup.

Thinking this, he couldn’t suppress his wine craving any further , and he confidently said, “As long as you teach me how to brew this, I’ll tell you everything I know about these symbols and talismans.”

However, brewing wine wasn’t something that could be done overnight. Even under ideal temperature and humidity, it would take at least seven days.

Xue Ranran indicated that it would take a very long time, but her Shifu’s situation couldn’t wait, so could the Elder Jiu tell them first. Elder Jiu proudly laughed and presented a porcelain wine vat covered in mysterious talismans.

According to Elder Jiu, while a day passed in heaven and a year passed on earth, this vat also has control of time. A day passes outside this vat, while a year passes inside the vat.

However, such manipulation of time was extremely draining on spiritual power. The vat full of talismans actually condensed half of the Elder Jiu’s lifetime of spiritual power.

This kind of absurd manipulation of time might explain why his elder brother, the Grand Medicine Immortal, ascended long ago while the Elder Jiu remained in Cuiwei Mountain, growing sweet potatoes to make wine.

Xue Ranran thought to herself, engaging in such frivolous pursuits… no wonder he and her former Grandmaster are birds of a feather!

Previous
Next

With the blessing of this treasure vat, the wine was brewed quickly. Following the steps from the “Playing Classic,” Ranran meticulously mixed the ingredients, her movements fluid and seamless, completing the process in one go.

The vat was also quite amazing. In just a short while, the aroma of wine started seeping through the sealed oil paper.

Elder Jiu excitedly took a sip, confirming it was indeed the desired taste. Now, he looked at Ranran as if she were a treasure, impressed by the skills of this young girl.

Worried that he might get drunk, Ranran hurriedly reminded him of his promise. Elder Jiu urgently took several big gulps more and then squinted, saying, “This talisman is the Seven Evil Transformation Spell. When used, it can transform a person into a beast, greatly enhancing their spiritual power. At the same time, the caster can also drive the target to extreme demonic transformation, a very powerful ability… This talisman is too domineering and wicked. It’s said not to belong to the human realm, merely used to manipulate desires and amplify greed… See here, what are these two characters?”

Ranran, with her three years of private school education, couldn’t hope to understand. Su Yishui glanced at it and said, “This is Sanskrit.”

Elder Jiu nodded, “Since tens of thousands of years ago, it was said that the Netherworld Spring had breached three times. During the last disaster, a group of Tian zhu people worshipped the Spiritual spring as a deity and founded a demonic sect called the Fantian Sect. These symbols were charms used by the sect members to enhance their spiritual power. They didn’t need to cultivate their foundations or Qi; they just needed the blessings from talismans, to grant them tremendous power like the water demon you encountered. This is why some speculate these talismans’ symbols are manifestations of the Spiritual spring’s power, used to seduce and manipulate people for its own ends…”

Hearing this, Ranran immediately thought of that Yue’e. She was also a greedy person; who knows if she fell to some temptation and so turned into that inhuman state?

Elder Jiu, sipping his wine, sighed ruefully, “All these people… their greed is too great, choosing not to remain humans… But the Fantian Sect was wiped out a hundred years ago in the battle of righteousness and evil. How could something like this still be circulating?”

Ranran was also puzzled: if these talismans were long lost, why did they appear in the Wangxiang River?

Could it be that the Netherworld Spring has breached again, creating these talismans to beguile people?

If the water demon had been deliberately created by someone, with the aim of driving away Qin Xuanjiu who guarded Wangxiang Pass, it was likely for opening a dangerous rift between the Yin and Yang realms, with intention to bring forth chaos.

Thinking about how her Shifu once gave Wei Jiu the key to the Netherworld Spring, Ranran couldn’t help but wonder if this had something to do with Wei Jiu?

Just then, Elder Jiu went into the house and brought out a small wooden box. Opening it revealed a velvet-wrapped… finger-sized small bottle?

The bottle was exquisite, with delicate patterns that also seemed like talisman symbols, its jade-like material shimmering with a faint light.

“Back when Mu girl was possessed by the Spiritual spring, she barely managed to escape it but she had no way to send it back to the Netherworld. She could only seal it temporarily with a Soul-Hosting Stone. I don’t know where she hid it. However, the Spring’s power will grow over time, even if sealed, it won’t last long. Once the stone cracks, it will summon many evil spirits… This is the Sky-Mending Jade that Mu Qingge had asked me to find. It’s made of millennium ice and condensed into spiritual jade. This was all there is of it, made into this small bottle. Unfortunately, she was gone when I finished it… If you ever have the chance to find the Soul-Hosting Stone, use this to contain the Spiritual Spring. It’s sturdier than the stone.”

Saying this, Elder Jiu handed the small jade bottle to Ranran. Clearly, he didn’t think much of Su Yishui, but seeing the evil talisman he brought, he knew the Spiritual spring that Mu Qingge had sealed might be causing trouble again. If he ignored this, he probably couldn’t live peacefully either and drink wine every day anymore.

Moreover, the Spiritual spring was Mu Qingge’s unresolved regret, so after some thought, Elder Jiu decided to give the bottle to this young girl, who he felt a connection with.

Since there was nothing else to inquire further, Su Yishui was about to leave with Ranran.

Elder Jiu felt a special affinity with this young girl and took the opportunity as she was leaving to give her a small cloth pouch.

“Besides being a wine connoisseur, I’m also skilled in drawing talismans. This pouch contains some protective charms. Perhaps you might need them. After all, following an unfortunate master like yours, you might get into trouble too. If things go wrong, be smart and escape first. If you’re not happy following this Su, you can seek refuge in Cuiwei Mountain with me. My abilities far exceed those of Su Yishui!”

Elder Jiu openly played the villain, trying to poach Ranran in front of Su Yishui.

Ranran looked at the red-nosed Elder Jiu and forced a dry laugh, not wanting to upset her Shifu, she hurriedly followed Su Yishui down the mountain.

On the way down, she voiced her suspicions and carefully asked, “Shifu, when you gave the key to Wei Jiu, weren’t you afraid that after obtaining the Spiritual Spring, he might come back for revenge?”

Su Yishui glanced at her and replied, “The Spiritual Spring is no longer in the Netherworld. Even if he goes, it’s just to see the scenery. He gave up so much of his cultivation to me; it’s only right to send him for a break.”

Although Ranran had already suspected that there must be something more to the key, she didn’t expect her Shifu to be so mean.

Wei Jiu with half of his golden core gone… when he goes searching for the Spring only to find a dried-up waterhole, his androgynous face must have turned purple with anger, right?

However, the Fantian Sect, exterminated a hundred years ago, had no survivors. If it was really the Spiritual spring that breached again, and using evil talismans to beguile people, how could they find out where Mu Qingge hid the Spring?

After hearing Ranran’s question, Su Yishui counter-questioned, “Where do you think Mu Qingge would hide it?”

This… although Ranran thought it would be more straightforward if her Shifu asked Mu Qingge directly, she still thought about it carefully and replied, “Mu Qingge had specifically instructed General Qin to guard this place, and this human-turned-demon, also appeared at Wangxiang Pass. That means the Soul-Hosting Stone should also be here.”

When they reached the foot of the mountain, Su Yishui briefly explained the situation to Qin Xuanjiu and then asked, “When Mu Qingge asked you to guard Wangxiang Pass, did she also tell you what you are guarding?”

Qin Xuanjiu raised his eyes as if trying to recall, then said somewhat evasively, “At thet time, Master was severely injured from battling the demon lord in Fan Yao’s Great Battle. She needed time to recuperate and saw many disciples buried here without any family to care for their graves. So she ordered me never to leave this place and to regularly tend their graves. That’s why I repeatedly turned down Lord Zhou’s offer to promote me to the capital and stayed here.”

Su Yishui listened to this, then asked mildly, “What else do you need to do while stationed here?”

Qin Xuanjiu hesitated for a moment and said, “Apart from tending the graves during Qingming Festival, every year on the first and fifteenth day of the month, I need to replenish the lamp oil in the temples I was tasked to build by Master, in the order of east, west, south, and north. This keeps the lamps in these temples lit, comforting the souls of the fallen warriors…”

These were clearly insincere words of evasion. It seemed Qin Xuanjiu was still wary of Su Yishui and didn’t want to reveal the truth.

So no matter how Su Yishui asked next, Qin Xuanjiu kept his mouth tightly shut behind his beard.

Seeing that Qin Xuanjiu didn’t want to tell him, Su Yishui didn’t press further. However, when Su Yishui was about to leave with his disciple, Qin Xuanjiu became anxious.

“The mastermind behind this hasn’t been caught yet, why are you in such a hurry to leave? If they regroup and break through… what should we do?”

Ranran found General Qin’s behavior very amusing, so she spoke softly, “General Qin, if you want my Shifu’s help, you must be willing to share what you know. Besides, your Master once entrusted you to seek help from Su Yishui if there’s anything unusual here, right?”

Qin Xuanjiu scratched his beard, feeling relieved as he finally spoke, “Back then, she subdued the demon lord and also took his Netherworld Spiritual Spring. Unfortunately, because Master nearly got controlled by it, she spent alot of effort in order to free herself. Later, Master said she sealed it somewhere in the Wangxiang Pass.
In order to prevent it from causing chaos in the world again, someone has to guard it always. When my Master accepted me as her disciple, she was already practicing dangerously close to demonic cultivation. The Soul Transference Technique she used was a profound art that could reverse the heavens and earth, shifting the stars themselves. If not controlled properly, the demonic nature within one’s body would surge uncontrollably. Initially, in order to suppress the demon lord, she used this technique to transfer most of his demonic nature and a large portion of his spiritual spring energy away. However, the demonic nature of the spiritual spring was too strong, and even my master struggled to contain it. Eventually, she devised a method. On the fifteenth day of the seventh lunar month, using the peak of Yin energy at Wangxiang Pass, she transferred the demonic nature and power onto a Soul Hosting Stone, sealing it thereafter. My duty was to guard this Soul Hosting Stone, but I truly do not know its whereabouts. My master only instructed me to diligently observe the BaGua Compass; if anything unusual occurred, I was to seek you out…”

Second Uncle Master Yu Tong couldn’t help but sigh when she heard this. Previously, she had believed that the female demon Mu Qingge had been tempted by powerful magic, which led her to dabble in the dark arts. Now, after hearing General Qin’s words, she realized how deeply misunderstood Mu Qingge had been by the world back then.

However, if she was trying to restrain the demon lord, she could have sought help from the orthodox sects. Why was she unwilling to explain her actions to anyone? And what was the purpose to send Qin Xuanjiu to look for Su Yishui to solve the breach of the Spiritual spring?

At this point, Qin Xuanjiu was already shedding tears uncontrollably, he continued: “But she was already weak at the time, and ambushed by the accursed righteous factions, resulting in her tragic death… You bastard! You were there but did nothing to stop it, allowing them to bully my master!”

As Qin Xuanjiu spoke, he couldn’t contain his grievances any longer and he wanted to kick Su Yishui. Yu Chen hurriedly intervened, but he also did not know what to say.

Ranran glanced at her expressionless Shifu and felt that beneath his calm exterior, he wasn’t as indifferent as he appeared. But as his disciple, she could only try to smooth things over.

“General Qin, there were so many people back then, and my Shifu can hardly fight them alone! Besides, he did his best to preserve GrandMaster’s soul and helped her to reincarnate on the Rebirth Tree. Now, GrandMaster Mu has been reborn and is doing well… By the way, why didn’t you go to Jiuhua Mountain to look for her?”

Previous
Next

At Ranran’s words, Qin Xuanji’s sobbing intensified, and he said with his wet beard, “Of course I went to look for her! But my Master spent twenty years on the tree so her memories are a bit confused. She said she doesn’t remember me anymore!”

After hearing that Mu Qingge had reincarnated, Qin Xuanjiu was so excited that he hadn’t slept for several nights. Before looking for Su Yishui, he had been inquiring all the way, leading him to Jiuhua Mountain.

But it seemed that his reborn Master was busy and had no time to see him.

Later, Qin Xuanjiu finally managed to run into Mu Qingge at the foot of the mountain, when she returned from Xishan. She looked at his pockmarked face in surprise and then laughed, saying she did not remember him. Could it be that he took her joke seriously and thought of himself as her closed-door disciple?

After all, everyone knew that Mu Qingge only took in disciples who were good-looking; being too ugly would hurt her eyes.

Qin Xuanjiu had wanted to say more to jog his Master’s memory but was impatiently driven away by the disciples of Jiuhua Sect.

So when Qin Xuanji went to Xishan to look for Su Yishui later, he cried his heart out while drowning his sorrows in alcohol. Even Su remembered him, why did his Master forget him?

Seeing General Qin so distressed, one can’t help feeling bad to see a grown man cry. Rannan contributed her small handkerchief to let General Qin wipe his tears and comforted him, “GrandMaster Mu may have forgotten things, and can’t remember you, but she will definitely not forget about important matters like the Soul Hosting Stone! As long as you guard Wangxiang Pass and repel those with evil intentions, when she recalls everything later, she will surely feel that she didn’t misjudge you and be glad she accepted someone as outstanding as you as her disciple!”

As Rannan spoke, her eyes sparkled, looking at Qin Xuanjiu with sincerity.

For some reason, Qin Xuanji felt a sense of relief and thought this did make sense. After all, his Master had been hanging on a tree for twenty years; how could he expect her to come back exactly the same as before?

The most important thing now was to guard the Soul Hosting stone and not screw up the task his Master had given him.

Now that they have discovered the motives of those behind the scenes, Master and disciples couldn’t go home for now. They had to slowly search for where the Soul Hosting stone was hidden.

So they settled into a house arranged by Qin Xuanjiu in the town near the Pass.

The adventure on Wangxiang River had made the young ones aware of their shortcomings. They might face even fiercer battles in the future and couldn’t always rely on the tiger and their Shifu Su Yishui to bail them out every time.

So every morning, even before dawn, they would practice swordplay, meditate, and work on cultivating their foundations.

Since Rannan had figured out the key to Pill refinement alchemy, Qiu Xier’s alchemy furnace had almost been idle. No matter how she practiced, the pills she made were not as potent as Rannan’s. Since Rannan wasn’t selfish about it, Qiu Xier simply became lazy and used the pills Rannan made to consolidate her foundation and cultivate her Qi.

Even though they were just basic Clear Heart Pills, they were very nourishing. Qiu Xier’s heart ailment had not recurred for a longwhite. So….. Shifu could now train his female disciples equally. In the early mornings, they would run laps with their two senior brothers.

In the words of their Second Uncle Master, without strong legs, they could stumble again in the next battle during formation. Something as foolish as tripping oneself up when subduing demons was simply humiliating!

To redeem themselves, they had to run ten laps around the river every morning.

But Rannan didn’t find it very tough. As Shifu said, once they mastered the essentials of foundation building, cultivating and regulating Qi in the dantian would make you feel light and agile. Covering a thousand miles in a day wouldn’t be just a myth.

Watching their little junior sister bouncing around like a little rabbit at the front of the group, while the three of them behind were slightly panting, only able to call out, “Little junior sister, wait for us!”

Rannan turned around and smiled, “You guys are too slow. I still have mushroom meat buns steaming on the stove in the kitchen! I’ve already finished ten laps, so I’ll go back first. You guys continue running!”

With that, Rannan ran towards Wangxiang Pass on her own.

It was early in the morning, and the Pass was open. Merchants doing business had already lined up early to pass through the inspection.

However, a team with magnificent horses and carriages stood out, escorted by soldiers, bypassing the queue and heading straight below the Pass. A military commander riding on a horse in front shouted loudly, “By the decree of His Majesty, the JiuHua Battle Goddess and Immortal Mu Qingge is requested to investigate the case of the demon at Wangxiang Pass. Quickly summon General Qin Xuanjiu to receive the decree!”

The man who shouted wore the official uniform of the Capital’s *Imperial Guards, with an Official plaque hanging from his waist and holding a shining imperial decree in his hand.
*Imperial Guards, also known as the Forbidden Troops

The city guards dared not delay and hurried to find General Qin Xuanjiu inside the Pass.

Rannan squeezed into the crowd, curiously watching the beautifully crafted wooden carriage. Just then, a gust of wind blew, lifting the curtain of the carriage, revealing Mu Qingge’s beautiful face.

The onlookers erupted into exclamations, whispering to each other, “Oh my, there is actually such a handsome young lady. Could it be that the Jiu Tian Fairy has descended from heaven?”

The people inside the carriage naturally heard the commotion. Mu Qingge seemed to enjoy the ordinary praises and raised the curtain further, looking out with a cool expression.

The crowd exclaimed, “WAH!” and they got even more excited, calling out “Look, it’s a fairy!”

At this moment, Mu Qingge smiled, ready to lower the curtain. But in the midst of her gaze sweeping around, she suddenly saw Rannan standing in the crowd. Her eyes paused, and she got off the carriage.

The soldiers cleared the way and dispersed the onlookers, as Mu Qingge beckoned for Rannan to come closer to talk.

“You… are Yishui’s little disciple, called Xue Rannan, right?”

Because Qin Xuanjiu had told them of Mu Qingge’s unknown hardships, Rannan felt very sympathetic towards this female demonic cultivator who had been misunderstood by the world.

Upon hearing Mu Qingge’s question, Rannian respectfully bowed and said, “Yes, that’s me. May I ask why Immortal Mu has come here?”

Mu Qingge looked at Rannan in a manner as how one would look at a junior, smiling benevolently, “You’ve come… has your master also come?”

Rannan felt that she couldn’t casually reveal her Shifu’s whereabouts. After all, their relationship was unclear, with unresolved grievances. So she just smiled foolishly and didn’t speak.

Seeing her like this, Mu Qingge didn’t get angry but instead held Rannan’s hand and smiled gently, “I once had a younger sister named Mu Ranwu, just like you, with the word ‘Ran’ in her name. Unfortunately, she’s no longer with us. But seeing you, it’s as if I can see her again, like a little stooge always following me around…”

As she spoke, Mu Qingge’s expression carried an indescribable sense of melancholy, as if talking to herself, “She never left my side, always leaning on me for everything…”

Then she turned her gaze to Rannan and said with a smile, “Although we’ve only met a couple of times, I always feel a sense of affinity with you. I really like you, child. If we consider it, you can be considered my grand-disciple. Calling me ‘Shi zu’ sounds too old, so just call me ‘Grandmaster.'”

Rannan learned from Qin Xuanjiu about the undisclosed truth of the past and also knew that this Grandmaster was not as bad as the righteous sects portrayed her. However, her over-familiar manner and deliberate move to establish a relationship made Rannan feel a bit uncomfortable. Ranran wasn’t a child who becomes friendly with anyone easily. Having her hands held by someone she wasn’t very familiar with felt awkward.

So she discreetly pulled away and took a step back, saying, “Immortal Mu, I still have a pot of buns steaming. I shall take my leave first!”

With that, she dashed away, heading back to deliver the message to her Shifu.

Watching the little girl abruptly run off without observing proper etiquette, Lin Yeting, the newly acquired wealthy disciple of Mu Qingge and the son of Prime Minister Lin, frowned slightly. “How is Su Yishui’s disciple is so lacking in manners! She runs off before finishing her words! But then again, Su Yishui has always been arrogant. It’s not surprising that he would produce such rude disciples.”

Lin Yeting had suffered from severe rheumatism and had once sought medical help from Xishan but was turned away. Su Yishui’s attendant had mercilessly mocked and insulted his father, accusing him of being corrupt, causing him to be utterly humiliated. However, due to the large crowd gathered then, he couldn’t retaliate, so his resentment towards Su Yishui was immense.

Fortunately, with Mu Qingge’s rebirth, his father, being the Prime Minister, had been entrusted by the Emperor to personally visit Mu Qingge. He then pleaded with her to relieve his son’s illness.

Although Mu Qingge had been hanging on a tree for twenty years, she was well-versed in human affairs and showed great benevolence. Not only did she remove Lin Yeting’s pain with her spells, transferring his rheumatism to one of his servants, but she also gladly accepted him as her disciple, allowing him to cultivate some body strengthening techniques.

Prime Minister Lin had always been concerned about his son’s frail health, so naturally, everyone was pleased with the situation. Lin Yeting knew that Mu Qingge was a person highly regarded by the Emperor, so he put aside his noble status and diligently studied under Mu Qingge, not for immortal cultivation but following the Emperor’s instructions to have a reliable person by Mu Qingge’s side. If Mu Qingge needed anything, it had to be arranged promptly, showcasing the Emperor’s favor.

However, his brown-nosing just now clearly fell flat. Hearing Lin Yeting mock Su Yishui, Mu Qingge’s gaze turned cold, and after giving him a glance, she rebuked, “Xishan was established by me, and Yishui is also my disciple. If we think about it, he’s your Senior brother. How can you speak rudely and mock your senior?”

Lin Yeting quickly apologized with a bow. But Mu Qingge’s attention had already shifted away from him, focusing on the general with a face full of pockmarks who was briskly walking out of the city gate.

This person… she had seen him before! He had once claimed to be Mu Qingge’s closed-door disciple and tried to establish a kinship with her at the foot of Jiuhua Mountain… Could he be Qin Xuanjiu, the commander of Wangxiang Pass?

With that thought, Mu Qingge put on a smile and walked towards that tearful pockmarked face…

Leaving behind the tearful scene of Master and disciple acknowledging each other at the city gate, Rannan ran all the way back to the small courtyard where they were staying, ready to report to her Shifu.

But to her surprise, after searching the courtyard, she found her noble and refined Shifu actually in the kitchen, rolling up his sleeves and using bamboo tongs to take out the buns from the steaming iron pot!

Hmm… With her Shifu having to carry out such mundane tasks, it seemed like the disciple had been negligent in service. Rannan hurried over, circling around Su Yishui, “Oh dear, Shifu, are you hungry? Let me serve the buns for you!”

But Su Yishui said he wasn’t hungry. Its just that she had mentioned before that when the buns are done, they should be kept for only *fifteen minutes more in the pot, exactly.
*半炷香 the time it takes to burn half a stick of incense

Previous
Next

When he saw that the time was up and she hadn’t returned yet, he decided to take out the buns first to avoid overcooking and affecting the taste.

Rannan was moved, her Shifu was so attentive, remembering every word she said!

So she quickly picked a bun with a red mark on it, blew on it, and handed it to her Shifu, “Shifu, you don’t like chopped green onions, so these with red marks are filled with a different filling that I made. Try it while it’s hot and see if it suits your taste?”

After saying that, she couldn’t wait and picked up one herself, broke it open, let out the steam, took a big bite, and then looked eagerly at her master, motioning him to eat while it’s hot.

The corner of Su Yishui’s lips curled slightly, like a smile but not. Following her example, he opened the bun, and ate it slowly one bite at a time.

After the master and disciple finished one bun each, not letting down the aroma of the buns fresh out of the pot, Rannan suddenly remembered the proper business, and quickly relayed the news about Mu Qingge’s visit to Wangxiang Pass with the imperial decree.

Although she suspected that her Shifu had a complicated relationship with Mu Qingge, her master seemed calm and composed right now, seemingly not agitated at all. He just used his chopsticks to pick up another bun and asked Rannan to prepare some sauce for dipping.

Rannan was meticulous, following the ratio in “Playing Classics” she prepared an oil and vinegar sauce for her Shifu.

This time it seemed to suit Shifu’s taste, as he leisurely dipped the sauce and ate another bun. Then, he suddenly asked, “How did you know that I don’t like green onions?”

…Uh, this…

Rannan suddenly realized that Shifu had never specifically told her to exclude onions and garlic when cooking. Although “Playing Classics” had detailed annotations, Shifu would still eat the dishes even when she made them with onions and garlic…

“And, how did you brew the “Detain Heaven’s Immortal”? That’s a fine wine created by Mu Qingge herself.”

Since they left Cuiwei Mountain, Shifu had never brought up this topic. She didn’t expect him to suddenly mention it now, catching her off guard.

Now, she couldn’t really say it was just her guess. After hesitating for a while, she could only uneasily reveal that she had accidentally discovered the hidden compartment in the study.

Su Yishui, with lowered eyes, continued to eat a bun while listening to his young disciple struggle to explain the section on “Fierce Beasts” in “Playing Classics.”

Of course, she couldn’t go into too much detail about the embarrassing incident from long ago, where Shifu had been teased by the female demon, to avoid Shifu getting angry right now.

The specifics would have to wait until Shifu returned to Xishan, and he could read it for himself.

However, Shifu would not let her off easily. With a flat expression, he demanded that she recite word for word, what was written about him. Under his relentless prodding, Rannan had to awkwardly recount everything in detail.

After reciting everything exactly as it was from the book, she was somewhat afraid to look up at her Shifu’s face.

But her Shifu remained silent for a long while, so she tentatively raised her head—only to see Su Yishui’s handsome face devoid of the raging fury she had imagined.

Seeing her finally lift her head, he then said very mildly “When cooking in future, you don’t need to specially exclude onions and garlic. I’m not picky about those anymore. Using sea salt to marinate longan fruit was a method out of necessity to preserve them, because there was no sugar. I don’t like to eat it.”

Rannan was somewhat surprised. Her former Grandmaster’s painstakingly observations, turned out to be all wrong? Come to think of it, her Shifu was the son of a prince, how could he possibly enjoy snacks favored by commoners?

Just then, Second Uncle Master, Yutong, walked in. “Master, Mu Qingge and disciples from Jiuhua Sect have arrived at Wangxiang Pass and are currently being welcomed at the general’s residence by Qin Xuanjiu. Qin Xuanjiu has sent someone to invite you over.”

Upon hearing this, Rannan heaved a sigh of relief. Her entrapping former Grandmaster had finally proved somewhat useful by getting her out of a bind.

Yutong had overheard a little, and seeing Rannan looking crestfallen after her lecture, she comforted her, “You don’t know about your Master’s childhood circumstances, naturally, you have some misunderstandings… Although he was the Prince’s son, he wasn’t acknowledged until he was ten. Before that, his days with the Lady were quite impoverished… My Master once told my brother, that one time, the Lady got some rare longan fruits during an outing and wanted to save them for him. But she was afraid they’d spoil on the way back, so she used sea salt to preserve them. When she brought them back, the Master found the taste peculiar but didn’t say anything to avoid hurting the Lady’s feelings, so he quietly ate them all…”

Rannan’s eyes widened as she listened. She had not expected Shifu’s childhood to be like this. But thinking about it, he was just an illegitimate son of the Prince’s concubine. If the Prince had ignored him before, wouldn’t he have been worse off than children from poor families?

“Then… why did Mu Qingge say that whenever he got angry in the past, eating sea-salted longan fruits would improve his mood?”

Yu Tong shook her head, indicating she didn’t know either.

However, as Rannan thought about it, her heart skipped a beat. She knew Shifu had been forced to join Mu Qingge’s sect. As a teenager at a rebellious age, he had to live with Mu Qingge’s unpredictable temperament, inevitably having to endure humiliation.

So every time Mu Qingge provoked and angered him, feeding him those salted longan fruits that represented bitter days, it was akin to *Goujian, the King of Yue, tasting gall in silence, patiently biding his time.
*勾践 Goujian was a king who forced himself to taste bitter bile, in order to remember his days of humiliation

This kind of endurance and testing of one’s limits… even the most raging anger could be extinguished by that sour and bitter taste, teaching the young man patience and resilience, like a spring ice river about to crack, calm on the surface but turbulent below…

But Mu Qingge had misunderstood, thinking he liked them, so every time he got angry, she would use them to placate him…

Ranran was startled by her own thoughts. At the same time, she felt a sense of inexplicable sadness: perhaps Grandmaster Mu’s behavior at that time was just her being playful, but it made a sensitive and melancholic young man feel deeply humiliated.

This kind of two-way disparity, a master-disciple relationship running counter to each other, was really lamentable……

Thinking about how Shifu would slowly swallow those unpalatable longan fruits in front of Mu Qingge, he was probably thinking about how to dismember her into pieces?

In this way, it could be explained why he would stand by and watch while Mu Qingge was besieged, with her soul scattered in the wind.

Ranran sighed again. The “Fierce Beasts” chapter in “Playing Classics” had been completely wrong. Throughout it all, perhaps only the part about “Retaliation for small offences” was accurate…

Perhaps because he couldn’t let go of the memories of oppression from Mu Qingge, that’s why Shifu was now so cold and distant from her. When Shifu finally arrived at the General’s residence with his disciples who had all eaten their fill of buns, it was already noon.

Wei Fang, who had been accompanying Mu Qingge in her wait, was very fed up! Seeing Su Yishui arriving late, he immediately raised his eyebrows and coldly snorted, “Su Yishui, making us all wait for you, you have quite the arrogance!”

Su Yishui completely ignored him. He looked at Qin Xuanjiu, who was serving Mu Qingge diligently, he went straight to the point and asked, “General Qin, what’s the matter that you wanted to see me about?”

This time, Qin Xuanjiu had finally given a few glances by his esteemed Master. As he explained the process of how he became a disciple, his respected Master seemed to recall some long-forgotten memories, remembering bits and pieces.

However, those past memories were still hazy, and his respected Master couldn’t recall most of it; she mainly relied on what Qin Xuanjiu told her.

Considering there were too many people around his respected master, including even disciples from Jiuhua Sect, Qin Xuanjiu kept his guard up and didn’t mention the Soul Hosting stone that contained the Demon Son’s power.

He would have to wait until there were no others around, to talk to his Master about this hidden secret.

Although he didn’t mention it, the fact that there were demons coveting this place was enough to arouse curiosity. Mu Qingge was instructed by His Majesty Su Yu to investigate the water demon matter.

Initially, she wasn’t very concerned, but when she saw Qin Xuanjiu, who claimed to be her closed-door disciple, and learned that Su Yishui was also present, Mu Qingge finally took things seriously.

However, since even Su Yishui couldn’t detect the mastermind behind the scenes, she was also at a loss, and could only wait for the hidden hand to act again so she could investigate further.

After Qin Xuanjiu helped his respected Master settle in, he passed through the garden and saw Ranran standing at the garden gate, holding a vassal of wine, asking him, “General Qin, I brought back a newly brewed “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” from Cuiwei Mountain. I remember you enjoyed it, so I especially brought you some.”

Upon hearing this, Qin Xuanjiu’s eyes brightened. He praised the Xue girl for her thoughtfulness, took the wine bag and eagerly drank a sip.

However, after that sip, Qin Xuanjiu’s eyes gradually glazed over, his sturdy tower of a body swayed unsteadily, and finally, he fell backward and passed out.

At that moment, Yu Chen rushed out from the corner and promptly caught Qin Xuanjiu, dragging him into the nearby room.

Su Yishui was waiting in the room, very much at ease.

He casually drew a talisman, then flicked his fingers to ignite it, burning it to ashes. He dissolved the ashes into a bowl of clear water and had Yu Chen pour it into the mouth of Qin Xuanjiu, who was lying on the ground. Then he had Yu Chen remove Qin Xuanjiu’s shoes, and drew another rune under his feet.

Ranran watched fearfully from the side, suspecting whether she inadvertently became an accomplice to a major crime and helped her Shifu to murder a high-ranking official of the court.

Just now, Shifu only asked her to serve wine, not to knock out General Qin!

Su Yishui looked at her big eyes rolling nervously and guessed her unease.

After he finished writing the spell under the foot, he told Ranran that he had only cast a “Forgetful curse” on Qin Xuanjiu, and the talisman under his foot was just a protective charm to ward off evil.

Since the Emperor has invited disciples from Jiuhua Sect to Wangxiang Pass, they will surely cause chaos again now that they have gotten mixed up in this. So Su Yishui simply added a “lock” to Qin Xuanjiu’s mouth.

He would temporarily forget about the Soul Hosting stone so that he won’t have to engage with the Jiuhua Sect people. Although this charm only lasts for three days, it should be enough.

After they put Qin Xuanjiu’s shoes back on, Yuchen brought him back to the Moon Gate where he passed out just now. Qin Xuanjiu woke up clutching the wine bag.

He shook his head dazedly and muttered, “Why is this wine so strong…”

But before he could finish speaking, the young girl standing before him snatched away the bag of wine, saying, “Perhaps it wasn’t brewed well. I’ll bring another bag for the General in future.”

The young girl ran away so fast, that Qin Xuanjiu hadn’t reacted yet when she had disappeared from sight.

Even though it seems like one of the more quiet chapters, without any exciting fights with demonic vines or rolling pins, but this is one of my favorite chapters.

Shifu and disciple eating steamed buns companionably together, just the two of them, without the others.

Most importantly, Su Yishui finally had the opportunity to ask Ranran, how she knew of the things she knew.

He must have been in so much inner turmoil since she started doing things that only Mu Qingge knew? Ranran had always been similar to Mu Qingge in behavior even though she seemed to be a clean slate, with no past memories. But when she brought out those dried longans he must have been quite shocked. Did he think she was testing him?

Or like General Qin, was he also very sad when Ranran did not remember him at all?
Was restoring the ice lotus pond his way to jog her memories of her past life? He seemed quite disappointed when she told him she didn’t remember anything.
Did he hope she will remember? Did he want her to remember?

I wonder how he feels now that he knows that his dear Master wrote a chapter on him in her ‘Play Book’ haha
This is also the beginning of clearing misunderstandings of two lifetimes and two people getting to know each other properly, again. Or are new misunderstandings being made? hahaha

When dinner time arrived, Mu Qingge specially had the royal chef whom the emperor had granted to her, prepare several exquisite dishes and served fine wine to privately entertain her beloved disciple, Qin Xuanjiu.

Qin Xuanjiu had been waiting for such an opportunity to see his Master alone! As they drank together, Mu Qingge tentatively asked him why she had sent him here in the first place. Qin Xuanjiu immediately couldn’t wait to say, “Master, I was just about to explain it to you in detail. Have you forgotten? You sent me here to…”

Mu Qingge handed him a cup of wine, leaned forward slightly, and smiled, “Yes, I sent you here to……”

She patiently prompted him, but the bearded pockmarked man before her was as if he had been struck in his acupoint, staring round-eyed and drawing out his words, “Yes, you sent me here to…”

This back and forth continued for a while, even though Mu Qingge usually had a good temper, Qin Xuanjiu’s antics irritated her, and she couldn’t help but set down her wine cup heavily, saying sharply, “General Qin, are you playing tricks on me?”

Qin Xuanjiu banged his head against the table, then fell to his knees and cried, “Master, how could I dare play tricks on you? I just don’t know if I’ve been drinking too much recently, my memory isn’t very good, I vaguely remember something, but I just can’t recall it…”

When he said this, Mu Qingge had nothing to say in response. After all, everyone has a bad memory. This disciple being as forgetful as his master, no one can be blamed more than the other.

However, Mu Qingge suspected that he was deliberately hiding something, dangling it in front of her without revealing it.

In a fit of anger, the just warmed up relationship between master and disciple suddenly turned cold. Qin Xuanjiu didn’t even get to taste a bite of the royal cuisine before he was unceremoniously sent away.

Feeling frustrated, Qin wanted to go and ask Su Yishui, as he remembered mentioning something to Su, hoping Su could remind him of what it was.

But when he arrived at the small courtyard where Su Yishui and others from Xishan resided, the courtyard was empty, with only a laboriously prepared Five-spice Pig Trotters still simmering on the stove…

Meanwhile, Su Yishui and everyone else, returned to prepare in the courtyard after meeting Mu Qingge during the day.

These past two days, Yu Chen, under Su Yishui’s orders, had brought a lot of dry straw, and then he led the few juniors to make straw men.

After the straw men were made, Su Yishui affixed the Activation talismans Ranran had obtained from Elder Jiu to the chests of the straw men. These straw men, like the ones planting the fields below Cuiwei Mountain, could now act upon commands.

It was already night when everything was ready.

For convenience when subduing demons, Qin Xuanjiu had given them his waist token to leave the city. Su Yishui had Yu Chen drive the carriage, taking a cartload of straw men and their disciples out of the city.
