They headed towards the direction of the military platform where Yue’e had previously worked. The ground there had just been compacted, and a new watchtower had been rebuilt. However, it had not been put into use yet, and with the patrols recently concentrated near Wangxiang River, entering and leaving was convenient.

Quietly, Ranran asked her master how they would determine if there was anything suspicious about the military platform. Su Yishui said mildly, “The Spirit Spring can bewitch the heart, knowing the deepest desires within. Wang Yue’e used to come here every day to cook, but gradually started dressing up, not afraid of getting the kitchen ashes on her new clothes. Moreover, she often laughed foolishly towards the direction of Wangxiang River by herself, indicating she had hallucinations, maybe she thought she was flirting with someone like a wealthy young man. The Spirit Spring is sealed and has limited power, only able to influence within a *30 meter radius. Yue’e is probably affected there, so going to the military platform will surely yield some results.”
*丈 is 3.33 meter

Listening to Shifu’s analysis, Ranran also found it reasonable.

However, she was still puzzled and asked softly, “If what we’re looking for is hidden by Mu Qingge, wouldn’t we gain something by asking her in detail? Why do we need to sneak around at night?”

Su Yishui lowered his head and looked at her. He said, “Didn’t she say she couldn’t remember? But she was seriously affected by that thing in the past, so it’s better if she doesn’t remember.”

He paused for a moment and explained further, “The seal on the Soul Hosting Stone’s demonic nature will gradually increase over time, and eventually, the Soul Hosting Stone will shatter on its own. The abnormality in the compass Qin Xuanjiu carried was because of this. The leaking demonic nature attracted covetous individuals. What we need to do is find it before the Soul Hosting Stone completely shatters. However, its power fluctuates like the tides with the waxing and waning of the moon. I originally planned to wait until the end of the month when its power wanes before acting. But now, people from Jiuhua Sect have also arrived, so we have to take the risk and act in the *middle of the month.”

Ranran whispered, “Will its power also weaken in the middle of the month?”

Su Yishui shook his head, “The Spirit Spring will rise in the middle of the month, it will be at the peak of its powers…”
*Middle of the month is 15th, with full moon which is when the Yin is the strongest

The disciples were immediately dumbfounded, looking at each other in shock. Dealing with a normal village woman who had been mutated by the Spirit Spring was already terrifying enough, and now they had to deal with the main entity. It seemed like an impossible task!

Qiu Xier choked up, almost in tears. Fortunately, their master spoke again, “Don’t worry, it’s been sealed for a long time, with limited abilities and no physical form. As long as you keep your mind steady and don’t get bewitched by it, everything will be fine. What you all need to do is spread out and find the location of the Spirit Spring. Once it’s confirmed, I’ll deal with it alone.”


After he said this, the disciples all let out a collective sigh of relief.

After groping around in the dark for a while, the carriage arrived at the military platform fifty li (25km) away from Wangxiang Pass.
*里 is 500 meters

Su Yishui took out a compass similar to those used by Feng Shui ( geomancy ) masters and distributed them to the disciples, teaching them how to use it before they dispersed.

It was said that the late Emperor of Daqi had once deployed troops and generals here to stabilize the northwest for thousands of miles. So, besides its practical function, this military platform also held a particularly sacred significance. Even when the current emperor was still a Prince, he had personally come here to reward the troops.

Over the years, this place had been regularly maintained. Even though the northwest was covered in yellow sand, the wooden painted surface of this platform still looked new.

This place could accommodate a thousand troops and horses, so it was quite spacious. Besides the platform for reviewing troops, there was also a pavilion for military officers to rest. Nearby was a small kitchen where Yue’e and the other women cooked.

Holding the compass, Ranran unconsciously walked towards the pavilion.

The pavilion was built grandly and exquisitely, in stark contrast to the rough and majestic architectural style of the northwest. It seemed to have been built to highlight the grandeur of the emperor’s personal expedition.

Ranran stared at it fascinatingly and said, tilting her head at the building, “Shifu, the style and carvings of this building are quite similar to the houses on our West Mountain, aren’t they?”

Su Yishui glanced at her coldly, his gaze strangely fierce for some reason.

Ranran suddenly remembered what her second uncle master had said. The houses on West Mountain seemed to have been built by the little prince Su Yu, for Mu Qingge while she was out traveling, at considerable cost.

And this place… It was said that Mu Qingge had also come here with the little prince to inspect troops… Mu Qingge loved indulgence, so could it be that this tall building was also specially built by the little prince for Mu Qingge’s extravagant tastes?

Ranran thought of how her master detested extravagance and waste, so she immediately stopped talking. However, from this perspective, the Emperor really valued talent! With such privileged treatment, it’s no wonder Mu Qingge was willing to help him.

Just then, Su Yishui led her to the right side of the military platform. He closed his eyes suddenly, and at the same time, grabbed Ranran’s slender arm tightly.

Ranran had unintentionally glanced at her master earlier. At the moment before he closed his eyes, there seemed to be a flash of red light in them. So even though her master grabbed her arm firmly, she didn’t dare to struggle, only asking softly, “Shifu… Are you not feeling well?”

After a while, Su Yishui finally opened his eyes, which were as clear as they have always been. He let go of her arm, looked at Ranran’s slightly reddened wrist, frowned slightly, and then asked, “Does it hurt?”

Ranran didn’t want her master to feel guilty, so even though she felt a searing pain on her wrist, she shook her head and smiled, saying it was nothing.

While everyone else was unloading the straw men from the carriage, Su Yishui handed Ranran a talisman made of cinnabar and gold lines.

“If I show any signs of abnormality and the situation goes out of control, you must stick this talisman between my eyes….. No, stick it on yourself.”

Ranran had her mouth half open, not understanding, “Can this talisman ward off evil spirits?”

Su Yishui nodded briefly, saying briefly, “If I’m ever controlled, you all should leave quickly.”

Ranran said in a small voice, “I will never leave Shifu behind… If you’re ever controlled, I’ll find a chance to stick the talisman on you.”

But she still felt worried, “Shifu, if even you could be bewitched, we who have shallow cultivation, won’t we be even more vulnerable? I’m afraid I…”

Before Ranran could finish, Su Yishui interrupted her doubts, “Evil arises from the mind and will magnify the host’s desires infinitely. Pure minds cannot be manipulated. You have a pure mind clear as a mirror, there’s nothing to be afraid of?” For some reason, Su Yishui seemed very certain.

Although praised by her master, Ranran still felt something was off. If she had nothing to fear, wouldn’t her Shifu, who has higher cultivation and lived in seclusion without desires, have even less to fear?

She couldn’t help but feel that her master was very wary of that Soul Hosting Stone.

But her master’s caution made sense. Since the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu was doing everything possible to obtain the Spirit Spring. And Mu Qingge had been targeted just for possessing it, so this Spirit Spring must be very powerful.

Just then, Su Yishui handed her an exquisite short staff with a button in the center. Su Yishui motioned for her to press it, and immediately, the staff extended like Sun Wukong’s Golden Cudgel, becoming longer.

“This staff had been made by an old acquaintance of mine. The shaft is made of ancient green iron. You hold onto it for self-defense.”

Ranran took the staff, about to say something, but her master went straight to the front of the military platform.

The strongest fluctuations in aura is in this spot, so it should be here.

He circled around the military platform a few times and quickly found something amiss.

The military platform was built of stones with large wooden boards on top. However, under the light of their torches and careful observation, one could see that the color of several stones in the west corner of the military platform were slightly different from the surrounding stones, obviously patched later.

Yu Chen took the pickaxe from the carriage and aimed it at those stones, swinging it down. With his natural strength, it didn’t take long before the stones shattered.

When nearly half of it was smashed open, it was indeed hollow inside. When the broken stones fell in, it actually took a long while before a sound could be heard as they hit the ground, indicating how deep the hole was.

As the opening widened, the foul air dissipated, replaced by cold wind, and a whistling sound came through, sending shivers down everyone’s spine.

Qiu Xier was a little scared, but fortunately, Shifu said they did not need to go down below. That dark hole was really frightening.

Su Yishui held a torch and without using the rope ladder tied to the entrance, jumped straight down.

Everyone else sat on the high platform of the military platform, waiting quietly.

Since Su Yishui went in, the howling sound from the hole seemed to lessen. Yu Chen and Yu Tong, the two siblings, squatted at the entrance, nervously waiting for their master’s update.

After about *the time it would take for an incense stick to burn, Yu Chen couldn’t help but stick his head in to ask, “Master, have you landed safely?”
*about 30 minutes on average

But all that came in response was the sound of whistling wind. Just as Yu Chen was about to shout again, a leisurely voice came from the hole, “I’ve landed, you can come on down!”

Yu Chen asked again, “Master, do you want Yu Tong and me to come down?”

The voice from the hole replied, “Everyone, come down!”

With the master’s command, the rest of them climbed down the rope ladder tied to the wooden stake at the cave entrance.

First was Yu Chen, followed by Gao Cang and Bai Baishan.

After Bai Baishan descended for a while, he shouted downwards, “Master, is it safe down there?”

Soon, Su Yishui’s voice came from the cave, “Hurry up, don’t dawdle!”

Upon hearing the master’s voice, Yu Chen sped up and was the first to land. However, when the other two landed, they were bewildered.

With torches in their hands, they looked around and found an empty cave with no one in sight. Su Yishui, for some reason, was nowhere to be found…

Meanwhile, on the surface, Rang Rang was originally sitting near the steps of the high platform with the third senior sister.

The cold night wind from the northwest was very chilling. Ranran, having experience guarding by the river, had bought a small hand warmer in town. She lit charcoal pieces, put them in a round copper box, then wrapped it in a thick cotton bag and tucked it into her arms for warmth.

After all, one must be fully prepared with a Shifu who likes to give surprise tests. She wouldn’t be surprised at all if their Shifu decided to throw them into a graveyard to test their courage one day…

Just as she was lost in her thoughts, the master’s voice suddenly came from the cave, ordering them all to go down. Their Senior Uncle Master had already gone down with the two seniors.

Qiu Xier’s expression fell upon hearing the master’s command. With a slightly tearful voice, she said, “Shifu, I’m feeling unwell. Can I wait here for you guys?”

“No! Come down quickly!” Su Yishui’s voice became stern, and seems very impatient.

Yu Tong hurried over to the two female disciples and said, “The Master wants us to go down. It must be because there aren’t enough people. Let’s hurry and not hold up important matters.”

Since second uncle master said so, Qiu Xier had no choice but to follow along. She could only shuffle slowly to the cave entrance and then said to Ranran, “Stay behind me. Being sandwiched between you and second uncle master will make me feel more at ease.”

Ranran nodded and was the last to descend into the cave.

Because she was holding a small torch, Ranran descended a little slower than the others. By the time she landed, she shone the torch around but saw no one else.

Ranran tentatively called out, “Shifu, Second Uncle Master!”

But after calling several times, there was no response at all. The cave was eerily silent as if no one had ever been there.

Taking a deep breath, Ranran tried to calm herself down. She illuminated the cave with her torch and carefully inspected it.

The walls around the cave were damp, and further ahead was a dark passage with only the sound of dripping water. After thinking for a moment, Ranran turned around and prepared to climb back up the rope ladder. But just then, Su Yishui’s voice came from behind her again.

“Come over here this way.” Obviously, he wanted Ranran to enter the pitch-black passage.

However, this time Ranran didn’t immediately go over. She hesitated for a moment before asking him, “Shifu, why can’t I see you all? Where did Second Uncle Master and the others go?”

At this moment, the voices of Yu Tong and Qiu Xier came from the dark passage, “Hurry up and come over, it’s just you left… Why are you so slow?”

Ranran hesitated and took a step forward, then asked Qiu Xier, “Third Senior Sister, it’s so dark. I’m a little scared…”

Qiu Xier impatiently said, “What’s there to be afraid of? Hurry up and come in!”

Ranran said “Okay” and turned around to grab the rope ladder, ready to climb up with all her strength. When she was heading into the cave earlier, Qiu Xier was so scared that she almost wet herself. Why was she now urging her on as if nothing had happened?

Ranran couldn’t see anyone else and felt something was wrong. Her intuition tells her to climb up first, get Qin Xuanjiu to bring soldiers to rescue them. Otherwise, if she perished in the cave as well, they will be completely wiped out.

But as she climbed the rope ladder, she suddenly felt her body falling straight down, as if an invisible force was pulling her into the dark passage.

In the moment Ranran was being pulled down, she took out the talisman Shifu had given her, and regardless of consequences, turned herself around and struck at what was dragging her from behind.

Her Light Body Technique was now most accomplished and her body was very light. She swiftly turned in mid-air while hitting out with the talisman in one smooth move.

As the talisman struck something, there was a “crack” sound, and sparks actually flew as if something had been repelled by the talisman. With a mournful and eerie scream, accompanied by a gust of foul wind, whatever it was disappeared.

Still shaken, Ranran picked up the talisman that had been blown away by the wind and was about to continue climbing the ladder when her feet were entangled again. This time, the force and speed were even more ferocious, not giving Ranran a chance to react, and she was once again dragged into the dark passage.

Ranran instinctively felt that entering the dark passage would be very dangerous. She quickly dropped the torch, took out the short stick the master had given her, pressed the spring in the middle, and the stick immediately extended at both ends, automatically lengthening. If pressed again, it would even shoot out hooks, which caught onto the entrance of the dark passage.

The pulling force on Ranran paused for a moment, but then it began to increase again.

At this critical moment, Ranran decided to take a risk and try the Demon-Subduing Technique Shifu had taught her.

She closed her eyes, focused her mind and loudly recited the incantation while gripping the stick tightly. Her clear voice echoed repeatedly in the dark passage, gradually emitting a dim golden light. Ranran finally broke free from the pulling force and, at the same time, kicked off the cave wall and barely escaped from the dark passage.

But as she tried to climb up to the cave entrance once more, the cave suddenly collapsed, completely sealing it.

At that moment, a voice came from the dark passage again, but it was the voice of her mother, Qiao Lian, calling out, “Quick, save me! Help! Save me!”

The voice was unmistakably her mother’s. Ranran’s palms sweated, struggling to make a decision.

In the end, she wrapped the golden talisman around the stick, held the spring-loaded stick tightly, and then sat cross-legged on the ground, as if she were meditating back at their Xishan grass hall.

Shifu had said that demons arise from the mind. Since she was convinced that these voices were deceitful, she must not let them disturb her mind. Since she couldn’t escape anyway, meditating was the best way to keep her composure!

Ranran’s current meditation skill and her ability to step on lotus leaves were techniques that have advanced to a higher level. In just a moment, she entered the realm of “Returning to the Void”.

Although her eyes were closed, she was already attuned with the heavens and earth, and every pore on her body could sense the subtle changes in the air.

When a gust of wind attacked, the staff with the talisman attached to it flipped along her wrist and accurately struck back. As the gusts of wind came from all directions, Ranran’s wrist moved quickly, and her staff danced.

This staff, crafted by an unknown expert, had two heads that changed direction with the force. For a moment, it formed a dense web shield around Ranran, giving a sense of impregnability.

Just then, the voice that had been calling Ranran with different voices suddenly changed again, roaring like a furious beast, “Why are you so uncontrollable? I can’t tempt you at all!”

This time, the voice was rough and hoarse, just like the voice Mu Yue’e used before she died.

Ranran remained silent, only gripping the staff with both hands, appearing completely focused.

The voice became increasingly frantic, akin to an enraged man cursing loudly. Strangely, when footsteps splashed through water in the dark passage, the voice abruptly stopped.

Ranran still kept her eyes closed, but when she felt someone approaching, she continued to strike with the staff.

Except this time, her staff was accurately grabbed by someone, and with a skillful move, she was pulled into their embrace.

Ranran let out a low cry and had to open her eyes.

When she looked closely, she saw that the one who had pulled her into their arms was… her Shifu, Su Yishui. However, he seemed to have fallen into water just now, so he appeared drenched from head to toe. Water was trickling down his straight nose, landing on Ranran’s face.

Although her Shifu was wet, still as handsome as ever, but Ranran noticed the redness in his pupils… just like the possessed villager Mu Yue’e.

She tried to break free from his embrace but found herself tightly held by arms with an iron grip, unable to escape. She could only warily ask, “Who… are you?”

But her Shifu remained silent, his gaze… was indescribably frightening. Ranran finally understood what Qiu Xier meant when she said Shifu’s gaze was terrifying. Staring into his eyes, she felt a chilling shiver to her core.

The golden talisman was still wrapped around the staff. Ranran tried her best to move her hands to the back and noiselessly removed the talisman, holding it in her hand in case of need.

Suddenly, Su Yishui lowered his head, getting closer to Ranran’s face, looking as if he wanted to devour her in one bite or do something else.

Ranran did her best to tilt her head away, but her lips accidentally brushed against her Shifu’s cheek… She clearly felt his body stiffen, seemingly uncomfortable by this affront…

So when her Shifu turned to look at her, she said with some tears in her eyes, “Shifu, I didn’t mean to…” But after this accidental kiss, Su Yishui’s grip on her seemed to loosen slightly.

Seizing the opportunity, Ranran suddenly reached out and stuck the golden talisman on her Shifu’s forehead. As the talisman took effect, she could see the redness in her master’s eyes slowly dissipating.

Everyone say “Thank you Spiritual Spring!”

Previous
Next

Ranran dared not even take a breath as she tentatively tried to break free from her Shifu’s embrace. However, although the redness in her master’s eyes had faded, he did not release his grip on her, still holding her tightly.

It was only when Ranran looked up at him questioningly that Su Yishui slowly loosened his grip, but their faces remained very close.

Rannian could only tilt her head slightly and tentatively ask, “……Are you…”

Ranran had wanted to ask if he was her Shifu, but it felt strange to ask that to his face. So, she dragged out her words, waiting for his reaction.

Su Yishui also looked at her with a tilted head but just did not speak. It wasn’t until he saw his little disciple frozen, almost unable to even blink her eyes that he casually removed the golden talisman from his forehead and spoke, “I am Su Yishui. The demon on the Soul Hosting Stone can mimic human voices. If you hear any voices, never believe them easily. It only steals the most memorable voices from your memory and mimics them, it does not know who you are.”

His explanation was logical. The voices she had heard before has never called her name.

Ranran remained wary. Who knew if this demonic stone had already gained sentience and form, transforming into her Shifu’s appearance to deceive people!

She decided to test her Shifu and said in a small voice, “You look really handsome…”

Su Yishui always forbidden discussions about his appearance, and disliked people staring at him even more. This test would reveal the truth at once.

Unexpectedly, this Su Yishui before her showed no sign of anger, just calmly said, “If you like to look, you can take your time and look all you want later. For now, stay close to me.”

Ranran obediently nodded, but as Su Yishui turned, she dashed off in the opposite direction.

Demon! The resemblance is uncanny! Little did it know, her sharp eyes immediately spotted the fault!

This time, its her collar that was grabbed, and in a moment Su Yishui pulled her back into his arms. “Why run? The entrance to the cave has been blocked, and we can’t get out for now.”

Ranran turned her head fearfully. She looked into his eyes and said “You’re not my Shifu…”

Su Yishui remained expressionless for a moment, then immediately understood. She must have recalled the statement from “Playing Classics” about him disliking discussions about his appearance, leading her to conclude he was fake.

So he dryly asked, “Did you bring the dried longan?”

Ranran nodded and took out the snack bag she always carried with her.

It was sewn by her mother, with several small compartments for carrying multiple snacks at once. One of the compartments contained the longan with sea salt that has not been eaten much. She had packed them a while ago, kept for emergencies. But after hearing from her Second uncle master she thought it was no longer necessary to carry it, but with all the recent unexpected events, she had been too busy to eat snacks and had forgotten to throw it away.

Su Yishui took it and put it into his mouth. He chewed hard and swallowed forcefully, then said coldly, “Can you follow me now?”

Only she, her Shifu, and Mu Qingge knew the complicated story behind this longan. Su Yishui’s sudden action reassured Ranran and she heaved a sigh of relief.

This was indeed her Shifu without a doubt… but where did everyone else go?

According to Su Yishui’s explanation, when he came down, he fell into a spiritual spring cunningly set by the demon stone.

Back then, this demonic force had attached itself to the Netherworld’s Spiritual spring, and it was adept at controlling water. Later, it broke free from the Netherworld but was trapped in the Soul-Hosting Stone for many years.

After a long wait for someone to finally come down, it immediately set a trap eagerly.

Su Yishui had just opened the hidden door of the secret passage, but he was momentarily distracted, slightly influenced by the demonic force, and later encountered Ranran here.

As for the others, they were obviously confused by the disguised voices and lured into the secret passage.

“What does it want with them?” Ranran was worried about Uncle Masters and the others, so she asked Su Yishui.

Su Yishui thought for a moment and said, “The demonic force in the Spiritual spring is bound by the Soul-Hosting Stone, so it can’t leave. It can only entice people who seek to use its power to smash the Soul-hosting Stone so that it can free itself completely.”

Saying this, he picked up a torch and led Ranran into the secret dark passage. The demonic stone seemed to fear Su Yishui very much. When he led Ranran into the secret passage, the enchanting voice that had been alluring her stopped completely.

However, the secret passage became increasingly damp, and in the eventually the water was already ankle-deep. Ranran’s Light Body technique seemed ineffective, her steps becoming heavier and she felt her strength being drained.

At this point, Su Yishui squatted down, indicating for Ranran to get on his back and he will carry her from here. Since the water here had a demonic nature, and Ranran’s cultivation was shallow, being in the water for too long could lead to undesired outcomes.

Listening to Shifu, she could only suppress her slight embarrassment and got onto Shifu’s broad back.

Shifu usually wore long robes and appeared tall and thin, but as Ranran lay on him, reaching out for his neck, her hand accidentally touched his solid chest.

…Shifu looked gentle and elegant but was in fact really muscular… And she had just accidentally kissed his face…

“Hold on tighter, don’t fall down!” Sensing that Ranran wanted to retract her hand, Su Yishui suddenly turned his head and spoke.

His sudden movement nearly made Ranran’s mouth touch his face again. If Su Yishui hadn’t held her steadily, she would have almost fallen backward when she whipped her head back.

And so she had no time to care about blushing and quickly wrapped her arms around Shifu’s neck, stabilizing herself on his back.

Although he was carrying a person, Su Yishui’s steps were as swift as he was flying, seemingly unaffected by the effects of the water.

It’s unknown what happened when he went down earlier, causing him to lose his senses momentarily.

Soon, they reached the end of the secret passage. Upon entering a hidden chamber, Su Yishui waved the torch and quickly saw oil grooves on the walls for lighting.

After lighting them, Ranran couldn’t help but exclaim softly. It turned out that both Uncle Masters, as well as senior brothers and senior sister, were sitting around a huge stone in the center.

The stone was covered in frost, and they were huddled against the ice, using their true qi and body warmth to “hatch” the large stone.

Second Uncle Master, who had a deeper foundation, was relatively better off. Although she was in a trance like the others, her body reacted automatically, circulating true qi to fend off the invading cold.

But Senior Brother and the others had weaker foundations. The cold had invaded their bodies, their lips turned purple and formed icicles. Beneath them, a stream of water flowed like a small creek, flowing into the secret passage.

Obviously, the water Shifu had waded through just now was the ice which melted from the stone. If all the ice on the stone completely melted, the seal on the Soul-Hosting Stone would be completely released.

Su Yishui said in a deep and calm voice, “Set up a protective formation behind me to guard your own mind.”

Ranran immediately began to form hand seals, sitting down on a stone stool to help provide Shifu with some protection.

After Su Yishui finished speaking, he leaped up, and in his hands were several medical silver needles. Using true qi, he shot the needles into the Heavenly Connection Points of the others.

As the silver needles entered their acupoints, Yu Tong was the first to wake. She realized her situation and immediately tried to move backward, only to find that her body seemed firmly stuck to the stone, unable to move.

At this moment, Yu Chen and the others also woke up. Gao Cang shivered from the cold, and starting to cry out. But the worst was Qiu Xier; her body was already frail, and now she couldn’t seem to wake.

The demonic force in the stone was deeply ingrained and Su Yishui also seemed very wary. He couldn’t easily approach, only putting two fingers into his mouth and letting out a long whistle.

Soon, a group of swaying “people” rushed out of the secret passage. It was the strawmen they had painstakingly made over the past few days. It seemed that these strawmen had been digging with tools above, digging open the entrance and then jumping in one by one.

The strawmen walked over, three to five in a group, and started pulling the frozen Yu Chen and the others away from the stone.

Although these strawmen had no flesh and blood, with the help of Elder Jiu’s talismans, they were incredibly strong, easily pulling these people off the ice stone.

However, their palms which had pressed against the ice stone had become bloody, as their frozen skin were torn off as the strawmen pulled them away.

Just at moment they were pulled off, Su Yishui quickly recited an Ice Spell, refreezing the Soul-Hosting Stone that was about to melt, and the water in the secret passage also flowed backward, wrapping the stone in a thick layer of ice once more.

Ranran also got up and helped Qiu Xier, who had been carried back by the strawmen.

“Give her a Clear Heart Pill,” Su Yishui instructed.

Ranran quickly took out the pill she had refined and crushed it, stuffing it into Xier’s mouth. Only then Xier slowly regain consciousnesses, shivering while half-asleep, muttering, “Did I kick the blanket again? Why is it so cold?”

Ranran didn’t have time to answer her senior sister because the Soul-Hosting Stone, which had been resealed, suddenly emitted angry screams and what sounded like many people talking. At one moment, it was Su Yishui’s voice shouting, “Let me out! I will make you all stronger!” and then it changed to Yu Chen’s roar, to Qiu Xier’s crying, making everyone’s ears ache.

Su Yishui remained unfazed, continuing to recite the Ice Spell, leading the water in the secret passage to flow back, gradually thickening the layer of ice.

But just then, the backflowing water seemed to have a consciousness of its own. It struggled hard, breaking free from Su Yishui’s control and converging into a female form.

Gradually, under the illumination of the firelight, the clear surface grew eyebrows and eyes, as well as the color of skin. A woman who seemed to have just finished her bath, dripping with water, appeared in front of everyone.

Ranran widened her eyes in astonishment because she recognized this woman… This beauty…..isn’t it Mu Qingge?

No, she was even more beautiful and charming than Mu Qingge who had just been reborn from the Rebirth Tree. It wasn’t about her physique but the lively spirit in her eyes.

Before, she thought that the Mu Qingge reborn from the tree, should look very similar to her portrait. Now, seeing this beauty, she realized that Mu Qingge after rebirth seemed… to look different from before.

The woman who appeared in front of everyone now, actually bore a striking resemblance to the red-clothed beauty riding a tiger in the Lingxi Palace’s painting.

Her eyes were watery, her clothes half undone, her pearly teeth gently biting her red lips as she softly said, “You have such a cruel heart. Are you going to continue to seal me? Let me out, and I promise you everything…”

Su Yishui looked at the lifelike Mu Qingge in front of him, and his body suddenly stiffened as she approached slowly.

While Ranran was stunned, she remained clear-headed. Seeing “her” approaching, she immediately reminded loudly, “Shifu, be careful!”

However, her worries were unnecessary. Su Yishui had already taken action while she was speaking. Using the torch in his hand as a sword, he thrust it straight towards the woman’s chest.

As the torch pierced through her, the woman stared wide-eyed, looking at Su Yishui with disbelief.

In Su Yishui’s handsome eyes, there was no struggle or reluctance, only an unmistakable disgust…

“How could this be? Your heart… wasn’t it…”

Su Yishui didn’t let “her” continue. He unleashed his spiritual power, causing the condensed spiritual water to collapse, losing its human form.

Seeing that Shifu wasn’t bewitched, Rang Rang breathed a sigh of relief. However she couldn’t help but wonder if Shifu had acted similarly when they besieged Mu Qingge with the three major sects, ruthlessly striking her with a sword through the heart?

She was actually curious about what the creature that could manipulate people’s hearts wanted to say. Because she always felt that Shifu’s feelings towards Mu Qingge were ambiguous.

However, in Cultivation and enlightenment, one must learn to let go and cut off worldly attachments, only then can they attain true enlightenment.

So, Su Yishui could hardly be blamed when he cut down his demonic Master on behalf of the righteous path…

In this critical moment, Ranran couldn’t help but be distracted for a moment. When she snapped out of it, she sighed softly again but then she saw Shifu’s cold eyes staring at her, a gaze akin to being stabbed with ice picks.

Ranran shrank her neck slightly, fearing that Shifu would get addicted to enlightenment and continue to kill disciples in pursuit of it, especially targeting a weakling like her.

After the spiritual water was dispersed, it flowed back onto the ice stone, forming a thick layer of ice again. The temperature in the entire secret chamber also dropped sharply.

After completely sealing the Soul-Hosting Stone again, Su Yishui walked up to the stone, and the others followed him cautiously, carefully observing the demonic stone.

It was obvious that this anomaly of the demonic stone was not caused by their entry into the cave because there were already many cracks on the stone, as if a touch would cause it to split open. That’s why there was spiritual water that kept bubbling out of it.

Now that Su Yishui had frozen the spiritual water again and resealed the Soul-Hosting Stone, once the ice melted, this thing would be uncontrollable again…

With his heart still racing from the scare, Bai Baishan asked Senior brother in a low voice, “When we were being controlled by this creature earlier, what did you see?”

Gao Cang’s eyes welled up with tears. “I saw my deceased mother holding me and humming under the peach tree at home… Whenever I heard her sing before, I would fall asleep quickly, so I couldn’t open my eyes no matter what… What about you?”

Bai Baishan wiped the cold sweat from the back of his neck, feeling lingering fear. “I… saw myself become a great Cultivator, and the three major sects were bowing to me in worship…”

When it came to Qiu Xier, she blushed and remained silent, but her eyes secretly glanced at Shifu. Ranran understood her thoughts and felt that she might have done something disrespectful to their elder in the illusion, so she tactfully didn’t ask.

However, listening to their accounts, this demon truly understood human hearts and could magnify the deepest desires, making people immersed in them, unable to resist.

It was too bad that Shifu was too strong, and the Soul-Hosting Stone couldn’t bewitch him, falling short of success in the end.

At that moment, Ranran suddenly noticed inscriptions on the stone walls of the chamber, and Su Yishui was holding a torch and examining them.

Her fellow disciples were trying to meditate and recover their strength. So Ranran walked over to look at the inscriptions.

Those inscriptions were probably also written by Mu Qingge, and they were as free-spirited as the person, with graceful unrestrained strokes.

“My good disciple, Shui’er, when you see these words it is like seeing me, by the time you read this letter, you should have let go of your grievances against me. If you can do this, that will be good. I believe you can also control the Spiritual Spring and send it back to the Netherworld. This thing has been tainted by the mortal world for too long, learning too much of human greed and vices. I fear that if this continues, its demonic nature will become stronger… Behind the waterfall in the western mountain valley, there is a cave with excellent temperatures throughout the seasons. Inside, there is a hidden jar of “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” wine. I’m afraid I won’t have the chance to drink it. By the time you find it, it should have already matured. Even though Elder Jiu has a technique to let ten years pass in a day, can true fine wine be rushed in a day? Only with the passage of time can one truly enjoy the essence of youth. Once matters here are settled, if you can taste this wine on my behalf, it would not have been in vain for it to age for so many years…”

According to Qin Xuanjiu’s account, Mu Qingge had hidden the Spiritual spring here not long before she was besieged in Jue Mountain and had her soul scattered.

So, these words were probably Mu Qingge’s final wish from her past life.

Aside from entrusting the important task of returning the Spiritual spring, what Mu Qingge had on her mind and could not let go of, was unexpectedly a jar of fine wine hidden in the cave behind the back mountain. How could such a carefree person plot to release a demon lord and plunge the Three Realms into chaos?

At this moment, she stole a glance at Shifu beside her and couldn’t help but be shocked. Because Shifu, who was usually cold and indifferent, now had an expression as if a river of ice had cracked, his eyes filled with indescribable desolation and resentment…

He suddenly used spiritual energy and wiped away the inscriptions on the wall. He then slowly turned to look at Ranran, staring at her with eyes that seemed ready to tear her apart in the next moment.

Ranran thought that Su Yishui did not like that she peeked and saw Mu Qingge’s message, so she quickly tried to step back discreetly. However, Su Yishui grabbed her wrist and didn’t let her go.

“To what extent can a person be so simple and so heartless? Knowingly heading to certain death, yet what they hold in their heart…. is just a jar of wine?” He suddenly asked Ranran.

Ranran stole a glance at the Soul-Hosting Stone. Seeing no abnormality, she verified that Shifu wasn’t possessed by the demon, so she could only answer the question seriously, “Um… although “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” becomes more fragrant with age, it’s indeed best after around twenty years. Shifu, when you go back, don’t forget to drink it. I’ll make scallion beef and salted peanuts as side dishes for the wine, alright?”

The lingering taste of “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” was very strong, with both sweet and spicy notes, which complements tender beef and peanuts perfectly!

Unfortunately, his disciple’s sincere answer only intensified the anger in Su Yishui’s eyes, and he gripped her wrist even harder.

Ranran suddenly realized that she had obviously fallen into the glutton’s mindset and couldn’t get out of it. She quickly cleared her throat and tentatively said, “I see that Grandmaster Mu cares about you, Shifu. *You are the first one she thought to offer her fine wine….. Of course, it’s not quite right for Shifu to risk your life to escort the Spiritual spring. If it’s too dangerous, Shifu, you shouldn’t go… Your disciple can’t bear to see you in danger…”
*先紧着你 giving you priority

The girl’s clear and gentle voice finally calmed down the few veins that had popped up on Su Yishui’s head.

He looked at Ranran with a gloomy expression until Qiu Xier finished meditating and stood up, calling out to Ranran. Only then did Su Yishui take a deep breath, slowly releasing her hand.

Ranran quickly stepped back a few steps, slipped over to where her fellow disciples were meditating, and left Shifu staring listlessly at the wall.

The others also finished restoring their breath and regained their strength, ready to leave the cave. However, the scene just now was too shocking, so everyone inevitably bombarded Su Yishui with questions about what had just happened.

Su Yishui explained simply that because this stone sealed a demonic spirit. Spiritual power had leaked for some time, it tempted a weak-willed villager and made her draw a curse on her own neck, then used her transformed into a water demon to harm soldiers, all to lure Qin Xuanjiu.

Ranran understood upon hearing this. After all, there were guards at the military platform, not something a villager like Yue’e could handle alone. If Qin Xuanjiu had been controlled, he could have made the soldiers open the secret passage to release the Spiritual spring.

It was too bad, Qin Xuanjiu’s life lot was too good, that he encountered the cold spell which froze the river, narrowly escaping this disaster. As for the calls to impeach him, it could only be said that General Qin didn’t know how to get along with others, and probably offended someone in the official circles.

Right now the Soul-Hosting Stone couldn’t bear the burden any longer, so the Spiritual spring must be transferred into the specially-made Spiritual Jade Talisman Bottle from Elder Jiu. However, the demonic nature of the Spiritual spring was strong. Although it had been sealed for a long time and its power had diminished considerably, thinking about the situation just now, it still seemed extremely dangerous.

“You guys go up first.” Su Yishui instructed them.

So the two uncle masters led them up first. But Ranran didn’t move from her spot. “Shifu, let me stay with you!” Ranran said, raising the golden talisman in her hand.

If Shifu was beguiled again, she could stick the talisman on his forehead.

But for some reason, Su Yishui was certain that it would not be necessary, that nothing would happen to him. Perhaps when he decisively dispelled Mu Qingge’s illusion just now, it also dispelled his inner demons?

So Ranran had no choice but to go up the rope ladder. She went to the medicine box in the carriage to get medicine powder and white cloth, and treated the bloody palms of the others.

Su Yishui also came up sooner than expected.

Ranran noticed that the talisman bottle given by Elder Jiu was tied with a golden rope, hanging around Shifu’s neck. It was originally made of white jade, but now it was as red as blood, as if something had been injected into it.

It seemed that Su Yishui glanced at her and then stuffed the talisman bottle into his collar, putting it out of sight.

Shifu must have resealed the Spiritual spring in the talisman bottle. Since the Netherworld Spiritual spring was so important, there seemed to be nothing safer than carrying it on oneself.

However, only Su Yishui and Ranran knew the secret of the talisman bottle. When they went up Cuiwei Mountain, only the two of them met Elder Jiu.

So except for the two uncle masters, the other disciples only knew they found something sinister that confuses the mind, not knowing that the stone in the cave held the Netherworld spiritual spring that was coveted by all in the cultivation world. They definitely did not know that Su Yishui had already transferred the spring into the jade bottle around his neck.

Ranran always knew when to speak and when to keep quiet. Since Shifu did not want to let the other disciples know, he must have his reasons. However, how to bury the big hole they dug became a problem.

The other senior brothers didn’t get up to Cuiwei Mountain, nor did they know why Qin Xuanjiu had been guarding this place for many years. Naturally, they didn’t know the secret of the Netherworld’s spiritual spring. Thinking that there was a demonic object here, and that the sinister stone was still in the cave. So Bai Baishan, feeling uneasy, asked Shifu, “The entrance is wide open like this. If someone breaks in there, what should we do?”

I don’t care what others say! The Spiritual Spring is a blessing!

I wonder why was Su Yishui affected differently?
The others went to warm up that stone, but he was wandering around, looking for Ranran?

Previous
Next

Upon hearing second senior brother’s question, Su Yishui leisurely replied, “Someone will take care of it.”

As he said this, the straw men that had just come out of the cave took out bags of sand from the carriage, along with tools like a trowel, and started meticulously patching the hole in the wall with rocks.

The straw men, driven by spirit talismans, all seemed very skillful, and it seemed they could finish repairing the large hole before dawn.

Now, everyone finally relaxed and hurried back to the city in the carriage to catch up on sleep.

Because of the commotion caused by the killings in Wangxiang River, the military had been on edge, and no one had used the military station these days, so when the mud and sand used to fill the hole dried, no one noticed.

The next day, in the night, Su Yishui also pasted the accelerating wine-brewing charm from Elder Jiu on the newly patched mud and sand. The newly patched area immediately dried and aged, leaving no trace of having been dug open.

As for Qin Xuanjiu, these days he had been accompanying his Master Mu Qingge. They had almost traveled all over Wangxiang Pass, but they had not seen any anomalies.

Lin Yeting said to Mu Qingge, “Master, Qin Xuanjiu offended the son of a general who came here for training before, which is why the incident with the water demon caused such a stir. Someone above wanted to deal with him, and they found a ready-made excuse. It might even just be someone creating a scare with a deformed person. Why bother staying here? His Majesty has been hoping for your early return to the capital.”

While Mu Qingge was on the way here, she had seen the corpse of the water demon. Due to much time had passed since death, it had mostly returned to its original human appearance, although wrapped in lime. However, the strong fishy smell was overwhelming, and Mu Qingge was unable to discern anything.

After hearing Lin Yeting’s words and thinking about Su Yishui’s cold attitude towards her, Mu Qingge smiled coldly.

After instructing Lin Yeting to leave, she couldn’t help but look in the mirror. The woman in the mirror had bright eyes and white teeth, stunningly beautiful.

This must be the face that Su Yu couldn’t forget right? He possesses vast lands and power, yet he could not embrace a beautiful woman. It truly is a regret one could not let go of…

However, as Mu Qingge looked at herself, she suddenly smashed the tea cup in her hand against the copper mirror—still not like her! Although there was a fifty percent resemblance in appearance, she just couldn’t replicate “her” carefree and disdainful attitude towards the world!

Could it be because of this that Su Yishui continued to ignore her?

Thinking about this, the beautiful face in the copper mirror suddenly revealed a trace of uncertainty. She slowly extended her hand, revealing a blood-red line on her white arm, like a winding snake, curling up her arm—this was the evil created by Wei Jiu! He actually came up with a way to use grudge water to nourish the Rebirth Tree!

As a result, after absorbing enough grudge water, her spiritual power became abundant upon arrival. However, the consequence of this expedited method was that after using spiritual power each time, she felt a discontinuity in her true qi flow, and the red line on her arm was clearly a sinister object.

This should be the evil thing that Wei Jiu had planned to use to control Mu Qingge’s life force when she was reborn, which is why he easily agreed to making a Soul oath with Su Yishui.

Because this grudge water had been used before the Soul oath was made, even if she died because of it, Wei Jiu wouldn’t be considered in violation of the oath.

Initially, this red line was not very noticeable, but in these past few days, it had grown wildly.

Mu Qingge dared not disclose her weaknesses to the crafty Elder Kaiyuan of Jiuhua Sect. She could only wait for Wei Jiu to come and threaten her, then see how to deal with him.

Thinking of this, Mu Qingge became frustrated again, unable to stop herself from wondering how “she” would handle such a situation if it happened to her?

Probably be as carefree as always, drinking wine under the moon, singing freely with friends? What in this world could make “her” feel the torment of sorrow that cannot be resolved?

Thinking of this, she gritted her teeth, took a deep breath, and slowly lowered her sleeve.

But what was so great about being carefree? Now, she was the unforgettable Mu Qingge in front of everyone.

Just then, Qin Xuanjiu suddenly came to call on her.

It turned out that when Qin Xuanjiu was washing up tonight, he suddenly remembered what Master had instructed him before, so he quickly explained everything to Mu Qingge.

Mu Qingge’s *pupils slightly contracted when she heard about the Netherworld Spirit Spring. This was extremely crucial information, but Qin Xuanjiu claimed that he had just remembered it. This kind of talk seemed suspicious, like he was trying to fool her.
*pupils dilates in response to increased cognitive activity, such as increased levels of arousal or mental effort ( apparently Chinese novel writers like to use this phrase lol )

However, the urgent matter was to take possession of the Netherworld Spirit Spring. As long as she had the power of the Spirit Spring, resolving the grudge water in her body should be easy, right?

Now the Elder Kaiyuan of Jiuhua Sect was only using her as a stepping stone, so that he could have easier access to the Emperor. Although he appeared polite on the surface, he was still wary of her.

Because although the spiritual power taken by the another spirit fruit was not much, it still had a great impact on her. If she followed the rules to cultivate and advance, it would probably take twenty or thirty years to recover it back.

In recent days, Mu Qingge had also been inquiring about the whereabouts of the spirit fruit that fell prematurely sixteen years ago. However, even Wei Jiu did not get any answers, she naturally gained nothing either.

These past days, Mu Qingge had been restless, always worried that something unexpected might happen.

If she could benefit from the Netherworld Spirit Spring, it would be a completely different situation. Even if “she” were still around, there would be nothing to fear.

Thinking of the power that the spring holds, Mu Qingge was very tempted. Even though she knew the Spiritual spring’s demonic nature was great and mishandling it could easily backfire, she could overlook it.

But still she had to keep this matter hidden from the people of Jiuhua Sect. Thinking of this, Mu Qingge’s gaze turned to Qin Xuanjiu who was following her…

He was the garrison guarding this place, so if he could assist her, everything would be easy. Indeed, when she prompted him, Qin Xuanjiu readily agreed without hesitation.

In Qin Xuanjiu’s view, this thing was entrusted by Master, so if she were to take it away now, it is as it should be.

However, Qin Xuanjiu really didn’t know where it was. Master had only told him to diligently watch the compass but hadn’t informed him of the location of the object.

Mu Qingge asked again, “Has Su Yishui left the city these days?”

Qin Xuanjiu suddenly remembered that after being driven away by Master Mu Qingge, he couldn’t find Su Yishui and his disciples, so he called the city guards. After inquiring, he found out that they had left the city three nights ago.

Early the next morning, Mu Qingge went to visit Su Yishui.

When she pushed open the gate, she saw pieces of mushrooms scattered all over the floor being dried, as well as other mountain products.

The girl named Xue Ranran, with an apron tied around her waist, came to open the door, and upon seeing Mu Qingge, immediately turned and called for Shifu.

However, Mu Qingge stared at Ranran.

This young girl was quite delicate and lovely. But without the aura of youthfulness, she would just be an ordinary-looking woman.

But Mu Qingge found that every time she saw her, she seemed to have become more beautiful each time. It wasn’t a change in her facial features, but rather… an inexplicable charm that made people involuntarily stare at her.

Being stared at so intently by Elder Mu, Ranran blushed and touched her cheek, asking, “Elder, is there something dirty on my face?”

Mu Qingge came back to her senses and smiled slightly, “No, I just feel like I’ve seen you somewhere before, but for a moment, I can’t remember who you resemble…”

Ranran nodded, “I look a bit common, so naturally I tend to be similar to many people.”

Mu Qingge was about to say something when she saw that Su Yishui was already standing behind Xue Ranran.

“May I ask why you’re here?” Su Yishui asked.

Mu Qingge looked at Su Yishui’s face and slowly said, “I have some private matters to discuss with you. Could you accompany me for a walk by the Wangxiang river?” As if she was afraid that Su Yishui would rebuff her again, she urgently added “It’s about the Spiritual Spring and not our personal affairs.”

Without any change in his expression, Su Yishui thought for a moment and then turned to Ranran, saying, “If the food is ready, you all can eat first. No need to wait for me.”

Ranran, who always respected her master, quickly said, “I’ll save you some food. The steamed egg with cured meat won’t be ready for a while, I’ll also save it for you.”

Su Yishui nodded, and Ranran hurried to fetch a cloak for her master and helped him put it on—since it was windy and cold by the Wangxiang river, even though her master was already a half-immortal, it wouldn’t hurt to wear something warm.

Moreover, her Shifu is tall and sturdy. Wearing this cloak with fox fur trim, he exudes an ethereal charm and looks ridiculously handsome. Ranran felt that since her master was going out for a walk with Mu Shizun, they might renew their relationship, talk about fine wines behind waterfalls, so she should dress him up a bit.

Mu Qingge watched this master and disciple, and could not help feeling a lingering discomfort in her heart.

The pair before her looked similar in age. With the man tall and handsome, and the woman petite and gentle, they definitely don’t look like master and disciple? They seemed more like newlyweds and the wife was seeing her husband off…

This Xue Ranran was still young and didn’t seem to have much worldly experience. It was reasonable for her to be infatuated with her handsome master… But Mu Qingge knew Su Yishui too well. He was someone with very high standards, admired by many women, but in the end, *it was only wishful thinking on their part.
*落花有意流水无情 literally means the flowers that fall into the stream have intent, but the moving water heartlessly washes them away

But for now, finding the Spirit Spring’s whereabouts was the most important.

Once they left the courtyard, Mu Qingge silently followed Su Yishui. As both of them have a strong foundation they moved swiftly. In no time, they arrived by the Wangxiang river with its constantly flowing waters.

Mu Qingge asked tentatively, “You should know that I hid the Soul Hosting Stone containing the sealed Spirit Spring here before, right?”

Su Yishui didn’t answer but said mildly, “Since you were the one to hide it, how would I know?”

He didn’t answer directly, deflecting the question, like a slippery fish in the water difficult to grasp.

Mu Qingge decided to be straightforward, “Qin Xuanjiu has told me. He also said you have been searching for it already. Since you arrived here first, you should know more about it. After I reincarnated from the tree, I have forgotten many things, so I hope you can help me find the Spirit Spring to prevent another tragedy.”

At this, Su Yishui lifted his eyes. He looked at Mu Qingge and said with a mocking tone “Don’t you have the current emperor backing you? And the disciples of Jiuhua Sect are at your beck and call. Why bother me, a person in seclusion to be mixed up in this? Besides, what does your affairs have to do with me?”

Hearing this, Mu Qingge couldn’t help but smile knowingly, “Are you upset? Actually, Su Yu and I are just working together. Although he is an Emperor in the mortal world, in the eyes of us cultivators, he’s just a flesh and blood body. How can he compare to you in my heart?”

Saying this, Mu Qingge couldn’t help but look down at the water’s surface, where the reflection of a beautiful and charming woman’s face could be seen… In the previous life, this face, so similar to hers, captivated many men, who were willing to go through fire and water for her.

How this face had been enviable and made many women jealous! And this was what Su Yishui liked…

“There’s no one else here, so you don’t need to pretend to be indifferent. Others may not know, but I know that you have feelings for me… It’s just that at that time, I had too many admirers and inadvertently ignored you, hurting you…”

As she spoke, she took a few steps forward, almost falling straight into his arms. She raised her head slightly, tears in her eyes as she said, “Only in times of adversity can you see the true hearts of people. When my soul was shattered, only you were willing to give up everything and exchange it for my reincarnation. Even if I can’t become an immortal, I will never disappoint you again…”

After speaking, she leaned forward as if to offer a kiss, but was suddenly pushed away by Su Yishui with great force.

He used so much strength that Mu Qingge almost fell into the Wangxiang river.

Su Yishui took two steps back, looking at the river calmly, and said flatly, “I think you’ve misunderstood something. As you say it was the past life. Since you were fortunate enough to be reborn, you should cherish it. After all, there were people who hoped for your well-being, even willing to sacrifice their lives to redeem your sins.”

Su Yishui’s words were not false. Back when Mu Qingge’s soul had scattered, those disciples who cried their hearts out were grieving like they were losing their own parents. Some even cut their flesh and blood on the spot just to give Mu Qingge a chance at rebirth.

And Su Yishui sacrificed most of his cultivation just to save her wandering soul which had not yet dissipated. It was precisely because of this sacrifice that she was certain that he had Mu Qingge in his heart.

But now, it seems that Su Yishui intended to clear all debts. From now on, their ties are severed and they would have no further entanglement.

Mu Qingge was caught off guard. She felt quite embarrassed when he shoved her away.

She looked at him in some disbelief, a cold expression on his face. She took a deep breath and suddenly changed to a light tone, “If that’s what you think, then it’s fine too. But… you already know the whereabouts of the Spirit Spring, don’t you?”

Su Yishui and his disciples had gone out of the city at night before, heading outside the city, and returned at dawn.

Qin Xuanjiu was sure he had never told anyone this secret, and Su Yishui had only asked about it before.

Given Su Yishui’s intelligence, after getting some clues from that boorish man, it was not impossible for him to figure out where the Spirit Spring was hidden.

Moreover, Qin Xuanjiu also said that it was the Mu Qingge from the past life, who repeatedly instructed him to seek out Su Yishui.

With this, Mu Qingge softened her tone and said, “Yishui, you already know how dangerous the Spirit Spring’s backlash is. It shouldn’t have appeared in the human realm in the first place, and you were also harmed by it before. Even I am not completely sure I can control it, so why don’t you hand it over to me to handle? Otherwise, if the righteous path finds out you’ve secretly hidden the Spirit Spring, you should know best what happened to me before.”

Although her words seemed caring, upon closer examination, they carried a hint of threat. It was as if she was saying, “If you don’t help me obtain the Spirit Spring, I will reveal it.”

When Su Yishui heard this, he suddenly smiled and turned towards her.

The man who usually had a cold expression, once he smiled, he exudes a charm that was hard to resist, like an ice river melting, elegant and delicate.

As far as she could remember, she had never seen Su Yishui smile at her like this, so she couldn’t help but feel a bit dazed.

At that moment, Su Yishui leaned over and whispered in her ear in a low voice, “The red line on your arm should be wrapping around your shoulder soon, right? If you delay a few more days, you’ll turn into a walking corpse, at the mercy of Wei Jiu’s torment.”

Mu Qingge’s originally rosy face turned extremely pale in an instant, staring at Su Yishui in shock and suspicion. “How… how do you know?”

Su Yishui still had a smile on his face, but his eyes carried a chilling coldness that made one shiver from the core. “You think that hanging on the Rebirth Tree for twenty years would allow you to enjoy the blessings left by your past life without worries? The Grudge Water is the most Yin substance in the world, fermenting in the abyss for thousands of years. Even Wei Jiu doesn’t fully understand this thing. If I were you, I wouldn’t be thinking about Spirit springs or rivers. It is completely useless to you and will only intensify the toxicity inside you, becoming increasingly uncontrollable. You’d better think about how to prolong your life and protect yourself.”

Mu Qingge gritted her teeth, took a deep breath, and said softly, “Yishui, you wouldn’t be able to bear watching me fall into Wei Jiu’s hands, right? In the past, even if I just smiled at other men, you would sulk for days without talking to me…”

Su Yishui’s expression grew even colder, but his tone softened as he looked at the rushing river water. “I will prepare some pills to suppress the Grudge Water for you. But Wei Jiu will probably come looking for you soon. If you can get the key to the Netherworld from him, I will have a way to solve the Grudge water problem for you.”

He had given the key to Wei Jiu before, but he didn’t know if Wei Jiu had destroyed it out of anger after he found out he was tricked. If it was still intact, returning the Spirit Spring to its original home would be simpler.

Mu Qingge stared at him wide-eyed. “How can I ask him for that? Why would he give it to me?”

Su Yishui half-closed his eyes, his words seeming to imply something else. “You’ve always been capable. If you want something, you can get it by any means necessary. It’s a matter of life and death for you, and I believe you’ll find a way. I shall await for good news.”

With that, he no longer bothered with her response. He turned around, and prepared to go back for dinner. His little disciple’s steamed egg dish was very tender, if delayed too long, it wouldn’t taste the same.

Mu Qingge watched him leave with eyes full of hate, digging her nails into her palm until it bled. Just a moment ago, she couldn’t even be sure if Su Yishui was talking to Mu Qingge or to…

That damned Wei Jiu actually did such a vile thing to the Rebirth Tree, causing her to be poisoned by the Grudge water even before she was reborn. In hindsight, the other Spirit Fruit had fallen earlier and avoided the Grudge water. If “she” were still alive, it would have been a blessing in disguise after all…

For a moment, countless thoughts swirled in her mind. Eventually, she took a deep breath and calmed herself down.

Since Su Yishui was willing to suppress the poison for her and delay its effects, it was now easier to handle. Others might not know, but she knew very well that the men who were once charmed by Mu Qingge’s beauty wasn’t just Su Yishui alone.

Even Wei Jiu, that demonic cultivator, was probably acting out due to unrequited love, right?

With so many powerful and capable men around her, how many people would long for that? With just a bit of charm, she could manipulate them as she pleased. Unfortunately, someone didn’t know how to use it. Instead of using her charms, she only liked to roam mountains and rivers in their spare time, drinking with some old, decrepit old men…

But this life was different. She was the one with the captivating appearance that could mesmerize anyone. With a little tactics, the situation could change immediately.

Su Yishui didn’t know his own weight. Despite halving his cultivation, he still wanted to claim the Spirit Spring for himself? Mu Qingge didn’t know that Su Yishui had plotted against Wei Jiu, acquiring part of his golden core. She sneered, turned and also left.

When she returned to her residence, Wei Fang was instructing someone to unload a pill furnace from the carriage. Seeing her return, he greeted her respectfully, “My Master wrote a letter and borrowed a Purple Fire Pill Furnace from the Leader of the Flying Cloud Sect. Its firepower is slightly inferior to your previous pill furnace but still usable. Since we’re not far from the Flying Cloud Sect, I had someone transport the furnace here first. Do you want to start refining now, considering the urgency on His Majesty’s side…”

Mu Qingge lowered her eyes and looked at the pill furnace, nodding in satisfaction, then ordered, “Place it in the hall for now. This place is full of danger; we’ll discuss it later after we go back.”

But after everyone dispersed, Mu Qingge’s expression completely fell. After the failed attempt to ask for the furnace from XiShan, she had tried using other furnaces back home several times, but they all ended in failure.

What the Emperor wanted wasn’t just common fundamental pills like a Cleansing Pill. Cultivators all know that pills could be divided into gold and silver tiers. Silver Pills are easy to refine, but Gold Pills often required extremely high aptitude and mentality.

Only those with a heart untouched by worldly desires could concentrate fully and refine Gold Pills.

Her heart, tainted by two lifetimes of worldly affairs, was obviously not calm enough. Even if she got the Nine Revolutions Profound Iron Furnace, it would probably still be difficult to refine pills.

This made her feel rather anxious. After all, everyone knew that the demonic cultivator Mu Qingge had extraordinary talent in alchemy. Earlier she had used the excuse that her furnace was not suitable, but now that Elder Kaiyuan, that old fox, had borrowed the precious Purple Fire Pill Furnace, she could no longer find an excuse anymore.

Thinking about how she had encountered one obstacle after another since falling from the tree, she couldn’t help feeling enraged. All of these could be blamed on Su Yishui!

Su Yishui… he’s just a cold block of ice that can’t be warmed! She shouldn’t have given in to her feelings and fallen for this man with a heart of stone!

As for Ranran, she thought that her master and Mu Qingge were catching up, and it might take a very long time. She was afraid the steamed egg dish would get tough if left for too long. After some thought she decided to eat it first.

Later, she would steam another bowl, which would be perfect for Shifu when he returns. But unexpectedly, as soon as she took two bites, Shifu came back. When he entered the kitchen he saw his disciple sitting on a small stool eating her master’s share.

His expression slightly darkened, and he took the bowl and spoon from Ran Ran’s hand.

Ranran gulped down the piece of cured meat in her mouth and hurriedly exclaimed, “Shifu! Please let me explain!”

Su Yishui didn’t even bother to change the spoon and directly used Ranran’s, tranquilly eating what’s left of the steamed egg.

Ranran thought that her Shifu must be starving after exposure to the cold winds by the river, so she quickly scooped some rice for him onto the small table and brought out the reserved half of the dried Tangerine Peel Duck to go with it.

“Shifu, why did you come back so soon? I was thinking you might be going to the restaurant in the nearby town with Elder Mu for a meal!”

Su Yishui took a few bites of the duck, then looked up at her and asked, “Why would I eat with her?”

Not Ranran who has not fallen for her Shifu yet ( or realize she has fallen? ), sending him out on his ‘date’ with his ‘ex’, looking all fine…

Not ‘Mu Qingge’ thinking those two behaving like a newly wed couple. lol

Let the hilarity ensue!

Previous
Next

Ranran would not dare to mention that she had guessed Su Yishui’s relationship dilemma with his former master, Elder Mu. Going to a restaurant, of course meant two people having a private conversation by themselves.

She couldn’t expose him, to save her Shifu’s dignity, so she could only force a dry smile.

Su Yishui ate gracefully but quickly, finishing a bowl of rice in a few bites. After putting down his chopsticks, he said, “The matters here are settled. We will pack up this afternoon and prepare to leave.”

Everyone smiled upon hearing this; they had long wanted to leave this horrible place!

If another demon were to appear, they wouldn’t be able to handle it with their current abilities.

However, they had gained something from this trip. When they were stuck in the underground passage at the Military Platform, their flesh was frozen from being attached to the Soul Hosting Stone for so long. However, during their recovery, they discovered that their spiritual power had become more refined.

Even chubby Qiu Xier could now jump lightly and get onto the carriage.

They only knew they were following their Shifu to find the demon responsible for Yue-e’s demonization, and they weren’t quite sure what was inside that big stone underground, but they vaguely guessed it was related to their improved foundations.

However, their Shifu said that everything bestowed by evil beings must be returned. These days, not only were they forbidden from using spiritual power, but they also had to calm their minds, dispel those spiritual energy, and write the Calming Heart Mantra fifty times a day.

According to their master, that thing is extremely malevolent. If one’s will was not firm enough, they could easily be tempted and fall into demonic cultivation. So, writing the Calming Heart Mantra for a month would help them keep their minds under control.

However, Su Yishui didn’t seem in a hurry to return to the Western Mountain to drink the aged wine of Mu Qingge’s. Seeing his disciples had been frozen so terribly and their misery from having to relinquish the recent advancement they received, he suggested they go soak in a hot spring to dispel the cold.

As for where they were going, it was called Cha Ming Mountain, located in the mild climate of Jiangnan. Without sword riding, it would take quite some time to travel there.

On the way, they would seize every opportunity to write their Shifu’s assignments on horseback or in the carriage.

Bai Baishan, being agile-minded, after he finished his homework, he came to sound Ranran out, “You were with Shifu when you went to Cuiwei Mountain. You should know the origin of that water demon spell. Also, when we were in the cave, you were the one who came with Shifu to rescue us. Did Shifu tell you what was inside that stone?”

Ranran shook her head, changing the subject, “Second senior brother, you only wrote this forty times, you still have ten left! Be careful not to get caught by Shifu; he might double your punishment.”

Actually, Shifu does not check their assignments; it was all based on their own sense of responsibility. Bai Baishan intentionally wrote larger characters on more paper, making his stack look thicker.

Unfortunately, his attempt to appear diligent was seen through by Ranran at a glance, and Bai Baishan quickly put a finger to his lips, whispering, “Shh.”

“Little Miss, please don’t tell Shifu, look at my wrist, it’s almost swollen. If you tell Shifu, and he punishes me again, my hand might be gone…”

Bai Baishan was afraid Ranran would expose him, so he put in all his effort to persuade his little sister.

Ranran chuckled at his nervousness, “You better finish the remaining ten, and I won’t tell Shifu.”

Bai Baishan glared at her, “You’re so unreasonable; now you’re not definitely not on our side. No wonder Shifu always favors you!”

Since coming out of the cave at the Military Platform, Bai Baishan’s spiritual powers was raised the most. This powerful feeling of lightness and agility was intoxicating.

If one day his martial arts could be as profound as Shifu’s, what a scene it would be! Unfortunately, these few days, Master had specially instructed them to dispel the energies gained from the cave, so Bai Baishan did not dare to use his skills.

It felt like having a fortune in hand but having to return it after just touching it; it was really frustrating!

So, he couldn’t help but jab his little junior sister with his words, to relieve his frustration.

Ranran ignored Second senior brother’s sarcastic remarks. As Shifu said, he led them to the door, but cultivation was up to the individual. If second senior brother wanted to slack off, he would always find a way.

As the younger disciple, she could only urge him on. Shifu from Western Mountain had always let his disciples manage themselves after teaching them skills.

However, Ranran herself had finished her assignments flawlessly. Qiu Xier now looks to Ranran for everything; seeing her meticulousness, she also finished her tasks diligently.

As for Senior Brother Gao Cang, he always took Shifu’s words as law and so he too wrote his assignments meticulously.

Bai Baishan, being set apart by their behavior, thus reluctantly completed a few more pages.

However, this journey wasn’t all gloom. They had thought it would be a leisure trip, but it nearly cost them their lives. When they arrived at Cha Ming Mountain and experienced the prosperity of Jiangnan, they truly relaxed and enjoyed studying and playing.

Although the winter in Jiangnan was cold, it was much better than the desolation and chill of the northwest. Ranran finally could take off her thick cotton clothes and wear light dresses.

She had grown a lot taller in the past year, but she was still slender, so she couldn’t buy clothes that was too loose. Those that fit her waist were often too short. So, when buying dresses, she often had to extend the hemline to reach her shoes.

When she saw Ranran in a floral dress paired with a white undershirt, Xier clapped and said she looked good, but she also commented that Ranran’s choice of colors was too plain, not bright enough.

Ranran is now somewhat influenced by Shifu, feeling that the brightly colored clothes she used to wear were indeed a bit hard on the eyes. Wearing these softer colors made her feel much calmer as well.

However, Qiu Xier didn’t agree. In her opinion, young girls should wear bright vibrant colors, otherwise they will be letting down their youth!

Because it was Shifu’s money, she chose a bright lotus root color for her long skirt, which looked like a full blooming bellflower from afar.

While the two girls were chattering and choosing clothes, Senior Brother went to the shoemaker to add leather soles to his cloth shoes, making them more durable and easier to walk in.

As for Second senior brother, who originally followed them to pick clothes but found it boring, he decided to take a walk outside. However, as soon as he stepped out, he felt drops of water on his face, even seeping into his eyes…

He looked up in bemusement at the eaves, where the water seemed to be dripping from. Then he hurried into a nearby bookstore to buy books.

After Ranran and third senior sister finished buying clothes, they went to look for second senior brother. When they turned the corner, they saw second senior brother carrying a bamboo book frame, smiling and nodding at a nearby alley.

Because of the angle, Ranran couldn’t see into the alley and didn’t know who second senior brother was talking to.

So, Ran Ran walked straight over, and just as he turned around, they almost bumped into each other.

“Younger junior sister, why are you so clumsy? Rushing over like this, what if you bump into someone!” Bai Baishan came to his senses and immediately patted his chest.

Ranran looked past him, and behind him was a dead end, no one in sight…

Unable to figure out what happened, Ranran asked, “Second senior brother, who were you talking to just now?”

Bai Baishan impatiently said, “Just someone asking for directions, they were right…”

As he turned to point, he realized there was no one behind him and was left stunned.

Just then, Qiu Xier ran over shouting, “Come on, there’s a monkey show over there. Senior Brother saved us a bench, so we can sit and watch!”

So, the two of them hurried over. Young people always love to have fun, and in that empty alley, water droplets seemed to continue dripping…

After watching the monkey show, they reunited with Second Uncle Master and went up to Cha Ming Mountain. Shifu had gone up the mountain ahead of them, to visit an old friend.

Originally, they thought Shifu would just take them to soak in some spring in the wild mountains. But they never could have guessed, that Cha Ming Mountain had a beautifully built tea house and hot spring pools.

Perhaps seeing their struggles and hardships at Wangxiang Pass, Shifu was so considerate to bring them to this villa where only wealthy people could enjoy tea and hot springs.

The owner of the hot spring pool on the mountain was over forty, of medium build. According to Second Uncle Master, he was also once a disciple of Mu Qingge.

This owner’s surname was Zeng, full name Zeng Yi. After Mu Qingge’s soul scattered, the righteous sects disbanded the disciples of Lingxi Palace, and he was driven away from Xishan and ended up here, managing the hot spring pools.

When Ranran saw this scholarly middle-aged man, she could still vaguely see the charisma of a once-handsome youth between his wrinkled brows.

When this Uncle Zeng saw Su Yishui, he didn’t treat him coldly like Qin Xuanjiu, but warmly welcomed him. Instead of arranging them in guest rooms, he had them stay in what seemed to be his own backyard.

When he saw the two female disciples Xue Ranran and Qiu Xier, Zeng Yi looked back and forth at the two girls, then settled his gaze on Su Yishui, as if asking something.

Su Yishui didn’t answer but made an excuse to dismiss the three younger ones after they greeted this Uncle Zeng, leaving only Ranran. Then he said to her, “This is your Fourteenth Uncle Master. You should thank him because the stick you use was made by him.”

Zeng Yi stared at Ranran, silent for a long while. It wasn’t until Ranran obediently held up a tea cup to serve him that he seemed to snap out of it, quickly took the cup, and somewhat excitedly said, “You… don’t be so polite. What do you like to eat? I’ll have the kitchen make it for you right away!”

Ranran felt that this Fourteenth Uncle Master was indeed a kindly elder, but she didn’t want to be presumptuous and casually order food, so she just smiled shyly.
