But when she looked up again, she saw tears welling up in the eyes of this scholarly uncle. He quickly wiped his eyes with his sleeve, forcing back his emotions, “The wind is a bit strong today, making my eyes water… You sit down quickly, I’ll bring some fruits for you to eat.”

Ranran looked out at the warm and sunny weather outside the window and didn’t know when the wind started blowing in the hall, causing Fourteenth Uncle Master’s eyes to water.

However, when he lifted his hand to wipe his tears, Ranran was shocked again. Because from his oversized sleeves, only his palm was visible, and not a single finger!

After Uncle Master left, Ranran served tea to her Shifu in the hall.

While boiling water and warming cups, she curiously asked, “Shifu, what’s the story with Uncle Master Zeng’s hand?”

Su Yishui glanced at her and slowly recounted the story of Uncle Master Zeng.

It was said that Uncle Master Zeng was once a master craftsman of weapons. The weapons he made were very highly sought after. However, because his father offended the powerful, bringing calamity to the family, they sent him to XiShan for refuge.

At that time, Mu Qingge thought the fair and refined Zeng Yi was an interesting and talented person, so she generously took him in, even providing him with ancient weapon-making texts to study.

Although Zeng Yi didn’t practice foundational cultivation or fast, the weapons he made were extraordinary. But later, after the death of Mu Qingge, he was captured by some influential villains who forced him to make weapons.

But he refused to do so, even when they threatened him with death. They ended up cutting off his fingers one by one. Fortunately, Su Yishui arrived in time and saved him.

*Only guilty of being talented, losing his fingers made him unable to make weapons anymore, but also stopped the rest of the world from being interested in his skills. He was able to maintain a peaceful life by managing the hot spring pools here.
*匹夫无罪怀璧其罪 比喻有才能、有理想而受害
Someone who suffered because they are talented or has ideals

Ranran felt deeply grieved and whispered, “So the spring-loaded mechanism stick was made by Master Uncle Zeng before he was harmed? Such skillful craftsmanship, but now he can’t make anything anymore, isn’t that a pity?”

Upon hearing Ranran’s whisper, Su Yishui chuckled lightly and said, “Take a look at the inscription on the stick.”

Ranran looked down and saw that there were two “Ran” characters in the shape of flowers on the inscription!

If it was a finished product from Master Uncle’s earlier days, how would he have known that the person using this stick in the future would be named Ranran?

Soon Ranran had her answer. When she accompanied Shifu to the backyard house to find Master Uncle, she happened to see him making something in a workshop.

However, he wasn’t using his hands but had removed his shoes and socks, placed his legs on the table, and deftly assembled various polished components with his ten slender toes…

The workshop was also filled with exquisite clocks, cosmetic cases, and similar items, all of which were presumably made by Master Uncle.

When Zeng Yi saw Ranran and Su Yishui, he quickly put down his work, put on his shoes, and stood up to greet them.

Seeing Ran Ran curiously examining a cosmetic case, he smiled and used his fingerless palm to open it. Surprisingly, a pleasant melody of strings and bamboo came from inside, and lifelike little jade figurines holding earrings and rings stood up and walked out of the box one by one, as if dancing gracefully to the music.

“This is my new creation. If you like it, you can have it to play with.” He pushed the cosmetic case towards Ranran.

Although Ranran was unable to recognize its worth, she guessed that such exquisite work must be very valuable. How could she accept it? She quickly waved her hand and declined.

But Su Yishui mildly said, “Your Uncle Master is offering it sincerely. Don’t refuse, accept it.”

With Shifu’s words, Ranran accepted it. She curiously opened and closed the lid repeatedly, her big eyes sparkling as she pondered the mechanisms inside the box.

Su Yishui then talked about their adventures at Wangxiang Pass and also thanked him again on behalf of his disciple for the excellent weapon he had provided.

Zeng Yi asked seriously, “Is it handy? When I corresponded with Yishui before, I roughly asked for your height, and I made that stick according to the height measurement in the letter. But now that I see you, it seems you’ve grown a lot taller. It seems I need to make some adjustments to the stick so that it fits your hand better.”

Ranran had entered XiShan for nearly a year now and had indeed grown taller. She thought about how her stick was specially made by Fourteenth Uncle Master for her, and she couldn’t help feeling touched.

He had created so many exquisite things using his feet instead of hands, which made her admire him even more.

Genius, even in adversity, can still change the world. Of course, it requires rock-solid determination to achieve that.

However, with so many senior brothers and sisters, why was she the only one who received Uncle Master’s love and received such a sophisticated weapon?

When Ranran brought it up, Master Uncle Zeng was momentarily dumbfounded. He then said, “I made something for everyone, but I haven’t had the chance to pass them to your Shifu yet…”

Ranran felt relieved after hearing this and nodded. However, as if remembering something, she earnestly said to Fourteenth Uncle Master, “Please rest assured, Uncle. I will never tell anyone where this stick came from. But Uncle, you shouldn’t make these anymore in the future. In my opinion, making cosmetic cases and clocks is already good enough.”

After all, Uncle had lost all ten fingers. If it was known that he regained his divine skills and attracted the covetousness of unscrupulous people again, wouldn’t it lead to a repeat of nightmares?

Upon hearing Ranran’s words which are mature beyond her years, Zeng Yi sat up straight and respectfully said, “Over the years, I have not made any more weapons… I just can’t stay idle, so I make some small items to pass the time. But *you’re right, I will learn to be more discreet in the future and not show off…”
*您 is a formal polite way to say ‘you’ but reserved for elder, seniors

Ranran noticed that Uncle Master was using a formal tone and sat up straight as well, saying, “Uncle Master, are you angry? Are you mocking your disciple niece for being too talkative and ignorant?”

Zeng Yi looked melancholy, but after a discreet glance from Su Yishui, he forced a smile and said, “You’re right. I just thought of how Master scolded me several times before for being too arrogant and not knowing how to show restraint. She often said that if she were still around, she would naturally protect us disciples, but if she wasn’t, we would all be vulnerable. Unfortunately, I was young and arrogant at that time, and I didn’t listen to her. I was only focused on creating more impressive divine weapons to dazzle the world. I didn’t expect that in the end, her words would all come true. I have learned my lesson, but I never expected the price to be so high… She must be… extremely disappointed in me!”

This was the second disciple of Mu Qingge that Ranran had met, besides Shifu.

People often said Mu Qingge was greedy and lecherous, superficial and likes to judge people by appearance. But Ranran felt that Mu Qingge’s disciples were all excellent people.

Based on what Uncle Master Zeng said, Mu Qingge would educate her disciples with such seriousness and care, indicating that although she didn’t manage to train any outstanding immortals, at least her disciples were kind-hearted and straightforward enough to be considered gentlemen.

Qin Xuanjiu could abandon his prospects and stayed in the extreme cold of the northwest for twenty years just because of his Master’s instructions. Zeng Yi would rather lose all ten fingers than help tyrants cause suffering to the innocent.

As for Shifu Su Yishui, his character is even more impeccable. He had been practicing medicine on Western Mountain for several years, although his medical fees were expensive, and he was a bit lazy, only treating a few patients each year. But his reputation for saving lives and benefiting the world was absolutely authentic!

In this way, although Mu Qingge had a bad reputation and ended her life somewhat ingloriously, with such disciples who lived uprightly, they were much better than those seemingly noble but actually corrupt orthodox sects.

Thinking of this, she comforted, “If Master Mu knew about your situation, she would definitely be proud of you!”

Upon hearing this from Ranran, Uncle Master Zeng put away his sadness and exclaimed with joy, “Really?”

Ranran nodded vigorously, finally coaxing Uncle Master Zeng to smile through his tears.

However, when night fell and she soaked in the hot spring pool with Qiu Xier, she saw the new weapon Qiu Xier had obtained—a common ring knife. Although the handle had exquisite patterns and the blade was delicate, it was nowhere near as stunning and extraordinary as Ranran’s mechanism staff.

Uncle Master Zeng probably made cosmetic cases often, understanding women’s preferences very well. Just the two exquisite magnolia bell ornaments hanging on the knife handle made third senior sister very satisfied. She leaned against the pool edge soaking in the hot spring while playing with the knife, commenting that the color and pattern of the handle matched dresses very nicely…

As for the eldest senior brother and the second senior brother, they received double swords and a longsword. Apart from the exquisite craftsmanship of the handles, there was nothing particularly remarkable about them.

It seemed that Uncle Master had run out of inspiration and did not put much effort into making things for the other three disciples.

However, the other three disciples didn’t know about Uncle Master’s past, let alone that Ranran’s weapon was also a gift from Uncle Master Zeng, so after thanking Uncle Master Zeng for his generous gifts, everyone was quite harmonious.

Ranran felt that Uncle Master Zeng showed great respect for Mu Qingge. But he didn’t treat Su Yishui with the same coldness as Elder Jiu or Qin Xuanjiu, which was very puzzling.

However, it was normal for relationships among disciples to be varied, some good and some not so good. Perhaps Uncle Master Zeng had a good relationship with Shifu in the past, which led to such a long-lasting friendship.

But recently, Ranran hadn’t been getting along well with the second senior brother. He seemed burdened with something heavy and often disappeared during this time of healing in the hot spring pool.

When he returned, he would be humming a tune and appear quite pleased with himself.

Since this place was near a bustling town, Ranran secretly speculated with Qiu Xier that the second senior brother must have gone down the mountain alone to have fun.

They didn’t know what fun things he was doing that made him go down the mountain so often without telling them.

Ranran nodded indignantly. Shifu always let his disciples roam freely and didn’t pay much attention to their studies. Since coming here, he often stayed with Uncle Master Zeng in the backyard workshop for a long time without appearing, so he was even more lax in managing the disciples.

And the two Uncle Masters were also out on missions. The second senior brother now seemed like an unleashed dog, always running outside.

After breakfast that day, Bai Baishan used stomach pain as an excuse and left the three disciples who were meditating and cultivating Qi, returning alone to rest.

Once he left, Qiu Xier quickly got up and said to Ranran and Gao cang, “Let’s secretly follow the second senior brother and see if he’s gone down the mountain to have fun.”

Gao Cang straightforwardly said, “Isn’t this improper? What if Shifu comes to check our progress?”

A change of scenery! Time to head to the beautiful Jiangnan for new adventures!

Meeting another of Mu Qingge’s disciples.
Zeng Yi seems to be the only one who knows the truth behind Xue Ranran!
He must be really trusted by Su Yishui.

Being a very bright girl, Ranran also started to notice somethings that seems out of the ordinary but she does not have enough information yet.

Previous
Next

Qiu Xier disagreed, “When has Shifu ever come to check our progress? We’ll go and return quickly, naturally he won’t find out.”

Ranran didn’t mind either; she was also in her playful years, and Shifu had never said they couldn’t go down the mountain. The second senior brother should have gone to the town nearby, which was very close. If they went to shop, it would be perfect to buy gifts for her parents.

After all, this was her first time going on a long trip away from home since birth. The last time she went shopping, she saw a piece of fabric suitable for her mother, but unfortunately, there was only about a meter left, which was not enough to make a skirt.
*一匹布 is about 3.3 meters

The shopkeeper told her that new stock would arrive in a few days, so it was just nice to go have a look. Going on a trip and returning empty-handed to West Mountain would be quite embarrassing.

Thinking about this, they tidied up, each took their weapons, wore veiled hats, and went down the mountain together.

This manner of young heroes felt very cool and unrestrained; the three juniors were now skilled and agile, flying and leaping down the mountain with great joy.

Because the tea and hot springs here were famous, the visitors were mostly wealthy families, so the town was bustling.

When they were near the town entrance, they had seen the figure of the second senior brother from afar. They had originally planned to secretly follow him, but unfortunately, the second senior brother hurriedly walked and disappeared after turning into a long street.

Since they couldn’t find him, they decided to simply shop and buy things. Besides buying gifts for their parents, Ranran also planned to buy a gift for Uncle Master Zeng. After all, she should express her gratitude after accepting his exquisite mechanism stick.

Ranran planned to buy Uncle Master a pair of thick-soled shoes and soft white cotton fabric. She would personally make him a few pairs of comfortable and breathable socks and embroider *Pine tree motifs.
*劲松 不畏风寒而挺立的松树。比喻刚强不屈的人。
Sturdy pine tree, used to describe resolute and unyielding people.

Uncle Master’s feet were as important as a craftsman’s hands and naturally needed meticulous care. While selecting breathable white cotton fabric, Ranran inadvertently looked up and saw the second senior brother in front of a courtyard, smiling foolishly, and then walked straight into the courtyard.

Ranran wanted to call Gao cang and Qiu Xier but didn’t know which stall they were at. So she simply put down the cotton fabric and walked towards the courtyard, wanting to see what the second senior brother was up to.

There was a tall tree next to the courtyard. Ranran lightly jumped up to it, and she could see the situation inside the courtyard.

She saw the second senior brother standing in the courtyard, smiling indulgently at a burly man, saying, “Rou’er, it’s only been a day, why do you miss me so much? Come on, wipe away your tears…”

As he spoke, the second senior brother took out a handkerchief from his pocket, hugged the burly man’s thick waist, and wiped his tear-streaked face. Finally, he planted a big kiss on the man’s dark and hairy face…

Ranran’s cultivation was not enough, and she was so shocked that she almost fell from the tree!

Second senior brother, so you’re like this! Your tastes are really too heavy!

Thinking that she unintentionally witnessed the second senior brother’s illicit affair, Ranran felt very sorry as well.

But soon, she realized something was wrong. The burly man whom Bai Baishan kissed looked very angry, gritting his teeth and showing a completely different expression from the teary-eyed appearance the second senior brother was talking about, as if he could tear the second senior brother apart at any moment.

However, his words were flat and dry, like reciting lines from a play, “Bai Lang, without you by my side, I can’t even sleep well. I’ve already prepared the bathwater for you. Do you want to take a bath first?”

Hearing this, the second senior brother raised an eyebrow, smoothly lifted the man’s chin, and said in a flirtatious tone, “Are you so impatient because I didn’t give you enough yesterday? Don’t worry, after I take a bath, I’ll make sure to give you a good time…”

Hearing this, Ranran tried to stop herself from puking. She bit her finger, and felt unsure if she should continue eavesdropping. Although she felt that the second senior brother also had the freedom to love a man, seeing him being affectionate with a hairy brute made her feel extremely embarrassed and had goosebumps all over.


But at this moment, she noticed that the burly man named “Rou’er” had led the second senior brother to a tub filled with crimson bloodwater.

The second senior brother seemed oblivious to the unusual tub and began undressing, chatting merrily with “Rou’er” while entering the tub. In an instant, the blood-red water in the tub eagerly rushed into the second senior brother’s body, and he suddenly rolled his eyes and fell unconscious in the tub.

Ranran was horrified. Just when she was about to go rescue the second senior brother, a woman walked out of the house and said to the burly man, “He has absorbed the blood of a horned demon and can’t wake up for a while! Go, drip more *’One Leaf Veils the Eyes’ into his eyes again, so he won’t notice anything wrong after he wakes up.”
*一叶障目

The burly man roughly lifted the second senior brother’s eyelids and dripped some medicine into his eyes, but it was unclear what the medicine was for.

Just then, the burly man named “Rou’er” couldn’t hold himself back anymore. He said to the woman, “Elder Tu, can’t you find a woman to do this kind of seduction work? This kid keeps touching me like a horny dog every time, I really want to cut him alive!”

The beautiful woman glared at him fiercely and said, “I’m the only woman in Crimson Gate, if you won’t do it, do you want me to deal with this idiot?!”

With that, the burly man quickly knelt down, bowing repeatedly and profusely declared that he doesn’t dare.

Tu Jiuyuan softened her tone and said, “He’s under the influence of the drug, so a few suggestive words can create illusions in his eyes and sounds in his ears. In his eyes now, you are the stunning beauty that only appears in his dreams, and he thinks he has had passionate moments with you several times. This is an excellent opportunity that must be utilized well. Su Yi Shui is on Tea Fragrance Mountain. This kid’s body has already absorbed the blood of a horned demon, so any pool he soaks in will have the poison of the horned demon, subtly poisoning without detection. Once Su Yi Shui is poisoned, his internal energy will be disrupted, which will help Master regain his core cultivation. If this plan succeeds, you will be the top contributor… Besides, you are not a delicate girl, what harm is there in letting this kid take a little advantage of you?”

Upon hearing this, “Rou’er” immediately saluted with clasped fist and declared loudly, “For the sake of the Master, I am willing to do anything!”

If it were an ordinary day, Ranran would have had the leisure to sigh at the hardships of being a disciple of the demonic sect. Even a proud and upright man of seven feet had to play the role of a woman to seduce others.

But now, her second senior brother was the victim, and from what she heard, they were planning something against theirShifu, Su Yi Shui! But what exactly were they planning to do?

Just then, after the female demonic leader finished her instructions, she turned and left the courtyard, walking towards another street.

Ranran looked at the second senior brother sleeping unconscious in the tub and was certain that since he was being manipulated by them, but he should be temporarily safe. So she agilely leaped from the rooftops, following that Tu Jiuyuan.

She walked swiftly to a lavishly decorated teahouse and walked in directly.

Some tea customers also wanted to enter, but they were stopped by two burly men at the door, who said that the teahouse had been booked and asked them to find another place.

Ranran knew that there must be some secrets in this teahouse, but she couldn’t enter at the moment.

So Ranran looked around and suddenly saw a tall Poplar tree on the street.

She walked over, circled behind the tree, took advantage of the distraction around her, lightly stepped on the tip of her toes, and leaped onto the tall tree. Then she jumped to a nearby rooftop, then another, moving like stepping on lotus leaves in a pond, quickly reaching the rooftop of the teahouse.

She found a shady corner of the roof, sat cross-legged, closed her eyes, and focused her mind. In no time, she entered a meditative state, able to ignore the noise from the street and listen clearly to the voices inside the teahouse.

A sharp male voice said, “Wei Jiu, His Majesty’s intention is simple. With a useless key, we can obtain the whereabouts of the Spirit Spring. Isn’t this a win-win situation?”

At this point, Ranran heard a familiar piercing laughter, “Mu Qingge has been reborn again, why has she become so timid? If she wants something from me, she should come and ask for it herself. Why involve an emperor to intimidate people? Does she think I, Wei Jiu, am a eunuch in the palace, peeing my pants at a mere threat and complying at once?!”

His words were sarcastic and pointed, and the seemingly eunuch-like man, upon hearing Wei Jiu’s biting words, smiled awkwardly, “How could Chief Wei possibly be like us servants? Your cultivation is profound, your followers are numerous, you are the number one person among the demon cultivators! His Majesty has never cared about immortal cultivation affairs, but now he needs Master Mu to refine pills for him. However, Master Mu has some misunderstandings with you. His Majesty is willing to mediate, and if we can turn hostility into friendship, wouldn’t it be a win-win situation? His Majesty is willing to give a reward on behalf of Master Mu, would these ten thousand taels of gold satisfy you?”

Wei Jiu smiled and said, “Mu Qingge said she knows the whereabouts of the Netherworld Spring, I believe her! But it’s not good for her to avoid me and seek help from other men. Tell her, the Marrow-Cleansing Pool Meet is coming up, and this time, my disciples from Crimson Gate will also participate. At that time, I will prepare a banquet for her and also check if the Grievance water poison she’s suffering from is serious. Of course, if she can’t bear it any longer, Crimson Gate will always welcome her. But if she continues to get other men to negotiate with me, even if it’s the emperor, I’ll treat him like a fart!”

To mock the emperor in front of a high-ranking eunuch like this, this demon has to the the only one in the entire world.

The old eunuch took a deep breath, seemingly finding it difficult to continue in his anger. But he probably knew Wei Jiu’s murderous temperament, so he just chuckled twice and said, “Back then, you secretly assisted His Majesty and he has always remembered it. If this matter fails, it won’t diminish His Majesty’s love and respect for you.”

Wei Jiu laughed coldly, “If he truly appreciated it, why has he only made temples for Mu Qingge to be worshiped? I don’t see him build a golden statue for me? These tricks of maintaining balance and giving benefits, let him save them for his officials.”

When the eunuch left, Tu Jiuyuan came over and quietly mentioned Su Yi Shui’s disciple has returned to meet “Rou’er” again in the small courtyard. At the end, Tu Jiuyuan said, “The Chief is wise. When we found Su Yi Shui’s disciples in town, you came up with this wonderful plan. That Bai Baishan is indeed a gullible fool.”

Wei Jiu smiled sincerely this time, “When I saw Su Yi Shui’s disciples in the town, I immediately took notice of this person with shallow roots and a wandering gaze… But it’s also strange, there’s actually a hint of demonic aura on him. If it weren’t for the lingering yin energy on him which has not dissipated, ‘One Leaf Veils the Eyes’ wouldn’t be so effective. This hidden piece must be used well.”

After saying this, the teahouse fell silent, only the sound of tea lids hitting tea cups and people sipping tea could be heard.

At this moment, Tu Jiuyuan hesitated again and said, “Chief, you’ve lost most of your cultivation, it’s time to retreat and recuperate. Why bother asking Mu Qingge to come personally? If there’s anything, I, your subordinate can convey it on your behalf…”

Ranran heard this, and Wei Jiu’s voice suddenly turned cold, and he slowly spoke, “Jiuyuan, do I need to consult with you before I do things?”

The woman called Jiuyuan seems to have knelt down with a thud, “Chief is wise and possesses great foresight. Whatever you do must have profound intentions. I spoke too much, I deserve punishment!”

After a series of slaps and punches to the face, there was a pause, then Wei Jiu spoke again, “Alright, get up. I know your private thoughts. You didn’t want me to see Mu Qingge, but don’t worry, I already said no one can replace you…”

Ranran, who was sitting on the rooftop, slowly opened her eyes at this point, allowing the bustling noises of the street to fill her ears again. At first, she wasn’t sure of the woman’s identity. During the birth of the Jue Mountain Spirit Fruit, there was chaos on Jue Mountain, and she hadn’t paid attention to the disciples of the Crimson Gate. But she never expected that the person this woman came to see secretly… turned out to be the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu!

Although she didn’t see him, Wei Jiu’s unique voice was unmistakable.

When did her second senior brother fall victim to the schemes of the demonic sect? Thinking that they wanted to use her second senior brother to harm their Shifu, Ranran couldn’t help but feel anxious.

So she stood up, intending to go back and report to her Shifu first.

Just as Ranran stood up, a string of bells fell from her pocket – these bells were bought by her third senior sister just now, with each of them having a string.

As Ranran bent down to pick it up, the tiles under her feet suddenly cracked, and a long whip wrapped around her ankle like a spirit snake, pulling her down directly.

In the instant she was pulled down, her body naturally reacted. With a quick flip, she broke free from the whip’s entanglement, steadying herself skillfully and landing lightly on the ground.

And at this moment, she also saw a man still sitting in a high chair, sipping tea.

It was indeed Wei Jiu. Unlike the ethereal aura of her Shifu, this man’s features are rather sinister in its beauty.

However, unlike his domineering attitude on Jue Mountain, the Wei Jiu who lost almost half of his core appeared much gloomier. Although he smiled when looking at her, there was a strong killing intent in his eyes.

It’s no wonder that when he had tried to ask Mu Qingge to become his Master but wasn’t accepted into the West Mountain Sect. This man might be beautiful, but he also gave off a chilly discomfort.

But now wasn’t the time to critique a great demon. When she fell down, many Crimson Gate disciples with swords and knives appeared out of nowhere, surrounding her. They were just waiting for Wei Jiu’s command to chop her into pieces.

Ranran did not expect to fall into such a dangerous situation in a mere instant. Now, she could only hope that the forest was dark enough that day and Wei Jiu has too many things on his mind, so he probably forgot what she looked like.

Thinking of this, she forced herself to calm down and smiled apologetically, “I was practicing my legwork on the rooftop and happened to pass by here. I accidentally stepped on the rooftop. I’m willing to compensate with silver, may I ask if the innkeeper is downstairs?”

As she spoke, she took out her purse to go downstairs and talk to the innkeeper.

But the people surrounding her showed no intention of letting her go. The swords and knives rang loudly, pointing directly at Ranran’s delicate neck.

They were all high-level cultivators, and their footwork was not weak. Now that someone had eavesdropped on their Master’s conversation, they naturally didn’t need to keep any witnesses alive. So the falling swords and knives didn’t hold back, chopping straight down.

However, Ranran was slippery like an eel. With a twist of her waist, she slid between the blades, jumped onto a table, and darted around like a rabbit.

Just then, the long whip that had pulled her down came again, carrying spiritual power with it.

Ranran glanced and saw that it was the beautiful woman standing beside Wei Jiu who was swinging the whip. She should be Wei Jiu’s right-hand woman, the witch Tu Jiuyuan!

The ankle that had been entangled by the whip earlier was still throbbing with pain. Tu Jiuyuan’s figure was hot, and her whip carried an equally hot and relentless forcefulness . If she were entangled again, she probably will be badly injured.

When the whip attacked, her body reacted faster than her mind. Ranran quickly pulled out a mechanism stick made by her fourteenth Uncle Master, pressing the spring in the middle. Hooks popped out from both sides of the stick, caught the whip, and automatically tightened it. Then Ranran quickly wrapped the whip around, making it unable to cause trouble again.

Her actions were smooth and fluid, completely imitating her Shifu’s moves when he was fighting with Wei Jiu, using that rolling pin to capture his weapons. Even her pose was identical.

At this moment, the man who had been drinking tea and watching suddenly stared at this familiar move, slowly put down his teacup, and gritted his teeth, “Little girl, so it’s you!”

Although Tu Jiuyuan had pulled the girl down just now, as Ranran had expected, he hadn’t recognized her immediately. He had just felt that this girl looked strangely familiar.

It wasn’t until she displayed the technique of entwining the whip, triggering a humiliating memory in Wei Jiu’s mind, that he suddenly remembered this was the girl who had smiled at him while sitting in the tree during the array formation in the forest!

If he remembered correctly, she was Su Yi Shui’s disciple and had witnessed the whole process of him being made a fool of by Su Yi Shui…

Although this girl seemed to have grown a lot, and she appeared fair and beautiful under the bright daylight, but her smiling face just now was just like how she looked in the forest, truly hateful!

Wei Jiu didn’t intend for anyone to know about his visit at this time, but he didn’t expect to hear some movement on the rooftop and end up pulling down one of Su Yi Shui’s disciples.

Wei Jiu couldn’t help but smile slowly, admiring the look of fear and shock in the little girl’s widened pupils.

Since she was Su Yi Shui’s disciple, he couldn’t just kill her outright.

Since he couldn’t vent his anger on that Su for the time being, playing with this little girl was better than nothing. How should he slowly kill her to somewhat vent his resentment over these days!

Ranran heard Wei Jiu’s words and thought to herself, “This is bad!”

She didn’t check the almanac before leaving today, and she ended up tracking someone she shouldn’t mess with, after tracking her second senior brother. Wei Jiu was an archenemy of their Shifu, and now that he had recognized her, falling into his hands would probably be worse than death.

But her Shifu had said, don’t panic when encountering demons and monsters. Now that she was surrounded, she could only use the “Delay” Technique to save herself. With her thoughts swirling, Ranran could only awkwardly smile to ease the tense atmosphere, and then cheerfully said to Wei Jiu, “Shifu has been waiting outside. He sent me to invite Master Wei. Can Your Excellency come downstairs to meet him?”

Upon hearing this, Wei Jiu’s expression changed slightly. He thought he had kept his movements hidden and had even used the soul-catching technique “One Leaf Veils the Eyes” to manipulate Su Yi Water’s second disciple, allowing him to use her for his own purposes.

He hadn’t expected Su Yi Shui to have caught on so soon and even sent a disciple to eavesdrop on the rooftop. In that case, has his scheme failed?

He also didn’t think that this seemingly inexperienced little girl in front of him could be telling such barefaced lies with a straight face, making it really hard to tell if Su Yi Shui was really downstairs.

Ranran calmly flipped the stick, released the whip, and then pointed in the direction of the stairs, saying, “Shifu is here, and he has also invited Elder Mu. Didn’t you want to meet her? They are waiting for you downstairs!”

This bait was quite clever. Wei Jiu had always had some unspeakable sentiments for Mu Qingge. When he heard that Mu Qingge was together with Su Yi Shui, he was immediately bothered.

By the side, Tu Jiuyuan also showed a hint of jealousy. Her face tightened, unable to resist, she headed towards the stairs to see what was going on.

In the moment she turned, a flaw in the encirclement appeared. Ranran seized this rare opportunity, silently recited a Flash technique, and with lightning speed, bounced up, leaped over those big men, and jumped down from the window.

Her agility was extraordinary. Although Tu Jiuyuan was quick to react and tried to use the whip to entangle her again, she missed the mark. What came back was just a pink shoe embroidered with tiny plum blossoms.

When Tu Jiuyuan jumped down the stairs, she only saw a startled crowd that immediately scattered, but she didn’t see the figure of that little girl anywhere.

Tu Jiuyuan cracked her whip angrily: “Little brat, next time I see you, it will be your death!”

In the time it took for her to turn around, Wei Jiu had already stood behind her, coldly saying, “Chase in the direction of the Tea Fragrance Mountain.”

Tu Jiuyuan hesitated, “But if Su Yi Shui is here too…”

Before she could finish, Wei Jiu had already grabbed her chin, smiling and saying, “Look at the useless trash I raised, not even as cunning as a little brat. If her Master were here, would she run away like a rabbit? Chase her down for me. It’s not easy to create this Bai Baishan as a pawn. We can’t let it go to waste!”

After saying that, he roughly pushed Tu Jiuyuan away. Tu Jiuyuan felt embarrassed by the mockery of her Excellency, signaled to her subordinates, and quickly leaped onto the roof, heading towards Tea Fragrance Mountain.

Meanwhile, Wei Jiu picked up the embroidered shoe that Ranran had dropped and looked at it – this should have been sewn by the girl herself. There was just simple patterns on the shoe surface, but there seemed to be words embroidered on the insole. Wei Jiu squinted and saw four big characters embroidered on it, “To Pass Every Test.”

Around the four characters was a circle of sincere prayer chants.

It would seem that the Master’s tests at West Mountain was strict. As a disciple, she had actually come up with such a wishing technique.

Everyone knew that when the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu smiled, it meant someone was going to die. He looked at the embroidered shoe and smiled darkly: Cunning little girl, when she is brought back here, he will be sure to make her suffer!”

Previous
Next

Ranran, after using a Flash technique to descend from the building, immediately blended into the crowd. After passing two streets, she encountered Gao Cang and Qiu Xier, who were tasting snacks in a pastry shop.

She only said “Wei Jiu is here” and the other two immediately turned pale with fear. The three of them then rushed out of the town at full speed. When they were about to run towards Tea Fragrance Mountain, Ranran closed her eyes and listened carefully, whispering, “Not good! Someone is chasing us!”

Since they had ambushed their second senior brother, they must know where their Shifu was hiding. Although Ranran had left the town just now, as long as Wei Jiu sent someone to chase in the direction of Cha Ming Mountain, they would definitely be caught.

Ranran knew that their Shifu had hidden Netherworld Spirit Spring on him. If Wei Jiu discovered this, there would be a fierce fight for it. If they were to fall into the hands of the Crimson Gate, their Shifu might be coerced by this demon… Right now they could only quickly inform their Shifu and ask for help.

With this in mind, she glanced at a magpie perched on a branch, then leaped up and swiftly caught the bird. From the charm pouch given to her by Elder Jiu, she took out a bird control charm and tied it to the magpie’s slender leg before releasing it.

With the bird controlled by the charm, it could now deliver messages like the crows of Cuiwei Mountain.

After doing this, she said briefly to her two fellow disciples, “The sound of the pursuers coming up behind us is very fast. We can’t outrun them. We can only delay now and wait for our Shifu and Uncle Master to come save us.”

After speaking, she looked around and saw a secluded mountain hollow with dense tree shade, perfect for hiding.

She then said, “Quick, let’s hide there. We need to meditate quickly and slow down our breathing. That way, we can evade the pursuers’ detection.”

When she eavesdropped in the teahouse earlier, she meditated and listened quietly. Even Wei Jiu didn’t notice her until she stood up later.

So now, they had to hide first, slow down their breathing, and see if they could escape the pursuers.

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang, having experienced trials in Wangxiang Pass, although they felt a bit panicked imagining Wei Jiu’s brutal methods of disembowelment, but they still reacted quickly to Ranran’s words and followed her to hide in the mountain hollow.

When the three of them sat cross-legged, silently reciting the Calming Heart Mantra they had been punished to write along the way. Surprisingly they quickly entered a state of meditation, reaching a state of selflessness. Not only did their breathing become slow and steady, but their heartbeats also gradually slowed down, almost as if they were dead.

The disciples of the Crimson Gate soon arrived at this location, but they suddenly couldn’t sense the traces of their targets, causing them to stop in their tracks and look at each other.

The surrounding area was dense with trees, providing ample hiding spots.

One of them drew a sharp arrow and shot dozens of arrows towards several hidden spots in the woods. Unfortunately, apart from the startled birds that flew away, there was no human sound.

So the disciples quickly continued to chase in the direction of Cha Ming Mountain.

When the pursuers passed by, Qiu Xier opened her eyes and took a sharp breath.

Because she just noticed that Ranran’s arm had been hit by an arrow, with blood gushing out. She couldn’t imagine how Ranran endured it when she was hit. Not only did she not make a sound, but she also managed to conceal her breathing.

Ranran, now recovered from her meditative state, felt a sharp pain in her arm. She had never experienced such suffering since childhood, so tears were swirling in her eyes.

“Little junior sister, let’s hurry and go. If we wait to be rescued, you might already have bled to death!” Qiu Xier urged with concern.

Ranran gritted her teeth and shook her head. “No, we can’t go anywhere now. We can only wait here. Tie my arm tightly with a cloth strip to slow down the blood flow. Then you two go first. Otherwise… I’ll only drag you down.”

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang exchanged glances. Gao Cang spoke first, “We won’t leave. We’ll stay here with you. If we leave you behind and go, how can we face your parents?”

Qiu Xier, who was initially undecided, agreed with what her senior brother said. She took out a handkerchief from her sleeve, tore it into strips, and bound Ranran’s arm tightly.

Ranran took a deep breath and tried to regulate her blood flow, slowing down her heartbeat to mimic a meditative state.

Even a swift bird would take about ten minutes to locate Shifu and deliver the message. It would also take time for their Shifu to arrive after receiving the message.
*一盏茶 10 minutes

So now, all she could do was wait, ensuring she didn’t bleed to death before Shifu arrived.

Unfortunately, fate seemed unwilling to give her even that little bit of time.

Just after Qiu Xier had finished tending to Ranran’s wound, Ranran’s ears twitched, and then she whispered, “More people are coming, meditate quickly!”

The disciples of XiShan were not particularly skilled, but their basic meditation skills were solid, and they quickly entered a meditative state!

This time, the newcomers were none other than the Elder of Crimson Gate, Tu Jiuyuan. She was uneasy and had brought two more disciples to investigate.

Their Excellency was currently recuperating and couldn’t use true qi, so such tasks of chasing down and eliminating people naturally fell to her, the capable right hand.

When they arrived here, Tu Jiuyuan didn’t notice anything at first. However, her red-eyed falcon suddenly moved its hooked beak and made a sharp cry. It then flapped its wings, attacking the hiding place of Ranran and the others like how it would attack a rabbit.

The Crimson Gate’s red-eyed falcons were raised on human flesh and blood from young, so they immediately sensed the smell of human blood and flew straight towards the injured Ranran.

Gao Cang and Qiu Xier quickly drew their weapons and, as the falcon swooped down, waved their swords to drive away the fierce bird’s sharp claws.

At this point, Tu Jiuyuan also saw the three people hiding in the mountain hollow. She couldn’t help but sneer, “How did Su Yishui train such a bunch of weaklings? Always hiding, not daring to fight back?”

Gao Cang, a hot-blooded youth willing to seek justice, couldn’t bear the mockery. He jumped up and drew his sword, ready to fight her.

But before he could even get close, Tu Jiuyuan caught him with her whip, and sent him flying straight into a nearby tree trunk.

Tu Jiuyuan’s wrist turned, and her whip now lashed towards the neck of the silly and dazed chubby girl.

She had already wasted too much time with these weaklings, Tu Jiuyuan was about to break her neck with one strike, then end the lives of the other two as well.

Qiu Xier was terrified, not knowing how to dodge at all. At this critical moment, she was suddenly pushed aside by Ranran.

Ranran had already broken off the long arrow on her arm. She picked up her mechanical staff again, entangling Tu Jiuyuan’s whip.

Unfortunately, this is now an old move, and Tu Jiuyuan was prepared. She swung her whip in time, pulling Ranran up and throwing her towards another sturdy tree trunk.

Well trained by Shifu’s stone-throwing practices, Ranran’s reflexes kicked in. As she was flung towards the tree, she grabbed a handful of leaves and threw them into the air. Then she let go of the whip with her staff, gliding lightly in the air, lightly touching the falling leaves with her toes, like she was a swan gracefully dancing in mid-air.

Tu Jiuyuan swung her whip several times, but couldn’t get close to the girl’s body. Feeling frustrated, she threw away her whip, drew out her twin daggers from her waist, ready to fight this slippery little girl hand-to-hand.

But as she thrust her daggers, she realized that the girl had turned her body, with legs split, hands poised, using Wei Jiu’s special technique Thunderous Sky Slash.

The disciples of the Crimson Gate all knew the power of this move; if struck, either death or serious injury awaited. Tu Jiuyuan, without time to think, instinctively dodged to the side.

Ranran seized this opportunity and shouted loudly, “Get into formation!”

This time, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier didn’t hesitate. They quickly took up their positions, forming a Demon-subduing formation.

Although their second senior brother was not there, the three of them could still form a *square formation. After silently reciting the mantra, they instantly became rooted in place.
*品 I guess this is close to a square lol

In fact, Ranran had improvised earlier, learning Wei Jiu’s moves from when he fought with Su Yishui in the Demon Vine Forest. It looked impressive but lacked any real power. However, she naturally had a good memory and managed to mimic it perfectly after just one look, enough to intimidate.

Tu Jiuyuan also realized this only after she dodged. Being tricked twice by this girl, she became enraged. As her whip struck out again, she was determined to kill this time.

Su Yishui’s self-arranged formation looked ordinary but was both offensive and defensive. These rookies, after experiencing trials in the Wangxiang River, had been focused on studying formations and had achieved some proficiency. Now, in actual combat, they were surprisingly adept at handling the situation.

Tu Jiuyuan swung her whip again, but even if the whip was as dense as raindrops, it couldn’t splash in.

But Ranran knew in her heart that her injured arm couldn’t hold up for too long. Once she fell, the formation would be broken, and none of them would survive, so… she absolutely couldn’t fall!

Tu Jiuyuan also noticed the gradually expanding bloodstain on her arm and knew she was the weakest link. So, she concentrated her attacks on Ranran, intending to crush this little girl.

Seeing how heavily injured her arm was and how young she was, logically this girl should be in a panic at this stage. However, while Tu Jiuyuan continued her relentless attacks, she noticed that the expression on this little girl’s face gradually became resolute, especially those eyes, which exuded an indescribable coldness…

Staring at her for a long time, it even stirred up memories that Tu Jiuyuan was reluctant to recall… It seemed like she had once fought fiercely with someone who had the same eyes before, and she had been defeated and begged for mercy back then…

Her frustrations building up to its peak, she was boiling with rage. Tu Jiuyuan suddenly bit her tongue and used a demonic technique that even a demonic cultivator wouldn’t easily use, sacrificing a portion of her own power to unleash all her potential, doubling her power in a short time, intending to end the battle quickly!

This time, the three *weaklings from Xishan couldn’t withstand the attacks anymore. Ranran was splashed with a mouthful of demon blood by Tu Jiuyuan and couldn’t open her eyes for a while, immediately being thrown by a whip.
*虾兵蟹将 literally shrimp soldiers and crab generals

Tu Jiuyuan burst into a maniacal laugh, thrusting her sword again towards the little girl’s heart…

But just as she was about to reach Ranran, a sudden powerful force attacked, propelling Tu Jiuyuan into the air, and she landed heavily on the ground, blood gushing from her mouth.

She looked closely and realized that Su Yishui had arrived with face full of fury, like a god descending from heaven. At this moment, Ranran couldn’t hold on anymore and fell from midair, landing squarely into Su Yishui’s arms.

Tu Jiuyuan didn’t even have time to react before Su Yishui struck her with his palm again. Having just depleted a portion of her power, she couldn’t even defend herself and was thrown back again. As blood gushed out of her mouth, Tu Jiuyuan knew that her mission to silence them had failed. She was severely injured and did not dare to linger in battle, quickly fleeing with her followers.

Qiu Xier looked closely and saw that it was Shifu carrying Little junior sister, his face ashen. She couldn’t help but say with tearful voice, “Shifu, you finally came!”

Su Yishui didn’t respond to her, but instead, he pressed a pressure point on Ranran to stop the bleeding.

Ranran was feeling weak from too much blood loss, and she struggled to open her eyes. She was gasping for breath as she told him, “Shifu… Second senior brother has been deceived by Crimson Gate with a sinister move. He’s in the second courtyard of Scholar Tree Lane in the town…”

Hearing Ranran speak with difficulty, Su Yishui’s tone was gruffly, “Be quiet, quickly adjust your breath to relieve pain!”

Ranran was very obedient and did become quiet. She didn’t even adjust her breathing because she had already passed out from the pain.

It was convenient that she had fainted because when she woke up again, she was lying in a warm bed in the hot spring Inn room. Her injured arm had also been bandaged properly. Although there was still a little bit of pain, it didn’t seem to be a big deal. At least she could still stretch her arm to touch the bag of dried sweet potatoes snack by her pillow.

She had brought these sweet potatoes from Cuiwei Mountain. They were gifts from Elder Jiu. Those sweet potatoes grown in climates adjusted by talismans were especially sweet, not only suitable for making wine and also perfect for drying into sweet potato slices. They were chewy and aromatic…

At that moment, Qiu Xier, who brought in some porridge, was pleasantly surprised to see her awake. She put down the porridge with a face full of joy and said, “Little Miss, you finally woke up. Do you know how long you’ve been sleeping?”

Ranran thought for a moment and said, “I must have slept for three or four days, right?”

Qiu Xier didn’t expect her to guess it correctly and admired her while saying, “Exactly three days. But how did you guess?”

Ranran pointed to the dried sweet potatoes in her mouth, “They’re not as moist as before. Estimating the time they turned hard, it’s probably three or four days… Pass me the porridge quickly; I’m really hungry!”

This ability to estimate time as a gourmand was really unparalleled.

Unfortunately, Qiu Xier was not in the mood to admire Ranran at all. She helped her up and fed her porridge while saying, “You’ve slept through *a whole day in the heavens. The human realm has changed drastically!”
*天上一日 is from the phrase 天上一日, 地上一年
Its kind of like Interstellar’s time dilation; means many things happened during this time

Ranran was really hungry, so she ate while urging her senior sister not to keep her in suspense and tell her quickly about what had happened.

Qiu Xier then recounted everything from the beginning. The first thing was that Shifu was absolutely terrifying that day, rushing as he carried her, like he was possessed by a god-slayer, killing anyone who blocked the way.

The Crimson Gate trackers who couldn’t find their targets had later turned back and ran straight into the mouth of the volcano.

Recalling the scene, it was extremely brutal. When Shifu went on a killing spree, Wei Jiu’s savagery of disembowelment would seem mild.

“Tearing live people apart with his hands! And they were burned to ashes before even hitting the ground! In the blink of an eye, more than a dozen Crimson Gate disciples were gone, nothing was left…”

Qiu Xier couldn’t help but shivered again, then she spoke of another matter, “Second senior brother has been in a water vat being punished all this time. Shifu said he would disperse his foundation and drive him out of the sect…”

Ranran looked up, slightly widening her eyes.

It turned out that after Ranran fainted, Su Yishui immediately took her back to Cha Ming Mountain. Second Uncle Master took Gao Cang and Qiu Xier to look for Bai Baishan.

Perhaps because they knew Bai Baishan was already a useless pawn, or they were afraid of being caught by Su Yishui, Tu Jiuyuan did not return to the courtyard to tell them to retreat.

So when Second Uncle Master kicked open the door, she saw second senior brother lying on the bed with a dark, burly man, looking completely mesmerized. His mouth was still nuzzling the bearded face…

In Qiu Xier’s words, seeing that scene made her wish she could gouge out her eyeballs, and immediately forget the horrible sight she saw.

When the burly man saw someone break in, he tried to get up but was quickly immobilized by Second Uncle Master’s swift hands.

Second senior brother was still defending the burly man, cradling him in his arms, loudly telling everyone not to scare his Rou’er.

Second Uncle Master snorted and forcefully stuffed a Calming pill into Bai Baishan’s mouth. When Bai Baishan came back to his senses and saw the facial hair on his “Ruo’er,” he screamed in terror and kicked “Ruo’er” to the ground with one foot.

Then, perhaps recalling the intimate moments he had with “her” over the past few days, Bai Baishan immediately felt nauseated and vomited profusely, according to Qiu Xier’s recollection, even vomiting up meals from the previous night.

Although Bai Baishan was rescued in time by Second Uncle Master, he was tied up as soon as he reached the mountain. He kept pleading his innocence, claiming that he fell victim to a trick by the demonic sect, leading him astray by lust momentarily.

According to him, he was at first just blinded by the wind on the street when someone wiped his eyes with a wet handkerchief. When he opened his eyes, he saw an extremely beautiful girl and was captivated. She then asked him for directions, and that was their first meeting.

Later, when he went down the mountain to help Second Uncle Master buy things, he encountered the girl again. Because she was so beautiful, he couldn’t help but be tempted. However, such secret rendezvous with a beauty would surely be condemned by Shifu, so he sneaked down the mountain to meet her.

However, meeting the girl was always quite exhausting for him, and he would often doze off, but he swore he never did anything to betray his master.

Bai Baishan spoke convincingly, insisting that when little junior sister woke up, he won’t be afraid if she questioned him directly and he could then prove his innocence!

Su Yishui didn’t bother to interrogate him and just ordered him to be tied up temporarily and thrown into the water vat, where he soaked for three days.

Meanwhile, Su Yishui personally brewed medicine every day for Ranran.

Now that Ranran was awake, she could confront second senior brother directly.

As he watched his junior sister approach, second senior brother, although tied up, couldn’t wait and stood up from the water vat, shouting, “Little junior sister, quickly tell Shifu that I didn’t betray him. It was the people from the demonic sect who tricked and took advantage of me. I’m the victim here!”

……

Ranran cautiously stepped back and said to Su Yishui, “Shifu, he should be poisoned by the horned demon. Please don’t let come into contact with him…”

Yu Tong coldly remarked by the side, “Master also noticed the poison in him, so these past days he was left soaking in a vat filled with cow bezoar and incense ash. The poison should be mostly cleared by now.”

Hearing Second Uncle Master say this, Bai Baishan suddenly realized that these past few days of soaking was not a punishment but detoxification.

Thinking about how he had cursing bitterly while in the vat, feeling wronged, Bai Baishan couldn’t help but feel ashamed and couldn’t lift his head.

But since Shifu was willing to take care of him, does this mean he wouldn’t be expelled from the sect?

Su Yishui said mildly, “You’ve soaked in the Water of the horned demon for many days, damaging your foundation. Even if the poison has been removed, it cannot be reversed. So, there’s no need for me to disperse your skills. Our master-disciple relationship has come to an end. You can leave the mountain to marry and have children.”

This horned demon poison was very insidious, capable of preventing the gathering of true qi. Ground into powder and used for bathing, its effects were even more potent. Fortunately, Su Yishui had a bit of cleanliness obsession and never went to soak in the hot springs; otherwise, he would have been affected already. It was clear that Wei Jiu wanted to control second senior brother, to poison Su Yishui, then take advantage of the situation to overwhelm the people from XiShan, reclaim his core, and get his revenge!

Bai Baishan had always harbored the ambition of dominating the three major sects and becoming a legendary figure. But now, hearing that he was on the verge of becoming useless, he sat back in the vat and burst into tears.

With flowing tears he said that he didn’t do it on purpose. He wouldn’t dare to betray his master if not for being compelled by evil spirits. His master had great divine powers and extraordinary medical skills; surely, he would find a way to cure the poison from the horned demon.

The once dignified young man cried like a three-year-old rolling on the ground. Even the eldest senior brother and third senior sister couldn’t help but plead for him.

Su Yishui seemed unmoved as he listened, only saying slowly later on “Your Bai family risked themselves to save a Xishan Elder, and was seriously injured as a result. I’ve always remembered this favor, which is why I accepted you as my disciple. The poison in your body is deep. Even if I kept you at West Mountain, you would be useless. Moreover, you were seduced by lust, which endangered your fellow disciples and caused them to be injured. Originally, you should have atoned for this with your life, but now I am only expelling you from the sect, which also fulfills our master-disciple relationship. Go on, collect some silver from Yu Tong before leaving. You can start a small business at home and live a comfortable life.”

After saying this, he couldn’t be bothered to talk further with Bai Baishan and left directly.

Bai Baishan finally managed to rein in his sorrow, he couldn’t help but try to gather his true qi, only to find that his dantian was really completely empty, with nothing left.

Out of the few disciples who entered the sect with him, he considered himself to have the highest talent. Who would have thought he would be ambushed and lose all his cultivation over the past year in one go.

He was familiar with the unwritten rules of cultivation. Once branded as a disowned disciple, bearing the reputation of betraying the master, it would be difficult to turn things around. Other reputable orthodox sects would not accept him either.

Even Su Yishui, who had put righteousness before family and betrayed Mu Qingge in the past, although praised verbally by the righteous path, was still secretly looked down upon by them for his actions.

But until the end, Su Yishui still refused to see him again. He was given some money before being told to leave Cha Ming Mountain.

Bai Baishan refused to leave and knelt at the foot of the mountain, even enduring heavy rain without getting up.

Su Yishui ignored the one who stubbornly refused to leave. After clarifying that it was Qiu Xier who had proposed to go down the mountain, she was also punished with a bamboo board beating along with Gao Cang, leaving them unable to move for a day, and could only sit on soft cushions.

Ranran felt that she had also made a major mistake this time. It was only because she had been unconscious and managed to escape, but she didn’t know how Shifu would punish her now.

Previous
Next

However, Shifu has not yet handed out her punishment. It would seem that the feeling of waiting, was even more uncomfortable than receiving the punishment itself.

In the evening, Rannran pleaded with Second Senior Uncle to send two flatbreads to second senior brother who was still kneeling below the mountain, so he wouldn’t faint from hunger. She also tried to stay inside the house and avoid running into Shifu.

But since she had already slept for three days already, it wasn’t appropriate to lounge in bed any longer. The next day, Ranran got dressed and went to the bamboo forest near the inn for a stroll. Coincidentally she saw Shifu returning from hunting on the mountain.

The little white tiger followed behind him, proudly carrying two rabbits in its mouth.

Su Yishui saw her and said, “It’s time to change your dressing.”

Ranran saw that her master’s expression had gone back to normal and not as angry as when he drove second senior brother away yesterday, so she obediently followed him back to the house.

After the little white tiger put down the rabbits, it sensibly brought Su Yishui’s medicine treatment box in its mouth. It then flopped down nearby to watch Su Yishui change Ranran’s dressing.

The bloody wound on her glistening white arm was very conspicuous. Normally, after a few days, the wound should have scabbed over. However, Ranran’s arm was still bleeding, barely stopped by the hemostatic powder applied to it.

Watching her master’s skilled movements, Ranran wondered if he had been personally bandaging her wound these past few days?

Ranran felt a bit embarrassed and said, “I have always had this kind of constitution since I was young. Once injured, I can never stop bleeding. My parents were very worried and consulted many doctors, but it didn’t help. So, they never let me leave the yard, afraid that I might fall and get hurt outside.”

Su Yishui remained silent and did not speak. He quickly applied the medicine powder to her wound and then wrapped it with clean cloth slowly. The techniques of a Divine healer were sublime, and Ranran was accidentally mesmerized watching Shifu’s side profile, and didn’t even feel any pain.

After dressing the wound, Su Yishui finally spoke: “Yesterday, I drove Bai Baishan away, only you did not intercede for him. Why is that?”

Ranran said in a small voice, “Would my plea have made a difference?”

Even Second Uncle Master couldn’t help but plead for him, but Shifu ignored it too, didn’t he?

Su Yishui listened to his disciple’s question with an expressionless face, and for a moment, his feelings were hard to discern.

This was not a time to be disingenuous, Ranran could only answer honestly, “You told us that copying the Calming Heart Mantra daily is to build the foundation of our cultivation, making one clear-minded and upright. Copying it everyday, besides dispelling evil energies, it also has the same effect in resisting enchantments and unorthodox practices. But second senior brother, apart from initially going through the motions, rarely did it consistently afterward. When we arrived at Cha Ming Mountain, he basically stopped altogether. If he had been diligent in his studies and not slacked off, even if he had been ambushed by Crimson Gate, he wouldn’t have been ensnared by their enchantments and made such a mistake. So, even though he didn’t intend to make a mistake, he already laid the groundwork for trouble. There must be a reason why Shifu didn’t want to teach him, so why should I make things difficult for you?”

After saying these words, she looked up at Su Yishui, but found him looking at her with mixed emotions in his eyes.

“I thought you had been fellow disciples with him for a year and would surely feel sorry for him… You used to be so soft-hearted…”

Although Ranran didn’t understand why Su Yishui would say something like “you used to be soft-hearted” but second senior brother’s mistake was indeed caused by himself: “Ignoring minor offenses leads to major ones. In the path of cultivation, one gains abilities beyond ordinary mortals, and if an evil person is nurtured, wouldn’t it be harmful for millennia? If second senior brother didn’t have a clear purpose for cultivation, it would be better for him to leave the sect. His desires were merely to stand at the pinnacle and be admired, if that was the case, he might as well study and take the imperial exam which is probably a faster way to achieve fame and success… However…”

She dragged the “however,” then spoke softly, “Second senior brother certainly has his faults, but Shifu, you also have your shortcomings…”

Su Yishui calmly asked, “What did I do wrong?”

“We disciples are youths with unstable mindsets… Good and evil are often just a thought away. Shifu, you knew that the Spirit Spring had harmful effects, yet you never supervised our studies. If you had been stricter, second senior brother wouldn’t have caused such trouble…”

Su Yishui listened expressionlessly. He suddenly said, “So it’s my fault as a master?”

Ranran regretted for saying too much and quickly said, “Your disciple dares not. Shifu has his reasons for everything he does.”

Su Yishui said expressionlessly, “I am also human, why wouldn’t I make mistakes? If one day you find that I’m an abominable person, what will you do?”

Ranran felt that her exam-loving master was suddenly testing her again, making her a bit flustered. This exam question was really tricky.

She clearly would not pass if she said she would take the side of an evil-doer, but if she said she would act righteously and kill her master to prove her path, she feared she would follow second senior brother’s footsteps and be driven out of the sect.

Using her toes to grip her only “To Pass Every Test” insole that was left, Ranran earnestly replied, “Shifu, with your lofty character, how could you possibly do evil? If such a day truly comes, there must be compelling reasons behind it. Your disciple is not talented, but I am willing to accompany you, endure condemnation by both heaven and earth, to stand through thick and thin with you!”

Perhaps her insole manifested its divine power, because after hearing this extremely brown-nosing answer, there was actually a hint of bitterness… and pain that flashed across Shifu’s normally indifferent face, as if her answer had stirred up unpleasant memories.

As Ranran waited nervously, her master said, “Remember, from now on, you are not to leave my side for even half a step!”

Ranran raised her eyes, feeling that this rule was rather odd. She tried to argue and said “……Shifu, your Sect rule seems to be a little imprecise. Even married couples don’t stick together all day. How do you quantify this half a step? There is no way to be together all the time, especially during sleep and bathing?”

Su Yishui looked at his little disciple’s mischievous expression, his eyes shone and he suddenly lowered his head and leaned down, “If you can’t do it, I will help you do it…”

Caught off guard by her master’s sudden closeness that enveloped her, Ranran could only stare blankly at Su Yishui’s eyes, their noses almost touching.

His eyes were deep and filled with meanings Ranran couldn’t understand.

Just then, Yutong happened to come in carrying a specially made arm cast. Since Ranran couldn’t move her arm freely due to the injury, Uncle Master Zeng made a lightweight support to stabilize her arm and prevent the wound from splitting open.

But she hadn’t expected such an ambiguous scene when she lifted the door curtain. Xue girl’s face, was about to touch the Master’s…

If she had entered a moment later… Yutong was startled and didn’t dare to think further.

Although, such scenes were quite common twenty years ago.

Mu Qingge, who often appeared carefree and idle, would corner the stoic Young Master at the corridor, forcing him to stand against the wall with her hand by his ear, teasing him with ambiguous words… completely like a flirtatious libertine gentleman teasing girls in the marketplace!

Every time she saw the Master’s tightly clenched fists by his side loosen and then clench again, she was filled with righteous indignation, and felt that Mu Qingge was too much of a bully!

But now, the situation has turned upside down…

Seeing Ranran nervously pinching her skirt with her fingers… Hmm, the Master is being too strict with his disciples! Even if he is disciplining them, there’s no need to get so close, look at how scared the poor girl is?

Adhering to the belief that everything the Master does is right, Yu Tong spontaneously resolved the meaning behind the scene before her and quickly smiled, saying, “Master, she already knows she was wrong. Now, Bai Baishan has been expelled from the sect, Gao Cang and Xi’er have also been punished. As for Ranran, she’s already injured, so naturally she knows she was wrong too. Isn’t that right, Ranran…”

Saying this, Yu Tong winked at Ranran, indicating that she should quickly admit her mistake to the Master.

Ranran nodded dully with a bit of self-reflection; she did indeed talk back to Shifu earlier.

Shaking her head to dispel the ambiguous scene just now, Ranran was even more worried about Wei Jiu using such underhanded tactics that was truly difficult to guard against. Besides, he was going to meet Mu Xianchang in Huayang Mountain in three days; who knows what tricks he would use against Elder Mu this time.

However, when Ranran mentioned this, Su Yishui didn’t seem to care and said, “Why should we outsiders worry about Elder Mu’s affairs? Oh right, you haven’t been punished for sneaking down the mountain without permission yet. Since you’re injured, you’re exempted from a beating. Go! Write the ‘Wind Riding Spell’ four hundred times!”

Ranran’s expression fell slightly. Why did the cursed Crimson Gate’s lackeys have to shoot her left arm? If it was her right arm, wouldn’t she have avoided being punished?

However, for unknown reasons, on the third day when Bai Bashan knelt shakily at the foot of the mountain, Su Yishui suddenly asked the Senior Uncle Master to bring him back.

Su Yishui told Bai Baishan that if he wanted to return to the sect, he could, but he had to stay with Uncle Master Zeng and learn to use his feet instead of his hands.

Enduring hardships was necessary to rethink the true meaning of being human.

If one day, Bai Baishan could assemble a self-ringing clock with his own feet, showing his strong determination, then Su Yishui would retract his previous words and accept him back under the XiShan Sect.

Bai Baishan was ecstatic upon hearing this and immediately expressed to the master that no matter how difficult the task was, he would do his best to complete it.

Ranran, however, had asked the master in a probing manner if her offensive words that day had caused him to change his mind.

But Su Yishui, while adjusting the strings of the zither, mildly replied, “Keeping rebellious disciple, in order to understand the hardships of being a Master. I wasn’t teaching you all seriously before, so I need to punish myself a bit and find some trouble for myself..”

Ranran was somewhat uncertain whether the “rebellious disciple” he mentioned referred to second senior brother or herself, who didn’t know her place. But since Shifu was willing to forgive second senior brother and gave him another chance, she was still happy.

Furthermore, Qiu Xier and Cao gang were also quite frightened after the fact. Second senior brother’s matter had served as a wake-up call for these lazy ones. Although Shifu seemed to be training them in a relaxed style, if they really did something wrong, the punishment would still be severe.

So, even though the scenery of Cha Ming Mountain was still beautiful, the hot springs were still comfortable to soak in, and the town at the foot of the mountain was also bustling, Gao Cang and Xi’er dared not be lazy anymore. They would get up early every day to meditate their cultivation foundation and memorize various spell techniques.

Although Ranran’s injury could have been a good excuse for slacking off, she did not dare to use it either. Apart from copying the spell mantras as punishment, she earnestly studied the books brought by Master Uncle.

As for second senior brother, he diligently trimmed his toenails and soaked his feet in white vinegar, and began practicing using his feet instead of hands with Master Uncle Zeng. Even during meals, he used his feet to hold the spoon.

However, he could not meditate and cultivate with everyone else for now; he moved to the hot spring’s workers’ quarters to live.

During the day, he also had to do some manual labor at the hot spring to offset the cost of meals.

The arm cast made by Master Uncle Zeng was very useful to Ranran. When she had free time from studying, she would go to the garden to pick flowers and place them in a bottle on Master Uncle Zeng’s workshop table.

On this day, she came to the garden again for a walk and saw a large bunch of gardenias blooming by the pond. She decided to do today’s meditation exercises here.

So she found a mat, sat by the pond watching the fish, and slowly entered a state of meditation.

This pond was close to Master Uncle Zeng’s workshop, and she could hear him grinding parts with a small file once she entered meditation.

Yesterday, Master Uncle Zeng had mentioned that he wanted to make her a lightweight soft silver armor—a type that was impervious to knives and spears. This armor was said to be made by winding a strong vine from the south around soft silver thread and interwoven into a latticework , a very laborious process.

At that time, Ranran had watched for a while and told Master Uncle Zeng that it wasn’t necessary since she would be by Shifu’s side in the future, wouldn’t dare to casually leave the mountain again, and so she wouldn’t encounter any more dangers.

But Master Uncle Zeng insisted on making it.

Just then, she heard familiar footsteps, it should be Shifu Su Yishui.

Master Uncle Zeng spoke, “Have you considered what I mentioned to you before? Keeping her here with me, is the best choice. If she follows you, sooner or later, the same disaster may happen again…”

Before he could finish, Su Yishui coldly interrupted, “No need, she must stay with me.”

Then came a long sigh from Master Uncle Zeng, “For her, its just matters from a past life; she has let go of everything. Why can’t you let go? Since you promised her an ordinary life, why not persist until the end, and also give her a tranquil and comfortable life?”

After hearing this, there was a very long silence. After quite a while, a low and deep voice murmured, “I have never taken it up, so how can I let it go?”

After saying this sentence, Shifu walked away with large strides.

This conversation had no context and Ranran could not make head or tail of it. But she also didn’t mean to eavesdrop intentionally; it’s just that her ears were too sharp when she was meditating, always catching snippets of others’ private matters.

This time, Ranran didn’t rush to get up. She waited until Shifu had walked far away before standing up from the flowerbed. Returning to the house, her mind was still pondering over who they were talking about.

But perhaps it was an old acquaintance of Shifu and Master Uncle Zeng; it was normal if she didn’t know who it was. But who was Shifu unable to take up, and unable to let go? Was it a man or a woman?

But Shifu was determined in wanting to keep her by his side…

Supporting her chin, Ranran pondered for a while but couldn’t figure anything out.

It seemed like she would have to ask Second Uncle Master when she had the chance. After all, Shifu had been cultivating for so long; did he ever think about finding an immortal companion?

Suddenly, she had a flash of insight. Could they be talking about… Second Uncle Master, Yu Tong?

A woman who had been with Shifu for a long time, wasn’t that only Yutong? She had grown up with Shifu since childhood, that’s almost like childhood sweethearts, right?

Ranran suddenly realized, thinking how Shifu didn’t seem to speak to Yutong much on most days, he was indeed very subtle in hiding his affection for her!

It seemed that she should remind third senior sister to be careful in front of Second Uncle Master because she might become their Master’s wife in future!

But if that were the case, wouldn’t Elder Mu be lovesick for two lifetimes in vain, unable to be together with the one she loved?

After a period of recuperation in Cha Ming Mountain, those few with frostbite were recovering well, and it was time to return to the Western Mountains.

After Wei Jiu’s losses and recent setbacks, he seems to have quieted down for a while, and he did not come looking to confront Su Yishui.

But recently, there were strange changes in the sky, frequent thunderstorms occurring, mostly concentrated around the famous mountains where cultivators gathered.

It seemed that many powerful beings were about to ascend, and such violations of the natural order naturally attracted heavenly anomalies.

At this time, the ginseng fruit on the Rebirth Tree would be very useful. Unfortunately, Mu Qingge had already thought of a countermeasure.

After leaving Wangxiang Pass, she hid in the Great Qi Imperial Palace under the pretext of refining pills for the Emperor.

The Founding Emperor of Great Qi was once a powerful cultivator who gave up halfway, unable to cultivate immortality but continued on a high note to become emperor. When the palace was built, they sought guidance from a highly skilled master and arranged it according to the Fuxi Eight Trigrams Formation, laying countless Spirit Absorption Stones in the palace’s foundation.

So, anyone with extraordinary abilities who entered this Palace would be disturbed in their spiritual power and would not pose a threat to the imperial heirs of Great Qi.

This was why Mu Qingge has chosen to hide here. Even though she couldn’t use her cultivation spiritual powers, there was also no fear of being caught.

Regardless of lightning and thunder on those various mountain peaks, she just had to hide safely and enjoy the Emperor’s hospitality in the palace.

And even though she now had a new furnace, she claimed that she was injured by Wei Jiu’s Grudge water and her spiritual power was damaged, so she couldn’t use the furnace. This excuse allowed her to smoothly avoid showing any weakness.

Su Yu really pampered Mu Qingge. For her living convenience, Su Yu allocated an entire corner of the West Palace to her, with a special Palace gate for her to facilitate entry and exit. Not only did he assign servants to attend to her, he also provided her with luxurious clothing, food, and various treasures. Even the most favored concubines in the palace were not as privileged as Mu Qingge.

Such treatment, comparable to that of an Imperial Tutor, was truly the envy of others.

One day, a Visiting Notice came from outside the palace, saying that Wen Hongshan from the KongShan Sect wanted to visit the War Goddess.

Upon hearing that Wen Hongshan wanted to see her, Mu Qingge raised her eyebrows disapprovingly. Perhaps this Wen Immortal lady wanted to talk to her about making amends, asking her to contribute her cultivation to aid their sect’s Abbess Wen in facing her lightning trials, or something along those lines.

Originally, she didn’t want to see her, but thinking that she could learn about the current situation of the KongShan Sect from her, Mu Qingge ordered someone to bring Wen Hongshan in.

Once a beautiful woman of the KongShan Sect, how splendid she was back then!

She had once become the savior of Su Yishui’s mother by seeking spiritual medicine for her. Under Su Yishui’s mother’s wishes, the two almost got married as Cultivation companions while Su Yishui was still in the Jiuhua Sect.

However, Mu Qingge tricked Su Yishui into swearing a Soul oath, and after losing a bet to her, he left the Jiuhua Sect and was forced to join the XiShan Sect, which put an end to their marriage plans.

And later on, when Mu Qingge got jealous and slashed Wen Hongshan’s face, Wen Hongshan went to Su Yishui, crying about her grievances. Su Yishui was furious, accusing Mu Qingge of being unreasonable and cruel. The two even came to blows, and Su Yishui eventually left the XiShan Sect.

What a pity, the once enchanting Miss Wen who captivated Su Yishui, now had scars on her face, and her once youthful face is now weary from the passage of time. Mu Qingge was very willing to see up close, the pitiful state of the present Wen Hongshan.
