When Mu Qingge, dressed in golden silk robes, appeared before Wen Hongshan, the latter’s state of decline was indeed highlighted to the fullest extent.

Mu Qingge was very satisfied with this feeling of looking down at her. She smiled and asked, “I wonder, what brings Miss Wen here?”

Wen Hongshan said coldly, “I have some private matters to discuss with you. Please dismiss the attendants so that our conversation won’t be overheard.”

Mu Qingge felt that Wen Hongshan was playing tricks, so she smiled faintly and stood up, ready to leave.

She just wanted to see the current sorry state of the woman whom Su Yishui had once been obsessed with; she wasn’t interested in what she had to say.

But just as she was about to leave, Wen Hongshan asked in a low voice, “Who… are you!”

This question made Mu Qingge pause, and her pupils slightly dilated.

However, she calmly waved away the attendants and waited until only the two of them were left before smiling and asking, “Miss Wen, your question is quite strange. What do you mean by ‘who am I’? Of course, I am Mu Qingge.”

Wen Hongshan stared straight into her eyes, sneering, “When you were on Jue mountain, you apologized to me, saying you were sorry for injuring my face when you were possessed.”

Mu Qingge smiled at her, asking in a probing manner, “Are you unwilling to forgive me and have come to settle scores with me?”

Wen Hongshan suddenly burst into laughter, her scars looking more grotesque due to her hearty laughter. She managed to stop laughing and then said coldly, “Everyone thinks that the scars on my face were caused by Mu Qingge, but only she and I know it’s not true. Back then, I devised a plan to let Su Yishui misunderstand her, so I deliberately put my face near her and got scratched by her sword. However, I didn’t know that Mu Qingge’s sword had just killed a poisonous snake, and the venom had not yet cleared, so the small wound festered badly, leaving behind this scar. Because I had set her up, Mu Qingge did not deign to look at me ever again. But you actually apologized to me because of my face?”

Wen Hongshan’s words made Mu Qingge’s expression stiffen slightly. She forced a smile, saying, “I don’t know what you’re talking about?”

Wen Hongshan looked at her with disdain in her eyes, “You think you’re Mu Qingge just because you have this face? Little do you know, anyone who knows her can tell at a glance that you are just a fake!”

Mu Qingge’s face tightened at these words, and she suddenly made a move, attacking Wen Hongshan.

Wen Hongshan’s visit was actually just a probe, but she didn’t expect to expose the fake so quickly with just one test.

As the adopted daughter of the KongShan Sect’s Abbess Wen, she naturally had excellent fighting skills. Although Mu Qingge’s attack was fierce, she dealt with it calmly and with ease, still smiling as she said, “I heard from the people of Crimson Gate that there were two fruits on that tree. I was doubtful at first, but unexpectedly, it seems to be true…”

Upon hearing this, Mu Qingge’s heart tightened, and she quickly stopped her attack, asking urgently, “What are you saying? You know that there were two fruits on that tree? Where is the other spiritual fruit?”

Wen Hongshan dodged to the side, observing the reaction of this fake, and couldn’t help but be amused, “You actually don’t know the whereabouts of the other spiritual fruit?”

She originally thought this was another cunning scheme of Mu Qingge’s, using a fake to divert attention while she enjoyed her freedom in hiding. She didn’t expect this fake to be unaware of the other spiritual fruit, which was quite entertaining.

Previous
Next

When Wen Hongshan saw Mu Qingge, who emerged from the spiritual fruit and proceeded to apologize to her, she became suspicious.

As for the matter of the two spiritual fruits, that intel was obtained by interrogating a member of the Crimson Gate sect captured by their sect that day.

Because Wei Jiu had previously searched the villages below the mountain, looking for a girl born in the Qinggeng year, Wen Hongshan, after inquiring around, deduced the truth behind the matter.

Her visit this time was to probe the fake, and to see if she could uncover the whereabouts of the real Mu Qingge. Unexpectedly, this fake also seemed unaware, which was quite intriguing.

Mu Qingge, did not need a Grudge water attack at this moment to feel her blood run cold all over — what she feared most still happened, someone had discovered that two fruits had formed on the Rebirth tree.

In other words, the fruit that should have perished long ago might still be alive?

Mu Qingge’s hands trembled, her mind in chaos.

When she had thought “she” was gone, she had felt a moment of sadness. She then thought that she would live out her life well for “her” too, this way, she could feel much more at ease.

But now, hearing the shocking news that “she” might still be alive, her heart was more fearful than joyful right now.

Su Yishui had been abnormally cold to her… Could it be that he also knew the secret of the Rebirth tree bearing two fruits?

Thinking about how he actually knew but coldly watched her put on an act, a sense of humiliation surged through her.

Mu Qingge took a deep breath and regained her composure, saying, “Did you come here just to say these incomprehensible words to me? You mentioned another fruit on the Rebirth tree, where is it now?”

Wen Hongshan, seeing that the imposter was still putting up a front, didn’t get angry but chuckled twice before saying, “Let me guess, who you are? Mu Qingge fell into the ambush set up by the three major sects because she was anxious to rescue her sister Mu Ranwu, who had fallen into a ‘difficult situation’. Little did she know, this was a death trap set up by her own sister with outsiders. Tut tut, Mu Ranwu, though she’s Mu Qingge’s sister, her aptitude is mediocre, with no accomplishments in cultivation, easily forgottable, leaving no impression. But this harmless-looking existence has a cunning and insidious mind, ready to harm her own sister without hesitation.”

“Shut up! If you dare to speak nonsense again, you won’t walk out of this palace in Great Qi!” Bloodshot veins appeared in Mu Qingge’s eyes, her voice suddenly hoarse, clearly using real qi and no longer able to maintain her calm facade.

Hearing her threat, Wen Hongshan coldly laughed again, “It seems you really are Mu Ranwu… You are quite something. Who would have thought that such an inconspicuous girl would have such extraordinary abilities. If that is how things are, we can cooperate.”

Mu Qingge, or rather Mu Ranwu, narrowed her eyes, “What do you mean by cooperation?”

Wen Hongshan said coldly, “Mu Qingge and our three major sects are sworn enemies. We must not let her escape and become stronger!”

Mu Ranwu also looked back at her coldly, after thinking for a moment, finally smiled slowly, “How do you want to cooperate with me, let’s hear it.”

Wen Hongshan clenched her fist and said word by word, “Of course, we must locate her first!”

Mu Ranwu smiled, her mind quickly thinking, and finally said, “Okay, I hope we can cooperate happily this time. But before that, I’ll have to trouble Miss Wen to help me with something.”

After speaking, she whispered softly in Wen Hongshan’s ear. Wen Hongshan’s eyes widened as she listened, “How dare you…”

Mu Ranwu lightly placed a finger on her lips and made a gesture, “Miss Wen, to achieve great things, you must dare to take risks no one else dares to take, don’t you think it’s time to change the leader of Kongshan Sect?”

……

Away from the chaos in the palace, let’s talk about Xue Ranran who followed her master to travel around. After returning to Western Mountain, the first thing she did was to take the gifts she bought for her parents and prepare to go down the mountain to see them.

However, the new sect rule stated: “Not allowed to leave Shifu’s side for even half a step.” If she wanted to go down the mountain, she naturally had to consult her master to see if he could make an exception for her to visit her family.

Although cultivators were supposed to cut off ties with the mortal world, Su Yishui was very understanding of his half-hearted disciple. After listening to her, he nodded and said, “I’ll accompany you.”

Xue Ranran was also very happy to hear this, “My mother makes delicious beancurd, and it’s even better with deep-fried red bean cakes! I’ll have my mother make it for you Shifu!”

But when she was going down the mountain, she had big and small bags, a lot of things to carry. As Senior brother Gao cang had been punished by their master last time for helping her carry things up the mountain, he didn’t dare to be overly attentive this time.

So Ranran had to carry her belongings along the rugged mountain road by herself.

But after a few steps, Su Yishui reached out and took the things she was carrying, saying, “Your arm injury has not fully healed yet, you need to rest it.”

After saying that, he walked on ahead with long strides.

Men who look like immortals could hold whisks or long swords, they can hold flutes or xiao, but carrying bags of local specialties and colorful fabrics did not seem quite harmonized.

This demeanor of accompanying the newlywed wife to visit her family … it really compromises the graceful and ethereal aura of her Shifu!

Ranran, walking behind, felt both touched and sorry.

Shifu! Your affection for your disciple, the only way to repay it is by *serving you, sir, diligently and loyally…

* from 中国二十四孝故事 the 24 tales of filial piety:
扇枕温衾 Using a fan to keep the parent cool in summer, using body to warm parent in winter
卧冰求鲤 Someone who removed their robe, used their body to melt the frozen ice to capture two carps to feed his ill parents, who actually did not love him

So Ranran clenched her fists, made a silent vow, and quickly followed behind her master, walking briskly and humming a tune along the way.

Although Su Yishui had long legs, he didn’t walk fast. He gradually fell behind Ranran and watched as the morning dew sprinkled among the trees, casting an exceptionally vibrant and dazzling light on the girl ahead of him…

Suddenly she turned around, revealing a set of pearly white teeth, and shouted with a smile, “Shifu, hurry up! Look, there are squirrels fighting up ahead!”

Unconsciously, his accustomed icy expression seemed to melt a little under the warm and sunny smile of the girl…

Meanwhile, in the town below the mountain, smoke was rising, and the villagers were starting to move around.

The Xue couple ran a breakfast stall and woke up very early. When Xue Ranran brought her master to the breakfast stall in town, the three small tables smeared with oil stains were already seated full of people.

Business was good, but Qiaolian’s face had no smiles, as if there were worries between her brows. It wasn’t until she looked up to collect money and saw her daughter hopping to her that she greeted her with a surprised and joyous expression.

“Good girl, when did you come back? Mother didn’t know! Oh, Elder Su, why are you here too? Come, come inside and sit down!”

The arrival of this master and disciple pair stunned the people eating at the stall.

My, where did this handsome couple come from? They made people’s eyes wander back and forth, not knowing who to stare at.

Qiaolian greeted her daughter and Elder Su, but her eyes were fixed on her daughter: this was her daughter… but how did she look so beautiful after just over a month? Although her features were still vaguely the same as the little girl she raised, Qiaolian felt that her daughter’s temperament and grace had become… indescribably beautiful.

For a mother, seeing her daughter *blossom into a woman, was a pride that overflowed from within, so after a slight surprise, she was filled with satisfaction and pride.
*女大十八变 literally a woman changes drastically at 18

Qiaolian smiled and accepted the compliments from the neighbors, then respectfully invited Elder Su to the house behind the stall, took a cloth and wiped the small wooden tables in the courtyard repeatedly, then had her daughter bring the prepared beancurd for Elder Su to try.

The toppings for Qiaolian’s beancurd were Ranran’s recipe, with sweet and savory options. After confirming that Shifu preferred the sweet flavor, Ranran prepared a bowl of beancurd with peanut and red bean for him.

After Qiaolian was finished the front, she hurried back to attend to Elder Su. As she looked at her daughter who asked if she liked the fabrics she bought, Qiaolian smiled and stroked her daughter’s face, saying, “Everything my little girl buys is the best.”

In the past few times, they had met hastily at the pavilion below the mountain. But this time, they saw Elder Su, she naturally asked when her daughter would be able to graduate from the Sect.

When she heard that her daughter might have to practice cultivation on the Western Mountain for a long time, Qiaolian looked hesitant, “Then… won’t she… be unable to marry and have children?”

Xue Liangui was afraid that his wife’s question would displease the immortal and endanger their daughter’s life. He quickly interrupted Qiaolian’s words and gave her a wink.

“Is it so important whether she marries or not? We are commoners, if Ranran marries now, she won’t find a good match anyway. Wouldn’t it be a lifetime of regrets?”

Qiaolian, after hearing Xue Liangui’s words, unexpectedly turned her back and covered her mouth, unable to hold back her tears.

Ranran was startled and quickly went over to ask her mother what was wrong.

But Qiaolian looked at Su Yishui and hesitated to speak.

Su Yishui put down the beancurd and said to Ranran, “I’ll go take a walk around the street, don’t wander around, I’ll come back to pick you up later.”

After saying that, Su Yishui stood up and went out, giving the Xue family of three some time alone.

Su Yishui was tall, had a cold demeanor, and wasn’t very approachable. When he sat in the courtyard, the Xue couple felt somewhat uncomfortable.

Now that Elder Su had left, the couple breathed a sigh of relief. Ranran was observant and had noticed her mother’s agitation. She didn’t know which of her father’s words had triggered her mother to cry.

So she asked her mother what had happened at home.

Qiaolian had been restless these past few days, unable to eat or sleep. Now that she saw Ranran, she knew she couldn’t hide it any longer, so she finally made up her mind to tell her daughter the truth about her parentage.

“Ranran, actually… you’re not our biological child…” After saying this, Qiaolian held her breath, waiting for her daughter’s reaction.

But Ranran only blinked and breathed a sigh of relief, “Is this what’s been bothering Mother? I’ve known for a long time, Mother found me on Jue Mountain.”

This time, it was the carpenter and Qiaolian who looked at each other in shock.

“You… knew for a long time? How is that possible? Who told you?”

Ranran smiled, “Mother, when I was six, you were talking to Grandma, and I was lying down resting. But I was actually awake, so I heard everything you two said.”

At that time, she was sick very often, and their family spent too much money on her treatment. The grandmother who knew about Ranran’s background couldn’t bear to see her daughter and son-in-law living in hardship, so she suggested they sell Ranran.

It wasn’t uncommon for poor families to sell their children, especially an adopted child like Ranran who was picked up.

But Qiaolian refused outright. She went back into the house, wrapped Ranran in a blanket and hurried back home that night.

Qiulian was stunned after listening to her daughter’s soft-spoken narration. She vaguely remembered this incident her daughter mentioned; at that time, Ranran was only six years old then. She actually knew everything in her heart!

Thinking back to Ranran’s behavior afterward, she did seem to lose some of her playful nature. Although her health was poor, she always tried her best to help with laundry, fetching water, and cooking… Also, whenever she went to seek medical advice, Ranran would always cry and refuse to take medicine as she did not like it, and forbade her to spend money on medicines. At that time, Qiaolian thought the child disliked the bitterness of medicine… Who would have thought it was for this reason…

Qiaolian’s heart felt a pang, and she started crying again.

Was this child so sensible because she was afraid her parents wouldn’t want her anymore? She was so young at that time, hearing such words must have caused her a lot of confusion and fear!

Seeing her mother crying again, Ranran quickly wiped her tears and said, “I was small at that time and didn’t dare to tell Mother that I knew, but later I felt there was no need to say it. After all, I was too weak, even Grandmother Huang next door said that girls like me wouldn’t fetch much money, and would not improve our family’s situation.”

At that time, Ranran actually even had the idea of selling herself to help the family’s finances. She even specifically asked Grandmother Huang next door, who had relatives in the county town who were brokers and knew the slave market well.

But Grandmother Huang, seeing how frail-looking Ranran was, told her that someone like her would end up costing more in medical and funeral expenses and probably nobody would buy her.

That’s when Ranran gave up on the idea and started helping her mother with household chores in earnest.

However, neither of them mentioned Ranran’s parentage again; why did Qiaolian bring it up again now?

In fact, Qiaolian didn’t want to either. But just half a month ago, her family suddenly came looking for her, saying that officials were asking about the person who helped Ranran get registered.

Furthermore, her family said there were wealthy people looking for their lost child. If they found the adoptive family, they would be rewarded with a hundred gold pieces.

Such compensation could buy the whole village! Who wouldn’t be tempted by that? They even wished their own flesh and blood was adopted.

Qiaolian’s family members were excited by the news and went to the government office, claiming that their daughter had adopted a child back then. So the officials went to Juefeng Village. Fortunately, Qiaolian had left in a hurry and hadn’t had time to inform her family, so they hadn’t tracked her down to this place yet.

But Xue Liangui, when he went to the county to take on carpentry work a few days ago, accidentally met some old acquaintances who told him about these matters. He was so fearful and told them not to mention encountering them here. He then returned and told Qiaolian.

But it turns out that person couldn’t keep a secret, and Qiaolian’s family came looking for her first.

The people who came to find the child this time were officials, different from the intimidating ones in black robes before; this indicated that Ranran might really be from a wealthy family.

Now that they were willing to offer a hundred gold pieces to acknowledge her, if they still didn’t come forward to let her get acknowledged, wouldn’t it mean that Ranran would continue to stay in their poor family for the rest of her days?

As Xue Liangui had said, even if Ranran became a successful cultivator in the future, when she came down from the mountain, she might only be able to marry a craftsman or farmer.

Qiaolian thought long and hard about it and even though she didn’t want to, she felt that now that the child was grown, she should inform Ranran about this matter and let her decide whether to acknowledge her birth parents.

After listening quietly to her parents’ story, Ranran shook her head without any hesitation. “Mother, I only have you and Dad as parents. No matter who comes, I won’t acknowledge them.”

After hearing her daughter’s words, Qiaolian felt that her years of love had not been in vain. She hugged her daughter, and mother and daughter both burst into tears again, causing Carpenter Xue’s eyes to redden as well.

When Ranran walked out of the courtyard, she raised her head and saw her master standing not far away under the lush tree at the street corner.

It was already Spring, and the tree was full of intoxicating pear blossoms. The snow-white flowers complemented the tall man under the tree, to exude an exceptional otherworldly aura.

The gentle breeze stirred his robes, and causes one’s gaze to also linger on him, reluctant to look away…

Su Yishui was feeding a cat sitting on the wall with a biscuit he brought from the Xue family. When he saw Ranran coming, he stood up and walked towards her.

He noticed Ranran’s slightly reddened eyes as if she had just cried, but he did not ask about it. Instead, after walking for a while, he spoke, “Tomorrow, I will arrange for Yu Chen to escort your parents out of town. Your fourteenth Uncle Master has properties elsewhere, and they will be well taken care of there.”

Ranran did not expect Shifu to want to send her parents away. She couldn’t help but ask in a surprised tone, “Why?”

Su Yishui turned to look at her and said mildly, “The people who came looking for you are definitely not your parents; they likely have ulterior motives. You need to hurry and send your parents away before they find their way here, or it could become unpredictably dangerous. You’ll end up crying again.”

Ranran wasn’t surprised that her master overheard her conversation with her parents. The walls, for someone with true cultivation, were not a barrier.

But why was Shifu so sure that the people offering the reward of a hundred gold pieces wasn’t her parents?

When she tried to ask Su Yishui again, he quickened his pace and didn’t seem eager to answer, which made Ranran feel frustrated. Her master was deliberately keeping her in suspense… how annoying!

Suddenly, a thought flashed through Ranran’s mind. She looked at Su Yishui strangely, then asked hesitatingly, “Shifu, Second Uncle Master said that in order to let Elder Mu be reborn, you had gone to Jue Mountain several times. And Jue Mountain is inaccessible to ordinary people, yet I was coincidentally found on Jue Mountain by my mother… You’re so handsome and outstanding, you must have many female admirers. Did you perhaps have a… relationship with a female cultivator back then and… had a child…?”

What Ranran really wanted to ask was, “Am I… your daughter?”

Inspired by Third senior sister’s fictional stories about the relationships and grudges among cultivator families, Ranran couldn’t help but think, maybe her master was so certain about her parentage because he knew early on that she had been abandoned there?

Thinking back on her master’s usual tough love for her, wasn’t that the very manner of a father? Did he secretly fall in love with a female cultivator back then, gave birth to her, but sadly couldn’t publicly acknowledge it, so he left her on Jue Mountain until her parents brought her back home?

Su Yishui seemed completely unprepared for a question like this. The expression on Shifu’s face, usually of a kindly father, turned less kindly.

He stared at her coldly for a moment, unable to speak for a long while, before finally squeezing out from between his teeth, “Listen carefully, I’m not your father!”

Ranran, seeing Su Yishui’s manner, felt that he was not lying, and she couldn’t help but exhale slowly. Although it would have been nice if Su Yishui were her biological father, somehow that would have felt quite odd.

Without the bonds of familial ties, the master and disciple can get along as usual.

However, it was clear that her master knew something about her parentage. He never once said anything pointless to trouble others. Although Ranran had told the Xue couple she wouldn’t acknowledge her real family, knowing the truth would help her handle the situation better.

Su Yishui, after being bombarded by her many indirect questions for a good while, unhurriedly stated that since he was certain that the people looking for the abandoned infant had malicious intentions, they needed to make arrangements as soon as possible.

The way to get the Xue couple to leave was quite simple. Ranran would just tell them that her Uncle Master had a well-paying job taking care of a place, earning fifty taels of silver annually. They would oversee things there, just supervising some workers, not as demanding compared to running a breakfast stall.

The Xue couple naturally liked such a monthly income. Ranran also tactfully reminded her parents not to contact their maternal grandmother for the time being.

The gold reward offered was too substantial. If one of the uncles on the maternal side accidentally said too much, it could lead to trouble. A family capable of offering a hundred taels of gold wouldn’t have had to abandon a newborn on a mountain.

There had to be more to this than meets the eye. There were plenty of stories in plays about treacherous officials hunting down orphaned heirs. If someone wanted to harm her, wouldn’t it endanger the whole family.

Before Ranran mentioned it, Qiaolian hadn’t thought about this possibility. Her daughter’s analysis made her break out in a cold sweat.

After carefully instructing her daughter to take care of herself on the mountain, the Xue couple quickly packed their things in the night and left with Yu Chen for Zeng Yi’s Linyang property.

However, they didn’t cancel the lease on the rented courtyard. Su Yishui said they needed it to draw out the enemy and see who was looking for Ranran.

So Yuchen and Yutong applied yellowish ointment to their faces, added some wrinkles, wore fake beards and wigs with streaks of white. They disguised themselves as the Xue couple and temporarily stayed in the courtyard.

However, Su Yishui seemed to have been upset by Ranran’s impulsive acknowledgment of kinship. After returning to Xishan, he didn’t speak to her for an entire day.

Later, it was only after Ranran specially made his favorite dish, Longjing Sweet Shrimp, did Su Yishui finally ease that icy expression on his face.

Ranran felt that, it was a misconception on her part, to misunderstand that her master could have had a child before.

If they set aside Shifu’s extraordinary abilities and otherworldly appearance, his volatile temperament would not have been attractive to girls.

After spending a long time with Su Yishui, Ranran slowly understood the true essence behind Elder Mu’s compilation of the chapter on Fierce Beasts – sometimes Shifu got angry for inexplicable reasons, making it difficult to figure out his likes and dislikes.

When he talked to her, he also would not reveal everything at once, like a beef tendon that one just can’t chew on…

YuChen and Yutong couldn’t handle the breakfast business like the Xue couple did, so they simply hung a notice in front of the stall, claiming they were unwell and would be closed for a few days.

The siblings spent their time in the courtyard, eating and drinking, waiting patiently for someone to knock on their door.

It didn’t take long before someone actually showed up. After two days, some people claiming to be officials from the state office, with stern faces accusing the Xue couple of kidnapping a child and demanding that they hand over their daughter.

Sharp-eyed Yutong, immediately noticed that the people with the officials were cultivators. After exchanging a few pleasantries, Su Yishui suddenly appeared, striking acupoints on these people and casting a Truth-telling spell. He quickly found out that they were sent by the War Goddess from the palace to search for someone.

扇枕温衾 Using a fan to keep the parent cool in summer, using body like a blanket to warm parent in winter
Out of the 24 stories, Ranran had to choose those two lol

When Su Yishui learned that Mu Qingge was the one who had sent them, he didn’t make things difficult for these people and simply had Yutong release them.

If it were someone else inquiring about the whereabouts of the spirit fruit, he might have to spend some effort.

But if it was this imposter, she would probably be even more meticulous than he was, fearful that someone might leak the traces of the real one and expose her true colors.

So, for that month, the pills that were supposed to be delivered on time to the palace to suppress the grudge water poison were “accidentally forgotten” by Immortal Su.

In the Western Palace, Mu Ranwu who was unable to suppress the grudge water inside her, screamed such painful cries that scared the palace maids and eunuchs away.

It wasn’t until she received a wooden box sent by Wen Hongshan that she finally breathed a sigh of relief. She wrote a letter, and sent them along to Su Yishui, acknowledged her mistake and stated that she had already found out about the two Spirit fruits. The one that fell to the ground first must be her younger sister. Worried about her younger sister, so she sent people to search for her.

And inside that wooden box was the key to the Netherworld Realm that Wen Hongshan had obtained from Wei Jiu.

Wen Hongshan still followed her plan in the end. She went to persuade Wei Jiu, negotiated terms with him, and exchanged them for the key to the Netherworld Realm.

Su Yishui picked up the piece of Ebony wooden key from the wooden box, turned it over, and looked at it against the sunlight. Although the square key was intricately carved with patterns, when aligned correctly, a faint and unclear inscription could be seen on the side – “Shui’er.”

It seemed that this key was indeed the one he had given to Wei Jiu. Otherwise, it would have been difficult for anyone to discover this inscription for replication.

Only one person called him that way in the entire world. Every time she called him, it seemed like there was a bubble of water in her mouth, rippling on her tongue… The look in those eyes was like a smile yet not quite…

“Shui’er…”

He put down the wooden plaque, plucked at the strings of the ancient zither on the side, lost in thought. Again, he heard the soft, sweet, and bright voice. He looked up abruptly at the young girl teasing him.

Ranran was wearing a plain white robe, her hair tied up in two buns, frowning as she held a small purple clay teapot in her hand, pouting and saying, “*This water has been mixed too sweet. I clearly told senior brother not to put too much melon juice. Looks like next time, I’ll have to do it myself…”
*its common for people to add 儿 to subject matter, in this case, Ranran put 儿 behind ‘water’, which became similar to how her Shifu had been called by Mu Qingge

Ranran had meditation exercises today, so Qiu Xier and Second Uncle Master went shopping. Therefore, lunch preparation was left to Senior brother. Since it was hot, a cup of sweet drink was refreshing, so after meditating for a while, she secretly drank a sip from the pot of sweet drink that senior brother had brought.

But the melon tea in this pot is really too overly sweet.

Just as she finished complaining, she saw Shifu, who was sitting in the main seat of the grassy hall and tuning the strings of the zither, looking over at her with deep and intense eyes.

Ranran quickly sat upright, thought for a moment, and then eagerly held up the pot, asking Shifu if he wanted some too.

Ever since she discovered all the errors in the Fierce Beasts chapter, she had conscientiously corrected a few, one of which was that Shifu loved to eat sweets.

The small sugar biscuits she made would usually be all eaten by her Shifu every time, and sometimes she wouldn’t even manage to grab one for herself. Maybe Shifu would also love this overly sweet pot of tea.

After hearing his disciple’s words of complaint, Su Yishui regained his composure, put the zither into its bag and picked it up, saying to her, “Today’s exercises are done. I’ll take you to drink something that is not sweet.”

Ranran got up and followed her Master outside, feeling very excited. She tilted her head and asked, “Shifu, are we going to drink the jar of wine left by Elder Mu?”

Seeing Su Yishui nod his head, Ranran grabbed her skirt and rushed to the kitchen. She grabbed some fried peanuts she had made, along with some dried fish, and chased after her Shifu to taste the fine wine together.

Su Yishui took Ranran to the waterfall cave behind the mountain, where he fetched the dusty aged wine.

When he broke the seal, a tantalizing aroma filled the air. Ranran sniffed it, suddenly understanding the meaning of “Detain Celestial Immortal.” The taste of this aged wine was truly incomparable to any wine matured with spiritual talismans.

She eagerly took out the pair of small ceramic wine cups she had brought, along with the peanuts and dried fish wrapped in oil paper, intending to let Shifu have the first taste.

However, after Su Yishui took the wine cup, he brought it to her lips instead.

Ranran felt a little embarrassed but couldn’t resist the enticing aroma of the wine. So she quickly took a small sip, finding it indeed rich and full-bodied, with a strong aftertaste that prompted her to quickly eat two peanuts to offset it.

And so, the Master and disciple sat on a large stone by the waterfall, each with a cup, drinking like this.

Wine relaxes people, and after a few cups, the usual respectful and strict atmosphere between master and disciple seemed to loosen up.

Boosted by the wine, Ranran curiously asked the question she had always wanted to ask her Master, “Shifu, people say that you hate Elder Mu. Is that true?”

Su Yishui had a few cups of wine. He sat, with his usually tight collar slightly loosened, his long legs resting on the large stone, and his half-tied long hair flowing behind him, oozing with a lazy attitude. Upon hearing Ranran’s question, he raised his wine cup and suddenly smiled like a river thawing in spring, “Why don’t you ask, everyone says that Mu Qingge is absolutely infatuated with me, is that true?”

Ranran looked at Su Yishui’s unusual lazy demeanor compared with his usual coldness, his lips slightly curved in a smile, he actually looked a little more wicked than the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu…

While she was in a daze, Su Yishui suddenly leaned closer to her. His face no longer smiling, he asked coldly, “Tell me, do you think Mu Qingge is infatuated with me?”

Ranran unconsciously leaned back, her head hitting the large stone behind her. She tried to avoid her Master’s nose and whispered, “Elder Mu always comes to see you on her own initiative and talks to you. Naturally, she must have some attachment to you…”

But Su Yishui wasn’t satisfied. He seemed unwilling to back away, just focused on looking into her eyes. In his eyes, filled with a drunken haze, there was actually a hint of wicked cynicism “”Some women, she would look at you like how I’m looking at you, smiling at you, saying you’re the best looking. You say that’s infatuation… Actually, it’s all just rubbish!”

His mouth curved into a smile, his eyes fixed on her, but there was no laughter in them, only an indescribable desolation and something else that she couldn’t understand..

Ranran felt a bit panicked, feeling that something was off with this atmosphere. Was her Master warning her not to be deceived by sweet words and affectionate gazes, and be cheated of her feelings in the future?

In her confusion, she grabbed the zither her Master had brought and placed it between them, and said ingratiatingly, “Shifu, it’s been a while since I heard you play the zither. Would you mind playing a tune while we’re in high spirits?”

Su Yishui finally sat up straight, poured another cup of wine and downed it in one go. He then took the zither, crossed his legs, and set up the instrument. He remained silent for a while, slowly plucking the strings. The melodious music flowed like a stream, filling the valley.

Ranran found Shifu’s zither skills irresistible, even more intoxicating than the wine.

Listening to the flowing music, she forgot the awkwardness from earlier and casually half removed her embroidered shoes by the cliff, her slender toes hooking onto the shoes as she swayed them to and fro. Eventually, she couldn’t help but hum along with the music.

Although there were no lyrics but the clear voice echoed in the ravine, the waterfall splashed down like broken jade and flowers bloomed on the cliff. A breeze blew, brushing the lively girl’s cheek and hair. In a trance, her carefree smile seemed to overlap with the portrait of the red-clothed woman in the hall…

Su Yishui silently watched his intoxicated disciple, finally stopping the music. He picked up the jar of wine, and took a gulp as he threw his head back. The strong aroma of the wine spread on his lips, teeth, and tongue.

The wine she brewed was just like her, initially too strong and made one uncomfortable, but once you thought you wanted to stop drinking, the flavor of the wine has already entered the throat, and became too hard to put down.

In a daze, he also couldn’t seem to figure out whether what made him intoxicated was the wine in the cup or the person in front of him…

As Ranran was singing happily, her smile still on her face when she saw her handsome Shifu suddenly falling straight down, making a splash as he fell into the deep pool below the cliff…

Afterwards, Ranran was filled with self-blame. If she had known earlier that her Shifu was actually so easily intoxicated, she would have definitely stopped him from drinking.

Elder Mu’s compilation of the Fierce Beasts Chapter was truly full of illogical rubbish, why did she record a whole bunch of mistakes but left out that Su Yishui was a lightweight drinker?

Ranran was very thankful that she had learned how to swim in time. After her drunken Shifu fell into the deep pool, she managed to fish him out by herself.

Of course, the wretched state during that time cannot be described. Ranran even had to press her Shifu’s stomach to squeeze out the water he had choked on, then blew into his mouth to help him resume breathing.

But her Shifu seemed dead, without any breath at all. Ranran stood there in a panic, mouth slightly agape, tears streaming down… She never expected that killing her Shifu would be so simple.

She was at her wit’s end and could only get up to search for someone else.

But as she left, Su Yishui who had been lying on the ground finally half-opened his eyes. He turned his head to look at Ranran’s back as she hurried away, and reached out to touch his lips. Just now it felt as if there were petals with a fragrant wine scent, had fallen on his lips, so soft and sweet…

Following that, Ranran ran to the front hall but couldn’t find anyone. When she returned to the cave again, she found that her Shifu had taken off his wet outer clothes and was sitting on the large stone by the river wringing his clothes.

Ranran breathed a sigh of relief, chanted “Amitabha Buddha,” and then cautiously asked, “Shifu, do you want to drink some hangover soup…”

Su Yishui glanced at her, touched the water on his face, then tossed out “If you dare to mention how I got drunk to others, will be punished according to the rules of the sect,” and left dripping wet.

Ranran carried the remaining half-jar of aged wine and gloomily returned to her room.

If her Shifu was so easily intoxicated, he really had no common interests with his previous Master. It’s no wonder Mu Qingge, despite having many outstanding disciples, had to go to Cuiwei Mountain to find Elder Jiu to enjoy a drink.

However, she was also slow to realize, as she recalled touching Shifu’s lips with her own to save him, she suddenly felt her heart beating too fast. Finally, she took a Clear Heart Pill and quickly meditated to control her emotions.

Desire is the devil in one’s heart, she must be vigilant at all times. Perhaps this is also a test of her cultivation level by her Shifu! She must remain in control.

After a month, the Heavenly Tribulation finally arrived in the mountains and rivers as scheduled, with heavenly thunder rolling everywhere.

Things remained relatively quiet in the Western Mountains. After Su Yishui had contributed his cultivation in the past, he had yet to fully recover. Even after absorbing Wei Jiu’s cultivation, it was only restored by half.

The methods of dealing with the Heavenly Tribulation varied among the experts, but most required highly cultivated disciples to assist.

Mu Qingge hid in the imperial palace and couldn’t be used. In recent years, there were no outstanding disciples among the three major sects. So in the final test, among the high level masters of the three major sects, Abess Wen from the Kongshan Sect was actually struck to death by lightning, while the others didn’t have enough cultivation and were fortunate to escape heavy punishment by the Heavens.

After this, replenishing new blood became of the utmost importance. Without cultivating capable disciples, they would not pass the next Heavenly Punishment.

Therefore, after the Heavenly Tribulation, Shifu received an invitation to the Marrow-Cleansing Pool Meet jointly issued by the three major sects.

This Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet could be said to be a very important gathering for the younger generation of cultivators.

As the name suggests, the Marrow Cleansing Pool is used to wash away worldly impurities and refine one’s essence. Located in *Tian Mai Mountain, it is said to be the place where ancient cultivator Dun Tian had sat in meditation before ascending.
*Tian Mai literally is Sky’s Vein

Tired of immortal longevity, he voluntarily turned into mountains, his eyes turned into pools. For cultivators, these pools has the function of cleansing and reshaping their foundation.

It is most effective, especially for those who have just built their foundation or have reached intermediate levels in their cultivation.

For disciples of the immortal cultivation righteous faction, they cannot rely on evil things like the Netherworld Spirit Spring, so they can only hope for the opportunity when the Marrow Cleansing Pool opens once every ten years.

Whenever the Marrow Cleansing Pool opens, Tianmai Mountain would shake and erupt with molten lava. After the lava solidifies, a blue pool would appear at the mouth of the mountain. Meditating in the pool allows for rapid cultivation progress.

However, if too many people enter the pool, it inevitably dilutes the spiritual power. So the righteous sects came up with a fair compromise, sending their most capable disciples to compete fairly.

The spiritual power of the Marrow Cleansing Pool is precious, and each person can only enter once. How could it be given to ordinary mortals? Naturally, only the outstanding younger generation disciples can seize this opportunity to advance their cultivation.

Although this rule may look fair, it actually blocks the possibility of disciples from other small sects of entering the pool. After all, everyone knows that the threshold of the three major sects is difficult to cross, and the promising young cultivators have already been picked up by the three major sects.

So the Sect Leaders and great cultivators of the three major sects have all practiced in the Marrow Cleansing Pool before. In the past few hundred years, unless they had outstanding talent, disciples from other minor sects would find it very difficult to get such opportunities.

This kind of elite selection, does not seem like something that the few inept XiShan disciples can participate in.

Therefore, when Second Uncle Master read the invitation to the Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet, Qiu Xier just nodded with envy, while Ranran curiously asked about the famous local delicacies and specialties near Tianmai Mountain.

Gao Cang shook his head sadly, “Unfortunately, we haven’t been in the Sect long enough to compete with the disciples of the three major sects. Otherwise, we would definitely be do our best to make Shifu proud of us!”

However, Su Yishui calmly said, “Such opportunities are rare, and you all naturally have to strive for them. Since you have received the invitation, you must go.”

Ranran widened her eyes and asked Second Uncle Master beside her, “Are the trials at the Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet difficult?”

Second Uncle Master thought for a moment and said, “I haven’t been to Tianmai Mountain, but it is said that in the past three hundred years, the Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet has been monopolized by the three major sects. There was only two times when disciples from other sects took the lead and entered the pool.”

Gao Cang, upon hearing this, immediately asked eagerly, “Who were they?”

Yu Tong, feeling proud, said, “One was naturally my Master, and the other… was Mu Qingge from back then.”

Ranran nodded admiringly. XiShan unexpectedly had such potential. In just a few decades, they produced two outstanding talents like the dragon and the phoenix.

Mu Qingge and Su Yishui were both geniuses rarely seen in a hundred years, and not something small fries like them could compare to. If they were to go to Tianmai Mountain, they would probably not be able to make their Master proud, but it would be good to go out and have some fun.

However, Qiu Xier and Gao Cang obviously didn’t think so. As they say, with Great masters come great disciples, and who knows, maybe another genius will emerge from XiShan this year.

So they begged Ranran to make them two pairs of “*Guaranteed Success” insoles, hoping to bring them some luck and achieve a good ranking.
*逢考必过 To Pass Every Test

These days, Ranran’s alchemy furnace had been burning nonstop. After returning from Cha Ming Mountain, her Master had her start refining Marrow-strengthening pills.

However, these pills were not for humans but for spirit beasts. They could help enhance the power of spirit beasts, especially those who had suffered injuries from many years ago.

Ranran knew that this was for the little tiger. It was said the battle at Jue Mountain had been very devastating. In a critical moment, the Gengjin White Tiger prepared to sacrifice itself to save Mu Qingge.

But Mu Qingge couldn’t bear to let her beloved spirit beast perish with her, so at that moment, she knocked it off Jue Mountain.

After that battle, the White Tiger’s spiritual power was greatly depleted. Although Su Yishui had treated it with divine herb like Lingzhi, the benefits were limited.

The reason it mostly took the form of a cat was actually due to its inability to sustain its spiritual power, and was its way to conserve energy.

The efficacy of the Marrow-strengthening Pill was very beneficial for treating the White Tiger’s injuries. If Ranran could refine them successfully, perhaps the White Tiger’s recovery progress could be faster.

Because most of the time, the White Tiger was always like a drowsy cat, especially after its great display of power on the Wangxiang river the last time, it was always off somewhere sleeping. Su Yishui hoped the White Tiger would become more energetic.

However, Ranran’s progress this time was not quite smooth.

In addition to precise proportions in the formula and mastering the fire levels of the furnace, Pill alchemy also required the willpower of the alchemist to empower the furnace.

Of course, the better the alchemy furnace, the better it can accept spiritual force, allowing all potentials to be fully materilized.

Ranran was using the alchemy furnace that Elder Mu had used before, which was of course great, but when refining higher-level pills, she would always seem just one step away from success.

Puzzled, she asked her Shifu if there was something she didn’t do well enough.

Su Yishui explained, “Anyone can refine lower-level pills, but for higher-level pills, the alchemist’s cultivation level also comes into play to empower the process. So those who practice alchemy must constantly improve their internal energy. Many alchemists cannot advance in alchemy skills, because their spiritual power is not increasing.”

Because her spiritual power was not enough, Su Yishui led Ranran in refining the final batch of pills together.

Before they started refining, Su Yishui told her that after the furnace was opened, he would have to go into seclusion again, so he couldn’t accompany her on the Tianmai Mountain trip.

After she was injured last time, her Shifu would keep an eye on her wherever she went. This time, Shifu was actually willing to let go, and allow her to go with her Master Uncles, which made Ranran extremely happy.

So after the pills were refined, Ranran did not see her Shifu Su Yishui again.

And it was obvious that Ranran’s pills this time was another failure. After the little tiger reluctantly ate one, it snarled at Ranran with a grimace as if dissatisfied with its taste.

Its size remained unchanged, and it seemed even lazier than before, often snuggling into Ranran’s arms and dozing off for days.

So when they went off to Tianmai Mountain, they had to bring this lazy tiger along.

Ranran herself didn’t hold out much hope for this Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet. This gathering was more of an opportunity for disciples of the major sects to make a breakthrough.

The odds for XiShan to get a chance was very negligible, so there was no need to hold high expectations.

They were going just to represent their Sect and maintain appearances.

However, before they arrived at Tianmai Mountain, the lackadaisical disciples from XiShan finally felt the unyielding determination from the disciples of other sects.

When they were still some distance from Tianmai Mountain, the roads were already filled with carriages and horses from various major sects.

Of course, there were also high level guards from the major sects. It was said that in the past hundred years, except for Mu Qingge, no demonic cultivators could get close to Tianmai Mountain. This was a consensus among all the righteous immortal sects; they couldn’t let the demonic path grow another demonic seed again.

When Ranran’s carriage was waiting for identity verification, it was at the back of the queue. In the time she took to peer out, she actually saw second senior brother Bai Baishan.

Bai Bashan had been sent by Uncle Master Zeng to deliver the protective soft silver armor to Ranran.

Seeing this grand scene of the long queues, Bai Baishan, who had lost his foundation, felt envious and somewhat despondent.

At the entrance of Tianmai Mountain, there was a Decline Visitors Stone ( Xie Ke Stone ).
*谢客 most likely from 闭门谢客

This was an entrance to a mountain valley, with a narrow passage in the middle flanked by a flat stone similar to a gate. To pass through, one had to use spiritual power to lift the flat stone upwards. If one’s spiritual power was insufficient, then they couldn’t enter the mountain gate.

When Gao Cang and the others finally verified their identities and arrived, there was already another long queue here.

Gao Cang was impatient, so he took them to the front to take a look. They saw that the flat stone was extremely heavy, even lifting it with their arms required a lot of effort, let alone using spiritual power. How could they lift it?

At this moment, there was a burly man with the same idea as Gao Cang, who was about to challenge the stone gate. He said in a bold manner, “Who set a rule to say we can only use spiritual power to pass? I’ll just go around here!”

With that, he leaped up, trying to jump over the flat stone. But just as he reached the top of the flat stone, a thunderbolt flashed, followed by a crack, and he was suddenly knocked down to the ground.

The female disciples of the KongShan Sect, who were waiting leisurely by the side, couldn’t help but burst into laughter. “The Marrow Cleansing Pool is a sacred place left by the Ancient Cultivator Dun Tian, how can it be defiled by mediocrity? The entire Tianmai Mountain is shrouded in the spiritual shield he left behind. Only on the day of the Marrow Cleansing Pool Meet, can one pass through this trial stone gate. What an idiot, trying to jump over the gate!”

The man who was knocked down by the thunderbolt was quite sturdy. After staggering for a while, he climbed up again, glaring over, but sat cross-legged in front of the stone gate, trying to concentrate his qi and spiritual power. However, the stone gate only moved slightly and then remained motionless.

And so derisive laughter arose again. Unable to bear the embarrassment, the man jumped up again, preparing to use his hands to lift the trial stone.

But as soon as his hands touched the stone, a bright lightning bolt struck him directly.

This time, after he screamed and fell to the ground and twitched for a while, he then lay motionless.

Previous
Next

Second Uncle Master watched the man lying limp on the side, sighed, and said, “His tendons and bones have been shattered, he’s completely disabled…”

The four young ones exchanged looks, they had no idea that this first hurdle would be so sinister. The stone couldn’t even be touched, it was truly terrifying.

However, as more and more people arrived at the Stone Gate, Ranran soon discovered that the man’s experience was actually considered fortunate.

Most people who took up the challenge, just managed to slightly move the trial stone, but they also didn’t dare to touch it or do anything against the rules, so they had to leave disappointed.

Finally, it was JiuHua Sect’s turn. The first one to step forward wasn’t the Chief Disciple Wei Fang, but a chubby-looking fellow who seemed quite pleased with himself. From their earlier discussions, this disciple named Guo was said to be the fastest rising star in recent years, second only to Wei Fang.

Among the junior disciples of Jiuhua Sect who had hopes of entering the marrow-cleansing pool, besides Wei Fang, there was only this Disciple Guo.

After he sat down cross-legged and adjusted his breath, steam started rising from his head quickly, and the trial stone, which had been motionless, suddenly shook violently and then rose bit by bit.

Amid the astonished exclamations of the crowd, the chubby fellow proudly stood up and was about to pass under the stone.

But just then, perhaps because he didn’t control his breath well enough when he stood up, the massive Trial stone that had been raised suddenly collapsed with a thunderous crash, hitting the man who had walked under it on the head…

Qiu Xier and Ranran had queued up. They greeted those in front and behind them to reserve their queue position, then ran under a nearby tree to sit down and eat their own packed lunch.

From here, they were completely caught off guard and saw the bloody scene of carnage. Qiu Xier screamed in fright and jumped into Gao Cang’s arms.

Second senior brother was trying to feed himself with chopsticks held between his toes, and the scare made him bite his big toe instead.

Ranran silently forced down the juicy fish balls in her mouth, then closed her eyes and held her breath, trying to forget the bloody scene as soon as possible.

This time, the new disciples of the three major sects were all silent, and no one made mocking remarks anymore.

Wei Fang seemed to have anticipated that something like this would happen and coldly said to the remaining junior disciples, “The marrow-cleansing pool is a blessing left by an ancient powerhouse. Those with weak blessings or unsteady wills cannot pass this threshold. Brother Guo did his best, but unfortunately, his cultivation was not enough, and his efforts ended in failure…”

As he said this, there was a hint of moisture in his eyes, and he wiped away the tears.

Originally, there were three more disciples from Jiuhua Sect who were going to challenge the trial, and their strength was not inferior to Brother Guo. However, with the remnants of their fellow disciple’s flesh and blood still under the stone, how could they concentrate their minds to lift the stone and pass the test?

It was possible that the next person to be smashed to pieces might be one of them.

So, although the remaining few disciples managed to lift the trial stone halfway, they hesitated and didn’t dare to pass, eventually exhausting their breath and returning in defeat.

At this moment, Qiu Xier was also very frightened and whispered to Ranran, “Oh my goodness, this trial here is actually more life-threatening than our Shifu’s. Even the outstanding disciples from Jiuhua Sect couldn’t pass. I guess we won’t even get close to it. Maybe we should go back early and not stay here anymore.”

But Ranran shook her head and frowned, looking at Wei Fang, who had tears in his eyes.

She thought for a moment and said, “I heard that Wei Fang has been here twice already, so he should have foreseen something like this. If he had been willing to advise the junior disciples that the critical moment should have been when the trial stone was lifted. Perhaps Brother Guo wouldn’t have had to sacrifice himself. But look, Wei Fang arranged the order for Jiuhua Sect to pass, but he let Brother Guo, who is equally capable as him, to go first and didn’t even give him any warning. From what I see, this trial stone is testing the wickedness of human hearts…”

Gao Cang and Qiu Xier hadn’t thought in this direction before, but after hearing Ranran’s analysis, they felt a sudden realization.

There can be only one who comes out on top in the Marrow-cleansing Pool Meet. Even if they are from the same sect, they will ultimately become competitors.

Wei Fang failed to pass last time, but this time he came with the determination to pass. In that case, how could he let the rising stars of the same sect pass the test?

As expected, the last person to challenge from Jiuhua Sect was Wei Fang. Although faced with the blood-soaked ground from his fellow sect member, Wei Fang remained unaffected, lifted the stone with his breath, and then passed through in a flash, as if he had been practicing diligently for a long time.

The only disciple from Jiuhua Sect who passed the trial was Wei Fang.

When it was Kongshan Sect’s turn, the situation wasn’t as tragic as Jiuhua Sect’s.

Because Abess Wen hadn’t been able to overcome the heavenly tribulation and had just passed away. The new leader of Kongshan Sect had not been officially decided yet, and the acting head was Abess Wen’s adopted daughter, Wen Hongshan.

Wen Hongshan had been to Tianmai Mountain before, but unfortunately, she hadn’t managed to beat Su Yishui for the chance to get into the marrow-cleansing pool back then.

The rule of Tianmai Mountain was that everyone could only come once in their lifetime. This meant that once they passed the trial stone, there was no chance for a second try.

Wen Hongshan had passed this first hurdle in the past, so after carefully instructing her disciples with the precautions, three people from their sect managed to pass.

Among these three, there were twin sisters named Wen Bingqing and Wen Yujie, said to be prodigies sought out by Abess Wen from the mortal world, who had already reached the Foundation Establishment of Fifth Heaven at a young age and were promising young talents.

The remaining person was a tall young man with a sun-browned face that no one knew much about. Apparently he was a relative of Wen Hongshan and had managed to join this Meet through her connection.

Although he had just joined the Kongshan sect, his strength was not to be underestimated. After meditating for a while, he also lifted the trial stone.

Thus, a day passed, and out of the long queue of hundreds of people, only about a dozen managed to pass.

The few timid ones from XiShan Sect didn’t compete and stayed under the shade of the trees, eating and drinking until the end. According to Qiu Xier, what’s the point of soaking in this pool?

Even if it’s comfortable, is it as comfortable as Master Uncle Zeng’s medicinal pool?

Just then, a long convoy suddenly appeared from halfway up the mountain, and Mu Qingge, who had been hiding in the palace and unseen by anyone, arrived gracefully.

Although she had lived two lives, for this new reborn body, had never been to Tianmai Mountain, so she was indeed eligible.

When she got off the carriage, the crowd that was about to disperse suddenly stopped. When they saw that she was also trying to compete for the opportunity to enter Tianmai Mountain, someone immediately complained, “Mu Qingge, you entered the Marrow-cleansing pool long ago. Aren’t you ashamed to compete for such an opportunity with the younger generation?”

Mu Qingge heard this but couldn’t be bothered to respond. She simply walked towards the trial stone, didn’t even meditate, and just waved her hand lightly, causing the massive stone to lift as lightly as a feather. After she walked past, the stone fell with a thunderous crash, in just the blink of an eye.

The stark contrast in power left all the proud young disciples who had previously passed the trial stone feeling speechless.

At this moment, Mu Qingge laughed softly and said, “I’ve lived twice, and this body has never entered the marrow-cleansing pool. Whether I’m qualified or not, the trial stone will be the judge. If anyone still feels aggrieved, there’s no rush; There are more challenges next, we can take it slowly.”

Turning her head, she looked at the XiShan disciples who were eating and drinking under the trees. After scanning them all, her gaze settled on Xue Ranran, who was biting into an apple.

The look in her eyes was complex. If it weren’t for the report from the person she had dispatched, Mu Qingge could never have imagined that the young disciple of Su Yishui she had encountered before was actually the fallen spirit fruit…

Su Yishui had recognized her very early on? He had actually kept her by his side since then. But this young girl had none of the bearing from her past life; in talent and appearance, she was nothing remarkable, much like Mu Ranwu who had faded into obscurity in her previous life…

Thinking of this, Mu Ranwu smiled. When she and her sister had perished together, she had used a soul-shifting technique to alter their destinies.

In her previous life, her sister was born under auspicious signs, her cultivation path smooth sailing, unlike Mu Ranwu who was born prematurely and had average aptitude, with nothing outstanding.

Now, they had truly and completely swapped their fated lot.

She wanted to see what accomplishments an average person could achieve, even if they had Su Yishui’s devoted affection?

Thinking of this, she stood on one side of the stone gate and smiled meaningfully at Xue Ranran, “Ranran, we meet again. Why hasn’t your XiShan sect passed this stone trial yet?”

Because she had sent someone to disturb her parents, Ranran’s liking for Elder Mu suddenly plummeted. So when Elder Mu spoke, she didn’t want to respond to her.

However, it was not early in the day, and the few of them really couldn’t delay any longer. If they couldn’t even pass the first test, XiShan Lingxi Palace’s dignity would really be lost.

Thinking of this, Xue Ranran said to her fellow disciples beside her, “Let’s go, let’s give it a try.”

Bai Baishan looked melancholy and put on his shoes and socks, saying, “You guys go try. I have no true qi in my body right now, so I won’t go embarrass our XiShan sect.”

So the remaining three came up to the trial stone.

Gao Cang was the one with higher cultivation among the disciples. After adjusting his breath in a cross-legged position, he started to move the stone with his energy.

Unfortunately, the stone only moved slightly, but when it was Qiu Xier’s turn, it didn’t even budge.

Mu Qingge didn’t care about the performances of these two at all; she was focused on watching Xue Ranran.

Even though she felt that Xue Ranran was not a threat, Mu Ranwu was still a little worried. After being adopted by the carpenter couple from the Juefeng Village, how did Xue Ranran manage to survive after leaving the Rebirth Tree?

The Rebirth Tree had long been destroyed, so how did Xue Ranran seem to be getting more graceful and delicate? There was no trace of any congenital deficiency in her appearance now.

Thinking of how Su Yishui had withheld the detoxifying pills to punish her for investigating Xue Ranran’s parentage, causing her to suffer horribly for a whole month, her heart harbored an unresolved resentment.

Now, the one who looks like a heavenly immortal was her, the one who possesses innate spiritual power was also her! Why wouldn’t Su Yishui look properly at her and instead kept this worthless person with no golden core by his side?

Thinking of this, she took a deep breath, smiling as she loudly addressed Ranran, “Miss Xue, it’s your turn.”

Ranran stood in front of the trial stone for a moment, lost in thought until Mu Qingge called out to her. Then she walked over and sat down to gather her breath.

As expected, just like Qiu Xier, the stone didn’t budge at all.

Mu Ranwu’s smile widened gradually, and her anxious heart slowly relaxed. Elder sister, as long as you don’t cause any trouble, living idle for a few decades isn’t too bad…

The others weren’t too surprised, seeing that the XiShan Sect didn’t amount to much. As they got ready to leave, Ranran turned to ask Second Master Uncle: “Is there a rule in passing the trial stone, that specifies only one person can go at a time?”

Yu Tong was also stumped by the question. Because the situation mentioned by Ranran had never occurred before.

After all, the temptation of the marrow-cleansing pool is no less than that of the Spirit Spring, which is a dream opportunity for many from the young generation of cultivators. How could there be anyone forming a group to pass the single-log bridge, since this was a matter that was to showcase individual strength?

Such a shameful and humiliating situation, other sects can neither come up with it nor do.

So Yu Tong honestly replied, “I don’t know either. But it seems there’s no such rule.”

Ranran turned back to Gao Cang and Qiu Xier, saying, “Do you remember the core meaning of our Demon Subduing Formation?”

Hearing her question, the three looked at each other and said in unison, “In the formation, we unite as one, advancing and retreating together, living and dying together!”

Ranran clapped her hands. “That’s right! Since the Demon Subduing Formation can combine our strengths, why don’t we set up a formation and see if we can lift the trial stone together?”

Hearing this, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier clapped their hands too. “Yes! Ranran, you’re so clever. Why didn’t we think of that?”

Although Ranran was the youngest, her adventures in Wangxiang River and Cha Ming Mountain had earned her respect and unassailable authority from her senior siblings.

The two of them just had to blindly follow whatever proposal Ranran suggested!

So amidst laughter and mockery from the other cultivators, three people squeezed at the trial stone in an unprecedented manner.

Then the three concentrated, following Ranran’s commands to lift the stone with their collective breath.

As the saying goes, three mediocre cobblers will surpass a Zhuge Liang, and the combined strength of three XiShan rookies shouldn’t be underestimated. The formation itself has a boosting factor to their strength, so although a single person couldn’t lift the stone, when the three of them coordinated, they managed to lift it.

Ranran pointed a finger to exert her power, then focused on her fellow disciples. “Hold steady and don’t lose heart. Use the Lotus Step to enter the gate step by step!”

Following Ranran’s words, the three stepped with the Lotus Step, moving like a rotating lotus flower, and flashed through the gate one by one.

Only after Ranran entered the gate last did the trial stone crash down, and the three XiShan disciples managed to pass the challenge together in this way.

Accompanied by the thunderous sound of the stone falling, the three young ones cheered and clapped, excitedly stomping their feet.

When Ranran made such a suggestion, the onlookers initially sneered in disdain, but gradually they became astonished and speechless.

Mu Ranwu stared fixedly at the girl’s lively smile, feeling a sudden thump in her heart, which made her hold her breath for a long moment.

After the three passed the challenge, Wei Fang was the first to come to his senses, shouting loudly, “This doesn’t count! You three clearly cheated!”

With his shout, others also shouted, expressing that these three were not qualified to continue to the next challenge.

Ranran turned to look at them, puzzled. “Strange, are you all examiners? Clearly, the inscription on the monument next to the trial stone says ‘The stone bearer can pass,’ it didn’t say that each time only one person can lift the stone! We all passed, so we passed the challenge!”

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang also confidently said, “We, the brothers and sisters of XiShan are harmonious and willing to pass the challenge together. Unlike you all, who selfishly play tricks and watch inexperienced fellow disciples die without giving them any advice in advance!”

This statement clearly hinted at something, and everyone looked at Wei Fang. Wei Fang’s face tightened, and he rushed forward to reprimand Gao Cang.

Too bad the XiShan disciples practiced Monkey Arts, with extraordinary lightness in their steps. They skillfully dodged, leaping onto trees to avoid Wei Fang and even made faces at him.

Finally, Mu Qingge spoke up and mediated, “Enough, since they passed the trial stone, naturally, they have passed the challenge. There are more trials to the Water Amusement Pool; this was just the first one. True gold fears no fire; you all don’t need to be too impatient.”

Her words were diplomatic, resolving Ranran and their group’s situation, showing goodwill, and subtly indicating that they had only used some clever tricks and not real strength. Even if they passed this challenge, the remaining ones could probably eliminate them.

Everyone was eager to move on to the next challenge, so they couldn’t be bothered to argue with the XiShan disciples anymore. After all, the ones they truly feared were Wei Fang, Mu Qingge, and that unknown dark-faced boy from the KongShan Sect.

These were the ones with real power, the ones who posed a real threat!

With Ranran and her group setting an example, those who hadn’t passed before also tried to team up to lift the stone together. Their foundations were better than those of the XiShan disciples, but mastering such cooperative formations took more than just a few days, so their effort was not as effective as just one person lifting it.

Now, the remaining people were convinced. Although the XiShan disciples were considered mediocre, they had indeed relied on some hard-earned skills to lift the massive stone.

So the ten over people who passed the challenge no longer ganged up on them. After glaring at the three, they all went towards the next challenge.

The dark-faced boy from the KongShan Sect didn’t seem familiar with the other fellow disciples and didn’t walk with them but strolled leisurely behind alone.

As Ranran walked, she ended up walking next to him. The boy suddenly turned to look at her, his eyes somewhat dark and unfriendly.

Ranran was eating dried sweet potatoes. When she saw the boy staring at her, she thought he was hungry, so she handed him the snack bag, saying, “Here, if you want to eat, just help yourself!”

The boy was taken aback, looking at the bag of dried sweet potatoes she handed over. He seemed wary, as if afraid there might be a trap inside.

Seeing his caution, Ranran simply grabbed a handful and handed it to him, saying, “Eat it, I made them myself. You can’t buy dried sweet potatoes this sweet elsewhere.”

The dark-faced boy slowly reached out and took the dried sweet potatoes but didn’t eat them. Instead, he put them in his own pocket.

Taking the opportunity to start a conversation, Ranran asked, “May I ask for your name and your ranking in the KongShan Sect?”

The dark-faced boy finally smiled slightly, glanced at her inquisitively, and said in a low voice that seemed to pour out from his throat, indistinctly, “My surname is Gui, and my name is Baqian.”

It seemed that Brother Gui Baqian had just joined the KongShan Sect. To have such strength as a newly admitted disciple was why the other KongShan disciples didn’t seem to like him much, showing obvious signs of exclusion.

Ranran also felt some sympathy for Brother Gui Baqian, so she took the initiative to give him a handful of dried sweet potato.

Tianmai Mountain was quite majestic. Climbing mountains in the north could take two or three days, and Tianmai Mountain was known for its steep terrain. After passing the first checkpoint and climbing a short distance up the mountain, it gradually grew dark.

Most of the people who made it through the first trial had already started practicing a higher level of cultivation. So, fasting for a few days wasn’t a problem.

According to their respective sects, they each settled down in an empty space halfway up the mountain and waited for the next day to continue their ascent.

But in the darkness and silence of the mountain, the three from XiShan started a barbecue.

Wherever Ranran went, she would make clear preparations for the matter of eating well beforehand.

Chunks of chicken legs marinated and wrapped in pig stomach pouches filled with soup didn’t need to be unwrapped. Wrapped in wet mud and buried directly in charcoal, they soon emitted a fragrant aroma. Qiu Xier also had five-spice sesame cakes in her bag, a perfect complement to the chicken!

When it was time to eat, the little white tiger suddenly appeared. It seems like it had followed them along the way. Although Tianmai Mountain was picky about people who entered, there were no restrictions on birds and beasts.

Ranran picked a large leaf from a tree, washed it with water from her bag, and put some cooled meat on it for the little white tiger to eat.

The little white tiger had developed a cleanliness obsession recently and didn’t like raw food much anymore. It also seemed to be in the fasting period and didn’t eat much. However, when it saw Ranran eating, it would also want to take a bite.

But with the three humans and one tiger eating happily, the aroma of the food disrupted the meditation of the fellow cultivators.

Those who weren’t very hungry before suddenly felt their stomachs churning rapidly when they smelled the fragrance of the chicken.

They don’t know what those Xishan fools did, but the spices they used have a unique aroma that makes one salivate and desperately swallow saliva.

Now, the pair of twins from the KongShan Sect couldn’t stand it anymore. Wen Bingqing and Wen Yujie walked over and kicked their fire pit, cursing, “What kind of nonsense are you making? Are you deliberately disrupting our meditation? If you want to eat, go home and eat!”

Ranran reacted quickly, holding her chicken leg and pancake and quickly dodged away.

The names of these twins sound pure and virtuous, but who would have thought they were so domineering, not even letting others have dinner. Gao Cang’s pancake was kicked away, and he couldn’t help but curse, “Why is the KongShan Sect full of shrews? If you don’t want to eat, why not let others eat?”

Qiu Xier was also furious and rushed forward to hit the sisters’ faces, but Ranran stopped them.

After all, the abilities of the three of them couldn’t match the outstanding disciples of Kongshan Sect. If they really fought, they would be the ones at a disadvantage.

However, the temper of the little tiger couldn’t be restrained by humans. It suddenly kicked its hind legs and silently pounced towards the Wen sisters.

The sisters were caught off guard, and their necks were scratched, drawing blood. They were so angry that they drew their swords, intending to kill the beast.

Previous
Next

Wei Fang had accompanied Mu Qingge to XiShan for her treasures before, so he naturally recognized the Gengjin White Tiger.

When he reminded everyone that this cat-like creature was Mu Qingge’s former mount, the Wen sisters cautiously took a few steps back.

The ferocity of the Gengjin White Tiger was well known to everyone. Although it looked like a furball now, if it were to erupt in the next moment, it wouldn’t be pleasant if someone got injured by it.

After scratching them, the white tiger swished its tail and left.

So the Wen sisters could only vent their anger at Mu Qingge, “Look at the beast you raised!”

Mu Ranwu sat by the side resting. At their words, she raised her eyebrows casually, “I have already severed the contract with the white tiger. What it does has nothing to do with me…”

Although Elder Mu had the temperament of a fairy, her stomach started rumbling as well after speaking, apparently also tempted by the delicious scent of XiShan’s dinner.

At this moment, Gui Baqian walked over, took out the dried sweet potato pieces that Ranran had given him earlier, and passed them to Mu Qingge.

Seeing this, the Wen sisters were furious again, accusing Gui Baqian of being too forward and embarrassing the KongShan Sect.

Mu Qingge smiled and accepted the sweet potato snack, but she didn’t eat them. She politely thanked Baqian for them.

Gui Baqian decided he wasn’t leaving. He simply sat down beside Mu Qingge and continued to openly stare at her, which was rather improper. But Mu Qingge tilted her head and smiled at him, engaging in a casual conversation. Her every move and expression exuded charm.

Qiu Xier whispered softly, “Our former Grandmaster looks so charming; she has admirers everywhere! But that boy is too impolite to take what you’ve given him to offer it to her like that!”

Ranran smiled, not minding these trivial matters at all. Tianmai Mountain was formed when Dun Tian passed away during meditation, with subtle energies flowing everywhere. Ranran was curious about what the next challenge would be.

However, Elder Mu should be the most confident, having been here before and won. It seemed like this opportunity would be hers as well.

With a mindset of seeing the world and gaining experience, Ranran felt completely relaxed, finishing the bread and meat in her hand happily.

After their fire was put out, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier also finished their food. They found a place far from other sects to meditate and wait for dawn.

As for what the second challenge would be, Shifu Su Yishui didn’t specify. He simply mentioned that besides the first challenge, the rest were illusions created by the ancient powers of Tianmai Mountain. They would adjust according to the strength of the participants each time, so they just needed to remain calm and focused to handle it.

Ranran wasn’t very interested in the Marrow Cleansing Pool. In fact, she had hoped that second senior brother could get the opportunity to restore his spiritual energy. Unfortunately, second senior brother has been with Uncle Master Zeng and seemed to have changed his mindset a lot, and was unwilling to come along.

There were over a dozen people who made it to this round, and their trio from XiShan were at the bottom. So, with the mindset of just gaining experience, the three of them were the most relaxed among everyone else.

When dawn arrived, everyone else began to move forward quickly, while Ranran and her group stopped from time to time on the mountain to pick wild fruits to eat.

Ranran noticed that brother Baqian was also not walking very fast, seeming to intentionally wait for them.

So when she met Baqian again on the small path, she couldn’t help but ask directly, “Brother Baqian, why are you walking so slowly? Your two fellow sect members have gone far ahead.”

Baqian smiled and raised his eyebrows, his dark skin making his teeth look very white. He slowly said, “It seems like you’re not in a hurry to move forward. Did Elder Su instruct you on something?”

Ranran understood now. This guy was suspicious that they had some cheating trick, and was deliberately probing with his words.
