She smiled and shook her head, “Shifu’s participation in the Marrow Cleansing Pool was over twenty years ago. Didn’t they say that the questions in the Marrow Cleansing Pool are almost never the same each time? Besides, your Abbess from Kongshan Sect had also passed the trial before, right? If there were any tricks, she would have passed them down to her disciples and grand-disciples long ago. But I can tell you a secret, if we climb this mountain too quickly, will be very tiring!”

Upon hearing this, Baqian’s smile seemed deeper, but his tone was cold, “Are you deliberately toying with me?”

Qiu Xier, who disliked people from the Kongshan Sect, couldn’t hold back and said bluntly, “Ranran, don’t talk too much with the mad dogs from the Kongshan Sect. If they feel unhappy, they might come and kick the fire.”

Just then, screams came from ahead.

They didn’t have time to argue and hurried along. It turned out that ahead was a tall mountain valley, with two sides connected by a rope bridge made of vines and rudimentary wooden planks. To cross, they had to climb the ropes and step on the creaking wooden planks.

For cultivators who had reached a certain level, this wasn’t much of a challenge. Even without the planks, they could easily cross the valley by climbing the ropes.

But the problem lies in the fact that the rope ladder is covered with vines and plants. However, these dark green plants seem somewhat strange; upon closer inspection, one would notice that they are wriggling.

Ranran took a closer look and gasped in shock.

What vines? They are clearly a mass of dark green venomous snakes entangled and coiled on the bridge. Moreover, each snake was not small in size, with open fangs and venomous tongues, their bellies bulging like wings, looking extremely terrifying.

The screams earlier had come from the Wen twins. Both of them seemed to be very afraid of snakes. They had stepped on the soft snake bodies while walking ahead, hence their hysterical screams.

Even those who weren’t afraid of snakes would feel their scalp tingle at the sight of this gathering of cold and poisonous creatures.

The dozen or so people glanced at each other, vaguely understanding that this might be the second challenge of the trial.

Qiu Xier tightly held Ranran’s hand and whispered, “The further we go, the harder it gets. Why don’t we stop here and go back home? They are all too strong, and we can’t compare to them.”

Ranran didn’t say anything because at this moment, the disciples of Feiyun Mountain from the three major sects were already preparing to go first.

Feiyun Sect specialized in *gold of the Five Elements, and are skilled in using various golden needle hidden weapons. When they saw the bridge filled with venomous snakes, they immediately took out the hidden golden needle cylinders from their sleeves and aimed at the snakes. Hundreds and thousands of golden needles shot out with a cold light, piercing the snakes’ bodies.
* literally gold but actually metal 金木水火土 ( the five elements )

These hidden cylinders were equipped with special springs, empowered by the spiritual power of the wielder. Every needle pierced deep into the snakes’ flesh and bones, causing them to twist and fall into the gorge.

Just as everyone breathed a sigh of relief and prepared to cross the bridge, a loud horn-like wailing sound from a wooden statue suddenly came from the other end of the bridge.

Accompanied by that sound, countless dark green venomous snakes surged from the other end of the bridge, once again occupying the entire rope bridge.

However, the Feiyun Mountain disciples had already used up most of their needle cylinders and couldn’t continue.

At this moment, someone grew impatient and, relying on their excellent lightness technique, attempted to leap and step on the snake bodies to cross. Only those with considerable skills would dare to attempt this. The distance in the valley was quite long, so even with a superb lightness technique, they would still need to land a couple of times, then use the force to continue forward.

At first, that person looked quite promising, accurately landing on snake bodies and immediately leaping. Their agile body boosted the confidence of the remaining people.

However, when it came to the final jump to cross the bridge, dozens of large snakes suddenly sprang up, entangling the person and pulling him down.

The person quickly swung their sword, but alas, the snakes managed to bite them a few times. The snake venom spread rapidly, and soon, the person’s face turned green, their body stiffening as they fell straight down the gorge.

The valley seemed quite deep, and after the person’s screams echoed for a while, they heard a thud from the mist-covered bottom of the valley.

Now, the remaining people looked at each other, none daring to act rashly.

Ordinary snake venom couldn’t affect cultivators, as their breathing practices of controlling the urgency of blood flow was part of cultivating inner energy.

Since the person had passed the first challenge alone, that showed he had a decent cultivation foundation. However, he couldn’t even adjust his circulation in time after being bitten by the snakes, becoming paralyzed immediately, which indicated how potent the snake venom was.

Just then, Gui Baqian suddenly walked to the edge of the bridge, picked up a wooden stick, infused it with true qi, and flames burst out instantly. He then threw the ignited stick onto the bridge, and in an instant, the flames soared high. The green snakes twisted in the fire, about to turn into ashes.

However, Ranran exclaimed softly, “Not good, the bridge is going to burn down too!”

The fire turned out too strong, burning through the ropes of the bridge in an instant. Seeing that the bridge had been burned through in several places and a few wooden planks had fallen, the water-based Jiuhua Sect disciples, immediately tried to put out the fire with water, but it was unstoppable.

It was Gui Baqian who realized that the bridge couldn’t withstand the fire, so he withdrew it back.

Everyone was stunned by his exceptional fire-controlling ability. Even the twin sisters from his sect looked at him with astonishment, clearly not aware of this new junior disciple’s skills.

At this moment, the Jiuhua Sect disciples had a clever idea of freezing the snakes with water to create a stable path. However, just as the ice formed, the bridge couldn’t bear the sudden increase in weight and broke two more ropes, causing several wooden planks to fall.

The bridge was now shaky, with only one rope left.

Wei Fang was frustrated and said, “Look at what you’ve done! Without the bridge, we can’t jump to the other side!”

Gui Baqian just smiled indifferently, his teeth dazzlingly white, looking unconcerned.

Now that several attempts had failed, the only remaining route seemed to be cut off as well. Wei Fang sighed, “This is great, now we can’t go over at all. It looks like we’ll miss out on the Marrow Cleansing Pool again this year.”

After all, there had been years when there were no outstanding disciples showing up, resulting in no winners for that year.

Just then, Gui Baqian suddenly made a move, chopping the bridge with a single stroke. Then, amidst everyone’s exclamations, he leaped over the broken bridge in one go, riding on the wind and landed on the other side.

Such skill in manipulating the wind was a move only mastered by the Heads of the major sects. No one had expected this new disciple from the Kongshan Sect to possess such ability, and he was quite unscrupulous too.

Clearly, he could have made the jump earlier, but he waited until everyone was out of options before cutting the bridge and crossing the valley, to block the advancement of others.

Looking back now, it seemed like he intentionally burned the bridge, as he didn’t care about crossing on the bridge himself; he just wanted to destroy it.

After crossing the bridge, Gui Baqian ignored the curses and complaints from the other end of the valley. He laughed coldly and continued on his way.

With no one else in competition with him and his unfathomable abilities, it seemed like he was the sure winner of this Marrow Cleansing Pool trial.

After Gui Baqian left, the Wen sisters became besieged by the rest.

Wei Fang was red-eyed with anger, his veins bulging as he shouted, “What kind of demonic recruit did your Kongshan Sect bring in? Why are your actions so unethical?”

The twins were also tricked by this conniving new junior brother. They couldn’t pass the valley and now had to take the blame for that boy’s actions, which made them well up with angry tears.

Some people are demoralized by now and started to team up and prepare to go down the mountain. Out of over a dozen of them, four of them left.

Qiu Xier said to Ranran and their senior brother, “Let’s leave too. It’s getting dark soon, and it’s not going to be easy to travel at night. If poisonous snakes come out again, we could really die.”

However, Ranran stood still, not moving at all. Suddenly, she clapped her hands and stopped Weifang and others who had finished their cursing and were getting ready to leave. “I have an idea. I don’t know if you’re willing to cooperate with us?”

Weifang looked at the shrimp soldiers and crab generals from Xishan with surprise and doubt. “What’s your idea?”

Ranran said, “Jiuhua sect is proficient in the water element, while we in Xishan specialize in the wood element, and the Kongshan sect specializes in the earth element. If the three of us join forces, we might accomplish something.”

The twin sisters also came over and asked, “How can we accomplish something?”

Ranran asked the senior brother to take out the small spade he always carried with him – as disciples of the divine physician Su Yishui, they are always on the look out for good herbs when they enter the mountains, so he often carried the spade with him.

After Gao Cang took the spade, Ranran walked a few rounds in the dense forest and finally dug out a young shoot of a vine plant.

Everyone looked closely and saw that it was the commonly seen Flying Dragon Blood Vine. This kind of vine usually grew on large trees, but once it matured, it would become very sturdy.

But what was she doing with a sprout of a vine? Did she expect it to grow into a vine bridge in a short time?

Weifang was too lazy to roll his eyes; he just said coldly, “Are you kidding us?”

But Ranran was not joking at all. She planted the vine shoot on the edge of the canyon and then inserted a wooden stick into the ground facing the opposite side of the canyon. She then closed her eyes devoutly and muttered something in her mouth.

If one got close enough, they could hear her murmuring words like “Little baby, grow up quickly.”

Weifang felt that he had spent enough time hanging out with fools. Since Mu Qingge’s generation, it seemed like that there were always some eccentric people in Xishan sect.

At that moment, Ranran took out the “ten years in a day” talisman gifted to her by Elder Jiu and stuck it on the vine.

In a flash, the originally finger-sized vine began to rapidly grow and entwine, soon extending forward along the wooden stick.

However, as the plant was growing too fast, and the nutrients and water in the soil were not enough. Its leaves started to turn slightly yellow.

The twin sisters finally lived up to their names; they quickly understood Ranran’s idea and silently used a soil-moving technique to continuously transport fertile soil from all directions.

Ranran motioned towards Weifang, “Will the friend in Tao please water it a bit. This will help it grow faster.”

Weifang also understood now and immediately silently used a water technique to rapidly irrigate the vine.

Meanwhile, Ranran took a dozen wooden sticks and her own fishing line, used light body technique to quickly ascend the vine bridge, and continued to connect the vine, guiding it forward along the wooden sticks.

Everyone watched in amazement as Ranran’s agile figure moved like a colorful butterfly. Such Light body technique seemed impossible without decades of cultivation…

Mu Ranwu had been watching from the side. Even though she had a smile of admiration on her face, but her hand by her side began to clench, and her arm even trembled slightly. The shadow cast over her by her outstanding sister in her previous life has resurfaced again…

Soon, the vine extended across to the opposite side of the canyon, and the vine itself began to grow thicker.

Ranran was the second to arrive at the opposite side of the canyon after Gui Baqian.

Mu Qingge was the third one to effortlessly jump over.

Seeing this, everyone was afraid that the girl from XiShan would follow in the footsteps of Gui Baqian and cut off the vine bridge. They all rushed to cross the vine bridge one by one, running and leaping across the vine bridge.

Ranran had to call out, “Take it slow, too many people will cause it to fall! Hey, you! Can you not push other people!”

However, there were also people whose light body technique was not up to par, such as Qiu Xier. After taking a few steps, she felt the vine sagging downward. She was frightened and immediately retreated. And because the vine had grown too fast, it also fell down at last.

Qiu Xier shouted over to Ranran and the senior brother with a mournful face, “You guys continue ahead; I can’t make it. I’ll wait for you at the foot of the mountain!”

Ranran knew that Qiu Xier was timid and didn’t force her, so she continued with their senior brother.

However, only seven people passed through this snake bridge checkpoint in the end.

Gui Baqian, who was the first to cross the bridge, had long disappeared from view. The ones left were the twin sisters Bing Qing and Yu Jie, Ranran and senior brother Gao Cang, Wei Fang from JiuHua, and Mu Qingge.

Wei Fang was still annoyed by Gui Baqian’s trickery and kept complaining to the sisters from Kongshan sect.

The elder twin sister, Wen Bingqing, couldn’t take it anymore and said glaring, “He is Master Uncle Wen Hongshan’s cousin, just someone who found a connection in. Who knows what his background is? If you have the ability, when you see him later, go argue with him. What’s the point of complaining to us?”

Wei Fang, feeling embarrassed, shot her another look and then quickly walked ahead.

As the terrain of Tianmai Mountain was extremely high, the higher they went, the colder it became. Ranran opened the small package given to her by her second senior brother and found that besides the soft silver armor made by Uncle Master Zeng, inside there was also a warm coat to keep out the cold, as well as a pair of finger hooks that could be worn on the hands.

Unlike the common finger hooks, these hooks could be hidden when not in use, appearing as a beautiful chain accessory for a young girl. But when pressed, spikes could pop out.

Ranran hid behind the bushes, put on the coat and soft silver armor, and also the finger hooks. She took a deep breath and came out to say to Gao Cang, “Senior Brother, let’s move slowly. Remember to keep a distance from Gui Baqian when you see him later.”

Gao Cang nodded straightforwardly and asked, “Junior Sister, what do you think Gui Baqian is up to?”

Ranran lightly furrowed her brows and said in a small voice, “I always feel like he… is like…”

Before she could finish, the sound of birds chirping suddenly came from afar.

The other four people walking in front also stopped one after another. They saw a bright red firebird leading a group of birds from the mountains, soaring into the sky and circling while chirping.

Wei Fang saw this and couldn’t help but exclaim excitedly, “This… is the Lingguang Divine Lord!”

The so-called Lingguang Divine Lord was commonly known as the Vermilion Bird in folklore, just like the Gengjin White Tiger, both being divine beasts with supreme spiritual power.

However, the Vermilion Bird was inherently aloof and usually resided in the northern sea, rarely leaving any traces, making it extremely rare for anyone to see it with their own eyes.

For a cultivator, if they could tame the Vermilion Bird as their mount, would be extremely enticing. It’s akin to the luxurious chariots and prized horses of the secular world, a symbol of supreme honor.

Even if one couldn’t tame it, just injuring it to obtain some Vermilion Bird’s blood would not be bad either. It was said that this blood was an essential ingredient for refining the Nine Turns Resurrection Pill, a priceless item.

Encountering the Vermilion Bird and not obtaining some spiritual blood would be a waste of such a rare opportunity.

Moreover, the small size of the Vermilion Bird indicated that it was still a young bird, which is the best time for taming. In this moment, several younger disciples were all eager to try to subdue the Vermilion Bird.

Mu Qingge’s eyes also brightened. Choosing a mount was a matter of great importance for cultivators. If she could obtain a spiritual beast that benefited her, it would enhance her cultivation when she formed a Soul Contract with it.

Her elder sister had the Gengjin White Tiger back then, which looked majestic and made others envious. If she could also have a mount as excellent as the White Tiger, it would be worth being reborn…

Thinking of this, she dashed forward too.

Ranran, however, did not want that. Taking care of the little white tiger already took up a lot of her time; if she had another bird, it would be difficult to split her time fairly between them. As for obtaining the bird’s blood and such, Ranran was even less interested.

Shifu had once said that entering Tianmai Mountain not only tested one’s foundational spiritual power but also their character. Her Shifu had instructed her to come here just for a bath; she didn’t want to get involved in unnecessary trouble.

Every plant and tree here had been nurtured by the spiritual power of the ancient powerful being . She didn’t have much ability herself, so it was better not to be too greedy and desire what was beyond her reach.

So while Wei Fang and the others were climbing up the branches to look for the Vermilion Bird’s location, Ranran and the eldest senior brother actually walked to the front.

After passing through a mountain hollow, the entire forest suddenly became quiet, and the sounds of birds chirping ceased.

Gao Cang was bewildered and muttered to himself, “Why did the sounds stop so suddenly? Could it be that Wei Fang and the others have already caught the Vermilion Bird?”

However, Ranran looked around vigilantly and whispered, “No, it seems like we’ve entered some kind of spiritual shield that isolates us from the outside world.”

But as soon as she turned her head, the eldest senior brother was also gone, leaving her by herself. Ranran called out for him a few times, took a deep breath and decided to continue forward.

The environment here was completely different from the dense and majestic atmosphere of Tianmai Mountain. The ground was paved with stone slabs, and there were fences with chrysanthemums, apricot trees, and thatched cottages ahead, giving off a pastoral vibe of “picking chrysanthemums under the eastern fence, leisurely watching the southern mountains.”

Who could be living in this dangerous place surrounded by fierce beasts, in the vast and lonely mountains.

Previous
Next

Seeing this little countryside dwelling, Xue Ranran cautiously pulled out her mechanism staff.

After experiencing the enticing and dangerous water demon from the Wangxiang river incident, who knew if this cottage in front of her was some demon’s illusion, intending to take people’s lives.

Ranran bravely walked along the stone path for a while but found that the path was soft, like wet soil. After taking a few steps, she saw patches of green sprouts.

She often helped Su Yishui dry medicinal herbs and immediately recognized that all the herbs here were medicinal.

Just then, she heard someone in the courtyard saying, “Strange, why is someone here so early? Could it be some ignorant bumpkin who doesn’t know the value of that Vermilion Bird?”

Ranran looked closely and saw an old man with white hair and beard, wearing Taoist robes and lifting up his trousers, examining several rows of green seedlings in the ground.

Ranran blinked hesitantly… This old man with white hair and beard… wasn’t he Elder Jiu from Cuiwei Mountain?

He had gifted her with many talismans back then, all precious life-saving treasures!

But when Ranran smiled and waved at him, the old man looked at her indifferently, seemingly not recognizing her.

Ranran didn’t immediately call out his name but tentatively asked, “Old sir, how have you been lately?”

The old man didn’t respond but stood up straight, examining her up and down. After a while, he suddenly asked, “Young girl, have you ever eaten Dragon Molt?”

Ranran, following her gourmand instincts, asked in return, “Dragon Molt? What does it taste like?”

The old man replied unhurriedly, “Very fishy and stinky; a sip of it will be unforgettable for a lifetime.”

After this hint by the old man, Ranran immediately thought of the disgusting medicine her master once gave her to drink, making her unable to eat for days.

She had asked Su Yishui what it was back then, but he refused to tell her, saying it was better for her not to know. Could it be… that drink was the Dragon molt the old man mentioned?

Seeing no reply from Ranran, the old man didn’t seem to mind either. He just took another look at her again and said, “Dragon molt can conceal a person’s spiritual essence, making it difficult to discern the cycle of reincarnation. What kind of demon are you? That you need to disguise this way?’

Ranran crouched down, glanced at the crops he was planting, and cleverly replied, “I’m just an ordinary little girl. I don’t understand what you’re talking about, sir. Those who can live in these deep mountains must be immortals. Do you have a demon-revealing mirror to test on me?”

The old man grinned, no longer concerned about whether she was human or demon, and went straight to ask, ‘Why don’t you go and contend for that Vermilion Bird?’

Ranran smiled, “In this world, there are many other things as precious as the Vermilion Bird. If we try to claim everything that we see as ours, won’t that be so exhausting. Besides, who knows if a misfortune might turn out to be a blessing? If I hadn’t come here earlier, how could I have met you, Old Sir… The Huai Shan and Dang Gui in your field are really good things. When cooked with black chicken, they are not only delicious but also nutritious and beneficial for health!'”

The old man listened to Ranran’s playful reply and laughed heartily again, “I thought you were a saint, turns out you’re just a greedy lazy girl! It’s a pity, this is just an illusion. These herbs can’t be used to make chicken soup for you.”

Xue Ranran blinked a few times, and reached out to touch the herbs. Sure enough, there was nothing there at her touch.

However, the old man looked around the scenery with great nostalgia and said slowly, “When I first met Dun Tian, I was just a teenager. He lived on the mountain, I lived below. Like a teacher and friend, really unforgettable. Later, he ascended, and I focused on cultivation, thinking we would meet again in the immortal realm. But who knew when I ascended, he had turned into nothingness, such is fate…”

Ranran listened, blinking at the old man. It seemed he was already over a hundred years old… She thought for a moment and suddenly asked, “May I ask if you know Elder Jiu?”

The old man nodded with a smile, “You actually know my younger brother? No wonder you used Little Jiu’s talisman when you were crossing the bridge.”

Ranran nodded and said, “I’ve had a brief encounter with Elder Jiu before, and drank wine once with him. You really look like Elder Jiu, just missing a red wine-soaked nose. That talisman had been given to me by Elder Jiu.”

When she first saw this old man, she thought Elder Jiu had come here from Cuiwei Mountain.

But seeing his steady demeanor, with an aura of an old immortal, completely different from Elder Jiu’s mischievous childlike temperament, she ventured to guess that this old man should be the powerful brother of Elder Jiu, The Medicine Immortal who had already ascended. That’s why she asked.

However, she wondered why he, who had ascended long ago, would appear in Tianmai Mountain and seem to be very updated with the situation of these younger disciples passing through the trials.

The Medicine Immortal laughed after hearing Ranran’s words, “My brother had very few close friends in his life, never knew he made such a young friend like you. But now, it does seem like you have some extraordinary qualities…”

As he spoke, he picked up the whisk hanging from his waist and waved it in the air, revealing the situation at the Vermilion Bird’s location.

The originally pheasant-sized Vermilion Bird, for some reason, had suddenly increased several times in size, its slightly curved beak emitting a deafening cry, its giant claws scratching at the approaching people frantically.

Wei Fang was even picked up by the Vermilion Bird and thrown fiercely towards a steep cliff.

The remaining people were also in a sorry state. The Wen twins couldn’t be bothered about the others and hurriedly followed the path that Ranran was on, turning around the mountain stream and fleeing in panic.

Mu Qingge, on the other hand, dealt with the situation calmly, dodging quickly with her agile skills. However, Ranran noticed that, in the chaos, Mu Qingge took out many mud-like balls from her pocket and threw them onto the slope…

But strangely, the scene that followed with these panicked people who turned around and followed Ranran’s path wasn’t the stone path, thatched cottages and herb fields, but a dense forest and a stream.

It seemed Ranran’s guess was correct; she and senior brother had indeed stumbled upon a place like the legendary Wuling Fishermen’s otherworldly grounds—not the Tianmai Mountain!

With another wave of his whisk, the Medicine Immortal showed another valley, where Brother Baqian who crossed the Snake Bridge early was fighting, not with the Vermilion Bird, but with a hornless black dragon.

The black dragon looked fierce, but it was already severely injured by Gui Baqian. Covered in wounds, he finally twisted the black dragon’s neck, opened its belly, took out its gallbladder, and swallowed it in one gulp.

After eating the dragon’s gall, Gui Baqian casually threw the spiritual beast’s body into the mountain stream. He wiped his mouth, and continued forward.

Ranran was curious, “Why didn’t he encounter the Vermilion Bird?”

The Medicine Immortal smiled, “He’s not on the righteous path; the Vermilion Bird’s blood is useless to him, but the black dragon’s gall is greatly beneficial. The spiritual beasts you encounter here are born from human greed. They only face their own temptations. Lacking ability, undeserving virtue, they only magnify their greed infinitely. With only brute force and no compassion, they will eventually be consumed by uncontrolled greed… Of course, those who can kill spiritual beasts also pass the test and are qualified to enter the pool… It’s a pity for that black dragon. Last time, it only lost its skin, but this time, its gall was taken…”

Ranran suddenly recalled that she had once drunk dragon molt. How could her master possess such a precious thing? It was priceless!

Could it be her Shifu Su Yishui, who defeated the black dragon last time? But the elderly man said that only those not on the righteous path would encounter the black dragon, right?

Ranran was confused and nodded helplessly, “Tianmai Mountain’s powerful being Dun Tian must have trained many outstanding disciples before. Just like my Shifu who enjoys putting people through rigorous tests. However, aren’t these tests too cold-blooded and harsh? There has already been many deaths from yesterday till now.”

The Medicine Immortal retracted his whisk, his smile slightly reduced, “Even though the trials are horrifying, aren’t people even more attracted to it? Great Immortal Dun Tian sat in loneliness and turned into a mountain. His ancient divine power condensed into his eyes, evolving into pools. To obtain such pure divine power from the Great Immortal, how could it be obtained easily without paying a price? My task is to come here every ten years and supervise those who pass the trials. However, you have passed too quickly, which really surprised me.”

Ranran scratched her head in embarrassment, feeling like she had *stumbled upon a treasure unknowingly. She then asked politely, “My eldest senior brother and I are not the most talented among these people. It’s just a coincidence that we came here. May I ask where he is?”
*瞎猫撞到了死耗子 literally a blind cat who stumbled onto a dead rat

The Medicine Immortal said calmly, “He didn’t pass through with his own strength but was led here by you. So even though he glimpsed the immortal realm, he was immediately bounced out. As long as he doesn’t try to kill the Vermilion Bird, he should be fine. This is an illusion formed from my secular memories before I ascended. Your ability to enter here is also a fate connection with me.”

Ranran tilted her head and asked, “Do you have to give up the joys of mortals when you became an immortal? What’s the point of becoming an immortal then?”

The Medicine Immortal smiled, “Without worldly desires of mortals, there’s no joy or sorrow. What then is unhappiness?”

Since Ranran heard that her senior brother should be fine, she relaxed a little and asked, “Old sir, in that case when can I leave, otherwise it will be dark soon, and I’m afraid my senior brother will get lost.”

Medicine Immortal’s smile deepened as he looked at this whimsical and clever girl and said, “Although your spiritual power is not profound, your intelligence and adaptability is the best among these people. Although the Dragon molt has obscured your innate spiritual foundation, you are by no means ordinary. Because of your outstanding performance, you now have the opportunity to choose the Marrow Cleansing Spirit Pool first. Follow me.”

Ranran followed behind the old man. Just a few steps in, she saw a chubby boy poking his round head out of a grass hut, holding a water jug and crying, “Big brother, what’s in here, it’s so spicy! I don’t want to drink this, I want to drink goat’s milk!”

Ranran was momentarily stunned. Although the boy was young, his eyebrows and eyes, especially the pouting expression of stubbornness, resembled Elder Jiu, who was fond of drinking.

She stopped for a moment, realizing that this boy had repeatedly cried out from inside the house, and his words were exactly the same each time.

Ranran suddenly understood, that these were the memories that Medicine Immortal found hardest to let go of as a mortal. And the person he found hardest to let go of should be his younger brother.

However, no matter how the boy cried, the old Medicine Immortal didn’t turn back. He just floated in mid-air with crossed legs, leaving this illusionary scene, leading Ranran through a bamboo forest, to a mist-covered poolside.

As the mist dispersed, Ranran discovered that there were actually two lake-like pools here. The surrounding mountain ridges and huge rocks were fully exposed, giving the impression of an old wrinkled face, with the two pools resembling the eyes on the face.

However, these two pools were quite different. One was milky white like cow’s milk, while the other was a deep pitch black.

Medicine Immortal pointed and said, “This is the Marrow Cleansing Pool. You can choose whichever one you like.”

Ranran looked at the two pools, both exuding profound and mysterious energies. She couldn’t help but ask curiously, “May I ask, Great Immortal, what is the difference between these two pools?”

Medicine Immortal said mildly, “Both are the divine powers that cultivators dream of. Before Dun Tian ascended, he once fell into demonic cultivation, where good and evil were hard to separate. He feared losing control, so he divided his spiritual power into two pools. The white one follows a gradual path, slightly slower in spiritual advancement. The black one, however, can advance one’s cultivation rapidly, but…”

At this point, he paused, then continued, “After bathing in the black water, one must sever emotions and resolve, and give up their deepest love in this lifetime.”

Ranran gasped at this and thought for a moment before saying, “My Shifu and Grandmaster Mu should have chosen the white pool, right? Life might be short, but we shouldn’t be too hasty. I will build up my spiritual power slowly .”

The Medicine Immortal was not surprised that this free-spirited girl would choose the white pool. But since she mentioned Grandmaster Mu, did she mean Mu Qingge?

When Medicine Immortal asked, Ranran nodded honestly.

Medicine Immortal looked at her with some surprise and said with a smile, “So, you’re Mu Qingge’s grand-disciple. No wonder, no wonder…”

When he asked about her master, Ranran said, “Of course, it’s Su Yishui from XiShan.”

Upon hearing this, the divine smile on the old man’s face disappeared instantly. He looked at her in astonishment and said, “You said your master is Su Yishui? The son of the former Prince Ping?”

Ranran nodded, feeling puzzled. “Old Immortal, do you know my Shifu?”

Medicine Immortal’s smile completely faded, his expression cold as he extended his finger to calculate for a while. Finally, as if encountering an unsolvable problem, he shook his head and sighed, “Forget it, forget it. What heaven decrees is not necessarily what fate dictates…”

With that, he said no more, waved his whisk, and turned to leave, leaving Ranran standing alone by the poolside.

It wasn’t until he disappeared into the mist that a faint voice came, “Your master’s choice back then was different from yours.”

Ranran was confused, not quite understanding what the Old Immortal meant.

Was her Shifu’s choice different from hers? Did he choose not to bathe in the pool, or… did he choose that eerie and terrifying black pool?

But thinking about it, there should be some ambiguity in the Old immortal’s words. Shifu is a person of integrity, how could he choose the black pool that extinguishes human relationships and true love?

It must be some misunderstanding in his words.

But she also needed to quickly bathe in the pool and go down the mountain. After all, her seniors were all still waiting for her.

So, she took off her shoes and outer clothes, slowly walked into the pool glowing with light, and as soon as she entered the pool, she immediately felt an indescribable warmth gathering in her dantian, circulating throughout her body along her meridians. Ranran involuntarily closed her eyes, floating on the surface of the water…

When she opened her eyes again, she found herself suspended in mid-air, feeling an inexplicable heaviness of spiritual energy on her body. This feeling of a filled dantian seemed to also be very calming and sets one at ease.

And at some unknown point, the Geng jin White Tiger had been sitting by the side of the pool, looking at her with an indescribable sense of melancholy, appearing mysterious and profound…

When Ranran lightly landed on the ground with her toes, she found that her clothes were completely dry. She asked the White Tiger, “Are you going to have a bathe too?”

But the white tiger slowly turned its head and looked towards the other side of the black pool. Following its gaze, Ranran saw someone in the black pool.

As she approached, splashes of water flew from the black pool, and suddenly, a shirtless man emerged from the pool.

That dark face was unmistakable; it was Gui Baqian, who had single-handedly defeated the black dragon earlier.

Clearly, they had all arrived at the same destination despite taking different paths. Although he captured spiritual beasts by succumbing to greed, his overpowering strength still earned him the qualification to enter the pool.

But he had chosen the Black Pool for rapid cultivation. At this moment, the water in that pool seemed a bit lighter, while the depths of his eyes remained black and indiscernible.

Ranran noticed the stark contrast of the skin between his face and his body, making his dark face even more conspicuous against his white body…

At this moment, Gui Baqian seemed to have just noticed Ranran standing in the white pool. He raised an eyebrow in surprise and said, “You actually made it here too?”

Ranran cautiously took a few steps back but didn’t say anything.

Just then, Gui Baqian seemed to have finished soaking. He leaped out of the water and charged straight at Ranran!

Although the little girl seemed quite capable and qualified to enter the Marrow-cleansing pool, Gui Baqian felt that there should only be one winner here. Tianmai Mountain truly did not judge strength accurately, allowing a laughable weakling like her to enter the white pool.

So, he decided to make the choice for heaven and eliminate this useless thing!

And so, his attack was a ruthless kill move and aimed directly at Ranran’s throat.

However, as he approached, there was a loud “clang” as if Gui Baqian had hit an invisible barrier and was instantly rebounded.

It so happens that there was a spiritual shield between the black and white pools. Once a choice was made, there was no turning back, and one couldn’t soak in both pools simultaneously.

Seeing the ferocious Gui Baqian unable to break through, Ranran felt completely relieved. She slowly opened her mouth and said with a smile, “Wei Jiu, have you no shame, pretending to be a disciple of the Kongshan Sect to cheat your way into the pool?”

Gui Baqian stabilized his posture upon hearing this and squinted at Ranran, saying, “How did you recognize me?”

Ranran leisurely put on her shoes and outer clothes, tilted her head, and said, “When you crossed Snake Bridge, your movement technique seemed familiar to me. I have a good memory, so I immediately remembered your fight with Shifu in the forest. And… your name is *Gui Baqian. If you add ‘woman,’ it becomes ‘Wei Jiu’…… When I thought about your ambiguous appearance, neither male nor female, I immediately realized that you are Wei Jiu.”
魏 = 禾 +女+ 鬼 禾=八+千
Another ‘coincidence’ is 禾 is read as ‘he’, so his name is quite literally he,she,ghost

In fact, the name Wei Jiu was just something he casually used; he had never intended to imply anything about his naturally feminine appearance?

Everything else Ranran said was fine, but she inadvertently hit Wei Jiu’s raw nerve, telling him to his face that he looked like a woman. This made Gui Baqian clench his fists and smirk coldly. He then tore off his mask, revealing his androgynous face… indeed, he was the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu!

“You little brat, what’s your name again?” he asked through gritted teeth, his eyes gleaming with malice.

Ranran wasn’t going to answer him. After saying that, she made a face at Wei Jiu and ran away at top speed, with the white tiger at her side.

Wei Jiu swung his fist again. This time, he actually cracked the invisible barrier like a spider web. “You little brat, next time we meet will be your end!”

Meanwhile, Ranran fled like the wind from the marrow-cleansing pool, but she no longer saw the Medicine Immortal or the cottage and medicinal fields. Instead, she went straight back to the valley where they had separated from the others earlier.

Seeing Ranran return, Gao Cang, who had been frantically searching for her like a headless fly, was crying with joy. “Junior sister, where did you go? You nearly worried me to death…”

As he looked closely at Ranran, Gao Cang’s voice grew softer and softer until he couldn’t help but ask, “Junior sister, what’s that on your forehead?”

Hearing that, Ranran walked to the stream nearby, using its surface to look at her reflection. To her surprise, there was a flower-shaped pattern on her forehead, resembling the character “mai” in seal script.

At that moment, those who had been struggling with Vermilion Bird like Mu Qingge, Weifang and the others also approached. When Mu Ranwu saw the pattern on Ranran’s forehead, she was immediately shocked and widened her eyes, “How… have you already entered the marrow-cleansing pool?”

For the younger generation of cultivators, being able to enter the marrow-cleansing pool meant a smooth cultivation path in the future. Those who entered the pool would eventually become the heads of major sects, whether in the immortal or demonic path, reaching a level of cultivation that others could only dream of.

Mu Ranwu knew well that her elder sister entering the marrow-cleansing pool, was an important step on the path to fame and power in the past.

Although she had acquired most of her elder sister’s spiritual power, this body was brand new. If she could cleanse her meridians and enhance her cultivation in the marrow-cleansing pool, the benefits would have been immense.

Most importantly, she had hoped that the marrow-cleansing pool would help her break free from the control of Grudge water. Who would have thought that Xue Ranran would bypass all obstacles with such ease like she had divine assistance, and successfully gain the opportunity to enter the pool.

Upon hearing Mu Ranwu’s words, Wei fang, covered in bloodstains, also noticed by now. He howled in frustration, “You worthless person, how could you be eligible to enter the pool? You must have pulled some trick when we were fighting the Vermilion Bird!”

As he spoke, he began to believe his own words, and he actually reached out to attack Ranran.

In the past, although Ranran could dodge, she definitely couldn’t confront Wei fang head-on and win. However, this time, she not only evaded skillfully but also handled it effortlessly, flicking Weifang’s forehead on a whim.

Although it seemed like only a playful action, this seemingly light flick sent Wei fang flying straight into the bushes.

渔翁得利 THE THIRD PARTY WINS

This time, not to mention others, even Ranran herself was shocked—she did not really exert much force just now, so how could the power be so great?

But the benefit of this attack was that the disciples of the other prestigious sects who used to look down on Xi Shan as insignificant rookies wouldn’t easily speak disrespectfully anymore.

In just half a day, the cultivation of Xue Ranran had far surpassed those disciples who had been cultivating for decades in the path of cultivation.

When Mu Qingge had emerged from the marrow-cleansing pool in the past, she quickly gained fame and enjoyed a long period of glory. If she hadn’t later taken the wrong path and opened the gates of the Netherworld Realm privately, she might very well have become the leader of immortal cultivation world, a great figure admired by the masses.

The same was true for Su Yishui. After coming out of the marrow-cleansing pool, his power increased significantly. In fact, he could even surpass his own Master, even rebel and defeat Mu Qingge, helping the righteous path to uphold justice.

But they were originally outstanding individuals. Now, this rookie Ranran, who couldn’t even be ranked among the disciples of immortal cultivation, had leaped through the ranks like this.

It won’t be hard to imagine, that her future would be incredibly splendid, far beyond their reach.

The two sisters, Bingqing and Yujie, were more composed in their thoughts. They didn’t show frustration like Weifang did, and with a smile that barely maintained their dignity, they congratulated Xue Ranran with a respectful bow.

However, Mu Ranwu glanced at the resentful Weifang and others, reminding in a soft voice, “Congratulations, Miss Xue, but… you must be careful. The spiritual power infused into the marrow-cleansing pool is too strong, and your blood may not absorb it immediately. As long as the floral pattern on your forehead hasn’t disappeared, you must be cautious about your body, never let it bleed… There have been cases in the past where powerful individuals entered the marrow-cleansing pool and were ambushed by malicious companions, losing their blood’s spiritual power…”

Her words seemed caring towards Xue Ranran, but they were filled with dangerous implications—The *present Mu Qingge, although her spiritual power had greatly increased, still couldn’t fully control it. Her blood was full of abundant spiritual power, essentially a human Vermilion Bird. If someone drank her blood, it would be akin to advancing in the marrow-cleansing pool.
( novel maybe a little confusing because we as readers know that Mu Qingge is Xue Ranran but to the characters, Mu Ranwu is Mu Qingge )

Indeed, as soon as these words were spoken, including Weifang who just stood up, their expressions subtly changed, their gazes towards Ranran becoming peculiar.

They had paid a great price on their journey here, and to end up empty-handed now, how could they leave contentedly?

…If what that Mu Qingge said was true, then drinking Xue Ranran’s blood might be an opportunity to turn it all around.

Thinking this way, the two sisters Bingqing and Yujie also exchanged glances that only they understood.

Ranran immediately sensed the subtle changes in these few people. Elder Mu was really formidable with her words, stirring up murderous intent and evil thoughts in the remaining ones with just a few sentences.

If they joined forces, Ranran wasn’t sure if she could easily defeat them right now. But she wasn’t afraid; she had never seen a ferocious beast in the forest pause to hunt when a fire was raging, so she just needed to divert their attention.

As the group slowly closed in, Ranran kindly alerted them, “Fellow Taoists, another person has also entered the marrow-cleansing pool this time, it’s Gui Baqian, and also… have you noticed, Gui Baqian is actually the demon lord Wei Jiu in disguise!”

As expected, the faces of the crowd paled, but the sharp-eyed Ranran noticed that Mu Qingge had remained calm, seemingly unsurprised.

Ranran continued, “So before Wei Jiu catches up, let’s hurry down the mountain!”

After speaking, Ranran grabbed her senior brother, preparing to leave first.

However, the twin sisters from Kongshan sect suddenly used earth techniques, trapping her feet. Wen Bingqing smiled, “Tianmai Mountain is so vast. If what you said is true, that Gui Baqian is Wei Jiu, if he intends to chase us, how can we escape? Only by working together can we repel the demon… How about this, Miss Xue, you share some spiritual blood with us, so we can also become your right-hand men and defeat the demon Wei Jiu together!”

In Wen Bingqing’s view, Ranran giving some blood, not harming her life, and benefiting everyone, why wouldn’t she do it?

The others’ eyes lit up upon hearing this, finding it very reasonable.

Ranran was speechless, realizing another life lesson—although animals don’t kill each other when fleeing in panic, she was facing… humans! Some people were worse than animals; in times of danger, they would do unthinkable and despicable things…

Gao Cang was infuriated by Wen Bingqing’s nonsense and immediately retorted, “You’re talking nonsense! Why don’t you share your thick skin? My junior sister entered the marrow-cleansing pool based on her abilities. Why should she share her hard-earned spiritual power with you?”

But thick-skinned people were everywhere. Ranran noticed that the positions of these few people had changed, forming a circle around her and her senior brother. If they acted together, it would indeed be difficult to deal with.

Weifang considered himself righteous, always speaking honourably. He also smiled superficially and said, “Miss Wen is right. Miss Xue wouldn’t watch others die. You just need to give some blood, which can save so many people. I believe your master will be pleased with you.”

Ranran couldn’t be bothered with these self-righteous people and pulled her senior brother to leave.

However, Wen’s sisters jumped up to block them, and Weifang drew his sword, intending to cut Ranran’s wrist. But before they could approach, Ranran deftly dodged and swept out with a mechanism stick, sending the Wen sisters flying.

Seeing them fly out like kites with broken strings, Ranran was also dumbfounded. She used to rely on tricks like running away, deceiving, and swindling when fighting with others, never directly confronting them.

She had no idea that, after coming out of the marrow-cleansing pool, her strength had such lethality.

The techniques Su Yishui had taught her before could not be used due to the lack of spiritual power, but now they surged in her mind. The subsequent battle was overwhelmingly one-sided. In just a few rounds, the Wen sisters and Weifang couldn’t no longer get back up.

Gao Cang didn’t expect that he hadn’t even acted, yet his junior sister easily won. He couldn’t help but laugh heartily, “With you bunch of amateurs, even if you were given spiritual blood, it wouldn’t save you!”

At this moment, Xue Ranran looked at Mu Qingge, who had been provoking others earlier. She hadn’t acted until now, just watching them fight coldly.

Only after Xue Ranran won decisively did she smile faintly, “Congratulations, Miss Xue, after entering the marrow-cleansing pool, you have indeed been transformed.”

Ranran used to have some good feelings towards Elder Mu. Although her reputation wasn’t good, she was someone who followed her feelings, which suited Ranran’s taste.

But in their recent dealings with Mu Qingge, Ranran started to feel… dislike towards her, feeling that she was similar to those hypocrites from Jiuhua Sect.

Thinking this, Xue Ranran exuded a full-on jianghu fighter’s aura and clasped her fists, “Elder Mu, there are no more people to fool now. Are you prepared to compete with me in literary or martial arts?”

Mu Ranwu had been silently estimating Xue Ranran’s current strength by the side.

Ranran was originally an immature fruit lacking innate spiritual force, so Mu Ranwu, after verifying her identity, did not feel it was a pressing matter.

After all, it was her who had assumed Mu Qingge’s identity, inheriting most of the past-life spiritual powers, and being favored by the Emperor.

She still had the Grudge water poison in her, so why bother annoying Su Yishui and picking on Xue Ranran, a useless person?

But what was so unexpected, was how blessed Xue Ranran’s life turned out to be, right? She actually managed to break through the trial levels with her mediocre spiritual power and finally got the opportunity to enter the pool.

Mu Ranwu had planned everything meticulously, but she failed to factor in Xue Ranran’s damned good luck.

Just now, she had silently estimated that Ranran’s current spiritual power was not inferior to her own. If they were to fight head-on, it would be another fierce battle.

However, Xue Ranran said she had no one useful left? That wasn’t necessarily true!

Thinking this, Mu Ranwu smiled faintly and said loudly, “Wei Jiu, come out! Didn’t you ask me last night if I would spend the night with you? Well, your chance is here. Let’s see if you can seize it?”

With her words, a somewhat familiar arrogant laughter came from the nearby tall tree, “Mu Qingge, the little girl is right. Why do you always order others around now, but not step up yourself?”

As she spoke, Wei Jiu jumped down from the tree, staring keenly at Mu Qingge.

It had been twenty years since he last saw this woman. So when Wei Jiu got the chance last night, he couldn’t wait to sit next to Mu Qingge and do some catching up.

At first, when Wen Hongshan found him and stated directly that it was at Mu Qingge’s request, to retrieve that key.

Wei Jiu had thought Wen Hongshan could be a useful pawn, so he proposed that Wen Hongshan find a way to help him infiltrate the marrow-cleansing pool Meet.

This Meet had always been controlled by their righteous faction, so a demonic cultivator like Wei Jiu naturally could never enter. Moreover, Tianmai Mountain was within the territory of the righteous faction, making it difficult to assail.

In the past, Wei Jiu had no interest in this paltry amount of cultivation, but after losing most of his core, he naturally had to find a way to make up for it. That’s when he remembered about the marrow-cleansing pool.

What righteous disciples, they were just a bunch of hypocrites wrapped in human skin.

That Wen Hongshan wasn’t a decent woman either, so Wei Jiu appealed to her interests, suggesting that during the heavenly tribulation, he would help her get rid of her mentor, making it easier for her to take control of the sect.

Every sect had unique divine treasures, and without being the sect leader, it was hard to use these things to further one’s cultivation.

If Abbess Wen still could not ascend and continue to occupy the sect leader’s position for decades more, Wen Hongshan would then be unable to use those treasures for herself, and probably become anxious.

After hesitating for a long time, Wen Hongshan finally agreed.

Thus, the deal was struck. Wei Jiu used some means to make Abbess Wen pass away convincingly during the heavenly tribulation.

With Wen Hongshan’s help, he took on the identity of a Kongshan sect disciple and smoothly blended into Tianmai Mountain.

However, in Wei Jiu’s critical eyes, why did Mu Qingge look slightly inferior after her rebirth?….. Although her features were similar, she lacked the wildness and carefree spirit she had before.

Actually, what was most alluring about Mu Qingge in her previous life had been her unbridled free spirit. Every time Wei Jiu imagined completely subduing this woman, getting her beneath him, his blood surged, as if possessed by a demon.

But then again she was now reborn as a young girl, so naturally, there would be some changes in appearance.

Last night, he teased her with words, but she only smiled without responding, which was more pleasing than her previous indifference to him in her past life.

Now, she unexpectedly brought up his flirting from last night. Wei Jiu raised his eyebrows in surprise.

Hearing Wei Jiu’s mocking words, Mu Ranwu smiled slightly, raised her chin elegantly, and did not avoid Wei Jiu’s impudent gaze. She said softly, “You poisoned me with the Grudge water, didn’t you anticipate that I would eventually come to you to detoxify? But now, although you have entered the marrow-cleansing pool, you have ultimately shared the spiritual power of the pool. Even if I wanted to rely on you, I’m afraid you don’t have the ability to detoxify me…”

Her method of fanning the flames are just as effective. As long as there was greed in people’s hearts, they would knowingly walk into traps.

Ranran thought to herself: Not good!

Sure enough, Wei Jiu turned his gaze towards Xue Ranran and said with a big smile, “Your Grandmaster is right. I don’t want her to suffer too much either. If I had more spiritual power, maybe I could help her to detoxify quicker. Do you want to take the initiative? I promise to cleanly break your neck when the time comes, without letting you feel any pain.”

Gao Cang yelled in anger, “My junior sister is not a nutritious soup, for you all to divide among yourselves!”

After saying that, he prepared to rush forward and fight them to the death. But before he could reach them, Ranran was a step ahead of him. She grabbed him and threw her senior brother to the other side of the broken bridge.

Wei Jiu had just entered the pool of darkness, rapidly improving his cultivation level. Gao Cang rashly attacking would be like hitting a rock with an egg.

“Senior Brother, you go down the mountain quickly and inform the Second Uncle Master and the others that Wei Jiu is here, so they need to prepare quickly!”

Gao Cang understood that with Wei Jiu here, perhaps disciples of the Crimson Gate were also present, making it very dangerous for those below the mountain. Thinking this, he knew he couldn’t help here and quickly ran down the mountain to inform them.

However, when he reached halfway down the mountain and looked back, he found that Wei Fang and the others had also come down the mountain. He couldn’t help but shout in urgently, “Why did you all come down? Leaving only my junior sister to fight the demon alone?”

It turned out that after Ranran threw Gao Cang over just now, Wei Fang and the others also asked Ranran to find a way to send them over.

Ranran was confronting Wei Jiu and couldn’t be bothered to throw them one by one, so she wrapped the fishing line from her pocket around a copper coin. With just a gentle toss, she shot the coin into the cliff on the opposite side.

So they all used light body techniques to step on the fishing line and cross the valley, catching up with Gao Cang along the way.

Upon hearing Gao Cang’s question, Wei Fang’s face didn’t change as he said without shame, “We haven’t entered the marrow-cleansing pool, so how can we be Wei Jiu’s opponents? Of course, we came down to call for reinforcements!”

“Aiyah!” Gao Cang stomped his foot in frustration and turned to run back up the mountain. However, he wasn’t proficient in light body techniques, so he couldn’t step on the fishing line to cross the valley. He could only watch as his little junior sister fought Wei Jiu alone.

Meanwhile, Xue Ranran, after everyone left, wielded her mechanical staff and engaged in a fight with Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu, who had been ridiculed by this girl as neither a man nor a woman just now, was truly annoyed. Remembering how she had made a fool of him so many times before, even if Mu Qingge didn’t say anything to provoke him, he definitely already wanted to kill this brat!

However, seeing those righteous disciples who were clamoring to divide her spiritual blood just now, how they have all fled at lightning speed, Wei Jiu couldn’t help but laugh while fighting.

“You little brat, you’re the only one left. Look, those so-called righteous people don’t care about you at all. Even if you die, no one will collect your corpse. You’ll just become a pile of bones in the wilderness. I’m someone who values talent. If you’re willing, I’ll overlook the past and accept you under my wing. How about it?”

But Ranran wouldn’t have it! She heard that Wei Jiu had very few female disciples, and it seemed that even the female Elder was also his woman. If she fell into the hands of this lecherous demon, her innocence would be in danger!

Now that she was evenly matched with him and could handle his attacks with ease, her confidence soared. So, while fighting, she made faces at him and said, “To be my master, you need to be as handsome as a celestial! Look at you, do you think you are as handsome as my Shifu?”

This was the second time Wei Jiu had heard someone say he wasn’t as good-looking as Su Yishui. This hit another sore spot for Wei Jiu, his phoenix eyes widened with anger and his expression became savage.

“Ugly freak, how dare you mock me for being ugly? Watch how I crush you into pieces, and see if your master even recognizes you after that!”

After saying this, Wei Jiu didn’t hold back and started to attack mercilessly, intending to kill this sharp-tongued girl within a few moves.

Ranran was nearly hit several times by him, and her newly gained confidence dipped. While she could handle people like Wei Fang and the others easily, facing a high-level demonic cultivator like Wei Jiu was still beyond her.

After trying to block a few moves, Ranran’s hands were numb from the impact. She dared not resist head-on anymore and relied on her agile movements to dodge around Wei Jiu.

Unfortunately, she was now alone, and she didn’t know how long she could hold out. If she fell into Wei Jiu’s hands, it probably wouldn’t be as simple as draining a few sips of blood.

Considering Wei Jiu’s cruelty, what he said was likely true… Thinking of this, Ranran couldn’t afford to relax and focused all her attention on dealing with Wei Jiu.

But just then, a cold light flashed past and stabbed straight towards Ranran’s chest.

Ranran looked down and gasped. A short arrow, as thick as a chopstick, was lodged right in her chest, causing her to grimace in pain.

Ranran took a few steps back, swiftly pulled out the hidden arrow, and angrily shouted at Elder Mu who shot it, “What are you doing? Shooting arrows in secret?”

Luckily, Ranran was wearing the soft silver armor made by Uncle Master Zeng, so the arrow boosted by spiritual power only caused her some pain but didn’t penetrate her skin.

Shifu had told Ranran before, that it was not true that Uncle Master Zeng had no cultivation skills at all. It was just that he took the path of craftsmanship, so when he concentrated on making weapons, the items themselves were imbued by the spirit power of the craftsman, becoming extraordinary artifacts. The same principle applied to other weapons crafting, making them a different kind of cultivation.

So, even a small soft silver armor was enough to resist a hidden arrow imbued in spiritual power.

Mu Ranwu also didn’t expect that her well-planned ambush failed. She didn’t know what Ranran was wearing, but it seemed that she was impervious to weapons.

Although Wei Jiu was difficult to deal with, Mu Ranwu felt that Xue Ranran was a greater threat to her.

With no one else present, Mu Ranwu didn’t need to pretend to be friendly anymore. Seeing her ambush fail, she was ready to rush up and join forces with Wei Jiu, first eliminating Ranran, this unpredictable loose end.

But little did she know that when she rushed over, she was knocked back by Wei Jiu’s palm.

Mu Ranwu was somewhat astonished, while Wei Jiu sneered, “Are you mocking me for not being able to deal with even a little girl? Do you need to come help me?”

Men’s pride could be strange at times, generally summed up as: they don’t allow others to mock their incompetence.

This implication of “incompetence” could make a man furious, be it in bed or out of it!

Mu Ranwu obviously didn’t consider Wei Jiu’s pride, inadvertently highlighting his inadequacies.

Seeing that Wei Jiu wouldn’t let her intervene, she could only step back and watch Wei Jiu show off in front of a little girl.

Just as Ranran was being forced back by Wei Jiu again, the dense forest nearby started to shake. Suddenly, the small white tiger leaped out of the forest, clawing straight at Wei Jiu’s face.

It was too fast. Wei Jiu couldn’t dodge in time and was deeply scratched by the small claws.

In an instant, the small white tiger’s body suddenly grew larger, emitting a deafening roar.

The Geng jin White Tiger seemed to have regained some strength and could finally reveal its true form.

Ranran was overjoyed and quickly changed her stance, cooperating with the Geng jin white tiger to confront Wei Jiu together.

The white tiger seemed to have observed Ranran and the others practice their formation often and it could position itself accurately. Despite being the first time teaming up with Ranran, it seemed to anticipate Ranran’s moves, creating openings for her each time she shifted her position.

Their coordination was seamless.

Even though they were only a duo and couldn’t form a “pin” formation, their swift movements were actually even more effective than the coordination with Gao Cang and Qiu Xier!

Ranran knew the most crucial thing at that moment was to disrupt Wei Jiu’s attack rhythm. She focused her mind, using long-range attacks with her staff and close-range strikes with her fist hooks, while leaping and switching positions with the White Tiger to fight Wei Jiu. They managed to inflict several new wounds on Wei Jiu many times.

The White Tiger’s attacks were also ferocious, even rearing up on its hind legs a few times, with its sharp teeth and tiger claws landing their strikes without missing.

After several rounds, Wei Jiu lost his advantage, covered in wounds and gradually losing ground.

Having soaked in the Black Pool, he had pursued quick gains, which resulted in a surge of spiritual power but also came with drawbacks. Without a period of adjustment, he couldn’t fully unleash this sudden increase in power.

It’s worth noting that after Su Yi Shui absorbed more than half of Wei Jiu’s core, he had also gone into seclusion for over a month to recuperate.

Seeing himself besieged by Ranran and the white tiger, Wei Jiu couldn’t exert his full strength and started to falter.

His manly pride suddenly meant little to him. Wei Jiu couldn’t help but shout at Mu Qingge, who was leisurely watching the spectacle, “Didn’t you want her spiritual blood? Why aren’t you helping? Should I deliver her to your mouth?”

But Mu Ranwu just sneered; she could already see that Wei Jiu was struggling.

However, she didn’t comply with Wei Jiu’s wishes to join forces against their enemy.

The white tiger was too ferocious, its spiritual powers seemingly even more powerful compared to when it fought alongside her sister in her past life. Mu Ranwu cherished her chance of reincarnation dearly and would not allow any scars on her flawless skin.

In such a conflict where both sides would suffer great losses, regardless of who dies, she would be glad of it!

She carefully manipulated Wen Hongshan, saw through Wei Jiu’s intentions, and led him all the way here just to eliminate Wei Jiu in one fell swoop, so that she could avoid being under his control again!

Previous
Next



水下溶洞 UNDERWATER CAVE

Of course, Mu Ranwu had originally planned to secure her qualification to enter the pool first, then use the isolation characteristics of Tianmai Mountain against Wei Jiu. But she never expected that Xue Ranran would also enter Tianmai Mountain unexpectedly. In the end, she was like a blind cat who ran into a dead rat, and even won.

However, this was even better. If Wei Jiu and Xue Ranran could both perish together, then she would have no more future troubles!

Did Su Yishui think he was the only one who knew how to get rid of the poison?

Thinking that she might soon be able to detoxify the Grudge water poison, a faint smile of joy appeared on Mu Ranwu’s face…

Just as Wei Jiu called out to her again, Mu Ranwu snorted coldly, threw the last mysterious clay pill into a nearby gully, closed her eyes suddenly, silently chanted a spell to catalyze the clay pill, and then flew down the mountain.

The matter of Wei Jiu appearing in Tianmai Mountain must not be leaked out; otherwise, the conspiracy between her and Wen Hongshan would inevitably be exposed. So Mu Ranwu had to intercept them before Gao Cang and Wei Fang descends the mountain.

With this in mind, Mu Ranwu moved extremely fast, leaping over the suspension bridge in a few bounds, and chased after Wei Fang and the others.

Xue Ranran caught a glimpse of Elder Mu throwing the clay pill and remembered seeing her do something similar in the vision of Medicine Immortal. She couldn’t help but feel some doubt. Elder Mu had thrown so many clay pills; it couldn’t it be that she found carrying them cumbersome and obstructive?

Just then, she saw red mist rising from where the clay pill had fallen.

The White Tiger, entangled with Wei Jiu, suddenly let out a roar, at the same time it used its body to nudge Ranran, as if urging her to leave quickly. It was going to hold the rear for her.

Ranran had a bad feeling, but it was already too late to leave the mountain. The red mist spread rapidly, and the clay pills scattered around seemed to burst open, gradually releasing the mist.

When Ranran heard buzzing sounds, she realized that this “red mist” was actually densely packed red flying insects.

Wei Jiu also jumped back right then, no longer entangled in the fight. He quickly surveyed the area and immediately muttered, “This is bad!”

These insects initially looked like sesame seeds, but they seemed to grow rapidly in the wind, quickly reaching the size of soybeans. In the blink of an eye, the entire mountain was covered with them.

Wei Jiu seemed to recognize these insects and his fair face began to darken with anger. “Immortal Devouring Bugs! Has Mu Qingge lost her mind? She actually summoned these things!”

These red insects seemed to have a common target and they all rushed towards Wei Jiu, Ranran, and the white tiger.

Ranran quickly wielded her mechanical staff, creating a vortex of airflow to block the insects.

However, one or two still landed on her arms and neck.

In the instant they bit her, Ranran felt her arms and neck go numb, and at the same time, her just replenished dantian suddenly felt uncomfortable, as if being drained of spiritual energy.

Just then, the white tiger swiftly pounced toward Ranran, using its body to surround her and blocking the first wave of attacks from the red insects.

Ranran buried her face in the soft fur of the white tiger. She heard the white tiger’s whimpers of pain in her ear. These red insects were just as formidable even when biting divine beasts.

These Immortal Devouring Bugs were not creatures of the mortal realm; they live on devouring spiritual energy. Their sharp mouths could penetrate flesh and bone, and once they targeted someone, they would continuously drain their spiritual energy.

At the moment when the White Tiger shielded Ranran, its body was immediately covered with a layer of red insects. Fortunately, it had thick fur, which temporarily resisted them.

Taking advantage of this moment, the white tiger half stood up and whispered in Ranran’s ear in human language, “Hold on to me, I’m going into the water!”

Ranran was startled by what the white tiger said by her ear because that deep voice… was clearly her Shifu, Su Yishui!

With no time to think, Ranran quickly grabbed the fur on its belly. The white tiger then jumped into the deep valley under the snake bridge in a flying leap.

Before jumping down, Ranran caught a glimpse of Wei Jiu igniting True Fire to burn those insects. Initially effective, Wei Jiu’s True Fire was also fueled by spiritual energy. Dealing with these weird insects that feasted on marrow and essence, it was apparent that this was a futile attempt.

Although many of the insects were burned to death, even more insects swarmed in, and they managed to suppress the flames in Wei Jiu’s palm. Soon, Wei Jiu’s body was covered in a layer of red insects, looking extremely creepy!

Ranran didn’t know what happened next because she and the white tiger had plunged into the deep valley. The valley was very deep, and after falling for what seemed a very long time, they finally fell heavily into deep water.

Immediately afterward, Wei Jiu, who was screaming from being bitten, also jumped down. The tremendous impact of entering the water temporarily dispersed the Immortal Devouring Bugs covering his body.

Unfortunately, these Immortal Devouring Bugs had already tasted the deliciousness of absorbing spiritual energy and were rushing towards the water, seemingly unafraid of it.

After Wei Jiu entered the water, he saw that the White Tiger was leading Ranran toward a cave below the water pool, so he hurriedly followed.

It turned out that the cave under the water pool was connected to another cave. After passing through a water passage, they climbed into the cave.

Ranran was the only one of the three who hadn’t been severely bitten, so her strength was still considerable. She quickly used her spiritual energy to move a huge rock and blocked the only entrance.

Ranran exerted force to tightly seal the rock, temporarily cutting off the pursuit of those insects.

In the pitch-black darkness, Wei Jiu used his palm to ignite fire and illuminated the surroundings, astonishingly finding that this place was actually a bedroom-like house, complete with beds, shelves, and books.

As they entered the house, there was no need to light a lamp; the surroundings became bright on their own, with sunlight streaming in through the windows. Colorful butterflies danced playfully in front of the peony flowers outside the window, and the faint sounds of a children playing with their mother could be heard.

Ranran could still smell the dampness of the water cave, and her body couldn’t feel the warmth of the sunlight. She blinked and immediately understood, “Is this……all an illusion?”

Just like when she mistakenly entered the Medicine Immortal’s medicine field farmhouse before, this should also be an illusion formed from memories. She just didn’t know which immortal left his memories forgotten here.

Wei Jiu was now sitting slumped on the ground, his body covered in wounds from fending off the insects. He felt weak all over and vigilantly watched Ranran to see if she had any intentions of attacking him.

Seeing that Ranran didn’t come over, he spoke, “This should be a memory sealed by a great Cultivator like Dun Tian. It is said that when a great Cultivator ascends, they have to let go of worldly attachments, so they seal their memories somewhere. They can return occasionally in the future to have a look if they wanted.”

Ranran found his explanation reasonable. In Dun Tian’s memories, there seemed to be a woman and a child, indicating that he had already started a family before becoming immortal…

Just then, a shout came from outside the window, “Husband, it’s time for dinner!”

Followed by a string of giggles from a child, “Father, if you don’t come soon, Bao’er will eat all the chicken legs!”

But the door remained unopened, and the calls were repeated over and over…

Before long, a bird with red feathers and a crescent-shaped white fluff around its neck flew in, hopping around the window.

Then, a woman’s voice singing a lullaby to put a child to sleep came from outside. The voice was as gentle as a meandering stream… The little bird also seemed to be enchanted by the song, curling up into a small fluffy ball, quietly tilting its head to listen.

Perhaps, before Dun Tian ascended, what he couldn’t bear to part with the most was his wife and child. However, in this deliberately sealed memory, he could only hear their voices and never saw their faces.

What made him unable to even dare to look at his wife and child’s faces in his memories?

She didn’t have time to think about it any further. She quickly crouched down to check the white tiger’s injuries. When they entered the water earlier, the insects on the white tiger had been shaken off, leaving behind numerous wounds that dyed its fur red.

Her heart aching, Ranran hugged it lovingly and softly petted its head. She then took out a small medicine pouch from her pocket. Although the medicines inside were damp, they could still be used. She applied them to the white tiger, hoping to alleviate its pain and make it more comfortable.

Just now, she was certain that she wasn’t hallucinating; this tiger did speak, and it used her Shifu’s voice. What was going on? Was her Shifu a Tiger spirit?

His appearance was indeed somewhat different from an ordinary mortal. If he was actually transformed from a demon, it was also very possible… After all, Fox spirits and the like were very seductive…

At this moment, the tiger raised its eyes slightly, and its cold gaze on her was exactly like her Shifu’s!

Ranran suddenly realized something. No wonder she felt something was off when she looked at the white tiger these past two days. It was because the little tiger had seemed inexplicably majestic and dignified.

Ranran thought of these past few days when she cuddled, rubbed her face on and petted the white tiger, even scratching its belly… She suddenly felt troubled!

Shifu! Please believe me, I’m not lusting after your beauty and intentionally outraging your modesty!

Just then, Su Yishui’s cold voice sounded in her ear again, “There’s a gold talisman I have given you in your pocket. Stick it on Wei Jiu. If you want to get out of here, you’ll need to use him. You can’t kill him for now.”

Ranran blinked and noticed that the nearby Wei Jiu didn’t seem to hear the white tiger speak.

She understood now. Her Shifu was using a technique which can direct his voice to a specific target, so apparently only she could hear him.

As for Wei Jiu, he sat on one side, meditating and recuperating. He was injured while fighting Ranran and the white tiger earlier, and later he was heavily bitten by the Immortal Devouring Bugs. He needed to recuperate well. Fortunately, not much of his spiritual energy was absorbed, and the white tiger was heavily injured protecting the little girl and lost its spiritual power, so there was nothing to fear with only Ranran left!

As for Mu Qingge……there was no need to wait for the backlash of the Black Pool to end his affection. He couldn’t wait to capture her and break her neck right this moment……He had already returned the key and the soul oath with Su Yishui has been nullified, so killing Mu Qingge should not be a problem…

He was just thinking this, when suddenly he felt someone approaching. Before he could react, a golden talisman was pressed against his cheek.

Even Ranran didn’t expect that she could stick that talisman so smoothly. She had just tried it casually and didn’t expect Wei Jiu to not even dodge, and she just stuck it on like that.

Wei Jiu glared with rounded phoenix eyes, gritting his teeth as he said, “Remove the talisman. What kind of righteous path would use this sneak attack?”

Rangran breathed a sigh of relief, half-squatting and staring at Wei Jiu with big eyes. She smiled bashfully, “I really can’t beat you, so I might as well stick a talisman on you. Let’s both calm down and think about how to get out of this predicament?”

What Wei Jiu regret the most at this moment, was refusing Mu Qingge’s assistance just now and not killing this little brat together earlier.

However, he’s at a disadvantaged position now. Although he had entered the Black Pool, which could expedite his cultivation, he had lost a lot of spiritual energy to the Immortal Devouring Bugs. Now his dantian was somewhat empty, and he needed to gather his Qi again to recover.

Thinking about this, he didn’t want to provoke the little girl and force her hand, so he said coldly, “Only I know how to solve the problem of these Immortal Devouring Bugs. If you want to escape, you’ll have to rely on my help!”

The meaning behind his words was to inform Xue Ranran not to try harming him at this time. If she killed him, she would also perish, trapped in the cave.

Xue Ranran sincerely expressed that the Demon Lord was worrying too much. However, if he could make a soul oath with her, guaranteeing not to harm her and the White Tiger, she would gladly remove the talisman for the Demon Lord.

Wei Jiu snorted coldly and did not agree, instead closing his eyes to meditate.

As Xue Ranran had temporarily taken care of that demon, she allowed herself to relax a bit. However, since this was an illusion and there were no real beds, she let the tiger lie on her legs, so that it could be more comfortable.

But the present Gengjin white tiger was not the small cat it used to be. Its large head resting on her legs felt quite heavy.

However, it would seem that due to its injuries, its now acting a little spoiled. When Ranran called it, its eyes remained half-closed but continued to silently snuggle into Ranran’s arms.

Thinking that this might be her Shifu, Ranran suddenly felt a bit at a loss. Just then, the voice of Su Yishui echoed in her ear again: “I used Beast Control Technique to connect my spirit with the White Tiger. However, now the White Tiger’s spiritual energy is dissipating too quickly. I don’t know if I can continue to control it. You should take the time to meditate and make the best use of the spiritual energy you just attained. Although those Immortal Devouring Bugs are domineering, they also have weaknesses. Every sun set, they will lose the yang energy that sustains them, and their activity will greatly decline.
