At that time, you can tell Wei Jiu to clear the way with True Fire, and you should be able to rush down the mountain…”

When Shifu spoke these words, his voice sounded somewhat weak. Ranran understood that the Beast Control Technique meant merging one’s own spirit with a spiritual beast. Now that the white tiger’s body was covered in wounds, it also meant that Shifu who was controlling the white tiger was also injured to some extent.

At this moment, Wei Jiu finally finished meditating and took a deep breath. With a smirk on his handsome face stuck with a talisman, he said, “Little girl, you actually managed to subdue Mu Qingge’s mount, you do have some skills. However, did your master tell you that these wild beasts are unpredictable? They may be affectionate one moment and bite your head off the next?”

Ranran thought for a moment and honestly replied, “Shifu didn’t say that. He just told us to be wary of you members of the Crimson Gate Sect. But I don’t think you’re as bad as my Shifu described. At least you have some skills and look quite manly in a duel, which is much better than the disciples of the Jiuhua Sect…”

Because she would need his help later, Ranran decided to say something flattering and stroke this demon’s smelly ego.

Her words made Wei Jiu quite pleased. He raised an eyebrow and agreed, “How can those hypocritical fellows compare to me?”

However, the white tiger in Ranran’s arms seemed to disapprove of her insincere words. It raised its head slightly and stared at her with its big tiger eyes.

Ranran stuck out her tongue. Out of habit, she reached out and scratched the White Tiger’s chin, and the White Tiger couldn’t control its own instinct and turned its body to let Ranran continue scratching its chin.

...Shifu, your disciple really didn’t mean to…

But at this moment, she could not tell whether it was the white tiger or her Shifu, who was looking at her with squinted eyes, and seemed to be waiting persistently for a comfortable scritch.

Ranran had no choice but to continue scratching the tiger’s chin.

And she had to continue bantering with Wei Jiu to ease the previously tense killing atmosphere: “Excellency Wei, now there are Immortal Devouring Bugs outside, and we can’t stay trapped here forever. Do you have any ideas?”

Wei Jiu snorted coldly, “Mu Qingge is deliberately plotting against me. But where did she get so many Immortal Devouring Bugs? These insects parasitize on the decayed corpses of Demon Mountain, and it usually takes twenty years for them to mature. Without careful nurturing, they cannot spread so rapidly under sunlight…”

Ranran understood the meaning behind Wei Jiu’s words. It had been less than a year since Mu Qingge fell from the tree. She would not have had the time to find these rare poisonous insects, let alone cultivate them personally.

So who gave Mu Qingge those insects? This was probably something that they could only find out from Elder Mu.

What Ranran was more worried about was whether these insects would spread from Tianmai Mountain and affect her Second Uncle Master and the others down the mountain.

At this point, Wei Jiu took a breath and slowly opened his eyes, carefully observing the pensive little girl in front of him.

To be fair, although she wasn’t a beauty as stunning as Mu Qingge, her features were delicate, especially her lively eyes. The longer one looked , she would became more pleasing to the eye.

As Wei Jiu squinted his eyes looking at her, he suddenly noticed that the White Tiger had raised its head alertly, blocking his impudent gaze that had been scrutinizing Ranran.

Wei Jiu snorted coldly, this inconsiderate beast, did it think he was interested in that ugly girl?

Although he had been tagged with a talisman, he wasn’t in a hurry because he knew that once he restored his true qi, he would naturally be able to break the seal of the talisman. He decided to let the little girl feel smug for a while…

As Wei Jiu was thinking this, suddenly another golden talisman slapped onto his forehead – Ranran retracted her hand and said with a shy smile, “Excellency Wei, your cultivation is too profound. You won’t mind if I put another one?”

Wei Jiu’s true qi, which had finally gathered, was scattered in an instant. He grinned with gritted teeth and said, “Xue… Ranran, right? You only asked after you already stuck it on, isn’t that quite unnecessary?”

Ranran wanted to say something else, but the White Tiger behind her used its mouth to tug at her clothes, indicating that she should stay away from Wei Jiu.

“No need to waste words with him. In order to stay alive, he’ll definitely cooperate with you… Scratch my back, the wounds are a little painful…”

After hearing her Shifu’s covert message, Ranran quickly continued massaging the White Tiger’s back. Then she obediently followed her master’s instructions and stopped talking to Wei Jiu, focusing on meditating instead.

Since coming out of the marrow-cleansing pool, she had felt her dantian qi surging violently, requiring her to meditate every now and then.

Seeing that Wei Jiu also closed his eyes and remained silent, it seemed that he was doing the same.

After a while, Ranran entered the realm of clarity. Even though she had crossed the stone wall and the pool water, she could still clearly hear the sounds from the world outside.

The buzzing sound of the red insects continued unabated. She didn’t know if senior brother had made it down the mountain in time to avoid this insect calamity…

Just then, Wei Jiu suddenly spoke again, “Little girl, I’m willing to make a soul oath, but you also have to swear that you’ll remove the golden talismans for me.”

Wei Jiu had tried several times just now, but he couldn’t break the talismans’ seal with his true qi. He didn’t know where she got it from; it seemed to be the handiwork of a skilled talisman maker.

Since he couldn’t break it, Wei Jiu could only accept Ranran’s proposal. However, he kept his guard up; he would only swear not to harm her on Tianmai Mountain. Once they were out of Tianmai Mountain, he would deal with her then.

Ranran nodded in agreement. After they both made their oaths, Ranran went over and removed the talismans from Wei Jiu’s face.

The moment the talisman was removed, Wei Jiu suddenly reached out and grabbed Ranran’s wrist, pulling her into his arms. Ranran didn’t panic. She blinked her big eyes and reminded the Demon Lord, “Um… the consequences of breaking a soul oath are quite tragic…”

Wei Jiu’s hand that was holding her wrist suddenly moved slightly: this girl’s skin is really delicate, just a touch feels like soft jade…

Before he could move his fingers to stroke her skin again, the tiger suddenly let out a deafening roar of anger and pounced towards him.

Wei Jiu quickly let go and dodged. He had forgotten that he had sworn not to harm this beast, but the beast couldn’t swear anything. If he provoked it, he would have to expend his true qi again.

“It was just a hand hold, how does that violate a soul oath? Could it be that you still don’t have a lover and your heart hasn’t opened yet, so you are feeling a little shy?”

Although they weren’t shaking hands anymore, Wei Jiu couldn’t help but tease verbally. However, she was really quite pretty, delicate and charming, with such smooth skin… I wonder if that sanctimonious Su Yishui has had a first taste, savored this little sweet fruit…

Ranran didn’t have time to deal with him. She looked bemusedly at the little white tiger licking her wrist. It seemed to think that Wei Jiu had dirtied her hand, so it simply lightly bit down on her wrist with its mouth, making low purring sounds as if it was very unhappy.

Hmm… Although Shifu had merged with the white tiger, he obviously couldn’t control some of the white tiger’s daily habits. This kind of finger-biting game was something the little tiger loved to do on normal days.

After soothing the white tiger, Ranran looked up seriously and said, “Whether my heart has opened or not is not important, but Excellency Wei, you must be starving. If you don’t go out soon, I’m afraid you’ll pass out from hunger in here.”

The reason she said this was because Ranran herself felt very hungry. The sudden surge of true qi, coupled with the movement of her breath, seemed to have stimulated her appetite, and fasting no longer worked.

Sure enough, right after she finished speaking, Wei Jiu’s stomach also rumbled. Ranran took out her snack bag. Although the dried sweet potatoes were a bit damp, they could still stave off hunger.

Seeing Wei Jiu glaring at her, Ranran handed some to him. This time, Wei Jiu didn’t stand on ceremony and finished it all in few bites – this girl’s snacks were quite delicious…

When Ranran entered the cave earlier, she had taken out the water droplet hourglass that Uncle Master Zeng had given her, to calculate the time they entered the cave. Now, it seems they had been in the cave for too long.

So Ranran said, “When we entered the water, it was just noon, with intense sunlight, which is when the Immortal Devouring Bugs were most energetic. But now it’s evening, without sunlight, so those Immortal Devouring Bugs won’t be as formidable. We can take this opportunity to break out.”

Wei Jiu didn’t expect that such a young girl would know the weaknesses of these Immortal Devouring Bugs. It really took him by surprise. However, she was right, now was indeed a good time to break out.

Its so funny when Su Yishui was biting/holding Ranran’s wrist in response to Wei Jiu holding her wrist, but trust Ranran to rationalize it as something the little tiger does with her fingers during play time.

Previous
Next

揭露真相 REVEALING THE TRUTH

After Wei Jiu finished eating the pieces of dried sweet potatoes, he felt a bit less hungry.

As he moved the stone blocking the cave entrance, he said, “When we leap out of the water later, I’ll use True Fire to clear the way and drive away the Immortal Devouring Bugs. But if the disciples from the Jiuhua Sect and the Kongshan Sect didn’t make it down the mountain earlier, those Immortal Devouring Bugs should have increased in number due to their spiritual power. It takes a lot of elemental energy to use True Fire. When my true qi can’t keep up later, place your palm against my back to help me sustain the true qi!”

Ranran nodded to indicate she understood. They then followed the secret passage back into the underwater pool and headed upwards.

Before they reached the water’s surface, the buzzing sound grew louder. When they leaped out of the water, they saw that the insects, originally the size of soybeans, had grown to the size of lima beans.

As Wei Jiu had said, the people who did not make it down from the mountain had nourished these red insects with their spiritual power, and since Tianmai Mountain was a place rich in spiritual energy, everything flourished there, making their attack even fiercer.

Wei Jiu, now replenished with true qi, leaped out of the water and ignited a blazing fire, burning the insects.

His true qi made the insects even more frenzied, akin to moths to a flame, coming one after another.

Fortunately, it was already night, so the insects’ speed and strength had noticeably decreased. Ranran used her stick like an oar to smash these insects to pieces.

Wei Jiu ran swiftly while igniting the fire, and Ranran and the White Tiger followed closely behind. Finally, the two of them leaped onto the White Tiger, letting it carry them forward, while Ranran placed her palm against Wei Jiu’s back to sustain his true qi and keep the flames going.

In this way, the two of them, along with the tiger, leaped and dashed forward until they reached halfway down the mountain. As Su Yishui had said, the insects’ attacks in the night were not as fierce.

But sensing the spiritual energy, the surrounding insects still swarmed towards them. A few with wings carrying fire fell on Ranran’s neck, biting her. Perhaps the pain caused her to lose concentration, and Wei Jiu’s fire weakened suddenly.

Wei Jiu gritted his teeth and said, “You! Don’t lose heart!”

However, Ranran was not distracted by the pain. She patted Wei Jiu’s shoulder and said, “Have you noticed that there are no Immortal Devouring Bugs gathered around that tree?”

Following her pointed finger, Wei Jiu indeed saw no trace of Immortal Devouring Bugs around a tall tree.

On that tree sat a large flaming red bird, emitting an orange-red light in the night. This was clearly the Vermilion Bird that Wei Fang and the others had wanted to capture earlier.

At this moment, it was leisurely perched on the tree, tilting its head to look at the two humans and a tiger being chased by a swarm of insects in the night.

The White Tiger beneath them, carried them swiftly towards the tree.

Ranran remembered reading about the Vermilion Bird in her master’s study, from the interesting books of the Immortal Realm, which said that it was a sacred and pure bird that rotten creatures avoided.

Wei Jiu had also mentioned that these insects grew out of the corpses in the Demon Domain, so naturally, they feared the Vermilion Bird…

Thinking of this, Ranran was filled with joy and whispered, “We’re saved!”

When they arrived under the tree, the red insects were indeed wary of the Vermilion Bird and didn’t approach, only forming a red cloud about five meters away from the tree, buzzing. Finally, the two humans and the tiger could heave a sigh of relief and take a breather.

The Vermilion Bird stood in the tall tree, glancing down at them with a disdainful look and flapped its wings, as if it would fly away in the next moment.

Wei Jiu also realized that the Vermilion Bird was the nemesis of the Immortal Devouring Bugs.

He whispered, “Such a spiritual beast is not easy to tame. It might be better to twist its neck, smear Vermilion Bird’s blood on ourselves, and maybe we can force these damn insects to retreat!”

As he said this, Wei Jiu, with murderous intent, prepared to suddenly leap and capture the Vermilion Bird.

This scene was exactly like what Ranran had seen earlier when he killed the Black Flood Dragon.

At the same time Wei Jiu was preparing to strike, the Vermilion Bird seemed to expand as if inflated, doubling in size. When it opened its mouth to screech, it revealed sharp teeth, appearing terrifying.

Ranran grabbed Wei Jiu’s sleeve, “Don’t try to kill it. If it flies away, we’ll have to fight the insects again.”

Seeing Wei Jiu still eyeing the bird sideways, she knew his evil intentions hadn’t faded, so she quickly diverted his attention, “Don’t you think that bird looks familiar?”

Wei Jiu looked towards the Vermilion bird, suddenly noticed a crescent-shaped white fluff on the bird’s neck and recalled the cute little red bird that had cooed at the window in the illusion…

Except, back then, the fluffy chick was adorable, but now it had grown so large that he couldn’t connect the two immediately.

Just then, Ranran softly spoke to the Vermilion Bird, “Divine Lord, we’re in great trouble and need your help. Do you like listening to songs? I can sing for you, if you’d like?”

With that, Ranran closed her eyes, recalling the song she had heard in the illusion, and began to sing softly. Surprisingly, the melody was exactly the same as the one they had heard in the hidden cave underwater.

Her voice was melodious and her memory was good, so she sang the song remarkably well.

Wei Jiu watched speechlessly, as the girl sang with closed eyes. As the night wind blew, and the moonlight splashed upon her, he couldn’t help but feel that she was so exceptionally beautiful that he couldn’t tear his eyes away…

The bird, which had already taken to the air, circled once and slowly descended again, stretching its neck and looking at Ranran in surprise. In the melodious song, it seemed to recall its former master. It danced joyfully on the branch as she sang, appearing very happy.

In the midst of Ranran’s melodious singing, the bird suddenly flapped its wings and circled above the tree, flying faster and faster until, with a sharp cry, it soared into the sky.

This time, its body transformed from red to dazzling gold, like a sharp arrow shooting into the sky. As it struck the clouds, the night turned into day, and finally, the clouds transformed into a golden rain showering down towards the ground.

When the myriad red insects were hit by the golden rain, they burst one by one, turning into pools of bloody sludge falling to the ground.

When Ranran stopped singing, the golden rain also ceased. After a night of fierce battle, the faint light of dawn spread, and all the rampaging red insects turned into bloody mud, not a single one left.

As the red blood slowly seeped into the ground, the earth of Tianmai Mountain began to tremble slightly.

Wei Jiu exclaimed, “Not good, the blood of these insects has contaminated the spiritual veins of this sacred place. Tianmai Mountain is about to collapse!”

Ranran tried to climb onto the tiger’s back again, but at this moment, the Geng jin White Tiger, having expended too much energy defending Ranran against the Immortal Devouring Bugs, had depleted its spiritual power and once again transformed into a cat-sized creature.

As the ground shook, it lost its footing and fell into the nearby abyss.

Wei Jiu turned back to pull Ranran to leave with him, but she lunged to save the tiger, which was about to fall off the cliff.

Despite her agile skills, the ground shaking was too severe, and she also lost her balance and fell.

Wei Jiu instinctively reached out to grab her, but he was just a step too late and missed her.

Wei Jiu himself was momentarily stunned, baffled as to why he had reached out to save that annoying brat. But as he saw her falling, his heart skipped a beat, and without thinking, he acted.

The thought of that girl possibly dying like this… He couldn’t help feeling… a little reluctant?

But at that moment, countless rocks and debris fell, prompting Wei Jiu to quickly hide his uncharacteristic sentimentality, swiftly leaping downwards towards the mountain base…

Meanwhile, as Ranran fell, she managed to catch the White Tiger in time. However, as she tried to stabilize herself by thrusting her stick into the cliff, it was already too late.

Just as they were about to fall off the high cliff and turn into meat patties, with a sharp cry, the Vermilion Bird, now a golden color, appeared again. In a flash, it caught Ranran and the White Tiger, then swiftly dodged the flying rocks while descending towards the base of the mountain.

Since Dun Tian had passed and turned into this vast place, the Vermilion Bird had been trapped in the mountain. Now that the toxic insects had corroded the spiritual energy field of Tianmai Mountain, the Vermilion Bird could finally break free and experience the vast world.

Ranran sat on the bird’s back, tenderly holding the White Tiger in her arms, tears streaming down uncontrollably.

The White Tiger weakly raised its head, and licked the tears hanging on the girl’s tender cheek. It then tilted its neck, seeming to lose consciousness…

Ranran took off her outer garment, wrapped up the little tiger, and chewed a Qi-boosting pill to feed it: Shifu’s Beast Mastery Forbidden Technique was similar to the Water Demon being controlled in the Wangxiang River. However, his possession was more thorough, as he and the White Tiger were connected in life and death, meaning if the tiger’s body suffered, her master would also be affected. She hoped both Shifu and the tiger would hang on and not suffer any mishaps.

Just then, Ranran inadvertently glanced down and suddenly noticed something in the stream at the foot of the mountain…

Leaving aside the catastrophe of the insect disaster high up the mountain, at this moment, the people below had already formed ranks, preparing to resist the Immortal Devouring Bugs invading from above. Mu Ranwu stood at the forefront of the formation.

The Elders who had come with their disciples to participate in the Marrow-Cleansing Pool ceremony also rushed over.

Mu Ranwu was waiting for this opportunity, the perfect chance to solidify her authority and clear her previous tainted reputation from her past life as a demonic lord.

When the righteous sects are defeated by the Immortal Devouring Bugs and in disarray, she would take action at the right moment, gaining fame and selling a favor to these righteous factions.

This plan was executing flawlessly!

Yesterday, when she flew down the mountain at lightning speed and intercepted Wei Fang and the Wen twins, she swiftly knocked them to the ground. She didn’t see that boy named Gao Cang, and she didn’t know if he clumsily fell into the cliff, but he definitely didn’t get off the mountain.

She didn’t kill Wei Fang and the others; she just knocked them unconscious. When the Immortal-Devouring Bugs come out later, these people will be the best nourishment for them.

As those insects suck enough spirit blood and grow to the size of a palm, they will start killing each other, leaving only the strongest one. As long as she, as the insect controller, control that insect king to enter her alchemy furnace and refine it bit by bit into elixirs, she can use this spiritual energies to suppress the grudge water poison in her body.

Thinking of this plan, which would eliminate both Wei Jiu and Xue Ranran, the two thorns in her side, and release her from the control of the Grudge water, Mu Ranwu felt extremely secure.

Even if Xue Ranran and Wei Jiu has won the chance to enter the marrow-cleansing pool, what use would it be? When they are being sucked dry and withered by the insects, they will probably regret coming to Tianmai Mountain…

Of course, she would still need to maintain appearances. When the Immortal-devouring Bugs swept through Tianmai Mountain, the people below the mountain also sensed it.

Fortunately, it seemed that these Immortal-devouring Bugs, being not of this realm, had triggered the spiritual shield of Tianmai Mountain, which automatically trapped them inside the mountain. Otherwise, if these insects spread all over, the people below would suffer as well.

Tianmai Mountain is located in the middle of the convergence of three major sects, and people from various major sects have already issued warnings last night. In just one night, all the experts from the Top sects have gathered to prepare for the invasion from the mountain.

When Wen Hongshan looked at this spectacle, she actually felt a little fearful in her heart. However, when she glanced at Mu Ranwu, she found that she was surprisingly calm.

Why didn’t she notice that Mu Qingge’s sister was such a deep-thinking person in her past life ? No wonder Mu Qingge was no match for her and was defeated by her schemes…

After a whole night, everyone watched as the “red clouds” on the mountain grew thicker and thicker. They also witnessed the tragic scene of Wei Fang and the others being sucked dry by the red insects when they barely reached halfway down the mountain, but were helpless to do anything about it.

This insect disaster was completely unexpected. It seemed that everyone who went up the mountain would not come back alive.

Late that night, Mu Ranwu finally managed to set her heart at ease. When daylight came, the insects on the mountain would begin their battle for supremacy.

She could finally rest easy…

Just as Mu Ranwu was feeling triumphant, something golden shot up into the sky from Tianmai Mountain. Then, a golden rain fell, followed by earthquakes and shaking mountains.

These sudden changes were overwhelming.

Qiu Xier looked at the collapsed Tianmai Mountain and let out a sorrowful cry, “Ranran! Hurry down!”

And Second Uncle Master rushed up the mountain when the spiritual shield loosened, trying to see if she could assist Ranran.

Unfortunately, when they rushed up, they encountered a black shadow speeding down the mountain.

That shadow was quick as lightning, heading straight for Mu Ranwu.

This black shadow was Wei Jiu. His face was full of murderous intent as he prepared to capture Mu Qingge and ask her why she had plotted against him so maliciously.

Since the key had been returned to Su Yishui, the soul oath had automatically dissolved. This damned woman had actually become so evil and vicious, so why should he even think about cherishing someone like her.

Mu Ranwu couldn’t let herself be caught by him. She dodged and evaded, shouting at the same time, “These Immortal-devouring Bugs were released by this demon! In order to get a chance to enter the pool, he devised such a malicious plan! AH…”

Before she could dodge, Wei Jiu slapped her savagely.

This slap wasn’t at all gentle; Wei Jiu’s long black nails even left five bloody trails on Mu Qingge’s fair face!

Mu Ranwu was stunned by the slap, not so much by the pain but she was shocked by the wave after wave of humiliation that followed.

In her two lifetimes, she had never had to suffer the indignity of being slapped in the face. In her past life, although she was not powerful, she was good at maneuvering through social situations and had her sister to protect her, living a life of ease and privilege.

And now, Wei Jiu, who had always coveted *her, actually struck her so mercilessly, truly igniting her anger! *Mu Qingge

On the sidelines, Wen Hongshan saw Wei Jiu descending the mountain and felt a surge of anxiety. When she conspired with Mu Ranwu, she was confident that Wei Jiu and all those who went up the mountain wouldn’t be able to come back down.

Otherwise, if someone managed to reveal that the junior Gui Baqian who entered the sect through her connection, was actually the Demonic cultivator Wei Jiu—that would mean her reputation would be completely ruined, and the position of Sect leader that was within her grasp would no longer be hers.

Wen Hongshan was no longer young, she had spent much of her early life mired in meaningless emotional entanglements.

Now, Wen Hongshan finally realized that she needed to make progress in her cultivation. Only by becoming the Sect leader could she fully enjoy the advantages of the Kongshan cave’s spiritual artifacts and become a great powerhouse of her generation.

But if Wei Jiu blabbed about the conspiracy between Mu Ranwu and her, and how she had deceived and murdered her mentor, schemed against her fellow cultivators, then in the entire cultivation world, there would no longer be a place for her!

So when Mu Ranwu made up the accusations against Wei Jiu and slandered him, Wen Hongshan was the first to respond, leading her disciples to confront Wei Jiu.

At this moment, the remaining Elders watched as the legacy of the marrow-cleansing pools, passed down generations, were about to be destroyed. They were aggrieved and frustrated. This demon should have been killed long ago. Now that he has entered the pool, he’s like a tiger with wings. He must not be allowed to leave alive!

With that in mind, everyone took turns to confront Wei Jiu.

Inside Wei Jiu’s heart, he was cursing up a storm.

The cultivation in his dantian was like a poor family’s rice jar, every time there was a little bit of surplus, it would still run out in an instant. He was a good demonic cultivator, but his life was really miserable.

Initially, Su Yishui robbed him of his cultivation, and when he finally recovered enough, he disguised himself and entered Tianmai Mountain. After overcoming all obstacles and entering the Black Pool, the spiritual energy he gained was then mostly sucked away by those insects.

Now that he had just escaped death and was ready to settle scores with that damned Mu Qingge, he had to face this continuous fighting with the righteous path. The Excellency Wei’s exasperation in his heart was about to burst out from the top of his head.

Right now he could only make a desperate attempt to break through…

Out of the corner of his eye, he saw Mu Qingge. She had incited everyone to fight against him and then hid aside, covering her injured face. It seemed she was about to scheme something else and claim credit with malicious intent…

Such a woman, a maverick in her past life, after being reborn turned out to be even more diabolical than him! It’s damn unbelievable!

Wen Hongshan also noticed that Wei Jiu was running out of spiritual energy. She was suddenly delighted and turned to Mu Ranwu with a fierce look, “Quick, go and kill him!”

Mu Ranwu never fought an uncertain battle. Seeing that Wei Jiu was indeed at his weakest, she finally relaxed, drew her sword for battle, ready to make a name for herself by slaughtering the demonic cultivator in one battle.

But just then, a loud bird cry came from the sky, piercing through the air and drawing everyone’s involuntary attention.

They saw a golden Vermilion bird soaring toward them from the direction of the collapsed Tianmai Mountain, dragging its long tail feathers. Everyone exclaimed, “Vermilion Bird!”

When it flew closer, they saw that there was actually a person sitting on the large bird’s back.

Qiu Xier was the first to recognize the person on the bird’s back as her junior sister Xue Ranran. She exclaimed with joy, “Ranran!”

At that moment, everyone also realized that the girl holding a white cat, on the bird’s back was actually the female disciple of the Xi Shan Sect who had stumbled her way through the first trial before.

Wen Hongshan looked somewhat panicked as she glanced at Mu Ranwu.

If it had just been Wei Jiu who survived, it would have been easier to deal with; they could have simply framed him for everything. After all, he was a demonic cultivator, and even if he revealed the truth, they could just accuse him of framing them.

But now with Xue Ranran appearing, it wouldn’t be easy to fabricate lies. She could only look at Mu Ranwu, hoping she would quickly come up with a solution.

Just then, the vermilion bird descended, and Ranran jumped down from its back. The adventures on Tianmai Mountain had left her clothes somewhat tattered and covered in mud, with her hairband undone and her long black hair cascading down her waist like a waterfall.

But when she leaped down from the bird’s back holding the little white tiger, she exuded a wild and spirited aura, like a daughter of the mountain god.

As she landed on her toes, Uncle Master and Yutong hurriedly approached her, asking with concern, “Ranran, are you okay?”

Ranran shook her head and turned towards Mu Qingge, widening her eyes as she asked, “Elder Mu, why did you release the Immortal-devouring Bugs on Tianmai Mountain? Don’t you know there are still fellow practitioners up there? Your actions have placed them in mortal danger!”

This statement caused a commotion among the crowd, and they all looked at Mu Qingge in disbelief.

Mu Ranwu hadn’t expected Xue Ranran to be so sharp and noticed her secretly releasing the mud-sealed balls.

However, she had already planned her response, trembling her lips in confusion, “Xue Ranran, I have no grievances with you, so why are you spouting such accusations? Everyone knows that nurturing those poisonous creatures takes at least fifteen years. But twenty years ago, your master nearly scattered my soul, and since then I’ve been living on the tree. How could I have nurtured such poisonous things?”

Wei Jiu let out a strange laughter when he heard this, “Mu Qingge, why don’t you have the same daring spirit as before? Since you dared to do it, why not admit it?”

Mu Qingge glanced at him, flicking her long hair and coldly said, “As you have said, I’ve always dared to admit to the things I have done. Although we’ve never gotten along, I truly did not release those Immortal-devouring Bugs. Are you also going to believe the slanderous words of this girl and insist on smearing my reputation?”

“Mu Qingge! Why don’t you admit it? Wasn’t it you who intercepted Wei Fang on the mountain, as well as us sisters, intentionally knocked us down, and then fed us to those insects?”

The golden light from the Vermilion bird was too dazzling, and it was only when a weak woman spoke up, that people realized the bird’s claws were holding onto two people.

One was Gao Cang, and the other was a withered-looking woman. People strained to recognize her and realized that this elderly-looking woman was likely one of the sisters of the Wen twins.

It turned out that when Ranran was descending the mountain, she suddenly discovered that there were two people lying in the river foam at the foot of the mountain.

She had the Vermilion bird fly lower, and then she discovered it was Senior brother Gao Cang and one of the twin sisters.

However, this sister Yujie already had most of her spiritual energy sucked away by the insects and looked spent.

It turned out that when Gao Cang had doubled back for Ranran, he couldn’t cross the bridge and so he went to the side, trying to see if he could walk back along the valley bottom to save his junior sister.

And so he fortuitously missed Mu Ranwu completely, and later, he found that he still couldn’t cross and had to dejectedly descend the mountain. He happened to see the three people who had been knocked down.

At that time, the red insects were swarming over. In the confusion and panic, Gao Cang only managed to carry the nearer sister Yu Jie and started running back towards the tree hollow.

Senior brother Gao Cang’s cultivation was very shallow, and ironically, that was a blessing in disguise. When he was bitten by the insects, he didn’t suffer too much loss of spiritual energy.

Previous
Next

付出代价 PAYING THE PRICE


Gao Cang was a simple person, but also really blessed. When the two of them accidentally stumbled into a small water pit, the wine gourd around Gao Cang’s waist broke open.

Inside was the twenty-year-old fine wine “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” that his junior sister had given him. He had been reluctant to drink it, and now it was all spilled in the small pit, filling the air with a strong fragrance of wine.

Surprisingly, these insects seemed to dislike the smell of alcohol. Moreover, the unusual fragrance of the wine did not dissipate after being mixed in the water, masking the spiritual energy on both of them. So they stayed very still in the small water pit, miraculously surviving until Ranran arrived on her bird and finally escaped down the mountain safely.

Now that Yujie was still alive, although barely, she could reveal the truth and bitterly point out Elder Mu and Wen Hongshan’s malicious intentions.

Wen Hongshan really wanted to chop Mu Ranwu into pieces alive. She had boasted that there was no way the Immortal-devouring Bugs would fail, yet there came to be four survivors who made it!

If it had only been disciples from the XiShan Sect surviving, with Wei Jiu still alive, it would have been manageable. They could have accused Xishan Sect of being enemies with Mu Qingge from her past life, and claim that they have colluded together to slander them.

But Yujie’s testimony was the most damning!

Therefore, Wen Hongshan decided to cut her losses. She just had to insist that Wei Jiu had impersonated her distant relative’s junior and deceived her, pretending she knew nothing about the rest!

As for the Immortal-devouring Bugs, Xue Ranran had already said that Mu Qingge released them, which had nothing to do with her!

Unfortunately, she thought she had everything figured out, but forgot about Wei Jiu as a variable.

Wei Jiu himself didn’t understand why, looking at the Mu Qingge he had been thinking of for decades, he didn’t have the slightest romantic thoughts.

Looks like that saying about the Black pool breaking bonds was true. Looking at Mu Qingge, whose face was scratched and in a sorry state, he had absolutely no lingering feelings that he had harbored for twenty years.

He watched as Mu Qingge and Wen Hongshan trying so hard, feigning innocence, and found it somewhat laughable.

Xue Ranran might not understand why Mu Qingge did this, but he suddenly understood everything. Mu Qingge was indeed a clever schemer, hoping to hit three birds with one stone.

Her plan allowed her to first retrieve the Netherworld key from him and then lure him to Tianmai Mountain. Next, the spiritual energy of Tianmai Mountain would rapidly strengthen the Immortal-devouring bugs’ growth and spread by absorbing the spiritual energy of those outstanding disciples who have come here.

Controlling the Immortal-devouring Bugs meant that she could reclaim the spiritual energy from everyone once the insects returned to the cauldron. Even without entering the Marrow-cleansing pool, she could reap all the benefits.

Such a meticulous plot, he didn’t believe that the idiot Wen Hongshan, could have come up with it.

Since that was the case, they shouldn’t blame him for exposing everything. So when Wen Yujie weakly pointed out that Wei Jiu impersonated a disciple of Kongshan and entered Tianmai Mountain, he casually said, “Right, I haven’t thanked Mu Qingge and Wen Hongshan yet! If it weren’t for your efforts to arrange for me to enter Kongshan as a junior disciple of Senior Wen, how could I, an unorthodox demon, have blended in so smoothly?!”

This statement shocked everyone. Because Wei Jiu was indeed wearing the robes of a disciple of Kongshan, and at that moment, he even casually pulled out a face-changing mask and put on Gui Baqian’s face.

As the dark face appeared, everyone recognized him as the disciple of Kongshan who had passed through all the challenges from before!

Everyone remembered clearly that this junior had been recommended by Wen Hongshan and she claimed that he was her relative’s nephew.

Wen Hongshan forced herself to remain calm, her scar looking even more twisted. “Wei Jiu, you’re slandering me out of spite. It must be you who harmed my nephew and impersonated him to get in.”

At this moment, Ranran calmly said, “Whether it’s true or false can be easily verified. As long as someone is sent immediately to Senior Wen’s hometown to investigate, we can immediately find out if Senior Wen really has a relative cousin named Gui Baqian with a dark face. If there’s no such person, how would Senior Wen explain this?”

Wen Hongshan became speechless again.

Today’s unexpected events has been too many, some of them had been completely out of the blue. She was an orphan, adopted by Abbess Wen at an early age. Where would she have relatives? If investigated thoroughly, she would be exposed for certain.

Originally, her forceful inclusion of Gui Baqian to Tianmai Mountain had already attracted dissatisfaction from her sect. Now that Gui Baqian had revealed his true identity, she was utterly unable to defend herself.

At this moment, Wen Hongshan wanted to slap herself. Why had she been fooled by Mu Ranwu into agreeing to this risky move? Now, there were loopholes everywhere, each one leading her into an irredeemable situation.

Thinking of how Mu Ranwu had told her that Xue Ranran might be the reincarnation of the real Mu Qingge… Wen Hongshan gritted her teeth in anger. Now, she could only insist these two people slandered her and then silence them later…

“You’re spouting nonsense! It was clearly Mu Qingge who released the Immortal-devouring Bugs. You all don’t know, she’s not actually…”

Before she could finish, Wei Jiu, seemingly unfazed, casually dropped another bombshell. “Senior Wen, what’s there to hide? After all, you’re someone who dared to murder your own master. Poor Abbess Wen, who let the wolf into the house, raising such a ruthless person… Tsk tsk, you’re actually more suitable for practicing the demonic path than me!”

This statement shocked everyone into an uproar once again.

Wen Hongshan, in a panic, said, “It’s all nonsense! My Master clearly failed to withstand the heavenly calamity and passed away naturally. What does that have to do with me!”

Unfortunately, she didn’t understand Wei Jiu. When he helped others do bad things, although he didn’t leave his name, he always kept some evidence. So when he helped Wen Hongshan before, he naturally left evidence.

“On the day Abbess Wen faced the heavenly tribulations, she should have taken the Replenishing Spirit pill to restore her energy. That pill was refined by you, and you had added Grudge water that causes intense pain and prevents the gathering of spiritual energy. If anyone is interested, they can go see Abbess Wen’s body. The poison of the Grunge water would have penetrated her bones. I believe traces of it should be found on Abbess Wen’s charred corpse… Oh, and this Grudge water is so useful, she definitely wouldn’t use it all up. You can search her now, and there might be some unexpected discoveries!”

Wei Jiu could tell that Wen Hongshan presently had the Grudge water he gave her on her person, just by sniffing the air.

This woman was both foolish and venomous. She probably carried it with her to be ready to backstab someone, but she hadn’t expected Wei Jiu to survive and expose her.

Just as Wei Jiu finished speaking, several Elders from Kongshan quickly moved and snatched the bag from her waist, shaking it out to reveal a bottle. When it fell to the ground, the Grudge water immediately spilled out.

The disciples of Kongshan were all seething. They had been wondering why, with Abbess Wen’s cultivation, even if she couldn’t overcome the heavenly tribulation, she shouldn’t have lost her life this way!

Now, everything pointed to Wen Hongshan. The senior brothers who were already dissatisfied with Wen Hongshan crossing generational boundaries were immediately up in arms, surrounding and capturing Wen Hongshan.

In the chaos, Mu Ranwu silently adjusted her sleeve arrow and shot it at Wen Hongshan’s chest. With so many people around, as the arrow imbued with spiritual energy pierced Wen Hongshan’s chest, she widened her eyes, unable to speak, and fell to the ground dead.

Mu Ranwu smirked inwardly. Unreliable woman, still trying to expose her true identity?

Now that she had successfully escaped the control of the three major sects, she relied entirely on His Majesty Su Yu, who was her current pillar of support.

And to gain the support of the emperor of this generation, she needed the identity of Mu Qingge, who is protected by His Majesty. She couldn’t let Wen Hongshan, this foolish woman, ruin everything.

After doing all this, she quietly retreated into hiding. Although she didn’t manage to kill Wei Jiu and Xue Ranran, it was not bad to have killed Wen Hongshan, who knew her true identity.

The future is long, Sister… we’ll meet again.

With this in mind, taking advantage of the chaos of dogs fighting dogs, Mu Ranwu quietly escaped under the protection of her followers, covering her injured face.

The remaining people watched as the Kongshan Sect cleaned up its mess. But when they came back to their senses after watching the spectacle, they realized that not only did Mu Qingge, who was suspected of releasing the Immortal Devouring Bugs, had run away, but even Wei Jiu, who had incited the conflict, took the opportunity to escape without a trace.

But just then, someone exclaimed, “Look at her forehead, she entered the Marrow Cleansing Pool!”

At this moment, everyone took a closer look, and indeed, there was a “Mai” symbol on Ranran’s forehead, which was the mark of entering the Marrow Cleansing Pool. In fact, Wei Jiu originally had one too, but after being bitten by the insects several times, the lines on his forehead had become faint and almost disappeared.

When the people below the mountain learned that this seemingly ordinary little girl was actually the selected winner for this Marrow Cleansing Pool event, there was another uproar. After the Tianmai Mountain collapsed due to the pollution of the Immortal Devouring Bugs’ toxic blood, it was unlikely that there would be another Marrow Cleansing Pool event in the future.

And this disciple from the Western Mountain, who was seemingly inept, turned out to be the beneficiary of the last Marrow Cleansing Pool event, which made those younger generation disciples who had completely given up on their ambitions both envious and resentful.

But remembering that Wei Jiu had also entered the pool this time, so the presence of a righteous sect disciple was balanced against him, was also somewhat comforting.

According to the customary rules, everyone had to congratulate XiShan for producing outstanding disciples and send gifts as a token of encouragement.

In the past, the three major sects were generous in their exchanges, offering elixirs, magical weapons, all worthy gifts.

However, they had no previous relationship with Xishan, and now that their outstanding disciples had suffered losses, they had to send a gift to the Western Mountain, a rookie who had somehow taken the lead without cheating. This made them quite resentful.

So the gifts they sent were not heartfelt. Later, on the way back, Qiu Xier sorted out the gifts received by Ranran during a rest break on the journey. Besides the usual swords and blades, she unexpectedly found a box of Mind Clearing Pills, a rather humble gift.

“What junk! Ranran’s Mind Clearing Pills are a hundred times better than these. Giving such things to fool people, the three major sects must be struggling financially and on the verge of closing their doors?”

Ranran was applying medicine to the White Tiger. After giving it medicine, she gently moved the unconscious little tiger to the sunny spot outside the shade.

After hearing Qiu Xier’s words, she replied nonchalantly, “It’s already good to receive anything. After all, it’s just a courtesy exchange. Not only did the Kongshan Sect not give anything, we even gave a token of goodwill to them, which could be considered as paying the ‘white gold’ to Abbess Wen of the Kongshan Sect. You didn’t see the look of distress on Second Uncle Master’s face when she counted out the silver. Let’s just forget about losses and gains, we were all able to leave unharmed this time, that’s the best reward.”
*white gold is condolence money

Qiu Xier nodded happily and said, “Anyway, now all the major sects know that our XiShan’s younger generation is the most promising. Ranran, you are also considered famous now, and in the future, you will surely make XiShan surpass all the major sects!”

Later on, the incident with the Immortal Devouring Bugs seemed to be entirely attributed to Wen Hongshan. After all, such poisonous creatures needed years of cultivation, so how could Mu Qingge, who had just reincarnated, have such a thing?

And with the grudge between Wen Hongshan and Mu Qingge over ruining of appearances and men, even if she claimed before her death that Mu Qingge had orchestrated everything and she had only aligned herself with Mu, this alone was not enough to convince people.

The reputation of the Kongshan Sect was also completely ruined this time, with the loss of outstanding disciples and the destruction of Tianmai Mountain, exposing such shameful internal conflicts like murdering their Masters. It was rumored that the three major sects would have to undergo a revamping, and the rising XiShan Sect might replace the Kongshan Sect.

But as Qiu Xier was happily imagining all this, she saw Ranran kneeling in front of the little tiger, treating it with great respect while massaging its limbs as it basked in the sun. It looked like she was taking care of a bedridden elderly father.

Qiu Xier is a straightforward person so she asked what her junior sister was doing.

Since coming down from Tianmai Mountain, the little tiger had not opened its eyes. Ranran wasn’t sure if her Shifu was still merged with the tiger. But thinking of how Shifu had gone to such great lengths to watch over her, Ranran was moved beyond words.

She was afraid that if he remained motionless in tiger form, it would affect his blood circulation, so of course she had to massage Shifu three times a day while on the road.

But her Shifu turning into a tiger really affected his immortal demeanor, and the method he used seemed similar to the forbidden curse of the unorthodox sect that merged with beasts at the Wangxiang Pass.

Ranran felt that this matter couldn’t be disclosed, lest it tarnish Shifu’s reputation. She only informed Second Uncle Master secretly, so they traveled by day as well as night, in order to return home as soon as possible.

As for the Vermilion Bird, some people proposed dividing it when they were back at the foot of Tianmai Mountain. Ranran smiled and pulled out her mechanical stick, smashing the trial stone into pieces. She said plainly that whoever wanted to divide the bird has to win her first.

After all, everyone belonged to prestigious sects, and dignity was still important. After this demonstration of strength, no one brought up the matter again.

But such a golden bird, if it always followed them, even though it looked flashy and cool, would invite other trouble.

On the way back, Ranran would tease the Vermilion Bird now and then with food. After a few times, she found that it loved to eat her peanuts.

Every time it shrank in size a bit, Ranran would reward it with a few peanuts. Gradually, it actually shrank down to the size of a sparrow seen in the underwater illusion cave, its body turning into a pale red color. It hopped around on Ranran’s shoulder, occasionally diving into the snack bag to find food. At first glance, it looked like a domesticated small sparrow.

But Ranran didn’t make any soul contract with this Vermilion Bird. If it liked to stay by her side, she would take care of it, but if one day it wanted to leave, it was free to do so.

This way, was easier on everyone. Ranran now focused more on the little tiger. Besides, she urgently wanted to return to the Western Mountain to see if her master’s physical body was unharmed.

After three days, the “Mai” on Ranran’s forehead finally disappeared, indicating that she had completely integrated the spiritual power of the Marrow-Cleansing Pool.

When she returned to the Western Mountain, the first thing she did was to check the place where her master often went into seclusion at the top of the mountain.

The tightly closed stone door required spiritual power to open but neither of the Uncle Masters could open it. However, Ranran could easily do it now.

When she opened the stone door, she immediately saw Su Yishui lying on the ground, not knowing how long he had endured by himself in this place.

Ranran had always hoped that her worries were unnecessary, but she didn’t expect her Shifu’s condition to be worse than she imagined.

She rushed over quickly, with the help of the two flustered Uncle Masters, they got him out of the mountain cave. However, when she helped her master up, Ranran caught a glimpse of the bottle sealed with the Spirit Spring on his neck, which seemed to flicker with a faint red light, but it disappeared in an instant.

Ranran didn’t have time to think about that. She recalled that Shifu had accompanied her to refine the pills for the tiger to eat, and he went into seclusion right after. It should have been around that time that he already merged with the tiger.

The battle on Tianmai Mountain and the Immortal Devouring Bugs had used up too much spiritual power. The little tiger had not awakened all this time, and it seemed that Shifu was also injured, not waking up no matter how she called.

At wits’ end, Ranran remembered the Ice Lotus Pool, which was an excellent place for healing. Shifu’s internal injuries were too severe, and someone needed to guide spiritual power into his body. Ranran was the only one who could accompany him into the pool.

So Ranran took off her master’s outer robe and entered the Ice Lotus Pool with him. The ice lotus in this pool seemed to have never waned since the last time they opened.

After entering the pool, the two Uncle Masters didn’t want to distract Ranran’s efforts to heal her master, so they retreated to the nearby house by the pool and waited.

Ranran held Su Yishui as they floated quietly in the water, feeling the abundant spiritual energy in the pool flowing back and forth. She guided it gradually into her Shifu’s body.

This kind of assisted healing of guiding spiritual energy was the most mentally exhausting. When she felt that the meridian blockages in her master’s body had been cleared, the fatigue from their desperate travel over the past several days, gradually dissipated in the extremely comfortable Ice Lotus Pool.

Ranran didn’t know when she accidentally fell asleep. When she opened her eyes, she found that her Shifu was already awake. In a daze, she couldn’t help but smile happily at him.

But as she was smiling, Ranran realized something was wrong. Why was she being held in her Shifu’s arms like a baby?

At this moment, there was suddenly a sun shower, and the fragmented pearls entered the water, causing ripples on the water. The crystal-clear droplets slowly slid down his straight nose and fell onto his broad chest…

Even Ranran, who had not yet experienced love, after waking up suddenly to such a beautiful scene of a wet-faced handsome man, could only feel her mouth run dry and she suddenly wanted to drink a cup of ice-cold melon juice to quench her thirst.

Su Yishui stretched out his long fingers to touch the still unhealed wounds on her slender neck caused by the Immortal Devouring Bugs, then lowered his head and frowned, “Besides here, where else are you injured?”

Ranran somewhat understood why the little tiger didn’t move after being scratched on the chin. At this moment, being touched like this by her handsome Shifu, she also felt a tingling sensation that made her unable to move…

She stared blankly into his gaze and stuttered, “There are some injuries on my arms… Shifu… why are you holding me?”

“You were sleeping so soundly that if I didn’t hold you, water would have entered your mouth and nose.” Su Yishui’s eyes slightly drooped, explaining in his mild tone.

If he said that, didn’t it mean that while she was asleep, he had been holding her like this and watching her…

But now that Ranran was awake, his arm still did not loosen, still holding onto Ranran.

This situation of treating someone but being caught sleeping by them was really embarrassing.

However, being embraced like this by her Shifu reminded her of the time when she was surrounded by those red insects, and Shifu who had merged with the white tiger, had risked his life and wrapped her tightly with his body to keep her safe and warm.

After her parents, Shifu was the best person to her, so she didn’t feel that her master was being inappropriate. If she even thought about those impure ideas, she would feel like she was tarnishing such a good person like her Shifu!

Ranran whispered, “Shifu, I’m awake now. It’s still raining. Do you want to go to the pavilion on the shore to take shelter?”

Only then did Su Yishui let go of her hand that was around her, but still holding her wrist, he led her to the pavilion by the lotus pool. Su Yishui bent down to pick up his outer robe, but instead of putting it on himself, he turned around and draped it over Ranran.

By now, the drizzle had gradually turned into heavy rain. Senior Uncle Master Yu Chen, who was looking out the window, was about to happily go over when he saw the Master has awaken, but he was held back by his sister Yu Tong.

Yu Tong was more sensitive than her brother. She had long noticed that something was off with her Master’s attitude towards his little disciple Ranran.

Now looking through the window, with the Master’s tall figure protecting the girl in the pavilion, not letting the splashing raindrops fall on her.

A handsome man and beautiful woman looking like such a good match, amidst the sound of raindrops falling like pearls.

This wasn’t just a master’s attention for his disciple… Ever since Mu Qingge died, the originally cold Master had become even more withdrawn. But ever since Ranran came to Western Mountain, the Master, who had been like an exiled immortal before, seemed to become more……human.

Thinking of this, Yu Tong didn’t want her thoughtless brother to disturb the ambiguous atmosphere in the pavilion, so she covered her brother’s mouth and pulled him away.

In the pavilion, Su Yishui picked up the towel on the stone table to dry Ranran’s long hair.

Ranran didn’t dare to trouble her Shifu, so she quickly took it over and stood up to dry Su Yishui’s long hair for him, “Shifu, why did you merge with the white tiger? This is really too dangerous!”

Ranran had read some books about practicing strange arts before. This kind of beast-controlling technique was slightly deviant; one could end up a beast for life if not careful. Her Shifu had taken such a huge risk, and just thinking about it made Ranran feel afraid.

Su Yishui mildly said, “You’ve been weak since childhood. Even though you drank the water I gave you, your dantian has been empty for too long, which can still damage your foundation. That’s why I needed to ensure that you would enter the Marrow-Cleansing Pool.”

His words implied not only protecting his disciple but also that if Ranran didn’t pass the test, he would personally be there to help her cheat.

Ranran widened her eyes, somewhat surprised at her master’s words, and asked in a small voice, “What if I didn’t pass, Shifu?”

Su Yi Shui smiled slightly at her question, his thin lips curling up to reveal his bright teeth, and he exuded a touch of wickedness.

Shifu did not answer, but Ranran felt that whatever he had planned must probably not be a good thing.

At this moment, she suddenly remembered the unfinished words of the Medicine Immortal, so she asked, “Shifu, when you participated in the Marrow-Cleansing Pool back then, which pool did you enter?”

Su Yi Shui’s smile faded slightly. He lowered his head, “What do you think?”

Ranran didn’t actually want to believe her vague guess. Could it be that her Shifu’s choice back then was the same as Wei Jiu’s? She couldn’t help but look up at her master, staring into his eyes and asking, “Did you… choose the Black Pool?”

Su Yishui didn’t speak, but his expression did not seem to deny it either.

Ranran couldn’t help but hold her breath, looking at him for a long time, she asked timidly,
“Then… did you pay a price for it?”

Previous
Next

灵泉附身 Possessed by the Spirit Spring

Su Yi Shui nodded slowly this time, but just as Ranran was about to ask him what was the price he had paid and how he had severed his emotions, he suddenly reached out and hugged her, his arms tightening around her until she found it a little difficult to breathe.

Through their damp clothes, she could even feel his heart beating violently. With his chin rested on her head, he spoke in a low voice, “Someone decided to compensate for my sins with her life without asking me……This kind of self-righteousness person, should I forgive her?”

Ranran didn’t have time to think about who that annoying person might be. She was struggling to breathe with her master hugging her so tightly. “Shifu… I can’t breathe… Are you feeling unwell?”

As she spoke, Ranran noticed that the talisman bottle on her master’s neck glowed with a red light again, but before she could exclaim her alarm, she was startled once again by Su Yishui’s actions.

Shifu was not only hugging her now, but he was rubbing his chin against her ear, exactly like… the playful little tiger.

Su Yishui seemed to also realize that his emotions were getting out of control. He struggled to suppress his strange actions, before reluctantly letting go and stepping back a bit, taking a deep breath before saying, “There are some side effects after using the Beast-Taming Art. The effects will pass in about a month….will be fine after time passes, just don’t come near me these few days.”

Ranran blinked, recalling the descriptions about Beast-Taming Art from the books. This kind of technique, which involves placing one’s soul in a spirit beast, would cause the practitioner to adopt the habits of the beast for a long time… So few people personally used such techniques.

The little Gengjin White Tiger liked to act spoiled and snuggle into her arms to be petted, scratching its chin and fur… Did Shifu just have the urge to act like a tiger and wanted her to scratch his chin and stroke his fur?

Seeing Shifu seemingly looking very upset, as if compelled by a strange force, Ranran reached out and stroked his long hair. Su Yi Shui seemed surprised by Ranran’s action, his eyes widened, but his body involuntarily leaned closer to her again.

The side effects of Beast-Taming Art were still evident, and its not easy to break the habits even after transforming back into a human form. The usually serious Shifu was now……adorable. Ranran couldn’t help but chuckle, but faced with such a handsome human-shaped big cat, she also found it rather difficult to take action.

Su Yishui stared at her playful and cute smile, his eyes suddenly turning slightly red, just like when he had been possessed by the Spirit Spring at the Military Platform before, exactly the same!

Oh no! Ranran exclaimed inwardly, but before she could check if the Spirit Spring on his neck had leaked out, he reached out and held her neck. In the moment Ranran looked up, her Shifu’s slightly moist lips stuck onto hers……

Of course, afterwards, Ranran expressed great understanding towards her master. It was just a side effect of possessing the white tiger. The little tiger often liked to be affectionate like this with her, sticking to her face…

For the sake of protecting her, Shifu transformed into the white tiger, and now he has these uncontrollable side effects!

She tried to calm herself down and rationalize the sudden situation, telling herself that she was just being kissed by the playful tiger.

But being kissed by a playful tiger wouldn’t give her this tingling sensation, being unable to move… This……was completely different!

After she dazedly let Shifu kiss her for quite a while, Ranran finally came to her senses. She pushed him away, and then tore down the mountain with long strides……She actually ran all the way to Uncle Master Zeng’s villa.

It has been three days since her daughter had suddenly arrived. She showed no signs of wanting to go back.

It was great that Ranran could visit her parents, but seeing her daughter looking distracted every day… could it be that she had offended Master Su and had been expelled from the sect?

Qiao lian and Carpenter Xue were now working in Zeng Yi’s villa, had good income and lived as well as the rich masters in the town. They even had little maids and servants now.

And all of this was thanks to Master Su. So Qiao lian naturally wanted to find out what was wrong with her daughter. If her daughter didn’t want to go back, they wouldn’t want to take advantage of Master Su’s kindness. They would have to apologize to the Master. But if her daughter had suffered grievances on the mountain, they would have to back her up and then leave together.

“Mother… it’s nothing. I just missed you, so I came to see you.”

Qiao lian didn’t believe her and couldn’t help but point out to her daughter, “It’s a three to five day journey from Western Mountain to this place! How did you come here?”

After coming out of the Marrow-cleansing Pool, Ranran’s body was light and agile, so although it was a three to five day journey for ordinary people, she could reach it after half a day of running.

When Qiao lian heard that her daughter had run here, she was truly shocked and at the same time, deeply appreciative of Master Su’s truly miraculous abilities to have trained her weak daughter to possess such divine skills.

Seeing her daughter had become so healthy, Qiao lian naturally felt relieved. After confirming that her daughter was not injured or endured any grievances, she urged her daughter not to be lazy. Since she had rested here long enough, she should quickly go back to continue to work on her cultivation.

After perfunctorily agreeing, Ranran turned around and sat down limply on a lounge chair in the garden.

It was easy to run down the mountain, but how to return naturally was another matter.

Ranran was now deeply regretting, why did she ran so far on impulse.

Wasn’t it just being kissed by Shifu? Its not like she had not been kissed by a tiger before, and in fact, there wasn’t much difference if one thought hard about it.

Shifu must also have been unwilling. He is usually so cold and aloof; if it weren’t for protecting her, why would he have found himself fallen to such a position?

Thinking about it this way, perhaps it wasn’t only embarrassing for her that day; Shifu must have felt many times more flustered as well. Especially after her running away in this way, he must have been even more mortified?

Moreover, Shifu’s eyes turned red. Could it be that his body is too weak, so he’s been affected by the Spirit Spring’s corrupting influence?

The more Ranran thought about it, the more worried she became. She got up with a grunt , not even caring to take the stir-fried pork and pickled vegetables that Qiao lian had prepared for her, and decided to return to Western Mountain right away.

But she did not expect that, as soon as she opened the door, she bumped into Second Uncle Master.

Seeing her, Yutong said crossly, “Ranran, why did you run off without a word? Do you know how worried we’ve been as we looked for you these past few days!”

In truth, Yutong didn’t know why Ranran suddenly left the mountain that day.

Their Master had also chased after her that day. However, by night time, he had returned, looking like he was in an icehouse. The Master, who had regained some vitality, became frosty once more.

Qiu Xier and the others were worried about Ranran and had searched the town below but didn’t find her. Last night, when the Master instructed her to look for Ranran at the villa and bring the medicinal tree root water she had been drinking over as well.

When Ranran took the tree root water, she felt deeply ashamed again. Even at this point, Shifu was still worried about her old illness and sent someone to bring her medicine.

Yet she completely disregarded Shifu’s body which is still not fully recovered, and ran off on her own. Just think, how wrong was she?

Shifu! I’ve been unfilial, running away like this and not staying by your sickbed and serving you with all my heart!

With this in mind, Ranran drank the medicine water in one gulp, wiped her mouth and prepared to return to Western Mountain with Second Uncle Master. But Yutong stopped her, “Master said, you miss your parents, so you can stay here for a longer time. I’ve brought the tree roots for you to make the medicinal water, so you can stay as long as you want…”

Ranran listened to this with her mouth slightly gaping, feeling unsure if Shifu was going to expel her from the sect.

Actually Yutong was also very curious about what happened between the two of them that day after they had gone. She couldn’t understand why Ranran had fled all the way here and refused to see anyone.

When Second Uncle Master asked, Ranran, who was usually very frank and direct, started to speak hesitatingly. She didn’t want to tell others about Shifu’s condition.

If others misunderstood Shifu’s character and thought he was morally flawed, it would be her fault as a disciple. Besides, she had thought that Second Uncle Master, who had been by Shifu’s side for so many years, might have some kind of special relationship with him.

She didn’t want to say anything that might harm the relationship between Shifu and Second Uncle Master…

But if Shifu didn’t want her to return, that made her even more uneasy. She was worried that something else might have gone wrong with his health during this time.

Now in Western Mountain, her cultivation was second only to Shifu. If some mishap happened to Shifu, only she could help him redirect spiritual power and protect his body…

Thinking of this, she couldn’t stay any longer and was determined to go back with Second Uncle Master.

Second Uncle Master couldn’t understand what Ranran was thinking either. Seeing her insistence, she could only bring her back again.

When they returned, Ranran didn’t see Shifu. She heard that he had started seclusion again, and stopped his meals.

But he had just suffered a serious internal injury and needed recuperation, so fasting was obviously not ideal right now.

Ranran bought premium beef brisket in town. She also remembered that Shifu liked to eat sweets, so she also bought sweet chestnuts to cook with fatty duck. As for dessert, she added some almond pastries with sheep cheese, paired with a mellow Two Springs Yin Hao Green Tea.
*银毫绿茶 银毫 yinhao is the fresh new green leaves from tea bush

She arranged a full tray and then carried it lightly, jumping all the way to the mountaintop.

The little tiger was lazily sunbathing at the entrance of the cave. When it saw Ranran, it immediately wagged its head and swished its tail.

Ranran placed the prepared meat bones and cut chicken pieces in front of it. The shrunken tiger didn’t eat much, but it was very particular and preferred the bones with some meat on and the crispy bone parts of the chicken was its favorite.

After feeding the little tiger, Ranran hesitated at the entrance of the cave for a while before entering with the tray.

But as soon as she entered, she did not see Su Yishui but smelled a strong scent of alcohol.

When she went in, Ranran saw small wine jars on the ground.

It seemed like Su Yishui was too drunk to be up, and sprawled on the stone platform.

A person who was usually so disciplined, with strong willpower, Ranran silently looked at the neatly arranged wine jars and the neatly folded semi-old clothes next to them. She really admired Shifu so much. Even when he got drunk, he didn’t allow his surroundings to be dirty and messy…

If it weren’t for the fact that he was lying there sprawled out, one would think he was just taking a nap, and not being drunk.

Shifu… could it be that he had been drinking to drown his sorrows because he thought I resented him?

Thinking of this, Ranran slowly crouched down, gently touching Su Yishui’s head. It was obvious that the aftereffects of the Beast-taming technique were still there. When her slender fingers touched his long hair, he couldn’t help but lean his head towards her hand like the little tiger.

Ranran found that she had no resistance to this cat-like attribute. Although Shifu was more haughty and aloof than the Gengjin White Tiger, but……stroking his hair, he was still very pleasant to touch.

At this moment, the drunk Su Yishui, seemed to sense someone beside him and suddenly opened his eyes.

When he and Ranran locked eyes, he suddenly sat up straight, staring at her big eyes.

Ranran didn’t expect Shifu to wake up so soon, and she had not even withdrawn her hand that had been petting his head. She cleared her throat, pointing to the tray beside her and said, “Shifu, I’ve made food for you… eat some while it’s hot…”

Su Yishui looked at the steaming hot food and then at the run-away young girl who had returned. In the end, without saying anything, he quietly put on his outer robe, then picked up the bowl and chopsticks and ate heartily.

The master and disciple seemed have a great rapport and neither brought up the incident under the pavilion during the rain. After Ranran cleared away the small wine jars, she couldn’t help but ask, “Shifu… do you like Second Uncle Master?”

Su Yishui just finished his meal. After setting down his chopsticks, he took a sip of green tea to cleanse his palate, then looked up at her, silent for a moment before saying, “I thought, you were going to ask if I like you……”

Ranran smiled in embarrassment, “There is no need to ask. Shifu, you treat all of us disciples with great care.”

How many masters in this world would risk their lives to save their disciples?

Su Yishui’s eyes seemed to lose their light for a moment, and he asked coldly, “Didn’t you already leave? Why have you returned?”

Ranran bit her lip and said in a small voice, “I came back because I was worried about Shifu…”

Su Yishui glanced at her and this time answered her previous question, “Your Second Uncle Master has someone she loves and they even have a child, living in the town below Western Mountain. My liking for her is the same as liking Yuchen, Qiuxier and Gao Cang.”

Having been here at Western Mountain for so long, Ranran never expected that Second Uncle Master had a child. She couldn’t help but be very shocked, “What? How come I didn’t know?”

She was so astonished by this gossip, so much so that she did not realize that Shifu’s “liking” solely did not include Xue Ranran.

As it turned out, there were many things about Western Mountain that she, a small rookie, didn’t know! Second Uncle Master indeed had a six-year-old son.

Because Second Uncle Master was responsible for purchasing things from the town below, she could visit her family below the mountain from time to time, reuniting with her child and lover. No wonder she occasionally saw Second Uncle Master buying some wooden toys.

That lover was a schoolteacher in the town below, thirty-four years old this year.

It was said that Second Uncle Master met him when she was sixteen, and they developed feelings for each other. However, Second Uncle Master did not marry him but only had a child with him. After weaning, she let the scholar surnamed Chang take the child down the mountain.

Later, Ranran curiously asked Second Uncle Master why she didn’t marry, and Yutong sighed, “Since I’ve decided to follow Master in cultivation, I will have to abandon the secular world one day. I will follow my brother to serve Master, while he has his own worldly life to live. If I don’t marry him, he can marry the woman he likes in the future, without carrying the reputation of being unfaithful. Isn’t that the best of both worlds?”

Hearing Yutong’s words, Ranran couldn’t help but remember the two sealed memories she encountered on Tianmai Mountain. Cultivation was desirable for mortals, but if one had to give up all the beauty of the secular world, it wasn’t as desirable anymore.

While applying medicine to the little tiger under the Pavilion by the pool, Ranran asked her Shifu who was drinking tea nearby, “What happened to Dun Tian’s wife and child later on?”

Su Yishui put down his teacup, looked at the distant mountain ridges, and said mildly, “Dun Tian had a life-and-death battle with the Earth Demon. His wife and child were taken by the Earth Demon as hostages. To defeat the Earth Demon, Dun Tian had to achieve enlightenment and reach a state of no desires. So he did not rescue his wife and child; after he subdued the Earth Demon, he ascended.”

Ranran drew in a cold gasp. Suddenly, she remembered that in Dun Tian’s memories, she never saw the faces of his wife and child. When Dun Tian ascended, did he feel guilty towards his wife and child, so much so that he didn’t dare to even think about how they looked like in his memories?

Thinking of this, Ranran felt quite bad and asked her Shifu softly, “Shifu, if one day, you are also faced with such a choice, would you sacrifice your greatest love like Dun Tian did to achieve enlightenment?”

Su Yishui heard her question but did not answer. Instead, he asked her, “What about you? What would you do?”

Ranran thought seriously. In her life, apart from loving her parents and Shifu, she also loved her Uncle Masters and senior brothers and sisters. If she had to exchange them for some stupid eternal youth, she would rather become an old lady with wrinkles immediately!

But hearing her words, Shifu furrowed his brow, grabbed her by the neck, brought her close, and said, “Remember, you should never sacrifice yourself for anyone! I risked my life in exchange for yours. In this life, you live for yourself only!”

Ranran did not understand what he meant. She thought by ‘risking my life’ he was referring to the previous incident when he saved her when he merged with the White Tiger.

But Shifu was not wrong to say this either. Without him, she would have died from illness long ago!

Now that she knew that Shifu and Second Uncle Master were not immortal companions, Ranran felt relieved. But being pulled so close by Shifu, she couldn’t help but remember the last time Shifu had kissed her…

Could it be that Shifu is suffering from the aftereffects of possessing the tiger again, and he wants to be playful like the tiger with her?

Shifu could put his life on the line for her, how could she repay this kindness? Even if she gave her all, it wouldn’t be too much!

With that in mind, Ranran reached out with her hand and scratched Shifu’s chin a few times.

Su Yishui was stunned by the sudden action of her improper hand. While Ranran scratched his chin, she asked, “How does it feel? Do you feel comfortable?”

Whether words or actions, they all carry the same frivolous manner to harass decent people. Su Yishui had encountered this more than twenty years ago. However, back then, that striking and captivating woman had been full of carefree spontaneity, although teasing, he had never entered into her heart.

But the young girl before him now, although her actions are a little… impetuous, but her eyes are full of innocence and simplicity.

Whichever type, it would make a man feel like he’s drinking aged mellow wine, drowning in it and never wanting to wake up…

Just as Ranran was about to pull away, Su Yishui caught her by her slender waist, his thin lips, faintly scented with wine, met hers again. But this time, it wasn’t as gentle as before; Su Yishui let himself go completely, fiercely and passionately deepening this kiss.

Ranran was startled once again by her Shifu… This wasn’t a tiger being playful? This was clearly a predator who caught its prey, devouring it whole!

When Su Yishui finally lifted his head like he still didn’t get enough, his little disciple in his arms had melted into a puddle after the kiss.

Ranran instinctively wanted to run out of the cave, but Su Yishui, now experienced, held her slender waist tightly, “Where are you trying to run to? Didn’t you say you’ll take care of me until I have fully recovered?”

Even without looking in a mirror, Ranran could feel her cheeks slightly hot. Was this what they meant by heavenly tribulation, thunder and fire intertwining? Was it the feeling she just experienced?

This time, Ranran dashed away again. After forcefully pushing her Shifu aside, she ran back to her room, diving under the covers and refusing to come out…

Qiuxier noticed that her little junior sister, after returning from her visit to her parents, seemed to have lost her soul, always appearing preoccupied.

Even during her favorite pastry-making time, she could get distracted. Watching Ranran pour a bottle of dark soy sauce into the flour, Qiu Xier couldn’t stand it anymore, but lean in and ask loudly in her ear, “Junior sister! Are you making savory almond pastries?”

Ranran then came back to her senses, looking at the dark-colored dough in her hand and exclaimed, “Oh no!”

Qiu Xier, understanding the situation, took the dough from her hand and threw it into a bamboo basket used for composting, then said solemnly, “Luckily, Second Uncle Master isn’t here, or she would definitely feel sorry for the wasted flour… Ranran, you’ve been absent-minded these past few days, always skipping Shifu’s classes. Either you claim to have a stomachache or a headache… Could it be that you didn’t bathe in the Marrow-cleansing pool at Tianmai Mountain but in an infected pool?”

Qiu xier’s words were not an exaggeration at all. Since the incident with second senior brother last time, Su Yishui seemed to have opened his spiritual sense as a good mentor, paying close attention to their studies, completely changing his previous lax and uncaring attitude.
