But the usually diligent junior sister now seemed possessed by second senior brother, playing truant and feigning illness.

Yet, when it came to the junior sister, their now strict Shifu went back to being lax. If Junior sister said she was sick, Shifu believed her without question and never urged her to attend class.

Because Qiu xier couldn’t cross the Snake Bridge at Tianmai Mountain, she was punished by Shifu to practice Light Body Skill. Everyday she had to walk back and forth on a hemp rope tied between two trees. If she fell, she had to skip dinner.

In just a few days, Qiuxier had lost alot of weight, her small pointed chin becoming prominent. So this morning, she tried to imitate junior sister and told Shifu her heels hurt, so she couldn’t stand for long.

But unlike junior sister’s situation, Shifu’s kindness was nowhere to be found. After hearing her complaints expressionlessly, Su Yishui instructed her to fetch spring water up and down the mountain until her heels stopped hurting.

After Qiu xier’s heels miraculously stopped hurting without any medication, she was particularly curious about junior sister’s secret to faking illness.

Ranran let out a long sigh but then asked third senior sister out of the blue, “Senior sister, has Shifu ever been particularly close to you?”

Qiu xier thought for a moment and said, “The closest proximity was when I made a mistake in writing the Wind Control Technique, and Shifu punished me by hitting a ruler on my hands. Now whenever Shifu looks at me, I will break out in a cold sweat… Why, did Shifu punish you too?”

Ranran thought of the heated kiss she shared with Su Yishui in his arms, and her ears started burning.

Qiu xier didn’t understand and, seeing junior sister blush, thought she might really have a fever, reaching out to feel her temperature in concern.

Just then, Gao Cang ran up from below the mountain, shouting loudly, “Junior sister, there’s a package with your name on it at the Guest-Declining Stone down the mountain!”

Ranran peeked out from the kitchen window and indeed saw a delicate package in Senior brother’s hands.

Seeing senior brother eager to open the package, Ranran hurriedly shouted, “Wait!”

Then she quickly jumped out from the window and said, “We don’t know who sent this package; we can’t open it recklessly. What if it contains Immortal Devouring Bugs? That would be disastrous!”

Upon hearing Ranran’s reminder, Gao Cang got frightened and threw the package far away on the ground.

Having personally experienced the scene of Immortal Devouring Insects covering Tianmai Mountain, he still can’t help but shudder at the sight of a red-headed fly now.

Are you also a little confused?
They were in the cave, then a pavilion by a pool was mentioned… but the little tiger had been basking itself outside the cave, so it might be just another pavilion outside his ‘man’ cave LOL

This scene hits different now right? Careful Ranran! Don’t mess with the Tiger! lol

Su Yishui’s attorney says:

Don’t blame Su Yishui! He is not in full control of his actions!
He has been weakened by the internal injuries, so the Spirit Spring is affecting him as well!

Next

一字回信 ONE-WORDED REPLY

Ranran cautiously walked over and carefully examined the package, only to find a line of words on top of it – “For Xue Ranran.”

She didn’t recognize the handwriting, and since she had just left her parents, it was unlikely that they would ask someone to deliver something so soon.

So the three of them gathered around the paper package for a long while, finally deciding to take it down the mountain and open it there.

But just as Ranran was about to take the package and head down the mountain, she happened to run into Su Yi Shui coming towards her.

When Ranran unexpectedly looked up and saw her Shifu in white wide-sleeved robes with half-tied hair, she suddenly felt at a loss like a mouse meeting a cat.

Her lips even began to tingle slightly, as if spontaneously recalling the agitated feeling of being swept away by fierce winds and waves.

However, Su Yi Shui seemed to have completely forgotten what had happened a few days ago. Without even looking at Ranran, he simply took the package from her hands.

Su Yishui recognized the handwriting on the package.

He looked up coldly at Ranran and said, “This is Wei Jiu’s handwriting.”

Ranran was somewhat bewildered, wondering why Wei Jiu would suddenly send her a package.

After Su Yishui shook the package to make sure there was nothing harmful inside, he opened the oiled paper wrapping.

Inside was a jade medicine box wrapped in fine velvet. Such exquisite items were very extravagent. Made from top-quality jade, hollowed out, and meticulously carved. When the small ring was pulled open, apart from fragrant medicinal pills and ointments for external use, there was also a handwritten letter from Wei Jiu.

As Su Yishui read the letter, Ranran couldn’t contain her curiosity and couldn’t help but lean over to read.

Without getting into Wei Jiu’s questionable character and morals, his literary flair was actually pretty good.

The letter described Wei Jiu’s thoughts after parting ways with Ranran, how he would reminiscing about their experiences of life and death together on Tianmai Mountain at nights. He even mentioned the sweet potato slices that Ranran had personally given him, which he cherished. Worried about any scars the insect bites might leave on Ranran’s delicate skin, he specially sent miraculous medicines to help her heal…

The following paragraphs were filled with flowery language of love and nature, moonlit nights, typical of when a man tries to flaunt his literary prowess, with thoughts meandering endlessly, as tedious and smelly as foot-binding cloth.

Before Ranran could finish reading, Su Yishui had already crushed several sheets of paper into ashes with his large palm.

Ranran said in a small voice, “I haven’t finished reading yet…”

Su Yishui tilted his head slightly, even his sharp nose emitting a cold aura. “Do you want to write him a reply so that Excellency Wei can write another one for you to enjoy?”

Ranran pursed her lips, unable to speak further. She watched as her Shifu raised his hand and threw the valuable jade medicine box down the mountain, crashing loudly and shattering into pieces.

After throwing away the box, Su Yishui left without looking back.

Ranran was very disapproving of her master’s crudeness. Although their XiShan sect and Crimson Gate sect were irreconcilable, there was no enmity with money. Such a valuable item should be returned or pawning it for money would have been better than just throwing it down the mountain.

However, Wei Jiu’s act of sending medicine to Ranran sparked Qiu Xier’s endless curiosity once again. How could her junior sister have such great charm, making even someone like Wei Jiu personally send gifts to express gratitude? Could it be that Wei Jiu had developed feelings for her junior sister and intended to lure Xishan disciples away?

In the cultivation world, such things occasionally happened, like when Mu Qingge enticed Su Yishui away in the past.

If Wei Jiu valued Ranran’s potential and wanted to lure away outstanding disciples from Xishan using his allure, it was entirely possible.

Qiu Xier thought Wei Jiu actually looked quite good, but alas, his tendency to open up people’s stomachs after disagreement, made him an unsuitable match for a celestial couple. Qiu Xier couldn’t help but shake her head and feel sorry for her junior sister.

However, from this perspective, her junior sister was still highly regarded by these powerful cultivators.

Learning from the lesson of their second uncle Master, who is bound to separate from her mortal partner after decades on the cultivation path, finding a fellow cultivator to ascend together was the true path of cultivation.

Hence, the partners of cultivators were mostly unrelated to romantic love; they simply supported and elevated each other over the long time it takes in their path of cultivation. Her junior sister’s recent rise in status at such a young age indicated that she might not have to wait until her face was full of wrinkles to achieve something significant. It seemed finding a cultivation partner would also be just around the corner!

Ranran had no time to dwell on these thoughts. She had indeed been deliberately avoiding Su Yishui recently, especially after the kiss in the cave, which was too ambiguous for her to rationalize. Of course, this was also related to the aftermath of Shifu using the Beast-Taming Technique.

Ranran was very self-conscious, and she dared not assume that her Shifu had any unusual feelings towards her. So she tried to avoid Shifu as much as possible these days. Once Shifu’s side effects subsided after a few days, their relationship of a kind master and filial disciple could naturally return to its harmonious state.

But Wei Jiu’s untimely solicitous letter had to arrive at this time, and untimely seen by her Shifu.

If Shifu misunderstood her resolve, thinking she was being tempted by a demonic cultivator and intentionally avoiding him to prepare to defect from the sect, wouldn’t that… be a huge misunderstanding?

So after avoiding her master for several days, Ranran finally took the initiative to bring freshly baked almond pastries to her master today.

Su Yishui was meditating by the poolside. He is tall and slender, with long limbs. Even though he is just sitting casually cross-legged in simple white robes, with his broad shoulders and his narrow waist, he was still very pleasing to the eye.

This must be what people mean when they think of majestic and elegance . From a distance, against the backdrop of the ice lotus pool, the man with thick brows and long hair actually surpassed the flowers in exuding divine refinement.
*龙章凤姿 literally majestic demeanor of a dragon and the graceful elegance of a phoenix

Ranran walked slowly over in small steps, but she didn’t get too close. Instead, she asked through the pavilion railing, “Shifu, would you like some almond pastries?”

Su Yishui didn’t look at her but said mildly, “Your body is so healthy today that you can leave the bed to make pastries?”

Ranran knew her recent attempts to feign illness were crude, and her weak lies wouldn’t hold up. But Shifu clearly knew the reason and had no right to reproach her.

She remembered that her purpose today was to express her true intentions, so she said very softly, “Shifu, please rest assured, no matter how demons tempt me, I will not defect from the sect…”

Su Yishui looked up at her this time, still speaking mildly, “*Don’t say something you cannot be certain of. Perhaps one day, you will find that I am not worthy of being your teacher, and you will voluntarily leave the sect.”
*话不要说满，事不必做绝

Upon hearing this, Ranran felt her Shifu was being too childish. Did he think she avoided him these days because she was repulsed by him?

So she hurriedly knelt beside him with the pastries in hand and said, “Shifu, what are you saying? How could your disciple abandon her Shifu? These days, I was just afraid that Shifu would always be like the tiger…… and when you recall it later on, you will feel uncomfortable.”

Su Yishui didn’t look at her, just closed his eyes again and said coldly, “Rest assured, I was just affected by the Spirit Spring leaking and lost control for a moment. It won’t happen again……”

Ranran understood his meaning; Shifu was saying that his side effects had dissipated, so he wouldn’t be as affectionate towards her like the little tiger as before, always hugging and kissing.

With her Shifu’s assurance, Ranran should have felt relieved. However, seeing him colder than before, she inexplicably felt a little sad. She couldn’t help but feel like their relationship… couldn’t go back to how it used to be.

But she didn’t have much time to dwell on this sadness because the jade bottle on Su Yishui’s neck, containing the Netherworld spiritual spring, was turning redder.

Su Yishui had once said that the spiritual spring should not linger too long in the secular world, or it would become increasingly sinister.

Unfortunately, Mu Qingge was killed shortly after she had obtained the Spirit spring, so the spring had remained in the mortal realm for about twenty years.

Although Elder Jiu provided a jade talisman bottle to contain it, it was not a long-term solution.

Before the Marrow-Cleansing Pool assembly, the Spring was stable because Su Yishui’s spiritual power could suppress it. But due to Su Yishui merging with the white tiger to protect Ranran and suffering heavy internal injuries, the Spiritual Spring seemed to sense his weakened state and became restless again, attempting to break free from its confinement and escape.

Later, when Ranran and the others returned in time, Su Yishui woke up in time. However, the flawless jade bottle now had two fine cracks.

This was not a good sign. Since Wei Jiu had returned the key, it was a matter of urgency to return the spiritual spring to the Netherworld.

However, opening the Netherworld had its timing and location requirements.

The timing had to be during the peak of Yin in the mortal realm, in a place where the Yin energies was at its strongest.

But the flow of Yin energy was constantly changing, affected by the seasons and temperatures. The timing and location of opening the Netherworld realm were unpredictable, so the pattern on the key would change every five years after each use.

The most recent best opportunity had already been used by Wei Jiu. Unfortunately, Wei Jiu’s went for nothing and he only found an empty and dried-up spring. The next opening would require another round of effort.

Recently, there has been a flurry of activity in front of Xishan’s Guest Declining Stone. After Wei Jiu sent medicine for the first time, perhaps seeing that the girl didn’t return anything on the Stone, he thought she was easily swayed by his literary talent and gifts, so he continued to send a few more times.

Noticing her Shifu’s increasingly tense expression, Ranran can’t avoid writing a stern letter to clarify her stance.

After finishing the letter, Ranran even specially showed it to her Shifu, asking if her response was appropriate.

Her Shifu glanced at the few lines of elegant handwriting and disdainfully threw it aside. He then wrote a big *”Get lost” on a piece of paper and handed it to Ranran, saying, “Copy it and send it out.”
*滚 go away, get lost

Ranran is a very teachable child, she immediately understood that her master found her writing too much for the devil and didn’t express a strong enough intention of breaking ties.

And Shifu’s one-word reply was ingenious, as it carried a strong sense of righteousness. So she respectfully copied a “Get lost” with explosive font, placed it on the Guest-Declining Stone along with all the gifts sent by Wei Jiu.

This one word was definitely effective, and since then, the stone finally resumed its peaceful days.

However, things with Wei Jiu has quieten down, but General Qin Xuanjiu, who guarded the Wangxiang Pass, came again.

Since the water demon incident, the court had sent people several times to search for new water demons. However, nothing sinister happened at the Wangxiang Pass again, and Qin Xuanjiu’s compass remained silent like a piece of scrap iron.

Qin Xuanjiu had never encountered such a situation before. When he went to the Capital to report to the Emperor’s inquiries, he also asked his mentor, Mu Qingge, how to deal with this situation.

But Mu Qingge coldly said she didn’t know and told him to go ask Su Yishui.

Later, it seemed like his master had completely forgotten about her closed-door disciple. He sent letters to the Capital several times, but never received a reply from Mu Qingge. He found out after that his master had left the capital to attend the Bone Marrow Pool Meeting.

This time, the situation has escalated too much at Tianmai Mountain. Even Qin Xuanjiu in the northwest heard the news, which said that Mu Qingge had not changed her evil ways and had caused a huge disaster by releasing something called the Immortal Devouring Bug, destroying the spiritual veins of the Bone Marrow Pool, and so on.

His revered mentor had just experienced a hard-won rebirth, yet in the short time when she had barely accomplished anything, criticisms from the righteous faction poured forth like a torrential flood.

Although Qin Xuanjiu was not present, he was sure his Master was good and someone was framing her.

Back then, if it wasn’t for his Mentor sealing the spiritual spring, wouldn’t the world have been in chaos? But people were blind and always blamed his Mentor!

Qin Xuanjiu believed it was the three major sects fabricating stories to smear his Master’s reputation, so he came to Xishan to find Su Yishui for an explanation. He also wanted to see if Su Yishui could help clear his Master’s name and remove the injustice.

Su Yishui didn’t get along with him and didn’t bother to meet him.

So Ranran went down the mountain to receive this Uncle Master Qin on behalf of her Shifu.

Qin Xuanjiu, seeing that Su Yishui didn’t even show his face, was very angry: “If my Master had kept rats and cockroaches back then, they would be better than Su Yishui! Now people from the major sects are cursing my Master, but he just remained indifferent and refuses to speak out about the good things my Master did for the world. He’s truly heartless!”

If General Qin said something else, it would be fine, but he insulted Su Yishui like this in front of Ranran, which made her very unhappy!

Her Shifu was the best in the world, who was this despicable Elder Mu to compare?

So Ranran was not very polite and told him about the situation at Tianmai Mountain back then: “If it weren’t for my lucky escape, I would have been killed by your Master on the mountain. Even if she was a great person in the past, since her rebirth, I haven’t seen her do anything good! My Master said that your Master also left you instructions in the past life. If the compass remained silent, it would mean that the situation at the Wangxiang Pass is over, and you can leave freely without being burdened by her orders. Since the present Mu Qingge has forgotten what she told you, just remember your Master’s instructions!”

It was true that Mu Qingge did leave Qin Xuanjiu with these instructions.

But at this moment, Qin Xuanjiu was shocked by Ranran’s words and stared at her with wide eyes.

“How… how is that possible? My Master is not like that… you, you little brat, you’re talking nonsense! I’ll tear your mouth apart!”

He actually lunged at her, ready to teach Ranran a lesson.

Unfortunately, Ranran was not the same as before. Qin Xuanjiu, with teeth bared and claws out, came at her, but Ranran easily knocked him down.

The tall man lay on the ground motionless, crying loudly, snot and tears streaming down, saying, “Even if the world curses my Master, I will never betray my Mentor! My Master is the best!”

Ranran felt like she was facing a three-year-old with a full beard, completely unable to reason with him.

But at that moment, Qin Xuanjiu choked up and stopped her from leaving, stuttering, “You once said that the ointment your Master prepared can heal flesh wounds… Can you get me a box? Otherwise, I’ll cry under Xishan every day, causing chaos in the Fengshui of Xishan, and no one will be able to cultivate peacefully!”

Ranran wasn’t afraid of his threats, but she found his shameless behavior both annoying and amusing. She asked who he needed the medicine for.

Qin Xuanjiu straightened up and said he heard that his Mentor’s face was scratched by Wei Jiu and had been festering, so he came to scold Su Yishui until he felt remorseful and ask for a divine medicine to heal his Mentor’s face!”

Ranran looked at the troublesome General Qin and felt a headache. She felt that Mu Qingge probably entrusted the Spiritual spring to Qin Xuanjiu not because she thought he was very lucky but because she saw that his stubborn streak made him unlikely to break his vows.

Ranran didn’t want to help heal Mu Qingge’s injuries, but keeping such a big man crying at the foot of the mountain was not a solution either. Finally, Ranran went to her Shifu’s pharmacy, rummaged through bottles and jars, and managed to find a bottle of ointment her master had prepared before. She gave it to Qin Xuanjiu and persuaded him to leave.

The only thing Qin Xuanjiu was right about, was that Mu Qingge’s facial injuries were indeed getting worse.

Although she had shifted the blame regarding the Immortal Devouring Bug incident onto Wen Hongshan, her reputation was still tarnished.

After all, intercepting Wei Fang and the two Wen sisters, was an undeniable fact.

As a result, the Elder Kaiyuan of the Jiuhua Sect completely turned against her, publicly stating that if he ever saw this ungrateful person again, he would surely kill her and scatter her soul again.

However, Mu Ranwu did not take the threats from the three major sects to heart.

At present, she didn’t rely on those so-called prestigious and righteous sects. Even if she incurred infamy, so what? People in this world respect strength; she was no longer an ordinary woman. Sooner or later, those righteous sects would have to look up to her…

However, at the moment, looking at the woman in the bronze mirror whose face was ruined, Mu Ranwu found it difficult to face herself!

She had spent the effort of two lifetimes to achieve her stunning appearance, yet Wei Jiu had destroyed much of it with a single scratch.

Thinking of this, she was filled with resentment!

Mu Ranwu viciously struck the mirror with the comb in her hand, creating a uneven large dent, causing the reflected image to become even more distorted and ugly.

Just then, a eunuch came to the palace gate to deliver medicine. One was the medicine personally prepared by the current emperor’s imperial physician. The other was sent by General Qin of the Wangxiang Pass, supposedly a spiritual medicine obtained from Su Yishui.

Mu Ranwu instructed the palace maid to keep the ointment sent by the emperor. As for the gift sent by that foolish Qin Xuanjiu, Mu Ranwu didn’t even bother to look at it; she just ordered the palace maid to throw it far away.

Qin Xuanjiu was indeed useless. She wondered why her sister had taken him in as a disciple in her previous life. Instead of seeking medicine from anyone else, he had to gone to Xishan.

Did Su Yishui and Xue Ranran have any good intentions towards her? How could they possibly send genuine medicine for her injuries? In her opinion, it might as well disfigure her further!

With that in mind, she instructed someone to bring the bottle of medication sent by Su Yu. Upon opening the pearl-encrusted jade medicine box, a faint medicinal fragrance wafted out.

After the palace maid tested the medicine, Mu Ranwu felt assured enough to apply it on herself.

Over the years, Su Yu, due to his poor health, had sought many experts, and so they collected quite a few remedies for flesh wounds.

After applying the medicine, Mu Ranwu felt that her previously burning wounds were soothed and felt much better.

Just then, the eunuch said softly, “His Majesty shows compassion for the War Goddess’s health, so he specifically obtained this Heart-Eroding Grass that can temporarily restrain the Grudge Water for you. However, this type of divine grass only temporarily alleviates pain… The specific solution still requires your careful consideration… The Grudge Water is also a demonic entity from the Nether realm, perhaps the Spiritual Spring is the solution to dispel it…”

Mu Ranwu thanked the eunuch with a smile and instructed to have him escorted out of the West Palace.

This Heart-Eroding Grass ingridient had been discerned by Su Yu’s alchemy master, from the pills Su Yishui had given her before.

With this spiritual grass which grows once every twenty years, she was not afraid even if Su Yishui falls out with her and refused to give her the antidote.

After taking the Heart-Eroding Grass, her body indeed felt much lighter. She dismissed the attendants and palace maids, then sat cross-legged on a fragrant mat, focusing on meditation and restoring her vitality. Cultivators must not slack off; she had inherited great energy from her sister, but it had been greatly reduced by the Grudge Water’s constraints.

If she didn’t strengthen her cultivation now, her strength might fall behind Xue Ranran who had just emerged from the marrow-cleansing pool.

In her previous life, she had secretly compared herself to her sister, falling behind for a lifetime, leaving an unresolved knot in her heart.

This lifetime, she clearly had a better start than her sister by several times. How could she passively watch that mediocre person surpass her again?

She absolutely couldn’t afford to lose inexplicably again!

Although the plan with the Immortal Devouring Bug at Tianmai Mountain had failed, she still had a way.

Because she knew that the Spiritual Spring of the Nether Realm was in Su Yishui’s hands. Previously, Su Yishui had used the antidote for the Grudge Water to threaten her, so she naturally dared not speak out.

But now that she had completely fallen out with the people of Xishan, she didn’t have to worry about these things anymore. Once news about the Spiritual Spring was in Su Yishui’s hands spread… The days in Xishan would be even more lively than Tianmai Mountain in the past… She hoped that her reincarnated sister would be able to find some peace and focus on cultivation…

Thinking of this, Mu Ranwu smiled delightedly while meditating. On her still unhealed face, the crimson scar appeared even more ferocious…

The aftermath of the Tianmai Mountain incident lasted a long time. Outstanding disciples from the three major sects were all injured, especially the Jiuhua and Kongshan sects suffered heavy losses.

The winner for the marrow-cleansing pool unexpectedly did not come from the three major sects, landing on Xishan, which had been relatively unknown for years! This served as an inspiration to new cultivators who had not yet joined a sect.

So after the morose Qin Xuanjiu had been sent away after much effort, there came a group of young people eager to join the sect.

Qiu Xier took Ranran to look down the mountain. This time, those who came to join were not ordinary disciples; they all had a refined aura and were likely not ordinary people. Some even came with an existing cultivation.

If they took in a group of outstanding disciples, it would mean that the Lingxi Palace of Xishan had seized this opportunity, with a chance to surpass the three major sects at one go and become the leader of the righteous path.

Unfortunately, even though Su Yishui had become more diligent about teaching his disciples now, he had no interest in having disciples all over the world.
*桃李满天下

I LOVE this following chapter after their kiss! I get a feeling things have slowly changed between Ranran and Su Yishui.

Su Yishui under the influence of the Spirit Spring, is now acting more like himself. Which is a good thing! This way, Ranran does not love the ‘wrong’ stoic Shifu and could see all his petty shortcomings for herself hahaha Jealous Su Yishui is such a hoot.

This is the first time Ranran had anything negative to say about her Shifu, and its because he did not decide to sell off that jade medicine box for money!
Little disciple only has money on her mind in this life, in contrast to how she lived lavishly in her past life.

But its obvious she was also in denial right?
She may not have the confidence to think that Shifu likes her but she definitely drawn to him like a moth to a flame. Who is the one waxing poetic like Wei jiu whenever she sets eyes on her Shifu?
Filial piety?? SURE.

Previous
Next

初次入京 FIRST TIME IN THE CAPITAL

Even though talented youths continued to come calling, the gates of Xishan remained tightly closed.

Second senior brother, who came to deliver items, greatly appreciated the master’s principle of preferring to have quality over quantity.

Bai Baishan now had no cultivation, equivalent to being a useless person. It was already a challenge for him to skillfully use his feet to eat; he was far from the realm of crafting intricate items with his feet.

If Shifu were to find new disciples with excellent aptitude at this time, wouldn’t it be a case of favoring the new and abandoning the old, leaving all his old disciples in the cold?

However, regarding the matter of accepting new disciples, Su Yishui had actually asked the opinion of his little disciple.

Ranran was administering medicine to the little tiger and was somewhat surprised by her Shifu’s words. “Shifu, regarding the recruitment of disciples, it is naturally up to you to decide. However, if we are to bring in new people, I’m afraid we will need to renovate some of the houses on the mountain again, which could be a bit troublesome. I wonder if Second Uncle Master is willing to spend money on repairs.”

After hearing her reply, Su Yishui nodded and instructed Yu Chen to go down the mountain and get them to leave.

Ranran felt that her Shifu was not someone indecisive and needed to listen to others’ opinions.

However, when it came to matters like the houses on the mountain or the goods and books stored in the warehouse, Shifu always bypassed the two Uncle Masters and specifically asked for her opinion, as if she were the old owner of Lingxi Palace, and he needed her approval for everything.

But Shifu had too many quirks, and Ranran had already gotten used to them.

Since the last quasi-cold war, she and Shifu had finally managed to resume a peaceful relationship between master and disciple.

They both tacitly avoided mentioning the two times they had embraced and kissed.

After all, there was still the danger of the spiritual spring leaking, and solving this matter was urgent.

Apart from the time spent practicing and meditating, Su Yishui always took Ranran to the study, where they buried themselves looking through the pile of ancient books.

The entrance to the Netherworld Realm was elusive, originally found on the patterns of the key.

However, Wei Jiu had already used it, so those patterned maps were now outdated. If they waited for new patterns to emerge, it would take several years at least.

But Su Yishui’s rune bottle around his neck might not last that long, so they had to find another way. They couldn’t just wait for the key to reveal a new map. The master and disciple duo tried to find some clues in the ancient books.

Mu Qingge was probably someone who loved reading in her past life and had collected many ancient books from all over. Ranran was now proficient in light-body technique, so she didn’t need a ladder to climb up and down for books, which was convenient.

But while she was busy dusting and flipping through the books, her Shifu was casually half-lying on the mat, supporting his head with one hand, reading the book “Playing Classic” compiled by Mu Qingge with great relish.

As a disciple, Ranran couldn’t reprimand her Shifu for being lazy and slacking off, so she worked even harder to read through everything, afraid of missing any hints or clues.

But after reading for a long time, she got dizzy and tired. Even though she was very energetic now and not as sickly as before, she still needed to catch her breath.

As she raised her head to refresh her mind, she happened to see the afternoon sun shining in on Su Yishui’s face. At this moment, the flowers outside the window were blooming brightly. She looked at her Shifu’s handsome face and couldn’t help but start to daydream: After the incident at Tianmai Mountain, Ranran thought that even if her Shifu had some affectionate feelings for Mu Qingge before, he should have been disillusioned by now.

Who knew Su Yishui could still casually read Mu Qingge’s old works without any aversion.

Was this considered lingering affections, intertwining of love and hate?

If her Shifu couldn’t let go of Elder Mu in his heart, how could he….. kiss her without any burden? Even if it was as her Shifu said, that his actions couldn’t be controlled due to the leak of the spiritual spring, but he had kissed her twice in a row!

Could it be, as Second Uncle Master said, that a man’s emotions would eventually succumb to the test of time? Once passionate vows, reluctance to give up, eventually became clouds in the sky and foggy moons, fading into an indiscernible memory…

When Su Yishui slowly lifted his head and looked at his little disciple, Ranran’s big eyes gazed at him gently, but it was as if she was looking beyond him, towards the distant mountains, rivers, and seas…

The little vermilion bird was pecking at peanuts by the window of the study. After eating a few, it mischievously threw the peanut shells at Ranran’s face.

Ranran suddenly snapped back to reality, but found that she had been carelessly staring into her Shifu’s eyes for quite a while. Her face blushed instantly, and she hurriedly explained, “Shifu, I didn’t mean to stare at you…”

Su Yishui slowly raised the book in front of him, blocking the view of his little disciple. He did not seem to want to hear her feeble explanation at all.

However, his leisurely words came from behind the book, “This book records the deliciousness of the pan-fried buns from ShengJi in the Capital. Do you want to taste the flavor of these pan-fried buns?”

When food is mentioned, Ranran’s Ren,Du vessels immediately opened up. She looked at her Shifu with delight and said, “Shifu, are you going to the Capital? Then take a look at page seventy-two of ‘Playing Classics’ The duck fat pastry cakes from the hundred-year-old Duck Fat Biscuit Shop in the west of the city are also worth trying. Just don’t know if the taste of these delicacies has changed since they were recorded twenty years ago…”

Su Yishui stood up and knocked on her head with the book. “Didn’t you also correct some errors in this ‘Playing Classics’ book? I can take you to taste them all. If there are any mistakes, you can make revisions.”

Ah! Hearing Su Yishui’s say this, Ranran’s face flushed and paled. She remembered her mischief, adding corrections to the “Fierce Beasts” section in “Playing Classics.”

She had thought her Shifu would never read such nonsense, but today he actually read it all through!

However, the reason Su Yishui suggested going to Capital was not because of a greedy appetite but because all the ancient books in the study were complete sets, except for a set of “Records of the Fantian Sect,” which was divided into two volumes. Volume One was still here, but Volume Two was missing.

This Fantian Sect was what Elder Jiu had mentioned, a demonic sect formed by those bewitched by the spiritual spring. There would definitely be records about the Netherworld Realm in their accounts, but unfortunately, the crucial second volume was missing.

But Mu Qingge was also afraid of forgetting, so she had written a line on the first page of the first volume: “Lent to Xiao Yu, with a pot of peach blossom jade bone wine, to be returned next month.”

When Ranran looked at her master pointing her to read this line, she was momentarily confused about who “Xiao Yu” referred to.

At this moment, Su Yishui said expressionlessly, “She should have lent the book to Su Yu, so we have to go to Capital to collect the book.”

Ranran blinked and tentatively asked, “Shifu? Are you planning to sneak into the palace to ask the emperor for something?”

Su Yishui stood up, patiently correcting her, “It’s us. Don’t forget, I told you, you are not to leave me by even half a step.”

……

Cultivation and the mundane world were originally two distinct realms that did not interfere with each other. However, after borrowing something from someone, even if it’s the Emperor himself, it should still be returned.

Ranran felt that her Shifu’s words made sense, and going to the Capital, such a bustling place, was quite tempting for someone like her, still young and with a wavering will in cultivation.

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang were also very excited. They had followed their master to remote places to vanquish demons and monsters, and now they could experience the hustle and bustle of the most prosperous place in the world, to feel the atmosphere of ten miles of colorful and bustling night markets.

However, when they finally arrived outside the Capital and were forced to camp in a small forest outside the city, the beautiful dreams of the three disciples were slightly shattered.

Qiu Xier persistently asked, “Shifu, are we staying here tonight? We could just walk a bit further and enter the city gates. There should be cheap inns in the city that won’t cost very much…”

Their Second Uncle Master laid grass mats on the ground under a tree, where Su Yishui sat cross-legged, instructing, “You lot, look for some soft branches to sleep on. If you fall off the tree, you’ll have to write the Lightness Mantra a hundred times.”

In these days, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier had made rapid progress in their lightness skills. However, spending the night on soft branches was still quite challenging.

But since it was Shifu’s orders, they didn’t dare to argue. Ranran took the lead and jumped onto a pine tree. Although the branches were dense, they were all sharp needles. Sleeping on them was like sleeping on a bed of needles, even more difficult than the master’s request.

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang saw Ranran taking extra effort and refrained from bargaining with Shifu.

So they each chose a sturdy poplar tree, but since Shifu had instructed them to sleep on the thin branches at the treetop, they had to go to the top of the tree.

However, during the night, they realized their strategy was flawed. While the Poplar tree’s branches were indeed strong, the tree was tall. When they accidentally fell, it was truly miserable.

Amid yet another of Qiu Xier’s cry from falling off, Ranran suddenly opened her eyes and looked towards the Capital. Dark clouds covered the city, with lightning and thunder, indicating an impending storm.

Turning to look under the tree, Ranran found Shifu also awake, staring fixedly at her. She couldn’t tell how long he had been looking at her…

When he saw Ranran look at him, he shifted his gaze towards the Capital.

Wondering about how long Shifu had been staring at her, Ranran’s ears started to burn. To ease the awkward atmosphere, she cleared her throat and asked softly, “Shifu, why is the rain so strange, only in the city, while outside it’s a clear moonlit night?”

Su Yishui did not answer, just gazed deeply towards the Capital before saying to Ranran, “You were not focused on sleeping so you need to be punished as well; you’ll have to write the Lightness Mantra two hundred times tomorrow!”

……

So Ranran had to close her eyes and try to sleep. However, after a while, the mischievous girl opened her eyes again and looked straight at her Shifu.

Shifu was indeed still watching her!

This time, caught red-handed, it was too late for Su Yishui to avert his gaze!

The two stared at each other in the moonlit pine forest, one on the tree and the other below, without saying anything for a while.

In the end, it was actually Ranran who dodged first, turning quickly on the tree to avoid Shifu’s somewhat intense gaze.

But she made a thud and Ranran also fell from the tree with an exclamation…

The next day, as they washed by the river, Qiu Xier was quite pleased. She had fallen three times last night, Senior brother four times, and even Ranran, who was so outstanding, had fallen once.

Her cultivation was not great enough when compared to Ranran, but she was not the worst.

At that moment, Shifu took out the six small compasses that the second senior brother had sent last time, clearly crafted by Uncle Master Zeng. Everyone had one, hanging from a necklace like a large pendant.

Ranran noticed it resembled the one Qin Xuanjiu held at Wangxiang Pass. It was just smaller and more exquisite.

Su Yi Shui told them it could predict good or bad luck. If the compasses were in disarray, it meant demonic forces were approaching, and they would need to be extra cautious.

Qiu Xier was puzzled, “We’re not going to remote mountains and waters but to the bustling city of Capital. Do we really need this?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t answer, just walked towards Capital. The disciples hurriedly followed, but Ranran, looking at the compass hanging around her neck, felt a faint unease…

Su Yishui still retained some humanity as their master. After entering the city in the morning, he invited three disciples who had not slept well for a night to have Shengji’s pan-fried buns.

Ranran discovered that Elder Mu was still quite reliable when it came to eating and drinking. Shengji’s pan-fried buns, which had been around for thirty years, were so delicious that they made one’s mouth water.

However, she noticed that Shifu didn’t eat them himself, just quietly served her the buns and even prepared dipping sauce for her.

Su Yishui had just bought the aged vinegar from the Baiwei Ji next door. The dip was only half a spoon of vinegar added with three drops of chili oil. The mix was precise, following the guidelines of “Playing Classics” comparable to the art of mixing poison.

The owner of the stall was nearing fifty and gave a few more glances to customers who brought their own vinegar to dip the buns.

When they finished eating and it was time to settle the bill, the owner cheerfully said, “There have been customers before who brought Bai wei’s vinegar to eat buns with. Let me think… it seems like more than twenty years ago, a beautiful young lady who looked like a painting came by. Tsk, tsk, tsk. Not only was she beautiful, but she was also generous. During meals, she would give golden leaves as tips! Real gold! Should I say this or not, young lady, you are also beautiful and eat so well, just like that lady, both of you are extraordinary beings like immortals!”

After saying this, the owner eagerly looked at Xue Ranran who was paying, hoping she would also give some tips.

After all, Baiwei Ji’s sealed vinegar was not cheap, specifically made for the nobles in the capital, and one jar costs five taels of silver.

For someone who is so particular to food and drink, she might be a young lady from a noble family come out to play. Surely, they would give a tip.

However, Ranran stretched out her empty hand and apologetically said, “Eight plates of buns, six bowls of fresh duck blood soup. I gave you half a tael of silver earlier, and you still owe me five wen.”

The owner’s face fell slightly, smiled awkwardly, and found some change.

Its not that Ranran didn’t want to be generous, but the rules of the Xishan Lingxi Palace was to live frugally. Behavior like what the owner described, giving a golden leaf as a tip for a meal, was extravagant and probably could get one expelled from the sect on the spot.

Ranran knew who the owner was talking about, probably Mu Qingge herself.

Thinking about how sinister and scheming Mu Qingge is now, Ranran sometimes felt that the Mu Qingge from her past life and the current Elder Mu were completely different people.

How did such a divine and extraordinary woman, turn into someone so intolerable now?

But thinking about how Mu Qingge used to be very close with the current Emperor Su Yu, with a backer like the young Prince Su back then, naturally, she had plenty of money to squander.

The expenses of XiShan now are all from hard-earned money from Shifu’s consultations. Naturally, they have to be as frugal as Second Uncle Master and meticulously account for every penny!

Just out of the bun shop, Qiu Xier dragged senior brother off to buy sugar figurines, while their Uncle Masters were instructed by Shifu to go to some alley to handle their accommodations in the Capital.

Ranran followed behind Su Yi Shui, preparing to shop around, when the sky was covered with dark clouds once more, and the master and disciple were stuck under the long eaves of the street market’s alley.

Watching raindrops splatter on the ground and pedestrians hurrying to seek shelter, Ranran curiously looked up at the sky, “The Capital is really a dragon’s ground, why is there so much rain?”

After saying that, she turned to look at her master beside her, who was staring at her intently, just like last night…

Perhaps fearing raindrops would fall on his disciple, Su Yishui slightly shifted himself to stand beside her, half embracing Ranran in front of him, shielding her from the rain. However, his clothes got wet, clinging to his shoulders, outlining the attractive and sturdy curves of his back.

Ranran could almost touch her Shifu’s chin if she raised her head a bit.

She carefully glanced at her Shifu’s neck, where the talisman bottle was tucked into his collar. There was no change in color, but the Yin energy from the spiritual spring occasionally leaked out, affecting Shifu’s mood.

If Shifu couldn’t control it, he might end up kissing her again…

Thinking about the passionate kiss with this tall man, Ranran’s earlobes blushed slightly.

But when she looked up again, she realized Su Yi Shui wasn’t looking at her; instead, he turned his head to watch raindrops fall under the eaves, deliberately avoiding her gaze as if he was also afraid of being misunderstood…

Just then, more people ran under the eaves to avoid the rain, diluting the ambiguous atmosphere between the two who were alone just now.

However, because of the crowd, Ranran was squeezed into her Shifu’s embrace. Su Yishui held her with one arm, preventing her from being jostled by others.

During this boring time waiting for the rain to stop, people sheltering from the rain naturally complained to each other, “What’s up with this weather lately? It rains almost every day. I didn’t even have a pair of dry socks when I came out in the morning!”

“Yeah! I really want to go to the Dragon King Temple and ask if they can move the rain somewhere else. Within a hundred miles, it’s only raining continuously only in the Capital! This is too unnatural!”

Talking about this sudden heavy rain, the people who were avoiding it were all too ready to complain endlessly about it.

Fortunately, the rain came quickly and left quickly. After *an incense stick of time, the rain finally stopped.
*30min to an hour

However, the sky after the rain was still gloomy, as if it hadn’t quite cleared.

When the rain stopped, Su Yishui walked to the river inside the Capital. The river was already full, reportedly due to this once-in-a-century continuous heavy rain. The Waterworks Department had started digging canals to divert the overflowing river water.

However, it was said that a few days ago, there was a murder case at the construction site, with three people dead, so the work was only halfway done and temporarily suspended.

Ranran saw Shifu staring intently at the river surface. She walked over, wanting to see what had caught his attention.

But as she approached the water, she suddenly felt a flash in front of her eyes. It seemed like fish scales from a passing fish under the water had been shining brightly.

When she took another closer look again, the river water was dark and obscure, and she couldn’t see anything clearly. At that moment, Ranran looked down at the compass hanging around her neck and noticed the gears on it were spinning frantically.

Startled, Ranran instinctively grabbed her master’s hand, quickly pulling him away from the inner river.

Her experience at Wangxiang Pass told her that there might be something strange in the river. It was better to stay away until she understood what was happening.

“Shifu, the compass on my neck was moving vigorously just now.”

Su Yishui nodded and said to her, “Go back and tell Gao Cang and Xier not to approach the city river casually.” After saying that, he added, “Let’s go, see if Yutong and the others have settled our accommodation.”

With that, Su Yishui did not seem like he intended to investigate further into the bottom of the river, and he walked away from the inner river.

Ranran glanced back at the calm river surface and quickly walked to catch up to him.

When Ranran reunited with Qiu Xier and the others and they all followed Shifu to a secluded mansion in the western alley of the Capital, they opened the seemingly ordinary main door. Inside the spacious courtyard, there were actually elegantly carved buildings and corridors, exuding a luxurious atmosphere.

This place did not seem like a house their stingy second uncle master would rent.

Upon hearing Su Yishui mildly mention that this was his property in the secular world, not a rented one, the three disciples who had not seen much of the world were shocked once again.

Besides the large size of the mansion on the limited and precious land of Capital, the furnishings in the hall, the hung famous paintings, and the antique items placed around, all seemed very valuable.

It was hard to imagine that their master, who usually wore semi-old long robes, was actually such a hidden wealthy person.

But upon careful thought, Su Yishui was once the son of a Prince, so it made sense that he had plenty of money.

However, the Prince had failed in his rebellion and was stripped of his title and properties. How could Su Yishui still retain this property in the Capital?

When Ranran cautiously asked Su Yishui about this, he simply said, “I’m not listed in the clan records of the ancestral house, and this isn’t the property of the royal family. It’s my private property, always under Zengyi’s name.”

Before he practiced cultivation, he was a child kept outside the main family, and although he later took the Su surname, he was still not listed in the Su family’s lineage records. When he said this wasn’t the royal family’s property, he was clearly saying this place was not gifted by Prince Ping xi.

Could it be that while he was cultivating, he was also earning a significant fortune away from the Sect, so he could retain this private property even after Prince Ping xi’s defeat?

Ranran suddenly remembered that when Uncle Master Zeng had fallen on hard times, Shifu had supported him in reopening a hot spring inn. That inn was exclusively for high-ranking officials and nobles, lavishly decorated. Just relying on Shifu’s income from treating a few patients a year would not be enough. It seems Shifu’s wealth is truly substantial; even if he doesn’t become an immortal and his father had been killed, he is still a wealthy man.

However, only three old servants have been maintaining this place for twenty years, so there are inevitably some shortcomings in the buildings. That’s why Su Yishui had Yutong and the others come earlier to tidy up the place for accommodation.

Because the mansion is spacious, each disciple got their own room. Ranran noticed that her room, like over at the Western Mountain, was located near water.

Shifu explained that her elemental affinity is wood, and being close to water is beneficial for her health. Actually Shifu was worrying too much, because she can’t go thirsty even if she is not beside water. That night, as if to confirm this, there was thunder and lightning, and torrential rain poured down from the sky.

Previous
Next

伤感离愁 SADNESS AND SEPARATION

Ranran wrapped herself tightly in the quilt, preparing to sleep quickly. However, she couldn’t help but peek outside at the sky, which was an indescribable pitch black.

So she got up again to close the window. Through the window, she saw Shifu holding an umbrella, standing on the eaves, looking up at the direction where lightning streaked across the sky in the pouring rain…

Because he had merged with the White Tiger and the residual effects hadn’t completely healed yet, so standing in the rain like this was not ideal. However, Ranran was tactful and didn’t go disturb him.

She could feel that there was a deep pool in Shifu’s heart, untouched by any kind of external storms. But what kind of melancholic past or sorrow lay hidden in that pool, it seemed it wasn’t something she, as his disciple, could inquire into.

The next day, after breakfast, Ranran brewed the medicine to heal internal injuries for Shifu and brought it to the corridor, to watch him drink it.

Since the incident at Tianmai Mountain, Ranran had been studying medical books, specially concocting this tonic to calm the mind and nourish vitality and body for Shifu.

Pills and elixirs, they nourish spiritual energy. For nourishing the physical body, these medicinal soups are needed for greater effectiveness.

But Su Yishui disliked the bitter taste of these medicines. Despite being usually calm and composed, he could hold the bowl and stare at the medicinal broth for a long time without drinking it.

Ranran had no choice but to watch Su Yishui without blinking, afraid he might pour the medicine into the nearby pool when she wasn’t looking.

To distract Shifu, Ranran took over the bowl for him, urging him to drink quickly while talking to divert his attention.

“Shifu, shouldn’t cultivators abandon worldly pleasures? Why do you have so many properties?”

This method seemed to work. Following Ranran’s wrist motion, Su Yi Shui finally drank the bowl of medicinal broth quickly, although his thick eyebrows were knitted into a frown.

Ranran quickly took out a preserved plum soaked in honey that she had prepared and stuffed the plum into Shifu’s mouth.

However, in her haste, her slender fingertips accidentally entered his mouth along with the plum and were gently sucked by his thin lips.

Ranran was startled, quickly retracting her hand. Before she could feel embarrassed, she heard Su Yishui slowly say, “Because there was someone who liked spending money, always indulging in pleasures and accepting money from unrelated people. At that time, I thought if I had these things, she wouldn’t have to spend money from other people and be criticized by everyone… “

Ranran didn’t expect Shifu’s answer to be like this. But at that time, the person who spent the most money around him… was Elder Mu Qingge, right?

Ranran’s expression was somewhat complex for a moment, hesitating, “Shifu, don’t you hate lavishness and wastefulness the most? Why did you encourage extravagance like this?”

Su Yishui bit hard on the plum pit in his mouth, his eyes fixed on her, as if he could see through her and saw another, murmuring softly, “She had been a rich young lady from a young age, but due to family changes, she brought her only sister to cultivate in Western Mountain. A genius among demonic cultivators, whoever became her master considered her a treasure and was particularly strict in disciplining her. Perhaps because of the strictness, she had none of the carefree childhood other children had and might have felt regretful. When she finally reached maturity, she loved to indulge in eating, drinking, and having fun, living like a reckless child… Growing up in wealth from childhood and then enduring years of arduous cultivation on the mountain, can you expect her to have any concept of money and wealth when she entered the secular world?”

If the “‘she” he was referring to was Mu Qingge, then everything made sense. This explained Mu Qingge’s extravagant and indulgent behavior and her love for food and drink.

Listening to Su Yishui’s tone, there was no blame, but rather a tone full of indulgence…

So all his desperate efforts to earn money was for his Master to spend it… no matter how you looked at it, it didn’t seem like being respectful and filial to an Elder; it looked more like a poor guy desperately trying to earn money to support his wife…

Thinking about the various entanglements behind Su Yishui’s actions, he had actually liked Elder Mu to this extent, Ranran suddenly felt a little bitterness in her heart.

It wasn’t really jealousy, just a profound sadness, and it was also more of worry. If Elder Mu was a good person, then it wouldn’t be a problem no matter how much Shifu longed for her.

An immortal partner like this, they also seemed very well-matched!

But Mu Qingge’s character was simply terrible! She was malicious and terrifying. If Shifu remained infatuated with such a treacherous woman, wouldn’t he be dragged into an irredeemable situation?

Thinking of this, Ranran felt a bit upset and bluntly said, “Shifu, why do you have to be this way? If someone is willing to spend the money of others, maybe it’s because they like someone else. And it also doesn’t mean just because someone has money, she’ll be with them!”

She spoke out of frustration for a moment, but when she raised her head, she found Shifu’s gaze… was somewhat frightening, as if possessed by the Spirit Spring…

He stared straight at her, as if to say if she didn’t apologize, this matter wouldn’t be settled.

Ranran, who rarely showed her stubborn temper, was as if possessed by a stubborn spirit right this moment and wouldn’t yield to Shifu’s gaze. So after throwing out those blunt words, she calmly picked up the medicine bowl and turned to leave.

In other sects, it was common for their masters to worry about their young disciples being distracted by romantic feelings, which would hinder their cultivation.

But in their Xishan Lingxi Palace, it was all twisted around. The disciple still had to worry about whether their Elder had fallen for the wrong person.

That night, Ranran couldn’t sleep well at all. She was slightly muddled and dreamt of Shifu and Elder Mu being very affectionate, playing the zither together in the gallery, drinking under the waterfall, embracing and kissing passionately in the water…

In short, all the scenes between her and Shifu were replaced by Elder Mu in her dreams… The result of that night’s dreams, if it must be described accurately, was like being fed a mouthful of dog poop.

As a result, Ranran felt somewhat disoriented even while eating breakfast. Even the deepest spiritual foundation couldn’t resist the depressing mood brought on by the nauseating dreams.

However, Su Yishui seemed to have forgotten about how his defiant little disciple had made him angry. Early in the morning, he personally went out and bought some fresh pan-fried buns from Shengji and brought them back for breakfast.

As Qiu Xier was eating, she noticed that the little junior sister seemed to be upset with Shifu. Although the vinegar was right next by Shifu’s hand, Ranran didn’t reach for it or dip anything in it, pouting and eating her dry bun in silence.

Shifu also looked tense and didn’t say a word the entire morning.

After breakfast, Qiu Xier secretly asked Ranran what was going on between her and Shifu. Ranran sighed softly and asked, “Senior sister, if one day, Mu Qingge becomes our Shifu’s wife, what would you do?”

Qiu Xier was also startled by this possibility, shivering slightly, then thought for a moment and sighed, “What else can we do? Rain falls from the sky, mothers marry off their daughters, and Shifu wants to marry a wife. These things are beyond our control! Naturally, we’ll have to save up some silver and pay the gift money. But think about it, in the past life, even though Mu Qingge’s reputation was already ruined to that extent, Shifu still ignored the controversy and sacrificed his cultivation to save her. That’s such deep affection! If Shifu finally gets what he wants and brings the beauty home, even if she’s a toxic beauty, us disciples can only congratulate our benevolent master…”

After saying this, Qiu Xier shivered again, then she chuckled and said, “Ranran, your little brain is quite interesting, always thinking about these and that. In my opinion, Shifu has to be crazy, if he is thinking about renewing his relationship with her now.”

As Ranran listened, she felt like she had indeed gone off track, and Qiu Xier’s perspective was more open-minded.

Whoever Shifu likes, whether they are demonic or celestial, that is his own business. What right did she, as a disciple, have to sulk and be at odds with Shifu?

Qiu Xier was right; she was being too nosy! So by the afternoon, she couldn’t continue to be sulky with Shifu. She found an opportunity and awkwardly talked with Shifu for a few sentences.

Fortunately, Su Yishui wasn’t the petty type of elder. Seeing his disciple took the initiative to extend an olive branch, he seemed to have been waiting for this for a long time and tried very hard to continue the boring and dry topics of conversation that she brought up.

After a few such instances of conversation, the relationship between master and disciple seemed to be fine again, without a trace of the previous discord.

Although Ranran’s mind finally turned this corner, her mood was still not serene.

One time, she watched as a spider repaired its web broken by the heavy rain, feeling sorry for the busy spider, she wanted to sigh for its hard work that was in vain ; she saw the fallen petals under the pavilion and felt sad that the flowers were short-lived, causing sorrow in the mud.

Eventually, even the usually outgoing senior brother was infected by the melancholy of the youngest junior sister and sighed at the continuous heavy rain outside the house. Qiu Xier asked the senior brother what was wrong, and Gao Cang stared blankly at the rain outside and said, “I just feel like exhaling a deep breath like junior sister does, is… quite comfortable.”

Qiu Xier also felt it made sense, propping her chin on her hand and looking at the falling rain and flowers, also sighing deeply.

However, they had come to the Capital for serious matters. Even if they were experiencing the first taste of sorrow as young people, they had to finish their business first before continuing to *indulge in being melancholy all the time.
*悲春伤秋 grieving in spring and sorrowful in autumn

Su Yishui needed to ask the emperor for an old book, and that wasn’t something he could easily do just by knocking on the palace gates.

The foundation of the Great Qi Palace was special, hiding mysterious formations. All cultivation and spiritual energy would be nullified upon entering the palace.

In short, it was impossible to enter the palace with supernatural abilities. Moreover, Su Yishui still carried the title of the Rebel Prince’s illegitimate son, so it was even less likely for him to just openly knock on the palace gates and call on his little Imperial Uncle.

Therefore, they could only patiently wait for the Emperor’s Inspection tours, temple visits, or visits to the Imperial monastery to see if they could get to speak to Su Yu.

After arriving in the Capital, Su Yishui didn’t seem to be in a hurry for the book. He spent days wandering around the inner river ponds of the Capital.

However, the compass on Ranran’s neck hadn’t moved at all, and there didn’t seem to be any unusual signs in the inner river either.

After a few days, Su Yishui finally took action, but it was to invite an old eunuch from the palace to have tea at a teahouse.

The eunuch seemed to recognize Su Yishui and shook his head, saying softly, “Didn’t you leave far away? It’s good to stay away from worldly affairs. Why have you come back to this place of trouble? If Madam were still here and knew you came to the Capital, how worried would she be…”

Su Yishui seemed to respect this old eunuch very much. He personally brewed a cup of hot tea for him and served it in front of him, saying, “After Mother passed away, her affairs were all taken care of by you, Master Zheng. Her body didn’t end up abandoned in the wilderness, thanks to your kindness. I’ve always remembered this favor.”

Master Zheng, the eunuch, waved his hand and said, “There’s no need to mention the past again. You’re living well now, and Madam can rest assured in the afterlife.”

Su Yishui continued, “There are some things of mine still in the palace. I came here to retrieve them. Has the palace been renovated in recent years?”

Master Zheng frowned when he heard this. “Back then, the late emperor employed experts to rearrange the Feng shui of the palace, and all the buildings were constructed strictly according to the blueprints. His Majesty is filial and hasn’t made any changes to the palace buildings except for routine maintenance.”

Su Yishui asked casually, “But I heard that the *Pool of Inquiry in the palace seems to have been expanded?” 问潭 tan is a pool, literal Asking Pool

Only then did Master Zheng remember and nodded, saying, “If you hadn’t mentioned it, I would have forgotten about it. That was about twenty years ago when His Majesty ascended the throne. Perhaps because he was young and liked boating with his consorts on the lake, he ordered people to dig deep into the Pool of Inquiry and expanded it into Lake of Inquiry.”

Su Yishui nodded, “Is the study of His Majesty still the same one used by the late emperor?”

Master Zheng nodded, “It hasn’t changed; it’s still that one… I remember when you were summoned by the late emperor to the study. I thought the recognition of your ancestry was imminent, but I didn’t expect the Prince Ping to… ahem, let’s not mention the past. Nowadays, no eunuchs are allowed to serve in His Majesty’s study. The only two palace maids who can enter are both mute, and he only sees them for official business with court ministers or when summoning talents from the Yi Ren Hall…”
*异人馆 Yi Ren Guan, Hall of Extraordinary Humans

Su Yi Shui narrowed his eyes and said, “Yiren Hall? I’ve heard that the Emperor values talents and has sought many extraordinary people and events. I wonder if that is true?”

The old eunuch looked at the bustling crowd below the Teahouse and then at Su Yishui in his gauze hat. He whispered, “Indeed. To the east of the palace, there’s a garden known as Yiren Hall, where the Emperor has gathered talented individuals. Whenever there’s a new person, especially one of great talent, they occasionally get the opportunity to enter the palace and meet the Emperor… Oh, by the way, tomorrow a prominent figure is coming to the Capital, and the Emperor seems eager to meet him. Yesterday, he even sent a palace entry token to Yiren Hall…”

Having received this information, Su Yishui thanked the old eunuch and Ranran saw her Shifu gracefully give the eunuch a note worth a hundred taels of silver. The eunuch initially refused but eventually accepted it, putting the note into his sleeve, and then warned, “The Battle Goddess is also staying in the palace now. I suggest you leave soon.”

It seemed that this old eunuch had experienced the turmoil in the Capital years ago and was acquainted with Su Yishui’s mother.

After saying this, the old eunuch left.

Yiren Hall?

Ranran felt that the term was somewhat familiar, suddenly remembering yesterday when she was eating buns at Shengji and overheard the neighboring table mention it. They said that carriages had been arriving frequently at Yiren Hall recently, indicating the arrival of many talented individuals. However, despite the influx of newcomers over the years, there had been no expansion of Yiren Hall, which was puzzling.

At the time, Ranran couldn’t make sense of it, but now she understood the what was it about.

Su Yishui stood up and said to Ranran, “Let’s go.”

Ranran obediently followed behind her master and went to the Teahouse near the city gate, spending quite some time there again.

After Ranran had eaten two plates of chestnut cakes, a tall, dark-faced man of eight feet entered the city. He didn’t queue up but instead showed the palace guards his waist token, then led his attendants straight into the city.

Su Yishui got up and left with Ranran, calmly following behind the tall man and his entourage.

As they entered the streets and alleys, Ranran felt the surrounding airflow suddenly solidify. Her Shifu immediately set up a spiritual shield, and when the tall man turned around, with a quick and precise motion, Su Yishui swiftly incapacitated the man with a flick of his finger, and his attendants were also swiftly subdued.

Ranran widened her eyes, unsure if her Shifu had turned to banditry.

Su Yi Shui bent down to remove the waist token from the tall man and found a letter of invitation from Yiren Hall.

According to the letter, this person was named Baoming, a disciple of Master Suiyun, skilled in controlling beasts. Therefore, he had received an invitation from Yiren Hall to serve the emperor.

Ranran noticed the animal-like claw in the broad sleeve of his right palm, resembling a colorful leopard, which was indeed extraordinary.

Seeing a person with a human body and animal-like attributes made her inexplicably think of the woman who merged with the fish at Wangxiang Pass.

Could it be… that Baoming also knew the forbidden technique of Seven Evil Transformation?

“Shifu… what exactly are you planning to do?” Ranran couldn’t help but ask.

Su Yishui extended his right hand and silently looked at it. After a moment, his slender palm turned into a leopard’s claw. However, this was just a common illusion.

His skills were fundamentally different from the man’s strange arts.

He looked at it repeatedly and then said, “This illusion can’t be maintained for too long. We need to be quick.”

Ranran had a hint of what he was planning. It seemed that her master intended to impersonate Baoming and enter Yiren Hall.

At this point, Su Yi Shui took out a box of oil paint he had bought on the way and handed it to Ranran, asking her to darken his face and use the beard he had cut from the unconscious Baoming.

After the beard went on, the man who was originally elegant and ethereal like an exiled immortal just turned into a big, dark-faced, bearded man, looking… very much like a bandit.

As she applied the beard, Ranran, who had never done such deceptive acts, couldn’t help but express her concern, “Is this really okay?”

Su Yishui looked down at the slightly pouting girl and mildly asked, “If you think it’s not okay, why help me?”

Ranran lowered her eyes and said softly, “I trust Shifu’s character…”

Su Yi Shui smirked slightly and his tone turned cold as he replied, “I’ve never claimed to be a good person.”

Ranran quickly glanced at him and muttered softly, “Following a good person to learn goodness, following a tiger to learn to bite…Shifu, if you get closer to people with noble character, your actions will naturally become more righteous…”

Since Shifu liked someone like Mu Qingge so much, even with a naturally good character, he will probably learn bad things. Ranran was trying to influence her master positively, hoping that her older shifu wouldn’t become bad, learning bad things from bad women.

This time, Su Yishui glared at her and didn’t say anything more.

As for the unconscious ones, Su Yishui didn’t leave them lying in the street but found an inn. He helped them inside, claiming they were drunk, and rented a room for them to continue sleeping. Also this way, they wouldn’t be discovered so soon, avoiding any exposure of their plan.

Su Yishui then transformed himself, Ranran and the others into Baoming and his attendants and went straight to Yiren Hall to carry out their plan.

Yiren Hall on the east side of the palace didn’t look particularly remarkable from the outside, with an old gate and did not even have a signboard. Su Yishui had to ask passersby to confirm that it was indeed Yiren Hall.

This “Yiren Hall” was actually established by the common people of the capital. It wasn’t part of the government’s administrative departments.

However, looking at the people coming in and out of the gate, it was clear where the name “Yiren” came from.

The thin old Taoist who had just entered didn’t move his feet when walking, as if being pushed by the wind, and floated into the gate.

There was also a woman with a full crown and a faint golden color, clearly someone who had also formed a cultivation core.

As for the others, it was also evident that they all had some foundation in cultivation.

Apparently although the entrance looked dilapidated with moss-covered walls, inside was magnificent, with exquisite food and beautiful servants. The Emperor generously supported these talented individuals with gold and silver, and if one could stay there, they would no longer aspire to become immortals.

Ranran was actually quite curious. Even if the Emperor valued talents greatly, it seemed unnecessary to keep so many extraordinary individuals in the Capital. People from the secular world, even if they admired cultivation, usually only sought longevity. It would be more practical to have more alchemy furnaces in the Capital to create longevity elixirs!

Su Yishui examined the gate slowly as Yu Chen walked over and knocked on the door handle.

The door didn’t open immediately. Instead, someone inside asked, “Who’s there?”

Su Yishui bowed and said, “Baoming from Suiyun Mountain, here by invitation.”

With this bow, he subtly revealed his transformed leopard-patterned claw.

The person inside saw it and after a moment, they invited him and his attendants in.

The one receiving them was the elderly man who had floated into the gate earlier. Upon closer inspection, Su Yishui noticed that the man’s left and right eyes were different. His right eye had a black iris, while the left one showed a faint golden color.

He stared keenly at Su Yishui wearing the gauze hat and slowly said, “May I ask, Sir, can you remove your hat?”

Su Yishui took off his hat, revealing a… dark hairy face.

The old man looked at his face, then at the leopard claw he had transformed, paused for a moment, and then smiled slowly, “Before, when the corpse from Wangxiang Pass who transformed into a fish was presented, I wondered if the Seven Evil Transformation Technique, which has long been lost, truly existed. Now that I see you, I believe it. I’m sure the Emperor will be greatly pleased with your talents.”

Su Yishui replied mildly, “You flatter me. May I know your name, Sir?”

The old man replied, “I am the person in charge here. You may call me Old Feng. The Emperor has been waiting for you for some time. After I report back to him, you may enter the palace for an audience.”

After saying this, he instructed his attendants to lead Su Yishui and his group into a courtyard to the southwest.

After they entered the room, Yutong was about to speak when Su Yishui made a gesture for silence. He then walked around the room and pulled out a few talismans from under the bed and ceiling beams.

Ranran had received many spirit talismans from Elder Jiu, so she recognized these as Sound Transmission talismans.

The voices of people inside the room could be heard clearly by the person who had placed the talismans. Understanding this, Ranran immediately spoke clearly, “Master, obtaining the Emperor’s favor, your future prospects will be boundless.”

Su Yishui said mildly, “The Palace is not a place for those from rural backgrounds like you lot to enter. After I enter the Palace later, you will go to the market and buy some food and drinks for me. I’m afraid the cooks here won’t know my taste, and I might not like the food.”

With this arrangement, when Old Feng led Su Yishui into the palace for an audience, Ranran and the others had a reasonable excuse to leave Yiren Hall.

Ranran couldn’t help but worry when she thought about how her Shifu would enter the Palace alone. Her master had been adamant that she must remain by his side. However, when it came to entering the lion’s den, he left her behind and went in alone.

What level of misunderstanding have we got here?
Xue Ranran being jealous and disapproving of…’herself’…
Yet this is really the better, and also more entertaining way ( for us haha )

And for our poor Su Yishui… for him who already thought that his Master Mu Qingge never had him in her heart in her past life, to hear Ranran telling him that he probably had no chance even if he was rich, must really hit him where it hurt…

And yet he got up early the next day to buy her more of the pan fried buns Ranran loved to butter her up is just so …..*insert your own emoji*!!

Previous
Next

李代桃僵 SEND IN THE DECOYS

It’s said that the foundation layout of the palace holds profound mysteries, and when powerful individuals enter the palace, their spiritual powers are suppressed.

That malicious Mu Qingge is also in the palace. If by any chance she instigates Emperor Suyu against my Shifu…

Ranran became more and more worried. Just then, the little Vermilion Bird jumped onto her head again, hopping around and asking for peanuts.

Ranran looked at the little bird and suddenly had an idea. Why didn’t she think of this before!

She reached out and tied a talisman to the Vermilion Bird’s foot, then patted its head and said, “Be good, go to the largest courtyard in the Imperial city. If my Shifu is in danger, come back and inform me immediately. Remember, don’t get too close to the soldiers with swords and weapons. I’m afraid your abilities won’t work inside the palace either, and if you’re caught and caged, it will be disastrous.”

After entrusting the bird with these earnest instructions, Ranran let it fly away. She then sat cross-legged in her room, connecting with the Vermilion Bird and using its eyes to observe the situation in the palace.

The Vermilion Bird quickly flew over high rooftops, and with its bird’s eye view, Ranran saw Su Yishui being led by palace attendants towards the palace gate.

The little Vermilion Bird was quite a lively one, circling in the air from time to time and darting around curiously. It flew to the west side of the palace at one point.

Ranran could hear what sounded like furious cursing coming from a palace building on the west side.

When the little Vermilion Bird stopped on a branch by the window, Ranran could clearly see a disheveled woman smashing things and cursing, “What kind of rubbish useless elixirs? Why hasn’t the scar on my face healed?”

Ranran focused her gaze and was startled because the woman was none other than Mu Qingge! After all this time, her facial scars hadn’t healed properly. Although they had scabbed over, they were still deep red, marring her once beautiful face, just like Wen Hongshan…

Ranran remembered how Wei Jiu’s claws had once torn open the Black Flood Dragon, so his claws were dipped with its blood. Perhaps it was due to the blood of a spirit beast that Mu Qingge’s wounds couldn’t heal.

But after she gave Qin Xuanjiu the medicated ointment, she had specifically asked her Shifu, and he had said that the medicine could neutralize the Black Flood Dragon’s poison and heal the wounds?

Ranran tried hard to recall the ointment she had made. It was indeed effective, even on herself and senior brother, who had been bitten by Immortal Devouring Bugs multiple times. After applying it, not a single scar or mark was left.

Why didn’t it work on Mu Qingge?

Ranran did not know that Mu Qingge had thrown away the medicated ointment sent by Qin Xuanjiu. She couldn’t help but wonder if there was something wrong with her concoction.

Although she detested Mu Qingge, the medicine she gave was genuine. If Mu Qingge had used it, at least the wounds on her face wouldn’t have festered like this…

Just then, a palace maid spoke tentatively, “Battle Goddess, the place has been cleared at Hui Xiang Spring for you tomorrow . They say soaking there can heal scars miraculously. You should go there more often; it will certainly benefit your wounds.”

Mu Qingge said coldly, “Let me try. If it doesn’t work, I’ll skin you alive!”

Watching the disheveled Mu Qingge scolding the palace maid angrily, and remembering that this woman might be liked by her Shifu, Ranran felt quite distressed and didn’t want to see anymore.

Just then, the little Vermilion Bird flapped its wings again, chasing after Su Yishui. It finally landed on a branch outside the study, peeking inside.
