As Su Yishui had anticipated, Emperor Su Yu was indeed receiving the “Bao Ming” whom he valued highly in the study.

However, when Su Yishui entered the study, guards came to search him and signaled for him to wait in the outer chamber, not allowed into the inner chamber.

At that moment, behind the heavy pearl curtains, a refined male voice slowly came through, “Is the gentleman Bao Ming waiting in the outer chamber?”

Su Yishui bowed slightly with clasped hands and said, “Indeed.”

Seeing that he didn’t kowtow, a eunuch nearby scolded sharply, “How dare you not kneel and pay respects to His Majesty?”

Su Yishui remained standing steadily, showing no intention of kneeling. The eunuch was about to reprimand further when the man inside the chamber said indifferently, “Cultivators view wealth and status lightly. In the eyes of the gentleman, all beings are equal. I, like any other, do not care much for worldly etiquette… Since the gentleman has come, it seems you agree to my previous proposal.”

Su Yishui lowered his eyes and said, “Now that I’ve met Your Majesty, please clarify the proposal in person to avoid any misunderstandings from previous letters.”

The man behind the curtains chuckled, “Why worry about misunderstandings? Didn’t you clearly express in your letters that you’ve admired Mu Qingge for years and longed to be intimate with her? If you hand over the Seven Evil Transformation Curse, perhaps I’ll arrange for you to meet, whether you can succeed then depends on your abilities.”

To outsiders, Emperor Su Yu appeared to highly regard his former benefactor, Mu Qingge. But the man behind the curtains spoke of Mu Qingge as if she were a trivial item, easily given away as a reward.

Su Yishui hadn’t expected that the Bao Ming he is impersonating actually harbored desires for Mu Qingge’s beauty. His brows furrowed slightly at this realization.

Even though Mu Ranwu was a fraud, she was using Mu Qingge’s identity. Did she ever think that the “Little Yu” she affectionately called was such a despicable man?

He said coldly, “Mu Qingge has always been arrogant and disobedient. I’m afraid she won’t obey Your Majesty’s orders, will she?”

The man inside the chamber replied coldly, “You need not worry; just say whether it’s possible or not.”

Su Yishui had originally come here just to meet Su Yu. However, since arriving in the Capital, he had sensed something amiss. Now, meeting Su Yu confirmed his suspicions.

Apart from other matters, what angered Su Yishui was how this man, who seemed to value Mu Qingge greatly, casually bestowed her upon such a vulgar man. Su Yishui felt his anger rising as his tone grew even colder as he said, “Your Majesty is indeed generous. But did you ever think, when Mu Qingge helped you ascend to the throne, that she was aiding such a despicable person!”

After saying this, Su Yishui suddenly moved, swiftly rushing into the inner chamber and grabbing the man behind the curtains by the neck.

Although the palace’s Trigram foundation could suppress spiritual abilities, Su Yishui had started martial arts training at seven and became a disciple of the great hero Yan Fei at fourteen. His martial arts skills were exceptional.

Before anyone could react, he had swiftly leaped and captured Su Yu.

Defeat the enemy by capturing their leader. As long as he held Su Yu, everything else would be easier.

However, when Su Yishui looked at the trembling Su Yu in his hands, he was momentarily stunned.

The Bao Ming he impersonated was fake, but he didn’t expect this Emperor behind the curtains… was also fake!

Although this young man resembled Su Yu greatly, Su Yishui recognized at a glance that he was only about seventy to eighty percent similar, a mere stand-in.

At that moment, all the doors and windows in the study suddenly closed, thick smoke billowed from the corners of the room, and from outside the room, a light laughter came from a sedan chair, “I am after all your little Imperial Uncle. Your defiance and readiness to fight at the slightest provocation is really like your father…”

Su Yishui’s voice came from inside the study, “When did you discover my flaw?”

The person inside the sedan chair chuckled, “You’ve met Old Feng, who is the Divine Master Feng Thirteen. The Leopard Claw created from illusion spell couldn’t deceive his eyes.”

Su Yishui said coldly, “So you’ve seen through me early on but still led me here?”

“After so many years apart, I’ve missed you. Let’s sit down and chat. But since your wild nature is hard to change, don’t mind if I calm you down a bit?”

As they spoke, wisps of green smoke rose from the study’s golden tokens, seeming to have their own consciousness as they hurriedly slipped through the cracks in the study.

At that moment, Su Yishui suddenly burst out from the rooftop, using martial arts lightness skills to dash towards a high tower in the palace.

At this moment, the Vermilion Bird perched on a tree branch outside the Imperial Study blinked its small black eyes, faithfully relaying the happenings in the study to Ranran.

The Vermilion Bird wanted to continue watching, but when Feng Thirteen, with his yin-yang eyes, happened to glance at it, he quickly turned his head, his eyes gleaming with excitement. He suddenly pounced towards the tree, preparing to catch the Vermilion Bird.

But the Vermilion Bird had already taken to the skies, avoiding the many arrows shot by Feng Thirteen on his orders, swiftly flying out of the palace.

Seeing the Imperial Study sealed off, Ranran jumped up with agitation. These people had acted swiftly and skillfully; it was clearly a trap that had been set.

The old man with yin-yang eyes was indeed capable. Not only did he see through her Shifu early on, but he also saw through the Vermilion Bird’s disguise.

Her Shifu was trapped alone in the dangerous situation of the palace, powerless now. Wouldn’t this make him vulnerable, at the mercy of others?

As she recounted the situation inside the palace to her Uncle Masters, both of them were also extremely worried.

Yu Chen immediately declared, “Even if we break into the palace, I will rescue our Master!”

Yu Tong, calmer than her brother, only said in a deep voice, “Our Master instructed me earlier that if he doesn’t return by dawn tomorrow morning, I must take the few of you and leave the Capital. After sending you away, I will join my brother to enter the palace and rescue our Master.”

Gao Cang said, “I won’t leave. I’ll stay and rescue our Shifu with you!”

At that moment, everyone was ready to sacrifice for their cause, but Ranran knew that sheer enthusiasm wouldn’t solve the problem.

This wasn’t an ordinary secular palace; it was a dangerous place designed specifically for Cultivators.

The group of scattered immortals kept in the Yiren Hall was likely just the tip of the iceberg, and Su Yu probably had numerous minions among the exotic beings.

If even their Shifu had fallen into jeopardy, then their unprepared group would be like moths to a flame upon entering the palace, exterminated with one blow, with no hope of rescuing their master.

However, Ranran had never seen Su Yu nor understood his character, making it challenging to plan how to save their master.

In some ways, Yu Tong was as stubborn as Qin Xuanjiu, with a rigid mindset. Since their Master had instructed her to escort Ranran and the others out of the city at dawn, there can be no compromise.

However, after they returned yesterday, it seemed they were being watched. Now, the entire courtyard was surrounded, and the annihilation of the Xishan sect seemed imminent.

But Yu Tong remained calm. She led everyone to an abandoned small courtyard in the house, pushed open a cabinet inside, revealing a hidden passage.

As they descended the underground passage, Ranran discovered a secret resting chamber along the way.

Seeing the dusty items inside, she speculated that someone had hidden here many years ago, evading pursuit. However, when Ranran’s torchlight revealed claw marks on the walls, it was chilling, as if this place had once held… a trapped beast.

Following this hidden passage, which had been dug who-knows-when, they emerged outside the city limits.

“This is a refuge tunnel my Master dug twenty years ago. I didn’t expect to use it today. You should return to Western Mountain now; Master forbids you from any delay on the road,” Yu Tong instructed before turning back.

Shortly after they left the city, the city gate finally opened. Old Feng with his Yin-Yang Eyes was leading a search, seemingly looking for Su Yishui’s accomplices.

Ranran thought her Shifu was meticulous; even their escape plan had been arranged thoughtfully. But when it came to himself, how had he fallen into the Emperor’s trap so foolishly?

Yet, considering the saying about *a tiger may doze off and fall asleep, if her Shifu had a momentary lapse of judgment and fell into the Emperor’s trap, it wasn’t entirely impossible.
*老虎还有打瞌睡的时候 : 再厉害的人也会有疏忽的时候
Even the most powerful person might be negligent sometimes

Thinking back to the unusual atmosphere she sensed in the Capital, this place before her was filled with inexplicable danger and strangeness.

Although her Shifu’s instructions were clear, she would never abandon him alone and flee!

Gao Cang and Qiu Xier also hesitated. Qiu Xier suggested, “The city is currently hunting people everywhere. Going back would be walking into a trap willingly… Maybe we can find our Shifu’s friends and see if anyone can help us rescue him?”

After saying this, they looked at each other. Apart from Zeng Yi from Cha Ming Mountain, their Shifu had almost no friends. Where could they find someone to help him?

In fact, Ranran already had an idea a while ago. She calmly said, “For now, one of us must sneak back into the palace to find out our Shifu’s whereabouts before we can plan further.”

Gao Cang frowned, “The palace is an impenetrable iron-clad fortress ; even the little vermilion bird almost got caught flying in. Now that our Shifu has been tricked by the Emperor, it’s probably as difficult as ascending to heaven to break in again!”

Ranran had already figured out a way when they were going through the underground passage. “Old tricks can still work. We will just use a decoy again, like Shifu did.”

Qiu Xier blinked, “Are you going to impersonate one of Bao Ming’s female disciples?”

Ranran shook her head, “I’m going to impersonate Mu Qingge!”

Tracking the Emperor’s movements wasn’t easy, but Mu Qingge, staying in the West Palace, had a predictable routine.

Yesterday, when the vermilion bird was spying, Ranran had overheard Mu Qingge planning to visit Huixiang Springs outside the city.

Now, with no other choice, Ranran decided to try her luck and see if she could find a breakthrough by finding Mu Qingge.

Although the wound on Mu Qingge’s face had already stopped bleeding, it was leaving a red mark, which naturally make her anxious.

It was said that the Huixiang Springs south of the capital had a miraculous effect on healing. With the information gleaned from the vermilion bird, Ranran planned to wait at the springs and seize the opportunity. At worst, if she could capture Mu Qingge, she could negotiate with her to exchange for Su Yishui from the Emperor…

With this plan in mind, Ranran hurried with her senior siblings without stopping, to Huixiang Springs to the south of the city.

Gao Cang and Qiu Xier now followed their junior sister’s lead. Even if Ranran told them to poke at a hornet’s nest, these two would do it without hesitation. Ranran’s mind worked differently, and they trusted her judgment without doubt.

Su Yu valued talents, and for War Goddess, he granted her the appropriate standing.

With a luxurious carriage and a long procession, even three extraordinary beings were assigned to escort her.

However, this bathing place for the nobles in the city, while guarded, still had blind spots and hidden corners.

Yu Tong originally wanted to use light body technique to leap over the walls, but Ranran said it was too risky.

Su Yu had many extraordinary beings working for him, and among the three escorts, there might be someone with extraordinary insight like Old Feng. It was better not to use spiritual power when infiltrating here.

Seeing carts of firewood being transported daily to the bathhouse, Ranran took advantage of her small size and blended into the pile of firewood. Meanwhile, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier kept watch outside.

The outer area of this bathhouse was easy to blend into, but the inner part where Mu Qingge was located was trickier.

Ranran noticed that the young and pretty maidservants shuttling back and forth in the bathhouse. She swayed her figure, lightly sneaking into the servants’ quarters, changed into a maidservant’s attire, and quietly slipped into the inner side of the bathhouse’s steam room.

Her light body technique had reached an incredible level. Even without spiritual energy, her steps were light and agile. With clever movements, she moved like a feather, dodging guards and sneaking into the open-air bath where Mu Qingge was soaking.

Mu Qingge seemed to dislike interruptions and was resting with closed eyes, but the moment Ranran entered, she immediately sensed something was amiss.

She waved her hand, summoning the sword placed beside her, and directed it to attack Ranran.

If it was in the past, Ranran would have been unable to dodge the sword and would have been pierced by it.

However, when Ranran looked at the swiftly approaching sword now, it was like watching a slowly drifting feather. Without thinking, she reached out and caught the blade with two fingers.

As she firmly caught the sword, even she was surprised: why did Mu Qingge seem weaker than when they were on Tianmai Mountain?

When Ranran pushed the sword away and pressed her small dagger against Mu Qingge’s throat, Elder Mu’s eyes widened in disbelief.

Although Ranran had undergone the marrow-cleansing pool, it was unlikely for her to surpass Mu Qingge by such a large margin!

“How did you sneak in here?” Mu Qingge asked in a low voice.

Ranran replied softly, “Hello, Elder Mu. There is poison on the blade of my knife. If you make a big move and accidentally cut yourself, I’m afraid your face will add a few more scars.”

Mu Qingge glared at Ranran but forced a smile. “What do you want?”

Ranran took out a golden talisman and placed it on Mu Qingge’s forehead, immobilizing her slightly, then got straight to the point, “Where has the Emperor locked up my Shifu?”

Mu Qingge was stunned by this and said, “What are you talking about? Su Yishui was captured by the Emperor?”

Evidently, she was unaware of this before and, after a moment of shock, relaxed into a smile, “Heavens, Su Yishui actually did something so foolish, rushing into Su Yu’s trap?”

Ranran blinked at her and said in a small voice, “Don’t smile too broadly, or your face might hit the blade…”

Mu Qingge finally stopped smiling. She raised an eyebrow, and said, “Su Yu is the one who caught your master. What’s the point of threatening me with a knife? Back on Tianmai Mountain, I had no choice but to try to use the Marrow Cleansing Pool to resolve the Grudge water Wei Jiu poisoned me with. If I’ve wronged you in any way, you should try to understand!”

Ranran didn’t buy into her hypocritical words. She softly said, “I came here to ask Elder Mu for help in rescuing my Shifu.”

Mu Qingge burst out laughing and insincerely replied, “Fine, I’ll agree to help you, but you need to release me first before we talk further.”

Ranran took out another Truth-Speaking spell talisman and stuck it to Mu Qingge’s face again. “Sorry, you’re too good at lying. I feel more assured after I question you again after placing this.”

Then she asked, “Do you really not know about my Shifu’s capture?”

Mu Qingge, with a grim face, honestly replied, “I really don’t know. I only heard that there was some commotion in the palace last night, as if an assassin had entered…”

Ranran asked again, “Do you know where the captured assassin is being held?”

Mu Qingge, was reluctant to reply but compelled by the truth talisman, explained, “If Su Yishui was really captured last night, Su Yu would likely still have him detained within the palace. Only the unique Feng Shui of the palace can suppress his spiritual power.”

Ranran asked once more, “Will you help me rescue my Shifu?”

Mu Qingge’s scarred cheeks twitched slightly. “There is no way I will help. He doesn’t care about me at all, all he has in his heart is you! I wouldn’t mind if both of you died together!”

Oh dear, this response was far beyond Ranran’s expectations. She was a little dumbfounded. How did Elder Mu know about the illicit incidents between her master and herself? And Elder Mu’s tone was filled with jealousy.

Could it be that Elder Mu had misunderstood something between Shifu and her from before, hence the jealous rage and the plot to harm her with the bugs?

If that were the case, didn’t she become a stumbling block in her Shifu’s romance? Their twenty years of unrequited love turned into complete despair because of her interference?

But now was not the time for problems with romance. Ranran had not assumed that she could persuade Mu Qingge to help rescue Shifu in the first place. She shook her head apologetically, then asked, “Do you often meet with the Emperor?”

Mu Qingge was already irritated; being forced to speak truthfully felt like her protective shell was being stripped away, but her mouth was not under her control. She gritted her teeth and said, “Su Yu, that bastard, is just using me. Why would he meet with me every day…… Damn it!”

Others thought the Emperor valued Mu Qingge highly, treating her like his own parent. Mu Ranwu also enjoyed this perception, proud of the vanity it satisfied.

But now, Mu Ranwu had to reveal that she was just someone’s pawn, especially in front of Xue Ranran. This sense of shame, was almost bursting forth from her scars.

Previous
Next

话未说完 UNFINISHED WORDS

To her utter surprise, Ranran nodded and sounded gratified, “So, Elder Mu, you know that Su Yu is not a good person. You must be wondering how I seem so much stronger than you. Actually, I think it’s because you’ve been in that sinister palace for too long, which has greatly diminished your spiritual power! As a woman, you still need to be careful… How about I free you from this burden, so that you don’t have to return to that dangerous place again.”

Ignoring Mu Qingge’s glaring eyes, she sealed her mouth completely and then tied her up and stuffed her into the nearby cabinet after applying a sleeping talisman.

Mu Qingge, under the effects of the golden talisman, wouldn’t wake up for a while. The cabinet was empty and used for decoration, so it shouldn’t be disturbed for a while. Once the people from the palace left, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier would come to deal with her, to prevent her from waking up and exposing Ranran.

Ranran’s figure was similar to Mu Qingge’s. Because Mu Qingge presently had injuries on her face, she always wore a veil when going in and out. So Ranran didn’t need to disguise herself further; wearing the veil would cover her face.

After putting on Mu Qingge’s clothes, clearing her throat, and lowering her voice to imitate Mu Qingge’s speech pattern, Ranran, was also naturally gifted with a parrot-like voice, able to imitate singing and speech perfectly. She managed to fool her way back to the carriage and returned to the palace without raising suspicion.

Although her imitation of the voice was quite similar, she only gave simple commands like “set off” or “go out” during the remaining time, keeping silent otherwise. In this remarkably smooth manner, she returned to the palace on the west side.

The Battle Goddess preferred to ride in luxurious carriages with high canopies, making several daily trips in and out, with guards and badges in place, allowing her to enter the palace smoothly. The palace guards had already grown accustomed to it.

As for Battle Goddess’s depressed mood and reluctance to speak much, the palace maids and eunuchs serving her also found nothing out of the ordinary.

In recent days, Mu Qingge’s temper had been erratic due to her facial injuries. Her sudden silence brought relief to the attendants, and no one felt masochistic enough to approach and fawn over her.

When Ranran returned to the Western Palace and dismissed her attendants with a wave, she first took a tour of the rooms. The room was lavishly decorated, with precious jewels piled on the table, and exquisite clothing hanging on screens.

Ranran knew that Elder Mu loved to live in luxury, and after touring her rooms, it was indeed evident.

Although Su Yu was merely using Elder Mu, he was really generous. Supporting a woman like this, solely relying on Shifu’s consultation fees……it would be rather challenging.

Ranran pondered for a moment, then sat on the couch and tried to mobilize her true qi.

As Shifu said, her dantian full of true qi had dissipated the moment she entered the palace, unable to gather again no matter what she tried. However, during meditation, she could still circulate her meridians to maintain her health.

Ranran felt that Elder Mu really threw all caution to the wind, just to avoid the three major sects. Spending too much time in such an atmosphere would greatly damage the foundation of even someone with a high cultivation level.

In theory, Elder Mu, with skills not inferior to her Shifu’s, could easily establish her own Sect. However, for some reason, this Elder Mu seemed accustomed to rely on others, using them as tools or being used as one…

Was this really her true character?

Ranran couldn’t imagine how the once carefree woman, who indulged in drinking and enjoyed life to the fullest, ended up being so timid and hesitant now.

Thinking about this, she was even more curious about Su Yu. How cunning must he have been, to be able to manipulate Mu Qingge for two lifetimes, using her all these while?

But the immediate priority was to find out where Shifu was. Considering Mu Qingge’s words about Shifu likely still being in the palace, Ranran found it plausible. Even if she couldn’t find Shifu, she could find the spiritual spring on his neck.

With that in mind, she took out the small compass made by Uncle Master Zeng. Similar to the compass Qin Xuanjiu had, it could detect faint waves of energy near demonic entities.

Ranran didn’t intend to act at night. The Great Qi Palace was too vast, and she couldn’t use true qi; moving around at night would only attract attention.

So, taking advantage of the rare, clear day, she put on her veil and confidently led a few palace maids to take a walk in the Imperial Garden.

Seeing the Battle Goddess’s figure from a distance, the scattered concubines and consorts looked at her with faint disdain.

After all, Mu Qingge, neither a consort nor a concubine, had taken possession of the best of everything in the palace, sharing the Emperor’s glory and favor, which naturally aroused envy and resentment.

Ranran hid her face in the veil, seemingly walking casually about but was actually checking the small compass hanging around her neck.

Shifu had the spiritual spring on him, and the compass should be able to sense some demonic energy. After walking back and forth several times, she noticed that the compass trembled slightly each time she faced the northeast direction, as if responding to something.

She looked in the northeast direction and saw a tall tower there, said to be where the founding heroes were honored by the former emperor, built right in the center of the Pool of Inquiry.

The Pool of Inquiry had been expanded twenty years ago and had become quite a large body of water.

However, as she was about to head towards the Pool of Inquiry — now called the Lake of Inquiry — she was stopped by someone and informed that it was a forbidden area of the palace and not to be approached.

Ranran could only express her curiosity and ask why it was a forbidden area. The guards exchanged glances, and one of them, with a forced smile, said, “You know, a few days ago, an assassin came and fled to the Lake of Inquiry. In the end, he slipped and fell in. The corpse hasn’t been retrieved yet. It’s such an ominous place; you’d better stay away.”

Ranran knew she couldn’t get close right now. But after hearing the guard’s words, she felt her heart lurch.

She had to leave for now but reassured herself silently: even if Shifu had temporarily lost his spiritual power in the palace, he couldn’t possibly be drowned so easily. There must be some deception involved, and she needed to quickly investigate the anomalies in the lake…

Just as she was deeply engrossed in her thoughts, a voice filled with anger sounded behind Ranran, “Why are you still staying here? Have you been dazzled by wealth and luxury?”

Ranran hadn’t sensed anyone approaching, so she turned around cautiously. It turned out to be a lady in a red dress, with a bright and charming aura, standing angrily behind her. Without any reservation, she grabbed Ranran’s wrist and pulled her into a nearby pavilion.

“You can all leave; I want to have a chat with the Battle Goddess.” The lady in red instructed her attendants.

Considering Elder Mu’s tendency to provoke trouble, Ranran wasn’t sure if Mu Qingge had offended this lady before. So, she remained silent, allowing the lady to take the lead and say all she wanted.

Seeing no response from her, the lady in red seemed anxious and impatient, speaking in a low voice, “What’s wrong with you? Why do you insist on staying in the palace? If you don’t have a place to stay, my father has a villa in the northwest of Ancheng. You can go there and recuperate peacefully. As for the poison of the Grudge water, I will find a way to get you some herbs to relieve it. If you stay here any longer, you might be sold off without even knowing what happened!”

As she spoke, the lady in red acted like she wanted to throw her out of the palace immediately. But it didn’t seem like jealousy; rather, it was genuine concern.

From the words of the lady in red, it seemed she was an acquaintance of Mu Qingge from twenty years ago, and she didn’t seem to approve of Mu Qingge staying by Su Yu’s side.

It appeared she also had a deep understanding of that Emperor’s scheming, and she seemed afraid that Elder Mu would be taken advantage of.

Seeing “Mu Qingge” standing there blankly without saying a word, the woman in red became agitated: “I thought I had persuaded you when I saw you leaving the palace before, but why did you go to Tianmai Mountain and come back?”

Xue Ranran tentatively whispered in a low voice, “…Do you know that Su Yishui has been captured?”

The woman in red was stunned for a moment, then laughed coldly, “Isn’t that great? You’ve already died once, don’t get bewitched again. What’s the use of caring about someone who is wicked like Su Yishui? Do you think he will really change for the better just because of your wishes? He’s already rotten to the core, beyond redemption. Let him fight with the Emperor, and you stay far away from all these, that’s what’s right.”

Ranran didn’t expect the woman in red, a palace concubine, to have such a low opinion of her Shifu’s character. Even if she was Su Yu’s concubine, she shouldn’t slander her Shifu like this!

Moreover, this “dogs fighting dogs”… it seems that she doesn’t have a good opinion of the Emperor either.

Just then, a eunuch came over, smiling without reaching his eyes, and said to the woman in red, “Consort Jing, why have you come here? Your father, Lord Zhou, just had an audience with the Emperor and was planning to come and pay his respects to you. He’s waiting outside your palace gates.”

Upon hearing this, the lady in red, Consort Jing coldly glared at the eunuch, then turned and left quickly.

But her gait was not like other palace concubines, who walked delicately like lotus flowers. Instead, she walked briskly and gracefully, almost as if she had martial arts skills.

As Ranran was about to head back, she saw Lin Yeting, the beloved disciple of her master Mu Qingge, being led by a eunuch to find his mentor.

Lin Yeting seemed to have noticed Consort Jing approaching Mu Qingge earlier. After paying his respects to his mentor, he knowledgeably said, “Consort Jing’s father, although holding a high position as Minister of War, but both father and daughter are really rigid in thinking. It’s been said that Minister Zhou Dao has been reprimanded by His Majesty several times recently, indicating a loss of favor… Before she entered the palace, it seemed she had a good relationship with you, Master, so I dare to speak up and advise you to keep them at arm’s length, lest you be burdened by these two father and daughter…”

Ran Ran immediately understood upon hearing this. This Consort Jing’s father, Zhou Dao, was actually the former superior of General Qin Xuanjiu, who guarded the Wangxiang Pass.

When someone used the incident of soldiers from Wangxiang Pass throwing themselves into the river to accuse General Qin Xuanjiu, it was this Minister Zhou Dao who strongly vouched for him.

However, Zhou Dao and the treacherous Prime Minister Lin have always been enemies. Now, Lin Yeting is taking advantage of the situation to sow discord, obviously working hard for his father.

Xue Ran Ran naturally had a strong aversion to the Lin family’s father and son. Although they had never worked together, she had long sensed their foul stench.

Moreover, if Lin Yeting continued to follow her around, she would not be able to act freely.

So, Ranran tightened her throat, imitated the voice of Elder Mu, and coldly said Shifu’s one-worded mantra: “Get lost!”

After saying that, she turned and walked towards her palace without looking back.

Although Lin Yeting also knew that his master had been extremely irritable these past few days, he never expected her to be so blunt in rebuking him today, leaving him dumbfounded for a moment.

But later, he realized that Consort Jing Zhou Feihua was once a close friend of Mu Qingge, so he suddenly understood that his words just now were too careless, possibly causing displeasure to his master.

Although he had upset his master, Lin Yeting was not too alarmed.

Did she really think she was a god-like figure? Although she was highly honored by His Majesty, that favor being withdrawn one day would catch her off guard.

Although he called that woman his master, it was at his father’s behest, to monitor her closely. Did she really think he, the son of a high-ranking Prime Minister, was someone at her beck and call?

Master Lin, unable to restrain himself, snorted coldly and turned to leave as well.

After returning to the West Palace, Ranran dismissed the attendants and prepared to change into a neat outfit, waiting quietly for the night to come.

With nothing else to do, she crossed her legs to meditate, hoping to calm her mind so she could discern her Shifu’s voice amidst the noisy sounds near and far in the palace. But no matter how carefully she listened, she did not a sound from her Shifu.

However, she did catch some unrelated voices.

She heard her so-called “beloved disciple” Lin Yeting seem to be whispering not far from the West Palace: “That old man Zhou Dao doesn’t know how to appreciate favors, he is quite stubborn and unwilling to move voluntarily. He might need a lesson… I heard that the Emperor has been favoring Consort Jing for several nights in a row… With this, Lord Zhou might have a chance to turn things around because of his daughter!”

Another eunuch with a high voice said, “If the Lord Chancellor is worried about this, it’s easy to handle. Recently, Consort Jing’s cousin also joined the Forbidden Army. They grew up together like childhood sweethearts… If the young master is interested, there’s a drinking session in the barracks tonight, a chance…”

The rest of their conversation was too soft for Ranran to hear clearly.

Right now, her sole focus was on rescuing her Shifu. Palace intrigue and power struggles were not her concern, so even though she heard it, she didn’t pay it much mind.

Soon, night fell, and Ranran silently calculated the time for the changing of guards in the Western Palace. Taking advantage of the shift change, she lightly jumped onto the roof from a window and swiftly headed towards the northeast tower.

Thanks to her Shifu’s strict training, even without using her Qi, her footsteps were light and agile. As she approached the tall building near the Lake of Inquiry, her small compass on her neck trembled violently. Ranran felt ecstatic; perhaps her Shifu was being held captive there.

When she stopped on the last roof, she saw a large open space ahead, with the high tower built in the center of the Lake of Inquiry. The island around it was surrounded by lush greenery and deep waters. The Forbidden Army around seemed wary of the lake, avoiding it from a distance, as if there were ferocious beasts inside.

She had used the eyes of the Vermilion Bird before and saw her Shifu rushing towards that high tower. Adding that to the words of the guards during the day, could it be that her Shifu had really fallen into the lake and hadn’t come out since?

Under the cover of night, Ranran crouched on the roof like a bat, avoiding being seen by distant observers. She closed her eyes and tried to focus, quickly hearing a strange gurgling sound coming from the depths of the lake.

Amidst the low, deep gurgling of the water, there seemed to be a hint of painful whimpering, that voice…… resembled her Shifu!

Ranran’s eyes widened in shock. Could it be… Shifu was imprisoned underwater?

At that moment, soldiers changing shifts seemed to be talking. A leader-like figure asked, “Any unusual movements from the Winged Immortal today?”

The person being asked replied, “Much calmer compared to yesterday. Didn’t that assassin fall into the lake by himself yesterday? The Immortal seems satiated today, behaving quite calmly without surfacing. Plus, you saw it hasn’t rained today.”

The leader spoke in a low voice, “You mustn’t be careless. If the Immortal fully awakens, the entire Capital’s foundation will be overturned. We must feed it on time and check the lake for tremors regularly…”

Ranran was bewildered. She suddenly remembered something about the inner river and the recent continuous heavy rain in the capital. Could there be something deadly hidden beneath the palace’s lake?

If so, was Su Yu insane? Concealing such a sinister creature in the palace, if anything went wrong, wouldn’t it affect everyone in the city? And what did they mean by feeding captured individuals to the Winged Lord? Could they be referring to her Shifu? Had her Shifu been captured and fed to that lake-dwelling monstrosity?

If Su Yu indeed kept some evil creature, similar to the Immortal Devouring Bug, it would require nourishment from someone with deep spiritual energy.

In many ways, her Shifu Su Yishui, was a perfect delicacy! The thought of Shifu possibly being fed to an evil creature made Ranran’s heart feel like it was about to explode.

Shifu, were you really killed by the tyrant this way??

Ranran took pause, knowing she still had a chance to sneak out of the palace, but approaching that deep pool could lead to her being devoured by whatever lurked inside.

However, the whimper from her Shifu that Ranran was certain she had heard earlier, he might be underwater struggling right this moment!

According to Elder Mu, Shifu escaped yesterday and jumped into the lake. If Shifu hasn’t come out yet, then Shifu must still be underwater…

Thinking of this, Ranran actually felt no fear. She had always been someone who, once decided on something, she wouldn’t look back.

If Shifu had really perished under the water, she would risk everything to retrieve even a piece of his bone…

Taking a deep breath, she prepared to jump down, but before she could leap, she felt a chilling presence behind her.

Slowly turning, Ranran saw Su Yishui standing there beside her, dripping wet, staring at her with his beautiful eyes.

Ranran held her breath, examining her Shifu from head to toe – complete and unharmed, not missing any arms or legs. Yet, there was an indescribable eeriness about him.

She was about to speak when Su Yishui gestured for her to go down from the roof and quickly led her along the ridge to a nearby palace.

Compared to previous emperors, there were not many consorts in Su Yu’s palace. This palace near the lake seemed abandoned for a long time, covered in dust.

As they entered the room, Ranran tried to grab her master’s wrist to check his pulse. This was a skill Su Yishui had taught her for discerning people. External appearances could change with illusions, but pulses remained consistent, especially her master’s, which was unique.

But when she reached out, her hand passed through Su Yishui’s body, piercing through his waist.

The person before her was not Shifu but merely an illusion… similar to how the spirit spring had once conjured Mu Qingge’s image at the military platform.

But this illusion of Su Yishui frowned sternly, “Why are you so disobedient? Didn’t Yutong send you all out? Why did you sneak into this place?”

If it were a demon’s illusion, how did it know about her Shifu’s orders to her Second Uncle Master?

Ranran stared at the illusion in a daze, her lips trembling as she whispered, “Shifu… are you dead?”

Could it be that Shifu had died too tragically, and now his spirit was lingering to appear before her?

Perhaps to fit with his disciple’s imagination, the man before her exuded a chilling and sinister aura, “Even if I am not dead, you’re close to driving me to my grave.”

Ranran was almost choked up, whispering, “Shifu…”

It would seem that Su Yishui did not want to scare his little disciple out of her wits, so he said in a low voice, “I can’t leave the palace right now, but there’s no immediate danger to my life. My movements are restricted, so I had to detach from my primordial spirit to meet you this way. How did you get into the palace?”

Ranran whispered, “I tied a charm to the foot of the Vermilion bird and saw you falling into the Emperor’s trap, getting captured… How can I go back with peace of mind? Even if I have to fight to the death, I must save Shifu……”

Hearing this, not only did Su Yishui not feel his disciple’s filial piety but he reached out to grab her shoulder, though his hand couldn’t touch her at all.

He tried to rein in his anger, emphasizing every word, “I forbid it. Don’t you dare die!”

Ranran was somewhat stunned by the inexplicable hatred in his eyes. Blinking at Su Yishui’s spiritual form, she dared not speak.

She seemed to have touched her Shifu’s sore spot again. At this moment, she was a little afraid of her furious Shifu.

Su Yishui also realized he had frightened Ranran. Seeing how she was shrinking a little from him, he did his best to take a deep breath, trying to calm the agitation in his heart.

Having sacrificed most of his core cultivation to the divine spell, he was highly sensitive to this spirit fruit that is Ranran and her unique aura, which was why he recognized her existence when they first met in Juefeng Village.

Just now when he was underwater, he woke up abruptly when he sensed Ranran’s aura, and conjured his spiritual form to find her.

However, this method of separating the soul consumes even more than Beast-Taming Arts, and he cannot sustain it for too long.

So, he spoke in a low voice, “Early tomorrow morning, find an opportunity to leave the palace and quickly return to the West Mountain…… It’s my fault, if I had known that the Capital was so dangerous, I would never have brought you here. Also, be extremely careful of Su Yu… He…”

I am excited about this Consort Jing! She seems to have insight into Mu Qingge’s feelings for Su Yishui from her first lifetime and things looks really promising since she seems to have alot of tea to spill hehe

Meanwhile Su Yishui is helplessly seeing Ranran once again placing her life in danger for him, when he cannot be at her side to protect her… why is life so difficult?

Previous
Next

潭底秘密 THE SECRET BENEATH THE LAKE

Su Yishui hadn’t finished speaking, but it seemed like his spiritual energy was depleting. His figure began to blur gradually, his voice trembling to the point of being inaudible. Before he could finish his words, he suddenly disappeared without a trace.

Ranran waited silently for a while, but the surroundings remained quiet. She couldn’t see her Shifu’s spirit form anymore, indicating that his spiritual energy wasn’t sufficient to sustain the illusion, causing it to vanish.

She cautiously moved to the side and looked down through the window. Under the moonlight, the rippling waves of the lake, her Shifu should be underwater in that area…

Ranran let out a quiet sigh of relief. At least for now, it was clear that Shifu wasn’t in immediate danger. Moreover, her master had been very furious just now, and if she didn’t listen to him, she might be expelled from the sect even sooner than her second senior brother.

For now, she could only retrace her steps back to the West Palace and plan further when daylight came.

However, as she turned back, she passed by a palace area and heard a familiar high voice, “Quick, carry him to Consort Jing’s bed. Empress Jing is used to practicing sparring before bed. She’s not in her palace now. When the Chief Steward of the Imperial Palace comes to deliver the plaque later, you know what to do, right?”

The voice speaking was none other than the eunuch who had whispered with Lin Yeting during the day.

Hearing this, Ranran, standing on the roof, couldn’t help but stop in her tracks.

Although she wasn’t familiar with palace intrigue, she understood what was being said now. It seemed like Lin Yeting had conspired with some despicable eunuch to drug Consort Jing’s cousin when he drank, render him unconscious, and prepare to place him on her bed.

Both the eunuch and the palace maid in Consort Jing’s palace had been bribed, and Consort Jing was currently practicing martial arts in the arena, providing the perfect opportunity for the scheme.

When Consort Jing returned and the eunuch from the Emperor’s chamber arrived, someone would inevitably discover the man in Consort Jing’s chambers. At that time, it would lead to exposing Consort Jing’s affair with her cousin, cementing her reputation as an unfaithful concubine.

This matter didn’t concern Ranran directly; it was just another tragic injustice in the deep palace.

Ranran continued quickly towards the West Palace. As she walked, she overheard Consort Jing speaking softly with a eunuch in a corner of the palace’s martial arts training ground.

“My father said that the internal river and the palace’s lake are connected. If there’s something suspicious, we should check the lake as well. Did anyone see a body float up after someone fell into the lake the other day?”

The eunuch also whispered, “There are always people guarding around the lake. I couldn’t get close… Lord Zhou has been investigating for so long without any clues. Maybe the rumors about monsters in the river are just that, rumors.”

Consort Jing shook her head, “This matter is of great importance. We can’t rest easy until we get to the bottom of it. Go and prepare what I asked you to prepare…”

After dismissing the young eunuch, she began to wield her long sword under the palace lights.

Consort Jing’s swordsmanship wasn’t just for show; she moved with agility, and her sword whistled as it struck, the floral patterns on her sword swaying around her agile body…

This kind of swordsmanship was almost reaching the realm of “Dao,” carrying an air of righteousness. It would take a lot of effort to achieve such mastery.

Ranran first eavesdropped on their conversation about the lake and then got captivated by Consort Jing’s skills. She couldn’t help but stop and watch, becoming increasingly fascinated.

She thought of General Qin Xuanjiu’s injustice in the past and how Minister Zhou Dao of the Ministry of War spoke up for him. This Consort Jing is the youngest daughter of General Zhou Dao, known for her straightforwardness. If she were falsely accused of adultery, it would be difficult for her to clear her name after being set up.

Although Ranran did not have any deep friendship with her, when Consort Jing had inexplicably scolded her in the pavilion during the day, Ranran had felt an unexplainable liking towards her.

She recalled the conspiracy she accidentally overheard, hesitated for a moment, and decided to meddle more and help this soon-to-be-wronged Consort Jing.

So, Ranran quickly moved to the roof beside the training ground, watching the nimble sword dance of the woman. She pricked her finger, quickly wrote a message on a torn piece of her inner garment, “There’s a man in your bed. Please deal with it quickly.”

After writing, she checked it, finding it concise and to the point, she wrapped the cloth around a stone and threw it towards Consort Jing.

After throwing it, she planned to leave quickly. Unfortunately, she underestimated the skills of this lady of the palace. Consort Jing had already pinpointed the location where the stone was thrown with lightning speed, intercepting Ranran at the roof’s edge.

Ranran reacted quickly, flipping down, narrowly avoiding Consort Jing’s sword tip.

However, dodging one attack led to more sword moves following.

Ranran was a bit dumbfounded; she had managed to pass through one difficult situation after another before so smoothly. She didn’t expect that her one moment of kindness would expose her true identity to Consort Jing.

If she had her spiritual power, she had a hundred ways to defeat Consort Jing, but now, in the palace, she was no different from an ordinary person. Looking at Consort Jing’s robust muscles revealed by her short sleeves… hmm, she had no chance of winning.

Consort Jing glared at the young girl in black standing before her. She had now pressed the sword tip against the girl’s neck, rendering her unable to move.

Consort Jing lifted the cloth wrapped around the stone, shaking it off and revealing the message. Her eyes widened as she coldly asked, “Who are you? What does this message mean?”

Ranran weighed the urgency of the matter, carefully gesturing for the lady to speak softly, and then whispered, “I am a junior of General Qin Xuanjiu, here to report a conspiracy against you by someone.

She wasn’t lying. If they considered Mu Qingge’s connection, she was indeed Qin Xuanjiu’s nephew disciple, a legitimate junior.

Upon hearing Qin Xuanjiu’s name, Consort Jing loosened the short sword at Ranran’s neck slightly and asked coldly, “Who is trying to harm me?”

So Ranran briefly explained about Lin Yeting buying off the eunuchs in the palace.

As for whether Ranran was telling the truth or not, it was quickly confirmed. With a glance from Zhou Feihua, her two maids and a trusted eunuch quickly returned to her palace.

They first tied up all the duty maids staying in the palace tonight, then found her cousin who was unconscious on the bed, clearly drugged.

Next, the eunuch swiftly moved the unconscious cousin to another location.

With Ranran’s warning, everything was resolved smoothly. Before the emperor’s men arrived, the abnormality in the palace was cleared.

Zhou Feihua was quite bold. Faced with the card sent by the emperor’s trusted aide, without a change in expression, she calmly stated that she wasn’t feeling well and couldn’t accompany the king tonight, requesting the emperor to pick another concubine.

The eunuch didn’t mind at all. It seemed that Consort Jing had given the emperor the cold shoulder before. He raised a string of colorful wind chimes in his hand and said, “His Majesty heard that you have been feeling unsettled lately and your sleep hasn’t been good. He specially ordered the eunuch to select this string of wind chimes from the Western Regions as a tribute, to hang by the window so you can sleep more peacefully.”

After saying that, the eunuch went and hung the wind chimes by the window.

Once she dismissed the eunuch sent by the emperor, Zhou Feihua touched with the wind chimes a little while.

The Emperor’s favor was like these wind chimes, beautiful but not practical. It looked good but was of no real use, only creating more enemies for her in the palace.

Unfortunately, those jealous women didn’t think about why a favored concubine for over a decade hadn’t borne any children.

After dealing with the bribed palace maids and eunuchs, Zhou Feihua returned to her palace to assess Ranran. Ranran had just been released from her restraints and was kneeling in front of Consort Jing, rubbing her wrists.

Zhou Feihua looked at her and suddenly asked, “Who are you exactly? If you don’t tell the truth, I’ll have the Chief Steward come and identify you, to see if you’re really from the palace.”

Ranran realized that it must have been her improper etiquette that gave away her identity to Consort Jing. She must have seen through her and recognized that she wasn’t a trained palace maid.

Seeing that Consort Jing was straightforward, Ranran didn’t beat around the bush and said respectfully, “Considering that I’ve helped you once out of goodwill and saved you, can you spare me this time?”

She then revealed her identity. When she mentioned that she was Su Yishui’s disciple, Zhou Feihua’s expression changed, but she still patiently listened to Ranran’s explanation of coming to save her Shifu.

Ranran kept some things unsaid and didn’t mention how she had replaced Mu Qingge and hid her in the bathroom cabinet. Zhou Feihua had a good relationship with Mu Qingge. If she had said it, Zhou Feihua might execute her on the spot.

Zhou Feihua didn’t know about Su Yishui’s capture before. To her, this news was worth celebrating with a few drinks.

However, this girl with big eyes had a good heart. Despite knowing the risk of entering the palace, she still lent a hand when she heard about someone else’s conspiracy.

As for Su Yishui helping Qin Xuanjiu subdue the water demon at Wangxiang Pass, her father had mentioned it before. Since Mu Qingge’s death, Su Yishui had upheld the reputation of Lingxi Palace and recruited new disciples, doing some decent deeds.

Dealing with matters on their own merits, this girl had risked being captured to save her. Zhou Feihua would remember this favor.

So Zhou Feihua thought for a moment and said, “Your master’s capture is his own fault, as he is the descendant of a rebel Prince and cannot escape death. It’s understandable that you want to save your master. I owe you a favor and will repay it. Tomorrow morning, I’ll have someone send you out of the palace. Don’t come back again, or next time I see you, I’ll have to treat you as an assassin.”

Ranran knew that Minister Zhou was upright in his official duties, and his daughter’s character wouldn’t be bad. If she said so, she would do it.

However, she didn’t understand why Zhou Feihua hated her Shifu so much. Was it because her Shifu had stood by and watched while Mu Qingge was besieged, even playing a role in it?

But when Zhou Feihua heard Ranran’s question, she laughed mockingly, “If only it were just a matter of character. You’re such a kind-hearted girl, how did you end up with such an evil master…” She stopped there, refusing to say more, and waved to arrange for Ranran to leave the palace at dawn.

But Shifu was still in the palace. How could Ranran leave?

Shifu had appeared to her using his soul form, indicating that he was trapped by something.

It was very likely that he was worried about her safety, so he tricked her into leaving first. If Zhou Feihua sent her away, it would be difficult for her to come back into the palace.

Ranran’s mind raced, and she suddenly remembered Zhou’s earlier instructions to investigate the matters of the lake and she came up with an idea. She spoke up, “Actually, my Shifu had sensed something strange in the boundaries of the Capital. The root of it lies within this palace. Unfortunately, he didn’t have time to investigate thoroughly before being imprisoned. If I leave now, wouldn’t it be giving up halfway?”

This statement indeed caught Zhou Feihua’s attention. She narrowed her eyes slightly, “Su Yishui also detected it? What did he find out?”

Ranran thought of her little compass and recalled how Su Yu had expanded the Pool of Inquiry into a big lake twenty years ago. Add that to her master falling into the lake and not coming out. All the mysteries pointed to the Lake of Inquiry.

Perhaps only by entering the lake could all the mysteries be solved. So Ranran, daringly, said, “There are demons in the Lake of Inquiry. If your Ladyship wants to find out the truth, I’m willing to go into the lake to investigate.”

When she was about to jump into the lake just now, her Shifu had appeared in his spirit form to stop her right at that moment. He did not allow her to enter the lake. The more he did this, the more determined Ranran was to find out the truth. Even if her Shifu were to expel her from the sect, she wouldn’t leave him alone at the icy cold bottom of the lake.

Seeing her determination, Zhou Feihua thought for a moment and then slowly spoke about what she knew.

It turned out that Zhou Feihua had been secretly investigating the anomalies in the Capital. Just a month ago, one of her father’s old subordinates returned from a night banquet and almost fell into the inner city river. At that time, he said he saw a huge creature emerge from the water, dragging the servant who was supporting him into the river with one gulp.

The old subordinate was so frightened that he immediately snapped out of his drunken state. Since Zhou’s official residence was not far from the incident, the old subordinate had stumbled his way over and desperately knocked on the door of Zhou’s mansion.

After Zhou Dao listened to his incoherent account, he immediately sent people to search the river. However, even after alarming the city prefect and despite mobilizing the district office and numerous fishing boats, they found nothing.

If there really was a huge creature in the river as the old subordinate said, with such a large-scale search, it would have been discovered long ago.

The district office concluded that the old subordinate was drunk and speaking nonsense, closing the case. As for the missing servant, he was ruled as a run-away slave.

But Zhou Dao believed his old subordinate’s words. He had picked up a shell-like object by the riverbank that looked extraordinary, not like a common item.

However, it seemed someone didn’t want him to investigate further. Three days later, the old subordinate, once again drunk, fell into a ditch, broke his neck, and died.

His wife pleaded with Zhou Dao, stating that it was the death anniversary of her mother-in-law, and her husband, being extremely filial, would never drink and revel on such a day, especially after the scare he just experienced. Why would he get so drunk again? Lord Zhou felt that something was amiss. He quietly hired people to search for clues.

Unfortunately, recently, it seemed he had fallen out of the royal favor, as the Emperor hinted that Zhou Dao should retire. If he resigned, he would have to return to his hometown, and this matter would be left unresolved.

Now, when Zhou Feihua heard Ranran confidently mention suspicious activities in the lake, she couldn’t help but ponder. Because she knew that the water in the lake came from the inner river.

Could it be… that the man-eating monster was under the lake in the Imperial palace?

When Ranran expressed her desire to investigate the lake, Zhou Feihua hesitated. “That place is a forbidden area in the palace. One of the emperor’s beloved consorts accidentally fell into the lake, causing the Emperor extreme grief. Since then, palace personnel are forbidden from approaching.”

Thinking Zhou Feihua was being apprehensive, Ranran tilted her head and said, “I’m not a person from the palace. Even if His Majesty investigates, it won’t implicate you, Your Ladyship.”

Zhou Feihua looked at her and suddenly laughed self-deprecatingly. “I never thought that after so many years in the palace, I would waste all my skills and become such a timid person. I am the one who wants to find out the truth, how could I put a little girl like you at risk? Your name is Xue Ranran, right? I’ve heard about you. You were the winner at the Marrow-Cleansing Pool this time. You were able to pass the test of the Great Dun Tian, just like Qingge back then, a rare talent. Won’t it be a pity if something happened to you in the palace lake?”

It seemed that Zhou Feihua was also someone who valued talent.

Ranran clasped her fists and said, “Shifu is the person who is kindest to me. Now that he’s alone and has no one else, who else can save him aside from me? Even if it’s a dragon’s pool or a tiger’s den, I will still venture into it!”

As she spoke, Ranran’s gaze was resolute, and her small face exuded an indescribable charm. For some reason, Zhou Feihua, in a trance, seemed to see another person in this young girl.

That person had been sitting on the top of a tall tower, looking at the dawn in the distance, smiling and saying, “He’s alone, and has no one else. Unless I give him a hand, who else would be willing to save him?”

That time, Zhou Feihua and “her” drank together all night on the high tower. At the farewell, Zhou Feihua never expected that it would be the last time they would meet…

When she heard that Qingge was reborn, Zhou Feihua was extremely ecstatic. Later, she had looked forward to Qingge entering the palace. But when the two met again, the once close friends who could drink together all night had become very distant.

Mu Qingge politely explained that she had lived on a tree for twenty years, and many old memories were hard to recall.

With change, their deep-seated friendship of the past seemed to not have borne fruit with the turning of the cycle of life.

Zhou Feihua sighed lightly, ending her inexplicable sadness. From this impetuous young girl, she seemed to have regained the heroic spirit of her youth.

She smiled and said, “Since you’re not afraid of death, why not accompany me? Let’s find out what secrets are hidden in the lake.”

After they agreed on their plan, Ranran asked curiously, “I heard that during the construction of the Great Qi Palace, an expert had guided it, so there are things buried under the foundation that can suppress spiritual power. Perhaps, that’s why the monster hasn’t caused trouble?”

As she said this, she fingered the small compass around her neck, lost in thought, and then looked at the birds chirping outside the window.

When Zhou Feihua turned around, the young girl standing by the window had disappeared, leaving only a clear voice floating in, “Consort Jing, I’ll go on ahead. If you trust me, we’ll meet again by the lake at midnight…”

Ranran’s light skills were excellent. Seizing the opportunity while it was still dark, she finally made her way back to the Western Palace.

She changed into Qingge’s clothes and then picked up pen and paper, quickly drawing for a while on the paper. When the outline was formed, she exhaled slowly, folded the paper, sealed it with wax, ready to send it out of the palace at the right opportunity.

During the day, she had to pretend to be Qingge. Only at night could she venture into the lake to find out the truth.

In fact, Ranran still had doubts and worried that Consort Jing might betray her.

But when midnight arrived, as she lay on the eaves, she saw Lady Zhou Feihua, dressed in black, appear at the agreed place. She knew then that this Lady’s credibility was as reliable as her swordsmanship.

With Zhou Feihua’s help, approaching the lake for the second time became much easier.

Zhou Feihua knew the time when the guards changed positions around the lake. After the second watch of the night, she took advantage of the wind direction, used a packet of sleeping powder provided by her confidant to incapacitate the guards around.

They then changed into diving attire. After exchanging a glance, they jumped into the water with a splash.

Zhou Feihua was an excellent swimmer, but in the darkness of night, it was pitch black and impossible to see under water.

She took out a night pearl to illuminate the surroundings. It was said that this pearl was a reward from the emperor himself, a testament to Consort Jing’s favor.

With the light from the pearl, they continued to descend, and Ranran’s thoughts grew heavier.

Because in such a large lake… there wasn’t a single fish! The layout of the palace’s water bodies always followed Feng Shui principles, and there should have been auspicious creatures like koi inside.

However, after descending for so long, holding a night pearl that would easily attract fish, the water was eerily silent, like dead water.

Ranran sensed something was wrong. She looked around but saw nothing unusual. She was about to signal Zhou Feihua to ascend when she saw Zhou Feihua, seemingly startled, wide-eyed, gulping water with bubbles forming around her mouth.

Following her gaze, Ranran turned her head and her pupils contracted sharply. She forgot to hold her breath for a moment and almost choked on the water.

Because following the dim light of the pearl, at the bottom of the pool, there was a huge creature coiled there—a dragon with complete scales and horns!

At first, the creature’s figure was blurry, but under the reflection of the night pearl, its body seemed to emit a faint glow of scales, gradually revealing its full appearance.

Fortunately, it seemed to be in a deep sleep, lying motionless at the bottom of the water.

And the dragon’s body was coiled around something, when Ranran took a closer look, she realized that was a person—long hair flowing like black waterweed in the water, the face also illuminated by the light reflecting off the scales, it was clearly her master, Su Yishui!

However, Shifu’s eyes remained closed, seemingly in endless slumber.

Zhou Feihua had choked just now and had to surface. Just then, the dragon slowly opened its eyes, and through its narrow slits, shone a golden light that Ranran felt was inexplicably familiar.

As the dragon stared at her, Ranran found herself unable to move. She could only watch as the massive dragon head slowly approached her. Its swaying whiskers even touched Ranran’s body.

What I really like about this chapter, was that when Ranran refused to listen to Su Yishui, she made that decision based on sound judgement and not just some rebellious streak. She guessed correctly that he only wanted her to leave because it was too dangerous.

What I usually can’t stand is headstrong female leads doing things that was illogical, just to show they are ‘strong of character’. Here, Ranran was genuinely concerned for his well being, and its funny how she thinks she is being filial but her instinct to not leave ‘Shifu’ behind was because of something else…

So, are you surprised that the secret is a dragon?

Previous
Next

一碗鸡粥 A BOWL OF CHICKEN PORRIDGE

Ranran desperately tried to calm herself down while also attempting to draw the mechanism stick tucked at her waist, preparing for a sudden attack from the dragon.

But just then, a familiar voice sounded in her ear, “So you actually know fear? A disciple as disobedient as you, I really should expel you from the sect immediately…”

This voice… It was her Shifu!

This voice, pouring into her ears, was just like how Shifu used to communicate with her through the White Tiger in secret. Ranran was certain that this dragon was communicating with her through their spiritual connection.

The dragon seemed to harbor no ill intentions towards her. It carefully retracted the spikes on its claws and lifted Ranran gently, as if afraid of hurting her. However, it was bound by chains, and even the slightest movement caused the chains to clatter loudly.

Seeing Shifu’s body entwined by the dragon’s tail, Ranran seemed to understand, her master had used beast control techniques to control this dragon, attaching his spirit to the dragon’s body. So, her master’s body at this moment was merely an empty shell without his soul.

As the dragon spoke, it gently lifted Ranran with its big claw and blew a bubble of water around her, enveloping her. With the bubble protecting her, Ranran could finally breathe freely underwater.

“Shifu, why… have you turned into a dragon?”

The golden dragon used its claw to hold the water bubble, and continued to transmit its voice, “This young dragon is about to mature. It had previously consumed many cultivators with formed cores but had been suppressed under the lake, unable to digest its spiritual energy, making its temperament increasingly irritable. If left uncontrolled, even the palace’s Trigram formation won’t be able to contain it. It would overturn the entire Capital, sparing no one. I’m temporarily controlling it with Beast control techniques to see if I can completely subdue it and send it back to the deep open sea.”

Hearing this, Ranran understood. When Shifu had seen the heavy rain in the Capital and noticed something amiss by the river, he understood the root cause. That day, Shifu had pretended to be deceived deliberately, then actively fled towards the Lake of Enquiry, jumping in to control this lurking water dragon.

But… why did the palace harbor such a colossal beast? What did Su Yu intend by raising dragons in the palace?

“Su Yu’s life is nearing its end. He is raising the dragon to prolong his life,” Su Yishui explained.

Years ago, Su Yu was poisoned by Prince Ping xi during the succession dispute and had been saved by Mu Qingge, but his body was already damaged.

Although he later became Emperor, he couldn’t regain his health. It’s said that he had been seeking elixirs and medicines everywhere, eventually turning to unconventional methods when his condition worsened.

Ranran suddenly understood everything. No wonder Su Yu had shown great interest in the water demon’s corpse at Wangxiang Pass. He had sent many people before and after to search for clues at Wangxiang Pass and had gathered people like Bao Ming who could transform their bodies.

Because Su Yu’s body was already severely damaged, those so-called alchemists and cultivators couldn’t help his immediate need.

Emperors always referred to themselves as the true sons of dragons, but Su Yu was taking it a step further. He wanted to merge his body with a real golden dragon to gain a dragon’s lifespan of thousands of years.

She had heard from the eunuch that her master had brought that the lake was expanded twenty years ago. That meant the Emperor had obtained this dragon at that time.

But where did this dragon come from? How did Su Yu manage to transfer it to the lake?

Su Yishui knew the dragon’s origin. He said mildly, “Someone was once saved by the Azure Dragon Meng zhang from the Dragon Island in the East Sea. Unfortunately, Meng zhang was killed by… the Demon’s Son from the Nether Realm. Before dying, the Azure Dragon laid a dragon egg, which probably fell into Su Yu’s hands later.”

If Su Yu had initially obtained a freshly hatched baby dragon, everything could be explained. But this dragon was forced to mature, compressing what should have been a growth period of hundreds of years into twenty.

This young dragon has consumed too much spiritual power, growing too quickly. Perhaps the Lake of Inquiry will no longer be able to contain it any longer. That’s why Su Yu is urgently searching for the Seven Evil Transformation Spell that can absorb the dragon’s essence, wanting to gain the dragon’s spiritual power to extend his own life.

It is precisely because of this dragon that the Capital has continuous rainfall, nearly causing a flood disaster.

After understanding all this, Ranran tried to move the water bubble around her, floating up and down around the giant dragon’s body—opportunities to see a dragon up close are rare, so she wanted to take a good look while her master could still control it.

Su Yishui looked on helplessly as his disciple floated around excitedly like a jumping bean.

It can’t be helped; this was still an immature girl with a playful nature, which was normal… and besides, he knew that even if she grew older, her nature might become even more immature. Someone who would live their whole life being carefree and playful couldn’t be expected to act with composure…

“But Shifu, it has consumed so many people. Why are you risking so much to save it? Isn’t there a way to eliminate it?” Ranran asked.

The dragon, upon hearing this, looked deeply into the water bubble where Ranran was bouncing around like a jumping bean and said mildly, “It deserves to die indeed, but someone once made a promise to its dying mother, vowing to return the dragon egg to its ancestral Dragon Island. Unfortunately…… she also met with an accident later and couldn’t fulfill her promise. I want to fulfill her promise for her and send this dragon back. As for the dragon’s nature, it is originally neither good nor evil. Away from those who tempt it towards evil, once it is far from the mortal world, why should humans need to judge its goodness or evil?”

Ranran, floating on the dragon’s horn at this moment, thought her master’s words spoke into her heart! But who was that acquaintance? Probably Elder Mu?

Qin Xuanjiu had mentioned before that Mu Qingge had once single-handedly suppressed the Demon’s Son, averting a disaster for the world. Even that Spirit Spring, was something that had been separated from the Demon’s Son.

Now thinking about how the Demon’s Son could kill an adult dragon, what a terrifying ability that was!

“Shifu, your physical body has been underwater all this time, is it really safe?”

Seeing Su Yishui’s body was also wrapped in a huge water bubble, Ranran worried that if anyone on the lake noticed something unusual underwater and took action, wouldn’t Shifu be unable to manage everything at the same time?

Because the dragon’s body was still entangled with countless chains made of mysterious iron, it seems that its movements were not entirely free either.

“I dare not fully unleash the dragon’s power. Once it becomes enraged, it would be too difficult to control. I can only look for an opportunity, see if I can wait until *Duanwu Zhenyang when the dragon’s demonic nature is at its weakest, then let it break free from the chains.”

*Duanwu Zhen yang, which is tomorrow.
*端午正阳 Fifth day of the fifth lunar month

Su Yishui had originally planned to take a risk, wait until noon when the sun’s energy was strongest, to unleash the dragon’s own power to break free from the chains and then control it to ascend to the sky and return to the sea.

After he discovered the signs in the Capital, he intended to enter the palace to investigate. When he saw scales underwater in the inner rivers, he vaguely guessed the truth.

Before jumping into the lake, he had explained the severity of the situation clearly to Su Yu, but Su Yu had insisted to go his own way, to use the dragon to prolong his life. So, Su Yishui had jumped into the lake and temporarily controlled the dragon.

Su Yu naturally knew he couldn’t keep the dragon any longer. Although he had many ways to kill the dragon underwater, he couldn’t bear to miss this chance to prolong his life, so he temporarily had no immediate way to deal with Su Yishui.

But the one thing Su Yishui had miscalculated, was Ranran’s unpredictable nature. She had actually controlled the vermilion bird and witnessed his capture, and even disregarded the danger to enter the palace.

If she were not here, he could be more reckless. But with her inside the Great Qi Palace, Su Yishui’s previous plans were all rendered useless. If he couldn’t control the dragon later, wouldn’t Ranran be in danger too?

However, Ranran felt that her master’s physical body must not remain in the water any longer. While the vigilance was lax now, it was a good opportunity to send his physical body out of the water to prevent Su Yishui from neglecting one for the other.

She remembered the joints where the magnetic force was reduced that she had discovered when running around the palace earlier, so she explained it to her Shifu again in detail. After a simple agreement, Ranran pushed his physical body and surfaced the lake.

Zhou Feihua was waiting on the shore. But when she saw not only Ranran surfaced, but a man was also pushed out, she was surprised.

When she saw that the unconscious man was Su Yishui, she immediately drew her dagger, ready to slit his throat. Ranran quickly stopped her, glaring at Zhou Feihua and said, “What are you doing? If you kill my Shifu, the dragon underwater will be out of control!”

She briefly explained the situation underwater to Zhou Feihua.

Zhou Feihua also knew it was almost time for a shift change, and it was also time for those drugs to wear off, so she glared at Su Yishui resentfully, then helped Ranran lift him into a sedan chair and returned to Zhou Feihua’s palace.

After they made it back, Ranran detailed the chain of events and the current circumstances to Zhou Feihua.

Zhou Feihua was silent for a long time when she heard that the dragon underwater was raised by Su Yu to extend his life. She struggled to digest this information.

Having stayed in the palace for so long, although she had sensed that something was wrong, she still couldn’t believe that there was such a demonic beast in the palace. However, only the emperor Su Yu could successfully hide a small dragon from everyone in the palace.

Since Su Yu ascended the throne, he had been diligent and loved his people. If nothing unexpected happened, after his passing, he would be known as a wise ruler of his generation.

But he had actually done such an appalling thing,. He was practically playing with the lives of all the citizens in the Capital.

But thinking about it, Su Yu’s body had indeed deteriorated significantly over the years, and she was one of the few who could see him. Listening to the sound of the Emperor coughing from behind the curtain was indeed heart-wrenching, feeling like thin threads of air were being torn apart.

But recently, the Emperor seemed to be recovering, and his spirit and complexion had improved a lot. If what Su Yishui said was true, that this small dragon was related to Su Yu’s life extension, then everything made sense.

Thinking of this, Zhou Feihua fell into contemplation, her head lowered, lost in thought.

In fact, Ranran didn’t expect Zhou Feihua to be of much help. If it weren’t for the delicate situation her Zhou family was in at court, Zhou Feihua’s first priority would probably be to consider how to help the Emperor live longer and healthier?

At this moment, Zhou Feihua self-mockingly smiled and said, “The reason I entered the palace back then was because Mu Qingge entrusted my Zhou family to diligently guard the king. At that time, she said she had altered the Emperor’s destiny on her own, and would not be able to escape heavenly punishment. However the Emperor Su Yu she saved in the nick of time, was too young and his character was still uncertain and needed someone by his side to support him well, so as not to disappoint the people of the world. I thought there was no place more convenient to do this than within the palace, so I became a consort. But later on, I became lazy, only wanting to avoid the jealousy and struggles in the palace, and also I thought that the Emperor was a good ruler who governed diligently and cared for the people. But… now the Emperor has actually done such things, it’s my failure to fulfill the task entrusted by an old friend. If things continue like this, even if my friend doesn’t blame me, I can only apologize with my life…”

Her meaning was clear in her words. Although she was Su Yu’s consort, in her view, she still bore the earnest instructions of Mu Qingge. Now that Su Yu had made mistakes by resorting to demonic means to prolong his life, she couldn’t evade responsibility either and must do her utmost to guide the Emperor back to the right path.

Ranran felt her words carried deeper significance. What did she mean by Mu Qingge altered destiny on her own? Wasn’t Su Yu supposed to be the destined Emperor? Then who should it be? The rebel Prince Ping?

Ranran didn’t understand the grudges of the previous generations of the Da Qi imperial family and was unable to make sense of it all at this time.

But what surprised Zhou Feihua more than Su Yu, was Su Yishui’s voluntary capture, just to subdue the restless dragon.

“When did he become so concerned about the world?” As she said this, Zhou Feihua unconsciously played with the dagger in her hand, seemingly looking for an opportunity to bypass Ranran and stab the unconscious man lying on the bed.

Ranran had to be on guard, sitting straight in front of her master to protect him, as she declared proudly, “My Shifu has always been such a good person, not only helping the world but also caring for his disciples and vanquishing demons everywhere. Even without high cultivation, he could become a deity through accumulated kindness!”

Zhou Feihua wasn’t sure about what the young girl said, because it did not match the Su Yishui she knew.

Her impression of Su Yishui had always been of a cold, aloof young man. So, hearing the naive words of Ranran, she couldn’t even muster a smile, saying coldly, “It’s just that you, a girl who hasn’t experienced much of the world, can’t see through his true nature… However, is it really true that he can succeed at noon tomorrow?”

Ranran nodded, saying seriously, “But it would be safer to find a way to unlock the dragon’s chains. The palace concubines all say that the Emperor favors you the most. People say that pillow talk is very effective, can you try to sway his favor and see if you can find a solution?”

Zhou Feihua, upon hearing this, smiled bitterly, “He turns his favor to me? It’s just because he wants to watch me in red clothes dancing with a sword, reminiscing about his old friend who passed. We haven’t spent a night together, so I can’t even sway his favor even if I wanted.”

As she said this, although Zhou Feihua’s face showed a bit of melancholy regret, there was no sign of the typical resentful abandoned concubine in the palace. It’s just that her words were a bit heart-wrenching. In that case, hadn’t she been living in the palace for the past twenty years like a widowed woman?

But Zhou Feihua said it was fine; she had spent these years enjoying painting and calligraphy, and her swordsmanship was even better than when she was a young girl. She was content with her life.

Ranran nodded, Zhou Feihua has turned the bitter years of serving in the imperial harem into a peaceful retirement life of a high-ranking official.”

This Consort Jing is truly a master of how to live a peaceful life.

Upon hearing Ranran’s admiration, Zhou Feihua smiled and said, “If given the chance, I would definitely leave this Imperial palace, roam freely in the mountains and waters, without any restraints. That would be a fulfilling life…”

Ranran also felt that it was a pity for someone like Zhou Feihua to be stuck in the palace, serving a sick emperor. She was very serious when she replied her, “There will definitely be a chance. When that time comes, enjoy yourself and make up for these years of owed happiness!”

This kind of encouragement for a consort to escape the palace was indeed rebellious. Zhou Feihua laughed heartily upon hearing it, expressing in a Jianghu manner, “I’ll take your good words as a blessing!”
