Although their ages differed by *fourteen or fifteen years, they could still talk happily, which was quite surprising.
*Ranran is already 18 years old… so this doesn’t seem quite correct

Since that was the case, the two continued to discuss their cooperation. Zhou Feihua promised that she would find a way to cover for Ranran’s master until the dragon left the palace.

Ranran explained that the Seven Evil Transformation Spell was just a demonic technique used by the Spirit Spring to enchant hearts. Once used, it would lose one’s true self. Although Zhou Feihua hoped for Su Yu’s recovery, she couldn’t let him lose his sanity as a price.

If an Emperor lost his benevolence and righteousness, the consequences would be unbearable for the world.

After they agreed on this, the sky started to lighten up. The palace maids were still asleep, but Ranran felt hungry.

Fortunately, Consort Jing lived a secluded life in the palace, so there was a small kitchen with only a stove to heat water and rice, which was just right for making porridge.

Ranran saw chicken meat and dried scallops in the kitchen, remembering the secret recipe for Chicken porridge from the [ Playing Classics]. She followed it and cooked a pot of thick porridge, the porridge was just the right thing to feed to her unconscious Shifu.

Although he was in a fasting state and didn’t need to eat or drink, considering how worn out he had been after merging with the White Tiger the last time, it was still best to have some nourishment.

Zhou Feihua watched as Ranran carefully fed the porridge to the unconscious man and wiped his face. Her attentive demeanor, rather than filial piety towards her master, resembled more of caring for a beloved husband.

While eating the porridge Ranran made, Zhou Feihua said, “Little girl, don’t be fooled by his good looks. This person has no heart. Falling for him will only lead to a bad end… This porridge is really delicious! Why don’t you stay in my palace from now on and accompany me…”

Just then, someone outside the palace announced, “The Emperor has arrived, Consort Jing please receive him!”

It turned out that Emperor Su Yu, upon hearing that Consort Jing was unwell, and specially came to check on her early in the morning.

Ranran’s body stiffened slightly upon hearing this, feeling like things had gone back to square one. This time, Consort Jing would be seen by the Emperor himself. And there was still a man in her bed, Su Yishui no less, which was much worse than her cousin from the Imperial Guards!

However, Zhou Feihua remained calm. She carried the clothes from the box to place behind the screen and, together with Ranran, placed Su Yishui inside the clothes box.

After doing this, Consort Jing applied some powder on her face and lips, deliberately making her appearance look a bit haggard, and went to meet the Emperor.

Since Ranran couldn’t show herself, she hid in Consort Jing’s inner chamber, guarding her own master.

But before Consort Jing could leave the room, the Emperor had already pushed open her door.

Consort Jing greeted the Emperor quickly.

Separated by a brocade curtain, they heard the deep voice of a man speaking gently, “Beloved Consort, there is no need for formalities. I heard that you were unwell, so I came to check on you…”

After speaking, the Emperor seemed to sit at the table in Consort Jing’s outer chamber.

On the table was the chicken porridge Ranran had just cooked, still emitting steam.

Consort Jing had to graciously offer it, saying to the Emperor, “I had the kitchen just make this porridge. If Your Majesty is hungry, would you like some.”

Ranran and two palace maids knelt in the inner chamber, she peeked through the brocade curtain with curious eyes, sizing up the Emperor Su Yu, whom she had only heard of but never seen.

The man sitting at the table had a gentle demeanor, bearing some resemblance to the impersonator.

However, no matter how well-trained the impersonator was, he couldn’t exude the noble elegance of a true royal. This Emperor, was definitely different, radiating an imperial aura.

And Ranran also noticed that this Su Yu actually bore a slight resemblance to his nephew Su Yishui in his eyes and brows, looks like they are both descendants of the imperial Su family.

Unfortunately, Su Yu couldn’t maintain the youthful appearance of Su Yishui, so the signs of aging were evident around his eyes and brows. His pale skin and tall, emaciated figure also indicated his ailing condition.

Noticing the fragrant porridge, Su Yu seemed genuinely hungry and smiled, “Consort Jing’s kitchen seems to cook better than my royal kitchen. The smell of this porridge is quite special.”

A eunuch beside him had already scooped some porridge into a bowl from the pot and tasted it first. It would appear that Su Yu was very vigilant; even if it was food from the beloved Consort, he still needed the eunuch to taste it first.

Usually, it was enough that the eunuch would only taste a little, to check for poison.

But today, after tasting a bit, the eunuch couldn’t help but scoop up a large spoonful and gulped it down, eating rather voraciously.

The eunuchs who served before His Majesty, apart from a bowl of plain porridge before going on duty, dared not eat anything substantial, lest they commit the offense of farting or burping in front of His Majesty.

So this eunuch who was tasting the food was truly hungry. Suddenly, he tasted this incredibly delicious chicken porridge that melted in his mouth, and couldn’t help but finish all the porridge in the bowl…

After finishing the bowl, he realized his indiscretion and was scared, falling to his knees and waiting for the Emperor’s punishment.

Su Yu chuckled, curious about the taste of the porridge that made the tasting eunuch forget etiquette. He took the bowl that Consort Jing had scooped for him from the pot, stirred it with a spoon, and then took a sip… The Emperor’s charming smile froze for a moment, then slowly chewed and swallowed the porridge, finishing the bowl just like the eunuch had…

“Beloved Consort, who made this porridge?” he asked suddenly Zhou Feihua while eating.

Zhou Feihua was stumped. She replied a little distractedly, “It was made by the servants in the kitchen.”

The Emperor looked at her with a smile, “Summon the person here and let her dictate the recipe. I’ll write down the recipe and give it to the royal kitchen staff so they don’t keep making food that doesn’t please me.”

Zhou Feihua hadn’t expected the conversation topic to turn here, so she felt caught off guard.

Ranran had not expected the Emperor to also be a food enthusiast, asking about the porridge recipe in the middle of the night. Just then, the steward eunuch beside the Emperor had already summoned the palace maid from the kitchen.

I was wondering how did Su Yishui use the Beast Taming technique if he cannot use any spiritual power? Don’t cultivators lose access to their spiritual powers once they enter the palace?
I am quite confused about this part…

However, it appears that the suppression is not absolute. Perhaps the lake is too vast and might be a place where the forces are weak? Otherwise the dragon would also be unable to influence the weather with its rain summoning abilities right?

Also, Su Yishui’s empty shell is still ‘alive’ but his soul is out with the dragon. But since he still had to use a bubble to keep himself breathing, it seems that other bodily functions are still there. So he can still swallow when he is unconscious? I am also confused by this part lol

Previous
Next

不老之身 ETERNAL LIFE

The palace maid was very frightened, thinking that the porridge was not to the Emperor’s liking, so he had summoned her to inquire about it.

However, she didn’t cook the porridge at all. If she confessed hastily, she would face the punishment of death by beheading.

So she glanced at the inner chamber and happened to see Ranran behind the brocade curtain. She immediately bowed and said, “Your Majesty, this porridge was cooked by that palace maid. I truly don’t know the recipe for this porridge!”

Su Yu smiled as he listened, then casually glanced at the little maid behind the brocade curtain who had kept her head bowed.

Zhou Feihua glared fiercely at the indiscreet kitchen maid, then asked directly, “Your Majesty insists on asking about this porridge. Is there anything wrong with it? If it’s not good, I will punish the palace maid severely. Guards, take her away and give her a beating!”

Ranran was not someone from the palace, and Zhou Feihua was worried that her identity would be exposed, so she wanted to preemptively take her away under the pretext of punishment.

But just then, the man with the yin-yang eyes, Old Feng, suddenly appeared at the door. When Su Yu waved his finger, Old Feng, with a murderous aura, walked towards the inner chamber.

Zhou Feihua stood up abruptly, blocking Old Feng, and coldly said, “Your Majesty, allowing a man from outside the palace to enter my inner chamber may not be appropriate, right?”

Old Feng was not very polite, trying to push past Zhou Feihua. But Zhou Feihua was not a weak person! When Old Feng made a move, she quickly countered, giving him a hard slap that made him take a few steps back.

Su Yu watched, his smile unchanged on his face, and said in a gentle tone, “Beloved Consort, what are you doing? Is there something in the inner chamber that you’re afraid I’ll find out?”

Zhou Feihua was about to reply, but in that moment, Old Feng flicked a flying insect with his hand. It fluttered over and bit Zhou Feihua’s neck.

With just that one bite, Zhou Feihua’s body went weak, and she collapsed on the ground.

Ranran, being sharp-eyed, saw the insect and felt a sudden tightness in her chest. That flying insect… why did it resemble the Immortal-devouring Bug from Tianmai Mountain?

Just as Zhou Feihua fell, Ranran quickly glanced at the positions of the window and the door, estimating her chances of escape.

Old Feng curved his lips and said, “Miss, you should know the power of this insect. If you don’t cooperate, I still have plenty of insects here. If I miscalculate and drain your spiritual power, don’t blame me!”

Estimating nearly no chance of escape, Ranran became more composed. She stood up and honestly replied, “It was me who made it. If Your Majesty finds it unsatisfactory, I will make it again. Why make such a fuss?”

At this moment, Old Feng also saw Ranran and whispered to Su Yu, “Your Majesty, I’ve seen this young lady before. She came to Yiren Hall with Su Yishui, disguised as Bao Ming. It seems she’s Su Yishui’s disciple.”

Although she wore a veil at the time, Old Feng’s yin-yang eyes were sharp enough to see her face through the thin fabric.

Su Yu’s eyes were fixed on her, his smile seemingly fading a bit. After a long while, he said, “It’s been many years since I had such delicious chicken porridge. The last time I had it was over twenty years ago… You’re Su Yishui’s disciple, Xue Ranran, right?”

Xue Ranran was rather taken aback that the Emperor knew her by name. She couldn’t help but ask, “Your Majesty, how do you know my name?”

Su Yu looked at the beautiful young girl in front of him and said mildly, “I also know that your mother found you on the Peak of the Immortal Platform and raised you by her side until Su Yishui took you in as his disciple.”

Ranran recalled that Mu Qingge had investigated her before, involving even the officials, so it wasn’t so surprising that Su Yu knew these things.

But why were these people all so curious about her parentage? Could she really be the daughter of some powerful figure?

She looked at Su Yu, who was in his thirties and could theoretically be her father, and asked directly, “Your Majesty, why are you so curious about my parentage? Am I perhaps Your Majesty’s missing illegitimate daughter ?”

Su Yu’s reaction to this question was similar to Su Yishui’s, somewhat displeased.

He leaned back slightly, a wry smile on his face. “Am I old enough to be your father now? You used to always call me ‘Xiao Yu.'”

Ranran was confused momentarily. This “Xiao Yu” wasn’t unfamiliar to her, it seemed like Mu Qingge used to call him by that name. But when had she ever called the Emperor “Xiao Yu”?

Could it be that the Emperor was confused by his illness and speaking nonsense?

Seeing Ranran’s puzzled expression, Su Yu waved his hand for a eunuch to bring a comfortable chair for her to sit and talk.

Seeing Ranran politely decline the tea brought by the eunuch, he just smiled slightly. “It seems Su Yishui hasn’t told you yet, that you are in fact a spirit fruit from the Rebirth Tree.”

Ranran was stunned. She had never thought that she, like Master Mu Qingge, had fallen from an Immortal Tree.

The fruit of the Rebirth Tree was a sign of immortal cultivation. Mu Qingge was from a generation of magnificent demonic cultivators, but what about her? Who was she?

She thought of Mu Ranwu, who had perished with Mu Qingge back then, and remembered her mother saying that when she was born, there was a “Ran” character in the palm of her hand. Suddenly, she made a connection.

Could it be that she was the reincarnation of Mu Ranwu, who had caused the death of Master Mu Qingge? If so, had she met this Emperor in her previous life?

For some reason, Ranran didn’t want to know about her past life.

She was content in this life. She had loving parents, a Shifu who dotes on her, and good senior siblings. If she hadn’t come to the Capital, she would have no regrets in this life.

She had no wish to be associated with Mu Qingge at all. Otherwise, she would owe her a life from her past life. And in this life, she would have to acknowledge a malicious elder sister and repay the debts from before……

Seeing Ranran remain silent, Su Yu was now certain that Su Yishui had probably never told her about her origins.

He smiled knowingly. “Fate is unpredictable and I did not expect this either. *Flowers are not flowers, mist is not mist. Things are fleeting. Do you want to know who you are?”
*花非花雾非雾 比喻所咏之物的短暂易逝，难持长久

Ranran shook her head, looking at Su Yu. “Since it’s a reincarnation, it means starting anew after falling from the tree. Who I was before is no longer important. I’ve been Xue Ranran all this while, and that’s good enough. Why bother knowing who I was in my past life?”

Su Yu didn’t expect her to be so straightforward and cut off what he intended to say.

But this was always her true self, always able to take things up and let go, impossible to grasp like the wind.

Compared to the woman in the West Palace who hid behind Mu Qingge’s name but engaged in shameful acts, and seemed so ridiculous.

Thinking of how that woman living in the West Palace, had spent so much effort pretending to be Mu Qingge, Su Yu’s lips curled with a cold smile.

He had actually thought that Mu Qingge had come back to find him. Unfortunately, when they first met, that woman had exposed herself accidentally.

Su Yu couldn’t tell if he had felt relieved or was extremely disappointed.

But just now, after eating that bowl of porridge and recalling the taste from the past, he felt that Mu Qingge being alive but forgetting everything wasn’t bad either.

Although Ranran wanted to end this topic, however in the imperial palace, he was the one who directed the conversation.

Since she didn’t want to face the truth for the time being, he wouldn’t force her. He just said mildly, “The people who intruded and stunned the guards at the Lake of Enquity last night, was it you and Consort Jing?”

Ranran knew that it must have been her and Zhou Feihua who had left some clues, which led the Emperor here.

At this moment, he probably didn’t know that her Shifu’s body was in the clothing box inside the room. But since Zhou Feihua and her had been exposed, if the Emperor searched Consort Jing’s palace, her master’s body would soon be discovered.

Su Yu would definitely show no mercy to her Shifu…

It was already day time. She could only delay and see if she could hold out until noon. When Shifu controlled the little dragon to ascend, chaos would surely ensue in the palace, and they would have a chance to escape.

Thinking about this, she nodded and directly asked Su Yu, “May I ask Your Majesty, why do you want to raise a dragon in the palace?”

Su Yu was not surprised that she had discovered the secret in the Lake of Enquiry. He had someone serve another bowl of porridge, eating while looking at her, and recounted past events, “Back then, after the battle of Fan Yao, I asked Mu Qingge if I could cultivate immortality with her. But she looked at my face and said, ‘You cannot have both the fish and the bear’s paw; one cannot possess immense power and supreme spiritual power at the same time, or else it will incur the jealousy of the heavens. Being able to control the world and benefit the people is also a form of cultivation, but this cultivation is bitter. For a person, several decades would be enough. If one day I can let go of power, it will not be too late to seek her out again to cultivate the path of Dao.'”

Ranran nodded as she listened, “Although Elder Mu has become somewhat erratic now, she was not wrong. Being an Emperor is indeed exhausting…”

Su Yu smiled and pointed to his own hair, “I’m two years younger than your master, but now my hair is mostly gray, and my body is gradually deteriorating. The ‘several decades of power’ she mentioned are actually only about twenty years for me. This ‘little Yu’ in your eyes can now be your father. Such immense power is really not as tempting as eternal life.”

Ranran listened to his words and shook her head, “But isn’t your so-called method of eternal life too much of a gamble? Have you not considered the consequences if it fails, and the people of the entire Capital end up in the dragon’s belly?”

Su Yu smiled faintly, “What I have wanted to do has never failed. If it weren’t for Su Yishui’s interference, I would have mastered the Seven Evil Transformation Spell by now. As long as I merge with that dragon and get rid of my ailments, I can benefit the people for generations…”

Ranran felt something was amiss with his words, “Your Majesty, in the twenty years of ruling Da Qi, you have indeed been a good emperor. But have you ever thought about how many talented individuals you have harmed by raising that dragon? That dragon should have been a divine creature swimming freely in the sea, but you have raised it to become fierce and brutal, confined to a small deep pool, feeding on humans. Are you really sure that after merging with such a dragon, you will still be the benevolent king who cares for the world? Do the people of the world… need someone like you for generations?”

This question was quite audacious, and Old Feng sternly said from the side, “How bold, how dare you speak to His Majesty like this!”

However, Su Yu laughed out loud, “You haven’t changed at all. Even though your appearance has changed slightly, you still won’t say anything against your conscience. But it’s not your fault. You’ve forgotten everything from the past, now you’re just an eighteen-year-old girl. Those who achieve great things should not be bound by trivial matters. In the battle of Fan Yao back then, you helped me quell the rebellion of Prince Ping, and how many people died? If one only cares about the lives and deaths of a few, without considering the long-term consequences, then the person sitting on the Throne now would be the Demon’s Son from the Netherworld, and the people of the entire world would be suffering!”

Ranran didn’t understand what he meant and didn’t have time to think about his words. She was now only worried about her master in the box and Zhou Feihua who collapsed. She needed to delay as much as possible, so she asked softly again, “Was it Your Majesty who gave Elder Mu the Immortal-Devouring Bug?”

If she guessed correctly, it was the Yin-Yang Eye Old Feng who cultivated the demonic insects.

Su Yu seemed no longer inclined to hide the truth and nodded readily, “It was me, but I didn’t expect you to also be at Tianmai Mountain at that time. If I had known, I would never have given it to her. Fortunately, you’re alright. Otherwise… I would never spare her.”

As a ruler, other than being able to ignore lives of individuals, it seems there is also a strange skill of shifting blame onto others.

In just a few words, the blame for nearly killing Ranran on Tianmai Mountain fell entirely on Mu Qingge.

But from his words, it seemed that he had treated Ranran well in her past life.

It would seem that Elder Mu had also enjoyed the Emperor’s favor before, and that her master had warned her to be careful of Su Yu.

Ranran decided she should still be more cautious around this emperor. She asked uncomprehendingly, “If Your Majesty only seeks eternal life, why help Mu Qingge with such matters? Your Majesty must know that the spiritual veins left by Dun tian’s great abilities at Tianmai Mountain have been ruined and can no longer be used.”

Su Yu looked coolly at Ranran, “For those who can become immortals, leaving the human realm is beyond my control. But Tianmai Mountain is still within the human realm. If someone with ulterior motives managed to pass the trial and gain spiritual power from the marrow pool that should not have existed, it will be a disaster for living beings. The great Dun tian decided to have no further attachments to the human realm, so why leave behind something that tests and tempts human nature?”

Ranran finally understood this time.

She had thought that Su Yu gave Mu Qingge the Immortal-Devouring Bugs to help her improve her cultivation, but perhaps the polluted end of Tianmai Mountain’s spiritual veins was what Su Yu truly wanted.

If the vermilion bird had not shown its power, these out of control insects would have broken through Tianmai Mountain and defeated all the cultivators of the three major sects at the foot of the mountain in one fell swoop…

The land of Da Qi does not need powerful immortal cultivators like Wei Jiu and Su Yishui. By destroying those sacred places where cultivators can raise their spiritual powers and form cores, he could prevent promising cultivators from emerging again. This is the true goal of Su Yu.

At this moment, Ranran finally understood what her master warned her to be cautious of. These people in high positions, with their iron will and steel nerves that decided life and death like gods, are truly chilling.

Ranran sighed and then stood up to look at the sun in the courtyard. It was almost noon, and her master should be taking action soon.

As the sun’s corona moved to the noon position, Ranran squinted at the dazzling sunlight slanting down and then turned to Su Yu with a fierce gaze, “Dog emperor, true strength cannot be suppressed and crushed so easily!”

As her words fell, there was a loud explosion from the direction of Lake of Enquiry, and a dragon emitting a faint golden halo burst out from under the lake. The chains entwined around it made tearing sounds due to the immense force pulling them.

Excitedly clapping her hands, Ranran righteous speech just now perfectly captured the moment, undoubtedly shocking that bad emperor!

Next would be Shifu’s magnificent display of power, striking a resounding blow to this dog emperor’s face!

In the instant when the giant dragon soared into the air, it seemed to collide with an invisible large net covering the vast sky. The entire sky flashed with a faint golden net, and after the dragon collided with the net, it seemed to be in immense pain, emitting a thunderous dragon roar before crashing heavily back into the lake.

All these happened in a blink of an eye from the time Ranran angrily cursed with “dog emperor”. The tremors of the failed attempt had not yet subsided and now her situation became extremely difficult.

She was truly infuriated by Su Yu just now, so much so that she spoke without thinking, scolding words like “dog emperor.”

Who would have known that Shifu’s escape was so short-lived? Like a carp that had just been slapped back into the water? She could only hope that Shifu would live up to expectations and leap out of the water again; otherwise, both Zhou Feihua and her fate seemed very bleak.

At this moment, Su Yu stood up and quietly asked, “Are you waiting for Su Yishui to emerge from the water? There’s no need to wait any longer. He had just expended too much spirit power and should now be overwhelmed by the dragon’s demonic power. He would be trapped forever inside the dragon’s body.”

Upon hearing this, Ranran turned quickly to look at Su Yu.

How did he know that Shifu had been using the Beast Taming Art inside the dragon’s body? Su Yu couldn’t have known what was happening underwater after Shifu jumped into the lake!

Su Yu smiled and said, “You must be curious about who told me, right?”

As he spoke, he walked to the window and casually flicked the wind chimes he had just given to Zhou Feihua, smiling, “If it weren’t for you and Consort Jing, I really might not have figured out Su Yishui’s plans!”

When Ranran looked closely, she finally saw the intricate patterns on the wrapping paper of the wind chimes… it was a voice transmission talisman!

Ranran couldn’t help but stare at Consort, who couldn’t get up after being bitten, but still had disbelief in her wide eyes as she laid on the ground.

So Su Yu had been listening to everything that had happened in this room through the voice transmission talisman on the wind chimes, yet he remained composed, and even pretended to recognize Ranran through a bowl of porridge.

But why didn’t he stop them from sneaking into the Lake of Enquiry? Why did he allow Ranran to retrieve Su Yishui’s physical body so smoothly?

At this time, the lake’s surface was broken by wave after wave. The giant dragon was tumbling painfully underwater, unable to leap out of the water again due to the chains that restrained it.

Listening to the distant sound of the lake water churning as if listening to soothing music, Su Yu was relaxed and pleased, “Previously, I indeed harbored thoughts of merging with the dragon. But this dragon is uncontrollable, and its demonic nature is becoming stronger… Seeing the water demon brought in from Wangxiang Pass, I can’t imagine merging with it and becoming half-demon and half-ghost with scales all over. So, after Tianmai Mountain, when I heard that Su Yishui had merged with the white tiger, I had a new idea…”

Hearing this, Ranran’s blood ran cold. She already vaguely guessed Su Yu’s plans. But how did this emperor know about Su Yishui merging with the white tiger, something only Xishan disciples knew? Why would this emperor be aware?

Just then, Old Feng already had his people open the clothing box containing Su Yishui. Su Yu walked to the box and carefully examined Su Yishui’s unconscious form, saying with satisfaction, “Look, he’s older than me, yet he still looks like an eighteen-year-old youth. Youthful permanence, which ordinary people desire, is so easily attainable for him…”

Ranran wanted to rush forward and snatch her master’s body but was restrained by several extraordinary individuals who surrounded her.

She exclaimed, “Are you… trying to *steal his body?”
夺舍 : 借尸还魂

Su Yu wants longevity but does not want to become half-demon and half-ghost. Could it be that his true goal is……Shifu’s body?

Su Yu laughed heartily, “Steal his body? There needs to be someone in there first! Since he has already vacated his position, how can I be stealing?”

Since Tianmai Mountain, Su Yu had been meticulously planning. When Su Yishui set off for the Capital, all the plans began to unfold.

Including the unusually continuous heavy rain in the Capital recently and the sudden appearance of a dragon shadow in the river, were all intentionally arranged by Su Yu to get Su Yishui’s notice.

He knew Su Yishui too well, a natural genius with astute mind, and also… overly confident.

To protect Mu Qingge, the mother of this dragon egg had been killed by the Jiuyun’s Dragon-Slaying arrow during the Battle of Fanyao, and had given birth to this dragon egg before dying.

Mu Qingge, tearfully promised the mother dragon, to hatch its child and send it back to the Eastern Sea Dragon Island. Unfortunately, Mu Qingge didn’t fulfill her promise and was besieged by the three major sects.

Since Su Yishui had always felt indebted to Mu Qingge, he would definitely fulfill Mu Qingge’s promise and find a way to rescue this dragon trapped in the palace.

Even if Su Yishui did not want to fulfill the promise, he would still absolutely not allow him to merge with the dragon…

Now, everything was proceeding according to his plan. Su Yishui’s soul was trapped inside the dragon, while this youthful and healthy body was unharmed and intact in his hands.

Su Yu’s smile deepened, looking somewhat greedily at the motionless Su Yishui—this healthy body without a soul but with his bloodline, was a heaven-sent opportunity and a reward from heaven!

Ranran gritted her teeth and said, “Are you willing to give up the throne for longevity?” How could Su Yu continue to be emperor with Su Yishui’s face?

Su Yu obviously had already thought about it. He said softly, “When I was young, I looked a lot like Su Yishui. At that time, you often stared at my face dreamily… So if I were to say that I took a cultivator’s refined elixir, which not only cured my ailments but also rejuvenated my youth, it would all be quite natural. I haven’t shown my face in front of the courtiers for a long time. Do you think when they kneel in the court and look at the dragon throne, they will really notice that my appearance has changed?”

His meaning was clear; as long as he claimed to have taken the elixir of immortality and regained his youth, gradually revealing his new appearance a little at a time, people would forget his original face and remember his current appearance.

Just then, Zhou Feihua, who couldn’t move before, finally regained the ability to speak. She stared wide-eyed and said, “Your Majesty! How could you have become like this? Please reconsider! You know he is…… how can you use this evil creature’s body?”

Su Yu looked at his beloved consort with a smile, his tone cold, “Beloved consort, you’ve also changed to the point where I can’t recognize you. You know I need that dragon to extend my life, yet you still want to help others release that dragon. It seems that you’re not as loyal to me as you claim to be……”

Previous
Next

封印灵泉 Sealing the Spirit Spring

or EVERYONE WANTS SU YISHUI

Zhou Feihua, upon hearing these words, urgently pleaded, “Your Majesty!”

However, Su Yu no longer wanted to hear her speak.

Lao Feng had already ordered someone to move Su Yishui’s body away. He turned and said, “Your Majesty, please prepare quickly. Now that Su Yishui has just depleted his vital energy and his spiritual force is turbulent, it’s the best time for you to switch positions!”

Su Yu didn’t want to delay either. This worn-out and sickly body was already too burdensome for him. Of course, he hoped to get a healthy body as soon as possible. So he ordered people to keep Ranran and Consort Jing detained in the palace, then he left.

At this moment, Consort Jing’s acupoints were released, but like Ranran, she was also tied up. It seemed that they were left for the Emperor to deal with after he has exchanged a new healthy body.

Although Zhou Feihua’s acupoints were released, her expression was still blank. She was still immersed in the truth that Su Yu had just revealed.

In her impression, the Emperor had always been a warm and generous person.

But in recent years, he had been tortured by illness, making his temperament somewhat strange, and he didn’t like to see people much. However, she never imagined that, in order to regain his health, he was secretly raising an evil dragon and scheming meticulously to exchange bodies with another…

How was this behavior different from becoming demonic?

When Zhou Feihua finally came back to her senses, she found Ranran in a very strange posture beside her, lying on the ground. Although she was tied up and couldn’t move easily, she pressed her ear tightly against the ground.

Zhou Feihua whispered, “What are you doing?”

Ranran looked up at her and said, “If chaos breaks out later, please find a chance to go to Su Yu’s study and find a book for me. This book concerns the safety of the world. Please do me this favor…”

Just as Zhou Feihua was about to speak, there was suddenly another earth-shattering noise from the direction of the Lake of Enquiry not far away. However, this time, it wasn’t the giant dragon leaping out, but a muffled sound like an earthquake.

Ranran’s eyes widened, and just as the sound was about to reach them, she suddenly shouted to Zhou Feihua in a low voice, “Quickly, move aside!”

In the next instant, the entire palace trembled again, and the bluestone floor cracked and surged.

In the moment the floor cracked, Ranran’s toes lightly touched the ground, and inexplicably, her spiritual energy had suddenly recovered, breaking free from the ropes binding her. At the same time, she pulled Zhou Feihua up and together they quickly got out of the collapsing palace.

After placing Zhou Feihua in a safe area, Ranran took out a knife she had taken from a guard earlier, cut the ropes binding Zhou Feihua. She also swiftly subdued several approaching guards.

They then went on separate ways. Zhou Feihua headed towards the imperial study, while Ranran silently recited the wind-riding technique and quickly headed towards Su Yu’s sleeping quarters.

Just now when the floor cracked, she immediately felt her body becoming much lighter, and the empty Dantian that had been empty since entering the palace was filled with spiritual energy again.

It seemed that after Shifu’s attempt to break to the skies with the dragon failed, he proceeded according to their underwater discussion, which was their second plan.

Before her night exploration of the lake, Ranran had circled the entire palace, roughly mapping out the strength of the spiritual energy constraints and kept the wax-sealed map on her body.

Her original plan was to send it out of the palace, to inform Second Uncle Master and the others see if they could dig a tunnel from outside the palace, and destroy the foundation of the palace.

Although this project was somewhat vast, with the use of talismans to drive the straw-men to hit the correct spots, it could be completed in a few nights.

As long as the foundation is destroyed, Second Uncle Master and the others will be able to come in to help.

But after seeing Shifu had possessed the dragon underwater, Ranran changed her plan.

If Shifu couldn’t break to the sky with the yang energy of Duanwu Day, why not try to go underground and completely destroy the Trigram Formation that restricted spiritual energy within the palace?

Now it seemed that this method had indeed worked. After Su Yishui’s failure to rise with the dragon, he tried to escape underground from the soft mud at the bottom of the Lake of Enquiry.

Although using a dragon as a *loach somewhat injured the dignity of the small dragon, at this critical junction, there was no room for too many considerations. Only by breaking the suppression could they escape.
*loaches like to dig and burrow

However, their original plan did not include handing Shifu’s body over to Su Yu. So after Ranran was freed from the spiritual suppression, she had no time for Zhou Feihua, she could only head quickly in the direction Su Yu had left.

When she arrived at the door of Su Yu’s palace, the guards there didn’t even see her figure clearly, only thought a white light flashed past them, and Ranran had already jumped into the palace. Inside the palace, a ritual altar had already been set up.

Su Yishui and Su Yu were lying in the black and white areas of a Tai Chi Yin Yang fish laid on the ground. Their wrists were entwined with a connected red string.

And Lao Feng was sitting at the array’s center chanting, not stopping even as the surrounding palace around him cracked.

Ranran noticed that there was an oil lamp above the heads of both Shifu and Su Yu. At this moment, the lamp above Su Yishui’s head seemed to be about to go out completely, with the flame flickering weakly.

Ranran took out her mechanism stick, and with a single leap, she pushed Lao Feng off the altar. At the same time, she drew a dagger and cut the red string between the two.

Her actions were quick, but Lao Feng suddenly opened his eyes and burst into laughter, “You’re too late, little girl!”

Just as she cut the red string, the lamp above Su Yishui’s head had gone out completely.

And as the light went out, Su Yishui suddenly opened his eyes.

Ranran anxiously went over to pull him up, “Shifu, how do you feel?”

Su Yishui slowly turned his head to look at her, then turned to look at Su Yu lying beside him, and a smile slowly spread across his lips…

He suddenly reached out and grasped Ranran’s wrist in lightning speed, intending to strike her spiritual acupoint.

Once that acupoint was struck, it would be difficult to call up even surging spiritual power.

Ranran usually practiced sparring with Shifu. Among the three disciples of Xishan, only she had been taught personally by Su Yishui, so when Su Yishui made his move, Ranran naturally raised her hand to block and counter.

But this Shifu left no room for maneuver, his moves were fierce. Ranran knew this was bad and quickly retreated, jumping out of the Yin Yang fish. She felt a chill on her back, looking at this man, handsome as ever, who was smiling at her, “You… are not my Shifu!”

The man slowly stood up, looking at his body and hands with exhilaration, “Although this is not my body, it has retained the original owner’s divine techniques. I am very satisfied…”

As he spoke, he made a gesture and cast a binding spell, swiftly attacking Ranran. Although Su Yu did not learn cultivation, this body he just acquired was a prodigy, and the techniques had become ingrained in its muscle memory.

With Su Yu just thinking it, he could unleash immense power!

Ranran tensed up, her fears had become reality as Su Yu had indeed taken over her master’s body!

Fortunately, her daily sparring with her master had also become ingrained in her muscle memory. She naturally evaded her master’s binding spell and darted aside.

Right then, a dragon’s roar sounded from outside the window. After the palace’s foundations were destroyed, the chains binding the dragon lost their effect, allowing the small dragon to soar into the sky and vanish into the clouds.

It flew extremely fast, disappearing into the sky without a trace, presumably heading back to its homeland, Dragon Island.

Ranran knew that this dragon had been raised cruelly and should not stay in the Capital once unbound.

Shifu must be sending the dragon back to fulfill the promise by Mu Qingge to her deceased friend. However, when he intended to return later, his body had already been taken over, and he might be trapped forever in the dragon’s body!

“You don’t need to be afraid. I won’t hurt you, and I could even treat you better than your master.” Su Yu smiled at Ranran and said, “Ranran, do you know? In your past life, you were actually…”

Before he could finish, his expression suddenly changed, and he reached for his neck.

There seemed to be something burning on his neck, and when Su Yu pulled it off, he realized it was a nearly cracked talisman jade.

This thing was so hot that it couldn’t be held. Su Yu withdrew his hand from holding it, flinging it far away.

Ranran inwardly cried out in alarm, trying to catch it but was too late.

The jade bottle shattered with a loud crack, and a large amount of water spread out. It quickly flowed beneath Su Yu’s feet, and it seemed like countless resentful spirits were floating in the water, emitting eerie laughter, “We’re free! Finally out!”

The spirit spring had been imprisoned for a long time. When Su Yishui’s body changed hands, the power binding the Spring as also relaxed. Combined with the destruction of the palace’s foundation, its power awakened. When Su Yu broke the bottle just now, it was finally released.

The Spirit spring had been waiting for this opportunity for a long time. The large volume of water surged up Su Yishui’s body like demon claws, swiftly enveloping him, trying to completely control him, while emitting strange laughter, “Still the body of the Demon’s Son suits me best… No, why has the soul in this body changed? Well, that’s fine! As long as they’re greedy, I love them all!”

Clearly, the *mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the bird behind.
*螳螂捕蝉黄雀在后 idiom : a situation where someone is preoccupied with dealing with an immediate threat or challenge but is unaware of a greater danger lurking behind

Su Yu had thought he had everything under control, but he had never expected that the Netherworld Spirit Spring was hanging around Su Yishui’s neck. Now, the Spirit spring was taking over and about to become the new owner of this body!

While the Spirit spring chuckled, it swiftly took control of Su Yishui’s body, and his eyes began to turn bloodshot!

Su Yu felt like his head was about to explode. Unable to bear the pain, he held his head and let out a painful scream. His voice also became increasingly eerie, piercing the eardrums.

At this very moment, it seemed like all the bad things were happening at once. However, Ranran quickly calmed down, reaching for a golden talisman she was holding.

She didn’t know if this talisman could completely suppress the Spirit Spring possession, but she had to risk it.

If the Spirit spring took control of Su Yu, it would control the entire world, and who knew what kind of atrocities it would commit.

Just then, someone flashed to her side. Ranran looked and was surprised to see Zhou Feihua who had returned!

She looked at Su Yishui with red eyes, her body trembling slightly, “What’s going on? Has the Demon’s Son appeared?”

Obviously, Zhou Feihua had also seen Su Yishui with red eyes before, but what did she mean by “Demon’s Son”?

Ranran didn’t have time to ask further questions. She took out two golden talismans, handing one to Zhou Feihua, “Stick this on his forehead. Otherwise, the Spirit spring will bewitch him, and who knows what he might do!”

Although these two women had not known each other for long, their tacit understanding was exceptionally aligned. After exchanging glances, they split up and attacked Su Yu from both sides.

The Su Yishui possessed by the Spirit spring, now has a surge in spiritual power, making him even harder to handle. Although Zhou Feihua’s swordsmanship was superb, she couldn’t withstand the torrential spiritual power and was quickly thrown back, crashing into a pillar in the hall.

On Ranran’s side, she was also struggling to get close to him but never got the chance.

Just then, he chuckled weirdly and attacked towards Ranran with a wave of his hand.

Actually Ranran could have managed to narrowly avoid it.

Su Yu had completely lost his sanity now, showing no mercy in his attacks, hitting out with soul-shattering strikes.

However, Ranran bit her lip and suddenly made a bold decision. When Su Yu came on with his fierce wave of attacks, Ranran didn’t dodge but instead took the hit on her back. As she coughed out blood, she used the momentum to turn around and stick the golden talisman on his forehead.

There was no other way. She had to endure this blow to get close to him. Ranran had made a split decision, putting her life on the line for this crucial opportunity.

However, this time the golden talisman wasn’t as effective. Although Su Yu paused for a moment, he then shook it off with a burst of force and attacked Ranran again.

But at that moment, a dragon’s roar suddenly erupted in the sky. The palace’s roof was violently smashed. The small dragon had returned, roaring, sweeping towards Su Yu, carrying him into the air, then left again with another roar.

Enduring the intense pain, Ranran took a deep breath, and whistled towards the sky, summoning Vermilion bird. As *Zhu que spread its huge wings and regained its full form, she also jumped onto its back and hurriedly chased after the direction where the dragon had gone.
Vermilion : Zhu bird : que

But just now, she was struck by unrestrained spirit power, even though Ranran had been wearing soft silver armor, it couldn’t stop it. Now, the soft silver armor inside her clothes shattered completely, and her body felt cold.

Ranran knew that this was the manifestation of a severe internal injury caused by spirit power. The vitality field in her Dantian was like a leaking water tank, rapidly disappearing.

She didn’t know how long she could hold on.

The dragon flew very fast, but the Vermilion Bird who have regained its physical form also flew like an arrow, quickly reaching the dragon’s side.

Su Yu who was possessed by the Spirit Spring, had been wrestling non-stop with the dragon, and they finally fell together. Although they have not reached the East Sea, they were now on the sea surface near the coast.

As they fell, Ranran also dived down with the Vermilion Bird.

As Ranran lay on the Vermilion Bird’s head, she whispered in excruciating pain, “Little Zhu Zhu, help me, your blood can purify demonic creatures, can you… let me have some?”

The Vermilion Bird maneuvered in the sky, loudly screeching. Ranran tentatively bit its back with her mouth and the Vermilion Bird didn’t seem to react, which Ranran took as its tacit consent.

So she bit hard, causing the Vermilion Bird to cry out in pain, but it didn’t shake Ranran off its back.

While Ranran took a mouthful of the Vermilion Bird’s spiritual blood, it flew to the side of the small dragon. Ranran took the opportunity to jump down. She caught Su Yu, who was entangled with the dragon, grabbed his neck, tilted his head, and poured the Vermilion Bird’s spiritual blood from her mouth into his.

The Vermilion Bird itself was a holy creature that repelled evil. Even the Immortal-Devouring Bugs from the Demonic Realm didn’t dare approach it.

Now that the Vermilion Bird’s spiritual blood had been fed to Su Yu, Ranran fell off, completely spent. If not for the dragon’s claw catching her in time, she would have almost fallen into the sea.

Su Yu urgently tried to vomit out the Vermilion Bird’s spiritual blood, but it was too late. The Spirit Spring couldn’t bear it, emitting a piercing scream, then it oozed out of his pores and eyes like sweat mixed with blood, got swallowed into the mouth of the small dragon…

Ranran wanted to hold on, but her internal injuries were too severe, and she couldn’t hold on any longer. Her vision darkened, and she fell unconscious.

When she woke up again, she found herself lying in a damp cave, with a pile of dry grass underneath…

Ranran’s chest still hurt greatly. She looked around with the light from the nearby campfire, and saw the man meditating by the fire with disheveled long hair and bare arms…

Looking at Su Yishui’s profile, Ranran felt a start as she remembered that her master’s body had been taken over by Su Yu!

She began to feel around her body, trying to find if she still had any gold talisman. But as she felt around, she realized that she was wearing… her Shifu’s undershirt!

She picked the fabric to make this undershirt at a tailor’s down the mountain, so she could recognize it at a glance. Looking over, she saw her own clothes propped up with sticks, drying by the fire…

“You dog emperor! Who allowed you to take off my clothes!” Ranran tried to get up but found that her back was fastened to a board, making it difficult for her to move.

At this moment, the man who was meditating slowly opened his eyes. Ranran noticed a faint redness in his eyes and her heart skipped a beat.

Oh no! The Spirit Spring hasn’t dispersed yet?

The man walked over, held Ranran down when she was about to move, and said coldly, “Move again, and your bones will be broken into pieces! You’ll probably be bedridden for life.”

This man’s stern expression didn’t resemble Su Yu’s smiling face at all; instead, he looked more like her Shifu with his cold demeanor.

Ranran remained still, but tears welled up in her eyes. “Su Yu, if you want longevity, I can give you my body. Please return my Shifu’s body back to him!”

Hearing this, the man chuckled coldly at the words, “How would you give it?”

Ranran actually didn’t hold much hope, since Su Yu was unlikely to want to become a woman. Her body probably held no allure for him…

But at that moment, the man leaned down, his long hair falling on the side of her face, his eyes with a faint blood-red hue fixed firmly on her as he said: “Are you even aware of the consequences of saying things like offering your body to a man harboring evil designs on you?”

Ranran felt that the despicable emperor had rebuked her when she hadn’t even scolded him for coveting her master’s body yet!

However… from the way he glared at her…she couldn’t help but feel that he looked more like her Shifu?

Right now, the man seemed to be trying hard to suppress the anger in his heart and the redness in his eyes. So he picked up the grilled fish from the fire and said, “You were clamoring for fresh sea fish some days ago, right? Today, your wish is granted, but unfortunately, there are no sour fruits to go with the fish. You’ll have to make do.”

Ranran held her breath as she listened… the words about craving sea fish were something she had told her third senior sister before arriving in the Capital. Her Shifu was beside them at the time and naturally heard it.

That despicable emperor wouldn’t possibly know about what she said… Does this mean her Shifu has returned?

She grabbed his arm and warily asked, “What did we do at the waterfall in the Western Mountain?

He lowered his head again, “Which are you asking about? Drinking wine? Listening to the zither, or you saving me by giving me mouth-to-mouth?”

Alright… he described it perfectly, but why are his words and expression so frivolous? He didn’t look one bit like her composed Shifu..

As he asked that question, his face got closer and closer to Ranran’s, as if he was about to give mouth-to-mouth to save his little disciple who didn’t know how to breathe…

Ranran was fixed to the board and couldn’t move even if she wanted to. Seeing him getting closer, she could only cry loudly, “Shifu! You scared me to death! You’re still teasing people like this! Did you know… I thought you could never come back!”

Saying this, Ranran’s eyes reddened with tears.

But Su Yishui didn’t think he did anything inappropriate. He raised an eyebrow and said coldly, “So I can’t even get a little closer? But you can voluntarily kiss Su Yu?”

“What kiss? I clearly did it to force out the Spirit Spring, by force feeding… him the Vermilion Bird’s blood… No, wait, but that mouth is also your mouth. How can you say I voluntarily kissed Su Yu?”

Under the gaze of Shifu’s handsome yet enigmatic eyes, Ranran almost couldn’t speak just now. It was only at the last moment that she remembered she had no other choice.

That was to expel the demonic influence! And she kissed her Shifu’s mouth…

Hmm, thinking back now, Ranran realized that she should have felt a little embarrassed about it and should have sincerely apologized to her Shifu. After all, she had been rather frivolous with Shifu.

But Su Yishui lowered his head and stopped the rest of what she intended to say with a kiss.

This kiss carried a tinge of urgency, as if confirming that a fragile treasure had returned to his embrace.

Ranran couldn’t move due to her injuries, so she could only let her Shifu kiss her almost to the point of suffocating…

When their lips finally parted, Ranran looked into his eyes, and it seemed that the redness had dissipated somewhat.

“Shifu… you’re not keeping your word…”

Shifu clearly said that they should both adhere to their master-disciple relationship in future, and neither should cross the line! So why is he kissing her to no end now?

Well, even though she had been “frivolous” with Shifu first, she had a legitimate reason. But what was Shifu’s reason for this behavior?

It turns out that Su Yishui did have a legitimate reason.

At that time, the mouthful of Vermilion Bird’s blood that Ranran fed him was quite effective; it immediately suppressed the demonic nature of Spirit Spring.

As Su Yu’s soul had just attached itself, and he had previously survived by absorbing the dragon’s vitality, he naturally carried some demonic nature.

His possession had just completed, and his foundation wasn’t stable yet. The Vermilion Bird’s blood first considered Su Yu’s soul as a demonic entity and expelled it. Then the Spirit Spring was absorbed into the dragon’s mouth, merging with Su Yishui’s soul.

Su Yishui used the power of the Spirit Spring, took this opportunity to transfer from the dragon’s body back into his own body.

However, Su Yishui couldn’t force the Spirit Spring out of his body yet. Because the talisman jade bottle was destroyed, if he forced out the Spirit Spring, it would attach to someone else randomly, leading to another bloody and chaotic situation.

Su Yishui could only use his own body as a temporary container to seal the Spirit Spring for now.

As much as I enjoy this story, I still question why Su Yu was able to use Su Yishui’s abilities.

I get that the physical body is the same, so I suppose the spiritual energy stored within is the same.
So Su Yu took over the ‘hardware’ of Su Yishui, able to use the system which has all the specs.

But a human body is not just a device? If the brain is the same so it retained the same knowledge about spells and techniques? What about other stored memories? Clearly that was not with the ‘bundle offer’ here.

I can accept ‘muscle memory’ for physical fighting.
That is the objective of repetitive training. So that one can take action without thought, to survive in that decisive split second.
The writer seems to explain this as an attribute that is special only to Su Yishui because he is a prodigy. lol So for him, spells and techniques are hard-coded in his body and also retained with the soul?

Now a deeper question.

What then is the soul?
What defines a person? The essence, personality, memories?

Su yu still retained his own set of ‘Su yu’ defining personality and memories when he took over.
Su Yishui while he possesses the dragon, obviously still retained everything he knows. He didn’t forget how to use his spells.

Xue Ranran, she was Mu Qingge, but without memories of her past life.
She still had the same kind of values on how she looks at life.
She still handled matters the same way she would have in her past life.
The difference was she started over with an ‘unfinished’ body since she was only on the tree for three short years, but the essence of who she was, seems intact. I suppose if she had stayed on the tree for the full 20 years, maybe she could have reincarnated with all her memories intact like Mu Ranwu has, instead of the broken fragments she has now. Maybe its like her memory drive was corrupted before she finished restoring lol

So now, does that make her the same person?

When I first read this chapter, I was wondering how did Su Yishui see Ranran taking the hit since he was supposed to be with the dragon at the time.

I suppose when the dragon broke free and flew away, Su Yishui might have needed to fight its impulse to escape. He only just managed to bring it back under his control, to return to the palace because he could never leave Ranran there by herself.

So that was how he came back just in time to see her being struck by Su Yu and became violent with rage.

SIDE NOTE
There is so much CG divine creatures in this drama, I really hope they can execute it well.

Previous
Next

一段友谊 A TIME OF FRIENDSHIP

However, in doing so, his temperament inevitably fell under the influence of the Spirit Spring. It was like being in the same cage as a fierce tiger, always vigilant, either coexisting with the tiger or being devoured by it.

The depth of redness in his eyes was an indication of the strength of the demonic nature. When Su Yishui kissed her just now, his eyes were red, showing that the demonic nature had become stronger and somewhat uncontrollable.

When Ranran learned about all this, she could no longer blame her Shifu’s capriciousness. Not only was the Spirit Spring extremely evil, but it was also quite a lecher, causing her Shifu to always lose control and do things he couldn’t restrain from!

Their bond between Shifu and her, as master and disciple was unassailable, how could it break apart because of a wicked little Spirit Spring?

Alright, when Shifu kissed her so fiercely just now, Ranran was actually quite shaken inside, feeling that the bond between master and disciple was like water flowing away, and it would be difficult to return to its original state…

But Su Yishui knew clearly in his heart, that his loss of control just now was because he saw this darn girl deliberately risk her life to take a blow to paste the gold talisman.

Now whenever he recalled that scene, he couldn’t control the impulse inside him to destroy the entire world… Thinking of this, his eyes began to turn red again, and at the same time, his hand uncontrollably reached out to grab her chin. But he used too much force, causing Ranran to move, which in turn pulled on her back, making her big eyes surge with wells of tears: “Shifu, it hurts…”

With this cry, the redness in Su Yishui’s eyes finally dissipated, and he carefully placed her back down, while quickly using his spiritual energy to help alleviate her pain.

Earlier, Su Yu had showed no mercy with that palm when the Spirit Spring went out of control. If it were someone else, they would probably have died on the spot. Fortunately, Ranran had soaked in the Marrow-cleansing pool before, which had increased her spiritual power to quite an extent. Moreover, after that, she had taken a mouthful of Vermilion Bird’s blood, which barely maintained her soul from dispersing, enduring until Su Yishui’s soul returned to his body and he promptly treated her.

But her spine had been shattered, requiring a blend of spiritual energy and quiet recovery. Her daily life and meals depended entirely on Su Yishui’s care.

Ranran didn’t have much confidence in her Shifu who has become demonic. The Spirit Spring’s demonic nature was very strong, enough to change a person’s temperament. And her Shifu using his body as a talisman bottle was already a major variable.

However, she discovered that her master had some know-how; it seemed like he had long learned how to coexist with the Spirit Spring. Although his personality had become somewhat gloomy and irritable, whether it was roasting fish for her or letting her drink water, he took care of her very meticulously.

In a short time, Ranran also figured out how to handle him; no matter how red Shifu’s eyes got, just quickly pretend to cry and be in pain. Every time she did this, the redness in his eyes would diminish quite a bit.

As for their current location, it was a deserted island in the sea. They had fought fiercely before, and ended up falling onto this small island.

Ranran had threw up blood due to her internal injuries, so her clothes got dirty which was why Shifu had taken them off and washed them in the sea before drying them by fire. Ranran tried her best not to think about the details of how he changed her clothes. Luckily, it was only the outer clothes that were dirty…

After Su Yu’s soul was forced out, it disappeared without a trace. According to Su Yishui, if that old Feng from the palace had some skills, he should be able to use Su Yu’s body to summon his soul and guide it back.

This time, Ranran saw the vast depth of scheming that “little Yu” was capable of. He was about to succeed, but was one step short when he failed to account for the Spirit Spring which caused everything to fall apart.

Thinking about it, this Emperor probably wouldn’t give up easily. Ranran was very worried about Zhou Feihua, who was still in the palace.

As for the little dragon, it was swimming around in the sea around the small island. Su Yishui had used a Qiankun ring made by Zeng Yi to clamp around its neck.

So when it wanted to swallow something, it had to come to Su Yishui to loosen the ring before it could swallow successfully, so it didn’t stray too far.

However, it had been imprisoned in a small water pond since childhood, and now suddenly coming to the vast and endless sea, its excitement was enough to offset the discomfort of being bound at its neck.

Since Ranran woke up, the waves around the small island seemed to never stop. The little dragon kept chasing schools of fish, splashing its tail on the shore, hardly ever having a quiet moment, behaving like a playful child let loose.

The next day, with Su Yishui’s channeling of spiritual energy, Ranran’s injuries had healed by about thirty percent. At the very least, she could remove the board and sit up.

So during the day, while Shifu meditated in the cave on the island, guarding against the malevolent nature of the Spirit Spring, she liked to sit on a reef, inhaling the damp sea breeze.

These days of digging mussels with a dagger on the reef for cooking and watching the little dragon chase fish would have been more enjoyable than study travels if she was not injured.

Initially, the little dragon would sneak closer to Ranran, then slowly revealing its head, looking like it was up to no good.

Having tasted human flesh before, it couldn’t help but desire this delicious little girl full of spiritual power, and long for a main course. But after a few ambushes where it nearly lost an eye to Ranran’s dagger, it finally learnt to behave.

And there was one time, this fierce little girl threw some kind of mud pill into its mouth. It then lost its appetite and actually felt nauseous for half a day after eating a fish.

After that incident, it didn’t eat for several days and later on, was no longer very interested in eating her.

What Ranran fed it, was of course the Heart-Calming Pill she refined. This pill’s effects were so potent that even a dragon could abstain from food.

As Su Yishui had said, this dragon had fallen into the hands of someone with ulterior motives who only pushed its spiritual power to maturity without teaching it right from wrong.

Now, as Shifu was planning to take it back to Dragon Island to fulfill an old promise, it was necessary to first suppress its malevolence; otherwise, it might continue attacking passing ships, becoming a monster that hunted people.

But compared to the little dragon, Shifu’s problem was more challenging and couldn’t be solved with a few pills.

Although most of the time, Shifu could restrain the Spirit Spring’s malevolence with his strong willpower, during the late hours of the night, when the Spirit Spring’s malevolence was at its peak, he occasionally couldn’t control it…

Ranran was still young with limited knowledge. She couldn’t understand the Spirit Spring’s *Zhu Bajie-like attribute. Why did Shifu always have to kiss someone when he had an attack?
*猪八戒 is from Journey to the West, this disciple was very lecherous and likes women

And why did he always leave her breathless?

On the third night on the small island, the sea breeze was chilly late at night. Su Yishui wrapped Ranran tightly in his clothes, he stroked her face which was still flushed, and asked, “Why, are you still cold?”

Ranran had been very sleepy lately, as sleeping was the best way to repair her body after the spiritual injuries. However, it was difficult to sleep when feeling cold.

Because of her internal injuries, Ranran couldn’t mobilize her spiritual energy to keep warm, so even with a bonfire late at night, she still felt chilly.

Su Yishui would quietly activate his spiritual energy, to hold her and keep her warm. But as he held her and looked at the fragrant and tender girl in his arms, he couldn’t help but want to kiss her.

Just a moment ago, he couldn’t resist again and held her red lips in his, kissing passionately.

The girl, who had been pale from the cold moments ago, blushed like she had a fever after Su Yishui pressed her with his warmth.

In the beginning, she felt shy and embarrassed being held like this by Shifu. But habits were really scary. It was only the third night, yet she was already accustomed to his warm and comfortable embrace.

When Shifu had asked if she was still cold, she shook her head. Her vitality would automatically circulate at night, beginning to heal her injuries.

She was so sleepy that she closed her eyes lazily, letting her thoughts be enveloped in cotton, snuggled her face deeper and deeper into Shifu’s arms, and then fell asleep peacefully, repairing her broken body.

If she opened her eyes at this moment, she would have seen Shifu’s eyes turn even redder, as if dripping blood…

Su Yishui slowly closed his eyes, tried his hardest to take deep breaths, and suppressed the violent urges within him.

Once the Spirit Spring got a foothold, it would endlessly amplify one’s desires. Su Yishui knew what his obsession was. And right now, what he had longed for in two lifetimes was in his arms, sleeping so peacefully.

But he had to struggle to restrain himself. These three nights on the island, he hadn’t closed his eyes at all, fearing that one slip would harm this little fruit that he had painstakingly begged for from the heavens.

Now, late into the night on the island, only the roaring of the waves could be heard. Su Yishui could not go to sleep, watching the girl in his arms sleep deeply. In the quiet cave, there seemed to be an almost inaudible sigh: “Qingge…”

These past days, the Vermilion bird had passed a cloth strip from Su Yishui to Yutong and the others, informing them of the chaos in the palace.

Although the incident with the dragon flying around was very brief, the commotion it had made under the ground was immense, shaking the entire Capital.

The day the little dragon ascended and the Vermilion bird spread its wings, such an extraordinary event had astounded the people of the city.

Combined with the fact that it was the Dragon Boat Festival that day. There were rumors of pouring realgar wine into the palace lake, stirring the guardian dragon of the palace, and the dragon had shown its divine powers and even flew together with phoenixes.

But beyond these ignorant claims, there were also rumors of the palace secretly raising a dragon, with the Emperor seeking longevity at the cost of nurturing a demonic creature that fed on people, leading to divine wrath that punished the Emperor, destroyed the palace, and even shortened his lifespan.

The Emperor probably couldn’t hold on much longer and was nearing death!

Those who knew a bit about the situation knew that this second rumor was the truth.

When the little dragon went wild underground, much of the palace was destroyed, and since then, the Emperor had fallen into a coma. Later, it was said that he woke up but remained hidden from view.

However, orders had been issued to suppress any rumors about the dragons in the city, only allowing talk of auspicious signs blessing the Great Qi.

But the people in the Capital were anxious, and the concubines who had sons were all harboring thoughts. Everyone tried their best to secretly take action.

After all, Su Yu had never formally appointed a crown prince. If anything happened to him, the forces behind these sons would surely vie for power, leading to a struggle for the throne.

In a note from the Second Uncle Master, she mentioned a few critical matters. The first was that Mu Qingge took advantage of the chaos in the capital and while they were rushing to the palace, secretly removed the immobilizing talisman and fled.

The second matter concerns the follow-up of the Zhou father and daughter. The entire Zhou family has been arrested, reportedly due to some witchcraft by Consort Jing in the palace, cursing the emperor, which led to the Zhou family’s downfall. It’s said that the father and daughter are now being imprisoned, but the specific situation is unclear.

Ranran is very worried about Zhou Feihua. After all the planning by Su Yu, ending up in failure, he will surely vent his anger on her father and her.

Thinking back to when Zhou Feihua could have turned Ranran in or not helped her sneak into the Lake of Enquiry, perhaps things wouldn’t have ended up like this. Ranran couldn’t help but feel guilty, thinking that she must rescue the Zhou father and daughter.

Three days ago, she couldn’t move due to her serious injuries, but now that she can, she wants to go back as soon as possible.

Su Yishui sat by the sea rocks with his hair loose, and said to her, “The Zhou father and daughter will be fine. I will find a way to save them.”

But Ranran firmly shook her head. “No, Shifu, you just escaped danger. If you fall into Su Yu’s trap again, what should we do? I owe her a debt, I will repay it myself!”

Hearing this, Shifu’s eyes turned red again, and he smirked devilishly, “Are you saying I can’t handle Su Yu?”

Ranran realized that now that Su Yishui was possessed by the Spirit Spring, he was like a touchy donkey, easily provoked to his demonic side. She carefully used her fingers as a comb, brushing his hair gently, and said, “How can he compare to you? That old man is very bad!”

Su Yishui was quite satisfied with “little Yu” turning into an bad old man. The slight redness in his eyes faded a bit as he pulled Ranran before him and began to tidy her hair.

“Shifu, when are we going back? My body is fine now,” Ranran asked.

Su Yishui pinched her cheek and replied, “We’ll go back in two days. The medicine you carried with you has run out, and if we delay any longer, you won’t have any energy.”

Hearing this, Ranran pursed her lips. It was Su Yu’s words that made her come to realize that the water she had been drinking might indeed have been soaked tree roots.

But those roots, were probably roots from the Rebirth Tree. Could she really be a fruit grown on that tree? Was she Mu Qingge’s sister… Mu Ranwu?

Su Yishui seemed to sense her thoughts and mildly said, “While I was in the lake, I overheard your conversation with Su Yu. As you have said, the matters of your past life have nothing to do with you now. You are just Xue Ranran, carefree with no obligations. As for your past owed favors, I’ll take care of them for you.”

As he said this, his eyes become less red, like clear autumn waters. Ranran lifted her head to look up at him, feeling a sudden gush of warmth in her heart.

So what if everyone said Shifu was the “Demon’s Son”? Even if he was possessed by the evil Spirit Spring, he was still the Shifu who dotes on her!

So when Su Yishui lowered his head to kiss her again, she couldn’t help but wrap her arms around his neck and deepened the kiss naturally.

She didn’t know what was in her heart, but looking at Su Yishui’s beautiful eyes filled with her reflection, she felt a strange sweetness.

And when he kissed her, her heart also raced and her ears filled with the rush of blood…

She didn’t even have time to think about what would happen to their relationship after Shifu returned the Spirit Spring to the Netherworld and was no longer driven by demonic influences.

At least on this island, there were no external disturbances, only sweet embraces. The sea breeze gently blew, the waves lapped the shore, and when the little dragon in the water caught a fish and flicked its tail, it created a brilliant rainbow in the sky…

But compared to the sweetness on the island, the atmosphere in the Great Qi Imperial Palace was dark and gloomy.

Su Yu withdrew from his body but was driven away by the blood of the Vermilion bird, which greatly damaged his primordial spirit. When Lao Feng discovered that Su Yu’s primordial spirit lamp was about to extinguish, he knew things were not good. He used the Summoning Spirit to guide Su Yu’s primordial spirit back to his body.

Although Su Yu managed to return to his body, he immediately vomited a large mouthful of blood upon waking up, a sign of his primordial spirit’s exhaustion.

Lao Feng knew that Su Yu is near his end. Su Yu himself knew that his mind was clear, but he was being held back by his body.

Now the border was in crisis. If he collapsed again, none of his sons would be able to handle the situation. With a heart full of ambition and strategy, but he would have to leave with regrets.

How could he be willing!

But at that moment, Wei Jiu from the Crimson Gate actually visited the Yiren Hall in person, demanding to see the emperor.

Previously, Su Yu had sent someone to ask Wei Jiu for the antidote for that imposter, but the eunuch was scolded by Wei Jiu and returned empty-handed.

Su Yu knew that this devil probably had ulterior motives, but he also wanted to see Wei Jiu.

So Wei Jiu was led by the palace servants and arrived at the imperial palace, passing through the ruins of the palace walls.

Wei Jiu’s eyes were sharp, and he immediately noticed that Su Yu’s primordial spirit had left his body before. Combined with the intelligence from the spies in the Capital, he couldn’t help but smile.

“Your Majesty, I underestimated you before. You actually managed to outwit even Su Yishui, that old fox. With such strategies, it’s no wonder Mu Qingge valued you so much.”

Su Yu, pale and weak, but still smiled faintly, “If Your Excellency Wei has come all this way just to laugh at me?”

After saying this, Su Yu started to cough violently, each cough accompanied by a hint of blood.

Wei Jiu sat on the chair brought by the eunuch, smiling darkly as he looked at Su Yu who was nearing the end, “Your Majesty, if you’re willing to answer a question that has been bothering me, I might have a way to extend your life.”

Su Yu slowly turned to look at him, “What do you want to ask…?”

Wei Jiu pulled the chair closer, but a eunuch immediately tried to stop him.

But Su Yu waved off the attendants. He, a dying man; was he afraid of being assassinated right now?

So Wei Jiu leaned in close to Su Yu’s ear and asked, “That Mu Qingge in your palace… is she actually real?”

A smile gradually appeared on Su Yu’s bloodless face, “What do you think?”

Wei Jiu pondered Su Yu’s subtle expression and seemed to catch a hint. He slowly said, “I feel… she doesn’t seem real. There were two fruits on the Rebirth Tree back then, but one grew poorly and fell early. I never found any trace of it… It’s quite suspicious now that I think about it.”

Su Yu smiled and said, “If you want to know the whereabouts of the other spiritual fruit, why not first tell me how to prolong my life? After all, I could breathe my last at any moment, and I believe Your Excellency wouldn’t want that. Shall I take this secret to the grave?”

Wei Jiu laughed and raised an eyebrow, “Since Your Majesty intends to deal with Su Yishui, then consider me, Wei Jiu, your friend. Please rest assured, I won’t let such a capable friend as you meet an untimely end…”

Su Yu’s smile deepened, “It’s been a long time since I’ve had anyone as a friend. I’m quite pleased. Since we are friends, after Wei Your Excellency extends my life, perhaps we can discuss the matter of the Spirit Spring in detail…”

Wei Jiu’s eyes flickered slightly. He came here wanting to know the true fate of Mu Qingge, but he never expected to gain such an unexpected reward as the Spirit Spring!

He sincerely took Su Yu’s emaciated hand and said, “Your Majesty, with me here, the King of Hell won’t be able to take you away just yet…”

Leaving aside the sincere friendship that had just blossomed in the imperial palace, we return to the the small island where there was only two people. Xue Ranran finally retrieved the foot she had crossed into the gates of death.

The power of the marrow-cleansing pool, actually stimulated deeper potential within Ranran after she had suffered serious injuries. Due to her congenital deficiencies, her spiritual veins had been thinner than those of ordinary cultivators, but after this severe injury, Su Yishui seemed to have rebuilt her spiritual veins in the aftermath, allowing her to better unleash her spiritual power.

In a way, it could be considered turning adversity into blessings.

When Ranran could circulate her spiritual energy and jump around, she felt that her spiritual energy was flowing more smoothly than before.

However, it was precisely because of the improvement in her spiritual power that she could sense Shifu’s spiritual power running rich and unrestrained, but that he was constantly suppressing the rapidly surging spiritual power induced by the Spirit Spring.

It was like someone constantly restraining a fierce tiger in their heart, never able to relax, or else the wild beast would burst out of its cage and be hard to contain again.

This constant and exhausting toil made Ranran feel heartache.

Next, they set off for Dragon Island, where they would send back this little dragon.

Dragon Island was deep in the East Sea, surrounded by the Dragon Clan’s barrier, even Su Yishui couldn’t pass through easily.

But the little dragon had no such restrictions. When they reached the edge of Dragon Island, Ranran earnestly instructed the little dragon, “After you go over, get along well with your companions, learn how to be a dragon properly, and don’t casually come out again, lest you fall into the hands of bad people.”

The little dragon seemed very impatient with Ranran’s mawkish instructions, constantly shaking its head and swinging its tail.

But as Ranran and Su Yishui were about to leave, the little dragon poked its head out of the water again, looking somewhat pitifully at Ranran.

Ranran smiled and said to it, “I’ll come to see you again when I have time in future. Eat more fish and grow even more majestic!”

The little dragon heard this, shook its head with its own majestic little dragon horn, and let out another dragon roar.

From afar, on the misty Dragon Island, there was an echo of dragon roars, as if urging the little dragon, who had been away from home for too long, to return quickly.

So, after waving goodbye to the little dragon, Ranran and Shifu returned quickly on Zhuque’s back.

This time, they didn’t go straight back to the Capital but met with Yutong on a nearby mountain.

When Ranran dismounted from the back of the Vermilion bird, she saw someone unexpected and was pleasantly surprised—Zhou Feihua was sitting by the fire with Yu Chen and Yutong.

Ranran exclaimed joyously, “Consort Jing, how did you escape from the palace?”

The present Zhou Feihua was no longer the Consort adorned in luxurious silks and Phoenix hairpins. She dressed in sharp men’s clothing, with her hair styled like a man’s, resembling a male armed escort in the Jianghu.

The poor Spirit Spring had to take the rap for Su Yishui and become a lecherous spring lol

So the interesting thing is, the Spirit Spring magnifies the desires of people. So Su Yishui loses control and he kisses Ranran. But the effect of kissing her, actually makes him stronger and able to suppress the spring, instead of becoming more under the control because he was indulging himself. I suppose he was making even more effort when he reminds himself what he cannot afford to lose?

Previous
Next

毒舌师父 THE MEAN SHIFU

When Su Yu wanted to punish the father and daughter of the Zhou family, the border erupted in war. The capable generals in the court were all old subordinates of Zhou Dao.

Upon hearing of Zhou Dao’s arrest, his old subordinates collectively petitioned His Majesty, pleading for leniency towards General Zhou.
