Although Su Yu was obsessed with achieving immortality, when it came to matters concerning his ancestors and the country, he never acted foolishly. At this critical juncture, he naturally couldn’t do anything that will destroy the morale of the generals.

However, he had long been wary of Zhou Dao. Taking advantage of this opportunity, he removed Zhou Dao from his official position and allowed him to retire back to his hometown.

As for Zhou Feihua, being a palace concubine, she naturally had to be dealt with according to palace rules. While her life was spared, she couldn’t escape punishment and was sent to the Cold palace.

Yutong, after receiving a reply sent from her Master by the Vermilion bird, she proceeded with his instructions. With her brother, they sneaked into the Cold palace at night, putting an unclaimed female corpse dug from an unmarked grave in her place and setting fire to Zhou Feihua’s residence.

After the people in the palace put out the fire, they would find a charred body, and from then on, Consort Jing would cease to exist.

Ranran only just learned about Shifu’s private arrangements, now she couldn’t help but look at Zhou Feihua.

Even though Su Yu was hateful, Ranran felt that Zhou Feihua was not as carefree as she appeared. She should have had feelings for Su Yu beyond their monarch-subject relationship.

Otherwise, sacrificing so much just to supervise the Emperor closely as a concubine would be too much! Perhaps Zhou Feihua entered the palace because she liked Su Yu, knowing full well that he had feelings for other women. She was willing to put on red clothes and dance with swords all night for him…

Now that Zhou Feihua had escaped from there, would she resent Shifu since she won’t be able to see Su Yu again?

When Zhou Feihua and Ranran were taking a walk together, Ranran asked if she missed the palace. Zhou Feihua sighed and said, “He has changed. He’s no longer the young emperor I once knew. He could even manipulate the person he likes, Mu Qingge. What am I compared to that? My father had hoped that I can leave the palace, and I was already tired of that life. Being able to fake my death and leave the palace is already a blessing from heaven…”

At this point, she turned to ask Ranran, “Who are you exactly? Su Yu said you are also a fruit from the Rebirth Tree? Could it be… you are Mu Ranwu who caused the death of Mu Qingge?”

Saying this, Zhou Feihua looked at Ranran with a sharp gaze.

Ranran understood the straightforward nature of this Consort and couldn’t help but scratch her two buns in frustration. “Since I’ve already died once, I naturally don’t remember anything from my past life. If Your Ladyship is willing to let bygones be bygones, then I’ll be grateful for it. Otherwise, wouldn’t it have been for nothing, hanging on that tree for so many years? I am just Xue Ran Ran now, nobody else!”

Seeing Ranran’s pained look, Zhou Feihua couldn’t bring herself to utter any malicious curses she intended to say. The young girl really didn’t remember anything, and it would be really unfair to scold her for things she couldn’t recall.

Moreover, she really liked this straightforward young girl. Perhaps the Rebirth Tree was even more powerful than *Granny Meng’s Soup. The sister who silently followed Mu Qingge in her previous life, the girl who often used underhanded methods, was now so brave and refreshing.
*孟婆汤 is a legend where people drink a soup to forget their past lives to move to another cycle

Of course, Zhou Feihua didn’t think Su Yishui was the one who had taught her so well to produce such an excellent female disciple.

In the evening, while grilling by the fire, she saw how affectionate Su Yishui and Ranran were with each other. They were sharing a roasted chicken leg so naturally, it was obvious that their relationship not as simple as master and disciple.

Mu Qingge sacrificed so much for him back then, yet he still lived comfortably, even taking in a beautiful and young female disciple, taking advantage of her.
*吃着鲜嫩的小豆腐 fresh and tender tofu = taking advantage of young girls

What kind of scoundrel could make a move on his own disciple? Su Yishui was truly a degenerate, rotten from the core!

Thinking of this, Zhou Feihua cautioned Ranran about many things, such as how young girls were easily deceived by men’s sweet words, and older men were cunning, hiding their malice well.

Ranran, knowing she was indirectly criticizing her master, had to defend him: “In order to save me, Shifu… is sometimes overcome by demonic influence and can lose control, but he has always been a gentleman. Don’t slander my Shifu like this!”

Zhou Feihua chuckled, “Who needs to slander him? Who do you think was the Demon’s son who caused Mu Qingge to be condemned by righteous people was? It was him, Su Yishui!”

Ranran glared but remained silent, but Zhou Feihua could tell the young girl was truly angry. However even if she was angry, she had to tell her the truth: “Back then, Su Yishui pretended to be severely injured and on the brink of death. He made use of his master, deceived her into opening the gate to the Netherworld realm, where he obtained the power of the Spirit Spring. Then, he incited his father to rebel and seize power. Which one of these things can be done by a good person?”

Ranran instinctively retorted, “You’re lying… Is there some misunderstanding?”

Zhou Feihua smiled coldly, “Misunderstanding? It’s hateful how he’s always deceiving women, bewitching Mu Qingge and manipulating her. She ended up bearing the blame for harboring the Spirit Spring of the Demon’s son! And in the end, he turned himself into a righteous hero, claiming to exterminate evil, while Mu Qingge died because of him, still carrying that blame! Is this something a good person would do?”

Ranran felt somewhat speechless. If that was the case, her Shifu had indeed acted dishonorably. Did he really deliberately frame Elder Mu?

While the two were talking, Zhou Feihua suddenly looked past Ranran’s shoulder and saw Su Yishui standing under a tree. She immediately asked him, “You sure know how to pretend to be a good person in front of your disciple. Tell us, how did you ruin Qingge back then…”

It turned out that Su Yishui had followed them without them noticing and had heard everything Zhou Feihua said.

Before she could finish, her entire body rose into the air as if pulled by an invisible force, and Su Yishui grabbed Zhou Feihua by the neck.

Seeing Su Yishui’s crimson red eyes, Ranran understood that Zhou Feihua’s words had triggered something demonic in him. She hurriedly leapt over and grabbed Su Yishui’s wrist, urgently saying, “Shifu! Control yourself, let go quickly, you might kill her like this!”

Seeing Su Yishui not loosening his grip but increasing the pressure, Ranran, had no other choice, she could only bite his arm.

Su Yishui, looking at her biting him, the redness in his eyes dissipated a little, and his grip on Zhou Feihua’s neck began to loosen.

Zhou Feihua had almost suffocated moments ago. After breaking free, she took several steps backwards, glaring and asked, “What’s this? You… cough … just realized you should kill and silence me?”

Ranran, afraid Zhou Feihua’s words would fan the flames and incite more trouble, quickly turned to her and gestured for her to be quiet. “You are already aware that my Shifu is at a very critical time right now. His temperament is not the same as he usually is. Please stop and refrain from provoking my Shifu any further.”

But before she could finish, Su Yishui coldly spoke up, “What she said is all true. I’m not the good person you think I am!”

After speaking, he didn’t even look at Ranran’s reaction and fell silent for a while before turning and leaving.

For some reason, Ranran, watching his receding straight figure as he left, felt a profound sense of pain and desolation…

Zhou Feihua finally recovered her breath and sighed in relief. However, the bruises on her neck were shocking, showing how much force Su Yishui had used just now.

Ranran applied a medicinal ointment to Zhou Feihua’s neck and asked in a small voice, “You said my master is a demon’s son, then…..did Mu Qingge know?”

Zhou Feihua stretched her neck for Ranran to apply the ointment and sighed again, saying hoarsely “Of course she knew, but she insisted that Su Yishui was bitter due to a difficult childhood and later felt resentful due to unfair treatment for his mother, leading to increasingly extreme thoughts. She was his master and couldn’t stand by while he fell into darkness. She said since she failed to teach her disciple properly, it’s only right for her to bear the blame on behalf of her disciple…”

Ranran knew that at first, Su Yishui had a deep misunderstanding of Mu Qingge, as seen in the “Playing Classics” Beasts chapter.

When Su Yishui silently ate the salted longan, did he think about seeking revenge against all those who had wronged him, including Mu Qingge, who didn’t understand him back then?

If so, then his subsequent retaliation against Mu Qingge would be understandable.

Thinking of this, Ranran sighed softly again. Zhou Feihua looked at her and said, “Why are you sighing so much at such a young age? If he is harassing you, you can leave with me. Don’t let him deceive–“

Before she could finish speaking, Ranran reached out to cover her mouth, and desperately signaled her to be quiet. In a low voice, Ranran said, “My dear Lady, please don’t anger my Shifu anymore. Besides, even at his worst, his master never abandoned him. As his disciple, how can I leave him during his most difficult time?”

Zhou Feihua rolled her eyes and fell silent. In some ways, this young girl was just like her former close friend!

As for the incident of Shifu being possessed by the Spirit Spirit, Second Uncle Master, Gao Cang and the rest only discovered it later. Shifu’s entire demeanor changed, becoming somewhat unlike Su Yishui…

People are always like this, they only cherish what they lose.

Qiu Xier now deeply missed the past when her Shifu had a hands-off approach and spoke little.

In the past, if Su Yishui saw them not performing to expectations, he would at most give them a cold look and then only make them write extra assignments or run laps up and down the mountain.

But now, Shifu… seemed to still have remnants of the dragon’s influence, ready to spew venomous words at any time.

For example, after they descended the mountain and found an inn to stay in, finally able to enjoy some delicious food.

During dinner, Qiu Xier and Ranran fought over the chicken legs, a common occurrence among the XiShan disciples. Everyone was used to this.

In the past, Su Yishui would simply watch on silently, then give his own chicken leg to Ranran.

But now Su Yishui could say to Qiu Xier with a cold look, “Getting so fat that your clothes are about to burst open, and still so greedy? No wonder you never improved in your Lightness Technique; have you ever seen a sow climb a tree?”

In front of everyone at the table, Qiu Xier couldn’t hold back her tears after being ridiculed by the master like this. She burst into tears, then ran back to her room, skipping dinner altogether.

After Su Yishui finished speaking, he coldly scanned the table, and no one else dared to take any more food. They silently finished quickly what was left in their bowls and then slunk away.

Ranran also wanted to leave, but Su Yishui held her back and placed two large chicken legs from the plate into her bowl.

“Shifu, this is too much, how can I finish it all? Besides, if I eat so much… I’ll probably become too fat to climb trees…”

Su Yishui casually continued to serve her food, “Then get a bit fatter, it’ll be more comfortable to hug you.”

Hmm… its lucky that third senior sister isn’t here, or after hearing Su Yishui’s comments with extreme favoritism, she might likely die crying on the spot.

Ranran really couldn’t bear to see her Shifu debase himself this way. She took him away from the inn and into the nearby woods. “Shifu, even if you’re possessed by the Spirit Spirit and feeling out of sorts, you must try to restrain yourself. Third senior sister is very sensitive; if you speak to her like this, she won’t be able to bear it.”

Su Yishui didn’t think he was being too harsh. He’s aware he speaks more sharply now, but it was only because of the Spirit Spring’s influence which no longer made him conceal himself, allowing him to express his true thoughts.

But he also knew that if the Spirit Spring’s possession were to continue too long, he will eventually lose control of himself. Among other concerns, he was most worried about hurting Ranran.

Every time he looked at her, uncontrollable desires surged in his heart. If she knew what he wanted to do to her, she would surely be frightened, run away and avoid him forever…

Seeing Shifu silent again with red eyes, Ranran quickly *humored him. She took out a honey-glazed hazelnut and stuffed it into his mouth.
*顺毛驴 比喻顺着他的脾气和意愿就能很好相处，否则就不好相处的人
Someone who is very easy to get along with if you don’t go against their wishes

Su Yishui seized the opportunity and pulled her into his arms, trying to calm himself, then said, “I’ll try my best…”

Ranran understood he meant that he will refrain from saying hurtful words in future. But as his disciple, teaching her master how to behave seemed somewhat inappropriate.

Wasn’t there supposed to be consequences according to Xishan’s rules for such misconduct?

Before Ranran could think it through, her thoughts were once again swept away by Su Yishui’s embrace and kiss, gone without a trace…

After their affectionate kiss, Ranran did manage to remember the main matter at hand.

Among all the events that happened in the palace before, the most puzzling was how Su Yu knew that Su Yishui once possessed the White Tiger.

This was something only the Xishan disciples knew, even their second senior brother did not know. Yet Su Yu was clearly well-informed, indicating a possible leak.

Ranran didn’t want to speculate about the two senior uncle masters or Gaocang and Qiu Xier being the traitor.

So she had to first be on guard regarding matters pertaining to the Spirit Spring. Ranran had to be careful of eavesdroppers. With only the two of them in the woods, she took out a cloth bundle containing a book, which was the “Records of the Fantian Sect,” that they intended to get during their visit to the Capital.

Zhou Feihua passed her the book when they parted ways yesterday. It was because Ranran had mentioned they went to the palace to find a book from the Xishan archives.

On the day of the Dragon Boat Festival, chaos broke out in the collapsing palace and Su Yu had been caught by a dragon and taken to the skies. Everyone was in a panic.

Remembering Ranran’s request, Zhou Feihua took advantage of the confusion and avoiding Old Feng, snuck into Su Yu’s study, where she quickly found this unusually worn-out book on his usual bookshelf. She then passed it to her cousin from the Imperial Guards, to sneak it out of the palace in the chaos.

Afterwards, she was captured, and the Zhou family was raided. Fortunately, her cousin was quick-witted and hid the book under an old tree in the Zhou family’s backyard.

Followed by a series of events involving faking Zhou Feihua’s death, Ranran finally got her hands on this book.

Zhou Feihua’s intention was clear: “Su Yishui was originally a cunning person, and now being possessed by the Spirit Spring, he has turned into an evil being. What do you think a ‘demon’s son’ is? It’s a very rare person who can reach the Netherworld Realm and take away the Spirit Spring. They must bear immense grievances to become the demon’s son – a vessel for the Spirit Spring. Mu Qingge was misled by someone back then…If its as you have said, Su Yishui is willing to return the Spirit Spring to the Netherworld Realm, it would be a blessing for the world. Otherwise…”

Zhou Feihua didn’t finish her sentence. She couldn’t help but touch her neck, where the bruises had not yet faded.

She had to set off immediately to find her father and make arrangements to leave the country. Even though she couldn’t help worrying about this young girl, she could only earnestly give her advice, bid a heartfelt farewell and leave.

Su Yu hasn’t fully recovered yet, but once he has enough time later, he will definitely not let her father go. Only by fleeing far away can he temporarily avoid the current troubles.

Now, Ranran handed the book to Su Yishui, hoping to find a way to the Netherworld Realm from its contents.

Su Yishui looked at the book and suddenly asked Ranran, “I have said, that everything Zhou Feihua had said is true. Are you really not afraid of me at all?”

Ranran leaned against the tree trunk, looked up at him, and said softly, “Why should I be afraid? You once said that the little dragon, went on the wrong path because it was left unattended. Shifu, you are human, and you will inevitably make mistakes. But aren’t you silently making amends for your past mistakes? I think if Elder Mu knew everything you’ve done, she wouldn’t blame you too much…”

At this point, Ranran found it difficult to continue. Considering how Mu Qingge had secretly released the Immortal Devouring bugs on Tianmai Mountain, this master and disciple’s feud seems far from over.

It would seem that Elder Mu has not forgiven Su Yishui at all.

Su Yishui took once glance at her, and continued to silently flip through the old book with his long fingers.

With both old books together, the next step was to carefully search for any clues inside. The book that was lent to the palace looked much older than the one left in Xishan. It seemed that Su Yu hadn’t stopped reading this book over the years.

The section about the “Seven Evil Transformation Curse” had been read repeatedly. Su Yu had likely studied it extensively over the years.

However, regarding information of the Netherworld Realm’s Spirit Spring, after searching the entire book, only a casual line was found – “Below the Falling Water Cliff is the Spirit Spring.”

Ranran was unsure if this was a description of the Netherworld Realm’s location, so she asked Shifu where the Falling Water Cliff was.

Su Yishui replied mildly, “It is said to be where heavenly water falls, creating a deep pit, bottomless abyss.”

Ranran frowned and thought for a while. She had never seen where heavenly water fell in such a manner on Earth, but there was a saying by poets: “The Yellow River’s waters comes from the sky.” Could this heavenly water refer to the source of the Yellow River?

Su Yishui nodded, then shook his head. He remembered that when he went to the Netherworld Realm before, although he headed north, it was far from the Yellow River, let alone be its source.

The entrance to the Netherworld Realm shifted each time, making it hard to pinpoint its exact location. However, right next to this line, there was an illustration of a red flower resembling an eagle’s beak.

Su Yishui squinted at it, recalling these strange flowers he saw at the entrance to the Netherworld Realm during his last visit.

Below the illustration, there was a line of annotation: Eagle Beak Demon Flower, blooms from blood.

Seeing this, Ranran had an epiphany. *”Heavenly water” could also be understood as divine punishment. Every few decades in the mortal world, wars would break out at the borders, causing a time of great suffering, which could be seen as a divine punishment.
*天水

During the great battle of Fan Yao, Su Yishui had also seen these flowers on the battlefield.

So, this demonic flower, which marks the entrance to the Netherworld Realm, might grow in places with the most bloodshed.

Now that Da Qi and neighboring country Gao Kan were in conflict, perhaps that was where the demon flower was about to bloom.

In any case, without other clues, they could only try with this direction and see if they could find any other leads.

Because Shifu couldn’t wait any longer.

As they left the inn, a rude guest from before, annoyed by the Xishan disciples’ carriage blocking his path, reached out and whipped their horses.

In the past, Shifu would have remained calm, secretly casting spells to teach a lesson to these arrogant bullies who only prey on the weak. But yesterday, Shifu actually lifted his leg and kicked the man into a tree. If Ranran hadn’t grabbed his arm with her life, Su Yishui would have probably killed the man.

From the moment they left the inn, it didn’t take long for their wanted posters to be plastered all over town.

The painter’s skills were good, or perhaps Old Feng had an exceptional memory; each portrait was very lifelike.

Only Qiu Xier, due to her extreme weight loss, did not resemble her portrait, making the fugitive third senior sister feel inexplicably pleased in her despair.

But now they were all wanted criminals in Da Qi. If they caused more public violence, Xishan’s reputation would be completely ruined.

Because Shifu’s mood was unpredictable and his killing intent was now too strong, they couldn’t stay in inns anymore and could only camp outdoors, as they headed towards the border.

During their journey, they visited Cuiwei Mountain, where Elder Jiu lived, hoping to get another talisman jade bottle for emergency use.

However, when they arrived at the foot of the mountain, they found that the once green fields were now barren, overgrown with weeds and untended.

The scarecrows that once worked in the fields were scattered, leaving only some dried grass and scattered clothes.

When they reached the peak of Cuiwei Mountain, the few houses had been burned to the ground, with charred wooden stakes and broken wine jars scattered everywhere.

Ranran inspected a half-empty jar of “Detain Heaven’s Immortal” wine outside.

For someone who loved alcohol so much, there was absolutely no reason to smash the wine jar before finishing it. What kind of trouble had Elder Jiu encountered to abandon this secluded place?

Ranran couldn’t help but worry about the old rascal. Elder Jiu has been living a peaceful life and shouldn’t have any major conflicts with others.

Who came looking for revenge? And where was he now? These were all unknowns.

Ranran repeatedly inspected the chaotic items on the mountain. Finally, under a stone outside the courtyard, she saw a few hastily scratched lines: “The Fantian Sect has revived, be careful…”

The word after “be careful” was incomplete, hastily scratched out, making it unrecognizable.

Previous
Next

*臭鱼烂虾 ROTTEN THINGS

*形容人窝囊废，没用 Actually I am not sure why this chapter is named this lol

Ranran only discovered these words just now because she laid down on the ground.

Elder Jiu was probably lying here before and used his nails to write them at the bottom of the stone.

She slowly got up and then realized that the place where she had been lying down was a drag mark, with even traces of someone’s nails scratching the ground. It seemed that after someone had lain here, they were dragged away by someone else…

Ranran felt cold sweat on her back. Elder Jiu was not an common elder without any strength; being dragged away helplessly like this clearly indicated some kind of sinister trickery.

However, due to the angle, the person who dragged Elder Jiu away did not notice the traces he left at the bottom of the big stone. Was Elder Jiu trying to warn her Shifu and her?

Were the attackers from the remnants of the Fantian Sect?

As Ranran was examining the ground, Su Yishui also approached. After squatting down and seeing the line of words, he furrowed his brows tightly.

The Fantian Sect was a demonic sect from hundreds of years ago, a group of greedy individuals who were gathered and manipulated by the Spirit Spring when it intruded into the mortal realm.

Back then, when they first heard of this name, they had been tracing the Water Demon and only learned about it after coming to the Cuiwei Mountain from Elder Jiu.

However, the Fantian Sect had long been destroyed by a powerful figure Dun Tian, wiped from existence. So how could a group from the Fantian Sect suddenly emerge again?

Unable to find many clues, Ranran and the others had to descend from Cuiwei Mountain. When she looked up, she unintentionally saw a crow on a branch.

Elder Jiu used to communicate with the people below through this crow. But now, this crow had no talisman symbols on its feet, just tilting its head stupidly and cawing.

Ranran felt a little sad and resolved to find Elder Jiu’s whereabouts. His brother, the Medicine Immortal, had ascended, no longer concerned with worldly matters.

So, she, as his young brief acquaintance, was the only one left to worry about the old rascal’s fate.

When they were searching for clues on the mountain, Second Uncle Master did not come up. These past few days, Second Uncle Master had poor appetite, eating very little, mostly they ate and chatted during meals, she would take a cup of tea and go for a walk to relax.

Qiu Xier secretly whispered to her, speculating whether Second Uncle Master was expecting another bundle of joy with the scholar at the foot of Western Mountain.

Ranran didn’t dare ask about that, but her Shifu probably thought so too. Second Uncle Master said she was a little fatigued, so he didn’t let her go up the mountain with them.

At this moment, Second Uncle Master was bored waiting, sitting on a large stone, staring blankly at the smoke rising from the nearby village.

Following her gaze, Ranran thought of something.

So on the pretext of buying some dried rations in the village, they managed to gather some clues from the villagers at the foot of Cuiwei Mountain.

Ten days ago, a group of outsiders came here. But it happened to be at night. Some people saw that those people were floating as they walked, with their heels not touching the ground.

This frightened several villagers who were catching loaches in the canal. It was said that one timid person, was so frightened to the point of vomiting bile, kept saying that they had seen a vengeful ghost.

Ranran, however, felt that what they saw was a group of cultivators who had mastered the Wind Control Technique. When using this technique, they would appear to be floating, as if riding the wind.

But when they got on the road mentioned by the villagers, Ranran’s nose was keen enough to detect the faint scent of Detain Heaven’s Immortal wine on the ground.

She thought that since Elder Jiu always carried a gourd of wine with him, if the cork of the gourd was not tightly sealed when he was abducted, the wine could have leaked along the way.

The scent of Detain Heaven’s Immortal wine was distinctive, and it has not rained here for more than ten days, so the lingering aroma remained. Luckily, Ranran had a keen nose, much more sensitive than the average person, so she followed the faint scent of wine all the way to the side of the river port.

Right now, the boats at the river port were very busy.

With the border in flames and this being an important transit point for goods, the boatmen coming and going were all busy loading and unloading cargo.

Yuchen quickly learned that twenty days ago, the boats at this river port were all headed to *Wuma Town.
*五马镇 literally Five Horses Town

There, a large army had been gathering, urgently needing supplies. As for merchants who wanted to go elsewhere, they were strictly prohibited from using the water route and were only allowed to travel by land.

In that case, did those people also take Elder Jiu on the boat to Wuma Town?

After hearing this, Su Yishui said, “In that case, let’s head to Wuma Town. After all, we already intended to investigate the front lines.”

Back then, Uncle Master Zeng took care of many businesses on behalf of Su Yishui, and in that Wuma Town, there was also a place called *Qianli Horse Trading Post, which would provide them with a place to stay.
*千里 Qianli is thousand miles

These past days, they had been roughing it outdoors. Qiu Xier also did not dare to eat much in front of her Shifu, causing her to suffer enough to lose some weight. Now, she was revealing a bit of her youthful and slender figure.

She was now looking forward to a soft bed and a good night’s sleep, and maybe sneak a big bowl of braised pork behind her Shifu’s back.

So, as they were about to reach Wuma Town, Qiu Xier was quite excited.

But when they arrived at the trading post, they found that this largest horse trading post in the area had their business signboard smashed to bits. The shopkeeper and the staff were not there, and there was only a seventy-year-old night watchman who spoke a local dialect that was difficult to understand. He gestured and pointed, trying to tell them that all the people from the horse trading post had been arrested by soldiers.

Yuchen and Gao cang exchanged looks with each other and quickly checked for any signs of surrounding activity.

After all, now the entire Xishan sect has been freshly labeled as wanted fugitives. It was said that along the route to Western Mountain, posters of them were plastered everywhere.

Of course, this wasn’t to make it easier for the soldiers to catch them. After all, they were cultivators, and ordinary soldiers couldn’t even get close, let alone capture them.

But this move effectively tarnished the reputation of Xishan.

Under this pretext, it was said that the three major sects had already gathered for a meeting, discussing whether to declare Xishan as a demonic sect. In the words of the Elder Kaiyuan, the Xishan sect had not repented, and was colluding with Mu Qingge to cause a dragon to destroy the palace, causing a great calamity.

Previously, Xishan had won the Tianmai Mountain’s Marrow Cleansing Pool event, which had displeased the three major sects.

So, although Elder Kaiyuan’s words had loopholes, no one delved into them. Instead, they all condemned Xishan sect, and it was even said that some sects were gathering their forces, preparing to seek justice from Su Yishui.

After all, Su Yishui’s actions had completely disrupted the balance between the cultivation world and the mundane world, causing trouble for fellow cultivators, which was unforgivable!

Now that something had happened to the horse trading post, was it because someone had noticed the connection between the post and Xishan?

On high alert and inspecting the area thoroughly, Ranran found out what happened while inquiring at the sesame dessert stall in town.

The recent incident with the horse trading post had nothing much to do with the disciples from Xishan.

This area produces great horses from beyond the borders, so there are many horse traders coming and going.

Due to the urgent situation at the border, where there is a need for horses, so all horses in various places have been requisitioned, including those here.

In times of crisis at the border, the requisitioned horses naturally cannot be priced at market rates; they are only compensated with basic rates. However, most horse traders would not object, as everyone understands the principle of mutual support in times of need.

However, just yesterday, a group of soldiers arrived and arrested all the shopkeepers and assistants at the horse trading post. They sent word that the owner should come to the military camp for questioning as soon as possible.

It was said that something went wrong with the horses handed over by the horse trading post. On the second day after handing over the horses, these horses were sent to the camp for deployment.

The horses handed over from other places were all fine, but only the horses from Qianli Horse Trading post had become extremely agitated when they reached Yanxing Mountain. They neighed wildly, causing great distress to the soldiers riding them, and what’s worse, a general was injured.

So, the military camp concluded that someone from Qianli Horse Trading post had tampered with these requisitioned horses, intending harm to the soldiers. That’s why they arrested the shopkeepers for interrogation.

Qiu Xier’s long-awaited warm bed and braised pork were now gone with the wind.

The wanted individuals had to retreat into the woods again.

However, Yu chen was experienced in building tents in the military camp, so he bought a cowhide tent in town. With Gao Cang’s help, they set up camp on the mountain, finally avoiding exposure to the elements.

When Gao Cang went to town with Senior Uncle Master, he brought back a piece of good pork belly, along with condiments like oil, sugar, soy sauce, and an iron pot.

While washing the meat by the stream, Ranran teased Qiu Xier, “Senior brother really spoils you. Look, you said you wanted braised pork, and he bought it to satisfy your craving.”

Qiu Xier had indeed become quite close to senior brother recently. However, she felt that her own matters were insignificant compared to Ranran’s.

Now she also noticed something unusual between Ranran and their master, so she asked quietly, “Shifu is so intimidating now, yet you still dare to get close to him. I saw you two sitting on the stone at the mountaintop looking at the moon yesterday. Are you really planning to become immortal partners with him?”

Ranran didn’t think that far ahead. Right now, she just hoped to safely return the Spirit Spring.

When their Shifu returned to normal… naturally, it would be as if nothing had happened. Talking about immortal partners or not would be irrelevant.

Qiu Xier was familiar with cultivation stories and became anxious when Ranran said she hadn’t thought that far ahead. She said, “You now also have some cultivation foundation. But do think it through. It is said that if you become immortal partners, advancing in cultivation becomes even more difficult.”

Ranran understood what Qiu Xier meant.

After all, their cultivation levels were different, and their time for ascension will also be different. Often, after one person ascended, they would cut off worldly ties. Even if they met again in the future, they would only treat each other with respect and courtesy, like strangers. Worse still, if one failed to ascend for a long time, they would become like Houyi and Chang’e, separated between two worlds, filled with regrets.”

Ranran felt Qiu Xier made sense. However, it seems that Shifu did not seem very interested in things like foundation building and ascension.

Given his talent, his current cultivation level should far exceed the powerful figures preparing for ascension in the three major sects.

However, compared to twenty years ago, Shifu’s cultivation did not seem to have progressed much. During the last ascension attempt of the powerful figures and their heavenly tribulation tests, he was not included.

However, with his two Beast Control feats, as well as sealing the Spirit Spring with his own body, all these things proved that Shifu’s cultivation is much greater than what he shows.

After all, being able to overcome the control of the spiritual spring requires immense willpower and spiritual energy support.

With such capabilities, why did Shifu stop advancing, choosing to remain confined to the small little West Mountain?

Ranran knows her own limitations, even if she was so fortunate to become immortal partners with Shifu, her current cultivation level was far from his. As Qiu Xier said, accompanying in cultivation sometimes may just be to pass the boring years. If they were destined not to be together in the end, there was no need to take it seriously from the start.

Their Shifu’s nightly activities everyday recently, mainly involved getting her to admire the moon and night scenery with him, Ranran wasn’t sure, but Shifu seemed to have been here before.

He seemed to know where all the beautiful scenery were. For example, yesterday, he took her to a mountain hollow full of little purple flowers. When night fell, in just a moment, they saw fireflies dancing among the flowers.

Ranran had never seen so many fireflies before. Shining on the purple flowers, they seemed to be covered in falling starlight, incredibly beautiful.

Shifu even brought a small net for her to catch fireflies with. Ranran enjoyed herself very much, she then lamented that it would be great if there was a firefly lantern.

Unexpectedly, as soon as she finished speaking, Su Yishui took out a paper lantern made of paper. During the day, Ranran had seen Shifu cutting wood and using paper he brought with him to make something, but she didn’t expect him to be making a lantern for her.

When she put the captured fireflies inside, she discovered simple line drawings on the four sides of the paper lantern.

There was a man and a woman sitting on a tree branch under the moon, looking at a sea of flowers. When fireflies danced in the flower sea, the fireflies on the lantern’s flower sea also danced…

One couldn’t tell clearly if this was inside or outside the painting. And whether Su Yishui had intended to paint this present scene… or was it a memory from his past.

Ranran considered Shifu’s thoughtful preparations, became more convinced that he had been to these places before. These clever ideas were obviously not something a prickly free spirited man would think of.

So she tentatively asked, “Shifu, have you been here before?”

Su Yishui was silent for a moment and replied, “Yes, I have…”

Ranran gently swayed the delicate paper lantern and asked again, “So Shifu you have made a lantern for someone else before?”

This time, Su Yishui shook his head. Looking at the fluorescence of the night, he said faintly, “This is the first time I made one. But someone once made a lantern for me to cheer me up…”

Ranran listened, suddenly feeling an indescribable discomfort in her heart. She took a deep breath silently and said in a small voice, “Then Shifu must have been as happy as I am now?”

Su Yishui half-raised his head, remained silent for a while, and then said in a low voice, “I was in a bad mood at that time and smashed that lantern to pieces…”

Ranran didn’t expect the memory of this beautiful scene to turn out like this. She was momentarily speechless, suddenly guessing that the person who made the lantern to cheer up her Shifu was probably Elder Mu.

So now, why did he make this lantern for her? Did he also hope that she would tear it apart and throw it back at his face to compensate for his guilt towards Elder Mu?

Thinking of this, Ranran lost interest in the scenery. Now that she thought about it, these past few days, fishing under the moon together, picking bird eggs with Shifu during the day, all these joyful experiences, Shifu might have done them with Elder Mu before.

Although Elder Mu has changed now, Shifu still reminisces about the past, so he brought her along to make up the number in order to relive those moments.

After Su Yishui finished speaking, he still seemed to be immersed in the past. By the time he turned his head, he found that Ranran had used a finger to poke the lantern into a sieve, and all the fireflies inside had escaped.

Ranran then handed the broken lantern back to Shifu, with lowered eyes, said, “I’m tired and want to go back to sleep.”

With that, she lightly left and went down the mountain on her own.

When she returned, Qiu xier and the others had already gone to bed. Ranran went back to her small tent, suddenly feeling like she had eaten too much tonight, feeling stuffy and uncomfortable in her chest for no apparent reason.

Just then, Su Yishui seemed to have returned as well, stopping outside her tent. Ranran didn’t want to speak to him and muttered from under the blanket, “Shifu, I’m tired and want to sleep early.”

Thinking he would leave, Ranran was startled when Su Yishui reached in and pulled her out of the tent. She thought that Shifu’s demonic side had strengthened again.

But Su Yishui had closed his eyes and tilted his head, asking, “What do you hear?”

Ranran quickly closed her eyes too, focusing and listening intently. After a while, she heard a thunderous sound rolling over.

“What… What is this?”

Su Yishui frowned and said, “It’s the sound of a herd of horses running.”

The herd of horses should still be far from them, but both of their hearing abilities were better than ordinary people, so they heard it early.

Su Yishui got down on the ground to listen carefully, then looked up and said, “There should be around five to six hundred horses in this group, running towards us.”

To avoid attracting attention from the authorities, they were hiding near the border mountains this time. Beyond this mountain was the territory of Gao Kan.

It was late at night, could it be that the Da Qi soldiers were preparing a night raid on Gao Kan’s camp, so the horses were galloping furiously at night?

After about the time it takes to burn an incense stick, in the vast open field below the mountain, a large number of horses were indeed running under the moonlight.

Ranran and Su Yishui stood on the tallest tree on the mountaintop, watching clearly. Contrary to Ranran’s original guess, these horses were all bareback, without saddles or reins, and no soldiers were riding them.

If they were being herded, why would they be herded at night? Moreover, these horses seemed to be running on their own without anyone driving them. Why wouldn’t they sleep at night but instead keep running?

As Ranran puzzled over this, Su Yishui suddenly said, “Let’s go. Go down the mountain and take a look.”

So the two of them went down the mountain with the wind, quickly arriving at the foot of the mountain.

When they reached the edge of the horse herd, under the bright moon in the sky, Ranran quickly noticed something peculiar about these horses.

It seemed like something was attached to the backs of these horses.

Ranran hastened her pace and ran alongside the horses. She quickly reached out and tore off a piece of paper from a horse’s back.

At that moment the paper was taken off, the horse seemed to instantly lose all its strength, neighing and convulsing before falling to the ground, foaming at the mouth, looking to be in extreme pain.

Ranran quickly took out a pill to protect its heart and fed it to the horse, then looked down at the piece of paper in her hand. She immediately recognized it as a beast-control talisman made by Elder Jiu.

Looking up, Ranran saw that the backs of all the passing horses were also stuck with these talismans.

It was obvious, someone was compelling them to run wildly. And with these horses running so recklessly, by the time they reached their destination, they would probably be half dead.

Su Yishui said in a low voice, “These horses should be the ones requisitioned for the Da Qi military camp. Someone is making them run into Gao Kan’s territory, so that the Da Qi army will have no horses to use.”

Ranran gasped at the revelation. Setting aside the jerk sitting on the throne, the current war was related to the safety of the border people of both countries, not just Su Yu’s personal national affairs.

The new king of Gao Kan was a cruel tyrant. It was said that when he was still a crown prince, because he suffered a defeat in battle, he had massacred all the Da Qi villagers he saw along the way, which was truly appalling.

If Da Qi failed this time, the people along the border would probably not be spared. Elder Jiu wouldn’t help such a brutal person even if he was innately mischievous.

Moreover… Elder Jiu has never been one to be interested in current affairs. It was unclear how someone from Gao Kan was so well-connected, and managed to go to Cuiwei Mountain to capture Elder Jiu, and even forced him to use talismans to aid tyranny?

As she thought about this, she looked at Shifu. When their eyes met, they immediately understood each other’s intentions. So the two of them each chose a horse, grabbed the horse’s mane, and rode along with the herd.

The herd quickly crossed the border and entered Gao Kan’s territory.

In front of them, they could see campfires in the military camp. The two of them quickly dismounted and, after some twists and turns, sneaked into the camp.

When they leaped onto a tall tree, Ranran overheard people inside the tent talking, “These talismans really work so well. In a few days, the generals of Da Qi will have to fight in the front lines riding donkeys and plowing oxen…”

Hearing this, the people inside burst into laughter.

Then someone said, “Since we have Immortals assisting us, we Gao Kan will definitely win this time! Why bother sending troops to fight, just use immortal techniques to turn beans into soldiers!”


Just then, a cold and clear female voice spoke, “Don’t forget that there is a price to pay for helping you with these things. You have to spread the word, say that it was Immortal Su from the Western Mountain who assisted you in obtaining these talismans and getting this group of horses.”

The person laughed, “Lady Immortal, rest assured, we understand. The name is Su Yishui right? He and his disciples have offended the Emperor of Da Qi, so they fled in fear of punishment and came to Gao Kan. Our King has already appointed him as the Imperial Advisor.”

The woman snorted, “You better carry out these things well. There are even greater benefits awaiting in the future. Don’t forget to give those horses the spiritual water I gave you. Otherwise, after such long-distance travel, without timely replenishment of spiritual energy, they will drop dead immediately.”

After saying this, the woman strode out of the tent.

In the moonlight, Ranran looked at the woman, feeling like she have seen her before. Upon closer inspection, wasn’t she Elder Tu Jiuyuan under Wei Jiu’s command!

Ranran suddenly understood that Elder Jiu must have been captured by the people sent out by the Crimson Gate Sect. And Wei Jiu instructed Elder Tu, to collude with the officials of Gao Kan, intending to frame and harm the Xishan Sect!

The unwritten rule in the cultivation world has always been to avoid entanglements with the mundane world. Their previous intrusion into the palace had already committed a major taboo, causing dissatisfaction among the cultivators.

And now, if such rumors spread, that Su Yishui has helped the tyrannical King of Gao Kan win a battle, not only in the cultivation world but also within the territory of Da Qi, the Xishan sect would become *immediate targets for eradication!
*臭鱼烂虾 was used here

Wei Jiu’s scheme is truly despicable. When the time comes, Xishan Sect would be crushed by everyone. Even the families of their disciples would face humiliation and abuse.

The Xishan Sect would be completely degraded to the demonic path, with no hope of turning the tide.

” The missing braised pork dinner “

Small complaint but I got confused translating. The author seemed to get confused with the time line and carried away with the long narration of events?

We see Ranran chatting with Xier, and the example about how she was upset after playing with the firefly lantern was from ‘last night’.

Yet, the events of ‘last night’ involved an entire adventure heading into the enemy camp and dealing with a setup involving horses controlled by talismans? But they had just started camping and preparing to braise meat while they chat about their love lives?

Well I suppose we just have to accept that this happened, within those few days haha
If you saw something I missed, please enlighten me!

Poor Su Yishui…..he is trying to share the beautiful scenes that Mu Qingge had shown him before, with her again, but now Ranran feels upset because 1) she feels like a replacement 2) nobody ever feels great thinking about the ex of someone you like lol
But when he did this, did he merely want to make her happy, showing her scenery that delighted her before? Was it for himself to relive the moment and address his own regret?

Perhaps retaining Mu Qingge’s intelligence and maturity, Ranran has never seemed to be just a typical young naive girl, which we got to see in the early chapters, when she advised her parents on how to deal with the village bully.

Here, she was not just some starry-eyed girl who will fall for Shifu’s romantic gestures without question and she tried to understand his frame of mind. I actually really like this.
This way, Ranran won’t like Shifu just because he did nice things for her, and she evaluates her own feelings properly and not blindly rush into anything.

Still, its a good development that she is starting to feel bothered and upset about who Shifu likes.
If she was really so carefree, indifferent and above it all, totally fine with their relationship going back to how it was before the ‘lecherous Spirit Spring’ appeared, things won’t look so good for our Shifu!

One last note

It would seem that in the past Xishan was actually a ‘demonic’ sect right?
I remember that Mu Qingge was supposed to be a talented Yin cultivator, and specialized in demonic cultivation.
Why was it fine back then, but no longer tolerated now? Was it because after the Netherworld realm incident, people no longer trusted those who were on the demonic path?
Life’s so tough for our demonic cultivators, like Wei Wuxian ouch

By the way, if you are new to the world of cultivation, the animated series Grandmaster of Demonic Cultivation 魔道祖师 will really help understand this world of cultivation, forming golden core, riding the wind, using spirit power with a zither, and basically running around subduing demons with a master!

Previous
Next

When Ranran thought of this, she was so angry that she stood up and drew out her small dagger. Su Yishui *sent her a DM to ask, “What do you want to do?”
*I had to sorry! lol maybe it should be SM because… secret message

After her spiritual veins were reconnected on the island, with guidance from Su Yishui, Ranran was now also proficient in the technique to channel secret messages. She glared at Shifu and silently channeled, “Of course, it’s to kill that woman. Shifu, aren’t you angry after hearing this? Why haven’t your eyes turned red?”

Su Yishui cast her a glance and said, “Didn’t you ask me to control my temper?”

Its true, since that day after she spoke to Shifu, he hadn’t verbally attacked anyone again. However, because he had nowhere else to vent his anger, he always took her to see the moon at night, catching fireflies…

Now wasn’t the time for Ranran to praise her master’s efforts in temperament control. After Tu Jiuyuan led her subordinates away, she and Su Yishui followed from a distance to see where she was heading.

Tu Jiuyuan hurried to another tent. Before she could collect herself, a clear voice came from inside the tent, “Elder Tu, you’re back? How are things arranged?”

Ranran, hiding in the bushes, widened her eyes with suspicion. This voice… if she was right, wasn’t it Mu Qingge?

Back when she and her Shifu entered the palace, Mu Qingge had been entrusted to the Yu siblings, Yu Chen and Yu Tong.

But later, she managed to escape. Who could have thought, she would end up here in Gao Kan, and even got involved with Tu Jiuyuan.

After hearing Mu Qingge’s question, Tu Jiuyuan coldly said, “Its just bringing some horses to Gao Kan, not some insurmountable task. What could go wrong?”

Mu Qingge’s voice continued, “The talismans on those horses are the same as the ones Xue Ranran usually use. Many disciples from the three major sects who went to Tianmai Mountain have seen them. My disciple Qin Xuanjiu can also testify. So, whether these horses can come over is not important. What’s important was whether a few talismans fell into the hands of the Da Qi garrison when those horses were driven away?”

Tu Jiuyuan laughed dryly, “Naturally, a few talismans did fall, but I really admire Elder Mu’s mind. You actually came up with such a scheme to frame others? Now, the reputation of Xishan Sect is completely ruined. I wonder what benefits you’ll get from this?”

After hearing this, Mu Qingge in the tent smiled slightly. She knew that Tu Jiuyuan didn’t have a good opinion of her, fearing that she would steal Wei Jiu’s favor.

She couldn’t be bothered with this petty woman either.

What benefits could there be in framing Xishan Sect? There were plenty. She had been reborn, with the hope of using Su Yishui’s indebtedness to her to return to Xishan.

The ice lotus pool in the Western Mountain, the alchemy furnace, and the nurturing spiritual energies of the mountain would all have been greatly beneficial to her cultivation.

But unexpectedly, Su Yishui seemed to have perceived her true identity early on, decisively refusing to let her return. From then on, she was like a stray dog, with no fixed abode.

The Tianmai Mountain incident made her a target of public criticism. Forced to seek refuge in the palace, she was double-crossed by that devious Su Yu. Not only did she end up being used by him, her spiritual power had been damaged by the Trigram foundation of the palace.

When she finally realized that she could be easily controlled by someone with an inadequate foundation like Xue Ranran, it was as if Mu Ranwu finally woke up from her dream.

She did not return to life, just to become someone’s pawn! She was now Mu Qingge!

If she couldn’t fully utilize the resources left by her elder sister, she would have come back to this life in vain.

Therefore, after much thought, she decided not to return to the Da Qi palace. Su Yu probably wouldn’t have long to live either. She needed to find anther patron who could benefit her.

Recently, because of Mu Qingge’s reputation, many of her former disciples came to seek refuge with her. Back then, others thought Mu Qingge was too casual in taking disciples, making her choices based only on appearance.

Little did they know, there were many hidden talents among these disciples.

At present, among her disciples are Wang Sui Zhi, who owns money banks all over the land. There were also several disciples who have joined other sects, resumed their cultivation practice, and are now determined to avenge their master.

Now, even though she had a notorious reputation among the three major sects, her disciples, like Qin Xuanjiu, rushed to her like lambs.

Mu Ranwu used to be unwilling to deal with them mainly because she was afraid of exposing her true identity. But now that her previous plans had failed, she had to rely on these disciples.

Fortunately, she often followed her sister around and was well aware of the disciples’ daily routines, so as long as she was cautious in her words, she wouldn’t give herself away yet.

With the support of Wang Suizhi’s wealth, Mu Ranwu’s days after leaving the palace were quite comfortable.

Unfortunately, Wang Suizhi only had wealth and lacked power and influence. So, she thought of the new King Yiling of Gao Kan. When he was still a crown prince, he had some interactions with Mu Qingge in the past.

Back then, King Yiling wanted to appoint Mu Qingge as the Imperial advisor and recommended her to his father. However, Mu Qingge coldly refused, stating that she was a cultivator and not interested in worldly wealth and glory.

Mu Ranwu was somewhat regretful then, because King Yiling was the most favored prince of Gao Kan and was destined to ascend the throne. Why offend such a person?

But later on, Mu Qingge went back on her words and got involved in worldly affairs, supporting Su Yu to become the new Emperor of Da Qi. This made King Yiling deeply resentful but also confirmed Mu Qingge’s ability to change heaven’s will and rewrite fate.

King Yiling was greatly ambitious from an early age, repeatedly provoking border conflicts even as a prince. Now as King Yiling, his greed had grown, and he definitely coveted the riches of Da Qi.

After Mu Ranwu made her decision, she decided to make use of King Yiling to seek revenge on Su Yu and Su Yishui, these two despicable men!

Although King Yiling was ruthless, he was far easier to manipulate than Su Yu, who was cunning and unscrupulous.

When she appeared with Mu Qingge’s face, even with scars, it still excited King Yiling greatly.

During the Battle of Fan Yao, when King Yiling was still a prince, he had watched from afar. That scene where Mu Qingge had rode a giant dragon, commanding a white tiger on the battlefield, a sight that was unforgettable.

With such a capable Battle Goddess defecting to him, even though King Yiling had been annoyed by her previous refusal, he wouldn’t show it. With Mu Qingge by his side, it wouldn’t be long before he could conquer the land and become the supreme ruler of the world!

As for Su Yu, she would never let him off either. Wasn’t he most concerned about his kingdom? Without it, he would be a pitiful, worthless sickly creature, pitied by no one even if left on the streets!

However, to establish a foothold in Gao Kan, she had to demonstrate some abilities. At the time, Tu Jiuyuan from Crimson Gate suddenly sought her out, offering a spiritual medicine to treat facial injuries and proposing a partnership with their Excellency.

Mu Ranwu felt that there was no need to cooperate with Wei Jiu so she turned her down flatly. She was somewhat wary of that Wei demon. He was also a winner of the marrow-cleansing pool and also practiced the demonic arts. If she wasn’t careful and fell for his schemes, he could drain her spiritual power completely.

But Wei Jiu knew how to understand her intentions well. After mentioning capturing Elder Jiu who drew talismans for Xue Ranran and outlining his plan, Mu Ranwu couldn’t help but be tempted.

After several discussions, they finally reached an agreement. So, she acted as a mediator, bridging the gap between Wei Jiu and King Yiling.

Next was to activate the Gao Kan undercover agents in the Da Qi military camp, attach spells to the horses in the camp, and let Mu Qingge control the horses. They had done a small test before, and the horses with spells were compliant, even seriously injuring a general.

If they fought at the front lines and Mu Qingge suddenly manipulated the Qi army’s horses, the results would be phenomenal. But hearing that many talented individuals from Yiren Hall had recently joined the Da Qi army over the past few days, Mu Qingge was worried that this tactic might be exposed. So, she decided to summon all of Da Qi’s warhorses tonight to destroy the morale of the Da Qi army.

As for Wei Jiu, he seemed to be playing both sides between Da Qi and Gao Kan, and she didn’t know what he promised to Su Yu’s side. Mu Ranwu knew clearly that everyone was just using each other, taking what they needed. It was all about who was more cunning and played the game smarter.

Ranran listened outside the tent and couldn’t help but turn to look at Su Yishui.

She never expected Elder Mu to have become so reckless and indifferent to right and wrong.

Mu Qingge was not just getting involved in worldly affairs but also aiding and abetting, inheriting *Shen Gongbao’s legacy!
*申公豹 Shen Gongbao was a villain in the mythical legends

She didn’t dare to stay here too long, not because she was afraid. It was just that her Shifu was now like a human talisman bottle, unpredictable and volatile in temperament. If he really started a fight, she was afraid it would lead to bloodshed and the Spirit Spring’s demonic nature might even take control of him.

So she pulled her Shifu away from the Gao Kan camp.

When they were out, Xue Ranran quietly asked her master’s opinion. Su Yishui said, “The mandate of heaven cannot be violated in the mortal world. Getting involved in these mundane matters will only damage the cultivation path. Wei Jiu and others like to meddle, let them meddle on their own.”

Ranran felt that her master didn’t grasp the key point, “But they clearly intend to use the loss of the horses to frame Xishan and make us bear the infamy! Also, Elder Jiu seems to be in their hands. Can we really just sit back and watch without saving him?”

Su Yishui seemed to be indifferent to the opinions of others. He was now without parents and attachments, moreover he had never been one who cared about what others thought.

As for him residing in Western Mountain, it was only because Mu Qingge had lived there before. If he couldn’t return to Western Mountain, he could easily find East Mountain, North Mountain, or South Mountain to live in. Cultivators valued solitude, and his worldly possessions had always been managed by Zeng Yi. Building a palace on a mountain top was not a problem.

However, since Ranran cared, he would still help her. He was hard-hearted, unlike her, who was deeply sentimental, whether in this life or the previous one, this had never changed.

Even though he had used her in the past and stolen the Spirit Spring, Qingge had never given up on him. He can betray the entire world, but he still owed Qingge an emotional debt that he can never fully repay.

In the past, he only wanted to become the strongest in the world, using any means necessary, willing to help his father seize the world and then take over.

Because the Spirit Spring had once said that if he could extinguish emotions and sever love, he would become the supreme ruler of this generation, surpassing even the highest great powers like Duntian.

At the edge of the marrow-cleansing pool, he had decisively chosen the dark pool. Emotions and love were useless things, not something he needed at all.

But in the end, his feelings had been stirred without him realizing it. It wasn’t until Mu Qingge took the blame for stealing the Spirit Spring, and at that moment when she lost her life before him, did he realize how heart-wrenching the things he had once abandoned were…

Su Yishui still couldn’t recall how he had spent that period of time. He just let his body drive him, numbly going back and forth to take care of the rebirth tree that may or may not succeed in saving her residual soul.

Every time he saw a new leaf grow on its withered branches, his heart would flutter a bit. It wasn’t until it slowly bore frail little fruits, containing familiar spiritual power, that his long-cold heart finally began to soften a little in the winter chill.

At that time, he swore a vow, that in this life, she wouldn’t have to bear heavy burdens for anyone. Not even for Mu Qingge herself!

Although he felt nothing for things like friendship, he didn’t want her to have any bit of sadness in this life.

Since she was worried about the old drunkard, and concerned that her parents and fellow disciples might be implicated and labeled as traitors, then he wouldn’t let the evil schemes of these people succeed.

Considering these, he replied mildly, “You’re right. What do you plan to do? Tell me…..”

Meanwhile, the Da Qi military camp was already in chaos in the middle of the night.

The warhorses locked in the stables collectively went berserk without warning, ramming the fences continuously. With some unknown strength, they even broke the thick wooden fences and then galloped out of the camp.

Many soldiers trying to stop them couldn’t dodge in time and were knocked down and trampled by the horses.

Watching the horses gallop away while they had no horses to pursue them, the generals and soldiers could only sigh and shake their heads in frustration.

Just as the commander and his generals were watching the dust kicked up by the running horses with urgency and regret, someone found scattered talismans in the stables.

Because Qin Xuanjiu was in charge of the cavalry camp due to military arrangements, he widened his eyes when he saw them.

These animal-controlling talismans were exactly the same as the ones used by Su Yishui and Xue Ranran before. Thinking of the recent rumors about Su Yishui causing chaos in the palace at the Capital, Qin Xuanjiu increasingly shocked and angry.

What was Su Yishui trying to do? First, he attempted regicide, and now he was betraying Da Qi to assist the barbarians of Gao Kan?

Considering Su Yishui’s temperament, such actions were entirely in line with his character. After all, he was the son of a rebel prince. Back then, he was almost restored to his prince status. If he had supported Prince Ping to become emperor, maybe he would have a chance to inherit the throne.

The more Qin Xuanjiu thought about it, the angrier he became. He reported this directly to the commander.

At the same time, Lao Feng from Yiren Hall in the Capital arrived with a group of people, along with representatives from the three major sects.

The Gao Kan army was approaching aggressively, and a massacre was imminent. Although the three major sects were cultivators, Master Kaiyuan of Jiuhua Sect was deeply involved in worldly affairs and had a close relationship with the Da Qi royal family.

He was very enthusiastic about things that accumulated merit like stopping wars. So, this time he led his disciples personally.

As for the other two major sects, they were not interested in these matters, but due to Master Kaiyuan’s persuasion and arrangements, they could only send some disciples to come along to make an appearance.

Initially, it was just a formality for them to show up. Unexpectedly, as soon as they arrived at the military camp, they encountered the incident of someone using talismans to control the horses and lead them out of the camp.

Master Kaiyuan frowned as he listened to Qin Xuanjiu’s hesitant recounting and slammed the table in anger.

“Su Yishui from Xishan has really gone out of line! I thought he was different from his demonic master, relatively upright in character. But now, it seems he has surpassed the female demon Mu Qingge and is on the path to surpassing her completely! Gao Kan, the new king, is cruel, yet he aids him in his tyranny. It’s simply a disgrace to the cultivation world!”

“Master Kaiyuan, you’re mistaken. What ability do I have to compare with someone as unfathomable as Su Yishui?” With a clear voice, Mu Qingge led her disciples who had come to seek refuge with her and walked in gracefully.

This time, all the representatives of the three major sects drew their swords and glared angrily at the woman who had entered.

Mu Ranwu was prepared and calmly said, “That day on Tianmai Mountain, Xue Ranran misled everyone, twisted right and wrong, colluded with Wen Hongshan and slandered me. I couldn’t defend myself, so I had to leave first.”

The newly appointed elder of Kongshan Sect, Wen Chunhui, sneered, “Although Wen Hongshan is a traitor of Kongshan Sect, if she didn’t act on someone’s instructions, why would she do such things? Now that she has been killed by someone in the midst of confusion, you intend to spout nonsense freely?”

Mu Ranwu frowned and said, “I didn’t know the reason at the time, but later I discovered that someone had stuck a talisman on my back. Upon careful reflection, it must have been manipulated when I was on Tianmai Mountain, which led to the act of releasing the Immortal devouring bug. As to this matter, General Qin can testify for me.”

Being called upon by his master, Qin Xuanjiu immediately nodded and said, “Yes, there was indeed a talisman stuck on Master’s body…”

Actually, Qin Xuanjiu wasn’t very clear about the situation on Tianmai Mountain. It was just that later, when he asked his master about the rumors circulating outside, his master explained it this way.

Of course, Qin Xuanjiu believed his master’s words. Moreover, didn’t that damned Su Yishui draw some nonsense runes under his feet? It made him forget to tell his master about the matter of the Spirit Spring at that time.

Master Kaiyuan snorted inwardly but smiled agreeably on the surface and said, “If that’s the case, then we have misunderstood Elder Mu. But since he was once your disciple, and now he’s so audacious, shouldn’t Elder Mu assist us in subduing the monsters of Xishan?”

If they could recruit this bitch Mu Qingge to deal with Xishan, that would be the best outcome. Seeing the former master and disciple in deep conflict and himself reaping the benefits, wouldn’t that be just perfect?

So, after listening to Mu Qingge’s feeble explanation, Master Kaiyuan surprisingly accepted it easily, only wanting to direct the spearhead at Su Yishui and the others right now.

The three major sects had suffered heavy losses in the last Marrow-Cleansing Pool gathering on Tianmai Mountain, with severe injuries and depleted vital energy. Only Xishan sect escaped unscathed and greatly benefited. Recently, many outstanding cultivators even aspired to join Xishan, reducing the number of disciples coming to Jiuhua, which made Master Kaiyuan very uncomfortable. Now he just wanted to destroy Xishan first and make other plans later.

The attitudes of the other sects towards Xishan were also very nuanced. Human nature was such that if someone had a bias against someone, they would believe anything negative about them, seizing upon any pretext to imagine all the crimes they might have committed.

Master Kaiyuan nodded, and others from the various sects echoed his sentiments, filled with indignation. Even if Su Yishui had high cultivation, he still could not escape everyone’s wrath.

Back then, Mu Qingge had also been very accomplished, but what happened in the end? Wasn’t she ultimately killed in the siege of the three major sects?

If Su Yishui was confirmed to have incited chaos in the world, he would become the enemy of the righteous path, and everyone would have to eliminate him! Xishan would then be thoroughly discredited, making it difficult for them to rise again!

Mu Ranwu had long anticipated the small-minded schemes of these righteous sects, so when she heard Master Kaiyuan’s words, she knew that her own game plan was half successful. At this moment, she sighed softly and said with a furrowed brow, “Naturally. When it comes to the past, I also bore many insults for Su Yishui… Perhaps you all don’t know? The demon’s son who came out of the Netherworld Realm back then was actually Su Yishui!”

What?

The faces of all the cultivators of the righteous path changed drastically! Mu Ranwu, as if enduring humiliation for the sake of her wayward disciple, recounted the incident of Su Yishui stealing the Spirit Spring and escaping the Netherworld Realm.

“I always thought he was my disciple, but I failed to teach him well. Instead, I allowed him to develop such ambitions to dominate the world. This was all my fault, so I chose to bear the insults, let everyone misunderstand, and finally sacrificed myself to reform him. But unexpectedly, all my sacrifices were in vain. Su Yishui is still audacious and ambitious, even infiltrating the palace to assassinate the emperor and attempt to defy fate. Before he commits more mistakes, I can only endure the pain of exposing his crimes to prevent everyone from being deceived.”

The elders of the other two major sects listened to this and looked at each other, asking, “Do you have evidence for this?”

Mu Ranwu pretended to sigh, “When you see Su Yishui, you will know that what I say is not false because the Spirit Spring that has been hidden in the mortal world for twenty years is now in him…”

With these words, everyone became restless and anxious.

The Spirit Spring, such a sinister entity, has always brought great calamity to the world whenever it appeared.

Moreover, thinking back, if Mu Qingge had really conspired with the demon’s son, why had she never used the power of the Spirit Spring?

It was the demon’s son who always wore a mask whenever he appeared, never revealing his true identity.

So what Mu Qingge said could very well be true. Su Yishui had actually deceived the world and hidden his identity as the demon’s son.

At this moment, Wang Suizhi, who was accompanying Mu Ranwu, also spoke up, “Wang’s money banks is spread throughout the land. These years, I have been following Master’s wish to search for the entrance to the Netherworld Realm to return the Spirit Spring. Master entrusted General Qin Xuanjiu to guard the Spirit Spring, but later, it seems that Su Yishui has taken it away. Recently, the revival of the demonic sect, Fantian Sect, is also evident. The world is in danger, and it will rely on all of you to turn the situation around.”

Although this Wang Suizhi didn’t have much cultivation, he relied on his immense wealth to collect ancient cultivation artifacts from all over the world. Moreover, he understood the situation clearly back then and didn’t blame the three major sects for his master’s tragic death.

So the people of the three major sects had dealings with this Wang Suizhi before and accepted his financial support. Now, hearing what he said, many doubts from back then about the sudden disappearance of the demon’s son were suddenly cleared up.

“So Su Yishui has still fallen into the demonic path. Since that’s the case, we cannot tolerate evil and let him harm the people of the world. When dawn comes, I will draft a proclamation to exterminate Su Yishui and his followers on behalf of everyone… Do you all agree?”

After Master Kaiyuan said this, everyone naturally nodded in agreement. However, Qin Xuanjiu had some doubts at this moment. In his view, Su Yishui was indeed despicable, but those disciples he had taken in were innocent, especially Xue Ranran, such a lovely and sincere girl.

Previous
Next

白忙一场 ALL IN VAIN


If it’s because of Su Yishui that those children have been led astray, and are now also implicated, made Qin Xuanjiu feel somewhat reluctant.

When he tried to intervene, Mu Ranwu smiled and stared at him, saying, “Xuanjiu, when Xue Ranran deliberately framed me at Tianmai Mountain, can’t you see that she’s not kind or innocent? By stopping this, are you aiding the evildoer?”

Listening to the Master’s words, Qin Xuanjiu fell silent. As for Mu Qingge’s other disciples, they had never seen Xue Ranran, so naturally, they wouldn’t intercede for her.

But just as everyone was drafting the proclamation, they suddenly heard someone outside the camp shouting, “Look! They’re back! They’re back!”

Next, the people inside the tent heard the thunderous sound of approaching hooves.

When everyone came out of the tent, they were all stunned.

In the distance on the plain, there were indeed figures of horses running, but each horse had a rider on it!

The scouts who were shouting realized their mistake and quickly sounded the alarm, changing their call to, “Enemy troops from Gao Kan! Prepare to meet the enemy!”

The righteous cultivators from the three major sects were there to help, and upon hearing this, they immediately took to the sky and formed a defensive formation.

However, as the group of horses approached, they realized something was wrong again. Although there were soldiers from Gao Kan on the horses, they all had dull expressions, seemingly only wearing thin clothes they sleep in and they didn’t even carry weapons while riding all the way here.

At this moment, they were unarmed and didn’t look like they were here for a raid at all!

The one driving the group of horses was a bright-eyed girl with braided hair in a bun.

When the group arrived at the Daqi military camp, the girl jumped down from her horse, stood up neatly, and loudly declared, “Xue Ranran, disciple of Xishan, under the command of the esteemed one, I have come to return the lost warhorses!”

Qin Xuanjiu was the first to step forward and, staring at the girl, exclaimed, “Xue Ranran, what are you up to? Why did you steal the horses first and then return them?”

Xue Ranran had been rather busy with her Shifu all night long. Elder Jiu had felt that they got along very well, and was quite fond of her at the time. In order to retain this girl who could brew wine, even tempting her by promising to teach her how to make spiritual talismans. So he gave her the bag of talismans with this intention, to let Ranran be impressed about Elder Jiu’s abilities and realize how useful these talismans were.

Of course, there was also half a secret manual of techniques for making spiritual talismans inside. Elder Jiu was quite cunning. Although cultivators could all make talismans, cultivating higher-level talismans was as difficult as reaching the sky. If Xue Ranran only looked at the introductory secrets, it was like eating a plate of appetizing peanuts; without the follow-up fine wine, she would inevitably feel curious and eager to learn the next volume.

When the time comes, he could then poach this obedient and lovely little disciple from Su Yishui, brewing wine and cooking for him every day.

It was fortunate that Elder Jiu had harbored such thoughts and Xue Ranran had long memorized the half-book of talisman-making secrets.

Making talismans was essentially solidifying the spiritual power of cultivators and condensing it onto paper.

With just the half-book with introductory information, she couldn’t make talismans, but she had more than enough knowledge to modify them.

So that night, she sneaked into Gao Kan’s military camp’s stables with Shifu. First, she melted calming elixirs into the horses’ drinking water, calming their spirits. Once the horses were calm, she removed all the talismans from their backs.

Modifying talismans required spiritual water, but Su Yishui said they didn’t have to go through all that trouble. He cut his wrist with a knife and had Ranran use his blood to modify the talismans.

Su Yishui’s blood was now demonic, and incredibly powerful. Although Ranran was just a beginner, she infused hundreds of beast control talismans in the bowl of Su Yishui’s blood, turning them into Troop Maneuvering talismans.

Elder Jiu’s talismans, combined with the blood of the demon’s son, was an incredibly powerful combination.

Because the horses had come rushing over, Gao Kan’s soldiers were gathered together, roasting lamb and celebrating with wine. After pouring the half bowl of blood talismans into the wine vat, those soldiers suddenly widened their eyes. In the later part of the night when everyone was asleep, they stood up straight one by one, went into the stables, climbed onto the horses, grabbed their manes, and rode out of the Gao Kan camp.

When the sentries realized what happened, they sounded the gongs and drums, but it was futile.

So each Gao Kan soldier rode a horse and sent these horses back to the Daqi military camp.

Now that the Gao Kan soldiers had dismounted one by one, they all fell to the ground and fell into a deep sleep. That night, Daqi became the one to effortlessly capture hundreds of Gao Kan soldiers.

Now, upon hearing Qin Xuanjiu’s questioning, Ranran smiled and said, “Misfortune may be a blessing in disguise. I can only say that the talismans on these horses were not placed by Xishan. As for now, these horses have returned with hundreds of prisoners of war intact. General Qin, please investigate thoroughly. We Xishan did not collude with Gao Kan to harm the people of Daqi.”

Just then, disciples from the three major sects also gathered around, coldly snorting, “Pot calling the kettle black, what trickery is Xishan up to?”

Although Ranran was unaware that Elder Mu had come to the Daqi camp to stir up trouble, when she saw Elder Mu standing next to the disciples of the three major sects, acting all friendly, she guessed the general idea.

Elder Mu had colluded with Crimon Gate and must have slandered her Shifu again.

The messy account between her Shifu and Elder Mu was hard to calculate. Xue Ranran only intended to clarify the horse theft incident, so with a clasped fist, she planned to leave.

But disciples from Jiu Hua and Kongshan sects jumped out one after another, blocking her way.

“Female demon, where do you think you’re going? You better confess now, where is the demon’s son Su Yishui hiding?”

Growing up, this was the first time Xue Ranran was bring called a female demon, which she was not accustomed to. But when she heard them calling Su Yi Shui as the demon’s son, she couldn’t help but glare at Elder Mu.

She actually divulged this. Could it be because her Shifu had hurt her feelings, and she planned to exact her revenge?
