However, these were also the truth. Ranran felt that her Shifu had indeed been the demon’s son before, and now he does have the Spirit spring. Since there was no need to explain, she didn’t intend to say anything.

In some ways, she should learn from her Shifu and not care too much about what others said, especially the opinions of these negative disciples of the three major sects.

Now that the horses were back and they had subdued the Gao Kan army’s morale, the upcoming battles would be in the secular world, following the will of heaven.

As for the obstruction from the disciples of the three major sects, Ranran was not too bothered. Since the last time her spiritual veins were severed and then reconnected by Su Yishui, she felt that her spiritual power had increased by more than one or two-folds.

However, she didn’t have a chance to compare and wasn’t sure how much she had improved until now, when the disciples of the three major sects blocked her path. With just a wave of her hand, she unexpectedly sent the Jiu Hua disciple flying far away.

Ranran was also startled by this; she didn’t intend to be so heavy-handed. When did the disciples of Jiu Hua become so weak?

Master Kaiyuan felt embarrassed when he saw this.

Since the incident where their top disciples were lost at Tianmai Mountain, Master Kaiyuan had really worked hard to urge his disciples to improve their cultivation. But today, before the people of the three major sects, his top disciple was as fragile as paper, being slapped to the ground.

Master Kaiyuan has always been cunning and crafty. He never acted without absolute certainty. For example, during the battle with Wei Jiu at Jue Mountain, he never made a move, leaving himself a sure way out.

He had also passed the test back then and had entered the Marrow-Refining Pool. Although he wasn’t as outstanding as the younger Mu Qingge or Su Yishui, his nearly two hundred years of foundational cultivation couldn’t be underestimated.

So he didn’t think much of Xue Ranran. Even though she had passed through the Marrow-Refining Pool, she was just a newcomer of the younger generations.

But now Jiu Hua Sect’s dignity was completely lost, and as the leader of the three major sects, the head of the righteous path, Master Kaiyuan had to step forward to regain some respectability.

So seeing Ranran still intending to leave, Master Kaiyuan shook his long robe, and he attacked Ranran directly with his sword.

It had been a long time since the disciples of the three major sects had seen Master Kaiyuan’s skills. But with the spiritual energy of an immortal, containing the aura of a sword, as soon as Master Kaiyuan made a move, one could sense the sword energy moving first, like a cave opening, radiating thousands of beams, making the hair follicles stand up.

Those disciples of Jiu Hua Sect who were good at flattery were already clenching their fists and applauding, “Master, what a move with the Demon-Suppressing Dragon Sword!”

This sword technique was like a rainbow piercing through the clouds, wherever it went, it stirred up the ground, even if Xue Ranran was an outstanding new talent from the Marrow-Refining Pool, what could she do?

Back then, Mu Qingge started losing ground after Master Kaiyuan had pierced her left shoulder with the Ferocious Dragon Sword.

A Daoist Elder who had cultivated for two hundred years could easily teach this unruly little brat a lesson!

Ranran also felt the pressure of Master Kaiyuan’s Sword Qi, which was tens of times stronger than his disciple Wei Fang’s.

But when she leaped and gracefully avoided his fierce strike, she suddenly heard Su Yishui channeling his voice to her: “Old dog Kaiyuan’s weak spot is on the right side of his waist. Aim there more often.”

Su Yishui was familiar with the tactics of the various sect leaders, especially aware of Elder Kaiyuan’s vulnerabilities. He listened to Ranran and didn’t reveal himself in case they evoked his killing intent and he loses control of the Spirit Spring. Instead he used secret messages to give his disciple an advantage, providing her handy cheat notes.

Upon hearing this, Ranran now had a clear target in mind.

She drew out her mechanism staff with one hand, manipulated her vitality qi in the air, causing the staff to lengthen continuously. It spun and twirled in mid-air before she swung it towards Master Kaiyuan’s waist.

This kind of remote manipulation over a staff was usually mastered by cultivators who had reached the Foundation Establishment stage for a hundred years or more. Yet Ranran, at her young age, had already reached a level of mastery where she could control it effortlessly.

Her attack silenced the surrounding crowd. Everyone looked at this previously unknown girl in astonishment.

Even Master Kaiyuan was taken aback, quickly mobilizing his true qi to defend against the rapidly changing staff that was flying towards him.

What surprised him most was how this little girl seemed to know exactly where his vital points were. She kept targeting his waist with the staff.

Although true qi shields were impenetrable and could withstand even a rain of arrows. But they still had weak points. Master Kaiyuan’s waist was the thinnest part of his true qi, vulnerable to attacks infused with spiritual power.

After a dozen or so exchanges, the agile staff suddenly extended and thrust directly at Master Kaiyuan’s waist.

Master Kaiyuan felt his true qi unable to hold steady, and he cried out in pain. The staff pierced through his true qi shield once again, striking his waist point.

His waist had been severely injured during the siege of Mu Qingge. A shard from the explosion of Mu Qingge’s divine artifact had embedded itself there, leaving lingering effects even after healing.

Now, this little girl seemed to know exactly where his weaknesses lay, attacking his vital points relentlessly. How could he defend against her?

But Master Kaiyuan was not one to be trifled with. Sensing that his vulnerabilities had been exposed, he quickly reached for his waist.

At that moment, Ranran heard Su Yishui’s voice again: “He’s going to use the Heavenly Bell Artifact. Retreat quickly and avoid further confrontation.”

The Heavenly Bell was an artifact left behind by the powerful Dun Tian.

Legend had it that Dun Tian’s inner demons were difficult to suppress. So, he refined a bell from the cold iron of the Snow Mountain. It was hung above his head every day. When the demons in his hearts arose, preventing him from meditating in peace, the bell would ring incessantly, emitting a chilling aura to dispel the demonic agitation.

Although Ranran’s cultivation had advanced rapidly, her experience in actual combat was still very limited. If the chilling aura of the Heavenly Bell invaded her body, it would surely cause damage. So Su Yishui told her to retreat quickly.

With this proactive retreat, Master Kaiyuan was given some room to gracefully step down from the fight.

He realized that this battle was not without uncertainties. Although he probaly wouldn’t be defeated, victory might be hard-won and embarrassing. So while the girl retreated, he quickly said coldly, “You’re just a new young disciple in the sect. If I were to kill you now, it would seem heartless on our part. Go back and tell your master, if you don’t want to stray into the wrong path, it’s better to hand over the Spirit Spring soon.”

Ranran actually replied with sincerity, “Please rest assured. Our Xishan Sect has always avoided worldly conflicts. As of now, the Spirit Spring couldn’t be sent back to the Netherworld Realm yet. My master fears its influence on the world and unfortunately lacks a suitable artifact to seal it. He can only temporarily seal it within his body. Of course, if among you there are powerful and virtuous seniors capable of sealing the Spirit Spring, my master is willing to yield and pass this thankless task back to you.”

If Ranran had said this before her battle with Master Kaiyuan, it would have surely drawn ridicule.

What was Su Yishui, who had once given his cultivated core to water the Rebirth tree, even worth? Back then, during the confrontation with Wei Jiu at Jue Mountain, he had embarrassingly admitted openly that he was no match for Wei Jiu.

But now, a new female disciple of Su Yishui could confront the sect leader of Jiuhua without falling behind, even making the usually composed Master Kaiyuan scream like a slaughtered pig. How shocking was this display of strength?

Therefore, although her words sounded grating and rather sarcastic, every sentence was true, making it even more embarrassing.

When Mu Qingge said that Su Yishui was hiding the Spirit Spring, they were still somewhat doubtful. But now, the young girl claimed that Su Yishui was not controlled by the Spirit Spring but had sealed it within his body. This terrifying hidden strength simply stunned everyone.

At this moment, someone else shouted, “Putting aside the lost horses incident for now, but your master caused a huge disturbance in the palace. It is indisputable fact that he had used an evil dragon to assassinate the emperor. The palace suffered numerous collapses! If you’re not harboring malicious intentions, why would such a thing happen?”

Ranran didn’t really feel like engaging with these righteous people who easily believe in rumors and are all too ready to frame their Xishan sect.

“The palace has been raising that dragon privately for over a decade. I believe fellow daoists here have acquaintances in the Yiren Hall in the Capital. Just make a little effort to inquire, and you’ll know the truth. There’s a high-ranking figure in the palace who’s been secretly raising the dragon, even using people to feed it, all in an attempt to prolong life with dragon’s qi. However, that dragon’s malevolent nature is hard to control. Shifu had feared it would destroy the Capital and cause suffering to the populace, so he secretly entered the palace and sent the dragon back to Dragon Island. If Xishan is falsely accused of such matters, then either you’re feigning ignorance or truly malicious.”

At this point, Ranran put two fingers into her mouth and made a loud whistle. A fiery red vermilion bird flew out from the distant woods. Ranran lightly stepped on her toes, gracefully leaped onto the vermilion bird’s back. Facing everyone, especially that Mu Qingge, she said meaningfully, “Cultivation is not easy; it requires maintaining a pure heart at all times. If we look back, in nearly two hundred years, only the Medicine Immortal has ascended among the great cultivators. It seems like many of you are stuck at a certain bottleneck. If you can let go of past grudges, be less competitive, refrain from hasty judgments of others, perhaps your path to ascension will be smoother.”

After saying this, the Vermilion Bird let out a long cry, swirled in the air with its long tail, then flew away into the distance with Xue Ranran…

Although many people had seen Ranran riding the Vermilion Bird before at the foot of the Tianmai Mountain, this time, they were still captivated by the dazzling divine light of the Vermilion Bird.

The Vermilion Bird is different from other divine beasts; it is a sacred and pure entity that wouldn’t form a soul contract with anyone. Only the purest souls could tame it.

The fact that it willingly let Xue Ranran ride, it was in itself a testament to the young girl’s character.

If it were an evil entity, the Vermilion Bird would rather turn into goo and perish together, than willingly debase itself by being ridden by someone malicious.

As they watched Xue Ranran riding the Vermilion Bird and disappearing into the distance, the lingering glow had yet to dissipate. Even if someone wanted to save some dignity by calling her a female demon, they were too flustered to speak.

At that moment, several disciples beside Mu Qingge spoke up, “The young girl named Ranran makes sense. Perhaps we’ve misunderstood…”

Before they could finish speaking, Mu Qingge shot them a sharp look and coldly said, “The appearance of Spirit Spring in the mortal realm heralds great chaos. Su Yishui caused me great suffering in my past life. Do you think he’s changed for the better in just twenty years?”

Master Kaiyuan was still suffering from the excruciating pain in his waist, but he maintained his composure to uphold the authority of the sect. Upon hearing Mu Qingge’s words, he immediately followed with, “The Spirit Spring is of great importance; we cannot let a mere little girl talk nonsense without proof. If what she said is true, it is still inappropriate to leave the Spirit Spring solely in Su Yishui’s care. We, as well as other major sects, need to supervise him and ensure that the Spirit spring is returned to the Netherworld Realm!”

However, each of the three major sects had their own agendas.

Wen Chunhui from the Kongshan Sect clasped her fists and said, “Everyone, the ongoing conflict between Da Qi and Gao Kan is part of worldly fate. The incident with the horses driven by spirit charms serves as a warning. If we cultivators meddle in such mundane matters, we may inadvertently defy fate and bring unforeseen calamities upon ourselves. Now that the horses have been returned, this matter is settled. Our Kongshan Sect has many female disciples; it’s not suitable for us to linger in the military camp. We shall bid farewell first.”

With that, she flicked her horse’s tail whisk and led her female disciples away without looking back.

This newly appointed Elder Wen was not a fool; she originally didn’t want to come here. It’s just that they had to consider Master Kaiyuan’s reputation, she had to come and go through the motions.

Earlier, when Mu Qingge had shifted all the blame onto the deceased Wen Hongshan, it made her very displeased.

And the words that the young girl said before leaving, were even more enlightening for her.

Indeed, how many great talents did the Kongshan Sect produce in the past? But why have they now fallen into such a decline?

Upon careful consideration, this decline seems to have started irreversibly since the siege of Mu Qingge.

The rules of the Kongshan Sect have always been about maintaining a pure heart and few desires, not getting involved in worldly disputes. Unfortunately, the former sect leader, Abbess Wen, and Wen Hongshan have all gone astray, leading the disciples to follow Jiuhua Sect and engage in improper worldly affairs.

If the matter with the Spirit Spring is true, it will certainly be another catastrophe. The foundation of the Kongshan Sect is too weak now, and the disciples are not yet mature; they really can’t withstand turmoil.

Since Master Kaiyuan has a face full of righteousness and that Mu Qingge has a self-sacrificing demeanor, then let them go ahead and save the world.

What she wants is to hurry back to Kongshan, refine more elixirs; if the world falls into chaos, the sect’s gates must be shut even tighter. They cannot keep following Master Kaiyuan recklessly.

On the side, the Elder of the Feiyun Sect is not a fool either. Among the three major sects, the Feiyun Sect was the weakest in terms of strength. Seeing the Kongshan Sect leave in the night, they too used the excuse that their sect leader has summoned their members back for urgent matters. After hastily bidding farewell to Master Kaiyuan, who was clutching his waist, they quickly left as well.

Now, most of the grand momentum of the Righteous Alliance had dissipated, leaving only some lesser-known sects staring at each other, silently contemplating how to leave gracefully without offending Elder Kaiyuan.

In a moment, the offensive launched by the Jiuhua Sect against Xishan had largely subsided.

Mu Qingge also knew that these remaining groups couldn’t produce any substantial outcome. She elegantly asked Master Kaiyuan to devise a plan and inform her, then led her disciples to leave.

She couldn’t reveal to these disciples her secret assistance to Gao Kan. Therefore, she currently resided openly in Wuma Town.

She had thought that with the three major sects leading the charge, they would incite everyone to attack Xishan like they did in her previous life. However, she never expected that Xue Ranran could retrieve those runaway horses and gain the upper hand in the confrontation with Master Kaiyuan.

In the world of cultivation, besides the labels of righteousness and evil, one’s strength spoke volumes. Now that Xue Ranran, a junior disciple of Xishan, had shown her prowess, it was enough to intimidate everyone.

And if the disciple was like this, the master possessed by the Spirit Spring would be unimaginably powerful!

So while exterminating demons and evil was the right path in the mortal world, blindly rushing forward without considering such vast discrepancies in power would be foolish.

At present, almost no one was willing to be a fool. All of Mu Ranwu’s efforts were clearly in vain.

Thinking about how Gaokan had lost so many soldiers as prisoners this time, she felt it would be difficult to explain to Prince Yiling. Mu Ranwu sighed deeply in frustration.

Previous
Next

惯会做人 BEING A GOOD GUY

She glanced at Wang Suizhi beside her. He had been looking thoughtful ever since he saw Xue Ranran fighting Master Kaiyuan earlier.

She suspected he might have noticed something amiss, so on the way back to Wuma Town, she asked, “Xiao Zhi, what are you thinking about?”

Wang Suizhi was no longer the dashing youth of years past, but being called “Xiao Zhi” by his master, he quickly responded, “Just now, I saw the stick that Xue Ranran used. It’s exquisitely crafted… not like ordinary objects, more like the craftsmanship of Old Fourteen.”

Old Fourteen? Mu Ranwu immediately recalled the renowned artisan Zeng Yi. Indeed, he possessed extraordinary skills in crafting; his hands seemed connected to the divine…

Mu Ranwu’s eyes lit up. It would be a pity not to recruit such a talented individual under her banner, wouldn’t it?

She tentatively asked, “Do you know what happened to Zeng Yi?”

Wang Suizhi shook his head, somewhat regretful, and said, “Back then, he was arrogant because of his talent and didn’t get along well with us. Later, when Xishan disbanded, he disappeared without a trace. He never came to find us afterward… Oh, that…isn’t that Old Fourteen?”

As the two were talking, Wang Suizhi, at the market on the border town, actually spotted Zeng Yi who had just gotten off a carriage.

After the incident with the Horse Trading Post, the shopkeeper and his assistants had been captured and not released. The others in the shop had no choice but to send a letter by pigeon to Zeng Yi, asking the boss to handle it.

Zeng Yi wasn’t too far from Wuma Town at the time. Since the incident in the Capital, he had not been able to reach Su Yi Shui and the others, nor did he know about Ranran’s recent situation.

Finally after receiving a letter from Su Yishui, saying he was coming to the border, Zeng Yi brought Bai Baishan and a few servants, hurrying all the way.

Unexpectedly, as soon as he arrived, he encountered an old acquaintance before he could even settle down.

When Third Senior Brother Wang Suizhi suddenly appeared in front of him and called out his name, Zeng Yi couldn’t help but be stunned.

“Old Fourteen, you’re hiding here. Do you know how long I’ve been looking for you?”

Zeng Yi quietly glanced at the woman beside Wang Suizhi, who was wearing a veiled hat and said with a smile, “Yes, Third Senior Brother, long time no see. And this is…?”

At that moment, Mu Ranwu lifted her veil, revealing a face strikingly similar to Mu Qingge from her past life. “Yi’er, it’s me…”

This face had a powerful effect on Mu Qingge’s disciples, bringing tears to their eyes. As Mu Ranwu waited for Zeng Yi to cry and rush over to acknowledge her as his master, Zeng Yi instead hesitated and said, “You’re… my Master?”

Wang Suizhi smiled and said, “Of course, your Master. Don’t you know that your esteemed teacher has been reincarnated on the Rebirth Tree?”

Zeng Yi collected himself and then respectfully greeted Mu Qingge, but there was no warmth in his words.

Mu Ranwu, recalling Wang Suizhi’s words about Xue Ranran’s mechanical staff possibly being made by Zeng Yi and sensing his lack of enthusiasm, tentatively asked, “Yi’er, it seems like you don’t want to see old acquaintances again?”

Wang Suizhi also hit his shoulder and said, “What’s wrong with you? Could it be that you’ve become obsessed with making weapons and don’t even recognize your Master anymore?”

Zeng Yi smiled wryly and said, “Of course not. It’s just that I’m now running a small business to make a living and no longer think about cultivating immortality. If you two have no other business, then I’ll take my leave.”

However, Wang Suizhi stopped him with a hand and smiled coldly, “Master had been generous to you in the past, yet you treat her like this? Could it be that you’ve joined forces with Su Yishui? Is the staff in his female disciple’s hand made by you? I recognized it at a glance… AH…”

Before he could finish his words, he was startled by Zeng Yi who suddenly raised his hand.

On those bare hands, there wasn’t a single finger, which gave Wang Suizhi a start.

Mu Ranwu also frowned and took a step back. “What happened to your hands?”

Zeng Yi explained, “When I was young and reckless, I offended someone, so both my hands were crippled. Now I run a small business, managing hot springs and horse trading, just to make ends meet. I’m just an ordinary person, not adept at cultivating. If you two have no business with me, I’ll take my leave.”

Wang Suizhi felt somewhat ashamed. Fourteen’s hands had seemed disabled for a long time. How could he have made weapons for Su Yishui’s disciple? It seemed that he had misunderstood Fourteen.

Zeng Yi was originally someone was very proud of his talent. Now that he had become disabled, it was understandable that he felt ashamed to meet old acquaintances and didn’t want to recall past events. If Wang Suizhi had known about his difficulties earlier, he would have surely helped this junior brother…

Thinking about everyone, including himself, who had left Xishan for a long time and faced their own difficulties, he felt quite emotional.

However, when Mu Ranwu looked at Zeng Yi’s hurried departure, she only seemed somewhat disappointed, with a hint of regret. “Different paths lead to different destinations. Since his hands are disabled and he doesn’t want to stay in contact with us, let him go his own way.”

What a pity for Zeng Yi’s genius in crafting, but since he had become useless, keeping him around would serve no purpose. Mu Ranwu never was one to waste effort on people or matters that didn’t benefit her.

As she turned away, she didn’t see the brief surprise on Wang Suizhi’s face. Wang Suizhi was a businessman and naturally adept at social interactions.

However, he never expected that after Master found out about Fourteen’s appalling experience, she would be so indifferent, as if she had only heard a story…

Could it be that the Rebirth Tree had made the once chivalrous and kind-hearted Master become cold-hearted?

As for Zeng Yi, meeting this imposter so unexpectedly also gave him a start. But he couldn’t directly expose her identity to his former senior brothers.

Hating that Master’s identity couldn’t be revealed to the world yet. Recalling the words spoken by Su Yishui when he guided her soul to the tree, Zeng Yi knew that in this life, the Master must not become Mu Qingge again.

Changing heaven’s will and destiny always came at a price. Back then, what Master changed was the fate of Emperors!

Now, with the premature fall of the spirit fruit from the tree, changing her birth date and eight characters, having all her spiritual energy *taken over by someone else, Zeng Yi didn’t know if she could escape divine punishment……

There weren’t many people left to protect Master now. But even if he had to sacrifice everything, he would definitely protect Master’s well-being!

Inside Wuma Town, this encounter between master and disciple seemed to have ended without resolution. Back to Ranran, riding the Vermilion Bird, arrived at the foot of the mountain and landed lightly.

She saw Su Yishui who had arrived first, sitting on a large rock, swinging the lantern she had punctured…

Actually, Ranran didn’t know what had gotten into her at that moment. She was angry and had impulsively pierced the lantern. Now, seeing Shifu looking at the punctured painting on the lantern, Ranran felt somewhat apologetic.

Between Shifu and Elder Mu, whether it was grudges or love affairs, it was their business. Did she have any right to lose her temper and damage the lantern that Shifu had worked so hard on?

Thinking of this, she hesitantly approached, took out her snack bag, and handed it to the man. “Eat some, it might improve your mood… um…do you want me to go to town and buy you a lantern?”

Su Yishui tilted his head and glanced at her guilty expression, said expressionlessly, “I don’t want something bought; you have to make it yourself.”

Ranran didn’t know how to make it, but placating Shifu was like placating a child—agree first, figure it out later.

So, after Ranran fed him three candied plums, the demon’s son Su Yishui, was at last in a slightly better mood.

Thus, the two returned to their campsite, now bright with the morning light of the next day.

As they returned, they happened to see Yutong just coming back from the rear mountains. With dew abundant in the mountains, her clothes were marked with water, showing she had been standing in the wild grass for quite some time. Or was it that she hadn’t seen her and Shifu for a while, prompting her to go search?

Indeed, upon seeing them, Yutong asked, “Master, where did you two go?”

Su Yishui replied nonchalantly, “Was there anything unusual last night?”

Yutong paused, not understanding. “Did something happen?”

Ranran couldn’t help but glance at second uncle master. Since their return from the sea island, everyone else was fine, but second uncle master had been absent-minded often. She recalled seeing her shed tears secretly before.

With the grand commotion last night, even sound sleepers would have been awakened by the sound of hooves. Yet second uncle master seemed clueless, clearly having left early yesterday and only returning just now.

Ranran was about to speak, but Shifu suddenly reached out and grabbed Yutong’s neck.

Alarmed, Ranran thought Shifu’s demonic nature had flared up again. Yutong, however, didn’t evade or resist, allowing Su Yishui to snap her neck, her face actually showing a sense of relief.

Just as Ranran was about to intervene, she noticed something odd—Su Yishui seemed to be channeling his spiritual power forcibly into Yutong’s body.

Su Yishui’s current spiritual power, was tinged with demonic energy, and surged like turbulent waves. Though Yutong had some foundation in Qi cultivation, she couldn’t withstand it. Soon, her meridians bulged, and something resembling an egg protruded from her abdomen to her throat.

At that moment, Su Yishui released his grip and Yutong collapsed to the ground, retching until she finally expelled something like a golden-shelled beetle.

Ranran was startled. She had initially thought it was an Immortal Devouring bug, but it seemed different, being bulky and unable to fly.

She raised her foot to step on it, but Su Yishui stopped her. He stooped down and scooped it into his water pouch, sealing it before tossing it into a distant mountain stream.

“That thing is poisonous; do not touch it. Now, if you have something difficult to say, you can say it,” Su Yishui finally spoke.

Yutong fell to her knees, tears already streaming down her face. “Master, my son was taken by Su Yu’s men. I never intended to betray you… If not for worrying about my son, I would have died for my sins long ago.”

At that moment, Yuchen, Gaocang, and Qiu Xier have heard the commotion and arrived as well. Seeing this scene, they were stunned.

It turned out that Su Yu somehow learned about Yutong’s family in the town below Western Mountain.

Just before they set off for the Capital, they sent people to capture her lover and son. But Yutong was unaware until later, when she found out, they already had leverage over her.

Later, Su Yu’s men located Yutong and forced her to swallow this Heart-Devouring Worm.

This worm not only could release poison but also transmitted sound and sensations, a genuine eavesdropping insect.

In other words, everything Yutong saw or heard would be transmitted intact to Old Feng, who controlled the worm.

If Yutong dared to reveal anything, they would immediately kill her son and her lover.

Although Yutong intended to sever worldly ties eventually, but it would be done knowing that these two are safe and sound, doing well.

Now, trapped in such a situation, although Yutong was loyal to Master, she didn’t know how to choose. If she spoke directly to Master, Old Feng would know immediately and likely harm her son. But if she left and refused to be Su Yu’s informant, Su Yu still wouldn’t spare her son and lover either.

Thus, Yutong could only try to avoid conversing or mingling during meals, even deliberately avoiding gatherings at night, to prevent any important information pertaining to the Spirit Spring from reaching Su Yu.

Last night was no exception. She ran to the rear mountains, cried her heart out, hence missing the exciting stampede of horses.

Here, the terrain was peculiar, a natural barrier. When circling to the rear mountains, all sounds, including the sound of hooves, were muffled, so she didn’t know what happened last night.

Ranran, hearing this, finally understood. She asked in a small voice, “Did you leak the incident about Shifu possessing the White Tiger?”

Yutong nodded in shame, then shook her head. “It should have been when I was chatting casually with Xu Lang before, and mentioned it in passing. Little did I know Su Yu would scheme like this, exploiting that and nearly endangering Master…”

Xu Lang was her lover from the town below. Who would have thought these words would indirectly reach Su Yu’s ears!

Curious, Ranran asked how Shifu had discovered the eavesdropping insect in second uncle master’s belly.

Su Yishui explained, “By right, it couldn’t be discovered. But these past days, she hasn’t eaten, but the worm in her belly is a greedy one. Due to her stagnant Qi, just now, I heard the insect’s noise…”

Ranran understood then.

Yuchen was enraged, stomping his feet and yelling at his sister, “I told you before, since you serve Master, how could you secretly start a family down the mountain? Now look, you’ve given them leverage, letting others control you and even committing treason! You, you…”

As he spoke, he suddenly pulled out a dagger, pulled open his clothes to reveal his chest, and cried, “My sister has done unforgivable things which is her elder brother’s fault. I can only repent with death. I beg Master to spare my unfortunate sister…”

Saying this, he thrust the knife towards his chest. But Yutong flew over, trying to grab the knife to kill herself. For a moment, the siblings struggled, both vying for death, making for a lively scene.

Ranran went up and snatched the dagger away, tossing it far down into the ravine. Then she took a deep breath and said, “Who’s right and who’s wrong can be discussed later. Su Yu has people in his hands, and that child is only six years old. He might be terribly frightened now, still waiting for his mother and uncle to rescue him. If both of you die, are you going to let Shifu handle this task?”

In Western Mountain, the weight of little junior sister’s words was second only to the Master’s.

With her command, everyone began searching for the waterskin pouch. Su Yishui’s strength was too much, and thrown it too far, they nearly lost it for good.

However, the little bug seemed to be at its last breath. When poured out of the water bottle, it flapped its wings a few times before it just died.

Yutong knew that if the bug died, it would surely reveal that things had gone wrong to the other side. Thinking that the father and son might lose their lives because of her, she felt a surge of sadness and grabbed the dead bug, intending to swallow it.

Qiu Xier, watching this, covered her mouth and retched, feeling like she could skip today’s meals again, so she could still lose more weight.

Finally snatching the dead bug from her, they heard someone shouting loudly at the foot of the mountain, “By His Majesty’s decree, Miss Xue Ranran is requested to receive the edict!”

The ones from Xishan glanced at each other. They hadn’t expected that as soon as the bug died, someone would arrive so quickly.

When Xue Ranran descended the mountain, she saw several palace attendants under the escort of Daqi guards, holding a sealed yellow-lettered message.

The letter was personally written by Su Yu to Xue Ranran.

He seemed to have anticipated that the bug would be discovered by Su Yishui. In the letter, he apologized on behalf of Lao Feng, attributing the incident to Lao Feng’s unauthorized actions. He mentioned that the child and the scholar had been brought to Wuma Town and have been settled in a courtyard.

Such understanding words made it seem like a genuine misunderstanding.

By the side, Su Yi Shui had a faint redness in his eyes.

It would seem that Xiao Yu was still good at playing people. Knowing Ranran’s birth secret, he wanted to appear as the good guy in front of her.

Using a child to coerce his mother was an utterly shameless act, and there was no good way to put it.

If Su Yishui hadn’t discovered the bug and this goodwill letter had arrived earlier, it would have seemed like Su Yu had discovered his subordinates acting inappropriately and took the initiative to admit it. The Emperor would have appeared as an honest and upright man before Xue Ranran…

This desperate attempt to please and ingratiate oneself was truly admirable! In her past life, “Xiao Yu” had gained Mu Qingge’s trust step by step this way, gradually alienating him…

Thinking of this, he couldn’t help but grab Ranran’s slender arm firmly. Ranran, sensing his demonic nature resurging, though unsure of the reason, reached back and held his arm, saying softly, “Uncle Master Zeng Yi should have arrived at Wuma Town. If Shifu is worried about deception, we can ask Uncle Master Zeng to send someone to verify first.”

As her hand rested on his, the faint redness in Su Yishui’s eyes gradually dissipated.

Since their whereabouts were now known, staying on the mountain was useless. They might as well return to town.

The eunuch smiled at Xue Ranran and continued, “When His Majesty was unconscious, some subordinates didn’t understand the situation and even put your portraits on wanted posters. His Majesty is much better now and has ordered your portraits, along with those of the other immortal masters, to be taken down. Please rest assured and go ahead to town.”

After delivering the message, the eunuch instructed the others to descend the mountain.

Hearing that the emperor had ordered the release of her son and Yu lang, Yutong was eager to descend immediately.

However, Su Yu was a cunning one, so they still waited a day to gather information, before returning to Wuma Town at last. Gao Cang and Qiu Xier went to the notice board and confirmed that their wanted posters were gone.

The incident of the horses had also been clarified, so the employees from the Horse Trading Post were also released.

Zeng Yi stood at the entrance of the Horse Trading Post to welcome Ranran. The son of the second uncle master and the scholar Zhao Xuan were brought over by her.

After Su Yishui checked their vitals and confirmed they were not poisoned, the second uncle master hugged her somewhat emaciated son in tears.

And so the warm bedding and the braised pork finally fell into place after a series of ups and downs.

While Ranran and third senior sister went to take a hot bath, Zeng Yi and Su Yishui had a private conversation.

“After Su Yu made such a big fuss, why did he act so kindly all of a sudden?” Zeng Yi had already planned to shut down all his businesses and follow Xue Ranran and the others in exile, roaming the world, but unexpectedly, things took a turn.

When he finished asking, not hearing a reply from Su Yishui, he turned to look and saw him sitting cross-legged there, hands clenched. Although his expression was calm, the veins on his arms were bulging, obviously silently resisting the sudden resurgence of his demonic nature.

Seeing this, Zeng Yi sighed slightly, took out a string of transparent glass prayer beads from his pocket, and handed them to Su Yishui. “These are the calming beads that Master begged from the Tower of Eternal Life when you fell into demonic tendencies back then. Wear them close to your body to alleviate some of the demonic nature. Unfortunately, I didn’t have the chance to give them to you before, so I held onto them. Now they can be of use again…”

Before he could finish his sentence, Su Yishui snatched the glass prayer beads away. When he put them on his wrist, a refreshing chill came, and indeed, the demonic nature slightly diminished.

“There’s nothing difficult to understand about what he’s doing. He must know that the Spirit Spring is in my possession. For the safety of the mortal realm, he can’t wait for me to find the entrance to the Netherworld realm quickly and return it. Moreover, he hasn’t died yet; someone must have given him some temporary relief, but to completely rid himself of the ailment and pain, he needs to visit the Netherworld realm. So, until we find the entrance to it, we’re temporarily safe.”

After calming his restless thoughts, Su Yishui explained slowly.

Zeng Yi nodded, sighing, “I know you’ve always resented Master for altering your fate. But you should also understand, if it weren’t for Master changing your destiny back then, even if everything had gone according to your wishes, what would have been the outcome…”

Su Yishui didn’t speak. He stood up and went to the window, where he could see the backyard of the horse trading post. Two girls who had just finished bathing were in the yard, looking at a newly born foal.

The young girl with slightly damp long hair was smiling exceptionally dazzling as she stroked the foal’s mane.

Su Yishui calmly touched the prayer beads on his wrist. Only he knew that he did indeed resent her, initially because she altered his destiny. But later on, he realized that his resentment towards her was just a little too much… What exactly was mixed into this resentment, only he himself knew…

Zeng Yi had gotten used to Su Yishui not responding. He thought he had hit the mark on Su Yishui’s thoughts and sighed before continuing, “Although you helped Master be reborn, you cannot bear the divine punishment for her. But when Master fell back then, she was not yet ripe, and we don’t know if altering her birthdate would be beneficial to her…”

This time, Su Yishui finally spoke, “I won’t let anything happen to her…”

Assured, Zeng Yi nodded, “When I arrived in town, I saw that Elder Mu, and the former senior brothers were all around her. Her deception will eventually dishonor Master’s name… What do you think, should we tell them the truth to prevent them from being deceived?”

So I guess the timeline is correct.

In Chapter 59, Ranran and Xier were washing the meat by the stream, and it sounded like they were still camping out? So it was their last night in the mountains before they moved back to town.

The night Ranran went to watch fireflies with Su Yishui and poked the lantern, they then solved all of Xishan’s problems in that same night.
After returning the horses, she fought with Master Kaiyuan ( still that long night ) and succeeded in dispersing all the righteous sects ( still night lol ) gathered to wipe out Xishan and foiling Mu Ranwu’s evil plot.

The next morning, they found out about Yutong’s situation but Su Yu then proceeded to remove their wanted status.

They only went back to Wu Ma town the next day, since they opted to wait a day.

So I guess they had braised pork two nights in a row, one in the mountains and once when they all had a reunion dinner back in town.

Previous
Next

各怀心事 EVERYONE HAS THEIR OWN THOUGHTS

Su Yi Shui replied coldly without hesitation, “No need. She is not Mu Qingge anymore, and she does not need any disciples to burden her. She has done enough for them in the past. If they are blind enough to insist on recognizing an imposter as their master, then they only have themselves to blame! As for that imposter, I promised Mu Qingge that I wouldn’t harm her sister’s life. I cannot break that oath. But if Mu Ranwu seeks her own demise, no one can stop her.”

Zeng Yi hadn’t seen Su Yishui so scathing in a long time.

He had thought that time had healed the once solitary, arrogant and extreme young man. But now, possessed by the Spirit Spring, he once again realized that Su Yishui’s heart was still so cynical and contemptuous, difficult to get along with.

Thinking that he had actually taken on three other disciples in addition to Ranran, it all seemed so inconceivable. He remembered asking Su Yishui the reason for accepting disciples.

Naturally, Su Yishui’s answer wasn’t about spreading knowledge, or passing on the immortal heritage. It was because if Ranran was the only young person on the mountain, he feared that she would feel lonely and out of place when she had to leave her parents behind.

After all, she had always been fond of making friends, in this life and the previous one.

Thinking of their fellow disciples who are around the imposter now, Zeng Yi sighed silently. But Su Yishui was right. In her past life, Master had taken on too many burdens, and he didn’t want her to still be so exhausted in this life, always giving to others…

He would have to find a chance to hint to those who have gone to the imposter. He could only hope that they wouldn’t remain blind for too long and would soon recognize what were the differences in their master.

As Zeng Yi sighed, Ranran’s little face appeared at the window, and she called out to the two inside with a smile, “Shifu, Uncle Master, it’s time for dinner! I stewed the braised pork before taking a bath, and it’s ready now. Third senior sister also picked some greens from the backyard to wrap the meat with, which is perfect for alleviating greasiness!”

Since the disciples of Xishan had not yet become immortals, they were quite indulgent in their appetites. Even though they had not feared the authorities’ pursuit as wanted criminals, they still stayed hidden in the mountains to avoid unnecessary trouble. Finally, they could sit down peacefully at a table for a meal.

The dishes on the table were plentiful. Besides Ranran’s braised pork, there was also locally famous roasted lamb leg, along with sweet onion scrambled eggs.

Uncle Zeng Yi felt it was inappropriate to use his feet at the dinner table with everyone, so he had his specially made spoon fitted onto his palm to eat.

The second senior brother, who came with Uncle Zeng Yi, kept glancing around at the dinner table.

Regarding second uncle master’s coerced betrayal of Shifu, Bai Baishan was actually rather pleased. If that were the case, he won’t be the only wayward disciple in Xishan. If Shifu didn’t punish the second uncle master, does it mean that his return to the sect might be imminent?

Now that his feet skills were considerable, and he wanted Shifu to see his efforts, during the meal, without saying a word, Bai Baishan took off his shoes and stretched out his legs, using chopsticks to pick up the biggest piece of meat in the bowl.

But his way of eating was quite unwelcome. He had barely picked up one bite with his chopsticks when Qiu xier and Gaocang pushed him off the table together.

Qiu Xier warned the second senior brother in a low voice, she was saving his life—Shifu’s temper was volatile now, and if the second senior brother dared to eat like that, he should be prepared for his legs to be broken.

The second senior brother felt a chill after hearing this. He put on his shoes again, eating his meal properly with his hands.

The little son of Yutong, named Nuo Er, sat next to his mother, eating with a oily shiny mouth and eyes lighting up, praising Sister Xue’s cooking skills.

While everyone was happily dining together, the distant outskirts of the town rang out with the sound of horns. It seemed that Daqi and Gao Kan had started fighting.

This inevitable battle was looming, and with the sound of distant horses’ hooves, the food on the table seemed less appetizing. So, after hastily finishing the meal, everyone went back to their rooms to rest.

At night, hearing the distant rumbling, Ranran couldn’t sleep peacefully. Suddenly, she thought she heard some movement next door, so she looked at Qiu Xier sleeping soundly beside her, carefully got up, put on her clothes, and walked out of the horse post.

At this time, during the ongoing battle, the city was under curfew. But Ranran didn’t intend to walk on the streets anyway; instead, she chose a secluded spot on the city wall and leaped lightly up.

Sure enough, sitting on the city wall was a familiar figure. Ranran walked over and sat beside him, whispering, “Shifu, the winds are cold at night, be careful of the chill…”

While speaking, Ranran suddenly noticed that Shifu had seemed to lift his sleeve and look at his arm earlier. Although he quickly put it back down, she still saw the black-line-like blood vessels bulging on his hand—signs of Spirit Spring’s demonic spread…

After Su Yishui covered his sleeve, he turned to look at her and said lightly, “The lonely moon in the desert is not something you can see anywhere else…”

Ranran followed his gaze and indeed saw the moonlight pouring down. The desert was like snow, this was different from the scenery in the mountains.

She suddenly thought, on this wall, who else had Shifu moon-gazed with?

Thinking of Elder Mu’s increasingly arrogant behavior, Ranran felt it necessary to have a talk with Shifu.

When she was in the military camp, it was entirely out of consideration for the old friendship between Elder Mu and her Shifu, that she endured without exposing her collusion with Gao Kan.

If Elder Mu continues to act recklessly, she will harm Shifu sooner or later. She wanted to ask her Shifu if there was still Mu Qingge in his heart. If there was, could he advise Mu Qingge to be a better person.

Thinking that she might have been the sister of such a woman in her previous life, Ranran really felt that it was good to not remember anything. Otherwise, having such a familial bond with such a selfish person might be really emotionally exhausting.

Thinking of this, Ranran sighed softly. Although she intended to advise, she didn’t know how to bring it up, especially considering her somewhat ambiguous relationship with her Shifu right now.

When Su Yishui draped his cloak over Ranran, she inexplicably asked, ‘Shifu, have you ever loved a woman?’

After asking, she immediately regretted it a little. Her Shifu had almost become an immortal couple with Wen Hongshan before, and later, he had been entangled with Mu Qingge. Recalling when he had kissed her, it didn’t seem like he was inexperienced and unsure, so asking this was really unnecessary!

With such a handsome appearance, outstanding demeanor, his romantic history is probably more than just these.

She asked about such private matters out of the blue; her Shifu is not going to tell her about them.

But Su Yishui, after listening, gazed at her very seriously and then asked, ‘What is love? Is it when your emotions are easily swayed by someone? Getting very angry at her, yet still unconsciously wanting to see her? Is it feeling excruciating heartache only after experiencing loss, living numbly? Or knowing that it can’t last forever with her, yet greedily wanting to……leave a trace in her heart?’

Ranran was at a loss at being asked. She had never loved anyone, so how could she understand such intense emotions as Shifu had described.

But the way he described it so vividly, it seemed that he had truly experienced love.

The person who could sway her master’s emotions and make him feel the pain of loss……probably only Mu Qingge!

Ranran suddenly realized that she had been holding her breath, and her chest seemed to have a sharp pain from not inhaling. Although this was something she had guessed long ago, when she heard it from his lips, she felt strangely uncomfortable.

Thinking of Elder Mu’s ruthless treatment of her Shifu, Ranran continued in a dull voice, ‘Shifu, what you just said may not be actually love. It’s just the irreconcilable feelings towards what has not been obtained… or maybe it could be just wishful thinking. If she doesn’t like you, why are you so stubborn not to let go?’

This seemed to hit the man’s vital spot, and now, its his turn to stop breathing for a long time. When Ranran looked up, she saw Shifu’s expression of unbearable anguish, and his eyes started to redden again…

Oh no, why did Shifu’s demonic nature flare up again? Just when she thought her Shifu was going to bend down to kiss her, the man, with a frosty expression, stood up abruptly and dashed out like a sword…

Ranran was left alone in the cold wind, wanting to chase after Shifu but unable to find his trace. Although her skills were improving, she was still far behind her master…

The next day, the streets of Wuma Town were crowded with soldiers returning from the front lines for rest and recuperation. People on the streets were also discussing the miraculous event of the celestial soldier appearing on the front lines yesterday.

It is said that during the battle between Daqi and Gao Kan’s armies yesterday, due to the fierce cavalry of Gao Kan, Daqi was in a declining position, losing ground.

Unexpectedly, a ghostly shadow flashed by, completely unrecognizable in the dark night, fast as lightning, and all the Gao Kan soldiers it touched were thrown off their horses and captured on the ground.

Just this single ghostly figure reversed the situation and led to Daqi’s victory in the first battle.

The barbaric cruelty of Gao Kan’s soldiers had terrified the people at the border for a long time, so when they heard about this miracle, everyone exclaimed that the deities had come to help. It’s just that no one knows which deity has such divine power.

While eating lamb dumplings on the street, as Ranran listened to the excited discussions of the two little commanders at the next table, she also stole glances at her Shifu. She then whispered, ‘Shifu, you told me that earthly matters have their own fate, and we cultivators shouldn’t interfere casually…’

Perhaps others didn’t know who this divine figure was, but Ranran immediately guessed that it was her Shifu who had unleashed his demonic nature last night. His demonic nature seemed to have gotten stronger now and could no longer be suppressed by just kissing.

So those Gao Kan soldiers became his punching bags. Fortunately, her Shifu’s will was firm, and he didn’t kill them all, just pulled them off their horses, coincidentally helping the Daqi officials turn defeat into victory, saving the villagers of several nearby villages…

After hearing her question, Su Yishui appeared unwilling to respond. After taking a bite of the lamb dumplings on the street, he frowned slightly in dissatisfaction, as if he didn’t quite like it.

As Ranran looked at her Shifu, she suddenly felt a burst of pride in her heart. Even if her Shifu himself thought he was bad, she knew he was definitely a good person!

Thinking of this, she immediately leaned close to Su Yishui’s ear and said, ‘Shifu, just eat a bit for now. I’ll make you steamed soup dumplings and sweet chestnut eight treasures chicken for lunch alright?'”

Su Yishui turned his head to look at the young girl smiling sweetly at him, and his heart couldn’t help but give a lurch. He reached out with his long finger to wipe the oil from the corner of her mouth, then said expressionlessly, “And sweet and sour fish……”

Ranran nodded vigorously, then picked up a dumpling and fed it to her master’s mouth. This time, Su Yishui obediently opened his mouth and ate it, seeming to be less picky now.

The master and disciple were feeding each other and enjoying their meal together, but on the other side of the street market, a man standing on the balcony of a tavern widened his eyes in anger.

Tu Jiuyuan watched as Master kept his eyes on the master and disciple in the distance, and cautiously said, “Excellency, Su Yu is still waiting for you in the secluded valley. Shouldn’t you hurry back now?”

Wei Jiu cast a side glance at her with a dark sinister expression and said, “Do I need you to instruct me on what to do?”

Tu Jiuyuan lowered her head and remained silent. But she knew that just now, when Master was looking at the master and disciple at the dumpling stall, there was undisguised jealousy in his eyes…

Thinking of this, Tu Jiuyuan felt a wave of sadness in her heart.

But Wei Jiu didn’t think he was jealous; he just hated Su Yishui, that thousand-year-old fox, for always being one step ahead of him.

Back then, he and Su Yishui had encountered Mu Qingge nearly at the same time. He had tried hard to please her but failed, while Su Yishui, stood out by being aloof, and caught Mu Qingge’s favor.

Later, when Mu Qingge had a falling out with Su Yishui, Wei Jiu thought it was his chance. He tried to approach her again, expressing his willingness to become her disciple, only to be flatly rejected once more.

The seed of resentment was planted, and Wei Jiu just couldn’t swallow this slight. When Mu Qingge faced retribution and perished, thinking that he would have to carry this frustration with him until the end of time, made him so enraged that he madly chopped down trees by himself in the forest.

Later, when he learned that Mu Qingge had reincarnated on the tree, he felt somewhat comforted. He vowed to seize the opportunity this time, setting up schemes by using the Grudge water, in order to control Mu Qingge firmly within his grasp.

Who knew that Su, that fox, would snatch an immature fruit and take it to his fox den early on?

He, Wei Jiu ended up wasting his efforts again!

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu couldn’t help but feel hateful! It was just eating dumplings, yet as master and disciple, *they actually behaved so intimately. When Ranran sweetly whispered in Su Yishui’s ear, Wei Jiu felt like his clenched fists could drip blood.
*你侬我侬: 两个人（多指情侣）关系很好，很恩爱。
Two people ( often a couple ) being very close and loving

He wasn’t a clueless kid about emotional matters; with just a glance, he could tell that this pair definitely harbored other feelings.

Su Yishui’s depravity surpassed that of twenty years ago! He only had to use small tricks, and Ranran who was still in her blooming youth, was grasped in his palm, giving him everything he desired.

Wei Jiu finally took a deep breath and stopped looking at the pair in the distance, turning around and striding downstairs.

After all, his feud with Su Yishui was far from over! This time, he had ventured into the Black Pool, and his cultivation also surged forward. If he could obtain the Spirit Spring, Su Yishui would be nothing then?

He was determined to one day crush Su Yishui into a pulp before Ranran, to show her which man was truly worthy of her!

Meanwhile, at the dumpling stall, the master and disciple settled their bill and got up. As they passed by a wine shop, Ranran couldn’t help but sigh softly, “Tu Jiuyuan has Elder Jiu’s spiritual talismans; that means he’s in Wei Jiu’s hands… I wonder how he’s doing now and when we can rescue him…”

At that moment, Su Yishui suddenly put his arm around her shoulder and said every word with emphasis, “Remember, I gave you this life. You owe no one, especially not to sacrifice yourself to save anyone else.”

Ranran thought Shifu’s tone was inexplicably serious, finding it somewhat amusing yet also touching, “Who says I owe no one? Although I don’t remember who I was in my past life or what happened, I’ve owed Shifu since birth!”

Su Yishui remained silent, saying quietly, “You don’t owe me; our debts are settled. You just need to focus on cultivating and fulfilling your path to immortality.”

When he said this, for some reason, Ranran felt a strange sense of detachment and indifference in his tone, as if the man who had kissed her before wasn’t him at all…

Ranran couldn’t help but think of the hidden room in Tianmai Mountain echoing with laughter from wife and children, the medicine field cottage and younger brother in the Illusory Realm of the Medicine Immortal.

When she ascended as an immortal, would she also hide away bits of memories about Shifu somewhere, occasionally revisiting them before leaving indifferently?

Ranran sighed and decided to eat more plums to suppress the sourness in her heart.

Human or Immortal, from her perspective, everyone wins some and loses some, making it difficult to find true fulfillment.

As for Su Yu, he was not in the palace at the moment but in the Blood Pool of Crimson Gate’s Mo Valley. Wei Jiu’s method to prolong Su Yu’s life was quite sinister, a method rarely used even among practitioners of the demonic path, involving transferring illness from one person to another.

Generally, this method was used to transfer sickness from a sick person to a healthy one. Mu Ranwu had used a similar method to treat the Prime Minister’s son before.

However, Wei Jiu’s method was even more vicious; most people who underwent this process died eventually.

Su Yu had once lost his soul, with his meridians severed. The person donating their health to him also needed to be a cultivator.

As Yiren Hall’s newly admitted couple of extraordinary beings were bound to iron chairs, and their spiritual energy was continuously absorbed into Su Yu’s body, his pale and emaciated body suddenly seemed revitalized, as if watered by celestial waters, and gradually regained vitality.

Even the fine lines around his eyes miraculously disappeared, making him look over a decade younger all of a sudden…

The body, once frail from prolonged illness, felt light and invigorated. This feeling was truly addictive.

However, Wei Jiu lazily commented, “Your Majesty, this method’s effect is short-lived and requires an increasing number of donors. If the process is interrupted, the backlash from the illness will be stronger. Therefore, for a permanent solution, we still need to find the Spirit Spring and utilize its power to ensure Your Majesty’s eternal well-being.”

Just two days ago, the Prime Minister’s son’s old ailment recurred with a vengeance, even before the court physician could be summoned, he had already breathed his last.

This led Prime Minister Lim to burst into tears, cursing Mu Qingge for deceiving and harming people.

Compared to that, Wei Jiu was more careful, explaining the pros and cons to Su Yu in advance, and also pointed out a more permanent solution.

Su Yu knew that Wei Jiu’s intentions in saying this were not about curing illnesses or saving people. He simply wanted to use the Spirit Spring as bait to manipulate a sovereign against Su Yishui.

However, when strong players teamed up, the game was always one move ahead. Whether one gained an advantage or suffered depended entirely on individual abilities.

Reports of front line battles would be timely conveyed to Su Yu, including the sudden appearance of a divine figure on the battlefield.

The border situation in Great Qi was stable, allowing Su Yu to breathe a little easier. The aftermath of his soul loss still lingered, and any disturbance on the front line would require a great deal of spiritual energy.

“Your Majesty, Miss Xue Ranran has not accepted Your Majesty’s kindness to stay at the Wu Ma Town Compound but has temporarily taken refuge in a horse stable.”

Su Yu nodded and calmly said, “Since she is unwilling, let it be as she wishes. However, prepare the clothing, equipment, and spring water from Huizhou Mountain for tea and the fragrant rice from Liu’an; deliver everything to the stable. She’s accustomed to fine things, and I fear she might suffer following Su Yishui…”

Before he could finish his words, Wei Jiu on the side laughed with his legs up, “I used to think Su Yishui was hypocritically detestable, but now I realize that everyone in the Su family is like this. Truly, talents emerge one after another, each with their own strengths! Now you were the one who put them on the wanted list, and you also watched as Mu Qingge framed Ranran. But looking at your words and actions now, I would think you’re her closest kin!”

Su Yu pretended not to understand the sarcasm in his words, continuing warmly, “Lord Wei, you also know that people do irrational things when they’re angry. Like you, my enemy is Su Yishui. I thought we had reached a consensus and formed a temporary alliance. But now you’ve brought Great Qi’s horses up to Gao Kan; what is your intention?”

Wei Jiu raised an eyebrow, “I only said I would join forces with you to deal with Su Yishui. As for your war with Gao Kan, that’s not within our consensus.”

Su Yu understood Wei Jiu’s meaning; in order to trip up Su Yishui, he would go to any lengths. As for whether Great Qi would win or lose in battle, he didn’t care at all, nor would he make any guarantees.

After all, Su Yu still relied on him for extending his life, and Wei Jiu didn’t care about this Emperor at all, let alone show any reverence.

Su Yu smiled faintly and didn’t speak further. Wei Jiu stood up, preparing to leave.

Unlike Su Yu’s superficial flattery, Wei Jiu always valued overpowering strength.

Although Su Yishui had the Spirit Spring, he did not dare to fully activate it and instead used his own body to imprison it, which became his fatal flaw.

Even if Su Yishui took Ranran as his disciple, so what? Without ability, how was he qualified to teach disciples?

Wei Jiu once again thought of the moments he spent with Xue Ranran on Tianmai Mountain. Ranran had been the one to give him a handful of dried sweet potatoes first, and always found reasons to talk to him.

From this perspective, Ranran’s initial impression of him was not too bad. Thinking of the scene where they fought side by side against the Immortal Devouring Bugs, Wei Jiu’s heart was stirred.

As for that Su Yishui, being possessed by the Spirit Spring again, it probably wouldn’t be so easy for him to come out unscathed.

Of course, Ranran didn’t need to sink with the declining Xishan Sect; the gates of Crimson Gate were wide open to welcome her. By then, she would realize that his abilities were far stronger than Su Yishui and could help her recover her cultivation sooner…

Twenty years ago, Wei Jiu unconsciously competed with the cultivator Su Yishui at every turn, and this unresolved emotions had turned into a demonic obsession. Now, discovering that Su Yishui had once again taken the lead, how could he just let it go?

Thinking of this, he waved for someone to escort Su Yu out. This young chap full of smiles was the most sinister; by prolonging Su Yu’s life, he had put the biggest stumbling block in Su Yishui’s path.

Su Yu didn’t mind Wei Jiu’s disrespect towards him. Just before leaving, he gently reminded Wei Jiu, “Your grievances are with Su Yishui, and Ranran is just a naive girl. She only cares about her master, so please bear with her…”

Wei Jiu felt that Su Yu was really shameless. Ranran was not the property of the Great Qi’s Majesty; what did it mean for him to speak like a patriarchal figure?

Oh no Ranran, stop telling your Shifu that Mu Qingge doesn’t love him…
That poor guy lol How much more can he take? That’s two times now lol

I wonder if Wei Jiu is the example by the author of who Ranran meant, someone who is stubbornly hanging onto unrequited feelings lol He obviously is obsessed with Mu Qingge, but he is in denial about it…

Previous
Next

身有奇能 EXTRAORDINARY TALENT

Su Yu’s sentence “she only cares about her master” was indeed displeasing to hear.

After saying these words, Su Yu got up and boarded the dragon carriage. He had been away from the Capital for too long, and the important ministers and nobles in the capital were probably restless by now.

But that was fine; it was just the right time for everyone below to do their own thing, to see how they form alliances and make their moves. When he returned and gave a show of his wrath, they would know just how little they matter.

Preparing to return to the Capital, Su Yu looked up at the sky. On his face, which had regained its handsome and youthful appearance, there was a hint of a wry smile. He then ordered the eunuchs around him to quickly set off for the Capital.

Because he knew that although Great Qi’s current war was going smoothly, the border conflicts no longer required his worry. However, a second life-and-death battle was soon to come here.

And what he had to do was watch the tigers fight from afar, hoping that this great battle would deplete the cultivation and spiritual power of these cultivators.

The previous setbacks in the battle with Gao Kan had made Su Yu even more vigilant now. Once these cultivators harbored evil intentions, they posed the greatest threat to the supreme Imperial authority!

Thinking of this, he sighed softly. If Qingge had known that he was so apprehensive about cultivators, would she still have changed Su Yishui’s destiny as emperor?

However, no matter what she thought, he didn’t think he was wrong in doing so. Once one is in that position, one’s thoughts and actions were beyond one’s control. If Su Yishui had taken that position, he would probably have been even more tyrannical.

Since ancient times, an emperor’s gentle affection signaled the downfall of a nation. Thinking of this, he slowly closed his eyes, no longer looking at the rolling dark clouds outside the carriage that signaled an impending storm…

The Chief Steward by his side had served Su Yu for many years, and back then, he had also witnessed the interactions between the young emperor and the War Goddess. His Majesty’s worry for the War Goddess was understandable.

However, he couldn’t help but feel that His Majesty’s words to Wei Jiu just now was not entrusting her into his care, but rather a provocation, stirring up Wei Jiu’s jealousy. Thinking of this, the old eunuch in the palace understood it all too well.

But remembering the War Goddess who had once treated his leg injury, the old eunuch sighed quietly in his heart.

May good people receive good rewards; may the War Goddess live a peaceful life this time…

After seeing off the Emperor who had been granted an extension of life, Wei Jiu waved and summoned Tu Jiuyuan, “Has the elder from the Fantian Sect left?”

Tu Jiuyuan nodded, “They have left after sending Elder Jiu here. But… Your Excellency, the Fantian Sect has been silent for hundreds of years, and now they suddenly emerge to cooperate with you in finding the Spirit Spring. Do you think it might be a trap?”

Wei Jiu sneered, “These few think I’m a fool and want me to stick my head out for them. Since that’s the case, why not play along with their wishes? Has that Elder Jiu drawn the Soul-Cleansing talisman I wanted?”

Tu Jiuyuan replied in a low voice, “Drawing the talisman consumes spiritual energy. When that Elder Jiu drew the Beast Control talismans, he had already expended most of his spiritual power. These days, he’s been clamoring for wine and refuses to draw more talismans…”

Wei Jiu coldly snorted, “Since he wants it, give it to him!”

Tu Jiuyuan hesitated, “But whenever he drinks, he gets drunk for a day, then wakes up and demands more…”

Wei Jiu frowned, “That old thing, you find a way to deal with him. Tell him that if he refuses again, we’ll push him into the Spirit Python Pool. When the pool of spirit snakes biting and entwining him, it will surely cure his alcohol addiction!”

The efficacy of the Soul-cleansing talisman is not inferior to reincarnation. Since he did not receive the Spiritual Fruit initially and missed Ranran’s reincarnation moment, perhaps it wouldn’t be so bad if he could let her forget about her present life again and let him become her master.

Thinking of Ranran calling him softly as her master while blushing in his arms, Wei Jiu’s mind wandered off for a moment as he raised his cup towards the red moon in the secluded valley and took a sip…

The border battles continued unabated, but the soldiers of Great Qi became more courageous as they fought, quickly pushing the front lines towards Gao Kan’s borders.

Although Wuma Town was not as bustling as usual, many merchants from outside the border rushed into the town to avoid the war, making it lively.

However, Su Yishui did not relax his demands on his disciples because of the border conflicts. Especially for Ranran, who had now regained her strength and opened her spirit channel, she could now practice the Thousand School Sword Technique.

This was the unique skill of all Sect leaders of Xishan, and as the face of Xishan, Ranran naturally had to learn it.

However, unlike controlling just one sword, the Thousand School Sword Technique required simultaneous control of five short swords, each with a different trajectory and role in actual combat.

Ranran could easily control one sword, but when it came to two swords, she struggled, let alone controlling all five swords at once.

When Su Yishui threw a handful of soybeans towards Ranran, she could only rely on her spiritual power to block them with her sword.

Unfortunately, the two swords didn’t listen at all, let alone slice through the densely packed soybeans.

As a result, all the beans landed on her.

When Su Yishui threw them, the beans had some vital force, so they hurt quite a bit when they landed.

But before Ranran could cry out in pain, Su Yishui’s face had already turned cold as he rebuked sternly, “While controlling the swords, why did you drop your spiritual shield? Do you really think your sword aura is impenetrable and can withstand attacks?”

Ranran knew she was at fault and could only explain, “Shifu, I was momentarily distracted, so…”

“No excuses. Do you think you can always rely on the protection of others? If one day I’m not by your side, with your current level of cultivation, can you protect yourself?”

When Su Yishui reprimanded her coldly with a serious expression, the senior disciples practicing nearby quietly slipped away, leaving Ranran alone to receive the lecture.

Although Shifu’s temperament had been unpredictable since being possessed by the Spirit Spring, he had always been good to the little junior sister.

However, recently, Su Yi Shui seemed even stricter with Ranran, making people hesitant to even try to persuade him.

Ranran lowered her head, listening to the reprimand from her Shifu. When Su Yishui finished, she raised her head and said in a small voice, “Didn’t you say you wouldn’t let me marry? Why can’t I always stay by your side?”

Su Yishui pursed his lips and looked at the teary-eyed young girl. He paused for a moment and said, “Your talent far surpasses ordinary people, and your progress in cultivation will be fast. One day, you will ascend to immortality, and naturally, I won’t be by your side then.”

Ranran did not understand, “Shifu, are you saying that your cultivation level is far above mine, and when you ascend to immortality, you’ll leave me behind?”

Su Yishui fell silent for a moment and said quietly, “I was being too hasty. But the principles of controlling swords depends on your own understanding. If you can grasp the key points, your progress will be faster… Practice on your own; I’m going to meditate.”

With that, he turned and walked towards his room.

Ranran silently watched Su Yishui’s tall figure. Through his white collar, she vaguely saw a black line like a blood vessel appear on the back of his neck.

She knew that the black line on his wrist had now spread to his neck. Once the black line encircled his neck, he would completely succumb to demonic influence.

The power of the Spirit Spring lies in destruction, catering to people’s inner desires, fulfilling the wishes of the host without restraint, thereby igniting greater greed in the heart.

However, Su Yishui went against the norm, constantly suppressing his greatest desires. Naturally, this provoked the backlash of the Spirit Spring. Once these long-repressed desires erupted, the demonic nature would also be multifold, with unimaginable consequences…

Ranran originally hoped that she could help Shifu by being a pleasant diversion and alleviate his demonic nature. But recently, he had been avoiding her. His aesthetic mood of getting her to look at the moon and flowers at night with him, also seemed to have disappeared.

She thought he had gotten weary of it. After all, reminiscing about the past with an unrelated person *was rather pointless.
隔靴搔痒 literally: scratching outside the boot

Until later on, she discovered that every nightfall, Su Yishui had Uncle Master Zeng Yi use chains made of xuan iron and a golden talisman to chain himself in the mountains outside the town.

If she hadn’t encountered Uncle Master Zeng returning at night, and that he wasn’t good at lying when she tried to sound him out, wouldn’t she have been kept in the dark?

When Ranran followed Uncle Master Zeng to the mountains, watching her Shifu resist the demonic nature with great effort while being chained by xuan iron, she couldn’t hold back her tears and rushed towards him.

Her Shifu, who was usually elegant like an exiled immortal, had to endure such torment in private. When she tried to approach, Su Yishui didn’t allow it, only struggling to tell Uncle Master Zeng to take her away.

The longer the Spirit Spring resided, the stronger the demonic nature became. It always tried every means to tempt him into doing things that would fulfill his desires but harm Ranran.

So Su Yishui could only seal himself with the xuan iron chain and the golden talisman during the night when the demonic nature was strongest, while staying in the mountains far away from Ranran, to suppress the turbulence in his body. He did not want Ranran to see his current sorry state.

The human heart, is always insatiable. He had originally thought that just staying by her side and watching her grow step by step would be enough. But later, how did he gradually become more greedy, longing to kiss her, longing to see his reflection in her eyes?

But now, just hugging and kissing passionately wasn’t enough anymore. When he smelled the faint fragrance on her body, he madly wanted to imprint her deeply into his body…

He could not ask for anymore. Su Yishui couldn’t control the expanding desire from the Spirit Spring, so he could only lock himself up when the demonic nature was strongest at night.

Ranran wanted to accompany her Shifu on the mountain, but Uncle Master Zeng Yi stubbornly dragged her down.

“He’s always been cold by nature, and when he had been possessed by the Spirit Spring, he almost killed you… his Master… So, when it’s nighttime, it’s best not to get close to him. He’ll be fine when the sun comes up.”

Looking back at the mountain, Ranran could faintly hear her master’s painful sobbing through the dense forest. She asked softly, “How did my Shifu break free from the Spirit Spring’s entanglement in the past?”

Uncle Master Zeng Yi sighed heavily, “You went to the Capital with your master, so you should know some past events. He was a concubine’s child of Prince Ping, without a father’s care since childhood. His mother suffered unfair treatment in the household, and his heart naturally harbored resentment. Besides, he was born at the most Yin hour. Prince Ping, influenced by evil arts, planned to use him to inherit the Spirit Spring, hoping for a smooth ascension to the throne. So when Su Yishui joined the cultivation sects, he had ulterior motives. He was young at the time but cunning, always scheming, always manipulating… If it wasn’t for you… My Master who discovered it in time, he would’ve almost become a demon king… You know the rest. My Master exhausted her life force to remove the Spirit Spring from him, later fell into a trap, and ultimately perished……”

Uncle Master Zeng Yi was originally talking about Su Yishui, and Ranran was listening attentively. Unexpectedly, he suddenly shifted the focus to her: “So, remember, don’t bite off more than you can chew. Life is precious, and you have attachments; your parents are getting old and waiting for you to care for them. Never put yourself in danger, like going into the mountains with your master, without thinking of your parents, forgetting your filial duties!”

Ranran listened with her mouth half-open, feeling like taking one more step towards the mountain would turn her into an unforgivable villain who was unfilial to her parents.

But deep down, she knew her Shifu was also losing control of the Spirit Spring. She just didn’t know when they would find the entrance to the Netherworld realm.

On this night, even though she didn’t go up the mountain, she waited at the foot of the mountain all night. When the sky turned light, Ranran who was leaning against the tree, sensed someone approaching and opened her eyes immediately.

Shifu had already descended the mountain, his usually clear eyes showing signs of exhaustion as he draped his coat over her.

“Shifu, are you feeling better”

Su Yishui lowered his head to look at her and said, “Why have you been here all night?”

Ranran looked at the black lines on his neck which seemed to have grown more, sighed silently, and stopped asking. Instead, she asked, “Shifu, when will the entrance to the Netherworld realm appear?”

Su Yishui shook his head slowly and said in a low voice, “If we still don’t have the location of the entrance seven days from now, I’ll have Uncle Master Zeng Yi take you away.”

Ranran asked again, “And what about you?”

Su Yishui lowered his gaze and said, “The Spirit Spring is an ultimate Yin entity and cannot be destroyed, but I will find a hidden place, sever my meridians, draw it out, and then seal it…”

“NO!” Ranran panicked upon hearing this, grabbing Su Yishui’s hand.

Su Yishui squeezed her hand back, noting the calluses on her once soft palm from daily sword practices in Xishan.

Just like her twenty years ago, whenever he was sick, she would touch his forehead with her callused hand. That woman in red would be in all smiles and sit by his bed, coaxing him to take medicine: “Be good Yi’er, after drinking this, I’ll give you salted longan fruits…”

He always seemed to see her smiling, even at the moment of death, when she was knocked away and saw him in mid-air, she still had a calm smile…

In the years that followed, he always wondered if her last smile was in self-mockery. Did she ever think that if she hadn’t taken in a traitor like him back then, would she still be untroubled, laughing at the world like Elder Jiu, living carefree, unrestrained and free?

Ranran saw at her master looking at her, but lost in thought again. She couldn’t help but hug his neck and said softly, “Shifu, no matter when, I will never abandon you.”

Since leaving the sea island, everything had gradually returned to how it used to be. Su Yishui hadn’t indulged himself for a long time, to be so affectionate with her.

After a night of torment, this tender intimacy seemed to be the best comfort. Su Yishui slowly reached out and hugged Ranran.

In the dim light of dawn, the two couldn’t help but embrace and kiss again…
