When Ranran got a little delirious from the kissing, her thoughts vaguely wandered to that time during sword practice, when Shifu said he wouldn’t always be there with her. Had he already made up his mind to die?

The thought of him dying alone in a secluded corner suddenly brought a sharp pain to Ranran’s heart. Her body went completely limp, and she fainted in Su Yishui’s arms.

When Ranran woke up again, she was already back in a room at the trading post, with familiar herbal root water boiling on the stove.

Qiu Xier was pouring medicine and let out a long sigh of relief when she turned and saw Ranran awake.

“Young Madam, you finally woke up. What happened? Did your old illness flare up?”

Since joining Xishan, Ranran hadn’t had a relapse for a long time. So she just shook her head and said, “Maybe I caught a cold. I should be fine after taking the medicine.”

Qiu Xier sighed in relief, feeding Ranran the medicine and saying, “Many refugees have arrived in town recently. The old temple is crowded and there are beggars everywhere. But that Elder Mu seems interesting; her disciple Wang Suizhi is recruiting disciples with a signboard. Only orphans without parents with handsome looks are accepted. Our Xishan Grandmaster hasn’t changed her tastes indeed!”

Ranran couldn’t tell if Elder Mu was good or evil now. After all, the woman in Shifu and Uncle Master’s words and the present her, was like a completely different person.

But Elder Mu taking in disciples was a good thing, just like in her past life, helping more orphans and preventing them from starving to death.

When Ranran got up, she asked where Shifu was. Upon hearing that he was in seclusion again, she understood that he might be unsettled and needed solitude, so she didn’t disturb him.

After she had enough sleep and felt fine, she took Qiu Xier to the town to buy groceries as usual. The disciples of Xishan were accustomed to her cooking, so whenever Ranran had free time, she would personally buy groceries for cooking.

As they walked near the western entrance of the town, they indeed saw Wang Suizhi asking dozens of street children one by one, preparing to select some with excellent aptitude.

Having nothing else to do, Ranran carried the basket of vegetables and listened nearby.

The standards set by Elder Mu for accepting disciples were quite peculiar. She didn’t inquire about their backgrounds or examine their spiritual veins; she only asked about the children’s birth dates.

After recording all the details, Wang Suizhi instructed his attendants to read out the selected children’s names.

Ranran always had an excellent memory. Even without pen and paper, she silently memorized the birth dates of the dozen or so children before her.

As the attendants read out the names, she watched the children’s excited expressions and matched them one by one, realizing that Elder Mu seemed to have a preference for children born in the twelfth lunar month.

The twelfth lunar month marked the transition to spring and was known for its heavy yin energy according to folklore. Did the fortune teller calculate this Elder Mu? Saying that these yin-heavy disciples would greatly benefit her?

When Wang Suizhi looked up, he noticed a young girl holding a basket of vegetables on the side, watching the commotion… It turned out to be Xue Ranran, who had confronted the head of the Jiuhua Sect that day!

He involuntarily took a step back, looking at her warily but with a polite smile, asking, “May I ask what Miss Xue is doing here?”

Ranran pointed to where he had set up his tables: “This is where the old lady sells dried tofu. You’ve occupied it, so the old lady can’t set up her stall, and I can’t make leek and dried tofu stir-fry tonight.”

Thinking she had come with hostile intentions, Wang Suizhi didn’t expect her response to be so down-to-earth.

One of his attendants, feeling indignant, spoke up, “This town is guarded by General Qin Xuanjiu. We’ve requisitioned this place with the general’s permission.”

However, Wang Suizhi waved his hand to stop the attendant’s rudeness, respectfully greeted the old lady who had been waiting nervously by the side for a long time, and then had the table removed to make way for her stall.

As Wang Suizhi was about to leave, he saw that Xue Ranran had bought all the dried tofu from the old lady.

Wang Suizhi smiled, “It seems Miss Xue really loves dried tofu!”

Ranran also smiled, “It’s already past noon. Even if the old lady sets up her stall, there won’t be many customers. I might as well buy it all. How about it? Does Elder Mu like dried tofu? I can’t finish all of these; I can give you some.”

Upon hearing this, Wang Suizhi was momentarily stunned, then blushed slightly. Although he had come from humble origins, he had become successful in business and hadn’t experienced for a long time, the hardships of setting up an open-air street stall and earning a few coins.

Obviously, he was the one who had been choosing orphans for a long time, even unintentionally occupying the old lady’s stall. Yet, he didn’t think about compensation when he was about to leave… In comparison, he was not as good as this disciple from Xishan, who showed more empathy for the poor.

“This…by rights I should pay for it. How can I ask you, Miss, to compensate?”

Ranran smiled slightly, “It’s not much money; please don’t be standing on ceremony with me, sir.” After speaking, she had Qiu Xier give Wang Suizhi half of the basket of dried tofu.

Although there had been discord between the former master and disciple of Xishan, they were still of the same sect and its not too much to share some dried tofu together.

*One doesn’t hit someone who smiles at you; although Master had a falling-out with Su Yishui, but Xue Ranran, as his disciple niece, was quite lovable.
伸手不打笑脸人 can’t bear to hit someone smiling at you

So Wang Suizhi could only accept it and then pondered for a moment before saying, “Miss, you have a very kind heart. If you head east in the city, fortune awaits you there.”

After that, he left with his entourage.

Ranran was somewhat skeptical of his words, but since the east side of the city wasn’t far, she decided to take a walk there.

As a result, as soon as she arrived at the eastern market, she accidentally stumbled on a stone under her foot. When she looked down, she saw a piece of silver that someone had dropped, just enough to cover the cost of the dried tofu.

So when everyone gathered for dinner that night, Ranran casually mentioned this incident. Zeng Yi, upon hearing it, wasn’t at all surprised and said, “The disciples of Xishan are not all lacking in spiritual energies; it’s just that their way of awakening is a bit unique and doesn’t enter the eyes of those prestigious sects. For example, Wang Suizhi, do you know why he is so wealthy and can rival a nation? It’s all because he can discern the flow of wealth without missing a detail. Picking up money is not a difficult task for him. However, it’s really stingy of him to let you pick up just that little silver.”

Zeng Yi seemed to look down on the calculating Wang Suizhi, and after speaking, he even snorted coldly.

Previous
Next

魔花盛开 DEMONIC BLOOMS

Ranran nodded in admiration after hearing that.

Thinking it over, the former disciples of Xishan were indeed all extraordinary. Qin Xuanjiu was always able to escape death with his good luck, Zeng Yi had a natural talent for exquisite craftsmanship, and now Wang Suizhi’s ability to find wealth everywhere was truly astonishing.

Qiu Xier was very fascinated by such extraordinary skills and kept asking if she could also practice such divine techniques?

Zeng Yi smiled wryly, “Such divine skills are innate talents, how could they be trained after birth? But what exactly is Wang Suizhi doing by recruiting so many orphans born in the twelfth lunar month?”

As Yutong added vegetables to her son’s bowl, she said, “What else can it be? It’s just an old habit acting up, finding some fresh youthful faces to please the eye…”

She stopped abruptly, realizing that her master was also recruited by Mu Qingge for his appearance to please her eye. She was afraid of touching her master’s emotional scar by mentioning it.

However, Elder Mu was no longer associated with Xishan and she now had a disciple who could attract wealth. She wasn’t short of money and it was her own business to have as many disciples as she liked.

As long as she didn’t provoke her Master now, it’s all fine.

When Wang Suizhi brought those orphans back to see his Master, some of the attendants on the side spoke out about encountering Xue Ranran.

Mu Ranwu, who had just finished meditating, slowly raised her head and stared at Wang Suizhi, asking, “What do you think of that girl?”

Wang Suizhi didn’t understand the meaning behind his Master’s question and honestly replied, “Seems to be a amiable girl…”

Mu Ranwu’s eyes, hiding sharpness in her gentle gaze, immediately shot over, calmly asking, “Is it just because she takes care of the elderly? Back on Tianmai Mountain, she was the one who accused and slandered me……that’s the same amiable girl that you speak of. “

Thus reminded by his Master, Wang Suizhi was jolted awake and quickly said, “Please rest assured, Master. I shall bear in mind and not be deceived by her facade again… But it seems that Old Fourteen has a good relationship with Su Yishui. Currently, the Xishan disciples are all living under Old Fourteen’s Horse Trading Post.”

Mu Ranwu thought of Zeng Yi’s bare palms and didn’t care much.

Just a useless person willing to associate with Su Yishui could go right ahead. After all, the capable disciples of her sister were now gathered around her; she was not lacking a disabled person with crippled hands!

Seeing that his Master still seemed upset, Wang Suizhi tried to ease the tension, “Master, now that you are taking in more disciples again and will find a famous mountain in the future, I will definitely build a palace for you that is no less than Xishan. You can establish your own sect and make it flourish. By then, how can Xishan compare to you? But Master, you must cherish your reputation and not give others a chance to slander you again. I noticed some people from Gao Kan came to visit you recently…”

After giving him a glance, Mu Ranwu smiled slightly, “Although I have never had private dealings with the Prince of Yiling, it’s normal for him to send someone to visit me since he has long admired the Immortal way. Why? Do I need to report my every action to you?”

Wang Suizhi quickly waved his hand, saying he wouldn’t dare. His Master always acted as she pleased; how could he expect her to report everything to him?

Mu Ranwu didn’t say much more and waved for Wang Suizhi to leave. Her sister’s disciples were all trained by her to be quite rigid; it seemed she needed to be more cautious about her connection with Gao Kan. After all, she now relied on these disciples for support.

Moreover, the Prince of Yiling in Gao Kan was just a lame duck. She had already given him the beast-control talismans, yet they were foiled by Xue Ranran, *allowing her to look good before the three major sects, Mu Ranmu felt stifled.
*露了脸 : 光榮、很有面子

Surrounded by useless people, unable to improve her cultivation, and watching Xue Ranran, a sickly child, gradually catching up to her, it was really frustrating.

So Mu Ranmu decided to take a different approach and find simpler ways to replenish the spiritual energy that she lost while staying at the palace.

Thinking of the method unintentionally mentioned by Tu Jiuyuan, Mu Ranwu was initially unwilling.

She knew that the spiritual energy she had snatched from her sister was righteous celestial energy, not of the demonic kind.

If she really used Wei Jiu’s method, it would deviate her from the righteous path. But seeing Xue Ranran already able to fight Jiuhua’s Master Kaiyuan and gain the upper hand, Mu Ranwu no longer cared about right or wrong.

Wei Jiu had also relied on depriving others of their spiritual power to rapidly increase his own power, so Tu Jiuyuan’s replenishment method was feasible.

But she had to do it secretly, without anyone noticing. Because she was reincarnated from the tree, she needed children of utmost Yin to match.

So she had Wang Suizhi recruit children born on the most Yin days of the twelfth lunar month.

Children with innate talent often opened their spiritual channels much faster than adults. Once these children had a foundation, she would absorb their spiritual energy, and they would at most become weak and sickly, and nobody would notice.

Seeing the dozen or so dirty children Wang Suizhi brought, Mu Ranwu breathed a sigh of relief. After all, with her foundation, such talent should not go to waste?

“Big sister, in this life, I will never let you surpass me!”

The border war ended faster than expected.

Because right before the war, hundreds of officials and soldiers from Gao Kan had been captured, and with the sudden appearance of a divine shadow during that previous battle, all sorts of superstitious rumors emerged.

The country of Gao Kan was originally superstitious, reverent towards gods and spirits, so this greatly affected their morale. The Prince of Yiling was furious, repeatedly asking his new Imperial Advisor Elder Mu why there were no response plans.

But Mu Ranmu ignored him completely. She relied solely on her disciple the General, hiding in Wuma Town and not coming out. In the end, the envoys he sent had never returned.

The King of Yiling suspected that the envoys had been killed by Mu Qingge, but without seeing any sign or bodies, he was furious and suspected he had been fooled by Mu Qingge again, wondering if she was still working for Daqi and had set him up?

From this moment, the vengeful King of Yiling completely hated this Elder Mu.

Although the war had temporarily ended, the days of continued warfare had left widespread grief, and the bodies that were yet to be buried attracted crows that refused to leave.

After Gao Kan’s army withdrew, Mu Ranwu led her disciples through the desolate grasslands where the armies had fought. It was already autumn. The autumn wind was bleak, but red flower buds began to bloom on the gradually yellowing grass…

Mu Ranwu squinted at the flower buds on the ground, feeling a sense of familiarity.

Suddenly, she remembered that before her sister entered the underworld in her past life, she had also seen such a splendid and bizarre patch of red flowers near the entrance to the underworld.

She couldn’t help but look up at the sky, seeing it covered in dark clouds, a sign of the most Yin and cold energy converging. Even if she hadn’t read the “Records of the Fantian Sect,” she guessed that this was an omen of changes in the world.

Thinking that the disciples of Xishan had been staying here without leaving, were they waiting for something?

While thinking about this, people arrived on the other side of the wilderness as well. Su Yishui had brought his disciples from Xishan to this place.

Mu Ranwu glanced at Qin Xuanjiu behind her, feeling confident. Even if Su Yishui realized she was an imposter, so what?

Based on his character, he would definitely not want her sister to continue using Mu Qingge’s name. That dog emperor didn’t care who she really was either. Compared to Xue Ranran, who followed Su Yishui wholeheartedly, Su Yu needed a war goddess who could stand by his side, whether she was real or fake. As for Wei Jiu, it seemed he didn’t want to expose Xue Ranran’s true identity either.

So Mu Ranwu was very composed now. But with her present strength, she was not ready for a direct confrontation with the Xishan sect.

And these red flowers seem peculiar; she needs Xishan to go and investigate first. So when Su Yishui and the others arrived, Mu Ranwu only coldly indicated they should go back, without even waiting to meet face-to-face, she turned and left.

When Ranran saw Wang Suizhi, the God of Wealth, she wanted to greet him kindly and thank him for his tip for last time. But Wang Suizhi just glared at her coldly and then turned away.

Ranran couldn’t help but feel embarrassed. She stuck her tongue out at Qiu Xier beside her, but before she could comment, she was attracted by the red flowers on the wilderness.

The killings at the border of the two countries had finally accumulated enough Yin energy, and strange flowers is about to bloom on the blood-stained land…

The most intense battlefield where the two armies fought was filled with bloodshed, and the red flowers there really flourished, already forming a sea of red.

It’s important to note that this is a deep autumn grassland, where the green grass has already turned yellow. And at this time, the emergence of red flowers with no name is indeed strange and unusual.

After the soldiers of both countries withdrew, the nomads’ horses and cattle continued to come to the wilderness to graze. However, wherever there were red buds with hook-shaped petals, the horses and cattle refused to approach, even if the nomads whipped them, they just stood there crying out.

Ranran looked at the flower buds before her, feeling that their dark red color resembled coagulated blood clots, and their shape, like fierce eagle beaks, exuded a murderous aura.

She couldn’t help but think of the line from ‘Records of the Fantian Sect,’ ‘Eagle Beak Demon Flower, opens by chasing blood.’ Were these flowers, born from bloodstains, the Eagle Beak Demon Flowers recorded in the book?

It seemed that Shifu’s speculation was correct; these vicious flowers did bloom on the battlefield covered with corpses.

“……How come there are so many Eagle Beak Flowers? Could it be that evil spirits are emerging again in this world?”

Ranran followed the sound and saw an old herdsman sitting on a horse suddenly hoarsely saying.

“Old Uncle, do you know these flowers?” Ranran asked curiously.

But when the old herdsman turned his head, Qiu Xier beside Ranran cried out in shock.

It turned out that the old man was thin with a face full of wrinkles, and only had two deep-set eye sockets on his face, with both eyeballs missing.

Lately, the weather has been overcast with no sunlight penetrating through. In such a gloomy weather, suddenly seeing such an old man near the strange flower sea on the wilderness, those with weak hearts could really pee themselves on the spot.

Ranran was also startled, but what puzzled her more was how could he see so many Eagle Beak Flowers without eyes?

But looking at the old man, besides looking scary, there was no spiritual aura on him; he was just an ordinary person.

Qiu Xier also asked, “Are you… human or ghost? How can you see these flowers without eyes?”

The old herdsman’s voice was desolate, “I used to be a soldier on the border, followed the War Goddess into the battle of Fanyao, experienced life and death, and lost a pair of eyes. At that time, the Fanyao battlefield covered with corpses was also full of these flowers. After seeing them once, I couldn’t forget their appearance… Little girl, judging from your voice, you’re still young; stay away from these flowers. They are not good things. Although I have no eyes, I can see them. Don’t you think they are sinister?”

After saying this, the old herdsman urged his old horse and, listening to the sound, drove the sheep herd back.

Ranran asked him from behind, “Excuse me, do these flowers eat people?”

This time, the old herdsman shook his head, “They don’t eat people, but they can make people eat people. Don’t go near to look at them, especially do not smell them, be careful not to lose your soul…”

As he spoke, accompanied by the bell sound on the old horse, the blind old herdsman urged the old horse and quickly moved away from these red flowers.

Ranran watched his receding back. She turned her head to speak to Shifu, but found that Shifu had been staring intently at the sea of red flowers.

She quickly reached out to pull him, whispering, “Shifu, what’s wrong with you?”

Su Yishui seemed to be jolted back to his senses. He barely suppressed the spreading redness in his eyes and said to Ranran and the others, “Let’s leave quickly; these flowers are just flower buds for now. Once they bloom, they will emit toxins. If people inhale too much of it, they will lose themselves.”

Upon hearing this, Gao Cang and Yuchen, who had already stepped into the flower sea, quickly retreated.

Just as everyone was about to move away from these flowers, a sudden west wind blew in. When the wind blew through the sea of flowers, those eagle-beak-like flower buds slowly bloomed, like eagles suddenly opening their beaks, spitting out blood-red stamens, like small tongues trembling in the wind.

In an instant, the entire flower sea was filled with fragrance, and a strong aroma spread out.

Ranran reacted the fastest. She quickly took out a Calming Pill, crushed it into two small pills, and stuffed it into her Shifu’s nose.

He already had the Spirit Spring’s demonic nature; if he were to be poisoned by the demon flower too, he would simply become a humanoid killing machine.

Su Yishui seemed to feel that this was demeaning, dodging his head, but unable to stop Ranran, he was still stuffed with the pills.

He helplessly looked at Ranran stuffing her own nostrils, saying, “Just hold your breath; why are you doing this?”

With Shifu’s cultivation level, holding his breath underwater for three days and nights was no problem at all as long as he didn’t inhale anything. But Ranran couldn’t take the chance, so stuffing was safer.

Although Ranran was not at Shifu’s level, holding her breath for *half an hour was also possible. But she also stuffed two pills to seal her nostrils.
*a stick of incense time 30-45min

But standing in the flower sea, Gao Cang and Xier obviously had no guard up. By the time Ranran wanted to stuff their noses, they had already inhaled the fragrance and pollen of the flowers into their noses.

In an instant, their bodies were covered in a faint red halo.

Next, suddenly, Qiu Xier’s eyebrows and eyes seemed to have been painted with a brush, her features became three-dimensional and beautiful, and her figure became even more curvaceous…

By the side, Ranran was also stunned. This… isn’t this a drastic change in appearance? Hearing Ranran’s words, Qiu Xier immediately took out a small bronze mirror she carried with her. When she saw her reflection in the mirror clearly, she couldn’t believe it, so she hurriedly walked to the nearby water puddle to see her reflection, immediately astonished and unable to believe, she knelt down by the water, she trembled as she touched her face and said, “How…how did I become so beautiful? I’ve turned into an unparalleled beauty!”

But when she moved farther away from the sea of flowers, her appearance gradually returned to normal. Qiu Xier tentatively walked back towards the sea of flowers, and her nose became more prominent again.

Looking at Gao Cang, after he inhaled some pollen and emitted a red light all over, he felt heat rising in his dantian, with a feeling of surging spiritual energy. So he shouted strangely, waved his hand, and sent out a spiritual ball, hitting a distant big tree, which fell down with undeniable force.

Gao Cang also laughed ecstatically, ‘I’ve become stronger, did you see? I’ve become so powerful!’

However, when he joyfully moved away from the sea of flowers, the vitality in his dantian suddenly disappeared, and he could no longer split mountains or cut stones.

So, not believing in superstition, he stubbornly approached the sea of flowers again, breathing in the fragrance deeply.

Ranran looked at the scene in astonishment and asked urgently, ‘Shifu, what’s happening to them?’

Su Yishui frowned and said, ‘This pollen seems to stimulate a person’s potential, satisfying their deepest desires…’

Ranran widened her eyes as she listened because she noticed that third senior sister’s appearance had become somewhat like Elder Mu’s. Becoming a beauty that overshadowed others was indeed third senior sister’s greatest wish.

But could these flowers have such effects? Wouldn’t everyone fight over them? Why did that old herder warn against approaching these flowers earlier?

Just then, Su Yishui said, ‘Quickly get them out of there. Otherwise, inhaling too much pollen might lead to addiction, and they’ll become slaves to these demonic flowers.’

Yu Tong and Yu Chen also blocked their nostrils with the pills Ranran gave them and covered their mouths with cloth, holding their breath as they flew into the sea of flowers to pull Gao Cang and Qiu Xier out. Qiu Xier’s appearance once again became ordinary, while Gao Cang’s divine skills disappeared instantly.

Both of them were somewhat unwilling. Even though they heard Shifu say that the pollen was malevolent, they kept looking back at the sea of Eagle Beak Demon flowers after being pulled away by Ranran .

Su Yishui waved his hand and set up a spiritual shield to cover the sea of flowers, preventing the scent from leaking out.

These demonic flowers were a sign of the entrance to the Netherworld Realm. However, looking around, other than the endless strange red flowers, there was nothing else abnormal, and no entrance to the Realm could be found.

When the four of them returned to the town, Zeng Yi heard the strangeness of those demonic flowers and couldn’t help but worry, ‘Since they’re so malevolent, it’s better to destroy them as soon as possible.’

Su Yishui shook his head and said, ‘Even if these flowers are burned, they’ll bloom as usual the next day. They’ll be in full bloom for seven days before disappearing on their own.’

Ranran blinked and said, ‘So we must find the entrance to the Netherworld Realm within seven days, or else we won’t know when it will appear again?’

Su Yishui took out the Netherworld Realm key and said in a low voice, ‘All things that carry Yin while embracing Yang. Noon is when Yang is at its peak and Yin begins to grow. The time the flowers bloomed today should be exactly noon, so tomorrow at noon, we’ll go back to the sea of flowers.’

Ranran nodded, intending to call third senior sister to cook with her. But when she turned to look at Qiu Xier, she found her staring blankly at a small bronze mirror, lost in thought.

Ranran called her several times before Qiu Xier came to her senses. She pointed to her eyes and said, ‘Ranran, do you see that my eyes have become much larger than before?’

Ranran looked carefully and said, ‘No, they’re still the same size.’

Qiu Xier became anxious, ‘Are you not looking carefully? They’ve clearly increased in size!’

Ranran couldn’t argue and could only say, ‘Okay, they’ve gotten much bigger, alright, let’s go cook.’

Qiu Xier finally showed a happy expression. When they entered the small kitchen, she said, ‘Today, I only inhaled a bit of pollen, and my eyes became larger. Do you think if I inhaled more, my appearance will improve a lot?’

Ranran looked up alertly and said seriously, ‘Didn’t you hear what Shifu said? Those flowers are evil. Sniffing their pollen and having your appearance change, aren’t you afraid?’

Qiu Xier felt a bit disappointed, pouting and playing with the firewood, muttering, ‘Talking to someone as naturally beautiful as you, you wouldn’t understand. You don’t know how much I hope to become more and more beautiful like you.’

The current Ranran wasn’t the frail and weak girl she was when she first arrived on the mountain. Her fully blossomed dazzling beauty at eighteen was truly enviable.

Qiu Xier thought her parents didn’t give her a good foundation and didn’t have much expectations. But unexpectedly, just by inhaling a bit of pollen today, it was like being reborn, and her appearance suddenly became much more radiant.

As for Gao Cang, he also seemed rather restless. While everyone was eating at the table, he was lifting dumbbells in the yard, muttering that his strength seemed to have increased significantly.

Second senior brother Bai Baishan did not go to the sea of flowers because he was working on new weapons with Uncle Master Zeng in the horse stables. But seeing the two of them acting strangely, he couldn’t help but feel fortunate that he hadn’t gone.

He had been bewitched before, mistaking a burly man with black hair for the beauty Rou’er. He knew very well the feeling of being ensnared by illusions. If he got bewitched again, there would be no hope of returning to Xishan.

That night was uneventful. As usual, Su Yishui had to go to the mountains to be locked with chains before nightfall when the demonic nature rose.

That time Ranran accompanied him in the mountains for a night, and the next day, her clothes had been damp from the morning dew, so Su Yishui ordered her not to go anymore. Otherwise, she might disturb his concentration at the foot of the mountain.

So even though Ranran couldn’t sleep, she could only obediently stay at the horse stables.

By nightfall, she still couldn’t sleep peacefully. She tossed and turned on her bed, and finally, she got up and prepared to meditate and cultivate her vitality.

These past few days, she could finally handle two swords steadily, but there was still a considerable gap from handling five swords…

As she quietly recited the breathing technique and circulated the qi in her dantian, she suddenly heard movement from the next room.

Ranran had remarkable hearing when meditating, and she immediately recognized that the noise was coming from Qiu Xier’s room.

At first, she didn’t pay attention, thinking that third senior sister was just getting up to go to the toilet. But in a moment, she heard moaning sounds.

Ranran frowned upon hearing it, immediately opening her eyes. When she stepped outside, she happened to see senior brother Gao Cang just scaling the wall.

When Ranran called out to him from behind, he didn’t even turn his head.

Ranran knew something was very wrong and quickly leaped over the wall, chasing after the two ahead of her.

Among the disciples of Xishan, Ranran was the best at light body techniques. In theory, she should have been able to catch up with the two early on.

However, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier seemed to have some kind of extraordinary speed today, as if blessed by a divine force, making it impossible for Ranran to catch up no matter how hard she tried.

In the hazy moonlight, their bodies seemed to emit a faint red light, looking extremely eerie.

I don’t know about you, but I am hoping this undignified Shifu with the blocked nostrils will be in the drama lol

I thought an Index might be helpful for re-reading in future.

However I don’t want the Index to have spoilers so I split them according to the places the adventures happened. Hope that makes sense lol

一同前往 GOING TOGETHER

Ranran gave chase for a while, then stopped and turned back to call for help from her two Yu uncle masters.

If she guessed right, Gao Cang and Qiu Xier must have run into the sea of flowers.

Right now, their Shifu was in the mountains battling the demonic influence. If something went wrong, she wouldn’t be able to handle it alone.

Upon hearing Ranran’s urgent explanation, the two uncle masters quickly grabbed their cloaks and hurried towards the flower sea.

Upon arriving, under the dim moonlight, they saw Gao Cang and Qiu Xier cutting their wrists and pouring fresh blood onto the spiritual shield set up by Su Yishui.

As the blood flowed onto it, the flowers within the shield seemed to grow wildly, pollen filled the air, red mist spread, and eventually the shield actually broke, dispersing with the wind.

Qiu Xier and Gao Cang acted as if they had taken some life-saving elixir, desperately breathing in heavily and heading deeper into the flower sea without looking back.

Although Yu Chen and Yu Tong had covered their noses, they didn’t dare to get too close to the flower sea.

When Su Yishui said to enter at noon, it was not just because it was the time of yin-yang alternation but also because the yin energy was not strong during that time.

But now it was midnight, when yin energy was at its peak, and the eagle-beaked flowers have grown much larger than they were during the day. Each flower looked like a giant eagle’s head, half-opened and eerie.

They weren’t sure if they could protect themselves once inside the flower sea.

At that moment, Ranran pulled out two short swords that Uncle Master Zeng Yi had just crafted for her, infused them with her energy, and charged straight towards the two running ahead.

Yu Tong gasped, thinking Ranran was going to “stab them through the heart.”

However, after the swords flew out, they hit Gao Cang and Qiu Xier’s acupoints with the hilt, knocking them down and immobilizing them.

At this point, Ranran was ready to enter the flower sea and pull the two back. But Yu Tong grabbed her and said, “You can’t go in. These flowers are too sinister. If something happens to you too, Yu Chen and I won’t be able to handle you.”

Ranran’s cultivation was now much higher than Yu Tong’s, and if Ranran encountered trouble, they wouldn’t know what to do.

So for now, they could only let Gao Cang and Qiu Xier lie there like this. When dawn broke, they would figure out a way to get them out.

Yu Chen took a rope from his waist, ready to lasso them and see if they could pull them back.

At that moment, a strong wind blew, and Ranran saw the pollen spreading above the flower sea without the shield, realizing this was very bad!

Before long, many blue fireflies appeared around the flower sea.

But Ranran felt her hairs stand on end. She whispered, “Are those… not fireflies?”

Yu Chen had experience from his time on the border and whispered back, “Those are the eyes of wild wolves!”

It turned out the pollen attracted wild wolves from the wilderness. These wolves, one after another, with their blue eyes, howled and lunged towards them.

As wild animals, their greatest desire should be meat. And now, here by the flower sea, they were their sumptuous night feast.

Ordinary wild wolves wouldn’t approach people with foundation in cultivation no matter how fierce they were. Wild animals were quite intelligent; they would sense danger and avoid those with spiritual protection.

But after inhaling the pollen, these wolves seemed to increase in speed and strength several times over, and their courage grew immensely.

Their instinct for hunting made them stronger, and the eagle-beaked flower pollen turned the wolf pack into reckless demonic wolves.

As the wolves surrounded and attacked, they seemed utterly fearless.

Soon, Yu Chen’s thighs and back were scratched bloody by the wolf claws.

Yu Tong activated her spiritual protection which barely withstood the wolf pack’s attacks, but her shoulders and arms were bitten by the ferocious wolves.

Ranran wielded her mechanical staff while controlling the two short swords with her energy, swiftly killing dozens of demonic wolves.

Perhaps in moments of crisis, humans could truly tap into their potential. Soon, Ranran drew out another short sword from her waist, and the airborne swords increased from two to three.

Though there were only three, their speed was fast enough to create a whirlwind of slashing, splattering wolf blood everywhere they passed.

Seeing they couldn’t gain an advantage, the wolves suddenly turned and ran towards the flower sea, seemingly drawn by something inside.

As the pollen spread faster, it also attracted flocks of iron-beaked ravens and similar creatures. They swarmed towards the flower sea, ignoring even Gao Cang and Qiu Xier lying there.

After Gao Cang and Qiu Xier regained consciousness, they stood up groggily, and struggled to follow the animals further into the flower sea.

Yu Chen quickly picked up the rope he had prepared and forcefully lassoed them, pulling them out of the flower sea like livestock.

This was not a place for them to remain for long. After getting these two out, they all hurried back to the town square.

The shield was down, and Ranran’s power wasn’t enough to set up a new one. They could only wait for Su Yishui to return and figure something out.

Ranran was mindful and sent a message to inform General Qin Xuanjiu, telling the soldiers not to go near the city outskirts. Otherwise, with the pollen spreading, innocent people might get hurt.

After Gao Cang and Qiu Xier came to their senses, they still clamored to go back to that flower sea.

Qiu Xier cried out, “Let me go, just once, please!”

When they noticed that Ranran and the others were going to lock the gate, Gao Cang even started using chairs to smash the door, while Qiu Xier used her head to bump into senior uncle master. Clearly, both of them were behaving abnormally, going somewhat out of control.

In the end, it was the second uncle master who tied up these two crazed individuals to a hitching post in the courtyard, finally calming them down.

And so they were tied up all night. The next day, right before dawn, there was a commotion at the city gate. Qin Xuanjiu suddenly arrived with people, smashing down the door of the Horse Trading Post.

He shouted as soon as he entered, “Where is Su Yishui? Did you people have something to do with those demon flowers in the countryside?”

It turned out that last night, some soldiers who went out of the city to set up camp were also enchanted by the dispersed pollen and entered that flower sea.

Just like Gao Cang and Qiu Xier, they were immediately entranced by the floral fragrance, experiencing various hallucinations and refusing to leave, completely intoxicated.

By the time they were discovered in the morning, their bodies had already been bitten by the bizarre plant’s petal-like bird beaks and pierced into their veins .

In addition to these soldiers, there were also many birds and beasts, all entangled by vines and turned into nourishment for the demon flowers without exception.

These plants fed on humans, using blood as fertilizer and their greed as nourishment. Those soldiers and animals trapped in the flower sea all perished.

Qin Xuanjiu initially invited Elder Mu to investigate, but Elder Mu only took a glance from afar and refused to approach, only saying that the residual spiritual field around the flower sea was set up by Su Yishui, so he should look for Su Yishui.

Mu Ranwu had seen these flowers before, but at that time, they only caused illusions and didn’t actively entangle people or drain them as ruthlessly as they did now.

These demon flowers were too terrifying, so naturally, Su Yishui gets the blame for them. Hence, Qin Xuanjiu came aggressively to find him.

However, as soon as he entered, he was startled by Gao Cang and Qiu Xier, who were tied to the courtyard pillar.

Has XiShan really become a demonic sect, using such sinister methods to discipline disciples?

However, upon hearing Ranran’s explanation that they did not plant those flowers, Qin Xuanjiu was not entirely convinced, especially with the residual spiritual shield set up by Su Yishui around the flower sea.

Ranran couldn’t understand and asked, “Didn’t I send someone to inform the General last night? Why did soldiers still enter the flower sea?”

Qin Xuanjiu was suddenly at a loss for words. He did receive a message from Ranran yesterday. However, at that time, he was meditating with his Master. When his Master heard about it, she asked Qin Xuanjiu to send someone to investigate what Ranran and the others were up to.

So Qin Xuanjiu had sent people, but he didn’t expect such a disastrous result.

Qin Xuanjiu regretted it deeply now. Being questioned by Ranran like this, his face turned liver-colored, unable to respond. Unfortunately, he couldn’t go back to confront his Master, so for a moment, he only thought about seeking death to atone.

So he immediately drew his sword, shouting to cut his throat. Yu Chen was so angry that he wanted to kick him away, telling him to go far away from the Horse Trading Post before killing himself, so as not to ruin the Trading Post’s business.

Just when the courtyard was in chaos, Zeng Yi, covered in mud, had run back in a hurry, “Its…..very bad…… Junior brother Su has broken free from the chains and has headed towards that flower sea!”

It turned out that last night, Su Yishui’s demonic nature had reached its peak, breaking free from both the iron chains and the golden talismans.

Zeng Yi watched helplessly as he broke the chains and rushed away roaring, and the direction he was headed was the flower sea in the countryside.

Ranran knew clearly that if Shifu entered the flower sea while he was not in a clear state of mind, and accidentally inhaled the pollen, he would likely be controlled by the demon flowers and become their nourishment.

So she didn’t have time to deal with Qin Xuanjiu’s nonsense. She turned around, and took off towards the countryside.

Except for Gao Cang and Qiu Xier, who were still tied to the courtyard pillar, everyone else, including Qin Xuanjiu, also followed after her.

Ranran was proficient in light body techniques, far outstripping the others.

When she arrived at the flower sea, she saw a tall man standing in the center of the flower sea from afar.

At this time, the man’s hair crown had completely loosened, his long hair and white clothes dancing in the wind. With thick eyebrows and deep eyes, he appeared devilish, the midday sun shining on the red pollen, giving off a strange light, making him seem like a demon god who has descended.

Ranran shouted loudly, “Shifu!”

The man slowly turned his gaze towards her and suddenly rushed towards her like lightning.

When cultivators reach a certain realm, their bodies automatically generate spiritual shields.

Ranran was no exception. Although she didn’t want to guard against Shifu, her body’s instincts had already reacted, summoning the shield to repel Su Yishui.

However, this unintentional defense completely infuriated the man who is now under demonic influences, as he felt that the girl was going to distance herself from him.

Before Ranran could even react, she was firmly grasped by him, and her spiritual shield was shattered.

Moreover, the force he used to grip her was not controlled at all, causing Ranran to cry out in pain.

But even so, the man kept increasing the force, while his thin lips screamed in Ranran’s ear, “Did you think you can escape me by dying? I want you to follow me to hell!”

Ranran tried to relax herself as much as possible, weakening the instinctive shield, while softly saying, “Okay, wherever you are, I will go with you…”

After speaking, she leaned over and kissed the man’s cold thin lips.

This kiss, was gentle and sweet, miraculously calming down Su Yishui’s mania once again, the thick black aura on his body visibly weakening.

She didn’t know why, but Ranran just knew that this man, no matter how demonic he became, would never harm her.

Because when she dove into the flower sea just now, the man had instinctively extended his spirit shield to envelop her, to prevent her from being harmed by the demon flowers.

Other than the Spirit Spring sealed within him, it seemed that any indication of her distancing herself from him would also drive him into madness.

So Ranran could only cling to her master tightly like a little gecko, not being apart for even a moment.

But to the onlookers, it looked like Su Yishui was going mad, assaulting his female disciple.

Especially that shout just now, was like a blatant threat!

Just as the two were embracing in the flower sea, suddenly a long whip lashed out: “Demon son! Let go of Ranran!”

Wei Jiu from Crimson Gate had appeared at the edge of the flower sea at some unknown time, and he immediately moved to rescue Xue Ranran who was being “held hostage” by her demonized master.

Seeing that Su Yishui seemed to have lost control to his demonic nature, Wei Jiu’s heart was actually filled with mixed emotions.

On one hand, he didn’t want Su Yishui to further enhance his spiritual power using the Spirit Spring, becoming invincible.

On the other hand, he felt that this Su Yishui, exposed so completely before Xue Ranran, must make her both frightened and angry, and she probably wished to rid herself of such a master at once.

At this moment, his timely appearance to play the hero and save the beauty was just right!

So, despite knowing the strangeness of the flower sea, Wei Jiu, relying on his skill and courage, rushed forward, wanting to snatch Ranran from Su Yishui’s embrace.

However, as the long whip flew, countless eagle-beaked demonic flowers were struck, causing the pollen that had settled to fly again, creating a red pollen mist in the sky above the flower sea.

When Wei Jiu stepped into it, he clearly felt the magnetic field change. After absorbing the blood and vitality of countless people, those flowers became even more enchanting.

Vines climbed and extended, forming strange patterns. Ranran who was in Su Yishui’s arms as they rose into the air, looked down and realized that the patterns on the ground of the flower sea looked very similar to her master’s netherworld realm key.

She looked up at Su Yishui, the redness in his eyes had not yet dissipated, but the force with which he held her seemed to have greatly reduced.

Ranran pulled her hand out from his embrace and felt for the key from his body. Comparing the two, the totem composed of demonic flowers on the ground was exactly the same as the key.

At this moment, Su Yishui, while dodging Wei Jiu’s attacks with Ranran in his arms, lowered his head and asked her, “These flowers seem to resonate with the Spiritual Spring inside me. Last night’s resonance was particularly strong, causing me to momentarily lose control… Did I hurt you just now?”

It seemed that he had finally regained his sanity. Ranran whispered softly, “No, but the pollen is spreading too quickly. I’m afraid people from nearby villages will also be drawn into the flower sea.”

Wei Jiu also gradually stopped his attacks. He also sensed the strangeness of the flower sea, and among his disciples, there were those who had entered the flower sea without holding their breath, and soon lost their reason and being firmly bitten by the eagle-beaked flowers, absorbing their spiritual energy and flesh…

Although these eagle-beaked flowers had appeared before, they weren’t as aggressive as they were now.

Perhaps after losing the Spirit Spring for a long time, the Netherworld Realm’s aura had deviated, causing the demonic flowers from the Netherworld Realm to autonomously absorb the life force of beasts and humans, replenishing their own declining power. At the same time, because they sensed the Spirit Spring on Su Yishui’s body, they actively opened the doors to the Realm.

That’s why those eagle-beaked flowers became so aggressive, absorbing people’s life force and etching the key engraving onto the ground.

This was also why Su Yishui had lost control and entered the flower sea.

For the first time in a thousand years, the Netherworld Realm wasn’t opened from the outside, but actively connected with the human realm.

The vines began to emit red light. With this light becoming brighter, the earth began to tremble and crack, the entire flower sea sinking and turning into a bottomless abyss. Ranran tightly held her Shifu’s hand. If they had to venture into the Netherworld Realm, then as she said, wherever Su Yishui went, she would go with him!

However, Su Yishui didn’t think so. When he regained his rationality, his first instinct before being sucked into the Netherworld Realm was to throw Ranran out.

But how could Ranran, this little gecko, be easily shaken off? Clinging tightly to his neck, she fiercely said, “Don’t you leave me behind!”

In the next instant, the two were sucked into the collapsing pit together.

At the moment they were sucked in, another figure followed suit, flying down with them and falling together with the two of them.

Ranran could clearly see that the sudden black shadow was Wei Jiu from Crimson Gate.

He must have been planning for a long time, waiting for the moment when the Netherworld Realm opened wide, and follow Su Yishui into the Realm. Behind him was the elder Tu Jiuyuan who also followed into the fissure.

As the sun in the sky shifted, the flowers on the ground withered in an instant, and the cracked earth quickly closed up. Apart from the four people disappearing into thin air, everything else returned to how it was before the red flowers bloomed.

……

Speaking of Wei Jiu, he hadn’t expected that Tu Jiuyuan would also jump down with them. Originally preparing to compete with Su Yishui for Ranran, he couldn’t help but despise Tu Jiuyuan for being meddlesome.

The abyss of the Netherworld Realm had no bottom. Once fallen into it, one would be corroded by decaying gas and turn into a demonic corpse. Therefore, Su Yishui also didn’t want to engage with Wei Jiu. He just held onto Ranran tightly and hung on to the cliff wall nearby.

Wei Jiu had the same thought as he did. He had planned to take advantage of Su Yishui’s unpreparedness to snatch Ranran and pull her into his arms.

Unfortunately, Wei Jiu was just a tad too slow and failed to grab Ranran. He could only turn around and grab Tu Jiuyuan, who was falling, and also hung onto the cliff wall.

Although he caught Tu Jiuyuan, his words were sharp and malicious: “You meddler, who allowed you to come down?”

Tu Jiuyuan pursed her lips and whispered, “I am willing to accompany my lord through fire and water without complaint…”

At this time, men and women from Xishan and Crimson Gate each occupied one side of the cliff wall. Because they were still quite a distance apart, they temporarily ceased hostilities.

Ranran finally manged to calm herself and take in their current surroundings.

The atmosphere of the Netherworld Realm was completely different from the human realm. Here, it seemed that the energies of yin and yang were reversed. The water on the cliffs didn’t flow downwards but swirled upwards, constantly floating and rising like pearls.

Above them, there was a winding river flowing upside down.

Ranran wiped the water off her face and looked at the large river above her head with some shock.

Su Yishui caught his breath and whispered, “Hold onto me tightly, don’t fall down!”

Ranran quickly held onto him tightly and then asked, “Shifu, is this the Netherworld Realm? Are we going down there later?” Strange cries seemed to come from the depths beneath their feet, and there was no idea what was down there.

Su Yishui shook his head and pointed to the rolling river above: “No, we have to climb up.”

The Netherworld Realm is different from the human realm; water can flow upwards. So, if they wanted to reach the part of the cliff where the water fell, they could only keep climbing upwards.

However, they were all living beings. When their yang bodies entered the Netherworld Realm, it felt like they were carrying heavy iron, making every movement extremely difficult. Even with high spiritual power, their actions became much slower.

Thus, the two couples had no choice but stop fighting and each started climbing up the cliff.

Wei Jiu sneered at Su Yishui and shouted, “Su Yishui, you can’t suppress the Spirit Spring. Why not just hand it over to me soon? That way, you’ll be much more relaxed.”

Ranran looked at Wei Jiu and said, “How shameless. You can suppress the Spirit Spring? Did you replenish your spiritual power that was consumed by the Immortal Devouring bugs at Tianmai Mountain?”

Wei Jiu hated it most when others looked down on his abilities. Hearing this, he immediately felt embarrassed and angry.

He looked at Ranran, smiled coldly and stopped talking, focusing on climbing up.

Because the Yin forces from the chasm was increasing in strength, if they stayed on the cliff wall for too long, they might be sucked into the endless abyss.

Seeing that her Shifu was struggling, Ranran tried reaching out to climb the cliff herself. She thought she would climb slowly after hearing Shifu’s explanation, but to her surprise, when she tried to ascend using her qi, she climbed a considerable distance effortlessly.

When she looked back at the other three struggling to climb, she felt like she was watching sloths and turtles.

And those three also gazed at her in disbelief.

So, Ranran climbed back down easily, got close to Shifu and whispered, “Is it really this difficult? Why don’t I feel anything?”

“You are not made of ordinary flesh but had been a fruit growing on a tree. The Rebirth Tree inherently belong to Yin, so when you’re in the Netherworld Realm, you naturally won’t suffer like us…”

Before Su Yishui could reply, Wei Jiu readily provided the explanation.

He had just had an unpleasant exchange with Ranran earlier, but now that he had calmed down a little, he was eager to ease the tension.

It had been quite some time since he had seen this little girl, Ranran. Now that he looked at her, it seemed like she had grown a little more. Her long hair, wet from the rising water on the cliff, clung to her snowy cheeks, and her big eyes were very lively.

He should have noticed long ago that her eyes were exactly the same as those of Mu Qingge in her past life.

Thinking back to when he was at Tianmai Mountain, he kept hanging around that imposter in front of Ranran, Excellency Wei felt that this little girl who was now a little hostile towards him, using some harsh words which can be forgiven.

He wouldn’t argue with her, lest Su Yishui take advantage.

But in Ranran’s eyes, Wei Jiu’s belated solicitousness seemed rather untimely, much like those sudden letters he sent to Tianmai Mountain, presumptuous and self-righteous.

So when Wei Jiu spoke, she didn’t look at him but instead turned to her Shifu.

Su Yishui patted her back and said, “Since you can climb fast, hurry up and go up. Wait for me on the riverbank.”

Previous
Next

道出真相 THE TRUTH IS OUT

Seeing that Shifu didn’t refute and just urged her to go up, Ranran knew that what Wei Jiu said should be mostly true.

She didn’t expect her Wood attribute to be so useful in the Netherworld Realm.

However, she did not climb up by herself. Instead she grabbed her master’s hand and pulled him quickly forward, leaving Wei Jiu and Tuo Jiuyuan far below.

She noticed that the black lines on her master’s neck has nearly circled around it, indicating that they needed to reach the cliff where the water fell soon to restore the Spirit Spring.

But she didn’t notice that the constantly rising water droplets have wet her clothes.

Su Yishui was very close to her at this moment. When she turned back to pull him up, her collar opened slightly, revealing her alluring white neck and collarbones.

Su Yishui needed to close his eyes and adjust his breath to suppress the surge of demonic impulses inside him. How was he going to climb fast?

But Ranran became faster and faster as they went, almost pulling Su Yishui up quickly in the end.

On the other side of the cliff, Wei Jiu also stopped talking. His objective here was clear: either obtain the Spirit Spring or take advantage of Su Yishui’s weakness after he stripped the Spirit Spring from himself, to kill him in one blow.

If the two tasks could be combined, it would be well worth the trip.

Although he had come here last time with a key, the Netherworld Realm was a dry land back then, weak in Yin energy, completely different from now.

Perhaps it was because Su Yishui brought back the Spirit Spring that the Yin energy in the Realm surged, and the water flow rose rapidly. Wei Jiu found it quite difficult to climb.

Seeing the two on the opposite cliff climbing faster and faster, Wei Jiu no longer cared about Tuo Jiuyuan behind him. His arm veins bulged as he tried hard to speed up and catch up.

Ranran and Su Yishui arrived first to the cliff of falling water above them.

However, diving into the upside-down riverbed was another difficult task. Just as Ranran reached out to touch the water, Su Yishui stopped her with his hand.

“Don’t touch it. The boundary of the falling water will only dissipate every two hours. Otherwise, we won’t be able to pass.” After speaking, he took out a handkerchief and threw it into the river.

Before the handkerchief touched the water surface, it seemed to touch something and instantly turned into ashes.

It was still far from two hours passing. Ranran looked around and unexpectedly found a recessed mountain hollow on the cliff, where they could rest and wait quietly.

As they entered the hollow, the two people on the opposite cliff also disappeared from sight.

Ranran shook her wet hair, wiped the water droplets off her face, and was about to speak when Su Yishui pulled her into his arms and started to kiss her passionately.

He had wanted to kiss her badly since just now, but thinking of Wei Jiu nearby, he had been enduring it.

After being kissed, Ranran would look a little dazed, with her blushing red cheeks she looked absolutely adorable. He didn’t want to let Wei Jiu get a free feast with his eyes.

Ranran wrapped her arms around his neck in response, and after their passionate kiss, she whispered softly against his lips, “Will you return to normal after returning the Spirit Spring, Shifu?”

Su Yishui’s arms around her waist tightened involuntarily. “Do you want things to return to normal?”

Ranran actually didn’t want to. These days, she and her Shifu were always close, even when they were silent under the moonlight, there seemed to be a subtle rapport.

But she also knew that her Shifu’s original temperament should be cold and somewhat distant. If it weren’t for the Spirit Spring, he wouldn’t never have taken an interest in a silly little girl like her.

Could she cling onto Shifu because of this critical period and force him to take responsibility?

However, thinking about a future where she had to pretend to get along with her Shifu as if nothing had ever happened, was really agonizing.

Perhaps after this, Shifu might feel uncomfortable around her, then she should really leave Xishan, and leave her Shifu.

Now that she knew the root cause of her illness, which was because she didn’t grow to maturity on the Rebirth Tree, as long as her master allowed her to take the Rebirth Tree planted in the small courtyard of Western Mountain with her, she could rely on the small tree to sustain her life. This way, she wouldn’t make her master doubt her and think that he would have to take responsibility for these absurd days.

However, she wouldn’t say any of these. After all, her Shifu couldn’t handle any talk of her leaving him at the moment.

So when Su Yishui asked, she slowly leaned her face against his chest, listening to his steady heartbeat, and said half-truthfully, “Of course, I hope you return to normal. Then we can take the newly made lanterns to catch fireflies…”

Su Yishui reached out to touch her long hair, and also slowly closed his eyes. Amidst the rushing sound of the rising water, the two of them leaned serenely against each other, as if this was not the gloomy and terrifying Netherworld Realm.

Unfortunately, there would always be someone who ruins the mood.

Apparently, they were not the only ones who discovered this wonderful place. Before long, the sound of water being struck suddenly echoed, and Wei Jiu, using his extendable long whip, also leaped over from the opposite side.

He and Tuo Jiuyuan also wanted to take shelter here for a while.

Because the terrain here was narrow, if they fought, there was a high chance that they would both fall off the cliff. So Su Yishui and Wei Jiu each occupied one side.

Wei Jiu looked at the black lines on Su Yishui’s neck that were exposed, chuckled strangely twice, and said, “Why bother suppressing it with such difficulty? You used to be the imposing Demon son, capable of doing anything with the Spirit Spring. Is it because you want to appear like a good person before Ranran, fearing that she will remember your past shortcomings?”

Su Yishui slowly opened his eyes, which were tinged with a faint red light, and glared at him with a sinister look. “If you say another word, I will fulfill your wish, activate the power of the Spirit Spring, and kill you as easily as killing a stink bug.”

Wei Jiu knew that Su Yishui was not bluffing. It was really not beneficial to anger him just then.

He shifted his gaze to Ranran again, teasingly saying, “Back then at Tianmai Mountain, if I had known that Mu Qingge was an imposter, I would have treated you nicer…”

Xue Ranran was originally meditating with her eyes closed and ignored Wei Jiu. However, after hearing his words, Ranran couldn’t help but open her eyes abruptly and looked at Wei Jiu with uncertainty.

What did he mean when he said Mu Qingge was an imposter?

These days, she had also thought about her past life. Mu Qingge had been ambushed by her sister, Mu Ranwu, who grabbed her waist and allowed other sect leaders to successfully attack her.

So every time she thought that she might be Mu Ranwu, Ranran felt a little guilty. Regardless of whether Mu Qingge was good or evil, it was an undeniable fact that Mu Ranwu caused Mu Qingge’s death.

This was also why Ranran yielded to Mu Qingge again and again.

But now, Wei Jiu suddenly mentioned such words. Mu Qingge is an imposter?

Ranran had always been intelligent. In a moment of clarity, she suddenly realized something she had never dared to think before—perhaps she… was actually Mu Qingge, the master of her mentor!

However, this absurd truth was rather difficult to accept. Her mind swirled in chaotic thoughts, and she couldn’t help but turn to look at Su Yishui.

Did……he always know that she was Mu Qingge? Or was there some misunderstanding?

Wei Jiu had thought that Su Yishui should have informed Ranran of the truth already. When they were on opposite cliffs just now, he could see clearly through the water curtain that Su Yishui was kissing Ranran.

He originally thought that Su Yishui had somehow weaved lies, carefully covering up all of his scheming in her past life.

But now it would seem that Su Yishui hadn’t revealed Ranran’s true identity to her yet.

Wei Jiu understood everything perfectly now. He couldn’t help but laugh loudly, “What? Su Yishui didn’t tell you the truth? That’s right, how could he have the nerve to say it? If he told that you are actually Mu Qingge, wouldn’t he have to explain all the schemes he had against you in your past life? Why do you think Mu Ranwu betrayed you and framed you? Isn’t it all his manipulations, stirring up discord between you and your sister, using his charm to seduce Mu Ranwu to betray you? I told you, he’s very evil! Now that he is under the banner of righteousness, has his pretense really made him into a good person? Using your memory loss to transform himself into your master, but not respecting the master-disciple relationship, seducing an ignorant little girl like you. Hahaha, the imperial Su family is full of hypocrites…”

Wei Jiu didn’t have a chance to say more. Because Su Yishui had already burst out in anger, roaring with red eyes, and exerted all his spiritual power towards Wei Jiu.

Tuo Jiuyuan had long sensed that Su Yishui was not right, and hurriedly shouted, “Your Excellency, get out of the way!”

Wei Jiu also sensed that Su Yishui was somewhat out of control. This fierce attack clearly mobilized the power of the Spirit Spring, roaring like an evil dragon as he came over.

Wei Jiu had deliberately provoked Su Yishui.

The power of the Spirit Spring was indeed terrifying. However, if the person possessed by the Spirit Spring went berserk, they would be devoured by it, and during the moment of soul consumption, there would be a brief period of stupor before the Spirit Spring took over completely. Su Yishui would then completely lose his soul and become a puppet of the Spirit spring. Wei Jiu had a new bottle and gold talisman made by Elder Jiu.

As long as he waited for the moment when Su Yishui completely loses control, he could seize the opportunity, and extract and seal the Spirit Spring from him. By then, Su Yishui would become a useless person with an incomplete soul. He would then slowly kill this nemesis as Ranran watched.

So when Su Yishui rushed over, he had already taken out the new bottle and gold talisman, ready to subdue Su Yishui and reseal the Spirit spring.

Unfortunately, no matter how much he had considered every possibility, he didn’t expect Su Yishui’s self-control to be so strong that he wasn’t completely under the influence of the Spirit Spring.

The golden talisman he held was also slapped away by Su Yishui’s palm, and the talisman bottle couldn’t withstand the onslaught of spiritual energy and shattered with a crack.

The terrain in the mountain hollow was narrow, and Wei Jiu saw that his ambush had failed. Trying to dodge again was too late; he could only urgently mobilize his spiritual power shield to resist Su Yishui’s thunderous strike.

Tu Jiuyuan suddenly raised her spiritual shield and rushed straight to the front of Wei Jiu, taking Su Yishui’s furious blow for him.

Tu Jiuyuan’s cultivation in the Crimson Gate was second only to Wei Jiu, but even so, her raised spiritual shield was shattered by Su Yishui’s blow. The sound of her bones cracking could even be heard, and at that moment, blood gushed out. If it were in the human realm and one suffered such a serious injury, there might be a chance of survival with a deep enough foundation. But this was the Netherworld Realm; once injured, it was like a flood bursting a dam, blood and true qi would accelerate leaving the body.

Ranran hurriedly blocked in front of Su Yishui.

She wasn’t trying to save Tu Jiuyuan; she was just afraid that Su Yishui would continue killing in a rage, causing him to be completely controlled by the Spirit Spring and be trapped in the Netherworld Realm forever.

Su Yishui also understood this. Wei Jiu had likely provoked him deliberately earlier. If he had unleashed the full power of the Spirit Spring, even Ranran wouldn’t be spared.

If she were really injured, he would probably completely lose control…

Wei Jiu also felt resentful, feeling that the perfect opportunity had been missed just now. If Tu Jiuyuan had attacked earlier instead of blocking in front of him, perhaps the talisman bottle wouldn’t have shattered!

Watching his long-time bedside companion and loyal subordinate lying in the mountain hollow, coughing up blood, Wei Jiu disdainfully glared at her and said, “Fool, did I ask you to meddle?”

Tu Jiuyuan was now lying limply in the mountain hollow, coughing up mouthfuls of blood, tears flowing continuously from her eyes.

After calming down Su Yishui, Ranran turned back to look at the appearance of the female demon Tu Jiuyuan, and couldn’t help but feel a little sympathetic.

She could see that although this elder Tu helped do evil things, she loved Wei Jiu very much. Sacrificing herself like this not only fulfilled her duty as a loyal subordinate but also sacrificed herself to save the man she loved.

But in the end, what she got in exchange for her life was Wei Jiu’s disdainful mockery. Ranran couldn’t stand it anymore.

She took out a medicine box from her pocket and threw it beside Tu Jiuyuan, saying, “This is a Heart-protecting pill. Take one quickly, or with so much blood loss, you might die soon.”

This female demon had committed many sins, but her sins would have their own consequences by the heavens. At this critical moment when her master’s demon nature was difficult to control, if he really killed Tu Jiuyuan, he would bear a heavy karmic debt, and his demonic nature would become even more uncontrollable.

Tu Jiuyuan looked at Ranran with a complicated expression, but seemed as if her spiritual power had been drained. She just cried and didn’t want to take the pill.

Ranran couldn’t help but angrily glare at Wei Jiu. “She sacrificed herself to save you like this, are you going to just watch her die? If you don’t feed it to her, are you expecting me to?”

Wei Jiu coldly snorted, then walked over and roughly pried open Tu Jiuyuan’s tightly closed mouth, stuffing the pill into her mouth.

This Heart-protecting pill was refined by Ranran and had much stronger effects than ordinary heart-protecting pills. Tu Jiuyuan finally managed to stop coughing up blood, but her body was already weak, and those shattered bones needed to be reset one by one for her to fully recover.

Ranran felt that after experiencing this life-threatening ordeal, perhaps the deep wounds in Elder Tu’s heart would be the most difficult to heal…

Love is misleading!

She don’t know why, but a sentence from third senior sister’s romance novels suddenly flashed through Ranran’s mind.

As for Wei Jiu’s words just now, she didn’t even want to think about them now.

They have more critical matters at hand, and who she was in her past life doesn’t matter right now. Restoring the Spirit Spring to its place is the priority, so she absolutely would not ask her master whether Wei Jiu’s words were true or not.

Calculating the time, it should have been about two hours now. When she turned around to check the river above her head, the barrier there had indeed weakened significantly.

So she turned around and said, “Shifu, we can cross the river now!”

Wei Jiu didn’t expect that after revealing such a shocking scene just now, although it had infuriated Su Yishui, Ranran, apart from the initial shock and confusion, quickly returned to normal, as if nothing had happened.

His schemes fell through. He couldn’t help but sneer and say, “Have you become foolish growing on the tree? Are you lacking insight or do you think I’m lying to you?”

Ranran raised her chin slightly, saying coldly to him, “Excellency Wei, you’ve lived foolishly for so long, are you only concerned about yourself? This Spirit Spring isn’t a good entity; the eagle-beaked flowers blooming all over the mountains are evidence. You’re just blindly seeking strength, but have you ever thought about the imbalance in the world, the withering of all things? What good is it for you to become the only strong person in the land? We don’t want to fight you now. If you’re willing to assist my Shifu in returning the Spirit Spring, I believe all major sects will reconsider their views on your Crimson Gate. And Elder Tu has only temporarily stopped bleeding; she can’t delay for long in this Realm. You should be a good person occasionally and do some good deeds now and then. How about it?”

When Ranran rebuked him coldly, the two men in the mountain hollow were slightly shaken in their hearts. It seemed like for a moment, they saw that lofty and unrestrained woman in red once again.

She never put petty emotions like love in her heart. With a straightforward and clear conscience, solitary and quiet, seeming to treat everyone she knew warmly, yet none of them could hold onto her.

Even the truly wicked Wei Jiu couldn’t help but be impressed.

Su Yishui didn’t pay attention to Wei Jiu this time, silently walking out of the cave and following Ranran, heading towards the waterfall.

Wei Jiu felt a bit embarrassed, jumping in anger. He glanced coldly at Tu Jiuyuan, letting her wait here, then turned around and followed Su Yishui.

Tu Jiuyuan struggled to speak, “Excellency, please go about your business, don’t worry about me…”

But before she could finish her words, Wei Jiu had already left impatiently.

According to the records of the Fantian Sect, the Spirit Spring is below this waterfall. After Su Yishui had used Mu Qingge to open the gate to the Netherworld realm back then, he had been here before, so he was familiar with the way.

After Mu Qingge separated Su Yishui from the Spirit Spring and sealed it at Wangxiang Pass, entrusting it to Qin Xuanjiu to watch over. But when the Spirit Spring took an unexpected turn, she asked Qin Xuanjiu to look for Su Yishui to resolve the aftermath.

Su Yishui naturally understood the intention behind it.

That indifferent and carefree woman, even if she ended up being harmed by him in the end, still firmly believed that he could become a good person who could save the world.

So she entrusted Qin Xuanjiu to find him and then instructed him to return the Spirit Spring intact.

Su Yishui couldn’t think any more. The Spirit Spring inside his body seemed to sense that it was going to be returned and kept roaring restlessly: “Don’t send me back, the Netherworld Realm is cold and lifeless, how can it compare to the fun bustling world of mortals? I can make you stronger, didn’t you embrace Mu Qingge in your arms? A woman like her, once she knows your true nature, how could she fall in love with you? I will help you possess her, don’t send me back!”

The voice of the Spirit Spring became more arrogant and piercing. Su Yishui held his breath and closed his eyes, swiftly plunging into the falling water.

The falling water cleansed the dust of the mortal world, allowing one to reach the other side of the Netherworld Realm.

As Su Yishui jumped into the River of Forgetfulness, Wei Jiu suddenly took action, taking out a talisman and quickly pasting it towards Ranran.

The thunderous blow from Su Yishui just now finally made Wei Jiu realize how unrealistic his idea of controlling the Spirit Spring for himself was.

Since that was the case, then the evil thing should be returned. But he didn’t come to the Netherworld Realm just to be a guardian for Su Yishui.

The Soul-Cleansing Talisman from Elder Jiu was quite overbearing. Why not paste it on Ranran while Su Yishui was entering the water?

By that time, all memories related to Su Yishui could be erased from Ranran’s mind.

When he brings Ranran out of the Netherworld Realm, she would be cleansed of her past and reborn again.

So Wei Jiu seized the opportunity and slapped the Soul-Cleansing Talisman towards Ranran’s back.

But Ranran was not a fool and had been on guard against Wei Jiu. When she caught a glimpse of Wei Jiu’s movement from the corner of her eye, she immediately turned around agilely, avoiding Wei Jiu’s reaching hand.

However, Wei Jiu’s other hand grabbed her shoulder, and he swiftly lunged at her again like lightning.

When he was immersed in the Black Pool on Tianmai Mountain, it was a demonic water closely related to the Netherworld Realm. So when he entered this realm, he could move as lightly as Ranran.
*But didn’t Su Yishui also went in the Black pool before? Or it was too long ago? Anywaay…

He had deliberately concealed his skills earlier, just to catch her off guard. Ranran was indeed lulled by him and didn’t dodge very cautiously.

Just as the Soul-Cleansing Talisman was about to hit Ranran, a hand suddenly reached out from the falling water and fiercely pulled Wei Jiu down.

Wei Jiu plunged into the water ignominiously. As he struggled fiercely, the Soul-Cleansing Talisman landed squarely on Su Yishui’s forehead.

The talisman touched his skin and melted into his pores. Stunned, Wei Jiu couldn’t help but curse in frustration.

But that talisman had not been easy to come by and should not be wasted. In a hurry, Wei Jiu could only quickly chant a spell to seal all of Su Yishui’s romantic feelings for Mu Qingge.

He had instructed Tu Jiuyuan to make Elder Jiu drink enough wine to extract information from him about the talisman, learning that it washed away extreme emotions of deep hatred and love but could not turn people into fools.

In hindsight, it was such a pity! But it was good to cleanse Su Yishui’s love of two lifetimes for both Mu Qingge and Xue Ranran!

The path was different but the end result was the same. If Su Yishui completely forgot about his belated love for Mu Qingge, he wouldn’t be entangled with Xue Ranran now?

So in the depths of the falling water, that talisman turned into a spiritual light and disappeared into Su Yishui’s forehead.

Ranran had also jumped into the water and saw what happened. She swam vigorously towards Su Yishui, wanting to pull him up.

But Su Yishui’s body was attracted to the forces of the falling water and quickly sank, disappearing into the vortex.

Ranran also wanted to follow, but found that her body couldn’t sink into the riverbed no matter what, only feeling the water getting hotter.

Wei Jiu exclaimed inwardly. This was a sign of the Spirit Spring returning to its position. When the Spirit Spring returned completely, the entire falling water would become boiling water, so he quickly grabbed Ranran, took a deep breath, and climbed up the bank. Just as Wei Jiu climbed out of the falling water, Ranran pushed him back into the water with her stick.

“Tell me, what talisman did you paste on Shifu?”

Wei Jiu was anxious; this water was really burning his buttocks! It unexpectedly triggered his spiritual power, freeing him from the heavy constraints, and he jumped out of the water.

“Of course, I pasted something good. If he can come out of the water in time, you will naturally know!”

After saying that, Wei Jiu laughed strangely, suddenly jumped backward, and left along the cliff.

Su Yishui had been absorbed under the falling water. As the Netherworld Realm had lost the Spirit Spring for too long, once he sank into the vortex, he would automatically detach from the Spirit Spring.

By then, when the Netherworld Realm restored its vitality, it would expel foreign elements and push them out of the Realm.

So he had to leave quickly, to see if he could return to the mortal world first, and then deliver a fatal blow to Su Yishui later. Without the Spirit Spring, Su Yishui should have no strength to fight him.

Ranran did not chase after Wei Jiu. She anxiously waited by the water’s edge for Su Yishui to surface. The water temperature was getting hotter and hotter. If her master didn’t come up soon, he was going to be cooked…

Just as Ranran was becoming impatient and preparing to jump into the water again, large bubbles suddenly emerged from the falling water, with scalding water splashing all around.

Previous
Next

被下降头 UNDER A SPELL

Ranran quickly swung her stick to scatter the water spray. At the same time, she saw the tall man finally springing out of the water from below.

Ranran was overjoyed and called out loudly, “Shifu…”

But Su Yishui, who had just leaped out of the water, seemed to be in anguish. He grabbed the cliff wall and kept banging his head against it, making sounds of distress. Ranran’s heart sank, thinking that the Spirit Spring was still in her master’s body, and she hurried over to him.

But Su Yishui abruptly lifted his head, his eyes staring blankly. Then, he cast an indifferent glance at her and disappeared like a shadow below the cliff.

At this moment, the Netherworld Realm began to tremble, and rocks continuously fell from the cliff. The Realm began its cycle, re-absorbing the Spirit Spring, entering a phase of self-repair.

The other three people seemed to have vanished, but Ranran didn’t feel that she was about to be expelled from the Netherworld Realm at all.

Her Yin constitution allowed her to remain light and agile in the Netherworld Realm, like a fish in water. But during this expulsion of foreign elements, the Realm couldn’t detect her. In other words, without a person with a Yang constitution to lead her, Ranran would not be able to find the exit and would be permanently trapped in the Netherworld Realm.

Ranran couldn’t understand why her master, who had clearly seen her just now, seemed to not recognize her at all and just left by himself.

At this moment, the collapse of the Netherworld Realm became even more severe. There was no solid ground under Ranran’s feet anymore, so she could only leap quickly between falling rocks while shouting loudly, ” Shifu! Shifu!”

The only response she got was the rumbling of giant rocks and the strange frightening cries from the chasm below.
