Ranran knew that when the cliff completely collapsed, she would fall into the abyss, never to return!

In this desperate situation, she could do nothing but futilely jump on the falling stones…

Unfortunately, she still landed on air, and her whole body starting to plummet rapidly. Ranran closed her eyes, not wanting to see the scene of her body being torn apart by monsters in the endless abyss.

Just then, her wrist was grabbed tightly by someone. Ranran opened her eyes abruptly and saw with delight that her Shifu had returned and had grabbed her wrist in time.

Due to his Yang constitution, he was suspended in mid-air, seemingly drawn upward by some force like a magnet. Ranran was caught by him, at least stopping her fall.

Although Su Yishui had caught her, his gaze was clear but cold. “Who are you? Why do you have the aura of my golden core?”

Ranran was dumbfounded. She couldn’t understand why her Shifu seemed to no longer recognize her.

At this moment, there was no longer a blood-red color in his eyes, and the black lines on his neck had completely disappeared. However, his entire aura was still gloomy and somewhat unfamiliar.

“Shifu… It’s because you gave your golden core to the Tree of Rebirth, that’s how I was reborn! I am your disciple, Xue Ranran!”

Su Yishui furrowed his brows, looking down at the girl whose wrist he was holding. Right now he was in the Netherworld Realm, his memories were jumbled, especially recent ones, fragmented, disjointed and chaotic.

Although he couldn’t remember why he came to the Netherworld Realm, he knew he was about to leave it.

And this tearful little girl with large eyes, for some reason, was being drawn deeper into the abyss.

He didn’t recognize her, but he sensed his core’s aura on her.

Of course, Su Yishui wouldn’t allow his core to be swallowed by the Netherworld Realm, so he grabbed hold of the girl.

Just then, a golden crack appeared in the air, swallowing them in an instant, disappearing into the dazzling golden light.

Ranran was blinded by the light, simultaneously feeling her body being pulled by two forces. She screamed aloud in pain, and could only hold tightly onto the hand that was firmly gripping hers.

When she opened her eyes again, she was still dazzled by the bright light, but it was the glaring sunlight from above, shining on her body, indicating that she had returned to the human realm.

However, the nauseating feeling of being torn apart had not completely disappeared. Ranran closed her eyes and adjusted herself for a moment before opening them again.

When she sat up, she realized she was lying on the wilderness that was previously filled with demonic flowers.

When the Netherworld Realm opened, the demonic flowers and the bodies drained of their essence in the flower sea all turned into powder, and the place had returned to its desolate autumn state……

Ranran felt that the wilderness seemed even more desolate than before, with signs of ice forming on the ground. She felt a bit cold in her autumn clothes, and if she didn’t mobilize her vitality qi, she feared she would freeze in moments.

Looking around, she found no one else on the wasteland except for herself.

Her Shifu, Wei Jiu, and Tu Jiuyuan were nowhere to be seen. Her Uncle Masters and Qin Xuanjiu were also gone.

Just then, she finally heard some sounds of fighting in the distance.

She quickly got up and walked over, only to find Wei Jiu and Su Yishui fighting each other… Well, she might have been a bit inaccurate in her description—it was Wei Jiu being beaten up by her master.

Wei Jiu clearly didn’t get his opportunity to take advantage. His imposing Crimson Gate Sect robe was torn into pieces, his hair disheveled, completely devoid of any dignity.

He had expected Su Yishui to be greatly weakened after separating from the Spirit Spring. Add the confusion caused by the Soul Cleansing talisman he had applied, he should be an easy target if Su Yishui somehow managed to escape from the Netherworld Realm.

So, at the moment Su Yishui pulled Ranran out, Wei Jiu struck out with his whip.

Wei Jiu had visited the Tian Mai Mountain, soaking in the Black Pool to recover some foundational spiritual energy. Although bitten by the Immortal-Devouring Bugs a few times, his recovery had been significant. Plus, during this time, he had ambushed many foundational figures of the Righteous Path, absorbing their spiritual energy. Therefore, his cultivation had subtly improved.

In the Netherworld Realm, hindered by the forcefield, he couldn’t directly confront Su Yishui, who possessed the Spirit Spring. But now that Su Yishui had returned it, Wei Jiu’s true vitality should surpass that of Su Yishui, who had lost half of his Golden Core.

This was why Wei Jiu had the confidence to follow Su Yishui into the Netherworld Realm and why he ambushed him here now.

However, he never expected that Su Yishui, who should have been weak, would be acting like he had divine assistance, attacking fiercely, his vitality surging and formidable.

The man who had just returned from the Netherworld Realm seemed to have just unsealed a long-restrained power, overflowing with an evil aura in every move, deadly and venomous.

Moreover, the spells Su Yishui used were surprisingly similar to his own, absorbing spiritual energy with each move. This time, Su Yishui didn’t even need the Devil Vine; he openly practiced the demonic way of absorbing others’ spiritual energy.

If it were anyone else, they would have been torn apart by Su Yishui long ago. Although Wei Jiu’s skills were not low, far exceeding the heads of the three major sects, he could barely defend himself and kept retreating.

Fortunately, Wei Jiu *had no qualms about looking pathetic, so even with Ranran watching by the side, he didn’t care about his dignity. He summoned a large cloud of black mist with his remaining spiritual energy and escaped with the heavily injured Tu Jiuyuan.
*装孙子 : 装可怜

When only Su Yishui and Ranran were left on the wasteland again, Ranran ran towards him joyfully, only to be ruthlessly pushed back by Su Yishui with a wave of his sleeve.

“Who are you really? Why do you keep calling me Shifu? Could it be that you were sent by Wei Jiu to steal my golden core?”

Ranran listened wide-eyed and tongue-tied to her Shifu’s cold words, at a loss as to how to respond. She could vaguely guess what Wei Jiu’s talisman was now!

Just then, the sound of horse hooves could be heard from a distance.

Ranran turned around to see that it was two uncle masters riding towards them.

When they spotted Su Yishui and Xue Ranran from afar, they wept with joy and shouted loudly for their master, urging their horses to gallop faster.

Yutong had already burst into tears, laughing as she dismounted and hugged Ranran first, then turned to Su Yishui and said “You two have finally returned! We’ve been waiting here for a whole month, coming here every day, and were starting to lose hope!”

A day in heaven is a year on earth, and it seems that the time in the Netherworld Realm is also different from the human realm.

Ranran and the others only felt that they had been in the Netherworld Realm for a few hours , but a whole month had passed in the human realm.

No wonder Ranran felt the weather turning cold; it should be winter by now.

Despite seeing her uncle masters, Ranran’s face showed no joy. Shifu had returned to the mortal realm, but why did she feel like she had……lost him.

The only silver lining was, Su Yishui still remembered the siblings Yuchen and Yutong.

His current memory was somewhat strange. He remembered everything from his past life with Mu Qingge that annoyed him, clear as day, not forgetting anything.

But unexpectedly, he forgot about the later Fan Yao Battle and most of the details of Mu Qingge’s tragic death. Then, it jumped to the memories of the last two years, becoming fragmented and scattered. Every memory related to Mu Qingge and Ranran was completely forgotten.

The Soul-Cleansing Charm cleansed mortal love. Su Yishui has forgotten the stirrings he had in the past and returned to being the obssessive youth who didn’t understand love.

When he heard from Yuchen that Mu Qingge had been dead for twenty years, his face actually showed a hint of anger, “I actually didn’t kill that witch myself?”

Xue Ranran shrank to the side, listening as the uncle masters struggled to repair their master’s memories. What she was thinking about at this moment was the bombshell that Wei Jiu dropped in the Netherworld Realm – she wasn’t the reincarnation of Mu Ranwu but the true reincarnation of Mu Qingge.

Putting aside whether this was true or false, at this moment, their master’s memories no longer contained the sweet moments with Elder Mu. Instead, all that remained was his resentment for being forced into Xishan and the harassment and contempt he suffered.

If she were to say that she might be the true reincarnation of Mu Qingge right now, she would probably be torn to pieces by her master and dipped in sauce.

So, she kept quiet, silently upset on the side.

Shifu, under the talisman’s effect, not only forgot about the past with Elder Mu but also forgot about all the sweet moments with her, Xue Ranran.

On the sea island, the two of them had cuddled while watching the rainbow-colored sea birds and the little dragon playing in the water, scenes that were still vivid in her mind. But now, she was the only one who remembered those beautiful moments…

Although Ranran had been prepared that after the return the Spirit Spring, she and Shifu might have to pretend nothing ever happened, and gradually return back to the normal master and disciple relationship.

However, she did not expect Shifu to be even more decisive than she could ever imagine, actually erasing her existence altogether.

After returning from the wastelands back to town, Su Yishui’s brow remained deeply furrowed. If not for Yuchen and Yutong being his trusted confidants, he really thought these two were spouting nonsense and speaking deceitful words.

What do they mean that he cherished his relationship between master and disciple, and gave up half of his golden core for the chance for Mu Qingge’s reincarnation?

And that there were two fruits on the Rebirth Tree, one of which was premature, and became his beloved disciple, Xue Ranran?

What do they mean in order to extend her life, he kept her in Xishan, teaching and caring for her dearly?

And the most absurd thing was, he went to the Netherworld Realm just to return the Spirit Spring he had stolen with great difficulty?

Su Yishui felt like he had been bewitched before, doing things without rhyme or reason.

Although his memories were temporarily incomplete, Su Yishui didn’t feel anything was amiss with himself, but did he really do all those things? He needed to slowly find out the reasons…

But when he heard that Su Yu actually defeated his father, Prince Ping, and ascended the throne smoothly, Su Yishui couldn’t contain his anger and said coldly, “What was the problem with me before? The rebellion I painstakingly planned ended in failure like this? How did you all assist me? Or did you collude with others and scheme against me?”

Yuchen and Yutong knelt down on the ground, saying helplessly, “Master, this was truly your decision alone. Moreover, Mu Qingge suddenly intervened in worldly affairs, assisting Su Yu, which turned the tide of the battle. Everything was predestined, and human efforts couldn’t change it!”

Su Yishui, upon realizing that his carefully laid plans had been defeated by Mu Qingge, his face darkened, and he slowly squeezed out three words from between his teeth, “Mu Qingge!”

This female demon was truly his nemesis! Why didn’t she die by his hands!

But since she had already been reincarnated, he could slowly settle their debt of hatred with her…

Thinking of this, Su Yishui slowly turned his gaze to the four so-called disciples beside him.

These four, were one more stupid than the other, completely unlikable. Especially that most beautiful young girl, although she had a pleasing appearance, but she was Mu Qingge’s sister, Mu Ranwu…

Recalling how she had once hinted that she could betray her sister for him, and subsequently kept him informed of everything, Su Yishui felt a genuine disgust towards this woman without morals.

This girl named Xue Ranran was born from the Rebirth Tree, no wonder she had his core’s spiritual aura.

As his thoughts wandered, Su Yishui suddenly made a move, intending to capture Ranran and absorb all her spiritual energy, reclaiming the power of his golden core.

His killing intent was strong, and completely undisguised.

The people in the room all shouted in alarm. Yuchen knelt down and tightly held onto his master’s thighs, while Yutong, like a mother hen, shielded Xue Ranran with her arms, “Master, we didn’t deceive you. Ranran is truly your beloved disciple and you dote on her the most. That damned Wei Jiu pasted some kind of talisman on you, sealing your memories. Please, don’t act recklessly, or else I’m truly afraid that you’ll regret it when your memories return!”

Uncle Master Zeng Yi stood nearby, his lips moving several times but hesitating to speak.

For a while, the hall was quite chaotic.

Although the Yu siblings were no match for Su Yishui, however their numerous years of servitude made Su Yishui temporarily suppress his killing intent.

However, he bluntly expressed his dislike for strangers around him, so these four foolish disciples are not allowed to remain too close to him.

When the first snow of early winter fell, Su Yishui heartlessly drove the four abandoned disciples onto the streets, forcing them to find their own shelter.

The four disciples stood under the eaves, exchanging miserable looks with each other.

Bai Baishan glanced at the three fellow disciples and said awkwardly, “I didn’t expect all of us to be kicked out by our master… It’s okay, at least I can explain when I go home. After all, I’m not the only one who’s been abandoned…”

Gao Cang also didn’t expect that after waiting for a month for their master to return, the first thing he did was to disown them. After hearing the sarcastic words from the second senior brother, he cried in frustration, “You’re the one who’s abandoned! We haven’t violated any sect rules, why are we being kicked out?”

Bai Baishan was indignant, “You and Qiu Xier have both been ensnared by the demonic flowers. How is that different from me being bewitched? It’s all evidence of weak willpower! It’s enough to be kicked out!”

This time, Qiu Xier also started crying along with the eldest senior brother.

At this moment, the door behind them cracked open, and they all turned around in joy, thinking that their master couldn’t bear to send them away. However, it was the second uncle master Yu tong, who said apologetically, “Um… your master wants to meditate, and he finds you all too noisy, so it’s better for you to move further away. It’s dark now, and the teahouses and taverns are closed. The inns in town should also be fully booked. If there is really no choice, you can go to the ruined temple to make a fire and shelter from the snow. Wait until the snow stops before finding an inn…”

Now listen here, does this sound like something a beloved master uncle would say?

Ranran, who had remained silent, spoke up, “Let’s go, our Shifu has just returned from the Netherworld Realm and needs to meditate in peace.”

By now, the snow had grown heavier. The four abandoned disciples from Xishan walked forward with difficulty, and Qiu Xier wiped her tears, saying, “Ranran, do we really have to spend the night in the ruined temple?”

“Why would you need to go to the ruined temple? All of you come with me.” A voice came from behind them.

They turned to see that it was the Fourteenth Uncle Master, Zeng Yi, who had come after them.

“I still have a Medicine shop in Wuma Town. Come with me and stay there temporarily,” he said.

Hearing their uncle master’s words, the four obediently followed him to the medicine shop in the east of town.

Although it was smaller than the Horse Trading Post, at least they have a place to stay. After Zeng Yi instructed his workers to prepare bedding and settled the children, he saw Ranran looking dejected and took the opportunity to comfort her when they were alone, “You know that your master has been enchanted by an evil charm, so don’t blame him. If he doesn’t get better soon, I’ll send you back to reunite with your parents. Didn’t you tell me before that you wanted to graduate quickly and go back to serve your parents?”

Ranran silently poured a cup of tea for her uncle master and suddenly asked, “In the Netherworld Realm, Wei Jiu said I’m actually Mu Qingge. Uncle Master, do you know the truth of this?”

After saying this, she looked directly at Zeng Yi, and Zeng Yi’s expression froze like he had been coated with glue.

After a while, his eyes reddened, he slowly set the teacup down, and then fell to his knees before Ranran with a thud, “Master, the disciple has been unfilial. For not acknowledging you, please punish me!”

Ranran’s question was merely a probe. Perhaps Wei Jiu was talking nonsense. She couldn’t possibly take that demon’s words seriously, could she?

She never expected that Uncle Master would react so strongly after hearing this question, kneeling so earnestly in front of her.

Ranran was startled and quickly knelt down to help him up, “Fourteenth Uncle Master, what are you doing? Aren’t you going to *overwhelm me?”
*折杀 is 对方的过分的礼节或过重的馈赠使自己无法承受 when given too much undue respect

But Zeng Yi just refused to get up, tears streaming down his face, “Master, what Wei Jiu said is all true. You are the true Mu Qingge of Xishan, our master. As for that one, she’s just an imposter. I know about this, and Su Yishui knows too. It’s just that he was afraid you will have to take up the responsibilities from your past life, so he didn’t want to tell you. I also thought that letting you live peacefully and blissfully in this life is better than anything else. We took such liberties, so please punish us, master!”

No matter how much Ranran tried to persuade him, he wouldn’t budge. She could only sigh and sit back down, looking at Zeng Yi kneeling on the ground, her head buzzing.

This trip to the Netherworld Realm had turned everything upside down, causing confusion between master and disciples. Her mind was also in chaos right then, and she needed to calm down and sort things out slowly.

After Zeng Yi tearfully finished acknowledging his master, he still felt uneasy, so he cautioned with concern, “Master, your current spiritual power is still not comparable to Su Yishui’s. He has forgotten the past, like he was a newly entered disciple, just a reckless kid. You must never, ever reveal your identity in front of him. Otherwise, he might do an about-face and turn hostile!”

Ranran blinked and asked, “So the current Elder Mu…… is actually Mu Ranwu?”

Zeng Yi nodded and sighed, “Master, please… don’t be soft-hearted like you were before…”

Ranran smiled wryly, “Uncle Master, please don’t call me that anymore. I’m just an eighteen-year-old girl now. How could I be your master, if the others overhear, they will find it very weird…”

Zeng Yi nodded repeatedly and kept saying yes.

In fact, in his opinion, Su Yishui forgetting his mentor Mu Qingge was actually a good thing. The relationship between them was like an ill-fated entanglement. If they could live well separately, it would be considered fortunate.

Now that Su Yishui was disowning everyone, acting coldly towards him and treating Ranran like a stranger, if Su Yishui kept thinking about absorbing Ranran’s cultivation to supplement his golden core, it would be disastrous.

Now that the matter of the Spirit Spring was over, there wasn’t much use to be staying here. He decided to leave with his master as soon as possible and stay away from the disputes from her past life……

Zeng Yi made his plans, so the next day before dawn, he had the servants pack their bags and prepare to leave.

But before they could finish packing, Yutong came looking for them again, saying that Su Yishui wanted Zeng Yi to go over and inquire about the businesses entrusted to him.

Most of the properties under Zeng Yi’s name were actually entrusted to him by Su Yishui before he secluded himself in Western Mountain. He was just a steward.

Now Su Yishui suddenly summoned him, obviously wanting to take back his businesses.

Zeng Yi feels that it doesn’t matter. Anyway, his savings over the years were enough to support his master and ensure that she would be well taken care of. If he didn’t have to deal with those businesses, he would be even more relaxed.

But when he returned to the Horse Trading Post, he saw the handsome and cold man sitting in front of his table, frowning at the table full of trinkets.

There were grasshoppers woven from grass on the table, a paper lantern that was just half finished, and two small bamboo baskets containing month-old dried sweet potatoes and other snacks that had hardened a bit.

Su Yishui instinctively felt that these were not things he had placed there, but the Yu siblings were sure that these were indeed all put personally by him. Including the notes on how to make lanterns, they were indeed in his own handwriting.

This really annoyed him. Su Yi Shui suspected that he had been bewitched in the past, otherwise why would he do such idle and boring things?

As Zeng Yi walked in, Su Yishui waved his long arm and swept all the things on the table into the dustpan on the side.

Oh no! Its the amnesia arc!

Actually things are just starting to get really good lol
Everyone, please don’t miss the indulgent Shifu too much, and look forward to meet the bad, gloomy boy Su Yishui!

Previous
Next

西山校规 Sect Rules of Xi Shan

Zeng Yi looked at the little trinkets swept into the dustpan and did not comment.

However, to Zeng Yi’s surprise, Su Yishui didn’t intend to take back his businesses but rather asked him to withdraw funds for setting up a new place for cultivation.

Su Yishui absolutely hated West Mountain. Since the palace coup had failed and his cultivation had been damaged, affecting his ascension with the Nascent Soul stage, it was a priority to find a new secluded place for cultivation.

Zeng Yi nodded and then had his account books brought over, placing them on Su Yishui’s desk, tactfully expressing his intention to leave.

Su Yishui listened expressionlessly and then said flatly, “Although I’ve forgotten some memories, I never doubt my judgment in people. Since I entrusted you with such a large estate before, and you managed it well, why would I retract now? I heard from Yu Tong that when you were in distress, I was the one who saved you. If you want to repay that favor, you should continue doing what you’re supposed to do, right?”

His tone now carried a hint of threat and coercion, devoid of the calm and tolerance he had nurtured over twenty years.

Zeng Yi sighed, treating the present Su Yishui as the bad-tempered youth from twenty years ago. Rather than arguing over words, he simply explained, “I’ve managed this for twenty years and I’m tired. I want to find a secluded place with no one around to live. The accountants below are all experienced hands, with their own rules and protocols. Even if I leave, you will be able to manage.”

Seeing that Zeng Yi had made up his mind, Su Yishui didn’t insist with empty polite words and just lowered his gaze, dismissing him.

Zeng Yi returned to the medicine shop and briefly explained the situation to Ranran, urging her to leave with him quickly. When they went back, they could pick up Ranran’s parents, then proceed to temporarily avoid worldly matters for some time.

Ranran listened, and understood that this was the best arrangement right now.

If she was truly Mu Qingge, her current situation was indeed dangerous. Su Yishui, who had completely forgotten the good points of Mu Qingge, was himself the biggest threat.

Although Ranran didn’t remember her past life after her rebirth, she had gathered enough information in these two years to piece things together.

Plus, Mu Ruanwu had deliberately schemed to take her place, so naturally she would not intend to get along with her.

But thinking about leaving Su Yishui, perhaps never meeting again in this life, Ranran felt an indescribable dull pain in her heart.

However, she was very certain about one thing: the affection Shifu had shown her all these while was probably meant for Mu Qingge. Regardless of whether he later loved or hated Mu Qingge, it had nothing to do with Xue Ranran.

Even though Wei Jiu and Uncle Master Zeng Yi both say she is Mu Qingge, she doesn’t remember at all and she didn’t feel that she should inherit anything from this identity as Mu Qingge.

Since Shifu had forgotten, then they no longer owed anything to each other. Perhaps this was fortunate for both of them.

She innately won’t indulge in sadness for too long, so when she felt out of sorts, she would automatically find something to do, like packing her bags and then using the small kitchen in the medicine shop to cook meat and vegetables, making the last meal to send over to Shifu.

According to Wei Jiu’s insinuations, her death in her past life was indeed closely related to Su Yishui. But Ranran tried not to think too much about past grievances.

In this life, Shifu had always been very good to her, so cooking a meal for him before bidding farewell to end their master-disciple relationship was only right.

But she didn’t dare to overtly show this last bit of filial piety. She handed the exquisite tray of food to second uncle master, letting her deliver it to the master.

Yu Tong watched Ranran, who was carrying a small travel bag, and couldn’t help but feel sad. She softly comforted her, “Your master has just forgotten temporarily, he will remember eventually. Gao Cang and the others haven’t left. Why are you leaving so hastily?”

Ranran knew that second uncle master didn’t know she was the real Mu Qingge. Otherwise, based on Yu tong’s prejudice against Mu Qingge, she wouldn’t have been so kind to her.

She sighed softly, smiled, and said, “I haven’t seen my parents for a long time and miss them very much. It’s better to part ways here and go back to be with my parents. This braised pork belly is Shifu’s favorite. I cooked it in a clay pot and it’s still steaming hot now. If it cools down, it will affect the taste. Pls hurry and take it to him.”

Yu Tong nodded, quickly took the tray and entered the dining room. But when she came out again to the door, there were only snowflakes swirling in the northern wind, and the girl who loved to smile had disappeared without a trace.

Although the Soul-Cleansing Talisman was quite overbearing, Su Yishui didn’t feel much discomfort.

Losing memories was indeed troublesome, but after filling in the gaps from Yu’s siblings, he suddenly felt that forgetting was also a good thing.

The past twenty years sounded mundane and boring. Most of the time, he was confined in seclusion in the cave on West Mountain, like he was punishing himself.

Leaving aside other matters, voluntarily giving up his golden core was indeed stupid and deserved punishment!

And the matter of taking disciples in the past two years might have stemmed from being too bored in seclusion on West Mountain, causing him to be like Mu Qingge and take in some useless disciples.

Those few *ugly disciples with the exception of Xue Ranran, were all quite mediocre. If he were to take in disciples, he would never have accepted such trash to waste his time.
*歪瓜裂枣 literally poorly formed melons and dates

As for Xue Ranran, it was only natural for her to have innate talent. After all, she inherited half of his golden core and essentially took a shortcut in cultivation. Although Yu’s siblings were very proud that he had always been like a good master and took care of his disciples with dedication, the current Su Yishui couldn’t feel any sense of accomplishment as a teacher. He only thought about how to retrieve his core.

Moreover… he remembered that he had already begun preparations to fast for cultivation. Usually, he ate once a day or once every three days. After all, consuming too much grain and rice was not conducive to purifying the spirit channels.

But what’s going on with his body now that he gets hungry every mealtime? Did he spend twenty years of seclusion on West Mountain for nothing?

However, Yu Tong’s culinary skills had greatly improved. The braised pork belly was savory and not greasy, perfect with rice. The stir-fried shrimp with beets was also delicious.

Su Yishui momentarily forgot about his big fasting plans and finished all the dishes.

This actually made him look forward to the next meal, thinking that he could just start fasting after a few more meals, it wouldn’t delay his cultivation too much.

But when the next meal was served, it took all his appetite away. The ingredients were somewhat old, and coupled with rough cooking, it tasted terrible. For example, the dish of stir-fried meat was overcooked and tough.

After taking two bites, Su Yishui immediately set down his chopsticks. He usually didn’t bother scolding people over such trivial matters, it was excusable that perhaps Yu Tong had just made a careless slip. However, after three days, Su Yishui couldn’t bear it any longer and called Yu Tong over to ask, “Why have the meals you’ve been making in the past few days been getting worse?”

Yu Tong looked ashamed and replied, “Master, these meals were all made by the kitchen maids from the Horse Trading post. If I made them, they would probably taste even worse…”

Su Yishui lifted his head to glance at her and asked, “Who made the braised pork the other day?”

Yu Tong honestly replied, “Of course that would be Ranran. You like her cooking the most. If it’s not her cooking, you never want to take an extra bite.

Su Yishui frowned and paused for a moment before saying, “Then……bring her back to cook.”

Yu Tong wore a troubled expression and said, “But…..that child has already left with her fourteen uncle master. I heard they went back to visit her parents.”

Upon hearing this, Su Yishui said flatly, “You may go. You don’t need to bring me any meals today.”

So it was Xue Ranran who made it! The former Mu Ranwu had become quite the gourmet in this life, just like Mu Qingge in making food and drinks.

Now that he thought about it, the taste of those dishes indeed had a hint of her sister’s style…

Both of them are just bad influences, promoting indulgence in worldly pleasures! If he had known earlier, he wouldn’t even have touched it. It’s good that she has left, he can now start afresh on the right path of cultivation, to proceed with fasting and purifying the spirit channels…

However, after a day had passed, he found that daytime was still bearable, but in the late night hours, Su Yishui always heard his stomach rumbling. His mind uncontrollably went back to the day, to the taste when he ate pieces of pork belly together with vegetables and rice in every mouthful…

When he realized he was chewing unconsciously, Su Yishui opened his eyes in exasperation: Damn it! Was he losing control? Why was he so hungry?

It wasn’t just hunger; there was also an indescribable emptiness in his heart, as if he had lost something important but couldn’t remember what it was.

This day, Su Yishui decided not to meditate. He laid on the bed which he has not been on for a while, to quieten his mind. When he turned over, he discovered a small snack bag under his pillow, embroidered with tacky apricot flowers and colorful butterflies, clearly a girl’s item. Below the bag, there was also the embroidered character “Ran,” like a round bud.

Opening the bag, there were preserved plums and jerky inside. Su Yishui took a dried plum and put it in his mouth. Because it had been stored for a while, it wasn’t as good as it had been a month ago. But when Su Yishui held the dried plum in his mouth, he could taste a unique sweetness, miraculously calming his restless pangs of hunger…

Su Yishui slowly closed his eyes and chewed. He then slowly opened his eyes, and glared at the delicate little bag in his hand with a murderous intent.

Now he was absolutely certain, that Xue Ranran must not stay! She was like her sister, a demonic hindrance to his ascension, a witch that shouldn’t exist in the world!

That demonic hindrance to an immortal’s ascension, had left quietly with uncle master Zeng Yi.

Zeng Yi didn’t bring any entourage, just traveling light with Ranran. Although he didn’t know light body technique, Ranran said there was no need to hurry anyhow.

So the two of them took the relay station’s carriage, and made several detours They first went to West Mountain, dug up the small tree in Ranran’s yard, then Ranran packed four large boxes of books from the Xishan study.

Setting off again, they finally arrived at the villa where the Xue couple were living.

When Qiao Lian heard that her daughter had graduated and didn’t need to go back to West Mountain anymore, she was thrilled.

Her daughter was already eighteen; they really couldn’t delay anymore. Coming back now was perfect for them to look at potential suitors.

But Ranran said she had no intention of marrying now, and she needed to avoid her enemies for a while, so she needed to seclude herself in the mountains for a period of time.

The Xue couple knew that their daughter’s background might be special. They had been hiding in the villa for too long, and were always on edge. If they could live in seclusion in another place with their daughter, it wouldn’t be bad either.

Being together as a family, was always a good thing.

Zeng Yi had an elegant villa at Lian Mountain. It was not part of Su Yishui’s estate, but one he built for his own retirement. The surrounding villages were also few, with beautiful scenery and pleasant climate.

So the four of them, along with the two servants who had served Zeng Yi for many years, went to Lian Mountain together.

After Ranran replanted the small tree in front of her room, she touched the delicate leaves on the tree, recalling the time when Su Yishui planted this tree with her.

At that time, she felt that her Shifu was really good to her. But now looking back, perhaps Su Yishui had more of feelings of guilt towards her?

That beautiful and sweet memory had been wiped clean from Shifu’s mind. From now on, he no longer needed to worry or go about doing things for her.

The Spirit Spring has been returned to its rightful place, balancing the human realm and the netherworld. From now on, she just had to live her own life as Xue Ranran…

Ranran was very broad-minded in her thinking, but when she felt her face itching and reached out to touch it, she realized tears were streaming down her face.

It would seem that some things were easy to pick up, but when it came time to let go, it would take some effort…

Fortunately, there were still plenty of matters for her to worry about. The white tiger and vermilion bird had followed her all the way to Lian Mountain. Little white tiger was still alright, sleeping and eating all day like a cat, or running off into the woods to catch rabbits and birds.

But the vermilion bird had been very restless these past few days, always perching on Ranran’s shoulder, pecking at her earlobes, urging her to hum and sing with it. Not even delicious peanuts could calm it down.

Moreover, its size seemed a bit uncontrollable. There were a few nights when it grew larger again and soared into the sky.

Although this place was rarely visited by people, such phenomena would eventually attract some unscrupulous individuals. So Ranran used her skills to set up a spiritual shield around Lian Mountain. Although the shield was not as powerful as her Shifu’s powers, it was better than nothing.

When Ranran left the West Mountain, she not only took away the small tree but also unceremoniously took several large boxes of books as well.

Since she was Mu Qingge, those books in the study belonged to her. Ranran loved reading, so she left a note for her Shifu, with polite pleasantries, expressing that she had taken the books, and if he needed them in the future, she would return them.

The truth was Ranran had no intention of returning them; it was just for show. If Wei Jiu’s words were true, and Su Yishui had caused her death as Mu Qingge, how could he have the nerve to ask for the books that belonged to her?

So, with Zhu que acting strangely, Ranran searched through the books and finally found the reason. Zhu Que… had entered a stage of longing for springtime romance.

In other words, it wanted to find a mate and lay some eggs.

Ranran was a good owner, but she didn’t know where to find a partner for it. So she simply explained Zhu Que’s current condition to it and instructed it to fly safely towards the southwest, to the southern land of the heavens, which was the native land of the vermilion birds. If everything goes well, it should find a suitable mate there.

After giving the instructions, Ranran opened the spiritual shield around Lian Mountain and let the little Zhu Que out.

But the little Zhu Que was reluctant to leave, circling around Ranran’s head several times. In the end, Ranran had to comfort it, telling it to bring its children to look for her in the future. Only then did it give a long screech and fly straight into the sky, circling and whistling in the clouds.

Just as Ranran was waving goodbye reluctantly to Zhu Que, like sending a child off on a long journey, someone behind her said coldly, “Do you not know the value of a vermilion bird, and just let it go so easily?”

Ranran spun around and saw the handsome man she hadn’t seen for a long time standing behind her, his eyes cold as frost.

“Shi…” Ranran was momentarily stunned, instinctively wanting to call him “Shifu.” But then she remembered that he had already expelled her from the sect, so she stopped herself in time and asked hesitatingly, “Why…are you here?”

Su Yishui noticed the girl’s alienation, very different from when she had come out of the netherworld, almost hugging him and crying in distress.

Thinking of how Yu Tong had vigorously tried to prove to him how attached this Xue Ranran was to him, was simply a joke!

Seeing Su Yi Shui looking at her coldly, Ranran took a deep breath silently, telling herself not to dwell on the past too much. Shifu did not remember their intimacy when the Spirit Spring possessed him, so there was no need for any embarrassment.

She cleared her throat and said in a small voice, “Zhu Que didn’t establish a soul contract with me, so of course it’s free to come and go.”

Su Yishui cast her a glance, somewhat surprised that this Mu Ranwu was not as greedy as she had been in her previous life. The legendary Zhu Que, unattainable to ordinary people, she just casually let it go!

Nevertheless, Su Yishui hadn’t forgotten his purpose in coming. He coldly said, “You took my golden core, and then went back to loot West Mountain. Do you think no one will hold you accountable?”

Ranran felt a little upset and whispered, “How can you take back something that’s already given away? It’s not like I forced you to sacrifice your golden core… You once said that the books in the study, I could take them as I pleased.”

Seeing his forsaken disciple so disobedient, Su Yishui snorted coldly, once again confirming that he had indeed been blind and made a mistake in taking her as his disciple.

Ranran knew, that if he really asked for his golden core back, she might lose most of her spiritual power, and her life might be at risk.

But even if she knew he had come to take her life, there was still an indescribable feeling in her heart now that she could see him once more.

But casting life and death aside, it was almost noon now. Ribs were still simmering on her stove. A pot of three salt-baked chicken was almost ready too. Complement these with some greens, even if she was going to die, she wanted to die with a full stomach.

So she simply ignored Su Yishui’s blatant threat and casually asked him, “…are you hungry? I made salt-baked chicken, it’s very delicious when eaten hot.”

It was just a casual question, and she didn’t expect him to accept. But to her great surprise, her former Shifu, handsome like an immortal, walked with composure towards the villa in the mountains with a cold look, his steps… somewhat hurried.

Uncle master Zeng Yi had gone down the mountain with his father for some business and wouldn’t be back for two days. These three salt-baked chickens were originally meant for her and her mother to eat over three days.

But with an uninvited guest, one pot of chicken was barely enough.

Su Yishui had come this time to settle scores with his wayward disciple. But since it was noon now, and she had extended an invitation, it wouldn’t hurt to have a meal.

At the dining table, Qiao Lian naturally took care of the guest warmly. Upholding the rural woman’s habit of not eating at the table when guests were present, she left her daughter to host her master.

So Ranran didn’t eat a single bite, just silently watched her former master devour the three chickens like he was possessed by a *weasel, leaving behind clean white bones.
黄鼠狼 has a related idiom 黄鼠狼给鸡拜年——没安好心
but ironically it seems the weasel is not all that fond of chicken lol

“…Shifu, how long have you been hungry” Ranran couldn’t change her habit in a short time. In a moment of carelessness, she called him “Shifu” again.

Su Yishui was satiated. When he put down his chopsticks, he realized he had forgotten himself while he ate.

But he always handled things calmly, so he completely ignored Ranran’s question and cut straight to, “You have my golden core. I won’t allow you to leave as you like. Pack up your things later, go back with me.”

Ranran fell silent for a moment and said in a small voice, “I won’t go back. If you insist on taking back your cultivation, then feel free to do so. You were once my Shifu and also saved my life, so you are entitled to whatever you want.”

She never liked owing people. Although taking back something that was given was childish behavior, she could forgive her Shifu since he’s a victim to the soul-cleansing talisman.

Now that her Shifu gets annoyed just by looking at her, if it was just because of the core, then he could take it back. Ranran felt that with her current spiritual power, even though she could be affected, it wouldn’t necessarily lead to her soul scattering. At worst, she would be weaker.

Su Yishui hadn’t expected this girl to be so stubborn; he narrowed his eyes for a moment, his face darkening. In his opinion, this was indeed the simplest way.

But the delicious taste of the salt-baked chicken still lingered in his mouth, and the thought that if she died, he may perhaps never taste such delicacies again, made him feel regretful…

The two sat at the table in silence, the frozen atmosphere making things quite awkward.

At that moment, Qiao Lian came over with washed pears and placed them on the table. Seeing their expressions, she tugged at her daughter’s sleeve and said, “Don’t anger your master. Although you’ve returned after completing your studies, a day as a mentor is a lifetime as a father. You should still be respectful and filial to Master Su in the future!”

Ranran thought to herself, in my past life, I was his master! I don’t see him showing respect? Now that he’s just forgotten a part of his memories, why did he turn into a ferocious devil?

After Qiao Lian left, Su Yishui suddenly stood up and said coldly, “When did I say you finished your training? Disobeying your master’s orders and leaving the sect without permission is tantamount to betraying the sect! According to the sect rules, your spiritual roots should be severed, your cultivation destroyed, and you should be tied with a rock and sunken to the depths of the Western Mountain!”

Ranran was eating a pear and almost choked upon hearing this. She quickly swallowed and said, “When did we have such sect rules? How come I didn’t know?”

Xishan was a laid-back sect, and the rules of Mu Qingge’s sect had been lackadaisical. Later, Su Yishui’s rules were not much better. Disobedient disciples were simply stripped of their cultivation and sent away from the mountain.

Such inhumane rules such as “tied with a rock and sunken to the depths of the Western Mountain”, she had never ever heard of them!

However, Su Yishui was very composed, as he lowered his eyes and said, “Am I the sect master of Xishan, or are you? If I say there is then there is!”

Hmm… even though Ranran really wanted to say that being a sect master wasn’t a big deal, she seemed to have done it before as well, but since Su Yishui was using sect rules to oppress her, she couldn’t say much more and could only follow him back for now.

Speaking of which, Su Yishui was able to find her here because of the aura of his golden core.

After he found out that his core had been divided and given to Mu Qingge, he had stood in the crowd and tried to detect it when Mu Qingge was parading about with her disciples. But he found that the core aura on Mu Qingge was not strong, as if half of his core that was in the tree had all gone to the fruit that became Xue Ranran.

It’s a little sad that right before they went to the Netherworld Realm, Su Yishui had been making another lantern for Ranran even after he said he wanted her to make one for him.
And she in turn, had left him some bedtime snacks under his pillow as a surprise.
URRRRGH

Still the new arc’s bad boy Su Yishui is also really fun.
The classic trope where the way into Su Yishui’s heart is through his stomach still stands LOL

Previous
Next

故意置气 TANTRUMS

ALT SUGGESTED TITLE : DATING THE REAL SU YISHUI

Qin Xuanjiu was promoted due to his outstanding performance in the confrontation with Gao Kan. Mu Qingge, on the other hand, leaned on this big tree for shade and has now established her own sect, once again establishing her own school.

Even Yu Tong and the others were surprised. In just over a month, Mu Qingge’s followers had become quite numerous, including many cultivators who have already attained their cores…

Even in her past life, Mu Qingge didn’t have so many powerful disciples!

It seemed like some force was supporting her from behind the scenes…

Su Yishui should have looked for Mu Qingge to settle old scores, but seeing her acting like the founder of a sect parading around, he became extremely anxious.

Moreover, for some reason, ever since he returned from the Netherworld Realm, he always felt an inexplicable emptiness and a sense of desolation in his heart, making him unmotivated in showing off his strength.

This feeling of emptiness and desolation always struck him unexpectedly, and he didn’t know how to reduce it. Although it didn’t affect his daily life, it made him inexplicably annoyed.

Food that was hard to swallow, a tongue that had become unusually sensitive, along with lines and lines of beautiful handwriting and mischievous notes and annotations in the books he carried with him, all subtly revealed how someone had once boldly changed his lifestyle habits.

Su Yishui felt increasingly angry towards that girl named Xue Ranran, and this burning anger was set ablaze when he arrived back at West Mountain.

According to Yu Tong, the Rebirth Tree that was planted in Xue Ranran’s yard had been dug up by its roots and taken away. Su Yishui had wanted to find a way to remove the effects of the soul-cleansing talisman, but he found that his study had been completely ransacked by a little thief.

The little thief even left a note, claiming to have borrowed them.

The words on the note, turned out to be exactly the same as the annotations in his books. Now Su Yishui finally believed what Yu Tong had said — he had once pampered this disciple a lot!

But no matter how much he pampered her, there should be boundaries, right? He never agreed, so how could taking away so many books without permission be borrowing? This was clearly theft!

As a result, Su Yishui suddenly felt very depressed. Every time he entered the empty study, he felt an inexplicable anger rising within him.

To counter Mu Qingge, he had also been recruiting disciples recently.

It was said that Xue Ranran had lived up to expectations and had made a name for Xishan Sect at the Tian Mai Mountain Marrow-Cleansing Pool meet. With this, the idea of establishing a new sect could be put off for a while. After all, West Mountain was spacious enough to accommodate more disciples. If he had to relocate and rebuild, who knew how long that would take.

A month passed this way, and Su Yishui just felt extremely hungry lately. Sometimes during meditation, he would be distracted. When he was in the empty study, he pulled out a book placed on the desk, and an old discolored menu fell out of the pages.

Looking at the handwriting, it should be written by Xue Ranran. There were even illustrations next to each dish name, such as Salt and Pepper Duck, Soup-filled Shrimp Dumplings, Dongpo Pork, all in all more than twenty dishes.

Beneath the dishes, there was a sweet little line: “Shifu, write down what you want to eat every day and leave it on the desk. I’ll make it for you at noon…”

Although Su Yishui didn’t remember, he could imagine himself flipping the dishes plaques like an emperor in West Mountain.

That little girl probably planned the ingredients for lunch while tidying up his study every day. After his morning meditation, he could enjoy delicious meals at noon.

But now, the menu was still here, yet the person who cooked the dishes had forgotten their gratitude and loyalty, and left the sect!

The gates of Xishan were too unsecured!

Later, Su Yishui didn’t know what he was thinking. He just went out aimlessly by moonlight, followed the aura of the golden core and found Ranran like that.

Although he came without a purpose, perhaps just to retrieve his books and reclaim his core at the same time.

Unexpectedly, when he arrived, he saw the silly girl letting go of the precious Vermilion Bird.

Although he really wanted to break that Vermilion Bird’s neck to obtain its spiritual blood, he inexplicably just stood by and watched with disinterest as Xue Ranran nagged incessantly to the Vermilion Bird, even bidding it farewell reluctantly.

This Xue Ranran wasn’t as shrewd as Mu Ranwu had been in her past life!

Su Yishui squinted as he drew this conclusion. When he looked at this girl again, somehow, his disgust towards her seemed to lessen a little.

After eating the salt-baked Chicken, Su Yishui felt that even though half of the golden core was precious, it didn’t matter to share it with this silly little girl for the time being.

At least her cooking was very delicious. Before ascending, having a good meal now and then, would be a comfort in the boring life of cultivation.

Since he had taken her as a disciple, there should have been some intent behind it, only he had carelessly forgotten it. With the power of his golden core in her possession, it was naturally safest for her to stay by his side.

Otherwise, if she fell into the hands of someone like Wei Jiu, wouldn’t he unduly benefit from his core?

Considering it like this, retrieving the disciple who had left the sect without authorization became par for the course.

Under the strict and ruthless rules of the sect, Ranran’s brief escape was declared over within a month.

Su Yishui seemed to be in a big hurry. Instead of waiting for Zeng Yi to return, he just had Ranran tell Qiaolian that her cultivation was insufficient and she had to return to West Mountain to cultivate. Then he was going to bring Ranran down the mountain immediately and go back.

Qiaolian, upon hearing this, became anxious as well. She spoke frankly to Su Yishui, “Master Su, our Ranran is not young anymore, and her cultivation is almost there. Her father and I were thinking of arranging a marriage for her soon. How much more does she need to cultivate? How about…we stop here?”

Ranran was afraid that Su Yishui would get angry at her mother, so she quickly intervened, saying that stopping her cultivation now wouldn’t be good for her health.

After hearing this, Qiaolian, fearing for her daughter’s life, quickly packed Ranran’s things and let her leave with the master.

However, on the way back, Su Yishui once again angrily discovered, that this young girl seemed to have no respect for him as her master.

If they were going on the wind, it shouldn’t take long to travel, but she was dragging her feet.

“Shifu, you see there’s a town ahead. When uncle master Zeng Yi and I came over, we ate at a Scallion Pancake stall in the town. They also served a pig stomach soup with the pancakes, which was really delicious. How about having lunch there?”

Su Yishui coldly glanced at her, intending to refuse flatly. But seeing her pitifully looking at him with her big dewy eyes, what came out of his mouth was, “… Street food, will it be unsanitary?”

Ranran quickly said, “The stall owners are very clean. I saw that they used fresh ingredients, and the pig stomach they used was very fresh too. The soup just out of the pot, with a spoonful of hot oil and fried chili peppers, is really fresh and spicy.”

Perhaps it was this greedy girl’s longing expression that moved him, Su Yishui unexpectedly said again, “Alright…”

However, when he sat in the cramped and crowded stall, his handsome face gave a dirty look like the unwashed pig intestines. He silently wondered why he was squeezing with a bunch of mediocre people to drink pig offal soup?

And the young girl sitting next to him, was wearing a pink floral jacket… so unbearably common!

“Shifu, see if the taste I prepared is alright?”

Ranran seemed not to notice Su Yishui’s dark expression, handing him the soup with added chili. Then she eagerly picked up a scallion pancake and started to eat.

Their scallion pancakes had crispy lard in them, making them incredibly fragrant.

Seeing the girl eating happily, Su Yishui hesitantly brought the pancake to his mouth and took a bite… Well, it was indeed soft, fragrant, and had a unique taste…

But he just couldn’t get used to eating with a crowd, so he only took one bite and put down his chopsticks.

When Ranran asked why he wasn’t eating, Su Yishui coldly said, “Buy more food later. Don’t take me to crowded stalls like this again. Since you’ve been my disciple for so long, didn’t you know that I don’t like being too close to strangers?”

… Ranran really didn’t know Su Yishui had this problem. Back in the capital city, he had patiently accompanied her, going to various stalls to taste food one by one.

The shops in the capital were even more noisy and crowded than these small-town stalls, and some even required queuing for an hour to get in!

But Su Yishui would accompany her patiently, never showing the annoyance he was showing now!

“Also, as a disciple of Xishan, dress more plainly. Don’t wear clothes like the ones you have on now in the future!”

Ranran pursed her lips and looked at her jacket… Well, she was indeed wearing a brightly colored coat made by her mother. The color is a little glaring.

It seemed that Shifu’s aesthetic sense hadn’t changed at all, only liking plain colors. But his disdain was completely undisguised now, completely devoid of the patience he had when picking out new clothes for her.

Perhaps he was also very annoyed back then but managed to hide it well. In order to compensate for his guilt towards Mu Qingge, he added a bit of patience?

Suddenly, Ranran’s heart was filled with mixed emotions, and even the delicious soup became difficult to swallow. She didn’t know if the soul-cleansing talisman’s effect would be lifted.

But Shifu had forgotten everything that happened after Mu Qingge’s death, and also forgot about their past together. He seemed to have changed completely.

This made Ranran realize once again, that all his affection for her might have been due to his guilt towards Mu Qingge.

If that’s really the case, Su Yishui might as well not regain his memories. Because she doesn’t need this kind of affection driven by guilt and compensation.

After all, she is now Xue Ranran, having forgotten everything as Mu Qingge. If she were to mindlessly receive the favors from her past life, she wouldn’t be able to be carefree in this life!

So Xue Ranran quietly took out a handkerchief, wrapped the unfinished pancakes in it, called the boss to settle the bill, and then said to Su Yishui, “I’m not eating anymore either, let’s go.”

When Su Yishui said these, he was just speaking his mind and didn’t mean to let the girl go hungry. Unexpectedly, she suddenly stopped eating after hearing just that one sentence.

At such a young age, she’s acting like this? Could it be because he was too easygoing before, spoiling this disciple to have such a rebellious attitude?

Thinking of this, Su Yishui snorted coldly and didn’t bother to indulge her spoiled attitude, simply got up and left.

Afterward, Ranran really didn’t ask him to stroll around anymore. She just asked the master to have tea and rest in an elegant teahouse, while she went to several shops by herself.

After all, she had gone home and now going back to West Mountain, she had to bring some local specialties for the uncle masters and the senior brothers and sisters. Also, second uncle master’s child would also need some new clothes and toys.

So after buying a round of southern specialties, Ranran returned carrying them.

Su Yishui frowned and asked her what she bought. Ranran enthusiastically listed everything one by one.

The current Sect leader of Xishan became more and more gloomy as he listened. This stupid girl bought so many things, even things for the cats and dogs of West Mountain, but there was nothing for him.

Was it because he didn’t let her eat to her heart’s content earlier, so now she was venting her dissatisfaction?

Actually, Ranran really didn’t mean to. She felt that Su Yishui was now annoyed with her, and if she bought something for him, he probably wouldn’t be pleased with it either. Rather than having to hear his ridicule, it was better not to invite it.

On the rest of the journey, the two didn’t have much to say. When they stopped, Ranran would find a shady spot, quietly drink water from her flask, and eat the somewhat dried-out pancakes.

Su Yishui originally wanted to meditate, but every time he closed his eyes, he couldn’t help but open them and coldly watch the girl hiding to eat.

During the journey, one of the hair ties she used to tie her hair broke, so her long hair was loose, and she simply gathered it up, tying it into a loose braid that hung over her shoulder. Strands of hair fell softly on her face, adding a touch of innocence, and the sunlight filtered through the branches, making her face glow like a pearl and jade sculpture…

When Su Yishui was lost in thought staring, Ranran suddenly looked up at him. When their eyes met, Su Yishui immediately lowered his gaze. But after doing so, he felt why he should feel guilty? What’s wrong with openly looking at his half of the golden core?

Thinking this way, he confidently opened his eyes again. But he found that that damn girl had turned around, facing her back to him as if to ignore him.

She… did she disdain him for looking at her?

Ranran was feeling upset at this moment. When she inadvertently met Su Yishui’s eyes earlier, he immediately closed them in disgust, as if he had seen something dirty.

In fact, all the way here, Su Yishui had been nitpicking at her, his words cold and harsh. It was like the fierce beast in the “Playing Classics” had come to life.

It was also precisely because of this, that Ranran realized how restrained and tolerant Shifu had been before.

She couldn’t remember the various wrongs Su Yishui had done to her in her past life, but she was very grateful for his quiet protection in this life.

In this case, she didn’t want to dig up old grievances, and just wanted to find a way for both of them to get along comfortably.

He seemed to not like to see her eat, so she would just turn her back to him.

When they returned to West Mountain, she would not appear often in front of him. After he got into a better mood, he could take back his golden core, and they would be even.

Thinking that if Su Yishui knew she was Mu Qingge, he would probably treat her worse than he did now. Ranran was so sad, she actually felt like crying.

But, this was also the real Su Yishui, a man who wasn’t bound by gratitude or guilt and acted according to his whims. If he could choose, Ranran guessed that her Shifu might prefer the current feeling of not owing anyone anything?

After walking for a while, they arrived at a mountain pass surrounded by mountains on all sides. The forest here was dense, and the scenery was lush and green.

When passing by a village, Ranran saw from afar several people kneeling and crying at the village’s ancestral hall.

Ranran had originally wanted to go into the village to fetch some water.

But after listening to the cries of those people for a while, she turned back and said, “Shifu, several families’ seven or eight-year-old children went to play in the mountains together, but they haven’t returned. They said that in recent years, there have been monsters eating people in these nearby mountains, and many people from the village have gone missing. So, normally, no one dares to go up the mountain. Now that the children are missing, two families’ men have gone to the town to report, but they haven’t returned, so the women are begging the village’s hunters and brave men to help find the children. But no one dares to go…”

Su Yishui seemed indifferent to these matters and only asked, “Did you get your water?”

Ranran shook her head and looked curiously at the surrounding towering mountains. “Shifu, do you think there really are monsters that eat people?”

Su Yishui replied indifferently, “It’s getting late, let’s hurry and go.”

Ranran knew, that her Shifu was much more indifferent now compared to before, seemingly uninterested in things that didn’t concern him.

However, when she saw the women kneeling and crying at the village entrance, pleading with the village’s hunters to search for their children on the mountain, Ranran still felt somewhat unwilling to turn a blind eye.

She said in a small voice, “Shifu, how about you sit here for a while, and I’ll go up the mountain to take a look.”

Su Yishui suddenly opened his eyes wide and asked coldly, “What do these people have to do with you?”

Ranran blinked and said, “Shifu, didn’t you tell me that *cultivators with higher cultivation levels should bear more responsibility? Not to single-mindedly seek immortality, and forget how to be a human first…”
*sorry I thought of with great power, comes great responsibility

Su Yishui furrowed his brows. “Did I say that?”

Ranran nodded confidently. Well… actually, it wasn’t something Shifu actually said but rather how she concluded her exemplary master had been living his life before he lost his memory.

After all, back then, he willingly risked his life to rescue the people of the entire capital, avoiding a catastrophic disaster caused by the rampage of the little dragon. If it weren’t for the damn Soul-Cleansing Talisman that was used on Shifu, he would never have let those women cry and weep without any concern.

Su Yishui squinted at the little girl’s teary eyes, unmoved as ever, and said, “Are you cursing me for being inhuman?”

Ranran waved her hands urgently and said earnestly, “Shifu, you are the best person I’ve ever met!”

She said this without any reservation. In this world, besides her parents, there was no one better than her Shifu… Even if he might have harmed her in her past life, she believed she hadn’t misjudged him.

Su Yishui looked at her extremely serious expression, snorted coldly, but still stood up and ordered in a cold voice, “Let’s go.”

Huh? Ranran was a bit puzzled, not knowing what he was up to.

Su Yishui said, “Aren’t you going into the mountains?”

With that, he got up and headed towards the dense mountains. Ranran watched his back, feeling a slight tremor in her heart. It seemed like her tough-looking but soft-hearted Shifu has returned…

Of course, Ranran soon realized that this was just a delusion.

Shortly after entering the mountains, Su Yishui picked a large rock, sat down steadily, and said, “I’ll give you an hour to find them. Don’t take risks that would damage my core.”

It turned out he followed her to constantly watch over the safety of his core, with no intention to search for people.

But what he said wasn’t wrong either, so Ranran quickly closed her eyes and listened to the sounds in the mountains.

Her hearing has always been good. As long as she focused, she could hear the nearby sounds.

But strangely, there was no sound in the entire mountain, except for the cries of deer and birds commonly heard in the mountains. As for the howling of wolves, it came from very far away.

Since the mountain was close to the village, the wild animals were also afraid of people and naturally stayed away from them.

Ranran didn’t hear anything unusual, so she lightly stepped and used the Wind Control Technique to quickly patrol the mountains.

Su Yishui got up and jumped onto the tallest tree, sitting on top of it, watching the little butterfly in a pink jacket fluttering up and down. A cold smirk curled at the corner of his mouth.

Wasn’t he supposed to teach her how to be a human?

Next, he would teach her the first principle of being a human – Never meddle in other people’s business!

There was a dark purple mist in the depths of the mountain… emanating an evil aura…

As for Ranran, she traversed the mountains without finding anything unusual. But when she arrived at a mountain hollow, she suddenly felt heavy miasma here.

Next, her legs seemed to be entangled by some sticky thin threads, almost causing her to fall from the branches. When she steadied herself, she looked closely and found that the trees in this mountain hollow were covered with large spider webs.

Ranran was considered a brave girl, but seeing such large spider webs as large as fishing nets, and a basin-sized spider crawling on them, made her hairs stand on end!

After her legs were entangled in the spider webs, it seemed to trigger movements from all over, and dozens of basin-sized spiders crawled out from various hidden corners.

And Ranran just learned that spiders could make noises too, as they moved their fangs-like mouths rhythmically, emitting a clicking sound, all while moving their eight legs towards Ranran.

Now Ranran no longer needed to draw her sword. She brandished three short swords and swiftly sent them flying towards the big spiders coming at her.

However, at the same time, she also drew out a sword to cut the spider webs entangling her legs, but the webs were sticky and tough, and she couldn’t cut them off no matter how hard she tried.

In her haste, when Ranran looked down, she suddenly saw white skulls all over the ground.

Clearly, the missing villagers were all laid in eternal rest here…

At this moment, more and more spiders were coming from all directions. They spat sticky silk towards Ranran and her short swords flying in the air.

After the short swords, controlled by her vitality qi, were entangled in silk, they couldn’t move anymore.

Even the mechanism stick that Ranran drew out was also entangled with a lot of silk.

…Su Yi Shui had been sitting on top of the tree all this time, waiting leisurely for Ranran to call for help. After she learned her lesson, he would naturally step in to save her.

But it seemed like the girl’s mouth was also sealed by the spider webs. She just wouldn’t shout for help.

Su Yishui raised his eyebrows, somewhat surprised, and thought: Is she dumber than the other three disciples?

Just as a string of large spiders was about to attack for their meal, Ranran suddenly acted quickly. She pulled out three Beast control talismans seized at the border and stuck them on the bodies of three big spiders ready to devour her.

The three spiders immediately stopped their attack, then, under Ranran’s silent control, they turned around and pounced on their own kind.

Ranran pulled out another talisman and stuck it on another spider’s body, letting it move its long legs and untangle the spider silk on her legs.

After breaking free from the siege, Ranran quickly disengaged and didn’t linger in battle anymore. She leaped out of the mountain hollow as if flying and then rushed to the base of the tall tree, shouting, “Shifu, run! There are Spider Demons of the Web Cavern!”

Su Yishui jumped down from the tree, looked down at the young girl with a face full of sweat, and asked, “Why didn’t you shout for help when you were in danger?”

Ranran was stunned, never expecting him to ask this. So she honestly replied, “Those spiders were so sinister, of course I couldn’t call you over. What if you were also entangled and placed in danger?”

Su Yishui had originally thought she was just throwing a girlish tantrum because he didn’t accompany her into the mountains.

But he didn’t expect her to be fearful that he would also be entangled by the spiders, so she didn’t call for him…

I wondered why Su Yishui would suddenly feel depressed… after all he didn’t want this disciple around him and sent her away right? Like where did this emotion come from… So maybe its his subconscious reacting to his girlfriend moving out of Western mountain and took all her things lol

Looks like Su Yishui went quite a long way on his ‘moonlight walk’…
hahaha Zeng Yi didn’t move far away enough…

Previous
Next

新晋同门 NEW INTAKE

“Are you saying that I would be afraid of those spiders?”

Ranran wasn’t in the mood to listen to Shifu looking for a fight. She had just noticed the unique patterns on those spiders’ bodies, and there was always a familiar aura that sent shivers down her spine. So she just wanted to quickly take her master out of the mountains, and then warn the villagers below to be wary of those giant spiders.

“Fine fine, my Shifu is the most powerful! He’s not afraid of any spiders or mice!” Ranran followed Su Yishui’s line of thought as if coaxing a child, then grabbed his arm and headed out of the mountains.

They used to be together all day long before, even sharing countless sweet embraces and kisses, so holding hands like this was not a big deal. Moreover, there was a reason for this urgency; she wanted to get him out of there quickly.

But in Su Yi Shui’s current memories, apart from his mother, he had never been so close to anyone else. The recent close contacts with women in his memory were all of Mu Qingge, teasing him.

This Xue Ranran actually pulled him around so impudently, just like her elder sister in her past life!

He couldn’t help but darken his expression, and wanted to shake off her hand.

However, his hand seemed to have a will of its own, automatically grasping her small, slightly calloused hand back, allowing her to lead him out of the mountain this way.

When Ranran mentioned the strangeness of those large spiders, Su Yi Shui was unfazed. “Those are not spiders from the human realm.”

Finally expressing her speculation after hearing Su Yi Shui’s words, Ranran said, “I sensed a dark Netherworld realm aura from those spiders… Could it be that because we opened the Realm, some creatures from there were brought out?”

Su Yi Shui replied coldly, “People here already started disappearing half a year ago; those creatures have been out for a long time.”

Ranran bit her lip, “What caused these demonic creatures to come out? Can we find a way to eliminate them? Otherwise, they will continue to harm people in the mountains.”

Su Yi Shui never bothered with matters unrelated to him. But seeing the girl thinking so seriously, he couldn’t help but remind her, “Didn’t you already come up with a plan to use poison against poison?”

Ranran was startled, suddenly understanding Su Yi Shui’s meaning.

When she went back and observed the situation in the mountain hollow, she found that the three spiders with talismans had already devoured most of their companions, their bodies swelling several times their original size, resembling three grotesque, pig-sized creatures.

“These are Ghost-Headed Spiders from the Netherworld Realm. If not for a famine, they generally coexist peacefully within their kind. However, in times of scarcity, they devour each other, accelerating their own growth in size and demonic nature to become more aggressive, capturing larger prey to survive…”

Ranran sucked in a breath of cold air. It seemed that these normally peaceful Ghost-Headed Spiders, were triggered to bloodlust under the control of the beast-controlling talismans. This led them to devour their kin and, due to absorbing their demonic traits, quickly grow to such massive sizes in such a short time…

Ranran couldn’t tell whether it was easier to deal with a pit full of spiders or three large monstrosities.

After about an incense stick’s worth of time, the hollow was left with only the three spiders that had talismans on them.

Seeing Ranran prepare to deal with the remaining three, this time Su Yi Shui spoke up with a tip, “The Ghost-Headed Spiders are tough all over, but the two spots resembling eyes are the softest; aim for those.”

Ranran nodded vigorously and immediately rushed towards the spider’s den.

At this moment, the spiders, having devoured their kin and grown significantly in size, stood as tall as horses, their eight legs towering. Due to their rapid growth, the talismans on their backs were also dislodged.

When the control of the talismans was lost, the three spiders seemed to stop attacking each other but, due to their increased appetite from their current size, they turned towards their “food storage.”

Only now did Ranran notice several spider sacs hanging on a large tree covered in webs.

As Ranran leaped to the treetop and inspected closely, she found that aside from goose egg-sized round spider eggs inside the sacs, there were also several groggy children!

It seemed they were the lost children the village women had cried about.

Perhaps because they were meant to be food for the hatchlings, these children had not been eaten by the spiders. Instead, they were rendered unconscious by the spider venom, ready to be slaughtered as fresh food, wrapped in the spider sacs.

But now, the three big spiders were too hungry to consider their future generations, so they eagerly extended their long claws to grab the children.

Ranran urgently pulled out her stick, and leaped onto the back of the spider at the back.

This time, she saw what Su Yi Shui meant by the two eye-like patterns. Taking aim at one, she triggered the spring mechanism on the stick, piercing it fiercely.

This spot, indeed softer than the hard exoskeleton, struck the spider’s vital point, causing it to emit a sharp shriek.

Ranran didn’t slack off, continuing the same tactic. With her agile movements, she quickly struck the vital spots on the remaining two big spiders.

The three spiders were pierced deeply, instantly collapsing like deflated balloons, their dark green liquid splattering everywhere.

At that moment, Ranran suddenly felt a wave of dizziness, and her body swayed slightly. She silently recited her mental mantra, regaining stability. Ever since she returned from the Netherworld Realm, she would feel dizzy now and then. At first, she didn’t mind, thinking it was due to transplanting the Rebirth Tree, but recently, the dizzy spells had become more frequent…

Once Ranran steadied herself, she gently set down the children who were gradually awakening.

The children looked around in confusion, seeing the hellish scene around them, and began to cry in confusion, hugging this beautiful big sister and wailing loudly.

Ranran relaxed and gathered the children around her, comforting them with gentle words.

Su Yi Shui walked over silently at this time, standing aside. Suddenly, he found the scene in front of him somewhat familiar… in the past Mu Qingge also used to comfort the children she adopted like this, using such tactics to win people’s hearts…

He suddenly felt a pang in his heart, unwilling to think further. He just strode over, picked up a purple bead the size of a walnut from the messy spider goo, and examined it. The bead exuded a black mist, giving off an ominous aura.

Ranran also stood up and looked at the bead, asking, “What is that?”

Su Yi Shui examined the bead and murmured, “Someone must have deliberately nurtured these spiders to cultivate these demonic pills…”

After hearing this, Ranran drew out a dagger and cut open another dead spider. Sure enough, there was a purple demonic pill inside its body as well.

The appearance of demonic creatures from the Netherworld Realm in the human realm was highly unusual; they turned out to be the oysters cultivating demonic pills, which was mind-boggling to think about.

Ranran suddenly remembered the Immortal-Devouring Bugs. That thing was also not from the human realm and, when it appeared in Tianmai Mountain, it had likely already been nurtured by someone for twenty years.

Could these spiders also be the work of that Emperor Su Yu?

Ranran wrapped the purple demonic pills in a handkerchief and then sent the frightened children back to the village.

The families of those children hugged them in tears of joy, repeatedly thanking the female immortal.

When Ranran asked when people started disappearing in the mountains, the village elders strained to remember, recalling that it was about three years ago when a ball of fire fell from the sky one night, dazzlingly bright, landing in the mountains.

At that time, some curious young men ventured into the mountains to see, but only one returned. He was so frightened that he had wet himself, saying there were monsters in the mountains that ate people.

Later, they reported to the authorities and invited Taoist priests to exorcise the monsters, but nothing worked. People continued to disappear in the mountains, and gradually, apart from passersby, no locals dared to venture into the mountains.

If these naive children hadn’t met the kind female immortal, they might have also gone missing without a trace.

After hearing this, Ranran couldn’t find any more clues. The villagers were very warm and insisted on keeping Ranran while they slaughter pigs and sheep.

Knowing that Su Yi Shui disliked getting close to people, Ranran took advantage of the village chief’s distraction and vanished like a bird.

This made the villagers kneel again, towards the skies, thanking the female immortal for her miraculous appearance.

Apart from knowing that demonic creatures from the Netherworld Realm had leaked out, there were no other leads.

Ranran thought about how many demonic creatures might be lurking in the abyss of the Netherworld Realm, and her heart sank.

Those purple demonic pills didn’t have much benefit for righteous cultivators. However, for those on the demonic path, they were treasures to enhance their cultivation and demonic power.

Someone must have deliberately nurtured these demonic spiders, and specifically released these Ghost-Headed Spiders on the mountain behind the village.

The rest of the journey after this, went rather smoothly. When the master and disciple finally returned to West Mountain, the two uncle masters saw Ranran’s return and were genuinely happy. Although their master had lost his memory, he still doted on Ranran, finally bringing her back at last.
