After replanting the Rebirth Tree, Qiu Xier helped water the tree while talking excitedly, “Do you know? Shifu is recruiting disciples again, this time it’s an open selection, the influence is comparable to the three major sects recruiting disciples.”

West Mountain’s reputation was not low now, and Su Yi Shui’s name was indistinctly even more prominent than the three major sects.

After returning from the Netherworld Realm, Su Yi Shui suddenly changed his approach, wanting to recruit capable disciples. Therefore, a month ago, he spread the news, attracting talents from all directions to the mountain gate.

However, this time Su Yi Shui’s method of selecting disciples was exceptionally strict, focusing on bone structure and spiritual power.

Just the first batch of bone readings eliminated more than half of the candidates. Adding Su Yi Shui’s disdain for people from the three major sects, after another round of careful selection, he eliminated those from the three sects that tried to switch over.

So, those who passed this rigorous selection were young with excellent bone readings, including some handsome young men.

Qiu Xier had been gloomy because Shifu had neglected them. They chose to stay behind back then, and didn’t leave with Uncle master Zeng and Ranran. After the two uncle masters interceded for them, they were brought back to West Mountain, but rather than disciples, they were treated more like servants who did labor.

Shifu no longer taught them as before, only letting them fetch water and chop wood, feeling like they had returned to their early days starting out in West Mountain.

Fortunately, now that a batch of fresh and talented disciples had arrived, Qiu Xier felt that Spring had finally arrived in West Mountain. So, in excitement, she specifically took Ranran to the martial arts field to show her the outstanding ones among the new intake of disciples.

Among them, one person stood out the most. When Ranran looked over, she found that the young man named Shen Kuo was indeed exceptionally handsome.

Tall and with a refined appearance, he always had a hint of a smile on his face, and was very likable.

There was also someone named Yue Sheng who was good too, rumored to come from a noble family, carrying the air of an independent wealthy young master.

While Qiu Xier and Ranran watched the disciples under the tree, those young men suddenly gathered around Shen Kuo and Yue Sheng, pointing and whispering towards Ranran and Qiu Xier, bursting into laughter now and then.

Shen Kuo was more composed, he only glanced up and then lowered his head.

However, the one named Yue Sheng stared at Xue Ranran for a long time.

Feeling uncomfortable being stared at by those young men, Ranran pulled her senior sister away quickly, ignoring the young men laughingly calling out, “Senior sister, wait!”

Qiu Xier was a little unsatisfied, “Aren’t we all from the same Sect? What’s wrong with saying hello when we meet? Why are you running away?”

Ranran said, “The food was still cooking in the pot when you dragged me here, of course, I have to rush back to check it! You’re so excited watching the junior brothers; if senior brother sees you like this, be careful lest he might ignore you!”

Senior brother and third senior sister had a good relationship, although they hadn’t talked about marriage yet, it was just a matter of time. Ranran naturally wanted to remind her senior sister not to be fickle.

Ranran was right, Gao Cang and Bai Baishan were quite uncomfortable with these newcomers.
Did Shifu think they were useless and was ready to favor these new disciples? Would they never be able to improve on their cultivation and just spend their days chopping wood and fetching water?

Ranran herself didn’t mind the newcomers to West Mountain; although Shifu no longer taught her personally either, she had reached the stage where she could cultivate her foundation on her own.

The saying “the master leads the way, the practice is personal” was true.

During her time in the Netherworld Realm, she had been torn by the dual forces of Yin and Yang when entering and leaving, which weakened her spiritual energy for a while. Coupled with dizziness and shortness of breath, she is in need of regulation.

Now that she’s been brought back to West Mountain by Su Yi Shui, she has the opportunity to repair her true vitality in the Ice Lotus Pool.

Unfortunately, West Mountain suddenly had many junior brothers of unknown names, and the various large rooms and courtyards that had been empty for a long time were now in use.

For now, there was a constant stream of people, and she couldn’t leisurely enter the pool during the day like before. When Ranran was taking a walk by the pool during the day, she ran into several junior brothers, including Shen Kuo.

Ranran’s reputation was very prominent, and many junior brothers had long admired this senior sister. Now that they finally had the opportunity, they eagerly introduced themselves.

However, Shen Kuo didn’t step forward. He was quite tall, so even standing behind, he could still meet Ranran’s eyes. When he smiled shyly and looked at fourth senior sister… well, Ranran also thought this young man looked really good!

Since there were so many people around the pool during the day, Ranran could only wait patiently until nightfall. When the senior brothers started meditating in the halls and stopped moving around randomly, she stealthily took a large scarf and wore a loose robe, and sneaked to the Ice Lotus Pool.

Although it was dark, the Ice Lotus Pool was glowing faintly in the night, its white petals like carved ice, reflecting colorful lights in the water.

When she slipped into the water, enveloped by the aura-filled water, she felt like a thirsty little tree finally relaxing and absorbing more water.

She stretched her body as she leaned against a large stone by the pool, and hummed a song softly, her nightingale-like voice echoing lightly above the lotus pond.

When Su Yi Shui stood by the back window of his bedroom, what caught his eye was the sight of a girl with long hair bathing and humming in the Lotus Pool.

Although it was night, her small face was illuminated by the Ice Lotus, shining brightly.

Even though he was somewhat far away, he could still see her expressive eyebrows and eyes, the slight curve of her lips… she was a girl who, with just one glance, made people feel sweetness, like the honey-preserved plums she made, addictive and leaving a sweet-sour aftertaste.

Su Yi Shui considered himself not lustful of women, but for some reason, he kept watching the girl soaking in the pool for a long while.

He felt that there were too many windows in his bedroom. The front window of his room directly faced the courtyard where Ranran lived. When he woke and glanced up, he could see her watering the flowers and trees in the courtyard.

The window on the east faced the West Mountain’s practice field. During the day, he had seen Ranran and Qiu Xier watching the young men under the tree, which didn’t escape his notice.

And the window on the west faced the Lotus Pool, which seemed to be a place Ranran often visited. During the day, when he was looking at the back mountain, he saw her loitering around the Lotus Pool several times and greeting the junior brothers passing by.

Perhaps when young people gathered together, they always had something to talk about. If one focused and listened, they seemed to be complimenting Ranran’s youth and talent, how her reputation has grown since Tianmai Mountain, and so on.

However, every single one of them were quite presumptuous, staring intently at their senior sister, looking like they were lacking sisterly affection.

At that moment, Su Yi Shui’s gaze turned cold, suddenly feeling that the disciples he had chosen seemed to have limited horizons. Such a lack of experience would probably not cultivate any good seedlings.

So he seriously considered, whether to re-select disciples.

And now seeing Ranran being so bold, taking a bath in the pool in the middle of the night, Su Yi Shui seemed to regain his long-neglected authority as a master, and strode towards the pool with a stern face.

When he arrived at the poolside in his white robe, Ranran had just come out of the pool. She had wrapped herself in a large scarf and was using a towel to dry her wet hair.

Su Yi Shui walked silently, and Ranran didn’t notice his arrival. She was drying her hair when she accidentally bumped into Su Yi Shui’s arms.

When her soft body entered his embrace, Su Yi Shui couldn’t help but feel a jolt in his heart. Habitually, his body acted a step ahead, firmly encircling her in his arms.

Ranran got a shock and thought she had encountered a lecher. She was about to summon her spiritual energy to push the offender away when she looked up and saw that the person holding her was actually Su Yi Shui.

Shifu’s long hair was half-tied, with his sword-like brows, eyes like stars, and his tall nose that had rubbed against her cheek countless times… she hadn’t seen his face up close like this in a long time.

For a moment, Ranran was a little confused. Thinking that Su Yi Shui had remembered everything, tears welled up in her eyes uncontrollably, and with a hint of a crying tone, she called out “Shifu…”

But this voice seemed to rouse Su Yishui, and he suddenly came to his senses, reaching out to push Ranran away.

Ranran was unprepared and took several steps back. If she hadn’t grabbed the nearby bamboo, she would have fallen down.

Su Yishui reached out to steady her, but this time, Ranran stepped back and avoided him.

He didn’t know why he felt a surge of displeasure in his heart. “Its the middle of the night and you’re taking a bath here? Don’t you know there are many men on the mountain?”

Ranran knew then that Shifu hadn’t recovered. She stood up straight, lowered her head, and said softly, “I deliberately waited until nightfall to come here. I didn’t expect that Shifu would also come… shouldn’t you be practicing and meditating with the juniors?”

Su Yi Shui frowned at her and suddenly asked, “You’re rather capable, actually able to soak in the Ice Lotus? Who brought the Ice Lotus to West Mountain?”

Ranran quickly glanced up at him, surprised that he had even forgotten about the Ice Lotus.

It made sense; this was related to memories with Mu Qingge. Back then, when he was almost falling into darkness, Mu Qingge had found the Ice Lotus and soaked with him to alleviate his demonic nature.

Ranran didn’t want to mention anything related to her past life in front of Su Yi Shui, so she replied indifferently to his inquiry, “Shifu, you should ask second uncle master about these things. I’ll go back now and won’t come to soak in this pool in the future…”

With that, she turned to leave.

But unexpectedly, Su Yi Shui grabbed her hand again, feeling her pulse carefully with his long fingers. His furrowed brow tightened even more.

“Why is your pulse so unstable?” he asked directly.

Ranran thought for a moment and said, “It has been like this since I returned from the Netherworld. I originally thought it was because I was away from the Rebirth Tree for too long, but later I realized it wasn’t… But now I’m much better.”

Su Yi Shui finally understood why she came to soak in the Ice Lotus in the middle of the night. For some unknown reason, she had some imbalance in her yin and yang meridians while in the netherworld, so soaking in the Ice Lotus was very beneficial for her body.

This girl had been unwell for so long, but she hadn’t shown it at all on the way back with him. No wonder she accidentally injured her arm when she fought with the Ghost-Head Spider…

Thinking of this, Su Yi Shui thought back to what he had reprimanded Ranran for earlier, and he tightly pursed his lips.

No matter how much he disliked her now, she was still his disciple after all. He couldn’t just watch her languish and die, could he?

Since he had given her half of his golden core, she must live up to his painstaking efforts!

With that in mind, Su Yi Shui said, “The effectiveness of the Ice Lotus is weaker at night. You should come to soak during daytime tomorrow.”

After saying that, he left gracefully with a sweep of his long sleeves.

Ranran looked at his back in confusion, blinked her eyes. Soak during the day? Was she supposed to chat with the junior brothers while soaking wet from the pool?

However, the next day, Ranran understood what Su Yi Shui meant. The Lotus Pool on the back mountain became a forbidden area, and no one except Ranran was allowed to enter.

As she bathed in the sunlight, leisurely swimming in the Lotus Pool, she felt that although Shifu had temporarily forgotten about her, he still loved his disciples so dearly.

When she emerged from the water, wiping off the water droplets, she happened to see the cold-eyed man standing not far away by the window on the second floor, seemingly looking in her direction. Ranran couldn’t help but wave at him, but the man turned and disappeared like a gust of wind at the window…

It’s really quite funny to see SYS16 was going through the same jealousy phase that SYS38 had gone through.
16 since that is the age when he still hated Mu Qingge when he was newly recruited to Xishan?
Was SYS 18 when his father rebelled?

Previous
Next

该不该罚

Ranran sighed silently in her heart and reminded herself once again: Shifu is no longer the same, and she should remember to maintain some distance, to avoid his disgust.

But the days back in Xishan were much more plentiful than before.

At the very least, the amount of food to be cooked was several times more than before.

Su Yi Shui recruited ten disciples this time. Plus the previous four, there were a total of fourteen disciples now.

If you counted Shifu and the uncle masters, that was nearly twenty people to feed. Most of these people were seventeen or eighteen years old, and they all had good appetites, still far from reaching the stage of fasting!

Handling three meals a day for so many people daily was too much for second uncle master Yutong. Apart from Ranran, she had to call on Qiu Xier, Gaocang, and Bai Baishan to help.

The two girls were still alright, as they were used to doing these things daily anyway. But Gao Cang and Bai Baishan were very unhappy.

Now, they couldn’t even get close to the training ground, and they had to spend the whole day in the kitchen, preparing meals endlessly.

Seeing those newcomers getting the master’s true teachings and spending their days meditating in the grass hall or practicing martial arts in the training ground, naturally, they felt unhappy.

But those new disciples were very diligent. Since Xue Ranran came back, several young boys would voluntarily come to help out in the kitchen.

The ones who were fresh-looking, quick with their hands, and sweet-talkers were particularly popular.

Just like now, Ranran is picking flat beans, and the youth named Yue Sheng came over, carrying a stool and sitting next to senior sister Xue.

At this moment, he didn’t show the demeanor of a noble young master. From time to time, he would chat with senior sister Xue, asking about her adventures on Tianmai Mountain and expressing his admiration as a junior brother now and then.

Eventually, the other two juniors also came over, listening to Xue Shijie talk, while eagerly watching her lively eyes and sweet smile.

When they first came to the mountain, they had only heard of this senior sister’s name but hadn’t seen her in person.

When senior Sister returned with the master, and they saw her for the first time in the training ground, they were amazed by her beauty.

Fourth senior sister was actually this beautiful!

Moreover, she was different from those mediocre senior brothers. She was the chosen daughter of the heavens, who had entered the Marrow-Cleansing Pool.

They wondered if she had any intention of finding a fellow cultivator to become a couple with in the future? And if she would look for one among her fellow disciples?

After all, they were all in the same sect. As the saying goes the one closest often gets the most opportunities. Practicing together and being together everyday, also made things more comfortable.

For a time, there were many young men who had these kind of thoughts. In addition to practicing, they all wanted to catch a glimpse of senior sister’s figure by the corridor pool on Xishan.

But this senior sister was a little too shy and didn’t really want to talk to them.

Therefore the time spent helping in the kitchen was particularly delightful. After all, in the cramped kitchen, senior sister had to talk whether she wanted to or not.

So the benches in the Xishan kitchen were rather insufficient. In the end, even second uncle master was “invited” out by her filial nephews, and they took care of everything in the kitchen!

However, Gao Cang refused to leave. He watched Qiu Xier smiling sweetly at these junior brothers, so he vented his anger by fiercely chopping white radishes with a knife.

Ranran didn’t think much about these young men who were close to her age. She treated them all as younger brothers, smiling and chatting with them without much thought.

This harmonious atmosphere continued to the dining table.

Su Yi Shui no longer ate with his disciples now. His meals were brought to the study by Yutong.

And the two uncle masters also didn’t eat with the younger generation anymore either. They remained in the study to serve the master.

So the large dining hall was filled with the younger generation disciples of Xishan.

Three tables were set up, each table could seat five to six people. But the table where Xue Ranran sat was particularly crowded, squeezing in eight people.

Gao Cang couldn’t even spread his chopsticks and couldn’t reach the dishes. He was so angry that he slammed the chopsticks down and said, “Is there more meat in the bowls on this table than on the others? Why do they all have to squeeze in here, can they let others eat or not?”

Initially, these young men still had some respect for the senior brothers of Xishan, after all, Gao Cang and the others were the first to join and had to be respected.

But in the past month, the new disciples had also sensed something — Master didn’t really care about these previous disciples, which was why he had made such a big deal out of recruiting new ones.

Moreover, Gao Cang and the others have very shallow foundations. There were several occasions when they couldn’t resist showing off their skills outside the training ground, but these new disciples with superior aptitude noticed their flaws right away.

Gao Cang and the others couldn’t even enter the training ground now; they were just rough laborers in Xishan.

People like that were eating at the same table as them, they hadn’t complained about him, so what right did he have to slam down his chopsticks and lecture them?

Yue Sheng was, apart from Shen Kuo, the best disciple in terms of foundation. Like Shen Kuo, although he hadn’t joined the three major sects, he came from a cultivation family. Plus, he had encountered opportunities and had already opened his meridians early, reaching the second stage of Foundation Building at the age of eighteen.

So the new disciples regarded him and Shen Kuo as leaders among them.

These days when he went to help in the kitchen, Yue Sheng was often teased by Bai Baishan’s words, with Gao Cang was always chiming in. Yue Sheng had already developed some resentment.

Now, being scolded by Gao Cang in front of Xue Shijie, Yue Sheng felt his face burning and stood up coldly, saying, “Is this table reserved for you? Why do you get to sit here? If you feel crowded, can’t you sit at the other tables?”

Gao Cang was sitting at this table because Qiu Xier was here. And Qiu Xier was inseparable from Xue Ranran. Plus there were many handsome young men at this table, so she naturally refused to leave!

But he couldn’t reveal these complicated reasons.

Back then Shifu had clearly stated that he and Bai Baishan were not allowed to flirt with the junior sisters. The ambiguous affection of young people was all implied.

In front of Qiu Xier, bring ridiculed by a junior who just started is intolerable!

Their argument escalated gradually, voices growing louder. The insults became more and more intense, with words like ‘greenhorn,”rice bucket who entered first’, ‘useless old-timer,’ and similar phrases flying back and forth.

Finally, when they were both yelling and wrestling each other, Qiu Xier couldn’t stand it anymore. She gave a shout and rushed over to help Gao Cang scratch Yue Sheng.

Several young men who were close to Yue Sheng also refused to back down, coming over to confront Qiu Xier. Even Bai Baishan, who was usually congenial and calm, couldn’t take it anymore and joined the fray.

When he found himself grappling with someone and his hands were occupied, he unexpectedly threw his shoes. His agile feet, well-trained, aimed straight for the nostrils of the younger disciples!

Unfortunately, Yue Sheng got a whiff of his toes and cried out in anger. Enraged, he gathered his inner energy and attacked Bai Baishan.

Since Bai Baishan had stopped cultivating after being under Uncle master Zeng Yi’s care, his dantian was quite depleted. If he was hit by Yue Sheng, he would probably have coughed up blood and been injured.

Ranran acted quickly and cleverly, flipping over a table to push Bai Baishan’s away. She then grabbed a plate of peanuts from the table and applying a little inner energy, struck the knee paralyzing acupoints of several people with just three to four peanuts.

As a result, those youths didn’t have time to react and all ended up kneeling on the ground.

By now, Yue Sheng’s eyes were red with anger, and he didn’t care anymore about seniority or respect. He shouted at Xue Ranran, “You’re actually helping those bastards. Quickly release me, the young master…”

As a result, their smiling and gentle senior sister did come over, not to release his acupoint but to raise her hand and give Yue Sheng a resounding slap.

“Whose ‘young master’ are you? You’re not even close to being a master here on Xishan!” Xue Ranran’s face was no longer smiling, and her stern small face actually carried a hint of chilling aura.

Yue Sheng still continued to glare, but Xue Ranran coldly continued, “In the rules of Xishan, there has never been one which allowed the disruption of the normal order, where juniors can use their abilities to bully their seniors. If it’s just a physical fight, just use fists and legs, but you actually used true energy to ambush someone! Do you want to kill second senior brother? If you are so capable, why did you come to apprentice? People like you, when your abilities grow, won’t you end up bullying your mentors and destroying your ancestors?”

Yue Sheng’s face turned red, gritting his teeth, “If I did something wrong, Master will teach me, who are you to lecture me?”

Xue Ranran laughed, feeling that these half-grown youths were sometimes like unreasonable children, always unwilling to admit their mistakes. So she bent down, looked at the kneeling Yue Sheng who couldn’t move on the ground, and flicked his forehead with her finger, smiling as she said, “Because I’m more skilled than you!”

Now Yue Sheng not only blushed, but his eyes were also red. He had always thought his foundation was good, but when Xue Ranran’s peanuts flew over, he couldn’t even react and failed to dodge them.

Being chastened in a demeaning tone by a woman and flicked on the forehead, such humiliation was enough to make one’s dantian explode…

“Is everyone done making a scene?” At that moment, a cold voice suddenly came from the door way.

Everyone looked up and shrank their necks. Without them realizing, Su Yi Shui had already appeared at the entrance, looking at them coldly.

This time, there was no more dinner to be had.

Su Yi Shui didn’t even bother to ask for reasons; he just ordered them all to go down the mountain to fetch water and fill a dried-up pond halfway up the mountain.

Everyone was dumbfounded, wanting to wail but not daring to.

When the others have all run off unwillingly, Su Yi Shui cast a glance over at Ranran who was still standing there without moving.

“Don’t you hear what I just said? Why aren’t you going?” Su Yi Shui’s tone was icy, with a hint of anger in his eyes.

But only he knew that the inexplicable anger bursting out of him wasn’t because his disciples were disobedient.

It was because the scene just now had seemed familiar, stirring up his long-held anger—Young Su Yi Shui remembered deeply how he had also been flicked on the forehead by an arrogant female demoness.

She was smiling at the time, and said, “What? Are you still dissatisfied after I criticized you? Since my abilities are greater than yours, you should obediently listen to me…”

Similar tone, similar situation, all ignited his anger, so Su Yi Shui’s tone towards Xue Ranran was quite harsh.

But who would have thought that the usually obedient little girl who always followed his instructions, would raise her head high this time and speak firmly, “I haven’t done anything wrong, why should I be punished?”

Su Yi Shui smiled instead of getting angry. “If you’re not wrong, whose fault is it?”

Ranran didn’t back down. “Discord among disciples, disrespect for seniors, infighting among fellow sect members, naturally, it’s your fault as the master!”

Su Yi Shui looked at her coldly and suddenly grabbed her by the *back, gritting his teeth. “Say that again?”
*命门 a point on the lower back where energy is focused and circulated during movements and exercises.

Ranran knew he wasn’t just bluffing, the current Shifu, was different from the soft-hearted master she knew before.

But she remained fearless and calmly said, “Shifu, when you accepted Gao Cang and the others, their innate talents were already like this, you weren’t deceived. You said back then that accepting disciples is about fate, they are all people destined to be with you, so regardless of their talents, you will teach them wholeheartedly. Although you seem to have forgotten the past, they are indeed your disciples. Just like adopted children, how can you abandon them easily?”

Su Yi Shui said coldly, “I didn’t kick these useless people out, are they not still on Xishan?”

But Ranran still calmly retorted, “Why do Yue Sheng and the others have no respect for senior brothers? It’s all because of your contempt for them, only letting them do menial tasks but not allowing them to train with you. For young cultivators, this is not just punishment, it’s also humiliation! But what did they do wrong? They followed you in dangerous situations, even if their abilities are lacking, they never backed down when facing demons and monsters. Even after you became irritable due to the Spirit Spring’s possession, mocking and ridiculing them often, they had never thought of leaving. Now, they are being looked down upon and bullied by the juniors, but you didn’t differentiate right from wrong. You punished them all without a valid reason, why should I accept the punishment to fetch water?”

Su Yi Shui laughed, mocking the rare display of obstinacy by the girl before him. “Just because my skills are greater than yours! Isn’t that enough reason for you to be punished?”

Ranran knew Su Yi Shui was using her own words against her.

Ranran rarely showed her stubbornness, but once she did, nothing could sway her. She coldly said, “Your skills are indeed greater than mine, but a mistake is still a mistake. Masters can make mistakes, its nothing, and they don’t even need to admit it to their disciples. I just don’t know if there are enough dried-up ponds on Xishan, in case you punish disciples again in future without a legitimate reason!”

Su Yi Shui usually had a deep sense of composure, even when he was angry, his face would still remain cold. However, at this moment, he was truly exasperated by this eloquent girl. Just as he was about to raise his hand, Yuchen and Yutong rushed over and quickly separated the master and disciple. Yutong scolded Ranran loudly for speaking nonsense and then secretly gave her a signal to leave quickly.

Although the master had a smile on his face just now, his eyes were full of killing intent, obviously driven mad by anger because of Ranran.

To avoid the tragic drama of the master killing his disciple at Xishan, as her uncle master, she naturally had to step in and ward off the disaster for this little girl, urgently separating these two.

Ranran was also beside herself today. After speaking her mind, she felt slightly better, so she took this opportunity to leave and quickly ran back to her room.

By now, the sun was setting. The other disciples had all gone down the mountain to fetch water, leaving the courtyard empty.

Now that Ranran’s anger had subsided, she laid down weakly under the young rebirth tree in the courtyard, looking up at the green leaves swaying in the wind. She murmured, “Today, Shifu will probably come to uproot you, and then we will both go to the *underworld together…”
*黄泉 is land of the dead

Thinking of this, Ranran still did not regret her impulsiveness earlier.

She was sincere about everything she said. Rather than being disappointed in her Shifu, but more like hoping “master” would improve, wanting him to live up to expectations.
*恨铁不成钢 literally hating iron for not becoming steel

She hoped her rebuke would make her Shifu come round , in case he recovered from effects of the soul cleansing talisman and would regret how he had treated the senior brothers.

But upon careful thought, the rules of Xishan were already deviant. Didn’t Su Yi Shui also become arrogant when his abilities grew, eventually toppling her, his former master?

In this sense, Yue Sheng and the others were just following Su Yi Shui’s teachings. If they had no respect for their elders and became arrogant with growing abilities, would they end up killing their master to prove their Dao?

Will the rules of Xishan will have to be rewritten in the future? Without killing one’s master, one cannot graduate as a disciple! But then, then there won’t be enough masters to go around. Writing the rules is indeed a skill…

Lost in her thoughts, she lazily lay under the tree, waiting. But there was no angry Su Yi Shui, coming to settle the score. Instead, second uncle master brought food over to her.

“Even if you are angry with your master, you shouldn’t skip meals?

Ranran got up and asked Yutong tentatively “Second uncle master… Has Shifu cooled down yet?”

Yutong looked at her cautiously probing expression and couldn’t help but laugh in annoyance, “So you actually know fear? How come you were talking back like you were courting death just now?”

Ranran grinned sheepishly and didn’t say anything, just took the bowl and chopsticks and ate heartily. Tonight, she had stewed a soup for four hours, and it would be a pity not to eat it.

After finishing the meal, the unpleasant feeling in her heart also nearly dissipated. Ranran was never one to dwell too long in melancholy. She took out the second volume of the Fantian Records that she carried with her and started flipping through it page by page.

Back when she and Shifu were lurking in the Gao Kan camp on the front lines, she had heard Mu Ranwu telling Tu Jiuyuan that she needed more talismans.

This indicated that Elder Jiu wasn’t with Mu Ranwu but in the hands of the Crimson Gate. And the spiders behind the village and the incomplete words left by Elder Jiu back then still had no solution.

Now, even though Shifu is freed of the Spirit Spring, but his mind was still not sharp. Naturally, she couldn’t expect him to venture into the Crimson Gate and rescue Elder Jiu.

So Ranran thought about whether she could find some clues again, but as she read, she felt exhausted, so she lay down under the tree and fell asleep with her eyes closed.

As for Gao Cang and the others who went down the mountain to fetch water, when they heard that Ranran had argued with the master, and refused to go fetch water, everyone gasped in shock.

Finally, when they returned after fetching water, Qiu Xier couldn’t help but worry, “Ranran, since Shifu already favors the new disciples, now you openly defied his orders, won’t that just make him dislike you even more?”

Ranran shook her head and said indifferently “Anyway he already dislikes me, so might as well speak my mind honestly. If I can persuade Shifu to treat you better, that would be best. If not, being driven out of the sect is also fine. Then I’ll just go back home and farm, with no regrets in my heart…”

These are truly Ranran’s heartfelt words. If Shifu cannot treat the disciples well, there’s no need to delay Gao Cang and their future.

The Foundation Establishment stage during a cultivator’s youth is crucial. Spending time in the kitchen dulls their sharpness, and the eldest senior brother and the others might truly end up being unproductive for life.

But it seems that her words, aside from being scorned by others, had no effect. The eldest senior brother and the others still suffered punishment for a night, leaving them sore and tired.

However, after a day passed, when Ranran was baking biscuits in the small kitchen, she suddenly heard Gao Cang calling excitedly at the window, “Ranran, come quickly, Shifu has asked us to meditate in the grass hall!”

Ranran hesitatingly took off her apron, and followed everyone into the hall. Sure enough, both old and new disciples were gathered, all here for their cultivation exercises.

The aftermath of filling the dried-up pond was significant. Now, the new disciples were looking at Gao Cang and the others with unfriendly eyes , and when they sat down there was a clear division, with the middle aisle acting as a boundary.

Ranran was afraid of angering Su Yi Shui, so she deliberately chose to sit behind Gao Cang on a grass mat, using the eldest senior brother’s towering figure as a wall, shielding her completely.

Before long, Su Yi Shui arrived in a simple and elegant robe. Now, he no longer dressed simply in old clothes. His clothes, crown accessory on his head, and even the jade pendant at his waist were all exquisite, and look like they were quite expensive.

Ranran had to admit that this more refined Shifu looked even more handsome and extraordinary.

Ranran was avoiding the master, but Su Yi Shui didn’t even glance at her when he entered. After everyone sat down, he briefly explained today’s exercises for Foundation Establishment before starting the practice.

However, the Foundation Establishment method Su Yi Shui was teaching now was completely different from what he taught Gao Cang and the others before. It was more complex and profound, requiring a high level of comprehension to circulate qi through the meridians.

Ranran tried to follow along, and she had to admit that although Su Yi Shui’s current teaching was difficult to comprehend, but once understood, it could greatly improve one’s cultivation in a short time.

But for Gao Cang and Ranran, Bai Baishan too, it was particularly challenging. It was like always running on a smooth broad road, thinking one was running well, only to suddenly come to a steep cliff. Not to mention running, even climbing would be very difficult.

While the other new disciples were smoothly circulating their qi with steam rising from their heads, the old disciples remained unchanged, showing no signs of gathering true qi.

Even Ranran herself tried several times to circulate her vitality qi but had to give up because she felt blockages in her meridians recently.

After two hours, Su Yi Shui suddenly opened his eyes and looked at the several senior disciples who showed no progress, saying coldly, “As disciples who have entered the sect first, being lax in your exercises and falling behind, such laziness, should you not be punished?”

When Su Yi Shui said this, the new disciples couldn’t help but show gloating expressions, taking joy in their seniors’ misfortune.

Su Yi Shui then looked straight towards Ranran, who was hiding behind Gao Cang, his gaze piercing.

Gao Cang couldn’t bear it and silently shifted the cushion under his buttocks, revealing his little junior sister behind him rather heartlessly.

Ranran lifted her head and cast a glance at him, but Su Yi Shui continued to stare at her, waiting for her response.

Ranran sighed, somewhat understanding the meaning of “Seek revenge for even a small grievance ” from “Playing Classics”.

But there was indeed nothing to protest about this punishment, so she simply said, “Shifu is right, we will accept the punishment!”

Then the four of them slinked out of the hall, ready to drain the pond everyone had just filled.

Previous
Next

自生自灭


When they left the hall and headed towards the pond, Qiu Xier couldn’t help but say in tears, “Is Shifu intentionally making life difficult for us? If he really can’t stand us, I’ll voluntarily leave the mountain. This daily water-fetching routine, is not for humans!”

In the past, if Qiu Xier had said such words, Gao Cang would have reprimanded her immediately. He revered the master the most and couldn’t stand anyone speaking ill of him.

However, this time, even Gao Cang remained silent. The boy in his teens clenched the wooden bucket in his hand tightly and finally squatted down, crying bitterly.

But Ranran said, “If we can’t learn our skills well, we deserve punishment. Let’s go.”

When the group reached the pond, they found that due to last night’s rain, the previously half-filled pond was now almost overflowing. With just the four of them, it would take ages to empty the pond.

Ranran looked at the dejected trio, without saying a word.

She felt a little guilty, thinking these three were being punished as well because of her. So, she started scooping water first, then carried the bucket and headed down the mountain.

The path down the mountain seemed to have changed significantly, perhaps due to the rain washing it away, becoming more rugged. One had to concentrate to keep their footing and move forward slowly.

Ranran concentrated on the path for a while before starting to walk down the mountain. However, after a while, she exclaimed in surprise and quickened her pace, rushing down the mountain to pour out the water and then coming back up.

At first, she walked very slowly, but as she continued, her pace quickened.

“Quick, fetch some water and come down with me!” Ranran exclaimed excitedly.

Bai Baishan and Gao Cang were discussing how to bid farewell to their master and ask for permission to leave. When they heard Ranran’s words, they looked up listlessly. “We’re already leaving anyway, why bother with fetching water?” Bai Baishan said.

Ranran walked over and pulled them up, saying, “Hurry up, I’ll show you something fun.”

Hearing her, they had no choice but to get up, fetch water, and follow Ranran down the mountain.

However, the mountain path was not only wet and slippery but also more difficult to traverse, with no remarkable features. Gao Cang and the others couldn’t understand why their little junior sister was so excited.

At this moment, Ranran spoke up, “Haven’t you noticed that the twists and turns of this mountain path are exactly the same as the qi circulation method Shifu taught us today?”

Hearing this, Bai Baishan focused on the path and tried a few more steps, looking delighted. “You’re right, little junior sister. We didn’t notice until you pointed it out! But how did the path change like this? Wasn’t it due to the rain erosion?”

Ranran shook her head. Looking at these paths now, it seemed like they were formed by a surge of vitality qi, not naturally formed at all.

If these rugged mountain paths were drawn by Su Yishui’s vitality qi, he definitely wouldn’t exert so much effort just to make things difficult for his foolish disciples.

She thought for a moment and said, “As you carry water, try circulating qi according to the direction of the mountain path and see if you can comprehend the main points.”

This time, they all put their hearts into it. While carrying water, they didn’t walk lightly as usual. Instead, they tried to maintain stability on steep slopes and slow down on uphill stretches to prevent the water from spilling out of the buckets. So, once they followed the route to circulate their qi, it became clear where to condense qi and where to speed up and turn.

After making dozens of trips back and forth, the stagnant qi that had been difficult to move forward suddenly broke through many obstacles. Gao Cang and Bai Baishan’s heads began to emit steam. Qiu Xier also had an epiphany, feeling that carrying water became lighter and not as heavy as before.

However, Ranran tried a few times and still felt her vitality being blocked. She knew that the aftereffects she experienced in the Netherworld realm had not dissipated, so she didn’t rush to circulate qi and instead used light body technique to swiftly carry water.

After understanding Shifu’s intentions, Gao Cang and the others became very spirited and stopped mentioning returning home.

After spending three days emptying the pond, Gao Cang and the others felt that their qi circulation is now abundant, and had greatly surpassed their two years of cultivation in the past.

The disciples’ comprehension levels varied, so naturally, the teaching methods had to be different. Su Yishui had evidently taught these foolish disciples through a more direct and intuitive method.

Ranran realized that she had misunderstood Shifu. She really shouldn’t have argued with him earlier.

Since she was wrong, apologizing was the right thing to do.

So, after emptying the pond, Ranran disregarded her sore arms and legs, and went back to the kitchen. She kneaded dough, made fillings, steamed the bean cakes that Shifu loved, and personally delivered them to his study.

Usually, at this time, Shifu would be reading. As expected, when she entered the study, Shifu was sitting on the incense mat, frowning as he read the few remaining books in the study.

Hmm, looking at the now empty study, Ranran felt that she had taken too many books with her when she left.

When she followed Su Yishui back, she didn’t bring any books back with her, so the book Shifu was reading now… is that deadly “Playing Classics”…

Seeing Su Yishui’s handsome brows become increasingly furrowed, Ranran decided to give the bean cakes to the senior brothers to eat instead.

As she was about to quietly back out, Su Yishui spoke, “Since you’re here, why not come in?”

So Ranran had no choice but to awkwardly smile and carry the tray in.

She deliberately avoided looking at the open “Playing Classics” and instead picked up the bean cakes, saying to Su Yishui, “These are red bean cakes I made myself with honey filling. They taste best eaten hot.”

Su Yishui didn’t say anything but looked at the steaming cakes. They were ordinary bean cakes, but Ranran had shaped them into little red rabbits with peach-shaped mouths, looking really cute, but no matter how you looked at it, they seemed like things for amusing children.

Su Yishui found it childish and didn’t want to eat them. He just lowered his eyes and said, “If there’s nothing else, you can leave.”

Ranran didn’t leave because she had come with the intention to apologize to Su Yishui. So, although it was difficult to speak up, she still said, “Shifu, I was wrong…”

Su Yishui raised an eyebrow, looking at the girl with blushing cheeks as red as peaches, and sneered, “You can make mistakes? Throughout the entire cultivation world, there’s no other disciple like you who dares to lecture the master, better don’t overwhelm me with your apology!”

If it were any other girl, hearing such mocking words would have made her cry and run away long ago.

But Ranran picked up a rabbit-shaped bean cake and solicitously placed it by Su Yishui’s lips, saying, “Shifu, take a bite of this rabbit’s butt. I added a special filling inside!”

Su Yishui, still with plenty of mocking words left to say, his mouth blocked by the rabbit’s butt, and the fragrance of the cake filled his nostrils. His mouth involuntarily took a bite.

Hmm… Inside was a diluted bean paste with honey, sweet but not cloying, quickly spreading and diffusing on his taste buds.

Ranran smiled and asked, “Isn’t it delicious? When I tried making it last time, I ate three of them at one go!”

After eating the sweet treat with honey filling, Su Yishui couldn’t help but put the rest of the rabbit-shaped cake held in Ranran’s hand into his mouth.

After finishing it, his brain seemed to be wrapped in the sweetness of honey, causing him to exert himself to recall what words he had prepared to scold this girl with.

“Are you sincerely apologizing or intentionally using food to shut people up?” Su Yi Shui couldn’t help but eat another peach-shaped bean cake, then asked with a stern face.

Ranran was pouring hot tea for him to cleanse his palate and replied with a half-raised head, “Naturally, I want to apologize and also make sure you eat well!”

After that, she quickly put away the “Playing Classics” she had written in her past life smoothly back on the nearby bookshelf. Then she sincerely said, “I shouldn’t have misunderstood your good intentions in teaching disciples. The foundation of senior brother and the others is indeed much weaker compared to the new disciples, so they can’t study advanced techniques with them. So, Shifu, when you had them do rough chores like chopping wood, it’s actually to temper them, to help them lay a solid foundation…”

But Su Yishui laughed coldly after hearing Ranran’s words. “You didn’t misunderstand. I did indeed make things difficult for them before, hoping they would have some insight and leave on their own.”

This… hearing Su Yishui’s candid admission, Ranran suddenly found it difficult to continue flattering him.

After a brief silence, she asked in a small voice, “But Shifu, why did you change your mind?”

Su Yi Shui stretched out his long arm, took down the “Playing Classics” again, flipped to the section about Ferocious beasts, and tapped on the pages, saying, “These annotations were written by you? I’m really curious, am I really as good as you say?”

Hmm, when she later corrected the mistakes, she did write quite a few good praises about Shifu. Like dotes on his disciples, being stern but soft-hearted, and being the best Shifu in the world, and so on.

Su Yishui leaned close and whispered softly in Ranran’s ear, “I’ve been thinking, I was probably tolerating you useless people around me for a reason. Before I remember it, you lot better become more useful, or else it’s a waste of food…”

Ranran’s mouth was half-open, especially regretting her actions of correcting the mistakes in the “Playing Classics” in the past.

It turned out that her previous self from her past life had looked foolish but was actually truly wise, completely seeing through Shifu’s hypocritical facade. This is no ferocious beast, he was practically a venom-spewing serpent with big fangs!

She looked at him with pursed lips, feeling increasingly dizzy from anger. So she picked up the remaining bean cakes and was about to leave.

But Su Yi Shui grabbed her hand before she could leave. “You brought it here and now you want to take it away? Are you a three-year-old child?”

Before he could finish speaking, his brows furrowed because his fingers happened to touch her pulse, and he suddenly noticed that her pulse was unstable, even worse than before?

Su Yishui asked urgently, “What’s going on? Did you take a wrong path in your qi circulation practice?”

Since he had discovered it, Ranran shook her head, feeling even more dizzy. As Su Yi Shui was holding her hand, her body went limp, and she fainted in his arms.

When her fragrant and soft body fell into Su Yishui’s arms, his body stiffened slightly, and he intuitively felt his empty heart suddenly filled up.

But he didn’t have time to think about it. He quickly sat her up and then placed his hand on her back to circulate vitality qi for her.

As his vitality qi circulated into her body, Ranran felt a familiar warmth spreading. She instinctively started circulating qi according to the mantra her master had taught her, as if a long-lost spring was flowing again, and the blockages were noticeably relieved.

However, Su Yi Shui’s brows were still furrowed because he found that the blockages in Ranran’s body were located at the major life gates of the Shen Ting and Cheng Guang. These blockages weren’t formed overnight but were due to innate deficiencies. It was just that someone had been guiding her qi circulation before, which was how she seemed no different from ordinary people.

Just now, when he activated his qi, this girl actually started circulating qi on her own, like a hungry little bird eagerly absorbing his qi.

He felt the qi in his dantian sink, and if he hadn’t quickly pulled back, she might have absorbed it all…

After forgetting parts of his memory, Su Yi Shui had always been puzzled by one thing — even though he had handed over half of his golden core, twenty years of cultivation should have been enough to compensate. So why was his current cultivation still insufficient to form a nascent soul? There also seemed to be subtle signs of internal energy depletion.

It wasn’t until just now, when he transferred qi to Ranran, that he finally realized that he must have been constantly transferring qi to this female disciple to prolong her life. That’s why his cultivation had stagnated and couldn’t progress further to reach the next stage. And all his hard-earned cultivation during these recent days was instantly drained in a moment by this damned girl!

Thinking of this, Su Yi Shui’s face turned extremely grim. He grabbed Ranran’s shoulders and emphasized each word, “What curse did you put on me? I actually sacrificed my vitality qi to nourish you this way?”

Ranran, who had just regained consciousness, blinked her eyes and was stunned when she understood Su Yi Shui’s words. Just now, when Shifu had transferred vitality qi to her, it was a cultivation practice they had done often in the past.

Every once in a while, when Shifu guided her in qi cultivation, he would also transfer vitality qi to her. So Ranran had already gotten used to it, thinking it was a necessary process for master and disciple in cultivation.

But Su Yi Shui had gritted his teeth and said that she was using the demonic cultivation’s dark arts to absorb qi… Ranran was gaping with surprise and speechless for a long while…

In other words, her recent bouts of dizziness was not because of a reversal of yin and yang, but because Su Yi Shui, after returning from the Netherworld realm, completely forgot to replenish her in time, causing her to collapse.

Although Ranran had inwardly decided to strictly adhere to etiquette with Shifu, and try to forget the memory of their period of inappropriate intimacy. But now she suddenly realized that Shifu had been silently using the cultivation that was precious to all cultivators, just to keep her alive. Ranran suddenly felt an onset of tears as her eyes reddened.

So what if everyone said that he owed her? She knew he had always done his best to compensate, even sacrificing his own foundation building cultivation to prolong her life! That was enough!

Perhaps due to her innate frailty, Ranran had never experienced strong emotions from childhood to adulthood. But her emotions were always stirred by the glaring man before her…

He had completely forgotten everything, but why did she feel indebted to him with her entire being, and unable to repay him back no matter what?

Feeling choked up, Ranran felt extremely distressed. She didn’t care about etiquette anymore and suddenly hugged the man’s waist, throwing herself into his arms and burst into tears.

Su Yi Shui had been waiting to see how this little demoness would defend herself, and explain how she had once bewitched him and absorbed his cultivation.

But unexpectedly, the little demoness didn’t say a word, just threw herself into his arms, crying loudly. Those who didn’t know better, might think he had taken advantage of her!

Su Yi Shui was extremely furious. He reached out, thinking to push her away with force, but the sobbing and limp little demoness in his arms made him feel at a loss.

He couldn’t push her away, and hollering at her didn’t make her leave. He could only let her wet tears soak the front of his clothes.

Watching her shoulders shake uncontrollably as she cried, Su Yi Shui’s countenance changed several times. Finally, he sighed helplessly and asked, “What are you crying for? Is it because you haven’t absorbed enough qi?”

Ranran finally raised her head, sniffed hard, and tried to calm down. She said, “Shifu, you should take back your golden core, and don’t transfer vitality qi to me again in future. There’s a natural order to the world. I shouldn’t have been reincarnated like this. Rather than always burdening you, it’s better to let me fend for myself.”

As a cultivator, the greatest pain should be the stagnation of cultivation, watching hope for immortality fade, and gradually aging and dying.

Even though Su Yi Shui was a rare genius, using vitality qi to nourish another was not a long-term solution. If it weren’t for his earlier scheming against Wei Jiu, he might have already exhausted his qi and been unable to keep up.

But he had never told her these things before. Ranran would never have let Su Yi Shui do this if she had known earlier.

Hearing the girl’s decided words, Su Yishui raised an eyebrow and said, “Aren’t you afraid of death?”

Ranran shook her head and said in a low voice, “I hope you can live well…”

Seeing the determination in her slightly red eyes, Su Yi Shui suddenly felt his heart tighten, the pain making it hard for him to draw breath…

He didn’t know what was wrong with him. Just the thought that Ranran might die filled him with inexplicable panic, as if he had seen her die before…

Su Yi Shui calmed his mind. As if driven by a mysterious force, he reached out to wipe away her tears with his hands, saying gruffly, “Until I remember why I saved you like this, you better stay alive! What I’ve given, you can’t just return as you like!”

Ranran looked at Su Yi Shui’s seemingly heartless expression but felt her heart overflowing with warmth. She couldn’t help but embrace this threatening ferocious beast again, sniffing greedily at his familiar scent in his arms.

For a moment, she couldn’t remember when was the last time she hugged him like this.

Su Yi Shui didn’t push her away. He lowered his gaze thoughtfully and coldly asked, “Did you always hug me like this before?”

This little girl was quite beautiful. Could it be that she had seduced him like this before, which made him pay special attention to her?

Ranran knew she had forgot herself. Although she was very reluctant, she slowly let go of him, sat up, brushed the stray hair from her forehead, and muttered, “Shifu, you… are just like my father… When I miss my father, I occasionally can’t help but hug you…”

This explanation seemed the most reasonable. Ranran didn’t want the current Su Yishui to have any misunderstandings.

She reminded herself not to lose control like this again in the future, so she didn’t notice that her fatherly Shifu’s face had turned even darker.

Su Yi Shui never expected her to come up with such things. He looked at himself in the mirror and saw his appearance as a nineteen-year-old youth. How could he look like this little demoness’s father?

He couldn’t help but say coldly, “Next time you miss your father, go back to visit him! Don’t call every man you see as your father. If there’s nothing else, you can leave!”

Ranran sniffed and got up quickly. “Shifu, do you… feel alright now? Do you feel uncomfortable?”

Perhaps it had been a long time since she had absorbed Shifu’s qi, and she seemed to have unconsciously absorbed a lot just now. She didn’t know if it would affect Su Yi Shui.

But Su Yishui was annoyed. He just repeated coldly, “Leave!”

Ranran had no choice but to slowly walk out.

When the young girl disappeared from view, Su Yi Shui realized belatedly that once again he had been too lenient and had let this little demoness off too easily.

After all, he had slowly given her more than half of his cultivation and vitality qi.

Su Yi Shui had never thought that there was anything too important in the memories sealed by the Soul-Cleansing Talisman.

But now he was increasingly curious about why he accomodated Xue Ranran so much and why he was willing to risk his life to save the Mu Qingge sisters.

If he wanted to find out everything, he had to find Elder Jiu to remove the Soul-Cleansing Talisman.

Ranran had always thought that Su Yi Shui had taken in so many disciples recently simply because he was dissatisfied with how weak his previous disciples were.

But later, she discovered that these new disciples all had astonishing backgrounds. For example, Shen Kuo, whose grandfather was the former Sect Master of Crimson Gate, Shen Wen.

Although Shen Wen was a demonic cultivator, back then he was also a respected great figure of his generation. Unfortunately, he mistakenly took in Wei Jiu, the ungrateful one, as his disciple.

Everyone knew that Wei Jiu, in his eagerness for quick success, had killed his own master, Shen Wen. Shen Kuo and Wei Jiu were sworn enemies.

Su Yi Shui took in Shen Kuo with obvious intentions — to gather forces and deal with Wei Jiu first.

As for Yue Sheng, he was a descendant of the Yu Mountain Sect, which used to rival the three major sects. The rise of the Jiuhua Sect and its leadership with the other two major sects to suppress Yu Mountain were events that few people now remembered.

But as a descendant of Yu Mountain, Yue Sheng was determined to revive his sect. Following Su Yi Shui, who was at odds with the three major sects, was a natural choice.

Although Yue Sheng was young, Yu Mountain Sect still had many connections, and he had gathered a lot of information about recent activities in Crimson Gate.

For example, there were many unfamiliar disciples entering Crimson Gate recently. They wore Crimson gate disciples’ clothes, but the other members didn’t recognize them.

Moreover, Wei Jiu had allocated a secluded dojo in Crimson Gate’s Red Flame Mountain to them.

So Su Yi Shui planned to lead his people to investigate and find out what was going on.

With so many talents in West Mountain now, Gao Cang and the others originally thought their Shifu wouldn’t take them along again.

But unexpectedly, their master brought along several senior disciples, including the slightly weaker Bai Baishan.

Among the newly selected disciples, Su Yi Shui only chose Shen Kuo and Yue Sheng, the top ones.

But this time, they didn’t travel by carriage but rode on the wind.

Yue Sheng still looked down on Gao Cang and the others, but his manner have become much more polite.

It was because when they hadn’t left the West Mountain, Yue Sheng had provoked Gao Cang and Bai Baishan several times, which Su Yi Shui had seen.

Su Yishui didn’t say anything, he just let Yue Sheng have a contest with Gao Cang, to step on eggshells. The loser would have to write the rules of the West Mountain Sect a hundred times.

I really hope this scene makes it into the drama!

Just imagining a furious and maniacal Su Yi Shui not being able to sleep, going out into the stormy night to carve out the mountain path, in his grand petty scheme to show Ranran he can dish out punishment justly, just to get back at her just makes me lol so much

Previous
Next

淬金之火 THE TEMPERING FLAME

“Stepping on eggshells” is an introductory skill in cultivation’s light body technique. It involves laying cracked eggshells on the ground and then leaping and jumping on them. The one who breaks the most eggshells or breaks them first loses.

For someone like Yue Sheng, who has a foundation in cultivation, this skill is really nothing. Yue Sheng instinctively felt that the master was favoring him by indirectly punishing Gao Cang, that silly guy, so he readily agreed.

However, when they arrived at the martial arts arena, Yue Sheng was dumbfounded.

It turned out that those eggshells were floating in two large pots set up, and the pots were filled with boiling hot water.

If one’s light body technique is weak, the eggshells won’t break underfoot, but the person might get almost cooked.

When Su Yi Shui ordered them to step on the eggshells, Gao Cang widened his eyes, took a deep breath, and silently used the light body technique to leap into the pot.

However, Yue Sheng hesitated for a long time and refused to jump in. He finally said, “I’ll just admit defeat in this round and go copy the sect rules as punishment.”

Before he could finish speaking, Gao Cang, on the other side, already lost his strength and fell into the pot with a splash. Just when everyone thought he would be screaming in pain from being scalded, Gao Cang looked pleasantly surprised and said, “Hey, why is this water only steaming but not scalding?”

Later, they found out that the water boiling in the two pots was the extreme yin water from the Ice Lotus Pond. Although it looked boiling hot, it was actually just warm.

Su Yi Shui then coldly said, “You always question why Gao Cang can be your senior disciple, right? He listens to the master without any doubt. Even with higher cultivation, you can’t match his obedience.”

In truth, Su Yi Shui didn’t expect that big fool Gao Cang would just jump in without any hesitation at all. It seemed that what Xue Ranran said about her senior disciples wasn’t exaggerated. Although their foundations were lacking, they were all naturally kind-hearted and loyal.

So, these few seemingly useless disciples finally showing some promise.

Yue Sheng knew he had shown weakness in this test, and his face, usually fair, turned slightly red with shame. He quietly went to copy the sect rules as punishment.

With this lesson serving as a warning, the conflicts between the new and old disciples came to an end, and everyone could practice peacefully together.

As for the mistake in the kitchen, given how “enthusiastic” the new disciples were, they were assigned all the cooking duties.

Anyway, Su Yi Shui had entered the stage of fasting and secluded cultivation again, cutting off contact with the outside world. So Ranran also had some free time now to focus on meditation with everyone else.

This time they went out, Su Yi Shui took all four of the senior disciples. Yue Sheng could come along was probably due to the connections from Yu Mountain. So, he also wanted to perform well and redeem himself from past shame.

However, as they descended the mountain, Xue Ranran noticed that the passing passers-by looked nervous, carrying machetes and similar weapons.

It was said that there had been many incidents of monsters harming people in the nearby mountains recently, so the passersby were always in groups of three to five and reluctant to travel alone, carrying handy defensive tools.

Xue Ranran thought of those ghost-headed spiders, realizing that many monsters had escaped from the netherworld this time.

After they had been traveling for a while, they started to see disciples from the three major sects. They all looked like they were in a hurry, heading in the same direction as Xishan’s disciples.

Xue Ranran whispered to Su Yi Shui, “Are all these righteous disciples mobilized to hunt us?”

Su Yi Shui shook his head. “They should also be going to the Red Flame Mountain. There’s something they want there too.”

Xue Ranran remembered a passage she had read in the Fantian’s records. She suddenly realized, “Now that monsters are rampant, the righteous disciples must want to suppress them quickly. Could it be that they want to find the Tempering Flame at the Red Flame Mountain?”

Back then, the powerful Dun Tian slaughtered the demon king in the Red Flame Mountain, leaving behind a true fire, which was said to be a seed of fire from refining the demon king’s corpse. It had endured a hundred years without extinguishing and could cleanse demons and rectify evil.

However, this true fire only showed itself when there was a surge of evil spirits in the world.

With a large number of monsters escaping from the Netherworld gate now, it might be the time for this true fire to emerge. It was no wonder so many righteous disciples were rushing to the demonic Red Flame Mountain, a place they usually despised.

The Crimson Gate was adjacent to the Red Flame Mountain. This area was vast and sparsely populated. Further ahead was a barren zone, scorching hot during the day and chilling cold at night.

So, before entering the wasteland, they had to fill their water bags in preparation. While Xue Ranran was fetching water by a stream, she could see the fiery Red Flame Mountain ahead.

It was said that before the powerful Dun Tian ascended, he had annihilated everything on Red Flame Mountain, which was once a demon’s lair. Because he had refined the demon king who killed his wife and children, the Red Flame Mountain spewed lava all year round, and the temperature around the mountain was exceptionally hot.

For some demonic cultivators, such temperatures were beneficial for cultivating their true qi, making it an ideal place for cultivation. That’s why the Crimson Gate, belonging to the Fire Element, had thrived here for centuries.

However, it wasn’t friendly to Ranran, who had a Yin wood elemental attribute. So, as soon as she reached the spring, she eagerly took off her shoes and socks, putting her feet into the water.

As the cool water rushed up, Ranran felt refreshed, just like a thirsty little tree that had found water again.

“What’s wrong? Feeling uncomfortable again?”

Su Yi Shui’s voice suddenly came from behind her. Ranran turned around and saw Su Yishui standing behind her.

Su Yi Shui frowned slightly at his female disciple impulsively taking off her shoes and socks.

Her feet were too fair, with toenails that weren’t stained with Stellaria juice but still displayed a charming light pink color. A pretty girl’s slender feet were enough to attract attention.

At least, those male disciples fetching water upstream seemed to be intentionally or unintentionally looking this way.

For the first time, Su Yi Shui felt that he had taken in too many male disciples. So, when he stood beside Ranran, his tall body naturally blocked the somewhat impudent gazes of his disciples.

Ranran didn’t notice her master’s private thoughts. She was still pondering some things she couldn’t figure out, asking, “Shifu, do you think the true fire left by the powerful Dun Tian can really rid the world of evil spirits?”

However, Su Yi Shui didn’t care much about these important worldly matters. He crouched down and felt her pulse.

For some unknown reason, Ranran needed more and more qi to replenish herself lately. Even if Su Yi Shui wanted to keep her around for now, he was worried that he couldn’t supply enough qi just by himself.

Moreover, Ranran was already on guard whenever she sensed Su Yi Shui about to replenish her qi. “Shifu, if you’re going to break into the Crimson Gate to save Elder Jiu, you must maintain your best condition. I’m fine, there’s no discomfort, so please don’t replenish my qi anymore!”

Ranran was afraid that Su Yi Shui would deplete his true qi at this critical juncture. This place wasn’t at West Mountain; if he depleted his true qi, there wouldn’t be enough time to sit and replenish it. So, she couldn’t let Su Yi Shui deplete himself, lest he couldn’t save himself in a crisis.

Su Yi Shui looked at her, feeling that his heart was being clutched again, even feeling an impulse to pull her into his arms.

In his opinion, he wasn’t under the spell of any soul-cleansing talisman. It was clearly this little demoness who had placed a spell on him.

This made him increasingly eager to retrieve forgotten memories and figure out what was going on with himself.

Why was it that lately, he always stared blankly at this young girl’s face, sometimes feeling a strange impulse when looking at her tender lips?

Even when he had nearly gotten engaged to Wen Hongshan before, he had always adhered to etiquette with her and never had such thoughts at all?

It was these wandering thoughts that made him absent-mindedly listen to Ranran’s words. Suddenly, he asked, “Do you have someone you like?”

If he remembered correctly, he heard her mother Qiao Lian mention about arranging a marriage for her, and even arranged a few young suitors for her in the past.

Ranran didn’t expect Su Yi Shui to suddenly change the topic like this and couldn’t help but pause for a moment with a “Ah?” Su Yi Shui continued calmly, “Just as your mother said, you’re not young anymore. If you don’t have any, among the disciples in the same sect, do you have anyone you fancy?”

She paused, was just about to say no, before she stopped. What was going on with her Shifu? Did he want to arrange a marriage on behalf of her parents, from within their sect?

While there were many handsome seniors and juniors in the sect, Ranran felt it was best to just look and not have any other entanglements with them. So, when Su Yi Shui asked, she straightforwardly said, “…There is one, but he’s not a fellow disciple. Please, Shifu, don’t ask any further.”

But as soon as she said this, Su Yi Shui’s expression instantly turned sour, and he coldly said, “Who is it? Tell me, I’ll check on him for you.”

Ranran lowered her head, absentmindedly toyed with the water with her fair feet and slowly said, “He’s just a person with a difficult personality… seems mature in appearance but actually quite childish … very petty and holds grudges, but he’s very good to me…”

Su Yi Shui grew more and more annoyed as he listened, coldly saying, “You actually like such a person with no redeeming qualities? You can’t find a decent man?”

Ranran burst into laughter and looked up at him, smiling brightly. “Yes, maybe he is not any good in the eyes of others, but in my heart, he’s the best. I don’t want anyone else!”

Su Yi Shui stood up abruptly. He had wasted enough time with this silly girl. He didn’t want to listen to her nonsense anymore.

What kind of decent man could a fool like her be interested in, who could be swayed with a few sweet words? He was just bored and actually asked her such a stupid question!

The journey ahead was extremely oppressive and heavy for the disciples of Xishan. Su Yi Shui’s face was as dark as ink, making everyone afraid to approach.

But no one could figure out what had upset Shifu so much. Qiu Xier asked Ranran, who also said she didn’t know.

Because Su Yi Shui seemed unwilling to talk to her, and after being given the cold shoulder several times, Ranran stopped trying to engage him. Besides, with two uncle masters serving Su Yi Shui, she didn’t need to approach.

During the journey, she chatted with her seniors and juniors to pass the time, deliberately distracting herself from sadness due to Su Yi Shui’s cold treatment. Ranran was never one to dwell in sorrow for too long.

However, every time she was amused by Yue Sheng and Bai Baishan’s antics and laughed out loud, she inadvertently turned her head and saw the sharp gaze Su Yi Shui cast her way…

Well, when Shifu was in a bad mood, disciples really shouldn’t be laughing too loudly.

But as they continued forward, no one could laugh anymore. Yue Sheng accidentally stepped on the ground ahead and let out a cry of pain. It turned out that the ground in this desert, which they had to pass through, had inexplicably become scorching hot.

Shen Kuo crouched down, thinking aloud, “This is a sign of spiritual energy gathering. Places with concentrated heat often have nascent soul cultivators… Could Wei Jiu be preparing to ascend?”

Hearing this, Yue Sheng showed some urgency on his face. Wei Jiu was the most notorious demon after Mu Qingge. If he could subdue him, he would surely gain fame. Whether Yu Mountain could regain its former glory depended on Yue Sheng alone, so he naturally didn’t want Wei Jiu to ascend after forming his nascent soul.

But Su Yi Shui coldly said, “His core formation is damaged; how could he form his nascent soul so quickly? This level of heat… is probably related to the Tempering Flame…”

However, it was best that they inquired about what had happened here from the locals. Near the Red Flame Mountain was a town called Red Flame Town. The town was desolate, with only one dilapidated inn.

As they approached, before Yue Sheng who was in the front could speak, an old man with a white beard who was making grass shoes at the door spoke first, “Are you all here to court death? If you have no business, leave quickly; otherwise, you won’t be able to leave…”

Qiu Xier cautiously asked the old man, “Why? Is it very dangerous here?”

The old man half-lifted his head and said coldly, “You’re not the first batch of people who came here to die. You probably won’t listen to advice either. My inn only has one room left; do you want it?”

Now that the ground outside was scorching hot, if they couldn’t ascend Red Flame Mountain today, they indeed needed a place to rest. However, both the inn and the old man seemed inexplicably strange, making them hesitant to move forward.

Just then, several people walked out of the inn. Leading them was Wealth God Wang Suizhi, and beside him were Qin Xuanjiu and others, with Mu Ranwu who was using her older sister’s name, among them.

Mu Ranwu seemed much more energetic compared to the last time they have met, with much more vitality. However, although she had taken in so many orphan disciples, there weren’t many with her at the moment.

Seeing Su Yi Shui and the others, Mu Ranwu paused slightly, then smiled again, “Why have all the disciples from Xishan come as well?”

She saw Su Yi Shui leading people and wasn’t afraid.

Because she knew that he would act out of consideration for her sister. Even if he knew she was impersonating her, he wouldn’t harm her. After all, he had promised her sister to take care of her.

Su Yi Shui felt guilty towards her sister, so no matter what excessive things she did, Su Yi Shui wouldn’t really hold it against her…

Thinking of this, Mu Ranwu naturally greeted Su Yi Shui without fear.

But when Xue Ranran saw Mu Ranwu, she felt more complicated feelings in her heart. Although this woman who deceived and swindled might have been her younger sister in a past life, Ranran couldn’t feel any sisterly affection for her now.

Seeing Wang Suizhi and Qin Xuanjiu and other disciples from her past life, being gathered around her, and recalling how Qin Xuanjiu had once cried bitterly because of his master’s neglect, Ranran was really worried about these disciples.

Given Mu Ranwu’s nature, she might be planning to use these disciples to do something.

Thinking of this, Xue Ranran coldly asked, “I wonder what Elder Mu is doing here?”

Qin Xuanjiu eagerly replied, “Recently, many demons have appeared everywhere, harming the common people. My Master is upholding justice, chasing demons along the way, and has come here. What about you all coming here?”

When Ranran heard about demons, her mind raced. “What kind of demons? Is it the Ghost-headed Spider?”

Qin Xuanjiu said, “Not just this kind; they are all netherworld demons. You, your master, and Wei Jiu once went into the Netherworld, secretly opened a rift, and released these demons! My Master had to clean up after you! From what I see, are you and Wei Jiu in cahoots? Is this intentional, to take advantage of chaos and expand Xishan’s power?”

Recently, Xishan had been recruiting and had gained many new disciples, at the peak of popularity and making people wary.

Gao Cang immediately glared, “Nonsense! Our Shifu went to the Netherworld to return the Spirit Spring. If the Spirit Spring had remained in the human realm, it would have caused great calamity!”

Mu Ranwu smiled and said, “Alright, Xuanjiu, don’t blame your senior brother. When he entered the Netherworld before, if he was unintentionally manipulated by Wei Jiu, it was also due to circumstances. I believe he didn’t deliberately release those demons…”

She timed her words just right. Old Feng from the YiRen Hall brought a group of people out at this moment, and his Yin and Yang eyes were assessing the disciples of Xishan.

In addition, the top disciples of the three major sects also appeared one after another. No wonder the old man at the inn said they were fully booked; this small, run-down inn is housing many hidden talents from all over!

It turned out that during this time, incidents of demons harming people had occurred everywhere, and the Ghost-headed Spiders encountered by Xue Ranran was just the tip of the iceberg.

Even the capital, with strong Yang energy, had experienced anomalies. Every night, large bats would come out to suck blood.

These chaotic phenomena of demons running rampant were even worse than when the demon’s son had secretly took the Spirit Spring out of the Netherworld.

Now that demons were multiplying, they would eventually become an uncontrollable disaster. So, the three major sects were invited by the YiRen Hall in the capital to come to Red Flame Mountain to search for the Tempering Flame that could suppress demons.

It was because of this seed of fire that the temperature and terrain around Red Flame Mountain were so different, with the ground beneath their feet being baked red.

However, no one knew exactly where this seed of fire was in Red Flame Mountain, not even its owner Wei Jiu.

So, everyone gathered here to force Wei Jiu to open the mountain gate and let them go find the true fire to drive away demons.

But they didn’t expect that Su Yi Shui, the former demon son, would also bring his disciples here. Thinking that all these anomalies seemed to be related to Su Yi Shui taking the Spirit Spring out back then, everyone’s anger vented towards the disciples of Xishan.

Mu Ranwu’s words were clearly provocative, deliberately inciting the anger of the crowd.

But just as she finished speaking, Mu Ranwu noticed that something was off with Su Yi Shui’s gaze, not the usual indifference but carrying a strong killing intent.

Before Mu Ranwu could react, Su Yi Shui had already attacked.

Mu Ranwu hurriedly raised her hand to activate her spirit shield to block, but Su Yi Shui’s hand was like a blade, directly breaking through the spirit shield and fiercely gripping Mu Ranwu’s neck.

Seeing him attack, Qin Xuanjiu rushed forward with his blade, but how could he be a match for Su Yi Shui?

But just then, two expressionless men suddenly appeared behind Mu Ranwu.

Their faces seemed sealed, their eyes not blinking at all, their hands turning Qi into blades as they attacked Su Yi Shui.

Their attacks were fierce and brutal, wrapped in a chilling killing intent.

Su Yi Shui naturally dodged, letting go and stepping back a few steps. Then, he narrowed his eyes he assessed the two strange men.

Mu Ranwu had been using Wei Jiu’s methods during this time, absorbing the spiritual power of Yin children. She had thought that she had recovered enough. But she didn’t expect Su Yi Shui’s moves to be even more ruthless, leaving her no room to maneuver and putting her in a life-threatening situation.

Although she had finally managed to break free from the steel clamp-like grip of the big hand, with the help of her two followers behind her, her throat was already hoarse and she could hardly speak.

She staggered back, frustrated and angry, “You… you actually want to kill me? Have you forgotten…”
