She wanted to say, “Have you forgotten that my sister entrusted me to you?” But now there were people around, and she still had to maintain Mu Qingge’s persona, so she could only grit her teeth and endure it.

Su Yi Shui coldly said, “I hate it most when others accuse me falsely. What do these demons have to do with me? You’re inciting trouble, such intentions deserve death!”

Mu Ranwu wanted to argue with him, but her neck was too painful, and her voice was hoarse like a duck’s, so her eyes reddened with anger.

By the side, Xue Ranran watched, clutching her neck as if Su Yi Shui had not strangled Mu Ranwu, but her delicate neck instead.

See here, if it weren’t for Mu Qingge doing so much for Su Yi Shui later on and moved him, this rebellious disciple would be a ferocious beast who could kill his master without any hesitation!

Even though she had been preparing for the possibility of dying weakly, due to insufficient true qi,

In her imagined scenario, it would be best to reunite with her parents, cook for them one last time, and then lie and tell them she was about to ascend to become an immortal and perhaps never seeing them again. She would then go to the flower sea she had visited with Shifu before. With fireflies dancing around her, she could quietly close her eyes and pass.

The thought of dying in Su Yi Shui’s eyes full of hatred, this kind of death is not too wonderful.

Ranran made up her mind to tightly hold onto her current protective armor. She was the sister Mu Ranwu. She absolutely couldn’t let Shifu discover right now that she was the past Mu Qingge!

Just then, an elder from the Kongshan Sect came out to mediate.

“Alright, we haven’t figured out the cause of the rampant demons yet. Why raise such a big commotion? Su Yi Shui, didn’t you come here to stay? Just go and get a room.”

With this statement, she indirectly refuted Mu Ranwu’s claim that the demons were released by Su Yi Shui.

Mu Ranwu knew that the three major sects wouldn’t be manipulated by her like fools this time. She could only grit her teeth in frustration, clutching her neck, and retreated to her room.

After this chaos, Su Yi Shui finally booked the last room.

But the room was so small that even if everyone meditated all night, there wouldn’t be enough space.

Ranran and Qiu Xier went downstairs to find some food and check if there were any extra blankets in the inn to lay on the floor. This way, meditating wouldn’t be too uncomfortable.

As night fell, everyone went back to their rooms, setting up spiritual shields to keep to themselves. However, when she went downstairs, Ranran heard voices coming from the backyard.

Ranran looked out through the open window and saw Wang Suizhi talking to a young boy brought in. The boy looked weak and terrified.

“Lord, please spare me? Its rare that Master didn’t take me for cultivation today. Please just pretend you didn’t see me! If I stay, I will surely die!”

Previous
Next

入山入阵 INTO THE FORMATION

Wang Suizhi frowned and scolded the kneeling boy in a low voice, “Since you’ve already become a disciple, how can you just leave like this? You’re betraying the sect! Besides, without parents, where do you plan to go?”

The boy choked up and said, “It’s because I have no parents, that you all bully me. You chose me and over a dozen other beggars to join the sect, but why did they one by one fall mysteriously ill and die, their bodies wasted away? What Master? I think she’s a blood-sucking skeleton demon!”

Hearing such rebellious words from the boy, Wang Suizhi was initially furious, but then he became resigned. He took out a pouch from his pocket and handed it to the boy, saying, “Since it’s come to this, I won’t force you to stay. Here’s some money for your journey, head northeast, where your luck will be better. Although you won’t become rich, it should be enough to feed yourself……”

The boy gratefully took the money pouch and hurriedly left like he was escaping for his life.

Wang Suizhi stood in the courtyard for a long while, sighing at the solitary moon. But as he turned around, he saw Xue Ranran standing in the corner. He was surprised for a moment, then politely nodded before preparing to leave.

Ranran couldn’t help but say, “Since you already know something is wrong with your Master, why not leave? Why assist in wrongdoing?”

Wang Suizhi’s face turned stern, “How dare you slander my Master?”

Ranran continued, “Actually, you already have the answer in your heart, but you refuse to believe it. Your Master may be great, but if she’s done wrong, blindly following her is akin to aiding wrongdoing.”

Wang Suizhi hesitated, “Miss Xue, what do you mean?”

Xue Ranran said, “When you recruited those children at the border, they were all born in the Yin month. I was puzzled at first, why pay such attention to birth months? But today, seeing the children with Elder Mu all looking weak and spent, while Elder Mu herself is radiant, I suddenly understood. She must have practiced a demonic method of extracting life force…”

“Stop your nonsense! How could my Master do such a thing?” Wang Suizhi was both angry and anxious, but he was more afraid to disturb others, so he lowered his voice and growled.

Ranran took a deep breath slowly. If she hadn’t discovered Su Yi Shui helping herself with replenishing her vitality qi, she might not have thought of this.

Both she and Mu Ranwu were fruits fallen from the Rebirth tree. Although Mu Ranwu used reincarnation to steal her sister’s cultivation, after depleting her vitality in the palace, her lack of inner strength should have presented.

Mu Ranwu didn’t have someone like Su Yi Shui to help her to replenish Qi, so how could she get through this crisis?

So tonight, after eavesdropping on Wang Suizhi and the boy, she immediately understood everything.

Seeing Wang Suizhi let the boy go, Ranran felt that Wang Suizhi’s nature was not evil. She didn’t want him to continue doing bad things with Mu Ranwu, so she deliberately pointed it out to him.

“Whether she’d done it or not, but deep down, you already have an answer, don’t you?” Ranran said softly after hearing his question.

Wang Suizhi was momentarily speechless, unable to come up with anything.

Of course, he had also noticed something wrong. The children he brought in, although they were thin from not eating enough, were all healthy before.

But after following the Master’s practice, the innately talented children fell ill one after the other, as if they were being drained dry. When they were dying, the Master would instruct them to be sent away, and he didn’t know if they lived or died afterward.

Wang Suizhi hadn’t slept well these days. Whenever he slept, he would see those children who were being sent away, looking at him with hollow eyes, and then he would wake up drenched in cold sweat.

But he couldn’t say these things to other disciples.

After all, the rebirth of their Master was a miracle everyone had longed for. If he said even half a word, it would be considered treason.

Now hearing Xue Ranran’s words, he actually felt enlightened. “If… I mean if it’s true, what do you think I should do?”

Ranran looked at the middle-aged man in front of her. Perhaps twenty years ago, when he was still a youth, he had also asked her for advice when he felt lost.

“If you feel something is wrong, why not leave…”

Wang Suizhi sighed softly, “You don’t know, my Master has brought in some people… Even if I wanted to leave, I can’t…”

Thinking of the two expressionless people who fought with Shifu during the day, Ranran was also curious. Who exactly were they?

Now that the relationship between Mu Ranwu and Su Yu was delicate, she wouldn’t be at ease having Su Yu’s people around her. If they weren’t from the Yiren Hall, could they be from the Crimson Gate?

Just then, on the other side of the inn, the sound of a child crying seemed to come through. It seems that Mu Ranwu wanted to cultivate, but found the child missing, so she sent people to search. The runaway boy hadn’t gone very far before he was caught by an expressionless attendant and brought back.

Wang Suizhi trembled slightly upon hearing the child’s cries, not out of fear of punishment from his master, but because he truly felt he had unintentionally done something that deserved condemnation.

Ranran took out a few talismans from her waist and handed them to Wang Suizhi. Then, channeling her voice only to Wang Suizhi, she conveyed, “These are invisibility talismans. If you intend to leave, please take the remaining children and General Qin with you. He’s too principled and easily manipulated. You can get him drunk, then stick the talismans on everyone and hide in the wine barrels behind the inn… These talismans can conceal your presence, and the strong scent of the wine barrels will also help to conceal you… Don’t confront Elder Mu, as she has strange people aiding her now, you won’t be a match for her…”

After receiving them, Wang Suizhi gritted his teeth, seemingly determined to trust this kind girl just this once. For some reason, with his years of experience in business and reading people, he just felt Xue Ranran was worthy of trust.

At this moment, Wang Suizhi suddenly said to Xue Ranran, “Miss, if you’re asking about wealth, your fortune lies in the north. If you head there tomorrow, you’re bound to make a fortune…”

While they were speaking, a hoarse voice came from the other side of the courtyard, “Miss Xue has quite the asthetic mood, asking for financial opportunities from my disciple in the middle of the night? Is there something that couldn’t wait until daytime?”

Mu Ranwu with her hoarse voice, appeared in the courtyard with a cold smile on her face.

Due to her neck being injured by Su Yi Shui, Mu Ranwu hadn’t meditated in time today. After a tired sleep, she woke up and couldn’t find the boy who had been nourishing her for several days. As she had been feeling on his qi for the past few days, she immediately sensed that he had left the inn.

As she prepared to go teach the runaway boy a lesson, she passed by here, and happened to overhear Wang Suizhi’s words, as if Xue Ranran was asking about financial opportunities.

Mu Ranwu immediately came out to put a stop to it. Now, Wang Suizhi was her wealth god disciple; why should Xue Ranran be allowed to make money?

Moreover, when did Wang Suizhi become so close with Xue Ranran? Did Wang Suizhi realize that she was an imposter?

Mu Ranwu currently needed alot of money and couldn’t do without Wang Suizhi, her money source. So she couldn’t let Xue Ranran influence Wang Suizhi.

In the past, Xue Ranran would never have confronted Elder Mu head-on. But knowing that she was deliberately impersonating her and doing shady and sinsiter things, Ranran now looked at her coldly.

She looked at the few pale-faced children behind Mu Qingge, thinking that these children might not last long either.

Thinking of this, she looked at Wang Suizhi again and told him via voice channeling “These children were recruited by you. If you have a conscience, find a way to save them. If you need help in the future, you can come to Xishan to find me… Actually have you ever wondered, is your current master really Mu Qingge?”

After conveying these hidden words, Xue Ranran turned to Mu Ranwu and said, “I happened to meet Master Wang here and chatted with him briefly. Elder Mu won’t mind, will you?”

Mu Ranwu was about to reply, but then she saw Su Yi Shui has also appeared in the courtyard. This startled her, and she took a few steps back, telling Wang Suizhi, “Hurry up and follow me!”

Wang Suizhi, on the other hand, seemed stunned by what Xue Ranran last said. Trying to maintain his composure, he cast an apprehensive glance at Xue Ranran, and left with Mu Ranwu.

Xue Ranran sighed. If she said she was Mu Qingge right now, she guessed Wang Suizhi wouldn’t believe her, and he might even think she was sent by Su Yi Shui to sow discord between him and his mentor.

So she could only give a slight hint and let Wang Suizhi figure out this mess by himself. However, those children really couldn’t wait any longer.

Anyway, they would all enter the mountains tomorrow. Even if Mu Ranwu noticed there were people missing, she wouldn’t be able to spare the energy to chase them. Hopefully, Wang Suizhi could use those talismans cleverly and escape Mu Ranwu’s control.

After Mu Ranwu and her group have completely gone.

Su Yi Shui walked slowly in front her, looking down at her. His handsome eyes narrowed slightly as he suddenly asked, “Are you unhappy because I attacked your sister during the day?”

She had been reluctant to go back to the room, choosing to linger in the courtyard. Was she mad at him?

Ranran took a pause, then immediately remembered that he thought that she was Mu Qingge’s sister, Mu Ranwu.

Thinking of this, she said, “She’s not my elder sister. I don’t have a sister in this lifetime. Even if she were my real sister, if she did something wrong, she should bear the consequences herself…”

Su Yi Shui heard this and snorted coldly, “In her past life, she doted on you the most, always protecting you in every way. You are sure disassociating so cleanly now.”

Although he had always disliked Mu Qingge’s pampering of her incompetent sister who acted like a baby, her sudden ruthlessness now seemed heartless and ungrateful.

Ranran sighed softly, “I was really wrong. Can’t I make up for the debt from my past life even by dying?”

Perhaps in the past life, she had pampered Mu Ranwu too much, allowing her greed to increasingly grow, ultimately leading to her desire to replace her.

She had made a mistake and paid with the price of death. In this lifetime, she had no sisterly affection for Mu Ranwu, nor did she want to shelter this extremely selfish and malicious woman.

But these words sounded different in Su Yi Shui’s ears. He felt that he was perhaps too hard on this young girl. She didn’t know anything in this lifetime. If he continued to criticize her, wouldn’t it be too harsh?

The next morning, as people in the inn were getting ready to leave, Mu Ranwu discovered that Wang Suizhi, General Qin, and the children she used to nurture her Qi were all missing.

Despite searching the entire inn, she couldn’t find them nor any clues. When asking the remaining people, they only said they saw Wang Suizhi drinking with General Qin last night, and after that, they knew nothing.

Mu Ranwu’s face turned red with anger as she glared fiercely at Xue Ranran. She was now absolutely certain that her handy pawns were missing because of Xue Ranran’s mischief!

Xue Ranran did not avoid her gaze and just stared coldly back at her.

Mu Ranwu felt her heart skip a beat instinctively, and her neck involuntarily shrunk: Damn it! The look in that brat’s eyes is exactly the same as when her elder sister glared at her in her past life! It made her instinctively want to shrink her neck and admit her mistakes… This feeling of being suppressed for a long time is truly maddening.

Compared to her perfect sister, everything she did was wrong, and she would never be as perfect as her!

Mu Ranwu bit her lip hard and could only temporarily set aside this matter. Once she found the Tempering Fire, it would be her time to shine in the world.

By that time, those traitors who left the sect, she wouldn’t let a single one of them go!

The wilderness around the Red Flame Mountain cooled down after a night, and it was only in the morning that one could walk on it comfortably.

Before setting off, Ranran was stopped by the old man watching the inn’s entrance. “Little girl, your shoes are torn. The road on that wilderness isn’t easy to walk on. Let me give you a pair of grass shoes.”

Ranran looked down and indeed saw a hole in her shoes. In this vast area with few people, it would be inconvenient to buy new shoes.

After thanking the old man, she took out some silver from her pocket and said, “I’ll buy a few more pairs, in case Shifu and others’ shoes got worn out too.”

The old man grinned, showing his yellowed teeth, “I only made two pairs. Take the other pair as well, free of charge, consider it a gift.”

Ranran sniffed with her small nose, paused for a moment, then smiled and said, “Thank you, old uncle.”

The old man lowered his head and said mildly, “I advise you all not to court your death. The road ahead is difficult…”

Ranran was about to say something else when the old man picked up his bamboo basket and went to the backyard to cut grass.

When Qiu Xier walked over and saw Ranran looking at the old man’s back, she asked, “What’s wrong?”

Ranran thought for a moment and said, “I seem to have seen this old man somewhere before…”

Qiu Xier looked as well but didn’t notice anything unusual about the old man. He was just an ordinary old man commonly seen in the mountains.

As the area around Red Flame Mountain became lively with people gathering, Crimson Gate’s Wei Jiu also received reports early in the morning.

He didn’t care at all about the people coming to challenge them.

The demonic sect Crimson Gate has been rooted here, other than the beneficial fire attributes for cultivation, the difficulty to attack this place played a significant role.

After ambushing Su Yi Shui at the border, he did not know how effective the Soul-Cleansing Talisman was. Later he learned from the spies he placed in the town that Zeng Yi had taken Xue Ranran and left Su Yi Shui, he knew then that the talisman had worked.

Since Su Yi Shui had forgotten his love for Mu Qingge, he naturally wouldn’t have any special feelings for Xue Ranran anymore.

Xue Ranran, toyed with and discarded by her master, must be feeling disheartened. Wei Jiu’s plan was to first watch her and go look for her when he has the time. If nothing unexpected happened, he would bring Xue Ranran back to Crimson Gate.

Unfortunately, when he went to look for her after dealing with matters in the sect, that Xue Ranran had already returned to Xishan with Su Yi Shui. Even her parents were nowhere to be found with Zeng Yi.

Wei Jiu knew that Su Yi Shui was recruiting forces, and among the new disciples, there was even a descendant of his master Shen Wen.

And it seemed that when he found Xue Ranran, he had intended to take back his golden core. Wei Jiu thought that Xue Ranran was quite cunning and would find a way to save herself. But that was good too. After Su Yi Shui completely breaks her heart, she would understand who knows how to really care for her.

When he heard that they were gathering at the inn near Red Flame Mountain, Wei Jiu wasn’t too flustered. He just sneered, “They want to enter my Crimson Gate to find the Tempering Flame, they’ll have to see if I, the master, am willing!”

But since they are already here, it would go against the principle of hospitality if he didn’t give them a good welcome.

Thinking of this, he ordered, “Someone, set up the Five Fiends Illusion Array and let our guests warm up a little!”

As for Xue Ranran, of course he would also prepare a special gift for her. Hoping that after she saw the true hypocritical nature of Su Yi Shui, she would realize the benefits of being with a truly cunning person like him…

As for the several groups of people from the inn, who arrived at the foot of Red Flame Mountain in batches, they did not encounter disciples from Crimson Gate to stop them.

But as they got closer to Red Flame Mountain, the temperature gradually became hotter.

Ranran felt her feet heating up again, so she took off her torn shoes and put on the grass shoes the old man had given her. When she put them on, they fit perfectly and seemed to have some peppermint and cool grass inside, making her feet feel cool and very comfortable.

She was about to ask Su Yi Shui if he wanted to change as well, when she noticed that he seemed to be staring ahead.

Following his gaze forward, the swirling sands in the desert scattered, revealing five huge eggs resembling big drums.

If one looked closely, the dust on these five eggs was blown away by the strong wind, revealing intricate carvings on their surfaces. The markings looked very ancient.

As the elders of the three major sects who were walking at the forefront saw the patterns on the eggs clearly, their faces changed drastically, one said in a low voice, “Not good! Are these giant eggs… the Five Fiends?”

The wilderness below the Red Flame Mountain was the battlefield where Dun Tian had fought against the Demon King years ago. It was said that the Demon King had gathered the Five Fiends’ artifacts to form a formation, intending to trap Dun Tian.

Later, it was Dun Tian’s wife, Rong Yao, who guided him with her voice infused with true qi, awakening Dun Tian in time to break through the formation.

Although the Demon King was ultimately killed, Dun Tian had achieved enlightenment when he abandoned his wife and children and ascended on the spot. Thus, this maze was preserved intact.

After all, it has been a long time, and even the three major sects’ discussions about the Five Fiends are vague. However, the patterns on those eggshells are recorded in the classics of various major cultivation sects.

These five fiends were Giant Mosquito, Golden Armor Beetle, Human-Faced Flea, Ghost Infant, and Mirage. Each fiend was a creature of evil Qi bred by the Demon King back then and sealed in stone eggs. They wouldn’t dissipate for hundreds of years.

Just as everyone was hesitant and uncertain, a melancholic and eerie flute sounded, piercing the eardrums and causing pain. The five giant eggs slowly floated up, and dense mist began to emanate from the cracks of the stone eggs, creating a formation.

At this moment, Elder Gao Shen from Jiuhua Sect shouted, “Excellency Wei, we are here with a request, why use such a big show of force to welcome us?”

A strange laughter came from the rocky caves scattered around Red Flame Mountain, “You Elders have always been hospitable to me before. Today, after much anticipation, we are honored by your esteemed presence. If I don’t make it more grand, wouldn’t it be disrespectful? Please, show your skills. Whoever can successfully pass through this Five Fiends Illusion Array, I, Wei Jiu, will offer fine wine to host you!”

After saying this, there was no more sound.

An elder from Feiyun Sect said, “The array is about to be set up, and now is when the defense of the Five Fiends is weakest. Let’s each choose a giant egg and attack simultaneously. If we can break them, we can surely break the array!”

After speaking, he pointed his hand, and a blazing fire shot towards one of the eggs in mid-air. Others also joined in, spells flying everywhere, with fire, water, and frost intertwining, creating a spectacular scene.

As people attacked the eggs, the flute melody suddenly intensified, its already unpleasant sound now resembling the desperate cry of an old crow on the brink of death.

The eggs continued to rise, and after reaching a certain height, they moved in unique trajectories in the air, then burst open with a bang, releasing a terrifying aura that surged towards everyone like a monstrous wave.

It was like a pot of fragrant soup instantly turned into black soup with the addition of pitch-black ink, the arena was filled with a sinister aura, surrounding everyone.

After resisting the impact of the sinister aura, they saw five huge gates of sinister energy appearing where the five eggs were. Everyone knew that to break the formation, they had to break through these gates.

At this point, it all depended on luck. Thinking about breaking into the formation that Dun Tian had once broken into, everyone was eager to try it, and make a name for themselves.

Some even took out Feng Shui compasses to sense which gate had the least sinister energy inside and entered that one. Because every formation would have a Life Gate, if they were extremely lucky and entered it, their chances of escaping smoothly would be higher.

Yue Sheng’s eyes were fixed on Lao Feng from the Yiren Hall.

He knew that Lao Feng’s Yin-Yang Eyes were very powerful, so he decided that wherever Lao Feng went, he would follow.

After Lao Feng surveyed the five entrances and decided to enter the one directly to the west. Just as Yue Sheng had thought, Lao Feng’s eyes could see through the mist. The other gates were filled with dense black aura, only the one directly to the west had the least sinister energy. So Lao Feng led the people from the Yiren Hall to enter the western gate first.

Yue Sheng was eager to enter as well but was stopped by Ranran, “You go in with the people from the Yiren Hall. Even if there’s no sinister energy in that gate, you could be ambushed by them.”

After saying this, Ranran turned to Shen Kuo and asked, “You are a descendant of the former master of Crimson Gate, do you know the way to break this Five Fiends Array?”

Shen Kuo shook his head slowly, “Although my grandfather was a demonic cultivator, his methods were only different from those of immortal cultivators. He never acted as boldly and recklessly as Wei Jiu, nor did he dare to use ancient evil formations. But according to the ancient records of Crimson Gate, the longer you stay in the formation, the stronger the attacks of the sinister energy, so it’s best to get out quickly.”

After hearing Shen Kuo’s words, Yue Sheng no longer wanted to waste time and clasped his fists to Su Yi Shui, “Master, disciple is willing to scout ahead for you and take a look at the west gate.”

After speaking, he turned around and hurriedly leaped into the west gate. Gao Cang was so angry that he spat at his back, “He’s really young master who cherishes life. Master has yet to choose, but he’s so eager to escape on his own!”

Previous
Next

熟悉小调 A FAMILIAR TUNE

But Mu Ranwu’s group didn’t make a choice either. Mu Ranwu looked around and then asked her disciples, “Which gate do you think is the best?”

What could those disciples say, they naturally followed their master’s lead. Mu Ranwu smiled and stood still, seeming not in a hurry.

At that moment, the other cultivators, each showing their abilities like the Eight Immortals crossing the sea, also chose their gates to enter the formation. However, people entered the west and east gates,with none going through the gate directly to the north. It was because it emitted a strong black aura, accompanied by occasional roars of monsters, which made it very ominous.

Su Yi Shui turned to Ranran and asked, “If it were you, which one would you choose?”

Ranran blinked and pointed to the large gate directly to the north, “This one!”

Su Yi Shui raised an eyebrow, “Why this one?”

Ranran’s answer was straightforward, “The god of wealth said that if I go north, I’ll find great wealth! It shouldn’t be wrong to listen to him.”

Although the god of wealth had noticed Mu Ranwu coming over at that time and deliberately raised his voice to change the topic, but he had never been wrong in indicating the path to wealth!

Qiu Xier shrugged helplessly, “My junior sister, if we die and was given a coffin and funeral goods, that’s also considered finding great wealth! How can we listen to a merchant’s words for such a important thing like breaking an evil array?”

Unexpectedly, Su Yi Shui nodded after hearing this, pointing to the gate directly to the north, “This path should have fewer people and is more quiet. Let’s take this one…”

The remaining disciples did not expect that their master’s reason was even more rough and hasty, choosing a path simply because it was quieter and less crowded, which made their expressions crumble.

However, they had to follow their master’s decision. So, the remaining disciples followed Su Yi Shui into the gate directly to the north. Mu Ranwu also chose the north gate without hesitation, following behind Su Yi Shui’s group.

She had attendants who could stand up to Su Yi Shui, so she wasn’t afraid of him turning hostile for now.

Compared to the unreliable mainstream sects and the strange talents of the Yiren Hall, Mu Ranwu was more inclined to trust Su Yi Shui and her former sister’s choice.

So, the two groups entered the most dangerous north gate one after the other.

The moment they stepped in, the ground where they had been standing at the center of the formation suddenly collapsed, and flames soared up thousands of feet.

It seemed that Shen Kuo’s words were not false. If they had hesitated for another moment, they would have been trapped in the sea of fire.

After entering the north gate, they found themselves in a sealed barrier, not as terrifying as it seemed from the outside.

It seemed like a dark and damp cave here. There was a faint light ahead, but as everyone approached the light, they involuntarily took a few steps back.

It turned out that directly ahead was a stone-built chessboard, and sitting beside it, playing chess, was a monstrous creature that didn’t look human at all!

Although it had a human face, its body looked more like a giant flea, full of blood…

Ranran vaguely guessed that the master of this boundary they had entered should be the human-faced flea among the Five Fiends.

It was said that this human-faced flea was the first person to use the Seven Evil Transformation Curse. Back then, he was a close friend of Dun Tian, but he fell for Rong Yao, who would become Dun Tian’s wife.

Moreover, after Rong Yao chose Dun Tian, he underwent a drastic change in temperament, turned to the demonic path, and eventually, due to madness, mistakenly used the evil curse and merged with a flea. Since then, he had a half-human, half-insect appearance, became a malevolent fiend, and was used by the Demon King, merged into the Five Fiend formation.

This person was said to be skilled at chess and had developed feelings for Rong Yao through the game. This obsession remained unchanged even after becoming a malevolent fiend. Inside this formation, he managed to conjure up a chessboard for his own amusement.

“This just got interesting, but here come you annoying pests… Well, it’s been a while since I tasted human blood. With you here, I can have a hearty meal…”

As the human-faced flea spoke, he suddenly chuckled wickedly, and at the same time, the atmosphere in the cave changed, thickening the air and making it hard to breathe.

All those who entered the cave had already stored their true qi in their dantian, automatically holding their breath like they were diving into water. However, the thickened air here seemed to consume true qi rapidly. In such a situation, it was difficult to maintain a spiritual shield while holding one’s breath.

Just then, countless large fleas began to attack, and everyone had to swing their swords wildly in response. However, when Gao Cang cut down one flea, the green liquid splattered onto his clothes, burning through them and causing him to scream in pain.

The same happened to the others. The only one not splashed with the liquid was Ranran. When the insect juice sprayed over, Su Yi Shui immediately pulled her into his arms, protecting her securely. The liquid splashed onto his back, Ranran lifted her head and she could tell from his furrowed brows that it must have burned him severely.

Bai Baishan accidentally got bitten by a flea, and his right arm went numb instantly, making it impossible for him to hold his sword.

However, the large fleas kept coming relentlessly, seemingly endless. If this continued, they would all become numb from the flea bites. Killing the fleas would surely result in the splashing of the dreadful liquid.

By then, they wouldn’t need the fleas to eat them; the corrosive liquid alone would dissolve their bodies.

This north gate turned out to be so perilous. Mu Ranwu, hiding behind two attendants who seemed impervious to pain, cursed angrily, “Xue Ranran, look at what you’ve done, choosing such a sinister gate!”

Xue Ranran wanted to roll her eyes at her. She didn’t deceive this Elder Mu to come in, Mu Ranwu eagerly followed but now blamed others.

Ranran knew that they couldn’t go on like this. So she shouted at the human-faced flea, “Your chess skills are just so-so, yet you keeping playing? Even I’m feeling embarrassed for you!”

This angered thousands of large fleas, and their angry buzzing made everyone’s ears numb.

Then, the sound of the fleas suddenly stopped. As the fleas receded like a tide, the human-faced flea lifted his head, waved his claws, and said ominously, “Little brat, how dare you say my chess skills are bad?”

Xue Ranran nodded and pointed at Su Yi Shui, “My Shifu is the real chess master. Would you dare to challenge him?”

The human-faced flea disdainfully glanced at Su Yi Shui and chuckled, “Alright, it’s been a while since I played chess with someone! If you win, I’ll let you leave, but if you lose… I’ll suck all of you dry until only your skins are left!”

Ranran turned to her master, extremely certain, “Shifu, it’s up to you next!”

But Su Yi Shui looked at her strangely and said in a low voice, “When did I ever play chess?”

Now everyone else is getting nervous. Bai Baishan eagerly said, “But Shifu, your chess skills are really quite good. You often set up chess in your study and play alone!”

Su Yi Shui’s expression turned cold. Although he had noticed the chess set in his study, he had no memory of playing chess at all.

Ranran deflated, squatting down. She guessed the reason. Su Yi Shui’s chess skills should have been taught by the past Mu Qingge. Unfortunately, at this critical moment, he had completely forgotten this life-saving skill.

After asking around, except for Xue Ranran, who had studied the chess manuals in her master’s study and played a few games with Su Yi Shui before, no one else knew how to play.

However, Shen Kuo spoke up, “I have some knowledge about it. Why don’t you let me handle it?”

But the large flea disagreed. It jumped high and said with an eerie tone, “Didn’t you say the little pretty boy would play? We can’t change players now!”

Among those who came in, the most handsome man was the one with the cold face. The human-faced flea despised handsome young men the most.

If this man was sucked dry and turned into skin, it would be quite a sight!

Thinking of this, the flea waved its claws and conjured up a huge chessboard, smiling gloomily, “Just playing chess is boring. Let’s use people as pieces to play!”

After saying that, it directed a flea to jump onto the huge chessboard.

At this point, Qiu Xier couldn’t take it anymore and shouted, “How do we play this? You have countless fleas, but we only have a few people. Won’t we run out of pieces soon?”

The human-faced flea barked loudly, making everyone’s eardrums tingle, “I don’t care! Figure it out yourselves! If you don’t even have this ability, how chould you challenge me in chess?”

Su Yi Shui stood beside the chessboard, looking dour like a bad chess player. Ranran channeled, “I didn’t know you forgot how to play chess, Shifu. Shall we bluff through a couple of moves first? I’ll tell you where to move the pieces, but the pieces…”

Inside this cave, there were no available stones to use. So, after some thought, Ranran handed her shoe, which she had changed out of in the morning, to Su Yi Shui.

Who said we must use people? Using objects should work too, right? As long as there are pieces on the chessboard.

However, as soon as the shoe touched the chessboard, it burst into flames and burned to ashes, leaving nothing behind.

The human-faced flea smirked, “This chessboard is condensed from malevolent qi. If someone with insufficient cultivation enters, they will turn to ash. So, what do you say? If you can’t handle it, just admit defeat obediently. I’ll make you all look good, using your skins as bed covers!”

Just then, Gao Cang rushed over, “Shifu, let me do it. Where should I stand?”

After he asked, Su Yi Shui also looked at Ranran, but Ranran didn’t dare to make a rash decision. This chessboard was too sinister. What if senior brother turned to ashes if he went down? Moreover, as third sister said, their numbers were limited. Even if they added Mu Ranwu’s group, they wouldn’t last long. Once there were no pieces left, wouldn’t that be considered a loss?

But for now, they could only delay. Gao Cang had seen Shifu play chess before, so at least he knew the basics of the first three moves.

So he jumped onto the chessboard first, landing on the left side of the flea.

Just then, as if finding it not exciting enough, the human-faced flea added, “I love fast-paced games and hate dragging things out. If each move takes more than five minutes, then the ones who moved earlier will be invaded by malevolent qi and turn into fleas! No regrets after the move! No regrets after the move!”
*半盏茶 is about 5-7min

After saying this, it chuckled wickedly again.

This thing was really not good. It only mentioned this rule after Gao Cang jumped down. Now Gao Cang was dumbfounded. In other words, if Shifu couldn’t win within a few dozen moves and there were no pieces left, everyone who jumped down would turn into something neither human nor ghost!

How short was half a cup of tea’s time! Seeing time running out, Qiu Xier panicked and shouted, “Shifu, hurry, I’ll jump second!”

At this critical moment, the usually timid Qiu Xier actually volunteered to jump second, not wanting her senior brother to become a disgusting bug!

Just then, Su Yi Shui heard Ranran channel, “Left third line, fourth line intersection…”

So Su Yi Shui echoed her words, and after counting, Qiu Xier quickly jumped down. The people around her exclaimed, “Qiu Xier, you jumped to the wrong spot!”

It turned out that in her haste, she counted the lines wrong and ended up jumping next to Gao Cang. This move was as good as not making one at all.

Qiu Xier also felt foolish, tears welling up as she looked at Gao Cang. However, Gao Cang held her hand to comfort her, “You don’t know how to play chess, so making mistakes is normal.”

This made the human-faced flea burst into laughter with delight, “A bunch of useless fools, you’ll all wait to become human skins!”

As it directed another flea to jump into the malevolent qi chessboard, a melodious song suddenly sounded from the side, as Ranran started humming a tune.

This left everyone puzzled. Even Mu Ranwu sneered and taunted, “Xue Ranran, are you also scared silly? Do you think singing can disrupt the human-faced flea’s chess game?”

Ranran seemed not to hear her sarcastic words and continued to sing. Her voice grew louder and louder. Perhaps even Shifu Su Yi Shui had forgotten that this song she was humming, was heard in the secret cave on Tianmai Mountain.

Back then, she had subdued the Vermilion Bird using this melodious and gentle song. According to Shen Kuo, this human-faced flea was once a close friend of the powerful Dun Tian and also loved Rong Yao.

So Ranran had no other plan and decided to use Rong Yao’s song to test the human-faced flea’s reaction.

Just as the human-faced flea was about to make a move, it suddenly looked up, its face twisted with agitation.

If Mu Ranwu hadn’t reminded it with that sarcastic remark just now, it would have almost missed the timing to put down the piece. So after it did, it immediately asked impatiently, “How…. how do you know this song? Shut up! Stop singing!”

Why would Ranran heed it? Its agitated state played right into her hands, so she jumped down as the third pawn piece without warning.

Su Yi Shui had not expected her to jump down without hesitation. When he tried to reach out to pull her up, he was too late.

He slowly clutched his chest with his hand, where he felt his heart lurch just now. What kind of sorcery had this little demoness used on him? Just now, he had felt a sensation as if his chest was about to explode.

But the singing grew louder.

The human-faced flea’s expression was now completely twisted, looking confused and flustered, seemingly trying hard to endure something. It strained to put down another flea.

This time, Su Yi Shui jumped down and landed next to Ranran.

Ranran didn’t expect him to jump down with her. He was the one playing chess, there was no reason for him to place himself on the chessboard and act as a piece?

But Su Yishui channeled to her, “Focus, and don’t stop singing!”

Ranran quickly steadied her mind and continued to sing. However, she couldn’t help but reach out to hold the large hand beside her.

She didn’t know if they could break out of this deadly chess formation, but before dying, she must hold onto his hand tightly…

The large hand she held hesitated for a moment before slowly tightening around hers. Ranran focused her mind and continued to sing calmly.

Just as the human-faced flea irritably placed another piece, Bai Baishan nudged Shen Kuo, who was staring blankly, “I’ve been off the mountain for months, and my cultivation isn’t as good as yours. I will probably not be able to counter the malevolent qi on the chessboard, so you go next!”

There’s an order to follow, to respect seniority, where the disciples should go first, then the uncle masters to follow. When there’s no one left, they’ll leave it to fate.

But Bai Baishan currently had the lowest cultivation and couldn’t even match Qiu Xier, so he let Shen Kuo jump first.

After a moment of hesitation, Shen Kuo followed the senior brother’s order and jumped down.

Ranran’s singing never stopped. At first, the large flea frowned and tried to concentrate on the game.

But that girl’s singing voice is really so alike Rong Yao’s! Even the tremolo at the end of the notes is exactly the same. In a daze, when he looked over at the girl, he seemed to see Rong Yao from years ago, in a pink dress, with a charming smile…

But it’s hateful that Dun Tian was solely focused on seeking enlightenment, leading to her soul scattering. If she had chosen him back then, even if he turned into a devil or a demon, he would never allow anyone to harm her in the slightest!

Overwhelmed with rage, and seeing that girl’s hand intertwined with the man beside her, he seemed to be transported back to the painful moment when he had lost his beloved.

At that time, she had left holding Dun Tian’s hand without looking back… When he placed his next piece, he was too slow, and exceeded the stipulated time.

In an instant, all the fleas on the large chessboard screamed and turned into ashes.

By this point, most of the people from Xishan had stepped onto the chessboard. Even Bai Baishan, whose cultivation was insufficient, had jumped onto the board, meaning they were almost out of pieces and nearly had to admit defeat and face death.

But now, the human-faced flea had violated its own rules. So they automatically won the game, and the malevolent qi inside the evil formation gradually dissipated. The large chessboard also vanished into nothingness, and the oppressive and solidified air also dissipated.

Just as the formation was about to break open, the human-faced flea suddenly leaped in front of Ranran and, in a daze, stared at her, asking, “Who are you exactly? How do you know how to sing Rong Yao’s song? Could it be… you’re her?”

He wanted to ask more, but the malevolent qi had dissipated, and his form couldn’t be sustained for long. When the exit of the formation opened, the demonic fleas inside had disappeared without a trace, leaving only the faint cries of the creature in agony, “Rong Yao, why did you choose him and not me…”

As they stepped back onto the slightly warm ground, the Five Fiends Formation was behind them.

After catching her breath, Ranran felt a bit melancholic. The despair in the creature’s slightly crazed eyes made one’s heart ache. If there were other ways, she didn’t want to sing the song of his beloved, stirring up his painful memories.

The word “love”, can truly lead one to descend into darkness. She couldn’t help but look towards Su Yi Shui. What would happen between them in the future? She felt rather lost in her heart. Its better if he couldn’t remember her, this way, maybe he could calmly accept it when her vitality qi ran out, instead of sacrificing half his life for her like before?

As she thought about it, Ranran’s heart was filled with a hint of sorrow. Yet, at this moment, she realized she had been holding Su Yi Shui’s large hand all along…

Of course, Qiu Xier also held Gao Cang’s hand tightly as they exited the formation.

But because of this, made things even more awkward. As Qiu Xier quickly let go of her senior brother’s hand, she glanced at Ranran and the hand she was holding with Shifu.

What was going on? Did Shifu get possessed by the Spirit Spring again? Why was he holding onto junior sister like that?

Ranran also wanted to let go, but Su Yi Shui seemed to have no intention of letting go. Instead, he pulled her over and sternly said, “Don’t act on your own next time. Why did you jump down without saying a word? Don’t you know the chessboard is condensed with malevolent qi, extremely dangerous? How are you, do you feel uncomfortable?”

Before Ranran could answer, Qiu Xier muttered from the side, “Shifu, Senior brother jumped first just now, shouldn’t you… show some concern for senior brother first?”

Gao Cang, completely clueless about the ambiguous situation between Master and junior sister, patted his chest and said to Su Yi Shui, “For Master, I would go through fire and water without hesitation. Don’t worry, I’m tough!”

With these two clowns running their gag, Su Yi Shui finally let go of Ranran’s hand slowly, but his eyes were still coldly fixed on the girl who acted on her own.

Ranran had no choice, while the seniors discussed the situation of others inside the formation, she said in a small voice, “Alright, I was wrong, I’ll listen to Shifu’s arrangements next time… But junior brother Yue Sheng hasn’t come out of the West Gate yet, I don’t know how he’s doing…”

Just then, Mu Ranwu also emerged from the formation.

The method Ranran used to break the formation just now was also confusing to her. How could Ranran break the formation so easily just by singing a song?

In her previous life, every time she practiced meditation, she was always left far behind by her sister. Master favored her sister, and if her sister comprehended something, he wouldn’t explain further and just let her teach herself after.

Now, seeing Xue Ranran break the formation so effortlessly, that sense of frustration of not being able to catch up with her once again surfaced.

Back then, she had used the Fate Transfer ancient jade she had obtained by chance and died together with her sister. At the moment when she stuffed the ancient jade engraved with their two names into her sister’s hand, she clearly saw her sister’s surprised look at the ancient jade, and then she smiled serenely and held it tightly.

Mu Qingge had known what that was, but she was nonchalant, not caring at all.

Mu Ranwu recalled the information she had sent people to inquire about in Juefeng Village, saying that when Xue Ranran was born, she had patterns resembling “Ran” on her hand, so the carpenter couple named her “Ranran.” Now, thinking back, those birthmarks was from the “Ran” character branded from her name on the ancient jade.

That was the clear evidence that she had deliberately stolen her sister’s destiny and cultivation.

But this reincarnated girl still lived so leisurely, completely unconcerned that her innate talents and cultivation had been stolen completely, while effortlessly captivating and gaining the affection of those around her.

This kind of *carefree and free spirited attitude, made the thief Mu Ranwu feel not an ounce of joy but rather a sense of inexplicable inferiority and frustration.
*千金散尽还复来 from poem 李白《将进酒》放荡不羁，纵情享乐的豪放品质

Because Mu Ranwu finally realized that whether the elegant figure before her was Mu Qingge or Xue Ranran, she was beyond her reach, someone she could never catch up to…

Previous
Next

揭露真相 REVEALING THE TRUTH

In the afterglow of the setting sun, Mu Ranwu looked at the smiling pretty girl who stood beside the tall and handsome Su Yi Shui, and a familiar mix of envy and hatred, the desire to replace her once again surging within her.

In this life, where exactly did she fall short compared to Xue Ranran! Why did even fools like Wang Suizhi and Qin Xuanjiu, who had been captivated by her, all abandoned her one after the other?

And Xue Ranran was calm and relaxed as she reclaimed everything that had belonged to her!

Thinking of this, Mu Ranwu’s nails once again dug deep into her palms…

Meanwhile, within the Five Fiends Formation, the wails and screams of despair continued. Because of their different choices, their encounters were also different.

Yue Sheng counted on his considerable cultivation and a bit of cleverness. He went alone with the people from the Yiren Hall into the West Gate. In hindsight, his odds did not seem good…

Just then, the Feiyun Sect and two elders from the Kongshan sect stumbled out from the East Gate. However, they seemed poisoned, their faces had turned purple-blue.

Seeing this, the disciples from Xishan dared not assist directly by holding them, only hurriedly handing over gourds filled with detoxifying pills and water bags.

After the elders have taken the detoxifying pills and spat out black blood in meditation, they regained their composure enough to explain what had happened. They had entered the Mosquito Mirage Formation. The mosquitoes’ stingers were filled with potent venom, and they also suffered a depletion of their cultivation, barely managing to escape.

As for the other formation gates where no one had come out yet, including the renowned Jiuhua Sect, it seemed like they were completely annihilated, with not a single person emerging.

The once prestigious Jiuhua Sect, as the foremost of the Three Great Sects, was now on an unstoppable decline…

At this moment, there was movement at the West Gate as well. A person staggered and fell out.

It was Old Feng, blood streaming from his eyes, seemingly blinded. He crawled and rolled on the ground, wailing in agony. Also stumbling out was Yue Sheng, his right arm severed, likely never to wield a sword with his exquisite skill again.

It turned out they had entered the Mirage Shadow Formation. When Old Feng initially used his Yin-Yang Eyes to inspect, he saw no terrifying creatures inside, so he chose that location.

His eyesight was accurate. Indeed, there were no demonic entities like in the other four formations.

However, what he had never anticipated was that the most terrifying aspect of this formation was the people who entered it.

Upon entering, the formation’s qi would enhance everyone’s potential to the maximum while also amplifying their greed. As they turned against each other, they could absorb each other’s abilities and qi. If they could slaughter everyone inside, the cultivation gained in half a day within the formation could rival that of many experts’ lifetimes.

Old Feng’s pride, his Yin-Yang Eyes, became the coveted ability of everyone inside.

In short, the Mirage Shadow Formation was adept at confusing the mind, inciting those inside to kill each other. When they lost what was most precious to them, they could leave the formation.

Old Feng lost his eyesight from Yue Sheng’s attack, and Yue Sheng was disfigured and lost his right arm due to Old Feng.

But when they came out, the cultivation and qi they had gained inside the formation dissipated like a deflating balloon, leaving them with nothing.

These two men suddenly awoke as if from a dream, unable to comprehend why they had lost their sanity inside the formation and crazily turned against each other. In the end, it was all for naught, like water poured into a bamboo basket, a fruitless endeavor.

Watching her disfigured and disabled junior brother rolling on the ground in pain and tears, Ranran hurriedly joined others in bandaging him.

However, she couldn’t muster any sympathy for this junior. If he hadn’t been so foolish as to rush into the West Gate, he wouldn’t have ended up like this.

Yue Sheng was now clearly unable to continue on their journey. So, Shen Kuo who had a close relationship with him, spoke up, volunteering to stay behind on the mountain to take care of his junior brother until their master returned.

With this arrangement, the only ones to remain uninjured to reach the main gate of Crimson Gate, were the group from Xishan, Mu Ranwu’s group, along with a few recovered elders from Kongshan and Feiyun.

Tu Jiuyuan had already been standing at the entrance to “welcome” the guests who had come from afar.

Wei Jiu had kept his promise; anyone who passed through the Evil Formation would be warmly welcomed.

As they entered Crimson Gate, drinks and food were already laid out in the main hall. Wei Jiu, clad in a lavish black robe, sat at the high seat to greet the Xishan group.

When he had set up the Five Fiends Formation earlier, he sat atop Red Flame Mountain, watching the tumultuous formations below with a leisurely swish of his wine cup, biding his time.

The fact that the people from Xishan chose the seemingly most dangerous north gate greatly surprised Wei Jiu. Anyone with a bit of sense could see the peril of the north gate. Unfortunately, Xue Ranran had foolishly followed Su Yi Shui into danger, and Wei Jiu wondered if they would safely make it out.

Thinking of the letter the brat had sent him with just one “get lost” written in it, Wei Jiu seethed with anger every time he recalled it.

The girl had rejected him repeatedly, not knowing her place. It served her right to suffer a bit! Otherwise, she wouldn’t know how lenient he had been with her.

Although Wei jiu felt his hatred slaked when he thought that Xue Ranran could die gruesomely in the formation, seeing them emerge alive still made him breathe a sigh of relief for her.

Even though she did not have him in her heart, if she had died in the formation, it would have been still somewhat regrettable for Wei Jiu. If she were to die… she should die by his hand!

Wei Jiu didn’t realize at all how twisted his thoughts had become, just chuckling darkly as he eyed Xue Ranran who seemed to have become even more beautiful .

Ranran hadn’t expected *a grand feast after the harrowing Five Fiends Formation. She wondered about the meaning behind Wei Jiu’s hospitality.
*鸿门宴 不怀好意、居心不良的邀宴，比喻想要加害客人的宴会

Wei Jiu lazily said, “We had some unpleasantness with Xishan due to the Spirit Spring incident before. However, with the influx of Netherworld creatures and chaos in the world, my Crimson Gate sect naturally can’t stay out of it. While the rumors of the Tempering Flame being on Red Flame Mountain are rife, I’ve never seen it for myself. The Five Fiends Formation earlier was also a test of your strength; otherwise, if anyone and everyone could enter my gates, wouldn’t that be too chaotic?”

The elders of Feiyun Sect had mostly purged the mosquito poison completely by now. Hearing Wei Jiu’s words and remembering their disciples lost in the formation, they gritted their teeth in anger and asked in a hard voice, “So, does Excellency Wei mean that you agree to let us take the Tempering Flame?”

Wei Jiu’s face, usually soft and gentle, now bore a sly smile. “I agree, but the premise is that after finding the Tempering Flame, you must have the ability to take it away!”

He had hidden meanings in his words, leisurely assessing everyone present but showing clear intentions of a temporary ceasefire.

The people who arrived here originally thought they would have to do another fierce battle with the Crimson Gate people, but they didn’t expect Wei Jiu to be so accommodating. For a moment, they were somewhat skeptical, unsure of what schemes this demonic leader had in mind.

However, Wei Jiu courteously arranged rooms for them and allowed them to search for the Tempering Flame on the hottest back mountain of Red Flame Mountain the following day.

But the people going up the mountain clearly didn’t want to stay at the main hall of Crimson Gate. Instead, they directly went to camp at the back mountain. Although it was hotter there, without the shelter of the courtyard walls, they could watch out for each other for any ambushes from the Crimson Gate people with a few people in formation.

After these guests have dispersed, Tu Jiuyuan quietly asked, “Your Excellency, are you really letting them search everywhere on Red Flame Mountain? The Netherworld creatures causing chaos in the world have nothing to do with us?”

Wei Jiu snorted coldly, “Elder Tu, what do you think about the temperature on the mountain this year?”

Tu Jiuyuan thought for a moment and replied, “Compared to the year before, it seems much hotter…”

Wei Jiu narrowed his eyes, “Although my Crimson Gate belongs to fire, my disciples are not barbecued meat. If Red Flame Mountain continues to rise in temperature like this, my Crimson Gate will have to abandon its century-old foundation and rare martial sanctum. If I’m not mistaken, it must be the Tempering Flame causing the continuous rise in temperature on Red Flame Mountain. So, it’s best if they can help me find this thing. When the time comes, I’ll take it for myself, and the world will have to rely on us, Crimson Gate, for peace…”

Tu Jiuyuan understood Wei Jiu’s hidden agenda of the praying mantis catching cicadas, with the oriole lurking behind.

And the Five Fiends Formation he set up was also to sift out usable talents while also weakening the strength of the righteous path. Even if they found the Tempering Flame, they would be outnumbered and unable to prevent Crimson Gate from taking advantage.

By that time, Crimson Gate could reap the benefits.

However, it greatly surprised Tu Jiuyuan that the West Mountain faction only had one disciple who got injured and the others managed to ascend the mountain unscathed.

Thinking of Xue Ranran, Tu Jiuyuan touched the wound that had not yet healed in her chest, feeling a complex mix of emotions.

She was an orphan, adopted by Crimson Gate since childhood, with her hands already stained with countless kills. In spite of her ruthless nature, she never liked owing anything to anyone, especially not favors or debts of gratitude.

Back in the Netherworld, if it wasn’t for Xue Ranran’s help, she would have died there, never to be reincarnated.

This debt of gratitude had to be repaid at some point. Thinking of this, Tu Jiuyuan left the hall, called a servant, and ordered them to prepare more ice water to be sent to the West Mountain group on the back mountain. It would seem too out of the ordinary if she only gave it to Xue Ranran, possibly arousing unnecessary suspicion from Wei Jiu, so Tu Jiuyuan decided to extend her hospitality to all, sending everyone ice water to cool down with.

Tu Jiuyuan sighed. Red Flame Mountain was indeed too hot, and that delicate-looking girl must be finding the scorching heat unbearable right now…

Xue Ranran was indeed feeling very hot, envying her fellow disciples who could go shirtless.

By the time they reached the back mountain, she had already removed her outer robe, leaving only a thin shirt. Even so, she earnestly considered if she was able to remove another layer.

However, after a while, she felt a refreshing chill. Turning her head, she saw that Su Yi Shui had sat next to her at some point and had quite naturally created a spiritual shield with his true qi, keeping the waves of scorching heat outside.

He still wore his long robes and crown, looking neat and composed, not a single bead of sweat on his forehead.

Ranran didn’t dare to casually use her true qi now, certainly not to indulge in such extravagance. She wiped the sweat from her forehead and smiled gratefully at her master.

Seeing the glistening sweat on Ranran’s fair skin, her thin shirt soaked through, accentuating her slender figure, Su Yi Shui suddenly felt flustered.

Feeling the temperature inside the spiritual shield rise, making her sweat slightly again, she couldn’t help but say, “Shifu, you should retract the shield. The temperature inside is not much different from the outside…”

Reminded by Ranran, Su Yi Shui reluctantly moved his gaze away from her sweaty face and focused on channeling his true qi again, and so the temperature inside the shield suddenly dropped significantly again.

Before long, several buckets of ice water with ice were delivered by Crimson Gate’s servants.

Wei Jiu was one who knew how to enjoy life. He used a spiritual shield to create an ice cave, so even if Red Flame Mountain was scorching hot, there was still cold water to drink.

Qiu Xier didn’t know that this was Tu Jiuyuan repaying Xue Ranran’s life-saving favor and specially ordered the ice water. She thought it was Wei Jiu being attentive to Xue Ranran once again.

Back then, Wei Jiu had sent so many things to West Mountain! So Qiu Xier stared blankly at Xue Ranran and asked, “I thought Wei Jiu had given up on you. Why is he sending ice water to bother you again? You shouldn’t drink the water he sent!”

Su Yi Shui turned his head slightly and asked Xue Ranran, “That Wei Jiu pestered you?”

Ranran thought about it and felt that Wei Jiu wasn’t really pestering her. That Demon Lord cared about his dignity a lot; after bumping into walls too many times, he wouldn’t deliberately seek to be snubbed again.

So she asked the servant who brought the water who had ordered it.

The servant replied, “Elder Tu said that all guests are treated equally, so we prepared some ice water to cool you down.”

Sure enough, soon after, the disciples from Kongshan and Feiyun, as well as Mu Ranwu’s group, all received ice water, treating everyone equally.

Ranran didn’t ask any further. However, she couldn’t help but think of Tu Jiuyuan.

When Ranran was about to leave the main hall, she murmured that having ice water would be nice, and Tu Jiuyuan had glanced at her then… If that was the case, Tu Jiuyuan was also a person of character…

After Su Yishui finished asking his question and waited for a while, but did not get a response from Ranran, he noticed that she had started daydreaming, with a faint smile on her lips.

Could it be that Wei Jiu’s small attentions and consideration had moved the young girl’s heart and made her think of him so easily?

Thinking of Mu Ranwu in the past life, who had also seemed easily seduced, Su Yi Shui’s heart sank, an unfamiliar sour feeling rising gradually in him.

He suddenly remembered that Ranran had mentioned she had someone in her heart, and it was a narrow-minded man with a bad character.

Back then, Su Yi Shui was still thinking, could there really be such an annoying man in the world?

But now, he had an epiphany. Could it be… that the man this girl said that everyone thought was bad… is the demonic cultivator Wei Jiu?

At this moment, he wasn’t thinking about whether Ranran would betray them on the battlefield but rather felt a stifling sensation rising within him. No matter how he suppressed it, it couldn’t be suppressed—after all, she was also his disciple in this life. How could she be so naive and inexperienced? Just anyone could enchant her so completely!

“…That Wei Jiu might be rather good-looking, but he lacks the demeanor of a man. You’ve not seen too many men, don’t be deceived by mere sweet words.”

Thinking of this, Su Yi Shui who rarely put on the airs of a master, now lectured his disciple in a stern manner.

Ranran didn’t understand why Wei Jiu was suddenly mentioned. She didn’t dare to drink the iced water, she just moved it closer to fan herself and cool down. But she couldn’t agree with her Shifu’s sudden comment. She didn’t think she had seen too few men, so she replied in a small voice, “Who said I’ve seen few men? At least you look more handsome than Wei Jiu…”

Su Yi Shui usually hated it when others commented on his appearance, but when this young girl earnestly said with widened eyes, that he looked more handsome than Wei Jiu, he suddenly felt very pleased.

So the temperature inside the spiritual shield turned icy cold again, and there was no need for that bucket of iced water!

The next day, before the sun had risen, the temperature on Red Flame Mountain had dropped slightly, and everyone discussed taking advantage of this to search for the Tempering Flame.

Great battles by Dun Tian had raged here before, and the rugged rocks bore traces of the fierce fights from that time.

For example, the only river valley on Red Flame Mountain seemed to have been created by a massive spiritual force.

As everyone began their search, Wei Jiu also appeared. He stood at the edge of a cliff, silently watching the expressionless guards around Mu Ranwu for a while before suddenly speaking, “She’s even gotten involved with the Fan Tian Sect. Dim-witted yet wants to play with eagles… not afraid of being pecked in the eyes by the eagles, interesting!”

At that moment, he saw Xue Ranran standing beside Su Yi Shui. Xue Ranran seemed to be saying something, but the man beside her remained unsmiling, and it seemed that she was being given the cold shoulder.

Seeing Ranran feeling ill at ease, Wei Jiu, after so many days, finally felt a rare sense of satisfaction. So, it was not in vain that he had cooperated with the Fan Tian Sect back then, exchanging the ancient text for Elder Jiu.

The Soul-Cleansing Talisman was truly marvelous!

Wei Jiu decided to add fuel to the fire and make Xue Ranran’s days in Xishan more unbearable. So he instructed an attendant to hold a large umbrella and he gracefully descended from the cliff, standing in front of Su Yi Shui with a smiling expression.

“Why, are you still letting this girl stay by your side? I seem to remember you hated her so much in her past life?”

Xue Ranran suddenly raised her head, immediately understanding what Wei Jiu was getting at.

Just now, she just had a fight with Shifu. She had clearly urged him not to replenish true qi for her again. But last night, while she was asleep, Su Yi Shui had still transferred a considerable amount of true qi to her.

After this morning’s meditation, when he, who had always been strong and vigorous, got up, his legs unexpectedly gave out, causing Ranran’s heart to ache when she saw this.

So she had just solemnly “warned” her Shifu that if he transferred qi again, she wouldn’t hesitate to leave without a word, seeking a corner to die alone.

Su Yi Shui’s face also turned cold as he said sullenly, “Xue Ranran, you’ve grown quite audacious, daring to threaten me? You have the aura of my golden core on you; even if you hide in a dung heap, I can still drag you out!”

So the master and disciple coldly ignored each other, and did not speak to each other.

Just then, Wei Jiu, dressed in black robes like a crow, suddenly descended from the sky, chattering endlessly.

Before he could speak any further, Ranran had already rushed in front of Su Yi Shui, and said warily, “Lord Wei, please step aside. Your presence here is making my compass unstable.”

Wei Jiu naturally understood that she wanted to silence him. The feeling of finally having the little girl in his control was too enjoyable!

He then lowered his voice deliberately and raised his eyebrows, saying, “What? Is it your compass that’s unstable, or is it your heart that’s too scared to move? Oh right, you still don’t know how much your master hated Mu Qingge back then! He really wished for an arrow to pierce her heart… Ah, damn it… Su, you actually sneak attacked!”

Wei Jiu didn’t know that his deliberate intimidation of Xue Ranran, as seen by the person who was under the soul-cleansing talisman effect, had appeared like a ruffian harassing a beautiful respectable lady.

Wei Jiu was actually so arrogant, that he would shamelessly tease his disciple right in front of him.

Su Yi Shui had never taken Wei Jiu seriously, so he raised his hand and launched a thunderous attack at Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu was a bit arrogant on his own turf, and they had just agreed to a truce yesterday. He didn’t expect Su Yi Shui to turn hostile so quickly and he narrowly missed being struck by the lightning.

“Stay away from my disciple, or don’t blame me for being rude!” After retracting the thunderbolt attack, Su Yi Shui warned him lightly.

Ranran saw the twisted smile of anger on Wei Jiu’s face and thought to herself, “This is bad, it looks like this lunatic won’t keep his mouth shut now…”

Sure enough, Wei Jiu sneered and decided to stir up a big hornet’s nest for the master and disciple from Xishan, saying, “What disciple? Have you been brainwashed by the Soul-Cleansing Talisman? She’s undoubtedly your Master! Haven’t you discovered, that Xue Ranran is actually the reincarnation of Mu Qingge?!”

His words were like a thunderbolt, causing everyone present to look at him in astonishment.

At first, Mu Ranwu was a bit confused about what was happening, but when Wei Jiu mentioned the “Soul-Cleansing Talisman,” she suddenly realized what he was up to.

So Su Yi Shui had been ambushed by Wei Jiu, who erased his memories of affection for her sister… Of course she knew how much Su Yi Shui used to hate her sister. If Su Yi Shui had returned to his former self, it would be quite… interesting!

So, even though Wei Jiu had just revealed the secret that Mu Ranwu had been desperately hiding, Mu Ranwu was feeling extremely ecstatic. The people she had brought were all from the Fan Tian Sect, with none of those foolish loyal disciples, so it didn’t matter if she admitted to this.

When she saw that Su Yi Shui seemed to not believe Wei Jiu’s words, she calmly said, “Big sister, why haven’t you told Yi Shui the truth? You’re the reincarnation of Mu Qingge, but in order to stay by Su Yi Shui’s side, you exchanged identities with me and pretended to be an inexperienced young girl… Your obsessive dedication is truly admirable, even to me, your sister!”

Ranran knew that Mu Ranwu was talking nonsense, but her choice of words was deliberately aimed at provoking Su Yi Shui’s raw nerves .

Su Yi Shui had always hated Mu Qingge’s *persistent pursuit of him in the past, when she forced him to become her disciple and also teased him from time to time.
*死缠烂打 persistent pursuit/harassment

If Su Yi Shui misunderstood and thought that Ranran was pretending to be Mu Ranwu to continue pursuing him… then given Su Yi Shui’s current ferocious nature, he would definitely tear her apart and dip her in sauce…

But now was not the time to desperately shout, “Please listen to my explanation” so Ranran decided not to waste time on useless things. She simply and clearly channeled a message to Su Yi Shui, whose eyes were gradually turning red as he stared at her, “There are urgent matters at hand. It doesn’t matter who I am. Right now, we need to find the Tempering Flame and Elder Jiu. Once you regain your memories, I will leave it to your discretion on how to deal with me…”

Su Yi Shui was actually waiting for this girl to explain herself. As long as she was willing to give an explanation, no matter how absurd her words were, he was willing to believe her for now.

But he didn’t expect that this girl would readily agree with Wei Jiu’s nonsense. She said she would leave it to his discretion? This was indirectly admitting that she… was the reincarnation of Mu Qingge!

Just the thought that he had actually fallen for this female demoness, even without the possession of the Spirit Spring, was enough to make the eyes of the once demon’s son turn red.

Previous
Next

谈谈生意 MAKING A DEAL

Ranran looked at his chilling gaze, feeling an indescribable bitter taste in her heart. He had forgotten everything, and now he was staring at her as if she were his enemy. He was probably about to break her neck in the next moment?

It’s just as well. She now needed more and more true qi to be replenished, and if Su Yi Shui continued to transfer vitality qi to herself, he would eventually become as emaciated as those boys adopted by Mu Ranwu.

Thinking of this, Ranran didn’t even want to evade. She just closed her eyes calmly, as if ready to be slaughtered.

On the other hand, Wei Jiu was ready to act. He was waiting for Su Yi Shui to show murderous intent, so he could rush forward and play the hero to save the beauty.

Although it was Wei Jiu who incited this disciple-master conflict, as long as Xue Ranran wasn’t foolish, she would naturally see who was the one who would protect her at crucial moments.

That Su Yi Shui was just an untamable white-eyed wolf! He just couldn’t remember some memories and he was ready to kill Xue Ranran, how genuine could such love be? It’s chilling just to think about it.

Mu Ranwu also smiled coldly and waited to watch the drama of the disciple who kills his master in two lifetimes unfold.

Wei Jiu really did have some tricks up his sleeve. He actually manipulated Elder Jiu to do such things. If her sister died at the hands of Su Yi Shui, that would be the best outcome.

She looked at Xue Ranran with a complicated expression, thinking to herself, “Sister, you can’t blame me for this. If anyone’s to blame, it’s yourself for loving the wrong person…”

On the side, Yutong and Yuchen had faces full of shock.

When Yuchen came to his senses, he immediately glared at Ranran and said, “You witch, what did you intend to do to the master?”

Bai Baishan and Gao Cang hurriedly restrained the agitated Senior Uncle master, and Qiu Xier also blocked and said, “What can she do? Of course, it’s doing meal preparations. Isn’t it always you, Senior Uncle master, who eats the most?”

Hearing this, Yu Chen’s glaring eyes narrowed slightly, feeling a bit speechless for a moment, after all, *since he had always enjoyed her food, he really had no place to criticize her too harshly .
*拿人的手短，吃人的嘴短
拿了别人的好处，就会刻意礼让三分，即使人家有缺点或者错误也就不敢说、不敢管了

But after hearing Wei Jiu’s words, Yu Tong suddenly figured everything out.

Why did the Master, who had been depressed for more than twenty years after Mu Qingge’s death, seemed to come alive again after taking in Ranran…

It turned out that Master had been waiting for Mu Qingge to be reborn all along. In his heart…

Thinking of this, Yu Tong disregarded her previous prejudices against Mu Qingge and hurriedly stepped forward to block Su Yi Shui and said anxiously, “Master, you mustn’t! This Ranran, you… you dote on her the most!”

At this moment, Mu Ranwu began to add firewood to the fire, saying calmly, “Yes, if sister schemes carefully, being humble and pleasing to others, that’s what people like the most. Back then, my master also cared for her like Su Yi Shui does now! When my sister was the master, she was respected by Su Yi Shui, and now that she’s the disciple, she still receives his affection. It’s truly enviable!”

What looked like words of envy were actually goading him to action.

Unfortunately, it would have been better if she had kept quiet. Just as she finished speaking, Su Yi Shui’s cold and stern gaze shot straight towards her.

Mu Ranwu was very afraid of him right now, so when she felt his gaze, she involuntarily stepped back several steps.

Su Yi Shui withdrew his gaze and looked down at the tightly closed eyes of the young girl before him. Her closed eyes seemed quite peaceful, with calm acceptance, like she was seeking death… If she really was Mu Qingge… how could he let her die so easily?

For a moment, Su Yi Shui weighed the pros and cons and suppressed the rage in his heart.

That woman by the side adding fuel to the fire, had no good intentions. Even if he was enraged, Su Yi Shui was not about to do something stupid.

Since she had chosen to be under Xishan in this life, to be his disciple, it was his own business how he disciplined her behind closed doors. He didn’t need people nearby to gloat over the spectacle.

After his anger churned within for a while, he took a deep breath and forcibly suppressed it. After a moment of silence, he then spoke coldly, “What are you all standing around for? Hurry up and use the compass to search!”

Wei Jiu had exposed Xue Ranran’s disguise with the intention of breaking the relationship between this master and disciple of two lifetimes. If Su Yi Shui injured Mu Qingge and put an end to their affection, he really wouldn’t mind undoing the talisman for Su Yi Shui. Then, Su Yi Shui would surely regret it, which would be quite a sight!

But he never expected that after the earth-shattering revelation, Su Yi Shui’s expression only changed a few times and then he acted as if he wanted to keep the peace.

After this bombshell dropped, all the splash landed solely on Wei Jiu’s face, like he was the only one who cared!

So he was somewhat incredulous and asked Su Yi Shui with a long face, “What’s this? Did you know all along?”

Had Su Yi Shui already discovered Xue Ranran’s true identity long ago, so he treated it so casually and unconcernedly?

He wanted to say more, but Ranran swept past him with a flick of her sleeve, saying, “Get out of the way, a good dog doesn’t block the road!” Then, with her small face, she coldly took the compass and walked forward on her own.

Wei Jiu was almost amused, Xue Ranran, you dare to call me a dog? Just wait and see if I will let you leave Red Flame Mountain alive!

Right now, he still needed to use these people. Since his instigation failed, he snorted coldly and flew back onto the cliff, continuing to leisurely drink his iced wine.

However, the younger generation of West Mountain lacked the will power of their master and had *completely erupted in an uproar.
*炸锅 突然发生吵闹

After sorting out the relationships (chart lol), Qiu Xier slowly sidled up to Ranran and whispered, “Ranran, should I call you junior sister or grandmaster?”

Ranran sighed, “Ancestor, don’t cause trouble. Hurry up and search. The temperature will rise soon, and we won’t be able to bear it…”

The back mountains of Red Flame Mountain was where the Dun tian once refined the Demon King. As long as the Demon King’s bones didn’t dissolve, his spirit wouldn’t die. Therefore, the true fire capable of refining his true form must be hidden here.

So, this place had the highest temperature in Red Flame Mountain.

Ranran carried Su Yi Shui’s and her own water pouch with her, so she took one and handed it to the silent man beside her, “It’s hot, drink some water to quench your thirst first…”

But when she reached out, he didn’t even look at her, let alone reach out to take it.

Ranran resignedly took back the water pouch, deciding not to talk to Su Yi Shui for the time being.

She didn’t think she had done anything wrong. In the first place, her reincarnation was all his doing. Now that he had forgotten everything, there was no reason for her to blame herself.

Thinking like this, Ranran calmed down and looked at the compass in her hand, wanting to find the Tempering Flame as soon as possible.

So she put away the water pouch and stayed away from Su Yi Shui.

But when Ranran withdrew the water pouch this way, Su Yi Shui felt even more disgruntled—no matter how cold he had been before, this little disciple had always stuck close around him, being loyal and filial.

Now that the truth has come out, she couldn’t be bothered to pretend anymore and even avoided him as she walked…

Thinking of this, he coldly said, “Where’s the water? Bring it here then!”

Ranran quickly glanced at him and passed him the water pouch, but when she reached out, he didn’t take it, totally showing a fault-finding expression.

Suddenly, Su Yi Shui reached out to grab her, and took her away from the others with one flying leap. After passing several bare hills, they arrived at a mountain hollow.

He held her chin and pressed her against a bare rock wall, gritting his teeth, “You’ve been deceiving me for so long, Mu Qingge, you are really so capable!”

Seeing his outburst, Ranran actually felt a sense of relief. She just knew that this petty ferocious beast would not react lightly after learning the truth, how could he have been indifferent to it?
