But seeing him accusing her, Ranran also felt angry. She forcefully pushed away his hand, “Who wanted to deceive you! If you undid the soul-cleansing talisman, you’ll know, you were the one who was aware of everything from the beginning. As for me, I was clearly your mentor before, but you took me in as your disciple, isn’t that messing up the order of things? When I found out who I was, I wasn’t as mad as you are now!”

Su Yi Shui’s was so angry his mouth twisted in a warped smile, “I would voluntarily take you in? You must have used some trickery, otherwise, how could I keep you by my side?”

Feeling resigned, Ranran didn’t want to argue with a stubborn person. She could only say, “Fine, fine, fine, I pretended to be pitiful and deceived you, begging to be accepted as your disciple. After this is over, you can kick me out of West Mountain as you wish. We’ll sever our master-disciple relationship.”

Hearing Ranran say this, Su Yi Shui didn’t even think, but intuitively blurted out, “You dare!”

Ranran felt rather helpless with his reaction. She forcefully squeezed the water pouch in her hand, taking a few big gulps, “Why wouldn’t I dare? You’ve forgotten our past and only remember my faults. Just what did I do to you in the past? Didn’t I raise you beautifully, providing you with food and clothing? As for the matters between us in this lifetime, it’s me alone who remembers and it’s quite vexing. When we meet Elder Jiu, there’s no need to wait for him to undo the talisman on you. I’ll ask him for another soul-cleansing talisman, to erase my memories about you. Then, you’ll be a stranger, and I won’t feel sad no matter how you treat me!”

As she said this, the rims of Ranran’s eyes were red with tears, yet her expression was stubborn, making it impossible for people to… not feel heartache.

At first, Su Yi Shui was still fine, but when he heard her say, that she wanted to completely erase him from her memory, his heart felt like it was being squeezed fiercely again, making it painfully hard to breathe.

The after-effects of spending last night transferring vitality qi also surged up at this moment. Although Su Yi Shui looked fierce, his legs gave out again and he collapsed on Ranran.

He really never expected, that his demonic master in her past life didn’t torment him to death, but now this reincarnated demonic master was about to cause him to die from anger.

Ranran also didn’t expect that the tall man would just collapse so suddenly. She was so frightened that she hurriedly helped him up, while being afraid that Wei Jiu and the others might take advantage of the situation. She could only say in a small voice, “Shifu, Shifu, what’s the matter with you?”

Su Yi Shui simply hadn’t managed to sustain the flow of his vitality qi. After drinking the water Ranran fed him, he felt much better. He pushed away Ranran’s soft hands trying to wipe the corners of his mouth, “Don’t call me Shifu!”

Ranran paused for a moment and said in a small voice, “But I can’t call you Shui’er either, so… how about calling you Mister Su in the future?”

“Mister Su” sounded proper, but this word inexplicably reminded Su Yi Shui, that he was now older than her. Calling him Mister Su was actually polite, even if she just called him *Uncle Su, it wouldn’t be wrong either…
*伯伯 is Uncle that is older than her father

Su Yi Shui’s heart became flustered again. Just what was the reason that made him revive this annoying person regardless of the consequences and keep her by his side, making him feel nauseated now and then?

If it weren’t for the time they spent together lately, perhaps he could have just steeled his heart and killed this witch.

But even if he forgot the past completely, the memories of their time together recently were still there. And she had cast a spell on him, causing him to always follow her with his gaze, and if he didn’t see her, he would feel dispirited all day.

Su Yi Shui didn’t know what kind of curse Xue Ranran had placed on him, but if this curse wasn’t lifted and she disappeared, wouldn’t it make him feel even worse?

At this moment, Ranran spoke up again, “Um… Mister Su, it’s getting late. Let’s hurry and find the thing…”

But Su Yi Shui remained motionless, his gaze fixed on the cliff face behind Ranran.

The stone wall behind them, similar to burnt stone, originally had nothing unusual about it.

But when Ranran was pressed against the stone wall by Su Yi Shui just now, combined with the hot weather, her sweat seeped into the stone wall.

As a result, as Ranran stood up, a painting suddenly appeared on the stone wall. However, due to the intense heat, the watercolor pattern flashed and then disappeared suddenly.

Su Yi Shui took the water pouch from Ranran’s hand and poured it onto the cliff wall. With the steam, a magnificent pattern appeared again.

This time Ranran could see clearly. It was a totem of a Vermilion Bird subduing a demon. With the appearance of the totem, the abdomens of two ghost-headed spiders grasped by the Vermilion Bird on the stone wall showed round holes.

An idea struck, and Ranran quickly took out the purple demon pills she had obtained from killing the ghost-headed spiders earlier. She embedded the two largest pills into the holes.

Upon placing them, everything fit perfectly. The entire totem, with the addition of the demon pills, became radiant, and the two spiders actually started moving. Breaking free from the Vermilion Bird’s claws, they desperately crawled left and right with their spider silk, forcibly splitting open a crack in the stone wall.

As the crack opened, a wave of heat rushed out, and orange-red magma flowed out from the crevice.

Both of them retreated, but Ranran was a bit late, and the magma flowed to her feet…

“Be careful!” Su Yi Shui acted swiftly, immediately picking up the young girl in a horizontal carry and leaped to a higher place, avoiding the scorching magma.

But Ranran exclaimed in surprise, because even though she had touched the magma just now, she didn’t feel any burning sensation on her feet.

She couldn’t help but lift her foot while in Su Yi Shui’s arms and found that the grass shoes on her feet had solidified into ice where they had touched the magma…

The strange situation here temporarily halted the falling out between the master and disciple. Ranran asked Mister Su to set her down, and then she tried touching the magma with the grass shoes on her feet. The shoes immediately turned into ice, completely isolating the heat from below, allowing her to walk on the magma.

Ranran was quite shocked and quickly took out the other pair of grass shoes given to her by the innkeeper from her bag. She carefully inspected them but found nothing unusual.

“Who is that old man? Did he foresee all of this and give me these shoes?” Ranran couldn’t help muttering to herself.

Su Yishui took the pair of shoes from her hands, changed into them quickly, and said, “I’ll go in and take a look. You stay out here and wait.”

Ranran looked at him with mixed feelings. She knew very well that he wasn’t afraid of her going in to snatch the Tempering Flame, but rather, he was afraid of her taking risks.

He had always been like this, although he spoke harshly, he always showed his care for her through actions…

“No, I want to go in with you. This is the north, which is my direction of wealth. There must be surprises and no dangers!”

After saying this, she directly went in by herself.

Su Yi Shui thought to himself, Why didn’t I see through her earlier? Although her temperament in this life seems more respectful and gentle than in the past life, her stubbornness and willfully going her own way are exactly the same!

As they walked into the crack, the others behind them followed the sound of the wall cracking from earlier and found their way there.

When they saw the master and disciple walking on the magma, entering the crevice, Wei Jiu hurriedly flew over, chasing after them towards the crack in the wall.

However, the hot air from inside the crack was overwhelming. Even with his spiritual shield up, he could barely withstand it. When he flew above the magma, there was a gravitational force pulling him down.

Wei Jiu saw the two people walking on the magma and so tried to land, but the heat almost made him roar out his golden core out from his dantian.

This was too damned hot!

How did those two manage to withstand it? Had their cultivation already become so much higher than his?

Wei Jiu’s feet were too scalded to touch the ground, so he quickly used his energy to leap backward and landed on the ground on his butt. The mighty demonic lord ended up sitting on the ground like a child denied candy, helplessly watching the two enter the crevice…

Even Wei Jiu couldn’t enter, let alone the others. When the magma surged out, they could only step back, and wait for good news from the two who entered.

As for Ranran and Su Yi Shui, wearing ice grass shoes made the magma feel like flat ground. After entering the crevice, they discovered that it was a barrier enveloped by magma.

As they walked in, the magma surged and splattered, and above the magma hung half a skeleton.

The skeleton looked quite eerie. Although it had a human shape, it seemed much larger than an ordinary person, probably over ten meters tall if the person were still alive.

Underneath the skeleton was burning flames, and now the half skeleton only had the sternum and skull left.

As they entered, the brittle sternum suddenly turned into powder, leaving behind a huge golden skull with fiery flames burning in its empty eye sockets, glaring fiercely at the two intruders…

“Is this the skeleton of the Demon King? How many years have passed, and his bones still haven’t been completely refined?” Ranran asked uncertainly.

Su Yi Shui mildly said, “The Demon King was the first generation of demons born in the Netherworld, with an indestructible body. That was why, Dun tian sought the true fire from the Heavenly Realm to refine his bones, preventing his rebirth. If it were ordinary true fire, even after ten thousand years, it wouldn’t be able to refine his bones.”

Ranran understood. She frowned and said, “The Demon King’s skeleton is only left with the skull. If we take away the Tempering Flame now, won’t his efforts be in vain?”

Su Yishui nodded slowly.

Ranran suddenly called out in a low voice, “Not good! We’ve opened the forbidden gate. Let’s get out quickly!”

This place had been hidden for tens of thousands of years. Red Flame Mountain has no rain all year round, and the stone walls would have no traces of water, so it shouldn’t have been discovered by anyone.

If some more time passes, the long-refined bones of the demon king will be completely destroyed.

However, with the continuous appearance of demonic creatures all over Da Qi, someone was clearly orchestrating this, leading them step by step to this place.

Including the ghost-headed spiders in the village before, all of them were crucial in opening this stone wall. It just so happened that they were all encountered by her and her master, so their arrival here seemed natural… yet at an inopportune time!

When Ranran realized this, Su Yi Shui had also thought of it. So he pulled Ranran back quickly and prepared to close the stone wall.

But suddenly, a piercing cold wind swept in from the crack in the stone wall, violently pushing the two apart.

Ranran stabilized herself and looked again, but the golden skull had completely disappeared without a trace.

Only the originally burning flames, after losing their burning target, began to wither and dissipate continuously, finally turning into a red bead the size of a flint, swirling in midair…

Su Yi Shui used water as a base, wrapping it around the bead, and froze it into an ice bead. The golden flames inside the ice bead were the Tempering Flame they had been looking for.

But there was no joy on Ranran’s face, nor on Su Yishui’s. They knew they had been used, but they didn’t know who had manipulated them.

When the two came out, the elders of Kongsan and Feiyun eagerly asked, “How is it? Did you get the Tempering Flame?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t speak, but just looked straight at Wei Jiu sitting on the chair brought by his followers.

His trusted lieutenant Tu Jiuyuan was applying medicine to his feet.

This guy loved to show off and very proud. If he had stolen the skull, he would never let himself look like a fool in front of others.

The first person Su Yi Shui ruled out in his mind was Wei Jiu.

At that moment, Ranran channeled a message to him, “Mister Su, don’t mention the matter of the Demon King’s skull to these people.”

Su Yi Shui, after hearing this, couldn’t help but calmly swept a glance at Ranran.

As Ranran felt that those present at Red Flame Mountain were not really righteous, she felt that if they mentioned the skull incident, she could even guess what kind of nonsense these people would say with her eyes closed.

It would probably be something like, “As expected of the demon’s son and the demon witch, and now they have colluded to release the first-generation demon.”

After all, in her past life, they had accused her like this, slandering her when she was Mu Qingge, and pushing all the blame to her.

Since that’s the case, one shouldn’t be too honest! The matter of what demonic wind had taken away the skull of the Demon King must be investigated thoroughly, but it must not involve these people.

But Su Yi Shui probably thought the same as she did, so when everyone eagerly asked if he had found the Tempering Flame, he only took out the ice bead and said, “This should be it…”

The eyes of everyone immediately lit up and they surrounded him, but at that moment, numerous disciples of Crimson Gate Sect rushed out from all around the mountain hollow.

The elder of Feiyun Sect sternly hollered, “Wei Jiu, what are you trying to do?”

Wei Jiu sneered, “I’ve said it before, you can search around this Red Flame Mountain as you please. But if you want to find the Tempering Flame and take it away, it depends on whether you have the ability!”

Su Yi Shui said loudly, “The item is in my hands, and I have no intention of taking it away. Lord Wei, let’s talk business!”

Wei Jiu chuckled darkly, “What business?”

“You can exchange one person for this Tempering Flame. After that, you can discuss with the elders of other sects how to subdue the demons in the world. What do you think?”

Previous
Next

冒名顶替 IMPERSONATION

Of course Wei Jiu knew who Su Yi Shui wanted to exchange for, but he smiled meaningfully and said, “Talking business in the Crimson Gate’s sanctum? It also depends on whether I want to talk to you or not?”

As a person in the demonic path, when you can rob for things like bandits, why bother to conduct business like a decent person?

Su Yi Shui remained calm and composed, just like back when he exchanged the key with Wei Jiu on Jueshan Mountain. He said, “Because I hold the lifeline of your Red Flame Mountain! Right now, the Tempering Flame has just entered a period of temporary weakness. If I fully ignite it, your Red Flame Mountain will instantly become a sea of fire. By then, your hundred-year-old sanctum will be destroyed in an instant, and I’m afraid you won’t have the capital to negotiate with me any more.”

As he spoke, he gently rotated the ice sphere in his hand, and the flames inside suddenly rose in temperature, warming the surrounding air…

Wei Jiu had suffered too many losses at the hands of Su Yi Shui and truly feared him. If he could avoid a fight and obtain the Tempering Flame from him, that would be ideal.

Moreover, even if this true fire was not real, the old drunkard was already of no further use to him.

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu sounded him out, “Are you sure you want to make this deal? In my opinion, this is a bad bargain!”

Su Yi Shui said coldly, “You also need to think clearly. Once this opportunity is missed, there won’t be another chance. If I change my mind, do you think you can stop me?”

After revealing Ranran’s identity earlier, Su Yi Shui’s reaction was really too calm, showing no signs of the effect of the Soul-Cleansing Charm. However, later when he took Xue Ranran away, he must have questioned her privately.

Thinking of the truth the old drunkard had said to him when he was drunk, Wei Jiu’s smile deepened involuntarily. “Alright, since you are so sincere, if I don’t agree, wouldn’t I be not showing respect for you? The person you want to exchange for is…”

Su Yi Shui said, “Hand over the Elder Jiu to me unharmed, and I’ll give you this Tempering Flame”

As soon as he said this, everyone around was shocked and angry.

The elder of the Feiyun Sect, who was considered friendly with the Xishan faction, said solemnly, “Su Yi Shui, you must be careful! Handing over the true fire of tempering to a villain like Wei Jiu is equivalent to handing over the safety of everyone in the world to him, isn’t it?”

Su Yi Shui said coldly, “Isn’t the safety of the world upheld by you righteous people? I’m just leaving the Tempering Flame at Red Flame Mountain. I believe Lord Wei will also have a good discussion with you all about how to save the world.”

After saying this, curses and accusations erupted from the elders.

Wei Jiu didn’t want these old elders to interfere in his deal. With a wave of his hand, he cast a silencing spell.

This place was his sanctum and also belonged to the fire element, so Wei Jiu’s spiritual force was more powerful here. Although it was just an ordinary silencing spell, it successfully sealed the mouths of all the elders present.

Then Wei Jiu said to Su Yi Shui, “Since it’s our business, we don’t need others to interfere.”

After speaking, Wei Jiu waved his hand to have his disciples separate the elders, and then had someone bring a wine barrel.

Inside the wine barrel was a bearded and unkempt old man, who was none other than the kidnapped Elder Jiu.

Wei Jiu had always suffered losses when dealing with Su Yi Shui before, so he couldn’t let his guard down this time either.

However, Su Yi Shui seemed really eager to leave right away, so there was no need for any further conversation when the exchange was made.

Su Yi Shui confirmed the true identity of the old drunk immortal, patted his face, let him say a few drunken words, and then had Yu Chen and the others take Elder Jiu away.

Wei Jiu was afraid that Su Yi Shui might change his mind. Moreover, Su Yi Shui and Ranran were able to enter the hot crevice completely unscathed, so their strength also made him wary. So he didn’t even let his disciples stop them, allowing the Xishan group to leave Red Flame Mountain undeterred.

But when they reached the foot of the mountain, Gao Cang became anxious.

He was a straightforward young man and couldn’t hold back his words, so he asked directly, “Master, by handing over the true fire of tempering to Wei Jiu, aren’t you going to bear a bad reputation?”

Ranran didn’t speak, but she had already guessed the reason why Su Yi Shui had done this. The true fire had been tempering the undying body of the demon king all this time. If it had been fully refined, it wouldn’t matter.

However, the golden skull had disappeared, and the demon king who had been burned for tens of thousands of years, harboring deep resentment. The true fire of tempering would definitely be tainted with this resentment. So, whoever possessed it was actually holding a talisman. If the demon king really managed to return, he would definitely come for the true fire of tempering and vent his hatred wildly.

With this in mind, there was no one more suitable than Wei Jiu to keep it safe. Letting him guard the true fire of tempering and bear the residual resentment of the demon king was like using poison to counter poison. Ranran believed that Lord Wei would be capable of handling this task well.

Thinking of this, Ranran even sighed for Wei Jiu, who thought he had made a steal. If he had known that the corpse of the demon king was not completely destroyed, he probably wouldn’t have wanted the Tempering Flame even if they forced it on him.

But such a huge secret couldn’t be revealed to the fellow disciples for now.

Now that they had finally rescued Elder Jiu, it depended on how the old immortal would help Su Yi Shui undo the Soul-Cleansing Talisman and restore all his memories.

Meeting up with Shen Kuo at the foot of the mountain, he was still taking care of his injured junior brother, Yue Sheng. Yue Sheng’s injuries were severe, and at this moment, he was already unconscious, looking barely alive.

Ranran looked down at Yue Sheng’s injured arm, furrowing her brows. She said, ‘Shen Junior Brother, did you forget to change his medicine? It’s been four hours since the medicine for this severed arm was applied, and its effectiveness will weaken. It must be reapplied with new medicine.’

Shen Kuo lowered his head in embarrassment and said, ‘Master and you guys have not come down the mountain all this time, and I was worried, so I forgot to change it. Please punish me, Senior Sister.’

Ranran shook her head. After all, they were all young boys, and it was indeed difficult for them to take care of the patients meticulously. She squatted down and changed the medicine for Yue Sheng.

However, Yue Sheng needed to return to West Mountain as soon as possible and recuperate in a suitable sanctum. It’s just that his severed arm can never be reattached, and it’s uncertain whether his path of cultivation can continue in the future.

When they reached the inn, Ranran couldn’t wait to find the old man who had given her the shoes.

But after searching the inn up and down and asking the waiter, the waiter said they had never had such an old man as Ranran described.

This person seemed to have appeared out of thin air.

As for the priceless treasure Elder Jiu, whom they had exchanged for a high price, they had no idea how much wine he had been plied with on Red Flame Mountain. He kept sleeping soundly without waking up.

Later, Ranran stuffed a Clear Mind Pill into his mouth, finally waking the old immortal up from his drunken state.

Looking at Ranran clearly, the old drunk immortal still drowsily said, “This alcohol is so strong, I actually dreamed so vividly. Little girl, are you here to brew the Detain-Heaven’s Immortal wine for me again?”

Ranran reached out and pulled his beard, asking, “Does it hurt?”

Seeing Elder Jiu nod obediently, she continued, “So, this is not a dream. We have already rescued you. Do you remember giving Wei Jiu a Soul-Cleansing Charm? Do you know how to undo it?”

When Elder Jiu realized that he was finally rescued, he sat up suddenly, and said guiltily, “I don’t remember anything. Don’t place any blame on me. How could I collude with people like Wei Jiu? But if he got me drunk, then I won’t know anything. In any case, I won’t admit to anything that I don’t remember!”

Back then, Mu Qingge had been framed as a scourge of evil and was eventually besieged before her vitality recovered.

Elder Jiu was too attached to the secular world, so he adamantly denied that he had “helped” people in the demonic path.

Ranran didn’t know to laugh or cry, and said, “I’m not like those people from Jiuhua. I won’t blame you for anything! If you don’t remember, that’s fine. I just want to know how to undo the Soul-Cleansing Talisman?”

Elder Jiu gathered his thoughts and asked urgently, “Girl, are you under the Soul-Cleansing talisman? Did you forget the brewing method of the Detain-Heaven’s Immortal wine, or did you forget other important things?”

When Elder Jiu learnt that it was Su Yi Shui who was under the effects of it, he breathed a sigh of relief. “So it was him. Then there’s no problem. Someone heartless like him, forgetting love is not a big deal.”

Ranran was upset and said sharply, “How is it not a big deal? He’s forgotten every single thing about me and even thought I had ulterior motives!”

Elder Jiu looked at Su Yi Shui, who happened to be standing outside the half-open door. He seemed to have heard Ranran’s low shout just now, and his body stiffened slightly.

At that moment, Ranran suddenly remembered the temperament of Elder Jiu and immediately said softly, “If you undo the charm for him, I’ll brew you some good wine and prepare some snacks to go with it. How about that?”

Elder Jiu had a longing look but then shook his head regretfully, “It’s a pity. There is no spiritual talisman to undo the Soul-Cleansing talisman. Otherwise, I could have had a few more good drinks…”

Ranran was shocked to hear this. “What? You say there’s no way to undo it… How is that possible?”

Su Yi Shui also frowned slightly at the door, finally understanding the meaning of Wei Jiu’s words when he said, “Don’t regret it.”

Wei Jiu had probably asked Elder Jiu about the possibility of undoing the charm long ago and only made the exchange after knowing it couldn’t be undone.

Well, these two archenemies can be considered as having schemed against each other, barely ending up in a tie!

Ranran suddenly felt empty inside. She silently turned around, and prepared to leave the room.

She did not expect to see Su Yi Shui standing at the door, and did not know how long he had been there.

As their eyes met, the thought that Su Yi Shui could no longer remember the past, made her feel as if half of her heart had been cut off. She lowered her head and ran past him towards the backyard.

Su Yi Shui tried hard to control himself, but he still moved to chase after her.

Elder Jiu watched their backs and muttered to himself, “I just said there’s no spiritual talisman to undo it, not that there’s no way to undo it. Why did those two leave without hearing everything?”

But that method was difficult in the first place, not something that could be easily changed by human efforts. Elder Jiu thought it was better not to say anything. Considering the suffering he had endured these past days, he had no mood to meddle in the love affairs of those young boys and girls. He stretched comfortably and then fell asleep soundly on the soft bed…

Meanwhile, after Su Yi Shui had followed her, he saw Ranran sitting under the locust tree in a daze.

Since the Tempering Flame had been sealed, the temperature around Red Flame Mountain had dropped significantly.

In fact, near dusk, thunder roared, and heavy rain that had not been seen for the longest time, began to pour. Standing under the tree, the girl who was looking up had raindrops on her face, and one couldn’t tell if she had cried sadly just now.

Su Yi Shui silently used his power to create a spiritual shield, isolating the heavy rain and enveloping the despondent girl within. He asked in a low voice, “What are you thinking?”

Ranran snapped out of her thoughts, looked regretfully at the bald branches, and murmured, “It’s raining… how nice. When spring comes next year and the tree blooms, locust tree flower dumplings with lamb filling will be so delicious. But its too bad… you probably don’t remember that taste…”

In the spring of this year, she had made dumplings with locust tree flowers filling for her master.

At that time, he had accompanied her on the mountain, under the pretext of practicing light body techniques, watching her jump around picking flowers all over the mountains.

The sunlight was gentle, the man in white was elegant, stretching his arms gracefully with wide sleeves, playing a melodious ancient qin in the gentle breeze and rain of flowers. She had leaped about with the rhythm, and picked a basket full of flowers.

So much so that for a long time afterward, every time she heard Shifu play the same tune, her nose would seem to be filled with the fragrance of locust flowers…

Su Yi Shui knew, that the news that his Soul-Cleansing Charm could not be undone seemed to have hit Ranran very hard.

In fact, he was also very curious about what kind of feelings he had developed for this reincarnated Mu Qingge. The Soul-Cleansing Charm washes away the deep love that’s engraved in the bone marrow. How could he have fallen for Mu Qingge – that demoness who had treated him as a plaything!

Su Yi Shui actually had loads of malicious words to say, but when he saw Ranran’s despondent look, those words dissipated on the tip of his tongue.

He frowned and said, “We’ve only met for two years in this life. Even if I don’t remember the past, you can tell me everything one by one… But remember one thing, don’t embellish or make up inexplicable things!”

He remembered Mu Qingge’s naughty and mischievous nature, always seizing every opportunity to tease people. If he let her speak unchecked, she might add in some absurd scenes.

Ranran wiped the raindrops off her face and suddenly chuckled bitterly, “What are ‘made-up things’? Like… you always sneakily kissed me when no one else is around, is that absurd enough?”

Su Yi Shui was annoyed by her brazen words and frowned, “Do you even need to ask? Such absurd talk, you first need someone to believe it! Alright, you’re lacking true qi right now. If you stay drenched in the rain like this, you’ll likely catch a chill. Hurry back to the room and warm yourself by the fire…”

With that, he took Ranran’s hand and walked towards the house.

If Xue Ranran said she hadn’t regained her memories from her past life, he would believe her for now.

From what he could see, the seemingly innocent young girl had not inherited Mu Qingge’s playful and careless behavior from her past life.

Since Xue Ranran was his disciple, he naturally had to teach her well. If she really became like her past self again, he would naturally deal with it sternly and wouldn’t tolerate it!

But for now, he just wanted her to dry off quickly and cheer up, and stop looking so depressed.

Right, he had asked Yu Chen to heat up some bath water earlier, so now would be a good time for Ranran to take a bath first…

Just as they reached the entrance of the inn, they happened to see Elder Jiu standing there. He burped and said, “Why did you leave so quickly earlier? I hadn’t finished talking yet!”

Ranran replied listlessly, “Elder Jiu, you shouldn’t drink for now. The alcohol that the Crimson Gate people gave you was extremely strong liquor, very harmful to your body. Even if you really become an immortal, drinking like this will ruin your digestive system!”

Elder Jiu pointed to the door to the bath and said, “What I meant was, although the Soul-Cleansing Charm can’t be undone with a spiritual charm, it actually blocks the emotional connection. If combined with a secret medicine made from gold, it can alleviate it slightly. I’ve already prepared the water. Let your master soak in it later and see if it works…”

With that, he burped again and turned to walk back to his room.

Ranran lifted the door curtain and indeed saw water in the bathtub inside, floating with golden powder and emitting a pleasant fragrance.

A glimmer of hope appeared on Ranran’s face as she looked towards Su Yi Shui.

Su Yi Shui thought for a moment and said, “You should go back to your room first.”

Since the water had been infused with a secret medicine made from gold and stones, Ranran couldn’t soak in it anymore. So he asked her to return to her room first.

If Su Yi Shui wanted to take a bath, it wouldn’t be appropriate for her to be around either.

Ranran went back to her room and changed her clothes. She couldn’t help herself and went to look for Elder Jiu again. This person was always muddled and unreliable when he drank. How could he come up with the medicine immediately after waking up? She had to clarify with him before she could be at ease. However, when she reached Elder Jiu’s room, he was already in a deep sleep.

Ranran took out her personal wine gourd, which had the last bit of the twenty-year-old Detain-Heaven’s immortal wine.

As soon as the wine cork was opened, the aroma of the wine was more effective than any hangover remedy. Elder Jiu hadn’t even finished his snore before he immediately opened his eyes and woke up.

“Little girl, you actually have such a private stash. Hurry up and satisfy my craving.”

Thinking that her master might be able to undo the Soul-Cleansing Charm, Ranran’s heart also relaxed a little. She said with a wry smile, “I met your brother who had already ascended, the Medicine Immortal, on Tianmai Mountain. Although you two look exactly alike, your temperaments and personalities are like night and day… I wonder how your ability to prepare medicine compares to your brother’s, and if there are any other side effects to this medicine?”

Elder Jiu put down the wine jug, burped, and in a drunken haze said, “My brother and I are as different as night and day, one is ugly and one is handsome. I look like our father, he looks like our mother. How can you say we look exactly alike? Did he become ugly after ascending to immortality, so he also became a square-shaped wine barrel?”

Hearing this, Ranran’s smile froze, and she grabbed the wine pouch from Elder Jiu, and exclaimed, “What did you say? You and your brother don’t look alike at all?”

Elder Jiu seemed startled by her reaction, nodded honestly, and then chuckled, “Many people hear our names and think that because we’re twins, we would look exactly alike… Hahaha, my brother is quite handsome, not inferior to that pasty-faced Su Yi Shui!”

But at that moment, Ranran felt that her blood was about to freeze.

If it wasn’t the Medicine Immortal that she encountered on Tianmai Mountain, then… who was that person?

Thinking of the person who deliberately disguised himself as Medicine Immortal, leading her into the pool, Ranran felt a chill run down her spine. She stood up suddenly, picked up a tea cup, splashed water on Elder Jiu, and asked, “Did you give my Shifu the medicated water to undo the Soul-Cleansing Charm just now?”

Elder Jiu was startled by the splash and momentarily forgot to get angry. He was also somewhat sobered by Ranran’s intense gaze and honestly replied, “What medicine? How can medicine undo the Soul-Cleansing Charm? I’ve been sleeping all this time, how could I have given bathwater to that Su?”

Ranran ran quickly towards the inn’s bathhouse.

When she burst into the bathhouse, Su Yi Shui had already taken off his garment, revealing an enchanting waistline, with a towel around his narrow waist. He was standing, staring blankly at the tub full of golden water.

It’s unclear what he was hesitating about, but fortunately, he hesitated long enough for Ranran to stop him.

Ranran leaped forward and hugged Su Yi Shui in an instant .

Su Yi Shui raised an eyebrow at the girl who was holding onto him fiercely, and when Gao Cang and Shen Kuo entered the bath, they were dumbfounded by this scene.

Ranran had exerted all her strength when she came rushing over. She was now near collapse, as she leaned weakly on Su Yi Shui’s firm chest, and whispered, “The medicated water is a ruse, don’t enter it…”

Su Yi Shui noticed her pale and frail face and immediately sensed her weakening vitality. He quickly carried her in his arms and returned to the bedroom to help regulate her qi.

After she had recovered somewhat, Ranran told Su Yi Shui what Elder Jiu had said. Su Yi Shui immediately understood that someone had impersonated the old man and used the time gap to give him the “prescription” before the real Elder Jiu woke up.

When Su Yishui took Elder Jiu to check the tub of golden water, the water had already been drained out through a pipe.

When they asked Gao Cang and Shen Kuo who were supposed to be watching the bath, they were also puzzled. They said they had both been guarding outside the master’s bedroom and hadn’t come back to the bath, so they didn’t know who drained the water.

But Ranran still felt a shiver in her heart. She whispered, “The person who impersonated Elder Jiu has appeared before us more than once…”

Back on Tianmai Mountain, the Medicine Immortal had given off a unique herbal scent. Later, when they entered the Netherworld Realm, they had encountered a blind shepherd with a similar scent on him.

Since he was disabled, taking medicine regularly was not out of the ordinary. In addition, at that time, Ranran’s attention was drawn to the strange flower sea, so she didn’t think much about it.

But later, when they were preparing to go to Red Flame Mountain, the old innkeeper who gifted her the grass shoes had also smelled of the same herbal scent.

Now thinking back carefully, Ranran was confident in her keen sense of smell. These three people were clearly the same person!

Thinking that someone had been following their every move, even guiding their actions, Ranran couldn’t help but shudder.

After her vitality qi had stabilized, she turned to Su Yi Shui and asked, “Shifu, you didn’t enter the tub just now. What were you thinking about?”

Of course, Su Yi Shui wouldn’t tell her that he was thinking about Ranran’s absurd words.

He would look for places with no one around to kiss her? Was he an old village bachelor who couldn’t find a wife? To think he would actually do such a preposterous thing?

But then he remembered how serious Ranran looked when she said those words. What if it was true… Su Yi Shui felt like he wanted to strangle that person who did such things.

But that girl’s lips seemed like they have been tinted by cherry blossoms, looking so soft, what would it feel like to actually kiss them?

As he thought about it, Su Yi Shui suddenly felt his cheeks grow hot. He was momentarily lost in thought, and when he came back to his senses, he saw the girl fiercely pounce over, hugging him tightly…

Although the golden water had been drained, there were still some traces left.

Elder Jiu carefully inspected it, frowning as he said, “This… it’s the gold pupa powder used by powerful experts to make evil talismans. If this powder has been boosted, it’s an excellent catalyst for possession. Someone deliberately wanted Su Yi Shui to soak in this water, is… trying to possess him?”

We will get to see Su Yi Shui’s enchanting waistline in the drama right? haha

* again I think the author got confused with the setup… earlier it said its a bath tub of water, but it later turned into a 池 pool – since its unlikely to be a pool I will revert to it being a tub of water which is more logical…How much gold powder would the imposter require to fill an entire bath pool right? Seems like it would weaken the effect of the soak as well..

Previous
Next

西山除名 EXPELLED FROM XISHAN


This statement was met with solemn expressions from everyone, especially Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran. They both thought of the skull of the demon king that had not been completely destroyed.

All along, there had been a hidden hand manipulating everything behind the scenes, silently guiding them into the Netherworld Realm and then finding the remains of the demon king.

Although the person guiding them so far seemed to have not shown too much malice, the feeling of being manipulated and played in the palm of someone else’s hand was extremely uncomfortable!

Who could that person be, who keeps impersonating others, disguising as the Medicine Immortal, an unknown elder, and even as the innkeeper?

Su Yi Shui said immediately, “We leave at night, and depart right now from the territory of the Red Flame Mountain!”

This place was too close to Wei Jiu’s territory, so it was indeed not suitable to stay for long. Moreover, the identity of the hidden manipulator was unknown, and they could transform into different forms, making it difficult to be detected. Therefore, they needed to return to their own sanctum as soon as possible to be able to set up a proper defense.

Of course, on their way back, they also heard some updates from the Red Flame Mountain.

After Wei Jiu obtained the Tempering Flame, he easily brought the elders of those sects under his control.

It was said that Emperor Su Yu also sent people to commend Wei Jiu for his painstaking efforts in obtaining the Flame for the sake of the masses, showing an intention to restore the Crimson Gate sect to good standing.

Wei Jiu had saved him before, which deserved some royal favor. This time, the extraordinary talents sent by Su Yu were nearly entirely annihilated, and now that demons were constantly emerging, Su Yu urgently needed powerful individuals to help him suppress the chaos. Naturally, he had to flatter Wei Jiu, the Demon Lord.

Furthermore, Su Yu had always been wary of the prestige of those righteous orthodox sects, fearing that they might overthrow his reign. If he could elevate the Crimson Gate through this opportunity, it would be a good counterbalance against those three declining major sects.

Now, Wei Jiu had already led the Crimson Gate sect out of the mountain and renamed the Tempering Flame to the Crimson Gate Sacred Fire. They were subduing and destroying demons along the way and gaining significant prestige.

Perhaps it won’t be long for Wei Jiu to become the new highly sought-after Imperial advisor of his generation, after the War Goddess, Mu Qingge.

As for Elder Jiu, he couldn’t return to Cuiwei Mountain at this time, and had to return to Xishan with them.

When he was almost sober, he finally explained everything clearly. Although the Soul-Cleansing Talisman could not be undone by another spiritual talisman, if the person affected by the charm fell deeply in love again with the person they have forgotten, the effect of the spiritual talisman would be automatically lifted.

After saying this, Elder Jiu also did his best to elaborate, “This deep love, means being together in life or in death, to be willing to die for the other. If Ranran encounters any danger next time, just use your chest to block the sword for her. If you are fortunate enough to survive, your memories will fully recover!”

Listening to this, Su Yi Shui’s face turned very frosty. He couldn’t even accept the possibility of having loved Mu Qingge before, so how could he fall deeply in love again? And he would even have to die for her by blocking a blade?

It’s really truly, utterly, ridiculous!

Xue Ranran also smiled wryly as she listened.

She felt that Su Yi Shui might have really loved Mu Qingge in her past life. This kind of love that could sacrifice half of one’s cultivation was undeniable.

But she was not Mu Qingge. She was just a fruit that fell from the Rebirth Tree, with her own skin and flesh as Xue Ranran.

Because of the memories and longing owing to the separation of life and death, in seeking solace, Su Yi Shui may have transferred his affections to her, and loved Xue Ranran.

And hence, there was his indulgence after being influenced by the Spirit Spring. Those memories had been sweet and beautiful, but were now bitter and sour to recall.

Now that Su Yi Shui lacked the deeply etched memories of Mu Qingge, Xue Ranran would mean nothing to him.

She couldn’t even be like those silly maidens in books, to confront and question whether the fickle person had ever loved her.

A man who now remembers nothing, explicitly informed her of the depth of his love, completely removing the ambiguous unease in guessing the degree of affection. It was almost too honest to look directly upon.

After hearing Elder Jiu’s words, Ranran again found a quiet hillside alone, gazing silently at the moon in the treetops to dispel her anguish.

Not too long later, someone sat down beside her. The man’s cold voice said, “You’ve also heard the solution. If you really want me to remember, be more proactive. Do exactly what you did to beguile me back then.”

Hearing the homework set by her former beloved disciple, the former Master of Xishan found it difficult to sustain her melancholy. She turned her head in surprise and asked softly, “Are you… implying that I seduced you?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t think he was being unreasonable, merely stating calmly, “Isn’t that so? In your past life, you have always liked good-looking young men, able to win hearts with just a few words. Although I’m not that kind of weak-minded person, I can’t say for certain that you didn’t use some extraordinary means to bewitch me when I was young and naive back then. Since it’s like this, just do it again one more time.”

Ranran was dumbfounded. Thinking carefully, in her memories, Shifu was the one who used his outstanding looks to bewitch her when she was young and naive!

As far as she could tell, there was indeed a fox spirit here, but unfortunately, it was a male fox spirit!

So she bluntly said, “Shifu, I can swear a soul oath that I have never tried to seduce you! Besides, you said the Soul Cleansing Talisman doesn’t bother you much, so… why don’t we just forget about it?”

Su Yi Shui felt that he had made a significant concession by coming over. But unexpectedly, this little demoness didn’t appreciate it and even hinted in her words that he was the one who was desperately clinging onto and deeply infatuated with Mu Qingge!

Could it be that he had actively pursued Mu Qingge back then? Su Yi Shui became angry. Anyone with a brain couldn’t write such an absurd scenario!

“Xue Ranran, don’t push your luck! Is it really that proud to make the effort to claim about having a leg-up about this kind of matters?”

With the conversation reaching this point, the deep bond between master and disciple was about to be temporarily set aside.

Xue Ranran rolled up her sleeves, preparing to have a serious analysis with Su Yi Shui, “No… let’s not talk about the present. Let’s just talk about Mu Qingge in her past life. Shifu, you should have heard from second uncle master that Emperor Su Yu built such a splendid residence in Xishan just to win a smile from Mu Qingge. And the Demon Lord Wei Jiu was also awkwardly trying to win her favor. At that time, Shifu, apart from being more good-looking, you didn’t seem to have any advantages! Although I don’t remember my past life, I can imagine being surrounded by so many handsome young men… If you didn’t put in more effort at that time, you probably wouldn’t have stood a chance…”

When she reached the end of her analysis, Ranran’s voice trailed into a lower pitch instinctively under Su Yi Shui’s sharp gaze.

“Why? Are you very proud of bewitching so many men in your past life?”

Ranran was somewhat speechless at being cornered “I… I mean, it’s my past life, it has nothing to do with who I am now… Even if I get married, I will have to wait for my mother to arrange it for me…”

Due to the issue of who seduced whom in the past, their moonlit heart-to-heart conversation ended on a sour note.

For the next few days, the two of them remained silent, not speaking to each other.

Even Elder Jiu could see that they were having a tiff, and he chuckled, “See, the Soul-Cleansing Talisman is also a touchstone talisman. No matter how deep the love, it’s just each taking what they need. If you easily forget and part ways, it’s also good!”

After hearing his words, Su Yi Shui glanced at the old man, then gestured with his long finger and spilled the wine that Ranran had brought for Elder Jiu onto the roots of a tree.

This made Elder Jiu jump in anger, cursing Su Yi Shui for being despicable!

After their fierce battle on Red Flame Mountain, everyone was somewhat worn out. When they left the territory of Crimson Gate, Su Yi Shui instructed Yuchen and the others to buy a carriage to transport Yue Sheng.

Ranran also had them change their clothes and shoes and wash them by the stream.

While washing the clothes, Qiu Xier saw Ranran staring blankly at the shoes in her hand, seemingly lost in thought. She couldn’t help but nudge her and then signaled with her eyes that their master was looking sideways at her from the other side of the stream.

Considering that the two of them hadn’t spoken or interacted for several days, Su Yi Shui’s face became increasingly sullen, frightening the uncle masters and fellow disciples not to even breathe loudly.

Unfortunately, the usually sweet-talking Ranran seemed to have lost her wit this time and didn’t try to cheer their master up.

If this awkwardness continued, perhaps Xishan would really witness a tragic drama of killing a disciple to right a wrong.

Feeling that she had perhaps gone a little too far these past few days, Ranran slowly put down the shoes and then lightly jumped over the stream, coming to Su Yi Shui’s side.

Qiu Xier couldn’t help but look at the two of them with a subtle atmosphere, sweating for Ranran.

But the two of them didn’t speak, just slightly moved their throats for a while before going to a nearby grove of trees one after the other.

Qiu Xier, seeing their throats move, also guessed that they were using voice channeling to communicate, and others couldn’t hear what they were saying.

She sighed, “What should we do? Junior sister has suddenly become our demonic Grandmaster. Will Master bully his Master?”

Gao Cang, who was helping her make *soap nearby, felt like Xier’s words were like a tongue twister and said foolishly, “Junior sister is so adorable, how could Master bear to scold her?”
*猪油胰子 is 肥皂

Before too long, Su Yi Shui and Ranran came out of the woods.

Perhaps because they had cleared up the misunderstanding, the impasse between the two seemed to have eased a little after that day.

Finally, two days later, Yue Sheng has regained consciousness. Ranran asked Shen Kuo and Qiu Xier to fetch some clean water from the stream.

Then she changed Yue Sheng’s bandages while casually asking, “When we went up Red Flame Mountain, junior brother Shen Kuo stayed by your side all the time, didn’t he?”

Yue Sheng struggled to remember. “My wound was too painful at the time. Shen Kuo said he had some calming pills, and after I took them, I fell asleep. When I woke up, it was when Master and you all came back… My life is completely over now… You shouldn’t have saved me, it would have been better if I died then!”

Ranran glanced at him. “If you really had a death wish, when we faced the Five Fiends Formation, you wouldn’t have abandoned us and rushed to leave with Old Feng, the person with Yin-Yang Eyes. If entering the formation was a gamble, you should be willing to accept the consequences. You were lucky to come out alive; you can’t blame us for saving you and then giving up on yourself!”

If the former arrogant Yue Sheng had heard this, he would have stomped his feet in protest by now. But now, hearing this, he felt ashamed.

If he had trusted Master and followed them into the most dangerous North Gate, he probably wouldn’t have ended up like this? Thinking of this, the young man looked at his severed arm and burst into tears, whispering, “Senior sister, I’m disfigured now and disabled. Will you… not like me anymore?”

Hmm… Ranran helplessly shook her head. “Even if you weren’t disfigured, I still wouldn’t like you. When we get back, I’ll ask Fourteen uncle master to make you a well crafted prosthetic limb. Maybe it can help with basic daily activities. Cultivation is about transcending the physical body in the first place. If your body was meant to be discarded, why care about its condition? As long as you’re alive, even left with only one aspiring breath, you can still maintain your dignity! If you see fourteen uncle master with his disabled hands, you’ll know that it doesn’t matter being physically disabled. If your spirit is disabled, that’s truly beyond remedy!”

Ranran’s tone was always gentle, but her words were firm. Hearing this, the despondent and dejected Yue Sheng felt a lot more at ease in his heart.

The next day when they were about to set off, Yue Sheng, who had been lying half-dead in the carriage, even got up and tried to help Qiu Xier and the others with their tasks using his other hand.

Actually, along the way back, Yutong had been on edge. She and her brother’s gazes always unconsciously scrutinized Xue Ranran.

Upon closer inspection, there was that feeling of awakening from a dream, wondering how she had been so blind before.

Although Xue Ranran seemed to have undergone significant changes in appearance compared to her past life, her gaze was very much the same.

And that calm and composed demeanor was also exactly the same, and her persuasive eloquence has been inherited completely.

Especially when she lazily lay down, eating snacks on a big rock! She was plainly Mu Qingge herself!

Yutong didn’t talk to Ranran any more now. She was not deliberately ignoring her, but really more not knowing what to say.

Only those involved in the situation knew the subtlety. Ranran felt that she really shouldn’t return to Xishan anymore.

So, when the group returned to Xishan, during a break in their cultivation exercises, Ranran tactfully expressed her thoughts to Su Yi Shui. If he agreed, she wanted to go back to spend the last bit of time she had left with her parents.

They didn’t have any children of their own, just this one adopted child, so she wanted to accompany them properly.

Su Yi Shui listened to her farewell, which sounded like her last words, and felt unhappy deep down.

He didn’t even look at the young girl standing by the bookcase. As he tidied the bookshelf, he said, “Since you are Mu Qingge, I naturally can’t have you as my disciple anymore. From this day forth, you are expelled from Xishan.”

Ranran had only wanted to bid farewell and cherish the time she had left, but she didn’t expect Su Yi Shui to be so unfeeling and actually expel her from Xishan!

In other words, in the time Su Yi Shui had started to accept disciples, the first one he would expel was actually her, Xue Ranran!

Hearing this, Ranran quickly glanced at Su Yi Shui and said, “I don’t have long left. What’s the harm to let me be associated with the name of Xishan? Must you expel me…”

Su Yi Shui vigorously dusted the non-existent dust on the bookshelf with a chicken feather duster. He said coldly, “Since you are already so detached about life and death, why care about being linked to the reputation of Xishan?”

Ranran felt that what Su Yi Shui said made sense. For someone who was going to die soon, there was indeed no need to care about the stigma of being a traitor to Xishan… Strictly speaking, she must be the only grandmaster ever to be driven out of the sect by her former disciple in the entire world.

She sighed softly, then turned around intending to go pack her luggage. But Su Yi Shui turned around and asked, “Where are you going?”

Ranran muttered, “Since I’m no longer a disciple of Xishan, how can I continue eating your food? I’ll pack my things and leave right away.”

Su Yi Shui sat back on his chair. “Where are you planning to go?”

Ranran looked out the window and said, “Naturally I’m going to find my parents. The taste of glutinous rice in Jiangnan is best at this time, making steamed cakes is very delicious. I will get a boat and travel along the Nan River, shop during the day, and stay overnight on the boat…”

She had sure thought it out thoroughly. This kind of journey filled with shopping and eating sounded beautiful just thinking about it.

It’s ironic that she had encouraged Yue Sheng to pull himself together the other day, but when it came to herself, she was so dispirited, only thinking about seeking death?

He didn’t say anything more, just coldly told her to leave the room.

The argument between the two could be heard from the study, causing the disciples in the martial grounds to look at each other and glance over there frequently.

Ranran lifted her head to look at the man with frosty expression… After this parting, they probably won’t see each other again in the future.

It’s not that she was in despair and seeking death, but her body was like a bottomless pit, truly a burden to him.

Now that someone was plotting something devious behind the scenes. If Su Yi Shui didn’t make adequate preparations, he might be dragged down by her.

So Ranran felt that leaving was the best choice. It seemed that he now understood this as well. Also since knowing that she was Mu Qingge, he probably felt thoroughly disgusted in his heart.

By expelling her like this instead of taking back the cultivation of his golden core, it could be considered as fulfilling their bond between master and disciple of two lifetimes…

Since realizing that all of this was the best choice, Xue Ranran didn’t hesitate when she packed up her things.

However, when she returned to the courtyard, she found that the Rebirth Tree in her courtyard had been dug up.

After asking Qiu Xier, she learned that it was Shifu who had senior uncle master dig it up. As for where it was transplanted to, Qiu Xier didn’t know either.

Without this tree, Ranran’s body would be even more difficult to sustain.

But this tree belonged to Su Yi Shui. If he didn’t want to give it, she couldn’t ask for it. Fortunately, there were still two portions of roots in her room, which should barely be enough to support her to return to see her parents…

So, after packing her luggage, Ranran left a farewell letter to her senior brothers and sisters and left.

When she was leaving, Su Yi Shui announced that he was entering seclusion, and spiritual shields were placed on the mountaintop. Even Yutong couldn’t get close, so there was no further need to bid farewell to Shifu.

Ranran didn’t want to go through the whole process of a dramatic farewell, so she quietly left by herself.

But when she left the Xishan Mountain Gate, someone behind her called out, “Senior sister, please wait!”

Ranran turned around and saw junior Shen Kuo who had followed her down the mountain without her knowing: “Senior sister, why are you leaving with your luggage?”

Ranran smiled faintly, “Yesterday at dinner, didn’t second uncle master passed down Shifu’s instructions and announced that I was expelled from Xishan? I’m no longer a disciple of Xishan, so naturally, I have to go back to my parents.”

Shen Kuo’s face showed a look of sadness. “I heard third senior sister mention about the grievances between you and Master, but maybe Master was just angry for a moment. He didn’t say he wanted to drive you off the mountain. Your vitality is really unstable now. What are we going to do if you leave by yourself and encounter danger? No, even if you insist on leaving, I must escort you. I won’t let you go alone.”

Ranran looked at the sincerity on Shen Kuo’s fair face, considered for a moment, then said hesitatingly, “If you insist, then let’s go together. This would be just right. I was going to ask Uncle master Zeng yi to make a prosthetic limb for junior brother Yue Sheng, so you can bring it back then.”

After reaching an agreement with her former junior brother, Shen Kuo didn’t even go back to the sect and directly left with Ranran.

In his words, his light body technique had already reached a high level, so even with two trips to go forth and back, it wouldn’t take too long. With Master in seclusion and no one supervising them, it was just right for him to escort senior sister back home.

The journey went relatively smoothly. Ranran couldn’t afford to casually expend true qi now, so Shen Kuo hired a carriage at the foot of the mountain to take her.

Sitting in the carriage, since they had nothing else to do, Ranran chatted with Shen Kuo, “Did you grow up on Red Flame Mountain when you were young?”

Shen Kuo shook his head. He was the descendant of the former Crimson Gate Leader. When the old master had been killed by Wei Jiu, he hadn’t been born yet, so he had never stayed on Red Flame Mountain.

Ranran hummed a song for a while, then suddenly said, “Since you’ve never been to Red Flame Mountain and are not familiar with the terrain there, how did you manage to go up and down the mountain in less than an hour?”

Shen Kuo was puzzled by the question, “Fourth senior sister, what are you talking about? Why don’t I understand?”

Ranran looked at him and said, “Do you remember when I brought everyone’s clothes and shoes to wash at the creek? I found something interesting. The soles of the shoes of senior brother and the others were stained with the unique red clay from the top of Red Flame Mountain, which was very difficult to wash. But junior Yue Sheng, who didn’t go up the mountain, had clean shoes. However, you… who were supposedly taking care of junior Yue down the mountain, your shoes also had red clay. Junior brother, can you explain to me what happened?”

Shen Kuo was at a loss for a moment. Then his face filled with shame as he said, “Senior sister, I was wrong. I indeed didn’t take good care of junior brother. At that time, he had fallen asleep. I was bored and also worried about you all. So I left Yue Sheng one time to investigate, but I got lost up there and came back down. I know it was wrong to leave him alone by himself. I won’t dare to do it again in the future.”

Ranran shook her head. “You weren’t bored; you were scheming carefully. That’s why you gave Yue Sheng a sleeping pill, deliberately creating an alibi and going up the Red Flame Mountain. I asked Yue Sheng, and he said he fell asleep when the sun was high, exactly when Shifu and I accidentally went in the crevice. When you secretly went up the mountain at that time, what were you planning to do? And the tub of enhanced golden water, you also secretly drained it, didn’t you?”

Shen Kuo chuckled lowly, his usually shy and reserved demeanor now tainted with a sinister aura.

“Fourth senior sister, you’re really wasting your talents not becoming a magistrate for criminal cases. Just an oversight on the soles of shoes have led you to so many conclusions. Yes, I did sneak up the mountain. After all, welcoming the bones of the Demon King is an important event. To take it away under the noses of everyone on Red Flame Mountain requires some effort. As for that golden water… if it weren’t for your meddling, our grand plan would have been accomplished by now, and why would I need to waste time talking to you here?”

Ranran stood upright now, looking at him warily. “Who exactly are you?”

Previous
Next

逆徒难弃 HARD TO CAST OFF A WAYWARD DISCIPLE

Shen Kuo burst into laughter. “Of course, I am Shen Kuo. If this identity were fake, how could I fool someone so cunning like Su Yi Shui? He wants to use me? Well, I am also using him, aren’t I?”

Ranran stared at him. “What is your connection with the Fan Tian Sect?”

Shen Kuo gave her a thumbs up. “You even figured that out?”

Ranran was just trying to bluff, but she didn’t expect Shen Kuo to admit to it so readily.

She had previously asked Elder Jiu about the sinister skills used by those who had abducted him from Cuiwei Mountain, which seemed similar to the exterminated Fan Tian Sect.

And since then, the Fan Tian Sect had reappeared now and then, with intricate connections to the Demon King.

Shen Kuo’s careful plotting to obtain the skull, made his connection to the Fan Tian Sect seem evident.

They had traveled far from West Mountain, leaving towns behind, and reached a remote area with no passersby. Shen Kuo felt that since Ranran had discovered him, there was no need to hide anymore, he might as well reveal his intentions and just kidnap her.

Even if Xue Ranran didn’t speak up, Shen Kuo had already planned to move and take action after they have gone on a little further. Now that she had seen through him, it was still just going ahead with his original plan.

“I am indeed Shen Kuo, but also the Protector Elder of the Fan Tian Sect. Xue Ranran… no, I should call you Mu Qingge. You are also essential to the revival of our Fan Tian Sect. How about it? Since Xishan doesn’t want you, why not come with me?”

His family had fallen, suppressed by Wei Jiu, and if he hadn’t joined the Fan Tian Sect by chance, he would have been hunted down and killed by Wei Jiu’s disciples long ago.

Now, only by reviving the Fan Tian Sect could he return to Red Flame Mountain and exact revenge on Wei Jiu.

Xue Ranran chuckled. “I didn’t expect Xishan to have such talents, even a prominent Elder figure from a lost demonic sect. You sure brag shamelessly, asking me to leave with you without even telling me what you need me for?”

Shen Kuo waved his hand and conjured a creepy talisman with purple light. Smiling sinisterly, he said “In the grand revival of the Fan Tian Sect, both you and Su Yi Shui are indispensable. Since you won’t cooperate willingly, don’t blame me, your junior, for being offensive!”

His technique wasn’t taught by Xishan. When the talisman advanced, it carried a sinister aura, chilling to the bone.

Ranran tried to use qi to control her swords to break his talisman, but found the purple light seemingly indestructible, like an impenetrable web closing in on her.

As she was enveloped, her spiritual energy seemed suppressed as well. Her swords fell from her control and clattered to the ground.

Shen Kuo could tell that Ranran had no strength left to defend herself and couldn’t help but smirk. He had initially planned to take care of Su Yi Shui first, then deal with Xue Ranran.

But unexpectedly, after their bickering during the journey back to West Mountain, Su Yi Shui decided to expel Xue Ranran out of the sect.

It would seem that he wouldn’t tolerate his former mentor for a moment longer.

Shen Kuo originally didn’t want to act rashly, but seeing even the Rebirth Tree in Xue Ranran’s courtyard uprooted, it seemed like those two had no room left for reconciliation.

This was a heaven-sent opportunity, too good to miss.

Now, Shen Kuo didn’t want to waste any more time. He summoned the ancient long-lost Deity Killing Talisman. With Xue Ranran’s current strength, she would not be able to withstand this ancient demonic array. Once subdued, she would soon lose consciousness and be easy to capture.

Shen Kuo felt he could carry her away soon.

Ranran collapsed very quickly. At this moment, he suddenly felt a cold wind come up from behind him. Without time to turn around, he quickly dodged sideways.

In spite of his quick reflexes, his spiritual shield was still shattered.

A sharp sword pierced his back. Shen Kuo could only move to let the blow narrowly miss his heart but still received a serious wound.

By the time he turned around, he saw the person controlling the sword swiftly advancing towards him.

The person with a solemn killing intent was none other than Su Yi Shui, who should have been in seclusion at West Mountain.

Shen Kuo’s spiritual prowess was much higher than what he had shown at Xishan. If not for this sword strike, Su Yi Shui, whose spiritual energy had been depleting of late, might not have been his match.

Just then, Ranran, who had fallen to the ground, suddenly leaped up as well. Clearly, her previous display of weakness was a deception to catch him off guard.

What could lull someone into a sense of complacency than almost defeating your prey?

But unfortunately for him, these two was seamlessly in sync. Shen Kuo’s carelessness allowed Su Yi Shui to gain the upper hand. When he finally reacted, Su Yi Shui’s hand was already on his back, absorbing his spiritual energy without restraint.

Su Yi Shui’s dantian was very empty, how could a starving person resist such a meal?

Shen Kuo was alarmed; at this rapid rate, he would soon be drained by Su Yi Shui.

So, he didn’t care about Xue Ranran anymore and drew out his sword to turn and attack Su Yi Shui.

Its too bad that, Su Yi Shui was already prepared and quickly affixed an immobilizing charm drawn by Elder Jiu on Shen Kuo’s forehead.

Although Elder Jiu was somewhat unreliable, his charms were still very effective. Shen Kuo was not only stabbed but also immobilized by the charm, leaving him with no other tricks.

Su Yi Shui then walked over with quick strides, took up Ranran’s wrist to check her pulse, asking her, “How is it, are you alright?”

Ranran shook her head and then said, “Ask him quickly, what does the Fan Tian Sect intend to do by scheming against us like this?”

Su Yi Shui nodded and stood up, taking out a Truth-telling Charm and affixing onto Shen Kuo.

Shen Kuo knew he had fallen into a trap. Although trapped, he remained calm and collected, only sneering coldly as he stared at the couple who had conspired against him. But when he saw Su Yishui stick a Truth-telling Talisman on him, his eyes suddenly filled with desperate fear.

“Master, I was wrong, please don’t ask me. I’ve already made a Soul Oath. If certain things are revealed, my soul will be destroyed and I’ll never be reincarnated!”

Shen Kuo knew the power of the Truth-telling Talisman and suddenly cried and pleaded in fear.

But Su Yi Shui remained unmoved, speaking coldly, “Where is the skull of the Demon King now? Who is the mastermind behind all these? What are you planning to do after capturing Ranran?”

Although unwilling, under the effect of the Truth-telling Charm, he had to answer truthfully to any questions.

So, even though he was reluctant, he had to speak, “The skull was taken by Mu Ranwu’s subordinates and sent to the Eternal Sea in the southeast. As for the mastermind behind this, we all in the Fan Tian Sect obey…”

When he reached this point, Shen Kuo, who was immobilized, suddenly widened his eyes, and his body spontaneously combusted, flames erupting from him…

He seemed to know he couldn’t escape death and let out a mournful laugh, “Fan Tian descends, changes the world, aids in the revival of gods, even in death… there’s life!”

In an instant, Shen Kuo had turned into a charred corpse, his burnt body dispersing and disappearing with the wind.

It seemed that what he had said before was indeed true. Someone had set a fatal seal on him; even if he wanted to reveal the mastermind behind the scenes, he would immediately be burnt to ashes, leaving nothing behind.

Ranran felt regretful. “Just who are these people, how can they have such great power? And where did this Fan Tian Sect come out from?”

Initially, back when she discovered the anomaly with the shoes by the stream, she had used voice channeling to secretly inform Su Yi Shui, whom she hadn’t spoken to for a few days.

So, the two of them devised a plan, deciding not to *startle the snake and see what Shen Kuo was up to. *alert the enemy

Ranran had gone down the mountain with the intention to branch out their forces. She would pretend to leave but would hide in the shadows to track Shen Kuo and his accomplices.

However, she did not expect Shen Kuo to chase after her and insist on escorting her, so Ranran went along with it.

But when Ranran noticed he changed the route and headed to a remote area, where he may likely meet up with his accomplices, she realized she might not be able to handle it if they continued forward. So, she suddenly confronted him, exposing Shen Kuo’s true intentions.

Now that Shen Kuo had been burnt to ashes, their only clue was lost again.

“You knew he was suspicious, yet you went with him? Are you trying to get yourself killed?” After taking Ranran’s pulse and replenished her qi, Su Yi Shui asked her with a stern face.

Ranran also had not expected Shen Kuo’s hidden strength to be so formidable. He claimed to be an Elder of the Fan Tian Sect. The two imposing individuals around Mu Ranwu also seemed to be members of the Fan Tian Sect.

It seemed that this resurgent Fan Tian Sect was not to be underestimated. Even if the righteous forces of the world united, they might not be a match for this demonic sect!

However, when they had devised the plan with Su Yi Shui earlier, they only said she would be going home to visit her family, and there was no mention of her being expelled from Xishan.

Ranran felt that Su Yi Shui had turned what begun as pretense into something real, under the guise of hoodwinking Shen Kuo, to accomplish what he had always wanted to do.

Since he was no longer her master now, it was inappropriate for him to reprimand her like a father.

“Of course it was because I had sensed that you were following us, so I revealed my cards to him… Since the traitor within Xishan has been successfully exposed, Shen Kuo is dead, there’s no further need for me to covertly follow him. Although what I said in the study was an excuse, it was also half true. I do want to go back and see my parents.”

As Ranran spoke, she withdrew her wrist from Su Yi Shui’s large palm.

Su Yi Shui watched as her small hand quickly retracted in a split moment like a slippery fish, his expression turned even colder. “I know you were speaking from your heart, but right now, you are also a target of the Fan Tian Sect. Rushing to go to your parents may expose them to unnecessary risks…”

Ranran also knew this and said, “I’ll find a way on my own. Mister Su, please go back soon.”

This time, Su Yi Shui unceremoniously grabbed her wrist. “What? I expelled you, so you’re upset?”

Ranran pretended to be light-hearted. “What’s there to be upset about? Since we have no relationship now, you can also relax…”

Su Yi Shui droned on “Even though you’re no longer my disciple, but I am still yours. We never dissolved our master-disciple relationship back then. As your disciple, how can I let my ill and weak Master wander the world?”

“Ah? Didn’t you… defect from the sect back then?” Ranran gaped, recalling the proud tone with which her second uncle master had spoken about this.

Su Yi Shui now experienced firsthand how once this girl severed ties, she would immediately heartlessly rebuff people she once knew.

When he said he would expel her, he was only in jest. He just wanted to see the young girl’s surprised expression when caught off guard.

But he didn’t expect that this woman, even after her rebirth, *she still behaved like she didn’t give a damn, and wouldn’t take anything with her when she left!
*from poem 徐志摩的《再别康桥》
悄悄的我走了,正如我悄悄的来；我挥一挥衣袖,不带走一片云彩

So, he paused and said mildly, “Yutong said that although I had left back then, you never officially expelled me from Xishan. In the end, you even made me the sect master of West Mountain. The master-disciple relationship still stands, and you can’t shake off our connection!”

Ranran blinked her eyes in disbelief; she never imagined that one day she would be able to stand above Su Yi Shui.

So does that mean, she could be his master?

Unable to contain her laughter, she said, “Are you serious? Then I won’t stand on ceremony…”

When Ranran finally showed a sly smile like a mischievous child, Su Yi Shui felt a sense of relief in his heart. For some reason, he couldn’t stand her with an indifferent expression, being uncaring about her own life or death.

Her white and tender face, still looked better with a smile, even though this brat was not above to take a yard after giving her an inch. After hearing his words, she actually changed her gaze and dragged out her words, “Shui’er… go, fetch some clean water for your master!”

This rascal, intentionally calling him “Shui’er,” which she knew he hated the most.

A vindictive smile also gradually appeared on Su Yi Shui’s handsome face. “…Master, have you ever heard of the term ‘wayward’ in this world? What a coincidence, I am just that kind of rebellious and unfilial disciple!”

Now Ranran also experienced the struggles of Mu Qingge. It was really likely to end up dying young after taking in an unruly disciple!

Now, although Xue Ranran had taken on the title of Su Yi Shui’s master, she had none of the authority that came with being a master.

After they came out of the dense forest, they did not return to Xishan in a hurry. Stopping in a town to eat, Ranran saw some freshly made raw marinated large crabs in a small inn, full of golden yellow roe, and she really wanted to eat it.

But Su Yi Shui forbade her with a stern face, saying that she was weak now and eating something wrong might cause trouble for her stomach.

If Su Yi Shui had indulged her like a doting father in the past, trying to compensate and fulfill her desires as much as possible, now he was like a debtor from her past life, with a sour face and contradicting Ranran at every turn.

She could endure in other matters, but when it came to food, Ranran was as persistent as Elder Jiu. When he refused to let her eat it, Ranran became truly angry, suggesting politely once again that they should part ways.

Their bond between master and disciple was shallow, there was no need to force it. She could go through the formalities now and call it quits, each going their own merry way.

Su Yi Shui snorted coldly, “You want to part ways, but do you have the ability? Defeat me, then talk about severing our master-disciple ties!”

It turned out that this annoying bond between master and disciple was even harder to sever than a couple divorcing! And the key was there wasn’t even a court to complain to, it truly left one speechless.

Ranran’s face fell slightly as she poked dejectedly at her rice with her chopsticks. Su Yi Shui watched her coldly, perhaps feeling satisfaction over controlling his master…

They stayed in an inn temporarily. At night, Su Yi Shui knocked on her door carrying a small earthen pot.

It turned out Su Yi Shui had found the small shop unclean; there seemed to be something dirty in the nails of the person who prepared the crabs.

So, he gone back with live crabs he had bought, spending money to have the chef prepare a serving separately for him.

Customers are king and Su Yi Shui was generous with payment, so the chef obediently washed his hands, trimmed his nails, cleaned the crabs thoroughly, prepared the ingredients, and made this one pot, all clean and proper.

But Su Yi Shui still pulled a long face. He could not understand why he acted this way, and it felt preposterous to him that he did it. However, when he later saw Ranran holding the pot as if it were a precious treasure, his expression improved slightly.

The next morning, after the crabs had been fully marinated and sliced open, the rich yellow crab roe spread over steaming rice, drizzled with the marinate sauce, was incredibly delicious.

Su Yi Shui had not believed when Yutong told him, that he had once indulged this girl and taken her all over the streets of the capital to eat at different stalls.

But now, watching her satisfied expression and bright shining eyes as she ate, he couldn’t help but think that he might really have been bewitched enough to travel around to indulge her love for food and drink.

After devouring a large crab, Ranran felt a bit embarrassed but smiled at her rebellious disciple. He may look cold, but he was still the same soft-hearted master.

So, she quickly put peeled crab legs and roe into Su Yi Shui’s bowl.

“Shifu, eat while the rice is hot. If you’re afraid of the cold-nature of the crab, you can drizzle some ginger juice.”

Su Yi Shui accepted the bowl slowly. “Why are you calling me Shifu again? Weren’t you planning not to acknowledge me, and not seeing me ever again?”

Ranran scooped a spoonful and brought it to Su Yi Shui’s mouth, coaxing him like a child, “I’m so young, how can I be your master? Even if you have expelled me from West Mountain, I’m still used to calling you Shifu…”

She brought up her age, and Su Yi Shui’s handsome face soured a bit more as he dragged his words, “Am I that old?”

Ranran quickly waved her hand “Not old, not old at all! Eating this mouthful of crab will help maintain your youthful appearance!”

Su Yi Shui snorted coldly and finally ate the spoonful of crab from Ranran’s hand.

Come to think of it, this was the first time just the two of them ate amicably together since Ranran’s past life was revealed.

Su Yi Shui also didn’t want to bring up their past grievances for now. He wasn’t very hungry to begin with, so after a few bites, he peeled a whole crab for Ranran, letting her eat to her heart’s content.

This kind of raw marinated food was fine to indulge in occasionally, but if eaten too often, won’t it be harmful to health?
