Ranran no longer had the hobby of collecting handsome men in this life, but her love for food was stronger than before. Perhaps it was her last lingering obsession before her soul was scattered.

After finishing the meal, the two finally discussed their next steps. Su Yi Shui said, “I deliberately left my aura at the top of West Mountain. If there’s still a traitor at Xishan, they would think I’m still in seclusion there. We should take this opportunity to find Mu Ranwu first, to locate the whereabouts of that skull. If we find out about the lair of Fan Tian Sect, we won’t have to be passive anymore.”

Mu Ranwu’s whereabouts were not as conspicuous as before.

However, with a little effort, they were still able find out. It was said that she was heading towards the Huainan area, seemingly going towards the sea.

This coincided with Ranran’s previous wish to travel south. Su Yi Shui recalled Ranran saying she wanted to travel to the mountains and rivers, so now they could enjoy themselves along the way.

On inconsequential matters, Su Yi Shui didn’t mind indulging Xue Ranran a bit. Especially now with unknown enemies lurking in the shadows; they couldn’t risk using their true qi to reveal their whereabouts.

So, they didn’t even use concealment techniques but hired a boat to travel south along the river.

As for the Rebirth Tree, Su Yi Shui had actually sealed it within a glass bead using enchantments.

The shallow soil inside the bead was said to be the *residual magical soil left behind by **Gun, the father of Dayu who controlled the flood waters. When exposed to wind, this soil would extend several miles, blocking river channels, making it very precious. The weak little tree was planted on this soil, and the Rebirth Tree was sealed within the bead, put on a silver chain, and placed around Ranran’s neck.
*息壤 xirang is magical soil in chinese mythology, has the ability to self expand and grow
**鲧禹治水

In Su Yi Shui’s words, this Rebirth Tree was no ordinary tree of the mortal realm, but had been held up here, slowly losing what’s left of its spiritual energy.

He contemplated for a long time and finally came up with this method, planting the Rebirth Tree on the xirang soil to see if it could alleviate Ranran’s debilitating symptoms.

After wearing this specially-made necklace, Ranran’s complexion improved significantly over the next few days, and her fair skin finally regained a rosy hue like peach petals.

So during the day, Su Yi Shui accompanied her to explore mountains and sight-seeing and when the moonlight sprinkled over the river, she accompanied Su Yi Shui in meditation, absorbing the essence of the *sun and moon.
*moonlight is still reflected sunlight lol

Perhaps it was because Su Yi Shui had originally given her half of his golden core, so when they sat together in meditation, their vitality qi in their dantian connected. Circulating in harmony, their cultivation surpassing several times over compared to when they had practiced alone.

In the past, Su Yi Shui seemed to have a restraining fear due to Ranran’s weak body. In the foundational cultivation, it was all about gradual progress, guiding her step by step into deeper realms.

But now with an unknown major enemy rapidly approaching, Su Yi Shui only hoped Ranran could become stronger, at least enough to protect herself. Therefore, his demands became even stricter than before.

Although Ranran had extraordinary talent in cultivation, her enlightenment far surpassing many peers, she was still far from meeting Su Yi Shui’s demanding requirements.

For example, today, Su Yi Shui taught her the mantra of Thunderous Passage, requiring Qi to penetrate the meridians instantly while also unleashing a critical hit.

Ranran had no problem with the Qi penetrating the meridians, but unleashing a critical hit required using the power of *Gen and Shen.
*I don’t know how to explain these, I suppose we can think of them as acupoints to channel power from?

She couldn’t grasp this Gen and Shen power. Su Yishui only mentioned it was a tongue-root technique, combined with Dan Tian activation.

But as Ranran activated her Qi while silently moving her tongue, she couldn’t grasp the technique.

The Thunderous Passage was a unique skill created by Su Yi Shui, just like the Qi cultivation method he had taught Gao Cang and the others before, both were breaking new ground and very profound.

Such techniques were often most difficult to master at the entry level. Once surpassed, they would be smooth and unobstructed, making rapid progress. This was also the crucial factor how Su Yi Shui had managed to surpass other powerful members of various sects in spite of his young age.

And now, Ranran was stuck at this entry step.

The two of them were now practicing a method similar to dual cultivation in sects, so they sat facing each other, very close.

When Ranran spoke with her eyes closed, the moonlight was clear and spilled on her fair face, and even the flutter of her eyelashes was illuminated by a small fishing lamp hanging on the boat, clearly seen by the man.

“Shifu, where are the Gen Shen? Why can’t I find it?” Ranran didn’t know that Su Yi Shui had been watching her attentively for a long while now. She half-tilted her head, pouting her pink lips slightly as she asked.

Her delicate chin was slightly raised, looking as if she was asking for a kiss…

Su Yi Shui didn’t know what came over him; he suddenly felt a rush of heat and abruptly leaned over, pressing his lips against hers.

Ranran’s eyes opened in shock, almost thinking that Su Yi Shui had regained his memories…

But after the passionate kiss ended, and her tongue was still tingling, Su Yi Shui lifted his head expressionlessly and said to her, “Now do you know where Gen Shen are?”

Previous
Next

重遇故人 MEETING OLD FRIENDS

Ranran didn’t expect that after the great Water-Fetching cultivation method, Su Yi Shui would create such a meticulous and attentive acupoint recognition technique.

So when they sat face to face, and she was “guided” by him, she didn’t have time to react at all, just stared at him with wide eyes.

Su Yi Shui was actually quite annoyed as well. He didn’t know what he was doing just now. It seemed like the moonlight tonight was very enchanting, clouding his judgment momentarily.

He was also suddenly inspired, for him to come up with that.

Ranran initially thought he had regained his memory, but it turned out to be in vain again. Seeing his *advantage-taking yet composed handsome face, she couldn’t help but feel mad. “Probably none of the disciples from Xishan knows where the points are. Is your tongue enough to go around? Do you need to guide each and every one of them?”
*得了便宜还卖乖 is the original phrase: won advantage but pretend to be innocent

As Su Yi Shui looked at her red lips, and her flushed and sarcastic expression, he felt another surge of heat. He didn’t know what came over him; his body seemed to act independently of his mind. He leaned down again, lowering his thick lashes and gave her some more guidance. But this time, the guidance lasted even longer, and his big palm even supported the back of her head.

This kiss was exceptionally intense, and Ranran had to close her eyes again to cope with it.

When their lips separated again, Ranran gave his chest a push and said fiercely, “I’m not practicing anymore!”

Su Yi Shui lowed his eyes, looking at her and suddenly asked, “You have kissed before?”

The first kiss was so sweet that he got a bit lost in it. But the second time, he realized that this seemingly inexperienced girl was quite responsive to him… Could it be, that she had kissed someone else before?

Thinking about this, an unfamiliar sense of jealousy surged in Su Yi Shui’s heart to his skull, the sourness giving him a bit of toothache.

After pushing him away, Xue Ranran stood up, saying loudly, “Yes, I kissed a pig before!” With that, she turned and jumped off the boat, walking on the ripples towards the riverbank.

How dare he turn the tables on the victim first? She didn’t even bring up his transgression of repeatedly kissing his female disciple from before!

If it was the past, it could be explained that Su Yi Shui couldn’t hold himself back because of his complicated feelings with two lifetimes. But now, he obviously didn’t remember his past, yet he still kissed her. But he had that calm, unaffected demeanor, which was quite infuriating!

As for his constant romantic entanglements, first with Wen Hongshan and then Mu Qingge. Surely not everyone is seduced by his handsome good looks, right? He was probably quite the experienced playboy, the Casanova of the cultivation world!

Ranran suddenly wondered, would he behave the same way if the person sitting before him was Qiu Xi’er or some other female disciple?

The more she thought about it, the angrier she became. If her cultivation was higher, she would restore the prestige of the sect master and clean up Xishan, and punish this womanizer.

Just then, Su Yi Shui also came ashore, standing behind her and saying confidently, “So, I have kissed you before?”

She sounded so fierce that Su Yi Shui naturally could tell that she should be referring to him as the pig.

Although he was called a pig, Su Yi Shui wasn’t angry. Instead, he felt quite relieved. Although he had suspicions that he had been seduced by this girl before, it was better than her having past affairs with other men.

As Ranran turned around, she asked him directly, “If it had been Qiu Xi’er or some other female disciple just now, would you have given the same guidance?”

Su Yi Shui was slightly stunned by her scenario, finding it completely unacceptable even in imagination. He furrowed his brows and said, “I’m not someone who guides every fool!”

After hearing this, Xue Ranran felt a lot of her frustration dissipate inexplicably.

Although it seemed like he was calling her stupid, she still felt a little sweet inside. Seeing Ranran smiling with her head lowered, Su Yi Shui thought the little demoness was proud of her boundless charm, gaining yet another admirer.

So he couldn’t help but remind her, “Hey, don’t look so pleased with yourself. I really just couldn’t stand your lack of comprehension just now…”

Ranran’s face fell slightly. After shooting a glare at him, she jumped back onto the boat and resumed her meditation.

This kind of hands-on teaching was indeed effective. When Ranran performed the Thunderous Passage technique again, the energy flow through her meridians was smooth, especially at the spot where her tongue had tingled during the kiss.

Once she grasped the basics, Ranran’s cultivation progress could only be described as *making great strides.
一日千里 going thousands of miles in a day

However, during the daytime, they still visited nearby mountain villages and towns for leisure.

On this day, when they arrived at Gong County, Ranran glanced at a notice posted on the city gate and couldn’t help but go “Eh?”.

Su Yi Shui’s hands were full of snacks she had bought earlier. After hearing her exclaim, he also took a look at the notice.

It was a notice about a missing wife. Apparently, the wife had left her husband due to poverty or some other reason, and the husband was posting notices pleading for her return.

“What’s wrong? Do you know this woman in the picture?”

Ranran turned her head and whispered, “Look, doesn’t the woman in this picture resemble Zhou Feihua?”

Su Yi Shui frowned for a moment. “Zhou Feihua? I’ve only heard her name before, never met her.”

Ranran frowned. Of course, he wouldn’t remember events from the capital, including the runaway Consort Jing who had faked her own death.

But Zhou Feihua’s husband… Wasn’t it Su Yu? Could it be that Su Yu had instructed people to post wife-finding notices and was searching for Zhou Feihua?

If that were the case, she couldn’t help but worry for Consort Jing. Was Su Yu planning something drastic against her?

In the following days, as they visited several villages, they noticed more of the same notice in prominent spots. However, Su Yi Shui discovered that, there were increasingly more missing person notices on the boards. Many had no pictures, just brief descriptions of the missing persons, often mentioning disappearing near the riverbanks, with rewards offered for any information leading to their discovery, dead or alive.

What was happening here? How were so many people going missing without a trace, and why were there no bodies?

Yet in cultivation, calmness of mind was crucial. Otherwise, why would there be the practice of seclusion and meditation?

Although they had questions, they continued their routine of enjoying thoroughly during the day and practicing diligently at night.

They would rest on the boat every night, choosing a quiet stretch of river. In the stillness of the night, they would sit cross-legged, exchanging their consonance energies.

However, every time she sat facing Su Yi Shui, it was a test of Ranran’s will to calm her heart.

For instance, now when she opened her eyes during meditation, she found Su Yi Shui staring at her intently, and she wasn’t sure how long he had been watching her.

“Hey, it’s hard for me to concentrate when you are like this!”

Since the day her Shifu “guided” her so intimately with his own mouth, Ranran stopped calling him “Shifu” that she was used to, and simply referred to him as “Hey.”

After all, their relationship was too complicated, and she had already been expelled from Xishan. Calling him Shifu, would be too much flattery for him.

And so, calling him “Hey” was more efficient.

However, Su Yi Shui felt that her casual address was quite impolite. But if she called him the alienating “Mister Su” again, that would seem even less natural than “Hey.”

He wasn’t sure why he always *decided to go easy on her, but he endured her disrespectful address.
*锱铢必较 excessive nitpicking over small details 大打折扣 big discount, reduction

Even though he knew she was the reincarnation of Mu Qingge, Su Yi Shui felt that Ranran the young girl, was much more likable than in her previous life.

At least for now, she hadn’t gone astray yet. She wasn’t surrounded by so many men and Su Yi Shui found it easy to get along with her.

Most of the time, he even found it very delightful to watch her meditate or eat.

Beautiful things naturally attracted more attention, and he only realized he was staring at her again after he heard Ranran’s protests.

Nevertheless, he always remained calm and composed. Even when he was caught, he would just close his eyes leisurely.

As Ranran looked at the man with closed eyes, his thick brows, straight nose, and long eyelashes longer than those of a girl’s… even his attractive lips was enchanting, and she couldn’t help but keep staring as well.

During this period of time, it was actually a rare chance for the two of them to be alone together, reminding her of the happiness she had felt on the sea island. If time could freeze at this moment, would she also have no regrets in this life?

She stared blankly, lost in thought. The man sitting opposite her suddenly opened his eyes and caught her staring .

“You don’t let me look at you, yet you stare at me like this. What do you have to say about that?”

Ranran didn’t expect him to suddenly open his eyes, and felt a bit embarrassed. She could only force herself to say, “You’re good-looking, but won’t allow others to look?”

Su Yi Shui looked at her *enigmatically and suddenly said, “You have half of my golden core and have my aura, so you’re not allowed to flirt with other men.”
*高深莫测

It would seem that her past fault of being lustful hadn’t changed. She still liked looking at handsome men, and every time Su Yi Shui thought of the numerous young men who surrounded Mu Qingge in her past life, he felt very annoyed.

Back then, he always treated Mu Qingge very coldly, rebuffing her advances.

But later, Mu Qingge met Su Yu. Because he was his junior uncle, the two looked somewhat similar. Suddenly, Mu Qingge seemed to transfer her warm affections to Su Yu, always smiling and charming with him, as if Su Yu had become his replacement.

Su Yi Shui believed he didn’t like Mu Qingge, but every time he thought about this, he felt very upset.

So seeing Ranran’s unchanged habit, to like to stare at handsome men, Su Yi Shui felt it necessary to make things clear. If she carries half of his golden core and go around cheating with other men… he wasn’t going to agree to that!

After hearing this, Ranran felt both angry and amused. “According to you, am I not allowed to be friendly with other men in this life?”

As she spoke, her big eyes shone brightly and she tilted her head slightly forward. Su Yi Shui felt tempted to guide her on activating the Genshen acupoint again.

This time, Ranran was vigilant and suddenly covered his mouth with her hand. “What are you doing? You’re not allowed to be frivolous with your master!”

If she didn’t say that, Su Yi Shui might not have found it amusing in his indignation. He smiled even more evilly “Alright then, how about this, you be frivolous with your disciple instead. Didn’t you used to love trapping me in the corridor?”

Ranran felt that he had kissed the palm of her hand blocking his lips and blushed furiously.

But she could understand herself from her past life. Teasing this kind of difficult and handsome youth was quite fun, seeing him pout and glare with his handsome face… it was really quite entertaining…

As they were teasing each other, Su Yi Shui suddenly stopped moving. Ranran also became alert because she heard faint splashing sounds underwater.

The splashing sound would be too loud for fish.

Su Yi Shui was alert and immediately pulled Ranran up, leaping out of the water.

Just as they jumped up, dozens of people wearing fishskin clothes also leaped out of the water, their sharp hooks aimed straight at the two on the boat.

Their eyes also emitted a strange blue light in the darkness.

Ranran looked carefully and realized that these people weren’t wearing fishskin clothes; rather, like the demonized woman at the Wangxiang River, their bodies were covered in sharp fish scales, and their hook-like protrusions were actually their claws on their hands.

Dozens of demonized enemies attacked them simultaneously, causing the river water to ripple, nearly capsizing the small boat.

She remembered how chaotic it was when dealing with one demonized woman in the past. Now with more than a dozen attacking them, it would be even more difficult.

But Ranran was no longer the weakling by Wangxiang River. Having just mastered the Thunderous Passage, she had a training ground to practice her skills. Easily summoning her energy, she effortlessly repelled the water demons attacking them.

But more and more of these water demons crawled out of the river, totaling about twenty or thirty, eventually flipping the entire boat into the water.

Su Yi Shui also realized the situation wasn’t good. These demonized people were empowered by the Seven Evil Transformation talismans and seemed more ferocious than the woman at Wangxiang River.

Fighting them on water would put them at a big disadvantage. So he grabbed Ranran’s arm, preparing to fly to the riverbank.

However, just as they reached the riverbank, they felt an invisible spiritual shield enveloping them, that was impervious to their attacks.

The people who set up this scheme were truly diabolical. Although these water demons weren’t a match for Su Yi Shui and Ranran, continuing like this would still exhaust a significant portion of their energy. After all, these people were driven by the Seven Evil Transformation talismans and would not feel exhaustion.

Just then, both the riverbanks suddenly erupted in loud fire crackers, cymbals and drums, accompanied by a dazzling display of fireworks.

The ferocious water demons, upon hearing the deafening firecrackers, emitted sharp and short cries, quickly turning and jumping back into the river.

Ranran understood, that these demonized water creatures feared bright lights and loud noises. In the blink of an eye, all the water demons vanished from the river.

As they disappeared, the spiritual shield overing the river also vanished.

At that moment, torches surrounded the riverbank, and a woman on horseback shouted loudly at the two standing on the overturned boat, “You two are actually still alive? Where do you skilled experts hail from?”

Ranran heard the woman’s voice and found it familiar. With the faint light from the bank, she recognized the woman on horseback and shouted happily, “Consort Jing… no, Miss Zhou, it’s me, Xue Ranran!”

It turned out that the woman on horseback was none other than Consort Jing, who escaped from the cold palace by feigning death, and now known as Zhou Feihua.

When she escaped from the palace, she had vowed to travel far and wide. Since then, there had been no news of her until a few days ago when they saw the notices looking for her. In the blink of an eye, they have reunited here.

At that moment, Zhou Feihua also recognized Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui.

When the two of them jumped onto the riverbank, Zhou Feihua breathed a sigh of relief. “Heaven truly blessed us. I was just thinking of sending someone to West Mountain to ask for your help, but I didn’t expect you to already be here.”

Ranran recalled the shocking scene just now and asked, “What has happened here? How did so many demonized creatures appear?”

Zhou Feihua sighed and turned to the dozen or so elders behind her. “Gentlemen elders, these two are powerful cultivators. With their help, the villages along the river might have a chance.”

The villagers saw the two of them fighting off so many water demons and still managing to escape unharmed, their previously troubled faces now showing a hint of joy.

After speaking, Zhou Feihua turned to Ranran and Su Yi Shui again. “This area is near the water, and after these water demons gather their strength, they will strike again. Hurry with me into the village. Once we’re in, I’ll explain everything in detail.”

So Su Yi Shui and Ranran followed Zhou Feihua to the QiongQi Village by the river.

The entire village seemed to be in a state of war, with the outer walls surrounded by fences made of thorns. Outside the fences, there was a ten meter wide ditch filled with white lime powder.

Usually, the villagers were frugal and rarely kept lamps burning through the night unless they had children studying in the family.

But now, every household in the village had lanterns hanging high at the door, illuminating the night like a festival, albeit lacking the joyous atmosphere. The village was silent, devoid of laughter and chatter.

Occasionally, the sound of a child crying at night seemed to be quickly suppressed by the adults, the entire village was shrouded in an undeniable terror.

Zhou Feihua was still dressed in men’s clothing, but instead of a coiled bun, she had a long thick braid tied behind her head, giving her a clean and crisp appearance.

After inviting Su Yi Shui and Ranran into her temporary residence in the village community, she had food and drinks brought in and began to talk about her experiences during this period.

It turned out that shortly after her feigned death, portraits of her began appearing in various prefectures and counties, with people secretly searching for her.

Later, she found out that her feigned death had been discovered by Su Yu. She didn’t know if the emperor couldn’t sleep at night and wanted to watch someone to do a sword dance again to ease his mind, but was frustrated because he couldn’t find a suitable one. So, he remembered her sleepless nights of sword dancing for him, and out of boredom, he suddenly dispatched a large number of people to search for her whereabouts.

Zhou Feihua had already seen through it all and didn’t think the emperor was reminiscing about old feelings. She just felt that the emperor was just used to having things his way, and he was feeling a bit resentful since he wasn’t the one who called it quits.

So, she did not dare to go to bustling places anymore and ended up here.

The people here were simple and the grains were fragrant. Few villagers ventured into the city, and even if they did, no one bothered to look at the missing wife notices.

Zhou Feihua had originally planned to stay here for a while before going to the Eastern Islands to visit Fusang.

However, just ten days ago, people in the village began disappearing while fishing by the river. Given the heavy rain and waves on those days, accidents were understandable.

But soon after, traces of water monsters were found by the river. Zhou Feihua had seen the water demon sent into the capital from Wangxiang Pass, so she immediately understood that someone here was deliberately kidnapping the villagers and turning them into water demons.

Although the local village elders reported to the authorities, the constables they sent also went missing. Combined with the previous monster attacks, the stationed troops in various places were preoccupied.

Small villages like QiongQi village were at the bottom of the list even in emergencies. Fortunately, the Miss Zhou currently residing here was righteous.

After saving the village head’s daughter-in-law with her sword at the riverside, she organized local patrols to monitor the riverbanks and had the villagers dig ditches and spread lime powder to block the invasion of the water demons.

Just three days ago, the water demons attempted to attack the village at night. Unfortunately, they had water on them and screamed in pain as soon as they burned as they crawled over the lime.

And Zhou Feihua has discovered their weaknesses, and had people sounding gongs, drums, and set off fireworks, scaring off the water demons.

Tonight, Zhou Feihua was patrolling the riverbank as usual when she saw a fishing boat with a lit lamp capsizing in the river. Countless blue eyes were shimmering, and she thought a passing passenger boat was in trouble, so she quickly led people to set off fireworks, only to find out that the ones rescued were Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran.

Ranran didn’t expect to encounter Zhou Feihua here. She only knew that Zhou Feihua had a very close relationship with Elder Mu, and they had been good sisters.

But now that she knew she was Mu Qingge’s reincarnation, which meant Zhou Feihua was her friend from her past life.

So, when she looked at Zhou Feihua, Ranran couldn’t help but hold Zhou Feihua’s hand, but she didn’t know what to say.

After all, she had no memories of her past life. If she rashly acknowledged their sisterhood, there wouldn’t be any old feelings to continue either.

However, Zhou Feihua obviously didn’t know Ranran’s true identity. Still, she had many things on her mind that she wanted to share with her, since Ranran knew of her past.

That night, because they needed to discuss tracking down the water demons, Ranran and Zhou Feihua shared a room.

Ranran had originally planned to sit cross-legged on a chair and meditate all night, but Zhou Feihua insisted on sleeping together and sharing secrets.

“Why are you sitting so far away? I have to shout to talk to you. Skipping meditation for one night won’t delay your path to become an immortal.”

Ranran also loved to be slack off. After hearing this, she took off her outer robe and lay down next to Zhou Feihua. “Consort Jing, I saw notices in nearby counties with your portrait on them. But they were written with hopes of a runaway wife returning home, the family not holding grudges, and such…. Is Su Yu looking for you?”

Zhou Feihua chuckled sarcastically. “What Consort Jing? That notice is just lifting the final veil that is concealing shame. No matter how grand the palace and my previous status, I was still just a concubine. He couldn’t directly express himself because of royal dignity, so he gave me the identity of a fugitive legitimate wife in the notice. When I have the time, I’ll express my gratitude facing towards the capital.”

Ranran blinked and asked softly “Why does he want you to go back?”

Zhou Feihua turned and looked at the young girl’s face full of spirit and charm, and sighed, “You’re still young and don’t understand that men can be despicable at times. When you think he is dazzling, he would see you as insignificant as weeds and stones. But when he realized he missed a convenient woman by his side, he thought he could just beckon and bring her back. My father said that the emperor sent people to the ancestral home several times, hinting for my return. He can forgive the past and won’t charge me with the crime of deceiving the emperor. Even if I had faked my death, he can let me take on the identity of Consort Jing’s cousin and re-enter the palace as a Consort…”

Ranran nodded and looked at the dignified and handsome Consort Jing “If I were a man, I would also love someone like you. It’s no wonder the dog emperor can’t let you go.”

Previous
Next

生门死门 GATES OF LIFE AND DEATH

Zhou Feihua burst into laughter and pinched Ranran’s tender cheeks, saying, “If you were a man, with this sweet talking mouth of yours, I’m afraid many girls would fall for you!”

When she talked about Su Yu, her tone was relaxed.

It was clear that Consort Jing had already emerged from the bitter and unspoken feelings she had when she left the palace. Spending time in the vast world had made her heart wild; how could she be willing to be a caged bird again?

Even if Zhou Feihua still had some lingering feelings for Su Yu, she was unwilling to go back to the past. Moreover, her father had publicly stated that she was dead, so she would not return and cause her father more worry.

After sharing her own troubles, Zhou Feihua was actually more interested in knowing Ranran’s recent situation.

When they last met, Su Yi Shui had sealed the spiritual spring with his own body, making him unusually violent and temperamental.

But now, hearing from Ranran that they had returned the spiritual spring, Su Yi Shui should have returned to normal. However, when he saw her just now, he looked indifferent and even furrowed his brow, saying, “Do I know you?”

Zhou Feihua was somewhat surprised, feeling that Su Yi Shui’s mind didn’t seem to be all there.

Explaining this would take quite some time. Ranran first asked if Consort Jing was tired, then talked about their journey from the Netherworld Realm and the Soul cleansing talisman that had been cast on Su Yi Shui.

Zhou Feihua listened lying down at first, then sat up straight when she heard that Su Yi Shui had completely forgotten his affection for Mu Qingge, she snorted coldly “When I first met Qingge, he did get angry with her because of Su Yu. It turns out that he already had improper thoughts about his master back then. Was it because he couldn’t have her, he wanted to destroy her? That was why he harmed Mu Qingge?”

Ranran felt it necessary to clear Su Yi Shui’s name and said, “It’s not like that. It was actually Mu Qingge who decided to change his destiny and prevent him from becoming a demon lord. That’s what caused the misunderstanding.”

Zhou Feihua didn’t believe it and coldly snorted, “Why are you like Mu Qingge, always speaking well of him?”

Hmm… Ranran thought that if she disclosed that she was Mu Qingge right now, given Zhou Feihua’s temperament, she might brandish a sword and demand to know what conspiracy she had with Su Yi Shui.

So Ranran decided to wait for a more suitable opportunity to reveal such explosive news.

However, she was very curious about how she and Zhou Feihua had met in their past lives. Bringing up old memories, Zhou Feihua also felt a little melancholic.

“In the past, during the rebellion of the Prince, Su Yu was still young and couldn’t support himself in the court. My father was neutral at the time and didn’t want to get involved in the royal family’s internal strife. Once, Su Yu’s whereabouts were accidentally leaked, and he was attacked. I was part of his entourage. At the time, a woman in red descended from the sky and saved Su Yu. That’s how we met. Afterwards, Mu Qingge persuaded my father to support Su Yu, and I became a guard for the war goddess in the army.”

Ranran murmured to herself, “I always couldn’t figure it out, what kind of providence made me… made her dare to risk everything and completely change it?”

Zhou Feihua also sighed deeply. Mu Qingge had not only changed Su Yishui’s sovereign destiny back then, but also altered the fate of both her and Su Yu.

She said softly, “Back then, Mu Qingge seemed to have seen some heavenly mandate that shouldn’t have been seen by mortals. Su Yi Shui’s fate was akin to that of King Zhou. Such a fate could make one rule the world as a supreme ruler, but the end would be extremely lonely. She once said that while people thought she sought fame and reputation and wanted to save the world, but she knew that she only wanted to save one person…”

Ranran listened quietly. Before, she couldn’t understand the feelings she had in her past life, but now she understood them somewhat.

The present Su Yi Shui, who had lost part of his memories, was already so aloof and arrogant. The past Su Yi Shui had been entangled in the vortex of power struggles, so he must have been extremely radical.

Back then, he had willingly invited the spiritual spring to possess him, wanting to leverage its power but not wanting to be completely controlled by it. So he chose to endure soul-rending pain every moment. If no one would save him, wouldn’t he be floating in an endless sea of suffering?

Thinking back to Su Yi Shui’s secret room in his home at the capital, where the walls were covered in shocking claw marks, one could imagine the pain he endured at the time.

Even though Su Yi Shui now resented Mu Qingge for changing his destiny, if Ranran faced such a choice as well, she would probably do the same without hesitation…

Talking about the past, Zhou Feihua suddenly remembered something Mu Qingge had told her back then, “But she once told me something nonsensical. She said that the key to the Netherworld Realm suddenly fell into her and Su Yi Shui’s hands, which was quite strange… Someone else like her, also seemed to have secretly glimpsed providence before…”

Ranran also sat up abruptly. She asked in a low voice, “Who was it, and where did they see providence?”

Zhou Feihua shook her head, “Qingge didn’t want to say more at the time, just saying that if I knew too much, I would invite trouble…”

At this point, Zhou Feihua sighed, “I once asked Mu Qingge, but she said she couldn’t remember.”

Ranran frowned, “Mu Qingge? When did you see her?”

Zhou Feihua said, “Just yesterday, I took people to transport lime from the nearby town. We encountered her on the outskirts of Huxi Town. She was leading a few disciples to capture traitors in that town. It’s said that her disciple Wang Suizhi had been tempted by the Demonic Sect and secretly took away some of her newly acquired disciples, so she tracked them all the way here to punish the rebels.”

Ranran’s eyes widened, “Did she… find them?”

Zhou Feihua said, “She should be close to finding them. When she hurriedly left me, her attendants reported something, and it seemed like they got a clue. But I told her that I’m in Qiongqi village, so if she has time, she would probably come looking for me…”

Ranran knew she couldn’t sleep tonight. Time was running out, and if she didn’t rescue her god of wealth disciple Wang Suizhi, this devoted disciple would likely be executed by Mu Ranwu that imposter .

So she got up quickly and went to knock on Su Yi Shui’s window next door.

Zhou Feihua also followed out, surprised and bewildered, “What are you doing? Are you going to bring Su Yi Shui to create trouble for Mu Qingge?”

Ranran couldn’t hide it anymore, and didn’t care if Zhou Feihua could handle it. She just said honestly, “Haven’t you ever wondered if the present Mu Qingge is still Mu Qingge? On the reincarnation tree, there were originally two fruits…”

After saying that, she tugged at her master’s sleeve and said, “Your senior brother is in trouble, do you want to come with me?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t have much affection for his senior brothers. Now, he was actually quite disapproving to seeing Xue Ranran protecting those foolish people like a mother hen.

However, he didn’t say anything. After all, they were here to investigate Mu Ranwu’s whereabouts. Since they had a clue, they naturally had to go and see what was going on.

But when they left the village, Su Yi Shui extended his arm and spun around outside the village. Then he said to Zhou Feihua, “I have set up a spirit shield here. You can enter from the main gate of the village. If there are unknown strangers, do not let them enter, or the spirit shield would no longer be effective.”

After that, the two of them disappeared into the night.

Leaving Zhou Feihua alone in the night breeze, confused about what Xue Ranran’s words meant…

According to Zhou Feihua, she had met Mu Ranwu when she was leading villagers to buy white lime powder, so Mu Ranwu should also be in Huxi Town at this time.

When they arrived near Huxi town near Qiongqi Village, it was already late at night, and there wasn’t even a night watchman in the town.

The two of them used light body techniques to cross the city walls. Ranran closed her eyes and listened intently. Apart from the snoring in the surrounding households and the sound of children crying at night, she couldn’t hear any other suspicious sounds.

How were they going to search?

Su Yi Shui said, “You and her are both fruits on the reincarnation tree, but she hasn’t absorbed much of my core, so I can’t locate her either. See if you can find a way to sense her presence at a closer distance.”

Ranran understood what Su Yi Shui meant. But now, trying to sense Mu Ranwu was as mysterious as trying to communicate telepathically with a long-lost sister.

But unable to rely on metaphysics, there were other methods. She could guess why Wang Suizhi came here.

Although his business was spread all over the world, the more remote ones were still here in the Jiangnan area. When he hurriedly left with those children, he must have thought about their placement.

They were still young and couldn’t protect themselves. Even if he gave them money, it wouldn’t be enough. So he probably wanted to send these children to his shop as apprentices, learn some skills, and support themselves in the future.

With this in mind, they now had a direction. They just needed to look on the signboards of those shops, taking note of those bearing the Shanxi Wang name. The largest business of Wang Suizhi here was a rice shop.

When they landed from the eaves and came to the rice shop with the sign of Shanxi Wang Rice Shop, they could feel that something was wrong when they stood in front of the tightly closed gate.

The sign on the main door said “Closed for five days.” It was originally a shop selling rice, but they could smell a strong fishy stench, and water was seeping out from under the door.

Su Yi Shui and Ranran exchanged looks and then leaped onto the roof together, peeling off the tiles to look down.

Under the moonlight pouring in, they saw several people tied to the pillars in the shop, some of them seemed to be children.

Su Yi Shui jumped down first, followed by Ranran. After they landed, the shop was still silent, and those people with lowered heads still remained motionless, presenting an eerie sight.

When Su Yi Shui lit a spirit fire with his palm, Ranran could see the faces of those bound people clearly. She couldn’t help but gasp.

It turned out that those people dressed as shop assistants had deep blue scales covering their faces with tightly closed eyes. Ranran also recognized that the children were the ones who had escaped from Mu Ranwu, and the bearded man with scales growing on his body was indeed Wang Suizhi.

These people were covered in thick white foam, emitting a fishy smell. Water was flowing continuously under their feet, spreading across the entire floor of the shop.

Clearly, they had been cursed and were undergoing a transformation.

Ranran quickly took out the Clear Mind Pill she refined and stuffed it into Wang Suizhi’s mouth. She used her palm to catalyze the pill’s effects.

Wang Suizhi gasped and half-opened his eyes with difficulty. When he recognized Xue Ranran, he weakly exclaimed, “Miss Xue, please leave this place quickly!”

Ranran comforted him, “Don’t be afraid, I’m here to save you all!”

Hearing this, Wang Suizhi’s eyes filled with tears, “My master… she’s gone mad! She actually colluded with some unknown Demonic cult. After they broke into the rice shop, they placed us under curses and bound us all. My master… master said those who betrayed her would suffer a life worse than death, and we would soon transform into water demons, becoming weapons of murder… Alas, my ability can see the life and death gates of others, but I didn’t know this town would be my own grave… My body has already started to change, maybe I will lose my sanity soon… I don’t want to harm people, please, Miss Xue, do me a favor, give me a quick and painless death. It’s just that those children were harmed because of me, I can only repay their lives in the next life!”

Ranran took out more pills and gave it to the shop assistants and the children. Then she said, “It’s not the end yet, why talk so pessimistically? These Seven Evil Transformation Curses are based on people’s greed. You are a good person, believe in yourself to suppress the spread of this curse. Before we come up with a solution, you must hold on!”

While they were talking, Su Yi Shui had quickly checked the entire shop. There was a passage behind the shop leading to the moat, usually convenient for boats to transport grain. The back door was half-open at this time.

The reason why no one was guarding here was that they had already hung the closed sign on the shop’s gate. When the people in the shop completed their transformation, these transformed people would certainly be driven by the evil talismans to jump into the river and be dispatched by others.

After the remaining people woke up, they were all shocked by their current state and started wailing in fear.

Wang Suizhi was quick-witted, fearing to attract attention, so he asked them to keep quiet and not scream. Su Yi Shui had already channeled the river water to wash away the sticky foam covering their bodies, and after letting them down, he saw strange runes tattooed on their backs with cinnabar.

It seems that these are why they are transforming.

However, the matter of undoing the talisman is not something Ranran and Su Yi Shui are good at. It seems that they were going to need Elder Jiu to help.

After saving everyone, Ranran planned to temporarily place them in the cave outside Qiongqi village.

The villagers have been frightened badly by the water demons these days. If they see these strange and ghostly figures, they might swarm up and beat them to death with sticks.

Did Mu Ranwu hate Wang Suizhi’s betrayal so much that she didn’t immediately kill him but used such a sinister method to torture him.

Ranran thought of the people who were accompanying Mu Ranwu, who seemed to be members of the Fantian Sect. Maybe they were eager to create a large number of water demons to expand their power, so they didn’t let go of anyone they could use.

Thinking back to the water demons they encountered on the river before, those were just missing fishermen. Obviously, their numbers were not enough, and even adding the few people in this rice shop wouldn’t make much difference.

If that’s the case, will Mu Ranwu continue to create closed places like the rice shop and curse more people?

Ranran considered if she were Mu Ranwu, where would she go next to continue to harm others.

Thinking of this, she couldn’t help but shudder. She just thought of QiongQi village which was full of people,

That village was secluded, out in the middle of nowhere. If the entire village was closed off, and everyone in it underwent a transformation, it would be a while before anyone would notice.

Su Yi Shui also thought of this. After contemplating for a moment, he said mildly, “I shouldn’t have left an entry point for the village. I wonder if your old bestie understood what you said?”

If she believed Mu Ranwu’s dishonest rhetoric and opened the village gate for her, the entire village would be done for.

In fact, shortly after Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran left the village, Mu Ranwu already rushed to Qiongqi Village with her people in the night.

The entire village had people on duty at night to guard against water demons. But the person on duty recognized Mu Ranwu from when they were transporting limestone with Zhou Feihua.

Hearing she was here for a visit, they were not suspicious at all, immediately about to open the village gate and laying down wooden planks for them to enter.

Mu Ranwu leisurely stood at the village gate, glanced disdainfully at the limestone-filled ditch, and calmly assessed the surroundings without any expression.

Just as Xue Ranran had anticipated, she was very satisfied with the remote terrain here. Even if the entire village underwent a transformation, there would be no contact with the outside world.

With Mu Qingge’s friendship with Zhou Feihua, she believed it would be easy to gain Zhou Feihua’s trust.

Although she could directly attack the village, wouldn’t it be easier to subdue these fishermen without any fuss?

Thinking like this, Mu Ranwu smiled and prepared to step into the village.

However, to her surprise, the gate only opened a crack before it was immediately closed by a hand. It turned out that Zhou Feihua had arrived at the village gate at some point. She prevented the villagers on duty from opening the gate, just looked closely at the woman outside the fence, showing no joy of reunion.

Mu Ranwu thought that Zhou Feihua who was hiding in this remote place, shouldn’t have heard the news of her true identity being exposed on Red Flame Mountain, so she smiled confidently and said, “When I saw you outside the town, I didn’t have time to talk to you. Now that I’m free, I came to Qiongqi village to look for you. How about it? Won’t you invite me into the village?”

At this moment, Zhou Feihua spoke, “I heard that you asked about Wang Suizhi’s whereabouts and mentioned he had betrayed the sect and done something rebellious. Have you… found him already?”

A hint of impatience flashed in Mu Ranwu’s eyes, but she smiled again, “Of course I have found him. If such a traitor is not punished, wouldn’t it set a bad example for other disciples?”

Zhou Feihua said, “Wang Suizhi is ambitious and greedy for silver. Before the Battle of Fanyao, he embezzled military funds, which shows his character. Such a treacherous disciple, you wouldn’t let him off lightly, right?”

Mu Ranwu knew that Wang Suizhi had once embezzled military funds and thus had a feud with Zhou Feihua’s father. So she sighed along with Zhou Feihua’s words, “I know he is worthless. Now he has dug his own grave. I have a way to deal with him… Feihua, how long more are we to chat across a ditch? Can you open the gate and let me in?”

Zhou Feihua’s face showed a hint of dark and unclear expression. Finally, she clasped her fists coldly and said, “It’s getting late, and the village has set a rule of not opening the village gate at night. As an outsider, it’s not appropriate for me to break the rules. Please go back first, and I will personally go to town and pay a visit tomorrow.”

Mu Ranwu didn’t come here to socialize or meet friends. The assistants at the rice shop in town, including Wang Suizhi, might successfully undergo their transformation at noon on the day after tomorrow.

By then, more than ten water demons would break out of the rice shop and jump into the water, causing panic throughout the town. Of course, she would not be returning.

Now, it was getting dark, and it will be *midnight soon, the best time for casting the talismans. So she didn’t want to waste time talking to Zhou Feihua anymore. She suddenly leaped up, intending to rush through the ditch fence and into the village.
*夜半 称作子时 11pm-1am

However, she didn’t expect that when she leaped up, she would collide with an invisible spiritual shield, which immediately repelled her.

After Mu Ranwu was reborn, the reincarnation tree on the Jue peak had withered and died. She hadn’t benefited from the nourishment of the reincarnation tree, so her strength was not as strong as before.

Being rebounded by this domineering spiritual shield, she actually spat out a mouthful of blood.

She was in shock: Who had set up such a powerful spiritual shield here? Did they…. already know she was coming?

Actually Su Yi Shui had set up this spiritual shield before he left, to prevent the water demons from retaliating. However, he left a gap at the entrance of the village for the villagers to come and go daily. After all, people in the village still needed to go out during the day to make a living. Leaving only this one gap made it easier to guard.

Mu Ranwu had unfortunately decided to cross the fence instead, and so she suffered a significant repulsion and was injured quite badly.

Knowing she couldn’t force her way through, she immediately let her eyes well up with tears, and said softly, “Feihua, what’s wrong with you? Have the water demons scared you so much that you don’t even recognize an old friend like me?”

Zhou Feihua stared at her face intently, saying clearly, “The actual truth of Wang Suizhi embezzling military funds back then, was probably only known to Mu Qingge and me. Even though he likes money, he is not a greedy person. When he embezzled the funds, it was to prevent Mu Qingge from participating in the battle. He has a special ability, he can see one’s fortune, and he can also see the life and death gates of people. When he saw that the area around Fanyao was Mu Qingge’s death gate, he came up with this plan, willingly bearing the blame of being greedy, just to stop Mu Qingge from going to Fanyao… He was right, Mu Qingge was indeed killed in the remote Jue mountain not far from Fanyao. At that time, he blamed himself for not having enough spiritual power to see the specific location, otherwise, he definitely could have saved his master…”

She then took a breath and smiled wryly, “Unfortunately, he didn’t know that it wasn’t that Mu Qingge did not believe in his words, but she was determined to change destiny even if it meant certain death! When Mu Qingge and I were drinking alone, she even joked that with such filial disciples, her life had not been in vain, but it’s a pity that the fate between master and disciples were too shallow. If there was another life, she will definitely teach them to achieve greatness… But now you hate Wang Suizhi so much, just because he took away a few newly recruited disciples… You are so petty, you are definitely not Mu Qingge!”

When she heard this, Mu Ranwu finally realized where she had made a mistake. She couldn’t help but burst into laughter, “Every single one of you, always talking about Mu Qingge this and Mu Qingge that? Alright, I know she’s the best, so perfect that it’s suffocating. She’s impeccable to her disciples, to her friends… But how did she treat me? I’m her sister by blood! She knew I wasn’t cut out for cultivation with such a mediocre foundation, but she dragged me into the world of cultivation. I’ve been ridiculed and looked down upon ever since!”

Previous
Next

一把破剑 A LOUSY SWORD

Mu Ranwu wiped the blood from the corner of her mouth and continued bitterly, “I could have gotten married and had children, lived a simple and happy life. But I was forcibly dragged and got a glimpse into another world of cultivating immortality. Do you know how inferior and miserable I felt at that time? With my apititude, when I am old and gray, my sister will still be youthful and beautiful, ascending to immortality with her enviable cultivation. By then, I would be left alone in the mortal world, dying in loneliness and despair! What did I do wrong? My sister wasn’t killed by my hands! She was the one who didn’t want to live. She willingly traded her life so that demonic Su Yi Shui could live! I just wanted to start over, to live well, is that not allowed?”

In the last few sentences, Mu Ranwu almost roared out in madness. The bloodstains at the corner of her mouth were still there, and under the flickering flames, she seemed to exude demonic vibes.

Zhou Feihua was also shocked by her mournful expression. Although she was angry, she didn’t know what to say.

At that moment, a clear female voice sounded, “If you want to live, no one is stopping you. When you were reborn at the Rebirth tree, Su Yi Shui didn’t expose your lies and deception. But you wanted to advance yourself at the cost of harming others, stepping on bodies to climb your way up, what kind of unconscionable logic is that?”

Mu Ranwu turned her head and saw that Xue Ranran had walked out of the darkness, and the tall and handsome man beside her was none other than Su Yi Shui.

He never left Xue Ranran’s side, still following her like a shadow? This girl, who is clearly not as attractive as herself, where did she get such great charm to captivate Su Yi Shui once again?

Making the aloof and proud Su Yi Shui submit to her, was another fixation of the reborn Mu Ranwu, but the mediocre Xue Ranran effortlessly achieved it.

Mu Ranwu now felt resentment at the sound of her voice. She sneered, “So it was you who told Zhou Feihua, no wonder this village has a spiritual shield. How about it, big sister? Have you added another follower to your ranks? You must be feeling pleased?”

Zhou Feihua, upon hearing this, looked at Xue Ranran in disbelief: So this young girl who always had a good rapport with her… she’s her good friend Mu Qingge!

Su Yi Shui, had no patience for this imposter, especially after hearing her nonsensical words just now, he was utterly disgusted!

Even though he had forgotten many things, he still remembered how Mu Qingge had pampered this sister. But now, in Mu Ranwu’s words, it had all become Mu Qingge’s sins?

Such an ingrate, it would be no loss to kill her!

With these thoughts, Su Yi Shui summoned his vitality qi and attacked Mu Ranwu.

Beside Mu Ranwu were those few strange men with dull expressions, all of them highly skilled. When Su Yi Shui fought them the last time, he had been at a disadvantage.

However, it had been **over a month since their last battle. During their journey, Su Yi Shui had been exchanging energy with Ranran during practice, and not only did her cultivation improve, so did his.

When Su Yi Shui and the five attendants fought together, Ranran also soared on her sword and fought alongside Su Yi Shui against the enemies.

The benefits of practicing together was immediately obvious in this intense battle. The two advanced and retreated, attacked and defended, their tacit understanding was as if they were twins. Even without eye contact, they could predict each other’s next move just from their energy fluctuations.

Under the bright torches in the village, the man’s long robes and wide sleeves fluttered like a dragon, and the woman was petite and delicate, with a slender waist and agile movements, exuding a thunderous and clear aura. Watching them, one would be entranced, completely forgetting that this was a tough fight for survival.

At that moment, Mu Ranwu, who had been hiding in the back, suddenly blew on an ancient xun around her neck. When the xun emitted a dull sound, more than a dozen water demons covered in scales surged out of the river surrounding the village and madly rushed towards them.

Mu Ranwu knew that if things continued like this, Su Yi Shui and his disciple would eventually gain the upper hand. Her goal in coming here was to transform the entire village.

Now that Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran were entangled in a battle with the others, their protective shield would naturally weaken, and they wouldn’t have the time to deal with so many water demons, which was a perfect opportunity for her to attack the village.

Unfortunately, she had forgotten to account for one person, and that was Zhou Feihua.

Although she didn’t have cultivation, she had followed her father and Mu Qingge through life and death, a female general who fought and killed on the battlefields.

Even in the face of a group of terrifying water demons, Zhou Feihua remained calm and collected. She ordered someone to beat the drum according to their usual training, waking everyone up and forming a tight defense around the fence.

When the water-drenched water demons entered the limestone pit and their bodies touched the limestone, they immediately began to steam and boil, becoming scorching hot. The water demons couldn’t help but let out piercing screams of agony.

However, when Mu Ranwu’s ancient xun sounded again, they appear to be controlled, continuing forward expressionlessly.

At that moment, the children in the village, at Zhou Feihua’s signal, started setting off firecrackers and banging on drums and gongs.

The cacophony of these noises disrupted the sound of the ancient xun, causing the water demons to retreat again, covering their ears in pain and trying to scatter in all directions.

Mu Ranwu became worried. She squinted at the protective shield outside the village because earlier some water demons had attacked it, revealing the outline of the shield.

In a faint light, Mu Ranwu immediately noticed that the main gate of the village was not covered by the protective shield.

Casting a glance at Ranran and Su Yi Shui who were fighting the five Fan Tian cult attendants, Mu Ranwu narrowed her eyes and rushed towards the village gate.

Although some villagers did their best to stop her, how could they be a match for Mu Ranwu? They were immediately knocked flying and fell to the ground.

Zhou Feihua swung her long braid behind her and silently drew her sword from her waist, ready to engage Mu Ranwu. Mu Ranwu sneered and tried to grab the blade bare-handed, but when her hand touched Zhou Feihua’s sword, it was searing hot, causing her to scream and let go.

“What the hell is this sword?” Mu Ranwu looked at her rapidly festering hand and asked hatefully.

Zhou Feihua smiled coldly as she brandished *a sword flower and said coldly, “You can’t even recognize this sword? It’s the Jue Chen Sword that your sister used to wield.”
*the skillful and artistic technique of shaping a sword’s movements into a pattern resembling a flower, often used in martial arts or swordplay descriptions

Mu Ranwu took a closer look. Although the sword had a new handle and scabbard, the rusty sword body was indeed familiar!

Back then, her sister had always used this old sword she found in the ancient tomb on the Western Mountain. Later, Su Yu couldn’t stand to see it and bought another famous sword for her sister, decorated with jade and diamonds, exceptionally luxurious, and gave it to her sister.

At that time, Mu Qingge seemed reluctant to accept it, but under Su Yu’s insistence, she accepted the sword and then gave this lousy Jue Chen sword to her.

Mu Ranwu felt extremely aggrieved at that time, thinking that Mu Qingge was throwing this unwanted junk at her. If her sister really wanted to give something, why not give her the precious sword given by Emperor Su Yu?

So, at that time, she smiled politely, with the excuse that she didn’t like violence and swords, and declined this junk.

After being reborn from the Rebirth Tree, she had remembered to ask Su Yu for the precious sword he gave to her sister, and she finally got her wish fulfilled.

She didn’t expect that Mu Qingge had actually given this sword to Zhou Feihua!

Speaking of the Jue Chen Sword, Zhou Feihua had used it for twenty years. Although she was no longer a youthful girl, she was at the prime age for a swordsman.

Over the years, the boring palace had become an excellent place for practice. So, in terms of swordsmanship, Zhou Feihua had already comprehended the essence of the Way of the swords.

She kept firmly in mind what her good friend had said when she gave her the Jue Chen Sword. “Although this sword looks old and worn, it’s a relic of an unnamed Sword Saint. He was obsessed with swordplay, and part of his spirit is imbued in the sword. If an ordinary person uses this sword, it’s just a rusty piece of metal. But if you accompany this sword for a long time and truly understand the essence of swordsmanship, this sword will come alive, and its power is not to be underestimated. Unfortunately, I haven’t delved deep enough into the study of swordsmanship, so I’ve let down this sword somewhat. I originally wanted my sister Xiaowu to practice with this sword. Her innate talent for cultivation is not high, but if she could practice swordsmanship, she could also achieve a saintly realm… Unfortunately, she said she didn’t like swordplay, so I’m gifting it to you. You won’t dislike it, will you?”

When Zhou Feihua picked up the sword at that time, she faintly felt the killing intent of the sword. So like a woman falling in love at first sight, she naturally accepted it gratefully.

In the following years, she held this broken piece of iron in countless nights in the deep palace, dancing with it in the morning and evening, cutting through the dew and snow.

Now, as Zhou Feihua held the sword in her hand, the rust on the sword slowly faded away, emitting a chilling brilliance, even forcing Mu Ranwu to retreat a few steps again.

Zhou Feihua said icily, “You always say that Mu Qingge neglected you, but she clearly gave you the best of everything right at the start. If you didn’t want it, who can you blame?”

With that, she attacked Mu Ranwu again, wielding the Jue Chen Sword, attacking tightly.

Mu Ranwu couldn’t arrogantly grab the sword bare-handed anymore and had to set up her protective shield for defense. However, the sword was too strange. It could pierce through her true energy and came close towards Mu Ranwu.

She could only dodge awkwardly and use her sword in her hand to block, but with a crisp cracking sound, her sword was already cut into two like tofu by that lousy sword.

Next, sword energy rained down, attacking densely. Mu Ranwu was forced to retreat repeatedly until she stumbled and fell into the limestone pit.

By now, the limestone pit had been filled with water by the villagers and was boiling hot. Mu Ranwu was scalded like a fish in a net, jumping up quickly.

Looking down, her body was already covered in clusters of blisters, like toad eggs.

“Arghh—” Mu Ranwu let out an exasperated scream.

If she had been defeated by Su Yi Shui or Xue Ranran, she could still console herself that it was because her true qi was depleted during this period, so her skills became inferior.

But what was Zhou Feihua? A mere consort in Su Yu’s harem, an ordinary woman, used to relieve boredom!

She was actually beaten to such a miserable state by this woman and couldn’t even get close!

And when she saw the great power of the Jue Chen Sword in Zhou Feihua’s hands, Mu Ranwu realized what kind of treasure she had rejected years ago!

Under a mix of shame, regret, and resentment, she became bitter again: hateful sister, why didn’t she make things clear back then? It caused her to miss out on such a treasure, and now she was made so miserable by this sword!

At this moment, Zhou Feihua had already flown over and joined the battle with Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran.

The addition of the female Sword Master immediately changed the course of the battle, causing the five Fan tian attendants to gradually fall into a disadvantage.

Mu Ranwu knew she wouldn’t gain anything here, so she decisively abandoned the five attendants and turned to run.

But Su Yi Shui had been keeping his eye on her, how could he let her escape so easily?

He swiftly pulled out a short blade from Ranran’s side and flung it out, piercing through Mu Ranwu’s shoulder, nailing her to a large tree.

And just then, the five attendants seemed to sense something and decided to sacrifice themselves to protect their leader, suddenly inflating their bodies like inflated skin bags.

Su Yi Shui hurriedly shouted, “Retreat quickly! Keep your distance from them!”

After saying that, he extended his wide sleeves to protect Ranran and they leapt away from the five people.

In an instant, the bodies of those five people exploded, scattering into smoke and dust with the wind.

Ranran couldn’t understand the significance of their self-destruction. But when Mu Ranwu inhaled their remnants, her strength suddenly increased, breaking free from the short blade pinning her down, then left laughing maniacally.

Ranran noticed that her eyes were somewhat bloodshot, looking as if she had fallen into demonic path.

Meanwhile, the other water demons also fell one by one, struggling to crawl towards the riverbank, trying to escape.

At this time, the villagers from the village also came out with axes and hoes, ready to kill those struggling water demons.

But Ranran stopped them, saying, “No! They are the fishermen who went missing a few days ago. They have been cursed and lost their senses. We’ll try to find a way to save them…”

Just then, a white-haired old lady squeezed out from the crowd, tottering as she walked . She was Zhou Feihua’s landlord in the village where she was staying. Her sixteen-year-old grandson had disappeared while fishing by the river a few days ago.

Now, she painstakingly looked over these monsters, she spotted one of the severely burned water demons.

That water demon had a silver earring on his ear. Her missing grandson had been born after her son died, so she had pierced his ear with her own dowry earring to ward off evil and prevent premature death.

Although the old lady couldn’t recognize the person, she recognized her own dowry ear ring, so she burst into tears of grief.

But just as she was about to approach her grandson, she was almost scratched in the throat by his suddenly extended sharp claws, and his arm was already dripping with blood.

A villager shouted, “They are already possessed by evil spirits and are no longer human. Why keep them? We should just kill them while they are weak!”

Those with missing family members naturally disagreed, so the crowd erupted into arguments.

In the end, Zhou Feihua spoke up, “Enough! Stop quarreling. Although these people have been possessed by demons, they were once your neighbors. How can we give up on them without trying to help? There is a cave in the mountains behind the village. I will find a way to lock them in there and then try to help them return to normal.”

Zhou Feihua’s heroic demeanor just now had impressed everyone, and coupled with her leadership in defending the village against demons in recent days, she had already gained their respect. So when she spoke, everyone fell silent.

Ranran took out spirit charms to immobilize these water demons and gave them some mind clearing pills.

However, these pills didn’t seem to work on those already demonized. After ingesting them, they only felt nauseous and vomited green fluids.

When these water demons were tied up with ropes and taken to the cave in the mountains, those who had not completely transformed yet from the rice shop began to wail loudly again.

Watching those fully transformed monsters, the shopkeepers and attendants felt it was hopeless for them, thinking that they would rather die than become like that.

However, those few children who had fled from Mu Ranwu were surprisingly calmer than the adults. They were all orphans, begging on the streets before, and later became sacrificial lambs for Mu Demoness. Perhaps they had experienced too much hardship. Faced with such a terrifying situation, they seemed even more composed.

Wang Suizhi sighed heavily, looking at Zhou Feihua who had come over, “General Zhou, I didn’t expect to meet you again here. But I’m afraid my time is running out. Could I trouble you to pass on some last words to my wife and children? As for my master… could you try to persuade her not to do evil anymore…”

Zhou Feihua handed him some coarse bread and pickled vegetables brought from the village, then pointed to Xue Ranran who was treating the injured monsters and said, “Your master is right in front of you. If you have anything to say, you can tell her directly.”

Wang Suizhi just muttered “okay” at first, but when he figured out the meaning of Zhou Feihua’s words, he looked at Xue Ranran with eyes widening, “What… what does this mean?”

After Zhou Feihua explained how she saw through the imposter Mu Qingge, Wang Suizhi actually prostrated himself on the ground like a child, crying loudly, “I knew my master couldn’t have become so malicious! It turns out she was an imposter! That’s great! Master! Master! Your disciple is foolish, you wouldn’t abandon me right?”

Ranran never expected she would have to coax middle-aged bearded men not to cry. The scene was quite chaotic for a while, and when she finally calmed down Wang Suizhi, she asked, “Why isn’t Qin Xuanjiu with you?”

Wang Suizhi wiped the snot off his beard and pointed to a bruise on his eye that hadn’t completely disappeared, saying, “I got my junior brother drunk at the inn in Red Flame Mountain and brought him out. But when he woke up and heard what I said, he said I was suspicious of our master and beat me severely before leaving by himself. I don’t know if he will go look for that imposter again and continue to recognize a thief as his master…”

After talking with Wang Suizhi for a while, Ranran turned around and left the cave. At a glance, she saw Su Yi Shui sitting cross-legged on a large stone, meditating.

She didn’t want to disturb him, so she chose another hillside, looking at the bright moon in the sky, and let out a long sigh.

But before the sigh could end, someone approached from behind, asking in a deep voice, “Didn’t you already save everyone? Why are you sighing?”

Ranran looked up at the handsome man standing beside her, feeling lost and melancholic as she said, “I used to feel that I had no connection with my former disciples. I don’t even remember them anymore, so naturally, I couldn’t feel any master-disciple feelings for them, except for being somewhat familiar with fourteenth uncle master. So, after knowing my own background, when I saw Mu Ranwu deceiving them, I did not immediately reveal my identity. Now thinking back, I feel quite sorry towards them. Mu Ranwu has become radical and insane now. If anything happens to Qin Xuanjiu, I’m afraid I won’t forgive myself…”

Su Yi Shui remained silent and didn’t speak. If he hadn’t lost his memory, he probably already known Ranran’s identity long ago.

But why did he allow that impostor to spread rumors and deceive others, surrounding herself with Mu Qingge’s former disciples and grand disciples?

In the past, Su Yi Shui probably couldn’t understand, but just now, when Wang Suizhi kowtowed to Xue Ranran and kept apologizing, calling her “Master” repeatedly, he couldn’t help feeling a wave of annoyance. It seemed like he couldn’t stand seeing Xue Ranran surrounded by a group of men…

Perhaps it was because of this inexplicable emotion that he couldn’t be bothered to expose the impostor, letting her spread rumors and deceive others, and incidentally attracting away those men who might be around Xue Ranran?

So, the main culprit should have been him, why would this girl take the blame upon herself?

But after turning over the words of apology on his tongue several times, Su Yi Shui still couldn’t bring himself to admit it was his fault. He just stiffly said, “If that Qin Xuanjiu really encounters danger, I will get him out… They are all grown men, *past their thirties. Shouldn’t they have eyes and brains of their own? Besides putting on a fake face, what resemblance does Mu Ranwu have to you? It’s their own blindness to mistaken her for you. What does it have to do with you?”
*而立 30 years old

Hearing this, Xue Ranran let out another deep sigh and looked at the tense man, *saying dejectedly “In my past life, I must have not thought it troublesome, to take on so many disciples. The good tempered ones are so few and most of them are so difficult. Did I end up dying from exhaustion in my past life… Hmmph…”
*心有戚戚 《孟子·梁惠王上》夫子言之，于我心有戚戚焉。

She didn’t finish her words and was quickly silenced by the infuriated man who lowered his head and sealed her lips with his own.

Su Yi Shui kissed her fiercely while thinking: She was indeed blind in her past life, and actually took in someone like him, who is two-faced and completely bad. But since she had accepted him, she couldn’t just shake him off whenever she wanted!

The bright moon hung high above, and after lingering for a moment as they sat on the large stone, the man and woman finally separated.

Ranran slowly leaned her head on the shoulder of the moody man, snuggling against him and quietly admiring the bright moon in the sky.

After settling everyone, Zhou Feihua, who had just come out of the cave, happened to see them from behind.

Although she still found Su Yi Shui displeasing, she also felt that the two of them seemed to have an entangled fate for several lifetimes. They couldn’t be separated even in life and death.

Hopefully, in this life as Xue Ranran, she wouldn’t have to bear too much responsibility anymore, and she could fulfill her wish to wander between the sky and the earth…

After this episode, the situation along the river seemed to have calmed down greatly, and no one else went missing for the time being. However, news of demons on the mountain behind the Qiongqi village continued to spread.

Although there were no reinforcements from the officials when they needed to drive away the demons, once they heard that the people of Qiongqi village had captured more than a dozen water demons, the officials immediately sent people to convey their instructions from above: “Our magistrate said that these evil creatures have been invaded by evil qi, and are beyond redemption. They must be burned with fire and let high monks recite sutras for their salvation. You ignorant villagers must not detain these evil creatures on your own, it’s better to hand them over quickly!”

The meaning of these constables’ words was straightforward—they wanted to quickly dispose of those demonized people.

Even though Su Yi Shui had sent a mountain sparrow with a talisman to deliver a message to Western Mountain, the distance was still far. Even if Elder Jiu rushed over quickly by riding on the wind, it would still take several days to arrive.

**So the master and disciple have been in a blissful romantic couple’s world 二人世界 for a month as they went sightseeing, shopped, ate nice foods and cultivated their way to Jiangnan!
It’s almost like jumping straight to a honeymoon hahaha
How is Su Yi Shui supposed to resist this?

Previous
Next

探入龙岛 TO DRAGON ISLAND

However, these constables showed no sign of giving up unless the people were handed over. The village head, feeling helpless, discussed with Zhou Feihua and Su Yi Shui to see if they could hand over the people first and then deal with the situation. After all, these were government officials. Once offended, their livelihoods as commoners would be in jeopardy.

But before Zhou Feihua could speak, Su Yi Shui coldly interjected, “No, we can’t hand them over.”

Just one Qin Xuanjiu had already made that girl feel so guilty. If Wang Suizhi and the others were going to be burned alive, wouldn’t that girl blame herself to the point of not being able to eat?

So, without any hesitation, Su Yi Shui flatly refused.

Now, the villagers were all having different thoughts. Those who hadn’t lost loved ones who were turned into water demons were a bit dissatisfied, thinking that causing the entire village to offend the government for a few monsters was making life difficult for everyone.

Some even secretly went to inform the officials, subtly revealing that the water demons were in the cave on the back mountain.

When the officials led a large group of people to search for the water demons on the back mountain, Ranran and Su Yi Shui, who had just moved the transformed people away, were standing on the treetops, observing the villagers leading the officials.

Ranran noticed that one of them was actually the nephew of Zhou Feihua’s landlady.

On the day the village was attacked, the nephew was still busy running around about the landlady, but who could have thought the next day, he would eagerly lead the soldiers to arrest his own nephew.

Su Yi Shui, however, wasn’t surprised. He sneered, “That family has only one heir, and the old woman’s husband’s family has no suitable descendants. If the old woman’s only grandson is gone, isn’t it just perfect for this nephew to step in?”

Although Ranran was clever, she never liked to think badly of people, which was the stark difference between her and Su Yi Shui. Perhaps Su Yi Shui, being a descendant of the royal family, was more sensitive and experienced in power struggles and internal conflicts with family.

After hearing Su Yi Shui’s words, Ranran took a deep breath and said in a low voice, “Sometimes, the line between humans and demons is very thin. Cultivating immortality is easy, but cultivating the heart is truly difficult…”

*Ranran said this unintentionally, but Su Yi Shui, as the former demon’s son, couldn’t help but cast a glance at her after hearing this.
*说者无意听者有心 the speaker may not intend a certain meaning, but the listener can interpret or understand it differently

Ranran knew what that glance meant but deliberately pursed her lips and said, “Hey, yes I’m talking about you! Even without your master, you should still cultivate diligently. You can’t frequently think about how to kill your mentor. I raised you with great effort, even if there are no merits, there are still hardships… aye…”

Before she could finish speaking, Su Yi Shui had grabbed the small bun on top of her head and started shaking it, instantly dispelling any trace of authority befitting a former master of Xishan.

Ranran could only hold onto his wrist, muttering softly in annoyance, “Stop it, my hair will get messy!”

Su Yi Shui smiled through gritted teeth, “If you dare mention raising me again, don’t blame me for being impolite for real!”

He felt that he was now too indulgent with this little demoness, practically fallen under her spell. Whenever he was near her, he felt somewhat distracted, constantly wanting to stick close to her all the time. If this continued, before the soul-cleansing talisman could be undone, he wouldn’t be himself anymore.

Su Yi Shui felt that he should be harsher with Xue Ranran and not be so clingy.

But now, her small bun was shaken loose by him, and a few strands of hair fell around her fair cheeks, looking… pretty cute.

By the time Su Yi Shui came back to his senses, he had already planted a kiss on her cheek, making Ranran feel a bit embarrassed. She whispered softly, “It’s broad daylight, this isn’t quite appropriate…”

With a dark expression, Su Yi Shui stood up and swiftly left, preparing to go to the back mountain to teach a few unlucky fellows a lesson and divert his attention.

Could this loss of self-control, also be a side effect of the soul-cleansing talisman? He needed to be vigilant and not let himself yield.

Ranran was unaware of her dear former disciple’s inner turmoil. She only knew that a mysterious heroic immortal had disposed of the officials and villagers who had gone to the back mountain, tossing them into a ditch.

Especially the nephew who had eagerly led the way, he was thrown into the manure pit for the villagers’ compost heap.
