For now, those officials returned empty-handed. But given the local officials’ enthusiasm for hindsight criticism, it was likely that those relocated individuals wouldn’t remain hidden for long.

Fortunately, within a few days, Yuchen and Yutong arrived in Qiongqi Village with Elder Jiu.

Elder Jiu, with a wine gourd in his mouth, carefully examined the transformed Wang Suizhi.

Although he had been continuously taking Clear Heart Pills, the transformation couldn’t be stopped. In the past few days, his pupils had gradually elongated, and he occasionally lost control of his mind.

Elder Jiu nodded, and Ranran thought he had a solution, so she asked, “Elder, how can we save them?”

Elder Jiu honestly replied, “I currently have no way!”

“Then why did you nod?”

Elder Jiu looked on admiringly and said, “This Seven Evil Transformation Talisman is even purer and more powerful than what was discovered at Wangxiang River. Very impressive!”

Ranran couldn’t help but laugh wryly and said in a small voice, “He’s my disciple from my past life, you have to find a way to save him!”

Elder Jiu now knew that this little girl was his actual drinking buddy from twenty years ago. After hearing his little buddy’s request, he said earnestly, “Have you seen their scales? They are *Jiao dragon scales, not from ordinary water creatures. They have transformed so many people, they probably used Jiao dragon’s blood as a catalyst. If you can find something to counteract its blood… like Green Dragon blood, maybe I can try something.”
*蛟 is the water dragon which Su Yi Shui took its molt and killed by Wei Jiu

Ranran furrowed her brow in thought; Elder Jiu was right. She had read in ancient texts before that a Jiao dragon, lacking tail and horns, spent its life to transform into a true dragon. If there were something to suppress the Jiao dragon blood, it would be Green Dragon’s blood.

But a Green Dragon was extremely rare. Even the dragon she and Su Yi Shui had rescued in the palace was just an ordinary small dragon. The blood of a vermilion bird was hard to come by, let alone dragon blood, which was like searching for a needle in a haystack.

However, this was the only way to save these transformed people. Ranran looked at the unconscious Wang Suizhi and resolved to give it a try.

When she told Su Yi Shui her plan, he frowned and said, “Dragon Island is a forbidden land for mortals. No one has ever entered or left there. Are you sure you want to go there to find Green Dragon’s blood and ask it of a bowl of blood?”

Su Yi Shui looked at her with a strange expression, recognizing in her this unyielding spirit of defying heaven and earth, fearless of life and death, is truly worthy of being Mu Qingge’s reincarnation. Only she would have such an unconventional idea, wanting to go to Dragon Island and meet her end.

With knitted brows he said, “Think carefully, neither I nor the disciples of Xishan will accompany you on this fool’s errand to die on Dragon Island!”

Ranran nodded decisively and said, “… I know someone on the island. I’ll just give it a try. But I will go alone, you don’t have to accompany me.”

She really did not want Su Yi Shui to go with her. So that same night, she had packed a small bundle and quietly left the village by herself.

When she came to a mountain hollow to fetch water to drink, she sensed someone following behind.

Without a word, she went to a flat area, swiftly jumped onto a tree and looked back. When their eyes met, it turned out to be Su Yi Shui staring at her from below the tree…

“Why are you here too?” Xue Ranran asked in surprise.

Because he had already made it clear that he would never accompany her to Dragon Island. At dinner, he had even instructed Yuchen and Yutong to prepare to return to Xishan.

Leaving quietly like this, was to not make things difficult for him, so she left without saying goodbye.

With a serious expression, Su Yi Shui said, “Have you forgotten? You have half of my golden core in you. How could I let you take my cultivation to feed a dragon?”

By now, Ranran had figured out Su Yi Shui’s aggravating teenage temperament. He always had to bring up that half of the golden core every few days.

Actually, if he truly didn’t trust her with it, taking it back would be as easy as turning his hand. Yet every time, he only thundered threats without following through. So, facing this paper tiger that only roared but never showed its claws, she just had to coax him and offer him a graceful way to back down.

Ranran smiled and jumped down from the tree, grabbing Su Yi Shui’s arm and gave it a sway. “Alright, I got it. I will definitely take good care of your things. I will be very, very careful so I can return it without damage in future. Shifu, the scenery on the East Sea is so beautiful, and the freshly caught fish are really delicious. But this time, without the vermilion bird, we can rent a boat. Last time out on the sea, we lacked some oil, salt, and seasoning. Let’s bring some rice, noodles, and soybeans; we can stew the fish nicely.”

The gourmet’s train of thought always clearly planned what could be eaten next.

Su Yi Shui had now also figured this little demoness out. If he upset her, she would call him “Hey.” But when she was happy, she would call him “Shifu.”

When extremely unhappy, she would raise her eyebrows and call him “Shui’er.”

But when she looked up at him and called him “Shifu”, that term was truly sweet sounding.

So, rushing to Dragon Island to become dragon food, became something to look forward to. Xue Ranran had this ability to turn a life-threatening journey into an incredibly leisurely outing.

Following behind Su Yi Shui, were Yutong, Gao Cang, Bai Baishan and Qiu Xier.

Since there were many people, they would need a large boat. Yutong specially rented a big boat at the pier, which could not only carry rice, noodles, and beans but also a potted orange tree. With diligent watering, they could pick oranges every few days.

Because Zhou Feihua had to take care of the demonized villagers, she didn’t come along. Helping her were Yuchen and Elder Jiu.

This was Gao Cang and Qiu Xier’s first time out at sea and they were rearing to go.

Seeing more and more people gathering, Xue Ranran couldn’t help but worry for them. She solemnly reminded them, “Senior brothers and sisters, we’re heading to the forbidden land of Dragon Island. It’s even more dangerous than Tianmai Mountain and Red Flame Mountain. Are you really sure you want to go?”

Nowadays, the disciples of Xishan were all experienced in facing daunting challenges, and even Qiu Xier was no longer the frightened little greenhorn crying by Wangxiang River.

After hearing the sincere reminder from her junior-no its former grandmaster, Qiu Xier said seriously, “Don’t worry, we won’t be landing on Dragon Island. We’ll only stay outside and guard the ship for you, dear elder.”

Xue Ranran playfully pulled Qiu Xier’s braid and said, “I’m clearly younger than you, yet you call me Elder!”

Qiu Xier grinned and said animatedly, “I always wondered why little junior sister is so much more outstanding than us. It turns out you’re the reincarnation of our Grandmaster! Now, we’re all confident again!”

Although they had entered Xishan together for cultivation, Xue Ranran had surpassed the three of them and emerged as a new force, leaving them far behind. Although their bond was strong with the four of them, there was occasionally still a hint of desolation in their hearts.

But now things were different. Xue Ranran was their grandmaster, so being outstanding was only natural. Even if this was made known, it brought them high spirits. The old plaque at Xishan’s gate, which had remained unchanged for so long, now looked more eye-catching.

Moreover, this trip was not joined by the disciples who were recruited later. Instead, they were the ones Shifu have brought along, which was enough to see that even though he had lost his memory, he was gradually recognizing their abilities.

So even if they were on a large boat, on their way to become food for dragons, they could still feel a faint sense of superiority.

After the large boat entered the sea, it didn’t rely on sails but on Su Yi Shui’s spiritual energy to drive it, making it much faster than ordinary boats.

As Ranran said, as they sailed along the waves, and fished at the stern while surrounded by seabirds was indeed very pleasant.

When they reached the island where they had rested for a few days before, Ranran pointed out to Su Yi Shui, hoping to evoke some remaining memories.

Unfortunately, even though they landed on the island, Su Yi Shui still couldn’t remember anything even when he looked at the firewood ash in the cave.

Soon, the boat arrived at the boundary of Dragon Island’s barrier.

One moment it was clear skies, but at the boundary, there were fierce winds, heavy rain, and rough waves.

When they focused on the dense clouds, it seemed like there was a terrifying beast hiding in them, silently observing the outsiders on the boat.

In the various legends of the cultivation world, there seemed to be no story of anyone surviving after entering Dragon Island.

So even after searching through ancient texts, there was no experience to draw from in this regard.

At this moment, Su Yi Shui instructed Yutong to bring a package containing two tight-fitting suits that resembled clothing for infiltration.

Upon closer inspection, one would see that the clothes were covered with fine black scales.

“When I ventured into Tianmai Mountain in the past, I *killed a black Jiao dragon whose skin has a water-repelling effect. After entering the water, it will automatically separate the water, allowing even those unfamiliar with swimming to move freely. I made two suits with this skin so that we don’t have to expend spiritual energy to part the water and they are also protective as they are weapons resistant as well.”
*huh? So did writer mix up because according to that Medicine Immortal imposter he only took its skin?

Ranran obediently changed into one. However, after she changed, she noticed Su Yi Shui staring at her without saying a word.

Ranran looked down… Hmm, it was slightly tight. She was a grown woman now, and this attire revealed her curves and accentuated her slender waist…

Just as she was considering whether to change back, Su Yi Shui draped a cloak over her shoulders. “There are still Gao Cang and other men outside. Wear this for now, take it off when we land on the island…”

Hmm… Ranran couldn’t help but glance at him sideways. Would there be no men on Dragon Island later? Wasn’t he going with her?

Even though it would be dangerous going ahead, Yutong planned to follow the Master and Ranran. So, she had also changed into a swimming attire early, ready to go along.

The three of them prepared to cross the barrier of Dragon Island. Initially, it went smoothly, but soon Yutong was swiftly bounced back by the barrier, like a ball thrown back into the sea.

However, even though Su Yishui and Xue Ranran felt a slight resistance, they were able to pass through the barrier smoothly.

So they had Yutong swim back to the ship and wait, then both dived into the deep sea, avoiding the stormy weather on the surface.

When they resurfaced, they had crossed the barrier of Dragon Island, and it seemed like all the wind and high waves had stopped.

It was said that in ancient times, dragons had done evil, so the ancient gods sealed them on Dragon Island.

Therefore, although occasionally there were young dragons with low spiritual power sneaking out during their molting period, once the dragon reached maturity and its power increased, it was almost impossible to leave the island.

As for outsiders, they couldn’t sneak in to steal dragon eggs because they couldn’t break through the barrier. After all, Dragon Island was meant to protect the people of the human realm; how could they be allowed in?

So it was puzzling how Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran could enter so easily.

However, when they reached the muddy beach and saw the skeleton of a water Jiao dragon, Su Yi Shui guessed the reason why they could land on the island. The Dragon Island barrier only prevented people from entering and dragons from leaving but didn’t stop dragon’s prey from entering the island.

Looking at the white bones of the water dragon, especially the spine that seemed to be crushed by a giant mouth, Su Yi Shui frowned deeply and said, “*You mentioned that I killed a black dragon when I was in Tianmai Mountain. Then I must have eaten a water dragon’s heart that enhances power. And you have also had water dragon molt water, so your aura must have changed.”
*what??? LOL oh writer…

Ranran understood.
*but we don’t understand writer

To dragons, a water dragon was like an appetizing fried loach. Plus, they were wearing clothes made from water dragon skin. So the barrier automatically recognized them as appetizers for dragons and allowed them in.

After understanding this, they weren’t as pleased anymore. Ranran suddenly remembered how the little dragon she once saved always peeked out of the sea with its eye, looking at her with ill-intentions.

Back then, she thought it was because it had eaten people before and couldn’t shake off the habit. Now, thinking about it, it was probably because her water dragon scent was too tempting, making that little dragon have a craving.

Although there were no dragons visible on Dragon Island at the moment, the intimidating and intermittent roar of dragons reminded them that there was more than one dragon on the island.

Ranran thought and asked, “Shouldn’t we retreat first and find a way to get rid of the water dragon scent on us?”

Back in the palace, dealing with a small dragon already caused them a lot of trouble. Now, going to the dragon’s territory bringing their own fragrance was truly seeking death.

Hearing this, Su Yi Shui quickly took off his water dragon suit, revealing his well-built upper body, and said to Ranran, “You should take off your water dragon skin too…”

What? Since this clothing was close-fitting, Ranran’s dressing order was similar to Su Yi Shui’s. If she took it off too, this pair of master and disciple of two lifetimes would be exposed before each other, and could end up being devoured naked by a dragon together… Just thinking about the scenario was offensive to the eyes!
*坦诚相见 here means naked lol

So she very firmly shook her head.

Su Yi Shui didn’t insist, he just said briefly, “It’s too late…”

Just as they were speaking, the ground on the island suddenly shook and churned, and something massive rushed towards them.

Both of them jumped up simultaneously, narrowly avoiding the dragon mouth that burst out of the ground.

Obviously, they encountered an Earth Dragon, eager to devour the two “loach” appetizers.

Ranran quickly remembered various dragon attributes she had read in ancient beast books and reminded Su Yi Shui, “Earth dragons are blind; they mainly rely on sound and scent for detection. It’s going to be difficult for us to shake it off.”

Upon hearing this, Su Yi Shui immediately wielded his sword and attacked the Earth Dragon’s nose. Since it was blind, then they could disable its nose and ears.

As long as it couldn’t smell or hear, they could easily get rid of it.

His sword was incredibly fast and immediately chopped off half of the dragon’s nose, stirring up the Earth Dragon’s nest.

In its agonizing roar, more Earth Dragons emerged from the ground, seemingly countless, coming to assist.

Ranran quickly glanced around and was disappointed to find that despite luring out so many dragons, not a single one was a Green Dragon.

They had no idea if the Earth Dragons’ blood was going to be of any use. But at this rate, she and Su Yi Shui might really perish on Dragon Island…

With the situation critical, there was no time for her to think too much. She could only stand side by side with Su Yi Shui and face the constantly emerging Earth Dragons together.

During the struggle, Ranran’s ankle was suddenly entangled by an Earth Dragon’s tail, pulling her straight down. Su Yi Shui quickly rushed over to cut with his sword,

But although the Earth Dragon’s nose was soft, its body was extremely hard, especially the tail, which was a sharp tool for the Earth Dragon to dig underground with. Su Yi Shui couldn’t cut through it.

Seeing Ranran about to be dragged into the hole by the Earth Dragon, Su Yi Shui decided to jump into the hole with her.

Once in the ground, it would be the domain of these burrowing dragons, and they would have almost no chance of survival.

Just then, a roar of a dragon suddenly sounded, and a pale golden dragon leaped out of the sea.

As the majestic dragon roared, Ranran’s ankle was suddenly released from the entangling tail, and all the Earth Dragons seemed to be suppressed, obediently lying on the ground.

Some even timidly retreated back into their holes, only showing half of their dragon heads.

Su Yi Shui steadied Ranran in time, and the two landed on a large reef on the island, looking up at the golden dragon hovering in mid-air.

As the golden dragon danced in the sky, the entire Dragon Island suddenly became eerily quiet, as if all the dragons were silent.

Ranran whispered, “Is it… the king of dragons?”

Su Yi Shui looked up at the dragon and said, “I don’t know, but it’s probably a mother, there’s a young dragon on its tail…”

Ranran looked closer and indeed, there was a smaller dragon coiled around the tail of the golden dragon.

However, that dragon… why did it look so familiar?

As Ranran was squinting, the little dragon slipped off the big dragon’s body, emitting a smooth, slightly coquettish squeak, and then flew towards Ranran with its dragon beard fluttering.

At this moment, Ranran finally recognized this little dragon. It was the one she and Su Yi Shui rescued from the palace.

Compared to back then, this little dragon had obviously grown a lot, but it looked relatively smaller when it was next to the big golden dragon.

But as its dragon eyes sparkled as it flew towards her, its intentions were unclear. Ranran couldn’t tell if it was here to reminisce or to hunt?

However, the dragon clearly sensed their vigilance and stopped in time, only playfully stepping on the head of the Earth Dragon lying on the ground with its dragon claw.

Then it shook its tail and jumped back into the sea. It then threw a few large fatty fish onto the ground before Ranran.

Although dragons were fierce, they hadn’t learned the hypocrisy and cunning of the human world.

So this act of actively offering fish was full of goodwill, to make a friendly gesture towards Ranran and Su Yi Shui.

Ranran breathed a sigh of relief. It felt really good to encounter a familiar dragon in dragon territory on Dragon Island!

Who would have thought someone so cold and formidable like Su Yi Shui would be such a 恋爱脑, so love-struck when he fell in love?
Seeing him fight against his own inclinations is really entertaining!

Regarding the case of whether Su Yi Shui had killed the black water dragon or not…
I guess we may only know in the drama… The novel writer is the unreliable narrator lol
I was wondering if the writer wanted to distinguish between Su Yi Shui and Wei Jiu, which was why the imposter said that he did not kill the black water dragon. However why would Ranran tell Su Yi Shui another version compared to the one the imposter told her? Writer seems confused lol

*shrugs*

Next

金龙神君 THE GOLDEN DRAGON GODDESS

Ranran said smiling to the little dragon, “What, do you want me to grill fish for you again?”

Back when Ranran was healing on the island, she also adjusted the little dragon’s tastes, grilling fish for it to eat. At that time, the little dragon had eaten with its dragon beard raised, looking very satisfied.

So when Ranran said this, the little dragon made another sharp coquettish sound, then turned to the golden dragon in the sky and made several calls, as if also strongly recommending the taste of grilled fish to it.

However, the golden dragon remained suspended in the air, looking down at the two people on the large stone with endless dignity and indifference.

Ranran clasped her fists and respectfully said to the golden dragon, “I am Xue Ranran from Xishan. I have come here with a request…”

After she said this, the golden dragon suddenly flipped in the air and let out another roar.

Next, all the dragons on Dragon Island began to roar, even the little dragon opened its mouth and let out a loud cry, shaking the sky with thunderous sounds.

Ranran and Su Yi Shui had to use their true vitality as shields to barely withstand the roars from all the dragons.

Amidst this earth-shattering dragon’s roar, the golden dragon suddenly emitted a faint golden light all over its body, turning into a huge sphere of water vapor.

When the mist dissipated, Ranran realized that the golden dragon had transformed into a woman with long golden hair and golden clothes all over her body. However, the dragon horns on her head had not completely disappeared, indicating that she was not an ordinary mortal.

Although there were legends in ancient times about divine beasts undergoing heavenly tribulations and transforming into human forms, such miracles were distant legends.

Yet today on Dragon Island, she could witness a real transformation of a dragon into a human, which made this trip already worthwhile.

Ranran looked carefully at this goddess who could transform into a human form. She was not stunningly beautiful, but carried an aura of majesty. It was a pity that there was a hideous scar on her face, extending from her cheek to her neck.

Without this scar, she would have been an elegant beauty.

As the goddess descended slowly, her eyes glowing with a faint golden color as she stared at Ranran and then at Su Yi Shui. Finally, she spoke to Ranran, “Your life force is not like an ordinary person’s. It seems you are someone who has died and been reborn?”

Ranran had come with a request, so she couldn’t lie. She replied honestly, “Twenty years ago, my soul scattered and was guided to the Tree of Rebirth, where I was reborn. May I ask the name of the goddess?”

The golden dragon said mildly, “I am a dragon, so I don’t have a name. I am the guardian god of Dragon Island. You can call me as you wish.”

At this moment, the goddess turned her head to look at Su Yi Shui. Her eyes, glowing with a faint golden color, could see through people’s past lives.

But when she saw Su Yi Shui, her brows furrowed even tighter. “You were born with the Emperor’s Fire element destiny, but your evil star is in the palace, indicating a natural born tyrant with a lonely fate, the former son of darkness… and yet someone has changed your fate chart, forcefully adding planet Mercury’s water to extinguish the fire, leaving a chance for survival… What kind of chaotic fate chart is this?”

Su Yi Shui knew by now that Mu Qingge had tampered with his fate chart all those years ago, but being told by a dragon that his originally fine emperor fate chart had been all messed up, he couldn’t help but glare at Ranran.

Ranran pretended not to see, and quickly changed the subject abruptly, pointing to the little dragon cuddling against the golden-haired woman’s feet and asked tentatively, “Is it your child?”

The golden dragon furrowed her brows slightly, saying resignedly, “It has no mother. After coming to Dragon Island, I don’t know why, but it took me as its mother and I just couldn’t shake it off.”

Everything now clicked for Ranran, so its her godson… A child from their own family always looks better, and since Ranran had rescued this little dragon, she naturally found it cute and lively like it was her nephew.

When it had first arrived on Dragon Island, it already knew to acknowledge the local dragon leader as its godmother. Such cleverness deserved a basket of grilled fish.

Regardless, perhaps due to the goodwill from saving their dragon kin by these two, the goddess did not immediately bring up the matter of them cutting off the earth dragon’s nose. She only asked, “You two have intruded into the forbidden area of the dragon clan. What exactly do you want?”

Ranran did not hide anything and said sincerely, “There are people in the territory of Daqi who are poisoned by the water dragon. We need the blood of the Green dragon from Dragon Island to save them. Can the goddess accommodate us and allow us to take some dragon blood back…”

Initially, the goddess’s expression was indifferent, but when she heard Ranran mention the Green Dragon, her expression slowly became terrifyingly fierce. She suddenly reached out and attacked Ranran!

Su Yi Shui remained calm as he stood by the side, but had been on guard against this guardian god of Dragon Island.

When he saw her suddenly attacking Ranran, Su Yi Shui immediately summoned his spiritual shield to block. However, the goddess’s power was too powerful. She easily sent Su Yi Shui flying.

When Su Yi Shui’s body hit a boulder, the tremendous force even shattered the boulder behind him.

This was the difference between a god and a human. Even though Su Yi Shui was exceptionally talented and had high cultivation, without ascending and crossing the tribulation, he had not reached the level of a god.

Now, he was like an ant compared to this guardian god of Dragon Island, completely incomparable.

Fortunately, the little dragon had been clinging to the goddess’s ankle and let out a low cry in time, causing her to exert slightly less force. Otherwise, it would not have been difficult for her to shatter Su Yi Shui’s soul.

However, Su Yishui quickly stood up, glaring at the goddess coldly. He suddenly drew out a golden-glowing club from his body.

The goddess furrowed her brows slightly. “The Dragon-Subduing Club… You actually have such a divine object?”

“This is the last Dragon-subduing Club left by the former god after driving the dragons into the island, left in the human realm. Do you want to try it?” Su Yi Shui said with a dark expression.

Although she was a goddess, with this Dragon-subduing Club, he could still fight her. He had Yu Tong bring this precious treasure from Xishan as a precaution for just such a situation. If the golden loach wanted a fight, he would fight her to the end.

Ranran flew to Su Yi Shui’s side, protecting him with her body. If the golden dragon goddess attacked again, she could block it for Su Yi Shui. At the same time, she also realized that she must have said something wrong just now, quickly smiling and trying to smooth things over, “Why resort to such force? It’s just a misunderstanding. The goddess looks benevolent and kind. Why would she make things difficult for us? Although we trespassed into the forbidden area, we had no evil intentions and have not come to take the life of the Green dragon. We just hope to obtain some blood to save people. Please calm down, goddess.”

Her voice was clear and sincere, with a hint of likable charm, looking much less aggressive than Su Yi Shui.

The little dragon cuddling the goddess let out a hmpph hmmpph with its nose, coaxing its godmother, whining softly for a while. It’s unclear what it said, but it finally calmed down the goddess.

However, her tone remained cold, “Using the blood of the Green dragon to dispel evil curses? Who taught you this method?”

Ranran continued respectfully, “I wonder if the goddess knows about the Elder Jiu of Cuiwei Mountain. He is a master at making talismans, and this was the only method he could come up with.”

Upon hearing this, the expression of the goddess became even more peculiar, but it didn’t seem like anger. Instead, it was a mixture of astonishment and understanding.

“The Wine Immortal? Does he have an older brother who ascended to immortality?”

Ranran was surprised. She didn’t expect the guardian god of Dragon Island to know an old drunkard from outside the island!

So she honestly replied, “Yes, his older brother is the Medicine Immortal, who has successfully ascended and is ranked among the immortals… When did the goddess meet him?”

The goddess said mildly, “A long time ago, I have also went out of the island, and met some people…”

Ranran was somewhat puzzled and asked in a low voice, “As the guardian god of Dragon Island, can you also leave the island?”

The goddess gently touched the scar on her face and said softly, “Every dragon can leave the island, as long as they can pay the corresponding price… When the mother of this little dragon left the island to help her friend, she paid with her life and could never return to Dragon Island. I also paid with five hundred years of my cultivation and this scar on my face…”

She seemed unwilling to continue and changed the subject, “…You two once saved my dragon kin, so you should not be wicked people. However, your wish this time may be in vain, because… there is no more Green dragon on Dragon Island!”

When she said this, Ranran was at a loss. Dragon Island was sealed by the former god as the dragon clan’s territory. If there were no Green dragons on Dragon Island, where could they find them?

“May I ask where the Green dragon has gone?”

The goddess glanced at them and said, “Follow me…”

Ranran was about to step forward, but Su Yi Shui stopped her. This goddess seemed unpredictable. If they followed her, it could be good or bad.

Ranran channeled a message to him “Either way, we can’t beat her. Whether we die on the edge of the island or in the center, it doesn’t make much difference. Let’s just follow her.”

Although her words made sense, Su Yi Shui felt like her words implied that he was weak and couldn’t beat a golden loach… the man’s expression darkened a bit.

He had been originally influenced by his father, and was more focused on worldly gains. But now his life had been completely changed by his good mentor, and maybe due to losing some memories, his former competitive spirit and desire to win seemed to have diminished somewhat.

However, when he was just now completely overwhelmed by this golden dragon’s absolute strength, that competitive spirit seemed to return… He wasn’t strong enough yet, not strong enough to kill gods… He needed to become stronger…

Thinking like this, faint runes appeared again on Su Yi Shui’s forehead, but they quickly disappeared.

Ranran didn’t look back, and did not notice the anomaly on Su Yi Shui’s forehead. She just pulled him along to follow the goddess, and they soon arrived at a valley in the center of the island. Although sunlight spilled in, the valley remained gloomy, with an aura of death which can’t be dispersed.

“This is the place of dragon demise. Although dragons can live for thousands of years or even ten thousand years, occasionally some dragons die during the three-hundred-year tribulation due to insufficient cultivation. Their skeletons are all here. The Green dragon you’re looking for… is over there.”

There were dozens of dragon bones of various sizes arranged in the deep valley. But the dragon body the goddess pointed to was different, as the bones still had dragon skin on them.

However, the once shiny Green dragon skin was now dull and dry. The most eerie part was that the dragon skin clung tightly to the bones, as if it had been drained by some creature.

At this moment, the goddess said coldly, “The Green dragon you’re looking for has long been sucked dry of its dragon blood and died. There are no more Green dragons in the world.”

Ranran was shocked, realizing why the goddess had reacted so angrily when she mentioned taking the Green dragon’s blood.

“Who did this? Ordinary people can’t come to Dragon Island, right?”

The goddess smiled coldly, “I was in seclusion at the time and submerged deep in the sea. When I sensed something wrong and came back up, the Green dragon had already been sucked dry and died. Ordinary people indeed cannot come here, but Dragon Island can block people, but not gods. The one who can slaughter dragons on Dragon Island without anyone knowing must be a deity!”

Su Yi Shui frowned, “Dragons are natural spiritual creatures. Killing a spirit dragon is a serious crime that incurs divine punishment. Which deity would knowingly commit such a crime?”

**The Green dragon is the god of the East, symbolizing the *Spring. Its blood not only has rejuvenation effects but is also said to revive the soul.
*少阳

However, these are just legends, unconfirmed by anyone, and it’s almost impossible for anyone to obtain Green dragon blood. It’s unbelievable that a deity would offend the dragon god and commit such a cruel act, draining the blood from the entire Green dragon.

What is the purpose behind this, is both puzzling and chilling.

The goddess said coldly, “If I find out who it is, even if they are an ancient deity, they will be torn apart by my dragon clan. If you have no other business, please leave Dragon Island as soon as possible. Otherwise, the scent of the water dragon on you is too tempting. Once the dragon horde loses control, I’m afraid you won’t be able to leave even if you want to.”

But Ranran was unwilling to give up and asked loudly, “Please, can the goddess guide me on how to break the Seven Evil Transformation Seal without the blood of the Green dragon?”

The goddess shook her head and then thought for a moment before saying mildly, “Actually, there is another person who should have the blood of the Green dragon. I just don’t know if he has any dragon blood left…”

Ranran asked curiously, “Who is it?”

The goddess paused and said, “It’s the elder brother of your friend—now the Medicine Immortal who has ascended to the lower god realm. He is obsessed with alchemy and loves to collect various rare medicinal materials. I remember that although he didn’t enter Dragon Island back then, he used the talismans given by his younger brother to drive two water rats into Dragon Island. While the Green dragon was fast asleep, he took a few drops of dragon blood.”

As she spoke, the goddess didn’t show regret for letting a thief into her home; instead, her tone carried a sense of melancholy, as if recalling the past.

The Medicine Immortal? Ranran now knew that the person she met on Tianmai Mountain was an impostor. But where to find the Medicine Immortal who has ascended, would be another problem.

Moreover, the people from the Qiongqi Village couldn’t wait until they found the Medicine Immortal either.

However, the goddess said mildly, “If I’m not mistaken… Every Qixi Festival, he will place thousands of lotus lanterns along the banks of the Lijiang River. It seems tomorrow happens to be Qixi Festival. I wonder if he, now an immortal, will still place lanterns by the river…”

Ranran was delighted to hear this. Their journey to Dragon Island had not been in vain, they had still found a lifeline.

Just as Ranran was about to bid farewell, the goddess kept staring at her. Her pale golden eyes turned a few times. After a long while, she said, “The scent of the black dragon on you is too strong, concealing your true essence. I just realized now that I seem to have seen you before your reincarnation…”

Ranran widened her eyes. What? Did she come to Dragon Island before? She suddenly remembered that the mother of that little dragon had helped her during the Fan Yao Battle. Did she come to Dragon Island and steal *the little dragon’s mother?
*苍龙 its confusing because this is another name of the Azure/Green Dragon but the author used 青龙 for the Azure dragon, so there should be a distinction

But the goddess seemed to sense her confusion and said lightly, “The Cang Dragon was born to respond to a heavenly calamity, so its death had nothing to do with you. However, you did come to Dragon Island before and deposited something here. Since you’ve reincarnated and came back here, I’ll return it to you.”

After saying that, she pointed to the highest peak of Dragon Island and said, “There is a stone wall there. What you left behind is there.”

With that, she seemed unwilling to speak any more to outsiders. She leaped into the air, transformed back into a golden dragon, and went into the sea. However, her voice still echoed in the air, “I have given the dragons of the whole island orders to grant you an hour of convenience. If you find the person who slaughtered the Green dragon in the future and inform me, I will be very grateful…”

As the golden dragon’s words faded, Ranran said, “Let’s go, let’s go up the mountain quickly.”

She was indeed curious. Why did she leave something in such a remote and uninhabited place like Dragon Island in her past life?

The two of them rode the wind all the way, encountering no obstacles along the way. Although they often saw dragon heads of various sizes in the trees and ponds, their lantern-like big eyes staring at them, drooling.

This constantly reminded the master and disciple that with their bodies emitting the scent of the black dragon, they were quite tempting to the dragons. Once the hour was over and the goddess no longer protected them, those dragons might rush over eagerly, unable to resist the temptation of wild prey from outside the island.

When they finally reached the mountaintop, they could see the entire Dragon Island. Although there were many exotic flowers and plants, and the scenery of the island connected with the blue waters was enchanting, they were not in the mood to enjoy it. They hurriedly climbed to the top of Dragon Mountain.

At the top of the mountain stood a thick stone pillar, as if a divine staff had been fixed here.

In the ancient past, dragons freely roamed between heaven and earth as divine beings. Later, it was said that the dragon clan violated heavenly rules, so the supreme god used this Dragon-Sealing Staff to seal them here, forever unable to leave the island.

Occasionally, dragons would leave the island, but their final fate was always death without reincarnation. The little dragon Ranran saved was born outside the island, and the fact that it could return alive back here, was probably due to this reason.

They found a cliff on the mountaintop, bare and covered with vines and black-green moss.

On one side of the cliff, there was a peculiar giant rock, several times taller than a person. The rock had many weathered holes, resembling a broken beehive.

Su Yi Shui waved away the vines on the cliff and guided water to wash it, revealing its true appearance.

In her past life, Mu Qingge must have loved exploring mountains and rivers and leaving behind her calligraphy. There was a long poem here, depicting the excitement of watching hundreds of dragons swimming freely.

Ranran tilted her head and looked for a while, thinking that her calligraphy in her past life was quite good, unlike her current self who hadn’t put much effort into writing.

However, Su Yi Shui focused on the poem for a while and paused at the end of the verses.

He squinted at the poem and realized it was an acrostic poem. Taking the first and last characters of each line, it formed the phrase “Wait until the sunset.“

It was already evening, and the sun was about to set. He said, “It looks like we have to wait a little longer…”

And so, the two of them sat on the side of the cliff, waiting for the sun to set in the west. They also had time to admire the rare beauty of Dragon Island.

The little dragon they saved refused to leave and kept bringing Ranran big fishes. So Ranran took the time to make a fire and roasted two fish for the little dragon to eat.

The goddess’s guidance had been crucial, and this little dragon was of big help, so it was only fair to roast fish for it.

Just as the two were enjoying the roasted fish with the dragon, the sun gradually lowered to the sea level.

Ranran looked up, and suddenly the setting sun shone through the largest hole in the weathered big rock, casting light on the ground next to the cliff.

The two looked at each other and immediately understood. They ran over, picking up branches to dig the soil. Before long, they unearthed something.

Buried there was a sandalwood box locked with a strange mechanism that couldn’t be opened by force, with runes attached to the box preventing it from being forcibly opened.

Ranran felt that her past self was really too mischievous, coming up with so many obstacles even on Dragon Island, which was full of hostile dragons. What could be inside this box?

However, the time limit given by the Golden Dragon goddess had expired. Accompanied by the roars of countless dragons, seemingly drooling and rushing over towards them.

Su Yi Shui reached out and grabbed Ranran, whispering, “Take the box, we need to leave Dragon Island immediately!”

After saying that, they each rode the wind and rushed towards the border of Dragon Island.

When they reached the boundary amidst lightning and thunder, the voice of the Golden Dragon goddess came again, faintly saying, “After you leave, if anyone asks about me, say that you have never seen me…”

After saying this, a golden dragon tail came out from the sea, creating a wave that pushed them out of the barrier.

Caught in the waves and pushed out, they heard Yu Tong urgently shouting not far away, “Master, Ranran, are you both okay?”

Ranran waved from the water and then jumped onto the large boat with Su Yi Shui.

They had spent almost a day on Dragon Island, but Yu Tong and the others said they only felt that they had been inside for less than four hours.

It seemed that Dragon Island was indeed an isolated immortal realm, and time there did not synchronize with the human realm.

Thinking of the guidance from the Golden Dragon goddess, they didn’t want to waste any time and only wanted to find the person who lit thousands of lotus lanterns on the banks of the Lijiang River on the Qixi Festival.

The Lijiang River was not far from the entrance of Dragon Island’s sea area. The river stretched for thousands of miles, flowing into the sea at its mouth.

When the large boat reached the banks of the Lijiang River, they could already see people placing the lotus lanterns in the night.

Before long, many young men and women arrived at the riverside one after another. It felt like finding someone here was akin to finding a needle in a haystack.

** Green Dragon

I actually didn’t realize this Green Dragon they mention as the Green Dragon

In Mythology there are four divine beasts… three have appeared in the novel so far

Azure Dragon, also Green Dragon 青龙 of the East

White Tiger 白虎 of the West

Vermilion Bird 朱雀 of the South

Black Tortoise 玄武 of the North

Previous
Next

千盏莲灯 A THOUSAND LOTUS LANTERNS

Ranran watched the young men and women releasing lanterns on the riverbank, exchanging glances and feelings with each other, but they couldn’t find anyone resembling the Medicine Immortal.

Elder Jiu with his wine-soaked nose and messy beard, was too deeply ingrained in people’s minds. Even though he had boasted that his biological brother was a handsome man, it was hard to believe, and there seemed to be an element of exaggeration in his words.

So Ranran mainly focused on finding an old man amidst the crowd.

However, although there were some elderly people on both sides of the river, they were all servants or coachmen, and no one was lighting lanterns on the banks.

According to what the Golden Dragon goddess had said, she hadn’t left the island in a hundred years. Even if the Medicine Immortal had a habit of lighting lotus lanterns, he might have changed his habit over the long years.

Thinking of this, Ranran felt a bit discouraged, not knowing where to start anew. Were Wang Suizhi and the others destined to be transformed into water demons?

On the other hand, Qiu Xier was caught up in the atmosphere on both banks and bought two lotus lanterns, squatting on the riverbank with elder senior brother to light them.

Since their adventure inside the array on Red Flame Mountain, their relationship had grown stronger day by day. They could be described as *inseparable. While lighting the lotus lanterns together, Qiu Xier even kissed senior brother on the cheek, causing him to laugh foolishly.
*如胶似漆 literally like glue or paint – sticking very close together

Su Yi Shui glanced at Ranran’s glum expression and asked, “Do you want to light a lantern? I can buy you a few.”

Ranran shook her head, lacking interest, and said, “No need. These are all for praying for love and relationships, it’s no use for me to light them…”

Actually, Su Yi Shui didn’t really think that putting glued paper lanterns in the river would achieve anything either, it was just a lame gimmick to amuse the young girl.

He just casually asked and Ranran gave him a casual reply. But after that, her response started to make him increasingly uncomfortable after he mulled over it.

They were so intimate now, and yet she seemed indifferent to matters of marriage? Was she using him as a practice tool, discarding him after use without any concern?

Mu Qingge’s negative traits seemed to have persisted even after her reincarnation!

With these thoughts in mind, he silently went to the vendor and splurged on a hundred lotus lanterns, along with some paper and ink from a small jar. He asked Ranran to write down her wishes on each one before releasing them into the river.

Ranran looked dumbfounded at the pile of lotus lanterns brought over by the vendor and uncertainly asked Su Yi Shui, “Will lighting these attract the Medicine Immortal?”

Su Yi Shui pointed to the small pieces of paper inside the lanterns and said, “Write down what you want to say to your sweetheart.”

Once again, Ranran was dumbfounded. There were a hundred of them; writing on all of them would fill several pages of love letters…

“Where would I find a sweetheart, and what should I write?” she couldn’t help but mutter quietly.

Was Su Yi Shui considered her sweetheart? He was someone with incomplete memories. He probably didn’t even know if his feelings for Mu Qingge stemmed from love or guilt towards her?

Ranran knew she liked Su Yi Shui, but she also felt that the level of understanding between them was far from the deep connection between third senior sister and senior brother.

Her words “Where would I find a sweetheart” made Su Yi Shui’s handsome face fall completely.

“You always kiss me even though you don’t like me, are you playing with me?” Remembering how she had behaved like this before, teasing and flirting with him in public and then chatting and laughing with his seniors, calling Su Yu “Xiao Yu” nonstop, she seemed really fickle!

Ranran felt that the previous kisses had been due to the influence of the Spirit Spring. As for the kisses after his memory loss, they were simply accidents that occurred during their teaching sessions. But if he arrogantly assumed that she could only love him, it was too presumptuous!

Ranran didn’t feel like arguing with him and simply gave him half of the lotus lanterns, saying, “Why should I write all of them? You can write to your sweetheart too!”

Su Yi Shui stared at her and coldly replied, “Many people admire me. Which one do you want me to write to?”

Ranran glared at him and said, “Then… give these lanterns away to someone else!”

Su Yi Shui immediately retorted without hesitation, “No way!”

In the end, after an argument, they both sat on the steps of the riverside pier, each holding a brush and writing on the paper before putting it into the lotus lanterns.

But just as Ranran finished writing on one and released it into the river, Su Yi Shui unexpectedly scooped it back up with a wave of his big hand and opened the paper to read.

“I hope he can improve his temper in future and not always grab people by the neck at the first sign of disagreement…”

These words didn’t sound like they’re written for a lover; they sound more like well wishes for a murderer.

Su Yi Shui threw the lotus lantern into the river, glaring coldly at her.

Ranran mimicked him and retrieved the lotus lantern that Su Yi Shui had just put into the water. On the paper were dynamic and graceful writing: “Virtuous and reserved, with refined manners…”

What did this mean? Was it hoping for his future immortal companion to have the demeanor of a noble lady?

Su Yi Shui spoke up, “Since no one gave you a lantern for Qixi, I wrote some well-wishes for you.”

Ranran was about to burst into indignant laughter. Was he implying that she wasn’t reserved enough, and lacked elegance and refinement in her usual behavior?

Su Yi Shui stated matter-of-factly, “You smile at people even when you’re not familiar with them. Don’t you know you have a pair of captivating eyes that unwittingly attract others? You also don’t consider the age of the other person. If they are naive and impressionable youths, being smiled at by you so casually might lead to romantic fantasies.”

Ranran didn’t expect her congeniality and ability to be liked by others, could be seen as frivolous behavior. She immediately retorted, “Well you don’t smile at people, but its not like you have not seduced other women! Wen Hongshan, and also Mu Ranwu, they’re all malicious! You should write: ‘Those who like me, need to have hearts as treacherous as snakes and scorpions, with bodies as resilient as steel, otherwise, they won’t last long in chaotic battles!‘”

Su Yi Shui hadn’t expected this young girl, once stripped of her obedient and filial disciple facade, to be so sharp-tongued! Unfortunately, everything she said was true, making it hard to argue.

For a moment, the two of them locked eyes, brewing their frustrations. Then like children having a tantrum, they used their pens as swords, “blessing” each other with many sentences. The result of seeing each other’s “blessings” so much was that both of their faces turned quite dark, completely missing the atmosphere of the tearful reunion of the Cowherd and Weaver Girl on Qixi Festival.

Finally, Su Yishui couldn’t take it anymore. He snatched Ranran’s brush and snapped it in two “Am I really that insufferable in your eyes?”

Ranran retorted, “I’m not that bad. I only wrote about how you like to say one thing but mean another and your terrible temper…”

Su Yi Shui, with cold eyes, handed her another lotus lantern, “Write something good this time….”

Ranran looked at his sulky handsome face and felt that in her past life, she really managed to depict this ferocious beast so vividly in her Playing Classics. With that thought, she picked up her brush and quickly drew long tiger whiskers on Su Yi Shui’s face.

Su Yi Shui hadn’t expected her to be so mischievous; he was about to go over and pull Ranran’s hairbun.

Ranran chuckled as she fell into Su Yi Shui’s arms, reaching out to touch his ink-stained cheek, gradually turning serious as she murmured “A human is not god, how can they be perfect. Even if you are bad, in the eyes of someone who truly loves you, you are still one of a kind…”

Su Yi Shui gazed deeply into her clear eyes and suddenly felt that all the words written on paper were not important anymore. At this moment, her eyes were full of him, and he knew that even twenty years ago, when he turned into the demon’s son possessed by the spiritual spring, there was one person who never gave up on him…

In her eyes, was he that unique person?

As these thoughts ran in his mind, Su Yi Shui had already lowered his head and kissed her cherry lips which lingered with the sweet fragrance of date cake.

As their lips and tongues intertwined, the heart fluttering entanglement of two lifetimes didn’t need words or eye contact, they could feel it through their heartbeats and exhilaration.

When they separated, Ranran looked at Su Yi Shui’s ink-stained handsome face and couldn’t help but laugh out loud.

Su Yi Shui turned her little head to look at the lake surface, showing her her own ink-stained face. During their kiss just now, Ranran’s fair cheeks was also stained with ink.

“Oh no!” Ranran couldn’t help but let out a cry of distress, quickly splashing water on her face. Meanwhile, Su Yi Shui asked solemnly “How about it, do you feel much better now?”

She couldn’t help but look up at him. She finally understood why he was teasing her like this today. He must have noticed her being troubled and guilty about Wang Suizhi and the others, so he picked a fight with her to divert her attention.

Su Yi Shui wet his handkerchief and wiped her face while saying “Everything is preordained. You’ve done your best. If it doesn’t work out, it’s also fate. If you could do everything perfectly, you’d be more powerful than immortals. Then what’s the point of cultivating and understanding the Dao?”

Ranran didn’t say anything, she just planted a wet kiss on his face and then quickly lowered her head to wash her face.

As she washed her face, upstream there were groups of lanterns flowing down with the water, their flickering lights reflecting on the lake, creating a dazzling scene. Ranran glimpsed at the lotus lanterns they had just released, suddenly dispersing in two different directions.

It seemed like an invisible force was pushing them apart. Squinting her eyes, Ranran carefully observed that among the group of lanterns, some were different from the rest, drifting faster towards the mouth of the river compared to the other lotus lanterns.

And her lotus lanterns seemed to have been pushed by those golden lanterns just now, so it floated towards both banks.

Su Yi Shui, who was washing his face, also noticed these lotus lanterns which seemed to carry spiritual energy.

After exchanging a glance, the two quickly stood up and headed towards the direction where the lotus lanterns were drifting from.

As they moved further ahead, they saw a piece of exposed land in the center of the river, where a man in a gray robe with cascading long hair sitting on this oasis, folding lotus lanterns with his own hands and then placing them into the river.

When those paper lanterns entered the water, they seemed to be imbued with energy, immediately spinning and rushing towards the mouth of the river.

Su Yi Shui and Ranran jumped onto the small island just as the man finished placing the thousandth lotus lantern and was about to leave.

Ranran quickly called out “Are you the Medicine Immortal?”

Hearing this, the man turned his head and glanced at Xue Ranran, then squinted his eyes, probably also noticing Ranran’s unusual destiny.

And Ranran quietly looked at the Medicine Immortal’s face, thinking to herself: If he really is the Medicine Immortal, then could Elder Jiu be a child his parents brought home to fill the quota?

This man was really too beautiful… Ranran racked her brain but could only think of the word “beautiful“.

But he was different from Wei Jiu’s feminine beauty. He exuded a clean and pure beauty, like the Western Mountain Ice Lotus, making people feel calm and not daring to tarnish it even a bit.

Looking at this face, then recalling Elder Jiu with his messy hair and beard, it really takes some imagination to associate these two as brothers.

However, that person actually nodded slightly and then looked over the two of them, saying, “One of you two, seem to be an old acquaintance of mine.”

Xue Ranran had been deceived by the Fake Old Immortal of Tianmai Mountain, so she naturally wouldn’t trust him easily. She smiled and said, “I am acquainted with your younger brother, he misses you very much…”

The Medicine Immortal smiled slightly, gazing at the vast river waves, and said softly, “This doesn’t sound like something he would say. If he really missed me, he would have ascended to immortality long ago. I’m afraid there are too many fine wines in the world, making him *forget his original plans… Mu Qingge, are you trying to probe me with these words, are you afraid that I’m fake?”

*乐不思蜀 is an idiom that originated from the Three Kingdoms period, referring to someone who is so contented or immersed in pleasure that they forget about returning home or their responsibilities.

Ranran didn’t expect him to see through her past life with one glance. It seemed that this person in front of her did have some connection with Elder Jiu. At least he seem to understand exactly what kind of person Elder Jiu is.

According to Elder Jiu, she had also been good friends with this Medicine Immortal twenty years ago. Judging from his appearance alone, he indeed met her aesthetic requirements for handsome men at that time.

When Ranran explained the purpose of their visit, the Medicine Immortal suddenly sighed, “You actually know I possess some Green Dragon’s blood? And both of you have the aura of dragons, probably from visiting the Dragon Island… Fengmou refused to give you the Green Dragon’s blood, so she told you to come find me?”

Fengmou? Ranran shook her head, “I don’t know anyone named Fengmou.”

The Medicine Immortal said mildly, “That’s the name I gave her. She said she didn’t have a name and let me call her whatever I liked. Her eyes contained a golden light like the sun, resembling a golden phoenix, so I named her Fengmou…”

Hearing this, Ranran immediately realized who he was referring to as Fengmou.

On Dragon Island, only the goddess’s eyes had a faint golden color. She remembered the scar on the goddess’s face, seemingly related to when she had left Dragon Island. Could it be that hundreds of years ago, when she left Dragon Island, she met the Medicine Immortal?

But why did the goddess forbid mentioning her to outsiders?

Sure enough, the Medicine Immortal then asked, “Is she…well now?”

Ranran clasped her hands and said, “We were entrusted to not discuss matters regarding the goddess, please forgive us.” As for the Green Dragon’s blood, Ranran briefly gave an account of the incident about how the Green Dragon had been drained.

The Medicine Immortal was quite shocked. After a moment, he looked at the lotus lanterns drifting towards the mouth of the sea in the distance and said with a wry smile, “Even if you didn’t say anything, I could guess. I come here every year to release lanterns, and these lotus lanterns drift towards Dragon Island… I thought she didn’t receive them. But since you’ve come to find me, it must also because she guided you. But if she received them, why doesn’t she respond to me and release a lantern out? Does she still refuse to forgive me?”

At this moment, Su Yishui spoke up, “Many years ago, a golden dragon appeared in Mount Bi, transformed into a young girl and fell in love with a cultivator. However, the love between humans and dragons is against the natural order, so in the end, they were forced to separate. And that dragon, lost five hundred years of cultivation in order to protect the cultivator from Heavenly Tribulation…”

The Medicine Immortal looked affected. He stood silently on the oasis for a while before saying, “Yes, that person who fell in love with the dragon girl was me. Back then, in order to collect the Green Dragon’s blood, I devised a plan for several water rats to go to the island. As a result, she came out of Dragon Island to capture me. After that, we met and fell in love. After she blocked the Heavenly Tribulation for me, she said she was tired of love and wanted to return to Dragon Island… never to meet with me ever again.”

When he heard this, Su Yishui raised his eyebrows slightly. The Medicine Immortal glanced at him and with a snap of his fingers, a jade bottle appeared in his hand, which he handed to Ranran, saying, “Give this to the *Old Wine Immortal, he knows what to do.”

After saying this, he turned to Su Yi Shui and said, “You must be Su Yi Shui, right? You seemed to have something to say just now, why don’t you say it directly.”

Su Yi Shui did not intend to say much, but considering that the Medicine Immortal did not make things difficult for Xue Ranran, he said, “You know where Dragon Island is, if you truly wanted to see her, I believe you have a way to get there. Why bother folding lotus lanterns here every year, relying on the river and the tides?”

Since losing his memory, he lacked the maturity and tolerance that had accumulated over twenty years. His words were sharp and incisive, and tend to be spot-on.

The Medicine Immortal smiled wryly, “Do you think I haven’t tried to find her? But she doesn’t want to see me. What can I do even if I go?”

Su Yi Shui said coldly, “A woman who was willing to sacrifice five hundred years of cultivation and ruin her appearance for you, said she doesn’t love you anymore, and you believed her? Was it because she said it decisively, or did you choose to go along with it? If you were in love with someone from the Dragon Clan, you cannot ascend no matter how high your cultivation is. Perhaps it wasn’t her who cut off the love, but she saw that your dedication to cultivation surpassed your love for her. To avoid you having to make a choice, she made the decision for you.”

The Medicine Immortal was moved by these words, his heart actually lurched for a moment. After becoming immortal, he hadn’t experienced such emotional fluctuations for a long time.

He asked softly, “Did she tell you all this?”

Su Yi Shui shook his head, saying indifferently ” I merely guessed. As a man, if you can’t protect the woman you love, whether you become immortal or not, is pointless. If you love someone, whether they’re human or ghost, in heaven or on earth, you should stay by her side! “

Su Yi Shui hadn’t finished speaking, when a cold female voice interrupted, “Such mundane views, it’s better left unsaid. Your cultivation is shallow, how do you know how difficult it is to become immortal? Medicine Immortal, if matters here are done; we should return to the immortal cave…”

Ranran followed the voice and saw a woman with a purple aura above her head approach the Medicine Immortal. She reached out naturally and took his arm, and seemed to be the Medicine Immortal’s immortal companion.

The years to become immortals were long, and often like-minded immortals would become partners, living in the same cave, cultivating together. Although they were not as loving as mortal couples, they were still companions in chess, alchemy and cultivation.

Ranran felt that Su Yi Shui’s words were too direct, fearing that he might offend the Medicine Immortal if he said any more, so she pulled his sleeve and bid the Medicine Immortal and the female immortal goodbye, and left with him.

The Medicine Immortal’s hearing was exceptional. Even though they had walked quite a distance, he could still clearly hear Ranran lecturing him in a low voice, “What’s the use of saying so much? His relationship with the goddess is already in the past. Now that he has a new immortal partner, do you want to incite him to be unfaithful?”

Su Yi Shui coldly snorted, “I just hope he won’t pretend anymore. Since the love is over and he already has an immortal companion, what’s the meaning behind releasing those lotus lanterns to Dragon Island every year? I just hope that next year, he’ll give peace to the one on the island…”

Hearing this, the Medicine Immortal felt a few painful twinges in his heart again. The Jade Lotus Immortal, who lived with him in the immortal cave, transferred some vitality to protect his heart meridians, saying, “You’ve forgotten that during the Heavenly Tribulation back then, you were cursed not to develop feelings. You’d better come back with me for cultivation. Don’t take the words of a rash youngster to heart.”

The Medicine Immortal watched Su Yi Shui’s departing figure and pondered, “Back then, I found it strange when I heard that Mu Qingge’s soul was shattered and yet managed to be reincarnated by shifting her soul to a tree. Even as an immortal, it’s impossible to perform such a feat against the heavens. How did that Su Yi Shui do it, to negate death with only half a golden core? Apart from having his destiny altered, doesn’t his life chart seem a bit peculiar?”

But the Jade Lotus Immortal didn’t care about the resurrection of a mere mortal woman, she was more concerned about the Green Dragon’s blood being drained.

The blood of the Green Dragon was extremely spiritual, just a few drops could achieve a great deal. And now, an entire Green Dragon’s blood had been drained. What did the person who offended the divine intend to do? This was what they needed to urgently get to the bottom of, as immortals.

“Let’s go.” the Jade Lotus Immortal urged again.

Back then she had accompanied the Medicine Immortal in cultivation, but later a golden dragon appeared, causing the Medicine Immortal to leave her. Fortunately, after some twists and turns, everything returned to the right path. Now she lived together with the Medicine Immortal in the same cave, becoming immortal partners.

She won’t allow the Medicine Immortal to act recklessly because of old feelings. That dragon tribulation… had long ended!

The two who obtained the Green Dragon’s blood didn’t even have time to inform Qiu Xier and the others. They hurried back without stopping to the Qiongqi Village.

When they arrived at the cave where the cursed people temporarily resided, they found the entire mountain surrounded by a large number of soldiers.

As the two of them leaped to the cave entrance, they discovered that the entire entrance had been blocked off with earth and rocks.

This was a method devised by Elder Jiu. By mixing lime with the soil and blocking the cave entrance, it temporarily isolated moisture to prevent those transformed from smelling the mountain spring’s aura and becoming frenzied.

However, only Elder Jiu and Yuchen were guarding the cave entrance, and Zhou Feihua was nowhere to be seen.

According to Elder Jiu and Yuchen, among the soldiers below, there were also a few people from the Yi Ren Hall. Initially, they wanted to use True fire to burn down the mountain. Zhou Feihua appeared to stop them and fought with them, revealing her whereabouts, which was then reported to the court.

Later, an edict came, specifying that Zhou Feihua should go to meet the emperor. As long as she agreed, they could temporarily refrain from setting fire to the mountain.

Zhou Feihua, in order to protect the cursed people who were unable to be moved, went down the mountain, to meet the emperor.

Time was of the essence. Ranran didn’t have time to explain the various dangers they encountered on the way or about meeting his brother. She just handed the Green Dragon’s blood to Elder Jiu and urged him to quickly detoxify these cursed people.

The people surrounding them at the foot of the mountain seemed loud and boisterous, but it was only due to their inner fear. Only by restoring these people to their original state as soon as possible could they dispel the apprehension of the soldiers.

药老仙 酒老仙
Old Wine Immortal
You probably realized that even though there is an ‘immortal’ in his name, I keep referring to him as Elder Jiu throughout the novel because he has yet to ascend and I didn’t want to confuse readers.
But his name does have the world immortal in it.

玩物丧志 LOSING FOCUS DUE TO FRIVOLOUS PURSUITS

Elder Jiu first ran to the mountain ditch and caught more than a dozen leeches, dripping a few drops of Green Dragon’s blood on each of them. The bodies of these leeches immediately emitted a faint green light. Then, he placed the leeches on the bodies of those who were cursed.

These soft worms automatically found places to bite in the gaps between their scales, then remained still, beginning to suck their blood.

Elder Jiu said they weren’t sucking blood but rather the demonic energy within these people. As the bodies of the leeches grew larger, the scales on these people’s bodies slowly disappeared, and their strange appearances began to recover.

And the once smooth and moist bodies of the leeches gradually grew scales, resembling shrunken Jiao dragons.

When the demonic energy was drained completely, Elder Jiu caught these leeches and put them into a wine gourd covered with runes. According to him, after refining for forty-nine days within the wine gourd, these leeches would turn into blood and lose their demonic nature.

As for those who finally broke the curse, they all began to sleep soundly. After all, experiencing such a huge transformation also depleted their vitality, requiring a good rest.

While they were asleep, Xue Ranran could finally relax.

However, as she stood at the mountaintop looking down, apart from the soldiers surrounding the mountain, there were also numerous lotus lanterns of different sizes floating in the rivers and streams below.

Ranran couldn’t help but think of the goddess. Just as Su Yi Shui said, after she sacrificed five hundred years of cultivation, perhaps it wasn’t that she didn’t love any more, but that she saw through the Medicine Immortal’s obsession with cultivation and chose to withdraw?

After all, as Elder Jiu said, his brother had always been dedicated to cultivation, definitely more so than him.

Ranran suddenly admired the goddess even more. To love and hate so decisively, to make a clean break, was actually stronger than many immortals and mortals.

Could it be that she refused to respond to the Medicine Immortal’s lotus lanterns because she had already guessed that in the long years to come, there would surely be someone else by his side?

If so, it would be better to forget each other in this world.

Just as she sighed, Su Yi Shui arrived behind her. “Your dear disciple has finally recovered from the curse, why are you still feeling down?”

Ranran shook her head. “It’s not that I’m unhappy, just feeling a little sentimental…”

Su Yi Shui followed her gaze and saw the lotus lanterns in the river below, instantly understanding what she was thinking.

“The Medicine Immortal and you are also old acquaintances. Back then, he thought you were also as unambitious in cultivation as his brother.”

Ranran smiled indifferently, “Being human or immortal is just a difference in longevity, why be so obsessed? The powerful Duntian achieved enlightenment, but in the end, didn’t he also lose interest in life and chose to enter Nirvana?”

Her indifferent demeanor really resembled Mu Qingge from twenty years ago. In the past, Xishan had always been a place for leisure. Rather than leading her disciples to cultivate immortality, it was more like leading a group of children to frolic in the mortal realm.

Although they all honed their respective skills, most of them had little to do with becoming immortal. They simply indulged in their own various interests. Otherwise, with Mu Qingge’s cultivation and skills, how could the three major sects flaunt their power?

Su Yi Shui used to detest Mu Qingge intensely, feeling that her carefree attitude hindered his progress. His earnest cultivation in Xishan was out of phase with his fellow disciples.

However, seeing the Medicine Immortal that day truly disgusted Su Yi Shui.

At that moment, he even felt that the goddess on Dragon Island was somewhat similar to his mother, who had been abandoned by the man who claimed to love her. That’s why he couldn’t help himself, but mock the Medicine Immortal.

In his opinion, a man could choose not to love, but he shouldn’t love with such calculation. To enjoy romance when there’s no trouble, but cast aside the lover whom he made promises to when things got tough, then occasionally reminiscing about that deep love later on—such people made him sick even with just a glance.

Unfortunately, such people were common in the world. Even Emperor Su Yu seemed to have regained appreciation for Zhou Feihua and was trying various ways to bring her back to the palace.

Early the next day, just as the sky was brightening, the soldiers below suddenly retreated one after another. It was said to be an order from higher ups, instructing them to no longer surround the mountain.

At this time, the people in the cave had also mostly recovered. They supported each other with sturdy branches as crutches and descended from the mountain.

When those people returned to the village, someone had already rushed to inform the villagers early on. Relatives came out tearfully to welcome them, but those who had once led the soldiers to besiege them all kept their doors tightly shut.

It seemed that the relationships in between neighbors in this village would need time to mend.

Wang Suizhi did not leave. After he made arrangements for his subordinates and settled the children, he explicitly expressed his desire to serve by Xue Ranran’s side, fulfilling his filial duty.

However, when Su Yi Shui clearly stated that food resources in the Western Mountains were precious and not to be wasted on idlers, Xue Ranran had to tactfully explain that she was no longer the sect leader of Xishan, and she also had to make a living under someone else’s roof, so she couldn’t bring her disciples along.

But Wang Suizhi said, “Master, how can you endure grievances under Su Yishui’s roof? The houses on Western Mountain must be old and unusable by now. Your disciple will find another mountain for you to cultivate and establish a new sect! That Western Mountain, you don’t have to return there!”

As that imposter Mu Ranwu had planned the same thing before, Wang Suiji had already made arrangements for everything. Not only did he select a beautiful mountain, but he also bought the entire mountain and started construction already.

With a wealthy and ambitious disciple, Wang Suizhi said that if his master was dissatisfied and unwilling to yield to Mu Ranwu’s tastes, he could also buy another mountain for her to cultivate.

This statement left Qiu Xier and Gao Cang gasping in awe, with envy written all over their faces.

However, Su Yi Shui’s expression darkened slightly, and his sharp gaze pierced through Wang god of wealth like a knife.

He even channeled a private message to Xue Ranran, suggesting that if she wanted to establish a new sect on another mountain, Wang Suizhi should first prepare a tomb for himself!

Seeing the seriousness in Su Yi Shui’s eyes, Xue Ranran, for the sake of her beloved disciple Wang Suizhi’s life, had to mediate and say that the Feng Shui on Western Mountains was excellent for her, and she was already accustomed to living there.

Wang Suizhi nodded understandingly, then took out a palm-sized gold abacus and made a few clicks. He began to assess the value of Su Yi Shui’s Western Mountain, stating that he was willing to buy it at ten times the market price, so that Su Yi Shui could relocate.

It was all Xue Ranran could do to firmly hold onto Su Yi Shui’s waist with all her strength, to avoid conflict between former disciples and eventual bloodshed.

In the end, Wang Suizhi used his merchant’s eloquence to its fullest. The result of the argument was that Wang Suizhi finally could return to Western Mountain as he wished and could serve his mentor by her side.

Through Wang Suizhi, Xue Ranran also learned more secrets about the Fantian Sect.

According to Wang Suizhi, the demonic ritual that used children as cauldrons to replenish Mu Ranwu’s vitality seemed to be a method taught by the Fantian Sect.

Moreover, the influence of the Fantian Sect seemed to be growing. Back then, Mu Ranwu under the guise of Mu Qingge, had once proudly told him that the rise of the Fantian Sect owed much to her efforts. In the future, all major sects would be under the rule of the Fantian Sect.

As an Elder who contributed to this revival, she and her disciples would reap endless benefits. Once they resurrected the Sect Master, they wouldn’t have to struggle to cultivate anymore. They could ascend directly without enduring the tribulations, and become immortals soon.

At that time, Wang Suizhi had felt uneasy about these grand promises. However, seeing how close that imposter and the Fantian Sect were, as a disciple, he couldn’t say anything.

But now, looking back, wasn’t this just a demonic path of evil? Those who bypassed the tribulations were not immortals but only demons. They had no place in the Upper, Middle and Lower Immortal classes, and could only be considered powerful demon kings.

After hearing this, Su Yi Shui asked, “Who did she say the Sect Master is?”

Xue Ranran had read “Records of the Fantian Sect” and had seen related descriptions in those two volumes. The one referred to as the Sect Master could only be the first-generation Demon Lord, the demon king whose skull was refined into gold!

Could it be that the Fantian Sect wanted to resurrect that golden skull?

At that moment, Ranran thought of the drained Green dragon again. Could the person behind all this be planning to use the dragon’s blood to resurrect the gold-skulled demon?

She also remembered the Rebirth tree that she was reincarnated from and asked Su Yi Shui if he remembered how he knew of the method of resurrection.

But Su Yi Shui could not remember about that part any more.

As for Zhou Feihua, after disappearing for three days and nights, she returned to Qiongqi Village.

Ranran asked her if the Emperor wanted to rekindle their old relationship.

But Zhou Feihua smiled coldly, “How could someone who sits on the throne be as sentimental as you and me? It turns out that my father’s old subordinates were difficult to control, so the Emperor had to reinstate my father and wanted to mend the relationship between ruler and subject. Thus, he thought of inviting me back to the palace… In his eyes, I am ultimately just a pawn with some remaining value.”

Ranran asked, “So, did you agree to return?”

Zhou Feihua shook her head, “My father sent me a letter secretly. The Emperor is currently treating my father favorably as he is unable to manage those generals well. However, once the crisis is over, my father will probably be the first one to go. But to appease the Emperor, I have to go to the palace and deal with him for a few days. After that, I will bid you farewell and hope you take care.”

Ranran didn’t understand the intrigues of the Great Qi Dynasty, but Zhou Feihua seemed to have already discussed countermeasures with General Zhou Dao. She didn’t want to say much more, so after bidding farewell by the river, they went their separate ways.

Before leaving, Zhou Feihua specially reminded Ranran, “The emergence of various monsters everywhere has increased the Emperor’s attention to the cultivation world. The Emperor is now very close to the Crimson Gate Sect. Like the Yiren Hall, the Crimson Gate sect will probably become another tool for the Emperor’s ambitions. Your Xishan is currently ahead of the three major sects in everything, so you must be extra careful in the future!”

Ranran nodded and also advised Zhou Feihua, “You should be careful too. Su Yu’s intentions are unpredictable. Being with such a person is like being with tigers and wolves. Your priority should be self-preservation. Once you settled General Zhou, you should leave quickly.”

Zhou Feihua nodded and said, “Consort Jing has already passed. This time, I am entering the palace in the capacity of a guard. Su Yu has been having nightmares recently, said to be haunted by nightmares. So, he is using my father as leverage to make me return to the palace to continue doing swordplay for him and dispel his nightmares. Once his nightmares subsides, he probably won’t cling onto me anymore.”

Ranran felt that Zhou Feihua was being a little too optimistic, so she handed Zhou Feihua a few spiritual charms, “These talimans can command birds to deliver messages. If you encounter any unforeseen events in the capital, be sure to send me a message as soon as you can.”

Zhou Feihua smiled and nodded. She couldn’t help giving Ranran a hug, patting her back gently, “You take care too and love yourself more. In your past life, you carried too much burden, all by yourself, even immortals couldn’t bear it. Now, Su Yi Shui is the sect leader of Xishan. If anything happens, let the tall man bear the brunt.
