If you sense any danger, be clever and know when to run. Do you know how heartbroken I was twenty years ago, when I heard you had died…”

Ranran couldn’t remember how her friendship with Zhou Feihua was twenty years ago, but despite the age gap between them now, they could still connect as if nothing had changed.

Friendship is truly mysterious. Even across two lifetimes, it can still continue seamlessly.

The two talked by the river for most of the night before reluctantly parting ways.

When they left the Qiongqi Village, it seemed that the number of monsters in various places had decreased. It seemed like someone had released the monsters to cause chaos, but then removed more than half overnight, restoring peace.

However, Elder Jiu said that too many monsters had appeared before, and the balance between Yin and Yang in the world had already been disrupted.

Ordinary people might think that the world was slowly returning to peace, but those with profound cultivation could sense that the balance between Yin and Yang seemed to be changing slightly. Perhaps something big would happen soon.

But for Wang Suizhi, who had just returned to Xishan, it already felt like the end of the world, and his resentment was hard to quell!

What kind of Sect leader of Xishan was Su Yi Shui? The palaces of Western Mountain were once magnificent and luxurious. How did they become so dilapidated now?

According to Yutong, this was actually the restored appearance after she recently had craftsmen repair it! Moreover, his former mentor, the present Xue Ranran, didn’t even live in the best house on Western Mountain; she just lived in the disciples’ courtyard.

Although there were flowers and plants in the yard, and the furnishings inside were the style favored by young girls, Wang Suizhi felt that it was all too plain and petty, not suitable for living.

With the arrival of the God of Wealth to Xishan, even ordinary fish on the dinner table had disappeared, replaced by deep-sea fish from the East sea, bird’s nest soup, and even prawns, each the size of a child’s arm.

This made the several bumpkin disciples of Xishan confused every time they sat down to eat and had to ask about every dish, otherwise they would not know what ingredients they were consuming.

And in the following days, many of Mu Qingge’s former disciples came one after another. They had acknowledged the wrong master in the past, but after hearing the truth, they came, crying and kneeling at the foot of Western Mountain, begging for forgiveness.

Xue Ranran had nothing that she couldn’t forgive them for, but it was difficult to fulfill their wishes and bring them back to Xishan.

After all, Su Yishui was now the Sect leader of Xishan. He had recently favored peace and quiet, and had driven away the batch of disciples he had recently accepted. Obviously he wasn’t going to allow Xue Ranran to bring back her disciples from her past life.

When Ranran asked him why he had asked the junior disciples to leave the mountain, of course, he wasn’t going to tell the truth. Seeing those young disciples surrounding their blooming senior sister Ranran, that atmosphere of youthful vitality, made him feel uncomfortable.

So, he just said solemnly, “In cultivation, besides cultivating Qi, one must also broaden their horizons and gain worldly experience. If one stays on the mountain for too long, they will only cultivate narrow-mindedness. Letting them leave the mountain for adventures will help them cultivate better.”

Such a dignified explanation, truly earned respect. Ranran recalled that he had also brought the new disciples to get experience at Wangxiang Pass in the past, which did indeed broaden their horizons, and their cultivation progressed rapidly thereafter.

So, when she saw off those tearful junior disciples leaving the mountain, as their senior sister, she was filled with encouragement, promising them a bright future.

The gentle words of consolation from their beautiful and kind senior sister, made these young men who had been coldly driven away by their master, feel the warmth of their sect once again. With lifted spirits, they carried their bags and left the mountain for experiences, vowing to return to Western Mountain as new individuals.

As for Su Yi Shui’s reasons for preventing the old disciples of Western Mountain from returning, they were even more lofty and grand.

“They have been away from Xishan for twenty years, each already having their own lives. Moreover, some of them have associated with Mu Ranwu. The human heart is inscrutable and must be guarded against. It’s fine if you want to acknowledge them, but it’s not suitable to bring them all back here… And as for that Wang Suizhi, although he is as wealthy as a nation, there’s no need for such a display on Western Mountain. Our Xishan’s financial strength is not inferior to his, we don’t lack his gold and silver.”

After saying so much, perhaps only the last sentence was actually heartfelt. However, Xue Ranran remembered that Yutong had once said that Su Yi Shui disliked extravagance, so his aversion to Wang Suizhi might indeed be due to an incompatibility of lifestyles.

So, Ranran secretly advised Wang Suizhi to be frugal and not to bring expensive ingredients, furniture and ornaments to the mountain, especially to her courtyard.

Wang Suizhi listened with tears in his eyes, “Master has been reborn for so long, yet you have to live under someone else’s roof this way? It’s regrettable that I didn’t know anything and couldn’t take care of Master properly. That Su Yi Shui is a selfish and heartless person! Clearly knowing that you are his master, he still acts like the sect master himself… Master, you should leave with me and establish a new sect in another mountain!”

The tears of this middle-aged man were actually more difficult to handle than the tears of a pitiful young girl. Moreover, when Wang Suizhi cried, it was truly heartfelt and difficult to hold back.

Ranran didn’t know how to comfort her beloved disciple, so she looked desperately at Su Yi Shui who was not far away, half-hidden in the window of a small building among the flowers.

He had been eavesdropping for a long time, it was time for him to show up and help her out of this predicament.

However, that man with a cold face just snorted and walked away without even looking back.

Ranran couldn’t help but feel a little angry and even thought that the idea of establishing a new sect and living alone was not all bad. At least, she wouldn’t have to see someone’s cold face anymore.

However, after a short while, Yutong hurried over and unceremoniously pushed away the still-sorrowful Wang Suizhi with her shoulder. She said to Ranran, “Master has already brought your parents and Mr Zeng back to Xishan. Tonight, Master wants to welcome them with a good meal, so help me plan a menu with dishes that your parents like.”

Being rushed this way by Yutong, did help get Ranran out of this awkward situation.

Moreover, she didn’t expect that Su Yi Shui, who had always complained about too many people on the mountain recently, would actually bring her parents over here. This was quite a pleasant surprise.

Wang Suizhi also stopped feeling sorrowful and went to catch up with his fourteenth junior brother, Zeng Yi. He had been puzzled before about why old fourteenth had supported Su Yi Shui in his tyranny.

Now that he thought about it, he realized that Zeng Yi had known everything early on and silently protected the true master.

However, it wasn’t until the evening that the Xue couple and Zeng Yi arrived at Western Mountain. Yutong must have rushed to tell her the news, because Su Yi Shui had asked her to help resolve Ranran’s situation.

So, after having a reunion dinner with her parents, Ranran specially washed some fruits and went to find Su Yi Shui by the Ice Lotus Pond.

In the past he used to like to play the zither by the pond at night, watching the faintly glowing ice lotus. But now, the amnesic Su Yi Shui didn’t quite like playing the zither and preferred to sit by the pond and light a lamp to read.

The moon tonight was beautiful. Ranran fed a piece of cut sweet melon to Su Yi Shui before looking at the dusty zither placed in the pavilion. On impulse she sat down at the zither, wiping off the dust with a handkerchief and oiling the strings. Then, she tried to tune the zither and play a simple tune.

Su Yi Shui had taught her how to play in the past, so she could barely be considered a novice. Therefore, although the playing was somewhat raw, it was still passable.

Su Yishui put down the book in his hand and slowly looked up at Ranran.

In her past life, Mu Qingge was an expert at playing the zither, and her zither music was comparable to celestial music. This had made him detest the zither and not like it much.

The zither in the pavilion had been a beloved possession left by Mu Qingge. Yutong told him that in these past twenty years, Su Yi Shui’s greatest hobby was playing this zither. His proficiency was supposedly quite high, which was somewhat inconceivable.

When Su Yi Shui saw Ranran playing the zither, he found that he no longer had an aversion to the deep and melodious sound of the zither.

Ranran tried to play half a tune but couldn’t get one note right no matter what. So, she looked up at Su Yi Shui and asked, “Shifu, how should this part be played?”

Su Yi Shui inititally wanted to say that he didn’t like playing the zither, but he still inexplicably got up and sat behind Ranran, wrapping his long arms around her and placing his fingers on the zither strings.

It seemed that sometimes *muscle memory was more useful than brain memory. Su Yi Shui didn’t even think much; his fingers automatically stroked the zither strings, playing a melodious tune.

The tune he played was “Living in seclusion in Mountains and rivers” the favorite of Mu Qingge in the past.
*渔樵 1 打鱼砍柴 2 渔人和樵夫 3 指隐居
山水 Mountains and rivers

This tune was quite difficult, but he played it effortlessly. He couldn’t help but wonder how much effort he had put into playing the zither in these past twenty years?

No wonder he hadn’t made any progress in cultivation in these twenty years. It turned out that, like the past life of this little demoness, he had been pursuing frivolous endeavors…

But when he saw Ranran turning joyously to look at him, immersed in the elegant music, Su Yi Shui suddenly thought that occasionally indulging in such distractions and frivolous pastimes wasn’t bad either…

*Its funny that Su Yi Shui couldn’t remember how to play chess but he remembered how to play the zither… I suppose playing a tune could be muscle memory and chess required to actually remember the stratagems? haha

Previous
Next

佳偶生怨 A good match turning into resentment

As the melodious zither melody filled the mountains, Wang Suizhi and Zeng Yi, the two fellow disciple brothers, were also drinking and reminiscing on a side pavilion.

Looking beyond the overlapping trees and the water pond, the two could see the scene of the two people playing the zither and gazing at each other by the lotus pond.

Wang Suizhi’s glass of wine was shaking in his hand, spilling all over, and he exclaimed with shock and anger, “Shameless scoundrel! How… how dare he treat Master this way!”

Zeng Yi used his palm to hold the wine pot and poured another cup for his senior brother. He said calmly, “Senior Brother, have a drink.”

Wang Suizhi slammed his wine glass down heavily on the table, “Such disgraceful behavior, aren’t you angry?”

Zeng Yi shook his head and said calmly, “If I didn’t know about their past, maybe I would be as angry as you. But did you think Master risked everything and went against the entire world for Su Yishui to change his destiny, just because of a master-disciple relationship?”

Wang Suizhi was stunned by the question, and Zeng Yi continued, “We claim to be good disciples of Master. Back when Master’s soul was scattered, only Su Yi Shui, this wayward disciple, sacrificed his own cultivation for a chance to save Master’s life. If we look at it from this perspective, we are ashamed to be Master’s disciples!”

Wang Suizhi’s face reddened slightly as he listened, and at this moment, Zeng Yi looked at the man playing the zither, gazing intently at the woman smiling sweetly. Zeng Yi couldn’t help but sigh softly, “So all our Master needs in this lifetime is happiness. We disciples shouldn’t interfere too much.”

Wang Suizhi, still not reconciled to this, shook his head and sighed, “I’m worried that Su Yi Shui has lost his memories about Master and has returned to his reckless ways from when he first joined the sect. What if he suddenly does something that harms Master?”

Zeng Yi was actually most worried about this as well, which was why he had secretly left with Master back then.

However, it seemed now that this worry was somewhat unnecessary. Although Su Yi Shui had lost his memories, his care for Master hadn’t diminished in the slightest.

It would seem that the bond between these two couldn’t be easily broken by a soul-cleansing talisman, so Zeng Yi was taking things step by step.

The close relationship of these two, didn’t escape the notice of Qiao lian and her husband.

Although they were from a rural background, they weren’t fools. They hadn’t been to the Western Mountain before, so they did not see the daily interactions between master and disciple before. Now, they were alerted to this situation where this master and disciple were… being too close?

The couple wasn’t going to let things develop naturally like Zeng Yi.

Their daughter was young and if she was captivated by this kind of handsome master immortal, it would be entirely understandable given her limited experience and world view. But what was this master immortal’s intention? They couldn’t let their daughter be taken advantage of just because she is young, and if he thought he did not have to take any responsibility!

So the couple discussed in private and decided to have a frank discussion with Master Su about their daughter’s marriage.

Before talking to Immortal Su, the couple first asked their daughter for her thoughts.

Ranran felt that her situation with Su Yi Shui was too complicated. Telling her adoptive parents would only add to their worries, so she casually brushed it off, “Mother, you and father are thinking too much. My relationship with master… is not what you think.”

Qiao lian glared “Not like what? I saw with my own eyes that you and Su Yi Shui were holding hands and strolling by the pond, and Su Yi Shui even picked leaves off your head for you. Does a master and disciple normally behave this way?”

Ranran,*hearing that that was all Qiao lian saw, felt relieved. “I thought you saw something else… Isn’t this normal? Master is kind to other disciples like this too… Mother, I need to go practice now.”
*LOOOL if her mother saw them kissing she would do something drastic

Ranran didn’t want to say more, so she said she needed to go practice on the back mountain, and then she ran off.

But Qiao lian felt that something was not right with what her daughter said, and she had actually sighed in relief after hearing her words. Could it be that these two had done something even more inappropriate in private?

She thought that her daughter was naive in her youth, unaware that she was being taken advantage of.

So the couple decided to confront Su Yi Shui directly in the study. After chatting idly for a while about all kinds of matters, the couple exchanged a glance and mustered up the courage and solemnly told Su Yi Shui that they want to leave with their daughter.

Su Yi Shui had asked the couple to come to Xishan because Ranran had been worried about the safety of her adoptive parents. After all there have been monsters roaming around and they live in a secluded place which didn’t feel very safe.

But he didn’t expect the couple to be so ungrateful and suddenly want to take Ranran away.

Su Yishui turned them down flatly without any hesitation.

Ridiculous! Just because they were Ranran’s adoptive parents, they thought they could make decisions like this? He was the one who gave Xue Ranran this life. If they had to talk about who had the right to decide, he was Ranran’s rebirth parent, not this rural couple!

Qiao lian also guessed that Su Yi Shui wasn’t about to let go easily, so she immediately brought up conditions “Immortal Master, I’ve also noticed these past days that you have been far too attentive to our daughter… But she’s all grown up now, and you should be more cautious about gossip. Speaking hypothetically, if you really like our daughter and want to marry her, its not impossible. But my daughter is from a proper family, if you have the intentions, you should first go through a matchmaker and then see what our family thinks!”

Su Yi Shui now recalled the conversation with the couple just now, which he originally thought was just idle chitchat. Now every sentence had some hidden meaning behind it.

For example, Qiao lian asked about properties and businesses besides the Western Mountain, which was probing into his financial background.

The carpenter asked about his age, how often he got up at night, and if he had symptoms of frequent urination, weak waist or kidney deficiency. They were worried if he was too old and weak to be able to make their daughter *happy.
*R21 stuff lol

Additionally, Qiao lian was particularly concerned if he had previous marriages, fearing that Ranran might inadvertently end up a concubine.

The couple had asked about all these details, only then did they bring up marriage for their adopted daughter, showing that they had been planning meticulously and being exceptionally astute, for their daughter’s future.

“She entered Xishan as my disciple, seeking longevity. This has nothing to do with what you’re saying.” Su Yi Shui coldly refused.

Qiao lian noticed that this Master Su seemed much colder towards them compared to before. Was he that confident now that he had taken advantage of their innocent daughter with his honeyed words?

Thinking this, Qiao lian’s boldness surged again, and she spoke more bluntly, “Master Su, you are not the ideal son-in-law in our hearts either. Ranran is now at the age of blossoming youth, and finding a partner of similar age would be most suitable. As for you… although you have the appearance of an immortal and look young, your age is still rather old. Our daughter has limited cultivation and may not be able to withstand the passing of time like you to remain young. So if you have no intention, you should make it clear to our daughter. Although our family is not as wealthy as yours, we are not the kind of people who would sell their daughter to be a concubine. Tomorrow we’ll take our daughter down the mountain, and we won’t trouble your further guidance!”

This was completely the attitude of a rural woman. If the marriage talks didn’t work out, she actually made a veiled insult about his age and health?

Based on Su Yi Shui’s temperament, he would have immediately got up and left. But for some reason, as the words reached his lips, they changed into “…Was it Ranran who asked you to propose marriage?”

Qiao lian thought for a moment and felt that it would be better to show unity as a family of three. She said, “Of course, Ranran has this intention. She has liked watching others getting married since she was young. Now that she’s of age, naturally she wants to become a proper wife through a formal marriage!”

So it was because Xue Ranran couldn’t wait and begged her parents to propose to him — Su Yi Shui thought this and suddenly felt much more comfortable.

Even though she always said she wasn’t sentimental to remain at Xishan, wasn’t there still a hidden desire for marriage in her heart?

Actually, before this, he had never intended to marry a fellow cultivator.

When he got engaged to Wen Hongshan, it was to fulfill his mother’s wish for him to get married. Later, when the marriage fell through, he didn’t feel any regret. Since then, he had never thought of adding any burdens to his life.

The fact that Xue Ranran was so eager to marry him wasn’t unexpected to him. After all, the admiration in the young girl’s eyes was unmistakable; she should have feelings for him…

Considering that she was still quite adorable now and not as annoying as she had been in her past life, and they also had been somewhat intimate, to take her reputation into consideration, marrying her in a formal ceremony… wasn’t out of the question.

After all, she had a stubborn nature, and even though she had improved significantly in this life, if left unattended, her true nature might emerge and become uncontrollable.

There were many things that a master couldn’t control. For example, chatting endlessly with handsome junior brothers, smiling at unfamiliar men, leaving abruptly from the Western Mountain over trivial disagreements, etc. If she married him, then these bad habits could all be corrected.

Thinking about it, marrying her would also have many benefits.

Anyway, whether he married a fellow cultivator or not didn’t matter to him. Leaving this position vacant was also useless. So he might as well marry her, so it would be justified *to manage her in the future.
*manage her? Su Yi Shui are you trying to manage a celebrity LOL

In a moment, Su Yi Shui weighed the pros and cons quickly and finally spoke, “I wonder if you two elders want me to find a matchmaker for the proposal? What about my senior brother Zeng Yi? He has spent some time with both of you and should be trustworthy as a guarantor for the match.”

Qiao lian’s biggest worry now was that her daughter was no longer chaste, and that this darn Master Su would use that against her. So when negotiating today, although her tone was loud, there was also some masked hesitation.

She had mocked Su Yi Shui for being old and weak earlier, but seeing his appearance looking like he was only nineteen, with his exceptionally handsome features that even at her age, she couldn’t help but take a few more looks at him.

Moreover, Su Yi Shui’s financial strength is unexpectedly formidable, with five or six shops in the capital alone, and countless other properties elsewhere, truly a hidden wealthy man.

Her daughter was beautiful, but she was still just a poor rural girl. Marrying someone as capable as Su Yi Shui was quite out of her league.

If she hadn’t been worried that her daughter was not sensible and had become too intimate with him too soon, Qiao lian wouldn’t have had the nerve to shamelessly force this marriage.

She never expected Su Yi Shui to be so forthright, and readily agree to find a matchmaker.

This made her and her husband extremely relieved, they exhaled a long breath and each sat back in their chairs. When Qiao lian recovered, she looked over Su Yi Shui again, now looking at him like her son-in-law, feeling very satisfied everywhere she looked!

Su Yi Shui even wrote an engagement proposal on the spot as proof for the couple. As for the *three letters and six ceremonies, he will follow up with it, and not one will be missed out.
*三书六聘 : 聘书、礼书、迎书 engagement letter, gifts letter, welcoming letter
纳采、问名、纳吉、纳征、请期、亲迎
Accept proposal, Confirm name, Accepting good news, Accepting betrothal gifts, Choosing wedding date, welcoming the bride

After settling this, the couple happily went to find their daughter.

Ranran was gathering Qi cultivation by the lotus pond, lightly standing on the lotus pod with her slender foot, nourishing herself on the water’s surface like a dragonfly.

But when she heard her mother joyfully tell her that they had discussed and finalized on her impending marriage with Immortal Su, Ranran’s qi sank, and she plopped into the water.

When she emerged from the lotus pond, her head was covered with green lotus leaves. She wiped her wet face and exclaimed, “Mother, what nonsense are you all talking about? When did I say I want to marry Su Yi Shui?”

Qiao lian thought her daughter, was just being young and shy, so she continued happily, “Immortal Su readily agreed. Not only did he ask Mr Zeng to act as a guarantor, he also provided his bazi and a proposal for us on the spot. This is not a joke!”

Of course, Ranran knew that once the proposal was made, it wasn’t a joke. But for Su Yi Shui to do this… wasn’t it because of the pressure from Qiao lian and her husband?

She couldn’t explain clearly to her ecstatic parents at the moment, and could only go back to change into dry clothes and summon up courage to go ask Su Yi Shui what he was thinking and why he had hastily agreed to Qiao lian’s demands.

Su Yi Shui was preparing medicine in the alchemy room. When he saw that Ranran had come over, he only cast one glance at her and continued with his work.

“My parents don’t know our complicated situation. You don’t have to take what they said to heart. I will explain to them properly, and your engagement letter doesn’t have to count.”

Hearing this, Su Yi Shui slowly put down the medicine bottle in his hand and looked up, saying, “It’s true that you are *not young anymore. If you’ve considered getting married, just tell me directly. Since I’ve kissed you, naturally I have to take responsibility for you. They are your adoptive parents and I’m now your master, we are all your elders, so discussing your marriage is reasonable and justified. Since it’s already decided, why shouldn’t it count?”
*even if its xianxia, in their world people can get married by 15

Ranran stared wide-eyed, almost getting ensnared in Su Yi Shui’s logic.

Perhaps her wide-eyed look was cute, as Su Yi Shui expressionlessly tapped her nose with the medicine bottle. “Although cultivators are not concerned with trivial matters, we still have some intimacy between us. Your parents asking me to marry you is also reasonable.”

Most of the time, Ranran was very accommodating to her capricious master.

But in matters of marriage, she had a stubborn belief: “Marriage should be based on mutual love between a man and a woman, promising each other eternity. But you have completely forgotten the past and only remember my shortcomings from my previous life. I’m afraid that even if you have a very slight affection for me right now, it only came about after we got along for some time. I don’t want you to settle like this. You already said that cultivators have a longer lifespan than ordinary people. If we regret it in the future, should we divorce, or do we kill each other for enlightenment? I don’t want to become resentful partners with you… I will tear up that engagement letter, and my parents won’t talk nonsense to you like that again!”

After saying this, Ranran turned around to leave but Su Yi Shui grabbed her arm. “Are you saying you don’t really like me, and all the intimacy before was just meaningless flirtation?”

When he asked this, Su Yi Shui’s brows were furrowed with anger, thinking that even after her reincarnation, she was still only here to play games in the mortal world! If she didn’t like him, why could she chat and play the qin happily and be intimate with him?

Ranran had to use her true qi to stop herself from vomiting blood out of exasperation “It’s not that I don’t like you, it’s that you don’t like me! If you really liked me, why can’t you remember me?”

After saying this, Ranran sadly ran out. Elder Jiu had said that if the love was deep enough, the soul-cleansing charm would resolve on its own.

But Su Yi Shui still had not recovered his memories from both her lives, which could only mean that although he had some affection for Xue Ranran, it wasn’t the deep love he had for Mu Qingge.

If that was the case, why force a marriage proposal? Ranran didn’t want to become resentful partners with Su Yi Shui, so it was better not to marry him.

But her abrupt departure left Su Yi Shui feeling frustrated by himself.

Initially, he didn’t have a strong desire to marry either. But he felt that since he had kissed Xue Ranran and she was still an innocent young girl, her parents coming to hold him accountable, as a man, he couldn’t shirk his responsibilities.

Moreover, whether as his disciple or his future wife, she would have to cultivate with him. Other than the marriage certificate, nothing else would change.

But he never expected that this darn girl would blame him for not remembering, as if it were his sin. Did she really expect him to die for her like what Elder Jiu had said?

If that were the case, her name in the cultivation world, might as well be called *”Wang Men Widow”!
*望门寡 is when a girl is engaged and her fiance passes away

Su Yi Shui originally had a nonchalant attitude towards marriage. But now, *he was the one so keen to marry, and so he found himself inexplicably determined to see it through.
*剃头挑子一头热 when doing something, one person is very passionate and the other is indifferent

If she didn’t want to marry him, who else would she want to marry? He wasn’t about to allow her to harm others!

In the end, that marriage proposal did not get torn up. Su Yi Shui got to Qiao lian and her husband first and said told them that Ranran was still young and playful. If she was to tell her parents that the engagement was not valid, he would go along with her wishes for now. However, that marriage proposal would always be valid for him. So until Ranran changes her mind, he asked the couple to keep it safe.

If Ranran wanted to marry someone else in the future… it wasn’t impossible, but she must cancel the engagement with him first.

Su Yi Shui’s tolerant and generous attitude once again won the favor of Qiao lian and her husband.

Later, as Immortal Su had predicted, Ranran came and immaturely insisted on canceling the engagement. Qiao lian and her husband had spoiled her since childhood, and their initial pressure for marriage was out of concern for their daughter being taken advantage of.

But now, since their daughter didn’t want to marry, it was a different matter. Although Immortal Su was indeed extraordinary and capable, he was getting older, and they didn’t know if he was truly as good as he appeared.

They would wait for their daughter to think things through before letting her marry.

Afterward, Ranran tentatively told Su Yi Shui that her parents wouldn’t give her the marriage proposal, but he didn’t have to worry, because she would never use the proposal to cause trouble for him.

Su Yi Shui glanced at her indifferently. “There are two copies of the marriage proposal, and your parents have stamped and signed them. If you go back on your word and want to marry someone else, you’ll have to bring that man before me and let me have a look!”

As he said this, Su Yi Shui’s voice was not loud, but Ranran felt a brewing murderous intent in his words, as if he was ready to act on it anytime.

Ranran asked cautiously, “And after you have a look?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t expect her to continue with this, and wondered if there really was a dog of a man she intended to bring before him. So he couldn’t help but look at her coldly “Xue Ranran, you can bring him over to try me.”

Su Yi Shui rarely used her full name like that, and Ranran could tell that his words were highly-charged. She couldn’t help feeling a little sweet inside her heart, so she tugged at his sleeve and said “I don’t want to marry anyone else but you…”

After hearing this, Su Yi Shui couldn’t help but feel his anger dissipate in a moment, but at the same time, he cursed in his heart: Not wanting to marry yet still teasing him, she hadn’t changed her ways from her past life at all. If he were still a sixteen or seventeen-year-old youth, wouldn’t she have toyed with his emotions and made him lose his soul completely? From this, he could tell that he had been bewitched by her ways twenty years ago, which was definitely forgivable. After all, the experienced enchantress had beguiled the ignorant youth that he was back then…

As he was thinking this, Ranran said in a low voice again, “I hope you could remember, not because I want you to die for me. If something really happens to you, how can I live on? But I just hope you would understand clearly why you are marrying me and I also know why I am marrying you, so we won’t become resentful partners.”

Su Yi Shui felt that Ranran’s thoughts were too naive and childish, but he finally relaxed his stiff posture, and allowed Ranran to lean on his shoulder. He said “You’re still young and don’t understand that most resentful partners in the world all had their period of sweet romance, before they turned resentful. So resentful partners usually didn’t start out because they didn’t think things through, but they just couldn’t withstand the test of time.”

Ranran blinked her eyes, saying softly, “So, if we cultivators become immortal partners, wouldn’t we face endless time and inevitably become resentful?”

Su Yi Shui thought for a moment and said very seriously “If your father’s worries about me, having an aching back and weak kidneys, getting up too many times at night, were true, then resentment will most likely grow.”

Hmm…

Ranran blinked, even though she was a very intelligent woman, she was unable to understand the meaning behind Su Yi Shui’s serious words.

Seeing that she didn’t seem to understand, Su Yishui leaned over and whispered a few sentences in her ear.

Ranran’s fair face immediately flushed red, and she stared speechlessly at Su Yi Shui. She then stood up stiffly, and kicked her former wayward disciple in anger before rushing out.

She couldn’t believe her ears. How could such a proper man like Su Yi Shui say such improper words?

But that night, Xue Ranran tossed and turned, unable to sleep. Eventually, when she finally fell asleep, she dreamt of herself in a red dress, covered in a red veil, being led by *Su Yi Shui into a red silk candlelit bridal chamber.
*男人 in the novel, the author liked to refer to Su Yi Shui sometimes as ‘the man’.

Ranran blushed furiously and hesitated to recall the events in her dream after the candles were extinguished. But the dream was both tiring and long, with someone whispering in her ear, “If I don’t exert some effort, what if you start to feel resentful?”

When she woke up in the morning, Ranran hid under the covers, and closed her eyes to secretly remember her dream for just a moment.

Then, Qiu Xier came to urge her to get up for breakfast, and when she saw Ranran’s blushing face from the window, she jokingly said, “Junior sister, why are you still in bed? Was raunchy dreams keeping you?”

Ranran threw a pillow at her, feeling a sudden panic — was she that obvious? If Su Yi Shui noticed later, what should she do?

This chapter made me laugh so much, especially how Su Yi Shui was acting nonchalant at first but later became so ready to ‘put a ring on it’ even though he can’t remember why or how he loves Mu Qingge or Ranran lol
Who was the one who just said very loftily, that love is not something to be measured by pros and cons… seeing how he is convincing himself that yes, its going to be great to marry Xue Ranran… just so hilarious…

Also Su Yi Shui was unexpectedly old-fashioned, pure of heart regarding ‘taking responsibility’. Even if he had been some cold blooded, ruthless former demon lord, he was like a switch when it comes to feelings. He only has ‘On’ or ‘Off’ hahaha

Talk about rapid advancement! Who would have thought they would get engaged before Su Yi Shui solves his problem with the soul-cleansing talisman? lol
Did you see this coming at all?

Ranran’s adoptive parents are just such a hoot. I am worried they have been written out of the drama though, since the trailer had said Ranran had ‘nowhere to go’… that made it sound like she was an orphan? I guess we will only know when the drama airs…

Next

李代桃僵 SUBSTITUTIONS

Ranran was worried for nothing. At breakfast in the early morning, Su Yi Shui was already surrounded and hounded by his future prospective in-laws.

Now with Qiao lian helping in the kitchen, it was very convenient for her to prepare hearty and nourishing dishes for her future son-in-law. This early morning, Su Yi Shui was treated to his very own pot of lamb, baizhu and yam porridge. The porridge was served with stir-fried pieces of sea cucumber as a side dish, all extremely beneficial for men’s health.

When Gao Cang tried to take some, Qiao lian stopped him and said, “You’re young and vigorous, and not yet married. You don’t need to eat this. Too much tonics for you might lead to nosebleeds!”

After this remark, everyone looked at Su Yi Shui and then at Xue Ranran.

Xue Ranran ignored everyone’s gaze and hurriedly ate the porridge with the bowl blocking her face. She couldn’t wait to leave the table.

She would definitely have to talk to her mother about this later. She couldn’t afford to be embarrassed like this. What did Su Yi Shui’s kidney health have to do with her? Being so anxious, wouldn’t it lead to misunderstandings from others?

But someone else wanted to talk to her too, and that was Yutong. Ever since she found out that Ranran was the reincarnation of Mu Qingge, Yutong’s gaze towards the young girl had become particularly complex.

She was quite prejudiced against Mu Qingge’s life, yet she was very fond of the present Xue Ranran. This conflicting feelings of affection and dislike left Yutong unsure of how to act around Ranran.

In the end, she could only try to avoid conversations to prevent awkwardness.

But now, under pressure from the Xue Couple, Su Yi Shui had already signed the engagement letter. When Yu Tong heard this news while helping in the kitchen, she was also very shocked.

Considering this, Yutong felt she couldn’t remain silent anymore. She needed to have a deeper conversation with Xue Ranran to understand the situation better and before she could entrust her master to her.

So she solemnly pulled Ranran aside into the bamboo grove and asked her with a serious expression if she was only toying with the master?”

Ranran rubbed her temples and sighed, “Your master is still shrewd even after being affected by the soul-cleansing talisman. As for my parents, they are straightforward and simple people in their actions. They have misunderstood my relationship with Shifu, which was why they hastily proposed this marriage. Don’t worry, I’ve already talked to them. I won’t be marrying Su Yi Shui…”

Yutong quickly interrupted her, “You have misunderstood. I’m not here to blame you. Twenty years ago, I was still young and prone to biases, so I have said some bad things about you unintentionally. Please forgive me.”

Yutong wasn’t foolish. After all these twists and turns, she had a better understanding of Mu Qingge’s character from twenty years ago. If she had been a little older back then, she might have been able to admire Mu Qingge like Zhou Feihua.

Now she finally understood why her master had been so depressed over the past twenty years. If these two could become a happy couple, it would fulfill the master’s long-standing wish, and everything will be settled nicely.

Moreover, she had some selfish motivations too, she wanted to tell Ranran about them now “In the past, my brother and I have always watched over our master. Besides the master-servant bond, it was also because our master was lonely and had no one else in this world. But if he has you as a companion, he won’t be alone anymore. Then, I can completely let go of my worries and resign from serving our master.”

Ever since her son and lover were threatened at the foot of the mountain last time, Yutong’s mindset had changed significantly.

Becoming an immortal was indeed desirable, but gradually watching her beloved grow up, even grow old was also an unattainable happiness for immortals.

Yutong felt guilty about her son and lover, so she had long abandoned the idea of cultivating for immortality and wanted to find an opportunity to leave the mountain and hold a long-delayed wedding with her lover.

And now, Ranran marrying the master was an opportune moment. So when Yutong approached Xue Ranran this time, it was somewhat like a mother remarrying, entrusting her responsibilities before she left.

Additionally, Yu Tong had not talked to Su Yi Shui about this yet. She was worried about the reactions of the master and her brother. If they disagreed, even if she felt reluctant to leave the father and son duo alone at the foot of the mountain, she couldn’t just leave on her own.

However, Ranran thought this was a good thing. Yutong’s son was still young, not yet seven, and was at an age when he needed his mother. She readily agreed to help Yutong talk to Su Yi Shui about this, so that Yutong wouldn’t feel embarrassed in front of the master and couldn’t bring it up.

When Ranran brought this up with Su Yishui, he responded seriously, “When she’s gone, who will take care of me?”

Ranran was grinding ink for him at that moment. She hadn’t expected him to say something so *crude, “So, just because you lack someone to take care of you, you’re preventing a family reunion?”
*虎狼之词 用来指一些词语一旦说出口，就变得不纯洁了。
Words that can be misconstrued to be vulgar

While Su Yi Shui transcribed his medicine formulae, he continued indifferently, “She was ready to leave because you were going to marry me. If you don’t marry me, can she leave with peace of mind?”

Ranran blinked, understanding his meaning. Goodness, so the main culprit preventing Yutong’s family happiness turned out to be herself?

She probably did not teach this ability to shift blame to this rebellious disciple in her past life. Ranran’s hand paused as she looked at Su Yi Shui’s handsome profile and asked, “Are you… forcing me to marry you?”

Su Yi Shui gave a cold laugh and organized his stack of finished prescriptions, “I’m not some rogue from your village who can’t find a wife. I don’t care if you want to marry or not.”

Although he spoke lightly, the slight frown and pouting expression showed that he was clearly annoyed.

Ranran chuckled, playfully rolled her eyes, and said mischievously, “Then, will you agree to let Yu Tong leave the mountain, and I’ll seriously consider our marriage?”

This time, Su Yi Shui snorted coldly and didn’t speak further. Ranran picked up her small brush and continued copying the prescriptions.

The enemy Xishan faced this time is the Fantien Sect, which has not been seen in the world for a long time. This kind of demonic sect is full of evil followers, so precautions must be taken. In recent days, the alchemy furnaces in the Western Mountain have been continuously burning to produce a batch of elixirs quickly.

The master and disciple were busy transcribing the prescriptions to distribute to the others.

But after writing for a while, Su Yi Shui suddenly spoke again, “How long are you going to consider?”

Ranran was dizzy from copying, so she exclaimed “Ah?” in confusion, but when she saw Su Yi Shui glaring fiercely at her, she suddenly realized he was continuing their earlier conversation.

How should she answer this? She didn’t know how long she needed to consider either. But her delayed response clearly displeased the big demon lord again.

With a cold face, he stood up, and left the study coldly with a graceful wave of his sleeves.

Ranran called after him, but he didn’t even turn his head, truly even more stubborn than a child.

Ranran thought he would take out his anger on Yutong. But unexpectedly, Yutong came running happily later, telling her that the master had agreed to let her descend the mountain. Even her dowry for the wedding would be provided by Xishan.

Yuchen, upon hearing that her sister was getting married, couldn’t help but cry even as a proud man. He felt that, as an elder brother, he had owed his sister too much. So much so that she was only getting married at this *old age.
*Yutong should be only 22 lol she had the child at 16 and her son was getting on 7
**So for reference Ranran is 18-19 which was why her parents were like.. you are getting old!

This crying turned into an unstoppable flood of tears, causing Su Yi Shui to finally say, “Why don’t …you go down the mountain too to live with your sister, and get married and have children?”

Yuchen immediately fell to his knees “Master, I will stay by your side for the rest of my life! Even if you drive me away, I won’t leave!”
*hahahah at this point I wonder if Su Yi Shui just wanted to have a 2 person couple life with his Ranran
Get a clue already Yu Chen

After saying that, he burst into tears again, as if a loyal dog was about to be abandoned, crying out of fear and worry.

Yutong’s marriage was a joyful event, which allowed the tense nerves of those on Xishan to finally relax a little.

Ranran personally went down the mountain with her fellow disciples to buy Yutong’s dowry and other necessary items.

However, when they returned to the Western Mountain, a figure covered in blood suddenly was came out from the side of the mountain road.

Everyone thought another demonic being had come to the Western Mountain and jumped back in fright.

But Ranran saw clearly that this person… wasn’t it Elder Wen Chunhui of the Kongshan Sect?

She was the elder who took over major matters in the sect after Wen Hongshan met her demise. Ranran had dealt with this elder before when she retrieved the stolen horses from Gao kan. She felt that this elder was different from people like Kaiyuan Elder and had a fair and upright character.

At this moment, she was covered in wounds, clearly very seriously injured within an inch of her life.

Ranran asked, “Elder Wen, what happened? Why are you in such a miserable state?”

Wen Chunhui had just taken a sip of water given by Qiu Xi’er, wiped the fresh blood from her face, and said in a trembling voice, “The three major sects have been nearly annihilated, not a single elite disciple remains. Retribution… could this be retribution?”

She was present when they besieged Mu Qingge back then. She remembered the woman dressed in fiery red, standing on the mountain top, watching the three major sects that were besieging her. She had said loudly, “I, Mu Qingge, am not ashamed before heaven and earth. I have dedicated myself to saving the common people. It’s just that some of you intentionally obscure the truth, unable to discern right from wrong. Although I do not fear death, I fear that you will suffer the consequences of your ignorance in the future. At that time, I’m afraid the orthodox world will be in chaos and no longer exist!”

At that time, Mu Qingge’s words were clear and convincing. However, the people eager to eliminate the demoness didn’t take her words to heart.

Unexpectedly, her words which resembled a curse were slowly being fulfilled more than twenty years later.

At this moment, Wen Chunhui looked at Xue Ranran, the reincarnation of Mu Qingge, with regret and self-blame, almost unable to continue her next breath.

Ranran hurriedly gave her a Soul Soothing pill, stabilizing her heart meridian temporarily.

But Ranran didn’t let anyone carry her up the mountain. Because according to Wen Chunhui, she had just experienced a fierce battle with the Fan Tian Sect.

The Fan Tian Sect was so sinister that no one could guarantee whether Wen Chunhui had been affected or if there were any demonic things on her body.

So Ranran thought it was more prudent to temporarily settle her in the thatched hut at the foot of the mountain.

When Su Yi Shui and the others arrived, Wen Chunhui weakly recounted her previous experience.

It turned out that when demonic creatures were rampant everywhere, the three major sects also had the idea of revitalizing themselves. After all, in the previous clashes between the righteous and demonic forces, the three major sects suffered heavy losses, and their reputation was in jeopardy.

So led by Elder Kaiyuan, they decided to take advantage of the extermination of demonic creatures to rebuild their reputation and recruit a new batch of talents to continue the prosperity of their sects.

Initially, this plan was sound. Although these demonic creatures were formidable, they were all creatures of the Netherworld, and had been recorded in ancient texts. If they were careful and vigilant, there was nothing to fear. If they couldn’t win, they could escape, which was easier than facing the generals of the demonic sect.

With this plan in mind, the three major sects displayed their banners high, and their entire journey was in high-spirits and well publicized.

However, when they gathered to capture the Nine-Headed Monster Python causing trouble in Python Mountain, something unexpected happened.

Because the Nine-Headed Monster Python had been eating many locals, its body had grown enormous and it couldn’t hide in the mountains anymore, making it easy to find.

At that time, Elder Kaiyuan intended to let his Jiuhua Sect take the lead. So after injuring the snake’s tail, he felt quite confident and brought local officials from the Prefecture and County to set up a viewing platform at the foot of the mountain, inviting officials to admire their righteous acts of subduing demons and monsters.

They also bought a lot of firecrackers, hired drummers and gong players in preparations for slaughtering the monster. This way, when they carried it down, while beating the drums, setting off firecrackers, they would create an atmosphere of monster subduing heroes.

All these were Elder Kaiyuan’s idea. He had also heard about Xishan subduing the water demons. What was originally a good thing to boost their reputation turned into a mess by those few ignorant people from Xishan.

It would have been fine to just subdue the water demons and hand them over to the local authorities for recognition and commendation.

Instead, the stupid fools from Xishan ended up offending the officials just to save a few villagers who had been demonized.

In the end, it seemed that the local people had complained in private, blaming those from Xishan for letting those who had been possessed go free. They didn’t know if these people would become possessed again in the future.

Elder Kaiyuan has learnt a lesson from the “foolishness” of Xishan and decided not to do anything that was laborious and thankless, so he made ready to just do enough superficial work.

But just when everything was ready and only awaited the final step, Elder Kaiyuan and the people from the other two major sects didn’t expect that an accident would happen. The giant snake that was supposed to be captured suddenly swelled up as if it had absorbed some immortal elixir, like a colossal dragon, it devoured several disciples from the three major sects on the spot. After absorbing their cultivation, the nine-headed monster python even grew thin yet huge wings behind its back, soaring into the sky and covering the sun.

By that time, Elder Kaiyuan knew that his plan had backfired, so he disregarded the officials who had been invited to watch the show at the foot of the mountain and tried to escape using earth escape.

He was in a sorry state, not able to escape yet, when Wei Jiu and the people from Crimson Gate arrived just in time.

Wei Jiu was currently cooperating happily with Su Yu, and like the three major sects, he also planned to take advantage of this opportunity to establish a righteous reputation, elevate Crimson Sect’s name, and eventually absorb the three major sects into his sect.

So after Elder Kaiyuan messed up the scene of killing the monster Python, Wei Jiu descended like a divine soldier, using extraordinary force to chop off all nine heads of the snake.

The firecrackers and the loud gongs and drums prepared by Elder Kaiyuan became a celebration for Crimson Gate’s Excellency Wei’s triumph.

The three major sects were crestfallen, originally intending to show off but ending up with humiliation.

However, Elder Kaiyuan had always been thick-skinned. He claimed that their three major sects laid the foundation for Crimson Gate’s final glory, so he plastered a fake smile and bantered with Wei Jiu.

Even the bodies of ordinary snakes could be considered treasures, let alone this nine-headed monster snake, which could provide materials for alchemy and cultivation. Elder Kaiyuan didn’t want Wei Jiu to take it all it, so he insisted on demanding a share.

Wen Chunhui had her pride. She had already lost so miserably fighting the monster python, how could she stay to share the spoils?

So she didn’t wait for Wei Jiu’s mockery and led her disciples to prepare to leave. It was because she led her disciples a few steps away in time that they narrowly escaped a bizarre calamity later on.

Just as the people from the other major sects argued with Crimson Gate, preparing to divide the large python, the severed heads suddenly exploded, splattering blue blood plasma everywhere, instantly enveloping several people close to the snake in blood bubbles.

Inside the bubbles, people struggled desperately. The blood bubbles would cave in and swell up alternately. After a while, they burst open, with two identical people crawling out of each bubble. Strangely, each pair of people looked exactly the same.

When Wen Chunhui, who was standing far away, saw this scene, she felt her hair stand on end.

The “twins” who walked out of the blood bubbles were also surprised. They looked at each other and exclaimed “demon!” before attacking their other selves.

Wen Chunhui was shocked by the sudden turn of events. Each pair of people that emerged from the blood bubbles not only looked identical but also had the same voice, fighting skills, and even weapons, making it impossible to distinguish between them.

Multiple groups of people started fighting at the same time, chaos ensued, and it turned into a messy brawl. Wen Chunhui was in a state of confusion. Although she knew something was very wrong, she had no idea whom to help.

After a while, the victors from several groups gradually emerged. Those severely injured turned into a blue blood mist, which dissipated lightly with the wind.

As for Crimson Gate’s Wei Jiu, he was defeated by “himself” and fell into a deep ravine.

The surviving Elder Kaiyuan showed a sinister smile on his face, looked around, and then clasped his hands, addressing Wei Jiu and the others from the sects, “I didn’t expect the monster python to be so cunning, actually transforming again. Fortunately, the monsters it created were weak, and we managed to defeat them easily!”

The victorious people from the other sects also echoed, as if parrots repeating, “I didn’t expect the monster python to be so cunning, actually transforming again. Fortunately, the monsters it created were weak, and we managed to defeat them easily!”

After saying this, they all looked strangely towards Wen Chunhui who was not far away.

Elder Kaiyuan smiled at her and said, “Elder Wen, you are the only one left…”

Wen Chunhui cautiously retreated a few steps with her disciples, intending to leave. However, those people suddenly picked up the only remaining snake head and threw it at her.

Wen Chunhui dodged quickly with her agile skills, but several of her disciples next to her were hit. They were also wrapped in blue blood bubbles, and when the bubbles burst, they engaged in another round of infighting with themselves.

And the last people left standing all had the same eerie smile as Elder Kaiyuan…

At that moment, Elder Wen Chunhui suddenly remembered the legend about this nine-headed monster python, which said that its blood could divide human bodies, allowing evil beings to replace them.

In other words, the people smiling at her were no longer the same people as before!

Just as she realized this, Elder Wen Chunhui was surrounded and attacked by those eerie smiling people.

When she was heavily injured and couldn’t defend herself, she suddenly felt nothing beneath her feet, and fell down a cliff. Immediately, a large hand covered her mouth, and spiritual talismans were stuck all over her body.

She turned her head and saw that Wei Jiu, who had fallen down the mountain cliff earlier, was hanging on a tree branch halfway up the cliff. He used his hand to cover her mouth and then applied an invisibility charm from Elder Jiu, creating the illusion that they had fallen into the deep ravine.

Wen Chunhui watched with wide eyes as the faces at the top of the cliff looked down grimly.

Just then, the sound of gongs and drums from below the mountain grew closer, and the officials, along with soldiers and villagers, came up the mountain to welcome the triumphant cultivators.

And so, those eerie beings, under the guise of the Three Great Sects and the Crimson Gate, descended from the mountain as if everything were all in order.

If Wei Jiu and Wen Chunhui had not miraculously survived, this entire substitution scheme would have gone completely unnoticed.

After those people carrying the monster python dispersed, two figures finally climbed up from halfway up the mountain.

Wei Jiu had endured half a lifetime of hardship, and now that he was finally about to rise, someone had impersonated him, which ignited a fire of frustration in his heart.

However, he was still astute. So he urged Wen Chunhui not to return to Kongshan Sect but to go to Xishan, to tell Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran about the situation of the Three Great Sects.

Now, the only ones who could protect her were the people from Xishan. Wei Jiu turned and headed for the imperial palace to explain the situation to Su Yu and find a solution.

Before parting ways, the two of them also saw the situation below the mountain from afar.

At that time, Wei Jiu, in order to show off his prowess, had told Tu Jiuyuan and most of the sect members to wait at the foot of the mountain.

And now, Tu Jiuyuan was kneeling before the fake Wei Jiu, listening to his commands. The fake Wei Jiu even lightly caressed Tu Jiuyuan’s chin with his finger.

Wei Jiu felt like he was about to explode with anger. But he knew that the imposter had completely replicated his abilities and cultivation, and with his own serious injuries, going out now would be *pointless.
*肉包子打狗 hitting dogs with meat buns, useless and just feeding them

So, they both acted separately, looking for reinforcements.

Listening to Wen Chunhui’s bizarre story, the disciples from Xishan looked at each other in confusion.

Qiu Xier was particularly anxious and said, “This… is quite difficult. Even the real and fake Monkey King was not discernible before the Mirror of Truth. If what you said is true, and the real and fake are so alike as if they were twins, how can we distinguish between them? Moreover, you speculate that most of the members of the sects have been killed. Even if you say it, I’m afraid no one will believe it.”

Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran also exchanged glances. Especially Xue Ranran, who couldn’t help but lament a little. When she was first taken in as a disciple by Su Yi Shui, the Three Great Sects were still thriving, at their peak.

Unfortunately, nothing lasts forever. With recent setbacks to the Three Great Sects, and now with major figures being replaced, it seemed like the sects would be wiped out soon. It was no wonder Wen Chunhui was so distressed and confused.

Although Su Yi Shui didn’t speak, he understood that the three great sects had to be saved. Once these strange creatures, transformed from the snakes have completely taken control of the Three Great Sects, they wouldn’t spare Xishan.

The current plan was to strike while they were still unaware of the exposure of their plan, catch them off guard, and eliminate them first.

However… Su Yi Shui was never one to trust easily: was the Wen Chunhui before him real or fake?

Xue Ranran seemed to sense his doubts, and she had actually also thought about this. The way to verify it wasn’t that difficult, but she didn’t know if her idea was feasible.

Something not really directly related but while we are on the ‘marriageable’ age when we watch period dramas, the main reason I guess why people used to consider 20s as ‘old’ was because of the overall life expectancy back then?

Perhaps due to lack of medical knowledge etc back then, according to history, even favored consorts in the palace, who should have had access to the best of everything, most do not live beyond 50 years old. This would make being in their 20s already like the mid point of their lives.

Something to think about.
Aren’t we glad to be living in this era now? Where being in our 20s is just ‘the beginning’?
