Next

一正一邪 ONE GOOD, ONE EVIL

About this description of the nine-headed python, Ranran had read about it in the Fantian Sect Records.

This python had the ability to divide and transform into human forms, creating counterfeits that were indistinguishable from the real ones, effectively replacing them. However, these counterfeits had a flaw that could be detected; because they were actually condensed from yin energy, during the brief period when yin and yang alternated at midnight or noon, these counterfeits would not cast shadows.

So, when noon arrived, Ranran supported Wen Chunhui into the sunlight, and on the ground appeared Wen Chunhui’s clear shadow, instantly reassuring everyone.

After hearing Ranran’s explanation later on, Wen Chunhui sighed in relief and said, “It is good that there’s a way to distinguish them. I’m really worried that those impostors posing as the heads of the major sects will cause chaos in the cultivation world.”

Although she hadn’t been affected by the snake poison splitting her body, several of her disciples who went with her had been replaced. Once those impostors returned, they would certainly cause trouble in the Kongshan Sect.

When Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui discovered that the skull of the Demon King had been stolen, they didn’t say much at the time in order to withdraw from Red Flame Mountain.

But after they returned, Xishan then sent letters to the major sects, explaining the theft of the Demon King’s skull and the intentions of the Fan tian Sect to revive the demon king and cause chaos. The letters also mentioned the rise of demonic creatures in various places, which are related to the revival of the Fantian Sect.

At that time, the major sects thought it was nonsense, believing that Xishan was being alarmist and causing panic.

But now, looking back, everything Xishan said had come true. Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran were among the few clear-minded individuals in the cultivation world who actually knew what was going on. Unfortunately, no one believed them at the time.

Wen Chunhui was now filled with regret and remorse. Thinking about the situation, every hair on her back stood on end.

The ability of the Fantian Sect to destroy major sects was even more terrifying than the demonic forces like Crimson Gate sect, completely taking over without anyone noticing. The most chilling thing is what was their ultimate goal with this action?

At this time, the major sects had inexplicably closed their doors and forbidden people from freely going up and down the mountains. Countless carts carrying black stones were being transported up the mountains, but what exactly was on those carts remained a mystery for the time being.

At the same time, Wei Jiu, who was now alone, also arrived at Xishan.

The once mighty Demon Lord hadn’t expected to come to Xishan seeking help from that person with the surname Su. So when he arrived at the foot of the mountain, he didn’t go up directly but wandered around instead.

In the end, he actually managed to sneak in with the crowd attending the wedding of Yu Tong.

On that day, with the marriage of Yu Tong, there were many relatives from the groom’s village, and everyone was in high spirits. Wei Jiu concealed his aura and specifically changed into women’s clothing. He already looked androgynous, except for being taller, he really looked like a handsome woman.

Then, taking advantage of the distraction, he slowly approached Ranran who was counting dowries under the corridor of the new house, and held a dagger against her waist.

“Little girl, don’t move, even though you’ve improved a lot, with my dagger so close, killing you wouldn’t take much effort.” he deliberately whispered close to Ranran’s ear.

Although Ranran was being threatened and the situation was dire, when she saw Wei Jiu dressed as a woman, she couldn’t help but burst out laughing, with her shoulders shaking.

Because only female relatives were allowed inside the new house, Wei Jiu had knocked out a matchmaker and changed into her clothes in order to sneak in.

He had just let his hair down and twisted a braid randomly, and had not applied makeup like the other village women. Was it really necessary for her to laugh so uncontrollably?

But before Wei Jiu could reprimand her, his wrist was firmly clasped by an iron palm, and he was lifted and pressed down to the ground.


Su Yi Shui appeared behind him at some point, flipping him over and stepping on Wei Jiu with one foot.

Wei Jiu seemed to have difficulty summoning his true vitality, so he could only struggle and curse frantically.

Even though Su Yi Shui hadn’t regained his memory, he was fed up with Wei Jiu, especially after seeing how close Wei Jiu had gotten to Ranran earlier, not knowing if he had offended her ear with his words.

Thinking about this, Su Yi Shui didn’t hold back and started punching Wei Jiu without restraint, determined to teach him a lesson.

Just then, the happy couple rushed in amidst the crowd of friends and family.

The originally merry villagers were stunned into silence when they saw the renowned divine healer Su Yi Shui sitting on the back of a “woman” with disheveled hair.

Ranran quickly stepped in front of the two men who were stacked together, laughing and saying, “*Just making trouble in the bridal chamber!”
*闹洞房 is a wedding tradition

After speaking, she turned around and signaled to Su Yi Shui.

Today was a joyous day for Yu Tong, so nothing should go wrong. Even if he wanted to teach Wei Jiu a lesson, it had to be done elsewhere.

So, everyone saw Su Yi Shui hoisting up the woman with long hair. In the blink of an eye, they had disappeared over the wall.

Ranran awkwardly tried to lighten the mood, saying, “Come on, the groom, should also carry the bride into the bridal chamber!”

With the cheers of Xishan disciples, they finally managed to resolve the situation.

As for Wei Jiu, who was carried away by Su Yi Shui, he seemed to manage to collect his breath. When he was thrown into the grassy area, he immediately cursed loudly and started grappling with Su Yi Shui.

Ranran stood by, munching on pumpkin seeds and watching the fight. It was clear that Su Yi Shui had the upper hand, landing punches with no resistance from Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu, was already weakened by the giant python’s poison, with his vitality weakening steadily. As they fought, he realized that tortoise’s son Su Yi Shui was once again trying to absorb the little true vitality he had left.

Infuriated, he cursed, “Su Yi Shui, are you even human? My dantian is so empty, I could raise fish in it! And you still want to absorb my true vitality! Why don’t you just stop people on the road and go rob the major sects directly! If you kill me, you won’t know the current situation of the major sects!”

This last sentence finally had some effect, and Su Yi Shui finally stopped beating him up.

If Wei Jiu had any other way out, he wouldn’t have come to Xishan to disgrace himself.

He had originally planned to go to the capital to seek help from Su Yu.

After all, they had always cooperated well, and Wei Jiu was on the verge of becoming the Imperial Advisor of Daqi.

But that damned Su Yu, only used people when it suited him, and he would deny knowing them if things went south.

Especially after hearing that Wei Jiu had been contaminated with the blue blood of the nine-headed snake, Su Yu didn’t even let him into the palace. At noon, he only sent an old eunuch who had previously relayed messages for the emperor, to send a few comforting words to Wei Jiu from a distance.

The gist of it was that the emperor was deeply concerned about the disaster at Crimson Gate Sect and worried for Wei Jiu’s safety. His Majesty believed in Wei Jiu’s abilities and that he was sure to overcome this calamity. He assured him that if he needed money, even if the national treasury was depleted due to war, the emperor would do his best to provide some silver.

While the words sounded comforting, apart from silver, Su Yu offered no other help. It seemed like he was content to watch the Fan tian Sect crush the major sects, including Crimson Gate sect.

Ranran knew the emperor’s cunning nature well. The latter half of the Fantian Sect Records had been in Su Yu’s hands for a long time, and she believed he has memorized it well. That’s why he had Wei Jiu stand in front of the palace gate at noon to identify the real and fake through shadows. Seeing how he could rear a dragon in the palace for so many years, he was far more astute than Wei Jiu.

In short, the emperor was now acting very cautiously, unwilling to wade into this mess and especially unwilling to openly oppose the Fantian Sect.

Because the palace’s foundations had been repaired, the protective shield’s abilities had also been restored. Wei Jiu couldn’t barge into the palace to strangle the ingrate Su Yu, so he could only stand in front of the palace gate, stomping and cursing.

Later, he tried to return to Crimson Gate sect to find Tu Jiuyuan. However, just like the major sects, Red Flame Mountain had also closed its doors. There were no signs of the disciples coming down the mountain.

And those stones that were transported up the mountain were quickly piled into towers on Red Flame Mountain, towering into the clouds. But what has unnerved Wei Jiu the most was the loss of his true vitality.

Since the impostor hadn’t managed to kill him on the spot and had taken over completely, they used another method, turning into nightmares and draining his spiritual power whenever he fell asleep.

Although Wei Jiu was highly skilled, he was still in a mortal body. Even if he could go days without eating or drinking, occasionally he would meditate and fall asleep.

But now, every time he fell asleep, he would see someone who looked exactly like him choking him, constantly absorbing his energy.

After brief naps, instead of feeling refreshed, he felt a loss of energy.

Wei Jiu did not dare sleep along the way, his eyes were red like ripe cherries, as if they were about to bleed. Forced into this situation, he had no choice but to come to Xishan for help from Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran.

To get two archenemies to help, Wei Jiu also offered some bargaining chips. He only said that he had a way to lead them back into Red Flame Mountain and investigate the truth behind the spirit tower.

After assuring Su Yi Shui with words and reaching a temporary ceasefire and cooperation agreement, Wei Jiu finally collapsed on the grass, wiping the blood from his mouth. He then closed his eyes, saying, “I just don’t understand why all the major sects suffered, but Xishan was spared from this disaster?”

Hearing this, Ranran slowly put down the pumpkin seeds in her hand. Wei Jiu’s question was quite intriguing, and actually Ranran herself couldn’t figure it out either.

Could it be that for the people of the Fantian Sect, Xishan was just an insignificant pawn, so they bypassed it?

Wei Jiu then took out a black stone from his pocket and said, “This is the stone they transported up the mountain. I managed to steal one with difficulty. See if you can find anything unusual about it?”

Su Yi Shui weighed the stone, feeling no weight in his hand. When he held it up to the sunlight, the black stone seemed to have a faint gloss.

But according to Wei Jiu’s words, about those stones transported up the mountain seeming to be stacked into towers, and after Red Flame Mountain suddenly appeared with a towering high tower overnight, he immediately remembered a similar record in the “Fantian Sect Records” It was said that during the time Nuwa mended the sky, she used five-colored stones, among which the black stone was light as a feather, connecting the energies of Yin and Yang. If used to build high towers, they could then reach the heavens and connect with the underworld.

Could it be that the towering high tower they were constructing on Red Flame Mountain was the same as the spirit tower described in the Chronicles, capable of connecting the energies of Yin and Yang?

What were they building these spirit towers for?

Just then, Wang Suizhi’s shopkeepers near the three major sects all sent back messages via carrier pigeons, saying they had sent people to look, and alongside the closure of the mountains by the major sects, there were also many vehicles transporting stones. Each major sect’s mountain peak had towering spirit towers built on them, visible from afar even without entering the mountains.

Every sect that cultivated immortality chose their cultivation grounds not on a whim but based on their own Five Elements to select a place beneficial to their cultivation.

So regardless of the current rise and falls of the major sects, their cultivation grounds were extremely rich in spiritual energy.

And now, with these impostors taking over the leadership of the major sects and beginning large-scale construction in various cultivation grounds, building black spirit towers, whatever these spirit towers were intended for, their effectiveness would surely be greatly enhanced.

But Wei Jiu couldn’t care about this now. All he wanted was to get a good sleep without having to worry about anything.

This method of stealing spiritual energy in dreams was nothing more than using similar magnetic fields to remotely absorb spiritual power when the victims were exhausted. If there were stronger magnetic fields interfering with the victim’s surroundings, the attempt would fail.

So Wei Jiu could only find peace in sleep by finding someone with similar or even stronger spiritual power to protect him.

And the only candidates now, were Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui.

According to Wei Jiu’s suggestion, he hoped Xue Ranran would guard and protect him—having a gentle and sweet girl by his side, even if he died in his dreams, he would be a romantic and handsome ghost under the flowers.

Unfortunately, with just one cold look from Su Yi Shui, accompanied by the cracking sound of his knuckles, Wei Jiu’s whimsical thoughts were cut off.

Although Wei Jiu was down on his luck, he was still quite particular. Despite his extreme desire for sleep, he refused to compromise on his principles, and Su Yi Shui also didn’t trust leaving this scoundrel alone, allowed to roam Xishan.

In the end, the most refreshing sleep Wei Jiu had experienced since cultivating immortality was on Su Yi Shui’s bed. Smelling the faint sandalwood scent on his archenemy beside him, Wei Jiu slept with limbs relaxed, feeling extremely refreshed.

However, when two big men who were enemies to the death were left alone, the atmosphere would always be a little strange.

Ranran knew that the Fantian Sect’s intentions were unclear at the moment and they still needed Wei Jiu’s help, so she was also afraid that Wei Jiu’s sharp tongue might anger Su Yi Shui and lead to his demise at Su Yi Shui’s hands.

So the next morning, as soon as she woke up, Ranran carried a basin of hot water for washing and went to Su Yi Shui’s room.

Su Yi Shui was meditating by the bed, with his brows furrowed and eyes closed in concentration. Wei Jiu was sprawled out like a large baby.

So Ranran brought a chair and sat opposite her master, also entering a meditative state, passing the time and waiting quietly for the two to wake.

The force of invasion that Wei Jiu had mentioned about entering dreams seemed to have hidden itself this time. The night passed peacefully without any strange disturbances.

By mid-morning, Wei Jiu finally woke up refreshed. As he opened his eyes and glanced past Su Yi Shui beside him, he directly looked at Xue Ranran sitting opposite him with her eyes closed in meditation.

Upon seeing her like this, he couldn’t help but become entranced. The charm between her brows and eyes seemed to carry the air of her previous life, an air of carefree confidence rarely seen in women’s eyes. If only she would wear red clothes like she did in her past life…

Before Wei Jiu could indulge further in his thoughts with narrowed eyes, a tall figure had stood up, completely blocking his view.

Su Yi Shui lowered his head, appearing concerned as he asked, “Did you sleep well?”

He was too close, making Wei Jiu nauseous, so he leaned back and raised his eyebrows, saying, “Thanks to Brother Su for watching over me all night.”

Only now did Su Yi Shui slowly stand up straight, his words suddenly cold, “Then I’ll trouble you to take away and dispose of the bedsheets and blankets from under you, I like cleanliness and can’t stand the smell of sweat.”

Wei Jiu felt Su Yi Shui was looking for trouble. He had clearly bathed before bed, so he was very clean!

He had been living in luxury on Red Flame Mountain for many years, always the one who sets the rules, even in front of Emperor Su Yu, he wouldn’t hesitate to speak his mind.

But now, under the eaves of Xishan, he couldn’t even sleep without Su Yi Shui, so even if he was provoked like this, he could only grit his teeth, smirk maliciously, violently pull off the bedsheets and blankets, then leave the bedroom in large strides.

After Wei Jiu left, Ran Ran said in a small voice, “Actually, you could have let him sleep in the guest room… This set of bedding is very good, why throw it away?”

Su Yi Shui glanced at her but remained silent.

This turtle son, Wei Jiu, had many demands when it came to sleeping. He needed a luxurious bed and wouldn’t settle for the practice room.

And the guest room was only separated by a wall from the disciples’ quarters. He didn’t want this shameless scoundrel to be too close to Ranran’s bedroom, so he let Wei Jiu sleep in his own room.

Who would have thought that Ranran would come over early in the morning and sit so close, allowing the shameless scoundrel to take several glances at her for no reason.

“The storage room still has new bedding, right? I’ll have someone bring another set.”

Ranran was thinking, that the covers was personally sewn by her, and the pattern of the bamboo was also chosen by Su Yi Shui from the patterns she brought.

But now he had forgotten about all that, so he just thought it was just an ordinary set of bedding.

Ranran didn’t bother with these trivial matters anymore, just remained silent for a moment before saying, “I couldn’t sleep well last night, I kept thinking about the black spirit tower. So I brought the map and after looking at it, I found some suspicious places.”

Saying this, she took out the map she had drawn overnight, marked the locations of the three major sects and Red Flame Mountain. She then connected these four points, revealing that Xishan was surrounded by them.

“I asked Wen Chunhui, and she said that someone from the government came to Kongshan Sect for help, claiming that they found a nine-headed python on Yao Mountain. However, when they arrived there, they found representatives from all major sects, all claiming to have been called by the government. However, the local government officials do not know who actually sent the message. Wei Jiu, on the other hand, said that the Emperor wrote a letter instructing him to subdue the nine-headed python. But when he asked the eunuch at the palace gate, the old eunuch said that His Majesty had never sent such a letter. It’s strange that for just one snake, different people are seeking help from the three major sects and Crimson Gate sect…”

Su Yi Shui spoke in a low voice, “So it means someone intentionally wanted these people to gather at Yao Mountain, to be trapped by the nine-headed monster.”

Thinking about this, both of them exclaimed in unison, “Why hasn’t that person behind the scenes sent a message to Xishan?”

In terms of current renown, Xishan was no less powerful than the three major sects and Crimson Gate, even vaguely showing signs of surpassing them.

However, the people from the Fantian Sect deliberately avoided Xishan. Why? Did they dislike Xishan’s feng shui, thinking it wasn’t worthy of building a spirit tower?

Or… were they actually targeting Xishan, which was being surrounded?

Xue Ranran took a deep breath again and said in a low voice, “You probably don’t remember the person who disguised himself as the Medicine immortal on Tianmai Mountain. He later appeared as a shepherd near the Netherworld realm flower sea, and also as the innkeeper at the foot of Red Flame Mountain. But every time he appeared, it didn’t seem like he had any malicious intent towards you and me… instead, he repeatedly reminded us to be careful, as if afraid that we would encounter danger… Is he really from the Fantian Sect, and what role is he playing in this series of events?”

Su Yi Shui remained silent. He had never felt inconvenienced by losing a memory before. But now, Ranran’s words made him furrow his brows, feeling somewhat dejected for not remembering such an important matter.

Of course, this dejection rose to the extreme during breakfast time.

After the new disciples of Xishan had gone, there weren’t many people left in the dining hall.

Someone like Wei Jiu, wouldn’t normally be allowed into the dining hall. However, the unsuspecting couple, Qiao Lian and her husband, took him for a guest of Xishan and warmly welcomed him into the dining hall.

Although the others were well aware, they didn’t correct them, lest the couple feel embarassed. So Wei Jiu arrogantly took a seat at the dining table.

Because Yutong had married and moved down the mountain, breakfast was prepared by Ranran and her mother.

When Ranran and Su Yi Shui finally arrived at the dining hall, Wei Jiu was already eating meat buns made by Ranran, praising with a sweet mouth, “Auntie, both of your cooking skills are just as good as the Nine Flavors Hall in the capital!”

Su Yi Shui narrowed his eyes, stood beside Wei Jiu, and said coldly, “You’re sitting in my seat.”

Wei Jiu lazily gave up the main seat, but as he turned around, he sat in the seat just vacated by Qiu Xier who went to get more rice.

This seat was good, right next to Ranran. He smiled and said, “The dried sweet potatoes you personally gave me before were delicious, but I didn’t expect everything else you make to be even tastier.”

Upon hearing this, Su Yi Shui’s icy daggers shot right over, not at Wei Jiu but at Xue Ranran.

Wasn’t she supposed to be at odds with Wei Jiu? When did she share snacks with him?

Xue Ranran felt that Wei Jiu was stirring up trouble. During the trial on Tianmai Mountain, were the dried sweet potatoes she gave, dragon meat? Was it worth Wei Jiu mentioning it from time to time?

If she had known earlier that the boy Gui Baqian was Wei Jiu in disguise, she would have fed him bird droppings!

But now that Su Yi Shui had forgotten, the yellow dried sweet potatoes had practically become evidence of infidelity.

Qiao Lian and the carpenter also noticed something was wrong and looked at each other with uncertainty, fearing that their daughter would have some entanglement with this guy who seemed a bit feminine.

She had just agreed to the marriage proposal with Master Su and couldn’t afford any scandals.

Just at this time, Qiu Xier returned with the rice just then and found her seat taken by Wei Jiu. She immediately became annoyed, “Hey, can’t you have some etiquette as a guest? Don’t act without manners everywhere. Early in the morning, I saw you throw away the quilt that was personally sewn by Ranran for our Shifu, it’s really outrageous! That quilt was made by Ranran for a month, and now you’re taking my seat… it’s really annoying…”

Qiu Xier’s voice trailed off as she spoke, because on the dining table, Su Yi Shui and Wei Jiu, the big bosses, one good and one evil, were both staring straight at her.

Wei Jiu stared at Qiu Xier because of her disrespectful words.

But Su Yi Shui’s gaze carried surprise and indescribable embarrassment.

Previous
Next

神棍徒弟 Charlatan Disciple


Su Yi Shui understood now: no wonder Ranran had hesitated to say something when she saw him let Wei Jiu throw away the quilt. It turned out that she had sewn that quilt for him herself.

If he hadn’t lost his memory, why would he let Wei Jiu that disgusting person, sleep on that bed with the quilt?

Thinking of this, Su Yi Shui looked at Ranran.

But Ranran continued to serve food to her mother as if nothing had happened, smoothly changing the subject.

After breakfast, it was time for Xishan disciples to refine alchemy and meditate. Wei Jiu and Wen Chunhui needed quiet rest due to their recent serious depletion before they could go down Xishan to settle the score with Fantian Sect.

After meditating on the Ice Lotus Pond, Ranran prepared to return to the alchemy room to refine pills.

In this life, she seemed to have surpassed her past self in alchemy. Perhaps because she was born from wood, she naturally amplified the furnace fire, so the elixirs she refined were even more effective than Su Yi Shui’s.

However, during alchemy, besides the proportion of medicinal ingredients and the enhancement of the furnace fire, what mattered more was the mental influence of the alchemist.

One must not lose focus during alchemy. When the furnace fire stabilized without fluctuating temperatures, one could take a small break.

Ranran stood up and stretched lazily by the window. She happened to see someone rummaging through water buckets in the laundry room separated by a moon gate from the alchemy room.

Thinking of Wei Jiu being on the mountain, she couldn’t help but remain vigilant and quietly approached.

To her surprise, it was Su Yi Shui, who had taken off his socks and shoes, stepping on the wet quilt in a large wooden tub.

That quilt… wasn’t it the one Su Yi Shui asked Wei Jiu to throw away?

She remembered that Wei Jiu, in his attempt to save trouble, had directly thrown the quilt into the mountain stream. So… did Su Yi Shui go down to the stream himself to retrieve the quilt and then bring it to the laundry room for washing?

Su Yi Shui had thought she was refining pills and wouldn’t have time to come to the laundry room. He didn’t expect his embarrassing act of washing the quilt to be caught by her.

For a moment, his face showed some stiffness and discomfort as he stood in the tub with rolled-up pant legs, unable to find a good excuse.

However, Ranran burst into laughter, walked over, and pushed him playfully, saying, “Who washes a quilt like this? I’ll take it to the stream and wash it with running water later…”

Su Yishui, with his handsome face, stiffly put on his shoes and muttered, “That guy threw the quilt onto a tree branch in the mountain stream, and now there’s two holes torn in it…”

Ranran squatted down to inspect it, then looked up and said, “If you still want this quilt cover, I’ll mend it and embroider bamboo patterns on it. How about that?”

This time, Su Yi Shui responded with an “Mm-hmm.” As Ranran was about to take the quilt and leave, he held her back, stayed silent for a moment, and then said earnestly, “I will find a way to undo the Soul-cleansing Talisman…”

This was the first time since Su Yi Shui’s memory loss that he expressed with such seriousness, of his desire to recover that period of missing memory.

Ranran’s heart was filled with indescribable bitterness and sweetness. His words implied that that period of missing memory wasn’t just cherished by her only. He also eagerly wished to recall their past together.

And his gesture seemed to be related to him accidentally throwing away the quilt she had hand-sewn. Ranran couldn’t help but leaned over and kissed his cheek.

Su Yi Shui had expected this young lady to mock him, but he was surprised to see her so delighted.

His self-loathing for going around the mountains to pick up a quilt so early in the morning eased considerably. He even felt that his foolish act didn’t seem so silly anymore.

However, he maintained his tough facade: “I thought you are not willing to marry me? Why be so frivolous with me now?”

Seeing him trying to act tough after getting a good deal, Ranran couldn’t help but scoff and put on a fake embarrassed look, saying, “My mother said I’ve been learning skills in the mountains for so many years, and now I’m almost nineteen. If I don’t marry soon, I’ll become an old spinster. If there’s no other young man I like, I guess I can just settle for you…”

Su Yi Shui pinched her nose, saying, “As if I would really want to marry you! You can be an old spinster for life!”

Ranran didn’t expect him to curse her like that, so she playfully poured the basin of water on Su Yi Shui, and they ended up laughing and playing around, but slipped on the water on the ground and ended up sitting down together.

Wei Jiu had just finished cultivating his qi and was about to change into clean clothes. When he entered the laundry room, he saw Xue Ranran…laughing and sitting on Su Yishui.

Damn, the variety of styles in Xishan is quite something! So this master and disciple pair usually indulged in this kind of cultivation.

Of course, Wei Jiu believed he has more appeal. If Ranran hadn’t been so confused and chose to be with him, he could come up with even more styles of play.

But now Wei Jiu just crossed his arms and coldly mocked, “The sect leaders of the major sects have all been replaced, and the survival of the cultivation world is in jeopardy. Yet you two are in the mood to play here? In my opinion, let’s not bother saving them, let’s just have fun together until the end!”

Ranran ignored Wei Jiu’s sarcastic words and instead asked him as she stood up, “Hey, you said you have a way to take us back to Red Flame Mountain, is that true?”

Wei Jiu raised an eyebrow coldly and said, “Of course it’s true, but… it will depend on Su Yi Shui’s abilities.”

It turned out that Red Flame Mountain had treacherous terrain, and the Crimson Gate sect had built many secret passages over the centuries.

Wei Jiu, having made enemies outside in recent years, valued the safety of his old nest even more. So in addition to the long-standing secret passages, he had newly built several more.

He had always been ruthless in his actions and didn’t leave any craftsmen who built the tunnels alive. Therefore, there were several secret passages that only he knew about.

When he returned to Red Flame Mountain, he checked and found that the old secret passages had indeed been sealed. But the new one he had built was still there.

However, he hadn’t dared to enter it earlier when he hadn’t slept for several days. Now that he had gathered enough manpower, he could dare to venture into Red Flame Mountain.

Wei Jiu wasn’t really concerned about the survival of the other sects; he just wanted to reclaim Red Flame Mountain and his many years of hard work.

So in spite of the pleasant scenery and delicious food in Xishan, he was still quite restless and just wanted to urge Su Yi Shui and the others to lead the charge for him.

But Su Yi Shui had a cunning and sly look, staying still as if waiting for something.

Wei Jiu, bored out of his mind, went to the alchemy room to tease Ranran, “He has completely forgotten about you, showing that he’s not devoted to you. Don’t you want to consider me and leave yourself a way out?”

Ranran fanned the fire in the alchemy furnace vigorously, making sparks fly dangerously close to Wei Jiu’s face as he leaned in. She deliberately imitated Wei Jiu’s smug yet restrained expression and said with a smirk, “Consider you for what? Consider you abandoning a woman in danger and running away alone?”

She couldn’t forget Wei Jiu’s indifferent attitude towards Tu Jiuyuan’s survival in the Netherworld. It seemed thatTu Jiuyuan and Wei Jiu had a complicated relationship, but it seemed like she loved an unreliable man.

Thinking about this incident, Wei Jiu’s face also darkened. After that trip to the Netherworld, Tu Jiuyuan had been seriously injured and took a long time to recover. Later, she repeatedly mentioned her slow recovery and wanted to go to the Southern Branch to manage things and recuperate there.

She wasn’t stupid; she didn’t directly say she wanted to leave the Crimson Gate, or she would have definitely been punished for violating the sect’s rules. But this act of using her injuries as an excuse was annoying.

What was she? Did she deserve to act so pretentiously? Didn’t she swear allegiance to the sect and offer her life to the superior when she joined the Crimson Gate?

But Ranran’s distraction made Wei Jiu remember the fake who impersonated him and flirted with Tu Jiuyuan.

At that moment, Wei Jiu somewhat understood why Su Yi Shui had asked him to throw away the quilt. A woman who had been defiled… he didn’t want her anymore!

Ranran initially had no intention to mock him, but Wei Jiu’s face turned sour and stinky, like he had fallen into a pickling jar, and then he angrily stood up and stormed off, swaying his black robe.

Ranran quietly made a mental note that the next time Wei Jiu tried to flirt, she would bring up Tu Jiuyuan to deter him from flirting in front of her.

https://www.52shuku.vip/yanqing/am/h4Vl_260.html

Another person as impatient as Wei Jiu was Wen Chunhui from the Kongshan Sect. She was also clueless about the current situation of her sect, so she tentatively asked Su Yi Shui when they could set off.

Su Yi Shui’s attitude towards Wen Chunhui was still mild.

When Su Yi Shui was still a disciple of Jiuhua Sect, he had once gone to Kongshan Sect for a trial, and that was when he met Wen Hongshan. At that time, Wen Hongshan was also a rising star in the Kongshan Sect, constantly suppressing Wen Chunhui.

During their training sessions, Su Yishui could clearly feel that Wen Chunhui’s cultivation was actually more solid than Wen Hongshan’s, but she knew how to hide her strengths and never competed openly with her seniors.

It was only after Wen Hongshan and the sect leader passed away that Kongshan Sect found itself short of capable individuals, and Wen Chunhui reluctantly stepped up to take on major responsibilities.

So, facing this Abbess who was of a gentle temperament, Su Yi Shui didn’t play dumb anymore and directly said, “We’ll set off after Ranran finishes refining the last batch of pills.”

However, Wen Chunhui was still worried. “We need to go to Red Flame Mountain first and then to Kongshan Sect. The journey is long, and if we don’t set off soon, I’m afraid…”

Su Yi Shui poured a cup of tea and handed it to her, saying calmly, “Who said we are going to Red Flame Mountain first? After leaving Xishan, we will immediately head for Kongshan Sect!”

Just as Wei Jiu wanted to use him as a spear, Su Yi Shui also wouldn’t mind using Wei Jiu as a hunting dog.

“But, all the mountain gates are sealed now, and Kongshan Sect doesn’t have secret passages like Crimson Gate. How do we get in?” Wen Chunhui asked, concerned.

Su Yi Shui, however, was unworried. “Don’t worry, I have my ways.”

Wen Chunhui knew that Su Yi Shui was a meticulous person, so hearing his words, she felt slightly assured.

She wasn’t one to talk too much. Later, when Wei Jiu tried to find out when Su Yi Shui planned to depart, she simply said she didn’t know.

However, Wen Chunhui noticed that Ranran’s pill furnace was constantly active. While others took ten months to refine pills like a pregnancy, she seemed to do it like cooking dumplings, opening and closing the furnace every few days and producing dozens of pills each time.

But all those beautifully shiny crafted pills ended up in the big mouth of the Gengjin White Tiger.

When the little white tiger consumed the pills, it was like eating seasoned beans, crunching down on those precious pills made from rare and valuable herbs.

The White Tiger had been seriously injured in the past, and its body had changed with its diminishing vitality. But unlike humans who could switch to pill cultivation if they failed in foundation cultivation, beasts had a slower recovery path.

But now, with a mistress who excelled in pill cultivation and refined pills like steaming buns, together with Wang Suizhi, the god of wealth who not only knew how to make money but also knew how to find treasures, constantly delivering various precious herbs to the mountain, Ranran’s pill furnace became even more active.

In just a few weeks, the white tiger’s size had continuously grown with the restoration of its vital energy, no longer able to shrink back to its former state.

Now it was twice the size of an ordinary tiger, and when it stood up, its white fur shimmered in the sunlight, and if it stared, it gave a sense of locking one’s soul under its gaze.

A spiritual beast like the White Tiger, was originally born and raised by nature. Even with intelligence, it was difficult to reach the realm of great cultivation masters.

But now, Xue Ranran had forcibly led her spiritual beast onto the path of pill cultivation, and it grew dozens of times faster than ordinary pill cultivators, faintly showing signs of absorbing abundant spiritual energy, nearing the realm of ascending to gods.

Wei Jiu was startled several times by the White Tiger who liked to jump out at him, and couldn’t help but ask Ranran, “Is this how you raise tigers in Xishan? If you keep feeding it like this, this tiger will become a divine spirit!”

Ranran ignored him, but privately she asked Su Yi Shui, “Do you think it’s enough already? I’m afraid that if we keep feeding it like this, *Baibai won’t be able to handle the sudden surge in spiritual power.”
*白白 white tiger’s name is white white hahahaha

Su Yishui approached the sunbathing white tiger. Even when lying down, it looked like a small mountain.

He closed his eyes, raised one hand, and the White Tiger obediently lifted one of its large white paws to meet Su Yi Shui’s palm.

When the palm met with the paw, countless strands of golden light seemed to intertwine between them.

As Su Yi Shui slowly opened his eyes, golden light flashed in both his and the White Tiger’s eyes.

“It’s ready.” Su Yi Shui said confidently.

In fact, some days ago, he had already taken the White Tiger secretly to the closest sect to Xishan, the Kongshan Sect.

Although those spiritual shields could block people, as he had suspected, they didn’t block spiritual beasts like the White Tiger, similar to the spiritual shields of Tianmai Mountain.

However, when he tried to manipulate the White Tiger with talismans to enter, they were burned to ashes upon entering the spiritual shield.

So the only way to explore inside was to attach his spiritual power to the White Tiger’s body, just like he did when entering Tianmai Mountain.

But this method consumed a lot of spiritual energy. When he returned, both he and the White Tiger had suffered varying degrees of exhaustion.

In the face of formidable enemies on all sides, Su Yi Shui couldn’t afford such a fatal flaw in this plan. So, the only solution was to greatly increase the White Tiger’s spiritual power, so it could reach the state of unity with his level of own spiritual power.

Only then could he freely possess the White Tiger and come and go as he pleased.

Now, the White Tiger, fed by pills, had skyrocketed in spiritual power, reaching a perfect state. It was ready to set off for exploration.

It wasn’t until they were about to depart that Wei Jiu realized they were heading to Kongshan Sect. He was furious, shouting at Su Yi Shui for being deceitful.

Su Yi Shui, with half lowered eyes, replied indifferently, “If Lord Wei wants to pass up nearby options for distant prospects, and insist on going to Red Flame Mountain, no one will stop you. You can go there on your own.”

Wei Jiu understood that he couldn’t do without Su Yi Shui now. Without his protection, he couldn’t even sleep peacefully.

He had nowhere else to find a more powerful ally than Su Yi Shui. For now, the only plan was to grit his teeth and follow them, finding a way to sneak into Kongshan Sect to investigate.

The founding master of Kongshan Sect was reportedly Wen Yi An, the senior sister of the great cultivator Duntian.

Back then, she harbored a secret love for her junior brother Duntian. Unfortunately, her love was unrequited, and Duntian ended up falling for Rong Yao, becoming a pair of cultivator companions with her.

Disheartened, Wen Yi An chose to establish Kongshan Sect opposite to Tianmai Mountain, where Duntian cultivated.

She remained unmarried throughout her life, never accepting male disciples, and all her disciples were girls who changed their surnames to Wen upon initiation.

That’s why all Kongshan Sect disciples were surnamed Wen, unlike other sects.

However, Ranran learned from Wen Chunhui during their journey, that their sect ancestor’s secular surname wasn’t Wen at all. This “Wen” was actually the secular surname of the great cultivator Duntian.

Ranran immediately understood. This Grandmaster Wen Yi An’s love was unrequited, so she secluded herself in Kongshan, living in a self-deceiving dream.

She remained unmarried, but took on her junior brother’s secular surname, never bore children of her own, yet raised a group of girls surnamed Wen.

Thinking harder, the peak of Kongshan faced Tianmai Mountain. Wen Yi An used to gaze from afar at Tianmai Mountain, knowing full well that her junior brother had a family and descendants. She immersed herself in fantasies of having children for him, isn’t it quite sorrowful?

As they arrived at the foot of Kongshan, before even getting close to the mountain, they saw a towering black tower reaching into the clouds.

Wei Jiu had seen a similar black tower constructed on Red Flame Mountain. Though its purpose was unknown, it inspired awe at first sight.

This time, Su Yishui brought along his four disciples, as well as Yuchen and Wang Suizhi.

Having the god of wealth with them meant they could easily find places to stay along the way, and Wang Suizhi, with his natural divination abilities, could determine if it was an auspicious day to set out.

But when they arrived at the town at the foot of Kongshan and settled in a temporary inn, Wang Suizhi stood at the inn’s door for a while, shaking his head. “No matter how I look at it, it is *ominous in all directions. There’s no sign of survival…”
*四处凶门 death gates in every direction

Wei Jiu, already frustrated during the journey, sneered at Wang Suizhi’s words. “Do you think you’re really a fortune-teller? Following your advice would mean the best course of action is to steer clear of this place.”

But Wang Suizhi replied earnestly “It’s too late there’s no life gate for a way back. Once we leave this town, there are signs of danger everywhere.”

His ability to discern life and death doors didn’t often manifest, he can only sense it usually only in moments of life and death crises.

After entering the town, Wang Suizhi hadn’t stopped breaking out in cold sweat. He sat on a chair and kept shuddering like he was ill.

Wei Jiu detested this display to waver morale at a critical moment, his temper befitting the Crimson Gate Sect Leader flared, and he sneered, “Since you’re so capable, can you tell if today might be your last day…”

As he spoke, he drew his sword and aimed straight for Wang Suizhi.

Wang Suizhi’s heart pounded in fear as he watched the sword approaching, unable to dodge in time.

Ranran casually took out a preserved fruit and used her spiritual energy to imbue it, deflecting the sword, causing it to veer off past Wang Suizhi.

After the scare, Wang Suizhi said, “I can’t see my own end, but I can tell I will have good fortune today, so I don’t think today will be my last day. However, if you step out of this inn today, you might encounter great misfortune!”

Wei Jiu didn’t expect this merchant to keep going, acting like a religious conman with his divination, and wanted to teach him a lesson.

But Ranran protected Wang Suizhi and coldly said, “You dare harm my disciple?”

While Ranran usually appeared beautiful and easy going, a very friendly lady, once she was protecting her *disciples, the fierceness of a mother wolf would burst forth from her eyes.
*犊子 : 晚輩、小輩的含義 juniors

Twenty years ago, it was well-known that disciples from Xishan were all lacking in skills, but they had a fierce tigress master who stood by her disciples.

If you provoked a disciple from Xishan, their master would really ride a tiger to settle scores with you.

Under Xue Ranran’s glare, Wei Jiu felt as if it was Mu Qingge who stood before him with her killing intent, so he instinctively took a step back.

Meanwhile, Wang Suizhi, with his scruffy beard, felt very blessed hiding behind Ranran, as if he was an old chick under the wings of a mother hen, basking in the long-lost affection of his master.

Su Yi Shui, on the other hand, glared coldly at him, ready to possess the White Tiger and tear Wei Jiu apart if he dared to harm Ranran.

Wei Jiu knew he was isolated and so he couldn’t be bothered with the idiotic Xishan disciples. With a snort, he walked straight out of the inn and into the streets.

Xue Ranran acknowledged Wang Suizhi’s abilities and said, “Since Wang Suizhi has divined the present dangers here, let’s trust him for now. We’ll stay in the inn for a day and decide tomorrow whether to go to Kongshan.”

Wen Chunhui also nodded in agreement. She had always been more easy-going and different from those who loved to show off like Elder Kaiyuan. Since she had taken refuge with Xishan, she naturally listened to the majority.

So, the group stayed at the inn to rest.

Before long, Wei Jiu returned to the inn, not alone but with a woman.

Ranran looked closely and realized it was Tu Jiuyuan, who should have been on Red Flame Mountain.

Just then, Su Yi Shui flicked his fingers, and the White Tiger lying in the courtyard stood up, growling and roaring at the two newcomers, causing the loose hair by their ears to tremble slightly.

Ranran stood at the door and asked, “Tu Jiuyuan? How did you end up here?”

Tu Jiuyuan glanced at Wei Jiu beside her and spoke, “After welcoming back the Excellency from before, I quickly noticed something was amiss with that person and saw many flaws. Later, I inadvertently saw the real Excellency wandering at the foot of the mountain and understood instantly. So, I seized the opportunity to escape down the mountain through a secret passage and made my way here, finally meeting up with the Excellency now.”

Wei Jiu spoke up at this moment, “She knows a lot of hidden information, let her come in and explain slowly…”

As he spoke, the two of them started walking towards the house.

Ranran, following Su Yi Shui’s gaze without changing her expression, looked towards the courtyard at the sun’s corona, and said with a cold smile, “Lord Wei Jiu, weren’t you very imposing just now, saying you wouldn’t come back?”

Wei Jiu sneered, “When did I say that? Don’t try to test me.”

With that, he started walking towards the courtyard. At that moment, the sun was at its zenith. The White Tiger stepped back slightly, allowing the sunlight to pour into the courtyard.

Ranran lowered her head and looked closely. There was no shadow under the feet of the two standing at the courtyard gate.

Next

如鱼得水 LIKE A FISH IN WATER

Wei Jiu and Tu Jiuyuan actually had no shadows!

The two people seemed to notice Ranran’s gaze and slowly lowered their heads, looking at their own feet. Then, they each revealed a sinister smile.

These two in front of them… were clearly two fakes split off from the Nine-Headed Monster Python!

At that moment, Su Yi Shui waved his hand slightly, and the White Tiger sensed Su Yi Shui’s killing intent, roaring angrily and pounced towards the two. The two also fought back.

These fakes fully inherited the power of their originals, even showing some improvements. If it were the previous White Tiger, it probably wouldn’t have been their match.

But now, under the boost of Ranran’s pill cultivation, the White Tiger’s spiritual energy surged. It usually ran wild all over Xishan, enjoying its freedom. These past few days, it was feeling very uncomfortable being cooped up in the inns while they traveled, unable to release its pent-up energy, and its wild nature was about to erupt.

Right now, it was like a big cat finding mice to tease, suddenly finding something fun.

After just a few rounds, the two fakes were scratched and bruised all over.

But they seemed to be impervious to pain. Even when their legs were scratched to the bone, their offense was unrelenting.

Seeing that they couldn’t get into the inn, the two exchanged a glance. Tu Jiuyuan suddenly threw two small porcelain bottles towards the house.

Ranran was already on guard against them. When she saw the bottles being thrown, she casually waved and knocked the cushions off the chair to wrap around the bottles. Su Yi Shui quickly took them, using his spiritual energy to tightly wrap the cushions around the bottles.

At that moment, Tu Jiuyuan rolled her eyes until only the whites are seen, and said with a sinister tone “Go back, what is happening here has nothing to do with you…” Before she could finish, the White Tiger tore off one of her arms. In an instant, Tu Jiuyuan looked like her soul was sucked out, collapsing and lying motionless on the ground, her skin taking on a deathly pallor.

As for the fake Wei Jiu, he quickly turned and fled.

When they chased out of the inn, Wei Jiu had already disappeared without a trace.

Su Yi Shui then peeled off the cushions and took out the two white porcelain bottles.

The bottles were thin and translucent. If Ranran hadn’t caught them with the cushion, they would have probably shattered on the ground.

Through the bottles, one could vaguely see something wriggling inside. Su Yishui took them and focused, slowly saying, “These aren’t deadly items, but rather poisonous worms that make people fall into a deep sleep.”

After the inn was booked by Su Yishui, he had secured it with a spiritual shield and even the original staff of the inn couldn’t enter.

Today, they have not gone out at all, so the followers from Fantian Sect who were spying on them, couldn’t hold themselves back and sent these two fakes to infiltrate the inn after Wei Jiu left. They were hoping to pour the poisonous worms from the bottles into their soups when they were unawares, knocking them out.

Ranran had originally thought the bottles would contain something like giant python venom, but it turned out to be poisonous worms that caused sleepiness. The extremely sinister Fantian Sect seemed unusually gentle towards Xishan people.

No wonder Wei Jiu had always tried to inquire if there were any old connections between Xishan and Fantian Sect, perhaps through marriages or something. Otherwise, why would Fantian Sect “favor” Xishan so much?

Although they now understood that the Fantian Sect seemed to want to capture the people of Xishan alive, their intentions still remained unclear.

Wen Chunhui still had lingering fear and asked, “Is Wei Jiu… dead?”

She remembered Wang Suizhi’s statement in the morning, and after Wei Jiu had left and a fake appeared, his original self was likely in grave danger.

Just then, there was another sound at the door.

It turned out Wei Jiu had returned after he fled!

Gao Cang couldn’t help but curse, “Damn it, isn’t this enough? Why do we have to go through this again? Are they going to let us have lunch?”

The White Tiger let out another roar and pounced towards Wei Jiu again.

Wei Jiu hastily defended himself, cursing loudly, “What’s wrong with this beast? Why is it suddenly biting people?”

Just then, his gaze fell on the torn body of Tu Jiuyuan on the ground. He was stunned, and before he could react, the White Tiger bit his arm, causing him to scream in pain.

Ranran noticed that he could feel pain unlike those fakes created from the python, so she quickly stopped the White Tiger and then looked at Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu didn’t care about the blood pouring from his arm. He just looked at Tu Jiuyuan’s corpse, his face darkening as he asked “Which of you killed her?”

It was already past noon, so shadow tracking wouldn’t work. After Ranran briefly explained what had happened, she said, “She should not be the real Tu Jiuyuan, but a fake created by the snake venom… Where did you go just now?”

Wei Jiu frowned and said, “I just went for a walk in town. This town is too remote. There are hardly any shops around. I wanted to eat outside, but the table at the restaurant was filthy, which killed my appetite, so I came back.”

He squatted down and stared at Tu Jiuyuan. Her face, which had accompanied him for years, now looked ashen, her eyes hollow and wide open.

Since the fake had infiltrated Red Flame Mountain, there was nothing surprising about this Tu Jiuyuan also affected by the snake venom replication. The real Tu Jiuyuan was probably killed long ago.

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu suddenly felt very annoyed and was about to walk into the inn.

But Ranran stopped him politely, saying, “It’s past noon now, and we can’t confirm your true identity yet. So you can’t enter this inn right now. Come back after midnight when we can verify your identity… Please have a walk outside for now, Lord Wei.”

Su Yi Shui gave a wave of his hand, and the inn’s spiritual shield repelled Wei Jiu out forcefully.

The force was so strong that Wei Jiu’s money pouch which was hanging at his waist came off and landed squarely into Wang Suizhi’s arms.

Qiu Xier was dumbfounded, “Uncle Master Wang, you really have wealth luck today. Without even stepping out, you’ve made a small fortune! This is so impressive!”

Meanwhile, Wei Jiu, who was forced out, couldn’t stabilize himself and fell sitting on the ground. He felt something sticky under him and when he looked down, he realized he had sat on dog excrement.

Even the hand he landed on was also full of it!

Wei Jiu jumped up in anger, cursing Su Yi Shui for being unscrupulous and demanded to go inside the inn to bathe and change his clothes. Unfortunately, the inn’s gate remained tightly closed, and until the right time, he wouldn’t be allowed in.

At this moment, Wei Jiu recalled the words of the old charlatan Wang Suizhi—”If you step out of this inn today, you might encounter great misfortune.“

Now it seemed that the old conman’s words had all come true, which was quite eerie.

Later in the afternoon, there was a heavy rainstorm. Wei Jiu took off his coat, threw it on the street, and walked a few steps, only to get soaked immediately. Although he managed to block the rain with a spiritual shield, his clothes were still drenched, and his bad luck was confirmed.

Standing under the eaves, Wei Jiu looked at the distant black tower on Kongshan with a gloomy expression. Yet in his heart, he couldn’t help but wonder if his loyal subordinate Tu Jiuyuan was really gone?

When midnight arrived, and his true identity was verified under the lamp’s light, Wei Jiu entered the inn wearing thin innerwear, his lustrous hair all disheveled, drastically diminishing the beauty of a demon lord of this generation. He exuded a strong killing intent, almost ready to slay immortals.

The next day, at the breakfast table, Qiu Xier couldn’t wait to ask Uncle master Wang if there were any auspicious signs today.

However, Wang Suizhi frowned and looked for a while before shaking his head with regret, “Yesterday’s attack was too severe. It still hurts at the back of my head, and I see black spots everywhere. You might have to rely on your own luck.”

Xue Ranran nodded and looked at her old disciple with some concern, saying, “You should rest well in the inn today. I’ve prepared some pills suitable for you to replenish your energy.”

Since the two fakes showed up yesterday, it meant their whereabouts were exposed. There was no need to hide anymore, especially since it was bright and suitable for a venture out to the sect’s gate today.

After breakfast, Wang Suizhi and Qiu Xier, the two least combat-capable, stayed behind to guard their ‘home’. The inn’s spiritual shield remained active, so they should be safe inside.

As for the rest, including Wei Jiu and Wen Chunhui, they set off together towards Kongshan.

The warnings Wang Suizhi gave yesterday about dangers everywhere and not going out had been validated. As they left the town, they found that the closer they got to Kongshan, the more the trees and roads were covered in a layer of dark brown mud. It seemed that a torrential black mud rain had fallen near Kongshan yesterday.

Ranran even noticed that the brown-black mud seemed to have a strong acidic smell, corroding and breaking many weak saplings along the way.

They also encountered sporadic travelers who had been burned while traveling at night, lying in agony in the black mud, calling for help.

Ranran quickly cleared a piece of land with her spiritual energy and moved the injured they met along the way to this open space. According to them, it started raining normally yesterday, but at night, a black rain fell, burning them. They had initially sought shelter in a cave, but the black mud started flooding in, forcing them to run out.

Even after the rain had stopped, thunder was still rumbling overhead over at Kongshan.

Seeing this situation, Wen Chunhui’s face changed. She had been cultivating diligently for decades and had seen some battles. This scene… why did it seem so much like the Heavenly Calamity her master once described?

It was said that if someone dared to defy the laws of heaven and earth, causing chaos with the Yin and Yang, the anger of the heavenly gods would bring forth natural disasters. First, a torrential black rain would fall, followed by thunderous calamities. At that time, within a hundred miles, there would be no safe place, and even the villages around Kongshan might be affected.

“How… could such signs appear?”

Ranran looked at the black spiritual tower whose construction seemed to be still progressing, and murmured, “Perhaps that unwelcome black tower has attracted the calamity…”

Everyone looked closely and indeed, most of the thunder was concentrated at the top of the tower, as if trying to shatter it. However, something seemed to be shrouding the sky above Kongshan, causing the black rain and thunder to be deflected and scattered around the surroundings of Kongshan.

They traveled swiftly on the wind and finally reached the base of Kongshan. The lightning and thunder were more intense, making it difficult to get closer.

Just then, amidst the thunder and lightning, Ranran vaguely saw several figures hovering in mid-air, looking towards the direction of Kongshan.

At that moment, one of them turned around and glanced at them. Ranran immediately recognized that person… wasn’t it the Medicine Immortal!

The last time she saw him was during the Qi Xi Festival. He had appeared as an ordinary clothed commoner, standing by the riverbank steps, resembling a grieving handsome scholar mourning his deceased wife.

But now, the Medicine Immortal wore a vermilion-colored robe, with a touch of vermilion on his brows, emitting a faint golden light, looking like an immortal. It made people recall the vast difference between him and his brother. He had already ascended to the ranks of immortality.

Seeing the group from Xishan, the Medicine Immortal left his companions and landed gracefully in front of them. “You’ve also come.”

Ranran respectfully said, “May I ask, esteemed immortal, what exactly has happened on Kongshan? How did it attract such a calamity?”

The Medicine Immortal’s face carried a chilling aura as he replied in a low voice, “Do you know what the tower on that mountain is built of?”

Wei Jiu furrowed his brows and replied, “Isn’t it made of black stones?”

The Medicine Immortal smiled wryly and shook his head, “If it were stones, how could it attract calamities? Those charred things… are the burnt bones of powerful cultivators who attempted to ascend through tribulations…”

Whether they succeeded in ascension or not, their bodies would be abandoned during the heavenly tribulations of ascension. These powerful cultivators had indestructible bodies, and unless turned into powder, their bones would remain abnormally hard.

No wonder the Fantian Sect had been scheming to replace all the leaders of the three major sects. Only by completely controlling these sects can they freely dig up the graves of these sects’ ancestors for hundreds of years and excavate the skeletons of those powerful cultivators.

Being able to build such high towers, and not just one, means they have also excavated skeletons from unknown mountain peaks…But why would they do such a thing?

Su Yi Shui suddenly spoke up, “Is the Fantian Sect planning to build the Tower of Reversal?”

The Medicine Immortal nodded with a heavy expression. Ranran widened her eyes, not understanding the purpose of this Tower of Reversal.

Wei Jiu, however, had heard something about it and, while shocked, he narrowed his eyes as he spoke, “As the saying goes, even immortals cannot redo their past mistakes. Once certain things happened, they are difficult to change. But there is a way to go against the heavens. It’s said that the Tower of Reversal can reverse time, changing things that have already happened… Such a ‘regret medicine’, actually exists…”

Now everyone looked at each other in surprise. Ranran hadn’t expected that the Fantian Sect’s plan was something that went against the heavens to this extent.

When she had went against the heavens and changed the fate chart of the secular emperor, she had almost ended up with a scattered soul. Yet the Fantian Sect was even bolder, wanting to change things that had already happened and go back in time.

What kind of regret did this demonic sect want to change?

Building such sinister towers obviously didn’t sit well with the heavens. Once the tall towers were completed, connecting heaven and earth, it would likely not only cause great changes in the human realm but also turmoil in the heavenly realm.

No wonder the Heavenly Emperor had sent several immortals to observe, ensuring that the Towers of Reversal would be destroyed.

At this moment, there was a momentary flash of light in the sky, and a thunderbolt snaked down from above like a light sword, striking towards the black tower with a crack, only to be blocked by an invisible light shield outside Kongshan.

After this lightning strike, countless thunderbolts descended one after another, as if connecting the sky and earth together. Ranran and the others were stunned by this scene resembling the end of the world, and even the immortals who accompanied the Medicine Immortal fell silent.

Although they were immortals, they had only recently ascended and were still lower-ranked immortals, so such a scene was not something they encountered frequently.

The thunderbolts continuously struck the light shield, spreading a layer of lightning on it. However, this light shield was formed in a mysterious way. Although it swayed constantly from the strikes, it held firm and didn’t break.

After half an hour, the thunderbolts gradually subsided, and the light shield fluctuated for a moment before slowly stabilizing.
*半柱香 :half an incense stick of time

Ranran and Wei Jiu watched in stupefaction, and even the immortals accompanying the Medicine Immortal took a sharp breath. They hadn’t expected that not even the Heavenly calamity could break through this light shield. This mission seemed to be in jeopardy, and they were at a loss, unable to come up with any plans.

Su Yi Shui had been focused on watching the thunder strikes on Kongshan, seeming to discover something. He said, “Let me try…”

Finishing his sentence, he leaped into action during a break in the thunder and lightning, arriving at the foot of Kongshan. He pulled out some silver needles and looked up at the thunder and lightning in the sky.

He had noticed clearly that every time the Heavenly calamity passed, there was a momentary weakness in this invisible shield, followed by a strengthening, preparing for the next wrathful thunderbolt.

So he wanted to coordinate with the Heavenly Calamity, looking for this momentary weakness.

However, by doing so, he also placed himself in great danger amidst the thunder and heavenly calamity strikes.

Ranran watched him agilely avoid the lightning, feeling her heart pounding.

She mounted her White Tiger and also entered the thunderstorm, wielding her mechanical staff to help Su Yi Shui divert the lightning.

Su Yi Shui, with a stern face, shouted at Ranran, “Who told you to come in? Get out quickly!”

Those charred bones used to build the tower had experienced the power of the Heavenly calamity.

And this Heavenly calamity was probably too much even for the heavenly immortals. Ranran’s reckless entry here, if struck, would likely result in instant death.

But Ranran urgently said, “Don’t waste time and delay things, hurry!”

Su Yi Shui glared at her fiercely but knew she was right. Now that she was amidst the Heavenly calamity, it would be too late even if she tried to leave.

Thinking this, he took out a silver needle used for acupuncture in each hand and, as the lightning struck intermittently, continuously shot them at the light shield, while he moved quickly all around, testing for weaknesses in the light shield.

As he suspected, this invisible shield was not unbreakable all the time.

When it was strong, the silver needles turned into green smoke upon contact. But when it weakened, the silver needles turned into powder.

After testing for a while, Su Yi Shui stopped moving around, standing still in one place. He reached out and pulled out a large number of silver needles, continuously throwing them at the light shield, all hitting the same spot. At this moment, the Heavenly calamity’s thunderbolts was drawn to the needles hitting the light shield, and struck at the same spot repeatedly. Over time, the light shield at that spot began to dent.

Observing from outside the calamity zone, the Medicine immortal’s eyes lit up. He said, “Impressive technique. Although the thunderbolt is mighty, it is randomly scattered in its attack. The silver needles may seem weak, but due to the concentrated spiritual energy at the needle tip, their force is quite significant.”

He realized that Su Yi Shui’s technique was quite unique, with each silver needle striking continuously at a specific rhythm in the same spot.

Before the light shield recovered from the last strike of the silver needle’s spiritual energy, it was struck by the next one. With the continuous strikes of the silver needles, the previous force not yet dissipated and new force was added, gradually damaging the light shield accumulated over time, making it possible to break through.

Su Yi Shui’s silver needles gradually decreased, but the number of lightning strikes directed at the light shield increased.

The invisible shield dented more and more severely, finally cracking under a series of thunderbolt strikes.

In a split second, Su Yi Shui, Ranran, and the White Tiger swiftly dashed inside. But the light shield quickly returned to its original state, with no trace of the crack.

At this moment, several robed immortals hovering in mid-air with worried expressions turned to the Medicine Immortal and said, “Those who entered are just ordinary mortals, plus a hairy beast. I’m afraid they won’t succeed, right?”

Wei Jiu, who had been watching from the sidelines, heard the words of these immortals and couldn’t help but snort coldly, sarcastically saying, “You all have immortal bones and divine muscles, yet you are afraid of getting struck by lightning and unwilling to take risks. So those who entered are mere ordinary mortals, not a single immortal…”

After hearing such sarcasm, the Medicine Immortal just smiled wryly.

Ascension to immortality is not easy, and those who have gone through it know *the terror of Heavenly tribulations, let alone the Heavenly Calamity that can destroy immortal bodies?
*天劫 tribulations 天谴 calamity

So just now, it was evident that the few immortals were cherishing their lives and not easily risking themselves to help.

Wei Jiu spoke the truth, and the Medicine Immortal wasn’t angered. However, an elderly white-haired immortal obviously couldn’t tolerate this. With a cold snort, he waved the whisk in his hand, and Wei Jiu suddenly flew up into the air, doing a somersault before crashing into the black mud below.

When he tried to get up, he felt like his body was being crushed by a millstone, unable to rise no matter how hard he tried. His head was pressed into the black mud several times, he looked extremely miserable.

Although a demonic cultivator of a generation like him could fight Su Yi Shui for hundreds of rounds, before true ascended immortals, they were like ants, easily crushed with a flick of a finger.

Wei Jiu’s fall was extremely pathetic, especially his neck and face, and he instantly screamed in agony from the corrosive black mud.

When the immortal stopped, he angrily stood up, looking at the several immortals hovering above, gnashing his teeth loudly with resentment.

It’s no wonder everyone wants to become immortal. This feeling of being above all beings is more satisfying than being an emperor. One day, he too would stand in the clouds and crush these people who dared to belittle him into powder… whether they were mortal or immortal!

Moving from Wei Jiu and his silent vow of revenge, the two who had entered Kongshan rode their White Tiger all the way up and soon reached the halfway point of the mountain.

Su Yi Shui had visited Kongshan often in his youth, so he was very familiar with the terrain here.

When they intruded, it seemed that the followers of the Fantian Sect in Kongshan had sensed something and started searching everywhere.

Just as Su Yi Shui and Ranran hid in a cave on a cliff, a familiar voice sounded above them, “There seemed to be a disturbance in the shield just now. Quick, search carefully, and don’t let anyone in!”

Ranran and Su Yi Shui glanced at each other. They both recognized the voice as Mu Ranwu.

They did not expect to find Mu Ranwu also in Kongshan. She seemed to be fitting in well in the Fantian Sect like a fish in water, what kind of benefits had she been given by the mysterious leader.

But since she was here too, it would seem that the following things could be easier.

When Su Yi Shui glanced at Ranran, Ranran immediately understood.

Although this sister from his previous life was a malicious person, but if they could capture her and attach a Truth Talisman to her, she would surely spill many important truths to them.

Previous
Next

曾经为神 ONCE A GOD

With a plan in place, the two of them set about finding the right moment.

Those expressionless disciples of the Fantian Sect seemed to be empowered by a mysterious force. If they all came rushing in at once, it would be difficult to handle. So, they had to seize the opportune moment to grab her carefully.

In Ranran’s little waist pouch, was stuffed full with the new talismans made by Elder Jiu.

When he was abducted and ended up in Wei Jiu’s hands, although he had suffered some torment, it also had a benefit — his skill in drawing talismans had greatly advanced.

In addition, now that Elder Jiu knew his little friend Ranran was his old friend Mu Qingge, naturally, he generously gave her many top-notch talismans as a gift.

So, after the two of them and the White Tiger applied the invisibility talismans, suppressed their true qi, and adjusted their aura, they went up the cliff. After they emerged, they looked around and found that there weren’t many disciples of the Fantian Sect around. Most of them were gathered at the mountaintop, still constructing the Heavenly-Defying Tower.

Mu Ranwu seemed to have gone to the mountaintop as well, so they followed her and arrived at the top of the mountain.

When they approached the black bone tower, both Su Yi Shui and Ranran both felt a chilling aura.

Even the Gengjin White tiger, felt uncomfortable, and the fur on its neck bristled.

Ranran comforted the tiger by stroking its fur and then looked at Mu Ranwu standing below the tower.

Due to the scars on her face, Mu Ranwu always covered her face with a light veil. When she looked at the bone tower, she would occasionally touch her face with her hand.

Ranran felt that perhaps this sister from her previous life wanted to turn back time to restore her appearance before it was ruined?

Just as Mu Ranwu turned around to prepare to go down the mountain and check on the intruders, she suddenly felt a gust of wind attacking her.

With a start, Mu Ranwu wanted to shout out, but her acupoints were sealed, and she couldn’t move at all. Then she was quickly lifted and brought to a cave below the cliff.

When Ranran and Su Yi Shui dispelled the invisibility talisman to reveal themselves, Mu Ranwu didn’t panic. She just chuckled coldly twice, “So it’s you two who had intruded. I already guessed you were up to no good…”

Ranran didn’t want to waste words with her and immediately slapped a Truth-telling Talisman on Mu Ranwu’s forehead. “Let me ask you, what does the Fantian Sect want to achieve by building this black tower?”

Mu Ranwu didn’t show any struggle on her face. It seemed that even without the talisman, she was also willing to answer this question. “What? Can’t you already figure this out? The existence of this Heaven-Defying Tower is to defy fate, reverse time, and resolve the regrets of life!”

Ranran frowned. “Such an insane idea. Wouldn’t this cause chaos in the Three Realms?”

Mu Ranwu laughed loudly after hearing this. “What’s wrong with chaos? This world is originally unfair in many ways. For those unfairly treated by heaven, don’t they need a chance to start over? Sister, guess what I would do if I could start over from scratch?”

Ranran said coldly, “Whose idea is this? Who is the mastermind behind the Fantian Sect?”

Mu Ranwu smiled and said, “He is a being beyond gods, the only saint in this world. As long as you follow him, you can obtain true immortality! How about it, sister? Why don’t you consider joining the Fantian Sect?”

But when Ranran pressed further about the identity of that person, Mu Ranwu couldn’t explain clearly. It seemed she truly didn’t know the person’s name and background. She only said that the person always wore a mask and was the one who single-handedly revived the Fantian Sect, which had already disappeared from the world.

Su Yi Shui looked at Mu Ranwu’s arrogant demeanor and said coldly, “It seems like you’re not at all worried about your current situation.”

Mu Ranwu laughed, “Since time is about to reverse, both you and I will live one more time. So, is the present moment still important? Su Yi Shui, don’t you also have many regrets? My elder sister acted on her own back then, changing your fate as an emperor. You were supposed to be the emperor of a generation, enjoying honors that countless people would envy, and few would exchange for immortalty. As long as you are willing to follow the Fantian god, you can also return to the past with your memories intact and make up for various regrets!”

As she spoke, Mu Ranwu’s eyes were fervent, and her words were quite enticing. Xue Ranran couldn’t help but look at Su Yi Shui, worried that he might be swayed by this madwoman.

However, Su Yi Shui replied coldly, “Only the incompetent would hope for time reversal. I have always moved forward and never looked back.”

This was not meant to mock Mu Ranwu but was his sincere words, even though he had forgotten his past with Mu Qingge due to the Soul-Cleansing Talisman.

Despite the hardships along the way, he seemed to have lost many things he originally wanted but gained many unexpected ones.

Therefore, Su Yi Shui only wanted to move forward and didn’t want to change any single thing about the present through time reversal.

Hearing Su Yi Shui’s words, Mu Ranwu sighed regretfully, “Stubborn as ever! But you didn’t expect that since you’ve come to Kongshan, you won’t be able to leave, right? The bones needed to build the Spiritual Tower are missing a few pieces, so since you’re here, leave behind your bones as construction materials for the tower!”

Before she finished speaking, Mu Ranwu suddenly broke free from the previous restraint, swung her sword towards Su Yi Shui’s face.

In just over a month of not seeing each other, Mu Ranwu’s strength seemed to have improved significantly. When she wielded her sword, her previous techniques from Xishan were no longer recognizable. It seemed she had learned new sword skills, each move precise and vicious, and the spiritual power she emitted carried a strange aura.

It looked very similar to the techniques of those expressionless Fantian Sect members.

Xue Ranran also stepped forward, and the two of them clashed with Mu Ranwu.

After they engaged, Xue Ranran was also greatly surprised because Mu Ranwu had become much stronger than before, almost like a different person.

Mu Ranwu also noticed this and couldn’t help but laugh aloud, “I have already sacrificed all my spiritual energy to the Fantian Master, in exchange for supreme power bestowed by the Master. Sister, do you always think that I should be grateful to you for ‘bestowing’ everything on me? Including inheriting your spiritual power? Well, now everything I have on me has nothing to do with you!”

She said this with a smug look. Did these two still see her as that inept underling, a nobody? Did they really think she was only here because of her lack of skills?

She wanted to catch them off guard and shatter the arrogance on the faces of these two cultivation geniuses, make them regret for not taking her seriously!

Thinking like this, Mu Ranwu became even more ruthless in her moves.

The only requirement to officially join the Fantian Sect was to sacrifice one’s cultivation and receive a new life. So Mu Ranwu had been hesitant.

But after the incident in Qiongqi Village, where she was humiliated, and her self-esteem crushed, she no longer hesitated. She finally gritted her teeth and sacrificed her spiritual power.

The Fantian Master indeed did not deceive her. Although she lost her spiritual energy, what she gained was ten times more powerful than before.

Now, she could easily fight against these two, feeling no strain at all. This feeling of turning the tables was indescribably exhilarating.

For a moment, she accelerated her sword strikes against the two, and the spiritual power she wielded became stronger and stronger.

Although this game of cat and mouse was enjoyable, what she wanted to see the most was her sword piercing through the bodies of these two!

Just then, a huge tiger leaped out unexpectedly, almost biting Mu Ranwu’s arm.

Startled, Mu Ranwu took a step back, finally realizing that the giant tiger was the Gengjin white tiger.

However, its current size was even larger than twenty years ago before it was injured. Its eyes gleamed with a cold golden light, as if it was about to ascend to immortality.

Mu Ranwu was quite frightened by the sudden appearance of the white tiger. She had feared this white tiger even twenty years ago, and now that it had grown even larger, it made her panic in spite of herself.

In her retreating steps, she accidentally stepped into thin air and fell off the cliff. As she fell, she realized that even if the white tiger was larger, with her current abilities, she could easily twist off its head.

The abilities gained so effortlessly sometimes made it hard for her to remember they were her own. By the time Mu Ranwu snapped out of her reverie, she had missed her chance.

When she turned herself around and jumped back onto the cliff, those two and the tiger seemed to have applied invisibility talismans again and disappeared.

Mu Ranwu gnashed her teeth in frustration, but the Heaven-Defying Tower would soon be completed. Once the four towers were built and connected, the reversal of fate was imminent!

By then, she would want to go back to before she came to Xishan.
