She remembered that Mu Qingge had thought about sending her, a young and frail girl, to be fostered by a farming family while she herself planned to sell herself to a wealthy household as a maidservant to support her. She had cried and refused to separate from her sister, and it just so happened that they encountered their master from Xishan, who then took them in as disciples.

*If she could go back to that time, she would absolutely not cry and let her sister become a maidservant while she would quietly wait for their master from Xishan to pass by.

This time, she would go up the mountain alone, learn cultivation, undergo trials at Tianmai Mountain, follow the path her sister had taken, become famous, and achieve greatness as a powerful cultivator.

If that happened, she would wholeheartedly redeem her sister, find a decent man for her to marry, let her live a good life in the mundane world. By then, she could peacefully watch her sister serve her husband, have children, gradually grow old, and die peacefully.

Perhaps then, she and her sister could get along peacefully, and she wouldn’t feel indebted to her sister anymore.

Hadn’t her sister also tactfully advised her that if she couldn’t bear the hardships of cultivation, she could go down the mountain and get married? Since marriage seemed so good, she could fulfill her sister’s wish in this lifetime.

By then, she could thoroughly repair the irreparable sisterly bond and proudly accept the admiration of others.

With such thoughts in mind, Mu Ranwu took a deep breath and turned back to the mountaintop, directing people to continue construction of the tall bone tower.

Meanwhile, Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui had already arrived at the back mountain of Kongshan. This place was the forbidden area of Kongshan Sect, rumored to be the place where the founding ancestor of the sect had passed into Nirvana. The mortal bodies of the sect’s past leaders and elders were also buried here.

As the burial place for Kongshan Sect’s elders, this area was deep in the woods, with gurgling streams and breathtaking scenery. However, what Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui saw when they arrived was toppled gravestones and ruined graves everywhere.

Xue Ranran felt a pang of sadness, and Su Yi Shui also frowned. They walked forward, and the ground was littered with open graves. It seemed that the black bone tower on the mountaintop had used a lot of materials from here.

However, the further they went, the fewer graves there were, and the more dignified the remains in those graves seemed to be.

At the center of the back mountain, there was only one large grave covering several acres of land. The tombstone read “Tomb of Kongshan Sect’s Founding Ancestor, Wen Yi An.”

Ranran remembered the stories about the sect that Wen Chunhui had told her on the way here and immediately understood that the person buried here was the founding ancestor of Kongshan Sect, Wen Yi An.

Her cultivation back then was not beneath that of the great cultivator Duntian, but in the end, instead of ascending, she chose to pass away and was buried in eternal sleep on this slope facing Tianmai Mountain.

Instead of going to Duntian’s side after ascending, she chose to give up and silently watch over the abandoned Tianmai Mountain from afar, maintaining a quiet vigil…

Ranran felt that this Elder Wen Yi An was a very special woman.

The contrast between this tomb and the chaotic graves around it was striking. Surprisingly, this tomb of the founding ancestor was intact and had not been disturbed.

Xue Ranran exclaimed softly and exchanged a glance with Su Yi Shui before hurrying to the tombstone.

Xue Ranran looked around again and whispered, “It’s strange. Almost all the graves of Kongshan Sect have been dug up, so why is the tomb of the founding ancestor left untouched? Could it be that her remains are not suitable for building the tower?”

Su Yi Shui also raised an eyebrow slightly, and the two of them speculated for a while. Could it really be that the founding ancestor lacked enough cultivation, or maybe she didn’t pass away here on the back mountain but elsewhere, and this tomb doesn’t contain her remains?

Just then, Su Yi Shui suddenly listened intently for a moment, then pointed to a distance and gestured to Xue Ranran to stay quiet. They both used techniques to conceal their spiritual energy, making sure none leaked out.

They had kept the invisibility talismans on them, so unless someone knew beforehand, they wouldn’t be able to detect them even if they were right in front of them, immortals included.

After a moment, footsteps approached, and a figure wearing black clothes, tall and slender with a mask on his face, walked over. His movements were slow and graceful, almost as if he floated along like the wind. *lol if he was so graceful why were there footsteps…

He carried a large basket and seemed to be here to tend to the graves. When he reached Wen Yi An’s tomb, he bent down, plucked the grass covering the tomb one by one, then took out a bowl containing meat buns and a bunch of rare golden chrysanthemums out of this season from the basket.

Su Yi Shui stared at the newcomer, his muscles slightly tensed.

At this point, Xue Ranran had a faint guess about this person, likely the Fantian Sect’s Master that Mu Ranwu had mentioned.

Since he wore a mask, his face couldn’t be seen clearly, but he came to tend to the grave of the Kongshan Sect’s deceased ancestor.

It was unlikely that he came here out of guilt for taking over their mountain. He must have some connection with Kongshan Sect, to come pay respects to the deceased.

At that moment, the person wiped the dust off the tombstone with his sleeve while speaking ‘Since the two of you have come here, why not reveal yourselves and speak? I am temporarily the owner of this mountain. Naturally, I will treat you as guests.’

After saying that, the person casually flicked two blades of grass with his fingers. The originally soft grass shot straight towards the two figures hidden in the distance, hitting the invisibility charms on their chests precisely, causing them to lose their invisibility.

Since they were now revealed, Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran boldly approached.

Xue Ranran sniffed the faint herbal scent in the air and suddenly clasped her hands courteously, ‘Thank you, Senior, for guiding and assisting me several times.’

Her sense of smell was sharp. She immediately recognized the scent from the fake Medicine immortal she met at Tianmai Mountain.

Later, she encountered the old shepherd by the flower sea and the elder who gave her grass shoes at the foot of Red Flame Mountain, both carried the same scent.

Therefore, she was certain that she had met this masked person at least three times.

The person didn’t seem surprised that Ranran recognized him. He simply said, “You’re quite clever to recognize me.”

Ranran replied, “The herbal scent on you is very distinctive and unforgettable.”

It wasn’t just the smell of herbs but a mixture of bitterness and sweetness with an indescribable sense of decay, making it memorable to Ranran.

The person said in a low voice, “I once traveled to the lowest level of the Netherworld, carrying the stench of decay from there. I can only cover it up with the scent of herbs…”

Ranran, sensing no hostility from him, tried to probe further, “May I ask if you are the Master of the Fantian Sect?”

The person stood up from in front of the tomb, looked towards the distant silhouette of Tianmai Mountain, and said mildly, “I just exchanged some things with a group of greedy individuals. They come and go freely, and I am not some grand master of a sect. Everyone will take what they need, and we part ways when we’ve benefited enough.”

Su Yi Shui, who had been observing him, spoke coldly, “So may I ask, why do you command those people to attack various sects, collect the bones of powerful cultivators to build these bone towers? What is your purpose?”

The man continued in a distant tone “The name ‘Heaven-Defying Tower’ itself is the answer, isn’t it? I want to defy the heavens, turn back time, and repeat the past. The deceased will be reborn.”

Ranran continued to probe, “The one you want to be reborn… is it the person in the grave right now?”

The man took a few steps back, looking down at the tomb, “The person lying here is someone I once wronged. But she should have already reincarnated by now, living a new life. Why would I disturb her peace?”

Upon hearing this, a sudden thought flashed through Ranran’s mind, something she had never considered before…

Thinking of this, she suddenly asked, “May I ask, do you know the powerful cultivator Duntian?”

The man sneered, “He’s long dead. Why do you ask about him?”

With that, he ignored the two intruders in the mountain and turned to leave. But at that moment, Ranran started humming the tune she had learned on Tianmai Mountain.

Her melodious voice echoed in this chaotic graveyard, carrying a hint of indescribable bitterness and desolation.

The man, who had intended to leave, suddenly stopped in his tracks upon hearing Ranran’s singing. Gradually, his shoulders began to shake, and he turned around abruptly, his voice hoarse, “Stop singing!”

His shout carried an oppressive qi, rushing straight towards Ranran, who was singing softly.

Where the shockwave passed, dust and stones flew, demonstrating its astonishing force!

By the side, Su Yi Shui immediately raised a spiritual shield to block the man’s attack, but the immense force caused intense pain to Su Yi Shui’s entire body, almost as if his meridians were about to tear apart.

He could barely withstand it, was not because of his profound cultivation but because the man, in his anger, had clearly held back.

“I know the purpose of your visit here. But now you should understand that with your strength, you’re just ants trying to shake a tree,” said the man.

Xue Ranran tightly held Su Yi Shui’s hand, as she stared intently at the man, and said with certainty “You… could you be the powerful cultivator who should have passed away…Duntian?”

The man, upon hearing this, calmly said, “You are indeed very clever. Not only does your singing resemble Yao’er’s, but your intelligence is also similar…”

Duntian’s wife was named Rong Yao, so by saying this, he tacitly confirmed Ranran’s statement, admitting that he was indeed Duntian.

During the great battle between Duntian and the Demon King, Duntian ascended to become an immortal due to his choice to abandon his wife and child in the fight.

However, in the endless years that followed, he was immersed in the pain of losing his loved ones. If he was Duntian, then the intention behind building this Heaven-Defying Tower was clear — he wanted to turn back time, to make a different choice before his battle with the Demon King.

Such an insane idea, coming from an immortal?

If Ranran had not verified it herself, she really couldn’t believe it?

“You… just because of a regretful choice from years ago, you went to such lengths, opened the Netherworld privately, released demons, attacked orthodox sects, openly defying the heavenly laws… Have you forgotten that you’re an immortal, a divine being who should protect all living beings?”

Upon hearing Ranran’s accusations, the man laughed bitterly and then slowly took off his mask…

When Ranran saw the man’s face, she couldn’t help but gasp again in shock.

Duntian’s original appearance should have been very handsome, and one could still vaguely discern his former features from the left side of his face. However, the skin on the right side of his face had already decayed, revealing raw flesh, making him look like a corpse. It was no wonder he masked the herbal scent. Without it, his rotten odor would be difficult to conceal.

At that moment, Duntian chuckled coldly, “Little girl, do you still see me as an immortal? What’s the point of telling someone who’s already fallen into darkness about what they can or cannot do? Isn’t that ridiculous?”

Ranran pulled Su Yi Shui and took several steps back.

Duntian had once ascended as an immortal but had fallen into the demonic path as an immortal.

He had fallen into darkness, but was hundreds of times more frightening than a mortal becoming a demon.

Because Duntian was once a god, but he fell from the immortal path into the demonic path, such a scenario was unheard of to Ranran.

If a person fell into darkness, they could still be subdued. But what about a former immortal who had fallen into darkness? What kind of a dangerous and terrifying existence could they be?

At that moment, thunder rumbled again above Kongshan, and in an instant, thunderclouds gathered, and the calamity of a thousand tribulations was about to strike again.

*Did Mu Ranwu not realize that their Xishan Master had only taken the two of them in as a ‘package deal’ only because he saw the potential in Mu Qingge? lol how foolish of her to expect him to still accept her with her mediocre talent for cultivation. This should be the biggest flaw in her plan? I don’t get it. Unless she thinks time reverses from this point, where her body is Mu Qingge’s and so she was the one blessed with innate talent? Time travel in xiania lol

Previous
Next

雷霆一击 STRIKE OF LIGHTNING

Ranran furrowed her brows and asked, “After experiencing so many twists and turns to finally become an immortal, why would you fall into the demonic way? Don’t you know that such actions will inevitably bring forth heavenly retribution?”

Duntian seemed unfazed by the thunderous storm, with a casual wave of his hand, and the protective shield over Kongshan became even stronger.

This action seemed to silently answer Ranran’s question — he simply didn’t care about the ostentatious Heavenly calamity. After falling into the demonic path, Duntian gained supreme power surpassing gods. Naturally, he acted without scruples and didn’t care about right or wrong anymore.

He didn’t seem to harbor ill intentions towards the intruding duo, but this puzzled Ranran even more. Many things seemed to have the traces of Duntian’s manipulation behind them. What was his purpose in doing all this?

“Dare I ask, Senior, why have you appeared before me several times to guide me? What is your intention?” She didn’t believe he was acting on a whim, suddenly wanting to do good deeds. “Moreover, what is the meaning of sending people to capture us?”

Duntian cast a glance at her, seemingly reluctant to answer that question. However, his gaze towards Su Yi Shui became slightly more focused, with strong disappointment in his eyes.

He said mildly, “If I had known this would happen, I wouldn’t have alarmed you two so soon. You are not ready yet… You will understand in the future. If you are unwilling to leave, you can stay here. They won’t trouble you, but I hope you don’t attempt to damage the ancient tower. They won’t let you succeed…”

After saying these nonsensical words, Duntian vanished like a gust of wind, leaving no trace behind.

Ranran felt that Duntian’s kindness towards her and Su Yi Shui was actually a kind of contempt. When you have absolute power, you don’t bother looking down to see what a couple of ants are up to.

Duntian was once an immortal, standing in the clouds. However, in his heart, did the once cherished mortal beings of the world gradually became insignificant, like ants?

Su Yi Shui asked Ranran to wait for him at the foot of Kongshan, as he wanted to try something at the Spirit Tower. However, Ranran refused and shook her head, insistent on accompanying him.

When they arrived under the Spirit Tower, none of the Fantian disciples stopped them, allowing them to come up all the way to the Black Bone Tower.

Su Yi Shui narrowed his eyes at the black bone tower and suddenly tried to push it with his power. Before he could touch it, he was flung out and crashed through the trunks of three thick trees.

The unfinished ancient tower now already possessed a concealed demonic nature, making it impossible for anyone to approach. Even those constructing the bone tower only scattered bones from afar, and the tower would automatically absorb them to gradually take shape.

Suddenly, Ranran began twitching her nose again, as if sensing some unusual scent.

Su Yi Shui knew that this little gourmet’s sense of smell was extraordinary. Just as he was about to ask what she smelled, Ranran asked, “What should we do?”

Su Yi Shui’s expression turned grave. “Let’s leave first, and inform others about the situation here.”

Dealing with someone who was once an immortal but now turned into a demon was a precarious matter. They needed to inform the other immortals hovering in mid-air and see if they had any solutions or could bring reinforcements.

When the intermittent thunder from the Heavenly calamity stopped, Su Yi Shui used his old method to take Ranran and the white tiger out of the protective shield.

However, when they emerged, the Heavenly calamity from above seemed even fiercer than when they entered. Lightning mixed with purple light continuously exploded overhead, and the frequency grew denser.

At the moment they emerged, the thundering should have paused momentarily to let them pass through. But the next wave of lightning followed closely.

So, the two, along with the white tiger, had to dodge swiftly, hoping to pass through quickly.

Just as they were about to exit the array, a lightning bolt flashed towards Xue Ranran.

Seeing that Xue Ranran couldn’t dodge in time, without any hesitation, Su Yi Shui instinctively changed direction and quickly knocked Ranran out of the thunder array.

And the lightning, glowing with purple light, struck Su Yi Shui directly.

After Xue Ranran was knocked out of the thunder array, she turned around and saw Su Yi Shui being struck by lightning, and couldn’t help but cry out. She turned to enter the array again, but the white tiger that had just leaped out seemed to know how powerful the thunder array was and used its body to block Ranran.

Seeing the light in the white tiger’s eyes, Ranran instantly understood that Su Yi Shui’s primordial spirit had already possessed the white tiger’s body at the moment of the lightning strike.

So, the one blocking her from entering the array now was Su Yi Shui’s himself. However, his physical body was still inside the array. If they didn’t pull him out quickly, Su Yi Shui would be stuck as a tiger for the rest of his life.

Ranran didn’t have time to think. She just remembered how Su Yi Shui had guided the lightning with silver needles. She took out something she had on her, and threw it hard towards the lightning bolt.

What she had thrown out, was the box she obtained on Dragon Island which could not be opened. This was left behind by Mu Qingge, but she had never been able to open it.

The item was made of a metal similar to refined iron and was indeed conductive. The lightning in the sky was instantly attracted to the box, sparing the man from being struck by lightning.

At that moment, the white tiger leaped quickly into the thunder array, threw the body onto its back, and turned to run. After being struck by lightning, the iron box actually did not turn into smoke but was bounced out with a crack, the lid opening and falling at Xue Ranran’s feet.

But at this moment, Ranran didn’t have time to look at it. She just put it back in her pocket, then hugged Su Yi Shui’s body, which was covered in wounds from the lightning strike, and looked over him anxiously.

Just then, the Medicine Immortal and the others hurried over. They had seen Su Yi Shui’s body being struck by the Heavenly calamity from afar.

Ordinary cultivators wouldn’t dare to face heavenly thunder unless it was their ascension time. There were even those unscrupulous masters who used their disciples to attract thunder for their own benefits during tribulations.

What Su Yi Shui had faced was not ordinary heavenly tribulation but the Ten Thousand Tribulations Heavenly calamity. So, after being struck, his chances of survival were slim.

But Xue Ranran didn’t care about all that. She desperately stuffed medicinal pills into Su Yi Shui’s mouth and activated her technique to protect his heart meridians.

The Medicine Immortal, who had been on the path of medical immortality, also quickly extended his hand to protect Su Yi Shui’s heart meridians.

However, he couldn’t help but exclaim in surprise, “His body hasn’t been destroyed yet. Why is there no primordial spirit?”

Ranran felt the body under her hands slowly resumed breathing, and she let out a sigh of relief. She pointed to the white tiger beside her and said, “His primordial spirit is in this tiger.”

The Medicine Immortal furrowed his brows without speaking. Although they had extended timely treatment and the girl’s pills was potent, according to common sense, Su Yi Shui’s body should have been badly charred.

Why was he only slightly injured with no major problems?

Thinking about how this mortal had once managed to guide Mu Qingge’s soul to be reborn on the tree, the Medicine Immortal found this man attached to the tiger was even more difficult to figure out than before…

Because Su Yi Shui’s body had suffered a heavy blow from the lightning, his primordial spirit needed to return to his body as soon as possible.

However, at the moment he returned, the pain from the lightning strike immediately invaded his senses. The man, who should have fallen into a coma, immediately moaned quietly in pain.

Ranran held his hand tightly with tears of distress in her eyes, and gently applied a cooling ointment to his wounds to ease the pain.

Wei Jiu circled many times around Su Yi Shui, seemingly weighing the chances of killing his archenemy, and the pros and cons of retaining or breaking alliances.

Xue Ranran glanced at the corner of her eye and immediately understood Wei Jiu’s intentions. So she immediately threw out the shocking news, disrupting Wei Jiu’s plans.

She briefly explained the situation inside. When she mentioned that Duntian, who should have passed into Nirvana, had turned into a demon and was the mastermind behind the Fantian Sect, everyone’s expression changed. Even the immortals looked at each other, and their indifferent faces finally showed some changes.

Wei Jiu looked at the immortals with a cold gaze and said, “A god from the divine class willingly fell and stirred up unrest in the Three Realms? Don’t tell me none of you noticed anything?”

The Medicine Immortal’s expression was solemn, and he suddenly spoke, “I remember when Duntian passed, the four tools of the Four gods of time had suddenly disappeared. Could they be… taken by Duntian?”
*四值功曹 four deities in charge of time, Year, Month, Day and Hour

The Four gods who managed time, had four tools, coronas, that had the power to adjust the seasons.

When the four coronas had disappeared, the Four deities were indeed panicked for a while. In the end, they barely managed by using the Eye of Zhu Long, which also could control the changes of time.
*烛龙 : 钟山的山神，无足之龙，开眼为昼、闭眼为夜
The mountain god of Clock Mountain, a dragon with no feet; when its eyes opened its day, when its eyes closed its night

If that were really the case, Duntian’s ascension had been a long-planned conspiracy. The four bone towers he built corresponded to the four coronas, thus, they indeed had the ability to reverse time!

When the Medicine Immortal mentioned this, the other immortals also became agitated.

Two of them exchanged looks and immediately turned and hurried back to the Heavenly Realm to report what was happening here to the higher gods.

They were just minor lower gods and couldn’t make decisions on such major events.

The Medicine Immortal, along with the white-haired immortal who had previously taught Wei Jiu a lesson, stayed behind to continue monitoring the situation at Kongshan.

According to the Medicine Immortal, other mountains were also experiencing thunderstorms. Duntian seemed to have the ability to split himself and had protective shields on all four mountains, resisting the Ten Thousand Tribulations Heavenly Calamity.

At this moment, Su Yi Shui seemed to have recovered well. After a long period of silence, he slowly stood up and asked, “Other than the Ten Thousand Tribulations Heavenly Calamity, is there any other way to dismantle the bone tower?”

The Medicine Immortal sighed, “I have never seen such a tower that defies the heavens, so how would I know how to unravel it? Now we can only wait for the higher gods’ response and see if they can come up with a strategy.”

That’s all they could do for now, so they patiently waited under Kongshan.

The Medicine Immortal’s character was still not too bad. During the time they had while waiting, he cleared the black rain mud around Kongshan and treated the wounds of the injured. With a wave of his hand, the medicine healed their wounds, earning him the people’s respect, who bowed repeatedly, wanting to build temples and statues for him in the future.

However, true immortals seemed uninterested in earthly offerings and he quickly erased the memories of the people with a wave, sending them back home.

According to the Medicine Immortal, after becoming a god, if there were too many people thinking of them in the mortal world, it would actually be a burden on their cultivation. After all, responding to too many worldly desires would keep them very busy.

Most people who ascended to immortality, other than seeking eternal life, desired inner peace. If immortals were like magistrates who managed all kinds of trivial mundane affairs, won’t that only add to their troubles?

So, many ascended immortals even abandoned their secular names, seeking a state of pure tranquility without any attachments.

Xue Ranran listened to all this in astonishment. Clearly, these true immortals were far from the benevolent saviors of mankind as she had imagined. Thinking about those who constantly bothered the immortals with offerings, perhaps the immortals were gritting their teeth while accepting offerings and cursing from their caves!

After applying ointment to Su Yi Shui’s wounds, although the pain eased, the wounds healed very slowly. The usual methods of rapid recovery for cultivators seemed ineffective against the thunderous tribulations of the Ten Thousand Tribulations Heavenly Calamity.

Before sunset, another heavy rain fell. Xue Ranran was afraid that the rain would wash over Su Yi Shui’s wounds, so she chose a spot under a low tree on a hillside, used her spiritual power to create a spirit shield to block the rain, and then moved Su Yi Shui, who was resting in a state of recovery, under the tree.

Afterward, Xue Ranran sat silently beside him, gazing at the bone tower under the dark clouds of Kongshan.

It was unclear how much time passed, but Su Yi Shui finally woke up. Slowly opening his eyes, accompanied by the pouring rain, he looked at the girl sitting quietly beside him. He sat up and draped the cloak on him over her, then asked softly, “What are you thinking about?”

Ranran turned to look at him, carefully avoiding his wounds, reached out to hold his arm, and whispered, “I’m thinking, if Duntian really reverses time and changes everything, maybe we won’t get to meet again?”

Such a reversal of fate, if it happened, would likely cause a chain reaction. By then, with the world undergoing tremendous changes, they might become two insignificant specks, never to meet again, strangers forever…

Thinking about this, Ranran couldn’t help but feel a bit melancholic.

Su Yi Shui didn’t seem to like her hypothesis. He just held her hand gently, then said softly, “Don’t worry, he won’t succeed…”

Listening to Su Yi Shui’s firm tone, Ranran’s rare moment of uncertainty instantly dissipated. She raised her spirits and said, “I won’t let him succeed either. He doesn’t know how difficult it was for me to take you all in as disciples back then. So, no one should think of making me start over!”

Her words made Su Yi Shui frown, recalling the mischievous look of this little demoness when she used various tricks to take him as a disciple.

He couldn’t help but ask in a low voice “You’re only reluctant to part with your disciples?”

Ranran tilted her head, looking uncertain “Of course, a few less disciples probably wouldn’t matter. Maybe… it would be better if you… hadn’t met me… ah!”

Before she could finish her sentence, Su Yi Shui had already pulled her into his arms. “Bad habits die hard! You first provoke me and then say such nonsense. Tell me, which disciple do you want to abandon if you were to reverse time?”

Ranran looked at his stern face, couldn’t help but laugh softly, and said as if coaxing a child, “Alright, even if I don’t want the others, I will still accept my little disciple Shui’er… ah… um…”

Su Yi Shui clearly didn’t want to hear his carefree master’s nonsense anymore, so he simply sealed her remaining words with his lips… In the meantime, between kisses, he whispered, “If you dare say such things again, don’t blame me for making you copy the sect rules…”

Xue Ranran had originally closed her eyes to accept his passionate kiss. When she heard this, she gradually opened her eyes, looking at Su Yi Shui with disbelief, and slowly said, “You… remembered?”

Making his disciples copy sect rules was something that Su Yi Shui loved to do the most before he lost his memories. She almost had swollen wrists from being punished by him back then…

As she looked up to closely examine the man in front of her, Su Yi Shui’s facial features remained unchanged, but the gloominess and cynicism between his brows disappeared, replaced by a calmness honed by the passing of time…

After being struck by lightning just now, her… her Shifu had finally returned! Su Yi Shui reached out and embraced Ranran, ignoring the pain in his wounds, and tightly held her in his arms.

When he was struck by that heavenly thunder, the effectiveness of the Soul-cleansing talisman was completely nullified, and memories of Mu Qingge and Ranran rushed into his mind like a torrential river.

No one could know what Su Yi Shui felt at that moment, only his lingering fear.

Fear that he had almost killed Ranran, fear that Ranran would distance herself from him because of this, fear that he had endured for twenty years, only to face such a twist of fate…

Fortunately, Ranran did not give up on him. Otherwise, he would definitely be strangling himself now, killing the reckless and selfish self who had lost his memory…

At this moment, heavy rain poured down. the two who had been together day and night but felt like they had been apart for a long time, were under the cover of the spiritual shield, with many things to say…

Wei Jiu lay diagonally on a large rock, able to see from afar through the heavy rain, beneath the tree on the hillside, where a pair was partially obscured.

Although raindrops splashed on the spiritual shield, making it impossible to see clearly inside or hear what they were saying.

But Wei Jiu wasn’t a naive child; he could naturally imagine what a man and a woman alone could do.

Those imagined, sickeningly sweet Xishan styles had obviously repulsed Lord Wei Jiu.

He couldn’t help but glare at the other disciples of Xishan and said, “What are we doing at this critical juncture? Your Sect Leader, who was just struck by lightning, still has the mind to enjoy romantic moments. Do you expect such a person to change the current  disadvantaged situation? I think we might as well wait for our doom.”

Gao Cang and Bai Baishan didn’t like to engage with this devil, but thinking that if Duntian succeeded, causing chaos in the world, they were both worried and anxious.

Especially Gao Cang, he didn’t want the world to start over again. Whether it was his master, his junior siblings, or his loved one, Qiu Xier, he didn’t want to miss any of them.

Now the distant tall tower seemed to be almost completed. No one knew what earth-shattering events would happen next.

But at this moment, the Medicine Immortal and the white-haired immortal who had been sitting there suddenly opened their eyes, their faces serious, and their lips trembling slightly.

Wei Jiu knew they were probably communicating with someone, but as immortals, their ability to communicate over long distances was extraordinary. They could sense each other even from thousands of miles away.

The white-haired immortal was still fine, but the Medicine Immortal seemed to be arguing with someone. However, in the end, he seemed to have been persuaded by someone. Helpless, he sighed deeply and said to Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran, who had just come over, “I’m leaving, and you should leave quickly too… Activate all your spiritual power and go as far as possible!”

Su Yi Shui looked at the Medicine Immortal’s serious expression and narrowed his eyes, saying, “Would the Immortal please explain clearly, what decision has the divine class in the Heavenly Realm made regarding the Tower of Reversal?”

The Medicine Immortal looked at Su Yi Shui. He originally didn’t want to reveal the heaven’s mandate, but for some reason, he decided to speak up in the end. “…The Towers of Reversal must not be allowed to be completed. Otherwise, there will be chaos in the Three Realms. Since the Ten Thousand Tribulations Heavenly Calamity cannot destroy the tower, then we must activate the earth’s veins and level the four mountains…”

Wei Jiu, hearing this, glared angrily, “Are you all mad?! This way of doing things is even more like the demonic path compared to my actions! Once the earth’s veins are activated, the entire surface within a radius will be overturned! By then, not just the four mountains, but even the manors and farms within a thousand miles will be destroyed! It will be a scene of extensive devastation, with great suffering… From what I can see, you immortals are not any wiser than Duntian in your actions!”

Faced with Wei Jiu’s accusations, the Medicine Immortal also sighed deeply, “You’re right, but if there were any other way out, the Heavenly Realm wouldn’t make such a decision. But now that the towers are about to be completed, if Duntian succeeds, the chaos caused in the Three Realms will be much worse than the destruction of the four mountains. Given the lesser of two evils, sacrifices must be made to stop Duntian’s madness.”

There was another part that the Medicine Immortal didn’t say out loud. As a lower immortal, his opinion was insignificant, and the higher immortals only informed him to evacuate quickly, and did not consult with him. By himself, he could not reverse the decision of the higher immortals.

“What I can do to help you ends here. Tomorrow at noon, when yin and yang intersects and the tower is about to be completed, the earth’s veins will tremble, and the entire surface will be overturned… Find a safe place to take refuge yourselves…”

With that, the Medicine Immortal turned to leave.

But at that moment, a cold voice came from behind him, “You once aspired to become an immortal wholeheartedly, just to be the Heavenly Realm’s lackey and messenger? How did that spirited cultivator who was full of ideals and wanted to save the masses, end up being such a submissive person?”

The Medicine Immortal’s body jolted, and he slowly turned around to look at the cold woman standing behind him, whose presence he hadn’t noticed until then.

She had golden hair and dragon horns, with a heroic aura, but unfortunately, a prominent scar on her face made people overlook her lively phoenix eyes…

“Fengmou!” the Medicine Immortal recognized the woman in front of him and cried out involuntarily. She was his lover before he ascended to immortality—Fengmou, the guardian god of Dragon Island.

Previous
Next

与你无关 NONE OF YOUR CONCERN

The Medicine Immortal could never have expected to meet his former lover, Fengmou, here. When he saw the scar on her face, his heart, which had become somewhat indifferent after ascending to immortality, suddenly tightened.

The white-haired immortal by the side was already impatient, feeling that the Medicine Immortal was talking too much with these mortals.

Now that even the guardian deity of Dragon Island has also appeared here, the white-haired immortal said coldly, “The orders from the higher immortals have been given, we shouldn’t linger here for too long. I’ll go on ahead.”

After saying that, he vanished into the clouds.

However, the Medicine Immortal couldn’t move his feet, only stared at Fengmou intently and asked “Are you here to see me?”

The guardian deity of Dragon Island looked at her former lover with cold eyes and said lightly, “I came here to settle the blood feud of the Dragon Clan. You should be returning to the Heavenly realm.”

She was not lying.

Because she did come here for revenge. When Ranran and the others left Dragon Island, she had told Ranran that if she found out who killed the Green Dragon on the island, she must inform her, and she would definitely avenge the Green Dragon.

The vengeful power of the Dragon Clan was unmatched. Such a large Green Dragon had been drained of blood alive by someone, and as the guardian deity of Dragon Island, she must avenge this grievance.

So when Ranran used water as a medium to draw a talisman on the spot and conveyed this message to Dragon Island, she broke through the imprisonment of Dragon Island once again and left the island seeking the murderer.

At this moment, Ranran also said, “When I was in Kongshan, I smelled a strong scent of Green Dragon’s blood on the black bone tower. I immediately understood that the blood binding those bones was from the Green Dragon. So when we were taking shelter from the rain earlier, I passed the message to the guardian deity of Dragon Island, asking her to come and check it out.”

The Medicine Immortal shook his head with some anxiety, “This place will be leveled to the ground soon, so you all should leave quickly. Even if you know that the Green Dragon was killed by Duntian, you are powerless!”

However, after Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui exchanged a glance, Ranran clasped her fists and said, “Old Immortal, this is related to the lives of tens of thousands of people. How can we cultivators shirk responsibility at this critical moment? We want to try again, see if we can destroy the bone tower before the Heavenly punishment arrives, and avoid this catastrophe of the mortal realm!”

The Medicine Immortal continued to shake his head helplessly, “If there were other ways, the heavenly realm would not resort to this extreme measure! This is the only way to stop Duntian’s madness… You should stop trying, use this time to notify the surrounding people to evacuate quickly.”

But after he finished speaking, he found no one responding. Su Yi Shui had called the disciples of Xishan to him, instructed them in a low voice, and then the disciples went down the mountain one after another. It’s unclear whether they were informing the people to evacuate.

But with only one day and night, it’s impossible to evacuate so many people from all over the land.

It was also likely that if they spoke of the impending catastrophe, people would just consider them a group of lunatics. Even if the Emperor of Daqi issued an edict for so many people to leave their homes and abandon their properties and lands, it wouldn’t be easy.

Thinking of this, the Medicine Immortal looked at Fengmou again and found that there was also a young man with horns standing beside her, who seemed to be clinging to her.

Fengmou stood aside, looking at the black tower on Kongshan, lost in thought.

The Medicine Immortal didn’t want to leave like this. He walked over and wanted to say something to her again, but the young man with horns suddenly jumped in front of Fengmou, showing his teeth menacingly at him, clearly still in his beastly mode despite having taken human form recently.

“Little Dragon, don’t be like this,” the guardian deity of Dragon Island reprimanded the youth with dragon horns in a low voice. He was her adopted son, who had taken human form early with her blessing of her golden light but still couldn’t speak, only making sounds similar to dragon cries.

So after she scolded him, the young man blinked his eyes innocently and made sounds like a whimpering puppy.

Xue Ranran watched her rescued little dragon, still not changing his ingrained habits, fond of guarding his food, couldn’t help but shake her head and smile, reaching out to pull the little dragon aside.

It had been a long time since these two had seen each other, and right now was an exceptionally dangerous moment. They would certainly have some private words to say about the bitterness of separation.

So Ranran deliberately pulled the child aside, not wanting to delay their reunion.

Meanwhile, Fengmou seemed to deliberately turn her head to one side, not wanting to let the Medicine Immortal see the scarred half of her face. The Medicine Immortal also sensed her discomfort, and could only hold his breath and ask her, “Was it because of this scar on your face that you left me with a letter, without saying goodbye back then?”

Fengmou didn’t speak, seeming to tacitly agree. The Medicine Immortal felt a sharp pain in his heart: “I thought… you were afraid, so you…”

Unfortunately, Ranran’s best intentions was being let down. The Medicine Immortal had walked up, but before he could say anymore to Fengmou, a female immortal descended from the sky.

Ranran looked at the female immortal, her head crowned with purple aura, who was the companion of the Medicine Immortal called Yulian Immortal when he floated lotus lanterns by the river.

It seemed as if sensing the reunion of the Medicine Immortal with his former lover, Yulian Immortal appeared in time and reminded the Medicine Immortal that it was time for him to leave.

The Medicine Immortal had never known that Fengmou’s appearance had been damaged in that divine punishment, and she felt so inferior that she didn’t want to see him. Thinking of how she had been alone on Dragon Island for so many years, he felt a surge of guilt.

Now with Yulian appearing and holding his arm, he felt a bit embarrassed, with a hint of awkwardness on his face.

He wanted to explain to Fengmou that the Heavenly realm’s companionship was just a cultivation partner in the same immortal cave, accompanying each other in cultivation, without the passionate emotions of ordinary men and women.

But all explanations froze seeing Fengmou’s cold eyes.

She suddenly turned her face straight on, no longer avoiding, allowing her scarred face to be exposed in front of these immortal companions. She took a glance at the declarative hand-holding between the Medicine Immortal and Yulian Immortal, sneered, then suddenly leaped up and transformed into a dragon, flying towards Kongshan.

Because the heavenly realm had made a decision, the Heavenly calamity also ceased, the rain storm over Kongshan ceased, but the dark clouds did not dissipate, seemingly brewing an even greater heavenly punishment.

And the rising golden dragon floating above Kongshan dispersed the gloom, making everyone involuntarily look at the golden dragon.

The Medicine Immortal shook off Yulian Immortal’s hand, as he watched the dancing golden dragon, once again recalling the past… Fengmou was such a proud person, and now he finally understood why she proposed to part ways back then. It wasn’t because she was afraid of divine punishment, but because she wanted to fulfill his path of immortal cultivation. She was even more afraid that he would feel guilty seeing her disfigured appearance, so she left without a word.

He was wrong. Over these years, if he had gone to Dragon Island just once and understood her thoughts, would he have made the so many mistakes, one after the other?

The guardian deity of Dragon Island came out this time to avenge the Green Dragon, even risking the danger of being punished again by heaven. Although at the moment of leaving the island, there was still a faint hope in her heart of seeing her former lover again, to tell him personally to forget her, and not to release those lotus lanterns drifting to Dragon Island every year.

But now, she felt that perhaps those lanterns floating every year were not reminiscing about her…

A slightly throbbing heart could gradually turn cold. Dragons are a race not easily swayed by emotions. Once emotions are severed, they would be cut off with a sharp sword.

Having seen the vastness of the world, soaring in the sky as a dragon god, how could she accommodate sharing his heart with another woman?

Xue Ranran watched the situation in front of her, seeing the Medicine Immortal’s regretful and sorrowful expression, feeling a sense of melancholy in her heart.

Although she had lived two lives as a human, her understanding of “love” was still not very deep.

Back then, this guardian deity of Dragon Island sacrificed her own cultivation and appearance for her lover to successfully ascend, willingly destroying her own cultivation and appearance, and proposed to part ways, fulfilling her lover. This was a willingness to sacrifice oneself, loving with hidden restraint.

And Duntian, after becoming an immortal, willingly fell and became a demon, wanting to reverse time and space even at the cost of destroying heaven and earth, in order to save his wife and children again. That was also for “love”, being willing to sacrifice everything without reservation.

These two kinds of “love” seemed similar but were completely different, which made Ranran feel a bit melancholic.

Thinking of this, she couldn’t help but turn her head to look at Su Yi Shui beside her and said, “If something unexpected happens to me, you must never become like Duntian, becoming a demon without any regard… Otherwise, I…”

Su Yi Shui immediately understood, he continued “Otherwise, you would never accept me like that, nor would you accept a rebirth bought with bloodshed.”

He understood her too well. However, he couldn’t help but ask in a low voice, “But… if something unexpected happens to me, how would you react?”

Ranran didn’t even think about it and said, “Even if my soul scatters, I will protect you!”

Su Yi Shui’s eyes narrowed fiercely, as if back to the time when he had lost his memories, said with a sinister tone, “You — dare!”

Xue Ranran knew that her mention of “soul scattering” touched on her Shifu’s raw nerve, bringing back the unpleasant memories he had just regained. But at that moment of glaring, it was as if her Shifu who lost his memories, had possessed him.

But Ranran knew that no matter which side of Su Yi Shui appeared, it was still his true self. The rebelliousness of his youth had never disappeared, but had been well hidden under maturity and restraint as he grew older.

No matter which side of him, she still liked it… Thinking of this, she didn’t say anything else, just held his hand tightly.

An unimaginable great battle was about to come. Regardless of the outcome, she wanted to be with him, in life or in death.

The guardian deity of Dragon Island, who had circled above Kongshan in dragon form, transformed back into a human form and walked over, saying to Ranran and Su Yi Shui, “I went above Kongshan just now, and the tower is indeed stained with the Green Dragon’s blood. Duntian has killed my clansmen, we will be irreconcilable… However, although this Heaven-Defying Tower is built, if it is to be activated, using only the blood of the Green Dragon as a blood sacrifice is not enough; it also requires a sacrificial offering. If you want to destroy the tower, you must not let the sacrifice succeed.”

“Sacrifice?” Ranran furrowed her brows slightly.

The guardian deity of Dragon Island nodded, saying in a low voice, “The operation of the Heaven-Defying Tower inherits the obsession of humans. Only with deep enough obsession can the tower go against heaven and reverse time and space. Therefore, the person making the sacrifice must have enough regrets and an obsession to bring about change to drive the tower’s operation.”

Although Duntian’s obsession was strong enough, he would absolutely not sacrifice himself. It remained unknown where he would find someone to sacrifice for the spirit tower.

By the side, Yulian Immortal couldn’t help but urge the Medicine Immortal to return to the heavenly realm quickly.

The situation here was simply a quandary. Being trapped here would lead to an irreversible calamity, especially with the guardian deity of Dragon Island here. She was even more anxious to get the Medicine Immortal to leave this dangerous place.

Just then, Ranran said, “I have already asked my senior brothers to contact the government when they went down the mountain. At the same time, I used talismans to command birds to send a message to Emperor Su Yu, trying to get as many people from the four mountains to relocate as possible. But considering the time, it’s definitely not enough, so we still want to do our best to stop Duntian. I wonder if the Medicine Immortal is willing to stay and help us?”

If it were before Fengmou scolded him, the Medicine Immortal might have reluctantly refused and reminded this little girl of the inevitability of fate.

However, Fengmou’s sarcastic words were still fresh in his mind. He also introspected, having lost his beloved, ascending to immortality, what was it all for? Was it just to stand high above the clouds during the calamity in the mortal world, pushing everything onto the inevitability of fate?

Now that Fengmou openly exposed the scar on her face without concealing it, yet those eyes that were once full of love never looked at him again.

There was a bitter feeling in the Medicine Immortal’s heart, mixed with a hundred emotions. But he knew that if Fengmou insisted on seeking revenge against Duntian, he would never leave her in this dangerous place and return to the heavenly realm alone.

Thinking of this, he turned to Yulian Immortal and said “I want to stay here. You should hurry back… Also, after I return, I will find another immortal residence and live alone…”

With that, he turned around gracefully and walked away without looking back.

Yulian Immortal’s hands hidden in her long sleeves were trembling slightly, gritting her teeth. She turned around and flew back to the sky.

Because the calamity of the heavenly punishment had temporarily ceased, it was not as dangerous to approach Kongshan now.

Su Yi Shui’s injuries from the lightning strikes had also been mostly healed by the Medicine Immortal’s treatment. After a brief reorganization, everyone prepared to enter Kongshan to destroy the spirit tower.

Although they didn’t have absolute confidence, but this time the group entering the mountain had the addition of the guardian deity of Dragon Island and the Medicine Immortal, two great powers. Although they might not be able to defeat Duntian who had turned from immortal to demon, at the very least, they could hold their ground.

As long as they could destroy the Heaven-Defying Spirit Tower, there would be no more incidents to defy heaven , and the Heavenly realm would not level the four mountains, causing suffering to the living beings.

They only had one day and one night left, time was limited and couldn’t be wasted any longer, so the group gradually arrived at the foot of the mountain.

Although the divine punishment had ceased for now, the great calamity was approaching, as if an invisible force was pressing down from the sky. The air pressure was so low that even many birds flapped their wings hard, struggling to fly low, flocking away in scattered groups.

Many beasts and rodents also came out of the mountains, rushing to escape in a panic.

And this group of people went against the flow of these birds and beasts, looking out of place. Because of this gradually descending pressure, even immortals like the Medicine Immortal were reluctant to waste effort floating in the air, and his shoes which hadn’t touched dust for a long time had to walk on the muddy ground.

Throughout this journey, Ranran seemed unaffected by the low air pressure, her mouth never idle as she ate the red sugarcane she got from the rescued villagers.

Several vendors selling sugarcane were very generous. Combined with the urgency to flee this area, they gave Ranran a large basket of sugarcane. Now that basket of sugarcane was on Su Yi Shui’s back.

The local sugarcane was sweet, but the juice was thicker in color, and the juice squeezed out was also a bright red. If one wasn’t careful, their mouth would turn rosy red.

As the great battle approached, everyone else was preoccupied, but the Xishan master and disciple of two lifetimes seemed so carefree. As Su Yi Shui walked along, he used his sharp sword that could cut metal like mud, to peel the sugarcane for Ranran, as if fearing she might not have enough.

Wei Jiu gave them the side-eye and couldn’t help but comment, “You guys are really leisurely. Are you afraid of death approaching and want to die with a full stomach?”

Ranran smiled faintly, “I thought you would sneak away quietly. Charging ahead like this doesn’t seem like your usual style, Lord Wei.”

Wei Jiu chuckled, “This kind of major battle will be recorded in the history of cultivation. Naturally, I want to enjoy it from the sidelines. Besides, those scoundrels in the heavenly realm have made a good account for themselves, even including my Red Flame Mountain’s centuries-old foundation into it. How can I fulfill their wishes?”

He was naturally rebellious, not following the orthodox path even during cultivation, and he had a natural aversion to those heavenly immortals. Even if he ascended in the future, he would likely fall into demonic path and not cultivate on any proper path.

But Ranran handed him a piece of peeled sugarcane, commending “Just for your statement of ‘not following their wishes,’ it’s worth a toast, but unfortunately, there’s no wine here. You’ll have to make do with sugarcane.”

This belated offering of “wine” by a beauty naturally made Wei Jiu’s eyes and eyebrows reveal a bit of smugness.

But just as he reached out to take it, Su Yi Shui snatched the piece of sugarcane away, “Lord Wei grinds his teeth at night, a sign of poor digestion. If you eat sugarcane, it might worsen the symptoms. Don’t harm our excellency here.”

Although Su Yi Shui was just being petty, he still displayed a frank and open appearance even in jealousy. With his memories restored, he also regained his sophisticated and subtly malicious demeanor.

Wei Jiu’s eyes narrowed coldly, “Nonsense! When did I grind my teeth?”

Su Yi Shui continued leisurely, “Naturally, it was when Your Excellency had a good dream on my bed…”

As the two bantered back and forth with cold remarks, suddenly, Ranran stopped in her tracks and pointed to the nearby river, “Look, what’s in the river?”

It turned out that due to the previous heavy rain, the nearby dried-up riverbed had filled with rainwater for a long time. Now that it was getting dark, with Ranran’s good eyesight, she suddenly saw something in the river. Upon closer inspection, it turned out to be a woman bobbing up and down in the water.

She was still entangled with a broken snake tail, and the strange pattern on it looked like the nine-headed monster snake.

The Medicine Immortal waved his whisk and rescued the woman from the water. It was only then, as the woman coughed out water desperately, that Ranran recognized her as Elder Tu Jiuyuan!

Earlier at the inn, there was a Tu Jiuyuan who had split off from the nine-headed monster snake and came to cheat people. Now, another Tu Jiuyuan entangled with a snake tail appeared in the river, making people doubt her authenticity.

As Tu Jiuyuan coughed out water, Wei Jiu had already drawn out his whip and wrapped it around Tu Jiuyuan’s neck with a flick of his wrist.

“Speak, what does this fake want to do?”

After Tu Jiuyuan coughed out water, she was lifted up by the neck and could only weakly hold onto the whip with one hand, the other hand protecting her stomach, and she said with effort, “Your Excellency, it’s me, Tu Jiuyuan…”

Her hair was wet, the corners of her eyes were red, her voice hoarse, and the hand holding the whip had already wrinkled from soaking in water for a long time.

Wei Jiu relaxed his grip slightly and asked coldly, “Why are you here?”

After coughing twice, Tu Jiuyuan said, “A fake Excellency had infiltrated Red Flame Mountain. After I exposed him, he tricked me into going to the back mountain, wanting to kill me to silence me. Luckily, I’m familiar with the terrain and escaped through a volcanic cave. I wandered around and finally saw the hidden marks you left along the way, so I followed them to the Western Mountains. But by then, you had already gone to Kongshan with Su Yi Shui and the others. So, I tracked my way here, but was targeted by the *nine-headed monster snake, unfortunately got poisoned by the snake, and it split out a fake…”

Wei Jiu narrowed his eyes. When he went to the Western Mountains earlier, he did indeed leave marks to find his disciples. But how did Tu Jiuyuan discover that there was a fake on Red Flame Mountain?

Upon hearing his question, Tu Jiuyuan smiled bitterly, “Because he was too courteous to me, unlike Your Excellency’s hot and cold attitude…”

Wei Jiu was somewhat choked by his subordinate’s response, his phoenix eyes slanted slightly, coldly laughing, “Consider yourself not completely stupid!”

Hearing this, Ranran couldn’t help but ask, “After being replicated by it, how did you escape without being killed?”

Tu Jiuyuan fell silent for a moment, “I don’t know either, it’s just when it sprayed snake venom at me, there seemed to be something glowing in my abdomen, which let me escape…”

Her explanation was obviously not very believable, but fortunately, it was almost midnight when the yin and yang changed, and those holding torches could look at her shadow and know the truth.

However, the Medicine Immortal had already discerned the truth in advance. When he reached out to check her pulse, his brows furrowed, and said in a low voice “You… seem to be pregnant…”

If it’s a fake body split from the nine-headed monster snake, no matter how lifelike it is, it can’t fake the pregnancy pulse unique to humans. And the glowing inside Tu Jiuyuan’s abdomen that she mentioned, which blocked the snake venom for her, obviously came from the spiritually endowed fetus in her womb, who saved her from death.

After hearing the Medicine Immortal’s words, Wei Jiu was the first to give an outburst. He glared darkly at Tu Jiuyuan and her flat belly, and finally asked coldly, “Whose child is this?”

Tu Jiuyuan obviously knew about her pregnancy long before, as she had been unconsciously holding her belly since she came ashore, looking very cautious.

Now, hearing Wei Jiu’s question, her cheeks, which had just regained some color, turned pale again.

Tu Jiuyuan, with trembling lips finally said, “This is my private matter… it has nothing to do with Your Excellency!”

Ranran couldn’t bear to listen to Wei Jiu’s nonsense anymore. She pushed him aside, draped her cloak over Tu Jiuyuan, and said, “We happen to be camping here. Let the fire warm you up. Your body is too cold, be careful not to affect the fetus.”

Previous
Next

真的假的 REAL OR FAKE

After saying that, Xue Ranran quickly lit a fire and let Tu Jiuyuan rest for a while. She also heated some sugarcane juice crushed with stones for her to drink.

Tu Jiuyuan glanced at Xue Ranran but didn’t thank her. She had grown up in a rather indifferent environment. If she accepted the kindness of others, she wouldn’t express gratitude, but she would remember it in her heart and would want to repay it as soon as possible, so as not to owe anyone.

Wei Jiu, on the other hand, watched on coldly, clearly neglecting Tu Jiuyuan who had just survived a disaster.

Actually, he knew in his heart that apart from himself, Tu Jiuyuan had no other man, and judging by the months, it couldn’t be the child of that fake. But she dared to secretly carry his child, which was already an unforgivable offense.

The Dragon youth beside the Dragon goddess, observing the situation with dissatisfaction, grunted. Xue Ranran couldn’t understand, so the Dragon goddess translated for him, “He said there are too many damned men here, he really wants to eat one up…”

Hearing this, Wei Jiu and the Medicine Immortal both glared at the boy, unsure of whom he was cursing.

The dragon youth silently tucked his head into the Dragon goddess’s arms, habitually arching for her to touch his little dragon horns.

This affectionate act made the Medicine Master Immortal feel rather sour.

But the situation was critical, and they didn’t have much time to dwell on the love and hatred between men and women.

Perhaps due to the excessive force used in resisting the Heavenly calamity earlier, the protective shield seemed to have less vigor than before. The Dragon Island guardian god transformed into a dragon again, and with a flick of her tail, she broke a corner of the shield, creating a gap.

As they entered, they encountered no resistance from the followers of the Fantian Sect. The mountain path was empty, with birds and beasts fleeing through the gap in the shield. The entire mountain seemed as deserted as its name suggested.

In this way, they arrived smoothly near the Spirit Tower.

Upon reaching the tower, they realized why they had encountered no obstacles along the way. It seemed that the tower had been almost completed, and the followers of the Fantian Sect couldn’t control themselves, committing suicide one after another, their blood splashing into the ditch at their feet and forming a small river absorbed by the Spirit Tower.

Mu Ranwu was among them, uncontrollably drawing out her sword as well.

Her spiritual power far exceeded that of the other followers. Combined with witnessing the fate of those followers, her face was now ashen with fear, as she struggled to control her power and tried to release the sword in her hand.

But that power was too strong. She couldn’t control her hand at all. Just then, she saw Xue Ranran and the others rushing over and immediately screamed in panic, “Elder sister, hurry! Save me!”

Xue Ranran was truly disgusted by that “elder sister” term. But she also knew that she must not let the Spirit Tower complete its blood sacrifice, so she controlled her short sword and aimed for Mu Ranwu’s wrist, trying to knock the sword out of her hand.

Mu Ranwu was exhausted at this point and couldn’t control her wrist anymore. Her sword, after deflecting the short blade, stabbed straight towards her own throat.

At this critical moment, Ranran’s other four short swords swiftly attacked.

Her skill in controlling the swords had become even more proficient, allowing her to simultaneously control five short blades at will. As the five blades swiftly attacked, they barely managed to block the sword aimed at Mu Ranwu’s throat.

In the gap where the sword was blocked, Su Yi Shui swung his hand and deflected the sword.

Mu Ranwu, still unable to control herself, picked up another sword discarded by another follower and continued to try to cut her throat. By now, tears were streaming down her face. “Sister, please save me! I don’t want to die yet!”

Xue Ranran rushed up and used her mechanism staff to once again knock the sword out of Mu Ranwu’s hand.

As the sky grew darker, the Medicine Immortal raised true fire into the sky, illuminating the surroundings of the dark tower.

When the fire flickered, Xue Ranran noticed that Mu Ranwu’s eyes, which were close to her, had a moment where their pupils turned into thin lines like snake eyes, giving off an indescribable eerie feeling.

Although her pupils quickly returned to normal after being illuminated by the fire, this momentary change was enough to alert Xue Ranran.

Sure enough, just as Ranran leaned closer, Mu Ranwu’s sword suddenly reversed and stabbed directly at her.

Although Xue Ranran was wary now, it was still too late to dodge. She thought of the soft silver armor made for her by Zeng Yi and could only mobilize her true vitality to resist this sword.

But the sword in Mu Ranwu’s hand seemed to be very unusual. When it stabbed straight at her, it carried a sharp evil energy that could split mountains and stones, pierced through her protective true vitality, and stabbed straight at Xue Ranran’s chest.

Just as she thought she couldn’t dodge this sword, a hand suddenly extended from a diagonal direction, with two fingers holding the sword body, and true qi flowed along the fingers, making the sword emit a clang sound.

Mu Ranwu looked up and saw that Su Yi Shui had arrived in time and caught the sword for Xue Ranran.

However, Mu Ranwu was not alarmed. She smirked maliciously and gently flipped her wrist holding the sword. Suddenly, more than a dozen long needles shot out from the handle of the sword, once again aiming at Xue Ranran.

This time, it was too fast. Although Su Yi Shui used true energy to send out a shockwave in time, one of the long needles still pierced through the true qi and stabbed directly at Xue Ranran’s chest.

Although she had the soft silver armor protecting her, the needle tip still pierced through Ranran’s skin.

In that instant, Ranran felt a fiery pain and immediately realized – this needle was contaminated, it seemed to have some kind of poison!

At this moment, Su Yi Shui had already reversed his sword and pierced through Mu Ranwu’s heart.

Only to see Mu Ranwu’s body quickly turning into green smoke, leaving behind only a grinning skull…

This “Mu Ranwu” was obviously fake, a creation of the nine-headed snake, which is why her eyes had a momentary snake-like change when facing the light.

Although the fake immediately perished, a green smoke started to rise from Xue Ranran’s head.

Wei Jiu and Tu Jiuyuan have experienced this. Seeing this situation, their faces changed, and they shouted together, “Not good! She’s been poisoned by the nine-headed python venom!”

Before they finished speaking, the green smoke condensed and indeed transformed into another Xue Ranran, identical in appearance and clothing, without any difference.

As soon as the fake formed, she suddenly turned and leaped towards the nearby bushes, disappearing without a trace.

Xue Ranran was fed a poison-clearing pill by Su Yi Shui, finally easing the pain from the snake venom.

At this moment, the ditch surrounding the Spirit Tower was flowing with thick black blood. After absorbing this blood, the Spirit Tower seemed to start breathing, as if it were a human body, undulating and wriggling.

However, these blood sacrifices were obviously just appetizers, not enough to activate the Spirit Tower.

Now Xue Ranran was more worried about why the Fantian Sect had gone to such lengths to create a shadow of herself?

Just then, the Medicine Immortal looked towards the top of the tower, his face suddenly changing, and he whispered, “The Demon King…”

Everyone looked up and saw a shiny golden skull at the top of the tower.

Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui immediately recognized it as the skull of the Demon King that had been stolen from the secret cave in the Red Flame Mountain.

This skull had not been refined all this time, gathering the resentment of the Demon King. Now it was placed high on the tower, its purpose unknown.

Xue Ranran shouted, “Elder Duntian, please come out and talk!”

But her voice echoed in the empty mountains, with no response.

The bone tower was steeped with the blood of the Green dragon, a blatant provocation to the guardian god of the dragons. Therefore, the goddess couldn’t hold back anymore and transformed into a golden dragon again, accumulating true energy and fiercely attacking the tower.

Ranran immediately shouted, “Stop!”

The golden dragon charged too fast and didn’t listen to her. Just as its tail was about to sweep the tower, the black bone tower actually emitted a roar similar to a wild beast. Many sharp bone spurs suddenly appeared on its sticky and wriggling surface. These spurs could penetrate even the tough dragon scales, piercing through the golden dragon’s tail.

These bone spurs acted like mosquito proboscises, greedily sucking the dragon’s blood once they pierced through.

Dragon blood was the source of a dragon’s spiritual power. Once drained, their strength would greatly diminish. So the guardian goddess immediately let out a painful groan and quickly retreated, trying to shake off the bone tower.

However, the adhesive force of these bone spurs was extremely strong, firmly hooking onto the golden dragon.

At this moment, the Medicine Immortal and the Dragon youth were both alarmed and rushed over together.

The Dragon youth flipped his body, transforming into a dragon shimmering with flowing light, and used his dragon claws to pull the golden dragon, while the Medicine Immortal drew out a sharp blade and hacked at the adhered bone spurs.

With their combined effort, they finally rescued the guardian goddess.

When the golden dragon transformed back into human form and fell down exhausted, Ranran noticed that the bone spurs were embedded with barbs and were stuck in her flesh.

“No, this tower is alive, frantically absorbing the flesh and blood of nearby spirits. We have no way to overturn it!”

The goddess endured the severe pain and said in a low voice. No wonder the immortals of the heavenly realm made such a ruthless decision. Only by overturning the tower by leveling the lands and burying it deep in the abyss could they deal with it. They should have long anticipated that this tower would be difficult to approach, and both humans and gods were powerless against it!

Wei Jiu gritted his teeth, “What should we do? Will my years of foundation have to be buried along with Dun Tian’s Spirit Tower?”

All his foundation was in the Red Flame Mountain. If they couldn’t overturn the Spirit Tower, it meant that his many years of effort would be ruined. Moreover, the Spirit Towers chose locations with concentrated spiritual energy.

After the earth-leveling catastrophe, it would be difficult to find a suitable place for cultivation. When his spiritual energy is finally depleted, perhaps he would gradually age, fall ill and die like an ordinary mortal, achieving nothing but turning into dust.

Just then, the voice of Dun Tian echoed in the vast darkness, “If I don’t let you try, how would you know your own capabilities? This bone tower not only has the flesh and blood of the Green dragon but also boosted by the spiritual essence of the Demon King. It has become a tower with both form and spirit. You are no match for it, so don’t dream of ants shaking the tree…”

Su Yi Shui looked around and loudly said, “The Heavenly realm will not allow you to go against the heavens. Instead of involving countless innocent lives, why not stop now!”

In the dark night, there came a melancholic laughter, “I just want to retrieve my most precious thing, but there are so many people trying to stop me. To become an immortal, one must undergo countless trials, sacrifice their most precious things. But what about after becoming an immortal? The Heavenly realm decides to overturn the world to destroy the spirit towers, and kill so many lives just by using a light phrase like ‘it’s the will of Heaven’?”

Su Yi Shui said coldly, “When you decided to sacrifice your wife and child, it was your own choice! Since you made the decision, why regret it now?”

Duntian stopped laughing, his voice filled with an intense coldness. “And you? When you watched Mu Qingge’s soul scatter, powerless to do anything, didn’t you regret it? Didn’t you want to kill everyone on the righteous path present there for her sake? Didn’t you want to break through heaven and earth, pulling her back from the underworld?”

Su Yi Shui remained silent, but what Duntian said was indeed his state of mind twenty years ago when he witnessed that tragic scene.

Although he had never met Duntian, this powerful being who fell into darkness could accurately express his thoughts from back then. Was it pure coincidence, or…

At this moment, however, Ranran spoke with unwavering conviction, “He won’t!”

“Oh? Why are you so sure? Do you really understand this man? He’s like that Demon King, both chosen demonic sons of destiny, destined to plunge the world into chaos and suffering!”

Facing Duntian’s questioning, Ranran spoke earnestly, “He won’t, because he knows that if he did those things, I wouldn’t live happily, and I wouldn’t want to continue living this way. Isn’t the reality proof enough? He didn’t do anything as insane as you did because of my death.”

Seemingly persuaded by her words, Duntian fell silent for a long while before saying, “Go now. This tower is about to activate, and everything in the world will be reset. I hope you don’t make choices you’ll regret…”

After saying this, a strong gust of wind swept through, lifting several people up and blowing them straight down the mountain.

In this sudden gust of wind, they were scattered.

When they have stabilized, they found themselves at the foot of the mountain.

Tu Jiuyuan’s body had been weak for a while, compounded by severe morning sickness recently, causing her footing to be unsteady, almost crashing into a tree just now.

Fortunately, Wei Jiu grabbed her arm, and steadied her.

“Be careful…” Wei Jiu said.

Upon hearing this, Tu Jiuyuan couldn’t help but look at him, her eyes seemingly trembling with something. But Wei Jiu’s next words shattered her heart: “When this matter is settled, find a reliable clinic and abort the child… Once you give birth to a mortal, you’ll have no chance of ascending to heaven!”

Tu Jiuyuan took a sharp breath, silently withdrew her arm, and lowered her eyes. “The child in my belly… has nothing to do with Your Excellency. I will take good care of it. Please don’t worry Excellency…”

Wei Jiu was accustomed to Tu Jiuyuan’s absolute obedience. Now, hearing her veiled words, he was immediately enraged. However, before he could glare, Tu Jiuyuan clutched her stomach and collapsed weakly, appearing exhausted.

With Wei Jiu’s temperament, facing insubordination from subordinates, there was never much talk, only decisive action. But now, looking at Tu Jiuyuan’s pale face, he recalled the strange sensation when he thought Tu Jiuyuan had died in the inn…

And so he stilled his whip that was about to strike out. He thought: once this matter is settled, he could settle the score with her slowly.

At this moment, other people blown down from the mountain also steadied themselves.

The Dragon goddess’s injury from the bone tower’s barbs continued to bleed, which would incur the loss of divine power. It needed to be stopped immediately.

The Medicine Immortal was anxious and tried to remove the bone spines for her healing. However, the goddess evaded, coldly saying, “No need, Ranran will help to treat me.”

Su Yi Shui from Xishan had excellent medical skills, and Xue Ranran, as his beloved disciple, naturally learned a bit. She even carried medicinal ointments for stopping bleeding.

So Ranran immediately took out the medicine bag from her bosom and used the tweezers inside to remove the bone spines for the Guardian.

The Medicine Immortal felt a chill after hitting this cold wall. At this moment, he somewhat understood Duntian’s feelings. The desire to turn back time, to correct mistakes, was indeed agonizing.

But now, Fengmou refused to forgive him, so he could only stand silently aside, watching Ranran skillfully remove the bone spines and apply the ointment to stop the bleeding for Fengmou…

The night grew darker, approaching midnight, with only the True Fire from the Medicine Immortal illuminating them. The oppressive force from above grew stronger, making it hard to breathe.

They knew that if they didn’t figure out a way to topple the Heaven-Defying Tower, they would have to retreat.

The Divine Punishment would arrive as scheduled at midnight tomorrow, and within the Four Peaks, there wouldn’t be a single piece of intact land. Whether mortal or divine, if they stayed here, they would be dragged into the abyss below, with no chance of escape.

At this moment, Gao Cang, Bai Baishan, as well as Wang Suizhi and Qiu Xier who had stayed at the inn, also rushed back to join them in the darkness.

According to Bai Baishan, they went to nearby government offices and villages to deliver letters, but the officials and villagers looked at them as if they were crazy.

Even if they spoke the truth earnestly, no one believed them. There was even a villager who was particularly aggressive, using farming tools to drive them out of the village.

“Now, we can only hope your letter to the Emperor arrives in time. But the Emperor is far away. Even if Su Yu believed this, he probably wouldn’t have time to evacuate so many people…” Bai Baishan’s shoes were worn with holes, he relayed these words with frustration as he took them off.

When Qiu Xier saw Tu Jiuyuan, she couldn’t help but cried out in fright.

It couldn’t be helped, when she was back at the inn, she had been frightened by the fake Tu Jiuyuan. Now, seeing her again, she couldn’t help but doubt her authenticity.

At this moment, faint sounds of drums came from a distance, marking midnight.

So Gao Cang said, “Junior sister, don’t be afraid. I’ll verify the truth for you!”

Saying that, he lifted the torch brought along to illuminate and came to Tu Jiuyuan.

Although this Elder from the Crimson Gate was weak physically, her aura remained undiminished. She glared coldly at Gao Cang.

Her expression resembled a dead demonic snake, but her shadow was glaringly visible, very real.

Obviously, this Tu Jiuyuan who had escaped from death was genuine.

Gao Cang looked and said to Qiu Xier, “Junior Sister, don’t be afraid. This Tu Jiuyuan has a shadow!”

Since it was midnight, Gao Cang enthusiastically lifted the torch again to shine it on the others.

Originally it was just out of boredom, trying to find amusement in hardship, but his smile froze suddenly when he shone the light on one of them.

That person… had no shadow beneath their feet!

Gao Cang stiffened his neck, slowly raised his head, and holding the torch, he stared at this person’s face, cold sweat beading on his forehead…

The person’s smile was as sweet as ever, “Senior brother, what’s wrong with you? You look like you’ve seen a ghost?”

Xue Ranran was staring innocently with her big eyes, speaking cheerfully to Gao Cang.

Gao Cang’s chin dripped with cold sweat, and his gaze moved back to Xue Ranran’s feet—indeed, there was nothing, no shadow!

“Ah… she… she’s not Ranran!” Accompanied by Gao Cang’s cry of horror, everyone’s gaze also focused on Xue Ranran.

Xue Ranran herself also looked down, then lifted her head in confusion, “Strange… where did my shadow go?”

Just then, a clear voice came from the nearby bushes, “Shifu! Be careful, there’s a snake demon impersonating me!”

With those words, another Xue Ranran gasping for breath emerged from the bushes.

Gao Cang shouted, “Stay back!” Then, he raised the torch and shone it at the feet of the newcomer —a clear shadow appeared.

It seemed that this newcomer was the real one. They had just been blown down the mountain by Duntian’s evil wind, and everything had been chaotic.

Perhaps this imposter took advantage of the chaos to slip into their midst.

Fortunately, Gao Cang used the torch to check everyone on a whim, otherwise, who knew what this imposter might have got up to!

Just then, the imposter seemed unwilling to give up, urgently saying, “What’s going on? I am the real Xue Ranran! My… where did my shadow go? Shifu! You have to believe that I’m the real one!”

Saying that, she rushed towards Su Yi Shui urgently.
