But Su Yi Shui drew his sword, pressing it against her throat in time, “Don’t move!”

The real Xue Ranran looked at the imposter with disgust, shouting loudly, “Shifu, this must be the imposter that appeared after I was poisoned earlier. Quick! Cut off her head to prevent her from causing more trouble!”

The imposter seemed furious, her face turning red, “You shut up! You’re the fake one!”

Su Yi Shui seemed too lazy to continue this farce, and with a twist of his wrist, he aimed his sword straight at the imposter’s neck.

However, the imposter seemed to perfectly mimic Xue Ranran’s skills, bouncing and evading fluidly, not falling behind at all. It seemed that killing her wouldn’t be easy.

Seeing this, Xue Ranran immediately drew her own mechanical staff, joining Su Yi Shui in battling the imposter.

Once she joined the fray, the imposter’s disadvantage became evident. In just a few rounds, her mechanical staff was knocked out of her hand. Xue Ranran swiftly shook her staff, knocking the imposter onto Su Yi Shui’s sword.

In the flickering torchlight, the sword pierced through the imposter’s chest, crimson blood immediately dripping down the tip of the sword, staining her pristine white clothes.

Previous
Next

一页天书 A Page from Heaven’s Book

“Shifu… I… I’m real!” After choking out these words, the imposter collapsed, limply falling to the ground.

But strangely, this time the imposter’s limbs didn’t immediately turn into green smoke like the previous ones did. Instead, she laid motionless on the ground.

Xue Ranran was suspicious that she hadn’t died, so she bent down cautiously to check for breath and a pulse—there was no movement at all. It seemed like she was quite dead!

Su Yi Shui also looked uncertainly at the red blood dripping off his sword, then shifted his gaze to the body lying on the ground…

Just then, Xue Ranran burst into laughter, “Surprised? Wondering why this imposter didn’t turn into green smoke?”

Su Yi Shui slowly shifted his gaze to her. At this moment, the dark clouds in the sky dispersed slightly, and the moonlight spilled onto the earth. However, Xue Ranran’s shadow under the moonlight gradually disappeared.

Meanwhile, a blurry shadow appeared under the fallen imposter…

Now, everyone was dumbfounded, unable to immediately understand what had happened.

Just then, from the distant town, the sound of drums rang out again, once, twice—clear drumbeats echoed, informing everyone that it was still midnight…

Why did the drums announce midnight again?

Everyone’s expressions changed slightly, and they looked at each other in confusion.

The Medicine Immortal raised his head vigilantly to look around, only to find that where the moonlight reached, the surroundings seemed to distort slightly, like ripples spreading out. But in an instant, everything returned to normal.

He understood… the fierce wind just now was all an illusion! Duntian used the flying sand and rocks as cover, blowing them down the mountain, then set up a twisted mirror illusion for them!

The drumbeats from the village just now were obviously fake, so they hadn’t actually reached midnight!

In this illusion, whether people had shadows or what appearance they showed was completely controlled by the illusion’s master, Duntian!

Over these days, the constant appearance of imposters in front of the Xishan disciples reinforced the importance of using shadows to distinguish between real and fake.

This made the Xishan disciples develop a habit—no shadow meant it must be fake!

Relying on this point, Duntian cleverly manipulated things, hiding the real Xue Ranran’s shadow and giving the imposter a shadow, then using Su Yi Shui’s sword to kill the real girl..

Hearing the Medicine Immortal’s explanation, Qiu Xier screamed in despair, falling onto her junior sister in a pool of blood, frantically stuffing a pill into her mouth, “Junior sister, you have to hold on, wake up, wake up quickly!”

Wang Suizhi was in tears, crawling towards his master on all limbs.

Meanwhile, Su Yi Shui let go of his sword, which clattered to the ground, and ran over like a madman, pushing away the people who were crying and trying to reach her, tightly embracing the girl covered in blood in his arms.

However, Xue Ranran, with her eyes tightly shut, could no longer suddenly open them as before, playfully smiling at him…

Seeing the fake laughing arrogantly, Gao Cang and Bai Baishan were filled with grief and anger. After being forcefully pushed away by their master, they roared and pounced towards the fake.

The power of anger was exceptionally strong, and Gao Cang’s fierce slash immediately chopped off the fake’s head.

The limbs of the fake immediately turned into green smoke and dissipated in the wind, leaving only the head, still sporting a proud smile…

The people who have gathered here all had differences, different allegiances, but the only thing they had in common was their varying degrees of fondness for the young girl Xue Ranran.

So when they saw Ranran die, the grief of the disciples of Xishan went without saying. Even Dragon Island’s goddess and the young dragon, as well as Wen Chun Hui, showed a sorrowful expression on their faces. The Medicine Immortal, as a friend of Mu Qingge, felt unspeakable regret. Even Wei Jiu and Tu Jiu Yuan felt embittered.

Especially Tu Jiu Yuan, who had always been grateful for Ranran’s repeated help, and had complicated feelings towards Ranran. She never expected she wouldn’t be able to repay the favor owed to Ranran now…

Just then, the deep voice of Duntian came from the sky again: “How is it? How does it feel to kill your loved one with your own hands?”

Su Yi Shui slowly raised his head, his eyes seemingly possessed by something, now bloodshot and his forehead showing the runes of the Netherworld Realm’s spiritual spring again. He emphasized every word “Why did you plot against us like this?”

Duntian laughed desolately, “You couldn’t understand why I built the Heaven-Defying Tower right? Fate is cruel, the heavens are unfair. Clearly, it’s the thing you cherish most, but you can only watch it slip away before your eyes… How can anyone know this feeling without experiencing it? Xue Ranran was the fruit born on the Tree of Reincarnation. Her soul is inherently unstable. Even if you want to use the Tree of Reincarnation again, it’s useless. For her to live again, there’s only one way! That is for you to willingly become the blood sacrifice! Stand before the Eternal Tower, dig out your heart and sacrifice it to the tower! Then, maybe when time reverses, you’ll have a chance to save your beloved…”

The Medicine Immortal’s face changed instantly upon hearing this.

He finally understood Duntian’s purpose behind all these scheming!

While the Spirit Tower could reverse time and space, Duntian’s body had already decayed from demonic corruption. He wanted to return to the past with his current memories to make up for various regrets, but he needed a brand-new body. So he went to great lengths to obtain the unrefined bones of the Demon King which still retained his spirit, and then let Su Yi Shui, the demon’s son, voluntarily sacrifice himself, and dig out his heart to exchange for the Spirit Tower to become a living tower. While reversing time, he would also obtain his own rebirth.

With the heart and soul of two demon lords, Duntian could also gain a larger force to control the Tower to reverse time and return to the moment of his lifelong regret, to make a different choice.

Thinking of this, The Medicine Immortal hurriedly shouted to Su Yi Shui, “Don’t listen to Duntian’s madness. If you die, how can you save your loved one?”

Su Yi Shui had been keeped his head bowed all this time. When he raised his head again, tears of blood dripped down his eyes, his tone sounded unusually calm, “It doesn’t matter if I die, but she will live again, won’t she?”

Su Yi Shui’s tone was too calm, and if it weren’t for the tears of blood that made people feel uneasy, it would have made people suspicious that he wasn’t that sorrowful.

This was the numbness that only extremely grieving people could display.

Everyone in Xishan knew how deeply Su Yi Shui loved Ranran, and especially this time, Su Yi Shui had killed her with his own hands, he should have been on the verge of madness from the pain. So his calm tone made people feel extremely distressed.

Now thinking about it, that Duntian was hateful and terrifying. He had been delaying his action all along, waiting for Su Yi Shui to remove the effects of the Soul-Cleansing Talisman before he took action. His fear being that Su Yi Shui’s love was not enough and it would be difficult to achieve the kind of pain, to regain something precious he lost, and destroy that which he had regained once more.

Only by using the heart of such a pained person as a sacrifice could enough grieve and resentment be generated to support the power of the tower to reverse fate…

Just then, Su Yi Shui finally slowly let go of Ranran, gently placing her on a soft grassy area, then covering her body with a cloak. He suddenly stood up and walked towards the direction of the Heaven-Defying Tower.

The Medicine Immortal became very anxious and shouted loudly, “Absolutely can’t let him go to sacrifice himself at the tower, quickly! Stop him!”

Once time is reversed, chaos will ensue, and everything will change. By then, even whether Mu Qingge will be born is uncertain, let alone talking about rebirth?

But now Su Yi Shui was clearly dominated by regret, completely swayed by Duntian’s temptation, and single-mindedly wanted to reverse time to give Ranran a chance to be reborn.

Once his sacrifice succeeded, the spirit tower would become active prematurely, and the Heavenly punishment and earth calamity might also come sooner.

The Medicine Immortal dared not think further, could only shout to everyone to stop Su Yi Shui from climbing the tower, not allowing him to ascend the tower.

Before the Medicine Immortal finished speaking, everyone had already rushed up, trying to stop Su Yi Shui.

Wei Jiu took the lead, trying to use his whip to pull Su Yi Shui down, but when his whip was pulled up, it was repelled back.

It turned out that Duntian had long set up a spiritual shield behind Su Yi Shui, isolating him from everyone, allowing him to dig his heart out without distractions. Even when the Little Dragon transformed into its original form and desperately rammed into the transparent spiritual shield, it couldn’t get through.

In the end, everyone could only watch Su Yi Shui, step by step, slowly climb up the tower along the ladder of scattered bones, reaching the top of the tower.

This time, the Tower of Bones did not show any aggressive spikes, allowing Su Yi Shui to slowly ascend to the top of the high tower.

When he reached the top of the tower, he could see that the golden skull of the Demon King had already merged completely with the tower, even growing black flesh like the tower’s body, and beneath the skull was a cavity that resembled a shrine.

Just then, Duntian’s voice rang out again: “Don’t hesitate anymore, quickly perform the blood sacrifice. As long as you are willing to sacrifice, Xue Ranran will once again gain life… This is the knife I used when I killed the Demon King back then. Use it to dig out your heart…”

As he spoke, a carved dragon knife floated to Su Yi Shui’s side. Su Yi Shui, with tears of blood flowing, his eyes red, picked up the knife, and then slowly asked, “Is it only my heart that can be used for the blood sacrifice?”

Duntian said, “Do you still remember the marrow-cleansing pools on Tianmai Mountain? I left those pools back then, the real purpose was to select the person who could offer a blood sacrifice to the living tower. Choosing the Black Pool means voluntarily severing love and affection. Those who are willing to sever emotions, when they fall in love, they fall even harder than those who are easily sentimental! Over these years, many people have come and gone at that pool, but only you are the most suitable! Unfortunately, Mu Qingge disrupted everything back then, causing my plan to almost deviate… Don’t hesitate anymore, once you miss this chance, Xue Ranran will truly be beyond saving. From now forth, there will never be such a clear and pure woman between heaven and earth.”

This last sentence indeed moved the man with tears of blood slightly. Su Yi Shui closed his eyes, his chest heaving violently, then suddenly raised the knife high and fiercely stabbed towards his own chest.

“No! Master!”

“Master! Don’t!”

At this moment, at the foot of the mountain, the disciples of Xishan were already in an uproar. Everyone was crying and desperately trying to stop Su Yi Shui.

But that sharp blow still fell fiercely… on the golden skull of the Demon King on the top of the tower!

The knife Duntian used was the one used by *Huangdi to kill the monster Kui back then, a holy knife blessed by the ancient sage to ward off evil. When this knife fell, the hard golden skull instantly shattered. The jaw of the skull made a cracking sound, as if emitting a painful howl, shaking the clouds in the sky.
*Classics of Mountains and Seas

And Duntian let out a thunderous angry roar, “Damn it! NO!”

With his roar, the bone ladder under Su Yi Shui’s feet instantly collapsed, and thorns of defense grew again on the bone tower.

Unfortunately, as the skull of the Demon King, the soul of the tower, had already shattered, the crucial point of the tower had been struck. The black flesh covering the entire tower rapidly shriveled and dried up, revealing the original skeleton.

The towering bone tower that reached the heavens, instantly became unstable and shaky.

At this moment, Duntian finally revealed his true form, standing in mid-air, half of his face rotted and twisted, he roared in anger, “How dare you? Do you even know what you’ve done! You’ve destroyed the only chance for your beloved to be reborn!”

“Didn’t my Shifu tell you from the beginning! His choice will never be like yours! Because he knows, I will never be willing to trample on the flesh and blood of others for a chance to survive!”

When everyone heard this clear voice, they turned their heads in astonishment, only to find that Xue Ranran, who had already stopped breathing and in a pool of blood, was… standing spiritedly behind them.

It’s just that her chest was still oozing red blood, looking extremely eerie!

Qiu Xier’s nerves was a bit lacking, suddenly seeing her junior sister coming back to life like a zombie, before she could think to be happy, she had rolled her eyes and fainted. Fortunately, Gao Cang caught her in time.

But Gao Cang also screamed together with second junior brother, and the three disciples held each other tightly.

Duntian couldn’t believe that Xue Ranran had actually come back to life. His eyes widened slowly, “How is this possible! You clearly died!”

After Xue Ranran was stabbed, the hidden Duntian, had already controlled the fake Ranran and confirmed for himself that she had no breath.

And Duntian didn’t need to get close to sense clearly that the motionless body had no signs of life anymore, and she had shed so much blood, which couldn’t be faked!

Xue Ranran sighed as she looked at her timid fellow disciples, then patted the dust off her body and with a rather obscene action, reached into her bosom… to take out a leather water bag.

The “blood” she had just oozed was actually from the leather bag.

“My cheeks are so tired from chewing to get this bag of red sugarcane juice! How is it? The bright red color can easily deceive, right? Hey, don’t stare at me with big eyes, I’m a person, not a ghost!”

It turns out that the “blood” from her was actually the juice of red sugarcane that she had been chewing all this while. Seeing Ranran playfully rubbing her cheeks, Qiu Xier, who had just come to, laughed as she cried, couldn’t help but wonder, “Ranran… when I touched you just now, and there was no pulse! Am… am I dreaming?”

After saying that, Qiu Xier pinched Gao Cang’s thigh hard, making big senior brother scream in pain, repeatedly shouting that he wasn’t dreaming.

Ranran gave her a playful glance, then took out the talisman stuck to her chest and raised it, saying, “This is Elder Jiu’s new creation, a sudden death talisman that can completely feign death. Although its effect only lasts for thirty minutes, it’s enough for a performance.”

When Elder Jiu drew this talisman for her, he solemnly told her that he had created it in order to escape from the Crimson Gate sect. But the wine they brought him was too good, he couldn’t bear to feign death, so he didn’t use it.

As he gifted this talisman to his little friend, it was to advise her not to be too stubborn. If she were to encounter a formidable enemy, it wouldn’t hurt to use the talisman to fake death and bide some time.

Unexpectedly, this seemingly useless thing was put to use at this moment.

As for the sword that pierced through her heart, it relied on Su Yi Shui’s skills. His sword was a soft sword crafted by Zeng Yi. As long as he used his ingenuity, he could puncture the water bag hidden in her clothes, bypass Ranran’s body, and let the blade exit from behind.

In essence, it was a magic trick from the streets!

Of course, Su Yi Shui’s horrifying blood tears, were also just red sugarcane juice. At this late hour, looking horrifying enough could cover up Su Yi Shui’s somewhat lacking acting skills.

For a man who always had no expression, portraying the wretched sorrow of losing a loved one was quite difficult. Luckily, with sugarcane juice to back him up, he wouldn’t falter!

Still not believing it, Duntian said coldly, ‘Impossible! When did you figure out my plan?’

Ranran threw the bag containing sugarcane juice on the ground, then took out a handkerchief to wipe off the bright red sugarcane juice from her clothes, determined to thoroughly explain and dispel Duntian’s doubts.

“Actually, I’ve been wondering all along, why did you send the fake Tu Jiuyuan and Wei Jiu to our doorstep that day? If it was just to capture us alive, you didn’t seem very urgent about it. So what was the purpose of this move to alert us? It wasn’t until I saw this…”

With that, she took out a small box from her sleeve, which was the one she retrieved from Dragon Island.

After the lightning bolt from the Heavenly calamity opened the box, Ranran and Su Yi Shui looked at what was inside the box together while they were sheltering from the rain under the tree.

At that time, Wei Jiu thought they were engaging in some romantic action and kept grumbling.

Inside the box was actually a page of “paper.” It looked like paper but was not quite, with the words on it appearing and disappearing, as if they were constantly changing.

And when they looked at it, the paper displayed one shocking line of words: “In the sixth month of the Yi Kun year, at three-quarters past the hour of Hai, Su Yi Shui kills Xue Ranran...”

When they saw these words, they naturally exchanged surprised glances. But just then, the words on the paper blurred again, and then it read, “The Heavenly mandate revealed, the world awaits its fate...”

Su Yi Shui immediately understood that this “paper” should be a page torn from the Heavenly Book by Mu Qingge years ago.

Mu Qingge had violated the celestial rules, peeked at the Heavenly Book, and saw Su Yi Shui’s destiny. That’s why later on, she boldly changed his fate chart and used her own life to give Su Yi Shui a chance to escape the fate of the demonic path.

However, for some unknown reason, she hid this page on Dragon Island back then. It wasn’t until Su Yi Shui and Ranran retrieved it that this paper saw the light of day again.

As for the recent sentence, it was obviously about something that was going to happen. Unfortunately, Su Yishui and Ranran had already seen it, so “the world awaits its fate” indicating there could still be changes!

Using just this one leaked line of information, the clever Ranran immediately worked out a plan with Su Yi Shui.

Even though they didn’t fully understand what would happen, when Ranran was poisoned by the snake venom, and they exchanged glances, they immediately understood why Duntian had sent those two fakes to the inn.

Perhaps he wanted to use the fake Ranran to create confusion and cause some trouble.

So everything that followed went smoothly. The two of them didn’t even need to rehearse. They cooperated calmly and orchestrated everything.

Su Yi Shui was actually a bit confused at the time and couldn’t tell the real Ranran from the fake. But even if the Ranran at that time was a fake, he wouldn’t have killed her.

When he manipulated his sword and saw Ranran acting according to plan, he immediately discerned the truth, and everything fell into place as they took up their different roles!

The Bone Tower was too powerful. Without playing some tricks to lower Duntian’s guard, they could never approach it. So this master-disciple duo came up with this plan, and it worked. They managed to smash the crucial part of the Spirit Tower.

Just then, as the Bone Tower kept loosening and collapsing, making thunderous noises, Duntian, after hearing Ranran’s explanation, felt immense disappointment and anger surge within him.

The opportunity he had waited countless years for was shattered, enough to ruin the mind of this person who had once been celestial but turned demonic.

He gave a loud roared was he swung his sword towards Su Yi Shui.

With the collapse of the Bone Tower, the Heavenly punishment also automatically ceased. The originally heavy atmosphere gradually dissipated, and the abilities of the Medicine Immortal and Dragon Island’s goddess could be fully exerted.

So when Duntian rushed over, the two divine beings also flew to Su Yi Shui’s side to help him withstand Duntian’s divine attacks.

But Su Yi Shui gave a wave of his hand and said, “There’s no need for you two to assist. Its better if I settle this matter with him on my own.”

After hearing this, the Medicine Immortal looked at Su Yi Shui somewhat incredulously. Even if his talent was very high, he was still just a mortal. How could he contend with Duntian, who had once been celestial and now turned demonic?

Su Yi Shui had fought against Duntian before, so he should know how formidable Duntian’s abilities were. Moreover, with the collapse of the Bone Tower and Duntian’s increased fury, Su Yi Shui’s decision to face Duntian alone seemed like a joke no matter how you looked at it.

Wei Jiu, who now had hope of recapturing Red Flame Mountain, seeing that Su Yishui had asked the two divine beings to stand down, suddenly became spirited and nervously shouted, “This is not the time to be stubborn! Defeating Duntian is tied to the safety of the world, and there’s no room for error!”

For this righteous statement, to actually came from the mouth of the devil Wei Jiu, was quite shocking.

But Su Yi Shui seemed resolute, and would not change his mind. After asking the two divine beings to step back, he walked forward alone to confront Duntian.

The disparity in strength between the two sides was too great.

The next moment, Su Yi Shui was heavily thrown to the ground by Duntian’s overwhelming force.

Seeing his master being beaten so severely, the disciples from Xishan couldn’t help but gasp in fear. Gao Cang asked anxiously, “Junior sister, should we just watch our master being beaten without helping him?”

Ranran couldn’t bear to see Su Yi Shui being beaten, so she simply lowered her head and looked at the “paper” in her hand.

At this moment, another line of words appeared on the paper – “In the sixth month of the Yi Kun year, at four-quarters past the hour of Zi, Su Yi Shui alone kills Duntian…”

The hour was just a little off, and Su Yi Shui was indeed facing Duntian alone. But how could he kill Duntian, Ranran couldn’t figure it out.

Could there be a mistake in this page of the Heavenly Book? Or was there some lack of knowledge, and accidentally, the beginning and end of this sentence were incorrectly placed, and it actually meant “Duntian alone kills Su Yishui”?

Previous
Next

两败俱伤 NOBODY WINS

Ranran couldn’t be blamed for having doubts, there are indeed no signs of Su Yi Shui gaining any advantage.

The sage said: ‘*Believe nothing unless it agrees with your own reason and common sense.’
*尽信书，不如无书 : 提醒人们在读书的同时要学会独立思考

When Su Yi Shui was once again brutally thrown to the ground, Ranran couldn’t remain calm anymore. She drew her mechanism stick and wanted to jump up to fight alongside Su Yi Shui.

But just then, Duntian suddenly spoke, ‘Hand over that page of the Heavenly Book to me, and I can spare his life!’

This was directed at Ranran. At this moment, after Duntian had beaten Su Yi Shui to vent his fury, his anger seemed to subside slightly, allowing him to think clearly.

His obsession for such a long time, how could he give up on it just because the Bone Tower collapsed? So after his anger subsided, he immediately started thinking about how to remedy the situation.


Ranran knew that if this page of the Heavenly Book fell into Duntian’s hands, it would cause a huge disaster.

At this moment, Duntian sneered, “Back then, Mu Qingge had such audacity, peeking at the Heavenly Book and then hiding a page… But do you know the consequences of peeking at heavenly mandate? Why were those mobs from the three major sects able to obliterate Mu Qingge? It was merely the divine realm punishing the audacious thief through the hands of the three major sects! Now, you did not learn your lesson and still peeping at the Heavenly Book. Aren’t you afraid that divine retribution will strike you again?”

Ranran nodded in agreement “You make a valid point…” With that, she suddenly ignited real fire to burn the page.

Actually, even if Duntian hadn’t spoken, Ranran knew that possessing this page from the Heavenly Book wasn’t a good thing. Otherwise, twenty years ago, she wouldn’t have hurriedly placed it on the Dragon Island before things went awry.

Now that Duntian wanted to snatch the page from the Heavenly Book, it was better to burn it to avoid further complications…

But just as the real fire touched the page, a hand suddenly reached out from behind Ranran to grab it.

Ranran quickly stepped aside, narrowly avoiding the attack, only to find that the person trying to snatch the page was Wei Jiu!

Wei Jiu smiled, “Such a precious thing, how can we just burn it? Do you know what it means to possess it?”

To possess the page from the Heavenly Book meant having insight into divine secrets, to be ahead of the heavens! Wei Jiu naturally wouldn’t let Ranran destroy such a precious item. He even wanted to snatch it for himself.

The Dragon Youth was the first to rush forward, using his divine dragon’s tail to sweep Wei Jiu aside.

Ranran coldly said, “Wei Jiu, must you cause more trouble at this time?”

Before Wei Jiu could respond, a strong wind rushed over, and Duntian came to snatch the page from Ranran.

Seeing Duntian attacking Ranran, Su Yi Shui immediately rushed forward with his raised sword and shouted at the same time “Protect Ranran!”

The Dragon Island goddess and the Medicine Immortal immediately set up spiritual shields to block Duntian, preventing him from reaching Ranran for the time being.

Duntian could not be bothered to deal with these people. He simply struck with deadly force, easily slashing the goddess’s arm and sent the Medicine Immortal staggering back, unable to control his breath.

There was no longer any obstacle before Duntian, and he aimed his blade directly at Ranran.

At this moment, no one was Duntian’s match. The chilling aura emanating from him almost felt like it froze people in place, making it impossible to avoid.

But just then, another figure rushed forward and blocked Duntian’s fatal blow with a sword.

This person who had rushed over without any regard for his life was none other than Su Yi shui!

However… Su Yishui now seemed like a different person altogether, his aura was no less than Duntian’s.

A faint mark appeared on his forehead again, and he easily blocked Duntian’s Huangdi Blade.

When the mark appeared on Su Yi Shui’s forehead, his entire demeanor had changed. His blood-red eyes were filled with an incomparable evil aura, and the erupting demonic power instantly pushed Duntian back.

Duntian was also stunned. Although Su Yi Shui had once been the demon’s son, he had already returned the Spirit Spring, so why did he still possess such demonic power?

And seeing Su Yi Shui effortlessly control this sudden surge of demonic power, it seemed like he was born with such power…

When Su Yi Shui reached out and unleashed another surge of demonic power, Duntian couldn’t even withstand it properly. The forces from both of them clashed violently in mid-air.

Duntian grunted, spitting out black blood from his mouth. Su Yi Shui’s previous strike had even broken through his defensive shield, hitting his heart meridian.

Duntian had once been an immortal, but later turned into a demon. However, whether it was demon or immortal, they could not be easily harmed by mere mortals.

But Su Yi Shui’s furious blow just now clearly contained divine power, far surpassing the abilities of a cultivator like him who had not been able to form a nascent soul after such a long time.

Duntian finally focused and carefully examined the runes on Su Yi Shui’s forehead. At first glance, these runes seemed similar to those of the demon’s son possessed by the Spirit Spring, but upon closer inspection, they were clearly the marks of a demon immortal!

In the celestial realm, there were countless upper, middle, and lower immortals, but demon immortals had not appeared for hundreds of years.

Immortals like Duntian, who had once been immortal but turned into a demon due to his extreme thoughts, he was just a decaying demon in terms of his body, not a demon immortal formed from a nascent soul.

“Have you… already ascended as an immortal?” Duntian’s mind raced quickly, coming to this conclusion.

Su Yi Shui said mildly “Twenty years ago, I had already ascended as a demon immortal…”

At the moment when he saw Mu Qingge’s soul scattered, his Dao had already been completed, allowing him to ascend as a demon immortal.

This was also the best ending “planned” for him by Mu Qingge.

The divine realm had intended to use him, a demon’s son, to experience tribulations for the mortal realm.

Just like King Zhou used Daji, causing chaos in the world to bear the rise and fall of the mortal realm, and ultimately dying in misery. When Mu Qingge saw the Heavenly Book back then, she was determined to sacrifice her life to change Su Yi Shui’s fate.

Her death was Su Yi Shui’s tribulation. After passing through this tribulation, he could smoothly ascend as a demon immortal.

Although Su Yi Shui publicly claimed that he had sacrificed his golden core to the Rebirth Tree for a chance at her reincarnation, in reality, he had used his own demon immortal’s nascent soul to nourish the Rebirth Tree, and captured Mu Qingge’s soul just in time.

A golden core’s consumption could be repaired and regenerated, but the damage to a nascent soul was irreparable!

In other words, he used his hard-earned Immortal status to exchange for Mu Qingge’s chance of rebirth twenty years later…

But by doing so, his nascent soul was considered ruined, and no matter how he cultivated again in the future, it was not likely to ascend again. It was no wonder that when the heads of other sects were waiting to welcome their ascension and tribulation, he was just relaxed and indifferent.

Su Yi Shui had completely forgotten about this part before, but now that he had been released from the soul-cleansing talisman, he naturally remembered everything.

He had already become a demon immortal with a half-ruined nascent soul. With it half-ruined, he couldn’t afford to consume his primordial spirit any further. Therefore, over the years, he occasionally absorbed some spiritual energy from demonic figures like Wei Jiu to replenish his vitality and completely sealed off the other half of his nascent soul.

But just now, at the moment when Duntian’s Huangdi Blade was about to touch Xue Ranran, Su Yi Shui completely released the prohibition, unlocked the other half of his nascent soul that had been dormant for a long time, so the demonic immortal runes on his forehead were fully displayed, and he engaged in a life-and-death struggle with Duntian.

Ranran looked at Su Yi Shui’s red eyes emitting an indescribable sense of danger and oppression.

At this moment, she felt that her Shifu seemed to be very, very distant from her…

The Dragon goddess’s face had always lacked many expressions of humans, but at this moment, her complexion slightly changed: “A demonic immortal… How could the Heavenly Realm tolerate him?”

Ranran, hearing this, couldn’t help but lower her head and look at the page of “paper” again. The line of words on the paper had not changed, still saying “In the sixth month of the Yi Kun Year, at the midnight hour, Su Yi Shui alone killed Duntian…”

But just as she focused on reading, behind those words, there were new words faintly emerging : “Su Yi Shui exhausts his nascent soul, perishing together with Duntian…“

Nascent soul? Su Yishui hadn’t formed his nascent soul yet, how could it be exhausted? There was no time to think about it. At the moment when she saw these words, Ranran had already leaped up and attacked Duntian again.

Based on past experience, the content on this page of the Heavenly Book could be changed. Since the Heavenly Book showed Su Yi Shui killing Duntian alone, then she would kill Duntian together with him to change the content of the Heavenly Book’s page!

As Ranran stood up, the Medicine Immortal swiftly followed. The Dragon goddess and the Dragon Youth all transformed into giant dragons, soaring towards Duntian.

“Shifu, you must not exhaust all your nascent soul energy!” Ranran warned Su Yi Shui loudly, then joined forces with the Medicine Immortal and the two dragons to engage Duntian in battle.

Tu Jiuyuan remembered owing Ranran a favor, so when she saw this situation, she was about to step forward with her sword. But Wei Jiu pulled her back: “What? Is your stomach no longer hurting?”

Tu Jiuyuan pursed her lips and said, “I don’t want to owe anyone favors…”

Wei Jiu knew this subordinate of his had grown up in Crimson Gate since childhood and was quite ruthless, but she hated owing favors the most.

Thinking of this, Wei Jiu snorted coldly, “Stay here and don’t move recklessly!”

As he spoke, he also drew out his long whip and rushed into the chaotic battle with Duntian along with others.

Soon after, Wen Chunhui and other Xishan disciples also rushed up to fight Duntian.

Although Duntian’s spiritual prowess was profound, dealing with a half-damaged demonic immortal was beyond his game plan. Add the Medicine Immortal, two dragons, Xue Ranran, and Wei Jiu, he had to expend a lot of energy.

Unfortunately, the collapse of the bone tower had destroyed much of his rationality. As he saw these people who were preventing him from reuniting with his wife and child, Duntian’s demonic nature grew stronger and stronger.

At this moment, even if he died, he would drag everyone present down with him!

Duntian, completely unleashing his madness, his hair flying wildly, the spiritual power enveloping him could crush bones and split flesh with just a burst.

Those with insufficient cultivation like Gao Cang and the others were unable to get close to them, being shaken by the residual power of these experts, falling to the ground and spitting blood.

Wei Jiu also struggled to withstand it. After just a few rounds, he was also shaken and repelled, collapsing on the ground. Xue Ranran, because she and Su Yi Shui practiced the same cultivation technique, were mutually dependent.

Since the other half of Su Yi Shui’s nascent soul was on Ranran, now that his nascent soul had awakened, it also stirred the dormant power on Ranran.

The two fought side by side, combining their strengths. With the assistance of the Medicine Immortal and the Dragon goddess, along with the Dragon Youth, they could match with Duntian.

Unfortunately, after several rounds of fierce battle, the Medicine Immortal and the two dragons were also heavily injured by Duntian.

Duntian didn’t want to linger in the fight anymore, he just wanted to snatch the page of the Heavenly Book from Ranran.

After repelling the two dragons, he seized the opportunity and launched a fierce attack straight towards Xue Ranran.

Su Yishui pulled Ranran back in time to avoid a vital hit, but that strike just happened to cut open Ranran’s clothes pouch. The page of the Heavenly Book floated down through the opening,

And at this moment, a figure suddenly flashed across the ground, picked up the page of the Heavenly Book, and turned to run.

Ranran saw it clearly, that person was Mu Ranwu! It seemed she had been eavesdropping for a long time, knowing the benefits of that Heavenly Book and wanting to reap the rewards.

Just as Ranran silently exclaimed that this was bad, Duntian waved his hand with a ruthless strike, directly knocking Mu Ranwu straight to the ground.

Mu Ranwu was in so much pain this time that she couldn’t even scream. She fell to the ground, twitching and clawing at the ground.

Duntian snorted coldly; she was just a puppet for him to use. Could she still become a troublemaker?

At that moment, Xue Ranran quickly landed and reached out to grab the page of the Heavenly Book, but Duntian arrived soon after, once again launching a ruthless strike at Xue Ranran.

This time, Su Yi Shui stood in front of Ranran again and took on the full blow.

Duntian’s strength was just too strong, and the other reinforcements had been repelled by him. Su Yi Shui knew that only by going all out and risking it all could they have a chance to defeat him.

Otherwise, with Duntian’s abilities and deep thoughts, another major disaster would eventually brew!

So this time, seeing Duntian attack again, Su Yi Shui didn’t dodge or evade at all, using his hand as a blade and directly thrusting towards Duntian.

And Duntian’s Huangdi Blade also plunged straight into Su Yi Shui’s chest. The blade was extremely long, but Duntian only pushed forward an inch before finding it difficult to exert any more force.

Xue Ranran had rushed over and grabbed the Huangdi Blade with both hands, preventing him from pushing forward. Meanwhile, Su Yi Shui had already turned his bare hand into a blade, directly thrusting into Duntian’s chest and grabbing his beating heart…

Being a demonic immortal with half a nascent soul was still an immortal, so he could grab and hold onto the demon Duntian’s heart. At the same time, he exerted force, pulling it out in one move.

Although Su Yi Shui’s chest was pierced, there was a cold smile in his tone: “I thought demons wouldn’t have heartbeat or warmth anymore. Your heart turned out to still seem human…”

Duntian still tightly gripped the handle of the blade, covering his chest where his heart used to be, glaring fiercely, still stubbornly trying to push the blade completely into Su Yi Shui’s chest.

“Even if I die! I will make you join me!” Duntian’s killing intent did not diminish at all. Just one more inch, and the divine blade would pierce through Su Yi Shui’s chest!

Ranran exerted all her strength to hold onto the blade, her hands dripping with blood, yet she didn’t dare to let go.

She quickly came up with a plan and looked at Duntian’s eyes, suddenly speaking, “There’s an ilusion space in Tianmai Mountain, with a small cottage by a stream, and birds chirping by the window. That must be the place you’ve always wanted to go. We… will bury you there. You can hear the laughter of your child every day, and your wife’s lullabies…”

With that, she endured the pain and anxiety, softly singing the tune she had heard in Tianmai Mountain’s illusion.

Accompanied by her singing, Duntian’s sinister expression gradually relaxed. Unconsciously, his face turned towards Tianmai Mountain.

Kongshan faced directly towards Tianmai Mountain, the place his senior sister had chosen as their cultivation ground, offering a splendid view.

In the cooling dawn, he could see the lush green mountains of Tianmai Mountain stretching endlessly. He saw the cliffs he had climbed with his wife, where his child had clamored for fruits on trees, one after another, crying loudly after the sour taste overwhelmed him…

It was truly a beautiful place, but for hundreds of years, he had not dared to step into that illusion because he feared that the dream would be too good, and the pain after waking up would be unbearable.

But now, he was about to fall into a dream from which he would never awaken, his chest emptied of its heart, yet remembering the sweetest memories from that illusion, making his emptiness a little less hollow…

In Ranran’s gentle singing, his hand gripping the Huangdi’s Blade finally loosened, and then pointing towards the direction of Tianmai Mountain, he fell down dejectedly!

The great Duntian, as he took his last breath, widened his eyes, looking straight beyond the towering mountains, at the place where his illusion was hidden…

As Duntian fell, Ranran didn’t even have time to exhale a sigh of relief. Although the blade didn’t completely pierce his chest, for Su Yi Shui, it was still a fatal wound.

Thinking of the definite ending on that page of the Heavenly Book, where it stated that the two would perish together, Ranran forced herself not to cry and not to panic! There was no such thing as an inescapable fate!

Since she had changed fate once, she could change it a second time!

Thinking of this, she loudly asked the Dragon goddess, “Quickly, bring the blood of the Green Dragon from the tower to Su Yi Shui!”

When she said this, the goddess immediately understood.

Originally, the Bone Tower had been formed by the coagulation of the blood of the Green Dragon. This divine blood with infinite power would be of endless benefit to the severely injured Su Yi Shui, and more effective than absorbing a hundred Wei Jius.

So the dragon goddess once again soared into the sky, circling around the ruins of the tower. As a dragon god, she could command all dragons effortlessly, so she easily drew out the dragon blood attached to the tower, gathering it into a blood spring that enveloped Su Yi Shui.

“You hold on, I’ll pull out the blade…” with the healing power of the Green Dragon’s blood to close the wound, only then Xue Ranran dared to remove the blade that had been stuck in Su Yi Shui’s chest.

This blade was no ordinary weapon. Once it cut, it was difficult to heal. Fortunately, the blade didn’t penetrate deeply, and thankfully, Ranran remembered about the Green Dragon’s blood.

When Su Yi Shui’s wound was finally covered by the dragon’s blood, and he managed to catch his breath, Mu Ranwu crawled over in pain “Sister… save me! Quick, use the Green Dragon’s blood to save me!”

Xue Ranran passed by her without even looking at her.

For this so-called “sister” from her past life, Xue Ranran had done her utmost.

In this life, she had never felt any sisterly bond with Mu Ranwu, and *the poisonous needles she had shot out earlier had erased any remaining trace of sympathy from Ranran.
*did the author get confused again? But Mu Ranwu probably created a fake of herself willingly in order to harm her sister

The *wolf from Zhongshan was beyond redemption. Learning the lesson once was enough!
中山狼: 比喻忘恩负义恩将仇报的人 describing ungrateful people

However, Mu Ranwu was provoked by Xue Ranran’s current indifference. “You are my sister! How can you ignore me! Haven’t you forgotten our parents’ instructions? I am your responsibility, the responsibility you can’t shirk from!”

Xue Ranran looked at the heavily injured Mu Ranwu, and said mildly, “But… I am no longer your sister, am I?”

Mu Ranwu was stung by the coldness in Ranran’s eyes. She finally realized that this girl who is friendly to everyone else, harbored an unmistakable disgust towards her.

Twenty years ago, her sister had never looked at her with such eyes!

At this moment, after being wounded by Duntian’s attack, she could feel her true qi dissipating rapidly, like a punctured water bag, with the little of her remaining life ebbing away.

“How could you say that! You’re my sister! The sister who loved me the most, who cherished me the most! How… how can you just watch me die!” Mu Ranwu coughed up blood heavily, yet still roared bitterly .

Xue Ranran was treating Gaocang and Bai Baishan. Hearing this, she sighed and said with sorrow, “But didn’t you kill that wonderful sister of yours with your own hands?”

Mu Ranwu was rendered speechless immediately—she had been the one who betrayed her sister back then, revealing her whereabouts to the three major sects, and even lured her sister into an ambush…

If it were Mu Qingge, no matter what she did, Mu Qingge would forgive her, and never nitpick like this! But… Mu Qingge was gone… she had been killed by her own hands.

When the chilling cold of death came to Mu Ranwu, the loss of blood made her hallucinate. At that time, she was still a girl with braids, crying and hungry under the eaves of a dilapidated temple, while her sister took out a hard dry bun, feeding her while softly saying, “Little sister, don’t cry. Think of this bun as freshly cooked red meat, fragrant and tender, with just the right amount of gravy!”

At that time, her sister was like a mother to her! But when did she lose her sister and couldn’t find her again?

“Sister… I want to eat the red meat you made…” When Xue Ranran stood up, Mu Ranwu choked out her final words, and took her last breath.

For some reason, Ranran, who could remain indifferent to Mu Ranwu’s curses, burst into tears at her nonsensical last words.

But she cried in uncomprehendingly, not knowing why she was shedding tears, as if there was another self living inside her, and that “her” was currently crying in sorrow for Mu Ranwu’s death…

Su Yi Shui had just regained some movement in his body. When he saw Ranran crying like a lost child, shedding tears looking at Mu Ranwu’s body, he struggled to sit up and pulled Ranran into his arms.

Although she may have no memories of her past life now, some things are engraved deep in the soul.

He knew how doting Mu Qingge had been to her sister, and it was precisely because of this that he remained indifferent to Mu Ranwu’s provocations time and time again. However, fate is unpredictable, and Mu Ranwu was deeply sinful and had woven her own fate.

All he could do now was to give Ranran a warm embrace, letting her cry freely, and completely sever all ties with her past life’s grudges and resentments!

However, Xue Ranran still remembered one important thing. As she bent down to pick up the page of the Heavenly Book, she found that the “paper” had become scalding hot, causing her to let go all of a sudden.

Just then, a divine light appeared in the dense darkness of the sky, followed by a celestial fire that ignited the “paper.”

“The heavenly mandate are not something mortals can peek into. Have you forgotten the consequences of prying into heavenly secrets?”

With this reprimand, several figures appeared in the sky.

Were you shocked by this reveal? The Medicine Immortal had been musing about the mystery of Su Yi Shui a while ago, dropping hints to us… but I was not expecting this! hehe

Finally, it would seem the final boss battle is finally over… but can our heroes finally catch a break?

Previous
Next

十日之期 TEN DAYS


Ranran followed the voice and saw several immortals who had previously supervised the *Ten Thousand Calamities Divine Punishment. Now, they were all surrounding a central figure with white hair and eyebrows, yet with a youthful appearance.
* I referred to it as Heavenly calamity otherwise its such a huge mouthful

It was this white-haired immortal who spoke.

In the celestial realm, immortals are also *divided into ranks. Those with relatively shallow qualifications, like the Medicine Immortal, are only lower-level immortals. However, seeing the other arrogant immortals’ deference towards the white-haired one, he must be a high-ranking upper-level immortal.
*三六九 different ranks

The Medicine Immortal addressed him as Venerable Purple Light, said to be one of the Eight Great Upper Immortals.

Xue Ranran greeted him with folded hands, saying, “After reincarnation, Ranran in this life, does not remember past events. I hope this Upper Immortal can understand!”

The white-haired immortal raised his eyebrows slightly. “You cunning little girl, are you planning to use your lack of memory as an excuse to evade responsibility?”

Ranran’s feelings towards these immortals were quite complicated now, especially since they had all arrived only after the fact, so she felt even weirder about them.

So she spoke without reservation “As a mortal, I have never stood high above and overlooked the world’s affairs. Therefore, I do everything with all my might, not betraying the conscience of heaven and earth! In order to resist Duntian and prevent the masses from falling into despair, we had to use everything available to us. This is how we barely defeated Duntian and prevented widespread disaster… Perhaps if all of you had arrived earlier, we wouldn’t have needed to pry into heavenly secrets, and victory would have been assured!”

Ranran’s words were like hidden steel needles within cotton! Anyone with a shred of dignity would blush upon hearing them. However, the immortals high above had long ceased to be ordinary humans, upon hearing Ranran’s sarcasm, they maintained impassive expressions.

What Ranran said was the truth. Those upper-level immortals had initially made a convenient decision because they couldn’t destroy the Bone Tower, opting to overturn the world to prevent time from flowing backward.

Now that Xue Ranran and the others had risked their lives and not only destroyed the Bone Tower but also killed the demonic Duntian, the heavens should not criticize them, morally or logically.

Just like mortals, immortals are judged by an invisible balance in the world. Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran’s actions had brought substantial benefits to the people and punishing them with death right now, would likely result in bad karma on those immortals who made such a decision.

So even though Xue Ranran had violated a major taboo by revealing heavenly secrets, the upper-level immortals had to consider their actions carefully.

The white-haired immortal continued, “The theft of the Heavenly Book is no small matter. Both you and Su Yi Shui are involved, and Su Yi Shui, as a demonic immortal, had used his nascent soul to intervene in the cycle of life and death without authorization, allowing someone who should have died to be reincarnated. *What’s the difference between this and what Duntian did?… Ten days later is when the gates of the celestial realm will open, and even those who haven’t transcended mortality can ascend to the heavens. At that time, you must enter the celestial realm and plead guilty before the Celestial Sovereign…”
*what difference was, Su Yi Shui gave something precious of his own, and did not harm anyone else doing that lol those huffy immortals are really annoying right?

Perhaps this upper-level immortal also had difficulty deciding on the severity of punishment, so he simply passed the hot potato to the *Celestial Sovereign, who oversees the upper immortals.
*天尊 in most xianxia this is the big voice in the sky

They had already destroyed the page of the Heavenly Book and could now report back to the higher authorities. As for other heavenly punishments, they would have to wait for the Celestial Sovereign’s decision ten days later.

However, the Medicine Immortal had acted on his own and joined these mortals in their nonsensical actions, so the Venerable Purple Light coldly ordered the Medicine Immortal to immediately return to the celestial realm to plead his case and await punishment.

The Medicine Immortal didn’t care much about being punished anymore. Perhaps Ranran’s merciless criticism of immortals had awakened him, and he realized he had forgotten his original intention of ascending to immortality.

Today, as a lower-level immortal of the celestial realm, he shouldn’t have been involved in such matters. However, the battle today was too thrilling and satisfying?

Furthermore, being able to fight side by side with Feng Mou again, it felt like a beautiful dream. Unfortunately, dreams always end. He glanced reluctantly at Feng Mou but was enveloped in a halo of light cast by Venerable Purple Light, ascending to the celestial realm.

When he looked back down at the ground, Feng Mou, who had repeatedly risked her life to protect him during the fierce battle just now, was unwilling to look at him.

He wanted to say something but didn’t know where to start. He could only sigh as his body gradually ascended and disappeared into the sky…

When the immortals all left, the people on the ground began to clean up the battlefield.

Although there were no casualties for Xishan, their injuries were severe. Gao Cang and Bai Baishan stabilized their heart meridians after taking the pills given by the Medicine Immortal, but their dantians were damaged, requiring a long period of recuperation.

The most frustrating thing was, despite their desperate efforts and placing their lives on the line, they were left with a deferred judgment from the celestial realm. Qiu Xier found this extremely disheartening and began cursing loudly at the sky after the immortals had left.

Ranran didn’t have the mood to join in cursing. She was currently using her spiritual energy to heal Su Yi Shui. His injuries were very severe, and although he could survive because of the Green dragon’s blood, he still needed quiet rest.

Ranran never knew that her reincarnation was actually exchanged with Su Yi Shui’s celestial status. If he had truly perished with Duntian, she definitely would not have wanted to stay alive by herself and *would follow him.
*but Su Yi Shui will be so mad! lol would they be two bickering ghosts?

But now that he was still alive, she could finally feel at ease. As for what would happen in ten days, she decided to take it one step at a time.

While everyone was recuperating, Wen Chunhui went up the mountain to inspect the houses of the Kongshan Sect. Despite Duntian falling into darkness, he wasn’t inherently bloodthirsty. The followers he had controlled were weak-willed and greedy, so most of the disciples of Kongshan Sect were imprisoned and those who had been controlled were gradually regaining their senses without fear for their lives. She instructed the injured to stay in guest rooms on the mountain until they recovered enough to leave.

However, Wen Chunhui politely excluded Wei Jiu and urged him to return quickly to Red Flame Mountain to assess the situation.

The Bone Tower in Kongshan was the main tower of the Heaven-defying tower, and now that the main tower had collapsed, the other towers were likely gone as well. As the backbone of Red Flame Mountain, he must return.

Wen Chunhui saw through Wei Jiu’s character, he was a true despicable schemer!

At such a critical moment, Wei Jiu still found opportunities to scheme. Now that Duntian had been dealt with, if Wei Jiu went up the mountain, who knows what trouble he might cause at Kongshan.

Wei Jiu also sensed the subtle hint in Wen Chunhui’s polite words, so he laughed coldly three times and waved his sleeve, telling Tu Jiuyuan to follow him back to Red Flame Mountain.

He was also eager to see how much of his foundation remained and had no interest in staying here any further.

Even though Su Yi Shui was injured now and it was an excellent opportunity to kill him. However, with those two dragons around, he would not be likely to succeed.

He had always felt that his abilities were comparable to Su Yi Shui’s, but Su Yi Shui had already cultivated into an immortal with the body of the demon’s son twenty years ago!

Wei Jiu finally understood the vast difference between them, and this bitter taste was enough for him to ponder over for the rest of his life. So he left rather quickly, without any dragging of his feet.

Tu Jiuyuan pursed her lips and followed Wei Jiu.

However, not long after, Tu Jiuyuan secretly returned to Kongshan by herself.

Ranran was leading a few disciples of Kongshan in the mountains to gather herbs when she suddenly returned. Naturally, she asked her if she had lost something.

Tu Jiuyuan, however, knelt down in front of her with a thud. “I already owe you a great debt, so I’m shamelessly asking for another favor. Please think of a way to protect my child.”

As the saying goes, a mother’s love knows no bounds. Wei Jiu made it clear that regardless of whose child was in her womb, she couldn’t keep it. If she returned to Red Flame Mountain with him, she would have to drink a bowl of abortion medicine.

But if she tried to escape, the punishment for traitors from Red Flame Mountain was bloody and brutal, and she still couldn’t escape death.

So after thinking it through, Tu Jiuyuan could only come to Xue Ranran and see if this clever girl could come up with a solution.

Ranran looked at Tu Jiuyuan’s pale face as she held her stomach and reached out to check her pulse. Despite Tu Jiuyuan’s tumultuous emotions, her fetal pulse was stable, indicating a healthy baby inside.

Ranran pondered for a moment before saying, “Originally, I could shelter you in Xishan, but with the celestial punishment awaiting me and my master in ten days, without knowing what will happen, I can’t offer you complete protection… Perhaps there is a place where you can seek refuge, but you need the owner’s permission. I can ask on your behalf.”

When Xue Ranran later brought this up with the Dragon goddess Feng Mou, Tu Jiuyuan realized that the ideal place Ranran spoke of was the legendary Dragon Island.

Surrounded by dragons, it was an extremely dangerous place. Even Wei Jiu, with his prowess, wouldn’t dare to venture and harm a pregnant woman there.

However, Ranran wasn’t sure if Feng Mou would agree, as Dragon Island was a forbidden place, unwelcome to mortals.

Ranran was shocked how Feng Mou immediately agreed to this, when she broached the subject with her.

However, Feng Mou mentioned that her help was also self-serving, it depended on whether Tu Jiuyuan would agree.

It turned out that the Dragon goddess had violated heavenly rules by leaving Dragon Island without permission, and punishment was inevitable. Feng Mou had previously lost five hundred years of cultivation due to divine punishment, and her appearance was also greatly affected. If she were punished again, it would be even more severe.
*I thought she took on the Medicine Immortal’s tribulations for him, why was this lumped together haha

So Feng Mou was willing to form good karma and help Tu Jiuyuan protect the child in her womb. When the punishment arrived, it was uncertain whether her good deed would lessen the punishment.

More importantly, unborn babies were pure and untouched by sin; divine punishment wouldn’t harm the pregnant woman, as the child has yet to sin in this life.

If Tu Jiuyuan agreed to help her as her protector in the future, she might be able to escape calamity.

Tu Jiuyuan agreed immediately. Growing up in Crimson Flame Mountain, influenced by the environment, she was ruthless in her actions but had a strong sense of loyalty. So when Feng Mou straightforwardly told her the situation, she readily agreed.

Regardless of where she went, she wouldn’t be able to escape Wei Jiu’s pursuit, so she might as well take a gamble. Even if something unexpected happened, she would take her child with her!

Feng Mou seemed to sense Ranran’s worry and added, “Don’t worry, even if I don’t survive the heavenly tribulation, since there’s no divine punishment, the little Dragon will also protect her. After she gives birth, he will send the mother and child out of Dragon Island.”

The Dragon she mentioned was the young dragon. Born outside Dragon Island, it hadn’t been imprinted with restrictions, so he wouldn’t incur divine punishment even if he left the island. That’s why she had brought it out of the island with her earlier.
*LOL technical oversight

Hearing the Dragon goddess’s words, the young dragon immediately protested with howls, seemingly unhappy with its godmother’s bleak words.

After arranging everything, Ranran bid farewell to the two dragons and Tu Jiuyuan, then returned to take care of her Shifu, prepare his medicine and wait on him by the sickbed.

They hadn’t had a chance to be alone since Su Yi Shui regained his memories.

Now, after a major battle, here was a rare moment of tranquility.

After feeding him the medicine, with the sun yet to set, but rain started to fall again.

They were staying in a guest room surrounded by dense banana plants. The sound of raindrops hitting the leaves made people drowsy.

So after feeding him the medicine, like a tired and coquettish kitten, Ranran climbed onto the bed as well, and buried her face in Su Yi Shui’s chest.

Su Yi Shui thought she was tired and wanted to rest, so he didn’t disturb her. He just held her, sniffing the faint fragrance on her body, and closed his eyes to rest.

But soon, he felt his shirt becoming damp. He raised her chin with his hand and saw tears streaming down her tender face.

“What’s wrong?” he couldn’t help asking with a furrowed brow.

Ranran choked out “You big fool, you actually gave up your nascent soul for me. Don’t you know that its different from a golden core? Once damaged, it’s hard to repair!”

Cultivators spend their lives pursuing immortal cultivation to transcend mortal life and achieve eternal life.

But Su Yi Shui cultivated into a true immortal with the body of the demon’s son, and yet he easily gave it up for her. Did he know what exactly he had given up?

Su Yi Shui wiped the tears from her face with his long fingers but found that the more he wiped, the more tears appeared. So he stopped wiping and directly used his lips to kiss away the tears on her cheeks, then lowered his head to kiss her lips, swallowing her sobs as well.

When the two separated, Ranran’s breathing was unsteady, and she found it was hard to work up the feelings to continue crying.

“I’m talking about something serious, why are you being so unserious?” She couldn’t help but try to push him away, but the man was like a rock, to heavy to be pushed away no matter how hard she tried.

Su Yi Shui’s gaze deepened as he stared at her, as if he wanted to devour her in one gulp.

He asked softly, “Do you know why I was able to have a breakthrough with the demon son’s body and ascend so quickly back then?”

Ranran swallowed and shook her head.

“Back then, there were too many men milling around you, but you never looked at me. I was thinking, when could I become stronger, strong enough that you couldn’t ignore me, and your eyes would be filled with me…”

Ranran couldn’t help but laugh at his sincere words. Did jealousy motivate one to progress? There were plenty of jealous people in the world. Following his logic, wouldn’t everyone be able to become an immortal from the demonic path?

“What about now? If other men appear around me, would you become like Duntian and fall into darkness again?”

Su Yishui raised an eyebrow. “I can save the trouble now. Haven’t I already proposed, and your parents have agreed? Although I’ve become an immortal, I still want to follow the secular etiquette. Tomorrow, let’s return to Xishan and get married.”

By then, he would be her husband, and if any reckless person dared to approach her disrespectfully, he would be absolutely justified in killing them!

Huh?

Ranran had thought Su Yi Shui would be worried about the heavenly punishment and discuss countermeasures with her. But she didn’t expect him to bring up marriage out of the blue.

This…was completely unrelated!

Su Yi Shui deeply regretted his arrogance when he had lost his memory. He didn’t know how to seize the opportunity. He should have consummated the marriage when he proposed, instead of wasting so much time.

So he felt it was time to move the wedding forward.

Ranran wanted to say something, but Su Yishui was afraid she would refuse, so he simply covered her mouth with his hand. “When I remembered everything, you were afraid that I only loved you from twenty years ago; after I lost my memory, I forgot all the old feelings, didn’t I still fall for you and landed into Xue Ranran’s hands again? If you make any more excuses, I will have to take you to court. Are you just toying with me and refusing to give me your heart?”

Ranran and he were nose to nose, and she looked at him as he questioned her coldly, while showing a fierce look as if he was afraid of being toyed with. It was just like his bad behavior back when he lost his memory!

In fact, in this life, Ranran had regarded Su Yi Shui as her master for the first two years since they have met. As for when it evolved into deeper affection, thinking back, it seemed to have happened when he lost his memory.

At that time, Su Yi Shui had none of the demeanor of being a master, and his temperament was very difficult! He was completely like the wild beast from the Fierce Beast chapter in the [Playing Classics]. But it was precisely because of this that she saw the bad temper beneath his usually aloof and perfect appearance and *couldn’t help but fall for him…

Ten days would fly by, and when that time came, she would face the celestial trial with him, with uncertain outcome.

But if she could marry him now, even if it was just ten days of sweetness, she would have no regrets in this life!

Thinking of this, she forcefully pushed away his hand covering her mouth and deliberately showed a flirtatious smile, teasingly lifting Su Yi Shui’s chin, looking at his handsome face with leering eyes, and couldn’t help but give him a kiss, saying, “Since you’re so eager to get married off, I’ll reluctantly accept you… A~h…”

She hadn’t finished her careless words yet when Su Yi Shui turned and pressed her beneath him, and for a while, they were swept away by passion under the waves of the blankets, their low laughter continuing… lessening the apprehension of facing the heavenly trial.

The next day, the group from Xishan finished their preparations and were ready to return.

Along the way, Ranran had some free time to quietly ponder over what Feng Mou had told her before they left.

Feng Mou said that the Heavenly Book was originally a wordless book set up on the Ascension Platform in the heavenly realm. The pages of the book were closed all year round and couldn’t be opened by ordinary people.

So how did Mu Qingge manage to enter the heavenly realm to read the wordless book and even tear out a page? It seemed to be an impossible and bizarre experience.

If Ranran could remember everything from her past life, perhaps she could solve the mystery. When they faced the heavenly trial, she could also handle it more calmly.

As for Su Yi Shui’s identity, it was indeed an awkward existence for the heavenly realm.

The demon’s son had been born as a tribulation for the mortal realm. If his merits were completed, there was still a possibility of ascending after exhausting his use, rewarded with a lower immortal status and slowly enduring hardships to progress up the ranks.

But those who became immortals with demonic bodies were already outside the hierarchies of the immortals and were not under the jurisdiction of the Heavenly Sovereign. Such a variable, and his mere existence made all immortals uneasy. And Su Yi Shui’s abandonment of his nascent soul was actually welcomed by the heavenly realm.

Even the Rebirth Tree Su Yi Shui had obtained back then was guided by a higher power. Whether it was done with good intentions or ulterior motives, it was up for debate.

Su Yi Shui looked at Ranran, who was lost in thought, and said mildly, “Don’t worry, I won’t let anything happen to you.”

But Ranran couldn’t help but ponder everything that had happened. After experiencing a series of twists and turns, she looked at everything around her with suspicion.

Additionally, there was a thought that had been lingering in her mind—was it also a conspiracy that Mu Qingge managed to see that Heavenly Book?

When they returned to Xishan, Ranran’s parents were already restless from waiting.

During these days, there were sudden changes in the world, especially with the four black towers surrounding Xishan. Lightning and thunder even reached Xishan, making everyone feel uneasy about the situation over at Kongshan.

Later Ranran had used messenger birds to inform Emperor Su Yu and at the same time informed uncle master Zeng Yi who was at Xishan, to take her parents and escape first.

However, when Qiaolian and Carpenter Xue had heard that their daughter was in danger, they flatly refused to leave. They cried and said they couldn’t leave Ranran alone to face the danger. They insisted on staying in Xishan and waiting for Ranran to return.

Fortunately, Heaven didn’t let down their love for their daughter, and Ranran finally returned all in one piece.

Qiaolian cried tears of joy and wanted to hold her obedient daughter in her arms like a baby, then hurried to the kitchen to prepare food and let her daughter who had worked hard for several days rest and recuperate.

Others may not know, but her obedient daughter was a first-rate hero who saved the world!

At the dining table, Ranran’s bowl was filled to the brim with food picked out by her mother.

Of course, Su Yi Shui took advantage of the mealtime to announce two things.

The first thing was that he was going to step down as the Sect leader of Xishan and return Xishan to Xue Ranran, at the same time severing the master-disciple relationship with Ranran.

This statement stunned the cheerful diners, and Bai Baishan asked cautiously, “Master… are you going to exile yourself from the sect?”

Su Yishui nodded, and Gao Cang immediately looked like he was close to tears. “Master, don’t you want us anymore? Moreover, how did Junior Sister anger you? You’re actually going to leave Xishan by yourself?”

Ranran felt that the table was full of delicious dishes that needed to be savored, but Su Yi Shui’s cryptic behavior was making everyone lose their appetites, which was a letdown for the chickens, ducks, fish on the table.

She glared at Su Yi Shui and then, ignoring her own embarrassment, loudly declared, “Don’t worry, although your Master is exiling himself from the sect, he has also found a good place to settle down… um… I’m getting married!”

Qiaolian blinked her eyes and was the first to understand. Her daughter had finally figured things out and was going to marry Master Su!

In this way, giving Xishan to her daughter would be part of her dowry, but wasn’t it still circling back to Master Su? Thinking that her dowry accumulated over all these time was finally being put to good use, Qiaolian was overjoyed. She grabbed Su Yishui’s hand and started calling him her son-in-law, my son…

Now, everyone finally relaxed and burst into laughter.

However, those who had been to Kongshan still had a hint of bitterness in their smiles.

They had heeded Ranran’s repeated urging and didn’t reveal the fact that they would have to face heavenly punishment for prying into heaven’s mandate, to Qiaolian and her husband.

So now, after hearing the news that the two were about to be married, their hearts were filled with mixed feelings: ten days later, facing the heavenly trial was going to be an unknown thunderbolt.

But for now, they still needed to prepare wholeheartedly for the wedding of this immortal couple.

Unfortunately, this joyous occasion couldn’t stop evil from coming to the mountain. On the second day, just as everyone was preparing the decorations, Wei Jiu had barged into the Xishan gate, aggressively questioning Su Yi Shui, “I’m asking you, where did you hide Tu Jiuyuan?”

To be brutally honest, while I enjoyed this novel very much, the author’s writing is not very subtle. The 伏笔 foreshadowing sometimes is done in a very clumsy way.

*what can I say she loves the same bad boy like Mu Qingge did hahaha
Kind of sweet she didn’t dare to love the perfect guy but couldn’t resist the imperfect one?

Previous
Next

堂堂正正 HONORABLE AND LEGITIMATE

Su Yi Shui stood in front of the mountain gate, watching as Gao Cang and Bai Baishan hung red lanterns on the gate of Xishan. He gave a wave of his hand, indicating that the lanterns were slightly crooked and needed to be straightened before saying slowly, “She is not a disciple of Xishan, why have you come looking here?”

When disciples of the Crimson Gate Sect join the sect, they were given a poisonous bug. Usually, it’s fine, but should they betray the sect, as the sect master, Wei Jiu can naturally activate the spell and track down their whereabouts.

When Wei Jiu discovered that Tu Jiuyuan had quietly run away, he was livid. Considering her pregnancy and physically weak, he didn’t immediately activate the poisonous bug, hoping that Tu Jiuyuan would calm down and return on her own to admit her mistake.

However, after waiting for two days without any sign of her return, Wei Jiu was completely enraged. He couldn’t wait any longer and immediately activated the poisonous bug. However, to his surprise, when he activated it, there was no response at all.

At that moment, Wei Jiu suspected that Tu Jiuyuan had returned to seek help from those from Xishan and that they had hidden her using some clever method.

So he came to Xishan in a rage to search for her, not knowing what was going on when he saw Xishan being decorated with lanterns and decorations.

When he understood that Su Yi Shui was getting married, Wei Jiu’s heart felt even more sour than ever.

After hearing Su Yi Shui’s denial, he sneered, “You sure denied it so completely, hiding my woman, are you preparing to become an instant father?”

Ranran, who was coming down the mountain, happened to hear Wei Jiu’s sarcastic words and spoke up, “Rest assured, the child you don’t want will have someone to love and care for him. You don’t need to worry about who his godfather will be.”

Wei Jiu had been suppressing his anger, but now, hearing the implied meaning in Ranran’s words that Tu Jiuyuan had found a new father for her unborn child, his anger soared. Through gritted teeth, he said, “Su Yi Shui, do you think you, a half damaged demon immortal, can intimidate me? If you don’t hand over Tu Jiuyuan, after your heavenly punishment, I’ll bring people to slaughter Xishan and torture your disciples to the bone!”

Although he had no intentions to become a father, let alone have Tu Jiuyuan give birth to a child, the thought of Tu Jiuyuan carrying his child and being with another man made him seethe with jealousy.

Su Yishui did not want to deal with Wei Jiu, but now, hearing his blatant threat, Su Yi Shui’s eyes also turned fierce as he slowly turned towards Wei Jiu.

After Wei Jiu finished speaking, he realized that Su Yi Shui’s gaze was full of killing intent, and he realized that he had said something stupid.

By saying that, wasn’t he forcing Su Yi Shui to kill him before the Heavenly punishment?

Thinking of this, he quickly retreated, but it was already too late. Su Yi Shui’s attack had arrived, each move ruthless and without holding back.

Since the battle at Kongshan, Su Yi Shui no longer deliberately sealed off his half of the demonic immortal’s nascent soul. When he made a move, even though it was just one arm attacking, his movements were as swift as a thousand-armed Guanyin.

In just a moment, Wei Jiu had already been hit several times, spitting out several mouthfuls of blood.

“Su Yi Shui! Damn you! We had fought side by side against enemies, and yet you disregard our past friendship like this!”

Wei Jiu struggled to withstand his blows, immediately backing away while cursing and clinging to their past alliance.

But Su Yi Shui turned a deaf ear, showing no intention of stopping; he was intent on killing Wei Jiu.

Wei Jiu now fully understood the huge gap in power between him and Su Yi Shui.

Su Yi Shui wasn’t in a hurry to kill him; he seemed to be playing with his prey like a cat with a mouse, and he was almost about to shatter Wei Jiu’s internal organs!

Helpless, while coughing up blood, Wei Jiu shouted “I was just kidding earlier! How could you take it seriously! I can even make a Soul oath, even if you’re struck by divine punishment, I will never harm your disciples at Xishan even by a hair!”

At this moment, Ranran spoke up, “Yi Shui, we are about to be married, it’s not suitable to have bloodshed. If he’s willing to make an oath, let’s hear what he has to say!”

With their divine punishment looming, Ranran didn’t want Su Yi Shui to commit more killings.

Finally, after Wei Jiu failed miserably to get what he wanted, after he made a perfect Soul Oath as a wedding gift, he could finally get lost.

As he was leaving, he still wouldn’t give up, and turned to Xue Ranran to say “Where is Tu Jiuyuan really at? I could swear another Soul Oath and I guarantee that I will not harm her and her unborn child!”

But this time, Xue Ranran shook her head, “She just wants to raise her child well; the poisonous atmosphere at the Crimson Gate is not suitable for a child to grow up in. She has never schemed against you, and she was your thankless caretaker, doing so much dirty work for so many years without any pay. You have already taken all the advantage you possibly could. If you had an ounce of compassion, you shouldn’t have forced her to the wall like this. You never cared about her life or death. Letting go of an insignificant woman, what loss is that to you?”

Wei Jiu was stumped by Xue Ranran’s words. He admitted to himself that he didn’t love Tu Jiuyuan. It’s just that over the long years, he had already gotten used to her care, and only she knew all of his preferences.

But to grovel like this for an insignificant woman, really touched his bottom line.

Unable to gain any advantage here, Wei Jiu finally left with a snort.

Su Yi Shui hugged Ranran, as they watched Wei Jiu disappear into the distance, and their West Mountain’s gate was finally peaceful again.

Tu Jiuyuan was on Dragon Island, shielded by the Dragon Shield, which cut off all trace of her presence in the mortal realm. Wei Jiu probably would never find Tu Jiuyuan and her child in his lifetime.

But Wei Jiu, who such an arrogant person, had just volunteered to swear a Soul oath for a woman he considered unimportant.

Moreover, after hearing that she was about to marry Su Yi Shui, he didn’t even care about being jealous, he just wanted to know Tu Jiuyuan’s whereabouts, which was quite intriguing.

Thinking of Wei Jiu and Su Yi Shui, both of whom had entered the Tianmai Mountain’s Black Pool, Xue Ranran couldn’t help but lament. The curse of the Black Pool, which severed love and affection, would make people experience the pain of losing their loved ones.

Perhaps the curse of that pool was to make people lose their loved ones when they realized their affection?

Thinking of this, she sighed and said, “Elder Wen of Kongshan sent a messenger pigeon, saying that they have found the illusion in the ruins of Tianmai Mountain and left Duntian’s ashes in the illusion, which kind of reunites their family…”

After the trial, Tianmai Mountain had collapsed, making it difficult to find the illusion. Elder Wen volunteered for this task, allowing Su Yi Shui and Ranran to make good use of the precious ten days.
