After all, the Divine punishment was uncertain, and every single hour for this couple who had been through so much was precious.

Su Yi Shui reached out and adjusted the necklace hanging around Ranran’s neck. The pendant was a transparent glass bead, inside was the Rebirth tree nurtured on the precious xiran soil.

Upon closer look, the rebirth tree has grown twice as big, its crown spreading out, and its branches filling up most of the glass bead.

Ranran’s inherent defiency had been mostly healed thanks to the protection of the rebirth tree. Her features now carried more charm from her past life, and her once petite figure had not only grown taller but also become more womanly…

Su Yi Shui looked at Ranran, feeling a tightness in his throat. He held her in his arms and whispered in her ear, “Don’t think about unrelated people anymore. We’re getting married tonight. Are you ready?”

Although Ranran was once known as a seductive demoness who flirted with three thousand handsome youths, she knew that she was only all talk no action, just for show twenty years ago, bearing the reputation of a demoness for nothing.

In fact, Su Yi Shui who appeared so proper and overflowing with a sense of abstinence, seemed very experienced when he teased and was frivolous with her!

Especially when they were fooling around in the Kongshan guest room, even though he stopped in time, he still took alot of advantage… Those savvy moves didn’t seem like those of an inexperienced novice!

Thinking of his past romantic encounters, she couldn’t help suspecting that he had some untold stories with Wen Hongshan and others, so she also felt a little jealous, saying, “How should I prepare? Don’t you already know everything? You said you never had feelings for any other women… Could it be that you don’t have feelings, but just did things?”

Su Yi Shui looked at Ranran’s rare jealous expression and chuckled softly, whispering in her ear, “What have I done with anyone else? It’s just that for the past twenty years, there’s always been a foxy woman in my dreams, calling me ‘Shui’er’ and seducing me. Perhaps after so many dreams, many things became self-taught…”

Ranran heard this and quickly looked around, afraid that Gao Cang and others might hear it. Fortunately, Gao Cang and Bai Baishan were perceptive; Seeing the new sect master getting lovey-dovey with the former sect master, they had ran off long ago.

Ranran laughed and hit his chest, saying, “I’ve never heard of anyone learning that in their dreams. Was the one in your dream a fox spirit?”

Su Yi Shui smiled, his thin lips curling. “Tonight, I must take a good look to see how many fox tails she really has!”

Ranran’s face turned completely red this time. She was just a newly turned nineteen-year-old girl who hadn’t had many messy dreams yet. Just thinking about what he said made her feel like her face was red to the point of dripping blood.

But no matter how shy she felt, it was time for the ceremony in the evening. Su Yi Shui refused to delay even for a day, he insisted on holding the ceremony at night.

Fortunately, Qiao Lian was eager to marry off her daughter and had been saving up the dowry for a long while. So, although the wedding only had people from West Mountain and the ceremony was simple, it was still lively.

However, the wedding dress Ranran wore was not prepared by Qiaolian. Su Yi Shui opened the West Mountain’s storage room and took out a sandalwood box from inside.

When he opened the wooden box, Su Yi Shui took out a fiery red dress from inside.

The fabric of this dress was made of an unknown material, with golden threads running through the red, and the chest and hem were adorned with sparkling gems. The long skirt trailed on the ground like the tail of a fire phoenix.

Such a luxurious and beautiful dress, both in fabric and craftsmanship, couldn’t have been completed in just a month.

Ranran asked Su Yi Shui, “This… couldn’t be something you prepared twenty years ago?”

Su Yi Shui nodded, quite willing to open up about his past awkward feelings. “You liked red clothes back then, so Su Yu wanted to appeal to your taste and bought a lot of fabric to gift to you. What he picked out with his coarse taste was so really so tacky. So, I specially sought out the Crimson rainbow weave fabric, and had a skilled embroiderer spend a whole year making it…”
*not Su Yi Shui thinking his uncle’s taste is bad and then ordering what could only be haute couture for his master for everyday wear

Looking at the dress that was completely new, with no signs of being worn, Ranran asked, “Then why didn’t I wear it?”

Su Yi Shui didn’t speak, but his brows furrowed again.

Ranran suddenly understood. On the day the dress was finished, she was probably no longer in the world. Su Yi Shui, filled with remorse, locked away the dress which had arrived too late in the sandalwood box and sealed it.

But based on his difficult personality, twenty years ago, he only enjoyed drowning himself in vinegar and never confessed to her. If there had been a chance to give her the dress, it wouldn’t have been a pleasant message.

It would probably be something like: “I got this dress by chance, and this kind of vulgar flashy gems suits you well, so I’ll give it to you since its a waste to throw away…”

Ranran thought this and said it out loud with a smile.

But Su Yi Shui reached out, playing with her loose strands of hair, and said mildly, “When a man gives a woman clothes, pay no heed to what he says, deep down, he hopes to see how she would gently remove the garment.”

Ranran felt a bit embarrassed hearing his improper words. She hugged the dress to her chest, turned and ran out of the storage room. But soon after, she peeked back in, and said to him “So, when I wear it, will you personally help me take it off?”

As she said this, her cheeks were flushed, she bit her red lips softly, and her eyes were shining shyly.

Su Yi Shui’s eyes filled with something at her words, and he swallowed involuntarily. The mark of the demonic immortal between his brows even appeared.

He reached out to grab the seductive little demoness, but Ranran slipped away like a fish in water, and ran away laughing.

On their wedding day, Ranran wore the dress that had been locked in the box for twenty years. Her hair was styled high, secured with a magnificent crown adorned with gold threads and jade, set with large pearls from the East sea, just enough to suppress the extravagance of the dress.

She wore a thin layer of red veil on her head, her delicate hands decorated with red nail polish, gently holding the hand of her second uncle master Yu Tong, she walked gracefully towards the hall.

Qiu Xier stared at her fixedly, whispering in awe, “Wow, isn’t this a fairy descending to earth? Ranran, you look so beautiful!”

And Ranran slowly raised her head, unable to help herself from looking at the man who had waited for her for two lifetimes.

Su Yi Shui was also wearing a red robe, with a golden crown and tied hair. Although the festive color was easy to make people appear frivolous, Su Yi Shui’s naturally aloof temperament added a hint of gravity to the red clothing.

He walked slowly towards her, reaching out to gently hold her hand. Although there were constant laughter and chatter around them, he still felt like he was in a dream, as if he might suddenly wake up and find that this was only a dream…

But the hand he held tightly grasped back, the unmistakable strength indicating that all of this was real.

The day he had been waiting for has finally arrived, he was to marry his little master in red!

Qiao Lian watched her daughter finally get married in good health, crying uncontrollable tears of joy. At the same time, she prepared a jar of medicinal wine for her son-in-law filled with dog kidneys, deer pen*s, with plenty of red ginseng, placing it on the bedside of the newly weds room.

As a mother-in-law, she was still worried about Su Yi Shui’s age and needed to add some kindling to feel more reassured.

She also hoped to hold her grandchildren in her lifetime. She didn’t want the couple to focus only on cultivating immortality and leave no descendants in the mortal realm.

Elder Jiu enjoyed such occasions with a full table of dishes to accompany his drinking. While drinking, he did not forget to hand a small brocade box to Su Yi Shui. “Here, this is what you asked me to draw… Remember to use it with control!”

Ranran, with the red veil covering her head, couldn’t help but half lift the veil slightly, her big eyes staring at the box. The jar of medicinal wine her mother prepared was definitely enough for one person to drink, so why did Elder Jiu bring another talisman as a wedding gift?

Forgive her for her temporary lack of seriousness but she couldn’t think of any legitimate use for that talisman.

Su Yi Shui seemed to see her full of questions, smiled slightly, pulled down her veil properly with his hand, and at the same time, his lips moved slightly, as if channeling some message to her.

This time, Ranran abruptly lifted the veil again, staring at Su Yi Shui with wide eyes, and then slowly covered her veil again…

Although this wedding was not as grand as those of worldly officials, almost everyone close to Ranran attended. Even after the ceremony, Zhu Que, who had left for a long time to seek a mate, appeared with two fiery little vermilion babies in the sky above West Mountain.

Accompanied by a long chirping sound, the adult and two babies flew in the night sky, their scattered red feathers shimmering with golden light, like fireworks filling the sky, dazzling yet impossible to look away from.

That night, the wedding wine that the newlyweds drank together was the Ten-Ingredient Tonic brewed by Su Yi Shui’s mother-in-law. Qiao Lian’s son-in-law did not let down such a potent good wine .

Under-aged readers, pls jump to the next Chapter

By the time night fell, Ranran felt that Su Yi Shui was surprisingly serious and diligent in examining for fox tails.

She even felt that she hadn’t exerted this much effort even in the life-and-death battle with Duntian!

Exhausted, she had to surrender in the end, preparing to get out of bed, as she warned Xishan’s exiled disciple in her capacity as the Sect master “You’re being so unrestrained… never satisfied, isn’t this wilfully being overcome by thoughts of greed? It’s greatly detrimental to cultivation! A~h~!”

Before she could finish her words, he pulled her back onto the bed.

He also replied with righteous indignation. He had been starved for twenty years and if he was not allowed to eat his fill, this would be too much of a grievous injustice!

Su Yi Shui now felt as if he had taken the appetizing version of the Qingxin pill made by Ranan. His appetite has been greatly increased, and it was only halfway through the feast, so the main course was not to be taken off the table!

And so the newlyweds’ bridal chamber remained closed for three days.

Ranran could only be thankful that she had practiced cultivation seriously before; fasting for three days was not a problem, or else she would have starved to death on the rumpled red sheets.

On the fourth day, she looked weakly at the handsome man with long hair falling loosely beside her. At this moment, he was half-dressed, looking dangerous yet charming.

But in this *honeymoon phase, clearly, he was the one exerting the most effort, so why did he now still look so alert and energetic, without a trace of fatigue?
*形容新婚时的欢乐

Su Yi Shui lay on his side, supporting his head with one hand, looking at the sleepy woman, and took out Elder Jiu’s gift box from under the pillow, and took out a golden talisman about the width of a finger.

Ranran opened her eyes and looked at the talisman, somewhat skeptical. She asked, “Are you sure you want to use it now?”

This question clearly offended the man greatly. He narrowed his eyes and said in a low voice “Are you doubting my ability?”

Ranran was now all too familiar with this look. She quickly pulled the covers closer and buried her face in the quilt, laughing softly.

“Anyway, Elder Jiu only drew just this one; it all depends on whether you have the ability or not… A~h, I’m sorry, I won’t tease you anymore!”

For a while, there was only playful laughter in the newlyweds’ room.

Meanwhile, outside the window, the delicate flowers were vibrant, refreshed by the recent rain, tapping against the window. Two little vermilion birds fluffed their feathers, jumping around the branches like two red velvet balls…

When the newlyweds finally stepped out of the room, there were only two days left until the ten day deadline.

After serving a cup of delayed tea to her parents as a newlywed bride, Ranran couldn’t even think about being shy. She asked in a hurry, “Quick, I’m so hungry. Mother, is there any leftover Five-Spice Braised Pork Elbow from the wedding day? Just give me some to fill my stomach.”

Qiao Lian looked at her son-in-law Su Yi Shui who was also present and couldn’t say too much, so she could only say with amused exasperation, “How many days has it been now? Even if it’s hanging in the well to keep cool, it must already be full of maggots! I’ll make you two some braised meat noodles!”

However, while she was cooking, she took the opportunity to sneak into the newly weds’ room and took away the jar of tonic wine.

This health tonic was too potent! Her daughter was delicate and fragile; she couldn’t let her body be harmed by too much nourishment!

The two newlyweds were inseparable and spent each day blissfully. Unfortunately, the happy times were too short; the ten-day deadline arrived in the blink of an eye, and today was the day the heaven’s gate would open and they have to meet the Celestial Sovereign.

According to the heavenly rules, mortals were not allowed to enter the heavenly realm.

Although Su Yi Shui had ascended to become an immortal with a demonic body, he had shattered his nascent soul and lost the qualification to open the heavenly gate by himself. Only when the heavenly realm actively opened the gate and led them could they pass through the gate into the heavenly realm for their trial.

When they woke up in the morning, they saw the clouds in the sky changing, first like fish scales, then quickly gathering together, layer by layer stacking up. It seemed as if an invisible giant hand was grabbing the white clouds, piling them up like mud, and quickly forming a platform. On the platform appeared a tall gate, with the sun embedded in it, radiating light so dazzling that people couldn’t look directly at it, and the end of the gate could not be seen from outside.

As the white cloud-formed gate took shape, stairs appeared descending from the platform, extending into the sky above West Mountain.

Gao Cang and the others looked up at the white cloud steps above their heads, full of astonishment and awe.

Ranran ignored the obvious steps prepared for them and whistled. With the whistle, a fiery figure flew to Ranran’s side, was Zhu Que who had just returned.

Ranran pulled Su Yi Shui onto Zhu Que. Zhu Que seemed a little intimidated by the wide-open heavenly gate, and seemed uneasy. It fluttered its body in resistance. It wasn’t until Ranran calmed it down that it relaxed, carrying the two towards the towering heavenly gate in the distance.

After flying for a while, they saw a beam of light, and the Purple Light Immortal appeared from the radiance, frowning at the two and saying, “You two have no etiquette. The Celestial Sovereign has decreed to lay down the guiding heavenly steps for you, yet you insist on flying over yourselves. Isn’t that being disrespectful to the Celestial Sovereign?”

Ranran smiled and said, “Greetings, Immortal! While these heavenly steps seem convenient, they are haphazardly laid out and may have tens of thousands of steps. Walking on them would be time-consuming and exhausting, not to mention that by doing so, it would be our admission of guilt. I may have some minor faults, but it’s nothing major. This audience with the Celestial Sovereign is to present our case, not to admit wrongdoing. Flying over ourselves not only saves the Celestial Sovereign from waiting long, but it also makes us more comfortable.”

Her meaning was simple, the heavenly steps were for convicted criminals to ascend. But she and her husband were going to the heavens to investigate the hidden secrets of why the Heavenly Book was leaked, which was an honorable and legitimate action.

Even if the heavenly steps were provided, they wouldn’t take them!

Previous
Next

天罚降临 DIVINE PUNISHMENT

The Purple Light Immortal didn’t expect these two who had violated the heavenly rules to be so strong-willed. With a cold snort, he said, “If you don’t pass through the guiding heavenly steps to enter the heavenly gate, you will have to endure the pressure of the heavenly realm as you pass through. By the time you reach the Seventh Heaven, you will be slapped back to the human realm. If you don’t want to delay any longer, you’d better obediently take the heavenly steps!”

Ranran looked at the heavenly steps, which seemed like a straightforward path leading straight up. However, upon closer inspection, she could see that there were countless fine thorns on the steps.

Moreover, Su Yi Shui had mentioned that those led by the heavenly steps were great evildoers who were going to the heavenly realm for trial. Once they stepped on the heavenly steps, it was actually a path of confession of guilt guided by the heavens. With each step, the fine thorns pierced in would involuntarily make one recall their past sins. The ten thousand steps were like ten thousand tribulations. When reaching the top, one often couldn’t help but repent, shedding tears of remorse.

Xue Ranran felt she had done nothing wrong, so why should she go through the ordeal of repentance on the ten thousand heavenly steps? Even if she stood trial in the heavenly realm, she didn’t want to end up in tears, begging for mercy on the ground.

Su Yi Shui thought the same way. He calmly said, “Please don’t block our path, Immortal.…”

As he spoke, he gave a wave of his sleeve, causing the Purple Light Immortal’s figure to sway slightly.

This action made the Purple Light Immortal’s face darken with anger. He was one of the Eight High Immortals in the heavenly realm, only beneath the Celestial Sovereign and the three Imperial Emperors, highly esteemed and powerful in his own right.

However, just now, a half-disabled demonic immortal had flicked his sleeve, and the wind from his sleeve actually made him sway slightly.

This unexpected turn of events made the Purple Light Immortal both surprised and furious. While he felt his dignity had been offended, he also harbored doubts — what kind of existence was this demonic immortal? With such an unconventional background, did his divine power surpass that of legitimate High immortals?

Just then, the Vermilion Bird carrying the two had soared all the way to the Fourth Heaven, ascending continuously with a constant long cry.

As the “Tai Xuan” text states, the heavens have nine layers. By the time they reached the Sixth Layer, it was no longer accessible to ordinary beings.

Although the Vermilion Bird was a sacred divine beast, it had not reached the stage of ascension, so when it ascended towards the Seventh Layer, it began to struggled a little…

Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran obviously noticed this, so when they reached the Seventh Layer, they lightly tapped the Vermilion Bird’s feathered back with their toes and leaped up, soaring straight towards the Seventh Heaven.

Although Su Yi Shui only had half of a nascent soul, the other half was within Xue Ranran, so each of them had half a nascent soul of a demonic immortal. They were able to withstand the force of the ascension when reaching the Seventh Heaven.

However, when they reached the Eighth Layer, Ranran felt a tremendous force pressing down from above, as if an invisible giant hand was stopping them from advancing.

Ranran’s figure became unstable, and if it weren’t for Su Yi Shui pulling her, she would have almost fallen.

Having watched them ascend all the way up, the Purple Light Immortal, who had been wearing a displeased expression all along, now looked slightly relieved. Standing on the Ninth Heaven, he sneered, “Mere mortals, how can you ascend on your own? If that were possible, wouldn’t those who ascend to immortality after countless tribulations become a joke? You two should know your limits and climb the heavenly steps step by step! But with the thorns on these steps grow as time passes, since you two have delayed for so long, you’ll have to endure more suffering when you finally climb up.”

His words were full of mockery, sounding very unpleasant to the ears.

Feeling Xue Ranran’s body weakening, Su Yi Shui grabbed her hand in time, and true energy continuously flowed from him, protecting her heart meridians. He also said, “The heavens breathe, just like human respiration. You must find the right rhythm of inhalation and exhalation. When the heavens exhale, you cannot go against it, but when it inhales, you can move forward.”

Xue Ranran understood his meaning. The heavens breathe, and when they exhale, it’s impossible to move against them, but when they inhale, there’s a chance to advance.

Although it sounded simple, in reality, these subtle changes were hard to perceive. It required great insight and perception to notice such nuances.

So the Purple Light Immortal just smiled coldly hearing this, preparing to witness the girl’s failure.

After listening to Su Yi Shui’s words, Xue Ranran closed her eyes. As a Wood element practitioner, she had been cultivating in the Ice Lotus Pool of Xishan, and every pore of her body had become unusually sensitive due to the constant immersion. She could keenly sense changes in the water vapor and airflow, even as a tree would. When she who had been born from the Rebirth tree, tried to feel the inhalation and exhalation of the heavens, she did so by feeling with every inch of her skin, an experience that could only be sensed but not expressed.

After a few tries, she really felt the subtle changes in airflow. So she stopped wasting her true vitality and tried to relax her body as much as possible, her sleeves fluttering, like a feather, drifting through the Seventh Heaven.

Su Yi Shui did the same. The two of them followed the rhythm of the heavens, ascending step by step, soaring straight up through the Nine Heavens!

Behind the Purple Light Immortal, several other immortals had also arrived. They watched in astonishment as a partially disabled demonic immortal who could never ascend again, and a mere mortal arrived not by the heavenly steps but like feathers ascending to the heavens. Each and everyone of them was left dumbfounded.

Putting aside whether they had violated heavenly rules, even on a rare day like today when the heavenly gate was open, in the thousands of years past, no one had seen a mortal ascend so effortlessly to the heavens!

If everyone knew about this loophole, what would be the point of cultivation? Wouldn’t the heavenly realm be overcrowded with high, middle, and low-level immortals?

So when the two from Xishan finally reached the Ninth Heaven by drifting effortlessly, the gazes of the immortals towards them were quite unfriendly.

Even the Jade Lotus Immortal, who had been *”invited” out of their immortal cave by the Medicine Immortal, had a complex expression as she watched them.
*he kicked her out lol

Ignoring the hostile gazes of the immortals, Xue Ranran just looked around, searching for the figure of the Medicine Immortal.

In this realm of the heavens, he was the only familiar person she knew, so finding him would make things easier.

However, as she scanned around, she didn’t see the Medicine Immortal anywhere.

The Purple Light Immortal seemed to have guessed who she was looking for, so he coldly said, “The Medicine Immortal, as a lower immortal, acted on his own and intervened in matters of life and death in the mortal realm. Therefore, he has been punished by the Celestial Sovereign and is confined to his immortal cave.”

Xue Ranran sighed softly, “So it turns out that there’s not much difference between the heavenly realm and the mortal realm. Those who took action made mistakes, but those who don’t do anything can hold themselves high and act like saints…”

With this statement, the faces of the immortals tightened. Actually, they had also felt that the Medicine Immortal’s punishment was a bit excessive. It was because the Purple Light Immortal had given exaggerated accusations which led to the Celestial Sovereign’s punishment of the Medicine Immortal.

Nobody wanted to offend the Purple Light Immortal, so naturally, they didn’t speak up. This punishment of Dun Tian was originally the responsibility of the Purple Light Immortal. Although overturning the Four Mountains would cause heavy casualties, subduing the demonic Dun Tian would also be a great achievement.

But unfortunately, this great opportunity had been snatched away by Su Yi Shui, that young girl, and the Medicine Immortal, which made the Purple Light Immortal very displeased.

Moreover, if the Medicine Immortal were to ascend the ranks based on this level of achievement, he would ascend to become a Higher immortal. Unfortunately, there could only be Eight high-level immortals in the Heavenly Court. If he ascended, someone else would have to step down.

So the Purple Light Immortal’s accusations were actually quite subtle. The other immortals were also cunning enough to see through it without exposing it, understanding the situation without saying it outright.

The Purple Light Immortal also noticed that this little girl was sharp-tongued and quick-witted. However, now that they were in the heavenly realm, the Celestial Sovereign would have his own judgment on these bold and reckless individuals. It seemed that her chance to talk her way out with her silver tongue was limited.

So he coldly raised his white brows and said, “You’ve wasted enough time. Please follow me to meet the Celestial Sovereign before the heavenly gate closes!”

With that, he and a group of immortals stepped on colorful clouds and headed forward.

Su Yi Shui and Xue Ranran glanced at each other, then tightly held hands and followed behind him.

The Celestial Sovereign had cultivated for ten thousand years, undergone nine hundred and ninety-nine tribulations to become the beginning of all things. He had long since transcended physical form.

As they progressed forward, they arrived at the realm of emptiness.

Here, mist and water were everywhere, and only a mirror-like body of water appeared before them.

The immortals stood on both sides in an orderly manner, waiting with their hands down for the Celestial Sovereign’s instructions.

Just then, the water rippled slightly, and a voice echoed in the void, “Su Yi Shui, Xue Ranran, you two are truly rebellious troublemakers. Despite providing the heavenly steps, you refuse to ascend with it. Do the rules of the heavenly realm mean nothing to you?”

Su Yi Shui replied mildly “Rules are established by consensus and followed by the masses. This is the case with all worldly laws. Only the heavenly rules are the most elusive. Who set these rules, and who agreed to them?”

Upon hearing this, the Purple Light Immortal’s face changed drastically, and he sternly reprimanded, “How dare you! You’re speaking to the Celestial Sovereign. He is the beginning of all things, and his words naturally set the rules!”

Xue Ranran looked at him strangely and said in a small voice “If ascending to the heavens wasn’t so exhausting, I would have doubted whether I had entered the palace of the mortal realm. To find that there are also bootlickers in this remote place outside of creation…”

The Purple Light Immortal’s face turned red with anger, but he didn’t want to argue with mere mortals, which would lower his status. So he just gave her a cold glare, preparing to see how she would end up in a while.

Upon hearing Su Yi Shui’s words, the Celestial Sovereign’s tone seemed calm, “You are indeed a rare case of the millennium, a demonic being ascending to immortality, truly of a rebellious nature. Heavenly rules are not established by gods or humans, nor are they my personal whims. They follow the natural order of heaven and earth. Otherwise, chaos would ensue, and both gods and humans would face calamities. You peeked at the Heavenly book, which is a fact. How could you not be punished to set an example and warn those with ill intentions?”

Although the Celestial Sovereign’s tone was calm, the mirror-like water surface had begun to ripple, and it seemed like the wrath of thunder was imminent.

Xue Ranran spoke loudly, “May I ask the Celestial Sovereign, there’s something I don’t understand. The Heavenly book is a forbidden existence in the heavenly realm, inaccessible to most. Why was I able to accidentally glimpse the heavenly mandate twenty years ago, even steal a page of the heavenly book and bring it to the mortal realm?”

The Celestial Sovereign seemed to pause for a moment before speaking, “Xue Ranran… or should I say Mu Qingge. Do you know that Su Yi Shui was originally the Imperial Emperor YuanYang who violated heavenly rules, and reincarnated into the mortal realm to experience tribulations? His fate chart is peculiar, and the reasons for it are not to be mentioned. He was not destined for love, but you forcefully changed his fate for him, thus creating the karmic bond between you two. When the Heavenly book suddenly appeared in the mortal realm and fell into your hands twenty years ago, it was a strange case, and the truth cannot be revealed to heaven’s eyes… So I cannot answer how the heavenly book was lost that day.”

Hearing these words, the faces of the immortals changed.

Within the heavenly realm, the Celestial Sovereign was the highest authority, followed by three Imperial Emperors managing the rest of the immortals.

Among them, the YuanYang Emperor was the supreme deity of masculinity. All male immortals ascending to heaven had to pay respects to him before joining the ranks of immortals.

However, they hadn’t seen this Imperial Emperor for a long time.

For an immortal to descend into the mortal realm to experience tribulations was akin to a high-ranking official being demoted, something none of the immortals wanted to experience. They only knew now that Su Yi Shui was actually the reincarnation of the YuanYang Emperor! Before, they only heard that the YuanYang Emperor had violated some heavenly rule, and was grounded by the Celestial Sovereign, and his cave had been sealed for a long time. These Immortals were unaware of when the YuanYang Emperor had reincarnated into the mortal realm.

But now, a perfectly fine and well-respected Imperial Emperor had become a half-disabled demonic immortal after experiencing mortal tribulations, with no hope of ascending to heaven again. This situation was difficult to reconcile, and the Celestial Sovereign must have been quite troubled by it?

Xue Ranran widened her eyes upon hearing this, then turned to look at Su Yi Shui.

He was once an Imperial Emperor! What kind of unforgivable heavenly rule had he violated back then to be demoted to the mortal realm to endure such a tumultuous fate?

Unfortunately, the Celestial Sovereign seemed unwilling to say more and just coldly said, “Regardless, you have peeked at the heavenly book twice, and cannot escape punishment. According to heavenly rules, you will receive the punishment of the Destruction of Divine Thunder, never to be reborn again! And Su Yi Shui, for destroying your nascent soul and tampering with life and death of another to revive Mu Qingge and disrupted the cycle of reincarnation, you shall also receive this punishment. Do you two have any objections?”

Just then, a divine cloud suddenly appeared in the sky, and a clear female voice spoke, “The heavenly book had been stolen, and the reason was unclear. If this woman accidentally stumbled upon it, human nature cannot resist curiosity, and few glances can be forgiven. Why mete out such a heavy punishment?”

Everyone turned towards the voice and saw a woman with long hair, forehead adorned with a crescent-shaped divine light, flying on a cloud surrounded by several female immortals. Surprisingly, the Medicine Immortal, who should have been grounded, also followed behind her.

Seeing her, all the immortals quickly paid their respects.

Xue Ranran learnt that this woman was the Xuan Tian Holy Mother, who had ascended to the heavens together with the Celestial Sovereign as his immortal companion.

The Celestial Sovereign had cultivated to a formless existence, but it would seem that the Xuan Tian Holy Mother was unwilling to do so, and still maintained her elegant and holy human form.

Upon seeing the Xuan Tian Holy Mother’s arrival, the Celestial Sovereign seemed somewhat displeased and asked, “Aren’t you supposed to be cultivating on the Western Jade Mountain? Why did you suddenly return?”

The Medicine Immortal didn’t want to trouble the Xuan Tian Holy Mother and immediately knelt down to apologize, “As a humble immortal, I dared to act rashly and wanted to plead for leniency for these two young friends from the mortal realm. That’s why I have implored the Holy Mother to come, hoping to spare them from death penalties!”

Hearing his words, the Celestial Sovereign coldly said, “You’ve ascended to immortality but still can’t let go of mortal affections. This is a great offense! Originally, I intended to punish you with a three-year confinement, but now it seems it must be increased. Within ten years, you are not allowed to leave your cave! If you disobey again, your immortal status will be removed by Divine Thunder and you can go to the mortal realm to cultivate again!”

The Celestial Sovereign grew angry, and the Medicine Immortal naturally was sincerely fearful and immediately accepted the punishment without protest.

Since the Xuan Tian Holy Mother had spoken, the Celestial Sovereign couldn’t directly refute her, so he softened his tone and said, “You’ve always stayed out of heavenly affairs, so you naturally don’t understand the intricacies. These two individuals have acted recklessly, and if they are not punished, it will not appease the grievances. It’s better for you not to interfere.”

However, the Xuan Tian Holy Mother remained unmoved, her tone icy as she said, “I have stayed out of heavenly affairs, due to the loss of my beloved daughter. When you and I ascended together, I was already pregnant, but ascending required me to abandon this child. I couldn’t bear to let her perish, so I brought a Bodhi tree from Yaochi, letting her inhabit it. Originally, a thousand years would have been enough for her to attain physical form and become an immortal of plants and trees. Unfortunately, the tree withered overnight, and the fruit disappeared… This Xue Ranran was also born from the fruit of a tree, and I seem to have an affinity with her. I wish to save her, and I hope the Celestial Sovereign will grant me this favor!”

Xue Ranran widened her eyes in astonishment. She had prepared herself to receive punishment when she ascended to heaven, but she never expected the highly esteemed Xuan Tian Holy Mother to come forward to plead for her.

It seemed that although the Medicine Immortal’s status in the immortal realm was not high, his connections were quite powerful!

The Purple Light Immortal hadn’t expected the Xuan Tian Holy Mother to personally intervene and plead for this arrogant mortal woman. Thinking that the Medicine Immortal was causing trouble behind the scenes, the Purple Light Immortal frowned again: the Medicine Immortal was indeed overstepping his bounds, showing a lack of etiquette!

So he spoke, “Holy Mother may not know, that Su Yi Shui is the reincarnation of the YuanYang Emperor, originally destined to rejoin the ranks of immortals after tribulations. However, due to this woman’s peeping into the heavenly mandate and altering his fate chart, he cultivated a demonic immortal body, damaged his nascent soul, and they now have a ridiculous karmic bond. Just a few days ago, they got married, and the YuanYang Emperor can never return now. They have also violated heavenly laws together. If they are not punished, how can others be convinced?”

After the Xuan Tian Holy Mother arrived, although she glanced at Xue Ranran several times, she never once looked at Su Yi Shui.

But after hearing the Purple Light Immortal’s words, the Xuan Tian Holy Mother’s gaze turned to Su Yi Shui. Hmm… her beautiful eyes were beautiful, but they now shine with a fierce light, like a mother wolf protecting her cub.

Xue Ranran couldn’t help but use her body to shield Su Yi Shui, not allowing the Holy Mother to glare at her husband!

The Holy Mother looked at Xue Ranran protecting Su Yi Shui like a mother hen, and her gaze actually softened. She moved closer to Xue Ran Ran and comforted her, “Your cultivation foundation is excellent. I’ve heard from the Medicine Immortal that you have saved countless people, accumulating immense merit. The heavenly principles are clear, and your good deeds will not be forgotten. If you sincerely repent, the Celestial Sovereign may not punish you so severely.”

After listening to the Holy Mother’s words, Xue Ranran asked earnestly, “If we sincerely repent, can the Celestial Sovereign spare us from the death penalties?”

Perhaps to grant deference to the Holy Mother, the Celestial Sovereign spoke, “Your marital fate was not originally in either of your destinies. If you two are willing to end this karmic entanglement and never meet again, there might be a glimmer of hope. Su Yi Shui’s nascent soul is half-destroyed, and his immortal status is ruined now. But he can live hundreds of years in the mortal realm, lead an enjoyable life, and when his lifespan ends, he can re-enter the cycle of reincarnation and cultivate immortal fate again. As for Xue Ranran, you have a profound connection with immortality. You have also saved countless lives, and your blessings are not shallow. If you can overcome this emotional hurdle and separate from Su Yi Shui, you will definitely ascend to immortality and become a high-ranking immortal in the future. Are you both willing to accept this arrangement?”

Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui looked at each other. They didn’t need to channel any secret messages, they understood each other’s answer from their eyes.

Xue Ranran turned her head slowly and said aloud, “No need. Since we cannot escape heavenly punishment, we are willing to endure it. I just want to ask, how many times will this punishment come? If we miraculously survive, will the Celestial Sovereign continue to punish us relentlessly?”

The Celestial Sovereign said, “No one has ever survived the Destruction of Divine Thunder. If you can withstand it once, then consider the punishment fulfilled. From then on, the past will be forgotten.”

The Celestial Sovereign’s meaning was simple: Either die or part ways!

Peeking into the heavenly books was the original sin, but what the heavenly realm seemed more concerned about was the fact that these two individuals, who were not supposed to have a marital fate, had intertwined their fates. So, even if they had to use divine thunder, they would split them apart!

Hearing this, Xue Ranran held Su Yi Shui’s hand tightly and said clearly, “In that case, we have decided only death will part us. Please, Celestial Sovereign, deliver the punishment!”

When she said that, the Holy Mother’s face became extremely ghastly. She reached out to hold Xue Ranran’s hand and said, “If struck by the Destruction of Divine Thunder, your divine soul will be obliterated, and you can never enter the cycle of reincarnation again. Why did you agree so recklessly? Don’t tell me…”

The Holy Mother’s words stopped halfway, her expression becoming strange, and then she slowly let go of her hand, and stopped trying to persuade her.

Perhaps she felt that Xue Ranran was too head-strong and not worth persuading anymore.

The Celestial Sovereign seemed to have anticipated that these two wouldn’t give in easily. Seeing this situation, he only said coldly, “Since that’s the case, you two will have no chance to regret your choice.”

As soon as he finished speaking, iron chains suddenly appeared and entangled the two. These were the Heavenly Binding Iron Chains, and once bound, they couldn’t break free. Once fixed in place, thunderous lightnings appeared above their heads, resembling giant dragons, even more terrifying than the Heavenly Tribulation of Ten Thousand Calamities.

If struck, their divine souls and bodies would immediately be destroyed, never to be reincarnated again!

The Purple Light Immortal watched the Medicine Immortal’s anxious expression with a slight cold smile. Then, he clasped his hands towards the sky and said, “The Celestial Sovereign’s wisdom will rectify chaos and restore order to the heavenly realm!”

But as soon as he finished speaking, he saw the Xuan Tian Holy Mother glaring at him coldly, with a chilling smile on her lips.

The Purple Light Immortal respectfully lowered his head, but he didn’t really care in his heart. The other immortals respected her because she used to be the Celestial Sovereign’s companion. But now that the Celestial Sovereign had become formless, their so-called marital relationship was just a name without substance. The Xuan Tian Holy Mother usually lived alone by herself. Even if he offended her, so what?

Xue Ranran and Su Yi Shui were bound together now. Tears glistened in Xue Ranran’s eyes as she said, “We just got married, and now we have to part… I’m really reluctant…”

Su Yi Shui lowered his head and kissed away the tears at the corner of her eyes, “Trust me…”

Ranran nodded vigorously and then shouted loudly, “Come on!”

The Celestial Sovereign seemed to sigh, the sound of which was like the helplessness of a stern father facing a stubborn child. Accompanying this sigh, the thunderous Destruction of Divine Thunder, as thick as a wandering dragon, roared towards Xue Ranran’s head.

However, as the fearsome blow came down, it exploded just one inch above Xue Ranran’s head and abruptly stopped.

Beside them, the Purple Light Immortal looked on, unable to help but exclaim in astonishment, “What’s going on? How did she manage to evade the Destruction of Divine Thunder?”

At that moment, the Celestial Sovereign spoke up, asking, “Purple Light Immortal, why is there fetal movement in her body?”

The thunderous heavenly punishment does not harm new life, a basic rule that all immortals are aware of.

Before this, the Purple Light Immortal had reported to the Celestial Sovereign that Xue Ranran was not yet married, and although they had married within a short ten days, it was impossible for them to conceive so quickly.

Could it be that the Purple Light Immortal had neglected his duty and withheld information?

Ah politics exist everywhere. lol

Previous
Next

一粒新芽 A NEW SPROUT

Hearing the Celestial Sovereign’s questioning, the Purple Light Immortal became anxious and also puzzled.

He had intended to punish Xue Ranran and the others earlier, but due to the gravity of the situation, he didn’t dare to act without authorization, so he allowed them ten days.

At that time, he had clearly used his Heavenly Eye and saw that Ranran was not with child, that could interfere with the heavenly punishment. How could she suddenly have a three-month-old pregnancy in just a few days?

Su Yi Shui watched as the lightning above Ranran’s head gradually faded away, and he was finally able to settle his anxious heart.

The heavenly rules were indeed strict, but there were ways to bypass them. When he married Ranran, Elder Jiu had given him an improved brewing talisman.

Elder Jiu was fond of wine, so he used the talisman to shorten the brewing time. A ten-year-old vintage could be obtained overnight.

And this improved talisman limited the accelerated time to within three months.

Of course, although the talisman provided the boost, this was also based on the man’s own ability! Su Yi Shui managed to let his wife conceive right away after marriage, which was another skill that was not easy to flaunt!

The heavenly might descended, formidable and irresistible, but with a child in Ranran’s belly, even the heavenly thunder had to yield.

When the Holy Mother grabbed Ranran’s arm earlier, she had also noticed this, so she remained silent, standing aside and waiting for the heavenly thunder to automatically avoid her.

Now that it was made certain that Ranran was three months pregnant, the heavenly locks naturally released, allowing her to return to the mortal realm.

But even though Ranran was spared the heavenly punishment due to her pregnancy, Su Yi Shui, being a man, couldn’t possibly be pregnant. He had violated the norms of the mortal world, a crime that was hard to escape from. Once Ranran was removed, Su Yi Shui would undoubtedly face the heavenly thunder’s punishment.

Just as Ranran was released from the shackles, a force suddenly pulled her away from the Immortal Execution platform, leaving Su Yi Shui bound alone.

In a swift move, Ranran managed to break free from that force and threw herself back onto the platform, tightly embracing Su Yi Shui.

Su Yi Shui lowered his head, his loose black hair falling onto her cheek. He whispered softly, “Be good, it’s too dangerous here, stand further away, remember what I told you… Don’t worry about me…”

Ranran suppressed her tears with difficulty and took off her necklace from her neck, hanging it around Su Yi Shui, then kissed his lips.

She knew that once she left the Immortal Execution platform, although they were only a few yards apart, they might be separated forever.

She didn’t know what kind of grievances they had from their past lives, but their love in this life was so rocky, falling in love easily, but staying together was so difficult…

Su Yi Shui also kissed his newlywed wife fiercely. They had only been married for a few days, yet they were about to be separated. If he could, he would have torn apart the heavens and overturned the obstacles that separated them.

The inseparable couple clung to each other tightly, reluctant to part. Although most of the immortals present were indifferent to love and separation, they couldn’t help but be moved.

The Destruction of Divine Thunder, devoid of human emotions, came rolling once again towards Su Yi Shui.

At that moment, the Holy Mother intervened with urgency, gently waving the white cloth draped over her arm to pull Xue Ranran away from the platform.

As Ranran was pulled away, the thunderous dragon-like lightning struck towards the Immortal Execution platform.

When Ranran struggled to get up and saw the thunder striking towards Su Yi Shui, she couldn’t help but scream loudly, “Shifu!”

Although she had married Su Yi Shui, in moments of danger, out of habit, she still called him Shifu.

But as soon as she finished her cry, the heavenly thunder struck, and in an instant, Su Yi Shui was enveloped in a dazzling flash of lightning…

When the lightning dissipated, not even a trace of clothing was left on the Immortal Execution platform.

The YuanYang Emperor, who had failed the tribulation upon descending to the mortal realm, had perished on the Immortal Execution platform… This scene touched all the immortals present, filling them with sorrow.

Ranran broke free from the cloth wrapped around her and rushed back to the platform as if she had gone mad, crawling on all fours as she searched for any trace of Su Yi Shui on the ground.

Unfortunately, apart from some tiny fragments of glass and pieces of broken chain, there was nothing on the ground at all.

The man who lay beside her with picturesque features, softly kissing her cheek, seemed to have disappeared into thin air, leaving no trace behind…

The Holy Mother couldn’t bear to see her in such a state, so she walked up to her and tried to help her up.

But Xue Ranran suddenly shook off her hand, focusing on the small green shoot sprouting from the divine earth…

At that moment, the Celestial Sovereign spoke, “Su Yi Shui has disrupted the heavenly rules and has been punished on the spot. His previous sins are thus forgiven. Xue Ranran, the heavenly gate is about to close in a moment, hurry and leave, return to the mortal realm!”

After speaking, the surroundings gradually dimmed, everything became silent and still. After delivering judgment on this earthly couple, the Celestial Sovereign left.

The other immortals also dispersed one after another. The Purple Light Immortal had originally intended to stay and escort Xue Ranran back to the mortal realm. But the Holy Mother coldly said, “I will escort her, you can return to your abode…”

Since the Holy Mother commanded so, the Purple Light Immortal had to comply and left respectfully.

On the Immortal Execution platform, only Xue Ranran remained sprawled on the ground, with the Holy Mother who watched her helplessly.

“Child, get up. You are also a mother now, you need to take care of yourself…” The Holy Mother spoke softly.

Xue Ranran didn’t speak, just with teary eyes, she turned to the Holy Mother and asked, “May I borrow a flowerpot from you, Holy Mother?”

The Holy Mother frowned slightly but still conjured a black-gold sand tray and handed it to Ranran, saying, “This is the pot I used to plant immortal herbs in Yao Chi back then. What do you need it for?”

Without a word, Ranran used her hands as a shovel, carefully transferring the tiny green shoot the size of a grain, along with the divine soil around it into the flowerpot. Then she held the pot like a treasure and said, “Thank you, Holy Mother. I will be leaving now.”

The Holy Mother glanced at the small shoot, suddenly understanding something. She then said thoughtfully, “Ranran, your immortal fate is deep. If you can sever emotional ties, you will surely achieve great cultivation. Do not be entangled by human emotions and stagnate. The heavenly punishment now can be an opportunity. You must understand that earthly love is fleeting, ultimately empty. If you leave this shoot in the immortal realm, I will take good care of it for you. This way, you can focus on cultivation and ascend to immortality soon…”

However, Xue Ranran shook her head firmly and said, “No, I made a vow with him. We will not miss each other again in this life. Thank you, Holy Mother, for pleading for me. But I am attached to the worldly life and cannot sever love to pursue enlightenment. I hereby bid farewell to the Holy Mother, we will probably never meet again…”

After saying this, Ranran protected the flowerpot with spiritual energy, cradling it in her arms, and walked towards the heavenly gate. Her seemingly fragile figure was resolute, never looking back at the heavenly realm that everyone yearned for.

The Holy Mother watched her retreating figure which never looked back, and suddenly, tears flowed from her usually cold eyes.

Just as Ranran descended the heavenly ladder, the heavenly gate gradually closed. The Holy Mother couldn’t hold back any longer and wanted to call out to her, but the heavenly gate closed too quickly, blocking her voice.

As she choked up, the voice of the Celestial Sovereign sounded in her ear again, “Su nu, she is no longer our child. Why are you so persistent and unwilling to let go?”

The Holy Mother, upon hearing this, turned around angrily, “Why isn’t she? She is the daughter I nurtured for a thousand years, almost forming under the Bodhi tree! Our daughter was about to be born, but because that bastard YuanYang Emperor got drunk, he prematurely picked the fruit from the tree. He made such a mistake, yet he only had to face one round of tribulations in the mortal realm. My thousand years of waiting turned into nothing! What did I do wrong? Why couldn’t I keep our only daughter in the heavenly realm? She had to follow that bastard to face the tribulations in the mortal realm. But that bastard keeps entangling my daughter in the mortal realm… Is he leading her step by step, so that she would never return to the heavenly realm?”

The Celestial Sovereign sighed helplessly, “So, you have been trying with all your means to guide Mu Qingge into the Yao Chi illusion, and let her see the heavenly mandate in the Heavenly Book. You originally hoped she would see the grievances that would happen between her and Su Yi Shui, so that she wouldn’t care about him anymore and focus on cultivation in order to ascend to immortality. You also hoped it would be best, if she could kill her demonic disciple to achieve enlightenment and end this karmic entanglement… But unfortunately, your cleverness backfired, making things worse the more you tried to help. Instead, she modified Su Yi Shui’s fate chart for him to ascend immediately, even if it meant sacrificing herself. They were supposed to face a tribulation and return to the heavenly realm, but now they are entangled together and had to suffer the heavenly punishment…”

The Holy Mother stopped choking up and just said coldly, “So you knew everything. No wonder you suddenly ordered me not to go to the mortal realm in private and even took away my Heavenly Mirror for watching the mortal realm… Then why not expose me publicly, take me to the Immortal Execution platform for trial, and prove your enlightenment by killing your wife?”

The Celestial Sovereign remained silent for a while before saying softly, “The heavenly way is clear, there are arrangements preordained. Now you can only look on as she has no hope of ascension and have to return to the mortal realm. Isn’t this the greatest punishment for you?”

Hearing this, the Holy Mother’s long hair flew as she screamed into the air, “She was also once your daughter! Don’t you feel sorry for her even a little?”

The Celestial Sovereign fell silent again, finally turning into a halo of light that tightly wrapped around the desolate Holy Mother. “I am formless for the sake of universal love, but has my love for you ever diminished? When Su Yi Shui obtained that Transmigration Tree back then, do you think it was picked from thin air? That Transmigration Tree was the Bodhi tree by the side of Yao Chi! I moved it to the Jue Mountain and guided Su Yi Shui in a dream on the way to extend Mu Qingge’s life. That’s the last thing I could do for her as a father. But her parental connection is no longer with us. You need to learn to let go. Although their marriage destiny is not written in the Heavenly Book, now their fates charts have been messed up and are entangled and intertwined together. I am the Celestial Sovereign, but even I cannot interfere too much. Isn’t she living well in the mortal realm? Free-spirited and carefree, very much like you in the past!”

Wrapped in this warm light, the Holy Mother felt as if she had returned to the embrace of her lover from years ago. She gradually calmed down, asked sadly, “Is she…really doing well like this?”

Unfortunately, this time the Celestial Sovereign couldn’t answer her.

He had been away from the love in the secular world for too long, and have forgotten how warmth or cold feels.

But those two children, when faced with life and death choices, still chose each other without hesitation, wasn’t that the best choice they believed in?

After the heavenly punishment, the grievances and karma of past lives were thus wiped away. May she never have to regret her choice…

Time in the mortal realm passed swiftly and unknowingly. In the blink of an eye, six years had flown by.

The grass and trees on the Western Mountain were even more lush, and a little child wearing red, with a tall pigtail, was playing around in the woods.

If someone passed by and saw this scene, they would surely suspect that the ginseng in the mountains had turned into a spirit, transforming into a child to play in the woods!

Just then, a tiger’s roar shook the dense forest, and a huge tiger leaped out from the woods, calling out softly to the child in red.

The little child was so shocked that he fell sitting down on the grass, with a mournful face saying, “Bai Bai! You cheated, I clearly said fifty counts! I haven’t hidden properly, why did you look for me so quickly? It doesn’t count! It doesn’t count! Let’s start over!”

But before he could finish complaining, a beautiful woman appeared and lifted the little child up, saying, “I asked Bai Bai to find you. Have you finished today’s homework? Sneaking out to play while I wasn’t looking again!”

The child turned his head and saw that it was his mother who had come, so he stopped pouting immediately and said with a pitiful look, “Mother, just let me play a little while longer, before I go back to do my writing?”

Xue Ranran smiled at her son, mischievous like a monkey, her eyes round and stern, deliberately grumpy, “I don’t want to deal with you, I’ll go to your father and complain about you!”

The child quickly shook his chubby face and said, “No! Mother, don’t say bad things about me to Father!”

But his mother was not lenient at all, she head-locked her little son with her elbow and walked straight towards their residence.

In the courtyard, various medicinal herbs were planted in the low fence. Amidst the fragrance of herbs and flowers, a dense big tree stood in the center of the courtyard like an open umbrella.

The naughty little child slipped out of his mother’s arms like a slippery loach, then with nimble footwork, climbed up the tree in a few steps. On the thickest branch, there was a large fruit. Perhaps to prevent it from falling prematurely due to its size, a net was carefully tied below the fruit, supported by a few poles, very secure.

The child climbed onto the branch and leaned his face against the big fruit, speaking in a babyish voice, “Father, I wrote a lot of big characters today, I was a little tired, so I went to play hide-and-seek with Bai Bai. Mother says she’ll spank me, you can send a dream to mother tonight, and tell her to be gentle, use her hand, don’t use the chicken feather duster. The chicken feather duster made by Grandmaster Zeng hurts when she uses it, if Shen’er gets hurt, who will water and pull weeds for you?”

As he spoke, the child started to feel very wronged, even sniffing and shedding tears.

Xue Ranran, watching her son “complain” like this, initially felt amused and annoyed, but seeing him with red eyes in the end, she also felt sad.

Over the past year, her son had grown up gradually, and she had taken him to play at Uncle Master Yu Tong’s house at the foot of the mountain several times.

After coming back, her son kept asking questions non-stop, such as why other children’s fathers below the mountain were human and not a big fruit? When his dad would come down from the fruit, he didn’t want to play hide-and-seek with Bai Bai anymore, he wanted to play with his dad, and he wanted his dad to lift him high and buy sugar cakes together in the market.

Xue Ranran had always been strong and optimistic in front of her son, but hearing these words, she quickly pressed her son’s little head against her, hiding her tears in the moonlight.

She sniffed, then forced herself to soften her voice and comforted her son, “Soon, when Shen’er grows up, your dad will naturally come down from the tree to find you…”

Little Shen’er felt that something was off with his mother’s voice. He half-raised his head, and saw tears in his mother’s eyes. He quickly straightened up, gently patting her back, and kissed her on the cheek, saying, “Mother, I don’t need Father, I have you, that’s enough! Don’t cry, Mother. Father is fine on the tree, you don’t have to wash his clothes and cook for him, he just needs to drink a few sips of water every few days… Be good, Mother, don’t cry.”

Xue Ranran looked at her son earnestly comforting her with his little face, feeling that he looked more and more like Su Yi Shui!

Every time she saw her son, she seemed to see her husband when he was young.

When she returned from the heavenly realm six years ago, apart from the baby in her belly, there was only the small sprout in the flower pot.

She transplanted this small sprout into the courtyard and then set up a mat next to it. Day and night, she almost didn’t dare to close her eyes, guarding this small sprout fearfully, afraid that something might happen to it.

Back then, when they discussed how to deal with the punishment from the heavenly realm, they had already made a plan. Xue Ranran could escape punishment with the baby in her womb. But Su Yi Shui had no way to avoid it, he could only bear this fatal blow.

And the Transmigration Tree sealed in Xue Ranran’s glass bead necklace was their last chance.

Su Yi Shui said he was confident that when the heavenly thunder struck, he could abandon his body and move his soul onto the Transmigration Tree, so she hung the necklace containing the Rebirth Tree around Su Yi Shui’s neck.

However, in that instant of lightning and thunder, anything unexpected could happen. Xue Ranran was mentally prepared, but when she saw Su Yi Shui being struck by lightning and disappeared into thin air, she still lost all her strength and collapsed on the ground. She did not even know how she descended from the heavenly gate.

And the small sprout on the ground was her entire hope.

That tree was a spiritual tree and couldn’t be boosted with Elder Jiu’s talisman. It could only absorb the essence of the sun and moon bit by bit, slowly growing and sprouting.

Watching the sprout grow taller bit by bit every day, Xue Ranran’s heart was suspended high because she didn’t know if, at the critical moment of life and death, Su Yi Shui’s soul had managed to attach itself to this spiritual tree.

Would this tree she guarded day and night, turn out to be an empty tree?

But this tree grew much faster than ordinary trees. *The day when her baby moved in her belly, the small sprout the size of a beansprout had grown tall enough to reach her waist.
*might be around 20 weeks

On Xue Ranran’s delivery date, when Yutong, who helped with the birth, came out with hot water, she saw that the tree, which was already taller than a person, had actually borne a tiny little fruit!

When Xue Ranran carried the newborn baby to the tree, she could even feel the extremely familiar spiritual energy emanating from the fruit even without touching it.

At that moment, Xue Ranran finally set her heart at ease.

Su Yi Shui’s soul had been completely captured by this Transmigration Tree. They only had to wait for the moment the fruit ripened and fell, and their family of three could finally reunite.

She lifted the sleeping baby to the tree and said softly, “Son, look, this small fruit is your Father.”

The baby yawned, struggling to open his eyes, looked at the small fruit, then entered dreamland with a smile.

Ranran knew that all she had to do now was wait patiently for the moment when the fruit would fall.

But six years had passed and there was no sign of the fruit falling despite it growing bigger and bigger.

Now, Ranran had developed a habit. Every day, after reading with her son and putting him to sleep, she would come to the tree and chat with the fruit about the events of the day.

Su Yi Shui had never told her before how he endured the long years before the fruit of the Transmigration Tree fell.

But now, she could empathize, fully understanding Su Yi Shui’s feelings at that time, of the mixture of hope, anxiety, desire, and fear he must have felt.

She was probably not be as strong as him, only six short years had passed, but she was already feeling overwhelmed with longing and anxiety.

Today was no different. After educating her mischievous son, Shen’er, she sent him to the study to practice writing.

With nothing else to do, Ranran carried a bucket and ladle, watering the tree while sitting underneath it, chatting about her and her son’s recent daily life.

“Two days ago, I took Shen’er to the town at the foot of the mountain. In these two years, many young people have appeared in the town. I wonder what they have grown up on, all of them seem to be filled with vitality, and they all have thick eyebrows and big eyes. I wonder if our Shen’er will grow up to be as handsome… If you still don’t come down from the tree, I may consider taking on some young disciples in the town, teaching them and passing the time. It’s been a long time since Xishan took in new disciples…”

Ranran talked to herself, unaware that after she finished speaking, the branches of the tree moved slightly even though there was no wind.

“Oh, by the way, Su Yu’s body couldn’t hold out in the end. Wei Jiu’s method of prolonging his life was cunning but harmful, and the backlash was very severe. He probably only had a few days left. There’s fierce infighting in the court now. Zhou Feihua and her father, with the help of Qin Xuanjiu and their old comrades, have set sail from Central Land. Oh, Qin Xuanjiu came to Xishan yesterday, crying and saying he wants to return to cultivate. This is the tenth time in these six years he’s talked about resigning and cultivating immortality… It seems West Mountain will become lively soon… Wei Jiu, that demon, is also quite bored. He hasn’t been able to extract Tu Jiuyuan’s whereabouts from me over these years. He even wrote a letter asking if I needed his help to find a ready father for our child. He’s also bored since he is so free, so it’s convenient for him to come and take care of us, the single mother and orphan.”

Previous
Next

三世一镜 MIRROR OF THREE LIFETIMES

After finishing recounting these daily trivialities, Ranran sighed slightly. She was lamenting how Tu Jiuyuan and her daughter had been living in seclusion on Dragon Island. The Dragon goddess once sent her a message, saying that Tu Jiuyuan had a daughter who looked just like her father, implying she would grow up to be a beauty. It was a pity for the exquisite and innocent girl, growing up isolated on Dragon Island due to having a heartless father….

However, if this sigh were to reach the ears of others, they might suspect that a woman who had been alone in bed for six years was finding the loneliness hard to bear, receiving letters from improper men and feeling a stir of youthful desires.

After this, Ranran gave the tree two more scoops of water, and prepared to rest in her room.

Nowadays, every night after putting her son to sleep, she would have trouble sleeping and sometimes will meditate under the tree all night.

During the day, the noise outside and her son’s laughter while playing would make her feel sleepy, so she had developed a habit of taking a nap in the afternoon.

Today was no different. After returning to her room, she took off her outer garment and lay down on the soft herb mat, half-closing her eyes.

As her son had said, every time she fell into a deep sleep, the man who had been absent for six years would occasionally appear in her dreams. Especially when she couldn’t sleep deeply during the day, it was hard to tell if it was a dream or reality when she was in a half-asleep state.

Just like right now, she had only just started to dream, she felt the door creak open and someone lifting the curtain and sitting on the bed.

She wanted to open her eyes but her eyelids felt very heavy, and she just couldn’t lift them. So, she could only let the person reach out and gently stroke her cheek before slowly lying down beside her…

Half-asleep, Ranran was tightly held by familiar arms, and she took in the scent which she had longed for six years, and felt as if she had returned to the first few days of her marriage.

She couldn’t help but hug the broad shoulders back, tears in the corners of her eyes, softly calling out, “Shifu…”

This soft murmur made the arms around her tighten even more, with an almost suffocating force, and a low sigh, “My little fruit…”

And then came the overwhelming, suffocating passionate kiss…

This kiss was too eager and real. Even in the deepest dreams, it would make one wake up breathless.

Anyone waking up suddenly to find a man by their side, holding them and kissing endlessly would be frightened out of their wits.

However, Ranran had her skills, so her first reaction wasn’t to scream for help but to immediately turn her wrist and control the five short blades hanging on the screen, to pierce through the curtain, ready to stab the lecher!

The five spirit-controlled short swords came fiercely, instantly reaching the man’s back.

But at that moment, a deep voice sounded in Ranran’s ear, “After such a long time, this is how you welcome back your husband? Your moves are so ruthless, do you want to become a widow?”

Accompanied by the man’s deep voice, the five short swords fell to the ground with a clatter as Ranran pushed the man off with force, and stared with wide open eyes at the intruder’s face…

Thick, dark eyebrows like mountains, eyes sparkling with starlight, and that straight and captivating nose, all belonged to him, whom she had revisited in her dreams countless times…

“You… are Su Yi Shui? Am I dreaming?”

The man didn’t answer, just bent down to kiss her again, their lips intertwined with longing and sweetness of reunion.

After a long time, he looked up, “Do you now know if you are in a dream or reality?”

The tingling sensation on her lips reminded her that the man in front of her was real! Her Shifu had only grown on the tree for six years, and now the fruit has ripen and fell!

Ranran was overjoyed and immediately hugged him, “You… how did you come down so quickly?”

This took Ranran by complete surprise. She had been prepared to meet him again twenty years later. If he could manage to come down before their son got married, that would have been good.

But to the man who had just enjoyed his drink of vinegar, there seemed to be a hidden meaning in her words, “What? Is this not the right time for me to come back? I suppose, you could be more at ease when you are taking in young disciples when you are alone. After all, there are so many young flower youths in town, just waiting to be carefully appreciated… Right, when is Wei Jiu coming to West Mountain to acknowledge kinship? I need to prepare and welcome him properly…”

Ranran’s daily ramblings under the tree were just idle talk, and she never thought the fruit on the tree could hear everything, and couldn’t wait to hold her accountable!

Now that she had been found out, she could only laugh and cry as she hugged him tightly, “…You still provoke me. Do you know how much I missed you all these years without you?”

How could Su Yi Shui not know? When his body was destroyed by heavenly thunder, his primordial spirit was drawn into the seedling. Although he was initially in a chaotic state of consciousness for the first few years, he could always feel a woman whispering next to his ear while holding a babbling baby.

At first, he couldn’t hear it clearly, but he felt that the woman’s voice was like the sound of trickling water, soothing and calming his restless emotions.

Later on, if he didn’t get to hear her voice daily, he would feel anxious and uneasy. Eventually, the babbling baby started to talk, always held by someone under the tree pointing at him and shouting, “Guo Guo…”

The gentle woman would always correct the baby, “This is your Father, look, how big and round and so cute! Quick, call Father…”

Then, as his consciousness gradually cleared, he began to recall the past and realized that the gentle voice belonged to his Ranran, and the babbling baby was his son whom he hadn’t seen yet.

Thinking of Ranran raising their child alone without him, he was more anxious than anyone else. He wished he could fall earlier, hug the woman who had insomnia tightly in his arms, and lift the jumping mischievous child high up, and kiss his little face fiercely.

However, his primordial spirit was tethered to the tree and he couldn’t break free even if he wanted to. He could only silently listen to her soft whispers, endure the lonely nights, and absorb the essence of the sun and moon to mature faster.

Finally, on this day, the big fruit finally fell, and he broke out of the shell, feeling the warmth of the sun on his skin.

The fragrant herbs in the garden reminded him that he had come alive again. He could walk step by step toward the familiar courtyard, push open the door, and see his beloved woman, with black hair scattered on the fragrant mat, snow-white skin and rosy lips, exactly as he had yearned for six years…

At that moment, he couldn’t hold back anymore, he just wanted to hold her tightly, to soothe the pain of longing.

As the wind gently blew, half-closing the door, it also kept the steamy scene hidden inside…

But for Shen’ ‘er, he had only had his afternoon lessons. When he went to look for his mother in the courtyard, the big fruit on the tree was gone.

As he cried loudly in a panic, a tall man in wide robes and long loose flowing hair walked out of the room.

His master uncles Gao and Qiu, both cried tears of joy, prostrating themselves and calling him their master. It wasn’t until the tall man lifted him up high in one lift, that he vaguely realized—his father had returned!

Shen’er nervously pursed his lips and tentatively called out “Father…”

The man fiercely kissed his tender little face, then placed him on his shoulders and casually asked him, “Do you want to go down the mountain to see the lanterns?”

Shen’er looked for his mother, but Su Yi Shui said with a smile “Your mother is tired and needs to rest for a while. Come on, I’ll take you to make paper lanterns!”

As the sun set, Ranran was finally able to get up with her sore waist.

Tonight happened to be the night of Qixi Festival. The canals in the town were filled with lotus lanterns. Many shops also hung lanterns at night, and groups of young boys and girls in the town were laughing and playing, making the place lively.

Ranran walked hand in hand with Su Yi Shui on the streets, while Shen’er sat proudly on his father’s shoulders, eating sweet cakes and holding the lotus lantern his father made for him, showing off to the other children nearby, “Look, I also have a father, my father is human, not a fruit!”

Unfortunately, the other children stared at him blankly after his boasting. They were not stupid and naturally could tell the difference between a person and a fruit. Was this child from West Mountain trying to insult them?

However, the couple was just too perfect. The man was tall and handsome, the woman was beautifully captivating, both exuding the aura of immortals. The child on the man’s shoulder was white and cute, they were truly enviable.

Su Yi Shui was still the same as before, now bringing two food lovers, big and small, eating from one end of the street to the other. The streets were bustling with people, filled with the atmosphere of the worldly life.

When someone set off fireworks across the river, the sky was filled with brilliance, like stars.

Ranran hugged Su Yi Shui tightly, whispering softly “It’s worth dying to stay by your lover’s side, let’s be a pair of mandarin ducks and not envy immortals…”
*得成比目何辞死，愿作鸳鸯不羡仙
比目鱼 鸳鸯 are animals used by ancient poets

Su Yi Shui listened to her suddenly reciting ancient poetry and said in a deep voice, “Don’t think about life and death recklessly, I will always be by your side…”

Thinking back on the hardships they had faced in their relationship, almost missing each other several times being separated by life and death, the peaceful years now were precious, no curse is to be allowed.

Ranran smiled playfully, cuddling with her son together in Su Yi Shui’s arms. They watched the brilliant fireworks in the sky, wondering if the gods in the sky also envied mandarin ducks rather than immortals when they saw this scene.

At that moment, the Medicine Immortal stood in the sky, looking at the riverbank adorned with lotus lanterns, especially the reunited family of three, also let out a sigh of relief.

“Why didn’t you go down to the mortal world to light lotus lanterns this year?” Suddenly, someone behind him asked.

The Medicine Immortal turned to look at the Qinglian Fairy standing behind him at some point, with a slight wry smile. He said lightly, “She already has a good person by her side, so I don’t need to disturb her worldly affairs anymore…”

In these past few years, he had hesitated several times about going to Dragon Island. It was only last year when the barrier around Dragon Island suddenly showed a crack, seeming to allow him to enter.

At that time, he thought that Feng Mou had finally forgiven him, naturally felt ecstatic.

However, what he saw when he entered was Feng Mou nestled in the arms of a tall young man.

The look in Feng Mou’s eyes as she looked at the young man was so familiar, filled with love. She had once looked at the Medicine Immortal with such affection as well…

“I called you here to let you know that everything is fine now. I hope you won’t disturb my peace anymore…” as she said this, Feng Mou’s eyes finally turned to him, but they became extremely cold.

At that moment, the Medicine Immortal looked at the woman standing beside the now grown-up little dragon and finally realized that his fate with Feng Mou had ended…

The Medicine Immortal could only turn around and leave, but he didn’t see Feng Mou coldly pushing away the hands of the young dragon when he turned around, causing the young man to look at her with a flushed face and red eyes…

After that trip to Dragon Island, he never again released a lotus lantern.

Thinking of this, the Medicine Immortal didn’t want to recall memories related to the lotus lantern. The fundamental reason why he had remained a lower Immortal and couldn’t ascend the ranks was that he had always harbored guilt in his heart. Now that Feng Mou had someone to take care of her, he could focus on his cultivation.

However, recalling the instructions from the Xuan Tian Holy Mother, he still needed to visit the mortal realm and give something to that couple.

Three days after Su Yi Shui came down from the tree, the Medicine Immortal arrived at the Ice Lotus Pool in West Mountain.

Xue Ranran didn’t expect the Medicine Immortal to appear so unexpectedly and cautiously greeted him, “Is the Immortal here to take us to trial for the Heavenly Court again?”

The Medicine Immortal smiled wryly, “Although I am a Lower Immortal, I am not in the position of the God of Misfortune, so I don’t come bearing bad news every time.”

Ranran immediately heaved a long sigh of relief upon hearing this. When they were punished in the heavenly trial, they had managed to avoid the death punishment by each finding a loophole.

Especially Su Yi Shui, after attaching to the Transmigration tree, he essentially experienced rebirth. His original nascent soul had been damaged and he couldn’t ascend again. But now, he was like a newborn who continued with his previous memories and retained his spiritual power, a fortuitous turn of events that will allow him to continue cultivating without limitations.

If the Celestial Sovereign disliked them and wanted to look for trouble after six years have past, disrupting their hard-won reunion as a family of three, it would be troublesome again.

When the Medicine Immortal handed her a small box, Ranran blinked in confusion and asked tentatively, “What is this?”

The Medicine Immortal said, “It’s the Three Lives Mirror from the immortal realm, capable of peering into a person’s three lifetimes.
